summary: This film tells the story of Rubin "Hurricane" Carter, an African-American man who rose above his troubled youth to become a top contender for the middle-weight boxing title. However, his dreams are shattered when he is accused of a triple murder, and is convicted to three natural-life terms. Despite becoming a cause celebre and his dogged efforts to prove his innocence through his autobiography, the years of fruitless efforts have left him discouraged. This changes when an African-American boy and his Canadian mentors read his book and are convinced of his innocence enough to work for his exoneration. However, what Hurricane and his friends learn is that this fight puts them against a racist establishment that profited from this travesty and have no intention of seeing it reversed.
translation:
Pretty good movie, but no true story.

Rubin "Hurricane" Carter was a notorious liar, a murder, and was never found guilty. New Jersey State has not gone a third time than 20 years. Carter got an offer in 1976: "lie test and go free". He did not take it. This movie should never have been done, but money speaks. Many people have unjustly spent their lives in prison and no doubt more blacks than whites. Why choose a wrong story?

Jens

summary: Viennese doctor Josef Breuer meets with philosopher Friedrich Nietzsche to help him deal with his despair.
translation: I had to stop watching this movie (a pseudo-intellectual product for sophisticated movie viewers) for twenty minutes because it was mediocre and boring enough to inspire yawning, not to mention that I soon had tears of $ 3.99 that I had wasted on blockbuster. Joanna Pacula's drama and her terribly Slavic accent are so terrible that you can clench your teeth. I knew that two hours from her would be two hours too much. Both Breuer and Nietzsche are played by inconspicuous actors with amazingly few talents. While we look at the subject of talent, Breuer's haughty assistant emerged from a local acting troupe. She obviously did not learn her trade. In fact, she is really terrible. All the public scenes looked staged, and the extras ran around mechanically on their best Sunday. It was much more satisfying to turn off this movie than to turn it on. Do not rent this horrible movie. I'm sorry you spent your money.

summary: Benkei, a master fighter and killer, vows never to take another life after his conversion to Buddhism. His faith in pacifism, however, is shaken and ultimately broken by the attacks from a trio of fighters known only as "the demons". Taking up his sword once more, he sets out to end their murderous terror.
translation:
This is seriously one of the worst movies I have ever seen. I love Japanese movies, and I think another director's movie, 80,000 V electric dragon, is a masterpiece. I really wanted to like this movie - Asano is a terrific actor and the plot was very responsive. but I could not find anything entertaining about it.

The movie lasts forever, until nothing happens. and the effects that the director used - such as the constant percussion and the exorbitant use of slow motion - only added to my growing annoyance over the fact that the plot was so incredibly slow and the actors exuberantly exaggerated. Much of the boredom was a series of superfluous additions that were utterly unnecessary-like an hour spent by Asano cutting Buddha statues and proclaiming that he does not worship. That did not add anything to the plot. a Japanese movie fan and I were constantly watching the time. we could not believe that this movie was as horrible as it was. and the final was awful. I thought the director would at least try to reward the viewer for making it through, but unfortunately I was wrong.

summary: Bhatinda-based school-going Arjun wants to follow in his much-maligned grand-father's footsteps and attain fame at the Wembley Stadium much to the chagrin of his father. After the latter's passing, he re-locates to live in Britain with his paternal uncle, and when admonished about his career, runs away. Years later Arjun will attempt to gain fame along with two associates, Zoheb and Wasim, and his sweetheart, Priya. He returns to Bhatinda and asks his childhood slacker and trouble-maker friend, Manjeet Khosla, to also join his band - a decision that will not only cost him his popularity, his career and dreams, but also his love.
translation: I'm just wondering, what's the purpose of making such films? the profit? And who are they referring to, what kind of intelligence does your brain need to use to see something like this crap? This movie is for children under 3 years if you are not an adult. That's why I think Hollywood started using cartoons in movies with actors like this one. You must forget the art of cinema, be sure that you will take tons of popcorn until this movie ends Laptop your phone This movie can easily be used in a restaurant, but certainly not in a theater, my dog, always next to my family is when a movie goes out of the building. That's for sure that this movie refers to people with no demands from cinematic art. The only thing that this movie can be used is to watch it when doing the supermarket shopping list. I give 2 stars for supporting Indian cinema efforts but for nothing more or less ..

summary: Steve Dailey is in the Abilene, Kansas jail waiting to be hanged when Judge Carr brings Cheyenne O'Malley into his cell and says that Dailey can go free if he marries the girl, without knowing her name, because she must have a husband to claim an estate. Dailey agrees and gets a letter of pardon from the Judge, who plans to kill him, but Dailey, with the help of his friend, Podo, escapes the jail and the Judge's hired killer, "Slow" Karp. He sets out to find his new bride but is captured and taken to the mansion of John Parnell. The latter tells Dailey that Cheyenne is actually a half-breed who runs a fur-trading company and needed a husband because of provisions in her father's will. Parnell is also a fur-trader but he wants Dailey to take over her business so they can work together. Dailey agrees, trails the wagon train and takes over but not before Cheyenne bull-whips him. Meanwhile, Karp has been hired by Judge Carr to kill Dailey and hired by Parnell to keep him alive. He plays ...
translation:
To be honest, I had heard that was pretty bad before I decided to see it, but I'm never one that makes others influence my point of view. In fact, I tend to watch something out of defiance! Bullwhip had one thing to do before the visit anyway, the fact that Rhonda Fleming and those beautiful eyes were in it immediately interested me. The picture is not very good and indeed very morally doubtful, all characters are corrupt and devious in a form or form, all motivated by greed or egocentric victories, that's all well and good, if the surrounding film can do justice to one Row of despicable people and create a tense climax picture. Unfortunately not, and since the finale fills your eyes with sugar, you can not help screaming that you've been cheated to watch a pretty bad movie, no one in the cast is coming with any acknowledgments, with Captain Guy Madison, painfully wood inside extreme case.

Not even the beautiful Rhonda can make me recommend this to anyone, 3/10

summary: Alice and Darlene, best friends, decide to take a trip to Thailand to celebrate high-school graduation. While there, they are befriended by charming Australian rogue Nick Parks. Nick convinces them to take a weekend side trip to Hong Kong, but at the airport, they are busted for smuggling drugs. They are convicted in a show trial and sentenced to 33 years; in desperation, they contact Yankee Hank, an American lawyer based in Thailand who has been reported to be helpful if you've got the cash.
translation:
We all have friends. Some of us have more than others, but there are really only one or two people you really feel connected to, people you can say are like your brother or sister. Alice (Danes) and Darlene (Beckinsale) are like that. You can see that from the beginning. They graduated, they go to parties together and they decide to go to Bangkok together, if they go to Hawaii. They are also being punished for trying to smuggle drugs into a third world country, which is a disaster. The rest of the movie is about survival and does not give up hope. It also has a strong message about the power of friendship and what it can mean to someone.

Brokedown Palace is a very good movie, it's not excellent and that's because of a few issues I want to talk about. But first I want to say what's good about the movie. And for beginners, acting is first class, and you can not look further than the two leads. Danes and Beckinsale are perfect in the roles they have. Alice is always fiery and looks a bit rough on the edges, but she seems to have more fun than Darlene. But sometimes this fun can get them into trouble. Darlene is always a bit conservative, and although that can sometimes be irritating, it would have served the two girls better if they had kept their own way instead of Alice. Bill Pullman is sufficient as the Thai-based American lawyer. The film is also very well photographed. While the interior of the prison is not the same as Shawshank or Natural Born Killers or Return to Paradice, it does show the necessary (but underdeveloped) hopelessness of the situation in which they find themselves. Johnathin Kaplan's guidance is also pretty good. We see the two girls struggling to get through each day, but you can see their minds are being exposed a little bit more each day. Brokedown Palace is excellent when it comes to friendship and shows that they need to rely on each other to survive. The other thing I had to comment on is the soundtrack for the movie. It enhances and complements the mood of the film to perfection. The song you hear in the trailer is also played in the movie and when it plays you feel the plight of the women in this jail. You can feel how alone they need to feel and how desperate they are to come out and return to the simple things in life. And it also makes you see yourself and realize how happy we are to live in the society we do. We have it easy compared to some countries and believe that music is a perfect catalyst for reflection on the subject. Part of the music is made by a group called delirium (I think), but it's Sara McLaughlin (misspelling, but how do you spell her last name?), Who plays the lyrics and her voice is beautiful and haunting and she adds so much in addition to the movie.

What I did not like about the movie was the stupidity the girls are showing. I will not say what it is, but if you see it yourself you will know what I am talking about. Besides, I did not really feel that the prison they were in was so bad. It looked more like a minimum security prison, and that may be because in similar situations in other films where men spend time in a foreign country, the prison scenes are always brutal and sadistic. But I did not understand that here.

Overall, this is a great movie and it really makes you ask, "How far would you go for a friend?" This is a difficult question and maybe one that none of us could honestly answer until it got into the same situation. Let's just hope it never matters.

summary: Fictionalized account of the life of famed French author Emile Zola. As portrayed in the film, he was a penniless writer sharing an apartment in Paris with painter Paul Cezanne when he finally wrote a best-seller, Nana. He has always had difficulty holding onto a job as he is quite outspoken, being warned on several occasions by the public prosecutor that he risks charges if he does not temper his writings. The bulk of the film deals with his involvement in the case of Captain Alfred Dreyfus who was falsely convicted of giving secret military information to the Germans and sentenced to life imprisonment on Devils Island. Antisemitism played an important role in the real-life case but is hardly mentioned in the film. Even after the military found definitive evidence that Dreyfus was innocent, the army decided to cover it up rather than face the scandal of having arbitrarily convicted the wrong man. Zola's famous letter, J'Accuse (I Accuse), led to his own trial for libel where he was ...
translation:
A thank you to the patience of Paul Muni, who spent hours each day in the make-up room to take over the role of Zola. Muni was one of the biggest stars of the 1930s and I wonder how many people today - except the classic movie fans - know about it. He was a giant in the industry for at least a decade. He could have won the Oscar for this performance, which would have given him two in a row when he won it the year before for Louis Pasteur. My own opinion is that although he tended to exaggerate a bit, he still thought he was one of the great actors of the "Golden Age". Whatever he played; You were tied to the screen and watching him.

In contrast to the Pasteur role, I thought that this story is a bit too much of what we have seen in the last 60 years: go overboard to become a Liberal hero. Even in 1937, Hollywood could not suppress its contempt for the police or the military, so it was important to tell us how corrupt these organizations are. Filmmakers simply love when authority is challenged and defeated. In this regard, this film is way ahead of its time since we saw this great time since the 1960s.

It should be noted, however, that the facts support this story. It also does not diminish Zola's achievements as a social reformer by eliminating certain evils. Good for him! I wish they had spent more time showing that than concentrating on an attempt.

summary: From the producers of the comedy smash Deuce Bigalow comes The Animal, about a small, wimpy Marvin, who doesn't have what it takes to fulfill his lifelong dream to be a cop. But his luck changes when he's critically injured in a car accident and a deranged scientist secretly uses animal organs to rebuild him. Energized by his new parts, Marvin leaves his weakness behind and achieves instant fame as a supercop. Now a hero, life is going great for Marvin until his animal instincts start taking over his body at all the wrong times. Marvin struggles to remain civilized and be a perfect gentleman with his new love, Rianna in a series of hilarious situations that would drive any animal crazy.
translation: Rob Schneider is a famous comedian for his movements, facials and performances of "non-humans". This time he is the animal. Marvin is a loser trying to be a hero and one day nobody calls a man who is under attack, so Marvin has to accept this case and rescue the attacked man. But on the way to the crime scene, he crashes his car and gets really damaged. He does not remember what happens and the next day his life is not the same when he finds out he has animal instincts. Of course, we have our wife, our main character trying to achieve, but his attempts are useless. She is played by Collen Haskell. There are no negative signs. The negative character is fate if I could use this metaphor. Marvin should find out how to become a normal person again. By the way, his animal instinct helps him in some situations. Schneider's performance is a so-so. The movie is so unreal that at times it gets stupid, but it's one of those movies called brainless fun, as I wrote above. So look at the monkey style Rob Schneider, but it's definitely not one of the best comedies of all time or one of the best movies in which Schneider performs. He's a great comedian, but that's not his best movie.

summary: Harrison is a young scientist who grew up under the thumb of his domineering rich posh mother Helena. Even in his adulthood she still has a stranglehold over him since she's financing his research based on the discoveries of his late scientist father. His obsession is to successfully use lizard DNA to stimulate regeneration of dead or dying tissue which could lead to cure for cancer or even regeneration of lost limbs in humans. He soon has a breakthrough but all his dreams are crushed when he learns that his manipulative mother and her unscrupulous boyfriend Dr. Hans Vaughn are planing to take all of his research from him and sell it as their own. Enraged, Harrison has an argument with his mother and Vaughn which ends in tragedy when an automated door accidentally sever his right arm. Harrison injects himself with his regeneration serum to try and grow a new hand. Unfortunately, it turns out that his new scaly limb has a killer mind of its own. Harrison runs away and finds shelter in ...
translation: A young scientist is trying to continue his dead father's work on limb regeneration. His arrogant mother has convinced him that he has murdered his own father and oversees his progress for their own evil purposes. A young doctor uses reptilian DNA extracted from a large creature and when his arm is easily torn off a few minutes later, he injects himself with his formula and gets a new murderous arm ... Granted, the special effects in "Severed Ties "are pretty good and grotesque, but the rest of the movie is awful. The severed arm behaves like a snake and kills a few people. Great deal. The acting is mediocre and the climax is silly.3 out of 10 points.

summary: Magloire Dazincourt, the owner of Bontemps, the largest sugar plantation of the entire South, asks his favorite cousin, Philippe Ferronaire, to marry his daughter Aglae Dazincourt and take over most of its management and family, including his colored mistress Cecile Ste. Marie, for whom he has a cottage build in New Orleans. When Magloire dies, Philippe becomes her lover and the father -not in law- of her son Marcel, named after his own father though, and promises her to get the boy educated in racially egalitarian Paris from age 18. However while still living in the decadent creole society in New Orleans, Marcel Ste. Marie gets in touch trough a colored carpenter with both his white and black roots, both of which bloodlines suffered greatly in the bloody racial civil wars on Haiti, a subject the American society refuses to deal with publicly, and the more people he gets to know or hears their past, the more he gets aware of social and racial matters. Then his father Philippe gets in ...
translation: Historical drama and coming-of-age story with free people of color in the pre-Civil War New Orleans. Start slowly, but pick up as soon as you learn about the main characters and begin the real story. This is not just a story about the exploitation of black women, because they were free people. They may not have all white rights, but they certainly had more control over their fates than their slave ancestors. The young men and women in this story must each make their own decisions about how to live their lives, whether they want to go into the corruption of the system or live with optimism and contribute to their community. I enjoyed all the characters, but my favorites were Christophe, Anna Bella and Marcel.

summary: Unable to afford the tuition needed to fund her private school education, Rayanna or Raya (Rutina Wesley) returns to her family home in the city while reluctantly re-evaluating her future. Upon learning that the top prize for an upcoming step-dancing competition is $50,000, Raya uses her impressive moves to earn a coveted slot in her good friend Bishop's (Dwain Murphy) predominantly male JSJ crew. Isolated from the local females due to jealousy and separated from her fellow dancers by gender, the ambitious dancer is subsequently kicked-off the team for showing off during a preliminary competition. Now, if Raya has any hope of realizing her medical school dreams, she will have to either earn back Bishop's trust or organize her own dance crew and start over from scratch. In the end, she eventually learns "how she move".
translation: I was a bit scared to see this movie because of its prices. But in Italy, such titles never live and I love the step so much that I decided to give it a try. And how surprised I was! The story is different from any other dance movie I've seen lately, with a deeper meaning than just "winning." It is touching and well written and well directed. Raya is such a strong character, I love the fact that she never doubts herself, she's so mature and focused and AWARE from her talent (and what talent does Rutina Wesley have, my jaw dropped in the recent dance scene). The way she pursues her dream and refuses to let anything stop her is, frankly, inspiring. Also the fact that she is not the typical super-hot chick (see Jessica Alba, Briana Evigan, Jenna Dewan, Zoe Seldana ...) makes her really appealing and real. Seriously, why is this movie rated so low? You can understand between the first 5 minutes that it is a good job. Really good. I even cried at the end of the movie. And the dance routines are just sick.

summary: Domini, an heiress who has led a cloistered life, visits the North African desert for spiritual renewal. There she meets Boris, recently escaped from a Trappist monastery. Their friendship ripens into love, but he conceals his past from her. Then in a remote oasis, they meet a man who knows his secret.
translation:
"The Garden of Allah" is a prime example of "popular women's literature," a turn of the twentieth-century style that combines the power of unrestrained erotic and exotic reveries with the stimulating glamor of false mysticism and the sado-masochistic bite of Catholic guilt. Just as Jane Eyre could not really be happy until her castle burned around her and her lover was permanently maimed for his sins or the heroine of "Rebecca" could not find true fulfillment in her marriage until her husband was put on trial The murder of his first wife (and her castle burned around her), or the poor psyche could not leave well enough and had to get Amor's secret out at any cost, Domini, the devout Catholic heroine of this tripe, can only achieve true sexual realization by unintentionally marrying a man who has renounced his holy religious vows. Like all these narratives, which are meant to incite the female reader and stimulate the vapors, it relies on the oldest tricks in the book: basic misunderstandings and the inability to express one's true feelings in the right place and time until it is too late. The logic is that any ultimate sexual ecstasy can be put down as long as one is willing to pay a high price for the atonement in the final act. It is Paul Claudel reduced to standards of the beauty salon magazine. Well ... It could have been a lot worse and it was often ...

Without the religious overtones, the plot of the movie is that of your basic porn strip: Oversexed monk, crazy by abstinence is driven, the desert escapes, in which he has a few buns in the dunes with a romantic, well-formed, but naive Catholic heiress, before reintegrating his monastery, the whole passion has left out and they had their disorder cleared up. And I'm really annoyed at comparing another commentator with Anatole Frances "Thais," a nifty novel whose purpose it was to ridicule the whole concept of Catholic sexual repression, some of which happily appeared in Massenet's opera of the same name.

But what makes this image unique in the annals of commercial female eroticism is, of course, the enormous constellation of talents gathered under a banner to make this cinematic, wet dream a dazzling, vibrant life bring. Constant Technicolor photography that will outlive us all, a truckload of worthy character actors (including a sweet dog), a music score by Max Steiner, determined to accomplish Michael Powell's "composed film" (ironically playing a minor role) in the silent version of 1927) always dreamed of giggling sometimes at the edge of dissonance, but always getting through in magnificent symphonic, operatic exoticism, a dream-like atmosphere in which material considerations play no role, characters magically traveling from one place to the next the dialogue is sparse, vague and suggestive, the art direction is close to the celestial, floral arrangements appear in the humblest hut or tent, the heroine's wardrobe is inexhaustible and all male characters are either aristocrats, saints, damned sinners, mystics or poets ,

Ahh ... Hollywood! The MGM DVD presentation of this film is blunt, but impeccable. The bitrate is very high throughout, the color registration is almost always perfect and the 2.0 mono sound complies with Max Steiner's score and Boyer's penultimate confession.

A historical note on this type of "women's theme": The following year (1937), Julien Duvivier, visibly inspired by "The Garden of Allah," directed "Carnet de Bal" where a very similar clothes-horse butter-does not melt in the mouth The heroine (widowed after the care of a sick man in the exotic seclusion of an incredibly romantic alpine villa on the lake) wants to find out what she has missed by writing in her first dance book She finds them all in good time, only to realize that every feeling that was between her and her was either misunderstood, overrated or had tragic consequences - it was Duvivier's cynical way of telling us to be on our guard impossible to guard idealistic ideas and we all have to grow up sooner or later.

summary: When a terrorist's body, infected with a stolen chemical, is recovered by the US military, the corpse is cremated, unintentionally releasing the virus/bacteria into the atmosphere over a small island. Soon the infected populace mutate into flesh-hungry zombies, and a trio of soldiers on leave must team up with a group of tourists and board themselves up in an abandoned hotel as they try to fend off the agile and aggressive living dead.
translation: Nobody really understands the logic behind the numbering of Italian zombie flicks, but ?? Honestly ?? Why should we care? Every single movie in the Zombi "series" delivers a lot of fun, evil gore and unnecessary shocks, and "Zombi 3" is no exception, despite all the production difficulties during the shoot. This film started off as an interesting Lucio Fulci project that needed to further develop its "Zombi 2" success, but it ended up being a typical Bruno Mattei product with more errors and stolen ideas from previous films. The script is hopelessly awkward and ignores all forms of continuity, every ingenious idea from George A. Romero's "Night of the Living Dead" and "The Crazies" is shamelessly repeated here and the theatrical performances are truly miserable and painful to watch. But all that did not bother me for a moment because the exaggerated, exaggerated blood compensated for everything! On a secret military base in the Philippines, scientists have completed the bacterial war fever virus "Death One" and prepared it for transport. After a failed attempt to steal the virus, the infested corpse of a terrorist is cremated and the zombie ashes contaminate the entire population of a nearby tourist destination. The last group of survivors must fight hyperactive and inhumanly strong zombies as well as soldiers in white overalls who have been instructed to kill anything that moves in the contaminated area. This movie is comparable to Umberto Lenzi's "Nightmare City". Really bad ... but incredibly entertaining with fast action sequences and several very creative zombie insanity situations. For example, the undead birds were original, and the whole zombie birth sequence in the abandoned hospital was pretty cool. The notorious flying-head scene is nowhere near as horrible as it was invented, and it's a perfect match for this cheesy and thoroughly enjoyable Italian zombie streak. Recommended for the fans; Do not disturb the negative reviews.

summary: Life couldn't get much worse for News Producer Tim O'Hara. He humiliates the one he loves, Brace Channing and ends up getting fired by her father. Then, a Martian from Mars arrives in his home. The Martian adopts the name 'Uncle Martin' and becomes friends with Tim, whilst he fixes his ship. Unaware to Martin, Tim actually wants to reveal him to the world, but can he actually do that to his new friend and 'Uncle'?
translation: Shazbot, that's embarrassing. In fact, here's a list of 100 that makes the embarrassment: 1.) a failed comeback for Christopher Lloyd. 2.) Jeff Daniels basically played the same role he played in the Live 101 Dalmatian remake that was not too juicy at the beginning. He sure has a fun way to promote his Purple Rose Theater ... 3.) Disneffluff. 4.) Another disappointing reminder that Wallace Shawn is for Disney, what Jet Li was for Bob Hoskins in Unleashed. 5.) Ray Walston, the original Martian from the TV series, played a small role ("cameo") in this film and died two years later of Lupus. Coincidence? 6.) terrible special effects. Seriously - terrible. 7th-100th) That damn farting suit by Wayne Knight ("Newman!") Uttered to an annoying degree. My favorite scene? HA! Hahaha! Ha ha ha ha ha ... Phew! ... Quality. You - you are a joker. Okay, let's end this review with a moment of silence for the agonizing death of this franchise, and if you want, you can say a quick prayer that Disney will not forget this travesty and something silly like a movie adaptation of "Mork and Mindy" with Tim Allen ............................................. .. ..........

summary: People are dying mysteriously and gruesomely, and nobody has a clue what the cause is. Only health worker Mike Brady has a possible solution, but his theory of killer slugs is laughed at by the authorities. Only when the body count begins to rise and a slug expert from England begins snooping around does it begin to look like Mike had the right idea after all.
translation: In the whole low-budget story. This movie has to be one of the worst. There are some humorous sides to the movie, but in general it was just awful. I just can not understand which person could not run a bunch of slugs. I mean, they have to be one of the slowest creatures on the planet. The only part worth paying attention to in this film is the close-up of a slug attempt to bite a man's finger. That was pretty amusing.

summary: Sidney Stratton, a humble inventor, develops a fabric which never gets dirty or wears out. This would seem to be a boon for mankind, but the established garment manufacturers don't see it that way; they try to suppress it.
translation:
THE MAN IN THE WHITE ACTION, as if I were ALL RIGHT JACK, takes a weak look at work and capital. Alec Guinness is a scientific genius - but an eccentric one (he never graduated from a ... um ... accident in a college lab). He succeeds in pushing into various industrial laboratories in the textile industry. When the movie starts, he is in the company of Michael Gough, and Gough (in a memorable moment) tries to impress his would-be father-in-law (Cecil Parker) by showing him the shipform company he runs. While having lunch with Parker and Parker's daughter (Joan Greenwood), Gough gets a message regarding some issues about the lab's unexpectedly big budget problems. He reads the huge expenses (because of Guinness's experiments) and chokes on his coffee.

Guinness continues to work for Parker's company, repeating the same tricks he did with Gough - but Parker discovers it too. Greenwood has discovered what Guinness is working on and persuades Parker to continue the experiments (but now legally). The result: Guinness and his assistant have apparently figured out how to make an artificial fiber that can constantly alter the electronic bonds within their molecular structure so that (in every way) the fiber stays intact forever. Any textile made from it will never fade, get dirty or wear out - it will last forever.

Guinness has support from a female trust, but not from her boss. He sees Guinness as a clearance sale to the rich. But when he explains what he has done, they turn against him. If everyone has clothes that last forever, he does not need new clothes! Soon, Parkers' textile tycoons (led by Gough, Ernest Theisinger - in a wonderful performance, and Howard Marion-Crawford) are all equally panicked, which could end their dealings. They try to suppress the invention. With only Greenwood in his corner (though Parker somehow sympathizes with him), Guinness tries to bring the news of his discovery to the public.

In the end, Guinness is defeated by both science and greed. But he finishes the movie because he sees the mistake in his calculations, and we suspect that one day he might even go through his discovery.

It's a brilliant comedy. But is the argument for oppression valid? At one point, the difficulties in making the fabric are shown (you need to heat the threads to a high temperature to actually join the ends of the material.) There is nothing that shows that the cloth stretches when the owner gets fat ( or contract if the owner gets thin.) Should we believe that people just want one set of clothes forever? What happened to fashion changes and new styles? And the cloth is made only in the color white (Guinness looks like a white from Ritter) We are told that color staining would have to be added sooner, would not that be due to the chemical reactions that sustain the structure of the fabric?

Unfortunately, that's not the case of a scientific paper, though a film about the hypocrisy of work and capital in modern industry, as such it is brilliant, but these questions, which I mention, constantly bother me about the validity of the oppression of Guinness invention

summary: A doctor specializing in bats, and his new wife interrupt their honeymoon to go spelunking in Carlsbad Cavern. There he is bitten by a fruit bat and inexplicably undergoes a transformation into a vampire bat. He ultimately escapes, however, escaping back to the caves. His wife, infected by her husband, kills the local constabulary and goes to join him.
translation: Unless the title is supposed to be a kind of spoiler for the transformation of the woman (the devils who are ruining it for us). Anyway, if this movie was not Made-For-TV, it should have been, he's so remarkably low-budget, stocky, underacted, and hits all 70s clich√©s except disco. No one is sympathetic, and you could be careless about what's happening to anyone in this one. Except for the bad, bad performances.

summary: Disillusioned and temporarily rudderless, John Woodson is about to experience a dramatic and profound metamorphosis. Through a mysterious set of coincidences, he finds himself on an adventure to Peru in search of ancient scrolls, known as the Celestine Prophecy. The prophecy and its nine key insights, predict a new awakening that redefines human life and provides a glimpse into a completely spiritual culture on earth. Resistant at first, skeptical and unsure, John finds that each step he takes, each person he encounters leads him to a new awakening. It is only in this letting go that he finds his destiny and comes to understand the meaning that had escaped him when his adventure began.
translation:
I've never seen anything as horrible as this movie. The movie was boring, long and terrible. The special effects stink like hell - it's like a movie in 1999. It's a total waste of an hour and a half of my time. Matthew Settle's appearance was pretty bad. I saw him in Band of Brothers, the Lt. Speirs were playing, he was not that bad. Not bad at all. But in this movie his acting was not convincing enough, it was pretty bad and there was no chemistry between the rest of the team. Besides, his eyes seem empty, as if he did not feel it. It really surprised me because he was good at Band of Brothers.

Anyway, do not even look at this movie. It's a big, big waste of time. Even if you have to kill an hour or two, you should do something other than watch this movie. Trust me, you will regret it!

summary: Hoping for a more exciting life than the suburban drawl he currently inhabits, nerdy salary man Morgan Sullivan takes a job as an industrial spy at Digicorp, a global computer corporation. Digicorp assigns him the duty of flying to various conventions around America, recording the speeches that are made. But when Sullivan meets a mysterious woman he begins to realize that his job may not be what it seems, as he descends into a dark underworld of brainwashing and struggles to maintain his own identity.
translation:
Cypher is a movie you should have seen because it is not the usual sci-fi movie. The artistic approach is painted with dark scenes and a kind of macro-view of what is going on. The close-up of the camera shows the director holding the plot illusory. The science-fiction aspect of the film is secondary to the plot of the film. The technology used in the film is not overly impressive, but the director uses the props well.

The character development is deliberately flat. The main character, Jeremy Northam, decides to delve into the world of espionage. It is up to the audience to find out its enigmatic character and it is the puzzle that interests the audience until the very end.

summary: Tom Smothers stars as the brave mountie, who along with his trusty horse and bitter deputy Paul Reubens must track down a killer who is stalking coeds at a nearby cheerleader camp.
translation:
"Pandemonium" is a horror movie parody that sounds dumber than funny. Believe me, when I tell you, I love comedies. Especially comedy parodies. "Airplane", "The Naked Gun" trilogy, "Blazing Saddles", "High Anxiety" and "Spaceballs" are some of my favorite comedies spoofing a particular genre. "Pandemonium" is not up there with these films. Most scenes in this movie left me in stunned silence because the movie was not so funny. There are a few laughs in the movie, but when you watch a comedy, you expect much more than just a couple of times and that's all the movie has for it. Geez, "Scream" had laughed more than this movie and that was more of a horror movie. How bizarre is that?

* 1/2 (out of four)

summary: A father and his son live together in a roof-top apartment. They have lived alone for years in their own private world, full of memories and daily rites. Sometimes they seem like brothers. Sometimes even like lovers. Following in his father's path, Aleksei attends military school. He likes sports, tends to be irresponsible and has problems with his girlfriend. She is jealous of Aleksei's close relationship with his father. Despite knowing that all sons must one day live their own lives, Aleksei is conflicted; his father knows he should accept a better job in another city, perhaps search for a new wife, but who will ease the pain of Aleksei's nightmares?
translation:
This movie is beautiful to watch, but it's like seeing really bad experimental theater. The plot (if there was one) makes no sense. But it is very "artistic". Many shots of half-dressed actors looking each other in the eye. Many artistic shots through windows and with people outside the frame. Marbles and people wander wistfully. Lingering close-ups of faces and bodies. When you're three with the cat on the roof, you're ready to throw a bottle of KY on the screen.

It's about the relationship between father and son, but you'll just want them to only deal with each other and with each other. If you always wanted to see bad Russian gay porn without cash, your wish is fulfilled.

summary: Four 1950's cultural icons (Albert Einstein, Marilyn Monroe, Joe DiMaggio and Senator Joseph MacCarthy) who conceivably could have met and probably didn't, fictionally do in this modern fable of post-WWII America. Visually intriguing, the film has a fluid progression of flash-backs and flash-forwards centering on the fictional Einstein's current observations, childhood memories and apprehensions for the future.
translation:
Nicolas Roeg's projects are, to say the least, variable, but no less interesting. "Insignificance" is obviously first and foremost an adapted set design: it is literally and quite "space bound". BUT, it pays to see this movie more than once: the underlying themes are not exposed, and it takes a while to adapt to the juxtaposition and role reversal of the four protagonists: Einstein, McCarthy, Munroe and DiMaggio.

Einstein is plagued by guilt over Hiroshima, but he believes the simplicity of a sexual connection with Munro; Munro is tired of being seen as a Bimbo and longs for intellectual credibility; Senator McCarthy is at the height of his witch hunt, but he is an impotent parasite; DiMaggio is uncertain about his fame, self obsessed and vulnerable to violence. Each of them contains the seeds of their own destruction. Every character has a troubled, abused past and a questionable future. Gradually, we see that obsession itself is the central theme. America's obsession with its cultural icons and customs of the postwar period; the obsessions of the protagonists for something that no one can have: peace and / or happiness.

Compared to the Theory of Relativity, a proposed unit field theory, and even the cosmos itself, all efforts and interactions of Roeg's protagonists seem insignificant. But these aspects of the physical universe (it's all quantum, trust me!) Influence us when they are applied to the development of the means to destroy us. Monroe's mention of the principle behind the neutron bomb (without calling it as such) is not an anachronism per se, but can only be understood by a contemporary public. In fact, ALL references within the script are only accessible to a knowledgeable observer: an author with '50s events / personality cults and how they affect us in the 21st century.

This film and its script are either very, very smart or extremely opaque and pretentious. Ultimately, however, probably insignificant.

live long and thrive :)

summary: After his father's death, a young man (Gregor Bakovic) uses the black mourning flag and sews himself a pair of trousers. He then takes a train trip and meets a variety of bizarre characters, including a stowaway, a deaf-mute duo, a balloon-seller, a bird enthusiast, and an attractive girl (Barbara Cerar). Their railway romance gets derailed, but a variety of sight gags and caboose comics keep the film on track and in loco motion.
translation:
... if this movie proves so well that they are indeed unnecessary.

Although a few lines, it was kind of weird to see this movie, no subtitles, in an unknown language. A friend of mine sent a VHS, including a few pieces of paper with all the lines translated into English. with their translation next to me, I started to see this story (it's actually a story), and I was stuck by the first tunes of the whistling melody in the opening credits. the colors, this minimal acting (well, in most cases), absurd comedy, slapstick, thoughtful, beautiful ... along with a few other films (Paris, Texas and Nenette et Boni), this is capable of having to speak to everyone - without words. Whenever you get the chance, you see it. Whatever you do - do not miss it. It is a unique experience. Oh, actors are great, the soundtrack is brilliant, the story is simple and told a thousand times - but rarely (never?) Sun.

summary: In England, when the naive Emilio buys an old van, he invites his friends Judd, Molly and Andrew and his sister Ally to travel to a lake in the woods. They get lost and while trying to get directions in a bar in the road to follow the trip, they are scared by a crazy old man, who tells that there are missing persons on the spot. Then, Emilio runs over a woman and she faints. The group sees a mailbox in the roadside and Judd, Molly and Andrew enter in the forest trying to get some help. Along the night, they are chased by naked fallen angels thirsty of blood and their keeper.
translation:
I've seen a lot of movies and rarely would I ever rate a movie "1", but this movie was beyond terrible.

The acting was terrible, the plot was ridiculous, the effects were unrealistic and the characters were annoying. Normally, when I watch scary movies, I think it's DUMB when the characters hear a noise in the house / forest / school / etc and then screams, "Hello, is anyone there?" - But at least they are credible when they do it. This movie could not even do it right.

This is a movie that will make other B horror films like Venom and The Fog look like Academy Award winning masterpieces.

I always have an open mind when watching movies and I can only say that this movie was a complete waste of time and I write this comment so everyone else thinks to watch this movie think again. IT IS HARMFUL!

summary: A director is casting dancers for a large production. Large numbers of hopefulls audition, hoping to be selected. Throughout the day, more and more people are eliminated, and the competition gets harder. Eventually, approximately a dozen dancers must compete for a few spots, each hoping to impress the director with their dancing skill. But, is this really what the director is looking for?
translation:
By the time this movie was released, I had seen Chorus Line on stage four times, eagerly anticipating the long-awaited production of a film in the story. My wife and I were in the hours before the opening of the box office on the day of the release of the film. It was not only a disappointment, it was a kick in the stomach.

At first, the story was "shifted outward" by recording scenes that were not within the boundaries of the theater. These limits are a big part of the meaning and impact of the story.

Second & Third Together (Assign Your Own Order): One of the original songs with a very dynamic dance number has been removed; A song that was NOT in the stage production was added. Say what ?? I'm confused!

The only reason I gave this movie 2 stars instead of 1 is my admiration for the talent and hard work of the performers. I've seen Chorus Line on stage six times now and I would not mind seeing it six more times before I die. It's great written, with wonderful music and heartbreaking true stories. If you want to see a musical that features a big cattle call audition, I recommend All That Jazz. If you want to see the story of A Chorus Line, you will see it on stage.

summary: A widow discovers after her husband's suicide that he has mortgaged everything they own and the banks are ready to foreclose. Faced with impending doom and little working knowledge except her ability to grow plants, she struggles to save her home. Enter her gardener, who is struggling to make a few marijuana plants grow in a hidden location and suggests that she use her green house to help grow the plants and sell them to make the money both need. He is wanting to get married, but needs capital. What he doesn't know is that his girl friend is pregnant and thus fears that they will be busted for growing marijuana. While supposedly working, the whole village is well aware of the endeavor and is hoping for their success. When the plants come in, Grace takes the crop to London and tries to sell it to a ruthless, but charming drug dealer. Everything busts loose from there.
translation:
"Saving Grace" is never funny, but it does make for a good laugh and I really enjoyed it. Brenda Blethyn is a good actress and does a great job in portraying widow Grace, who grows on marijuana to pay off her massive debts. The supporting role also does a good job. French actor Tchecky Karyo has a funny little role. The premise alone is appealing. The idea that a woman would grow and smoke over the mountain sounds funny enough. And the film sometimes plays with the premise. Of course, there are shallow moments, like one in which two older women hold Grace's tea leaf marijuana leaves and start making childish antics in the shop where they work. That was a mindless gag that did not really stand out. The sound of the film is dejected and sometimes boring, but I laughed enough to give this English import a recommendation.

My result: 7 (out of 10)

summary: Get on the Bus follows several Black men on a cross country bus trip to the Million Man March. On the bus are an eclectic set of characters including a laid off aircraft worker, a former Gang Banger, a Hollywood actor, a cop who is of mixed racial background, and a White bus driver, all make the trek discussing issues surrounding the march, manhood, religion, politics, and race.

summary: An examination of Islam, violence, and the fate of the non-Muslim world.
translation:
It is not obvious to look at this film (so I recommend to the viewers to research the people presenting their case), but this talk about the realities of Islam and its encouragement of violence and intolerance towards all non-Muslims is lacking Objectivity and also completely failed to consider the human condition. It is one thing to document that the Koran says many things about how a pious Muslim has to interact with non-Muslims, but any realist can realize that not every person who feels he or she is a follower of Islam agrees with all the principles to this belief and system and follow it. There is reason to question much about the moderators so that viewers must view the presentation with a healthy skepticism; Do not swallow everything, hake, line, and sinker without thinking of anything.

A specific, for example, explores the person Walid Shoebat; who claims to be a former Muslim who committed a terrorist attack in Bethlehem. There are many ways in the world that believe none of these allegations. I am not yet I was Muslim. I never read the Koran. I am not a Christian, nor a member of any faith. But I am an intelligent and demanding person. While the film is quite disturbing in its depiction, how some Muslims see their commitment to Islam; I remind you that Islam is more than the views of the fundamentalists. Just as fundamentalists and evangelical Christians are, there are differences in the intensity of faith and commitment among Jews and Muslims.

If you see this movie, you have to turn on the salt shaker hand. A grain will not be enough, you will need more. Please use your own thoughts and think for yourself, research what is being presented, and assess the state of the world and how Islam fits in based on more than what is said in 98 minutes of video. There is a red thread of political affiliation among those who put this film together, indicating a certain bias. Be your own brain.

summary: In the future, humanity has constructed several space colonies. But the corrupt Treize and his organization Oz have manipulated the United Earth Sphere Alliance into controlling earth and its colonies with an iron fist. To counteract this extreme measure, rebel colonies launch Operation: Meteor; an attempt to smuggle Mobile Suits made of Gundanium alloy to earth to combat the corruption and free earth and the colonies from Oz's control. One of these "Gundams" is piloted by Heero Yuy, who is shot down and is forced to blend in to enemy society. Now up against social issues with a girl named Relena and Oz and its puppets, Heero must unite with other rebels and save his people.
translation:
Dear Readers,

With high expectations, people are leaving Earth to begin a new life in space colonies. However, the Allied forces of the United Earth Sphere Alliance will receive great military control over the colonies and will soon seize one colony after another in the name of justice and peace ...

The year is after Colony 195. Operation Meteor , To counteract the tyranny of the Alliance, rebel forces from several colonies are sending new arsenals to the ground, camouflaged as shooting stars ... Anyway ... The Alliance forces are beginning ...

Gundam Wing is the most popular and successful of the entire Gundam series. Featuring state-of-the-art anime animation, stunning action, fantastic mobile suits, stunning scripts and some of the most memorable characters in anime history.

I will try to explain the plot of Gundam Wing as well as possible. The Earth has now settled in space, but the UESA forces have forcibly taken them, along with the help of the mysterious elite Force OZ and their shadowy leaders Treize Kushrenada and the Romefeller Foundation. Five pilots are sent to Earth to control mobile suits of extraordinary power, the Gundams. Pursued by the mysterious Lieutenant Zechs Merquise, Treize's deputy, a young teenager named Relena, and the Alliance military, the Gundam pilots unleash hell for the freedom of the colonies all along, a conspiracy that is the darkest. Treize begins begin.

Signed, The Constant DVD Collector

summary: What happens when you throw two guys who hate each other together. A cool call center executive Jimmy Cliff (Saif Ali Khan), a desi wannabe gangster Bachchan Pande (Akshay Kumar) add for good measure a beautiful girl Pooja (Kareena Kapoor) who cant be trusted - on a journey across spectacular India - a journey which will alter the course of their lives in more ways than one - a journey where even enemies need to trust each other if they want to stay alive. Trouble is, in this world no one can be trusted ever. And to top it all there is the evil eye of Bhaiyyaji (Anil Kapoor - Slumdog Millionaire and 24), maverick gangster who enjoys killing people as much as he enjoys learning to speak English.
translation: The sight of Kareena Kapoor in a two piece bikini is the only thing that wakes you up while watching Tashan ?? the mega-disappointing, startling new movie in theaters this weekend. Bad movies are bad movies and we see them every week, but Tashan is not just a bad movie, it's a horrible movie. Terrible, because it takes its audience for granted, also because the filmmakers expect to get away without a conspiracy or common sense just because they have big movie stars on board. Written and directed by Vijay Krishna Acharya, Tashan is what you would describe as a road movie, but one that goes in the wrong directions. Saif Ali Khan plays the lead role in Jimmy Cliff, a call center manager who teaches English to Bhaiyyaji - this is Anil Kapoor, who plays an ambitious UP gangster who desperately wants to be cool. Jimmy keeps an eye out for Pooja, the gangster's pretty young assistant (played by Kareena Kapoor), who uses Jimmy to cheat her boss of 25 crore rupees. Determined to regain his money and punish both Jimmy and Pooja, Bhaiyyaji recruits his most trusted henchman to complete the job. So you have Akshay Kumar as Bachchan Pandey, the gangster loyalist from Kanpur, who tracks down the culprits and recovers the stolen money that is scattered all over the country. Like those awful eighties, Tashan is also held together by them, a threadbare script centered on a vendetta plot. But the treatment is so over-the-top, so forgiving that it can not connect. Instead of a coherent script or a traditional three-axis structure, you'll get a handful of phrases around which most of the scenes are laid out loosely. This shrill thing in the desert, the action scene in a Rajasthani fort, Kareeena's bikini moment, even this ridiculous climate-action scene with Shaolin monks, a water motorcycle racing through a filthy Naala and whether you believe it or not not a Dhanna-style horse Tonga. To be fair, not all of these set pieces are done badly - the item song in the desert is actually quite neat - but very little of it makes sense in the larger picture, because one can easily go from one piece to another using the script really. Little expected in a seemingly rapid road movie to find a disgusting sentimental flashback track about childhood love. One sees the problem with Tashan that no one is familiar with this movie, which movie they made. What's more, I do not think they did care - the movie stinks of arrogance. Arbitrarily, they pack up elements from every genre without really stopping and seeing if the mix works, Tashan is like a stew stew.There are movies that kill you quietly, and then there's Tashan, a movie that puts you through excess kills. Packed in dazzling camerawork, exotic locations, and fancy costumes, each frame of the movie probably costs a couple of lakhs together, but in the end, it still feels like a hollow, because the story does not last. Getting the Tarantino tale and the style of Stephen Chow does not help, either, because they do not merge with the gossamer action of the film. You could have complained a little less about it if the characters were more appealing, but Anil Kapoor's annoying Hinglish dialogue lets you cut your wrists, and Saif Ali Khan gropes his way silly through the movie, unable to find his feet. Kareena Kapoor, now queen of exaggerated delivery, is doing a decent job. But if Tashan is saved to some degree, it is of course thanks to Akshay Kumar's irresistible presence and spontaneous approach to the character. You're upset when he cries out in the crotch, and you look scowling as he delivers those ambiguous dialogues, but for a moment you can not take your eyes off the screen when he's up there. Despite good music by Vishal-Shekhar, the songs seem like they only prolong your misery. Well, Tashan is a test of your patience. If you did not know, Tashan means style. I'm sorry to say this movie has none.

summary: Bo and Luke Duke are southern cousins. In Hazzard County, Bo and Luke help their Uncle Jesse and their sexy cousin Daisy run the Moonshine business and always getting into trouble with Sherriff Roscoe P. Coltrane and recklessly driving in their orange car "General Lee". Boss Hogg, the mean and corrupt local county commissioner who hates The Dukes evicts The Dukes from their farm. Bo and Duke travels to Atlanta and meets up with old friend Katie Johnson and her friend Annette as they set out to find out why Boss Hogg has evicted them from their farm and what he plans to do. With local ace race car driver Billy Prickett in town to take part in the Annual Hazzard Road Race rally, Bo and Luke sets out to save their farm and foil Boss Hogg's scheme.
translation:
I'm a big fan of the Dukes of Hazzard TV Show. And I really enjoyed this movie. I had a lot more fun here than with other summer blockbusters.

It's funny to hear that people are complaining about this movie with apologies like "lame plot" and "it's a lot coarser than the show". Does anyone remember the rawness of humor in the pilot episode? Daisy makes incest jokes and Bo says that Luke probably fathered half the children in the orphanage. The only reason that it has been cleaned up is because it has changed and used to be timeslot.

And as far as the plot goes. It was the perfect Dukes plot. In fact, as a remake, it probably remains true to the source material, as any TV show that has wandered off the big screen.

While Sean William Scott and Johnny Knoxville are not as EXACTLY as their small screen versions, they do a great job and work very well together. I was not keen on Burt's boss Hogg. And I would have a little more incompetence from Sheriff Roscoe. In the movie Roscoe is a little ... scary.

And who had no smile on her face as General Lee races through the streets of Atlanta and the back streets of Hazzard? Br />
People, allow yourself to enjoy a movie that's just an excuse for nostalgia, bikinis and car chases, you will not apologize. It's just a great dumb movie!

summary: Al, Louise, Max and Sy - four literary types who work in the theater business - are discussing what they believe to be the real life truths underlying their work, Max who writes primarily tragic plays, and Sy who writes primarily comic plays. Al proceeds to tell them a real story of a troubled woman named Melinda Robicheaux showing up unexpectedly at a door in the middle of an important business dinner party. Melinda long ago left her physician husband to embark on a relationship with who she initially believed to be the man of her dreams, which ended up not being the case. Melinda tries to put her life back together with the help of select people at the dinner party, some who have their own ulterior motives. Melinda's appearance also opens up the cracks existing in the marriage of one of the couples at the dinner party, while it leads to the dissolution of a friendship that has existed since college. With this basic outline of a story, Max and Sy try to make their point of life being...
translation:
Possible spoilers.

Although there was a good show - especially Chloe Sevigny and Radha Mitchell in the comedy half - it was not an engaging movie. The transitions between the part of the comedy and the part of the tragedy were clumsy or sometimes not obvious. This viewer was initially confused by the fact that the support bandage differs in the two halves; I thought, with the way things were laid out in the opening scene, that the people who surrounded Melinda would be the same people, just reacting differently (more like a "He Said, She Said" premise). But what we have are two completely different stories and two completely different women, both played by Radha Mitchell.

The two playwrights in the opening scene - the comedian and the tragedian - supposedly take the same premise and go from there, but the two stories are only tenaciously related. They do little to support the topic of discussion that almost anything can be considered comedy or tragedy. Nice cast, but a disappointing movie.

summary: In ancient Rome, the people finally oust their despised king, Tarquinius, and declare the city a republic. Tarquinius makes an alliance with the Etruscan king, Porsenna, to take back power in Rome, but a Roman general, the heroic Mucius, sets out to stop him.
translation:
In the United States, very few films were shot about Rome that did not come into being during or shortly after Julius Caesar's time. Hollywood's sword and sandal epics usually have a Christian theme, which makes it difficult to go back to earlier Roman history (Spartacus was probably the first exception to this rule and met with resistance in Hollywood because Jesus was not in it) />
It is interesting to see at least one image that takes place not only before the time of Caesar and Christ, but also when Rome was just one city among many on the Italian peninsula and had just ousted the hated King Tarquin and formed the Republic ,

But this is not a historical movie; it's peplum, and while production values ‚Äã‚Äãare not ground, the acting and characterizations are cardboard. I can only imagine what the dialogue was in Italian, but with the wooden English dubbing it is very cheesy. I made some good laughs out of it first.

I have not seen many movies of this genre since I missed most of the 60's Hercules movies. It's funny to some extent, but if the movie goes on, it gets a bit boring.

One thing is certain: If I had seen this film at the age of ten, I would have loved it. At this age, I have done everything possible with Romans and swordfights. At least this movie brought back some childhood memories.

summary: When relaxed and charming Ben Wrightman meets workaholic Lindsey Meeks she finds him sweet and charming, they hit it off and when it is winter Ben can spend every waking hour with Lindsey, but when summer comes around the corner Lindsey discovers Ben's obsession with the Boston Red Sox. She thinks it is perfect until everything goes downhill for them.
translation:
I got this movie about a month ago and am now a fan of Drew Barrymore. I love a happy ending and this movie gives a brilliant with the truths of Red Sox! It's about a math teacher who takes some promising kids on a math ride to a company where the successful Lindsey (Drew) shows them some information. This then leads to the Ben (teacher) and Lindsey dating. But it's not all easy when he confesses he's a massive Red Sox fanatic.

First of all, things are fine, but then his baseball gets in the way of Lindsey's life. In the end, everything is fine and it took a shot to let Drew run across the field !! I got it for two pounds in blockbusters, so I was happy. If you like such films, I suggest you watch Drew's works like Charlie's Angel and 50 first dates or even her new movie with Hugh Grant in "Music and Lyrics".

summary: Riding her bicycle on her way to school, a dreamy, ten-year-old, red-haired farm girl decides to take a shortcut through a ruddy and luscious autumn forest, somewhere in the mountainous region of eastern France. Unexpectedly, the young girl encounters a bright-eyed red fox, however, the untamed wild animal flees in an instant, leaving her longing to meet again. Since then, a whole winter has passed and still no sign of the elusive fox, but with the arrival of spring, the girl determined to find the animal, finally locates its den and an ambitious effort to grow accustomed to each other begins. As we witness a succession of compelling scenes, lost inside the enchanting and breathlessly exquisite landscape, we observe the bond between a human and a savage animal grow gradually stronger, yet, a wish and question emerge. If only we, humans, could talk to the wild beasts, and if we could, could we ever become friends?
translation: I saw this movie with the most positive expectations. I had seen Jacquet's previous movie (March of the Penguins) and had heard a very positive review of it on the radio. I was very disappointed. Above all, this movie is terribly boring. Literally NOTHING happened. I tried to describe the content of the film to a friend, and we both laughed because I could only stammer things: "Well then winter comes, and then spring, and then there's an eagle and a river and once it's there dark, and the girl goes into a cave, and another time the fox has babies "and so on. After about half an hour, I sighed, yawned, rolled my eyes, cursed the radio station reviewer, and hoped it would soon be over. But the movie went on and on. When it finally came to an end, I had fallen so low in my chair that I looked a bit like Stephen Hawking. The most annoying parts of the film are (a) The girl who is obviously there to give children someone to identify with. She wears the same clothes throughout the movie (one year) and shows exactly two facial expressions: joy and sincerity. She is cute, no question. A film about the beauty of nature, like this one, would have gone better without its all too human presence. I was constantly hoping that she could be eaten by a bear, drowned in the river, or become similarly terrible. (b) The commentary on the girl's adult voice telling us nothing but negligible, obvious, boring, superfluous things. (c) The music that is desperately subtle. When the girl jumps around happily, the music jumps around too. If the fox is threatened by an eagle, the music also becomes threatening. It reminded me of the early days of filmmaking and was just too predictable. Granted, many of the kids who watched the movie with me obviously liked it, at least they got involved somehow. Therefore, my warning only applies to adults: If you are over ten years old, avoid this movie. You can get better (and cheaper) sleep in most other places.

summary: The photographer Leon lives with his girlfriend and waitress Maya waiting for a chance to get in the photo business. When Maya contacts their friend Jurgis, he schedules a meeting for Leon with the successful owner of arts gallery Susan Hoff; she analyzes Leon's work and asks him to improve the quality of his photos. During the night, the upset Leon decides to wander on the streets taking pictures with his camera, and he follows three punks down to the subway station; when the gang attacks a young woman, Leon defends her and the guys move on. On the next morning, Leon discovers that the woman is missing. He goes to the police station, but Detective Lynn Hadley does not give much attention to him and discredits his statement. Leon becomes obsessed to find what happened with the stranger and he watches the subway station. When he sees the elegant butcher Mahogany in the train, Leon believes he might be a murderer and stalks him everywhere, in the beginning of his journey to the darkness.
translation: I've heard and read many eulogies about "Midnight Meat Train" based on a short story by no less than Clive Barker and supposedly the best adaptation of his work since the original "Hellraiser" he directed himself, but so far I can only do a lot to express mixed feelings about my visual experience. The best term to put the whole movie into words is: disgusting! The violence is sadistic and extreme, which undoubtedly attracts fanatical young horror fans, but it's also indescribable and exploitative. Normally, I'm very pro-violent, but it has to serve at least some purpose. The butcher ?? literally? "Midnight Meat Train" is designed solely to shock and knock back viewers with weak nervous systems and easily cause stomach discomfort, and even this is not fully effective due to the use of digital computer effects. There are more imperfections, some even bigger than the pointless blood, but maybe I should focus on the good elements first. The basic concept is definitely promising and several sequences (such as the Chase in the freezer) literally swell with nerve-racking tension and macabre atmosphere. Unfortunately, the timing is very uneven and the elaboration of the potentially fantastic plot is unnecessarily complicated. Probably processing a short story into a long feature film scenario is responsible for the timing irregularities, but I really think they could have done more with the resolution as well as the character of Vinnie Jones. The plot introduces Leon, an aspiring photographer in New York whose agent advises to search through sinister images for the truly threatening face of the city. Leon then becomes obsessed with stalking an introverted and suspicious butcher who always awaits the midnight train. Leon is right, because the butcher turns out to be a relentless serial killer who literally smashes his victims with a big hammer, but the murderer's motivation and behavior suggests that something much more important is running on the rails at night. "Midnight Meat Train" takes place in naturally disturbing locations such as subway stations at night and animal slaughterhouses, but the film also benefits from good acting performances and a truckload of downright disturbing images (such as carcass on meat hook and blood smeared train wagons) Director Ry√ªhei Kitamura ("Versus", "Godzilla Final Wars") does not exploit everything. The ending leaves a lot of questions unanswered and, even if Clive Barker would think so, I still think we deserved a slightly more conclusive finale. "Midnight Meat Train" is a somewhat intriguing and definitely haunting film, but not without specifications. It is not intended for slightly offended viewers, but maybe people looking for coherence and clarity should leave it alone.

summary: After several years apart, old friends Nina and Michael reunite in Germany, accompanied by Michael's associate, David. The three decide to take a weekend trip into the woods to escape the stress of their lives and relax for a few days. Unfortunately, the woods are inhabited by a long-forgotten family of cannibalistic mountain people - and these three look like the perfect meal.
translation:
A group of friends face a family of vile cannibals as they camp in the beautiful German countryside.

The concept of the mutant cannibal family is almost as old as the hills that the inbred freaks often call home, so any director who tries to breathe new life into the genre, have to come up with something special to impress. With Barricade Timo Rose tries to give the well-worn routine a Teutonic twist by transplanting the plot to the Black Forest and giving her the German low-budget splatter treatment. The result is a very bloody but totally unoriginal effort that is made almost unimaginable thanks to some terrible directing decisions - especially the incessant use of fancy filters and irritating editing techniques.

Had Timo Rose decided not to use every trick his editing software offered, and then perhaps Barricade had been a pretty entertaining Glefest: his inexperienced troupe was doing reasonably well. the bloody effects are suitably gastric vertebrae; and there are a scare or two and even some well thought out scary moments. However, all of this is completely destroyed by the terrible camera work, the restless editing and the overwhelming flood of visual gimmicks that give the film the desperate look that is so inexplicably popular with today's filmmakers.

I'm giving Barricade 3 out of 10 for the weird Gore, which has a nifty scene where a guy needs to drink acid, lots of nasty wounds caused by a lot of spicy gadgets, and some pretty proper shotgun damage.

summary: Marshall Lawson loses his strike-team in a cold-blooded and seemingly random attack. After this he takes it upon himself to investigate the suspicious circumstances of the brutal killings. Soon he uncovers CTX Majestic, a covert military operation so secret, that now the military wants Marshall eliminated. Resolute in his pursuit, Marshall engages in a merciless battle with a drug dealer operation that appears to be secretly funded by a rogue arm of the military.

summary: A secret Service agent and a news reporter investigate the conspiracy behind the assassination of the President.
translation:
I think it's possible I've seen worse movies, but this one is a real stinker! The plot is unremarkable, but that's not the worst. The direction is not nearly as expected from Andy Ching. He is able to do a good job, but he did not manage to pull this movie together.

Angie Harmon starred as a reporter urging the murder of the president and really slaughtered the role. there was no chemistry with the good, her behavior was flat and wooden, and the 5-inch stiletto he wore throughout the movie was absurd.
