summary: With a combination of documentary footage and animation, the science and history of rockets, and the effects of space travel on man are illustrated.
translation:
Oh, where are you going, my little one, kid ...

Turn around and you're two, turn around and you're four ...

I remember me to those shows when they first aired in Disneyland. I remember sitting there, electrified by Werner Van Braune's explanations of rocket science. I watched as history, science, and humor were woven together in a compelling story of possibilities.

That was fifty years ago. And the shows are back in the Disney Treasures series, and what a treasure they are. I watched her last night and tonight with my 8 year old daughter, who did not even come into the room at first, but later changed her mind when she saw that they were partially animated. As she watched, I watched her and in the end she was almost as engrossed as me.

Turn around and you're a young woman with her own babies ...

Certainly, some of the predictions about the moon were wrong. But there is a lot of information that is still pretty accurate, and the overall presentation is still impressive. I thought that my daughter's teacher wanted to show her to her class, not just as a 50-year-old artifact, but also as an entertaining and easy-to-understand lesson in history.

Turn around, turn around and around again ... you wonder how much has really changed in 50 years.

summary: Nasik-based Heerendra Dhaan and Raj Ranade are bodyguards of a politician, but after their employer is implicated in a scam, they end up assaulting a police officer and flee to Mumbai. Once there they meet with Rambhabhai, who in turn, gets them employed with a gangster named Shambhu. After a short while the duo are apprehended by Police Inspector Narsimha, questioned, and after they agree to cooperate to bring down Shambhu, are let go. The two do succeed in assisting the police arrest Shambhu, but they themselves are arrested, tried in Court, and sentenced to a year in jail. After their discharge they are met with Inspector Narsimha, who wants to recruit them to capture and kill dreaded bandit Babban Singh, who had slaughtered his wife, Kavita, and son, Subbu, as well as cut his arms off. Heerendra and Raj agree to carry out this task for 8 Lakh Rupees. They re-locate to Kaliganj where Heerendra falls in love with auto-rickshaw driver, Ghungroo, while Raj gives his heart to Subbu's ...
translation: Every now and then in Indian cinema there is a movie like Sholay, which changes the way the audience perceives a good movie. And only now and then (hopefully) we have a RGV Ki Aag, which breaks all standards and creates its own. A standard so low that it can never be broken. Ram Gopal Varma manages to take a crucible of talent and create a dish so stale that you can smell it from afar. Taking a classic like Sholay and murdering is totally unforgivable and I can not believe he almost called the movie RGV ki Sholay. Although Sholay contained many folklore elements, the film managed to build on its plot by defining the characters so clearly that they lived on forever. What Aag does is take those characters and confuse them so much that we need a fight to find the worst. The realism element is completely missing and what the film ultimately delivers is a group of "actors" parading in a less and seemingly unrelated set of events. A star for this film is a ridiculous waste of a voice. it is time for RGV to become aware of the reality of its failure and conjure up another "other" action that can be classified under the cinema.

summary: In 1692, a young girl in Salem, Massachusetts accuses several residents of being witches, and they are burned at the stake. In 1980, a young woman who is a descendant of the accuser finds herself having recurring nightmares about the incident and comes to believe she is being terrorized by the ghost of the father of the women who were burned as witches.
translation: On the seemingly endless search for well-made, well-played horror films, it's rarely possible to find one that even comes close to the goal. Needless to say, I was very pleasantly surprised when I came across "Burned at the Stake" on a US cable network while leafing through channels. The premise is relatively simple. In 1692, the young Ann Putnam (Swift) is the loudest witness against alleged witches and drives away gratuitous charges against anyone who deserves their displeasure. It is manipulated by Reverend Parris (Peters), who also acts as a court leader in matters of witchcraft and Satanism. Things get complicated when Ann starts accusing members of the Goode family of witchcraft. Salem (from 1980 or so), Loreen Graham (also played by Swift) begins unusual visions just before she visits the Salem Witch Museum. A stranger in a 17th-century robe tries to receive her there and the building. He continues to pursue them, while strange phenomena increasingly involve them. Soon it seems that she is obsessed by Ann Putnam's spirit. Unfortunately, another description is more involved and would betray too much. Although the film is not action-oriented and is probably of little interest to many viewers, the performances are good and the seventeenth-century dialogue in the many flashbacks of the film sounds very convincing. The production values ‚Äã‚Äãare solid except for some special effects. By the way, the film's technical advisor was Laurie Cabot, Salem's official witch. Spectators who appreciate a well-made, atmospheric, yet unobtrusive horror movie may appreciate this. Author / director Bert I. Gordon has a long career in horror and science fiction filmmaking and is best known for his work on a series of big bug films and related works.

summary: A Baltimore sandwich shop employee becomes an overnight sensation when a photographer's photos he's taken of his weird family become the latest rage in the art world.
translation:
The best part about this movie is that it's fun. It's full of humorous characters and interesting situations, starting with the cheerful, innocent Pecker (played by Edward Furlong), who photographs almost everything he sees in daily life. Other great characters include Pecker's friend Matt ("he's a thief, but he's really a nice guy"), Pecker's sister Chrissy (who's addicted to sugar) and Pecker's Catholic grandmother, who lives in a statue of the Virgin Mary in her Room discovered.

The film delicately depicts how daily life has many riches to offer and manages to emphasize this point without making too much of a fuss. There is always the danger of spreading messages about the value and dignity of the "common people" to slip into a kind of inverted "holier than you" - but "Pecker" avoids these traps and allows the audience to understand the point while allowing Enough scope for viewers to compare this message with their own thoughts on the subject.

I recommend the movie especially because it's a lot of fun.

summary: A private detective kills the wife of one of his most important clients when she refuses to take part in his blackmail scheme and even plans to expose his unsavoury methods to her husband. In an ironic twist, the PA is rehired by his client to assist Columbo in the investigation.
translation:
"Death Lends A Hand" is one of the most important early episodes of "Columbo", which helped define the show for the next thirty years. It's the first of Robert Culps four appearances (three as murderers) playing the same role in every show.

In this case, plays Culp Brimmer, the head of a large detective company, which is asked to investigate whether the wife of the affluent newspaper magnate Kennicut has an affair. Although she is, Brimmer decides not to tell Kennicut in the hope that he can extort his wife in return for information about her husband's business partners. She reacts badly to this suggestion, it comes to a dispute, which quickly becomes violent when Brimmer slaps her face. Because he wears a big ring, the blow hits her and kills her.

There are some truly priceless moments in this episode. One of my favorite scenes is where Columbo pretends to read the palm of his hand, though this is indeed a trick to discover the shape and size of Brimmers Ring, without admitting that he knows the killer wore a ring. Since Columbo is Columbo, he only reveals what he really knows when it's time to turn the screws a bit. At first he plays goofy the role of a rather simple-minded man, who is excited by the "life-line that goes over the moon-hill," or an equally ridiculous, palm-reading hocus-pocus.

Another A great scene is when Brimmer tries to offer Columbo a job for his company and has bribed him to stop poking his nose. Even Columbo does not reveal that he knows what's going on, he pretends to be honored and enthusiastic about this job offer.

And there's one more where Columbo Kennicut before Brimmer says he wishes the murderers could hear their conversation. He wants to point out to Brimmer that he stands by him without directly charging him, so he decides cruelly (but understandably under the circumstances) to play mind games on Brimmer to panic him and do something stupid. What he does of course! The mourning Kennicut is unaware of the subtext of this conversation. It's only about to end that Columbo explains everything to Kennicut (not shown on the screen).

I will not reveal how Columbo finally puts the killer pop in the nail, but let's just say that there is a potato. ..

A really good episode, possibly the best of the first series. If you like it then you will also like "Double Exposure", also with Robert Culp.

summary: Archer Coe has been found dead in his locked bedroom. The cops consider it suicide, but Philo believes otherwise. When the Coroner shows up, he finds that Archer had been hit with a blunt object, stabbed and shot - making suicide unlikely. When the evidence points to his brother, Brisbane is found stabbed to death in the closet. Archer had a number of enemies, any one of which would have been glad to knock him off, but which one did and how did the murder occur in a room looked from the inside. Only one man, the keen, fascinating, debonair detective Philo Vance, would be able to figure out who is the killer.
translation:
There were times when this movie seemed a lot more complicated than it had to be, but I think that's part of its charm. Detective Philo Vance's powers of observation seem to be greater than all the oriental spying noses of the era when it comes to the final assessment of the murders. Dropping the dagger into the Chinese vase was the kicker for me; I mean, could not someone just drop it?

Vance (William Powell) had a line at the beginning of the movie about Archer Coe's "psychological impossibility" of killing himself - I had to think about that for a while. I was wondering if there really is a scientific basis for this concept to be true and I did not study psychology myself. Seems logical, but then there is always the case that does not fit the rules.

You know, I got kicked out of the agitated forensic scientist (Etienne Girardot), who sent me to Star Trek's dr. McCoy, the few times he said, "I'm a doctor, not a magician" and "I'm a doctor, not a detective." I can imagine DeForrest Kelley watching the movie and saying, "I'll need that someday."

Once the killer's identity is revealed, it does not seem like a big surprise, but until then, it's really anyone's guess. Apart from Archer and Brisbane Coe, the film did not answer the central question of the title and the murder I was really interested in - who killed Sir Ghirlie, Sir Thomas MacDonald's dog?

summary: Shyam and Makarand work as photographers in a commercial advertising agency. Both of them like to fool around with women, even though Makarand is engaged to be married to a doctor named Anjali. In order to outsmart each other, they two get into a competition of shooting a photograph, and Sam wins it, goes on a trip to the United States of America. Upon his return, he finds that Makarand is living a very enviable lifestyle with three of the most beautiful girls, who also work as air-hostesses. Sam meets them all, and finds out that the trio are unaware of each other, falls in love with Pooja; and begins several moves to upset Makarand lifestyle, and possibly get promoted as a Supervisor.
translation: Garam Masala is one of the funniest movies I've seen in years. Akshay Kumar is excellent as the womanizer who has affairs with 3 girls and is engaged at the same time. John Abraham is sometimes amusing and this is one of his best works so far. Paresh Rawail is as usual in most of his films. Director Priyadarshan has produced great films in the past. Hera Pheri, Hungama and Hulchul are among the best. Garam Masala is his funniest movie he made. The three newcomer actresses are average. Rimi sen does not get much leeway in this film. I was impressed to see how Priyadarshan made a movie with a simple story of a man who also has an affair with 3 girls. All 3 girls have a day off the same day and land in the same house. Packed with Laughs, this is a non stop entertainer.

summary: A comedy comprised of short sexually suggestive skits.
translation: An update on the skits and jokes you saw on a burlesque stage in the first half of the 20th century. It is a series of several jokes played. Some of them you can tell your grandmother, some not, but it's a pretty sure bet she's heard them all before. It's not that bad for what it's trying to be. Before you hire it, remember that it is an older style of entertainment and has more value than story than comedy or tickle. Robin Williams has a few bits, but he is interchangeable with the other players.

summary: Timon and Pumbaa start to watch the original Lion King movie, but Timon keeps insisting to fast forward to when they come in, because they weren't seen in the beginning of the story or anywhere until halfway through. Pumbaa suggests telling the audience their story, which begins before Simba's journey begins. Through this, we meet Timon's mother and Uncle Max, discover why he left his meerkat colony, where he learned Hakuna Matata, how he meets Pumbaa, and the perils they encountered while searching for their dream home.
translation: If the Lion King was a Disney version of Hamlet, then the Lion King 3: Hakuna Matata is a Disney version of Guildenstern and Rosencrantz are dead. Just like Tom Stoppard's seductive film, we can plot the storyline from the perspective of two of the See secondary characters from the original: Timon, the meerkat with a penchant for song change, and Pumbaa, the warthog with flatulence. By following their story - instead of Simbas - we will see why all the animals bowed when Simba was presented by Pride Rock. We find out what made Timon and Pumbaa follow Simba to Pride Rock to drive out Scar. And we learn how they coped with the hyena once and for all. Nathan Lane as Timon gets most of the best jokes, but he is supported by Ernie Sabella as Pumbaa. It is also good to hear Matthew Broderick and Whoopi Goldberg re-live their roles. Julie Kavner and Jerry Stiller give their distinctive voice to two new characters: Timon's mother and uncle. The only downside is the constant stop-start rewind fast-forward device, which does not always help drive the story forward. With that said, there's a brilliant zoom near the beginning of the movie. With more laughter than any other third-season film in a Disney series, Hakuna Matata is worth a visit - if only for the hot-tub scene, which is still fun, though a bit predictable.

summary: New York's Odyssey Detective Agency is hired by two different clients to follow two women suspected of infidelity. Ladies' man John Russo trails Angela Niotes, the elegant wife of a wealthy Italian industrialist, while Charles Rutledge and Arthur Brodsky follow Dolores Martin, the beautiful young wife of a jealous husband. Their respective cases are complicated when John falls for Angela, and Charles falls for Dolores.
translation: This is supposed to be a personal film for Peter Bogdonavitch. He relied on his life, but changed things to suit the characters who are detectives. These detectives date beautiful models and have no problem getting them. Sounds more like a millionaire Playboy filmmaker than a detective, right? This whole movie was written by Peter and shows how remote he was. You should write what you know, and he did. And leaves the audience bored and confused and jealous, in fact. This is a curiosity for people who want to see Dorothy Stratten, who was murdered right after the shoot. But Patti Hanson, who would marry Keith Richards in real life, was also a model like Stratten, but is much better and has a bigger role. In fact, Stratten's part seemed forced; added. She does not have much to do with the story, which is very confused from the start. All in all, every character in the movie is someone few people can identify with, unless you're a Manhattan millionaire with gorgeous supermodels on your call. For the rest of us it's a nuisance snore party. That happens when you are not in contact. You entertain your few friends with insider jokes and endure all the rest.

summary: Cinderella (named Zezolla) and her family live mid 20th century, where fashion is practically everything. As her father is won over by a selfish woman named Claudette, Cinderella must keep her new step-mother from murdering the only family she has left. Add in an anti-social mermaid literally living in a cave, a bored prince with an ear for rock n' roll, and the glamour of the 1950's and one'll find that this story can't grow old.
translation: Creative use of modern and mystical elements: 1956 Cadillac convertible to transport evil stepmother Kathleen Turner (John Waters "Serial Mom") and 2 twisted sisters; Queen Mab as a fairy godmother; David Warner (evil in "Time Bandits") in the red coat at the court; Cinderella (she is a baby) shovels coal into an insatiable furnace; Cinderella and her charming prince both look like rock stars. Isle of Man locations.

summary: No sooner does Italian-American widow Loretta accept a marriage proposal from her doltish boyfriend, Johnny, then she finds herself falling for his younger brother, Ronny. She tries to resist, but Ronny lost his hand in an accident he blames on his brother, and has no scruples about aggressively pursuing her while Johnny is out of the country. As Loretta falls deeper in love, she comes to learn that she's not the only one in her family with a secret romance.
translation: I'm really surprised that this movie did not get a higher rating for IMDB. It's one of those movies that can easily come from someone, but for the romantic comedy "Moonstruck" is really in a class of its own. It's attitude and ethnic charm are things that people take for granted. The casting alone makes it a near-perfect movie. Some movies in the 1980s were as good as "Moonstruck" and it's funny too. **** out *****

summary: Three 40-something women in a small English town meet weekly for a ritual of gin, cigarettes, and sweets -- and swapped stories arguing which of them has the most pathetic love life. Kate is headmistress at the local school; her best friends are the town's police chief and a cynical, thrice-divorced doctor. When Kate begins a fling with a handsome younger man, less worldly than her friends but passionate and sincere, the other women can't simply be happy for the couple's unusual new romance. In jealousy they promptly take it upon themselves to break up the pair, taking drastic measures which result in unintended outcomes, some happy and some tragic.
translation: I thought that was one of those really great movies that you can see with a bunch of close friends. I laughed and cried and laughed and cried at the same time. It was just very touching. Although it was not a new concept, it was a very successful movie.

summary: Billy Ray Lee and Guile (Johnny Yong Bosch and Jason Narvy of the successful Power Ranger television series) a pair of small time thieves bungle their biggest heist, and stumble into a second chance. Robber's instinct draws them to an abandoned warehouse where they covertly witness a man inputting data into a computer. They see the man nervously stash a book into a hidden safe, then exit the warehouse. Thinking the book is valuable and with nothing to lose, the duo breaks in and steals it. Unknown to them, undercover FBI agent Kim Matsuda is observing them at a distance. She watches horrified and helpless as the two unwitting interlopers compromise a long-term sting operation set up to nab a ruthless gang of high-tech bank robbers. The book contains bank codes and passwords for accounts amounting to millions of stolen dollars! The intensity increases as Kim tails them and quickly formulates a plan to retrieve the book.
translation:
As a 90-minute experience, it does not conform to the standard of "Drive" as the actors do their job at "who am I?" Have clearly learned. Academy, while the action sequences are generally not better than those in the excellent Mark Dacascos beat 'em-up. But those who enjoyed "Drive" (and I thought it was wonderful!) Will certainly enjoy that as well. You certainly will not go back to the beginning and see it all again, but you will definitely return to some of the action scenes for a while.

It's refreshing to see that art's quality fight choreography is still being practiced, even if not in Hong Kong, and I'd like to see what these guys like with the budgets, time and respect Yuen Woo-ping and Corey Yuen Kuei. If you go through the first half hour and are not driven crazy by the dreadful dialogue, then you are on the safe side. Bosch is great and can really thwart a move with some great acrobats, kicks and simple acts of courage.

If you are lucky enough to be within 500 miles of a copy, then track it and watch it. It is not Shakespeare. In fact, it is less clear than Coolio in "China Strike Force," but you will be impressed with both the movements shown and the pain of the stunt team (I'm pretty sure there is no sure way right on yours land) head, or be forced to push with a raging car on a wooden roof!?).

summary: When he wakes up the morning after his bachelor party in bed with a strange woman, a man presumes he must have cheated on his fianc√©e. Guilt leads him to try to cover it up in the week before the wedding, high jinks ensue.
translation: The only salvation was the small part of Larry Miller. summary: A strip-joint owner and a manicurist find that they have many things in common, the foremost being that they are psychotic serial killers. They fall in love and are happy being the family that slays together, until one day they come up against a plumber who also happens to be a cannibal.
translation: Do not pay attention to the comments behind the curtain! The majority of people who leave positive comments on this film must receive royalties. This is a horrible movie in every way. summary: At an annual pace, a huge colony of ants is forced to collect every piece of food that grows on their island for a group of menacing grasshoppers. But that all changes when a misfit inventor ant named Flik accidentally knocks over the offering pile thus forcing the grasshoppers' devious leader Hopper to force the ants to redo their gathering of food. Despite the fact that his friends don't believe him and desperate to help save the colony, Flik volunteers to go out into the world and search for a group of 'warrior' bugs. Instead, what he got was a talented group of circus performers. But when the grasshoppers return and take control of the island, Flik must prove himself a true hero before it's too late.
translation: This movie blew me away. If you can only see one of the animated bug movies this year, you will see it instead of Antz. The plot, characters and jokes are better in A Bugs life. Even if you stay in your seat until the end of the credits. It's the best part of the movie. Rating 9

summary: A woman constantly runs from town to town with her 12 year old daughter to escape failed relationships. The film opens with one escape and the shift into a new start in San Diego. There Mom takes up with a controlling trucker and fights with her weirdo boss. Meanwhile, the daughter, used to making the constant shifts, finds a fit at school including getting chosen for a play lead.
translation:
... but the actress who plays the daughter just does not seem believable.

It does not work for me when I see an actress of about 25 years playing the role of a 12-year -old ... Other commentators have suggested that this is one of the messages of this movie that children sometimes seem more adult than adults, but with the casting, as it is in this movie, it just does not work out.

You may want to review other comments to find out what this movie is about because I could not bear to watch it through to the end.

I agree The premise for this film is beautiful - I wish another director would try to re-record this story.

summary: Bill Dancer and his young companion Curly Sue are the classic homeless folks with hearts of gold. Their scams are aimed not at turning a profit, but at getting enough to eat. When they scam the rich and beautiful Grey Ellison into believing she backed her Mercedes into Bill, they're only hoping for a free meal. But Grey is touched, and over the objections of her snotty fiance, insist on putting the two up for the night. As they get to know each other, Bill becomes convinced that this is where Curly Sue belongs - in a home, cared for by someone that can give her the advantages that his homeless, nomadic existence lacks. He plans to leave the young girl in the care of Grey and take off.... but Curly Sue has other ideas!
translation: Curly Sue is 6 years old and has a wealth of hair and a life as a drifter. She and her father, Bill (Jim Belushi), try to survive on the streets by being little contemporaries. In Chicago, Bill decides to jump in front of a car in an expensive car park, while Curly will yell at the strained victim's complaints and traction. It happens to be a very upscale lawyer named Gray (Kelly Lynch) who is appalled by what she did. The scammers not only earn money, they can also spend the night in Gray's apartment. Even then, Gray feels she owes them more, so the three stay together for a spell. Gray knows only the lucrative legal transaction and nothing about life. Who could teach her better than Bill and Curly, these savvy experts for the realities of life? But all good things must come to an end and there is no life left for a legal expert and a few cheaters. Or is it there? This is a sweet and funny movie about the unexpected. Curly is certainly as entertaining as Shirley Temple, but of course much edgier. Belushi gives a rare touchdown performance as the defeat on his lucky hit and Lynch is brilliant as the cocky but gentle touch lawyer. John Hughes, as writer and director, once again shows his magical touch, because the script is alive and unpredictable. Just watch as Curly and Bill Gray bring out a money-free night and see the humorous results. Do you long for Happy Endings, long promised and finally delivered, with a few uncertain moments in between? This is your tailor made movie.

summary: A young voyeur follows a woman through a neo-noir metropolis.
translation:
Saw it at UCSB's Reel Loud Festival and was * shocked * that it won the Golden Reel Award. I was not the only one because the audience had mixed reactions to the piece. I thought there were many other better movies out there, but then I learned that the jurors were very much rooted in film theory and other artistic crap. While cinematography and editing are on par with many other short films, storytelling is nothing more than an average student play. Seems like "serious" student films must include one of these categories: sex, intrapersonal struggle, and finally suicide - Nick and Kate go out and include all three. Please, be original!

Oh, and it could be the opinion of my outsider, but the guy from Montecito sounds a bit wrong. Does anyone else have such a thing?

summary: "In the Gay Nineties New York had grown up into bustles and balloon Sleeves ... but The Bowery had grown younger, louder and more rowdy until it was known as the 'Livest Mile on the face of the globe' ... the cradle of men who were later to be famous." The scene opens in a saloon named "Nigger Joe's" ...
translation:
One of my favorites, this film tells of two feudal New York "characters", Steve Brodie (Raft) and "Chuck" Connors (Beery), both of whom are eager to be the "Main Guy" in the Bowery in the late 19th century ,

Brodie (1863-1901) and Connors (1852-1913), were real people, though this was a heavily fictionalized account of their antics (based on a game). Brodie is legendary (did he do it? - it's still a cause for altercation!), Jump from the Brooklyn Bridge (1886), for which he became famous, is shown here around the same time as the Spanish-American War (1898). Director Walsh clearly had a great affection for the time, so beautifully restored here, and it contains a wild rumbtime ragtime number from saloon singer Trixie Odbray (a young Pert Kelton). Raft is on his slickest like Brodie, and Beery again shows what a smart actor he was as tough, generous, and sometimes quite touching connors. Pretty Fay Wray is the love interest that both boys pursue.

Full of life and energy "The Bowery" moves at a fast pace (unlike many early "talkies"). It's not an easy movie to find, but it's worth paying attention to.

summary: Haunted by a secret, Ben Thomas looks for redemption by radically transforming the lives of seven people he doesn't know. Once his plan is set, nothing will be able to stop him. At least that's what he thinks. But Ben hadn't planned on falling in love with one of these people and she's the one who will end up transforming him.
translation: This movie was a really great movie about something that concerns us all. I know that I have often encountered it personally. Thankfully, Will Smith encountered the social problem of texting while driving. People, do not do it. An hour and forty-five minutes are not enough time for this purpose. Personally, I wanted to throw my phone away after the movie. I was glad to see that other people in the theater had seen the news and unloaded their cellphones with the empty bags of popcorn. I decided to disable all SMS on my phone and encouraged others to do the same. If you are interested in your family, let them observe this important public service message on text messages while driving or they could kill seven people. Thank you for showing us the way.

summary: Long time friends and aspiring Toronto-based filmmakers, Kenny Hotz and Spencer Rice (who Kenny calls Spenny), have written a movie, a transgender mob comedy called "The Dawn", the script which they are trying to sell to get produced. They envision the movie to be a big budget Hollywood production with an all-star cast, rather than a low budget flick. Through cold calling, they quickly learn that they will need one piece of the movie in place - whether it be financing, or a major star or director signed on - before anyone else will really listen to them. More importantly, they need a reputable agent to do the leg work for them. They take the opportunity of the 1996 Toronto International Film Festival - a festival where many of the Hollywood elite attend - to pitch the movie to whomever will listen. Some people do give them advice, as well as advice concerning the making of this documentary, however they garner no solid leads. Thus, they move to the ultimate step in trying to get their...
translation:
I really enjoyed this documentary about Kenny and Spencer's attempt to play The Dawn. Was a great look at how outsiders try to get inside to make it big.

The story was well arranged and organized in an interesting way that made the movie flow well. Certainly worth a watch. My only complaint is that they apparently had no closure. Maybe that's part of the point. But we really do not expect that to happen (or normally happens).

The film is also a great way to see the personality of Kenny and Spencer outside their Canadian television show. You can see a little bit of what's to come.

I'm looking forward to the chance to see The Papal Chase.

summary: A bigoted, fanatical nun comes face to face with the lives she ruined through her teachings when a quartet of her traumatized former students return to perform at her Christmas Eve church lecture.
translation: Christopher Durang must have been taught by a memorable, terrible nun because he just can not let go of the concept. The play "Sister Mary Ignatius explains everything to you" was - at least in Hollywood - presented in exactly the same tone as Diane Keaton's lecture scenes. Sister Mary was an exaggeration, a mockery, a bitter satire of a serene, self-assured, doctrinaire and high-judgmental nun - and as she was played by Lynn Redgrave, she was hilarious. But the film insists that we take this exaggeration absolutely seriously - while, as mentioned, the same tone is retained in the scenes "explains everything". The two approaches collide head-first and in the last twenty minutes the film leaves the track, plunges into the gorge and explodes. There are no survivors. It could have worked if the tone of the scenes with the four former students and their encounter with Sister Mary were the same as those of Sister Mary. Or when the scenes of Sister Mary were presented more realistically. It does not work that way at all.

summary: While investigating his friend Chin Ku's (Hwang Jang Lee) death, martial artist Billy Lo (Bruce Lee) is killed. His younger brother, Bobby Lo (Kim Tai Chung), investigates both deaths. His search takes him to Japan, where he befriends Lewis (Roy Horan), master of the Castle Of Death. But when Lewis is brutally murdered, Bobby must investigate the mysterious Fan Yu temple, where he must enter an underground pagoda and face off with the most terrifying of enemies.
translation: This is a high quality cheese food for B-movie kung fu movies. Bruce "wannabe" Lee is played by Bruce Li ... I think. Of course, let's show you short clips of Bruce and take close-up pictures of his eyes and if you do them at the right angle during a certain time of the day during the winter solstice, it looks like Bruce. You'll laugh in awe that movie splicing is not very good, but some cool deleted scenes from Enter the Dragon are thrown into the mix. According to the film, Bruce Lee was killed with an arrow when he hung on a helicopter. Of course, they believe that this can excuse Bruce Li for trying to be Bruce, even though his character is to be Bruce's brother (who for some reason still mimics Bruce's gestures and fighting styles - very BAD). See Bruce, go one on one with the cowardly lion. The prop department stopped at Kay-Bee, do you understand? Bruce also does not mind beating a crippled man brutally. Towards the end, the director decided "Let's throw a flashback" for a scene that was shown just 3 minutes ago !! You must have thought that only single-celled organisms with attention deficit disorder could fully understand this movie.

summary: The Evil Dead meets Scream as an evil professor, through an ancient staff and a book of incantation, possesses the bodies of a group of fraterity and sorority pledges during a night of "hazing" activities in an abandoned mansion. When the students meet one grisly death after another, the survivors finally realize it's the professor who is possessing their friends and killing them all off. Now none of them trust each other-- is it their friends or puppets of the professor that they're hanging with? Somone better figure it out quick... or none of them will make it through the hellish night of The Hazing!
translation:
I mainly saw this movie to see Brooke Burke (as Jill), whom I met briefly in LA at a fashion show in her first feature film. I was hoping to see more of her, but thought she played her role very well. Since she is such a beautiful and well-balanced TV presenter and model, it was not surprising. I was wondering why she was killed and what happened. Maybe I just missed it.

I was not really sure about the genre of this movie, and although I liked the actors, I felt like a college crowd. I tried to stay open, considering that horror was not my favorite genre, but I felt like I'd outgrown the gags. It seemed to slip out in some places, suggesting in some places what powers the evil professor had and, like many other films, had an unsatisfactory ending.

After writing a few scripts I know that much of it is difficult and it can come to personal opinions, how many movies you have seen and studied and with which you have connected at any given time ,

In short, I found it interesting but no satisfying act and end for me. If Jill (Brooke Burke) had finally returned through the portal and kicked everyone's ass, that would be a satisfying ending and would deserve a higher rating.

summary: The film is about Slim, Slam and Slum from the Danish cartoon series, three young boys at twenty-something who lives in an apartment in Nordvest in Denmark. They are the kind of guys which is using a lot time sitting on the toilet, playing Playstation and smoking pot. But suddenly they all quit their bad salary jobs, and start on fresh with something new. They get a big weird idea on gaining money, power and respect. First of all they start a popular web site that their conman partner Dahlg√•rd which after a little time betrays them and sell the site. Then the three boys start Boomin Crew, a music group of hip hop. They all suddenly get in love with the three honeys, Dit, Dat and Dut, and their new goals are to try snap up with them.
translation: Slim Slam Slum is a sad and disappointing picture. There is absolutely no reason to apologize for a picture. Do not go there, whatever you do, do not. Instead, watch the TV shop for 10 hours. That way, you'll be easily amused.

summary: In 1986, David Whitman came home, contaminated his wife and child, and watched them die. Years later, he leads a hazmat team investigating an industrial accident near Budapest. One contaminated man escaped. Terrorist expert Holly Anderson is part of a unit which operates on the premise that the contaminated man is a terrorist murdering his victims. Whitman, on the other hand, believes the contaminated man to be an innocent victim. Either way, the contaminated man must be found, because after he touches people, they live only a few minutes.
translation:
Note: I'll reveal an important part of the storyline, but if you've looked at the DVD cover or promotional material, you'll know it already.

This movie seems to have been written by an eleven-year-old who is not very intelligent and was probably very tired when he wrote it. The writer does not know the difference between a chemical and an organism. Forget the fact that the UN and the NSA seem to be leading the show in Hungary. Forget about the fact that if these Master Intelligence agents chase after someone whose mere touch will kill you in about a minute, they will not wear protective gear (not even gloves). These are nonsense in the context of this movie. In the scientific world within this story, 2 + 2 = 6.34 and gravity goes sideways.

The fact is that the people in this film (with a few exceptions) do not behave the way people behave. Almost every time a character reacts to something, it is inappropriate. The love story (of course there is one) makes soap opera scripts like Shakespeare.

I can not believe we were wasting a free movie rental on this thing.

summary: A Secret Service agent (Wilson) battles an arms dealer who is creating a cyborg army.
translation: Synopsis: When his wife, a news reporter, is kidnapped and replaced by an android double, intelligence agent Eric Phillips tracks her and reveals an arms dealer's plan to create an army of invincible androids to assassinate world leaders br /> I did not expect much when I saw this sequel to Richard Pepin's low-budget sci-fi / action-hybrid "Cyber ‚Äã‚ÄãTracker" for the first time. This movie was nothing special, let alone a blatant rip-off of The Terminator and RoboCop. This sequel is the same as before, with a continuous action sequence that opens the movie. There are many explosions, heavy gunfire and a huge body count, as well as some martial arts moves courtesy of movie star Don "The Dragon" Wilson. The whole movie seems to be a series of action scenes associated with minimal action. On the showfront, Wilson is a bad actor. He really needs a personality transplant.

summary: The year is 2010. Teenager Alan Tracy, sent off to a distant boarding school, is the youngest of the sons of Jeff Tracy, a retired American astronaut. Jeff, a widower, has formed International Rescue, and raised his sons to act as a secret, volunteer organization which uses highly advanced technology to save lives worldwide. Jeff and his older sons John, Virgil, Scott, and Gordon, who like Alan were named after the Mercury Seven astronauts are joined in this effort by Lady Penelope and her butler/chauffeur Parker. Their futuristic hardware is largely developed by a genius scientist known as Brains, who lives at the International Rescue base on Tracy Island, somewhere in the Pacific.
translation:
I was one of those "few Americans" who grew up with all the wonderful creations of Gerry Andersen. Thunderbirds was a great series for the time and would have made a great action / adventure movie if only the writers had figured out where to target them.

I expected it to be a romp, but I did not expect it to target such a low age group. Like Lost in Space, this could have been visually stunning as well as exciting. It should focus on more action / adventure and the goal of the original series ... to save people in trouble.

Instead, it focused on Alan saving the day instead of his brothers (who were also occupied) young anyway against the original). The breakout part was Lady Penelope and Parker. The characters in the original were not that important to me, but I was grateful for them in the movie. They stole the show!

I've always favored Thunderbirds for high tech rather than stories, and even that did not give me enough time in my opinion. I would like to have seen more cool gadgets.

But then I'm just a big kid ...;)

summary: The Maclean brothers, Paul and Norman, live a relatively idyllic life in rural Montana, spending much of their time fly fishing. The sons of a minister, the boys eventually part company when Norman moves east to attend college, leaving his rebellious brother to find trouble back home. When Norman finally returns, the siblings resume their fishing outings, and assess both where they've been and where they're going.
translation:
... not living in Montana and especially not living there at the end of the 19th century.

"A river flows through" is certainly a well-made film from a cinematic point of view. Great scenery, Redford is playing well.

Unfortunately the story is bad (if there is a story at all).

I regretted the narrator / author, who is as dry, narrow minded as his father, a preacher. Driven, not leading his own life, he keeps his brother, who is also locked up in the small town, losing his life. The author does not even come close to his brother's motive, but at least he realizes that he lacks the least amount of humor. All there is is fly-fishing, where even as an old man he follows his father's style.

The end is not surprising, it is predictable from the beginning.

Definitely not a must (3/10)

summary: Dennis Buckstead has the hardest calling in his church. Not only has he been asked to coach a group of non-basketball players in his church but the bishop has demanded that he lead the team to the Basketball Championship. Word from the top is that this is the last season of church ball and Bishop Linderman isn't about to have his team lose for the 20th year in a row in the last season of church ball history! What was supposed to strengthen the body, invigorate the mind and cultivate brotherly love seems to bring out the worst in these church-going ball players. Dennis must find a way to bring his team together and build unity along the way to win the championship or go down in church ball history as the worst team that ever played.
translation:
I have never been a big fan of Mormon movies. As a Mormon, I always felt the humor was too exclusive for the LDS community and made us look like a bunch of obsessive wackos. I was hoping that would be the breath of fresh air, the Halestorm movie that I could finally discuss with my non-Mormon friends.

Boy, I was wrong.

I figured Because this B-list talent like Clint Howard, Gary Coleman, Andrew Wilson and Fred Willard (one of my favorites) had, at least, that would be weird. And besides, the basketball of the church is ripe for many hilarious gags and the like. But I have to say, throughout the movie it did not seem like anyone knew what they were doing. Every joke fell flat and every opportunity for a really funny gag was ignored. The dialogue was boring, and the movie had some of the worst character developments I've ever seen. Every single character except Wilson's was less than one-dimensional. It's hard to believe that after nine re-writes, the movie was still as dull as the train crash I saw. I can not put into words the anger I felt from this situation. My friends and I were extras in the last game scene, so we went to the premiere in Washington City, UT. Kurt Hale, the director, was there and I have to say I avoided any contact with him after the show. He waited at the door, apparently ready for a response. I could not help but tell him that not only did his movie tear away a good one and a half hours of my life, but that he left an uncomfortable, painful scar I'll never forget.

Here are a few specific issues I had: There was a little love subplot between the janitor and the chubby pianist, but these two characters came out of nowhere, and were impossible to care for, so mine Friends and I were constantly wondering why we should take care of these two lame, uninteresting characters. There were plenty of side stories that came up every now and then, and everyone promised the audience the chance to laugh, but everyone came and went in a cloud of smoke and ended up before anyone could even take care of it. That's how the whole movie felt.

This movie was a big disappointment and I feel bad for anyone expecting the first really funny Mormon movie. True, the jokes in this one are not too exclusive for the Mormons. On the other hand, it's hard to say what a joke was and what a loud ringing in my ears was.

Please, do NOT watch this movie. Keep the imagination in mind that this movie is hilarious. Spare yourself the disappointment I went through

summary: Michael O'Hara, against his better judgement, hires on as a crew member of Arthur Bannister's yacht, sailing to San Francisco. They pick up Grisby, Bannister's law partner, en route. Bannister has a wife, Rosalie, who seems to like Michael much better than she likes her husband. After they dock in Sausalito, Michael goes along with Grisby's weird plan to fake his (Grisby's) murder so he can disappear untailed. He wants the $5000 Grisby has offered, so he can run off with Rosalie. But Grisby turns up actually murdered, and Michael gets blamed for it. Somebody set him up, but it is not clear who or how. Bannister (the actual murderer?) defends Michael in court.
translation:
This is the second time I've seen this movie in about 12 years. These remarks come from someone who thinks Kane and Ambersons are amazing, worthy films. But the rest of Welles' career is unfortunately wasted on material unworthy of his talent and too skinny to resist his cinematic embroidery. And if he does a potboiler like Shanghai, the lack of something substantial to hang his cinematic tricks is just kind of sad. I could not tell you what he researched here. It's all mannered like Welles's godforsaken Irish brogue; This takes a lot of effort, but adds absolutely zero to the movie. Several Welles projects were so overdeveloped and baroque. Mr. Arkadin (choose a version, any version) is a similar project. The material is irrelevant. It just can not stand the weight of all this noodling. For a director dealing with reality-based drama (as here), he never feels an incentive to tie his bundle of imaginations back to reality; or to a coherent story. The murder-for-hire plan is ridiculous.

Kudos to Welles, because Hayworth cut her hair and made that performance out of her. The camera loves her. She is the most classic, classy, ‚Äã‚Äãsultry and gorgeous femme fatale ever to be played on film. But their betrayal comes so late in the movie that it feels like a desperate decision, so the movie has a genre it fits into. The movie can not be saved by a noir convention that has been used in the last 60 seconds.

If everything in L.F.S. said and done, are the folds all for what? to convince you that you have seen something thoughtful? Welles to do more? so that you twist your eyes? Welles has no sensitivity to the extent of a story or story to tell directly. One wonders what Shanghai has to say to anyone who is not a crippled billionaire, arranging a four-prong murder-for-hire scheme, or a fanboy falling in love with cinematic fantasies without meaning and substance.

Overworked, absurd, not engaging.

summary: Five young adults are about to find themselves in a fight for their lives, pitted against evil itself! While on vacation in a foreign city, one of the five makes a seemingly innocent albeit ignorant mistake and soon all of them will realize the cost of such an inconsequential action. A stranger appears to help them, but is this too little, too late?
translation:
This is the kind of movie that is so bad that you can not stop seeing it, because you keep telling yourself that it can not last until the end. It just can not '. You know, "worse than Jaws 4" - kind of bad.

I think seriously, I just saw ONE movie worse than that, and then we talk about religious crap about how you'd go to hell to lie or watch football .

Gore? In fact and much of it. Well made blood? No way.

The acting is more than bad and all the lines are lousy clich√©s for the story that only consists of sex, blood and violence like so many other gore movies.

If you're looking for a mix between Ichi the killer and August Underground, you'll be looking forward to it not find it in the live feed.

summary: In 1999 an alien spaceship crashed onto the earth. Hidden on board were the secrets of a unique science known as Robotechnology. Databanks found in the ship were transferred to the Earth Robotech Computer Complex. In 2009, an alien search party arrived from hyper-space to reclaim their lost databank. The united Earth Government was forced into an Inter Galactic war. Earth forces were able to win the first battle......but at a great cost. The planet was virtually destroyed. New population centres grew out of the ashes..... It is now 2027, a second armada sent by the aliens is nearing earth, they have come to recapture the secrets of their lost technology and then destroy the Earth.
translation: I saw his movie in Dallas, Texas when he came out in 1986. I remember they spent prizes on the show to watch the movie. After watching the movie, I can see why. The movie was not bad and not great either. The problem with this movie was that he was trying to tell a side story. They created a new story, new characters and tried to wrap them around the Masters saga. My biggest complaint is that the plot is a second wave of Robotech masters attacking Earth. They even used the same scenes from the Master Saga, but with different dialogues. As a kid, I loved the movie. But unfortunately I have not seen it as an adult and can not give a better rating. In retrospect, I was disappointed, but now I would like to see the movie and re-evaluate my attitude. Should someone please publish this movie so the whole world can judge? I love Robotech and can not wait for The Shadows Chronicles.

summary: All Tess Trueheart wants is to settle down to a quiet life with her boyfriend, detective Dick Tracy. But there's something pretty rotten going on in town, with someone pretty rotten behind it, and Tracy has his hands full with the likes of villain Big Boy Caprice and with the almost irresistible Breathless Mahoney.
translation:
In the late 1980s, Warren Beatty created and starred in the literary epic of Reds on the founding of the Soviet Union out of the eyes of the iconoclastic radical John Reed. It was a profound movie, entertaining and with a message presented by an All Stars cast. At the end of the decade, Warren Beatty has created another type of epic in Dick Tracy that promises nothing but entertainment with a whole slew of the best actors around a great old time banging under plenty of makeup. That's both Reds and Dick Tracy can be from the same person, speaks volumes about the range this man has as a player. In this film Beatty managed to get all the famous cartoon characters out of the Strip and put them into an original script.

The city's top gangster, Big Boy Caprice, is taking a step to really eliminate the competition. The film begins by tearing out the stooges of Lips Manlis in the style of a Valentine Massacre style and then equipping Lips himself for a cement coat. But Caprice's moves make him a target for Tracy.

Meanwhile, a third mysterious and faceless individual attempts to overthrow Caprice himself. Will our hero sort out that thicket of crime?

The spirit of fun that this movie has is really contagious. When people like Al Pacino, Dustin Hoffman, Paul Sorvino, William Forsythe, R.G. Armstrong make outrageous to look like the cartoon creations of the strip writer Chester Gould and then devote themselves to an exercise to carve the largest piece of ham, you have to love this movie.

Al Pacino got a nomination for Best Supporting Actor, but any of these guys could have, except that Pacino, as Big Boy Caprice, has most of the time on screen. Only Beatty plays it completely hetero, the others all seem to play from him. Dick Tracy won Oscars for Best Art & Set Design, Best Song written by Stephen Sondheim and introduced by Madonna, Sooner Or Later. The fact that he even got someone like Sondheim to write a score for this film just shows that Sondheim wanted to get involved in the fun. As far as Madonna is concerned, the material Girl with all these theatrical heavyweights as club-torch singer Breathless Mahoney more than lives up to her.

Prior to this movie, Dick Tracy films were handed over to B-pictures and worse than Saturday afternoon series. The only thing that rivals this all-star extravaganza is a radio show that was recorded for the Armed Forces Radio during World War II and came on vinyl. Can you believe a cast like Bing Crosby, Bob Hope, Frank Sinatra, Dinah Shore, Jimmy Durante, Judy Garland, Frank Morgan and the Andrews Sisters? Try to find a picture of this gem.

Until then, Warren Beatty's classic comic will work well for the big screen.

summary: The heat of a meteor crashing into the lake incubates a prehistoric egg, which grows into a plesiosaur-like monster that terrifies the community.
translation:
- The movie begins with a meteorite falling into a lake. What the locals do not know is also a dinosaur egg at the bottom of the lake. The meteor warms the lake and turns it into a huge incubator. You guessed it, the egg hatches and releases a dinosaur that is terrorizing the church.

- What a garbage. It's not that I care about the stop-motion sound dinosaur, it's all the other thing about the movie that bothers me. Acting is horrible. The dialogue is absolutely ridiculous. The comic relief is anything but funny. Logic is nonexistent. Any resemblance between the "scientists" in this film and an actual scientist is purely coincidental. I could spend an eternity talking about the bad side of this movie, but you get the idea. I think it's pretty safe to call this disaster "MST3K Worthy".

summary: A man is shaken out of his contented, middle-class existence when his wife is raped and murdered by a crazed serial killer who has been terrorizing New York City.
translation:
SEX WISH was actually released in the early days of the video boom (minus ten minutes more, um, "extreme" material) and caused a tabloid storm in a teacup when it allegedly inspired a copying murder case. Strangely enough, the newspapers have touched this extremely disturbing strip under the carpet in their rush to hurry the comparatively harmless role models like FROZEN SCREAM and NIGHT OF THE DEMON, and the film is therefore almost forgotten. I jumped at the chance to watch it on a DVD-RW and spent most of the movie with my jaw on the floor. It's not so much politically incorrect as totally crazy, a triple-X version of Michael Winner's DEATH WISH (did the title bring the game so far as to the inspiration?) With hardcore sex and some really ugly acts of violence seething brew the seventies Sleaze. If you do not think you're squeamish, it can force you to think again. When SEX WISH is over, you should cleanse your eyeballs with disinfectant and take a long hot shower to clean yourself. If a movie really deserves the title "It's just a movie, just a movie, just a movie," it's this one.

Highlights (or Lowlights) - a rapist who uses a vibrator on a victim as he masturbates over her, Harry Reems' stealing mustache, the helpless young black couple being forced to kill the sword killer beat (they would have won Oscars for their absolutely credible performance if the Academy had gone crazy) The man is castrated because of his problems, and a jerky, crafty way that threatens to lift the proceedings beyond their obvious grind-house origins. Do not say that I did not warn you. If you thought the world was an innocent place thirty years ago, you will be very, very wrong with SEX WISH.

summary: Between the heaven and the Earth exist the Zu's mountain range, where live the immortals of Omei, the highest mountain of Zu, but the kingdom is in danger by Amnesia, a renegade immortal what want to rule Zu and all the world. White Eyebrows, Zu's leader, call to his most experts fighters for to defeat Amnesia until destroy It, but Amnesia hides in the legendary and almost myth Blood Cavern in order to make stronger his powers. While Red, Eyebrows' servant, watches the enter of Blood Cavern, King Sky and the others warriors will try to find a way of exterminate Amnesia with an ancient and powerful mystical swords, hoping to be free of the Amnesia's threat.
translation: OK, at first the video looks like it was filmed in the 80s. I was shocked when I found out that it was released in 2001. Second, the plot was everywhere, and the story is confusing right away. Had there been a short prologue or an introduction, the story would have been better. I also value fantasy, but this movie was too much. It was bizarre and badly filmed. The scenes did not run smoothly and the characters were strange. It was hard to follow and maybe it was the translation, but it was even hard to understand. I love Chinese epic movies, but if you're looking for a Chinese epic fantasy movie, I would not recommend this movie Promise (visually stunning, plot is interesting and good character development). Careful, you will be disappointed.

summary: A cannibal rapist rises from the grave as a flesh-eating zombie sex maniac! Two Seattle cops, a satanic cult and a flying demon fetus try to stop the lust-crazed ghoul before he can kill again.
translation: No, that should not be a high budget brilliance, but it's brilliant in itself. You have to take it for what it is, a low-budget masterpiece where a zombie rapist swings a 12-inch love rod that makes him flutter. Those who came to give this film a low review were probably looking for the next cult classic or hidden "gem," they say, and just did not quite get there. I like how everyone points to obvious observations like the "5 cent baby attached to a fish rod", haha, well. I do not think a movie with a budget like this could afford "good" actors or effects, so they worked with what they had. The guts and innards were indeed very convincing. The film was a bit choppy from sequence to sequence, but overall, this is one of the better movies I've seen lately and follows no trend or predictability. very good for a laugh.

summary: "Kon-Tiki" was the name of a wooden raft used by six Scandinavian scientists, led by Thor Heyerdahl, to make a 101-day journey from South America to the Polynesian Islands. The purpose of the expedition was to prove Heyerdal's theory that the Polynesian Islands were populated from the east---specifically Peru---rather than from the west (Asia)as had been the theory for hundreds of years. Heyerdahl made a study of the winds and tides in the Pacific, and by simulating conditions as closely as possible to those he theorized the Peruvians encountered, set out on the voyage.
translation: The tweed professor types thought they had found out everything. The current populations of Polynesia were descended from migratory Asians, who streaked fearlessly for thousands of years from the Far East, island to island, east to Tahiti, and all the other exotic tropical islands of the South Pacific. But established thinking simply does not fit the young Norwegian ethnographer Thor Heyerdahl. If this explanation was correct, why did some of the people born and raised on these islands have traditions, works of art and physical characteristics similar to those of Asia but of South America? What can the vegetation of Ecuador, Peru and Chile look like on the island several thousand kilometers away? Is it just a coincidence that the islanders are pointing to the South American Sea and say that their ancestors come from there, led by Tiki, their equivalent of Adam? To what extent do Norwegians speak of Scandinavian precursors hunted out of their colonized South American continent and, together with some of the indigenous peoples with whom they had become friends, across the sea - to the west? It's all too much to be a coincidence for Heyerdahl. An expedition begins with an incredible amount of moxie, a handful of crewmen and local know-how for traditional raft building. It is as much an excursion into human imagination as a pseudo-scientific demonstration that such a journey is possible only with the foundations of tools and seamanship. The Oscar-winning documentary can be dated in its tone and Anglo-ethnocentric approach, but it does emerge with an adventurous spirit that even puts the space program, released a decade later, on the verge of risking everything a theory to test that they think is true. Wonderful. Do yourself a favor and read the book first. It's an amazing switcher and the perfect setup for the newsreel-style movie.

summary: A young boy dies from a stray bullet during a shootout between a cop and mob family member who had previously been supiciously given probabtion, only to break its terms. New York's Deputy Mayor, Kevin Calhoun starts digging for information.
translation: Brilliant execution in the representation of once and for all, this time at the political scene, as "good intentions actually pave the way to hell". Excellent!

summary: The seven American lawyers hired by Australian media magnate Jack Doulan, whose company rivals Albert Teal's Digicron for preponderance on the world market of telecommunications, are suddenly struck during a video conference in Seattle by an incredibly fast-working virus which wipes out everyone on their floor. Dr. Nick Baldwin, a brilliant virologist who works as an 'insubordinate' ambulance technician after being fired for failing to observe procedure, is first on the site and points out to US Army disease specialist Dr. Samantha Carter, who told him there were deaths in several other cases but never a trace of the virus, his ambulance has taken a survivor to his hospital; her therapeutic incompetence gets the patient killed, him assigned as temporary consultant to her army research unit- even there computer model operator Darren is killed by the virus, which also strikes at other sites in and around Seattle, notably at places where Digicron's 500 TV channels setup box is being ...
translation:
Despite his clich√©s, virtually "no-name" cast and an apparently low budget, I thought this movie was alright; much better than I expected. I was skeptical at first - the idea of ‚Äã‚Äãa computer virus that can infect people seemed a bit ridiculous. But in the end, I thought the movie worked well with the concept (though some scenes were a bit clich√©d). The cast was pretty good and the two leads seemed to take their roles very seriously. I do not think Janine Turner looks a bit like a Geena Davis. Maybe it's just her face or the make-up, the hair, and the clothes she had in this movie, but it's always in the back of her mind.

Although it's not a must have Fatal Error is an entertaining movie that will keep you watching until the end.

summary: Haunted by a secret, Ben Thomas looks for redemption by radically transforming the lives of seven people he doesn't know. Once his plan is set, nothing will be able to stop him. At least that's what he thinks. But Ben hadn't planned on falling in love with one of these people and she's the one who will end up transforming him.
translation:
Seven Pounds stars Will Smith as Ben Thomas, an IRS debt collection agent who has an ulterior motive to meet those who are back on their tax payments. Thomas has caused the deaths of seven people talking on the phone while driving, and the film follows his attempt to atone for his obvious, unpardonable crime.

The story is as subtle as a brick a green house window. What you see is exactly what happens - even the end of the Titanic was more surprising compared to Seven Pounds. There is absolutely no twist, there is never any confusion or doubt about what happens.

I usually only like Will Smith when he's in Bad Boys mode. The guy is at his best when he carries a gun, drives a Ford GT and says "Aw Hell Close", when he tries to behave seriously, he just appears as a pathetic attempt to get an Oscar who is so desperate for , That's probably the main reason why I did not look forward to the movie, even though it's very understated here. There are moments of comedy, but they are subtle, in fact it was the most submissive performance of Will Smith I've ever seen, and for that very reason he was fantastic and ironic should be nominated for a grand prize.

The supporting cast were all great too - Rosario Dawson looked pretty closely at deaths from throughout the movie and Woody Harrelson and Barry Pepper were fine, with all the other little players.

Overall, it's a whiny - but it does not throw away all the usual clich√©s and sentimental violins to give you no choice but to cry. There were a few times that even my hard heart almost broke. It will be hard for you to find none of the situations that are not related to your own life, which makes it all the more real.

I would give it 8/10. The Will Smith Show moves into drama without the despair of The Pursuit of Happiness, and makes it all the better.

summary: The human eye, the human form, the human face: these are the three central images of this avant-garde collage and kaleidoscope of shifting and fractured images, changing colors, and pulsing rhythms. Near the end, a tree appears briefly, and birds fly - first white, then red and blue. Celtic knots morph from one to another. The images become Rorschach tests although the mood, driven by the rapid changing images and the soundtrack, remains frantic.
translation:
When I first heard about this movie 20 years ago, when I was a grade school kid (!), It happened that one day I was thumbing through the encyclopedias in the classroom and under the entry for movies (or movies, I remember not), there were several stills for different films from mainstream to experimental, and one of them on the side was a quiet for OffOn. It really fascinated me, as it stood out the most on the page (it was a silence from the film of the scene with the eye overlaid with other elements).

About 18 years later, the public library here where I live has had the entire 4-DVD set of "Treasures of American Film Archives" published by the National Film Preservation Foundation , So when I read the notes on the DVD cases for the set, I was pleasantly surprised that OffOn was on one of the discs. After all these years, I finally got to see the movie! After I saw it, it was not that I expected it (it was more of an organic-looking movie, not that that was a bad thing, but I expected it to have more electronic aesthetics), but it was Still an impressive movie, IMHO, considering the techniques that Scott Bartlett used to make the film, including hand-tinted the film itself, and with video equipment for some of the movie scenes (filmed by a video monitor), there's one more Distressed, lo-res look.

Do not get me wrong, the techniques used in this movie were groundbreaking in 1972. That's why it's still one of my favorite short / experimental films, and also a creative inspiration for me ...

summary: A childless couple attempting to conceive discover that his sperm are "lazy". Several trips to a fertility clinic prove fruitless. Also, the wife had surreptitiously quit taking the pill and provided her doctor with a sperm sample before the husband agreed to start trying to have a baby. The deception alienates the husband for a time. To compound things, a female architect has the hots for the husband and lures him out of town on business at exactly the wrong time.
translation: This is meant to be a comedy, but above all bad taste and nothing remotely to make the movie smile. The film is about a couple looking for a child, and those in real life who are in this situation will squirm over the depicted images. For example, scenes in a fertility clinic are not the least bit funny and are, frankly, embarrassing. The male lead, who plays a construction worker and in his safety helmet, comes as a bad excuse for rejecting Village People. The female lead is trying to look 20 years younger than she is. Both leads are unattractive, unattractive and unconvincing. In the film, there are various ridiculous and inconspicuous scenes, for example, with a low-cost airline that has no sense of humor. The only reason I give this 3/10 instead of 1/10 is a score for Shirley Maclaine, who is a class above anything else in the picture, and a grade for a reasonably decent (if old) music.

summary: A sailor prone to violent outbursts is sent to a naval psychiatrist for help. Refusing at first to open up, the young man eventually breaks down and reveals a horrific childhood. Through the guidance of his doctor, he confronts his painful past and begins a quest to find the family he never knew.
translation:
After watching the movie in the original version, I was happily surprised when the DVD came out, as this movie did not have the wide distribution it deserves.

Denzel Washington's directorial debut and the finished product have nothing to envy other films about the same theme by more experienced directors. The movie has a very professional look. It shows that Mr. Washington learned a lot on the other side of the camera. He brings a different perspective on this film.

One of the best things the movie has is undoubtedly Derek Luke's good performance. He is an actor who will undoubtedly go far with the right guidance. His attitude towards the troubled young man who at this point in his life has been hurting him in turmoil and suffering for a bad hand life, until now, is very true. His answer is a beautiful portrait of a man in pain, who is basically very good and has so much to give, but no one seems to see that side of his character.

In the worst of his despair, Antwone becomes drunk in a very sober, if somewhat subdued way. Davenport, played by Mr. Washington. Because of the fear in Antwone, he misses the opportunity to open up to this man who wants to help, but because of the constraints in his office, only has three sessions and then has to lay off his patient.
Finally, Antwone finds love for Cheryl, patient enough to let him see her through the love she gives her and the support she gives him.

The lead performances are really good. Dr. Davenport by Denzel Washington also has its own problems. He is not a happy camper either. He can help Antwone, but he can not help it, or his relationship with a worshiping woman.

The talent in the movie is incredible. Joy Bryant makes a fine cherry. Novella Nelson, who is a good actress, is outstanding as Mrs. Tate, the abusive foster mother.

The reunion of Antwone with his unknown family is a bit too sweet and sentimental, but of course, if you believe that Fisher finally finds happiness, then you have to accept that part of the movie as well.

summary: Cynthia lives in London with her sullen street-sweeper daughter. Her brother has been successful with his photographer's business and now lives nearby in a more upmarket house. But Cynthia hasn't even been invited round there after a year. So, all round, she feels rather lonely and isolated. Meanwhile, in another part of town, Hortense, adopted at birth but now grown up, starts to try and trace her mother.
translation: First of all, there was not really anything in this movie that really grabbed me. It was not a bad movie, just another movie in which I said, "Well, that was nothing special," after I saw it. There was probably drama and stuff, but it just did not grab me, but was rather half-dull. As I said in the headline, it was, in a sense, very cheap. The quality of the film itself (the images) was of inferior quality, reminding me of cheap TV movies rather than a respected English filmmaker. The camera angles and recordings were in my opinion very amateurish. There were no close-ups or similar effects to create interesting scenes. I have not seen many English films and the ones I saw did not really impress me more than that and they lined up something similar to what was done with the camera work, the colors and stuff like that. "Game" tried to be cooler, hip & smart (see my review of "Lola Rennt"), but it was not successful for me either. Overall a little indifferent movie that was nothing special (at best, I'm afraid) and basically wasted over two hours.

summary: Ruby, a young woman, arrives in a Florida resort town during the off season to make a fresh start. She gets work as a sales clerk in a souvineer shop run by Mildred Chambers. She dates, and sleeps with, Ricky Chambers, Mildred's conceited son, but breaks off with him when she finds she's just another conquest. She gets involved with Mike, a left-wing greenhouse worker. As the seasons change, Ruby's relationships with others and herself go through metamorphoses as she makes choices and discoveries establishing her own identity. A character study.
translation:
First, I want to say that I'm a big fan of Ashley Judd; so I was curious to see this, her debut role. No argument that her talent is obvious and her performance is excellent. I think I can also see how the professional critics liked the aesthetic content of the story. However, I like to think that movies should entertain us and that's where this movie fails.

When I was halfway there, I thought, "How long do we have to watch bored, a shopgirl standing idly in an abandoned souvenir shop and changing the goods?" It seemed to take forever!

Then, I thought, maybe this is one of those films in which the director tries to put the audience in a relaxed state before meeting them with a dynamic event. No such luck. The film continues its boring, boring, uneventful story until the end.

I'm not saying that because I'm an action junkie. I like all kinds of movies, especially romantic comedies. But I expect entertainment.

Add the fact that the camera and sound quality is comparable to your neighbor's bad home videos. Depressing!

I just do not understand how anyone could like this movie. Zero entertainment value. The longest 114 minutes of my life.

summary: Bourne is once again brought out of hiding, this time inadvertently by London-based reporter Simon Ross who is trying to unveil Operation Blackbriar--an upgrade to Project Treadstone--in a series of newspaper columns. Bourne sets up a meeting with Ross and realizes instantly they're being scanned. Information from the reporter stirs a new set of memories, and Bourne must finally, ultimately, uncover his dark past whilst dodging The Company's best efforts in trying to eradicate him.
translation:
At the end of the first hour, my jaw was comfortably between my feet. The film never leaves, and I never mean, in action. It can be light action, but it is action. Again, every member of the cast suits perfectly. The explosions were realistic, the chases were feasible and the fighting was unbelievable. Matt Damon will forever be Jason Bourne.

All I really have to say is that every Bourne movie gets better and this is no exception. The plot, the stakes, the plot. I will never know how they do it. I applaud the man who wrote the screen for each of these films. Because if he had not done such a good job with the first film, we would not have to discuss this here.

So, do not look at him in the cinema, see him in the cinema when it's still out, where you live, but if it's not December 11th, Bourne will come to your house!

summary: A scientist experimenting with matter transmission from place to place by means of a laser beam suddenly decides to use himself as a test specimen. But the process goes awry, and one side of his body becomes hideously deformed and instantly lethal to anyone it touches.
translation: First of all, this movie is shit. But let's examine why. The proposition that a machine is capable of transforming matter into energy, storing it and then transporting and reuniting it, is at least fascinating. But that is as far as they accept this premise. Instead of investigating what could happen if someone made that kind of machine, they break that damned thing. That could have been a good condition. Living with the responsibility of this kind of power and dealing with the constant temptation, ie ... the invisible man. But no .. they break the damn thing. And Lembach wants to leave. Then the doctor puts the thing back together and tries to transport itself. Just to make it stupid of his beautiful, but stupid secretary. Which would not have happened if Lembach had not decided to leave. Now he is on the land side, killing people because his little experiment failed, and they would not give him any money. Wah. Then, to make the movie worse, throw in a dry British relationship between the two semi-competent professors who were hired to help him. Between their love sessions, they make some half-hearted attempts to find him while he half kills London. All this could have been done by breaking the damned machine, which would never have happened if Lembach had not left. This movie has tried, so I give it an honest 2 stars for the effort, but it would have been better if they had not broken the damn machine that would have Lembach trying it again. Damn Lembach !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

summary: Over the spring of 2000, sixteen average Americans (divided into two tribes which eventually merge into one) were sequestered on the deserted island of Pulau Tiga for 39 days. For their stay, they must learn to live as a tribe, although eventually, it is everyone for themselves. They compete in challenges for "luxuries" (a barbecue, a phone call home, etc.) and immunity.
