Every three days, the losers of the latter challenges must face tribal council, where they will account for their actions by voting one person off of the island. At the end of day 39, there will be only one survivor left who will leave the island with one million dollars. Based on the Swedish game show, "Operation Robinson."
translation: How did this piece of shit stay on TV for so long? It is terrible. It makes me shoot someone. It's so wrong that it's actually worse than a 1940s sci-fi movie. I'd rather have a stroke than watch this nonsense. I remember seeing it when it first came out. I thought, hey that might be interesting, then I figured out how absolutely, how insane, ridiculously stupid it really was. It was so bad that I actually took out my pocket knife and put my hand to the table. Please, people, stop seeing these and all other reality shows, they are the garbage that disturbs the networks and cancel the quality programming that requires some thought to build.

summary: Anthony John is an actor whose life is strongly influenced by the characters he plays. When he's playing comedy, he's the most enjoyable person in the world, but when he's playing drama, it's terrible to be around him. That's the reason why his wife Brita divorced him; although she still loves him and works with him, she couldn't stand living with him anymore. So when Anthony accepts to play Othello, he devotes himself entirely to the part, but it soon overwhelms him and with each day his mind gets filled more and more with Othello's murderous jealousy.
translation: A lovingly remembered melodrama? especially thanks to Ronald Colman's fine Oscar-winning central performance? on an often-discussed topic: the nature of action and how it can overtake the perception of reality. In this case, we have a well-known thespian who grapples with Shakespeare's "Othello" so that the last third of the movie plunges into the thriller genre. Press Representative Edmond O'Brien (who happens to be fond of Colman's co-star and ex-wife Signe Hasso) "investigates" the possible involvement of the actor in the Desdemona-like asphyxiation of a celebrity-seeking waitress (a very slender Shelley) Winter). The theatrical-New York atmosphere of the immediate postwar period is vividly recorded by the couple of Garson Kanin and Ruth Gordon and the legendary "actor-director" George Cukor (all of whom were awarded the film by the Academy); By the way, the film got a second Oscar for Miklis Rozsa's eclectic score. Colman, forever the gentle leading man who was blessed with a velvet voice, does Shakespeare feel well? the deeper his character falls into obsessive jealousy, murderous rage, and finally paranoia; however, he is not disappointed by a supporting role, which includes director Ray Collins, reporter Millard Mitchell, detective Joe Sawyer and coroner Whit Bissell. Although the middle section is somewhat tense, the film with a remarkably well thought-out Expressionist resolution compensates for all the shortcomings.

summary: Set in the 30s, Helen and Adelle are two women whose sons commit a gruesome murder. After their conviction, they move to Hollywood change their names and open a dance school for girls. Adelle is looking for a good life and when one of the parents of her students who is wealthy takes a liking to her she thinks she's got it made. Helen thinks that someone who blames them for what their sons did is stalking them. But Adelle thinks it's all in her mind.
translation:
The 1930s. The posh, elegant Adele (wonderfully played by Debbie Reynolds with dignified determination) and the beefy, stale Helen (the magnificent Shelley Winters, who runs at full speed with her usual histrionic talent) are the mothers of two killers. Leaving behind their cheesy midwestern past, they move to Hollywood to start their own dance school for aspiring children's starlets. Adele begins to date brisk millionaire Lincoln Palmer (the always-fine Dennis Weaver). On the other hand, the religious fanatic Helen soon falls into despair and madness.

Director Curtis ("Night Tide", "Ruby") Harrington, works for a clever script by Henry Farrell (who wrote the book) "Whatever Happed to Baby Jane?" Based on the script for "Hush ... Hush, Sweet Charlotte" and co-writing a complex and compelling psychological horror thriller about guilt, fear, oppression and religious zeal amok. The super cast has a ball with its colorful roles: Michael MacLiammoir as a pompous speech teacher, Agnes Moorehead as a serious fire-and-sulfur radio speaker, Yvette Vickers as a snide, overbearing mother of a bright-eyed wannabe kid star, Logan Ramsey as a sneaky detective, and Timothy Carey as a scary bum. An ingenious talent recital set piece featuring Pamelyn Ferdin (the voice of Lucy in the "Peanuts" TV cartoon specials) serves as a showman and original "Friday the 13th." Victim Robbi Morgan makes a wickedly indecent dead Mae West impression qualifies as a specific marker. David Raskin's scary score, a fantastic scene with Reynolds performing an incredible tango in a posh restaurant, the imaginative time of depression, Lucien Ballard's pretty cinematography, and above all, the macabre ending, are all excellent and effective. MGM presents this grandiose gem on a chic DVD double sheet featuring "Who Aunt Roo?" Both images are presented along with their cinema trailers in razor-sharp widescreen broadcasts.

summary: A gruesome homage to the cult Amicus anthology Asylum, Cradle of Fear unfolds four screamplays all linked by the unspeakable need of an incarcerated child killer to wreak vengeance on those responsible for his imprisonment. Helped by deranged angel Dani Filth, who leaves a trail of charnel house death in his crimson wake, the cannibal convict forces two Goth vamps to endure a one night stand from hell, two tough female robbers to see through each other, an obscenely rich coke-head to chop up more than a few lines and an internet surfer to descend into madness when he uncovers the ultimate web depravity.
translation:
It had a plot SURPRISING! ;) I have seen movies with less action (I do not want to mention Asian movies, but ...). I thought the camera was not bad at all for a cheap movie, and the atmosphere was not so bad either. There is no real reason for most things people do and how they react to what happens. Although I think that about many movies, in this case, of course, it was terrible.

It robbed some movies so badly only for individual scenes. Acting was bad, but I saw worse. The movie was bad, but I have seen worse. Watching this film is an experience between boredom, laughing fits, death wish, sadism, horniness and entertainment at a low level.

So, if you like bloody movies with stupid plots then this is the movie for you.

I've given it 3/10 because it can be entertaining if you do not expect to see a good movie and you're in the right mood.

summary: On 24 October 1955, the hard-work geologist of the Hadley Oil Company Mitch Wayne meets the executive secretary Lucy Moore in the office of her boss Bill Ryan in New York and invites her to go to a conference with the alcoholic playboy and son of a tycoon Kyle Hadley. On the way of the meeting, he confesses that they had traveled from Houston to New York to satisfy the wish of the reckless Kyle, who is his best friend since their childhood, of eating a sandwich from club 21 and the meeting was just a pretext to Kyle's father Jasper Hadley. Mitch and Kyle immediately fall in love for Lucy, and Kyle unsuccessfully uses his money to impress Lucy; then he opens his heart and proposes Lucy. They get married and travel to Acapulco and the insecure Kyle stops drinking. Meanwhile, Kyle's sister Marylee is an easy woman and has a non-corresponded crush on Mitch that sees her as a sister. One year later, Kyle discovers that he has a problem and might be sterile and starts drinking again. The ...
translation: Another one in which they do not do like this category. This story of a family with some real skeletons in their closet is still considered good-clean, sometimes over-the-top fun. Robert Stack and Dorothy Malone are at their peak as the distressed Hadley siblings, and they really took the roles and ran with them. Malone won an Oscar and Stack was nominated in the minor categories, both awards being well deserved. They compensate for the somewhat dull leads. Neither Bacall nor Hudson could ever be described as bad actors, but they both had better roles and played them much more convincingly than here. It's pretty hard for me to accept that Rock Hudson plays a red-blooded heterosexual like this, but that's more of a personal bias than anything else. But that does not take the overall entertainment value of the movie, which is considerable and this movie is extremely good to see. If you wake up in a night and this movie starts, I would say, watch. Its worth it.

summary: A Baltimore sandwich shop employee becomes an overnight sensation when a photographer's photos he's taken of his weird family become the latest rage in the art world.
translation: Once you've gotten the title of the movie, "Pecker" is a great movie, perhaps one of John Waters best. A wonderful cast, led by strong performances by Edward Furlong and Christina Ricci, makes the story very funny and very real. There are some shocking scenes that are definitely not suitable for small children, but they are there for a purpose. Unfortunately, this film was not produced in series, and the majority of the public will be given the opportunity to see it. When the opportunity comes, look at this movie.

summary: When a terrorist's body, infected with a stolen chemical, is recovered by the US military, the corpse is cremated, unintentionally releasing the virus/bacteria into the atmosphere over a small island. Soon the infected populace mutate into flesh-hungry zombies, and a trio of soldiers on leave must team up with a group of tourists and board themselves up in an abandoned hotel as they try to fend off the agile and aggressive living dead.
translation:
In addition to the Slasher films of the 1970s and 80s, the "Walking Dead" were probably the second most popular horror subgenre. While Slasher films had "Black Christmas" and "Halloween" to get it going, zombie movies had George Romero's "Dead" movies. Shortly after the success of his first two in the series, other directors wanted to save money. Many Italian directors were particularly interested, such as Lucio Fulci, who brought us 'zombie' a year after Romero's 'Dawn of the Dead'. known as "Zombi" in Italy and some other countries, and there Fulcis movie was known as "Zombi 2". Apart from the Walking Dead, it has no relation to Romero's film, but is a good movie in itself. It was a great success in Europe and 9 years later a sequel was born.

Pros: Lots of beautiful, lush countryside. Great score. Acting is not good, but the cast is play and seems to enjoy the experience. After a slow start, the tempo moves like an action movie. Lots of cheese and unwanted joy for bad movie lovers. Good job with the make-up effects. Lots of blood and some decent blood.

Disadvantages: Virtually less plot. Nothing you have not seen yet. Amazes some things from the first "Return of the Living Dead" films. Cardboard sign. Because of the bad rock music of the 1980s (not that I say that all the rock music of the time is bad), the clothes and overall look of the movie, he did not age too well.

Final Thoughts: Above all, this is not a true continuation of Fulci's cult classic. In fact, I do not know if it was ever meant to pick up where this movie left off. For those who do not know, Fulci was ill during production and ended up leaving and was replaced by Bruno Mattei. Mattei movies are pretty ridiculous, but like this movie, many are good campy fun. And that's all this movie really is, just something that you can see for fun.

My rating: 3.5 / 5 (So-bad-it-good rating) 2/5 (Serious review)

summary: A group of film students attempt to finish a horror movie that stopped production years earlier when the director was killed. Unaware that every attempt to complete the pic coincided with the murders of those involved, the students return to the original location in an isolated part of the country. When filming begins, so do the killings.
translation: A student filmmaker hires a B-class actress (a delicious diva-MOLLY RINGWALD!) To complete the horror film that her mom (a terribly boring Kylie Minogue!) Tries to make 12 years ago. It is a curious decision to act, to say the least, as every Australian horror fan knows that the genre unfortunately lacks female directors. The movie has a curse because Molly had to kill a psychopath on the original set. But she is back because she needs the exposure. Unfortunately, the curse is still there and people are starting to die on the "set". Cut is an Australian attempt by the modern Slasher, but unfortunately it does not bring anything new or exciting to the table. In fact, it breaks half of Wes Craven's 90s filmography. Many film world name drop a la "Scream" (except it's Aussie name drop - Jane Campion ... see how that's not so funny) and many "is this real or is it a movie" a la "new Nightmare "The editing is bad, the music is annoying, the effects are ridiculous, almost everything is bad. Fortunately, the film can have a sense of humor: at one point, a well-dressed girl in the film crew tells the owner of the house where they are filming: "Do not worry, we'll treat your house as if it was ours own, "to which he answers", that does not mean anything to me, you look like you live in a garbage dump! "Ha! And Molly's ridiculous one-liners were enough not to regret renting it. "Do you have any cola in here?" (as she rides in the film professor's car) and "Does anyone know where I can buy tofu?" (the first thing she mutters on the set) and "Where the hell is my agent?" (Oh wait, I thought that for her.)

summary: When a large Irish woman falsely accuses Buster of breaking a window he is hauled before a Polish judge who speaks no English and assumes they are there to be married. She takes her new husband home to meet her four gorilla-like brothers.
translation:
None of Keaton's best efforts was perhaps a veiled attempt to avenge the family he had married-the Talmadges. A Polish-English language barrier and a series of coincidences lead Buster into a marriage with a large Irish woman who treats him (along with her father and brothers) shabbily until they think he may be an estate heir. There are many false identities - gags are set up and, above all, they do not pay.

This Metro Short has at least two real laughs - Buster deftly turns his lack of food by using the calendar on the wall and the basic ignorance of his adoptive family to literally put the meat on his plate bring. The other is a family photo where the whole group slowly falls to the ground as the tripod of the camera loses its stability.

The Yeast Beer Overflow could have been the trigger for a massive series of gags on gags, but stops short (for the whole construction) of the development.

Cinemas print is clear and clear and the score is one for player piano, drums and sound effects. None of Buster's best efforts, but worth a few laughs.

summary: 13-year-old Brian is the sole survivor of an unreported plane crash. Alone in the Yukon wilderness, Brian must learn to survive by his wits, find food and shelter, and brave wild, hungry animals until or if he is found.
translation:
In my lit class, we just finished the book, Hatchet, and this movie is nothing like the book. (1) Brian never ate worms in the book. (2) He did not know the name of the pilot. (3) His mother cheated on his father in a station wagon, not in the woods where anyone could see it. (4) The man with whom the mother cheats has no black hair, he has blond.

Now for the unrealistic parts of the movie: (1) A thirteen-year-old can not beat his fist through a window at once.

And for acting, the kid Brian played was a terrible actor.

However, I think the scenery was impressive, although I doubt very much that the director even read the book.

This movie is good if you did not read the book Hatchet by Gary Paulsen, but if you have, then start a letter of complaint to the director.

summary: The past, present, and future lives of surviving Oceanic Flight 815 passengers are dramatically intertwined as a fight for survival ensues in a quest for answers after crashlanding on a mysterious island. Each discovery prompts yet more secrets, as the hastily-formed colony search for a way off the island, or is this their home?
translation: Lost has something interesting for everyone. You can say a lot about this series, and a lot has been said, so I will not be the one to spell it back for you. Just read the people who loved it and you'll know why you want to see it. The beauty of this series is that it is completely new. There are not many films - and even fewer - series that are based solely on the theme of suspense, but Lost does justice to the theme with pride. It's all about the unexplainable and if you combine that with an exotic location, nice plot twists, excellent cast and a good format (present and past combined in separate episodes) you'll have a series where every episode is a story own, but part of a larger narrative. You want to have all the insights of the characters, you want to see the big picture, and you'll want to know where the scribes bring you. The result is that it's a series that will not let you go. More skeptical, the series went back a little in season 2, probably because of its own success. It is known that Lost was originally written for only one season and when the overwhelming success followed, the authors were overwhelmed. In my opinion, they have made the mistake of adding more secrets and at a higher speed in the second season to then solve the (at least in part) of the first season. At the end of the second season, everything ended with a great blurring of secrets, plot changes, and unexplained phenomena, but there is only so much that a viewer can see. The difference between Season 2 and 3, however, was enormous. Season 3 provided many insights to partially replace them with new questions. And that's the way they should write; You want to scroll from one action to the next, do not make a tsunami of secrets about you, and then track down a few to explain to the audience. They have the third season and bring us a bright future for the fourth season. It's good to see that another format of a series is so popular.

summary: Stefania and Tommaso are to marry and want their wedding to be special. They travel to Stefania's childhood church and there meet a priest who rises to the challenge. In the ceremony the couple are confronted with not only the beauty of their love but also the darker challenges of marriage; the loss of togetherness, the temptations, the interference of others. Yet, through it all they and their guests learn that love is something that we all must do alone.
translation:
(Spoiler)

I was very curious about this movie after hearing that it was clever and funny. I had to stop halfway because of the unbearable boredom.

The idea behind the film would have been acceptable: showing how the relationship between a man and a woman develops, through all the problems and difficulties that two people living in a big city can experience , What I did not like about the whole movie was two things.

First of all, the film was so down to earth that it looked like it would describe the problems that a couple has to solve in one day - everyday became everyday and boring.

Secondly, the general sloppiness of production, with dialogues that were barely understandable.

Pity.

summary: A trio of Neanderthals struggle to live in modern day America.
translation:
Peeew that stinks! As everyone knows, it is based on some Geico insurance commercials; What nobody knows is WHY ?! These commercials were amusing at first glance; hardly any food for a series. (The talking geo-gecko - that's another story.) Well, that would make for a fascinating series!) And why on earth did ABC agree - as the press reported - to buy Geico's cave rights? After all, the idea of ‚Äã‚Äãcavemen fighting in the modern world is hardly unique to television; Phil Hartman had a recurring Saturday Night Live role as The Unfrozen Caveman Lawyer over a decade ago. And this is how such a concept works best - as an occasional installation. But a regular series? Fuhgeddaboudit. (A series from the 1960s titled "It's About Time" also used the cavemen in the concept of the modern world.) It lasted one season.) One of the show's directors, also responsible for the Geico commercials, was recently quoted as saying "We were so excited when we shot our commercials because we felt we had something that was very unique and we had bigger stories to tell." Not correct.

In the annals of bad television, this will be considered one of the worst of all time, alongside the "Me and the Chimpanzee" of 1972. The lead actor in the embarrassing Chimp fiasco actually went into shame-for-association hiding after being abruptly canceled. No doubt our cavemen will follow suit.

summary: Horror anthology about a psychiatrist who uses virtual reality to probe the minds of three unsuspecting patients, a paranoid woman home alone, a meek man with a roommate from hell (Paxton) and a man obsessed with his own death.
translation: This movie still scares me on the bone. This movie was not only bad as in low budget, poorly played, etc., though it certainly was all of those things. The problem with this movie is that it purposely tries to annoy the viewer, and with great success. What I want to know is, is this supposed to be a horror movie? I mean, it's definitely awful, but not the way horror movies should be. I could see the first segment trying to be horror and fail, but what the hell is the second segment? It's just annoying. The third segment is like an artistic student film that surprisingly makes it the least painful segment. It is an atrocity that this movie is not far below the last 100, so get your votes (1/10) in people !! I know some people have given these good reviews, but, well, they're lying in a sadistic attempt to trick you. Trust me, it's impossible to like this movie. The only advantage of this film is an amazing life-prolonging effect: it feels like you've been watching this movie for years, after only the first half-hour has passed.

summary: A documentary on the threat that climate change poses to the Earth - it's causes, effects and history and potential solutions to it. Presented by Al Gore through a lecture that he has given to audiences across the globe, plus through more introspective moments.
translation:
Well done Al Gore! You became the first person to earn $ 1 billion in the lie of global warming! Like all the other man-made mythical creatures in the world, this one with the best lies to have so many people in it. Safe pollution is not a good thing, and I would love if all the trees continued to grow, but global warming is a business! It employs thousands of people, all of whom are very misleading.

Google it! There are just too many things that just do not go together, but well done Al, you failed as a politician, but you made a lot of money by sucking the world.

What's next? Santa is real?

summary: Eighteen-year-old Mathieu vacations at the beach with his family when he meets local teen C√©dric. After an extremely erotic kiss, the boys begin a passionate romance, complete with skinny-dipping at night, nude dancing on the beach and intense lovemaking in the dunes; yet, as Mathieu grapples with his sexuality and copes with his sick mother, absent father and annoying kid sister, his bond with C√©dric grows stronger until it bursts.
translation: I found this film for the first time looking for works that St√©phane Rideau was involved in, still in an extraordinary rape caused by the amazingly beautiful "Les roseaux sauvages" (in Portuguese Juncos Silvestres) by Andr√© T√©chin√©. I was looking for similar movies, in the age limit. I then found ¬´Presque Rien¬ª, a film in which director S√©bastien Lifshitz amazed us in a wonderful way and in 2000 received a nomination for the Cannes Festival. The story is about two guys, the boys next door, Mathieu (J√©r√©mie Elka√Øm) and C√©dric (St√©phane Rideau), who meet during the summer holidays. In a country far from where he lives, Mathieu spends days with his sister on the beach. There he meets C√©dric, a local, with whom he begins this summery and enlightening relationship, very much through the sensual and seductive personality that St√©phane Rideau gives to his characters (in Les 6 - year olds he still preserves the 6 innocence of the sweet seducer, Witch matures here). A role model in directing, in the amorous order, in the intimate and self-confessed description made about a boy who first faces his (still ambiguous) sexuality and great love. The first love, in its terrible progression, ecstasy-despair. The best of the film is the best of France: the passionate passion, the hot and excited rationalism, the brownish beauty, the simple and natural acceptance of the families, albeit not without surprise and first rage. Yet there are the beach, the luminosity, the lightness, the simplicity of the summer, the freshness of the breeze, the melody of the wave and the expressive eyes of an introverted Elka√Øm (hesitant, hurt, confused, passionate). Gender is not shunned or exploited, it is treated as it is, without an exhibitionistic intention. This is a work of dramas of unusual quality, without cheap sentimentalism, and shows an inevitably real image of two homosexuals in their best youth, just like any ordinary human being, albeit with a social fear of rejection and shame. It's well worth seeing, especially by those who love French films (though the DVD front page is very lame, with the two actors between dozens of stars greased with Brilliantine). A movie witch deserves an 8-9 in my opinion!

summary: A Bible professor from 1890 comes forward in time to the present via a time machine and cannot believe the things that he sees!
translation: This movie seems to send the wrong message. There can be morality without using Christ. People of other religions, I believe, can go to heaven. I am a Catholic who goes to church every week, but I do not agree with such Christian arrogance. This is the worst time travel movie I have ever seen and I have seen Timeline.

summary: In Paris, the pedantic Alexandre lives with his mate Marie in her apartment, an open relationship. Alexandre, who is idle and chauvinist, spends his days reading, drinking and shagging women. After flirting with his former affair, Gilberte, who tells him that she will marry soon her boyfriend, Alexandre meets the Laenne Hospital nurse Veronika Osterwald and they schedule a date. Alexandre learns that Veronika is a promiscuous woman that loves to shag and introduces her to Marie. They have a threesome and Alexandre has a crush on Veronika.
translation: Well, of course, women are on average over-sensitive and needy, which is interestingly portrayed from mother to whore, if not pseudo-artistic, extravagant, or open-hearted. Unlike many of you, I only saw La Maman and La Putain twice. How many good films have I improved my opinion after a second look. All I know is what I've seen and needs to deepen into more exploits until I've purchased the DVD myself. I have not figured out exactly why I enjoy this movie so much, but really, why do I care why? Although I'm sure I can and will formulate a wonderful statement. Okay, so that you contradict that, maybe it's a bit boring sometimes, I'm not an expert. The blonde reminds me of a nice Grushenka.

summary: A nurse apprentice, who had a bad day at work, meets a computer programmer at a car garage. The man is urged to go somewhere, but his car is not ready yet, so the nurse offers him a ride. Before leaving the man, they pick up the nurse's baby nephew. Once on the street, they almost run over a young man. Not knowing if he is hurt, they pick up the man too. But the worst luck begins when the car brakes break down.
translation: This movie is so bad that it hurts. The car makes 30 miles an hour when it's supposed to go 100 ... the gear stick (in park!), The nurse who rides a cell phone on her shoulder for almost 2 hours ... can not do any of the 2 idiots take this damn phone? There is nothing credible in this crap. I would be ashamed to be seen in such a movie!

summary: After his wife dies, 55-year-old businessman Philip Emmenthal, at the prompting of his playboy son Storey, populates his Geneva villa with eight and a half concubines. Three are from Kyoto, where Storey manages Pachinco palaces. Each has a distinctive personality: a nun, a child bearer, a gambler, a student of Kabuki, a horsewoman with a pet pig, a maid. Philip throws off his strait-laced and repressed attitudes, immersing himself in pleasure. After about a year, the women begin to assert their own power. Side adventures pre-figure the household's breakup, and the women depart in one way or another, one at at time. Philip's fate is in the hands of Palmira, his favorite.
translation: Greenaway seems to have a habit of deliberately dismissing his viewers. This film begins with incestuous and meaningless, meaningless, casual incest. That's Greenaway's big problem. He prefers salon tricks to shock, to do something really meaningful. Technical skills are not enough. He is just a little perverted because of the perversity.

summary: You're invited to the wackiest wedding since Robert Altman last threw the rice, where no one is polite and everyone "acts" real. What is truth, and what is fiction? How does one discern reality from pretense? These are serious questions, but if you're looking for answers √† la Japanese abstraction, German expressionism or Swedish nihilism, keep looking, because The Wedding Video has the answer, "REAL WORLD" style. In the first film to come out of the MTV phenomenon, Norman Korpi (the gay guy from "Real World-New York") and creative partner Clint Cowen have made a deliciously wicked satire that skewers all the clich√©s and conventions of the reality show. Norm plays "Norm" who hires "Clint" to film his gay wedding. He invites his best friends - all popular "Real World" alums - and has Clint tape them as they arrive for the bachelor party and ceremony. The cast members have great fun parodying the on-air personas that MTV created for them through its editing: San Francisco's Rachel is now...
translation: This is one of the funniest movies I have ever seen. If you know the real world and people from these shows, this movie will be top notch, if you've never seen the real world, you'll still think it's an extremely funny movie, but you will not get any insider jokes the actors and the TV show.

summary: Haunted by nightmares. Plagued by a past that won't go away. When Maddy goes to a party with her new boyfriend, Shawn, she only wants to meet his friends and have a good time. They tell her about their 'Murder Club' and invite her to join. Confused but intrigued, Maddy really wants to be part of the group. Before she can join, though, the 'Murder Club' members are being killed off, one by one. Who can be trusted? Can the killer be stopped? Or will they all bleed?
translation:
Pretty much the nicest woman in show business and the sexiest Debbie is doing another good job here. Although her work in American Nightmare was far superior, she is still worth watching in this movie.

The cast is filled with your typical Melrose Place types, chiseled features and seductive curves that I've never seen before. Unlike Debbie, Laura Nativo was the only actress I had ever seen in the similar Delta Delta Die.

The plot revolves around a group of Californian arrogans who inaugurate the poor naive Debbie Rochon into their clique. They tell her that they have a murder club and that she has to kill someone in order to be accepted. Debbie wants nothing more than to be accepted by these cool people, so she quickly kills a person, and now the group has to decide what to do with her after she falls in love with her joke.

VIOLINCE: $ $$$$ (Plenty! Debbie Rochon has occasionally injected blood over her and all the murder scenes are done in your face.) Gore dogs will surely enjoy!)

NUDITY: $$$$$ Debbie Rochon has several nude scenes, as do many of the actresses without names. The pool party just seems to be an excuse to make everyone naked, man and woman alike. Julie Strain also has a topless Cameo, but she character is gone after the first five minutes).

HISTORY: $$ (Could have gotten a higher voice because the plot was very interesting and unique, but the plot serves as a filler between nude scenes. I understand that B-rate movies often use nudity, but thats marginally excessive.

ACTIVITIES: $ (The drama is below average, to say the least.) Rochon is always at Reat, easily the best B-rate actress in the industry today, but her figure in American Nightmare was superior, Danny Wolske does a good job as Debbie's object of desire, but the other actors were nothing to write about.

summary: Sarah Silverman stars as Sarah Silverman, an unemployed single woman who still behaves like a child. Sarah depends in everything on her sister (played by her real sister Laura). Sarah is petty, self centered, childish, sometimes dumb and always Jewish. Other characters are her two gay neighbors (or gaybors as she calls them) and Laura's boyfriend who is a police officer.
translation:
Comedy Central sometimes has a habit of making great programs - Chappelles Show, The Daily Show, The Colbert Report, and then there are some that love or hate some people - Stella, Dr. Cat. Then there are some shows that have their defenders but are just terrible - Mencia and now Sarah Silverman.

This show is based on the fact that Silverman is self centered, which can be funny (Colbert report) but can be awful (Mind of Mencia). It should not shock anyone that I believe the latter is. This show is a parody of a sitcom and society, a program so absurd that it loses its absurdity and it's just not funny. A woman has farted many times because it is not common. We do not need 25 minutes of it. When a criminal is disarmed by a Queef, he simply loses his attraction - we saw it in Jay and Silent Bob Strike, except that the women were hotter, and the whole scene was more absurd, made it better. But the best comparison of this show is with Stella, unless Stella was more subtle, which made the absurd comedy funny. It had a better acting, and I think a bit more of a fantastic realistic look.

Maybe the fact that some reviews are so negative (I'm very skeptical of the critical acclaim, but do not deny fan reaction) To this show is the amount of advertising, very offensive advertising by many Programs far beyond advertising for other programs. Many people wonder why Sarah Silverman has a career and others are still bitter when better shows are canceled. This show should never have passed the pilot phase. Back to Norm showed much more promise, but this show makes it happen. And as far as critics are right, many things that have been commonly panned have seen their status rise immensely. Last time I checked, Britney Spears also gets good reviews. Take this comparison as you wish, because someone will undoubtedly accuse me of being psychotic on IMDb because he does not like this show.

summary: In a marksmanship contest, Lin McAdam wins a prized Winchester rifle, which is immediately stolen by the runner-up, Dutch Henry Brown. This "story of a rifle" then follows McAdams' pursuit, and the rifle as it changes hands, until a final showdown and shoot-out on a rocky mountain precipice.
translation: Remember, I'm a fan of the genre, but have recently seen this movie. As I've been overlooking it all the time, it's a miracle for me. For me, this is a better movie than the much-praised "High Noon". It's a great western with excellent acting and a great story. The DVD is in beautiful black and white with outstanding cinematography. If you like Western or James Stewart, this movie is unmissable.

summary: In the millenium version of this classic Gothic horror we find Abraham Van Helsing (Plummer), who has tangled with Count Dracula (Butler) in the past, working as an English antiques dealer. Simon (Miller) is a vampire hunter in training under his apprenticeship. Van Helsing and Simon travel from London to New Orleans to rescue Van Helsing's daughter Mary (Waddell) from the family's life long nemesis - Dracula.
translation: Responsible for the big producer Wes Craven and the financiers are the tartars for this big-budget debacle: a thrash metal update of "Dracula", with a condescending verbal punch against Bram Stoker (who did not want his name on this thing anyway )) and nothing for the rest of us except Slasher-style bumps and blood. Christopher Plummer looks awkward nowadays as Van Helsing - not just a descendant of Van Helsing, but the true; He keeps himself alive with leeches that come from the corpse of Count Dracula, who is exhumed from her coffin after she is stolen from Van Helsing's tomb and flown to New Orleans. That's what New Orleans needs in the 21st century! The film, well produced but without a single original idea (except for multi-ethnic victims), is both repulsive and lazy and begins to repeat itself after about an hour. * from ****

summary: Two sailors, one naive, the other experienced in the ways of the world, on liberty in Los Angeles, is the setting for this movie musical.
translation: Everything that should be a musical comedy. Gene Kelly (as Joe Brady) does not miss a step and Frank Sinatra (as Clarence Doolittle) does not miss a note. Scenes with them are very good and show how much talent can contribute to a somewhat uneven plot. Sinatra's "I fall in love too easily" is an indication of his then and future best time. Kelly's "Mexican Hat Dance" with a young Mexican girl is adorable. Kelly earned his nomination for Best Actor. And there's a bushel of really funny lines, like, "You think the Navy is taking drugs?" "You think anyone sings a sailor to sleep?"; and, "We had a bit of trouble, we picked up a small child." A thoroughly entertaining film, just the thing to shake off the dust of a recent World War II.

summary: L.A. in the early 1930's: racism, poverty, and disease color the Bunker Hill neighborhood where Arturo Bandini, a lover of men and beasts alike, has arrived from Colorado to write the great Los Angeles novel. After six months and down to his last nickel, he orders a cup of coffee, served by Camilla Lopez, beautiful, self-possessed, and Mexican. Arturo gets advice, encouragement, and an occasional check from H.L. Mencken, so he keeps writing and he keeps seeing Camilla. But, he's mean to her for no apparent reason, so the relationship sputters. A housekeeper from back East suggests a way out of his jealously and fears. "Camilla Bandini": is it in the cards?
translation:
I love the portrayal of the 30s and 40s in the movie. I love Salma Hayek. I was more than willing to love this picture. but . , ,

BOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOO! ! ! !! !

No, sir, no good. The only entertaining aspect for me was that Colin Farrell's character is an insecure author, and this script, in spite of grappling with the luscious theme of racism, is approaching the audience in the style of an ABC aftershoot special.

The only person who did not sound like he was "acting" was Sutherland, and his minutes were few.

Stale approach to a tired action.

summary: In a futuristic society, some people are selected at birth to become soldiers, and trained in such a manner that they become inhuman killing machines. One of the most succesfull and older of these soldiers (Russell) is pitted against a new breed of soldiers, and after the confrontation is believed to be dead. His body is left behind in a semi-abandoned colonial planet, where everything is peaceful, and he is taught about the other aspects of life. But eventually he has to fight the new breed of soldiers again, this time to defend his new home...
translation:
I fell in love with this silent action drama. Kurt Russell and only Kurt Russell could have played that well. Todd (Kurt Russell) was born from childhood to know nothing but war and fight. He is thrown onto a planet after being outdated by genetically modified soldiers.

The stage is ready and another classic icon of action movies is born - SOLDIER. Not Rambo, not Schwarzenegger, not Bruce Willis, not Mel Gibson, not Jason Statham - Kurt Russell owns this role and has made it his own - original, daring and all too human. I miss the fact that sequels were never made.

10/10

-LD

summary: Prosperous California couple Carter and Meghan find the perfect live-in nanny when they hire Abby Reed. But no sooner does she arrive than she begins to arouse suspicion in friends and neighbors who, one by one, start dying. By the time Meghan looks deeper into the past, it's too late. Abby's work has already begun.
translation:
This movie delivers. The best part is when the awkward teenage neighbor tries to drive away from the babysitter and in the background looks like he has never been near a bicycle in his life when he tries not to fall off.

But this movie does not stop when there's less than 5 minutes later a scene of nothing but an arm reaching through a fence and into a radiator pulling out a beer.

stereotypically grinning fathers, multiple storylines that lead nowhere, and a former seaQuest actress with a Bluetooth cell phone add up to make this a perfect Saturday night at home.

summary: In a 1950's mining town called Coalwood, Homer Hickam is a kid with only one future in sight, to work in the local coal mine like his father. However in October 1957, everything changes when the first artificial satellite, Sputnik goes into orbit. With that event, Homer becomes inspired to learn how to build rockets. With his friends and the local nerd, Homer sets to do just that by trial and a lot of error. Unfortunately, most of the town and especially Homer's father thinks that they are wasting their time. Only one teacher in the high school understands their efforts and lets them know that they could become contenders in the national science fair with college scholarships being the prize. Now the gang must learn to perfect their craft and overcome the many problems facing them as they shoot for the stars.
translation: This is a gem, a real piece of Americana for all that this includes. If you yourself are programmed to resist "life-affirming" stories, just stay away and leave it to the rest of us who still believe. And what makes the icing on the cake really delicious is the fact that it's based on a true tale of rags-to-millionaire, without having to apologize for the details that have been changed to make a compact story. Chris Cooper is one of the greatest live actors, and the complex, self-contradictory goodness of the core father he portrayed could only be made successful by someone with his skills and insights. The simple-minded comments that refuse to accept a father trying to break the law while sensing that he may not be on the line expose the limitation of the commentator, not the scribe or the acting. This is not for the cynics or the simple ones.

summary: In Bagdad, the young and naive Sultan Ahmad is curious about the behavior of his people. The Grand Vizier Jaffar convinces Ahmad to walk through the city disguised as a subject to know his people. Then he seizes the power telling to the inhabitants that Ahmad has died while he sends his army to arrest the Sultan that is thrown into the dungeons and sentenced to death. Ahmad befriends the young thief Abu that helps him to escape from the prison. They flee to Basra and plan to travel abroad with Sinbad. However Ahmad stumbles upon the beautiful princess and they fall in love with each other. But the evil Jaffar has also traveled to Basra to propose to marry the princess. When they see each other, Jaffar uses magic to blind Ahmad and turn Abu into a dog. Is their love doomed?
translation: I grew up with it as my favorite movie. The special effects are unbelievable for the era and have won prizes. I can remember the dialogue as if I had heard it yesterday. It's just a great, timeless adventure. The music is by Miklos Rosza, the best in cinema history. Sabu is the thief. Conrad Veidt is the big villain. I have a copy within reach, for the next journey into the past. Whoa there! Rex Ingram wants out of his genius bottle!

summary: All all-female gang of Old West bank robbers comes out of retirement to rescue a sister in peril.
translation:
Oh, come on, people give this movie a break. The only thing I liked about it was ......... Sorry, I'm still thinking. Oh yeah!!!! When John Wayne came and shot the bad guys. Oh, sorry, wrong movie, I thought of a better movie. Let me see now, I'm still trying to defend it. Oh yes, the chick of Clueless was in it. Do not drop Stacy Dash. I mean, we all make mistakes. But boy, Stacy, you made a dooooosie.

summary: A family driving through Nevada decides to take some snapshots at an out-of-the-way ghost town named Weaver, and horrible things start happening.
translation: This is waaaaay too much ... so frustrating to watch .. I was waiting for the whole damn movie to end and finally get some ANSWERS !! .. and what I had in the end was nothing but a HUUUGE neon sign question mark over my head !!!!! I have not seen such a bad drama and such a nonsense movie for a long time .. and what bothers me is .. how come someone (an actor) reads the script of such a bull !? # @ Movie and say OK, I'm IN !!! LET THE FILM THIS! That's awful !!! This movie SUUUUUUUUUUUCKS !!!!!! I just can not believe that I spent one and a half hours of my life on something like that !!!

summary: Jean Claude Van Damme plays a dual role as Alex and Chad, twins separated at the death of their parents. Chad is raised by a family retainer in Paris, Alex becomes a petty crook in Hong Kong. Seeing a picture of Alex, Chad rejoins him and convinces him that his rival in Hong Kong is also the man who killed their parents. Alex is suspicious of Chad, especially when it comes to his girlfriend.
translation:
Usually I do not like revenge movies .... PERIOD. But Double Impact has a bit more than your typical Revenge Plot premise. You see, DI has action, accuracy, exotic locations (ie Hong Kong), ingenious weapon battles and enough martial arts to satisfy your craving for impressive unarmed combat. Like all revenge movies, he has villains that you would like to throw out of a glass window on the top floor of a 40-story building! Double Impact, however, has not stifled sensational crap that struck the plot and the elitist, racist and venomous social stereotypes, the "Eye for a Eye" and "Death Wish 2".

But in the The Double Actually the plot division is as transparent as Saran Wrap. The explanation why the guys spoke in French accents is a lousy one. It was not the watery action that made this movie bad, but the use of clich√© lines and movements from other films (from Lethal Weapon to The Princess Bride) really made it worse. Nevertheless, Double Impact is still visible. But why did those shitty films have such rogues (for example, this greedy British man who killed Chad and Alex's parents and that deadly lesbian redhead), would you love to hate with the fiber of your being?

But when the night turns from magic to murder there is only one man who could be responsible, the man she thought was gone forever. Now, Donna and her friends must find a way to escape the sadistic rampage of an obsessed killer, and survive their Prom Night.

summary: Guy Maddin reluctantly returns to his childhood home, an abandoned Canadian island, where his parents ran an orphanage. As Guy fulfills his dying mother's request to paint the lighthouse which served as the orphanage, memories of strange events there overpower him. An undercover investigation by child author/detective Wendy & a revolt by the repressed children, blew open a cover-up by Guy's parents. Wendy disguised herself as her brother Chance and discovered that Maddin's inventor father performed outr√© scientific experiments on the orphans.
translation:
This is one of those films that are more interesting from an academic point of view than from an entertainment perspective. I rate my ratings by how much I enjoyed or entertained the movie, so I give it a 4th. If I rated it as an academic movie, it would get a 10.
It's very interestingly recorded, like a pseudo-dumb movie with elements of sound effect and reality. It is supposed to convey disjointed memory and fragmentation of the mind, and it is interesting in this regard.

However, the movie has a lot of nauseating elements that I did not find so entertaining. They are mainly disturbing. It also has some very interesting pictures and some interesting concepts, but some of the character relationships (especially between the mother and the son) are quite disturbing.

Overall, this movie will appeal to you or it will not. It was interesting from an academic point of view, but it was not a good clock, and I probably will not go back to it a second time.

4/10 if you are looking for entertainment. 10/10 from an academic perspective.

summary: Bourne is once again brought out of hiding, this time inadvertently by London-based reporter Simon Ross who is trying to unveil Operation Blackbriar--an upgrade to Project Treadstone--in a series of newspaper columns. Bourne sets up a meeting with Ross and realizes instantly they're being scanned. Information from the reporter stirs a new set of memories, and Bourne must finally, ultimately, uncover his dark past whilst dodging The Company's best efforts in trying to eradicate him.
translation:
Since I have not seen the previous two in the Bourne Trilogy, I was a bit reluctant on the Bourne Ultimatum.

But it was a very exciting experience and I did not have the problem of not understanding what happened because I did not see the first two films. Every part of the story was easy to understand and I fell in love with the Bourne Ultimatum before it reached the interval! I do not think I've ever seen such an exquisite and gripping movie, especially an action movie. Since I usually shy away from action and thriller movies, that was great news for me. Ultimatum is one of the most compelling films, attracting attention from the first second to the last minute.

Matt Damon was just fantastic as his role as Jason Bourne. I've heard a lot about his great performances in the Bourne 1 + 2, and now this fabulous actor has another one to add to his list. I look forward to seeing more of his films in the future.

The stunts were done in style - everyone was brilliant and I was just shocked by the impressive effect of this movie. Well done.

summary: Two garbagemen (Tom Wilson, Karim Prince) are picked up by aliens to be experimented on and they become the lead in stopping the ultimate alien invasion which is secretly being planned by a weak Dr. Strangelove clone (Wigald Boning as Strangemeister).

summary: Santa Claus, high above the North Pole in his cloud-borne castle equipped with more surveillance devices than the Impossible Mission Force, prepares to deliver presents on Christmas night. Santa is especially interested in helping Lupita, the daughter of a poor family who wants nothing more than a doll; and a young boy whose parents are so wealthy they never spend any time with him (Santa fixes this by feeding them Pan-Galactic Gargle Blasters). However, the Devil will have none of this and sends his minion, Pitch, to foil Santa's plans. Pitch in turn recruits three Naughty Boys to help him set traps for Santa.
translation:
When I was a kid in the 1970s, every Saturday and Sunday afternoon there was a local theater with children's mills (someone remembers them?). They showed this thing a year around Christmas. Me and some friends have seen it. I was expecting a cool Santa Claus movie. What I got was a terribly dubbed (you can say) and really scary movie.

Something about Santa Claus and Merlin the Magician (do not ask me what they are doing in the same movie) fighting Satan (a joker in a silly devil costume with horns!). The pictures had huddled in my seat. I always found Santa scary so it would not help. The guy in the Satan suit did not help. But what really scared me was the wooden reins that pulled Santa's sleigh. When he tore them up and the scary sound they made and the movements - I remember having nightmares about these things! All those years later, I still remember going out of the theater, more than a little worried by what I saw. My friends were also a bit scared of it. I was watching an ad on TV and all those nightmares came barking back. This is a scary, disturbing little Christmas movie that will probably scare off the pants of every little boy who sees it. Avoid these - unless you really want to punish your children. This gets a 1.

summary: Bourne is once again brought out of hiding, this time inadvertently by London-based reporter Simon Ross who is trying to unveil Operation Blackbriar--an upgrade to Project Treadstone--in a series of newspaper columns. Bourne sets up a meeting with Ross and realizes instantly they're being scanned. Information from the reporter stirs a new set of memories, and Bourne must finally, ultimately, uncover his dark past whilst dodging The Company's best efforts in trying to eradicate him.
translation:
I do not award ten star ratings easily. A movie really has to impress me, and the Bourne ultimatum has gone far beyond that. Plus, this trilogy is so well done that I think it's one of the biggest movie trilogies of our time. Although all three films could not be any different than the Ludlum novels, they are still a powerful milestone in film production. The Bourne ultimatum made me cry that the show was over, but I could not even smile for hours.

From the moment the opening title appeared, I knew we had a chance to ride. Paul Greengrass has done it again. Everything we love about the previous Bourne movies is here again: the action, the dialogue, and of course the shaky camera. For me, the last was never a problem. I think that it adds to the tension.

I'll see this movie several times before it's released on DVD simply because it's awesome. It's a perfectly satisfying conclusion, and the time should pass as a fantastic movie and an overall memorable trilogy.

summary: The sexy, evil scientist Doctor Humboldt is attempting to resurrect an Ancient Egyptian king named Thotep in order to start the Fourth Reich. summary: Gabriel Noone is a late night radio-host in a big city, specializing in spooky tales culled from his active imagination. When Gabriel's lover decides he needs some "space" and moves out, Gabriel descends into a funk until a publisher friend brings him a manuscript written by 14 year-old Pete Logand, a troubled young fan. Pete's story touches the vulnerable Gabriel deeply. Pete was severely abused by his parents and is now under the care of his former social worker, Donna Logand, who has adopted him. Pete is very ill and he and Donna are keeping a low profile in a small town in Wisconsin to avoid discovery by Pete's mother. Gabriel develops an unsettling long-distance telephone relationship with the boy and his guardian. Nothing is as it seems and the skepticism of friends causes Gabriel to become suspicious of Donna and her motives, so he tries to resolve the loose ends by traveling to Wisconsin to confront Donna and Pete. But this effort is largely unsuccessful and we are left ...

In this critically acclaimed psycho-thriller based on true events, Gabriel (Robin Williams), a celebrated author and late-night talk show presenter, will be intrigued by the shocking story of a young listener and his adopted mother (Toni Collette) about the story of this boy, but Gabriel finds himself in an expanding mystery hiding a deadly secret? according to the official synopsis of the film.

summary: Donald Woods is chief editor of the liberal newspaper Daily Dispatch in South Africa. He has written several editorials critical of the views of Steve Biko. But after having met him for the first time, he changes his opinion. They meet several times, and this means that Woods and his family get attention from the security police. When Steve Biko dies in police custody, he writes a book about Biko. The only way to get it published is for Woods himself to illegally escape the country.
translation:
There was a great movie about Steve Biko. Unfortunately it was not. Denzel Washington - never the most flexible actor - is completely unable to convey the great charisma of Biko. Attenborough's big mass scenes are ridiculous. The Soweto massacre was not like that, three neat rows of children (some make wagon wheels!) Marched happily into the soldiers' weapons. When Biko is dead, the movie quickly goes into farce. If the fight against apartheid was something, it was a black fight, but somehow we should all be caught by the flight of a white man and his family. I'm sure Donald Woods was a decent man and he would be the first to say that Biko was important while he was not. Penelope Wilton's accent is pure Hampshire and she does not seem to realize she's in South Africa at all. at all. The forest's family dog ‚Äã‚Äãgets more lines than the black maid. When the family fled, one of the women I saw the movie with - by the way, one of only about a dozen black people in a big, full movie theater - whispered, "This is like the sound of music." She had a point.

Overall, this is a film by a well-meaning, if somewhat clumsy, White Liberal about a radical black struggle. And really, South Africa needs well-meaning white liberals like a hole in their heads.

summary: Alice and Darlene, best friends, decide to take a trip to Thailand to celebrate high-school graduation. While there, they are befriended by charming Australian rogue Nick Parks. Nick convinces them to take a weekend side trip to Hong Kong, but at the airport, they are busted for smuggling drugs. They are convicted in a show trial and sentenced to 33 years; in desperation, they contact Yankee Hank, an American lawyer based in Thailand who has been reported to be helpful if you've got the cash.
translation: I accidentally caught this movie on the cable in the middle and had to rent it to see its completeness, and I'm glad I did that. They are used as sacrificial mules in a heroin smuggler ring. Detained, the girls learn to cope with their imprisonment while trying to find a way out of their difficulties. All they are trying to help themselves, is insufficient if the Thai criminal justice system has flaws and the girls got into more trouble and lose the trust of their American lawyer "Yankee Hank". Hank gives up defending her after feeling cheated on by Alice (Claire Dane). However, Hank's Thai wife smells a rat in the case and does some more footwork of the investigation and finds out that the girls were really victims. The end of the film, when Alice makes a selfless act to save Darlene (Beckinsale), has dissolved me into tears. I really enjoyed this movie and would recommend it.

summary: The filmmaker's subjects are patriotic young Americans - ordinary men and women who heeded the call for military service in Iraq - as they experience recruitment and training, combat, homecoming, and the struggle to reintegrate with families and communities. The terrible conflict in Iraq is a prelude for the even more challenging battles fought by the soldiers returning home - with personal demons, an uncomprehending public, and an indifferent government. As these battles take shape, each soldier becomes a new kind of hero, bearing witness and giving support to other veterans, and learning to fearlessly wield the most powerful weapon of all - the truth.

summary: Gillian Holroyd is just your average, modern-day, witch, living in a New York apartment with her Siamese familiar, Pyewacket. But one day a handsome publisher, Shep Henderson walks into her building and Gillian decides she wants him--especially as it turns out he's marrying Merle Kittridge, an old poison penpal from Gillian's college days. So, Gillian casts a spell over Shep. But her powers are in danger of being exorcised by something stronger than the bell-book-and-candle routine: Love.
translation:
The 1960s television series Bewitched owes her idea to this film. This is the film Jimmy Stewart and Kim Novak made immediately after their occupation in Vertigo by Alfred Hitchcock. This one is not as obsessive as this, but Novak is just as captivating.

This was Jack Lemmons 10th movie and he is well supported here, as is Ernie Kovacs. The movie has a lot of good things about it. Hermione Gingold is very good in this film, almost as well supported as here in The Music Man. The cast is very solid.

This film has a late 1950s New York feel and a cat as witchy as any other cat in any movie. It is very worth seeing, because it is a love story with all the emotions of each, and a little magic to boot.

It's not Vertigo, but I think because it followed this movie, viewers then did not rate it as well as it deserved - be glad that William Asher saw it, so that 1960s series has emerged. I'm not so happy about what Will Ferrell did on the big screen, this movie is way better than that.

summary: Bill Maher interviews some of religion's oddest adherents. Muslims, Jews and Christians of many kinds pass before his jaundiced eye. Maher goes to a Creationist Museum in Kentucky, which shows that dinosaurs and people lived at the same time 5000 years ago. He talks to truckers at a Truckers' Chapel. (Sign outside: "Jesus love you.") He goes to a theme park called Holy Land in Florida. He speaks to a rabbi in league with Holocaust deniers. He talks to a Muslim musician who preaches hatred of Jews. Maher finds the unlikeliest of believers and, in a certain Vatican priest, he even finds an unlikely skeptic.
translation:
Bill Maher's Religulous is not an attack on organized religion. It is an attack on Christianity and Islam. In addition to mocking a bunch of rabbi who invented spoiled machines to circumvent the Sabbath rules, he does not really attack Judaism and is furious when a rabbi actually challenges the existence of the state of Israel. If Bill Maher were to complete his hypothesis, he would realize that the founding of Israel in the Palestinian territories is based on the so-called "sacred books" of organized religion. This is evidence of his utter lack of objectivity or focus in the creation of this film.

I find it really hard to believe that the man is atheist or even so intelligent. Anyone can go to a religious person and laugh at them and call them stupid for their beliefs, but what do you have to offer them in return? Nowhere does he tell them why he thinks they are stupid. What makes him the "rational" person in the room? In a way, it reflects how it really is not and looks just as stupid as these people.

If you want to watch a good movie / documentary on the true evils of religion How much religion can be detrimental to human civilization, you see Richard Dawkins' "root of all evil." It's a brilliantly researched documentary that clearly outlines what he hopes to achieve.

Bill Maher's Religulous is not funny, does not raise interesting questions and does not give insight into such a controversial topic. It seems to be the insult and enthusiasm of an old man dissatisfied with his Catholic education. I almost feel sorry for him.

summary: A world record orgy, wild sex scenes, ninjas... just a typical day at the office when you happen to work on a porn set. Director Chuck Steak is making his last film and wants to go out with a bang. With the help of veteran actress Roxy Free and the outrageously endowed Lance Long, they concoct the biggest and most absurdly complicated porn film ever made. But along the way, everything that can possibly go wrong does go wrong. Tempers flare, secrets are revealed and a hidden past is exposed, as all hell breaks loose during the climactic orgy scene. It's a wild ride in this rowdy and heartwarming tale of life in the adult film industry.
translation:
Spinal Tap was funny, because if you knew something about heavy metal, you could see in-jokes everywhere. If you know something about pornography, this documentary will keep you cold. Everything in it sounds wrong.

Spinal Tap was funny because it needed a familiar world and pushed her over the top. This movie is definitely not funny because it makes a picture of how porn is made that has no relation to the real world.

Acting here is uniformly awful, but that would not matter much if the core idea of ‚Äã‚Äãthe movie was good. But it is not.

summary: Hard drinking, burnt out ex CIA operative John Creasy has given up on life until he's hired as a bodyguard to protect nine year old Pita Ramos. Bit by bit, Creasy begins to reclaim some of his soul, but when pita is kidnapped, Creasy's fiery rage is finally released and he will stop at nothing to save her as he sets out on a dangerous, revenge fuelled rescue mission.
translation:
There are many reasons to watch this film: to see the reality of Latin America in terms of the kidnapping thing, the police corruption on a continental level, among so many realities that we live the Latins.

The performance of Denzel Wahington was brilliant, this guy is still an excellent actor and that goes on and on. Dakota Fanning has just turned 10, has become an excellent actress and I congratulate her. The rest of the movie was by miracle, I have it in my collection.

I hope Hollywood producers have made a film in Venezuela that better portrays our reality in terms of crime, drug trafficking or political issues. They were only a few of the films they play Venezuelan country (for example: Aracnophobia, Jungle 2 Jungle, Dragonfly) they should do more than they do in Mexico.

The song "Una Mirada" I hope it stays in the soundtrack, it's outstanding. My vote is 10/10

summary: Bourne is once again brought out of hiding, this time inadvertently by London-based reporter Simon Ross who is trying to unveil Operation Blackbriar--an upgrade to Project Treadstone--in a series of newspaper columns. Bourne sets up a meeting with Ross and realizes instantly they're being scanned. Information from the reporter stirs a new set of memories, and Bourne must finally, ultimately, uncover his dark past whilst dodging The Company's best efforts in trying to eradicate him.
translation:
The Bourne Ultimatum - Jason Bourne (Matt Damon in his best role of all time), the newest spy kid in the block, is bringing his search for identity to an end, as he also wants to end the CIA's latest program "Blackbriar" in order to To make assassins like himself.

I was so excited about this that I saw yesterday and today its predecessors. The identity was as brilliant as I recall, and Supremacy remains the weak (but still enjoyable) link in the weakest storyline, and apart from a chase that slightly surpasses the pursuit of the film, there is a lack of action and excitement ,

Hoo boy, has ultimatum tension? Even if you know that Bourne is going to escape the authorities (and the boy turns these films into incapacitated by the police), it's still brilliant to watch him. It's amazing to think that two boys with handguns and mopeds can generate 10 times more tension than anything these 150 million giant robots did in Transformers.

Create it with Paul Greengrass, who has this idiosyncratic style of shooting Stedicam a la documentary, even though he films characters that are anything but ordinary, in places like the CIA headquarters where nobody with one Camcorder is allowed within 10 miles. He seemed to listen to my various complaints with Supremacy, since the act in Ultimatum is nothing short of awe, with various devices used as weapons that are a candlestick, a hardcover book (I will never look at them the same way again) and an electric fan (do not ask). The music has also helped to create a lot of suspense, and there was hardly a moment not to bite.

The acting is good and the development of Julia Stiles' character "Nicky" has staged her situation a new highly sympathetic light. Damon plays his signature role with restraint, but with competence (which sounds slightly small but actually looks like Matt Damon could dodge the CIA and Interpol is something), but noticeable moments of sharpness as he still tries to do his humanity Find. This longing for a real life could get boring, and almost in Supremacy, but it just works better in Ultimatum (better script).

I recall a scene in "Goldeneye" (the only good movie by Pierce Brosnan Bond) in which Sean Bean's character James asks if the martinis will ever silence the screams of all the men who he killed. Bourne deplores all the people he has killed, and he thinks (or at least thought about it) about the meaning of action without purpose, life without meaning and how the government has turned men into resources. Still, resources that know Krav Maga and can make weapons out of anything.

Note: It always bothered me that despite everything, he's a super spy and is being chased almost everywhere by the CIA, Interpol and the police, so Bourne never thought of trying his very best Disguise facial features or forge new passports. Sunglasses maybe?

If you have a pulse and love action movies, Bourne Ultimatum is for you. Damn, it's probably the best action movie coming out this year. Of course, it would be an idiot to see it without first watching the others. In the end it does matter, but I'm almost tempted to overlook that. This is the first "3" movie to reach or surpass at least the original this summer and that says something.

A-

summary: Settled in Canada, of Indian origin, Nandini and Shekhar live a fairly harmoniously and busy lifestyle with their young child. While Nandini has family in Canada, Shekhar has no one to call his own. Then one day there is breaking news of violence in India, and that's when Shekhar asks Nandini to accompany him to India as he fears that his parents may have been in killed. Nandini is shocked to find out that Shekhar does have family, but had never discussed this with her, nevertheless she accompanies him. Upon arrival, they are greeted by Shekhar's uncle and cousin, and it is then that this young couple learn that they have entered a war between the two families - a war that they and their child may not survive.
translation:
Well, I'll be honest: It's not exactly a sholay. But you can not get a sholay every week. In fact, one could see in this film clear signatures of "not without my daughter" (Sally Field, 1991). However most 'inspired' films go, this one was well-inspired, well-handled and well-made. Nana Patekar tends, as usual, to exaggerate his hysteria, but everyone else is praiseworthy. Especially about Dipti Naval: saw her after a long time, but she has lost none of her grace. In fact, she played a lot better than I last saw her. Another of the Bollywood stars who seem to get more and more beautiful as they get older?

All in all, a nice watch.

summary: At an annual pace, a huge colony of ants is forced to collect every piece of food that grows on their island for a group of menacing grasshoppers. But that all changes when a misfit inventor ant named Flik accidentally knocks over the offering pile thus forcing the grasshoppers' devious leader Hopper to force the ants to redo their gathering of food. Despite the fact that his friends don't believe him and desperate to help save the colony, Flik volunteers to go out into the world and search for a group of 'warrior' bugs. Instead, what he got was a talented group of circus performers. But when the grasshoppers return and take control of the island, Flik must prove himself a true hero before it's too late.
translation: Critically, people say that Antz is better. Antz is a good movie, but I enjoyed Bugs Life a little bit more. I can not remember a Pixar animation except for the two Toy Story movies that made me laugh so loud. The animation is clean, the story is original and does not preach. The Voice Overs make this movie. Dave Foley is a serious ant that often gets into trouble. Hopper is an excellent characterization of the always wonderful Kevin Spacey, as is Haydn Panettiere as Dot. There is also Sterling support from Dennis Leary, David Hyde Pierce and Madeline Kahn, and I could go on and on. The script is awesome, so funny and sometimes even touching. The social messages of Antz are missing, but what we have is rock solid entertainment. 10.9. Bethany Cox

summary: Near a backwoods Ontario small town, a young alien, on vacation, crashes in his ship. Disoriented, this confused young extraterrestrial is captured by a young boy who, after naming him Phil, introduces him to the stupor of hard liquor before the boy's hick father throws him out. Roaring drunk and bunking with a friendly talking beaver, Phil eventually wanders into a bar where his new addiction traps him even while he wants to go home. Meanwhile, a secret US black ops organization activates a drunken field agent to find the alien. However, while he searches, Phil's easily manipulated personality leads him down paths that will profoundly affect his new native friends.
translation:
Phil the Alien is one of those bizarre movies in which humor is based more on the peculiarity of everything than on actual punch lines.

At first it was very strange and pretty funny, but as the movie progressed, I did not find the jokes or oddities funny.

It's a low budget movie (that's never a problem in itself), there were some pretty interesting characters, but at some point I just lost interest.

I imagine that this film would address a pitter that is currently participating.

For something similar, but better try "brother from another planet"

summary: Navin Johnson sets out to travel to Los Angeles to attend the wedding of his pen pal, Marie, but is sidetracked by the leader of a gang of hobos who takes him to Las Vegas when learning of Navin's skill at playing cards.
translation:
I'm at the other end of the previous comment.

First of all, I do not think that this should be a direct continuation of "The Jerk". I mean, it's not "The Jerk 2" ... it's "The Jerk, Too", which leads me to believe that many of the character names are the same, but in fact they're about a completely different person />
Think about it: Almost no connection to the previous movie, except the character names; a very different story; different occupation; and the fact that it is a partial musical.

I say, give this movie some credit. It has a lot of laughs in it. Mark Blankfield in his prime.

summary: Mexican English teacher Pablo Fernandez seeks a better life for himself and his spoiled daughter Christina (5) after losing his wife in a hurricane. Pablo becomes a tomato picker as illegal immigrant in California. While driving his illegal employer Charlie's truck, he accidentally runs over Dinah Knightly (6), who later dies. Dumb, arrogant detective Bryant and brighter but superstitious rookie Steven Lightning investigate and set chase. Petty would be-TV reporter Soid finds out first and blackmails Pablo to take her along fleeing to Mexico or she'll report him. The Fernandez's make it to Canada. On the road improvisation gets out of hand.
translation: This movie has an interesting plot, but the acting is pretty bad and the script is bad. I was very disappointed. The moral dilemma faced by the main character is intriguing, but due to poor writing and casting, this potentially profitable premise is plundered. 2 of the 4 other people in the theater left after about 45 minutes and the other 2 laughed at how bad the movie was. I kept it up to the end, but I have to admit that I played blackjack on my phone to make the last 30 minutes bearable.

summary: "The Brak Show is a story of a neighborhood. It's the story of a family. It's the story of what happens when adults have children and those children go to school. And Brak is in it. He lives in a house. A house on a quiet street not unlike yours or mine. A house in a neighborhood. That's The Brak Show." So goes Cartoon network's description of the new sitcom starring Brak, the absent-minded space pirate from the Space Ghost cartoons. He goes through the all the typical sitcom situations with his friend Zorak. Also along for the ride are Brak's parents, his brother Sisto, and his next-door neighbor Thundercleese.
translation: Let Braik do a good show. After all, he and Zorak live their own lives outside Spac Ghost Coast To Coast. I have to say that I love these shows very much. They are completely what started Adult Swim. Brak made it big with an album that came out in 2000. It may not have been platinum, but his show has been very popular with tons of people who love Adult Swims Shows. I have to say that out of all the Adult Swim shows with no plot, this must be the one with the most ever made plot. That's why I like it so much, it's just such a classic in the Adult Swim story. I think that's just a great show if you do not like it. Hey, there were tons that hated it and tons that loved it.

summary: A young, wealthy club kid's life spirals downward into an out-of-control world of drugs, sex and violence.
translation:
To be honest, I had no idea what this movie was about when I started. So I watch movies whenever possible. No prejudice. I thought that was a movie about stoners in the woods or something. I was wrong, somehow.

Loaded was kind of boring at first, but once it started running, it really got me hooked. I know the feeling of being pulled into something dangerous in which you feel helpless, but doing things you do not want to do.

Another user said that this movie is silly and implausible, but I want to be different. Such things happen. I'm sorry, but not everyone lives in a dream world where nothing bad can happen and crazy situations are "implausible". Really sorry, but the reality of the world is that they happen. The creator of this movie and the actors did a great job explaining how things can just go bad and how people can make really bad decisions. Sometimes things are going well, sometimes bad and that's life.

I recommend this movie.

summary: After a death in the family, the bisexual Anthony and his slutty girlfriend of convenience embark on a bizarre road trip filled with multiple sex partners, an eclectic psychic (Mink Stole), and an amusingly submissive younger brother. While en route, Anthony's sadistic past catches up with him when he discovers an ex-gangbanger is stalking him across the country.
translation: First of all - there's absolutely no flirting in this movie - with Anthony or anyone else. These people do not flirt - they just do it. Your first acid test is to wade through more than 15 minutes of intense violence and sexual perversion. That would not be so bad - Hell, I like violence and perversion as much as the next reviewer, but without a context to put it in, it's disgusting. So you come through the torture and the chaos. Then we meet Donna and the movie turns into something completely different - not better - just different: a street scene without a heart. There are lame attempts at comedy, thanks to cameos - written broad and widely played by Judy Tenuta and Mink Stole (and a few whores and drag queens). They all deserve better. Photography is deliberately disorienting, so if you get motion sickness (or any kind of illness) - this movie is not for you.
