When I think about it, I'm not sure who this movie is for - except perhaps gay and bisexual S & M fans who like bad-written, poorly shot Indy films about themselves.

summary: A mental hospital, faced with a severe decrease in funding, is forced to release mass-murderer Ethel Janowski into a halfway house. Ethel is psychotic, delusional and has a hefty appetite. In fact, her killing spree began 13 years before with the murder of her grandmother, who had forced her to go on a diet. Now that she's tasted the home-cooked fare at the halfway house, she'll do absolutely anything to get more.
translation:
There are some bad movies out there. Most of them are pretty funny. "Criminally Insane 1" was one of those films. So bad that it was fun and important. "Criminally Insane 2" must be one of the worst movies ever made and come from me, that says a lot because I'm not the kind of person to say anything is the worst. But believe me, that was just terrible and only 1 hour to walk is 1 hour too long.

The film has a pretty incoherent story, but who cares about the story, if all you want to see is a big fat woman who runs around killing people because she is not fed. Well, you can not see that in this movie, except for all the flashback sequences that come from the first one. The new story could have been really funny when Ethel was sent to a halfway house and murdered everyone, but until the last 20 minutes of the movie, nothing happens and you fall asleep at this point.

The camera work in this movie is just horrible. This literally reminds me of something I took with my friends when I was 15. The sound quality is different because you can not understand a word that most characters say. To give an example of how bad it is, go to a New York subway and try to understand what's being said on the speakers, that's how the movie sounds. Not that it matters what they talk about, because the actors are about as dry as a dead piece of wood.

Now I know that saying the worst movie out there is pretty tough, but words can not describe how bad this movie is. If you do not believe me, look at it yourself. 1.10

summary: Three stories of werewolves in the early 21st century. "Blood Reunion" - A horror writer returns to his home town but finds a secret he could not have guessed as a child. Old Blood - As a couple grow closer a secret is revealed but to get what one of them want they must make the ultimate sacrifice. Man Beast - A man is hunted through a forest. But what secrets does the hillside community hold?
translation:
Really bad shot on video "movie" made by not one, not two, but three amateur video makers.

If you want to make a bad horror movie, at least throw some blood, gore and nudity. There is some blood supplied by latex arm props bought in a Halloween store. There are lesbians and hookers, but no nudity or sex. The lesbians spend a lot of time in bed, but only talk.

There seems to be no editing effects - fades, wipes, etc. From time to time, a bit of black seems to separate scenes. >
Terrible music from bad heavy metal bands, whose sites take up most of the credits. The werewolves are represented by rubber masks attached only to the "actor" face. They did not even bother applying brown make-up to their necks, arms, or wrists.

I guarantee that a 10-year-old could make a better movie with a video camera. Rent or watch this movie, except as an example of how to make low-budget video.

summary: A young boy stumbles into a mysterious girl who floats down from the sky. The girl, Sheeta, was chased by pirates, army and government secret agents. In saving her life, they begin a high flying adventure that goes through all sorts of flying machines, eventually searching for Sheeta's identity in a floating castle of a lost civilization.
translation: I saw the original English version on video. Disney's selection of voice actors looks very promising. I can not believe that I say that. The story is about a little boy who meets a girl with a story linked to his own. The two are thrown into one of the funniest and most intriguing stories in any animated film. The animation quality is excellent! If you've seen Disney's job as a Kiki delivery service, you can see the quality in their production. It almost redeems them for stealing the story of Kimba, the white lion. (But not quite!) Finally, Miyazaki's films are properly published! I can not wait to see an uncut English version of Nausicaa!

summary: Jerilee Randall, a simple schoolgirl living in the San Fernando Valley, dreams of becoming a famous screenwriter. While at a party, she meets the son of a famous screenwriter. The son invites her over to his house; she accepts. They drive away with some other people, and that night, she is assaulted by one of the son's friends with a garden hose. The friend is interrupted in his assault by screenwriter Walter Thornton, who arrives in time to save her from an even more disgusting fate. Walter's rescue of Jerilee begins a friendship between the two, and before you know it, the two fall in love. They marry. Their marriage falls apart when Jerilee's script rewrites actually improve one of Walter's screenplays and he feels one-upped. Jerilee then goes through affair after sordid affair in her attempt to write her own screenplay and have it produced.
translation: I have shown this film several times here at college, and every time I show it, the number of people watching with me grows exponentially ... in addition to the virgins, anyone I've already shown MUST do it again see! It takes a while to get used to it, but in the end the whole room screams, shouts, yells, rewinds the scenes, repeats dialogues, and is fully immersed in the cinematic experience that Pia Zadora in "Die lonely lady "is" scene by scene after the scene of the most clumsily filmed, badly written, horribly played TRASH is thrown at you in a total assault that counts as the most come I own (no small statement, friends Nothing compares to 2 U, Pia ... and I do not think I'm the only one who ever felt that way!

summary: A man visits Alcatraz prison after having dreams about all the people who died there. When he gets there, his brother is possessed by an evil cannibal demon. The ghost of a female heavy metal singer who was killed there tries to help the man fight the monster.
translation: The plot is absurd and lame, even sucking are performances and dialogue is hard to keep your eyes open. I advise you to have a caffeine-fueled friend on hand to wake up in time for some gore effects. Why are you bringing Alcatraz? In this case, it becomes increasingly difficult to swallow. All the while I wondered who this movie was supposed to be for: Klotz full of lame subplots (like the Cannibalism US Army Captain) That's low-grade.BTW in every way! This movie is banned in Germany !!

summary: Film critics Michael Phillips of the Chicago Tribune and A.O. Scott of the New York Times give their opinions on the latest new releases. The films are reviewed with the classifications 'See It', 'Skip It', or 'Rent It'. They also make suggestions as to excellent films they recommend for renting on video.
translation: Since Siskel's death and Ebert's absence, the show has remained in the incompetent hands of Richard Roeper. Roeper is not a film critic, he just criticizes everything he does not like personally, d. H. Films with country music are panning because "I do not like country music!". and children's movies get a standard "Do not watch it now, wait until it comes out on DVD and rent it for your kids!" Roeper may be an idiot, but in a different area. The weekly guests are better for Ebert, but who wants to pick a daisy in the middle of a cow dung? All in all, it's the only show in town and that alone makes it worth seeing. As for Roger Ebert, if Stephen Hawking can speak, you too can! It is your thoughts and thoughts that we long for. Do what is necessary to free this usurper from his self-declared throne.

summary: Anna is becoming lost in the loneliness of her own world when she discovers she can visit another, a house she has drawn herself and occupied by a young disabled boy. But as she discovers more of the links between her fantasy world and the mundane present, she is drawn only deeper into a dream turning into a nightmare.
translation:
Anna (Charlotte Burke) develops a strange fever that causes her to faint and slip into a world of her own creation. A gloomy world she drew with a sad little boy as the inhabitant of an old, clumsy house in the middle of a lonely field. It lacks in detail, just as every child that draws the house, and its resident Marc (who can not walk because Anna did not draw his legs) are inhabitants of this purgatory / limbus world. Anna begins to visit the boy and the house more often to find out what it is and tries to help save the boy, but her fever makes it harder and harder for her to wake up than kill her catch and Marc there forever.

Wow! It's a good word to sum up Bernard Rose's brilliantly haunting and poetic paperhouse. A movie so simple it's almost impossible to explain and impossible to forget. While you can find this puppy in your horror area, it's anything but. It is more of a serious imagination, expertly directed and exceptionally well played, especially Charlotte Burke and Elliot Speirs (Marc). And yet it is not a children's movie, but to remind us of those carefree days that are now only dark memories. Rose creates a rich tapestry of moody ambience that creates an exciting backdrop to the brilliant story and great actor. Paperhouse refrains from trying to explain its dreamy qualities and leaves most things to the imagination of the beholder. There is a lot of symbolism and ambiguity that you can bite into. Paperhouse likes to play with the mind of the beholder and captivate you with its very own sense of reasoning. As the story unfolded, I was always impressed with how powerful the movie was until the finale, leaving me with a smile on my face and a tear in my eyes.

Bernard Rose's visuals are brilliant here. He is able to create an unnervingly gloomy atmosphere that seems simple on the surface, but as a whole is much larger than the sum of its parts. The acting is from the young Charlotte Burke in this, her feature film debut, is also really impressive. Unfortunately, she has not graced the screen since then. A deserved Burnout Central Prize seems only appropriate for this performance. Towards the end, the film lingers a bit here and there, but I easily missed it. I wish they had taken a darker turn and created a much more powerful finale, which in retrospect would have proved all the more annoying and truly captivating. The movie as it is is still one for the books and deserves to be seen by any serious movie lover. It's a poetic journey told through the innocent eyes of a child, a powerful movie that has much to think about and much more to praise.

summary: The Greek army is about to set sail to a great battle, but the winds refuse to blow. Their leader, King Agamemnon, seeks to provide better food, but accidentally slays a sacred deer. His punishment from the gods, the sacrifice of his daughter Iphigenia.
translation: Michael Cacoyannis has had a relatively long career, but has surprisingly few credits to his name, including some real clothes like the hostile Cold War satire The Day the Fish came out. Iphigenia, however, is a highlight. Adapted by Cacoyannis from the piece by Euripides, it is a superior reproduction of the classic tragedy and has recently made its first television appearance in many years in the United States courtesy of the Flix Channel. The film is shot on an epic scale, but definitely not a "big" movie, with an emphasis on simple history: King Agamemnon is forced to sacrifice his daughter Iphigenia. , much to the dismay of Queen Clytemnastrae (Irene Papas). Kazakos and Papas are both outstanding, but it is the stunning Papamoschou who brings the most interesting elements to the screen, combining the innocence of childhood with the dawning realization that she is the plaything in a political game. Highly recommended for fans of international cinema.

summary: The first scene, like almost all others, is a fighting scene. A girl, about 18, is sacked from her factory work because her trial period is over. The girl, Rosetta, is quite upset and the cops will have to arrive to get her out. She has her reasons: she lives in a caravan, with her alcoholic mother. She goes looking for work as some go to the war. Treasons, murders are in her mind, if not in her acts.
translation: At first I got squeamish after watching this movie for five minutes (because of the bas script). I do not think this movie has any meaning. It's boring from the first to the last minute. I do not understand why this movie scores so high. I gave it 1/10, but actually it's not more than 0/10.

summary: In Coruscant, the Jedi Obi-Wan Kenobi and Anakin Skywalker rescue the Supreme Chancellor Palpatine from the Separatist General Grievous' spaceship and Anakin kills Count Dooku with his light-saber after a fight; however Grievous escapes from the Jedi. When they land on Coruscant, Padm√© Amidala comes to tell Anakin that she is pregnant. Soon he has premonitions of his wife dying during the delivery. Palpatine requests that Anakin join the Jedi Council against the will of the members but he is not promoted to Master and stays at the rank of Knight; further they ask him to spy on Palpatine. Anakin is manipulated by Palpatine about the true intentions of the Jedi and is tempted to know the dark side of the Force that could be capable of saving Padm√©. Further Palpatine discloses that he is Sith Lord Darth Sidious. What will Anakin do?
translation:
To paint a movie about the prequels and the "real" Star Wars trilogy would even tax a great filmmaker ... Mr. Lucas is not that filmmaker.

To the case of a good man in the dark needs a good actor ... Mr Christensen is not this actor.

The first 60-80 minutes are overwhelmingly boring with just a few bags of even more lightsaber fights, but there is a lack of edge because you already know which main characters survive to the original Star Wars.

Earl Dooku (Christopher Lee) has a very volatile role here and the best idea is to keep Jar Jar Binks quiet!

No, the film only comes about when the Chancellor turns on the Jedi and has a large (oversized) sequence of lava falls

summary: After having watched his cop father abuse his mother and compel him to become a Sub-Inspector with Maharashtra Police, Anant Velankar, who had wanted to complete his MBA, re-locates to live in Bombay. It is here he meets and falls in love with a Lecturer, Jyotsna Gokhale. Proud of his profession and hoping to make a change, he soon realizes that the police are manipulated by politicians like Rama Shetty to do their bidding. Frustrated, he turns his anger on suspects held in cells and beats them mercilessly. His frustrations arise after he is sidelined for a medal while apprehending a dacoit, and being counseled by Jyotsna to resign from this job. Things only get worse after he is humiliated by Rama Shetty, who is now campaigning to be a Municipal Councillor, as well his superior, Inspector Patil. He takes to alcohol, gets suspended and with a Delhi-contact gets reinstated. Things only get worse after he brutally assaults another suspect resulting in death. It is this news that will ...
translation:
The performance of Om Puri, Smita Patil and Sadashiv Amrapurkar and all the chemistry goes well with the minimalist approach to storytelling and directing by Govind Nihlani. The dialogues of Vijay Tendulkar are also great.

I have not seen another movie like this. It's a whole, each piece fits so well into the storyline. You can not be impressed by this movie.

Amrish Puri arrives as a bossy husband and 'baap' of Om Puri. Om Puri is the young man caught between his sense of duty and his inability to fight the system. Sadhashiv as Rama Shetty gives the film just the right touch with its smiling and gentle-talking villain. The first meeting of Anand Velankar with Rama Shetty at Sadhashiv is breathtaking. Smita Patil does not play a major role, but her part does not detract from the main plot.

In addition, Kafi Inamdar plays the role of a policeman who has come to terms with the system and how it works. To say the right things in the right places and to know how to stay away from difficulties. He is also the 'guru' of Om Puri and helps him when he gets into trouble.

The film not only brings the difficulties of a policeman who does his duty but also of the other to the clean side of brutality in police custody. Om Puri begins hopelessness and a burning desire to free herself in this extraordinary performance in Ardh Satya.

A treat for all fans of Indian cinema.

summary: Paul is a meek electrician who, with his nagging, dominating wife Beatrice, moves to a new house in a neighborhood stricken by a series of robberies. That night, the gang responsible breaks into their house, beats up Paul, murders Bea, and makes off with the valuables. As Paul is coming to terms with his wife's death, she appears as a ghost only he can see and hear, nagging him into hitting the streets (later with his garbageman neighbor) and avenging her, with some interesting methods of doing so...
translation: This movie should be number one among the 100. Acting is so terrible that when my son and I saw it, we almost became physically ill. And the story is worse. I could always talk about how bad it is, but all I really wanted to do was add a warning to Frankbob's review, as I see no-one else has bothered to do so. Do not waste time, money, energy or anything else in this movie. Thank god we saw it on TV so we did not spend anything on it. If we had, I would have been forced to write those responsible for this abomination and be forced to send a curse in their general direction. To summarize, I have always enjoyed watching Carrie Fisher. But I'm sad to say that she's not worth watching in this particular movie. Do not spoil your opinion of Carrie by looking at it.

summary: Quantum Airlines flight 66 has just taken off from Frankfurt, Germany bound for New York's JFK International Airport with 247 passengers aboard. After take-off, a man infected with a Doomsday Virus passes out while a flight attendant and doctor try to save the man. The pilot tries to land the plane but can't because the people on the ground know about the virus. An ambassador and his secretary help the pilot struggle through the government's secret attempt to shoot flight 66 out of the air. And if the plane does land, Doomsday has arrived on earth.
translation:
Sometimes Lady Luck smiles at me. I had originally made a VHS cassette from this wonderful TV presentation - and copied it. I was heartbroken when I realized what I had done because I could not get a copy of it anywhere else. Recently, I subscribed to digital cables, and while I was searching in upcoming movies, I'm there surprise was a scheduled broadcast of the movie. This time, however, I made a copy of it on DVD, so there is no chance to repeat my mistake.

I finally saw it again after eight years and it was as exciting and tense as when I saw it for the first time. There is a little prelude to this story in which my first contact with "Pandora's Watch" came with a live reading of the book on public radio. I just looked at the transmitter for lunch on the way home and since the first part I was thrilled. Every day I waited expectantly for the next chapter to be read.

When I learned a few months later that the book would be broadcast on television as a movie, I made sure that my book was deleted schedule for this event.

First, I would say that the film was very faithful to the book, in contrast to what another reviewer said. That is already a rare achievement for television films.

Secondly, I agree with others about the casting. I could not imagine a better choice for Captain Holland than Richard Dean Anderson. Literally, the film could have crashed and burned without proper occupation for this pivotal role. Anderson has never been better, and it's a shame we did not see him anymore. In fact, all the performers have done an excellent job. My only complaint about the film - and the book - was the interjection of the "terrorist plot" with which a private business jet was armed air-to-air missiles and stalked their pilot and fired the plane hit. Basically, we're talking about less than 36 hours to orchestrate and execute a plan like this, and people, that's just not realistic with all the players involved. Also unrealistic was how little the airliner was affected, first having then blown off two of its engines.

The beef aside, I enjoyed the building voltage and found it very believable, as the reactions of foreign governments were portrayed both in the film and in our films.

If you have the opportunity to watch this movie, definitely do it.

summary: A homesick Pvt. Snafu learns that his family are almost as commited to the war efforts as himself.
translation: Frank Tashlin's "The Home Front" is one of the lifeless Private Snafu short films, a series of cartoons made as instructional films for the military. Instead of doing Snafu some inappropriate acts that lead to disaster, "The Home Front" focuses instead on his loved ones at home and on how much they have to offer the war effort. Snafu realizes that he was wrong when he thought it was easy for them. It's a concept with few opportunities for good jokes and instead Tashlin plays the daring card stronger, widening jokes with strippers and slightly dressed dancers instead of effective comic relief. The result is a well-meaning abbreviation that today has little relevance or entertainment value as a historical artifact.

summary: Paris, 1969. The filming of a sci-fi movie set in the distant year 2000 is in trouble. The director's obsession with the actress who plays the sexy secret agent Dragonfly has clouded his judgment and the film has no ending. A young American, in Paris to document his life on film with total honesty, is brought in to finish the movie with a bang. This proves to be difficult when the line between his fantasy life and reality becomes blurred, and he finds himself seduced by the charms of Dragonfly.
translation: CQ was the worst movie I've seen this year. Almost every movie I see in the theater is at least entertaining or has something to say. This film looked like it had been staged by a film student for his intro. for filmmaking. His father makes big films. His sister has done a good job. But brother Roman? NO! One critic had the audacity to compare this movie to Godard's Le M√©pris (contempt). While Coppola jr. Having the same idea, a movie about film, he tried too hard to make himself European, artistic and witty, when all is just kitsch. The lead actor wears the same expression throughout the movie as if he were either in awe or shocked that this movie was made around him. Schwartzman somehow manages to drop his role as an extravagant director. Depardieu is fine. The one scene that has any real movie spoof humor is, surprisingly, not the B-movie scene, but one that plays in Italy; a montage of shots of different characters in a very small car, driving around and picking up random people. That was the only thing that reminded me of the movie that I suspect has tried. Or rip off. Or both. The documentary film starring in the camera and filming various objects was played, the ending was given a "twist" or artistic value ... I think the funniest thing about this movie was the movie itself and not so as it was intended. No wonder this film was sent back after a festival screening to be re-cut or re-shot or whatever, which makes me curious how bad it was before. I can not believe it could have been worse. If you want to see a good spoof of the movie, check out the films by Austin Powers. All of them. The opening to the third is more entertaining and ingenious than this whole movie. Lil 'Romy, for the sake of the cinema, please go back to manage your cousin's music videos. Leave the godparents to dad.

summary: Four athletically able teenagers along with their brainy friend Billy are selected by Zordon to fight the evil of Rita Repulsa, her monsters and her minions after the witch is accidentally released from imprisonment in an intergalactic dumpster on the moon. Later in the series, the rangers are joined by Tommy, the once evil Green Ranger designed for Rita's evil, but later was deprogrammed and spent two portions of the series briefly as the Green Ranger. Over time, some rangers had to pass their powers to others as well. Action scenes and scenes with Rita were edited from footage based on Japanese action sagas. Replacement villain Lord Zedd was designed in the U.S.
translation:
The Power Rangers is definitely the worst TV show and completely ridiculous plastic toy line in the history of the United States.

There is absolutely nothing, even remotely entertaining, about this completely terrible TV show.

The owners of this show should be ashamed of themselves, as there is no redeeming value for this nonsense.

Today's kids should try to watch better shows like the Toy Story movies instead of this garbage.

summary: Rose is a shop assistant at Harrods and finds herself in a top floor storage room when the mannequins seem to come to life. She's rescued by a man who calls himself the Doctor but reveals little about himself. Her Internet search leads her to a man who believes that the Doctor is an immortal alien who has been instrumental in averting various Earthly disasters. Their paths cross again and Rose helps the Doctor in fighting a race of plastics-based creatures whose home world may have been destroyed in a battle involving the Doctor. Rose seems like the perfect companion for his future travels.
translation:
As an integral part of British pop culture such as Monty Python and James Bond, Doctor Who was a big hit for 26 years (1963-1989), making it one of the world's longest-running TV shows (most series are lucky) ten seasons). Plans to restart the series have always been on the BBC's agenda, and after a miscalculated (not to be Americanized) TV movie produced by Fox, he did not manage to complete the magic of the original version for nine years Captured (Comic Relief Parody and Animated Miniseries) were needed before the Ultimate Time Lord could properly return, courtesy of acclaimed writer Russell T. Davies.

Davies Brilliance in reintroducing the character lies in his decision to do so through the eyes of an outsider: Rose Tyler (Billie Piper), a London-based young woman who leads a normal life, until one night it is attacked by living plastic creatures. She is rescued by an elusive stranger, who simply introduces herself as a doctor (Christopher Eccleston) and then disappears after annoying: "Nice to meet you, Rose, run for your life!". As she becomes more and more curious about this "man," she soon finds herself in a whole new world: extraterrestrials, invasions, journeys through time and space, and of course the ubiquitous police box-shaped TARDIS.

The true triumph of this episode, however, is Piper's achievement: in theory, Rose is in her late teens, almost the same age as thousands of young audiences who have never heard of the doctor before. Her portrayal of an ordinary girl, lost in a new, exciting universe, represents the new generation's response to the return of a TV icon, and the chemistry that is currently forming between her and Eccleston is a sign of the new Doctor Who, the old one is just as good.

First, fifth, ninth, it makes no difference: There might have been others before Eccleston (and Piper, for that matter), but together he is, William Hartnell, Peter Davison, and the rest of the bunch a single character, one so cool, he does not even need a name: he is THE Doctor.

summary: A young, wealthy club kid's life spirals downward into an out-of-control world of drugs, sex and violence.
translation:
That's it. That's one. This is the worst movie ever. Ever. It beats everything. I have never seen worse. Take the trophy back and give it to these people ... there's no comparison.

Even three days after I saw this (for some reason I still do not know why) I can not believe how terribly horrible this movie is / was. It is so bad. So far from anything that could be called a movie, story, or anything that was ever to be created and brought into our existence.

That made me question if people really are on this earth or are not doing good. I felt disgusted with ourselves and our progress as a species in this universe. This kind of movie truly hurts us as a society. We should be ashamed. I really can not stress that our global responsibility as people living and creating art is that we must prevent the emergence of these blatant distortions of our reality for our own benefit. It's embarrassing. I do not know how in the world any of these actors, writers or the director of this movie sleeps at night, knowing that they've played a role in making Loaded. I do not know what kind of disgusting monsters see these movies.

That said, I love a good "bad" movie. I love Shark Attack 3, I love Bad Taste, they are HILARIOUS. I tell all my friends to see them because they are "evil".

But that ....... that transcends the line of "bad" to a whole new dimension. That is embarrassing. That's the bad thing, where you know everything that will happen, every line, every action, every death, every sequence, BEFORE they happen; and not just like a second or two before, I mean, after seeing the first 5 minutes before.

Every cheesy cut "effect" is shamelessly used over and over again to a disgusting point. I really do not want to see the "shaky" camera drug intoxication effect or Jump Cuts or Swerve Cuts or any Fancy Cut Ever Again Ever. This is meticulously boring, repetitive and simply teases the audience.

But ....... and let me be specific here, the DAMAGE to this movie is that in the face of production it appears that a pretty decent amount of money has actually been put into these excrements. Personally, I'll grab the director's shoulders if I ever see him and shake him to servility and demand that he run home and swallow two liters of Drain-O or I'll do it for him.

Once we have needed a new form of inhumane torture for our POWs abroad, show them this movie over and over again in a padded cell. Trust me, I think they will be more wasteful with suicide methods after the 72nd time they've gone through it.

Stop these films, they are just the most disgusting of all facets of our society. You're welcome. Stop. NOW.

summary: In one of East London's most volatile neighborhoods, pride, rivalry and revenge are the only codes on the street. Touted as a British Boyz in the Hood, Bullet Boy is a gripping and authentic drama that takes an unflinching look at two troubled, street-smart boys. Fresh out of jail, 18-year-old Ricky (Ashley Walters, Get Rich or Die Tryin') and his 12-year-old brother, Curtis, struggle to walk the straight and narrow when a minor street clash escalates into an all-out neighborhood war. For Ricky and Curtis, friendships, family and loyalty will be tested to the extreme in a world where guns are a fact of everyday life and boys try to be men before they're even teenagers. Music by Massive Attack.
translation:
It's a bad, very bad movie.

Well, for people, a really realistic movie is a good thing. It's not for me. Life is also predictable, bad, evil, trivial, meaningless, sometimes. Maybe that's why people say this movie is real.

Too many commonplaces: You're black, you're a criminal, you're damned damned, whatever you do, you'll end up shooting or being shot by someone; Do not let the children play with their weapons, it could be dangerous; and then there are those who go to church, and then they are good, very good ... Before that, I had not seen such a bad movie yet. Maybe that's why I never realized how important photography is in a movie. In this, every scene taken outdoors during the day is clear and annoyingly blue. It was not even important to correct the color balance. Oh! So far, I've "rated" more than 300 movies in this database, and this (3/10) is my least valuable yet.

summary: At 18, Diana has a chip on her shoulder; she's close to expulsion from high school for fighting, her mother is dead, her dad is surly, the popular girls at school set her teeth on edge, she knows men can cause pain. When she picks up her younger brother at a Brooklyn gym where he boxes to please his father, she decides she wants to train. Hector, a coach, reluctantly agrees to teach her. It's soon clear to him that Diana has talent; he pushes her. She spends time with another young fighter, Adrian, who has a girlfriend, but Diana intrigues him and stirs real feelings he tries to articulate. She, too, must accommodate her toughness and ironic detachment to her feelings for him.
translation:
While the story of a restless child turning to boxing for self-esteem and anger management is hardly a new thing, the story here takes a new turn when the protagonist is a girl instead of a boy.

Diana has problems at school. She just can not stay away from the fight. At home, her father keeps putting her down. Her brother trains boxing in a gym and one day, when she picks him up, she decides that she wants to work out as well.

It would be easy to call this movie a "rocky girl," I think. But that's not what it's all about. The story actually benefits greatly from the fact that the main character is more of a girl than a boy. That way you can handle more problems at the same time. First, the problem that she is not accepted because she is not a girl, and then when she goes into the pits because she's a girl at all. It's also a story about how one purpose can change another's life. How positive things can make you grow. I do not want that to sound pretentious, because the movie does not look pretentious at all, but what I'm saying is true.

Michelle Rodriguez is also very good in the lead. It's really a shame that she's now stuck in the "hard girl" typing, because that's not really her role in "Girlfight". Sure, she's a boxer, but it's the more sensitive moments that really make her shine.

So maybe that's your average underdog story with a twist, but she's been raised far above the crowd by Rodriguez. Performance. I rate the 7/10.

summary: Butch convinces Tom and Jerry that there's no reason to fight and they should all sign a peace treaty. Tom and Butch even rescue their pals from a fellow cat and dog. But then a steak falls off a truck and the boys can't decide how to divvy it up, ultimately losing it completely, and the truce is off.
translation: This movie seems to be well remembered when Tom & Jerry signed a peace treaty. Things are idyllic for a while, but it's getting predictably sour. Probably the most memorable moment was the endless fight with a pipe, a frying pan and a baseball bat, in which the two, plus Butch, the dog at the beginning and at the end of the short takes part. I enjoyed it, and you should try to catch it on Cartoon Network.

summary: A pair of entrepreneurs with more bravery than brains hit upon the idea of blood surfing: spreading chum in the water in order to attract sharks, then hopping on a surfboard and riding through the middle of the pack. As they're filming their promotional documentary, the fun gets interrupted by a thirty-foot long salt water crocodile that begins snacking on everyone in the expedition. Will any of them make it back to civilization?
translation: ... which is not exactly a ringing confirmation. Overall, "DinoCroc" was a much better movie. Sure, in this movie, Matt Borlenghi played a complete wissasche that screamed the whole movie about his little brother being eaten by DinoCroc. But the special effects in "DinoCroc" were better, the storylines were better and the acting was better. Here are the issues with "Blood Surf" - 1) The killer crocodile looks like a kid's model with a retractable jaw. 2) the plot is ridiculous. Matt Borlenghi & Co. are shipwrecked on a deserted island, where they meet a rabid group of ugly Filipino natives trying to force themselves on the women in the group. What a complete waste of 15 minutes movie was. And 3) there is not enough croc time. There are a few redeeming qualities of "Blood Surf" - the actresses are quite attractive and Matt Borlenghi is eaten by Croc towards the end of the movie. But if you're on your deathbed and only have enough time to see a Matt Borlenghi / Killer crocodile movie, skip it and start "DinoCroc" instead.

summary: Shecky Moskowitz, a deservedly struggling young comedian, lands a menial job on a cruise ship as the Miss-Universe contest is being held on-board. The Big Man On Deck for this voyage is Dickie Diamond, the ship's comedian and all-around ladies' man. As an assorted array of thugs, Panamanian mercenaries and terrorists try to storm the ship, Shecky hopes for one big chance to prove himself and enter the exciting world of cruise ship comedy.
translation:
I can say without any doubt that Going Overboard is the worst movie I've ever seen, and yes, I've seen Cujo. Adam Sandler is an abomination as Schecky Moskowitz, a would-be comedian who works on a cruise ship. That's the story.

That's it! Nothing else in the movie makes sense, it's like a crazy man's breakfast all over, and not in a crazy, bare gun, but rather frustrating: "Throw both shoes on the way." even General Noriega appears, for no reason that I can understand (at least not for humor). Then there's Miss Australia, which has the worst Australian Accent I've ever heard, and you have something I will not call the worst movie ever, because Going overboard does not even meet the basic definition of a movie. I highly recommend this movie as it will enhance the reputation of any bad movie you'll ever see. I guarantee that the first thing you say after watching a bad movie is "at least it was not as bad as Going Overboard".

summary: Ricky is a promising young scientist whose experimental formula regenerates dying cells. Ever since his parents died, Ricky's been trying hard to balance work while taking care of his younger brother Jermaine. When Jermaine is killed in a violent drive-by shooting, Ricky does the unthinkable to bring him back to life. His brother is now a blood-thirsty zombie wreaking carnage all over the hood. Now it's up to Ricky's colleague Scott and the boys in the hood to stop Jermaine from killing and turning the entire hood into zombies.
translation:
I will be honest. I have this movie so I can make fun of it. I mean, come on, "Hood of the Living Dead"? What other reaction could I have? The thing is, the movie (and its creators) decided they would not make fun of it. Instead, it would try to be a good movie.

And you know something? It came terribly close. Slightly less cheese in the stage music, a little more professionalism in photography, the drama, the trivialities (like the props - loves the Best Buy bag) ... well, it's not a classic of the zombie movie genre, though it is still a pretty pretty little movie for itself. And the acting, writing and tempo are all surprisingly better than I expected. There's even some decent humor about how two of our leads discuss how to decide if a dead zombie is really dead.

If you can overlook the low budget (which leaves its fingerprints on everything, oh) and the almost constant obscenities, that can be a pretty fun time in the cinema. No, it's not great. Yes, it could have been better. But the creators, the actors, the crew, all tried to make a good movie (instead of a camp classic) and that counts for a lot. The series of Campy zombie movies is a mile long, and thank you, guys, for not adding anything.

Kudos to the Quiroz brothers. I would like to see what they do next. And hey, someone, give them a budget!

summary: Former Homicide Shift Commander Al Giardello is now the leading candidate for Mayor of Baltimore. As he walks toward the platform to do a political speech, he is shot. Former and current Homicide Detectives try to find out who shot their former boss. All of the actors that were regulars or recurring characters in the series are in the movie.
translation: I've always been a fan of the show, so I admit I'm biased. When the show ended, I felt that too many questions went unanswered. This film felt closed to me. Seeing all the people I've been following together for the last couple of years has been very satisfying. I understand that this is probably the only murder movie we can expect. If so, this is the way to go out. This film is sometimes poignant, sometimes annoying, but always satisfying. If you're or were a fan of the show, check out this movie.

summary: Cecile, decadent young girl who lives with her rich playboy father Raymond. When Anne, Raymond's old love interest, comes to Raymond's villa, Cecile is afraid for her way of life.
translation: The overheated act of "Bonjour tristesse" comes from a youthful first novel by Francoise Sagan, who became a bestseller, though God knows why. For teens who want to get rid of a potential stepfather, this can have a certain appeal. Do not be impressed that David Niven plays the Playboy father and Deborah Kerr the stepmother. Unfortunately, too much is on the fragile shoulders of Jean Seberg. She is beautiful and easily fulfills the image of a spoiled teenager. The problem is that she can make poses, but she can not act. Anyone who saw her as Jeanne d'Arc in Otto Preminger's first film, St. Joan-Seberg, knows that at the age of 19 she could not produce a film. This film, also by Preminger, fulfills the "promise" of the first. It was her second movie; She was 20. What did Preminger think? That Niven and Kerr could compensate for Seberg's lack of ability to act? No chance? Seberg's character is at the heart of the story and although she is so convincing, she may be physically 17 years old, but she can not fulfill the emotional demands of the role. I do not know if she ever became a successful actress in her short life because she had no influence on my consciousness in her later pictures. But if you think this movie is better than mediocre, you need a taste test. Despite Niven and Kerr, this remains a youthful story that was executed in Art Nouveau style by a beautiful young girl who urgently needed acting lessons.

summary: Freelance reporter Jennifer and her two friends, Karen and Vicki, accept an invitation for cheap room and board in a large farmhouse offered by a friendly, but shady, museum owner named Ernest Keller since all the motels in and around town are booked for a holiday parade fair Jennifer is covering. But unknown to the women, some unseen "thing" has been living in the basement of the house for over 20 years and is looked after by Keller and his shy sister Virginia, in which the "thing" soon gets out and begins harassing and killing the women one by one in various violent, but seemingly accidental, means.
translation: Three girls (a purely female media crew, including cult actress Barbara Bach, no less) who visit a small town to hold a festival, eventually rented rooms in a house that they should have avoided like the plague. Well done little shocker, a bit suffering from some superfluous dialogue scenes and a pretty thin storyline (which does not do very well in hiding its secrets). An underlying theme is particularly disturbing (as in: vintage shock material), and that's basically what the movie is about. Performances and cinematography are way above average compared to many other movies from the late '70s / early' 80s, but what really makes me recommend this film is the rather long climax scene in the basement. From the moment the "Keller Junior" characters were introduced, his performance dropped my jaw and she closed at the end of the movie. A very pleasant surprise is the fact that the actor Sydney Lassick (who was crazy in "One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest" and now in "The Unseen") plays one of the leading roles.

summary: Sick of her life, housewife Nancy just wants it to be over and done with, but rather than kill herself, she hires a stranger from the Internet to do the job for her. But fate takes a strange turn when she meets her killer and the two fall in love. Of course, Nancy realizes that love and murder do not naturally go hand in hand.
translation:
Maria Bello does not seem to care what people think about her choices in film roles. Again she chooses a very difficult and not popular movie in which she can play. Maybe she needs those movies to get rid of the sugary (aka "Hollywood") that she is doing here and now (Coyote Ugly and of course Mummy 3) />
While I think she fails to achieve that Whatever pretends (I will not spoil that), Maria Bello is just as great as in her other independent / minor films in which she plays. It's her performance that boosts the movie. This, combined with the weird theme, has almost done the trick for me. But in the end (and even if I try to overlook some mistakes, such as bad tempo and dramaturgy), the movie is still too long

summary: Once in the life (of drug dealing and organized crime), can anyone get out? During a brief jail stay, two half-brothers, who have rarely seen each other while growing up, connect. One of them, called 20/20 Mike because he can sense people nearby, concocts a scheme in which the two of them will steal some dope from young couriers. The heist goes awry when Billy, the junkie brother, shoots the victims of the theft. The brothers hole up in an abandoned building, and 20/20 Mike seeks help from an old cell mate, Tony, whom he thinks is out of the life. It turns out that they have stolen Tony's dope, and Tony's boss wants the two thieves dead. Is there any way out?
translation:
This is really a big unknown movie. Perfect dialogue without the typical clich√©s. This film relied on the talent of the actor and it was deducted. It even had a bit of a comedy in it, but it was not over the top. Once in a life is what should be a crime drama, not the typical peculiar effects of garbage thrown in with sex. I especially loved the interracial aspects of everything.

Now on the actors themselves. Laurence Fishburne has been great at playing a career petty criminal. It is a shame that he is only allowed to show his talent in his own film. Titus Welliver was fabulous as Fishburn's junky half-brother. Eamonn Walker added flavor to the already perfectly flavored film. Paul Calderon was perfect as a fat monkey / drug lord. I loved his acting since "King of New York". But the best acting in this film came from Gregory Hines and Michael Paul Chan, who were perfectly paired as two of Calderon's henchmen.

Once in a lifetime is surely a keeper. **** 1/2 * from *****.

summary: A group of very efficient robbers strikes banks in downtown area of Stockholm. Detective Klara and commanding officer Krona takes on the case.
translation:
Swedish action films have evolved in recent years into something that mimics American action movies like "Heat," but on a low budget. This movie follows the same recipe as "Noll Tolerans" and "Livvakterna". However, it is obvious that they are trying too hard to make a cool and hard movie.

The story has been seen before, the dialogue is artificial and the acting is very bad, especially by the lead actress. The film attempts to paint a picture of hard-nosed, military-looking robbers without remorse, and a female investigator who has completely lost her with past problems, but at the same time acts rationally. It does not work very well.

The bluish-styled photo style does not seem to be fresh anymore, and in this picture it did not even work well. Only a few scenes look really good. Also, the sound sounds pretty weird and it sounds like many of the dialogues are being recorded later.

The main quality of this movie is Stefan Sauk, though he does not make a convincing portrait of a SWAT team leader, has some really funny lines. The music is also pretty good.

summary: A young boy dies from a stray bullet during a shootout between a cop and mob family member who had previously been supiciously given probabtion, only to break its terms. New York's Deputy Mayor, Kevin Calhoun starts digging for information.
translation:
We often see films about unwanted things in politics, but I still recommend City Hall. In a role in which he was born, Al Pacino plays as New York mayor, who has to deal with the shooting of a boy. But it turns out that nothing he does will really make a difference. In this movie, the characters are as crude as we would expect of anyone involved in a political scandal. No matter how much you trust a politician, you may have your doubts after watching this movie.

I understand that I can not give a concrete example of something similar to the movie, but that's not the point. If we had idealistic impressions of those at the top, this film tears down such ideas. Certainly one to which I encourage you to see. Also with John Cusack, Bridget Fonda, Danny Aiello, Anthony Franciosa and David Paymer.

summary: The show is set in the town of Trinity, South Carolina. Lucas Buck, the local sheriff, has supernatural powers. He uses these powers to manipulate people into making evil choices. Lucas himself has already committed crimes such as murder and rape. A young boy, Caleb Temple, has seen the deaths of his mother and father (both suicides) and older sister (murdered). Caleb does not know that he is the biological son of Lucas Buck. The sheriff plans to corrupt his son, but faces obstacles. Caleb's new legal guardian is his adult cousin Gail Emory, a reporter. Gail also investigates the mysterious deaths of her own parents. Caleb is helped by the ghost of his sister, Merlyn Temple.
translation: I bought the DVD set on the recommendation of Amazon.com based on my other interests. They hit the nail on the head with this. I remember the show when it was on TV, but I've always wondered what happened to it. Ten years later, it's like seeing it again for the first time. Lucas Black as Caleb Temple and Gary Cole as Sheriff Lucas Buck are great together, although they are a bit rivals. Fast represents good (Caleb) and evil (Sheriff Lucas Buck). I've never really understood what Lucas should be, but suffice to say that he has some special powers that I believe were not granted by any saint. He can ring phones, write or even change a person's feelings. Nonetheless, there are a few episodes in which he becomes a good guy despite everything. All in all, this is an excellent series that, like so many others I can imagine, has been canceled ahead of its time (Point E. Pleasant, Threshold, Nowhere Man, and SeaQuest DSV, to name but a few). The Steven King's The Dead Zone (the sunny USA Network) seems to be the only one in the genre that seems to make it. There is simply nothing left to watch TV on TV. This is because everything that has to do with Christianity and Satan is offensive and must be pulled out of television immediately. In the meantime, I keep buying DVD sets and watching shows that are still on TV, but have been remotely controlled by religious zealots so we could see quality shows like Family Guy and American Dad and The Simpsons Crap that is).

summary: The passage from this world to the fantasy kingdom of Stormhold is through a breach in a wall beside an English village. In the 1800s, a boy becomes a man when he ventures through the breach in pursuit of a fallen star, to prove his love for the village beauty. The star is no lump of rock, it's a maiden, Yvaine. Tristan, the youth, is not the only one looking for her: three witches, led by Lamia, want her heart to make them young; and, the sons of the dead king of Stormhold want her because she holds a ruby that will give one of them title to the throne. Assisting Tristan are his mother, the victim of a spell, and a cross-dressing pirate of the skies. Will Tristan win his true love?
translation: The 14-year-old in me is immensely happy that he can now make really good-looking fantasy movies, and that they are all the rage, which is a lot of fun with Lord of the Rings, Harry Potter, and the Chronicles of Narnia cash at the box office , This year we will (and have already seen) a few more, especially the Golden Compass, with the most exciting trailer I've seen this year. Stardust, based on a novel by Neil Gaiman, appeared in cinemas this week with little more than a peep. I saw no previews, just a few commercials. The critical reaction is a kind of blah. I would not have seen it if I had not waited for a friend to see the Bourne ultimatum, and nothing interesting was opening this weekend. Well, if you forgive the awful pun, the stars must be right, because I went to Stardust, and I loved it. It's not a big movie like Lord of the Rings. The storyline is your very simple fantasy quest (the hero goes in search of a fallen star), which is full of obstacles. But within this outline, the story is alive and imaginative. It just aims to make a lot of fun, and a charming little romance. And it works wonderfully. There were a lot of big movies this summer, but none of them was almost as funny as this one. There is a lot going on, but the story is well told and almost completely coherent. It's not a masterpiece, but it can definitely take the same floor as the Princess Bride (though I do not like it as much as the previous movie). Have fun here if you are a fan of the genre.

summary: Two boys (Ramallo and Manuel) and a girl in the Spanish Civil War are involved in the death of other two boys, one killed, the other suicided. This terrible secret will be with them for all their lives. Years pass and they meet in a hospital for tuberculosis treatment. She is now a nun, Ramallo is a thief and Manuel is obsessed by religion. Reality is too hard to feel, only the sea should be the best place, where all is quiet...
translation:
Yesterday I saw El Mar and thought it was a great movie. It begins with a childhood episode in the life of the 3 main characters: Ramallo, Manuel Tur and Francisca. Then we jump about 10 years in a hospital, where the 3 friends meet again.

Religion, sickness, love, violence and sexuality are raging throughout the film, creating a intense and suspenseful movie. > I see people who complain that the movie is too bloody, and I think they missed the gist of the story. It is a violent, intense and sad story. People are expected to suffer. Cry. Get injured. Blossoms. And I think that what the film shows is not made for pure shock or tasteless tasting. I know that some people find their films "clean" even when they are violent. But sometimes a movie has to make you uncomfortable. This is one of those movies. And it's a great movie.

The only mistake I found was that there were 3 or 4 moments in which some details of the plot were not 100% clear, and only after thinking about them at the end of the movie, everything made sense. But it was not important to the overall story, so I still give this movie a 9.

summary: Former Homicide Shift Commander Al Giardello is now the leading candidate for Mayor of Baltimore. As he walks toward the platform to do a political speech, he is shot. Former and current Homicide Detectives try to find out who shot their former boss. All of the actors that were regulars or recurring characters in the series are in the movie.
translation:
I became a fan of the television series "Homicide: Life on the Street" late in the show, but quickly became a fan It was a cop show that was unlike any other. Visually different in the use of hand-held cameras, who took viewers everywhere with their multi-ethnic and mutiracial performers and their different and intriguing personalities, and all the best and bad things covered police department, including the corruption and personality conflicts that bubble to the surface.

Homicide: The Movie, the sequel to the series, is as good as a TV movie. After Lt. Giardello (Yaphet Kotto), now a candidate for the mayor of Baltimore, was shot dead, the cast of the series are back to help in the search for the murderer. In addition, the performers who have left the troupe and those who have died manage to take their place in the film. The intensity and the fire that marked the series return, and the font is brimming with the same fire that characterizes the series. All in all, a terrific TV movie.

Vote: 9

summary: It is the story of an average, popular American teenager named Wendy Wu who discovers that in order to win the coveted crown she must first learn the way of the warrior. Wendy Wu has a one track mind, and that track leads directly to the title of homecoming queen -- no unscheduled stops, and no unnecessary detours. When a mysterious Chinese monk named Shen arrives to mold Wendy into a fearless kung fu warrior, however, her royal aspirations suddenly jump the track as she desperately attempts to juggle her boyfriend, her homework, and of course, the fierce competition to become homecoming queen. Now, as Wendy begins to train her mind, body, and spirit in the ancient tradition of the martial arts and her inner warrior gradually begins to emerge, the girl who once obsessed over popularity finally begins to put that popularity into perspective as she gradually realizes what truly matters in life.
translation: Wendy Wu: Homecoming Warrior has a very good, strong plot, but is ruined by cheesy details throughout the movie. I am a younger teenager and I did not enjoy this movie very much. I thought the effects would be terrible, but they might seem entertaining to the younger kids. The Matrix moves ruined the action, you know it was absolutely wrong. Then there was the Yen Lo, an evil spirit who had at times random people and homecoming in which Wendy strove to win. It all ends like a typical movie when Wendy and her Buddhist monk cousin defeat Shen Yen Lo (and destroy him forever). So Wendy learns a lesson ... blah, blah, blah. I'm ready for the next DCOM.

summary: The B.T.K. killer harasses a news reporter with threatening letters as he ponders about the murders he committed 30 years ago.
translation: This movie is the biggest steaming pile you know, coming from Wichita Kansas and growing up there, I know that 90% of the movie was Bogus. Apart from the names of some victims, nothing else was right. The film looks like it was made with Daddy's cell phone camera. He had footage that I believe came from another movie, along with footage from a slaughterhouse. Usually, I enjoy watching bad movies because it's going bad, badly prepared or nonexistent sets, and a very dull and short ending. It was a struggle to see through to the end. I recommend that you do not waste your money on this movie or you'll be sorry. crunch

summary: Richard Haywood, a Californian high school's coolest kid, secretly teams up with another rich kid in his class, brilliant nerd Justin 'Bonaparte' Pendleton, whose erudition, specially in forensic matters, allows them to plan elaborately perfect murders, just for the kick, for which they set up Richard's marijuana supplier, their school's janitor Ray Feathers, as a psychotic serial killer. The case is assigned to detectives Cassie 'the hyena' Mayweather, who carries a sequoia-size chip on the shoulder from her previous life, and her brilliant new partner, Sam Kennedy, who just transferred from the vice squad; they can work together very well, and even fit romantically, but fall out over different professional attitudes towards the investigation, which Captain Rod Cody and her understandably vindictive abused ex, Assistant D.A. Al Swanson, soon ban her from when she disobeys instructions and hand to him. When the plotting boys both dig class-mate Lisa Mills, their unnatural bond comes ...
translation:
I was pleasantly surprised by Sandra Bullock's performance in Miss Congeniality and decided to give Murder By Numbers a chance. Although her role in "serious" roles (see Hope Floats, Speed ‚Äã‚Äã2, 28 Days) is decent in courageous, self-evasive roles, she leaves much to be desired. Her character is at the same time omniscient, confused and sexually unadapted (the sub-plot of Sandra's past acts as a superfluous filler that does little to develop her already flat character). The two teenage boys performed well, though their forensic expertise and catch-me-is-can stance was blunted by the "we did it!" Chris Penn, the obvious suspect, is wasted here, as is Ben Chaplin's creative partner / lover.

*** Spoilers Ahead *** Mediocre, other than that, the biggest bugs can be traced back to a TV-of-the-week plot that never completely invites you into the murder motives, and how Mentioned, the stupid mistakes (vomiting a rare meal on the murder scene, being overly comfortable and framing the schoolmasters, the two guys hanging out together in public, a comfortable love interest to cause friction, etc.) leave the gaze of Intrigues lead to boredom and disappointment by the killers. The end was strictly "By the Numbers" and was probably the most disappointing aspect of the movie. With the now clich√©d tactic of showing almost the high point scene at the beginning of the film and then filling the audience in the way we arrived at that moment, the final scenes surprised no one and lacked the so - called intelligence that the Movie pretended to come to his conclusion. A somewhat promising concept, but poorly executed and weak in almost every way. * out ****.

summary: Cinderella (named Zezolla) and her family live mid 20th century, where fashion is practically everything. As her father is won over by a selfish woman named Claudette, Cinderella must keep her new step-mother from murdering the only family she has left. Add in an anti-social mermaid literally living in a cave, a bored prince with an ear for rock n' roll, and the glamour of the 1950's and one'll find that this story can't grow old.
translation: I saw this movie twice with my teens who love it. This should be a cult! The best line: "Your dress is really cool!" says the prince to Cinderella. Kathleen Turner shines as stepmother. I also like the cars and motorcycles of the 50s. The melancholy prince is a big departure from the typical Swashbuckler. He tries to stay cool, but fails to hide his love for the fairytale princess. Her slipper is not a glass (true to the original story), but Cinderella loses nevertheless, but gets it back from the heir to the throne. My only complaint is that it is no longer shown and seems almost impossible to get. Hopefully Blockbuster or Amazon will soon have it in stock.

summary: Kenny Williams, a lieutenant on the homicide squad, is engaged to Maxine Carroll, the Mayor's secretary. Or isn't he rather married with his job? For each time he has a date with his longtime fianc√©e, he is prevented from keeping it by his devotion to duty. Maxine, in desperation, decides to take action and bring Kenny to the altar. Who will win, Maxine's curves or the glorious fight against crime?
translation:
Melvyn Douglas and Joan Blondell play a starring role in "The Amazing Mr. Williams," a 1939 mystery / comedy that is pretty good, though it was forgotten, probably because of the many incredible films that came out in 1939.

Douglas plays a talented police detective who is married to his work while his girlfriend is waiting for a wedding that is constantly postponed. What happens in this movie is no exception - he is called into a murder scene just as he's walking down the hall again.

Both stars were excellent in the comedy, worked well together (and often), and helped make this sex battle fun. Edward Brophy and Donald McBride are on hand for great support.

As you can read in other reports, Melvyn Douglas does not care much about a woman.

Entertaining if a little bit on the long side.

One of the comments here destroys Melvyn Douglas, one of our greatest actors. He literally floated through dozens of films as the other man and best friend before appearing as an old man in movies. He was not lazy, but a very diligent actor (who made it easy), who simultaneously had a Broadway career with his film career. He simply was not cast as a leading man in movies or given very demanding roles under the studio system. I challenge everyone to watch his devastating performances in "Hud" and "I never sing for my father" and call him lazy or wise for his grin.

summary: Hamlet, son of the king of Denmark, is summoned home for his father's funeral and his mother's wedding to his uncle. In a supernatural episode, he discovers that his uncle, whom he hates anyway, murdered his father. In an incredibly convoluted plot--the most complicated and most interesting in all literature--he manages to (impossible to put this in exact order) feign (or perhaps not to feign) madness, murder the "prime minister," love and then unlove an innocent whom he drives to madness, plot and then unplot against the uncle, direct a play within a play, successfully conspire against the lives of two well-meaning friends, and finally take his revenge on the uncle, but only at the cost of almost every life on stage, including his own and his mother's.
translation:
Kenneth Branagh's "Hamlet" meets all signs. Acting is great, 70mm cinematography is gorgeous, Oscar-nominated costumes and sets are stunning, and Patrick Doyle's score (also Oscar-nominated) is sensitive and moving. Oh yes - the screenplay by Will S. is not bad either. Film critics agreed with Branagh when he received the fourth Oscar for "adapting" the script, but his decision to use the entire text was bolder. I can not imagine many better ways to fly four hours.

Almost every decision that Branagh makes makes brilliant work: using the English Blenheim Palace for the exterior, the Edwardian clothing and the staging of being or not in a hall of mirrors to name a few. The cast of Hollywood greats like Robin Williams, Billy Crystal and Jack Lemmon in small parts may distract, but that's fussy. The main character is distinguished: Derek Jacobi captures the contradictory nature of Claudius; Kate Winslet describes sharply Ophelia's descent into madness; Julie Christie introduces passion into her portrayal of Gertrude; Richard Briers is pitch-perfect like the Conniving Polonius; and Nicholas Farrell highlights Horatio's potentially ungrateful role in the apotheosis of true friendship. Every speech, every line, every word is conveyed with passion and conviction; There is no wasted moment in the whole movie. The last scenes increase the extent of Shakespeare's tragedy in a way that is not possible with theatrical adaptations.

Branagh's "Hamlet" is a bold, ambitious and ultimately successful attempt to match the size and poetry of Shakespeare's language as well as eloquent images. It's probably the biggest Shakespearean adaptation ever made ?? High praise, but well deserved.

summary: Eric Forman is a typical high school student growing up in Wisconsin in 1976 with his family and his friends. Together, they have the same kind of joys and sorrows that just about every teenager has while growing up. This show parodied many of the attitudes, events and fads of the 70s, along with those who grew up at the time.
translation:
Let's face it: Last season (# 8) was one of the worst seasons in any show I've ever enjoyed (mostly I've never found dry periods that last a whole season). But if you judge that show in the last season, it will naturally appear inferior. That's a totally unfair assessment - because "That's 70's Show" was a brilliant and funny sitcom about a bygone era and how the people who lived there were not as different as we are today ,

Alright ... ignoring Season 8.

Topher Grace plays Eric Forman, a horny freak of a teenager with an eternal love for Donna (Laura Prepon), the next-generation feminist girl. Her friends Danny Masterson (Hyde), Mila Kunis (Jackie), Wilmer Valderrama (Fez) and even Ashton Kutcher (Kelso) give fantastic performances in (almost) every episode. The best is probably Fez, a foreign exchange student as mentally promiscuous as she is. Which country does he come from? Try to find out! For another dimension of entertainment, Debra Jo Rupp and Kurtwood Smith are as phenomenal as Eric's parents. Rupp, as Kitty, is both awesome and sweet, just like Mrs. Brady Marie meets Barone, while Smith's Red is mainly there to scare the pogees out of everyone. Don Stark and Tanya Roberts play very well as Donna's parents, the chauvinist but sympathetic Bob and the fiery Midge. Occasionally, Tommy Chong appears as Leo, a stoner who serves Hyde as a father figure.

Apart from the anachronistic mistakes that often occur and the exaggerated lessons that sometimes come (and the "70s" is a terrific show with amazing script, spot-on direction and a good mood, which pulsates through each episode, they are all alright.

summary: In the highlands of Scotland in the 1700s, Rob Roy tries to lead his small town to a better future, by borrowing money from the local nobility to buy cattle to herd to market. When the money is stolen, Rob is forced into a Robin Hood lifestyle to defend his family and honour.
translation:
I must say, the first time I saw this movie was about 6 years ago and I really enjoyed it back then. I bought the DVD recently, and after a second look, I wondered why I liked it. The acting was awful, and as always we have the stereotypical clansmen in their fake costumes. The acting was terrible at best. Tim Roth did a good job, as did Liam Neeson, but I have no idea what Jessica Lange was thinking.

The story line was good, but the execution was just bad. I am so sorry that Scotland is portrayed in the movies like this. Braveheart was even worse, these are films that only save grace. But seriously, people did not talk that way at the time, why do all the actors have to have Glasgow's accents? Just another movie to capture the essence of already tired and annoying clich√©s. I notice that the only people here who say that this movie is good are the Americans, and to be honest, I can see why they like it, I know that they have a crush on men in kilts. However, if you remember buying the DVD, I would say that you spend your money on something else, like a better movie.

summary: Jack Saunders and Bob Corby are two boxers in love with Nellie. Jack and Nellie are married but their marriage is flat so she starts to look to Bob for comfort.
translation:
I sometimes get tired of reading reviews of some of the lesser-known Hitchcock movies, because almost every one of them starts by grossly ignoring this movie, or that this is a hidden Hitchcock gem or a true Hitchcock super or some other generic, if - only - people - would - see - that - they - would - see - that - that - is - a - big - hitchcock - movie - just - as - much - as - dizziness - north - by - northwest - psycho - Back - window - etc. So I would like to say that if - only - people - would see - that - they - would - see - that - that - is - a - big - Hitchcock - movie - only - so - Vertigo - North - by - Northwest - Psycho - Rear Window - etc.

Well, that might overshoot a bit, the ring is not at all imaginative in the same league as any of the movies that are twice above were mentioned, but compared to the other films, the Hitchcock in the late 1920e r and early 1930s, I really think that t The ring is one of the most photographed and most-watched movies of almost all. As an almost brand new director, there are some amazing dream sequences and brilliant editing segments that show why Hitchcock attracted so much attention early in his career. Granted, the movie starts with things, among other things, the most disconcerting spectacle of an idiot black circus artist (and I use idiot in the final manner, as Stephen King does so often) eggs and fruit from a bevy of not the noblest white people on him thrown. I suppose that just shows how incredibly different those circuses and people were back then, but I think it's one of the most daunting sequences in any Hitchcock movie I've seen.

The main attraction at the circus is a fighter who claims to be able to knock everyone down in one round, but when he hits his match, it's against a man who has his authority not only in the boxing ring, but also in the ring to challenge the finger of his wife. So begins an entertaining, if not very tense, challenge for the love of a woman who effortlessly and thoughtlessly swings from one man to another.

(Spoiler) For example, there is a scene where her husband watches her from the top when she is dropped off at home late at night, and just before she goes into the building she becomes the Car returned to a kiss. This kiss is never explained, and there is also the fact that in the end, if she remains true to her husband or at least ultimately chooses to meet her, she will look each other in the eye but not really kiss her.

summary: When he wakes up the morning after his bachelor party in bed with a strange woman, a man presumes he must have cheated on his fianc√©e. Guilt leads him to try to cover it up in the week before the wedding, high jinks ensue.
translation:
I had hoped that this movie would be entertaining as other genres of its kind. It was lame and I did not have to laugh much. Look at HBO, maybe, or if you have a free rental you need to waste, and you need a movie to pass the time. But I do not recommend paying to see it.

The plot is simple and straightforward, and it could have been funny, maybe if the script was better. Jason Lee can be hilarious, and he laughs here and there, but the movie falls flat. Just do not go see this one. The direction is lackluster, but for what it is, directing is not so important. I think its main drawback is that it's just not very funny. See something else, do not waste your time here.

summary: Professor William Conroy, otherwise a model citizen, serves jail time for a car accident which proved fatal for his lover and student. In prison, he hears 'too much' about the murder of fellow inmate Evan, whose assertions he ignored that the deaths in their penitentiary multiplied suspiciously. Dirty jailer, Price, accidentally messes up the warden's instructions to get Conroy murdered by ruthless killer Lawrence during a transport. Conroy has some trouble convincing even his lawyer Eric Hawthorne he's the target of a manhunt. They and investigative reporter David Dart discover the dirty part played by Jim Corcoran's rich and influential 'Justice for victim families' vigilante society.
translation: Former brat and actor Rob Lowe plays in a movie in a high security American prison. I felt like his character would be popular in the first series of OZ for the wrong reasons like Tobias, but PROXIMITY is not such a movie, it's more like a "Man on the run" movie THE REFUGEE. It also leans on the issues of punishment and justice, with James Coburn introducing a spokesman for a victim interest group, but any intelligent discussion of how society deals with criminals is completely ignored as the film degenerates into old stereotypes from shootings and car chases

summary: "Strange Fruit" had everything that makes a legendary rockband: Money, Fame, Success, Groupies, a Singer who died of drugs and even a divine ending, when lightning struck the stage during an open-air. Twenty years later, all band members are minding their own businesses, the idea of a band reunion is brought up by, well, public request. Tony, the former keyboard player, sets out only to find his former friends working as a roofer, a gardener and a hotel clerk. They all became rather everyday people, married or still single, they definitely are not wild and crazy anymore. But with the help of former manager Karen, who is still dreaming of Brian, the apparently deceased lead guitarist, they all, old, fat and wrinkled as they are, try to catch that spirit again.
translation:
I thought this movie was fantastic. It was funny. Somehow it reminded me of Spinal Tap. This is a must for every 70's rock fan. (I hope I and my friends are not so in twenty years!) Bill Nighy performs excellently as the off-kilter lead singer trying to recapture that old ghost,

Stephen Rea fits perfectly in the movie as the glue that tries to keep the band together, but not successful.

If you love music and have ever been to a band, this movie is definitely for you. You will not regret seeing this movie. I know that I do not know. Even my family thought it was funny, and that says something.

summary: Riding her bicycle on her way to school, a dreamy, ten-year-old, red-haired farm girl decides to take a shortcut through a ruddy and luscious autumn forest, somewhere in the mountainous region of eastern France. Unexpectedly, the young girl encounters a bright-eyed red fox, however, the untamed wild animal flees in an instant, leaving her longing to meet again. Since then, a whole winter has passed and still no sign of the elusive fox, but with the arrival of spring, the girl determined to find the animal, finally locates its den and an ambitious effort to grow accustomed to each other begins. As we witness a succession of compelling scenes, lost inside the enchanting and breathlessly exquisite landscape, we observe the bond between a human and a savage animal grow gradually stronger, yet, a wish and question emerge. If only we, humans, could talk to the wild beasts, and if we could, could we ever become friends?
translation: This is a very beautiful and almost meditative film - there is hardly any dialogue, apart from the narrative; and the landscape and music complement each other perfectly. At first I did not connect the red hair of the girl and the fox until it was shown to me by a friend (who also has red hair!). It's almost an old-fashioned kind of children's movie that kids today prefer animations like Shrek or Toy Story, etc. - but I think young people should be more familiarized with the beauty and wonder of nature that movie certainly does. Maybe not the best movie of its kind, but certainly an excellent and relaxing prospect for all ages - not just children.

summary: An animated retelling set to Prokofiev's suite. Peter is a slight lad, solitary, locked out of the woods by his protective grandfather, his only friend a duck. In town, he's bullied. When a wolf menaces the duck - as well as grandfather's fat cat and an ill-flying bird that Peter has befriended - Peter bravely tries to tree the wolf. Grandfather, the townspeople, and the hunters who have antagonized Peter figure in the d√©nouement.
translation:
The animation in this reinterpretation of Peter & the Wolf is excellent, but in 29 minutes the movie is inducing sleep. They should have called it "Peter & the Snails" because everything is moving at a snail's pace. I could not even see the movie in one session - I had to watch 15 minutes at the same time, and it was pure torture.

Save 30 minutes - do not watch this movie - and you will thank me ,

I can only assume that the Oscar nomination committee followed only the first few minutes of the candidates. To vote for the winner in the category "Best Animation Short Cut", voters unfortunately have to go through the whole thing. I already feel sorry for them - and have to predict that there is no way to win this movie.

summary: Rayford Steele is an airline pilot whose relationship with his wife has gone sour;he ponders having an affair with an attractive flight attendant, Hattie Durham. In the midst of a flight to London, a number of their passengers mysteriously disappear, and chaos takes hold as a number of vehicles on the ground and in the air are suddenly unmanned.
