Meanwhile, Buck Williams, a television journalist, is pondering the rash of sudden disappearances as he works on a report about Dr. Chaim Rosenzweig, an Israeli scientist who has devised a formula that would make any soil on earth easy to cultivate. However, Buck wonders if there's more to Rosenzweig than he first imagined when he discovers the doctor is in cahoots with two multi-millionaires who plan to broker the invention to promote their own agenda of international domination.
translation:
It's been a while since I first saw it, so I saw it again with the second movie in the series. While I realize that there is a third film I have not seen yet, I will read under the original title ...

Only from the point of view of production value, screenwriting and film production, this film fails on many levels, even if some succeed. What can you expect from a low budget "B" movie? Not much, and it works from the point of view of production. However, the writing is certainly disconnected, with little character development ... exactly what I would expect if there is a movie. I had no problem with acting ... the cast is solid; However, the script in both films gives the performers little opportunity to really stretch. Because the film is "Christian," this is predictable, as one can not well portray violent chaos of the "end times" without also breaking some of the ethical norms normally associated with Christianity. In other words, the mistake is to turn this into a G-weighted film if the content, even in the most conservative biblical interpretation, would be R-rated by some measure. So, if the purpose of the film is to scare people into the Christian faith, then the movie should be a bit scary, right? However, you can not comment on a movie adaptation from a book without commenting on the book or, in this case, a number of books. There are certainly many Christian materials that are worth making for films ... but not the "Left Behind" series ... and these films eventually fail because they are bestselling poorly written novels that are down to bad Theology As a Southern Baptist minister, I confess that the books were a guilty pleasure for me, although I still have to complete the last two books in the series. I have described them as decent fiction, and if the books were to argue that this is a "possibility" or interpretation of the theme of biblical eschatology (study of the "end times"), then I could live with it. This series is in Christian circles splitting, because it promotes the "literal" interpretation of all Scripture on a more appropriate hermeneutics. This inevitably leads to the standpoint of the "pre-tributary, millennia-old" disposition that removes an all-encompassing, powerful God far too far from the human world, in other words, as I have always said, God should be our helicopters and bombs It is not because they need the ultimate work, but because many people, especially unthinking Christians, can not think beyond their own thoughts. Worldviews have a pro-conservative, fundamentalist attitude to the interpretation of the Bible and seek to impose it as the "only" interpretation.

So the books carry with them agenda, not so much to understand the "lost" their need for Christ, but to say that the fundamentalist standpoint is the only valid way to understand the Bible , I remember very clearly a couple of years ago, in the second novel, when I read a scene in which the characters refer to a person who was "left behind" because he did not hold that view; as if "real" Christians who were worthy of being "caught up" could not possibly cling to another eschatology. This is troubling for several reasons, the least of which is because a "rapture" is mentioned only briefly in the Scriptures and their connection to real end-time prophecies is at best weak.

But the real problem With these books comes how they share the Christian community and how they present "true" Christian behavior. Ultimately, I feel that they are hardening more people to an otherwise legitimate belief / religion rather than gaining people for it. It turns all Christians into caricatures that are both despised and ridiculed by the world, even though there is a theological space for a great variety of Christian beliefs and behaviors. As a Christian body, we have done such a damage to society in 2000 years of history on the whole ... and we certainly do not need to promote it through film to thousands, maybe millions, of others.

summary: nan
translation: While this trip certainly does not do justice to its predecessor, it has more than just memorable moments. My personal favorite, shortly after we dumped it into a city block with its "Videodisc Cannon", we see a close-up of Nimoy's face. As a single tear disappears from his left eye, we know at this point that Nimoy is more than just a killing machine. The viewer can not help but be torn into his emotional turmoil, and we understand that his previously shallow affect was just a facade. Absolute brilliance !!! The sex scenes show a nice balance, carnal but not pornographic. After that I had the feeling that I understood pretty well how to operate the Magnavision Videodisc Player. Too bad that they were not produced in over 25 years.

summary: Valentine's Day 1988: At the school dance, geeky Jeremy Melton bravely faces one rejection after the other when asking four popular girls to dance with him. A fifth girl, plump and insecure, agrees, but they end up making out under the bleachers. When a group of school bullies catches them, the girl claims that Jeremy attacked her. This causes them to strip off his clothes and beat him up in front of the entire school. Flash forward to 2001. We meet the five girls who were in that school gym: Kate, Paige, Shelly, Lily and the formerly plump Dorothy. They are all in their 20's now and trying to sort out their love lives, which is appropriate, since Valentine's Day is coming up. After a disastrous date with a loser, one of the girls, a pre-med student, is murdered by a Cherub-mask wearing killer who sent her a death threat in the form of a Valentine card prior to the attack. After the four remaining girls are reunited at her funeral, they all start receiving threatening cards and ...
translation:
"Valentine" is another horror movie added to the list of stalk and slash movies (think of "Halloween", "Friday the 13th", "Scream" and "I know what you did last summer") ). It's certainly not as good as the movies I've listed, but it's better than most of the rip-offs that come after the first "Friday the 13th." Movie came out. One of these films was the 1981 Canadian "My Bloody Valentine", which I hated very much. "Valentine" is a better movie than this, but it does not say much. The plot: A nerdy boy is teased and beaten by a couple of classmates at the beginning of the movie. Then the movie moves years later, when these classmates are all grown up, they are picked one by one. It is believed that the killer is the boy who has now grown up and is looking for revenge. But is he? Or could it be someone else? "Valentine" has an attractive cast that includes Denise Richards, David Boreanaz, Marley Shelton, Jessica Capshaw and Katherine Heigl. They do what they can with the material they have, but a lackluster script does not really do them justice. There are, however, some scary moments.

** (of four)

summary: Three pets (Chance, a young dog unfamiliar with the world; Shadow, an aging, wise dog; and Sassy, a snobby cat) are left behind when their family goes on vacation. Unsure of what happened, the animals set out on a quest to find their family. This journey across America is very dangerous and the animals risk never seeing their masters again. The group of pets travel across forested mountains and areas of wide-open countryside, while their family searches for them in the same areas.
translation:
I watch this movie all the time. I have seen it with family 3 to 87 and everyone in between; They all loved it. It really shows the true scenes a dog has and the love and loyalty you get from a pet. Just beautiful.

It's great for those who love comedy movies, tear-jerker movies or just pets.

The music is wonderful, the animals spectacular, the scenes really thought out and the characters perfect. What I liked about the characters are the true and well-mixed personalities: Shadow (The Elder, a Golden Retriever) He is the sage who is filled with the wisdom and mindset of every dog. Chance (the American Bulldog puppy) is basically a puppy with a witty side, the funny character; And Sassy (The Hymilayan cat) She is the real cat that shows what a real cat will do for her owner, the real girly.

summary: Eva has just gotten married to an older gentleman, but discovers that he is obsessed with order in his life and doesn't have much room for passion. She becomes despondent and leaves him, returning to her father's house. One day while bathing in the lake she meets a young man and they fall in love. The husband has become grief stricken at the loss of his young bride, and fate brings him together with the young lover that has taken Eva from him.
translation:
First, let's clear the "hoopla" out of the way. Hedy Lamarr was considered one of the most beautiful women and the films were a perfect medium for the many to see their beauty on screen. Here we have Hedy as a young boy I recently bought an uncensored version of this classic from 1932/3. Yes, we see a short close-up of Hedy, who is naked from the hip, but although she has filmed the floating and run-away horse scenes naked, the director Gustav Machaty uses the cover of twigs, reflections in puddles, medium and long shots to show her so in this famous scene; So, do not imagine that there are any lascivious close-ups or clinches. Your friend, Pierre Nay, always keeps his clothes. Yeah, pretty daring for his day, but how pushy he looks now through 2003.

Put simply, this is the story of a young girl wh o marries a much older man (why is she never told us and what has Eve ever seen in him? money?), which is then in a fresh and unloving Marriage is caught. She then returns to her father after leaving her husband and father to lie to his son-in-law. After a ride on her horse, Eva decides to swim in the strengthening swimmer and load her clothes onto the saddle of her horse. However, her horse gets romantic ideas herself and gallops to salute his stable mate out of the lake and tries to recover her horse, but an engineer at work sees and fetches the horse then searches for its owner. And so is the romance born. Her husband sees that his rival has to win Eva, then decides to shoot himself later, but I thought that was rather illogical and his main weakness given his earlier loveless relationship with Eve.

Although it's a 1990 reissue title on VHS, the sound is 70 years old, is a bit soft and crackles with background, in line with movies of his age. After a Time of Grief Our handsome friend is obviously so in love with Eve that he imagines her as a mother with a child, so we must assume that they live happily ever after in the late 1930s. This is a lyrical piece that can be enyoyed for its own sake and not just for its eye-catching title. I gave it 7/10.

summary: In WW1,German intelligence sends a team of saboteurs and a female spy to Scotland to kill Lord Kitchener.Also,German intelligence sends another team of spies to Allied headquarters in Belgium to steal the secret Allied defense plans.German female spy, known as Fraulein Doktor, is tasked with stealing the new mustard gas formula from its French female inventor.The German army plans to use the new French mustard gas on the battlefield during the upcoming German offensive against the Allied armies.
translation: This is an excellent, but hard-to-find, trippy World War I espionage thriller in the inimitable Italian 1960s style. From the psychedelic graphics of the opening credits and the great score by Ennio Morricone to the lesbian love scene with Capucine to the lavishly produced apocalyptic no-man's-land fight scenes with poison gas and German cavalry in the gas-tight "Storm Trooper" process, a film that should not be missed , It's a movie that captures the horrors and cruelties of war and the recklessness of players on and off the battlefield. Apart from the fighting scenes, some of the productions and special effects are primitive, apparently because most of the budget for this film was saved for the fight scenes, but for lovers of '60s cinema it should not be a problem. I saw this movie on television for the first time many years ago and had the foresight to record it on VHS. I still have the tape and enjoy seeing it again from time to time.

summary: The United State's Department of Homeland Security is led to believe an American teen hacker playing a terrorist-attack simulator game online is a real terrorist out to destroy the U.S.
translation:
Let's face it - if you've rented a STDVD sequel to a forgotten 80's gem and expected it to be better than the one you mentioned earlier, then you're an idiot. Wargames: The Dead Code complements the long list of unnecessary sequels that the DVD market has filled so easily. Films like these do not need spoilers because YOU already know them.

The "storyline" for this "movie" is as follows: Nerd meets girl; Girl likes nerd; Nerd likes girls; Nerd is inadvertently involved in Top Secret Government Computer; Nerd and girl go to another country; Nerd and girls are eventually persecuted by government actions in the other country; Nerd and Girl meet an important old guy who dies in the "movie" at Key Point; Nerd and girl are captured; The computer of the Top Secret Government is going crazy; Nerd is hired to beat Top Secret Government Computer; Nerd beats Top Secret Computer with the same old Top Secret computer from the first Wargames "movie"; Nerd saves the day; Nerd is laid.

The end.

Acting, script, effects, score and cinematography are what you would expect - B-Class. Some familiar faces are in here, and if you're not a big fan of Colm Feore, you should avoid it. Granted, the movie will not make you crazy enough to eat your own toes when you see it, so if you like cheap-looking STDVD sequels, then you're home.

Unfortunately, Mathew Broderick was also familiar with some "masterpieces" that he could not even do a five-second cameo in this one. But can you blame him?

summary: Erik, and Cooze start college and pledge the Beta House fraternity, presided over by none other than legendary Dwight Stifler. But chaos ensues when a fraternity of geeks threatens to stop the debauchery and the Betas have to make a stand for their right to party.
translation: To summarize this film: Without a real plot, this movie consists of 80 minutes of insane characters who either drink or make bad jokes. The music is just terrible, the humor is not funny and all female characters are kinky idiots or total geeks. It seems to me that the film was actually written by a 14-year-old boy who thinks drinking is cool, women are designed to please men, and anyone who opposes that view is geeks. Also, the movie has nothing to do with the original American Pie films except some names and Mr. Levenstein, who is a minor character in this movie. The only good thing about this movie are the good-looking girls. Do not look at this movie and do not be fooled by rating 5.4 as it's obviously overrated and does not earn anything over 2.

summary: Portrait of an American innocent. In 1955, Bettie Page (1923-2008 ) waits to testify before a Senate subcommittee investigating the effects of pornographic material on American adolescents and juveniles. In flashbacks, we see her childhood in Tennessee, a brief marriage, a gang rape, and her going to New York City in 1949. There she takes acting lessons, models for photos, and acts in short films for adults, earning the nickname, "The Pin-Up Queen of the Universe." We see her relationship with merchants Irving and Paula Klaw, photographers John Willie and Bunny Yeager, boyfriends, and the public. Through it all, she is wholesome, sporting, and forthright - Eve before the fall.
translation:
Firstly, I've heard great things about this movie, not least in the retro / vintage scene and the stocking lovers who love Bettie Page absolutely and did not disappoint. The film was shot in very clean black and white, with colors added for key scenes, giving Bettie Page's early life and career a documentary feel.

There are many things I did not know about Page. First there was the gang rape, later there are her early attempts to develop an acting career and then glamor images, first with a camera populated with men who can not get enough of her and later with the Klaws, Paula and Irving, despite their bondage - and fetish photos act as extremely sympathetic and friendly people. If only modern porn producers were like that, maybe a better porn would be a consequence! For the most part, the film is not a slander against the evil of pornography, but an attempt to show the environment that existed in the 1950s for fetish and nude pictures of women. This environment was extremely repressive, perhaps in a good way, because it meant that there was no "saturation effect" that we have today when it comes to pornography. It also seemed a lot less hard. Page comes as someone who enjoys their work and does not seem to be mined by it. In many of her photos, she is seen tied up and gagged (and tries to make a conversation), swinging a whip with verve, thus arousing the photographers who take their pictures and girlie in the "initiation style" bondage movies that are pretty tame compared be with the hardcore stuff we have now.

Page never became an actress and left pin-up when she was in her thirties for "Jesus Christ." Her belief in God and Jesus never goes away, even when bound and gagged, she still insists that she has received a "gift" from God to do "that thing". When I see this movie, I know more about Page and I am impressed with her modesty, her beliefs and her behavior. It's unique compared to the Identi-Kit clones we have today and those who can actually say, "There's a life after porn."

summary: King Higlack of the Gauths entrusts prince Finn and a fire ball weapon to his champion, slayer Beowulf. They lead twelve men on a mission to help king Hrothgar of the Danes, whose once glorious realm is terrorized by the undefeated monster Grendel. The task is made more difficult as Hrothgar kept gruesome secrets.
translation:
For starters, this is not nearly as bad as some of the other trash that the sci-fi channel produced; This does not mean that Grendel is a good movie, in fact he is very bad, but he definitely has the potential to be much better. The film's weaknesses are in character design, character, absurd additions to the story, the visual effects, the music and mostly the acting.

When I talk about character design, of course, what our heroes and villains look like. Beowulf and the other Danes look more like ridiculous Vikings than warriors of brutal strength - this helmet our main character wears is just too silly. Grendel looks like the Hulk, but with strange tentacle attachments on his elbows.

The characters are very limited. Beowulf is the same from start to finish, but Finn - a useless buddy - has achieved some two-dimensionality thanks to his romantic subplot, and Unferth also gets an idea as he becomes less conceited.


The special effects are powerful awful. Grendel and his mother Hag are poorly designed, and as such, they are less credible on the screen.

The music is overbearing, especially when a character dies.

All in all, this is not the worst movie ever by Sci-Fi. No. It's actually one of the better movies, though it's still garbage, it's good garbage that at best makes it a guilty pleasure. The only thing that works is the dialogue, which is still wooden here and there.

I recommend you skip this movie and see Robert Zemeckis' old story from Beowulf, simply because this movie (Grendel) is only half the story, and not the whole thing that makes this movie one Three star review receives.

summary: A secret Service agent and a news reporter investigate the conspiracy behind the assassination of the President.
translation: Do not be fooled by all the big names like Burt Reynolds, James Woods and Anne Archer. They are just glorified extras. Her scenes were probably filmed in a day or so. Whatever your motives for this movie are, if you have an actor like James Woods you should use it better. For me, that's a sign of a bad direction through and through. The story itself was not that bad. And the action of most actors was above average. Cuba Gooding Jr., however, was terrible. He was so incredible that I almost laughed at his dramatic scenes. And since this was meant as a serious movie, that can not be good. The action scenes were not bad, but they lacked the special punch to make it more exciting. It was needed a better direction again. Even the pace was wrong for a movie like this. It took the main character almost half an hour to get going. This is way too slow for an action thriller of only 90 minutes. The only redeeming factor is Angie Harmon. She is doing her best to make everything work. Too bad the director let her down. Yes, this movie could have been much better with a great director. Andy Cheng is far too inexperienced as a director to pull it off. And for an action / stunt coordinator of his caliber, expect at least exciting action scenes. Do not waste your time with it. Avoid!

summary: Alex, a sad-eyed mournful man, goes into psychotherapy: he discloses he's a hit man. He also tells the doctor, after a few sessions, that he's attracted to a young woman he's met in the waiting room. She's Sarah, 23, quick, edgy, and perhaps attracted to him as well. But he's married, the dutiful father of a young precocious boy, so Sarah brushes him off. In flashbacks we see him get his start as a killer, at his father's prompting: it's the family business. Dad gives Alex his next assignment: to kill the therapist. Alex keeps returning to Sarah, calling her, stopping by her apartment, as he decides what to do about the hit, his father, his marriage, and his malaise.
translation:
It is always sad when such films are overlooked by the majority of moviegoers. "Panic" is a wonderfully compelling and poignant study of a character who feels trapped in the futility of his own life.

William H. Macy, like Alex, is as convincing as ever. This fine actor seems to have a special talent for pulling at your heart, no matter how flawed his characters may be; we may not always tolerate the lifestyles of the protagonists he plays, but the emotions of fear and confusion that he causes in us are often all too painfully familiar. The title "panic" seems paradoxical at first, given the lack of obvious emotions. At some point, Alex tells his doctor that he rarely gets angry. But as this story unfolds, it becomes more and more obvious that anger and despair, not indifference, are the driving forces behind this man's existence.

More than once I was reminded of his performance in "Fargo". another strong drawing-driven movie. In "Fargo" and "Panic" we are witnessing a middle-aged man who somehow does not seem in tune with the rest of his life. He has lost his way, and the only way that seems deceptively back is darkness. He knows he makes bad decisions, but desperation overcomes self-control and common sense.

Alex connects to Sarah, a 23-year-old woman (played by Neve Campbell), whom he meets in a doctor's office. Thematically this union is less coincidence, more the work of fate. Alex finds some comfort in Sarah, perhaps she senses that she is a companion like him, someone who has lost her way and hovers aimlessly through the rest of her life, waiting impotently for his inevitable conclusion.

In a perfect film world, there would not only be many more films like "panic", but they would also reach and be appreciated by a much wider audience. If you look at movies for the richness and depth of characterization, rather than just the latest state-of-the-art special effects, then "panic" is hard to miss. A +.

summary: Eddie Hall and his partner Slim are a pair of nickel-and-dime con men on the hustle. Nearly caught by the police, Eddie ducks into Ruby Adams's apartment and convinces her to hide him. Ruby isn't averse to taking advantage of the gullible herself and has even tried to manipulate money out of Al, the square shooter from Cincinnati who adores her. Ruby and Eddie hit it off, but when Eddie accidentally kills a drunk who was pawing Ruby, he takes off and she ends up in a women's reformatory, where she discovers she is pregnant. Devastated at the thought that Eddie has deserted her, she doesn't realize that Eddie has undergone a great change--one that will have a powerful impact on her.
translation: I expected this movie to be an ordinary 1930s romance. Boy meets girls, they fall in love, boy loses girls, boy wins them in the end. It was not like that at all. Clark Gable plays the cheater Eddie with all his usual charisma and mischievous eyebrow lift. He hides from the police as he enters Ruby (Jean Harlow) 's apartment to see her covered in bubbles in the bathtub. Immediate chemistry. It's hard for a while, but a girl can only resist that grin for so long. The heat between them is obvious, and there are some scenes that are definitely pre-production code! When a blackmail job gets bad and Ruby ends up in a boarding house for "restless girls," she is unhappy and, thanks to the fidget her roommate gives her, begins to believe that Eddie will never come for her. Harlow plays the hard-nosed, fast-talking Ruby perfectly. She never lets Gable get all the good lines! It is a particularly moving scene in which she plays "her song" on the piano, which is played perfectly. The last fifteen minutes have made me cry every time. A really sweet romance.

summary: Having discovered they could turn animals invisible, a group of scientists test the subject on a human. Head of research, Dr. Sebastian Caine decides to use himself as the subject. After the experiment can't be reversed, it takes a toll on Caine's personality, causing him to hunt down and kill his colleagues
translation:
I come to the movies every week and visit this site regularly, but never before have I felt compelled to comment on a movie.

Add to my list of horrifying bad movies - Last Man Standing, Spawn, The Bone Collector - I can now add the vehicle that was 'Hollow Man'.

From the terrible opening credits - a ridiculously long cast and crew run along with Alphabetti Spaghetti - to the insulting finale - a world record number of clich√©s and some of the most absurd dialogues and spectacles that ever made it to the movies - This movie is bleak, and only the impressive computer graphics keep you from running long before the end.

This is not just my opinion - it was that of my friends and everyone around us. When large parts of a public laugh and moan during and after a serious thriller, it is clear that the movie is hopeless.

Not only that, it was also sick. The director took the plot for a fierce film beyond the boundaries of realistic fare and into the spheres of a blood-soaked B-movie. It's hard not to think of the director as a dirty old man, because the scale of the invisible man's out-of-lab trips to the outside world was just two attempts to feel some breasts. Maybe sex is the first thing you make invisible, but apart from the aesthetic pleasures of the women involved, it does not make entertaining movies.

[follow spoiler]

Go to the movies sick outside, and things are even worse. While Kevin Bacon does a fine job of increasingly filming himself as a "hollow man," the others - perhaps hampered by a terrible scripture - do an even better job than a hollow cast. A longtime member of the team is found strangled by the invisible man in a locker. "He's finally caught," shrugs a colleague without any trace of emotion. This is normal for the course, and the lab team fluctuates between sheer fear and utter indifference at such a speed that one wonders how they got into acting. They torture themselves fearfully through the lab corridors, the weapons are ready, but seconds later, one of the group members jumps happily down the corridor to fetch blood for an injured colleague. The senior woman treats the invisible with courtesy and good humor, even after he insults and abuses her, and there seems to be little response to his outbursts, even after drowning the Pentagon chief. "He drowned in his pool last night" the same woman, spectacularly failing to put two and two together. The script is littered with this kind of poorly-played pedestrian dialogue, and the rest is just an AZ of movie clich√©s that are thicker and faster when the movie gets to the point of complete Disbelief and amusement in the end progresses.

The "eureka" moment on the computer, the female taking off at the window, the looped security video - the list is truly endless - the predictable disregard of strength in numbers, the decision not to kill the two main stars but to place her in a place of probable impending death and to leave her to herself, the nearly dead good guy who emerges from nothing to emerge the woman, the bomb and the ubiquitous land of Tdown-Timer, the fireball blast that just started before she reaches heroes, the falling lift that just stops before he meets her, and more than anything the immortality of evil.

The invisible man was burned to pieces with an improvised flame thrower, beaten with electricity, hit with a bar around his head, who had just cut through one of the smaller actors, and then the blast, the fireball, and the total destruction of the laboratories apparently has survived, more than enough life is left to rise through the fireball for a last pop at the movie heroes - at which time the unbelieving onlookers writhe and watch their clocks.

That this extraordinary bad movie actually made it! The cinema is amazing. Even the name of the film is as hopeless as the movie itself, and not even impressive special effects come close to the savings that should be avoided at all costs.

summary: Meg and Charles Wallace are aided by Calvin and three interesting women, Mrs. Which, Mrs. Whatsit, and Mrs. Who in the search for their father who disappeared during an experiment he was working on for the government. Their travels take them around the universe to a place unlike any other. They must learn to trust each other and to understand that everyone is different.
translation:
(That may be a bit on the spoiler side) I'd like to start by saying that I did not see the whole movie, nor could I because it was obvious from the first hour that I would be incredibly disappointed. This, of course, is the problem with what many believe to be an amazing book and turns it into a Disney TV movie.

A Wrinkle in Time should have been made an amazing movie a long time ago. It has a great story that could appeal to children and adults. Plus it built quality continuations. But Disney crafting was not the way to go. The problem with the film is that all the things they've changed to turn it into a visual story have darkened what was so great about the book. It's a complicated and emotional story for kids. There was no reason to make Charles Wallace purely "psychic" because that was the easiest way to explain it. There was no reason to write a dispute between the three Mrs. Ws as extra tension, there is enough tension in the story without that. There was no reason to remove Meg's glasses ... that took us the scene, which is a very sweet scene between Calvin and Meg that appears in the book.

I could nod for days about small things, but I also think bigger things, like the Art Direction was off. For example, let's see what Camazotz looks like with his strangely dark sky. The scary thing that appears in the book is that Camazotz could be Earth. It looks like earth. It has people who look like people. The sky is blue, the grass is green and children are playing. But something is a bit gone. The directors decided to make Camazotz a complete different one instead of taking the lesson in the book and applying it to the overall direction of the film. The lesson is of course that Camazotz could very well be the Earth if we forgot to love. It would have been a lot scary to spend a nice afternoon walking down the street while the kids hit the balls in the same rhythm.

Unfortunately, I did not pay attention to the end. Maybe someone can tell me that Disney messed up the end too.

Overall, an artistic disappointment.

summary: A young French woman returns to the vast silence of West Africa to contemplate her childhood days in a colonial outpost in Cameroon. Her strongest memories are of the family's houseboy, Protee - a man of great nobility, intelligence and beauty - and the intricate nature of relationships in a racist society.
translation: This film is all about subtlety and the difficulty of controlling the ever-changing boundaries of morals, race relations and desires. Granted, it's not a movie for everyone. There are no chases, no exploding buildings, no murders. The drama is in the tension that is unsaid by looks, minimal gestures, spatial boundaries, light and things - sometimes superficial. It's about identity, memory, community, belonging. The different parts of the film work together to reinforce the leitmotifs of self and other, identity, desire, limitations and loss. It will reward the attentive and sensitive audience. It will displease those whose palates require explosive, massive, spicy actions. It's a beautifully filmed human story. That's all.

summary: Chennai-based ACP Anbuselvan works together with a team of anti-narcotics officers and with the help of an informer virtually bring drug-dealing to an end. He is dedicated and believes being involved with anyone romantically may endanger her life, but changes his mind after he meets with Maya. Unknown to the entire unit, the informer was working for a gangster, who wanted all competition eliminated, and thus reign as the king of the underworld. Then Anbuselvan's world will be shattered when he and some of his team will be suspended for their involvement in the killing of a gangster, the brother of Pandiyan, while the latter vows that he will not rest until he has killed the entire team and their respective families.
translation:
Indian cinema is typical of policemen in two broad categories: they are either the honest guy or the bad guys. The honest guys always scream in the best of voices and fight against the system, while the bad bulls enjoy most but end up suffering.

This movie breaks at least the usual formula and gives a refreshing look of policemen and their lives. The director takes a look at the life of a young, ambitious cops. The music is interesting and the editing is a trendsetter in Indian cinema.

The movie is sometimes slow and the dilemma Anbu faces when it comes to Maya is sometimes overplayed. But I would still give this 9/10 because it has many premieres.

summary: A Lutheran church outside of Germany. Those close with the minister, Dietrich Bonhoeffer, advise him not to return to Germany, but a doctor insists that he must due to his religious beliefs. Despite the possibility of persecution by the Nazis, Dietrich Bonhoeffer returns to Germany and preaches of the Jews and against Hitler and his Nazi agenda.
translation: I saw fascinated and enchanted by the voice and the physical play. The roles each character played were excellent. The text, the words, every gesture, the sunrise, told everything. The movie spoke to me. It enlightened me to another perception of a man who believes in humanity. Who believes in peace and gentle behavior. I was also held in disbelief by portraying victims and human dignity. Power without mercy, is insane and without feelings. To want power at the expense of humanity is so incredible. This movie made me so anxious for the people who are no longer in this world. And I think of her with sadness. I like this movie for the conversations and facial expressions to everything. May this movie be blessed.

summary: Paris, je t'aime is about the plurality of cinema in one mythic location: Paris, the City of Love. Twenty filmmakers have five minutes each; the audience must weave a single narrative out of twenty moments. The 20 moments are fused by transitional interstitial sequences and also via the introduction and epilogue. Each transition begins with the last shot of the previous film and ends with the first shot of the following film, extending the enchantment and the emotion of the previous segment, preparing the audience for a surprise, and providing a cohesive atmosphere. There's a reappearing mysterious character who is a witness to the Parisian life. A common theme of Paris and love fuses all.
translation:
Gorgeous movie by some of the best directors in today's industry. The film also plays some of the great actors of our time, not just from France but from everywhere.

My Favorite Segments:

14th Arrondissement: Carol (Margo Martindale) comes from Denver to Paris to learn French and to develop a sense of her life.

Montmartre: There was probably no better way to start this movie than with this segment in the romantic Paris br /> Loin du 16√®me: A picture of Paris that has made us better known since the riots in the Cit√©s is. Ana (Catalina Sandino Moreno) spends more time looking after someone else's child (she's a nanny) than her own.

Latin Quarter: It's so much fun to see G√©rard Depardieu as a "tenancier de bar" with Gena Rowlands and Ben Gazzara about their divorce.

Tour Eiffel: Do not tell me you do not like these mimes!

Tuileries: Such a treat, Steve to see Buscemi as a tourist, making contact with a girl in the subway (no-no).

Parc Monceau: Nick Nolte is great. Ludivine Sagnier too.

I spent three days in Paris in 2004 and this movie makes me go back!

Seen in Barcelona (another great city), in the Verdi, on March 18, 2007.

84/100 (***)

summary: Rayford Steele is an airline pilot whose relationship with his wife has gone sour;he ponders having an affair with an attractive flight attendant, Hattie Durham. In the midst of a flight to London, a number of their passengers mysteriously disappear, and chaos takes hold as a number of vehicles on the ground and in the air are suddenly unmanned. Meanwhile, Buck Williams, a television journalist, is pondering the rash of sudden disappearances as he works on a report about Dr. Chaim Rosenzweig, an Israeli scientist who has devised a formula that would make any soil on earth easy to cultivate. However, Buck wonders if there's more to Rosenzweig than he first imagined when he discovers the doctor is in cahoots with two multi-millionaires who plan to broker the invention to promote their own agenda of international domination.
translation: I find it sad that Christians (and I am one) feel that we have to make films like "Left Behind". We have much better stories to tell that do not have to preach like that. I was very disappointed in this movie. As an aspiring filmmaker who believes in Christ, I see this film as the perfect example of what I'm not going to do with my film career.

summary: With the end of the North American Civil War, the manufacturers of repeating rifles find a profitable means of making money selling the weapons to the North American Indians, using the front man John Lattimer to sell the rifles to the Cheyenne. While traveling in a stagecoach with Calamity Jane and William "Buffalo Bill" Cody and his young wife Louisa Cody that want to settle down in Hays City managing a hotel, Wild Bill Hickok finds the guide Breezy wounded by arrows and telling that the Indians are attacking a fort using repeating rifles. Hickok meets Gen. George A. Custer that assigns Buffalo Bill to guide a troop with ammunition to help the fort. Meanwhile the Cheyenne kidnap Calamity Jane, forcing Hickok to expose himself to rescue her.
translation: Sure, this movie is not historically accurate, but it's a great conversation. Most DeMille images, especially the later epics, are slow and cumbersome, but the plot moves here in a clip. The story is basically a series of peaks with very little quiet moments. The plot leads us from an Indian raid on a cabin; one of the best parts of the film awarded to Jean Arthur while trying to appease the indigenous war painting. After that, she and Cooper are taken to the war camp and tortured. Later comes a protracted battle with the Cheyenne. The whole thing is ridiculous, but very funny and entertaining from start to finish. Jean Arthur is one of the best actresses of this time and she shines here.

summary: This cinema version of the Sam Shepard play is set well after the mid-century. James Woods as the alcoholic farmer drives a huge beater with a rusted roof which is emblematic of the general disrepair of his farm. A lovingly tended lamb with maggots is the reverse emblem of something helpless, needy and cared for. The refrigerator is spoken to as a character, as if standing in for absent nurturing from Woods' self-centered wife. The couple have two kids who must come of age as their home is being torn apart around them and the parents pursue fantasies of "better things" offered by crook Randy Quaid. Henry Thomas as the son copes by holding on to the land and creating a poetic commentary, and the responses of his sister to the crisis become a powerful and surprising tribute to womanhood.
translation:
2 stars out of a possible 10 - and that's overly generous.

I thought with a cast of James Woods, Cathy Bates, Randy Quaid, Lou Gossett Jr. and Henry Thomas - how could it be missing. I was wrong.

I'm just wondering what drug Sam Shepard was on the weekend when he was driving this piece of dribbling. I thought Sam S was crazy for a long time, this film, based on his playing, confirms it.

This is the kind of artistic bs.s. Performers love to sink their teeth as they give them the opportunity to emote endlessly. But for the viewer sitting in this nonsense garbage, there's absolutely nothing you could love about this movie.

You did not see dysfunctional families until you saw this bunch. Pa is crazy, Ma is crazy, the son is crazy and the daughter is, oh yes, crazy. They also have mouths on them who utter words that make a sailor blush, especially the teenage daughter.

In addition to the above, as if that was not enough, the plot - and it's so skinny you could read it thoroughly - has a hole the size of Alaska.

Ma is conspiring to sell her rundown farm. As it turns out, Pa is also. Now, I do not pretend to be a real estate expert, but the last time I checked, real estate that they have in common has to have both signatures to be sold. If only one of them owned the property, then the other could not legally sell it, so it would be pointless for that person to do so. Mr. Shepherd prefers to ignore this fundamental fact, and therefore his action does not work.

Not that anything else really worked.

The Only Possible Reason Someone Could See This movie is when they are absolutely desperate to see James Woods in full frontal nudity, and I can not imagine why anyone wants that ,

summary: College freshman Cassandra "Cassie" steps into a nightmare of otherworldly visitations after surviving a devastating car accident. Haunted by a grim reaper of a far different kind, her only hope is to cling to chance encounters with her lost love Sean and the aid of a mysterious young priest named Father Jude. It is the spirit of Sean, her soul mate, who guides her to love, but it is her friends Matt, Annabel and Annabel's morose friend Raven who try to draw her to the dark side.
translation:
Inexperienced, boring and incoherent supernatural "thriller" in which the student Cassie (Melissa Sagemiller) is the constant victim of hallucinations and nightmares after a car crash challenges the life of her friend Sean (Casey Affleck).

I can not begin to tell you how bad this is ... nothing of any importance ever occurs and there is no real entertainment value. I did not like this cast in this particular movie - they are all unconvincing (then again, their roles are not good). To promote this as a horror movie is a joke. Where are the horrors? There is no sense or tension - there are some good songs, but that's it.

How on earth did this project get the green light? Author and director Steve Carpenter has no recognizable vision or talent that I can feel. Worst of all, the conclusion really makes the whole movie pointless.

The alleged "killer cut" I saw is 86 minutes of pure boredom.

1/10

summary: Gunfighter Rick Martin returns to his hometown of Casper, Wyoming to learn of the fate of his mother and to warn the town of an impending raid by the Tom Quentin gang. The townspeople however reject him, afraid that his gunslinging past will cause new trouble. Rick learns that his mother did not die of illness but was murdered, and he comes to suspect the town's leading citizen -- a man now engaged to marry the woman Rick loves.
translation: I liked Top Gun. It held my interest. Predictable plot, decent character development and storyline. It is quite similar to High Noon that city dwellers seem weak and scared to hold their own against a villain. This movie has some good actors who really did not have a chance to share all their talents. Also, some of the actors were not recognized for their roles. Denver Pyle was a handsome man when he was young. John Dehner, Rod Taylor are outstanding in their roles. Sterling Hayden did the best he could with bad stuff. You can hardly imagine him as a gunslinger. Laura, played by Karen Booth, was a disgusting character. She seemed flattered that two men were arguing about her. Pooh. Finally, how can people travel without luggage? Especially women.

summary: A man who has devoted himself to serving the leader of the free world is accused of plotting against him in this thriller. Pete Garrison (Michael Douglas) is a veteran Secret Service agent who has had a long and distinguished career helping protect the president of the United States. David Breckinridge (Kiefer Sutherland) is a fellow Secret Service agent who learned most of what he knows from Garrison and holds him in great respect. When intelligence data suggests that there is a mole within the Secret Service who is part of a plot to assassinate President Ballentine (David Rasche), Garrison launches an investigation to ferret out the rogue agent, and asks Breckinridge to go over the evidence with a fine-toothed comb. Breckinridge is shocked when the clues point to Garrison as the traitor within the Secret Service, but his sense of duty compels him to see that his former mentor is placed under arrest. Garrison eludes his captors and struggles to prove his innocence while tracking down...
translation: It's been 19 years since Gordon Gekko used "Wall Street" to tell us that greed is good. Now Michael Douglas takes the GG persona and turns her into a secret service agent, Pete Garrison. Guess what? It works out! This is a solid political thriller that advised me. The detailing of the security arrangements made by the SS on behalf of the President and the First Lady was also fascinating. All the guiding principles were pretty good, but I could not accept Eva Longoria as Secret Service Agent. While Jodie Foster has just gotten you to give up the belief and really think she was FBI Agent Starling in Silence of the Lambs, you do not feel the same way at Longoria. Nonetheless, this is a funny movie, escape entertainment with the Beltway as a backdrop.

summary: This casts key characters from the Jungle Book into a 1930's pacific setting where Baloo is a bush pilot who finds himself as part of a struggling courier company.
translation: In 1990, the world of Disney TV cartoons was certainly in its heyday. Shows like Chip n Dale Rescue Rangers, DuckTales and Gummy Bears were already popular, and now Disney made another great cartoon and this cartoon brought the birth of the Disney Afternoon. This cartoon is called TaleSpin. It's about the old jungle book character Baloo the Bear, who gets a job in the aircraft business. In the series he meets Kit Cloudkicker, the former Air Pirate and good cloud surfer, the business lady Rebecca Cunningham and her hyperactive daughter Molly. This series is very funny and has a lot of great puns that you may not understand as a child but understand later in life. This is a cleverly written series and it's great to add it to your DVD collection. Parents, buy this for your kids so they can see all those horrible Nickelodeon cartoons. If you liked TaleSpin, check out "Darkwing Duck" and "Goof Troop". Turn it!

summary: New Year's Revolution (2006) was the second annual New Year's Revolution pay-per-view event produced by World Wrestling Entertainment (WWE).
translation:
Not bad for Raw's first PPV of 006. But the end was really shocking for everyone present and those watching at home.

FIRST GAME - RIC FLAIR VS. EDGE W / LITA FOR WWE INTERCONTINENTAL CHAMPIONSHIP Not a bad opener, these two can seriously play a great match if they have more time to compete in a wrestling match. Flair wins after Edge hits him with his MITB briefcase. 3/10 SECOND MATCH- TRISH STRATUS VS. MICKIE JAMES FOR THE WWE WOMEN'S CHAMPIONSHIP Not bad, considering these divas compete against each other for the first time in the ring. Mickie chooses a modified chick kick, but Trish ducks her own chick kick and wins it to keep her title. 3/10 THIRD MATCH TRIPLE H VS. BIG SHOW Really good, this match was real. The whole match HHH focuses on Big Show injured arm, but Big Show is still fighting back. Later, HHH is able to overthrow Big Show and get a pedigree for the win. 5/10 FOURTH MATCH SHELTON BENJAMIN W / MAMA VS. VISCERA {That was a bonus match} Not so bad, it was alright. After Viscera was down, Benjamin's mother got a purse {which had bricks in it} and hit Viscera three times with it. Viscera stood up, only to be caught by Benjamin for beating the tall man with a twisting heel kick. 4/10

FIVE GAME - JERRY 'THE KING' LAWLER VS. GREGORY HELMS Boring, slow and sloppy. Both men did not try very hard. Jerry Lawler wins after a fist drop for the win. 2/10

SIXTH MATCH TORRIES Wilson VS. VICTORIA VS. ASHLEY MARIA VS. CANDICE MICHELLE IN A FIRST WOMEN GAUNTLET MATCH It was quite entertaining for me. Ashley {I think} eliminates Candice last time to win the first women's Gauntlet match. 5/10 Seventeenth Match - John Cena VS. CHRIS MASTERS VS. CARLITO VS. SHAWN MICHAELS VS. KANE VS. KURT ANGLE W / DAIVARI IN A DISPOSAL CHAMBER MATCH FOR THE WWE CHAMPIONSHIP It was a cool knockout game. But nothing will surpass last year's eliminator, which was the best. The last three are Masters, Cena & Carlito. Carlito turns his back on Masters and gets a roll-up to eliminate him. A few seconds later, Cena gets a catch-up on Carlito to win the knockout and retain his WWE title. But his night was not over yet. 7/10 After the match comes Vince McMahon and congratulates Cena on his victory. Vince McMahon says his night is not over yet and says Edge is challenging money for the title in his Money In The Bank opportunity. Edge comes out with Lita, hands Vince the briefcase and goes into the ring when Cena has another match tonight.

EIGHT MATCH - JOHN CENA VS. EDGE W / LITA FOR THE WWE CHAMPIONSHIP {Cena, who was acquitted during the Chamber match} is immediately hit by Edge, Edge then hits a spear on Cena, hits the cover & to his shock, Cena breaks out. Edge nails another spear & covers for the shocking three counts as he defeated Cena and won the WWE Championship for the first time in his career. 1/10 So the New Year's Revolution of last year was better than this year, but it was still alright. The European Championship match was also good and the shock from Edge taking his MITB opportunity is definitely the most shocking on the PPV show.

Overall: I'll give it a 7/10 and a C

summary: Trash is a coming of age drama set amongst the poverty stricken trailer parks of the deep South. In a spiraling tale of hatred, love and loyalty, two teenage friends realize that the only way for each of them to escape their miserable futures is by forever sacrificing the other.
translation: You need to give this action sketch to any would-be filmmakers arriving at the bus station in Hollywood. Then they fill in the gaps and put their story in the city or ghetto they just came from. You know exactly what this film is about, from the opening shot, four young guys playing in grainy slow motion, accompanied by voice-over narrations. Next stop after the bus station must be to buy stock footage of four boys playing in grainy slow motion. Once they grow up, it's easy to spot the author / director among the four. He is the calm, thoughtful, long-haired one who is never seen in his pants without his composition book. This means his outstanding writing talent will be his ticket from Hickville to Hollywood. Only here there is no literary talent. And if you still can not figure out who he is, here's a clue: the author and his character have the same middle name. It took more than an hour to find out that those twenties were still in school. What looked like a prison was apparently a high school, the director was the director. Once again, the poor, misunderstood rebel can throw anyone in the movie on the sidewalk, murder and plunder, but is powerless against his alcoholic father. How about striking back, boy, how are you all the others? Numerous fistfighting scenes for no apparent reason. Howling bad dialogue. Many scenes are out of focus. Cartoon characters appear again and again as little players and extras and draw unintentional laughter from the premiere audience. Exaggerated in extreme cases. And if you do not fully understand the self-important speeches or the slow-motion scenes, just listen to the arrogant music. It will recognize you and what you should feel. Poor Marisa Ryan has to earn many frequent flyer miles as she travels across the country, working in these amateur regional films. The biggest sin is that the public should feel sympathy for children slaughtering old women, running, robbing and stealing puppies chained to a tree while complaining about their sad, sad life. But if we could just get out of this city and go to college. Yes, that's the ticket. Why does every twenty-year-old filmmaker believe that his life so far is so important and so interesting that the world can not wait to see it on screen? If this film is as autobiographical as it seems, then the author should better look over his shoulder for policemen who carry cursory arrest warrants.

summary: A woman enters a restaurant one morning - only to be met with silence instead of people talking.
translation:
Nacho Vigalondo is very famous in Spain. He's a kind of bad showman who can make you sick ... very embarrassing. Nacho had made a few commercials on television, I remember one in which Nacho was looking for Paul Mc Carney near Madrid (the commercial was about a Mc Carney CD collection).

This little movie is like a Nacho commercial: bad story, bad direction and terrible performances. I can not believe a disgusting movie like this was at The Kodak Theater. Poor Oscar ... summary: --**Contains Spoilers**----Air Force pilot John Sands has been wrongfully imprisoned in a military detention center, where his memory is to be chemically wiped because some of his superiors feel threatened by the knowledge that he gained from his assignments to operations that were deemed too sensitive for the regular intelligence services. Later, after John escapes from the detention center, a top secret Air Force Stealth Bomber known as the X-77, which uses the latest in stealth cloaking technology, making it capable of going anywhere undetected, is stolen by corrupt Air Force pilot Ratcher. General Tom Barnes, John's former commander, hears that John has been arrested after taking down a group of men who were robbing a rest stop. Knowing that John was Ratcher's trainer, Barnes sends John to northern Afghanistan with fellow pilot Rick Jannick to recover the X-77, promising John that he will be a free man if he succeeds. Barnes has Admiral Frank Pendleton, who is on an aircraft ...
translation: I can barely find the words to express how extremely horrible this movie is. I was sold on the promise of the action, with Segal and stealth planes that usually provide a fun action movie. I can honestly say that I would rather erase my eyes with a cocktail stick than have to see this movie again. The acting was so terrible that it was almost funny. The story was incredibly weak, with action holes so big that you could fly a F117 through them. The script was so bad when I found out that a 10-year-old wrote it, I should not be the least bit surprised. The direction and production is so amateurish, I would not even hire these people to shoot my worst enemies wedding video. Utter Utter. Those responsible for this film have cheapened the art and they should be ashamed of themselves. Steven Segal should never show his face in public again, I can not imagine what made him star in this, the worst movie I've ever seen in my life.

summary: Inspector Gadget is back in an all-new animated movie. Gadget is still a klutz and Dr. Claw has a vicious new plan that makes him a super-hero in disguise to try to ruin Gadget and to take over the world, but as usual Gadget in his zany ways wins.
translation: Essentially, this film is about Inspector Gadget's archenemy Doctor Claw, who has returned to the now peaceful city of Metropolis after many years. Claw's plan is to thwart Gadget once and for all by using a newer "cooler" criminal investigator to destroy Gadget's popularity. Unfortunately, the film fails miserably, the series was great, but it was revived with tragic consequences almost 20 years later. Without the voice of Don Adams as Inspector Gadget, it just does not cut anymore; Dr. Not only is Claw visually less scary, he sounds more like a cold-blood wrestler than his original intimidating self. Granted, this is a children's movie, but the plot is so painfully weak (forbid skies, I mention the animation) that it fades in comparison to the original series. Someone has also decided to update Penny to bring her two decades up, she now has a rebellious clothing style quasi-punky and does not play half the role she has played in the TV series. The gadget mobile speaks, as well as a plot-angle focusing on talking cars. Maybe I'm just a kid who loved the show that was flared up, but I thought that the live action version was more painful than I could stand, but now they go off and ignite this complete dilution of the high quality TV series us. It's more than I can take.

summary: Two young children and an adult in a small town have an encounter with an alien spaceship. 25 years later the children are reunited as adults in the same town which is now beset by strange cattle mutilations. Matters become worse when the cattle mutilations are joined by human murders and mutilations.

Seriously, all you have to do is wonder why this movie was made, if you have a killer who has some good death scenes, if you'll show alien encounters that show more than a weird whirlwind thing, and if you do Do you have lightsabers, then call yourself Star Wars.

summary: A group of scientists, working in a deep underground lab, clones and hatches a 1,000-year-old dragon, after finding its remains in a cavern in southern England. After the critter goes from one cell to full grown in 3 hours, it goes on a rampage, killing most of the scientists and escaping to the surface. Naturally, bullets don't faze it at all. Our Intrepid Hero helps kill if before it can menace all mankind. Sort of "Alien" meets "Reign of Fire".
translation:
there are those movies that are bad, they are funny, then there are those where you scream "I want one and a half hours of my life back" ... that's pretty much what that is.

Dean Cain tries to be an actor, but fails. the SFX are really bad (repeated scenes and stones that look like falling paper) and the plastic guns with torches glued on them ... the split-screen effect that shows several things at the same time is just terrible.

This movie can not even be used as one of those simple night entertainers, it's just so bad.

If I could make negative reviews, I would do it

summary: Two American tourists on a romantic camping trip are brutally murdered. A few days later, during the ancient festival of Samhain, a group of American university students moves into a beautiful cottage, surrounded by a lush forest and a majestic lake They are here to learn about the rituals of the ancient Druids and other Celtic legends. But in the remains of an abandoned copper mine, lives the ancestors of an incestuous clan of cannibals. Stalked by a hulking, disfigured mutant, the students and their chaperone are in for the most harrowing time of their young lives. And keeping their heads on their necks will become their main concern...
translation: I understand, I check the movie I saw. I realize that virtually all the nudity and blood was cut out of this movie and completely castrated it. summary: Santa Claus, high above the North Pole in his cloud-borne castle equipped with more surveillance devices than the Impossible Mission Force, prepares to deliver presents on Christmas night. Santa is especially interested in helping Lupita, the daughter of a poor family who wants nothing more than a doll; and a young boy whose parents are so wealthy they never spend any time with him (Santa fixes this by feeding them Pan-Galactic Gargle Blasters). However, the Devil will have none of this and sends his minion, Pitch, to foil Santa's plans. Pitch in turn recruits three Naughty Boys to help him set traps for Santa.
translation: This movie is meant to be a "happy" story about Santa Claus and his "magical and mystical" wonders. But it's downright scary instead. Two things in this film that stand out in my mind as frightening are 1) the way Santa looks. Have you ever seen a terrible-looking Santa Claus? and 2) the "evil rep. of Satan" pitch is just weird dances are just sick to watch. Watch this movie only if it's the MSTed version or if you like to laugh. I can not believe that this is a children's movie.

summary: The story ultimately revolves around two "men of honor"; their relationship, their individual and joint failures and triumphs. Carl Brashear is determined to be the first African American Navy Diver in a time where racism is rife. Leslie Sunday is his embittered trainer, determined to see him fail. Fate, challenges and circumstances eventually draw these two men together in a tale of turbulence and ultimately triumph.
translation:
This is one of the best military films of all time. And it's great because of its focus on values. It is a great human interest story that turns a commitment to honor, loyalty, love and determination.

Gooding and DeNiro are outstanding in the lead roles. It's wonderful to see the Master Chiefs' racism evolve through Carl Brashear's determination, drive, and yes, honor to respect and love. The title indicates the source of their bond. I never noticed, until the last time, how brilliant Carl Lumbly's portrayal of Carl's father, Mac Brashear, was. In a way, it is a cornerstone of the movie that Carl's memory of his father carries him through hard times.

I'm picky about the movies I buy. This is one of those rare ones that I would like to have on my shelf. It will be seen many times in the future, I'm sure.

summary: Anna Zador is a secretary who's been working for 6 years at Count Willie Palaffi's bank. Every day, she rides to work on her bike and places flowers on Willie's desk, but Willie (the Budapest playboy) doesn't know that she exists. "Whiskers", noticing Anna to be a sweet and beautiful woman, believes she would be the perfect wife for Willie. He insists that Marika (Willie's personal secretary) invite Anna to Willie's costume birthday party - she does so reluctantly for she wants to marry Willie. Marika, knowing Anna is low on cash, offers to help her get a costume. At the party, everyone is dressed elegantly, while Anna is in a simple Angel's outfit. Willie, feeling sorry for her, asks her to dance, but when he sees the guests laughing at them, he makes an excuse and goes upstairs. Upstairs, Willie falls asleep and dreams that an Angel named Brigitta comes to earth to marry him. On their wedding night, Brigitta loses her wings to Willie's delight. He is less delighted when her ...
translation:
I just read a book about Anita Loos' work and the photo in MacDonald's TCM Magazine in her angelic costume looked great (impressive wings), so I thought I was going to watch this movie. I had never heard of the movie before, so I had no preconceived notions about it. I thought it would have made a nice start with Eddy as a playboy and MacDonald as a secretary he does not know exists. The scene in which she shows up at the costume party in her simple angel costume with an uncooperative halo and wings that do not stay was really adorable. I even went to the movie when Eddy went to sleep and imagine her as a real angel. But after a while it started to crumble for me. Eddy stays "asleep" for the rest of the movie, so it's all a dream. Whatever happens from then on does not matter because he just dreams. The rest was pretty plain and pointless. I had to force myself to stick to it. And the last number, in which MacDonald changes in a crazy hallucination of the music number to the music number, was simply crazy.

Did Eddy "wake up" earlier and the original story went on, or did he really marry an angel? I think it would have been a lot more interesting. I wanted to see more of her true character.

There were not really enough musical numbers to call it a musical. The first few songs were good, but the jitterbug that MacDonald plays was like nails on a blackboard. Totally wrong for her opera voice. Nevertheless, Eddy and MacDonald still shine and show what true stars are.

summary: The B.T.K. killer harasses a news reporter with threatening letters as he ponders about the murders he committed 30 years ago.

summary: A space probe is infiltrated by alien beings and then crashes on a remote Pacific atoll. A group planning to build a resort hotel land on the island and discover it to be inhabited by giant mutant monsters created by the aliens in an attempt to conquer the world.
translation: The Japanese have always had incredible ambitions in their fantasy films. They have always been ready to destroy cities with giant plastic monsters from outer space and elsewhere. The problem is that they never had the money to make a compelling special effect. This film, published in France under the title Les envahisseurs de l'espace, is no exception. His goal is to show three creatures from the giant octopus to the giant lobster, which tries to prevail over the humans. It is extremely embarrassing and ridiculous, but also very pleasant. After all, we like these creatures and these movies, right?

summary: In order to generate more endorsement revenue, Champion City's resident superhero Captain Amazing arranges for the release of supervillain Casanova Frankenstein, only to be captured by him. The city's fate rests in the hands of seven loser superhero wannabes: the spoon-flinging Blue Rajah, the shovel-wielding Shoveler, the possessed bowling ball-hurling Bowler, the flatulent Spleen, the only-when-nobody's-looking Invisible Boy, the mysterious Sphinx, and the perpetually-angry Mr. Furious.
translation:
OK. There are people who should not see this movie.

1) Do not look if you do not like satire or black humor. 2) Does not like it if you were insulted by the guards. 3) Do not look at it, if you want a serious superhero movie.

The rest of you, run, do not go to see _Mystery Men_. It's funny, it's weird, it's a delightful waste of every bad superhero cliche known to man. Occasional thrusts in junior-high spirits do not ruin the tongue-in-cheek, casual humor of Jeanane Garafalo, Ben Stiller and Hank Azaria, as well as a few amusing smaller parts of Geoffrey Rush and Greg Kinnear. (It's good that Louise Lasser also gets work.) I laughed the whole way. Extremely unserious, a bit weird, but - well -.

summary: With the exception of vampires, every monster from folklore and mythology is a missing link between apes and humans, and they all seem to love Chicago. To combat the threat, Chicago PD formed Special Unit 2, known to the rest of the department as a deep-cover plainclothes unit they should steer clear of, to hunt them down and eliminate them. Officer Kate Benson, who has always been seeing things out of the corner of her eye since childhood, gets recruited into the unit when she discovers people are being kidnapped by real-life gargoyles for food and is paired up with trigger-happy Nicholas O'Malley.
translation: The TV productions at the beginning of the year 2000 were between weak and bad. In front of Marks like (Alias, Lost, Prison Break, Desperate Housewives or Monk) the TV did not have the right hit, which could catch the attention and interests of the 2000s viewer. Titles like (Relic Hunter), (Mutant X), (The Lost World), (Sheena) or even (Baywatch Hawaii) were not encouraging for you to watch and follow, or at least they were not as fascinating and interesting as the time what preceded them. (Special unit 2) was no exception. In fact it is men in black meets the X-Files parody! (As if that were the special unit 1). But even after this brilliant formula; It did not work well. It was promising; At the time, there was a saturation of the "supernatural" cases after a decade of many X files, the natural mind to mock it too (imagine Mulder as a womanizer!). However (Special Unit 2) was not the strongest in this one, or a strong one when it comes to making a comic sci-fi show. It was very ridiculous, for example, where every sexy situation has to be turned into an ugly disgusting situation. It enjoyed this bad taste disgusting. (Michael Landes) was not charismatic and mostly unbearable as a comedian. His chemistry with (Alexondra Lee), as well as any alleged sexual attention, was all lethargic. Sure, the show has a funny look, but overall it was unfunny work. It is clear that there was nothing more interesting than his main idea. Under (Evan Katz) 's other work as a co-writer and co-producer like (Seven Days) before or (24) later, that must be a low point! Despite its strong personality, it was a silly joke most of the time. So if that was the goal, they were actually making one of the darkest! And really, it would be one of the rarest times to be grateful for the cancellation of a show after only 19 episodes!

summary: After World War 2, Senior Japanese Officials and their followers were killed and buried together in China, after being defeated and forced to give in. The Japanese Evil People of Nine Chrysanthemum have sworn revenge and are secretly plotting against China after sealing the graves of the Officials. Before their conspiracy can come to an end, Chinese police Captain Li and Taoist master Mao Yuan Feng discover the conspiracy and kill some of the Japanese Evil People. The members who survived used then their blood to call them back from Hell and became Devil Masters. But before their Japanese Imperialist Agressive Ambition can succeed, Captain Li and Taoist Master Mao Yuan Feng kill them and defeat their plot of revenge for good.
translation:
This video was initially banned in the UK and allowed without cuts last November.

It contains the Playboy Playmate of the Month October 1979, Ursula Buchfellner. The opening cuts back and forth between Buchfellner and misty jungle pictures. I'm not sure what the purpose was. It would have been much better to focus on the tub scene.

Laura (Buchfellner) is abducted and held for ransom in the jungle. Peter (Al Cliver) is sent to find her and the ransom. Of course one of the kidnappers (Antonio de Cabo) manages to spend time productively while another (Werner Pochath) whines incessantly.

The ransom exchange goes to hell and Laura runs into the jungle. Will Peter save her before the cannibals eat anything? Oh yes, there are cannibals in this jungle. Why do you think it was a video? Muriel Montoss√© is found by Peter and his partner (Antonio Mayans - Angel of death) on the kidnapper's boat. Montoss√© is very comfortable. Peter leaves her and goes off alone to find Laura, who has since been captured. They spend time with sex and do not see the danger approaching. Guts, anyone? Great fight between Peter and the naked devil (Burt Altman).

Blood, decapitation, guts, lots of head-on, some big curvatures by the cannibal priestess (Aline Mess), and the line "She ripped her heart out," which is funny when you see the movie ,

summary: A homicidal dune-buggy trio terrorizes a busload of Las Vegas bound tourists with the intent to kidnap one of them.
translation:
I have not seen it for over twenty years. OJ was the bus driver, Arte Johnson was the tour guide, Lorenzo was the kidnapper.

Yes, Lorenzo looked very home like the bad guy, a natural. I think I saw it most for OJ back then, when I saw Towering Inferno and Cassandra Crossing, but also Arte Johnson.

I was a little bored that Johnson was so serious. >
And yes, it moved the plots. When I read other posts, I remember it was a conspiracy to kidnap a rich girl, but then this priceless stamp business came out of the blue.

I went, a stamp? If it was a late movie, I would probably record it to check it again, but I would not be nostalgic about it. Not yet anyway.

There are better movies from the seventies like these to check.

summary: Samantha Morrow, a middle-class mom deserted by her shallow husband, David. In order to keep a roof over her head - not to mention the head of her son, Travis - Samantha decides to take in boarders.
translation:
This movie was so awful that it was almost good ... almost. We love musicals, but not this one. Despite the terrible sound quality, the poor camera work and many actors who can not sing or dance, Anthony Rapp did indeed perform well (especially towards the end). The figure Marjorie, a drunk lady, was also nice to look at.

The plot is very unexpected and could have been fun without horrible singing and cool piano music. Granted, some of the songs (fantabulous) are pretty catchy (but not in a good way).

Open House is a fun movie to watch, just because it's awful! We think it could be a good stage musical (with excellent actors).

summary: Based loosely on the poem by Rudyard Kipling, this takes place in British India during the Thuggee uprising. Three fun loving sergeants are doing fine until one of them wants to get married and leave the service. The other two trick him into a final mission where they end up confronting the entire cult by themselves as the British Army is entering a trap. This is of the "War is fun" school of movie making. It has the flavour of watching Notre Dame play an inferior high school team.
translation:
My favorite movie "Imperialism" and one of the best action-adventure films of all time. Grant, McLaglen and Fairbanks dominate the screen with daredevil and wise crackers to satisfy everyone but the "PC" of the filmgoers. Memorable scenes abound - the 3 sergeants and their 20 sepoys fight hundreds of thugs; MacChesney & Cutter give Bobby Coote the edge ("save some for the elephant"); Cutter to MacChesney - "I'm an Expedition"; Din shatters Cutter out of jail, with a fork ("What do you think I'm trying to break out of? A bleeding pudding ?!) And the incredible temple scene with Cutter sings and then announces, fat as tin -" Alright, you're all arrested! "

I could go on, but suffice to say that I try to film this movie whenever it's running, and for armchair adventurers and generals it's hard to imagine a better 2 hours.

summary: The master sleuth must deal with the menace of Charles Augustus Milverton, an art dealer who has a profitable sideline as a blackmailer with much of London's high society in his grip. Unfortunately, he is no amateur at his line of work and Holmes must use all his cunning and skill in some risky operations to foil this criminal.
translation:
The master extortionist, based on Sir Arthur Conan Doyle's short story "The Adventures of Charles Augustus Milverton," is the first full-length Sherlock Holmes story I ever saw with Jeremy Brett. The story is interesting and dark. The film has a slightly sad, sad feeling, but it's pretty entertaining (with some especially funny scenes).

* spoilers * Sherlock Holmes and dr. Watson seeks to expose the identity of an illusive extortionist who has ruined some of England's most prominent families by publishing private letters that in one way or another will destroy their lives. They finally find out that he is Charles Augustus Milverton, an "art dealer," after the few tragic consequences for victims who could not pay. Our heroes will next need to help Lady Eva Blackwell, who has to pay a sum beyond her money, or her upcoming marriage will definitely be canceled. The scene in which Holmes and Watson break Milverton's house is intense. Although the movie essentially has a happy ending, the tone is sad and regretful.

Outstanding performances by Jeremy Brett and Edward Hardwicke (as always) and Robert Hardy as a notorious villain (most viewers probably recognize him today as Cornelius Fudge in Harry Potter), Serena Gordon as Lady Eva Blackwell, Norma West as Lady Swinstead and Sophie Thomson as Agatha (the scenes between her and Holmes are a riot). I give it a *** 1/2 out *****. My only complaint is that there was not enough Inspector Lestrade. (I wish they'd added in the scene at the end of the short story where he gives the description of the two burglars, one of which agrees with Watson.)

summary: Spy vs. spy. Three Yale grads, class of 1954, join their respective countries' secret service. We follow them for 40 years - through the outing of a British spy, the Hungarian revolution, the Bay of Pigs, the scent of moles, and the collapse of the USSR. Fictional characters - Yalies Jack McCauliffe, Leo Kritzky, and Yevgeny Tsipin and Jack's boss Harvey Torriti - rub shoulders with real figures like Kim Philby and James Angleton to tell stories of romance, intrigue, double-crosses, false leads, suicide, execution, and exile - in the name of ideology, patriotism, paranoia, perfidy, and one-upsmanship. Can the CIA claim any credit in the West's Cold War triumph?
translation: I regret that I bought this series. I expected more action, more objectivity and more consistency. This is just a pure propaganda series, very dark, without charm, or romance, it's just boredom. I think the actors are also pretty weak. O'Donnell may seem charming as Robin (with Batman), but in this image he lacks any charm. He probably loses his childhood charm when he gets older, but does not win the charm of an adult. Not surprisingly, it has not been shown in many countries and is sold in the UK for 40% of the recommended price and has not even been published in the Netherlands.

summary: Now declared legally sane, Norman Bates is released from a mental institution after spending 22 years in confinement over the protests of Marion Crane's sister Lila Loomis, who insists that he's still a killer and that the court's indifference to his victims by releasing him is a gross miscarriage of justice. Norman returns to his motel and the old Victorian mansion where his troubles started, and history predictably begins to repeat itself.
translation:
Horror plunder of a classic.
