It was not convincingly written why Mary should develop such a liking for Bates. He can be more stable until they start playing pranks with him, but he still does not help himself with his actions. (A comparative stranger is invited to stay alone with him in his recently vacated motel, telling the attractive young girl about his mental health problems in the past, laying around the knives, etc.) That should have kept Mary in addition to her previous knowledge very careful of him, but that does not happen, just so they can later play the 'insane identity murder game'. Which in itself is ridiculous: "So-and-so is the true murderer - and she too - he too! There were too many fictional twists to hit a story on screen when the narrative did not need to be extended It was nice to see Perkins back in his famous role, but that's the only little treat to be ripped off, it's definitely not a patch on Hitchcock, and if you do not intend to approach, then you should not bother at all ,

summary: Nasik-based Heerendra Dhaan and Raj Ranade are bodyguards of a politician, but after their employer is implicated in a scam, they end up assaulting a police officer and flee to Mumbai. Once there they meet with Rambhabhai, who in turn, gets them employed with a gangster named Shambhu. After a short while the duo are apprehended by Police Inspector Narsimha, questioned, and after they agree to cooperate to bring down Shambhu, are let go. The two do succeed in assisting the police arrest Shambhu, but they themselves are arrested, tried in Court, and sentenced to a year in jail. After their discharge they are met with Inspector Narsimha, who wants to recruit them to capture and kill dreaded bandit Babban Singh, who had slaughtered his wife, Kavita, and son, Subbu, as well as cut his arms off. Heerendra and Raj agree to carry out this task for 8 Lakh Rupees. They re-locate to Kaliganj where Heerendra falls in love with auto-rickshaw driver, Ghungroo, while Raj gives his heart to Subbu's ...
translation: This movie should not be watched because it should be a flop. Ram Gopal Verma wanted to do a remake of the classic Bollywood movie "Sholay" first, but after having problems with the original creators, he decided to continue with the project and ... I think, let all the good parts of the film (acting, Screenplay, songs, music, comedy, action, etc.) and film the film, just because he already hired the crew. Waste of money, a waste of time. After making films like Rangeela, Satya and Company, he drew a Coppola (godfather) on us; What did you think RGV? Anyway, the story, though hard to follow, is almost like old Sholay. Ajay Devgan plays Heero (Beeru, Sholay) and Ajay, a new kid who plays Ajay (Jay, Sholay). Both "bad but funny" friends help a policeman to catch a bad boy first. Later in the film retired policeman hires them as personal safety and protection from the hands of a very popular Bubban played by Amitabh Bachan. If you have not seen Bollywood movies, the good guys win in the end. There I have just saved you 3 precious hours of your life!

summary: A sheriff investigating the disappearance of a young girl from a small island discovers there's a larger mystery to solve among the island's secretive, neo-pagan community.
translation:
Unfortunately, this film does not honor the original. Nicholas Cage, pretty wooden as far as the actors go, gives the screen a range of abilities, from unbridled to exaggerated. The side occupation is not better.

The story remains very similar to the original, but much worse. There are not enough details to allow the audience to see what is being sold. It turns out, it's just an invoice of bad goods. Unbelief can not be lifted, nor can be given in doubt. The only frugal aspect of this film is that it is very visual, as the medium requires, and whoever explored the place should be praised.

There was a lot of laughter in the audience and several boos in the truest sense of the word meant the end.

Disappointed! Wait for the original to appear on TV, pour a whiskey and enjoy.

summary: In 1700, the pirates of Madagascar menace the India trade; British officer Brian Hawke has himself cashiered, flogged, and set adrift to infiltrate the pirate "republic." There, Hawke meets lovely Spitfire Stevens, a pirate captain in her own right, and the sparks begin to fly; but wooing a pirate poses unique problems. Especially after he rescues adoring young Princess Patma from a captured ship. Meanwhile, Hawke's secret mission proceeds to an action-packed climax.
translation: Against All Flags is the classic Swashbuckler. It has all the elements Adventurefan can hope for and more, because in this case, the Virgin in Need is not really in need. As Spitfire Stevens, Maureen O'Hara is the best athletic and performs her opponents despite the social norms of that time. Anthony Quinn rounds out the three best actors as the reckless Captain Roc Brasiliano and proves to Brian Hawke (Flynn) as a cunning and capable nemesis. For the classic adventure fan "Against All Flags" is a must. Although it is not in the same league as some of Errol Flynn's previous work (Captain Blood and The Sea Hawk, for example), it is still a very entertaining activity.

summary: Royal Navy captain Wentworth was haughtily turned down eight years ago as suitor of pompous baronet Sir Walter Elliot's daughter Anne, despite true love. Now he visits their former seaside country estate, rented by his brother-in-law, admiral Croft, so the financially stressed baronet can afford a fashionable, cheaper residence in trendy Bath. First the former lovers meet again on the estate, where they feel vibes again, but neither dares admit them until it seems too late. Yet the truth becomes clear, both have moved, but meet again in Bath.
translation: Somewhere, on this page, someone wrote that you should just read them to get the best version of the works of Jane Austen. I agree with that. But we love the adaptations of great literature, and the writers' recent strike reminds us that without good writers, it's hard for actors to bring their roles to life. The current version of Jane Austen's PERSUASION shows us what happens if you do not have a good foundation in a well-written adaptation. This version is not comparable to the 1995 version with Amanda Root and Ciaran Hinds, which was well played and retained the essence of the era and the limitations of the characters (with the exception of the bizarre parade and kissing in the street scene in Bath). , The 2007 version features a Twitty Anne who seems to be scared. The other characters were not very developed, which is a crime, considering how Austen could paint such wonderful characters with carefully chosen understatements. The sequence of events that made sense in the novel has been jumbled and Mrs. Smith, Anne's bedridden and impoverished schoolmate, walks around in Bath - chirping, as many of the characters seemed to do. The strength of the character and the intelligence of Captain Wentworth, which made Anne love him at all, did not seem to be written in the Wentworth by Rupert Penry-Jones. Ciaran Hinds had more substance and at one glance could convey so much more than P-J could do with his poses. All in all, the 2007 version was a disappointment. It seemed to make the novel questionable in a tangible, costumed melodrama. If they wanted to bring our modern emotional extravaganza into Austen's work, they should have done what they do with adaptations of Shakespeare: adapt them to the present. At least "Bride & Prejudice" was taken out of the historical and locational settings and was fun to watch, as was "Clueless". This was not a PERSUASION, but they did not know what else to call it.

summary: Talented small-town girl Lily Mars hounds producer John Thornway for a part in his new play, but he doesn't want anything to do with stage-struck amateurs. But when Lily follows him to New York, he gets to know her better and his opinion of her changes for the better. Then, when the leading lady of the play walks out, Lily gets her big break on Broadway.
translation:
Lily Mars is part of a film genre that seems to have disappeared with the studio system. Ok, since you know my bias, here are some reasons why I think this movie stands out.

1. Although the basic plot - Lily Mars (Judy Garland) goes to New York, becomes a star, and wins the heart of her director (Van Heflin) is a pretty stick Hollywood story of the time, the authors the topic vary a little more than usual. Although Lily has her big break when the star gives up, she is not successful and has to swallow her pride and play a small part in the show again.

2. Judy Garland (enough said!)

3. The supporting actors have some really great performances. Spring Byington as Lily's mother is really wonderful, as is Fay Bainter (the mother of the director - John Thornway (Van Heflin)). However, the outstanding support performance goes to character actress Connie Gilchrist as Frankie, a one-time actress turned theater depot.

Worth a watch for sure. One of those films designed to make you feel better about the world and your dreams.

summary: Louie Jeffries is happily married to Corinne. On their first anniversary, Louie is killed crossing the road. Louie is reincarnated as Alex Finch, and twenty years later, fate brings Alex and Louie's daughter, Miranda, together. It's not until Alex is invited to Louie's home that he begins to remember his former life, wife and best friend. Of course, there's also the problem that he's attracted to Louie's/his own daughter.
translation: I've always been a big fan of this movie, above all, you've seen the cast, the acting is outstanding and helps to bring this film forward very well. Cybill Shepherd received great reviews for her role and they were well deserved. The beginning of this film begins in the past, when Corinne Jeffries (Cybill), whose images of perfect marriage come to a shattering halt when her husband Louie dies unexpectedly. Fortunately, Louse gets a second shot to life when he agrees to be "recycled" to newborn Alex Finch (Robert Downey, JR). Alex continues to live his new life and forget his past life while Corinne tries to get along with her. But fate crosses Alex's path 23 years later, when he meets Corinne's daughter Miranda (Mary Stuart Masterson) and is suddenly inundated with a plethora of unwanted memories (this is where the fun begins and awkward situations arise). The music is great and the scenes are felt hearts and very sweet. You will not be disappointed if you give it a chance, chances are you will like it. Very funny and cute!

summary: Dublin, 1920. Gypo Nolan, strong but none too bright, has been ousted from the rebel organization and is starving. When he finds that his equally destitute sweetheart Katie has been reduced to prostitution, he succumbs to temptation and betrays his former comrade Frankie to the British authorities for a 20 pound reward. In the course of one gloomy, foggy night, guilt and retribution inexorably close in...
translation:
Great and unforgettable, breathtakingly atmospheric and brilliantly played by all.

I really can not understand what kind of people ponder this masterpiece and the preponderance of voices as 8 (and nine ones!)>
This is the biggest movie along with "Grapes of Wrath" from John Ford. I'd say it's Long Voyage Home's turn, though it's pretty far back.

Rating: 10. It deserves a 12.

summary: Set in the 1930s, an honest, goodhearted man is forced to turn to a life of crime to finance his neurotic mother's skyrocketing medical bills.
translation: What happened to Michael Keaton? What a great actor and he proves it in this movie. This movie is actually FUN! And the reason this movie is funny is for two reasons: an excellent script and Michael Keaton. This movie is one of the funniest comedies in Hollywood history. This movie is the ultimate parody of gangster movies. In this movie, Hollywood makes fun of itself by using the genre of gangster film as the basis for a truly original comedy. The rest of the cast is also funny, especially the supporting cast. If you like to laugh and watch a movie with nonstop humor, then this movie is for you.

summary: When not solving murders in Tinseltown, Detective Joe Gavilan and his rookie partner Kasey Calden both moonlight in other fields: Gavilan sells real estate (poorly), and Calden aspires to become an actor (Brando, namely). Assigned to the vicious in-club slaying of a promising young rap act, the two detective delve into the recording industry where they hope to find answers - ideally ones that also come with property buyers or auditions.
translation:
This movie even manages to be meaningless for 2/3 of the journey. Unfortunately, the movie is too confused. While I know that some of the plot applications are standard on "Buddy Cop" movies, I was attracted by the characters who excite each other, but in the end the movie relies too much on chase sequences and I lost interest
The filmmakers have done a great job of calming down the characters and doing their own thing. We recognized who they are early and identified with both cops. We have formed our own opinion instead of being forced by constant bickering.

In the end, there is too much going on, and it has a very negative effect on what could have been a pleasant escapism. This is about Joe Gavilan (Harrison Ford) at the end of the film:

1. His real estate deals 2. His affair with a radio psychic 3. He is being investigated by internal affairs 4. The murder investigation < br />
If you add in Casey's concerns that you like to exclude, he wants to be an actor and revenge the death of his father. Now some of these things come together and even come together well, but all the plot elements come together in the midst of this fake hunt, which is so long and pathetic that I barely have time to break my boredom and make a shit about what's going on. The impressive script acrobatics can not overcome the bad filmmaking.

As if a ridiculous chase sequence was not bad enough, one that had four separate sections and could take nearly half an hour was not bad enough, Joe Gavilan Fields is calling over his real estate business while he's the culprit hunts with a pistol. All these unscheduled storylines and jokes make it completely meaningless to me whether the criminal gets caught or not. We have already forgotten the murder story at this point or not, because several storylines and feasts of the chases have stunned us beyond comprehension.

While I could go over the chases and how you could ruin a decent story, I will not do it. This could have been a very pleasant formula film, but it was far too big for his breaks and it became a waste of time. Harrison Ford and Josh Hartnett did pretty well and a small Gladys Knight appearance is worth mentioning. Unfortunately, none of the actors can help forget this hopelessly misguided film.

This will probably be better than those like "The Hulk" and "Lara Croft II", which still does not make film good. I once heard that Harrison Ford claimed to only make films that he thought would make money, I'm not sure if that's true or not. What is true is that in order to get great box office you do not need a great movie or a great actor, this movie also has no lead roles. My advice to Harrison Ford would be to stick to Indiana Jones because at least you can still run.

summary: The great case of Jarndyce and Jarndyce drags on, an obsession to all involved. Then a question of inheritance becomes a question of murder.
translation: "Bleak House" is undoubtedly the best adaptation of a Charles Dickens novel that ever came to the screen. Still one of my favorite novels, I was extremely pleased with this TV Mini series. The late, magnificent Denholm Elliot was perfectly staffed, as the noble John Jardyce and Diana Rigg were pure perfection like the lost Laddy Dedlock. The film captures the essence of the Dickens era and is extremely faithful to the book, making only small action cuts that do not affect the story. above all a brilliant, moving and atmospheric film.

summary: A pair of corrupt cops spend their illegal cash on an uptown New York City apartment. John Lydon stars as Leo Smith, a disturbed teenager who plays a bizarre game of cat-and-mouse with cop O'Connor ('Harvey Keitel'). He convinces him that he's the notorious cop killer that has been hunting police officers. O'Connor kidnaps him and makes him his permanent guest inside his apartment. Is Smith the corrupt cop killer? Can Harvey get to the bottom of this twisted case before it's too late, or will he get caught up in some twisted game?
translation:
Encouraged by the positive comments on this film, I was looking forward to this movie. Bad mistake. I've seen over 950 movies and that's really one of the worst of them - it's terrible in almost every way: cut, tempo, plot, drama, soundtrack (the film's only song - a lame country track - is not played) less than four times). The movie looks cheap and evil and is extremely boring. Rarely have I been so happy to see the credits of a movie.

The only thing stopping me from giving him a 1-score is Harvey Keitel - while this is far from his best performance, at least he seems to be trying a little hard. Only for Keitel-obsessives.

summary: Stripped of his medical license after performing an operation while high on amphetamines, famed LA surgeon Dr Eugene Sands abandons his former life only to find himself crossing paths with Raymond Blossom, an infamous counterfeiter. Employed as a "gun-shot doctor" when Raymond's associates cannot risk visiting a hospital, Eugene is lured deep into the criminal world and becomes entangled with his boss's girlfriend.
translation:
It's hard to believe that David Duchovny was at the forefront of his fame in 1997, with X-Files, one of the finest sci-fi series of all time, at the forefront of fame. Nine years later he is almost forgotten, and his attempts to make it on the big screen failed miserably. I can not even explain why, he's a fair actor, but probably his moment of fame has put him into an eternal role that needs great talent to break it.

At the same time, Angelina Jolie was much less well known and she was really lucky that a movie like "Playing God" did not lead her career to a dead end. Luckily for her, "The Bone Collector" and "Girl, Interrupted" were waiting around the corner, and when Lara Croft arrived, her career started.

There is not much to tell film. It's Andy Wilson's only big movie, and there has to be a reason. Everything is banal, and most of what happens on-screen is expected in the story of an ex-doctor rescuing the life of a shooting victim in a bar, only to then see work for the mob. The off-screen voice is particularly bad, with a moralistic text that kills every shadow of the movie's cinematographic experience. You probably will not see the movie, but in DVD rental stores or on TV. Try to look for something better.

summary: Over the spring of 2000, sixteen average Americans (divided into two tribes which eventually merge into one) were sequestered on the deserted island of Pulau Tiga for 39 days. For their stay, they must learn to live as a tribe, although eventually, it is everyone for themselves. They compete in challenges for "luxuries" (a barbecue, a phone call home, etc.) and immunity. Every three days, the losers of the latter challenges must face tribal council, where they will account for their actions by voting one person off of the island. At the end of day 39, there will be only one survivor left who will leave the island with one million dollars. Based on the Swedish game show, "Operation Robinson."
translation:
This show offers interesting places like the travel channel. It is charged as a reality, but in reality it is pure Prime Time Soap Opera. An attempt is made to use exotic locations as a fa√ßade to get people into a fake contest and then the audience goes on to hook the participants into soap opera style.

It also lends itself to an early game show CBS The Pioneer to Beat Clock-by invent situations for his candidates to try and overcome. Then it rewards the winner money. If they can spice it up with a little interaction between characters, even better. While the game format is in slow motion compared to Beat The Clock, the real accomplishment of this series is to escape reality.

This show contains elements of various types of successful past programs. Reality television, hardly, but if you are addicted to the contestants, locals or competition, this is your cup of tea. If you dont, this whole series is dripping as I say, dripping with sauce. It's another show that hides behind the reality label. That's the trend that started in 2000.

It's smooth and well produced, so it might take a while. After all, even repeats of Gilligan's Island, Green Acres, Beverly Hillbillies and The Brady Bunch. This only deals with professional actors. The intelligence is about the same.

summary: Set in modern times, vampires roam the earth and are humans mortal enemies. However, a substitute has been found for human blood, a substitute that vampires can consume with the same effect as human blood. This is True Blood. Now humans and vampires can coexist in harmony, and even form relationships. But there will always be rogue elements on both sides ready to exploit the uneasy truce.
translation:
Man, I find it really hard to believe that the wonderful Alan Ball had something to do with this mess. Having seen the first two episodes so far, I can safely say that this show is not on my list. It just has so many things working against it.

No actor is particularly good. Anna Paquin as the main character Sookie, is just terrible. I remember she was better at many other things I saw her in, maybe it's just writing. It's also no fun to look at her, there are moments when she honestly looks ugly. The actor playing Bill is marginally better, if only because his character is supposed to be somehow wooden and aloof. The other actors do their best, but with the clich√©s of hard-to-apply accents, it's a tough job. Tara is an absolute misery, Rutina Wesley absolutely kills the accent. It's bad like nails on a blackboard. Almost as horrible is Nelsan Ellis, it's hard to understand what he sometimes says. Both his character and Taras seem a bit racist to me. I do not know to have a character who says why I'm on a HBO show that is not The Wire just seems a bit strange. The cast is Sookie's grandmother, her sex-addicted brother, and the only ingenious cast I've ever seen as Sheriff in William Sanderson.

The story seems to meander in this direction at this point, no real worry about keeping the viewer interested. The love stuff is very Dark Shadow-sy. Although the camp factor of something like these old Dark Shadows episodes increases by ten. Sometimes it felt so great that I just had to assume that it should be so. But unlike a show like Buffy, which has finished the camp masterfully, that's not the case. Not with the Campiness is the extreme gore and graphic sex of the show. I am not averse to these two, if they are well done, as they have done in many other HBO shows, but here they have at least prolonged the hard sex scenes with Jason Stackhouse, which seem a bit over the top and pointless.

summary: Charlie B. Barkin (Burt Reynolds), a rascally German Shepherd with a shady past, breaks out of the New Orleans Dog Pound with the help of his faithful friend Itchy (Dom De Luise), a nervously hyperactive dachshund. He then makes tracks to reunite with his gambling casino partner Carface Malone (Vic Tayback), a shifty pitbull who has planned a dastardly, and potentially deadly, double cross. Suddenly, Charlie finds himself at the Pearly Gates, face to face with the Heavenly Whippet (Melba Moore). Charlie weasels his way back to earth and reunites with Itchy. He plots his revenge against Carface and, along the way, acquires help from a little girl named Anne-Marie (who can talk to animals). After a series of fiendish schemes, close scrapes and unexpected adventures, both Charlie and Anne Marie find their lives at stake. Only one can be saved and the outcome is in Charlie's paws...
translation:
I wish children's films were still made that way; dark and deep. There was character development (and Charlie is the epitome of dynamic character), plot development, great animation, emotional involvement and a rational, relatable and consistent theme. If not for the handful of song-and-dance routines, you would never have thought that this was a children's movie, and that's why I give it such a high rating. This movie is an excellent movie, let alone a children's movie. Which brings me to my second point: this must be the darkest "kids" movie I've seen in a long while, a 22-year-old. I would be shocked if a child under the age of eight in the second half and in the first half of the movie were not completely scared and it ends with one of the saddest ends ever encountered (aka "Jurassic Bark") you guys who are 'Futurama' fans) and that makes this movie so good. Just because the film generally arouses emotions that we do not usually like to feel and accept are bad, does not make the movie itself bad; in fact it means that it has succeeded. Good funny movies should make us laugh; good horror movies should scare us; good sad movies should make us sad. My point is, good movies should move you, not just entertain you; this movie has moved me.

Also, this film is incredibly violent by today's standards for a children's film and contains topics that are not suitable for some children by today's standards. Parents, I would say look at it first. I'm not usually there to say anything, but I saw it yesterday and it even came as a surprise to me.

summary: Major Ranvir Kaul (Amitabh Bachchan) is a POW who was captured along with over 30 soldiers by Pakistani soldiers in 1971 during the war between India and Pakistan. 33 years later Ranvir's son Gaurav (Akshaye Khanna) decides to go on a rescue mission to Pakistan and bring back his father who he has not seen since he was a child. Helping him on his mission is Khan (Sanjay Dutt) who had successfully escaped from the same prison.
translation:
Where should I start?

# 1 Amitabh's son, played by Akshaye Khanna, is 30.

Amitabh has been in jail for over 33 years ... he

A ) Telepathically transmit the semen home?

B) asked a nice Pakistani guard to send it for him?

C) They allow marital visits in secret Pakistani prisons

D) All the above

E) The producers had a little too much bhang in

Time when they approved the screenplay?
<# 2) Amrita Rao (Yummm!) wants Khanna - he's yum, yum, yummy ... and apparently he wants her - who would not, right ?! ... but when her father is exterminated and then killed (I hardly believe that this is a "spoiler" because you have to be brain dead and blind to not see that in the movie). He is quite emotionless about this catastrophe and with the tip (metaphorical) of his hat, leaves her behind to save his father, no matter what they have lost, and says (paraphrasing): "If God wants it, we will meet again "... Basically this means:" I will get my dad d done MY job, sorry for your loss - CYA! Buh bye! "- Callus, even beyond the Hollywood standards ...

# 3) There are so many holes in this terrible waste of time called movie, that you can drive all the jeeps, truck camels and everything else. Pass - really, complete and total waste of time - Oh! There is a great dance sequence (yes, just one - as in Dance Series - regardless of the quality) Great Belly Dance - but NOT worth watching for.

Are you renting Veer-Zaara or Lakshya (is Hrithik Roshan ever going to take acting classes?) for better Indo-Pak conflict movies ... Actually Veer-Zaara is damn good - 7.5 / 8 I would say!

summary: In this live-action TV series, the Turtles are older than in the movies or cartoon, and are joined by a fifth, female Turtle. "Venus De Milo" mutated with the other 4 Turtles but was washed away with the current in the sewer into New York's Chinatown before Splinter came across the turtles. After learning the Shinobi arts in China for 17 years, Venus has returned to New York. The Turtles are now faced with new villains such as Dragon Lord, Bonesteel and Vam Mi.
translation:
Sometime in 1998, Saban had acquired the rights to produce a brand new Ninja Turtles action series. Of course, since I was a fan of the TMNT at the time, it obviously caught my interest. When I started watching the show ... to say that I was disappointed with the end result is an understatement. Some time later (more like recently), I had a chance to revisit the series.

First, let's talk about some of the positive things. They managed to render the Turtles' Cave, as it was last seen in the movies, relatively well, given the limited budget they provided. There is a tendency for this gloomy atmosphere regarding the sets and so on. And the turtle suits, though not the biggest piece of puppetry and whatever, were functional and seemed pretty sturdy for most of the action stuff that would follow in the series.

People tend to complain about getting rid of Shredder quickly and replacing him with those original villains that could easily be used in a Power Rangers show. But you can only beat Shredder until it gets boring and undermines its value as a villain ... and besides, most fans do not know, or do not remember or just ignore the fact that they're in the original comic Shredder was in the very first issue! Forget the countless resurrections that would follow. From a personal point of view, I was somehow glad that they got rid of Shredder, because then the anticipation grew to the point where they would eventually bring him back in a later episode. I think Shredder works best in small quantities, because then his encounters with the Turtles are all the more memorable.

Unfortunately, they replace him with those original villains who, as I said, seemed more suited to a Power Rangers show than a Ninja Turtles show. And with these new magically swinging generics comes a new female, magically swinging turtle, the infamous Venus De Milo. I will be honest; I never made friends with her. I am not against the idea of ‚Äã‚Äãa female turtle; I'm only against the idea of ‚Äã‚Äãsomeone who uses magic, and thus stands out as a wild sight in a clan of ninja turtles who seem to be a little out of their domain. I almost have the impression that this could have been the Venus De Milo show dealing with their supposed enemies, and the TMNT are just there to deliver the star power (or whatever, given the time frame left over) remained). Fortunately, they all share the limelight.

Next Mutation was aired after a season, and the creators were more than happy to ignore it. Given the time and maybe another season, I really believe that this live iteration of the TMNT could have been something and maybe got a shot at size. But while the idea was solid, the execution was flawed (though there are some good episodes in this series). As it stands, Next Mutation is one of those curiosities in Turtledom that is best buried and forgotten.

summary: Donald Woods is chief editor of the liberal newspaper Daily Dispatch in South Africa. He has written several editorials critical of the views of Steve Biko. But after having met him for the first time, he changes his opinion. They meet several times, and this means that Woods and his family get attention from the security police. When Steve Biko dies in police custody, he writes a book about Biko. The only way to get it published is for Woods himself to illegally escape the country.
translation: I show this film students in language and media law because their lessons are timeless: why to speak out against injustice is important and can bring about the changes sought by the oppressed. Why press freedom and freedom of expression are important for democracy. This is a must to see how apartheid was made aware of the world through the activism of Steven Biko and the journalism of Donald Woods. There is also an important lesson of freedom of speech: "You can blow out a candle, but you can not blow out a fire, and as soon as the flame starts to catch, the wind will blow it higher." (From Biko by Peter Gabriel, shake the tree).

summary: Mike O'Donoghue's parody of "Mondo Cane" showcases curious performers, strange musicians, celebrity mutations and unusual short films, including Thomas Alva Edison's "Elephant Electrocution".
translation: I actually saw this movie in a theater. As soon as I handed my money over to the cashier, she said two words I had never heard in a theater: "No refund!" Once I heard those words, I would have just waved my money away and gone home. But no, unfortunately I went in and watched the movie. This movie has made no one laugh in the theater. Not once. Not even unintentionally! Most of the time we sat in stunned silence. Every ten minutes someone screamed "This movie SUCKS!" The audience would enthusiastically applaud and then sit in stunned, bored silence for another ten minutes.

summary: In the late 1930s, world politics begin to head in a dangerous direction. In Europe, Germany expands and rearms and proceeds to annex several border countries into the Reich. Meanwhile, Italy attempts to establish a Facist Colonial Empire under Mussolini while the Empire of Japan stands ready for a major war with China. Enter the Henry family, headed by career naval officer Victor "Pug" Henry. "Winds of War" thus follows the exploits of Pug and his children, all of which are set against the backdrop of world events leading up to the Japanese attack on Pearl Harbor in 1941.
translation:
.... this Mini does not get better with age. I saw this and it's sequel, when originally sent, and like so many others was blown away. At the beginning of 2002, I borrowed the novels for WOW and W and R and was even more impressed. I then decided that I had to see both again and invested $ 200 plus on the DVD sets. I watched both Minis again in painful detail and realized that I had done things backwards - I should have bought the novels and borrowed the DVDs.

Do not you think it's abysmally wrong? Read the novels and see for yourself. Do not think this is outdated? Screen it for someone who is not old enough to see it originally aired and see the reaction you get (warning - reactions from such people range from horrified looks to tummy tears).

According to the trivial department for This Mini - Dan Curtis himself chose Ali MacGraw and Robert Mitchum. Huh !! Production quality, music scoring, dialogues - a great story was turned into a soap opera of the late '70s by an overambitious producer / director who went berserk. This thing was dated the minute it was completed.

These two minis were great, as an original show and to those of us who saw them, pulling on a nostalgic string that reminds us of a younger day. IMO - this mini does not nearly match its reputation and is very disappointing.

summary: The Creeds have just moved to a new house in the countryside. Their house is perfect, except for two things: the semi-trailers that roar past on the narrow road, and the mysterious cemetery in the woods behind the house. The Creed's neighbours are reluctant to talk about the cemetery, and for good reason too.
translation: Ah, clich√©s, clich√©s, clich√©s; They are a major part of a variety of horror films. This one has a lot of them. Yet it is Stephen King, one of the best masters of horror. This movie was really good, just too predictable. And what horror movie has no stupid people? This one is overflowing with backward victims who are begging for their lives to be taken. Pet Semetary I thought it was a bit scary. The way everything was set up was really scary, but not terrifying. Acting was mostly SO believable, the tension was not so exciting, but the entertainment level is high; My eyes were practically glued to the screen. All Stephen King fans must watch this movie, but like everyone else, expect an OK thriller.

summary: A multi-volumed documentary mini-series, "The World at War" covers the entire history of World War II from the causes of the 1920s to the aftermath of the Cold War in the 1950s. Emphasis is also placed on several inside story episodes, where events are covered which occurred inside Germany and Japan such as resistance to Hitler, life in general under a dictatorial regime, and particular emphasis is focused on the Jewish Holocaust.
translation:
The music and dark interpretation of Laurence Olivier perfectly set the tone for this outstanding documentary. This is still a must for WW II buffs, descendants of the participants in this conflict, politicians who think things always go their way when they expand their foreign policy on the deck of an aircraft carrier (do you hear that George Bush?) And everyone others who are curious or need to know why a particular aspect of this conflict occurs. The 26 episodes are roughly in chronological order, but can be seen out of sequence, as they are more or less independent. For the new viewer, there will be a new realization due to the sheer volume. Actual images of the battles are interspersed with interviews of the participants of the stories. Many of the interviews are with second-line authorities, that is, staff to assist the main characters, soldiers, captains, secretaries, eyewitnesses and the like. You get a real taste of what war is all about.

I'm watching the DVD version of the original TV documentary. I strongly recommend it over the worn, gaptoathed, overpriced VHS listings on eBay. I paid 120 cdn for five 2-sided DVD discs. This new version includes bonus material and is in full screen mode. The menus are easy to follow, there is first a selection of which episode you want to watch and then, once you have chosen, you are given the opportunity to play different chapters in the episode or to play the whole episode. It is understandable with such a comprehensive presentation that there is a tiny amount more navigation in the menu, but the impact of what you will see is not diminished after 30 years, no, after 60 years since the end of the war.

I remember watching the first show on the Buffalo PBS Station just before I left London in 1975, and from that point on I wished I could have a copy. Now my wish has finally come true.

See this documentary. Tell your friends. Buy a copy for your library. Remind and honor the sacrifices and challenges that have been overcome by those from America, Russia, Britain, Canada, and all the other nations and peoples who were involved in the ultimate victory. What an eye-opener.

summary: This puber-comedy is a kind of mixture between "Animal House" and "Police Academy". Four boys are sent, for different reasons, to the Sheldon R. Wienberg Military Academy. The life of discipline asks a lot of the four geeks. Of course these boys know how to make a party out of the hard times. Will they be "real men" after one year?
translation: This movie is so cheap, it is adorable !!! With Ron Liebmann (Major Vaughn) he delivers the most entertaining movie tricks in film history. I own 2 copies of this movie on video ... on one, Ralph Macchio is actually caught in the background while cracking Major Vaugn while scolding on "hash". Obviously, they forgot to remove that flaw from the movie, but it shows how funny the movie is when the actors themselves can not have a serious face !!!

summary: An ex-boxer is drifting around after escaping from the mental hospital. He meets a widow who convinces him to help fix up the neglected estate her ex-husband left. Her Uncle talks them both into helping kidnap a rich boy for ransom money, and the ex-fighter must make decisions about his loyalties and what is right.
translation:
After Dark, My Sweet is a great, modern noir filled with dodgy characters, country lanes and naturally sweaty characters. It seems that most of the really big noirs of the last two or three decades have taken place in the south, where the men are glittering and the ladies, uh, are also glittering. Why? Because it is hooooottttttttttt. And everyone looks better wet (at least the men do - sweaty women leave me clammy). Anyway - there could be some spoilers.

This movie is a wonderful example of everything a Noir should be - steady pace (though some with attention disorders call it "slow"), clear and broad (though not simple) characters, and tons of atmosphere. No, if anything, it's about moods and attitudes. That's why the big guys are not marked by their traditional definitions of "great" acting (look at Bogart, Mitchum, Hurt and Nicholson - they (and their characters) were anything but real - but they had style and hatred and in a crime Movie, that's exactly what you want). or quick adventures (again, all the big noirs seem to burn slowly like a cigarette). Big noirs create an environment and you only live with the characters for a few hours.

After Dark My Sweet let it go - and be entertained by some very interesting and complex characters. Uncle Bud and Collie are intriguing - they never allow the audience to know what's really driving them - and Patric and Dern (I love Bruce Dern, by the way) are pitch perfect, especially Dern (see previous comment). They take the characteristics of a character and give them depth and our sympathies.

The story itself is also interesting. There are better plots in the world of Noir (hardly a secret here - mostly it's tension), but this one is solid. If anything, the simple "good" plot has more to do with Jim Thompson's writing than anything else. At Thompson, land is almost secondary; he has avoided the labyrinthine tales of Hammett and Chandler for simpler stories with stronger, confusing characters. Watch a novel like The Killer Inside Me and you'll see straight away (what it's about). When it comes to Thompson, that's not what it's about, it's what it's about (to quote Roger Ebert). So, really, the relatively simple act of kidnapping is not the point and, if you do not like it, well the jokes about you.

Why is this an 8-star movie instead of a 10-star movie because of the female lead role. It's not bad, per se, but it's not Angelica Huston or Anette benning (see the adaptation of Jim Thompson's The Grifters, if you do not know what I'm talking about - besides, it's a better movie and you should start with contemporary Noir - It's the best of the 1990s and challenges Blood Simple to the title of the best since Chinatown - she just does not have the chops (or the looks for that matter) and though she and Patric have some chemistry, I do not have it with her. Well there.

summary: Alex, a sad-eyed mournful man, goes into psychotherapy: he discloses he's a hit man. He also tells the doctor, after a few sessions, that he's attracted to a young woman he's met in the waiting room. She's Sarah, 23, quick, edgy, and perhaps attracted to him as well. But he's married, the dutiful father of a young precocious boy, so Sarah brushes him off. In flashbacks we see him get his start as a killer, at his father's prompting: it's the family business. Dad gives Alex his next assignment: to kill the therapist. Alex keeps returning to Sarah, calling her, stopping by her apartment, as he decides what to do about the hit, his father, his marriage, and his malaise.
translation: Panic delivers the goods ten times with Oscar caliber appearances by William H Macy, Neve Campbell and Donald Sutherland. In a movie about the decisions we make and the consequences we live with. Chillingly Honest and thought provoking, Panic is easily one of Hollywood's best movies in years to come. The impact remains with you immediately after leaving the theater.

summary: Rayford Steele is an airline pilot whose relationship with his wife has gone sour;he ponders having an affair with an attractive flight attendant, Hattie Durham. In the midst of a flight to London, a number of their passengers mysteriously disappear, and chaos takes hold as a number of vehicles on the ground and in the air are suddenly unmanned. Meanwhile, Buck Williams, a television journalist, is pondering the rash of sudden disappearances as he works on a report about Dr. Chaim Rosenzweig, an Israeli scientist who has devised a formula that would make any soil on earth easy to cultivate. However, Buck wonders if there's more to Rosenzweig than he first imagined when he discovers the doctor is in cahoots with two multi-millionaires who plan to broker the invention to promote their own agenda of international domination.
translation:
Surprisingly, the film has a redemptive quality as it nears its end. For the other part, this film is a really bad and lame, with a small budget, offensive badly written script and everything that goes with it.

It's silly that with all the money in Christian circles never seem to get enough money to make a decent movie. I'm not a religious spirit, so I really do not care, but filmmaking is a good tool to reach a new audience for the churches and make people more interested and curious about reading the bible, for example. In this regard, these films always seem to be a missed opportunity.

The low budget really hurts the movie and brings it down. It makes the movie ridiculous to see with its effects, and it gives the entire movie a beefy B-movie-like feel.

But what hurts this movie more is its writing. The stuff that's just going on in this movie is just insulting to the intelligence and then I'm not complaining or talking about the religious aspects of the whole story. The way the movie progresses is unlikely and the people in this film are doing so highly unlikely things to offend their viewers.

I also hated how the movie was sometimes like a soap opera. It seemed to me that they just had a hard time making a full-length movie out of it, and they added characters and dramatic developments just to fill things up. That just did not really bother me.

Still, it has to be said that as the story gets more focused on the basics, the movie becomes firmer and more enduring. Still, it remains predictable, but it has prevented this movie from being a total wreck that you can see, and as far as those kinds of movies are concerned, there are far worse things to look at, though I do not think that one Film will win any new souls.

4/10

summary: While a little girl's life and limbs are in jeopardy, Tritter becomes more manipulative and House suffers withdrawal.
translation: I'm glad to read so many negative comments about the Tritter story. Everyone I talk to says the same thing. They like House's rugged nature and intelligence, but really do not like the vindictiveness of this ongoing action. It makes the true nature of the hospital's history visible and makes everyone mad at the police department. It must be a caring nature instead of vengefulness for everyone in the hospital. In addition, there seem to be many questionable legal aspects about what Tritter actually does. He alone can not freeze accounts and have the authority to prevent doctors writing prescriptions for patients. Much of the vindictiveness he shows hurts the very sick patients in the hospital and that's not a good story to portray. I did not think the episode was terrible because of the story itself, but if you put in the Trittor piece, I can handle it and hurt the rest of the plot. People say that they hate to see the plot. Please change it. Let Tritter out.

summary: In a futuristic society, some people are selected at birth to become soldiers, and trained in such a manner that they become inhuman killing machines. One of the most succesfull and older of these soldiers (Russell) is pitted against a new breed of soldiers, and after the confrontation is believed to be dead. His body is left behind in a semi-abandoned colonial planet, where everything is peaceful, and he is taught about the other aspects of life. But eventually he has to fight the new breed of soldiers again, this time to defend his new home...
translation: I loved this movie and I will watch it again. Original twist to man's plot against man against self. I think that's Kurt Russell's best movie. His eyes conveyed more than most actor words. Maybe there is hope for humanity despite intervention by the government?

summary: In Madrid, the housewife Gloria lives in a tiny apartment with her husband, the taxi driver and forger Antonio; her lunatic mother-in-law, who is addicted in bottled water and cupcakes; and two teenage sons, one of them a drug dealer and the other gay. Gloria works as cleaning lady to raise some money for her dysfunctional family and is addicted in pills; her best friend is her neighbor, the call-girl Cristal. Antonio has a secret passion on a decadent German singer for whom he had worked as driver in Germany. A writer tries to convince Antonio to forge letters from Hitler and travels to Germany to meet the singer to invite her to participate in the scheme. Meanwhile Gloria delivers her gay son to a pervert dentist. Her mother-in-law finds a lizard while walking with her grandson on the street and they call it Dinero (Money) and bring it home. When Gloria has an argument with Antonio, she hits him on the head with a piece of wood, killing him. Now the police detectives investigate the...
translation: I really wanted to like this movie much more than me. That's because I like crazy foreign comedies - especially the weird ones that totally surprise you. Although these were often surprised, these were almost never pleasant surprises. It reminded me of South Park, where almost every social norm was violated, until the only ones left were too sick to be weird. For example, after investigating adultery, drug abuse (of almost any kind - from pot, heroin, speed to glue sniffing), prostitution, S & M, suicide, murder, etc. the film came to the hilarious (?) Theme of pedophilia. Mom encouraged her one son (who looked about 12 years old) to sleep with neighboring men. In fact, at one point in the movie, she gives this boy to the dentist instead of paying for dental work! Funny?! You want to kid me. This movie just goes too far and plunges into the "black hole of comedy". What should they make fun of, about cancer or rectal tumors?

summary: This is the story of Mr. Fox and his wild-ways of hen heckling, turkey taking and cider sipping, nocturnal, instinctive adventures. He has to put his wild days behind him and do what fathers do best: be responsible. He is too rebellious. He is too wild. He is going to try "just one more raid" on the three nastiest, meanest farmers that are Boggis, Bunce and Bean. It is a tale of crossing the line of family responsibilities and midnight adventure and the friendships and awakenings of this country life that is inhabited by Fantastic Mr. Fox and his friends.
translation:
After watching the movie, I was really shocked to see such a high rating on IMDb.

"The Fantastic Mr. Fox" is an adaptation of a beloved childhood classic that portrays the story of smooth, sleek film protagonist Mr. Fox (or 'Foxy') as he attempts a 'last' robbery to steal from the dreaded Boggins, Bunce and Bean. That's right, a short, a fat, a slimmer or whatever it is.

I'm not sure where to start my review. Well, me 'I was in my late teens and never was a fan of Roald Dahl, but I like his material well enough after reading some of his books as a kid and Matilda and Charlie and the Chocolate Factory have seen again and again. However, this film is fighting for an audience. Is it aimed at children? Adult? I'm still uncertain! Many of the "jokes" would give birth to a child, especially since Mr. Fox, for example, visits a lawyer or complains about being poor. In addition, an audience of (I assume) children is expected to sympathize with a character who steals and kills chickens. I'm all for the food chain, but you can practically see Mr. Fox biting his neck! Surely that's a bit much? And also the plot ... well, it's kind of boring. I only stayed hoping it would get better, but instead I became more and more annoyed with Mr. Fox and his son Ash for making stupid decisions.

Meanwhile the humor is falling. I only laughed once or twice, although I have explicitly recognized attempts by jokes. I think part of it is that the voice is so incredibly flat and monotone. The speakers have no sense of weird timing, but aim at the subtlety of humor that only works with certain media. George Clooney aims to portray Mr. Fox as charming and elegant, but his voice has no character. Meryl Streep shows no emotion, I did not even realize that Bill Murray played a role until the end of the credits, and Ash, twelve years old in Fox Years, sounds like he's about 30.

I love Animation, especially stop-motion, but the visual style has circled me a bit. Characters are tall, spiked and without any warmth of design. They move with very little fluid and often the animation is jerky and weird. There is also a pronounced "mixed medium" as sporadic and unsuccessful 2D components are added. Characters look directly into the camera and talk; it was very embarrassing. There were a moment or two when Kylie looked straight into the camera, did not move and whirled on his eyeballs. It really scared me.

Fantastic Mr. Fox had so much potential. Many people still seem to like it - look at the reviews. Maybe it just was not for me.

summary: Kol is an evil guy about to be executed on a distant spaceship. He manages to escape on a shuttle and make his way to some woods in America. The commander of the spaceship decides to send out The Alienator to execute Kol at all costs. Kol meets up with some teens and Ward Armstrong and together they all try not to get killed by the pursuing Woman of Death - The Alienator.
translation: I do not know what this other meeting talked about. This is definitely not a bimbo movie, in fact I do not think there was a decent-looking girl in it. No, it's just cheesy, badly done, Ed Wood-style science fiction. And it is bad. I can not even tell you how bad it is. I saw it on the cable late at night and I was shocked. The fact that this film was ever released is an insult to us all. The actors were either friends of the producer or mentally retarded, the special effects are a joke, and the tempo is insanely slow. For me, music is the most important thing. A monkey could write a better topic with a toy xylophone. Do not rent this thing, but if you ever see it on cable, watch it. You'll be amazed how bad a movie can be.

summary: Twenty-four year old Angeleno Lionel Carpenter teaches a citizenship class at night school, most of his immigrant students who have no idea of what he is teaching in the language barrier. He has also had no luck with women largely due to the sheltered life he's led under the wings of his overbearing mother. His lack of encounters with women in the sexual sense is unlike his brash cousin, Sgt. Danny Bonhoff, who will do anything and take whatever opportunity to be up close and personal with the opposite sex. With Danny's help, Lionel is able to lose his virginity, although it isn't a totally satisfying experience. Regardless, Lionel learns that the reason for his nausea and vomiting following that encounter is because he got pregnant from it, he being the first male in recorded history to be so. By this time, he and one of his students, Russian gypsy Segoynia Savaka, have fallen in love and want to get married. They have to decide what to do about the baby. But the infamy and notoriety...
translation: I'm pretty sure this was the worst movie ever. If you can not get a 13-year-old boy to laugh at silly humor, you should give up the comedy forever. Unfortunately Joan Rivers has chosen differently. The movie is full of predictable gags (some of them are racist) and very funny jokes. Especially noteworthy is the scene in which the doctor tells the main character that the rabbit has died and he is pregnant (as I write this I can not believe that this was actually a movie scene). The man hurries to a dead rabbit on the doctor's desk and tries to give it mouth to mouth. ROTFLMAO! NOT! The punchline that can tell you how bad things are in this movie is, "I knew I should be up there." ha ha ha ha ah ............

summary: The Green Arrow sends out for reinforcements and Bart Allen, a.k.a. Impulse, Arthur Curry (Aquaman) and Victor Stone (Cyborg) return to Smallville to help him take down LuthorCorp's secret lab called 'Project 33.1'. During a break-in at the LuthorCorp facility, Bart is captured and tortured by Lex for information to who hired him. Clark sets off to rescue him but is felled by kryptonite. An alarmed Chloe goes to Oliver for help, and the newly formed "justice league" springs into action to rescue Clark and Bart. Meanwhile, Oliver painfully decides to break up with Lois, feeling that his dedicating to justice is more important, but he leaves out that information from her.
translation:
This particular episode of Smallville is probably the best episode since reunification. This is for many reasons. For example, it brings the series back to some of its roots. He greets Lionel from a supposedly long absence with the Luthorcorp Plaza office in Metropolis. This room was not in Smallville for a very long time, and when we see it again, it brings back many of the memories of the Smallville's past. Not to mention, Lionel's conversations with Lex are always admirable.

Another pleasant return is, as you can imagine, Bart Allen (aka Impulse), AC (aka Aquaman) and Victor Stone (aka Cyborg). Steven Deknight not only unites the former Justice leaguers, he adds them to the Smallville formula in a unique way, making it almost as if it were a full-length movie.

From there you get the Basic Story, Green Arrow makes the league, tries to blow up 33.1, Bart is captured, Clark rescues him and the plant is blown in Kingdom com. Everything is good and graceful, with a good mix of stealth, action, pace and tension. Oh, and Cyborg has some cool new upgrades that match the character of the Justice League :)

The music is probably the reason why this episode works so well. If you remember correctly, the first episode starring Steven Deknight was Season 4 Agless. This was a mediocre episode, but something felt out of place. Maybe it was the music, or the acting, or the fact that in the end "we did not find you, you found us", somehow people lost faith in the formula. But thankfully, Steve Deknight has delivered in this righteous episode.

I had a few thoughts of Justice, who managed to miss the full 10. Especially the far too cheesy outcome of the Justice League expanding the Ridge facility. I mean, it would have been so much cooler if Green Arrow and Cyborg had started on Oliver's bike (remember the arrow episode). Clark and Impulse should have obviously been running, and Aquaman should have swum across another path. But that was so unbelievably cheesy that it removed 2 points from the full 10 points.

Second time another cheesy moment, not as bad as the first, but when Green Arrow says "Let's go, save the world". That made me flinch. All in all, judging by the theatrical performances, the music, the directing and production values, the pros outweigh the cons, and this is still one of the best episodes in Smallville's history, and perhaps the second-best episode in Season 6 br />
7 out of 10 ...

summary: Eighteen-year-old Mathieu vacations at the beach with his family when he meets local teen C√©dric. After an extremely erotic kiss, the boys begin a passionate romance, complete with skinny-dipping at night, nude dancing on the beach and intense lovemaking in the dunes; yet, as Mathieu grapples with his sexuality and copes with his sick mother, absent father and annoying kid sister, his bond with C√©dric grows stronger until it bursts.
translation:
What initially seemed to be just another introverted French film that offered no more than an ominous feeling, became a really enlightening and satisfying presentation for me at the second viewing.

Spoiler of Art follow.

Bad Cedric; he did not seem to know what hit him. Bad audience; We were first trapped in something that seemed like a really beautiful and romantic story, just to be led back and forth into the dark reality of the mismatch. These two boys just did not belong to their first ambiguous encounter. As much as Mathieu and Cedric were sexually attracted to each other, the lack of a deeper emotional bond made it impossible for Mathieu, an intellectual being, to meet someone whose sensitivity was more attuned to carnival celebrations and fanfare.

Technically, I loved the camera in this movie. Subtitles were completely unnecessary, even though my French is "presque rien". I could see it again without the annoying English translation and enjoy it even more. It was a polished, very professionally made video. Although many scenes seem superfluous, I rate it as nine out of ten.

summary: Victor is growing up on the Lower East Side and is at the age where he is driven by desire and unchained by maturity. His image as a ladies man is shattered when he is found in Fat Donna's bedroom. Soon, as a result of his sister's big mouth, the whole Dominican community knows. Full of confidence, Victor sets out to reclaim his image by winning Judy. Judy proves to be elusive and difficult. Victor persists, and with a surprising tenderness, ultimately wins Judy's heart.
translation: One of the best movies I've seen in the last five years! The cast is universally spectacular in a story of young love and bravery on the Lower East Side of New York City with the two leads as superstars in the making. Funny, charming, sad, and inspiring, this is a totally refreshing version of Urban Youth that gets Larry Clark's often disgusting shit into the gutter where it belongs ... though I have to admit that Bully had a cut above his normal price. To raise Victor Vargas is a movie you'll miss for yourself to miss ... so do not miss it!

summary: When a high-ranking government official's daughter's boyfriend is kidnapped, it's up to Mark Robinson and Phil Davids to find the shadowy organization responsible and bring them to justice.
translation: This is really a very bad movie. Why? Above all, the story is bad. It's an artificial story that connects all sorts of things that make no sense. It just seems like a wrong experiment. Second, the actors can not play realistically. You can not even talk as an actor. Why did I buy this movie? And what do I have to do with it now?

summary: At 43, Luis is a confirmed bachelor, happy with one night stands, a success as a creator of perfumes. He has one problem: his mother and five sisters, who form an intimidating family council, want him married. Luis contrives to hire a woman to pose as a fianc√©e who will jilt him at the altar, leaving him disconsolate, with an excuse not to marry. He hires Emma, the sister of a colleague. She restores antique furniture and wants to adopt a child from Brazil. Things go too well: when Emma doesn't show up at the wedding, Luis's mother requires hospitalization; only Emma can bring her out of her swoon. It's time for a new plan that involves more tangled webs. And the child?
translation:
I think Charlotte Gainsbourg is one of the best performers in the world. I can not understand why some people say it is not. Boring....??? Maybe the one who said that she is boring because he is boring. She is a great actress and the movie was excellent. It has many wonderful ideas and very good performers. The direction was great. I describe myself in the French environment with all the refinement and the scent, flowers, churches, problems, etc. If she goes to the sister's shop, it's just unbelievable. Everything is great. We have a very good actress, wonderful, for a long time. Alain Chabat and Bernadette Lafont are perfect. I like him more than in his next film LA SCIENCE DES R√äVES. And Eric Lartigu has done a very good job.

Ana

summary: An adventurous quest for a treasure hidden in King Solomon's mines, based on H. Rider Haggard's timeless tale.
translation: I only give 3 stars for the beautiful pictures of Africa. The rest was ... boring. For about 50min we have the floor plan of the action ... In the war of the worlds took the introduction part, oh, about 10min? Then it was real action! It's like this: "Let's go for a walk in the savannah and enjoy the beautiful sunsets!". And maybe a message like "Do not kill elephants!" Very ecological. I would have expected that from a "new" Steven Segal movie, not from this one ... The main actress makes me think about artificial suntan, dyed hair and too much foundation! And I have not seen a scene where her hair is messed up or she is sweating or her clothes are dusty. She just does not look like a 19th century woman! And in the bar where they're looking for our hero, Swayze says he looks like Dracula. Hmmm, Bram Stoker wrote his book and published it in 1896, and it became famous in the next few years. Livingstone and other explorers went to Central Africa from 1840 to 1880. So, except the action takes place between 1896 and 1900. Houston, we have a problem. :) Swayze makes a nice impression .. as a nutshell - hard on the outside, but soft and cuddly on the inside. Not that I would cuddle with a nut, but you understand it. He really manages to see this beaten puppy several times on his face. The film stank. Way too long and increasingly boring. Do not look at it! Do not buy it! It is a waste of your money!

summary: In this loose modern adaptation of the classic novel, Cate and her adopted brother Heath grow up together and fall in love once they hit their teens. Her desire to leave the simple life conflicts with his wishes for them to stay at the Heights (their lighthouse home) together. It gets worse when her father dies, leaving everything to Cate's awful older brother Hendrix, who hates Heath. Cate ends up marrying the wealthy Edward, while the bitter Heath becomes a rock star and exacts revenge upon those who mistreated him. Once he and Cate start an affair, tragedy follows.
translation: terrible, just terrible! my old roommate saw this trash and it drove me crazy. The book is one of my favorites and it is a shame that some people will never know what it is really because their first impressions come from such a dribble. they have changed so much that they are hardly recognizable anymore. which amazes me, because the book reads like a soap opera anyway and provides enough food for modern entertainment. It's like one of those Lifetime movies that are "based on a true story," but completely invented. there is nothing of the emotion or depth of the book, only mindless melodrama. If you are a high school student looking for a way to get out of reading, I suggest you try a different version.

summary: The two lovers are living together and are not married as they hesitantly explain to her brother. They had made a promise as children to get married when they grew up, but they "didn't wait." It's an important plot point as it drives Cooper's actions when he discovers that Crawford and Young are living in sin.
translation:
In his first screenplay, based on his own short story "Turn About," William Faulkner delivers a bizarre story of loyalty, sacrifice, and truly strange relationships. The story was originally only about the characters Tone, Young and Cooper, but MGM had to put Joan Crawford in a different picture to fulfill their contract, and Faulkner committed himself by creating a female role. Crawford insisted that their lines be written in the same capricious style as the Young and Tone of their co-stars, leading to unintended hilarity as these three communicate in a telegraph-like shorthand that sounds like a Monty Python sketch ("Wuthering Heights ") in semaphore). Seriously, the almost completely unfamiliar sentences make Ernest Hemingway read like Henry James.

The film also reflects some familiar Faulkner themes, with an almost unnaturally close relationship between brother and sister (as in his "sanctuary" and elsewhere.) As Young Crawford suggests in Tones present instead of an engagement ring, THE THREE of them share their engraved childhood rings, the closeness of Tone and Young is also remarkable, especially when they look at the fate of Thelma & Louise, to be honest, it's scary.


That means there are some nice performances. Young is particularly involved in a scene where he was inducted into Cooper's fighter plane, and Roscoe Karns is adorable as Cooper's flying buddy. Ton, despite his inability to express himself through realistic dialogue, has a nice moment and throws his own stealthy tears over the fate of his young mate. Crawford, even without meaningful dialogue, usually works either wooden or melodramatic, which is a balancing act for a role.

The battle scenes - not surprisingly, for a Howard Hawks movie - are the most exciting part of the whole picture. But not enough. As far as I'm concerned, that's 75 minutes of my life. I will never come back again.

summary: Gabriel Noone is a late night radio-host in a big city, specializing in spooky tales culled from his active imagination. When Gabriel's lover decides he needs some "space" and moves out, Gabriel descends into a funk until a publisher friend brings him a manuscript written by 14 year-old Pete Logand, a troubled young fan. Pete's story touches the vulnerable Gabriel deeply. Pete was severely abused by his parents and is now under the care of his former social worker, Donna Logand, who has adopted him. Pete is very ill and he and Donna are keeping a low profile in a small town in Wisconsin to avoid discovery by Pete's mother. Gabriel develops an unsettling long-distance telephone relationship with the boy and his guardian. Nothing is as it seems and the skepticism of friends causes Gabriel to become suspicious of Donna and her motives, so he tries to resolve the loose ends by traveling to Wisconsin to confront Donna and Pete. But this effort is largely unsuccessful and we are left ...
translation: This movie is a mess. I am surprised that there is even a theatrical release. Without Robin Williams it would have gone straight to the video. It is badly written. It is badly aligned. Worse, it's an interesting topic, making it a ridiculous and boring thriller that has no tension and no inner or emotional logic. Especially after the first half hour, the film fits into a series of ridiculous set pieces. This is so exaggerated that the audience with whom I saw it had to laugh about it. Save your money. The trailer is totally misleading - it's not exciting and there's no thrill - in fact, the movie is the worst offense that it's just boring.

summary: Six months after the events depicted in The Matrix, Neo has proved to be a good omen for the free humans, as more and more humans are being freed from the matrix and brought to Zion, the one and only stronghold of the Resistance. Neo himself has discovered his superpowers including super speed, ability to see the codes of the things inside the matrix, and a certain degree of precognition. But a nasty piece of news hits the human resistance: 250,000 machine sentinels are digging to Zion and would reach them in 72 hours. As Zion prepares for the ultimate war, Neo, Morpheus and Trinity are advised by the Oracle to find the Keymaker who would help them reach the Source. Meanwhile Neo's recurrent dreams depicting Trinity's death have got him worried and as if it was not enough, Agent Smith has somehow escaped deletion, has become more powerful than before and has chosen Neo as his next target.
translation:
`The Matrix 'was an exciting summer blockbuster that was visually awesome, but also curious in its' Twilight Zone' style. This is the general rule - and this sequel does not fit with its predecessor. Worse than that, it's not even comparable to it.

`Reloaded 'explodes on the screen in the most unprofessional way. In the first few seconds, the first impression is generally good as Trinity is shot in a dream. Immediately thereafter, the film appears in the nose. After catastrophic first 45 minutes, it gradually gains momentum as it enters the Matrix and the fight with Agent Smith takes place. But it loses all speed when it reaches the 14-minute chase sequence and gets even worse at the big moan-worthy spin. The worst part is the overlong "Zion Rave" scene. Not only does it have absolutely nothing to do with the storyline, it is also a pathetic apology for porn and depressive dance music.

The bullet-time aspect of `The Matrix 'was a good match, but in' Reloaded 'they use too much to make it look boring. In the first case there were interesting plot turns, but here it is too linear to be interesting. The movie is basically just a series of stylish distractions that keep us from seeing how empty they really are. It works on the wrong principle that bigger is better. It seems that `The Matrix` franchise quickly drank into the special effects of misfire, the other franchises such as the 'Star Wars' saga have dropped.

The acting standard is usually poor. The best character of course is Hugo Weaving's "Agent Smith" - the only one who is a little interesting. Keanu Reeves is the definitive neo, but in all the special effects there is little room to make a big impact. Oscar nominee Laurence Fishburne becomes a monotonous mentor with poor dialogue. Carrie Ann Moss's role as an action chick could have been made much better by any other actress.

A poor, ragtag movie, `The Matrix Reloaded 'is a disappointment. Those who did not like the first one will probably not flock around. This is only for diehard fans. Even in the own subgenre of the Bonanzas (Minority Report, The Matrix, etc.) that is still quite poor. My IMDb Rating: 4.5 / 10.

The now 73-year-old Kennel Murder Case still offers a stylish look at the old classic thriller. What makes it as good as it is is, first, the mystery is complicated and smart, but still logical. summary: This movie follows the life of a young German woman, married to a soldier in the waning days of WWII. Fassbinder has tried to show the gritty life after the end of WWII and the turmoil of the people trapped in its wake.

The style of "Maria Braun" is reminiscent of melodramas of Fassbinder's favorite Hollywood director Douglas Sirk and gives an insight into the loss and survival in post-war Germany. Hanna Schygula literally shines in every scene of the movie and she's awesome.

8.5 / 10

summary: Ten years in the life of Abraham Lincoln, before he became known to his nation and the world. He moves from a Kentucky cabin to Springfield, Illinois, to begin his law practice. He defends two men accused of murder in a political brawl, suffers the death of his girlfriend Ann, courts his future wife Mary Todd, and agrees to go into politics.
translation:
The young Mr. Lincoln is the first film of the director / star collaboration of John Ford and Henry Fonda. I remember Fonda telling years ago that, as a young actor, he was understandably nervous about playing Abraham Lincoln, and was afraid he would not live up to the challenge.

John Ford reassured him before shooting He said he would not play the Great Liberator but only a prairie lawyer. That decided Fonda headed a cast that turned John Ford into a classic movie.

This is not a biographical film by Lincoln. This was previously in the sound era with Walter Huston and a year after Young Mr. Lincoln, Raymond Massey had the Pulitzer Prize winner piece by Robert Sherwood Abe Lincoln in Illinois. Massey still remains the final Lincoln.

But as Ford said, Fonda did not play the Great Liberator, just a small city lawyer in Illinois. The film covers about 10 years of Lincoln's early life. We see him working in a grocery store and getting a few law books from an immigrant pioneer family whose path he would cover later in history. And his romance with Ann Rutledge's early death, which makes Lincoln a melancholy creature.

Nearly 10 years later, Lincoln is now a practicing lawyer who is beginning to make himself felt. He has spent a few semesters in the legislature, but he's back in private practice, not really sure if politics is for him.

This is where most of the action takes place. The two sons of this family had received the law books of that time when they were charged with murder. He offers to defend her. And not an ordinary murder, but one of a deputy sheriff.

The process itself is fiction, but the Gambit defended in the defense of Richard Cromwell and Eddie Quillan, who played the two sons, based on a true Lincoln case. I will not say more.

Apart from the performances, Young Mr. Lincoln's great strength is the way John Ford captures the mood and atmosphere of a small prairie town in Illinois in a Fourth of July celebration. It's almost like watching a newsreel. And it was the mood of the country itself, young, alive and growing.

Fans of John Ford movies will recognize two musical themes that have been repeated in later films. During the romantic interlude at the beginning with Fonda and Pauline Moore, who played Ann Rutledge, the background music is the same theme as in The Man Who Shot Liberty Valance for Vera Miles. And at a dance, the tune Lovely Susan Brown, the Fonda, and Marjorie Weaver, who plays Mary Todd, is the same thing that Fonda danced with Cathy Downs, in My Darling Clementine's dance for the reanimation of a church in Tombstone.

Lincoln will forever be a favorite subject of biographers and playwrights, for two reasons, I believe. The first is that he is the living embodiment of our own American mythology of people who, through their own efforts, ascend from the bottom up to the height of power. In fact, the young Mr. Lincoln vividly shows the background from which Lincoln came. And second, the fact that he was our president during the biggest crisis in American history and that he made a unique good and moral decision to free slaves during the Civil War, albeit for some political reasons. His assassination has secured his place in history.

In addition to Fonda and others I've mentioned, Fred Kohler, Jr. and Ward Bond, the two city thugs, Kohler as a murder victim and Tie the main prosecutor. Also Donald Meek as prosecutor and Alice Brady in their last movie as pioneering mother of Cromwell and Quillan. And a very nice performance by Spencer Charters, who specializes in rustic characters as judges.

For a movie that captures the drama and romance of the time he plays, you can not be better than Young Mr Lincoln.

summary: The supposedly servile Ood are now in the control of some type of beast that describes itself as Satan and claims to be a being that has existed since before the creation of the known universe.
