The plot is technically not bad. It's just that we usually follow a car, take a trip through a forest, and inspect a building. That's what editing is about. I suppose the story would not support much more technically. Not much here.

summary: Crime novelist Catherine Tramell is living in London, and becomes the center of police investigation (yet again) when her football player boyfriend drowns in a car accident and it is revealed that he was already dead because of a drug overdose before Tramell drove the car into water. Police psychoanalyst Dr. Michael Glass is called for examining Tramell, and is intrigued by the seductive and manipulative woman. On the other hand , his friend Det. Roy Washburn is sure Tramell is guilty. Tramell asks Glass to treat her for her 'risk addiction' problem, and with each therapy session , Glass gets more and more suspicious about her intentions. As more and more murders are committed, including that of Glass's ex-wife, Glass becomes obsessed with proving Tramell's guilt even though the evidence is contradictory .
translation:
In my book "Basic Instinct" was a perfect movie. It had outstanding acting on the parts of Stone, Douglas and all its subordinates to the smallest role. It had wonderful photography, music and the noirest noir script of all time. It all adds up to a movie that's as good as he'll ever get!

This sequel is the exact opposite, it can not possibly get worse, bad acting and a lame script, combined with totally awkward direction, that's really bad, boring, annoying. The only thing that keeps you focused is the relatively short wait for the next scene, which is an exactly replicated copy of the original. These copies are so bad that they make you laugh, and I laughed a lot, despite everything, because it was like watching the destruction of a glowing monument. The only things that are good in this terrible mess are the excerpts from the Jerry Goldsmith score from BI1. Michael Caton-Jones and the scriptwriter even have the dialogue "There is no smoking in this room" in the interrogation scene and yes, she sends her lawyer (who is now a lawyer) away!

I'm sorry I saw this horrible movie that should never have been done! It damages the original, it is that bad. The only redeeming value is the realization that cosmetic surgery (and I'm sure Ms. Stone could buy the best surgeon money) can do a good job, but obviously can not restore the perfection of the original. And as far as the human body is concerned, it also applies to filmmaking. There should be a law: never make a sequel to a perfect movie!

summary: Archer Coe has been found dead in his locked bedroom. The cops consider it suicide, but Philo believes otherwise. When the Coroner shows up, he finds that Archer had been hit with a blunt object, stabbed and shot - making suicide unlikely. When the evidence points to his brother, Brisbane is found stabbed to death in the closet. Archer had a number of enemies, any one of which would have been glad to knock him off, but which one did and how did the murder occur in a room looked from the inside. Only one man, the keen, fascinating, debonair detective Philo Vance, would be able to figure out who is the killer.
translation: One of the better Vance films succeeds more through interesting plot and artful director of none other than Michael Curtiz. This time a hated financier is found dead - shot in the head - in his locked and locked bedroom upstairs. Philo Vance, who learns of the situation during his trip to Italy, decides to end his holiday and try to solve what he considers murder and what everyone else considers suicidal. William Powell is as friendly as Philo Vance. He never seems to push and is always very smooth in what he says and does. Powell is backed by a host of very talented actors - some first-rate character actors and actresses like Mary Astor as a niece who hated her uncle Ralph Morgan as the dead man's secretary, Paul Cavanaugh as a rival dog fan, Arthur Hohl as his uncle mysterious butler, Helen Vinson as a neighbor kept blonde, and two really good performances by James Lee as a Chinese chef and fat Eugene Palette as a wise police detective. Add to the mix a wonderfully funny twist by Etienne Girardot as a public coroner, always missing his food. It's this depth of suspects and a story that has many plots of twists and turns that make The Kennel Murder Case a fast-paced, fun secret.

summary: A young girl in the hills of Indiana, who had been abandoned by her family and raised by a bootlegging old woman, is taken by the authorities and made the ward of a childless couple.
translation: My life is about saving animals. I volunteer at a cat rescue organization. I am a vegetarian because I could not kill an animal to save my life. I can not even kill a spider, I'm putting it outside. The scene in which the children throw stones at the bird until he dies, while Sooner participated in the attempt to be accepted by the other children, made me sick and has been persecuting me ever since. It just convinces me that people are pathetic in their need for acceptance. The end - the foster parents take over earlier - does not solve the depiction of animal cruelty. Why would anyone want his child to see this movie?

summary: When her sister is kidnapped by white slavers, only Grandpa knows what to do. He puts in a call to a fictional hero, Jake Speed. She is amazed to find that he actually exists, and that as flesh and blood, is much less formidable than his reputation.
translation:
One of my favorite films for a number of years was "Last Action Hero"; Unfortunately, Arnold Schwarznegger has decided to spoil my fun by becoming a corrupt bastard politician; Well, now I can not stand a movie in which he could have had a hand.

The adventures of Jake Speed ‚Äã‚Äãactually play with some themes similar to those in Last ... Hero; So I was happy to find it on DVD, so I watched how these topics performed so well.

Despite the "conspiracy within the plot" that included white slavery during the civil war in an African nation, this is not an action movie. The storyline that includes the "plot-in-a-plot" is actually a question the movie does not want to solve: is Jake Speed ‚Äã‚Äãa real person who helps the heroine save her sister from the white slave trader? ; or is he actually a fictional character (meaning that the heroine somehow entered the universe that really only exists in a series of fabric novels)? I suggest that this is not so clearly defined in the film and that Wayne Crawford and Andrew Lane are aware of it. The film thus becomes a presentation of what the audience might expect from a fictional "adventure story" universe. This is actually a rich topic whose potential severity is tempered by the lovable and campy sense of humor.

There are weaknesses in the movie - especially the cinematography that makes the movie look like a television show. And sometimes the pace slows down.

But I really like these characters, and I enjoy the adventure they live, no matter how silly they are. And I find the idea that this adventure actually takes place in a novel intriguing.

Stay under a lot of considerations - a good show!

summary: The gang creates a huge mess after they get into a taffy-pulling contest.
translation: This Hal Roach comedy, A Tough Winter, is the ninety-ninth in the series "Our Gang / Little Rascals" and the eleventh sound film. Basically a mannequin for the black comic Stepin Fetchit, who gets a special bill here, we see him go to his hut, where the gang hangs around. Farina gets him a letter of love from the post office and is instructed by Stepin to read it because he can not read it during the day while he goes to NIGHT school. It's by chance his lover in Tennessee, so Farina must have stuffed his ears with cotton now, because it's too hot for him to hear! In another room, Weezer gives instructions to Mary Ann to make Taffi off the radio, but because he runs into the kitchen again and again, he misses the crossing of the spokeswoman with rice pudding and Spanish tamale, Mary Ann with Tabasco and Lux mixed! After the preparation is done, Jackie and the rest of the gang help with the awful-tasting, but very sticky substance, because it keeps everyone hanging on the walls. While they all try to clean up the mess, Stepin works in the basement on various pipes and sockets that mix the functions of various devices like a phone that sucks, a vacuum ringing, and a fridge that plays music! The end. What I have just described points to the meandering nature of this "Our Gang" short number, which served as a pilot for a potential Stepin Fetchit short film series. It's just as good that it never happened, since Fetchit's characterization of the lazy Negro was amusing in small doses and would be considered very offensive today. Many of the scenes I've just described are good for a few laughs, though the final sequence was so confusing that the results were just too blah for me. In summary, A Tough Winter is a curiosity that should be seen at least once. By the way, Stepin's real name was Lincoln Theodore Perry.

summary: Murderous screenwriter Stanley Caldwell, who incidentally is thought to be dead, returns to the scenes of his crimes.
translation: actually ... this "video camera" effect, it's just, it's an effect, a pretty good ... (you do not know much about directing a movie, right?) This movie is actually BETTER than the original, it is fun to watch, made for television, does not have to follow any rules. I find it hard to see number one because he kills the first girl, it is disturbing. and all the time we spend for Judd Nelson to get away with it, we're on his side as the spectators. I hope someday we will see a 3rd hut by the lake, but I doubt it. When you watch this movie, you can understand how real films are made, because it's like a movie in a movie. Judd is one of the scariest villains of all time, and he's more realistic, he does not just hack mindlessly like in other horrors.

summary: Sissy Hankshaw is born with enormous thumbs that help her hitchhiking through the U.S. from a young age. She becomes a model in advertising, and her New York agent, "the Countess", sends her to his ranch in California to shoot a commercial, set against the background of mating whooping cranes. There, she befriends Bonanza Jellybean, one of the cowgirls at the beauty ranch. The cowgirls take command of the ranch from the Countess, and drug the cranes with peyote. The police besiege the ranch.
translation: This movie stinks. The stink reminds of bad cowpies who sat too long in the sun. I can not believe that so many talented actors have wasted their time making such a hopelessly terrible film. Angry!

summary: A documentary on the rivalry between two rock bands. On one hand we have The Dandy Warhols, and its leader Courtney Taylor-Taylor, and on the other The Brian Jonestown Massacre, lead by Anton Newcombe. They used to be close friends but their differing lifestyles and ambitions, especially that of Anton Newcombe, have forced them apart, to the point of being enemies.
translation:
I saw this movie for the first time as I flipped through my parents' DirecTV movie channels. It was on the Sundance Channel and just started. I love music, especially the late 60's and so the BJM has been listening (the dandies are alright). Everything about the Brian Jonestown Massacre fascinated me from the music, Anton and Joel's personalities to the illegal drug use. It was funny because when I saw the first party scene when all the lines were making, my parents passed by and decided to watch (the expression on their faces was priceless). Anyway, this is definitely one of my favorite movies because it introduced me to Brian Jonestown Massacre, who is now my favorite band of all time.

Just look at it ... seriously

summary: In the mid-22nd century, the Earth ship Enterprise is launched under the command of Captain Jonathan Archer. When the crew rescues an alien from a crashed spaceship, Earth gets its first look at the alien's race - the Klingons. Archer and his crew must walk a fine line as they attempt to communicate with the Klingon pilot, whose language is completely unknown, and whose homeworld wants him back. Is this the beginning of friendship...or interstellar war?
translation:
The pilot of Enterprise has one thing missing since the original Star Trek: a dose of realistic, flawed personalities. The utopian characters of the Next Generation became tiring, they were so noble that they were incredible. I also like the negotiation that people are embittered towards the Vulcans. It's funny to see them as swanky snobs. I'm looking forward to seeing when people become the dominant race between the two, though I do not think it would work in the timeframe of the show. The only drawbacks that came up to me were the "fast end of the end at 2 o'clock" feeling of the end that is common among many of the trek shows. The second was the shameless search for reviews by some pointless sexy scenes. It was out of place, a good sci-fi show should be able to stand alone without trying to fill the youthful audience with some skin. But it's not my job to make the show profitable, so good.

Let's see what happens in the next episode.

summary: A night out on the town turns into a nightmare as six young college students find themselves hunted by a killer.
translation: Good deaths. Good mask. Cool ax. Good looking girls .... but beware !!! No plot and small scares Reduce the standards completely. They tried to do a "I know what you did last summer", but in the end they made a "scream". But hey, what do people expect from a horror movie? Answers completely different. Rent it if you want, but I always regret having seen it.

summary: When Max's performance is no competition for producers' nephews and bigger "names," his only option is to cripple the competition - literally. But as the roles get bigger, the competition gets stronger, the stakes get higher, and now with an undercover thespian cop on his trail, Max must struggle with his ongoing road to success and the choices he's made.
translation: A struggling actor finds the best way to break into Hollywood to start eliminating the competition. But what makes Break a Leg a real gem is the sardonic view of the existence of the fighting (and not so) LA actor. It brings us into this world with effortless irony and wit. It also has a polished look and a very skilful direction under Monika Mitchell. Break a Leg is one of those rare independent films that does not affect its production values ‚Äã‚Äãat any level. Writing is narrow, dialogue first. Cassini is an actor, and the role really shows his talents. The climate scene between him and Rene Garcia is an instant classic and could be considered one of the funniest Hollywood scenes of all time. I saw it in an advanced show and everyone in the audience laughed uncontrollably and then swarmed away.

summary: The fish and frogs gather at the old mill pond to hear a jazz concert. Performers include caricatures of Cab Calloway, Fats Waller, and tap dancer Bill Robinson ("Bojangles").
translation: This is the cartoon that should have won instead of Country Cousin. Visually well done and much more fun and memorable. Worth seeing just for the music alone! Although there are elements that undoubtedly affect the sensitivity of some of these days, the cartoon needs a bit of perspective. It's over sixty years old and it's just a cartoon after all. I'm handicapped, and if I was as hypersensitive as the people who look at things like that cartoon and endure trouble, I would have curled up in a fetal position and would have died. Sometimes you have to light up, put your head back and float! Caricatures of celebrities in cartoons were common in the 1930s and 1940s and were almost never terribly flattering. Bing Crosby is said to have hated it when he was used more than once. *SIGH*

summary: Richard Haywood, a Californian high school's coolest kid, secretly teams up with another rich kid in his class, brilliant nerd Justin 'Bonaparte' Pendleton, whose erudition, specially in forensic matters, allows them to plan elaborately perfect murders, just for the kick, for which they set up Richard's marijuana supplier, their school's janitor Ray Feathers, as a psychotic serial killer. The case is assigned to detectives Cassie 'the hyena' Mayweather, who carries a sequoia-size chip on the shoulder from her previous life, and her brilliant new partner, Sam Kennedy, who just transferred from the vice squad; they can work together very well, and even fit romantically, but fall out over different professional attitudes towards the investigation, which Captain Rod Cody and her understandably vindictive abused ex, Assistant D.A. Al Swanson, soon ban her from when she disobeys instructions and hand to him. When the plotting boys both dig class-mate Lisa Mills, their unnatural bond comes ...
translation:
Murder By Numbers is one of those movies that is expected to be made for TV but is not. Considering that Bullock is the only actor (although Michael Pitt seems to be looking for bigger and better things), it's no surprise that this movie quickly disappears from memory and is replaced by more important things. How to ... remember to close your front door when you go out. Or put clothes back on when you come out of the shower.

Bullock plays Cassie Mayweather, a policewoman with personal problems (not all). Together with her new partner (Ben Chaplin) she is assigned to investigate the murder of a young woman. Nothing out of the ordinary except that the perpetrators are a few teenagers who think they planned and executed the perfect murder. As the investigation progresses, a battle of wills arises between Cassie and prime suspect Richie Haywood (Ryan Gosling).

The paralyzing problem here is that the two channels are hopeless. Although she is very nice to look at, Bullock is about as believable in the role of a hardened cynical policeman as Rodney Dangerfield (actually he would be better!). Chaplin is a total nothingness for his sins and I am sorry that he has to put this film on his CV to get to Hollywood. At least Gosling and Pitt, as the sneaky mocking suspects, are appropriate. As if dubious leads were not bad enough, a story that would make anyone sleep and a very predictable (but illogical) end shoot this movie in the head before it has a chance to run.

"Murder By Numbers" has absolutely nothing to offer, even a senseless nude scene from Bullock would not save it. Well, just a little, but still not enough to save it. Forgettable, predictable and redundant - this is a movie that will not bring the cop genre forward. As Cassie probably says in her next case, there's nothing to see here. Go on, keep moving ...

summary: Detroit, the early 1960s. Curtis Taylor, Jr., a car salesman, breaks into the music business with big dreams. He signs a trio of young women, the Dreamettes, gets them a job backing an R&B performer, James "Thunder" Early, establishes his own record label and starts wheeling and dealing. When Early flames out, Curtis makes the Dreamettes into headliners as the Dreams, but not before demoting their hefty big-voiced lead singer, Effie White, and putting the softer-voiced looker, Deena Jones, in front. Soon after, he fires Effie, sends her into a life of proud poverty, and takes Deena and the Dreams to the top. How long can Curtis stay there, and will Effie ever get her due?
translation:
I had been looking forward to seeing Dreamgirls for a long time ... which has to do with all the reviews, nominations and media attention. And I have to say, the first quarter of the movie was good! It really portrayed the black music scene back then. But as the movie went on, my whole family and I were completely bored. The singing came again and again, one after the other. I mean seriously, just a music number and it could even have worked on RENT.

Also, I have not found any character development on any of the characters; I did not care what happened to them! Even when Eddie Murphy's character died of an overdose of drugs, I knew that I should be sad, but I just could not feel any emotions for that character. The characters got a weak background about singing in their childhood and whatever, but there the personalities were not revealed enough to pull me in.

After all, the conflict was simply not significant enough to interest viewers as to the lack of character development. This movie reminded me of a copycat movie based on Ray, Chicago and Rent (Ray and Chicago were wonderful movies in my opinion). Overall, I think this film would be best suited to someone who is not really into an overall story, but still enjoys two hours of entertaining and entertaining vocal engagements.

summary: Bobby is a Los Angeles teenager who buys a customized Dodge van to pick up girls and spruce up his dull life, all while trying to win money racing other vans in order to pay for his own.
translation: THE VAN is a simple teensploitation image created specifically for the drive-in, where you feel comfortable and have plenty of opportunities to laugh and cry with your friends. Danny Devito has a small but rich role as a car wash manager and is almost stealing the show! All the leads are well played, the characters complex and the director quite competent for this type of picture. An international edition of the Krone.

summary: Lilly (Baby Face) sleeps her way from basement speakeasy bartender, literally floor by floor, to the top floor of a New York office building. Bank sub-manager Jimmy McCoy finds her a job in the bank only to be cast aside as she hooks up with the bank's president. When he complains of not seeing her she says: "I'm working so hard I have to go to bed early every night."
translation:
This is one of the boldest and most important of the so-called "pre-code" films shot in Hollywood in the 1930s. In contrast to some pre-code films that occasionally dealt with issues that would never have been allowed after 1934/5, this film plunged from start to finish into a very dirty but entertaining storyline. The conventional morality of the late 30s and 40s was definitely NOT obvious in this film, since the movie is essentially about a sneaky woman who sleeps her way to the top - and does not apologize. These "big boys" both enjoyed sex and used it on every man who could help her get rich, something that would never have been seen in movies that were made only two or three years later.

The movie begins with Barbara Stanwyck working in her dad's whiskey bar. She is not only her boss but also her pimp and encourages her to sleep with a local government official so that he can run away from the illegal bar with impunity. Although not clear, it seems that Daddy has "borrowed" his daughter's body for a long time.

After being almost raped and attacking this man by tearing a bottle of beer With his skull, Barbara has had enough and goes to the big city. It does not hurt that she still blew up her father and killed her, but her sense of self-expulsion and showing nothing seemed to be the impulse to move.

Despite Depression, Barbara uses sex to get a job at a huge mega-bank. She starts a rather low job as a store manager, but sleeps from one job to the next in a matter of just a few weeks - until she sleeps with the head of the bank and his future son-in-law !!! It all ends in tragedy, but Babs does not seem too shaken by the deaths of these two men. In fact, she can later immerse herself in the life of the NEW CEO and is once again at the top (perhaps in more ways than one).

Now it's time for a wonderful movie, because it was so rude and unrepeatable. Barbara played a 100% sociopath - a woman without morals and without conscience - just a desire to squeeze as much out of life as she could, no matter who hurt her. But the brave authors and producers "dumped" and thought it important to risk a redemptive end. Considering that this woman was so evil and deceitful, her change of heart was a big disappointment in the end and seriously affected the movie. In many ways, this reminded me of the end of JEZEBEL - how again a bad person "sees the light" and changes at the not very convincing conclusion.

My advice is to try to watch RED-HEADED WOMAN and DOWNSTAIRS. RED-HEADED WOMAN resembles BABY FACE, but in the end has no magical transformation - the main actress is really a skunk! In DOWNSTAIRS, a movie very similar to RED-HEADED WOMAN, the roles are reversed and a man (John Gilbert) plays a similar dogged character. Both are classics and a bit better than this movie.

This movie is an amazing curiosity of a short time of often ultra-greasy Hollywood movies and in this light it is very worth seeing for Cinephiles. Even fans of The Duke take note - John Wayne plays a very minor role in the film and it is very unusual for a very young Wayne to play such a conventional role.

summary: A spin-off of the medical drama "Grey's Anatomy" centering on the life of neonatal surgeon Addison Montgomery.
translation:
It looks as if the brilliant team of Shonda Rhimes has outsourced this writing somewhere off the coast, maybe in the MediocreLand? "PP" reminds me of one of the many protracted, promising, but predictable David Kelly Flicks (Picket Fences, Ally McBeal and now Boston Legal). The crazy cases that they get are so strange that they hardly cause sympathy or sadness. And that's what makes good medical dramas - dramatic situations you're afraid of "That could be me" mood. They are not funny either.

The actors are pretty good, but the storylines are dead and can not be brought back to life. I'm a therapist and let me tell you - Amy Brennan plays the incredibly incompetent, unethical, untrained therapist. Whoever writes their stuff went through the ethics and broadcast / countertransference courses at Stanford. Someone should give them an ethics code for reading (the episode with the woman bleeding in the nose and the therapist's involvement). No therapists are so bad.

Women who crave men who have moved on - have died, we all have "Sex and the City". Addison, in her adolescent aggression to the type she likes - very age-related, looks so unnatural to a woman over 40, and this otherwise talented actress does not believe it herself and does not deliver it very well. The only successful / tasty developments are that Addison struggles with her decision to move to LA and the "Voodoo Dr" and his mastering of widowhood.

This concept could work with a whole new writing team.

summary: Nancy Drew accompanies her father on a business trip to Los Angeles California. Nancy booked an abandoned house for them to stay in hiding the mystery of a movie star's murder from her father as a promise that she would stay out of trouble and be normal. Fitting into high school as a normal teen turns out to be harder than it sounds, for Nancy Drew. She soon befriends a younger boy and determines that the sleuthing world is where she belongs. While snooping through the attic, she finds a letter from the Hollywood star, Dehlia Draycott, written to someone named 'Z'. This leads Nancy on a wild goose chase as she comes to find out that Dehlia has a secret daughter, her daughter is to inherit everything and someone killed Dehlia because they were written out of the will.
translation: I've read over 100 of Nancy Drew's books, and if you're not bright enough to understand it, Nancy Drew was the film of a young Nancy Drew, not the 18-year-old, who's not all from school Books are about. That was when she was sixteen. Of course, she would not be as smart as the one in the book, considering she's only in the 10th grade. Otherwise, I thought the movie would be very cute. It was clean and adequate for everyone. It was funny sometimes. I thought Emma Roberts did a great job. She was articulate, full of character and sweet. I liked the embarrassment Nancy and Ned had because they were obviously not old enough to be in a serious relationship, as they had in the books. It was a cute PG movie that I enjoyed a lot because, unlike most people my age, I enjoy films without sex, drugs or obscenity.

summary: Dr. Bill Cortner has been performing experimental surgery on human guinea pigs without authorization and against the advice of his father, also a surgeon. When Bill's fianc√©e Jan Compton is decapitated in an automobile accident, he manages to keep her brain alive. He now needs to find a new body for his bride-to-be and settles on Doris Powell, a glamor model with a facial disfigurement. Jan meanwhile doesn't want to continue her body-less existence and calls upon the creature hidden in the basement, one of Bill Cortner's unsuccessful experiments, to break loose.
translation:
This recalls the days of the Matin√©e, when children who nowhere else could hang out, took their appointments to the balcony after they had thrown their younger siblings under the blanket. It did not matter what was on the screen - the little kids sat there and the big kids ignored it. The adults, of course, would never see it.

But they put it on video, anyway, along with most of the other creaky, low-budget "B" horror movies of the Golden Age ... of television. The film's inherent and unintentional humor is derived from stale ideology (the "bad girls" that were harvested to replace the wretched body of poor Jan - they had come) overused action (a mad scientist trying to divine God a violent yet conscientious monster (whose presence in the former scientist's rural laboratory is never fully explained, and acting polarized on wood or over-the-top.)

This is one great party movie, provided your guests enjoy adding dialogues and commentary on otherwise vile cinema exploits, and if you or your guests prefer more passive entertainment, this movie is also available as a video in its Mystery Science Theater 3000 treatment, in the moderators and dolls of the cult TV series make the necessary additions for you.

summary: A group of popular students play a cruel prank on a shy nerd resulting in a terrible accident. Years later a reunion is held where each of the students face a stalker killer who may be the same nerd out for revenge.
translation:
I've seen Slaughter High several times over the years and always found it to be a brilliant slasher strip with a weird sense of humor, but I never knew it was shot in the UK and I never knew that the actor was Marty Rantzen plays (Simon Scuddamore) committed suicide after the film was released. I think I saw it last night when the actors seem pretty weird to the Americans, and some of them are not very good at hiding their English accents.

All this aside, this is the story of the class nerd, Marty, who is the jokes of his classmates, and on a certain day, the April Fools joke, he is being put into the girl's dressing room by Caroline Munro curly (yes, plays a teenager) and humiliates big time on film. Of course, the coach catches the gang at work and they all get a lot of training to punish them, but not before a few of the guys escape Marty a joint he's trying to smoke in the chemistry lab, but he's full of it, which makes him sick and when he runs to the toilet, one of his classmates sneaks in and sets a chemical that reacts to something that mixes Marty, resulting in a fire and the leaking of a bottle of nitric acid, leaving poor Marty behind

Ten years later, the same gang set out for their reunion in good old Doddsville High Street, strangely boarded up and inaccessible, but thanks to ingenuity, they manage to get in the place that seems to be deserted. .. except that there is a room in which a banquet and a liqueur are distributed, and so eat, drink and be happy. Because soon they will die, of course.

The gang is followed in turn by a figure in a fool's trap, but could it be Marty? They do not know, they think he's either in a madhouse or working for IBM, they're not sure which. But whoever it is, he makes quick work of them. Especially disgusting is the girl taking a bath to wash her blood off one of her classmates, whose innards spilled over her as he drank poisoned beer. She's the victim of an acid bath that I believe was one of the parts that were originally cut in the band version because it seemed particularly disgusting when I saw it this time. I could be wrong, but I think that was not on the tape.

In any case, there is a kind of twist end, and that also includes material that is not on the band, I think. There's also a bit of frontal nudity cut out, but other than that I did not really notice if there were other parts in this uncut version, probably like that, but it's been a while since I last saw it If you're a fan of Slasher movies from the 80s, then grab the new release DVD, because it's a fun little slasher with a good atmosphere and a good feel. 7 out of 10 points.

summary: Nothing and no one in Ernie's life wants him to be a writer. Not his boss, not his roommates, not even the neighborhood meter maid. All seem bent on squashing him and the noble pursuit of his dream... writing his first novel. The only place Ernie feels safe and confident is in his imagination. But when the world he hates encroaches on his typewriter, Ernie loses focus, and the typewriter goes silent. Uninspired and unable to write, Ernie decides if he can't gain people's respect, he can certainly take it. Magically, the very act of standing up for himself gets the typewriter clicking, but entwines Ernie in a bizarre tangle of crime, kidnapping, robotics, and kung fu. Ernie ultimately finds liberation in the least likely of places - namely handcuffing half the neighborhood to a stolen fire hydrant in the middle of his living room. Today Ernie is inspired.
translation: Adam Jones' movie "Cross Eyed" takes the viewer on a journey of salvation as the lead actor takes control of the wheel and tidies his life. Adam Jones has found a fanciful and refreshing way to strengthen and realize his character, most importantly. These truths become visible to both the characters and the audience as you laugh with them and play the credits. The simple but attractive attire \ costumes will let you guess what you will see next. You can not help but smile and laugh at the antics that take place in this movie. I can not wait for his second effort. It's only a matter of time before Jones strikes again. Bravo!

summary: Comedian Eddie Murphy brings his proudly raunchy comedy act to a sold-out stadium and pontificates in his own vulgarly hilarious fashion on such subjects as sexual orientation, puberty, dating, disciplinarian mothers, ice cream trucks, and the personality traits of certain singers.
translation:
I've never laughed so much and giggled in my life! The first half has kept me in stitches; The last half brought me completely unkempt! I think I giggled for 15 minutes after the video was over.

His timing and delivery for his stories are almost unequaled. And although he talks fast, you start every joke. That's probably why my "laugh center" was so overwhelmed; It took another 15 minutes to laugh at everything.

summary: Four 1950's cultural icons (Albert Einstein, Marilyn Monroe, Joe DiMaggio and Senator Joseph MacCarthy) who conceivably could have met and probably didn't, fictionally do in this modern fable of post-WWII America. Visually intriguing, the film has a fluid progression of flash-backs and flash-forwards centering on the fictional Einstein's current observations, childhood memories and apprehensions for the future.
translation: Roeg made some great movies, but that's a turkey. It has the feel of a piece written by an untalented high school student for his class task. The decoration is somewhat surreal, but the real story is unbearable hokum.

summary: An immigrant leaves his sweetheart in Italy to find a better life across the sea in the grimy slums of New York. They are eventually reunited and marry. But life in New York is hard and tragedy tarnishes their dream of a better life in the new world.
translation:
"The Italian" is one of the big or almost big movies of 1915 that are available today. The year was a turning point for the feature film, especially in America: Lois Weber's "hypocrite", Cecil B. DeMille's "The Cheat" and, of course, D.W. Griffith's "The Birth of a Nation" sets new standards for the arts. This year, Russian filmmaker Yevgeni Bauer shot two of his best pictures, "After Death" and "Daydreams". The French series "Les Vampires" also has their admirers today, although I disagree with them. The creation of the full-length film was led by Europe, mainly by Denmark, France and Italy, but the dominance of this market and, to a degree, art shifted in 1915 across the Atlantic.

The most important artistic achievement of "The Italian" is its stunning and often innovative cinematography. There are some picturesque sunsets, moving framing, including a short overhead shot of the Italian race to buy a wedding ring, and another shot of him holding on a moving car, and in general there are clever uses of different camera angles and Expert lighting throughout A particularly stunning shot is a close-up of the Italian who gets angry as he slowly approaches the camera to an extreme close-up, reminiscent of DW Griffith's "Musketeers of the Pig Alley" (1912). He is so angry that his surroundings even begin to shake his anger.

Unfortunately the cameraman seems to be unknown. The director, although originally without credit in the film, is now known to Reginald Barker. About five of his other films made for Ince are also available today, but tend to be unremarkable. "Civilization" (1916), which he worked on, was a big production but a deeply flawed film. Incidentally, I suppose one or more of the cameramen who worked on Civilization also took photographs of The Italian.

In addition, all production is very advanced at this time. Venice and New York are well done, though the film was filmed in Los Angeles (for the romanticized Venice) and San Francisco (for the ethnic slums of New York). There are extensive flashbacks, though maybe one or two too many. I particularly like the clever division of the narrative, as it is played in a book by a character played by the same actor, George Beban, who also plays the main role in the inner main narrative. Reading the story is further briefly framed by opening at the beginning and closing at the end of the curtain blinds, √† la theater, reflecting in the inner story during the Revenge climax in the nursery, with the opening and closing of window curtains. Parallel editing, in-camera dissoles and irises are professionally handled. In addition, Beban and Clara Williams play a good role as his wife.

On the other hand, "The Italian" has some disadvantages. The early moments of the film's comedy coincide rather discordantly with the last bits of hard and heavy melodrama, though the environmental changes from romanticized Italy to naturalistic New York work well, largely because it is aided by lighting and photography. The harsh dissolution of the American dream in this film, reinforced by the sharp photographs, must have been urgent for the immigrant classes, who were then a disproportionately large population of the film audience. The Corrigan character should have anticipated more; His brief introduction, which advocates for another politician, seems inadequate for his later centrality to the Italian's revenge. In addition, the filmmakers were either medically na√Øve or careless in not explaining the child's lack of breastfeeding and unwarranted belief in the healing powers of rest for the other child. Apart from the flaws in the plot, "The Italian" is exceptionally well done.

summary: The Maclean brothers, Paul and Norman, live a relatively idyllic life in rural Montana, spending much of their time fly fishing. The sons of a minister, the boys eventually part company when Norman moves east to attend college, leaving his rebellious brother to find trouble back home. When Norman finally returns, the siblings resume their fishing outings, and assess both where they've been and where they're going.
translation:
When I saw this movie for the first time, I was with my dad. He encouraged me to watch this movie because it was one of his favorites. After watching the movie, he immediately became one of my favorites.

A river flows through It's about two brothers, each going a different path in life. Norman Maclean (Craig Sheffer) is the older of the two brothers and he is on the path of education. Paul Maclean (Brad Pitt) is the rebellious younger brother who travels on a road full of obstacles. The movie follows these characters as everyone goes their own way.

There is no disadvantage for this movie. They will be entertained all the way. The acting, director and script is all perfect. The two things that are extraordinary are the cinematography and the score. Both bring you into the world that Robert Redford creates for you.

This is a great movie designed to be a classic. It's safe in my book. If you have not seen this movie yet, check it out as soon as possible, it will stay forever.

summary: "Offside" is about a group of Iranian girls who attempts to enter Tehran's Azadi Stadium dressed as boys in order to watch a big football match but some get caught and arrested. After the establishment of the Islamic Republic in Iran, women are not allowed to enter the stadiums.
translation: In The White Balloon and Crimson Gold, the two other films by Jafar Panahi that I've seen, the director mixes surprising amounts of depth, which on the surface are rather small. In Offside, Panahi's serio-oomic homage to Iranian women who stand up for their rights, I do not think he's that successful. Of course, not what he says is not important (and it's a pity that, like almost every other Panahi film, the Iranians can not see it). But after a while, the movie feels a bit flat and even feels like 90 minutes. Not to say that I did not like it. The actors are all fantastic and the celebration at the end of the film is contagious. But it's not an important job in my opinion.

summary: The movie describes the life of Adolf Hitler from childhood to manhood, and how he became so powerful. It describes his poor childhood in Austria, it describes the first world war from his point of view, and how he became the strongest man in Germany. The movie show us how Hitler turned from a poor soldier into the leader of the Nazis, and how he survived the attempts to kill him. It describes his relationship with his mistress Eva Braun, and his decisions and enemies inside Germany and inside the Nazi party.
translation:
Well, first I would like to add that I myself am a historian. In a movie based on historical events, I search for historical facts. However, this is not the case here. Sure, the movie is entertaining and anything but the fact that it's not based on true facts is more than annoying. Hitler was not anti-Semitic in his youth, he even worked for Jews before the First World War. However, it was during the First World War and after that he formulated his views on the Jews. His education in this film is also inaccurate, Hitler as a child was not a disturbed little brat. He had a more or less normal education. Nothing is mentioned about his lost brothers and other important pieces that contribute to the puzzle that is Hitler.

Robert Carlyle is a great actor, but he does not really fit into the role of Hitler. Hitler was not as impossible and unstable as he is portrayed here. In his younger years he was a charismatic person who "manipulated" people through his charms. His unstable behavior and outbursts of anger began in the turning point of the war.

I would like to see a film about Hitler's life, based on true historical facts and not on allegations. I really hate it, for example, when people blame Hitler and others for blaming and tell inaccurate stories, just to paint a picture of them as pure evil. It is much better to tell the story EXACTLY so that everyone can learn what it was like! Those behind this film should do some research before the creation. Because it seems like they do not even know what really happened. Hitler was not even shot dead during the revolutionary march in Munch, his shoulder was torn out of his socket.

There is more to see a good documentary than to see it.

summary: There are times when it's right and proper to simply bury the dead. This is not one of those times... Gram Parsons was one of the most influential musicians of his time; a bitter, brilliant, genius who knew Elvis, tripped with the Stones and fatally overdosed on morphine and tequila in 1973. And from his dying came a story. A story from deep within folklore; a story of friendship, honour and adventure; a story so extraordinary that if it didn't really happen, no one would believe it. Two men, a hearse, a dead rock star, five gallons of petrol, and a promise. And the most extraordinary chase of modern times.
translation: This movie was a real disappointment to me. I was a fan of Gram Parsons for a long time, and when I found out they were making a movie about him, I was very excited. I got the movie on VHS when it came out, and was disgusted with what I saw. The movie was not about his life but about the consequences of his death. I thought it was a descent of Gram's life and music, but they had to make a film about his death. I'm fed up with hearing about his death in books and movies, I wanted a movie about his life, not his notorious death. I was very disappointed. I wish people would look at his life, more than his death. The only good thing about this movie was its soundtrack. This movie is a disappointment for any Gram Parsons fan.

summary: Belle's Magical World comes to life in three charming fantasy adventures presented like chapters in a storybook. In The Perfect Word, a silly misunderstanding between Belle and the Beast leads to a lesson in forgiveness. Then, in Fifi's Folly, a romantic evening for Lumiere and Fifi snowballs into a thrilling plunge down the mountain in a runaway sleigh. In Broken Wing, Belle urges the Beast to free a tiny songbird as an act of kindness. Enriched with gentle lessons and two original songs that seamlessly fold one tale into the next.
translation:
Disney has now made straight to video sequels a good part of their many animated features. Two of them were made for their classic "Beauty and the Beast" from 1991. Well, these are not real sequels, since they are both located between the events of the first movie. The first of these two Direct Video Movies was "The Beauty and the Beast: The Enchanted Christmas," which some fans of their theater predecessor did not seem to enjoy, but I think that's usually going to happen with sequels. However, this second, "Belle's Magical World", is definitely inferior.

The film shows three short stories, all taking place while Belle is in the castle, and the place is mesmerized by the sorceress. The first is "The Perfect Word," where a misunderstanding at the table between Belle and the Beast causes trouble and none of the first apologizes. The next story is "Fifi's Folly," which marks the fifth birthday of Fifi and Lumiere, and Lumiere is unprepared, so Belle helps him. However, Fifi sees Lumiere practicing Belle with Belle and thinks that she is indeed in love. The film ends with "The Broken Wing". In this story, Belle looks after a bird with a broken wing, but a bird in the castle is likely to cause trouble when the animal finds out how he hates birds!

The plot I gave is for the original VHS version of Disney's third movie, Beauty and the Beast. Apparently the DVD version adds another story called "Mrs. Potts's Party", but I only saw the original version. However, as I very much doubt that a story would stand out as a classic over the rest, I see no point in seeing the special edition. Anyway, the first thing I'll say about "Belle's Magical World" is that the animation is very two-dimensional compared to what we are used to from Disney, which obviously would disappoint many people. I did not like "Beauty and the Beast: The Enchanted Christmas" so much, but you certainly can not say the same thing about its animation. I am sure that the stories in "Belles magical world" entertain many children (mostly younger, I think), and every story has a moral, so they can teach them valuable lessons. But for adults, the movie really does not have much. Personally, I was in no mood for it, finding that the constant conflict between Belle and the Beast became tiring, and the stories did not impress me at all (they are not very well written). In "The Perfect Word," Belle tells the beast, "You're being rude ... and stupid!" It's a bit cheesy, and I think there are a few other cheesy moments in these stories.

When this video came out, I was about eleven or twelve years old. I do not know what I thought about it at the time, since I had lost interest in Disney until then, and it would be years before I regained that interest. Even when this film was first released, I think I've gone a bit beyond the age group it was focused on. I saw "Beauty and the Beast: The Enchanted Christmas" just a few months ago, but unlike this movie, I've never heard of it until recently, I think, after watching the first installment of Disney's 1991 hit. Well, as much as I like the theatrical original, I would not have missed much if I had never noticed the existence of this film. For small children, I am sure that "Belle's Magical World" can be very entertaining and probably somewhat instructive with its moral, but I do not recommend it for adult Disney fans.

summary: The love which binds mother and daughter -- seen through the prism of one mother's life as it crests with optimism, navigates a turning point, and ebbs to its close. Overcome by the power of memory, Ann Lord reveals a long-held secret to her concerned daughters; Constance, a content wife and mother, and Nina, a restless single woman. Both are bedside when Ann calls out for the man she loved more than any other. But who is this "Harris," wonder her daughters, and what is he to our mother? While Constance and Nina try to take stock of Ann's life and their own lives, their mother is tended to by a night nurse as she journeys in her mind back to a summer weekend some fifty years before, when she was Ann Grant, a young woman who has come from New York City to be maid of honor at the high-society Newport wedding of her dearest friend from college, Lila Wittenborn. The bride-to-be is jittery, and turns to her maid of honor rather than her own mother for support. Ann stays close to her friend...
translation:
The story of a woman (Ann) on her deathbed, her two daughters (Nina and Constance) and their thoughts about their past. The flashbacks are about a weekend when young Ann is Lila at her girlfriend's wedding. At the wedding she meets Harris, who will influence her for the rest of her life. Through all the ups and downs of her work and family life, she remembers him as her true love. Her daughter Constance is older, "responsible," a mother of two, and has things together. Nina jumps from friend to friend and from job to job and is not sure about her direction in life.

Especially the good. The detail of the period in the movie is great. The clothes, hair, cars, houses, etc. really put you in another time and place. And there is very good quality in the movie. Vanessa Redgrave is pretty good at portraying the main character and her fragile state of mind as her life comes to an end. Claire Danes is beautiful and does a great job as a main character when she was young (and she is a great singer). Hugh Dancy has given life to the character of Lila's brother Buddy.

Bad, which unfortunately is everything else. Things are constantly disturbing the story of how it unfolds for us. The chemistry between the young Ann and Buddy is great. They have fun and dance. Then ... shall you believe that she no longer likes him as a friend and that his yearning only annoys her. And I thought the whole thing, "he could be gay," was out of the blue and served no purpose.

Then we have Harris. The character looks wooden and scary. Had that been another genre, you would have known Harris was a serial killer right from the start. It's an incredible stretch to think that all these girls loved him so much (but they make the other guys look pretty lame to help him out).

And the greatest problem of all. Why do not Ann and Harris get together? They fall for each other. You have this great night of sex in an old dirty gardening shack, come home to experience Buddy's tragic end and then ...

Nothing.

They meet a few years later, and all have been fogged and I could not help but wonder why. WHY? The movie does not let you know why they were forced to marry other people, so I had a hard time pitying them.

The part of the story in the present is pretty boring. The stereotype good daughter and the stereotype bad daughter. Nina changes the course of the movie, but I'm not sure why. I'm not sure what convinced her to change her life. There is a "touching" scene where the daughters meet, who agree with old Ann, who dreams that she is chasing a butterfly. It is really lame and embarrassing.

"There are no mistakes," Ann advises us. The statement does not match the story. And it does not sound true after watching the movie and I wish they had not wasted the talent of such good actors.

summary: During the Spanish Civil War, a republican courier travels to England to try and buy coal. He meets with an amount of local hostility, while his life is at risk from those on the fascist side. Support comes from an unlikely if attractive quarter.
translation: A film that dramatizes an understandable aversion to the inevitable arrival of World War II when a Spanish Republican sent by his soon overthrown government (Charles Boyer) interferes in England to seek support for his cause Affecting wealthy mine owners, not to sell the coal to the fascists in Spain. Annoying the locals, he is convincingly beaten in one scene, and faces a raging band of miners later in the film who see him as another threat to their shaky livelihood. Despite its socioeconomic hierarchy, xenophobia and world politics, this film skilfully deals with a dark and intriguing intrigue with unfaithful compatriots played by Katina Paxinou and Peter Lorre. Filmed in numerous darkly lit scenes in a drab hotel by James Wong Howe, he gets under his skin more than once.

summary: Christopher Knight, also known as Peter Brady of the '70s phenomenon, The Brady Bunch and Adrianne Curry the first-ever crowned America's Next Top Model first met and caught each others eye during VH1's Surreal Life 4. Now it is almost a year later and they are living together and in love! Their budding new romance is the topic of VH1's new reality show. Throughout the series, the cameras capture the everyday lives of these lovebirds as they try to juggle their love lives and working in Hollywood. Just like any other couple, right? Wrong. There is a twist to the plot. Although Chris loves Adrianne, the 47 year bachelor is reluctant to marry her. For 22 year old Adrianne it was love at first sight and she's ready for commitment. She has given him an ultimatum. Will Chris step up before she moves out?
translation: I do not watch a lot of TV and came across this show. Reality Show? I hope that's not real. If I were a man and had such a complainer and married to someone so snotty, that would be a reason to divorce. I think she's a bad example of how a person should treat a person she loves. This is one thing that is wrong with our world right now, so many people in bad relationships, selfish and do not know what it really means to truly love another. It is self-sacrificing and not something that should be merritt. This does not give you a very good feeling of watching what should be in private consultation. If his personality in the series is real, then he deserves someone who is much better, who shows true true love and care for him, and appreciates who he is. Is this show a reality or is it suitable for reviews? I would really like to know. Sincerely, GB

summary: A secret Service agent and a news reporter investigate the conspiracy behind the assassination of the President.
translation:
SPOILERS AHEAD

This is one of the worst movies of all time - it is as simple as that. There is not any quality of redemption about this film. The first 10 minutes are quite difficult - they actually lead you to believe that this movie will be shocking and will have you on the edge of your seat. Instead, spend 83 minutes beating yourself while seeing stolen and bad scenes without organization. The lake was ridiculous, looked like an aquarium and had the same plant in different parts of the lake bed. Characters show their advanced teleportation abilities, such as Alex Thomas, who falls drunk into the lake and then lands in an impossible position on his boat. Angie Harmon performed a miserable performance as Kate, aggravated by the space-time-continuum-rift dialogue written last minute by a fifth grader. An example of this would be when she said, "Flashlight!" in such a silly way that it shows the threshold of how much a human body can shrink before it locks in the middle. After all, editing this movie was by far the most bizarre and dreadful I've ever seen. It was as if the cameramen had been a bunch of chimpanzees that scientists had given camcorders. An example would be if we suddenly get a close-up of the headlight on Alex's car. I bet there was little or no time to edit this movie. The end was absolutely pathetic. Obviously, the authors were trying to create a sort of mysterious storylines that would make the viewer, "Oh yeah!" Instead, we look at a stupid spider that somehow fits in with the plot. Unfortunately, there is not a million-dollar perspective that could save this film from being a blackening crap.

I give this 0.5 out of 10, with the .5 coming from the fact that this movie was shot on film instead of becoming a storybook.

summary: Film version of playwright Tennessee Williams' "The Milk Train Doesn't Stop Here Anymore" involves very wealthy Flora 'Sissy' Goforth, supposedly dying, and living in a large mansion on a secluded island with her servants and nurses; into her life comes a mysterious man, Angelo Del Morte and "the Witch of Capri." The mysterious man may or may not be "The Angel of Death".
translation: Is the rich, ill Elizabeth Taylor, who wants to court the Angel of Death on her island fortress in the Mediterranean, or is she exaggerating her - or, more precisely, exaggerating her - as always? In fact, both are adequately titled in Director Joseph Losey's wandering, meandering mess called "Boom," as the minds in the lush, luxurious setting are almost ready to explode. Richard Burton climbs up Taylor's mountain uninvited; She dresses him in a samurai robe with saber. Although it looks great in widescreen format, the picture is otherwise quite deadly, an omission that even Liz 'n Dick-philes should avoid (the group of stars, what the hell!), Achieved in their film careers of the late 60s an ego Madness Nadir here). Meaningless, confused and irritating, "boom" is a disaster - though screenwriter Tennessee Williams, who has adapted his own fruitless piece, "The Milk Train Does not Stop Here," is said to quite like it! * from ****

summary: In a world destroyed in a war between man and machine, a hand-stitched doll with the number 9 written on its back comes to life. The world he has awakened in is frightening, but he quickly learns that he is not alone and that there are others like him, also with a single digit written on their back. The first one he encounters is 2 who tells him something of what happened to the world. 2 is also thrilled with the disk 9 is carrying, one with three unique symbols on the front. 9 soon learns that the disk and some of the other dolls who are prepared to die for the good of humankind may be the last hope for man's salvation.
translation:
I used to think that movies require plots or other means to even worry about the plot or anything that is going on. This movie has shown me that you do not have to have such a thing.

I could just put it that way. But IMDb wants me to have more lines. It was kind of pretty. not necessarily in the least. The way the characters talk in the movie makes you think that it should have happened in a few days, but there's no time, and I'm pretty sure everything will happen in an hour.

If you're looking to talk, buy a gallon of milk and see how fast you can drink it before you vomit. It would be a much better use of your time. Time you will never get again. Jurassic Park 3 was better played than this movie.

summary: The murder of a cop in 1968 is reopened when a dying jailbird makes a deal with the police in order to get released earlier and tells them that he found drugs in the victim's car.
translation:
Over the years, I've seen a few cold-case episodes, starting with Season 1 episodes in 2003-2004. And though most were good, this particular episode was not only the best of the best, but also has few rivals in the Emmy categories. Although some do not agree with the content of the story (ie, the relationship between man and man), I doubt anyone could see that without being deeply moved in their minds.

The story is essentially about a case reopened based on the testimony of a dying drug trafficker. The two key players in the 1960s are two police officers named Sean Coop (aka the cold Fallopfer bearing his surname Coop) and his partner Jimmy Bruno.

In the story, Coop Single, Vietnam veterinarian, is having a deeply troubled past. Jimmy, however, is married, with children no less. Both are partners in the police and not only form a friendship, but also a secret love affair, both of which must hide from a profound and obviously homophobic culture.

The flashback scenes of her life are mostly in black and white, with occasional splashes of color. Examples include the red police car, the yellow curtains on the window in Jimmy's bedroom, where Jimmy's wife watched Coop and Jimmy drinking in an alcoholic state arguing and kissing. I found it interesting that only selected items were colored in the flashback scenes, everything else in black and white. I still have not figured out the color scheme and the reasons for it.

The clearly homophobic tension between colleagues and the two main players only increases the intensity of the episode. An important emotional scene was when Coop was confronted with his father after the christening of Jimmy's baby. In this scene, Coop's father, Sarge, who was a respected military officer, confronts Coop over the rumors about Coop's relationship with Jimmy. One can be sorry for Coop, at the time when Coop's father's shame and shame on Coop was heaped on her - "You will not embarrass our family ... and you're not my son." - Clear reference to the hostile views of same-sex relations of this epoch.

Additional tension can also be seen in the police gown, in the Coop and another officer after Coop and Jimmy with the inscription "Batman and Robin Homos".

As for the relationship between Coop and Jimmy, it is obvious that Coop wanted more of Jimmy in his life. Once you can see the tension in Jimmy's face when he has to choose between his devotion to his wife and children, his church and yet his undying devotion to Coop.

In the end, Jimmy leaves Coop, aware that he can not have Coop and his family at the same time. Sadly, Coop is being killed, perhaps because of his relationship with Jimmy, but Coop may also have been killed for his knowledge of drug money and police corruption, which was higher in the troop.

The most moving scene Throughout the episode, Coop, as he died from gunshot wounds in his patrol car, softly said his last words about his police radio to his partner: "Jimmy ... we were the lucky ones not that. "

The soundtrack selection was outstanding throughout the episode. I enjoyed the closing scene with actor Chad Everett playing the still grieving Jimmy, who is now much older and clearly misses his former partner Coop.

I recommend this episode and consider it the best. It's without a doubt the best written, well played and well done of all the Cold Case episodes I've ever seen.

summary: A movie that starts out with the "Man in the Mirror" music video, it then changes to a montage of video clips of Michael's career. Next comes a parody of his Bad video by children, and then Michael is chased by fans in a fantasy sequence. 2 more videos are shown, and then a movie in which Michael plays a hero with magical powers. In it he is chased by drug dealer Mr. Big and saves three children. Videos included in the movie are "Smooth Criminal" and "Come Together".
translation: I saw this for the first time when they showed the 1993/4 around Easter and did not think much of it. I bought it on DVD last year when I started to meet Michael Jackson (I liked his music earlier) and enjoyed it more now. I'm older. It's a good movie, but it's not going to be that classic movie like The Sound Of Music, West Side Story, the Wizard of Oz, etc. Michael Jackson as an actor was good and so were the other performers. There were disturbing scenes like the little girl Katie beaten by gangster Frankie Video, played by Joe Pesci. The scene that scared me when I was younger was when Michael turned into a robot. My favorite song on the movie was Smooth Criminal I think it was better than Thriller in my opinion.

summary: Executive transvestite Eddie Izzard takes his show to San Francisco to give a brief history of pagan and Christian religions, the building of Stonehenge, the birth of the Church of England and of Western empires, and the need for a European dream. Along the way, he dramatizes Dr. Heimlich's search for a maneuver, the naming of Engelbert Humperdinck, Scooby and Shaggy as archetypes, Neil Armstrong on the moon, society's tolerance of mass murderers, how we sing anthems and carols, Hollywood adapting British films, JFK's trip to Berlin, thoughts on puberty, and how to work schoolbook-French phrases into Parisian conversation. Closeups catch the glint in his eye and his carefully-applied make-up.
translation: funny. funny. intelligent. ingenious. I dumped the canals a few years ago a night ago. came across this and a wildfire began. I stayed up late every night, tapping it for everyone I know. a few. like 3 people from the nearly 100 people I watched, did not think that it was as great as me. the others laughed so loud that they cried and thanked each other. Please do yourself a favor. Run not run. look at this and enjoy it. Intelligence and humor. It's a win-win situation. I wish I could have an afternoon tea with him and meet the really rare comedian we need as a company more than ... Sane Chaos.

summary: Three girls, each about 15, deal with puberty, the onset of sexual attraction, and, for two, the pressure of virginity. Marie, who's slight and diffident, quiet and nearly expressionless, is friends with Anne, who's a bit chunky and impulsive and has decided that Fran√ßois will be her first love. Watching synchronized swimming, Marie is suddenly attracted to the team captain, Floriane, beautiful, aloof, tall, and rumored to be a slut. Fran√ßois pursues her. Marie begins to hang around her; they trade favors, and soon it's an odd sort of friendship. Each of the three experiences her own first, and Marie must sort out attraction and friendship.
translation: In the areas in which they overlap, this good film is light years ahead of the 2004 Innocence, which gave the impression of a rough-eyed and heavily breathing young girl. Here the effect is much more realistic and really invades the minds of the three protagonists as they sneak through a youth traversed by pitfalls. The three principals, all unknown to me, make very confident appearances, perhaps so natural that it becomes difficult for them to repeat that quality of acting in other films, so I would not be too surprised if they did not hear again become. It would be nice if this would get away from the Art Houses and to the multiplexes, where there is only an outward chance that it "speaks" to the bubble gum crowd to whom it is not aligned.

summary: A girl, whose mother dies of sorrow from her husband's family's rejection, grows up singing and dancing like her mother. She works as a dancing girl and is courted by a prince, but can think only of a man she has never met, who left her a message on the train. She dreams of him and cannot dance, becomes frightened and runs into the night
translation:
Without a doubt, this film must be one of the biggest ... in film history. I've watched it too often to remember, and every time it's like seeing the movie for the first time.

Where do you start?

Meena Kumari's Center Performance is undoubtedly one of the best in her career, closely followed by Sahib Bibi aur Ghulam and Phool aur Pathar. Every movement and nuance of their performance makes any other Bollywood heroine fall back into importance. Her masterful interpretation of Kathak, coupled with her grace, tragic vulnerability and poetic delivery of Urdhu, is like nothing that has ever been seen on the Bollywood canvas.

Pakeezah is perhaps the most stylized interpretation of the human condition; The photography, the magnificent cinematography and staging are so charged with symbolism and meaning that the viewer is breathless.

Naushad's music is second to none, his knowledge of Gharana's courtesan music is unbelievable, and the way he punctuates the narrative with dark atmospheric motifs and overwhelming romantic melodies is indeed remarkable.

My only advice to anyone seriously enjoying the spectacle of total cinema should be to watch this epic mediation life and art.

summary: Roddy is a decidedly upper-crust "society mouse" who lives the life of a beloved pet in a posh Kensington flat. When a sewer rat named Sid comes spewing out of the sink and decides he's hit the jackpot, Roddy schemes to rid himself of the pest by luring him into the "whirlpool." Sid may be an ignorant slob, but he's no fool, so it is Roddy who winds up being flushed away into the bustling sewer world of Ratropolis. There Roddy meets Rita, an enterprising scavenger who works the sewers in her faithful boat, the Jammy Dodger. Roddy immediately wants out, or rather, up; Rita wants to be paid for her trouble; and, speaking of trouble, the villainous Toad - who royally despises all rodents equally, making no distinction between mice and rats--wants them iced... literally. The Toad dispatches his two hapless hench-rats, Spike and Whitey, to get the job done. When they fail, the Toad has no choice but to send to France for his cousin - that dreaded mercenary, Le Frog.
translation:
From the creators of Shrek ???????? .. OK, that got my attention.

Now the creators of Shrek have also made Madagascar. Madagascar was half as good as Shrek.

And now Flushed Away is half as good as Madagascar.

That means Flushed Away is not good. The animation and all the special effects were extremely good, but the movie was not.

The story of this movie was for kids only. It is really not possible for adults to actually love this strip.

But there were many jokes that are meant for adults. I bet kids do not understand the jokes.

Nevertheless I like this strip.

I am completely disappointed. 4.10

summary: Georges has Down's syndrome, living at a mental-institution. Harry is a busy businessman, giving lectures for young aspiring salesmen. He is successful in his business life, but his social life is a disaster since his wife left him and took their two children with her. This weekend his children came by train to meet him, but Harry, working as always, forgot to pick them up. Neither his wife nor his children want to see him again and he is driving around on the country roads, anguished and angry. He almost runs over Georges, on the run from the institution since everybody else went home with their parents except him, whose mother is dead. Harry tries to get rid of Georges but he won't leave his new friend. Eventually a special friendship forms between the two of them, a friendship which makes Harry a different person.
translation:
Although the plot elements seem to "The Eighth Day" as if they have been done many times, the film still has much of the spark, mystery and symbolism that Jaco Van Dormal's first film had. Although it is not as good as "Toto the hero", which will always be on my favorites list, the film still leaves a lot of emotions. Daniel Auteil, from the distasteful "The Closet" of 2001, plays down his role and is afraid of playing too much (rightly, the role could have been ruined if the actor were too dramatic). However, I felt that the part was a bit more realistic and focused more on the character itself than on the character's growth.

Do not go into this movie and expect the dark humor and the unexpected twists You have "Toto the hero" because you will be disappointed. However, the film still serves as a decent, if not faulty film

summary: Disillusioned and temporarily rudderless, John Woodson is about to experience a dramatic and profound metamorphosis. Through a mysterious set of coincidences, he finds himself on an adventure to Peru in search of ancient scrolls, known as the Celestine Prophecy. The prophecy and its nine key insights, predict a new awakening that redefines human life and provides a glimpse into a completely spiritual culture on earth. Resistant at first, skeptical and unsure, John finds that each step he takes, each person he encounters leads him to a new awakening. It is only in this letting go that he finds his destiny and comes to understand the meaning that had escaped him when his adventure began.
translation:
I have just watched this movie and have not read the book. The good thing about the movie is that in some places you think for a while about the spiritual theme, evolution, sensuality and your role in the world.

However, the immersion of the film is easy to break and there is very little relationship between the viewer and the characters. It is very clear that the book loses a lot in this movie version. The events that should show sincronicity are almost unrecognizable. For the viewer, a lot of thought has to be given to whether the scene indicates a coincidence, and more, that it has something to do with a bigger purpose.

Enlightenment scenes are visually poor and do not create the better feeling it should. Do you remember the enlightenment with Keanu Reeves (in Little Buddha)? Well, that's not true.

Most scenes are poorly executed. There are many scenes that really do not develop the story and also do not help create an atmosphere.

The better actors in this movie, namely Hector Elizondo, Joaquim de Almeida and J√ºrgen Prochnow, can not save it. The first 2 seem to have gotten more scenes than their characters to save the movie, and because they paid more, but that does not work. Most scenes are not really necessary and do not help the story at all.

J√ºrgen does well in his scenes and sells himself as a bad guy (as always), but the script does not help him with it all. The scene in which he tries to convince John (Matthew Settle) to join him is just a bad script. The execution of the scene, when he dies in an explosion, is performed absurdly bad. The flashbacks during the movie can not even be commented on.

Overall, this movie is a big time bale, read the book! I did not read it, but it's probably a billion times better than that, it has to be.

It's so bad that I had to write my first comment in IMDb.

summary: A scientist taints his mother's scientific experiment with his own drug that transforms pain into a pleasurable experience. Unfortunately for the three women involved in the experiment, the drug works a little bit too well.
translation:
Well. That was no surprise. many people will tell you that is bloody. but they are all talking about "Shiztz" this movie is very slow.

It starts with a guy who makes a concoction feel no pain he calls it "my son" there are some bloody scenes, but I I found her somehow weak.
