look at this, if you want the 20-10 minutes final scene, which is still not great and has a random scene of the guy trying to rape his mother .. yeah it is funny.

summary: In 1912, Quentin E. Deverill, an eccentric expatriate American professor, uses his unique skills to solve mysteries in London.
translation: I can not remember many details about the show, but I remember how passionate I was about it and how I was determined not to miss any episodes. Unfortunately, we did not have a VCR at the time, so I never saw the show again. However, I can clearly remember how I felt when I saw it and how thrilled I was every time it happened. Sam Waterstone was my favorite actor these days (I think I was almost in love) and he remains one of my favorite actors of the day, mainly because of his appearance on the show. I would like to buy / steal / download this series, I think I would try very hard to see it again and to go back to a long-forgotten childhood ... any ideas? Does anyone know a website dedicated to the series or has the episodes on tape from their first broadcast?

summary: Arthur Sailes must have the courage to marry his beloved Ben Sheets and stand against the obstacles that face him. His brother, Victor, a devout Christian, plans to get himself reinstated into the church after they throw him out because his brother, Arthur, is gay.
translation:
I do not know what this film director Sam Mraovich is all about. I would normally say that this is a movie that should not exist, but this movie could be the most important of all times. This movie should only exist for the purpose of being without a doubt "The Worst Movie Ever Made". I've seen bad movies in my life, but that somehow breaks what I thought was bad into something hard to imagine.

Everything in this movie is hilarious, but the only funniest thing is this Mraovich himself thinks it's a great movie.

Oh wow ...

summary: A cop on vacation at a mountain resort comes to the rescue when the resort is taken over by violent criminals.
translation:
Maverick policeman with family problems and preference for his weapon ?? Check! Isolated location with valuable object asking for theft? Check! Tasty-looking love interest? Check! Assorted band of silly cardboard cannon lining rogues with dodgy European accents? Check! German-sounding evil guy played by an English actor with a piece of cheesy dialogue for every occasion? Check! Corny One liner ?? Check!

Deary me, does this movie take the little bit or what? The clich√©s are as thick and fast as an avalanche and most of the performers just stand around wondering how bad the script is!

In a blatantly cheap and cheerful direct shot to the video rip-off of The Hard On a Mountain (complete with some notched lines from the above) we have all the usual action-movement clich√©s is counted bit by bit, while we are thrown along with some good old-fashioned violence and nudity to wake someone up in the audience who may just have nodded off.

Jack Wild is the cop in full on John McClane's mode here, who even makes time for the old villain with the gun, has used all his bullets to pinch a point.

Look up these three pounds from the supermarket bargain box on IMDb. I am amazed that this dud had produced not one, but two sequels. I have to find these gems on DVD! It looks like the first sequel is a rip-off of Under Siege 2 and the second sequel, well, God knows! One thing that's always a bad sign is that the actor playing Jack changes with every movie and even the character's name seems to change for the third installment.

Still, blind purchases of cheap DVDs would not be the same, even if the studios did not constantly trudge material of that dreadful quality !!

summary: When 21-year-old Leo, the oldest of four brothers, announces to his rural French family that he's HIV+ family bonds are tested. The family decides that 11-year-old Marcel, the youngest, is too young to understand, and the family agrees to keep the unsettling news from him. Marcel overhears enough to understand that something amiss with Leo and when the two travel to Paris together, Marcel confronts Leo with what he suspects.
translation:
This movie was in my collection for a while, but it was not before a friend of mine remembered me? until I decided that I should take a look at it. I did not know much about Close to Leo? just that it should be an excellent coming out movie and it is a very serious topic? AIDS.

Although the person who has help ?? is Leo? The scenario describes the way in which Marcel (Leo's youngest brother) struggles with the illness of his relative. First everyone tries to hide the truth from Marcel. one believes that he is too young to understand his brother's illness? The fact that Leo is also a homosexual contributes to the parents' unwillingness to deal with the young Marcel. I know from experience that on many occasions most older people do not want to accept the fact that even when one is young, this does not automatically mean that they are unable to accept reality and, in a proper way, even themselves to act. Except for the fact that the family tried to hide Marcel's truth, did they make a big impression on me ?? how did you support your son? even after discovering the truth about his sexuality and illness. The fact that they allowed the young Marcel to travel to Paris with Leo to meet his ex-boyfriend was quite a gesture from them? most of the families I know will be reluctant to do so. There is a lot of warmth in the scenes where the brothers spend some time together? You can see that they are real friends, taking care of each other.

Close to Leo is an excellent drama that I can highly recommend

summary: Aida, featuring the actress Sophia Loren, is a film adaptation of a theatre performance written by Verdi. The plot revolves around the character Radames who falls in love with what he thinks is a slave in a country his armies has conquered. The young woman is actually the daughter of the leader he ousted.
translation:
I suppose this movie is relevant today because it was an early Sofia Loren movie. She was 19 years old when the movie was shot in 1953.

I saw this movie because I wanted to see some of Sofia Loren's early work. I was surprised when she came to the camera after her skin was browned in brown makeup to resemble an Ethiopian princess. Sure, today this would be considered a bow and avoided in filmmaking. It actually became annoying to see Ms. Loren in skin color throughout the movie.

Yes, this movie would have been done better if the real opera singers made this movie. Then the vocals and the actual facial gestures of the real artists would have been obvious. I discount the comments of others, if the real opera singers are older and heavier.

As beautiful as Ms. Loren was at the age of 19 and still is today, the movie would have been shot better than even though it was played on stage. After all, we do not see any beautiful young people singing on stage with "old opera singers" behind the scenes behind the curtain! Do not be shy about the success of using heavy opera singers. All you need to do is refer to the most artistically produced commercial for the J. G. Wentworth Company, where the opera singers on stage so professionally sing the praise of the company's product. This is one of the best and most entertaining TV commercials ever produced.

The quality of film printing also makes this production a little worse. The color ink has faded a lot and that can not be helped.

To improve this movie on DVD, the production company should add English subtitles so that we, who do not speak Italian, can know what the text is saying. It would help the story and teach it more than the narrator 30 seconds introduction to the scenes.

Do not watch this movie because of the story of Aida or the fact that this is an opera. Apart from Ms. Sofia Loren, none of her co-actors is known or remembered by this author. Instead, watch this movie if you are a fan of Ms. Loren and wish to see her at the age of 19, regardless of production.

Larry from Illinois

summary: Legendary poet, singer/songwriter and alleged ladies man Leonard Cohen is interviewed in his L.A. home about his extraordinary life and times, interspersed with old footage from his private photo collection and lavish praise plus elaborately performed Cohen cover songs from a motley crew of colleague musicians, amongst whom Kate & Anna McGarrigle, Rufus & Martha Wainwright, Nick Cave, Jarvis Cocker and U2's Bono and The Edge. By way of dessert the latter two and their band mates even get to back up the man for a special performance of his own.
translation: This movie should have been only 10 minutes. I mean, in this thing there is really only 10 minutes worth of content (I even hesitate to call it a movie). The opening credits of the film was promising. Since the film starts with brief comments from the man himself, you really rub your hands and stay tuned for more shots of Cohen's life. Well, Nick Cave does a decent job for one of Cohen's famous songs. The length of Cave's Performance makes you even more eager to see more of Cohen whose wit and well-spoken words have tickled you already. But, as it turns out, Cave's performance is just the beginning of lengthy, boring performances by literally a group of no-one who does not even have the slightest attraction to keep you in place. I mean, what does the filmmaker really think? Five minutes of close-ups of would-be singers in a fake concert in Australia !!! What does the filmmaker think to offend the public by adding "false applause" to these endless, mean performances? The film is a perfect torture that shows you very little of what you have seen. There is not a single footage of Cohen's past. Apart from some photos of his early days as a singer / poet there is absolutely nothing! If you add up all the minutes that Cohen speaks, you may not even reach 10 minutes. But these 10 minutes are treacherously presented between the catastrophic camera work that is being held by some of the most unattractive people who scream Cohen's lyrics. If you ever decided to waste your money on this movie, DO NOT! Just throw it in the trash and save yourself at least time.

summary: Mulder and Scully investigate a series of bizarre deaths, all of which involved healthy young adults who died of massive coronaries after having sexual intercourse. Mulder believes the heart attacks were brought on by massive amounts of pheromones though Scully is somewhat skeptical. The geographic distribution of the murders leads them to Massachusetts and a religious cult known as the Kindred. The sect allows them into the group provided they surrender their weapons. They are also upset to learn that one of them may be committing murders in the outside world. They have a secret however, one that will astound the open-minded Mulder.
translation: Gender Bender does something for the X-Files. This episode has an interesting premise, a good story, but an end that's missing. Gender Bender is also the X-Files debut for actor Nicholas Lea, better known as Alex Krycek. In this episode he plays Michael, a man who was attacked by one of "The Kindred". You have to see this episode just to see Nic Lea's less spectacular debut. An interesting thing about the "power of seduction" of Kindred. When Marty does it to his victims, they turn to him. But when Andrew seduces Scully, she's just disoriented and dizzy and is not attracted to Andrew. Maybe it's because Marty has more experience than Andrew. This episode reminds me why it was sometimes unfortunate to film in British Columbia. Throughout the episode, it's so wet, muddy and muddy that it would not have been much fun. Despite the disappointing ending, Gender Bender is still a decent episode.

summary: Wang Bianlian is an aging street performer known as the King of Mask for his mastery of Sichuan Change Art in a true story. His wife left him with and infant son over 30 years ago. The son died from illness at age 10. This left Wang a melancholy loner aching for a male descendent to learn his rare and dying art. A famous master performer of the Sichuan Opera offers to bring him into his act, thus giving Wang fame and possible fortune, but Wang opts for staying the simple street performer. Then, one night after a performance he is sold a young boy by a slave trader posing as the boy's parent. "Grandpa" finds new joy in life as he plans to teach "Doggie" (an affectionate term often used for young children in China) his art. All is well until Doggie is found out to really be a girl.
translation:
King of Masks is a shockingly beautiful and deeply moving film. The film is based on a true story and has won 16 awards from around the world. The focus is on Wang Bianlian, a street artist in 1930s China who gets older but has no successor to pass on his face-changing art. He has a unique talent for quickly switching masks in performance and no one knows how he does it. He longs to have a grandson because his art is a family heirloom that can only be passed on to a male heir. We then go out on the street and see people selling their children because they can not afford to take care of them: some even beg for their daughters to be taken for nothing, because daughters in this society are not worth much. Wang Bianlian's story continues from there.

The movie was so amazingly good, the acting was amazing, and the issues were so weighty and well addressed. There is inequality between the sexes and the depressing fact that no one wants a little girl in this time and place. Interestingly, the famous opera actor who always plays a woman and is known as the Living Bodhisattva is a man who dresses as a woman, and while he is famous and respected, he sees himself as a lowly, half-woman. As we move further into the movie, the issues of the human slave trade and its demand and thus the lack of a possible solution to it, face the brutality and corruption of the military and police and the helplessness and lack of power that each individual can face due to unfortunate events or even good intentions.

This is definitely one of the best movies I've ever seen in my life, and Xu Zhu, the actor who plays Wang Bianlian, presents another beautiful performance.

summary: When a body is found in the New Orleans docks, it's pretty obvious that he died from gun shot wounds. The police surgeon notices that the man is also displaying other symptoms and Lt. Commander Clint Reed, a doctor with the U.S. Public Health Service, diagnoses a highly contagious disease, pneumonic plague. He tries to convince local officials to find everyone who may have been in contact with the dead man. The Mayor supports his efforts but many, including the police, are doubtful. Reed wants to avoid publicity so as not to panic the public. They have little information to go on - they don't know the dead man's identity - and Reed estimates they have 48 hours before disease begins to spread. With police Capt. Tom Warren going through the motions, Reed sets out to find the killers.
translation: Kazan's early film Noir won an Oscar. Some of the reviews here are very detailed and detailed on the film and its symbolism and rate it very high. I can almost see where they come from. But I prefer to make a long-forgotten film, which was apparently filmed without budget and documentary, a little weaker. In the streets of New Orleans, the lung plague is going on, and it is the job of a military doctor (Widmark) and a city detective (Douglas) to arrest the main transporter (Palance). The film is moody, recorded in strong black and white and uses places very well. Widmark is wonderful as always. Forget the symbolism (crime equals illness and disease equals crime) and just enjoy the hunt. It is not always easy to see a movie like this, now that we are in this new century, because it is of a particular style that was very short-lived (after the Second World War to the early fifties) and probably not for laymen will be interesting movie observers. For those who will see this for the first time, commit to the big chase in the end. It's different, and honestly, I do not know how they filmed it. I can say that it probably took just as long to film the finale as the first 90 percent of the movie.

summary: Arthur is a happy drunk with no pretensions at any ambition. He is also the heir to a vast fortune which he is told will only be his if he marries Susan. He does not love Susan, but she will make something of him the family expects. Arthur proposes but then meets a girl with no money who he could easily fall in love with.
translation: I have loved this movie since its 1981 debut! I've lost track of how many times I've seen it! It always makes me laugh or cheer when I feel depressed. The three leads are awesome and the script is priceless, and how do you not get nostalgic when listening to the theme song? I think, I pull this movie without realizing it. I know the whole script, so if anyone sees it for the first time, I have to hold back and say something about how funny the next line is. I can not even narrow it down, though, Sir John's character is probably the most memorable. The famous "I'll alert the media", when Arthur announces his intention to take a bath, is still priceless, but the list is truly endless. The scene with Arthur, who will soon be the father's fianc√©'s house, is a hoot, especially his interactions with the moose. Do yourself a favor and watch this movie!

summary: When Holly (Amanda Bynes) is 16, her father takes a job in Japan and she moves in with her strait-laced sister Valerie (Jennie Garth) in New York City. Val finally has both a great career and a great boyfriend in a carefully organized life on the Upper West Side when Holly moves in and tries to become a part of her sister's fabulous life.
translation:
I just started watching the TV series "What I like about you" and I have to say that it's a pleasure to see them. I'm always happy that new shows are going well considering that many shows go out before you can really get a feel for them. I've seen Amanda Bynes since "All That", she's really a funny girl, what's the best part about her comedy is that it's so natural and what I mean by that, it's something a person here tells her best friend could not be rehearsed.

I just started seeing the show and fell in love. I'm just looking at repetitions, but I'm looking forward to the next season. All characters in the show give the whole story something. It's nice to see an old face from other shows I've enjoyed in the past, like Jennie Garth from "90210", Leslie Grossman from "Popular" and Wesley Jonathan from "City Guys". The New Character are also very talented, Nick Zano has the charm that you love him, even if he did something wrong (Bynes).

Overall, this show has the right ingredients to succeed. I'm looking forward to seeing it grow.

summary: The story of a seven-year-old mischievous orphan boy named Junior. He is hardly a model child; mean-spirited and incorrigible. One day, he is adopted by a loving man along with his obnoxious wife named Ben Healy and Flo Healy. Ever since Junior comes into their lives, he turns ordinary days into full-scale comic nightmares! He also leaves a path of serious destruction in his wake, and is even pen pals with Martin Beck (A.K.A. The Bow Tie Killer, a notorious serial killer who kidnaps his faithful correspondent, along with Flo). And now it's up to Ben as he undertakes a rescue mission to get Junior back from Beck before he plans on hurting him.
translation: I have to admit that I caught this a couple of times in the USA Network. There is only something in the, well, stupidity of this strip that makes me want to see it whenever it runs. Yes, you are right with the subpar action, the act that only a seven year old might like, etc. But I can not help but sympathize with some actors. On the other hand, some of these actors have signed up for the even crueler sequel.

summary: In a 1950's mining town called Coalwood, Homer Hickam is a kid with only one future in sight, to work in the local coal mine like his father. However in October 1957, everything changes when the first artificial satellite, Sputnik goes into orbit. With that event, Homer becomes inspired to learn how to build rockets. With his friends and the local nerd, Homer sets to do just that by trial and a lot of error. Unfortunately, most of the town and especially Homer's father thinks that they are wasting their time. Only one teacher in the high school understands their efforts and lets them know that they could become contenders in the national science fair with college scholarships being the prize. Now the gang must learn to perfect their craft and overcome the many problems facing them as they shoot for the stars.
translation: This is a gem, a real piece of Americana for all that this includes. If you yourself are programmed to resist "life-affirming" stories, just stay away and leave it to the rest of us who still believe. And what makes the icing on the cake really delicious is the fact that it's based on a true tale of rags-to-millionaire, without having to apologize for the details that have been changed to make a compact story. Chris Cooper is one of the greatest live actors, and the complex, self-contradictory goodness of the core father he portrayed could only be made successful by someone with his skills and insights. The simple-minded comments that refuse to accept a father trying to break the law while sensing that he may not be on the line expose the limitation of the commentator, not the scribe or the acting. This is not for the cynics or the simple ones.

summary: The Maclean brothers, Paul and Norman, live a relatively idyllic life in rural Montana, spending much of their time fly fishing. The sons of a minister, the boys eventually part company when Norman moves east to attend college, leaving his rebellious brother to find trouble back home. When Norman finally returns, the siblings resume their fishing outings, and assess both where they've been and where they're going.
translation:
One of the things about the movie that warmed my heart strings was that dry fly fishing was a major part of the scene. I occasionally did my dry fly fishing, tied my own flies, and, with my brother and dad, spent a day on one or the other river, getting the elusive brook trout to get up and take the fly offered to them.

When we had such opportunities, the differences between us disappeared, and every pressure of the world melted away to be replaced by fame, to be absorbed in the activity and life of the place, in we were.

This was one of the amazing things I was told in the movie when the pastor and his two sons, Norman and Pauly, performed the ritual. Because when fly fishing there is something ritual, because there are so many games ritual. You can not just throw your fishing line and hope for the best. You'll need to adjust to where you are, scan in the surface of the water, considering how it's flowing and where the best point might be to place your fly and, depending on your skill, you could even your fly to land there long enough for a fish to notice and strike. The "art of fly fishing" has been so well steered and represented that they themselves can be classified as artists.

The title of the film could not be chosen more aptly, because the river actually went through the life of father and two sons. However, this film is spreading wider than the family and community in Montana, on the Blackfoot River, where the movie is being played. It has the ability to involve you, inspire you, captivate you as the family, community and time story unfolds. The narrated story is not just a family story, but a story of life. What can be classified as the "flow of life"

summary: Biographical movie about the famous rock singer Elvis Presley.
translation: Kurt Russell's chameleon-like performance, paired with John Carpenter's flawless filmmaking, undoubtedly makes it one of the best boob tube bios ever aired. It also holds: The emotional foundation is strong enough that it will never age; Carpenter has preserved the power and ultimate sharpness of the life of the single King of Rock'n'Roll for posterity. (I was a Borderline Elvis fan most of my life, but it was not until I saw this amazingly moving movie that I saw BEYOND contemplate the image of the man himself. It was a revelation.) ELVIS remains one of the top ten TV movies of all time.

summary: In the first sequel to Tarzan, the Ape Man, Harry Holt returns to Africa to head up a large ivory expedition. This time he brings his womanizing friend Marlin Arlington. Holt also harbors ideas about convincing Jane to return to London. When Holt and Arlington show Jane some of the modern clothes and perfumes they brought from civilization, she is impressed but not enough to return. Tarzan wrestles every wild animal imaginable to protect Jane but when he disallows the expedition from plundering ivory from the elephant burial grounds, it is he who takes a bullet from Arlington's gun. Jane eventually believes that Tarzan is dead but he is nursed back to health by the apes. As Jane and the returning expedition are attacked by violent natives, we wonder if Tarzan can rescue them yet again.
translation:
I recommend watching this movie with your partner if you are planning a romantic evening with him. The chemistry between Johnny Weissmuller and Maureen O'Sullivan as Tarzan and Jane is so oppressive that it could fog your screen.

After the original film we start to see how Tarzan and Jane adapted to the jungle and each other. Jane's terse jungle attire and Tarzan's protest, as Jane hides her visitors, illuminate that they are not only romantic but also sexually in love.

The imagination can be the constant touching and love conversation between Tarzan & Jane to illustrate how much Jane Tarzan teaches love emotionally, romantically and sexually. And Jane's student is not only hugging, but thrives on his unprecedented sexuality.

The skin show in this movie is not in the charts. In addition to Jane's two-piece sexy waist, leg and hip baring costume, she also has an underwater nude swim with Tarzan. (Although it's not O'Sullivan, but the Olympic swimmer Josephine McKim, who doubles for them in this scene) Weissmuller also shows a huge body and perfect chest muscles in his barely present loincloth. The ladies will be happy when Weissm√ºller emerges from the water after his long fight with the giant crocodile and lets out his cry - with his water-soaked loincloth he literally falls off his hips.

It is a shame that the over-protection censors have toned down the adult nature of Tarzan films after this entry. Although the Weissmuller Tarzan films would still flourish in the coming years, they would barely approach the sex appeal of this film.

summary: A group of guys capture a young girl with the intent of hurting her. They torture her in many ways, from beating her to putting a sharp piece of needle-like metal through her eye which pierces across her retina.
translation:
Many people like this series unfairly, but some of Guinea Pig's videos are pretty entertaining. Devil's experiment, in particular, has some truly fantastic effects - not just the infamous eyeball scene, but also a very realistic skin on the foot and a hand slamming with a sledgehammer are very realistic - especially for the vintage and low budget of the videos.

Let me start now for those who do not know: This film is an "extreme" torture / counterfeiting snuff movie that appeared in Japan in the mid-1980s. The story is simple: a young girl is being held by a few men and forced to brutally torture herself to see where her break point lies. This brings with it brutal violence - all realistic effects including those mentioned in the last paragraph, as well as a painful-looking application of hot oil to the trapped girl's arm and the insertion of maggots into the subsequent flaky wound.

The least effective sequences are at the very beginning of the video and consist of an unconvincing slap session, in which three men take turns banging their heads and a second sequence in which the three Men take turns kicking the girl and pushing her to the floor. These two scenes are obviously staged and diminish the realism of the rest of the process.

The actress who plays the victim of the "experiment" is quite convincing in having pain and takes a lot of it with abuse and gross things in front of the camera. Her reactions, how she strapped headphones to her head and loud noises for hours are played, are frightening. Some of the other maltreatments she takes are suspended in a net from a tree during the only time they rest. There is also a disturbing scene in which the giggling kidnappers go through their bowels and another nasty greasy scene where they spin in an office chair and are forced to drink a bottle of Jack Daniels until they puke.

If you have not seen this series. I hope I helped you decide if you want to give this episode a chance or not. 8.5 / 10 for Devil's experiment.

summary: The Hennessy clan -- mother Cate, daughters Bridget and Kerry, and son Rory -- look to one another for guidance and support after the death of Paul, the family patriarch. Cate's parents lend a hand.
translation: 8 Simple Rules is a fun show, but it also has some life lessons, especially a mature lesson on going after a loss, the episode in which Paul died, the first episode I've ever seen on the show ABC is coming. The Hennessy clan - mother Cate (Katey Sagal), daughters Bridget (Kaley Cuoco) and Kerry (Amy Davidson) and son Rory (Martin Spanjers) - see each other after the death of Paul (John Ritter), the family patriarch. Cate's parents (James Garner and Suzanne Pleshette) help. I'm looking forward to the second season of this show later that they decided to bring David Spade to this show because he starred in the NBC series "Just Shoot Me!" Was finished. But all this show is pretty good. This show reminds me a lot of the classic family sitcoms from the 80's and 90's that used to be on ABC.

summary: Jean and Shag Williams locate a newly built house and decide it's perfect for them to buy. One thing the developers forgot to tell them about was that it is built on a graveyard. Within days toilets start to flush by themselves and the garage door moves up and down by it's own accord. Will Jean and Shag realise that the place may be haunted by ghosts before it's too late.
translation:
Bathebo, you big dope.

This is the worst piece of garbage I've seen in a long time. I just stumbled upon it on late night TV and it's painful to watch. Really painful. How is this done? Terrible, terrible, terrible! OOOOOO ..... The toilet flushes again by itself! Creepy toilet! Creepy toilet! Creepy toilet! It does not seem to me that long ago in 1992, but when I look at it, it seems like 1952. I mean it's awful. Please do not waste your time on the dirt!

Scary old black man telling them not to build the pool in the yard. Creepy! Creepy! How is this stuff done ???

summary: When her visa expires, a young Japanese immigrant in San Francisco agrees to marry a Japanese-American boy to avoid being deported back to Japan.
translation:
This is one of those films that explore the cultural struggle of people in the East of Western cultures.

Loving on Tokyo Time is a sad movie about the inability of opposites to dress because of big cultural differences. Ken, a rock'n'roll fanatic, marries Kyoto, a Japanese girl, so she can stay in the United States when her visa expires. The marriage is only expected temporarily until Kyoto becomes legal again. But Ken, who seems to be lost in every respect, likes Kyoto and is eager to get things going. That's bad for Rock'n'Roll, despite his friend's insistence on stifling Kyoto and getting rid of all obligations to girls, just to inspire some broken-hearted songwriting and all that.

But Kyoto comes from a strict traditional Japanese education, and does not expect to be married to Ken for so long. Not only that, she is homesick and wants to return to Japan. It is sad that this is someone Ken believes he can love and be with all that except that he thinks he has found someone who feels that the girl does not expect to stay that long , It's not that she does not like Ken, it's just that she's used to a completely different way of life. She says, "I can not tell him how I feel in English, and Ken can not tell me how he feels in Japanese." It's a pretty sad love story with a killer techno Nintendo soundtrack.

I recorded Loving on Tokyo Time because it reminds me of one of my favorite 80s movies, Tokyo Pop. And for those of you who have enjoyed Loving on Tokyo Time, check out Tokyo Pop (a New York singer goes to Japan and joins a Japanese American cover band), except that it's a movie with a happy ending.

summary: Kevin Chan (aka Jackie) is a Hong-Kong cop, who scores his first big hit by virtually single-handedly capturing and arresting a big drug- lord. Of course, the drug-lord isn't too happy about this, and frames Kevin with the murder of another cop (who happened to be on the take). Kevin has to clear his name, whilst keeping himself from getting killed or arrested, and keeping his girlfriend from leaving him.
translation:
This is Jackie Chan's best movie and my personal favorite. After the disappointing US production The Protector, directed by James Glickenhaus, Jackie took the concept and placed it in Hong Kong. This is also likely to be Jackie's most violent film, with the audience writhing in the bone-breaking stunts.

The action is fast and furious, Jackie and his crew have really put a lot of effort into the fight design. Bones have been broken and blood shed in making this movie, as you will see in the credits.

The script is a simple cops and robbers affair, nothing special, after all it was written around the action. I have to say that the English version has some dubious dubbing, but it should not distract you too much.

So, round up the guys, crack the beers and enjoy. Incidentally, the film was called "Glass Story" by the stunt crew. Why? I let you find out for yourself !!

summary: Set in modern times, vampires roam the earth and are humans mortal enemies. However, a substitute has been found for human blood, a substitute that vampires can consume with the same effect as human blood. This is True Blood. Now humans and vampires can coexist in harmony, and even form relationships. But there will always be rogue elements on both sides ready to exploit the uneasy truce.
translation:
I hope whoever coached these losers on their accents was fired. The only highlights are some of the minor characters, 3 out of 5 of my pets were killed at the end of the season (and one of them was a cat to put that into perspective).

The whole story is about sex and nothing else. Sex with vampires, gay sex with gay vampires, gay sex with heterosexual vampires, sex with vampire blood, sex with vampire blood, sex with vampires, vampire sex, non-vampire sex, sex because we're scared of vampires having sex because we're crazy about vampires Sex, because we just became a vampire, etc.

Nothing against sex, it would be nice if it would be a bit more subtle to be spiked in the plot. Maybe you have a story and then you put some sex in it. But they did not even do that ... and Anna Paquin is a dizzy lout-slut. Either she's shit or her character is shit, I can not figure out what.

Another part of the story that I find highly unbelievable is why the 150 year old vampire Bill, who seems to have his stuff together, would be interested in someone like Sookie. She constantly flies away from him to control things he can not control. He goes for two days and she already decides that he "will not come back" and suddenly has feelings for dog men? Give me a break. She should be a 25-year-old woman, not a 14-year-old girl. People who are close to her die everywhere, and she has the brightest smile on her face because she just gave away her V card to a buddy because she can not read his thoughts? As the protagonist of the story, I hoped that the show would do a little more to make it understandable, and someone you're interested in, not someone you secretly keep hoping, will be killed or put into a coma. I can not find anything about her character that I like, and even the fact that she can read mind is impressively uninteresting and not in the least interesting.

I will not waste my time seeing Season 2. Come June.

summary: 25 years ago two boats raced G√∂ta Canal. It's about time to copy the race with live TV-coverage. Some really wild reality-TV.
translation: OK, now, let's see. What was funny in the first movie? I know, people with funny accents, people who fall into the water, silly boat accidents and funny comments between the two teams. In this movie, they twisted the accent part to the max, not good. A lot of people fall into the water for unsafe reasons, not good. Bootcrash, check. Funny comments between the two teams, but they failed. And there are too many personalities to follow in this movie. This film should be about what happens on the water, not on land. I am sorry to say that the funny parts and the sponsors of the film go too far. Not good. All in all, I give it four out of ten, as it has some funny parts.

summary: The movie explores Cinderella's "happily ever after" life as a princess in three stories, with help from the Fairy Godmother. First, Cinderella's awkward first days at the palace, when she tried so hard to fit in that she forgot to be herself. Second, how Jaq felt so left out that he wished to be a human. Third, how Cinderella taught one of her nasty stepsisters how to smile which leads to her own true love.
translation: I've always thought Cinderella II was the worst movie I've ever seen (followed by Peter Pan 2 and some other sequels like The Lion King 2 and The Hunchback of Notre Dame 2). All these films are made with the same idea; Because the film has no plot, they try to make up for it by filling it with jokes. I'm not saying the jokes are bad, but they make up most of the movie. The first time I saw the movie, I would have given it 1/10. But now I think about it, most of the kids are not interested in how good the original movie was, they just care that the movie is entertaining. I still think the movie was a bad sequel, but that does not mean it's awful. Now I think it deserves a 3/10.

summary: Because of his salacious language, late-night radio advice-show host Leon Phelps, along with his sweet and loyal producer Julie, is fired from his Chicago gig. They can't find another job. About that time, two things happen: he gets a letter from a wealthy former lover who offers to take care of him (but she doesn't sign her real name, so Leon, an inveterate Casanova, has no idea who she is), and a group of angry cuckolds, all of whom have surprised their wives in flagrante delicto with Leon (who has a distinctive tattoo on his booty), are closing in, armed and dangerous. Can he find the sugar mommy and escape the wrath of the mob of husbands? What about Julie?
translation: When I heard about this movie, it should be the funniest thing I've ever seen. Yes, it was funny. I mean, I like everything to the end, where ........... Oh no, I can not tell you. It's funny. The vulgar language. That's why I say if you like movies that are sexually funny, look at them, but if you do not, then hang up your money to rent it or buy it.

summary: This cinema version of the Sam Shepard play is set well after the mid-century. James Woods as the alcoholic farmer drives a huge beater with a rusted roof which is emblematic of the general disrepair of his farm. A lovingly tended lamb with maggots is the reverse emblem of something helpless, needy and cared for. The refrigerator is spoken to as a character, as if standing in for absent nurturing from Woods' self-centered wife. The couple have two kids who must come of age as their home is being torn apart around them and the parents pursue fantasies of "better things" offered by crook Randy Quaid. Henry Thomas as the son copes by holding on to the land and creating a poetic commentary, and the responses of his sister to the crisis become a powerful and surprising tribute to womanhood.
translation:
2 stars out of a possible 10 - and that's overly generous.

I thought with a cast of James Woods, Cathy Bates, Randy Quaid, Lou Gossett Jr. and Henry Thomas - how could it be missing. I was wrong.

I'm just wondering what drug Sam Shepard was on the weekend when he was driving this piece of dribbling. I thought Sam S was crazy for a long time, this film, based on his playing, confirms it.

This is the kind of artistic bs.s. Performers love to sink their teeth as they give them the opportunity to emote endlessly. But for the viewer sitting in this nonsense garbage, there's absolutely nothing you could love about this movie.

You did not see dysfunctional families until you saw this bunch. Pa is crazy, Ma is crazy, the son is crazy and the daughter is, oh yes, crazy. They also have mouths on them who utter words that make a sailor blush, especially the teenage daughter.

In addition to the above, as if that was not enough, the plot - and it's so skinny you could read it thoroughly - has a hole the size of Alaska.

Ma is conspiring to sell her rundown farm. As it turns out, Pa is also. Now, I do not pretend to be a real estate expert, but the last time I checked, real estate that they have in common has to have both signatures to be sold. If only one of them owned the property, then the other could not legally sell it, so it would be pointless for that person to do so. Mr. Shepherd prefers to ignore this fundamental fact, and therefore his action does not work.

Not that anything else really worked.

The Only Possible Reason Someone Could See This movie is when they are absolutely desperate to see James Woods in full frontal nudity, and I can not imagine why anyone wants that ,

summary: Relatives of a recently deceased man meet at his eerie castle for a reading of the will. They encounter a sinister piano player who turns out to be a toy maker, and his toys are imbued with murderous intentions.
translation:
Boris Karloff is Matthias Morteval, a dying, lonely old mother who lives with some servants in the Morhenge Mansion and tells his doctor friend, "Do not try to treat me, Doctor, I'm disgustingly healthy!" He invites his nieces and nephews to his home and warns them that they may have inherited a hereditary disease that causes madness by "shrinking the brain" (?)

*** SPOILER * **

Morteval / Karloff dies, and murderous "toys" (designed by his dead brother) begin killing the relatives. A mini cannon fires real bullets into a man's face, a life-size knight in armor attacks with an ax and a dancing Sheik stabs people with a knife. A guy being strangled makes some weird faces. In the end, Julissa and her friend find that Karloff is still alive and hiding in the dungeon, where steel doors seal the room. He plays the recurring organ music (a kind of death rattle for the murders), the brother's spirit begins to speak ("The whole house will go with me!") And the villa goes up in flames.

This senseless mess is too dark, boring and the stupid dialogue never goes to the lips.

summary: Snooty opera singer meets a rough-and-tumble fisherman in the Louisiana bayous, but this fisherman can sing! Her agent lures him away to New Orleans to teach him to sing opera, but comes to regret this rash decision when the singers fall in love.
translation:
Cheerful hyper-joyful '50s cheerfulness, which gives the asocial, pathological behavior a new meaning. Danza and Grayson will ask for mercy.

It's a shame that all the people involved in this movie are now dead (or in nursing homes). I somehow thought of condemning her for torture. As this movie began to unleash its shamelessly aggressive operatic attack on my poor, defenseless eardrums, I immediately felt strong pains enveloping my whole being. This damn muscular vibrato can smash Soviet tanks into tiny pieces, forget about glass.

Why did not you switch the channel if you did not like it? A good point, a good point ... The answer is that I wanted it, but the pain was so sudden and agonizing that I fell to the ground in pain, trying to catch my last ounces of energy I could not reach the remote control though.

A cute little fisherman with the questionable talent of singing with an annoying opera voice is spotted by Niven, who then goes on to "pigmalionize" him. Lanza is in love with the asymmetrical Grayson, but she treats him with disdain as expected, until they finally hook in. That may seem like a pretty thin plot, but this loud movie is so full of vocals and music that there is hardly any dialogue Film is Relentless Forget the torture of hippies and prisoners of war with Slayer's "Reign In Blood" (as in a South Park episode) Whatever the silent conversation among the stupid adults, this weird music everything is infantile - as if they were all 6 years old posing as adults. I can only envy people who find movies like these funny. It must be great, easy to please: what a world of wonderment would open up to me if only I could enjoy a silly old gag as a hilarious, extravagant comedy.

But let's take a look at this phenomenon, the musical of the 50s. My best guess is that 50's musicals have offered the more daydreaming idealists among us a look in Utopia or the sky (depending on whether you go to church or go to Lenin's tomb), or at least a very cheesy version of that fantasy , inspired places. TTONO is more a representation of hell, but that's just me. I do not like musicals. People talk, there is a story - but suddenly every four minutes they start to sing, whereupon they suddenly calm down and pretend that nothing unusual has happened! If you think about it, musicals are weirder than science fiction movies.

Worse, TTONO (my favorite pizza, by the way) is not just a 1950s musical, but also one with screeching operas. Opera is proof that there is such a thing as over-training a voice - to the point where it becomes a piercing weapon, rather than a means to please the listener. The clearest example of this travesty is when Lanza and Grayson combine their Dark Side vocal powers for a truly unbearable duet. I tried to decrease the volume. I lowered it from 18 to 14. Then from 14 to 10. Then 8. I ended up lowering it to a 1, which is usually low enough to be heard only by specially trained dogs and certain types of marsupials nevertheless, I could hear that the two scream like donkeys!

Take the scene in the small boat in the river. Danza starts with one of his deafening, mind-racking tunes and then ... nothing. No animals to see anywhere. Even the crocodiles, who are mostly deaf, have almost disappeared. If you look closely, you can even see how the trees turn from green to yellow in just a few minutes. No, that was not a continuity error, it was simply old torture of the flora. And these trees were just dull pictures! Imagine how real trees would have reacted.

The reason why glass breaks up when a high C is torn out of the overweight belly of an opera writer is not due to any laws of physics regarding waves and frequency, but because glass is only human - so it can just take so much pain before it commits suicide by spontaneous self-explosion. I can hear the loudest, most rude Death Metal band for hours, but just give me a minute of soprano and I get a headache.

summary: An interweaving narrative chronicling the antics of such diverse characters as: a transsexual taxi driver, a family obsessed with hygiene and toads, a fiery reverend, a carnival owner who kidnaps women into marriage, and a xenophobic couple who run a local shop for local people.
translation:
For the first time, I accidentally looked at the LoG while I was on TV: since then, I've never missed an episode.

It's very funny, like a mix of Brass Eye's Social Commentary, the Fast Show is an excellent one-liners, and an amazing storyline that seems to evolve every week without ever going anywhere. The best example of this was Hillary Briss's special stuff - what was it about?

The humor will not please everyone. Some will say it's just too sick, and it's easy to see where they're coming from. Try it anyway. If you do not like it, do not look at it, but if you like it, you'll be glad you've accepted my advice.

summary: In order to generate more endorsement revenue, Champion City's resident superhero Captain Amazing arranges for the release of supervillain Casanova Frankenstein, only to be captured by him. The city's fate rests in the hands of seven loser superhero wannabes: the spoon-flinging Blue Rajah, the shovel-wielding Shoveler, the possessed bowling ball-hurling Bowler, the flatulent Spleen, the only-when-nobody's-looking Invisible Boy, the mysterious Sphinx, and the perpetually-angry Mr. Furious.
translation: I really did not expect much from this movie, but it was not bad; it was actually quite good. This movie contained some of the funniest pieces I've ever seen of a movie. Now I'm not saying that's one of the funniest films ever, but I've laughed a lot in some places. "The police thought the death of my father was a suicide, saying that he had fallen into an elevator shaft, some bullets." Now this movie is not for everyone, its mostly silly humor like zoolander or dodgeball; If you hate these movies, I would probably recommend you to stay clear. All in all, it was an entertaining movie about a group of would-be superheroes who eventually became real heroes. It's a very overrated comedy that many people probably have not seen yet, because, as I expected before the viewing, it looked like utter garbage. After watching this movie, I finally understand why this movie was able to put together such a superstars cast that includes Ben Stiller, William H. Macy, Hank Azaria, and even that child of Good Burger. It is because Mystery Man is full of excellent comedic writing duration of 7 out of 10 years. A very big surprise.

summary: Returning to England from a bombing run in May 1945, flyer Peter Carter's plane is damaged and his parachute ripped to shreds. He has his crew bail out safely, but figures it is curtains for himself. He gets on the radio, and talks to June, a young American woman working for the USAAF, and they are quite moved by each other's voices. Then he jumps, preferring this to burning up with his plane. He wakes up in the surf. It was his time to die, but there was a mixup in heaven. They couldn't find him in all that fog. By the time his "Conductor" catches up with him 20 hours later, Peter and June have met and fallen in love. This changes everything, and since it happened through no fault of his own, Peter figures that heaven owes him a second chance. Heaven agrees to a trial to decide his fate.
translation:
This movie has the most beautiful opening sequence of all time. I saw this movie for the first time a week ago, since then I see the opening every day and every time I get so excited, the first time I heard David Niven utter the immortal words of Sir Walter Raleigh's The Pilgrimage:

Give me my Scallop of Silence, My Wand of Faith, on which I may walk, My Treasure, Immortal Diet, My Bottle of Salvation, My Gown of Glory, the true bar of hope; And so will I make my pilgrimage (??)

Do you know why it would be a truism to say that Michael Powells and Emeric Pressuburger's life are quite justified in creating such a wonderful opening? Because they were recorded in the poets' paradise long before they made this film.

I imagine both of them being brought to trial during the last judgment and saying casually to an angry God: I apologize, sir. Do you want to know what we did during our lifetime? Well, well, you'll see: we've directed and produced: I know where I'm going, Colonel Blimp, Red Shoes ?? Do you think that's enough sir? It is quite obvious that these two great artists have already fulfilled their duty to God, Nature of the Muse, or Whatever you call it, when they shot a matter of life and death. The fact that other people's lives are justifiable for their actions might not be clear to everyone, even though I think my life would have meaning had I never done anything else to see this movie.

Of course classic cars will be tempted to say: Such films do not make them anymore. You will have been wrong in part; they have not made films in the past.

I have already quoted Keats, but I repeat his words: A beauty is always a pleasure.

summary: This is the story of a young resourceful heroine named Lisa Reisert who hates to fly, but the terror that awaits her on the night flight to Miami has nothing to do with a fear of flying! Upon boarding the plane, Lisa is trapped on a red-eye flight with a creepy villainous handsome and charming man by the name of Jackson Rippner, who's playing middle-man in the plot to assassinate a Homeland Security official. He's got her father pinned down by a would-be killer, using that advantage to coerce Lisa into phoning the luxury resort where she works and arranging to move the target into a pre-set position.
translation:
Wes Craven has become one of the most successful killer thriller movies ever. After seeing his films, you will find your new fears. People do not know which Wes Craven Thriller movie is the best because they are all different.

In this film, Lisa is terrorized by fellow travelers. He forces her to kill and if she does not, Jack will kill her father. Lisa is in huge disarray, because whatever she chooses, she will kill.

acting was unreal. Rachel McAdams and Cillian Murphy behaved incredibly well. The emotions were right. Idea and script for this movie is also great ...

Sometimes it reminds a "scream", but it's definitely better than both "screams" sequels together.

And what can I say - this is the best killer thriller movie in the 21st century yet ...

summary: A group of childhood friends, now in their thirties, reunite at Camp Tamakwa. Only a few of the original campers show up, but they still have a good time reminiscing. The people share experiences and grow while at the camp. They are dismayed to discover that the camp's owner, Unca Lou, is going to close the camp down.
translation: If I could go back, even as an adult, and relive the days of my summer I spent at the camp ... I would be so quick. The camps I went to were not even that great. They were in Texas, where the mosquitoes actually carried people away, but we had horses and fishing. The movie cinematography was amazing, the characters funny and believable, especially Perkins, Pollack and Arkin. Sam Raimi's character and sub-antics were priceless. So who ever thought this movie was lame ... I feel great pity on them because they can not put their unbelief off long enough to imagine camp life as an adult again, or they never went as children. The point was that these people had the opportunity to retire and become young again, and they did it on every occasion. I wish I could. It was funny, intelligent, beautifully written, brilliantly cast and the craftsmanship takes me back, so I always want to look at it only for the landscape. Sorta like Dances with Wolves and LadyHawk ... good movies, but the wild becomes a character as much as the actors. Rent it, see it, buy it and watch it over and over again ... never gets old. ; 0)

summary: Shecky Moskowitz, a deservedly struggling young comedian, lands a menial job on a cruise ship as the Miss-Universe contest is being held on-board. The Big Man On Deck for this voyage is Dickie Diamond, the ship's comedian and all-around ladies' man. As an assorted array of thugs, Panamanian mercenaries and terrorists try to storm the ship, Shecky hopes for one big chance to prove himself and enter the exciting world of cruise ship comedy.
translation:
This movie was so bad that I could not stand it without doing anything else. There was no action and no point. I was completely bored and for a movie about a stand-up comedian I could not remember a joke or a funny line worthy of the description. Politicians without charisma who speak jargon could not be less entertaining.

How was this done? Is there no quality control in the movie? Watching the girls in bikinis was the only distraction during this horrible experience.

It's hard to imagine that Adam Sandler, who has become popular and appeared in fine comedies, has survived after this kind of revelation. He was not in the least funny in this movie, so it proves that writing in the effective comedy is so crucial.

summary: A man's terminal illness reunites him with his estranged brother.
translation:
I start writing this report during a break while watching the movie. It's the first time I've tried this, but I'm having trouble getting through without occasional breaks. That's not because it's intense, but because it's bad.

It's almost painfully tedious and unbelievable, especially when the supernaturally robust dying brother Ryan (Colm Feore) is tragic and bitchy on the screen, self-loving and self-pitying. That would have been a much better movie if they'd just let that character out of the story.

He adds nothing but grumpy, maudlin, very irritating melodrama. Maybe someone decided that if they did not convince Ryan they would only make him offensive. The problem with that is, who cares if a spoiled, whining, disgusting idiot dies? Not me.

The ONLY thing this character has for him is the fact that he is dying and I'm sorry, but that's just not enough. Dying does not make anyone special. We all die sooner or later. It does not give anyone the right to expect sympathy while behaving like an idiot.

The other two characters and the actors they play (David Cubitt as Theo and Chandra West as Sarah) are much more interesting, and their story, without Ryan's self-pitying interruptions, would have a much better movie made. But it's not over yet and it's time to play PLAY again. Maybe something great will happen before the end ....
No. We are sorry. This rented turkey is coming back tonight!

summary: Apathy, technology, paranoia, disease and medication. Meet Arin. Arin is a shy videographer who finds it too much to handle to go out and meet girls, so he sets up an account on meester.net. The flood of responses never comes, save for one email from Susan, a struggling artist who finds her job as a waitress stifling her creativity. Susan is also on the shy side and is seeking an alternative to the classic dating situation. When Arin and Susan finally meet, that alternative dating situation comes to life as the two refuse to communicate verbally with each other, wanting to avoid bullshit small talk. Instead, when they do need to communicate to each other, they pass a pen and pad back and forth.
translation: All hype! What better way to describe a movie about people who are upset because they can not release their movie through a mainstream distributor? Consequently, they do it themselves. Otherwise, the hype of the film does not justify the content of the movie. The story is absent and could easily be a short one. Acting is bad, but the animation and music is pretty good. Otherwise, do not waste your time - do not believe in the hype! However, if you have the opportunity to watch the movie for free, do so. Then you do not have to waste money. Nevertheless, the filmmakers make their story well and create Cliffhanger with their self-obsessed mini-series. Otherwise they are one-hit-wonder who never had a hit.

summary: "The Straight Story" chronicles a trip made by 73-year-old Alvin Straight from Laurens, Iowa, to Mt. Zion, Wis., in 1994 while riding a lawn mower. The man undertook his strange journey to mend his relationship with his ill, estranged, 75-year-old brother Lyle.
translation: Perhaps the most personal of David Lynch's works is most accessible. This time around, Lynch does not provide the enigmatic thematic structures that involve an action or not, but a reflective, fragile meditation on the universal themes of aging and the family, and finds relief in both. The simple true story of an Iowa farmer (Richard Farnsworth) driving a lawn mower to Wisconsin to visit his estranged, maltreated brother, there are still many of the unique and original visual dreamscapes (some pretty eye - catching aerial photographs of the heartland, filmed by Veteran cameraman Freddy Francis) to make it an undeniable lynch effort and characterizations that are some of his most memorable. Farnsworth is superb in a stoic but sympathetic way, letting the stories he hears on his journey become part of his life, and Sissy Spacek gives some of her best work in a smaller role than his mentally challenging but attentive daughter The mystery reveals itself in a poignant way by a gentle twist in the sensitive writing of John Roach and Mary Sweeney), but the rest of the small cast of a person delivers indelible achievements, one of the most notable being Barbara Robertson, whose accidental killing of a deer is simultaneous maudlin and sad at the same time. But this is Vintage Lynch with its ability to engage and unsettle you in its best form. For those unfamiliar with Lynch, or who know him only through his violent, disturbing reputation, this is an excellent start; For those who know his work, this is one of the best in his repertoire.

summary: The story of menstruation begins, as the motherly narrator informs us, with the pituitary gland - a gland at the base of the brain that sends hormones throughout the bloodstream that order growth. When a girl reaches an age somewhere between 11 and 17 - the average is 13 - the pituitary gland sends maturing orders to the ovaries, which in turn order the uterus to create a thickened lining, filled with watery fluids and blood. If an egg is fertilized it will remain within that thickened lining for nourishment. But if the egg is not fertilized, the body has no use for the extra nourishment, and it passes out of the body - which is the process called menstruation. The narrator proceeds to disprove taboos against bathing or exercise during menstruation. She advises that girls should keep a calendar that keeps track of the number days between periods. And she notes how good posture, healthy foods and positive attitudes can affect the menstruation cycle.
translation:
Here is one of those educational short films that are made to learn the unknown people out there about facts of life. This time, the target audience is adolescent girls, the fact of life is menstruation. This animated film, created by Walt Disney Pictures, apparently with some sponsorship from Kotex.

It starts by explaining how hormones make you grow and develop. With the help of animation and a narrator, it shows us how the body, especially the ovaries, uterus and vagina, works and why it all leads to menstruation. It's almost amazing, here becomes a funny touch, as the subject of sex is avoided. Even the word is never mentioned, though "educated" will happen once. I do not know why I saw that, but since it's one of those rare short films that might give you an idea of ‚Äã‚Äãan innocent time, maybe you should try it.

summary: Simon and Mark live together in London. When Mark dies of AIDS, Simon gets on with his life rather quickly - too quickly to suit Mark, whose ghost reappears to disrupt Simon's cruising, moving back into their flat to prompt Simon to experience and express feelings. Simon is adamant that feelings, especially love, are not for him. Subplots develop as Mark and Simon observe their neighbor Siobhan's love life and as Simon spends his days as a satellite-TV installer partnered with Dogger, a homophobe ignorant that Simon is gay. Is there any key that can unlock Simon's feelings and allow Mark to rest in peace?
translation:
I read some positive reviews about this movie and was really surprised at how awful the whole thing was. Positioned as a cross between an AIDS story and a kind of "ghost" / "blithe spirit" story, this movie can not always pay attention to what it wants to be.

Simon and Mark are a gay couple with an "open" relationship - Simon can have anonymous (if safe) sex on the side if he wants. Mark is HIV + and he and Simon do not seem to have sex anymore. When Mark dies, Simon tries to suppress his feelings after being rejected by his father years ago, wiping out his memory and simply continuing his bachelor's degree. Not that his behavior before Mark's death was much different. But Mark returns in spooky form and thwarts his various attempts as he makes Simon open up and admit his true feelings.

Unfortunately, Simon is such a selfish DIFFICULT, it's impossible to feel empathic with him for the most part of the movie. Until he is more sympathetic, it is too late to take care of it. Mark, on the other hand, appears in Demi Moore's footsteps of "Ghost", crying violently throughout the movie.

After Mark returns, there is a bizarre change in tone. Suddenly we get some lame attempts with humor, in the TV series "Bewitched". But that does not take long. As soon as Simon's emotional health is at stake, the whole thing becomes increasingly lewd, with amateurish attempts to tug at your feelings. The finale, with a gilded muscle-boy angel leading a tearful signal to the sky while a chastised, grieving Simon waves goodbye, is simply amazing, especially because it's not intentionally funny.

summary: In the year 1984, rocket bombs and rats prey on the inhabitants of the crumbling metropolis of London. Far away on the Malabar Front, a seemingly interminable war rages against Eastasia. The Ministry of Truth broadcasts ceaselessly to the population via its inescapable network of telescreens. These devices, which pervade all aspects of peoples' lives, are also capable of monitoring their every word and action. They form part of an elaborate surveillance system used by the Ministry of Love, and its dreaded agents the Thought Police, to serve their singular goal: the elimination of 'thoughtcrime'. Winston Smith is a Party worker - part of the vast social caste known as the Outer Party, the rank and file of the sprawling apparatus of government. Winston works in the Records Department of the Ministry of Truth - the section charged with modifying historical news archives for consistency. When by chance Winston uncovers incontrovertible proof that the Party is lying, he embarks on a ...
translation: A few weeks ago I read the classic George Orwell novel, 1984. I was intrigued and thought it was one of the best books I've read lately. When I rented the DVD, I was intrigued to see how this adaptation was measured. Unfortunately, the movie did not even come close to creating the ambience or developing the characters that Orwell did so masterfully in his book. The director seems to think that anyone watching the movie has read the book because he does not try to show WHY the characters act and feel the way they do. John Hurt, the lead actor, is droll all the way and barely plays until the end. We never really experience what he does for a living, or why his love relationship is forbidden, or what the political climate is and why the protagonist wants rebellion. This book can not cope in film without proper narrative and explanation of the political system that oppresses the characters, and the fact that they are missing is the biggest drawback of this film. Apart from that, John Hurt was a horrible casting candidate and looked about 15 years older than the 39-year-old Winston he should portray. On the plus side, the rest of the cast was well-chosen. It's just too bad they were put in such a terribly adapted movie with the wrong lead actor. -Brian O.

summary: Summer 1939 in the Provence, France: the 14 years old Julien has a crush on his cousin Julia, who lives together with his family in their small hotel. Unfortunately she ignores him, because she's several years older. Then the hotel guest Charles enters the competition, a slimy twenty-something who lusts for the girl, despite the fact that he's engaged.
translation: As others have mentioned, all the women who are naked in this movie are usually absolutely gorgeous. The plot very clearly shows the hypocrisy of the female libido. When men are around, they want to be persecuted, but when there are no "men" around, they become the persecutors of a 14-year-old boy. And the boy is really fast becoming a man (we should all be so happy at this age!). He then has the courage to pursue his true love.

summary: Youngsters from different countries, races, and social background are forced to integrate when they all enroll in Columbus University. They all have their own problems, such as finance, harrassment, personal safety, and self doubt. Additionally, campus life seems to be causing a problem for everyone: racism. Students, already under pressure to perform in the classroom, on the track, or in front of their friends, are strained to the breaking point by prejudice, inexperience, and misunderstanding.
translation:
Despite, or perhaps because of, the skillful use of music to underline the motivations and ideologies of each of the main characters, stereotypes exist in this not too subtle kinematic screed, and truthfulness and characterization are out.

One has the impression that John Singleton was immersed in the poststructuralist theory of literature because it was the taste of the day and "higher learning" was the tendentious result. The low point of the film is the "Peace" rally, in which the symbols of the "Free Love" movement of the 1960s are taken up again for a "Take Back The Night" rally with lively, dazzlingly identity-conscious music acts in tow. Perhaps the director in his primitive revisionism tried to assert that identity politics was the new Vietnam? Ooh, how Adrienne Rich of him? And Remy, who fires into the crowd, is a nice touch if you're in Rich's way of political stance.

I wish I could give this movie negative stars. I can only recommend it to those who are interested in history in the 1990s, a time when radical feminists brought the academic trinity of race, class and gender into popular culture and declared human hatred a "viable and honorable political option". Where is Camille Paglia when you need her?

summary: When petty thief Cosimo is given the plan for the perfect heist from a lifer in prison - the kind of job you dream about - he has to get out of jail, fast. But with Cosimo stuck in the joint, it's up to his girl Rosalind to track down a patsy. But while no one wants to do the time for Cosimo's crime, everybody seems to know a guy who will - and for a share, they're willing to track him down. Before long, Rosalind has five guys trailing behind her, looking to get their bungling hands on a piece of the action.
translation:
Cosimo (Luis Guzman) ends up in jail for car theft and there he gets the plan for the perfect robbery of a life-companion in prison; So he has to get out of prison quickly. He tells his girlfriend Rosalind (Patricia Clarkson) to find a man who will spend his time in prison for some money. But no one wants to do Cosimo's crime and yet everyone seems to know a guy who will do that. Soon the bad boxer Pero Mahalovic (Sam Rockwell) founds the details of this so-called "perfect job".

First of all, I think that this movie was very funny and in my view I would recommend it to everyone. This film is a remake of the Italian comedy "I Soliti Ignoti". I have not seen the Italian original, so I can not judge or compare these two films. But "Welcome to Collinwood" is a great comedy for itself, about four people trying to steal the money from the vault in a house. Everyone has given his share of the brilliance of this film. Really excellent movie for these actors: Sam Rockwell, William H. Macy (good), Isaiah Washington, Michael Jeter (good), Luis Guzm√°n, Patricia Clarkson, Jennifer Esposito and finally George Clooney has their share in this project.

Maybe saying that this movie is just a comedy is not fair. That's more than that. Because of a difference. All thieves in this film have very small wishes when asked: What are they doing with their money? Mostly she secures her future in a very modest way. This fact goes beyond the comedy into the soul of these criminals. And not only she, but also the policeman Babitsch, who is portrayed as a corrupt person; so here directors Russo presents us fact that criminals and police are the same. Actually, everyone is in Collinwood; and not just in Collinwood because all people hunt money legally or illegally. I do not like all the movies where the audience finally likes and cheers the thieves. But that's an exception. You have to love them all. Riley with his little baby and his wife in prison. Toto with his pants. Cosimo with his line: "Your mother is a whore!" and all the others. They're like characters in my favorite comic, Alan Ford. They're all trying to make some money, but they're just not lucky. But they all did a good deed: they gave Riley money so he could get his wife out of jail. They are all heroes in my eyes because many "honest" people would not do that.

summary: The autobiography of elegant criminal, Fran√ßois Eug√®ne Vidocq, from his birth in a French jail in 1775 to his appointment as chief of police of Paris where he intends to rob the city bank. Along the way, he escapes from jail with Emile, who becomes his partner in crime, poses as a lieutenant to rob a showgirl of her ruby garter, and steals the jewels of a marquise in whose home he's a guest. He's also posed as an artist's model for a portrait of St. George (Emile's face is the dragon's), and the marquise's granddaughter falls in love first with his visage and then him. Can she help him slay his own dragons, especially when the showgirl reappears and the bank vault beckons?
translation: The often reliable Leonard Maltin says this is a "delightful romance" and Sanders is "outstanding". Maltin must have mistaken this movie for something else. Sanders is weird and funny and awesome, as always, ?? You can imagine that he has delivered the line regarding adultery: "Sometimes the chains of marriage are so heavy that they have to be borne by three", but boring, wooden and outdated describe this film more closely. The story itself, an autobiography with Sanders as a lovable jewel thief, Francois Eugene Vidocq, who becomes a police chief but can barely resist the temptation of his jewels, is entertaining enough, but it has the same kind of hollow historic Hollywood treatment that has defaced such Time epics like * Marie Antoinette * and certainly the deplorable * Forever Amber * (screaming for a classic remake). Although Sanders tries to give his character a certain depth in his defense, everything is in vain. I'm an outrageous Douglas-Sirk fan, but that's 1946, and it's one of Sirk's earliest American pursuits that misses many of the typical details that would define his flowery, chest-hard potboilers. Sirk just wet his feet here and made a series of nondescript films over the next decade, until he won gold with * Magnificent Obsession *, and shot us with estrogen celebrations like * All That Heaven * * Worn On The Wind * and imitation of life *. But * Scandal in Paris * is hardly his best work ?? a relatively low-budget affair with cheesy sets and ineffective costumes.

summary: Young Australian, Barry McKenzie, travels to England with his Aunt Edna after his father dies and a request is revealed in his will.
translation: A big hit after being released with Australian audiences, it may still be funny today, but its exaggerated political impropriety and outspoken, lewd humor can make it a bit of a thrill. It's too long; Some of the content may have been saved for the sequel to Barry McKenzie Holds His Own, which urgently needed new things. Granted, his ocher-Australian attitude is funny, but also gets annoying when the movie gets dressed. Some say Crocker's songs are the best pieces, and they are certainly original, but "hilarious"? The adventures of Barry McKenzie will be considered a milestone in Australian cinema, but we should do everything in our power to ensure that Australian audiences do not see the majority of Australians as Barry McKenzies (or Mick Dundees!). , Rating: 5/10

summary: nan
translation: Here's why the Jane Show does not work. Once again, Canadian fool producers and authors can not create a sitcom without turning it around. I guess these people do not look much of T.V. from the USA, who pat the sitcom model down. No, here we have to do something else, we have to make the A story absurd and then have a meaningful B story to make up for it. The characters are two-dimensional and the storylines are way over the top: forklift racing ??? give me a damn break. Here is a small piece of advice for the show's authors: Do not write funny situations, find the funny thing in situations. And remember, you have to be born with a sense of humor to write really funny stuff, and not just an improviser.

summary: Armageddon (2006) is a professional wrestling pay-per-view event produced by World Wrestling Entertainment (WWE).
translation:
Armageddon PPV

The last PPV of 2006

Smackdown brand.

Game Results Ahead ********

Nice opener. Let us continue.

Teddy Long announces a new match for the tag team titles: London and Kendrick will defend themselves against: Regal and Taylor, The Hardyz and MNM IN A LEADER MATCH !!!! Here we go!

Match 2: Fatal 4-way ladder match. That was total carnage. If you start from three of the four teams here, you would expect chaos. The spots were fantastic. A total spot party. Mercury has suffered a damaged nose and tears on the eye. He is in the hospital now. Get well soon, child.

Above: The Miz v. Boogeyman. (Ugh) That was not appropriate. Will the Boogeyman ever wrestle? The Miz is too shit. After an insane crowd, they are killed by it. DUD.

Chris Benoit against Chavo. That was a strong match. I enjoyed it. Chavo hit a Killer Superplex at one point! Benoit has also met eight German suplexes! Benoit wins with the sniper. Good things.

Helms v. Yang Cruiserweight title championship game. That was a good match. Unfortunately, the stupid fans did not care. WHY? Helms and Yang are very talented and have done well. I agree with JBL. He ran to the crowd. JBL is 100% correct. Learn to appreciate or get out.

summary: Portrait of an American innocent. In 1955, Bettie Page (1923-2008 ) waits to testify before a Senate subcommittee investigating the effects of pornographic material on American adolescents and juveniles. In flashbacks, we see her childhood in Tennessee, a brief marriage, a gang rape, and her going to New York City in 1949. There she takes acting lessons, models for photos, and acts in short films for adults, earning the nickname, "The Pin-Up Queen of the Universe." We see her relationship with merchants Irving and Paula Klaw, photographers John Willie and Bunny Yeager, boyfriends, and the public. Through it all, she is wholesome, sporting, and forthright - Eve before the fall.
translation:
I have known Bettie Page for many years. The soft-core porn pictures of her from the 1950s are now iconographic and still have a strong relationship today. Even in the hetero-fetish world, the "Bettie Page" look is still very popular and remains as unique as it was then. So I saw this movie with a certain familiarity. The result did not disappoint.

Among other things, it was very entertaining to see the actual characters of the film such as Irving Klaw, John Willie and Bunny Yeager. Everyone looks at the trailblazer today. Mary Harron did an excellent job of creating the desired ambience of sexual repression and hypocrisy in America in the 1950s, along with a sexuality that was innocent by today's standards.
