I particularly liked the use of monochrome over color as a visual shorthand for the emotional and spiritual climate Bettie was in.

I think Gretchen Mol did an excellent job of portraying Bettie's character in all of her innocent sexuality and all her naivety. Bettie loved to look pretty, loved the attention, did not see anything wrong with nudity and enjoyed getting dressed in "silly outfits" for the camera. The underlying sexuality and the deeply fetishistic desires were completely lost in her. To this day, she still does not understand "what the fuss was about" when it comes to her pictures or her S & M content.

That's not to say that she's uneducated or too simple. I just understand that she just does not understand fetishism and will never do it. No harm there. Bettie Page is just who she is. The film captured that very nicely.

The social atmosphere of the 1950s, presented by Mrs. Harron and written by her with Guinevere Turner, really makes me happy that I live in the day and the age that I am doing. The hypocrisy and oppression, combined with the massive ignorance of our sexuality, combined into a frighteningly overwhelming world. The movie captures that and cheers her, while Bettie endures everything with her unshakable faith and steady naivety.

This movie was sometimes a bit slow, but hit all the points that Mrs. Harron tried and hit her well. I would even recommend this film for those people who do not even know who Bettie Page was and what effect she had on American culture. For those with such interests, this movie is a must.

summary: Shecky Moskowitz, a deservedly struggling young comedian, lands a menial job on a cruise ship as the Miss-Universe contest is being held on-board. The Big Man On Deck for this voyage is Dickie Diamond, the ship's comedian and all-around ladies' man. As an assorted array of thugs, Panamanian mercenaries and terrorists try to storm the ship, Shecky hopes for one big chance to prove himself and enter the exciting world of cruise ship comedy.
translation: Some time ago decided to collect the films of Billy Bob Thornton (due to class films such as "Sling Blade", "A simple plan" and "The man who was not there"), it was inevitable that there would be the one or other turkey in there. What I did not realize, however, was that there could be one such bad thing. I'll give you an idea how unbelievably bad this movie is - the funniest dialogue in it is "Knock Knock", "Who's There?", "The Big Smelly Man", "The Big Smelly Man Who?", "The One big smelly man - you are! ". Yeah guys, it's really that bad. Billy Bob is only about two minutes in there (I think he needed the work at this time of his career), and the rest of the film is painful. For some reason, though it's undeniably terrible, I do not hate it. This is probably because I have saved my anger for any high budget special effects trash like "The Fast and the Furious" and no "no budget" look like this. 2/10 on a push.

summary: A group of very efficient robbers strikes banks in downtown area of Stockholm. Detective Klara and commanding officer Krona takes on the case.
translation: It feels like Swedish films are trying to become American and I just do not understand it. In this movie, the performance of some actors is terrible and the script is nothing special. Do not waste your time!

summary: In Budapest, Hungary, the Matuschek and Company store is owned by Mr. Hugo Matuschek and the bachelor Alfred Kralik is his best and most experienced salesman. When Klara Novak seeks a job position of saleswoman in the store, Matuschek hires her but Kralik and she do not get along. Meanwhile the lonely and dedicated Kralik has an unknown pen pal that he intends to propose very soon; however, he is fired without explanation by Matuschek on the night that he is going to meet his secret love. He goes to the bar where they have scheduled their meeting with his colleague Pirovitch and he surprisingly finds that Klara is his correspondent; however, ashamed After being let go he does not disclose his identity to her. When Matuschek discovers that he had misjudged Kralik and committed a mistake, he hires him again for the position of manager. But Klara is still fascinated with her correspondent and does not pay much attention to Alfred. Alfred works out a plan to reveal himself to Klara's who ...
translation:
Ernst Lubitsch's contribution to American cinema is enormous. His legacy is an outstanding group of films that will live forever, as is the case with The Shop Around the Corner. This film has been transformed into other, less aspirational films and a piece of music without the charm or elegance of Mr. Lubitsch's own and defined version.

Margaret Sullavan and James Stewart worked together in several films. Her characters in this film are an example of how to be in a movie without seeming almost like an actor. Both stars are adorable as the pen pals who do not know each other, but who had the fate, they worked together in the same store in Budapest.

The reason why these classic films worked so well is the astounding support throws the studios together frame by frame. Here we have the wonderful Frank Morgan playing the owner of the store. We see, among others, Joseph Schildkraut, Felix Bressart, William Tracy and Charles Smith, who impressively prove to us that they are in Budapest.

So these movies will live forever!

summary: During the 1950s California aging bank robber Roy "Mad Dog" Earle is pardoned after 8 years in prison.Once out of prison, Roy,at the request of his crime boss "Big Mac",decides to pull one more heist before retiring.His target is a fancy mountain resort hotel where employee Louis Mendoza is Roy's "inside man".Roy Earle's team of robbers include hotheaded Babe,Red and dance-hall girl Marie.Marie falls for Roy but he only thinks of innocent young girl Velma whom he recently met.Velma has a slight foot handicap and smitten Roy plans to pay for her foot surgery with his share of the loot.Unfortunately,the robbery doesn't go as planned.
translation: A true classic, ten out of ten! Every actor is perfect, the script is an enthralling series of exciting scenes. Scenes in the car and scenes in the mountains are breathtaking. I wonder if this movie has already been released on DVD because it is in the widescreen version. I saw this movie in the late fifties, maybe three or four times, and never forgot it again. I remember it was one of the first Warner Cinema features, a process called Warnerscope, which provided a very neat cinematography. Shelley Winters and Jack Palance earned an Oscar for their performances. The only thing I could criticize was that I was not instructed by someone like, say Nicholas Ray, to increase his rhythm and tension.

summary: A documentary on three young people who live in Medell√≠n, Colombia, an area ruled by a gang with ties to the nation's paramilitary armies.
translation:
One of these "Thank-God-I-not-live-there" documentaries. This tells of two hostile factions in Colombia, guerrillas and paramilitaries, and the surrounding peoples of Medellin.

Rifles, drugs and death are rampant. The boys, who are not older than 22 and are not in the middle of the war, are in jail. The girls ?? not women, girls ?? always react the same when one of them is killed with tears and screams. You scratch your head; What did you really expect? I do not know what is even more disturbing: the nocturnal shootings and riots, or that everyone just passively accepts things as they are. Or to see this boy drinking, who obviously is not his first beer, all that, 10? If you take these young men out of their situation and give them a place where they have the opportunity to do more, to be more, how many would choose not to stay?

Based on This documentary, I'm afraid.

summary: Timmy Turner, a 10-year-old boy, has had it with his babysitter! He summons his fairy godparents who have the power to grant him wishes. Some of the wishes are really helpful, others don't work out so well. Timmy's godparents Wanda and Cosmo have ideas of their own and always lead Timmy on interesting adventures.
translation: For the first 3 seasons, Fairly Odd Parents was as tasty as candy, bright and sweet and addictive. Now it's as tasty as Pepto-Bismol. And unfortunately, Pepto-Bismol is exactly what you need when you look at the newer episodes, where all the sweetness has been replaced by insults and violence, which has not made you laugh. Cosmo, once one of Nick's loveable characters, has become an insulting, filthy cretin that the occupation of Family Guy did not even want to know. Timmy has become a selfish, arrogant idiot with whom Bart Simpson would happily beat the snot (and considering Timmy's sophistication that would require a lot of beatings). And poor Wanda ... a true charmer who has become the victim of her husband and godchild, she is now called a "complainer" because she cares about the well-being of others. Plus Cosmo stupidity causes pain for everyone else, but he is never punished for it, nor does he learn any lessons. Which pretty well describes Butch Hartman's attitude to children: they are rude, vulgar, and not too bright. Thankfully, that lousy toon was canceled, along with Butch Hartman's darling, Danny Phantom. At least Butch - unlike Cosmo - got what he deserved.

summary: A sheriff investigating the disappearance of a young girl from a small island discovers there's a larger mystery to solve among the island's secretive, neo-pagan community.
translation:
This must be one of the worst fillings I've ever seen and I've seen a few. It's slow, boring, amateurish - not even consistent within its own simplistic reading of the plot. The actors are not acting. I can not blame them - they have been given a script of such banal banality that they can only walk with pain behind their eyes, which has nothing to do with the evil processes in SummersIsle.

There's no moment in this movie that's true - not an honest line or a single moment of being moved. The character of Nicholas Cage is so poorly drawn that you do not feel a little compassion for him in all his harassment. I have no doubt that I saw a suffering man above, but it was Nicholas Cage who was fully aware of the fact that he was in the worst movie of his entire career.

summary: While undergoing open heart surgery, a man's failed anesthetic leaves him completely alert, but paralyzed and unable to tell his doctors
translation:
From the beginning, this film had a few shortcomings. The protagonist of Hayden Christensen is a wealthy young mogul who has inherited his father's considerable wealth and power, and he struggles to fill his father's shoes and cut the apron that keeps mom (and co-manager) too tight. He also has the problem of having heart disease and waiting in the limbo, which is the organ donor registry. There are also little background stories that largely ignore her first instincts that later became important, such as his friendship with his surgeon (Terrence Howard) and his romance with a middle-class girl (Jessica Alba). Uncreative storylines, but not bad enough to ruin the movie. The only true "Oy Vey!" Moment was the name of Lena Olin's character. Overbearing woman named Lilith ... subtle!

The surgical scenes are not censored at all. I appreciate that people who find surgery scenes scary may not. The horror of being awake during anesthesia was initially well done. They watch in emotional agony as Christensen screams inside through the chest cut and the rib spreader. The moment of irony of the followers comes when he is one of the unfortunate few awake during anesthesia, but he is also fortunate that it helps him to learn that his surgical team is planning to assassinate him.


There are two more twists at the end of his relationship with his mother. One of them is an impressive gesture from Olin, which makes so little impression because of the bad writing. The other is a mystery about the family's past, which seemed very touched and meaningless.

The initially well-done anesthesia-consciousness drama is lost in the poorly written conspiracy drama. There is one last attempt to bring it back, which falls flat and takes the entire movie with it.

summary: John Holmes was a legend of the porn industry and revered in circles as a stud. But in 1981, years after his successful career and star fading, Holmes was a desperate man with his own internal demons to live up to. He's estranged from his wife, holding onto a relationship with his teenage mistress, and living as a junkie in search of his next fix. But one fateful night left four people dead and John as a key suspect in one of the most grisly murders in Los Angeles. Was he partly responsible for what happened at Wonderland Avenue?
translation:
Val Kilmer ... loves or loathes him, sometimes he gets under the skin of a character and pulls out a performance that makes you, 'Hey! This guy is a GREAT actor! He did it in Jim's leather pants in The Doors and he did it again in John's leather pants.

Turning around the fall and fall of pornographer John Holmes, Kilmer struts on his knees We unravel one of the biggest mystery puzzles that Hollywood has not solved for over twenty years, Holmes being the prime suspect for a brutal Manson-like carnage is.

What Kilmer does so effortlessly is the understatement of the celebrity who turns anyone into someone who longs for someone who had him and then lost. Go, see him, you'll know what I mean.

summary: The story of the famed siege of the Alamo during the Texas Revolution, in which a small band of soldiers held off an overwhelming army under the Mexican general Santa Anna long enough to allow the Texan army to gather its strength.
translation: Burt Kennedy used to be a very good director, but you never knew it with this clumsy mess. Not only does this film look cheap, it's cheap too - most of the combat scenes are from the far superior "The Last Command" of 1955, and the material recorded 32 years ago is more contemporary than anything on this picture. The few action scenes actually filmed for this film are disorganized, confused and incompetent and look just as shabby as the rest of the picture. This has the look of a bad student movie (and the budget does not seem to be much more). It moves like molasses, the plot is mostly either exaggerated ham or below the surface comatose - although Raul Julia performs better than most of the other performers - and it's full of trouble historical inaccuracies. In addition, it is far too long. If you want to make a boring movie, do it in an hour or so and put it behind you - do not stretch it out over three hours, as is the case here. If you want to watch a good movie about the Alamo, check out John Wayne's 1960 version, or even the 1955 movie that stole his action scenes. Hard to believe that six producers made such a lousy film. Skip it.

summary: The US needs to convince the visiting emir Khala'ad of Othar to allow an American military base in his strategic realm. Clueless nightclub waitress Sunny Ann Davis accidentally spots and stops a terrorist shooting at the president and his royal guest. Her naive comments charm the press, so the State Department recruits her for its Protocol. She falls in love with charming Middle East desk chief Michael Ransome, who resigns rather than help trick her into a 'contact mission' to Othar, where the emir's plan with her unexpectedly stirs a revolution.
translation: Actually, Goldie Hawn is from Washington (Takoma Park, Maryland), but I digress. This is a kind of Mr. Smith goes to Washington kind of movie, with some variations, but the same premise. I recorded this movie years ago because I had a crush on Goldie Hawn. The story is interesting, but it's unlikely that a cocktail waitress will get an important job in the government just because she saved the life of a big girl. It made me laugh and made me angry at the same time. It made me laugh because some of the situations she was in were so ridiculous I had to laugh. (POSSIBLE SPOILER FORWARD). It made me crazy to think that our government would set up an average citizen in the way it was built. And the speech she gave in the end ... beautiful. Too bad that not many people in real life have such guts.

summary: One day after Kyle gives $20 to a homeless person, South Park becomes overrun with panhandlers.
translation:
Night Of The Living Homeless is a funny parody of the 1978 movie (and remake 2004) of "Dawn Of The Dead". Only this time ... with the homeless. The episode has homeless people who all come to South Park and the people I can not figure out why. They treat the homeless as zombies who want to change, and a few parents end up like in the movie on the roof of a supermarket. Now it's up to the boys to figure out where they come from and how to get rid of them. This is a pretty funny episode with some good moments, like the guys singing their own version of the 2pac / Dr.Dre song "California Love". Overall, a good episode.

8/10

summary: When a chauvinist millionaire buys the television network where the sexy Elvira is the horror hostess of a late show, she quits her job with the intention of producing her own show in Las Vegas. However, the producers demand 50 thousand dollars from her and Elvira does not have the money. Out of the blue, she receives a telegram informing that her great-aunt Morgana died and she has an inheritance to receive. Elvira drives to the uptight town of Fallwell, Massachusetts, where her convertible breaks down. While repairing her convertible, Elvira inherits an archaic mansion, a recipe book and a poodle. Her great-uncle Vincent Talbot proposes to buy her book, but the poodle hides it in the sofa. Meanwhile, the conservative council of Fallwell feels uncomfortable with Elvira's clothes and behavior and does not let her find a job. But cinema owner Bob Redding and the local teenagers help Elvira. When she decides to cook a dinner to impress Bob, she uses Morgana's recipe and finds that it is...
translation: "Elvira, Mistress of the Dark" is a kind of "Harper Valley P.T.A." with touches of the supernatural. Elvira (Cassandra Peterson) leaves her job as a horror film hostess after the owner of the new station has become fresh with her. She now relies on a Las Vegas show to get her through, but she has to learn that she has to raise more money for the show. It looks hopeless to raise this money until she learns of the death of her aunt, who then brings Elvira to Massachusetts to read the will. A house to repair, a dog, and a cookbook are all things left to her by her aunt, and again it seems that Elvira has trouble making the money for the Las Vegas show. The adults of the small and narrow-minded city make things worse by making it harder for Elvira. Only the local hero (Daniel Greene) and a group of teenagers will make friends with her. Elvira's uncle "Vinnie" (W. Morgan Sheppard) urges Elvira for a cookbook, but Elvira soon learns of her powerful inheritance, which includes casting, and some very effective casseroles. Elvira no longer wants to sell the cookbook to her uncle, but he is determined to understand it in the knowledge of his power. Elvira is then burned at the city's stake for witchcraft and the showdown between her and her uncle. The plot is pretty simple, but the humor and the well-developed characters keep it up at a good pace. "Elvira, Mistress Of The Dark" is full of sweet, rude, mischievous and clever humor, fueled by the many visual gags, puns, props, songs and parodies. The touch of the occult makes this movie one of the best horror parodies of all time. It's a well-made movie with a terrific spectacle by all the actors; including Edie McClurg and Jeff Conaway (from "Grease"). There are also beautiful special effects. Many people (including myself) wondered if the Elvira character could wear a feature film, and the answer is pleasing: YES!

summary: Swedish scientist named Karl Markov is taken hostage by the KGB. After his daughter Nadia is also kidnapped and brought deep into the heart of Russia, a group of highly trained ninjas, led by American CIA agent Mason, is ordered to get them out.
translation: You have been scolded and beaten by my harsh statements about "femme fatale" / "guns n 'gals" movies! Now comes another breed in disappointing rediscoveries: Ninja Movies! I have already seen many of them, and let me tell you, they are not all that it is. They usually do not stay in the spot. This, among all others, does not suffer from originality! What does a ninja have to do with preventing a nuclear holocaust in Russia? And should not that be a "martial arts" movie? Can a lot of shots sound like an incredible action movie? Is blood the main reason for loving this to death? Will you waste some of your hard-earned money on a lady singing in her transparent tank top? The answers to these important questions can be found in THE NINJA MISSION, which should be included in the martial arts section of your video store. For even more senseless ninja fun, try the Godfrey Ho films from Trans World. You get what you deserve and that is a promise! Only recommended for hardcore ninja addicts!

summary: Adapted from the successful play, the film takes place in the 19th Japan where a war between demons and their slayers is fought. Izumo, an Kabuki actor with a demon-slaying past, meets and falls in love with Tsubaki. However, something is not right as mysterious marks appear on her body as time progresses. At the same time, it is announced that Ashura, the queen of all demons, will be resurrected and bring destruction to the universe.
translation:
Japan is in serious trouble. Demons have infested Edo, taking possession of earthly forms and subjecting them to their unholy will. In addition, the rebirth of Ashura, Queen of Demons, is near. The only thing that stands against this serious threat is the Demon Wardens, a fearsome group of warriors who could be as bad as the demons themselves.

Izumo is a retired demon guard who died five years ago, took up theater instead of demon slaying after accidentally killing an innocent child (in a battle strangely reminiscent of the dusk-dawn bar scene). One night, he happens to meet a beautiful and mysterious woman named Tsubaki. Their destinies are intertwined (literally) and they are bound by fate to be lovers and enemies.

If you think this sounds like your typical Japanese fantasy / swordplay epic, you're wrong. In fact, there is nothing typical about Ashura. It's a smorgasbord of many different genres of the movie. The just mentioned, as well as a comedy, drama and romance. Director Yojiro Takita (Onmyoji) juggles the genre quite respectfully (though the comedy seems forced in some scenes) and the end result is a ridiculous but really funny popcorn movie.

Of course there are mistakes in the movie. Some of the humor seems to be invented and out of place. And action is not the greatest thing. But seriously, are you watching fantasy / swordplay / comedy films for the great acting performances? No, we see her for the action and crazy CG visuals that Ashura has in spades. Not to be misled, the movie is not just action, but generously cut with lots of sword fighting and buckets of green blood to make the average viewer happy.

Bottom line; The film has its faults and is not a martial arts epic, but it does not try to be and it offers interesting visuals and good sword fighting action. The reason the movie worked for me is that it never takes itself too seriously and if the spectator does the same, he will surely love this funny and silly sword fighting fantasy action strip.

My rating 7 out of 10. Fun popcorn movie.

summary: Poor Annie every time she falls asleep, her dreams are haunted by visions of a faceless man committing unspeakable crimes. Just like a kid afraid of the dark, the Boogeyman has made her afraid to close her eyes. Annie soon realizes her hideous dreams are predictions. If she can harness this terrifying power, perhaps she can prevent the bloody slaughter she forsees, and track down the Boogeyman before his body count climbs any higher. Their actions are very brave, but are Annie and her friends the hunters... or the hunted?
translation: in fact, it's basically the same movie. And they could not even correct the timeline of events. Maybe that was intentional because of laziness or not interesting. one thing, this thing is a real woofer. it did not even deserve it. I saw it as a second feature on the original The Boogeyman CD. I thought my head would explode, and I urge you to run as far in the opposite direction as you should be cursed with the misfortune of combing your way. It should come with a warning like: Warning - may cause your IQ to drop several points when you are near it. For me, there is no doubt that this thing is a 0/10

summary: TV presenter Will Chaney is as cute as they get and a dear devoted daddy to his pre-teen son Benjamin 'Ben'. Alas the somewhat shy, confused boy is the only good thing that came out of Will's marriage. Under divorce custody rules Will picks up Ben at Denver airport at the start - and near tears drops him off again at the end of every major school holiday. There Will meets divorc√©e Jane, who similarly picks up and drops off her daughter. Both good, involuntarily part-time parents hold back dating to spare their kids another traumatic break-up. Luckily their best friends, Will's cameraman Charlie and Jane's sister Georgia, encourage them to go out together. Once Ben gets used to the situation, at last saying 'dad' instead of Will, he gives his crucial blessing, even picks Jane over the only other date dad presented to him, so exit Maddie. Finally Will considers a bold move, which however is probably detrimental to his first shot at promotion from weatherman to news-desk presenter, as ...
translation: I'm glad someone made a movie about how hard it is to risk your heart a second time. Or third. This movie is exactly what it promises - lovely, amusing and it gives you that good feeling when it's over. The plot may not be very inventive, but there are millions of ways to tell the story, and they have not all been used yet. The cast is perfectly chosen, although Scott Wolf does not look like a father of an eight-year-old, even if he wears a suit. Well, the sparks are in the right places, supporting cast is lovably supportive and though you could probably predict the whole movie, you would not want to change the channel. It's just the right kind of entertainment for a Sunday night.

summary: San Francisco is preparing for the premiere of a new staging of the Puccini opera, Turandot. The passionate story of the Chinese princess Turandot, and the mysterious three riddles which are the key to her heart, are on the lips of opera buffs throughout the city. At the same time, a serial killer is haunting the gay bars of the city and is killing HIV positive long-term survivors. Stefan, a young gay East German medical student, arrives in the city for a medical congress and is following the trail of his dead father, a once high ranking AIDS researcher in the East. Stefan is investigating whether the HIV virus was an incremental result of secret human experiments that were conducted in US prisons in the seventies - a thesis of the Berlin professor Jakob Segal, which was spread by state agents of former East Germany. Secret lists involving these biological experiments are rumored to have surfaced in San Francisco. Stefans main contact person is being killed in an illegal club, right ...
translation:
Jochen Hick wrote and directed this little thriller of an exciting movie based on the concept that the AIDS virus is a government-mutated sheep virus designed to rid the world of gays and apparently in the years leading up to the onset of the terrible disease Convicts was tested. Without the sharpness of the concept of film, this would fall into the category of many films about the destruction of the world by a rampant, non-biased infectious organism.

Stefan (Tom Wlaschiha) Traveling from Berlin to San Francisco to study his father's scientific assumptions about the induced sheep virus and its effects on the convicts into whom it was infused. He encounters some contempt and resistance to a dead theory, but also meets some people who know the theory and support his investigation. Simultaneously with his visit, there will be a series of serial killings in which every victim will be killed in a similar manner and accompanied by every murder of Puccini's opera "Turandot", which is currently opening at the San Francisco Opera. A police investigator Louise Tolliver (Irit Levi) and her attendant policeman (Kalene Parker) are following the murders as Stefan goes around the sex clubs and bars in San Francisco trying to locate men who may have been guinea pigs for his father's theory , He encounters a strange guy Jeffrey (Jim Thalman), with whom he has an attraction for cats and mice, and a prominent Doctor Burroughs (Richard Conti), who seems strangely involved in the occupation of suspects. How it all ends is the game of the film, a story so much about the search for identity between Stefan and Jeffery, as it is for the investigation of murders.

While Tom Wlaschiha, Jim Thalman and Richard Conti are good with their roles (they're the only three who already have acting experience in this movie!), the quality of the film drops considerably by the less than acceptable Minimal talented Irit Levy and Kaylene Parker: when they are screen the credibility of the story falls below zero. There are some little cameos from other actors that brighten the screen for the moments they inhabit, but throughout the movie he is suffocated by the incessant repetition of "Nessun dorma" as Mario del Monaco sang from a recording of the opera - and that seems to be the reason for the movie! Good idea for a movie and some good characterization by the actors, but there is no solution to the initial premise that started the whole thing. Grady Harp, February 6th

summary: Young secretary Carla is a long-time employee of a property development company. Loyal and hardworking, first to arrive and last to leave, Carla is beginning to chafe at the limitations of her career and is looking to move up. But as a 35-five-year-old woman with a hearing deficiency, she is not sure how to climb out of her humdrum life, though she is confident in her own abilities. Into her life comes Paul Angeli, a new trainee she decides to hire. Paul is 25 years old and completely unskilled, but Carla covers for him when the need arises because of his other qualities - he's a thief, fresh out of jail and very good-looking. It's a case of good meeting bad.
translation:
This film has a rotting core of flexible morals and yet a stubborn sense of justice. So many of the regular Joe's among us would love to "stick to the MAN". The "MAN" is represented in this case by several different characters. Mr. Keller, about whom Carla reports in her office. Later, Paul owes Mr. Marchand the club owner. And then there's Paul's probation officer. There seem to be so many questions about the side story of this last character. Reviewers point out that this is a weakness in an otherwise very successful underground ping-pong game between our two protagonists, escalating their tits until their lives change dramatically. They are committed to every agent of the "MAN". One or both can be fired, killed or imprisoned if they do not do as they are told.

The film has a sense of relief at the end. Carla is finally laid. Your boss is forced to be an idiot. Mr. Club owner is a mushy mess in his own bathroom. You get the $ money $. And ... they do not need to worry about reporting to the probation officer because HIS moral weakness leads him to hide his wandering wife in the basement (or whatever the police found to arrest him). It's a critical unconscious trigger for the castle glass that made us so tight. It does not matter that someone else gets Paul's file later to oversee his release; For the moment they are free! You could even get away with it!

Woohoo ...

You stuff it to the man!

summary: Youngsters from different countries, races, and social background are forced to integrate when they all enroll in Columbus University. They all have their own problems, such as finance, harrassment, personal safety, and self doubt. Additionally, campus life seems to be causing a problem for everyone: racism. Students, already under pressure to perform in the classroom, on the track, or in front of their friends, are strained to the breaking point by prejudice, inexperience, and misunderstanding.
translation: Higher learning is a slap in the face for those of us who have been in the closet for too long, regardless of their ethnic background. It is an issue that most of us would like to ignore, but we can not afford it if there is a real progressive change in the way we can accept and understand diversity. Some have criticized this film as hateful or stupid. It is about ignorance prevailing in the world and some continuing to dominate our society. Everyone involved in this film has done a good deed by showing what steps need to be taken further to avoid having to make movies higher. It sounds like a dream, but we have to start somewhere and that helps.

summary: Vince Lombardi High School keeps losing principals to nervous breakdowns because of the students' love of rock 'n' roll and their disregard of education. The putative leader of the students is Riff Randell, who loves the music of the Ramones. A new principal, the rock-music-hating Miss Evelyn Togar, is brought in and promises to put an end to the music craze. When Miss Togar and a group of parents attempt to burn a pile of rock records, the students take over the high school, joined by the Ramones, who are made honorary students. When the police are summoned and demand that the students evacuate the building, they do so, which leads to an explosive finale.
translation: It is amazing that the actress P.J. Soles did not become a big star after playing Riff Randall, number 1 in punk rock group Ramones, at Rock'n'Roll High School. Soles is so effusive that she does not mind that she's obviously too old to be in high school (this fact is offset by the fact that all the kids look 24). The film is a fast-paced joke that does not excite; In the end, everything is torn to pieces, and so it should be. Mary Voronov, a naturally kinky and witty presence as a Nazi-style headmistress, gets a great, unique piece at the beginning, where frisbees fly dangerously close to her head (how many takes did she use, right?) Was it a lucky hit ?) and Dey Young is very appealing as Soles best, Kate Rambeau. The weakest link, ironically, in this "high school" chain group are the Ramones. They can not play, they are not funny, and their concert segment takes too long. A Ramones song, "I Want You Around," is treated like a fantasy and is well captured; other minor songs are good, especially a rare Paul McCartney ballad that was heard at the beginning ("Have we ever met?"). Have fun! *** from ****

summary: Dr. Hackenstein is a genial but somewhat misguided scientist. He murders the locals for their body parts, but it's not for power or scientific research; he just needs them to put his wife back together.
translation: Apparently there is a very good reason why I never heard of "Dr. Hackenstein" in front of me and a few buddies have come across it by chance and stupidly decided to give it a chance. This reason is: it's shit! It's a very pointless, dull, feeble-minded and totally unthinkable horror comedy / parody. To be honest, I'm not even sure if that was meant as a comedy, because sometimes the script takes itself seriously and really tries to be a really ambitious and original horror game of the late 80's. In 1909, at the beginning of a new era in medical science, Dr. Elliot Hackenstein according to the opening sequences exactly three women? no more and no less ?? to renovate his beloved wife, whom he accidentally killed. She is now just a living head, but the stupid body-eaters only supply male carcasses. So, if Dr. Hacking screams, "I need to bring back three female bodies to my wife," his words are not even cold and it miraculously only three young women appear (and a really annoying nerdy kid) with problems with the car pointing at his front door. Why does not that happen to me? "I need a bunch of sexy voluptuous women to fill my empty harem !!!" ?? See nothing! Anyway, the good doctor sees his wish fulfilled, but unfortunately? for science that is ?? he develops sympathy for one of the three girls. "Dr. Hacking "is a lame movie that seeks to steal on the success of" Re-Animator "and even blatantly stealing some of the weird aspects of this classic one-of-a-kind talking headset. It's easy to understand why this movie is not mentioned anywhere because it does not appeal to fans of horror or comedy. The funniest figure is undoubtedly the loud-talking grave robber Ruby; presented by the anti-cherubic Anne Ramsey. The horror fans of the '80s will certainly remember Wes Craven's "Deadly Friend", where she plays the nasty old neighbor beheaded by a basketball. "Dr. Hackenstein" is said to take place in the early 1900s, but there are few attempts to recreate the atmosphere of that era (except perhaps for some cars). Dr. Hackenstein's lab is a pretty stereotypical '80s set, with all sorts of smoky cauldrons and test tubes full of fluorescent colors.

summary: After more than four hundred years of war between the Shinobi warriors of the Manjidani Koga and Tsubagakure Iga clans, the Lord Hattori Hanzou decrees that they must live in peace. Both clans live hidden in the woods and mountain without confrontation and without training ninjas in the shadow art of Shinobi. In 1614, the Lord of the Lords is convinced that the clans are dangerous threats for keeping peace in his lands, and his advisor plots a Machiavellian plan to destroy their best warriors in a contest. Meanwhile, the young Iga Oboro and Koga Gennesuke fall in love for each other. When Oboro's grandmother and leader of Iga clan Ogen and Gennesuke's father and leader of the Koga clan Danjo kill each other, Oboro and Gannesuke must lead their warriors in the ultimate battle of the Shinobi clans.
translation:
"Shinobi" is one of those movies that think that the mere act of killing a character automatically brings a sense of sincerity or emotion into the story. Unfortunately, the characters have to be developed so that the public really cares about the mortals, otherwise all you have is a series of arbitrary acts of violence. The problem is especially aggravated if you have many characters who all die.

OK, so if you do not care about making the characters somehow memorable or sympathetic, you can at least PLEASE REASON why they die plausibly, right? Nope. Here we have a war between two Ninja clans, where no side really knows WHY they are fighting. They kill each other because the Emperor says that. But even after it becomes apparent that the Emperor wants to see ALL dead, they still refuse to give up their meaningless missions. That's no stubbornness ... that's just stupid.

Good, good! There is no character development and the plot does not provide a sound reason for the fight. At least they die in cool action scenes, right? Again, NO! In fact, many of the fights are not even battles: Super Ninjas, who has spent so much time and effort on film, suddenly die (and lame, in my opinion). I'm talking about things like, "Lalala, I'm running with you and I - * the neck is slashed *." The end for this character. Not even in the middle of the film did I throw my hands into ridicule in frustration.

summary: General Hammond summons Colonel Jack O'Neill out of retirement to embark on a secret rescue mission. O'Neill confesses that he disobeyed orders to destroy the Stargate on Planet Abydos, and that scientist Daniel Jackson may still be alive. Arriving on Abydos with his team, O'Neill meets up once again with the scientist, who has discovered a giant elaborate cartouche in hieroglyphics. All signs point to the fact that this is a map of many Stargates that exist throughout the galaxy - a development that makes the dream of the SG-1 team to travel throughout the universe in time a reality.
translation:
Stargate SG-1 follows and expands the Egyptian mythologies in Stargate. In the Stargate universe, people were enslaved by the Goa'uld, such as Ra and Apophis, and transported to habitable planets. For thousands of years, the Goa'uld have been harvesting humanity and influencing and spreading human cultures. As a result, earth cultures such as the Aztecs, Mayans, British, Scandinavians, Mongols, Greeks and Romans are found in the known habitable planets of the galaxy. Many well-known mythical places like Avalon, Camelot and Atlantis were found or existed earlier.

Currently the Earth's Stargate (found at an excavation site near Giza in 1928) is housed in a top-secret US military base known as SGC (Stargate Command) under Cheyenne Mountain. Col. Jack O'Neill (Anderson), dr. Daniel Jackson (Shanks), Captain Samantha Carter (Tapping) and Teal'c (Judge) compose the original SG-1 team (a few characters join and / or leave the team) in later seasons). Together with 24 other SG teams, they travel to distant planets, explore the galaxy, and seek out defenses from the Goa'uld, in the form of technology and alliances with friendly advanced races.

The parasitic Goa'uld Use advanced technology to cast themselves as Egyptian gods and are geared for galactic conquest and eternal worship. During the first eight seasons, the Goa'uld are the main opponents. They are a race of highly intelligent, unscrupulous snake-like extraterrestrial parasites capable of attacking and controlling the bodies of other species, including humans. The original archenemy of this race was the system owner Apophis (Peter Williams). Other system owners, such as Baal and Anubis, play a central role in the later seasons. The ninth season features a new villain, the Ori. The Ori are advanced beings with unfathomable technology from another galaxy who are also focused on galactic conquest and eternal worship. The introduction of the Ori is a departure from the primary focus on Egyptian mythology in an exploration of the Arthurian mythology around the Ori, their followers and their enemies.

summary: (Korean with English subtitles) Helmed by one of Korea's leading directors, Hong Sang-soo, Jisook joins two of her girlfriends for a holiday in Korea's Kangwon Province. But in an eerie twist of fate, her former lover, Sangkwon, plans a getaway for the same destination, where tragedy brings them together once again.
translation:
A common storyline in films is that the main characters leave the hustle and bustle of the city behind and find themselves in the tranquility of nature. The Power of Kangwon Province features two stories of people doing just that and trying to find their way to popular Korean parks in the mountains of Kangwon province. But instead of epiphany, we have two characters whose journey to nature was just another form of escape.

The tempo of this film is slow and contemplative. In the end, we learn what really brought everyone to Kangwon Province, and we learn how they are connected. For those who want to give Hollywood glamor and a movie a definite answer, this movie will not satisfy. But for those who want a movie that makes them think, wonder and influence them years later, this movie will more than satisfy that longing.

summary: How do children respond to tragedy? On an icy road near Chicago, Marianne dies in a crash, leaving Joe and their daughters, Kelly, about 16, and Mary, about 9. That summer, a friend from Joe's graduate student days, 20 years before, arranges a teaching job for him in Genoa. When they arrive in June, Joe starts teaching and the girls have the summer before school starts: Kelly quickly falls in with youths her age; their club and beach life leads to sexual awakening. Mary, burdened by guilt for her mother's death, is solitary. The girls take piano lessons, Mary draws, and she also sees and talks to her mother. Joe asks them, "Are you okay?", but is that enough?
translation:
This film is about a family trying to deal with the mother / wife's death by moving to Genoa, Italy.

The plot of "Genova" sounds promising, but unfortunately it is empty and without focus. The film consists only of a collection of scenes that depict the everyday life of the family, such as swimming, piano lessons or cooking eggs. Most of these scenes are superfluous and tedious, and viewers are not fully emotionally involved. The end is very disappointing because it is not spectacular, moving or emotional. I can say with certainty that I am disappointed and bored by "Genova". The only good thing about the film is the sunny weather and the beauty of Genoa. "Genova" can serve as an extensive tourism promotion for the city, but not as a movie to be enjoyed.

summary: A woman has dreams that she is a werewolf so she goes out and finds men. She proceeds to have sex with them and then rip their throats out with her teeth. She eventually falls in love but then she is raped and her lover is murdered so she goes out for revenge.
translation:
"A young woman suffers from the delusion that she is a werewolf based on a family legend of a predecessor accused of being killed and supposedly to be one, and because of her earlier treatment by men, she travels the countryside seducing and killing the men She falls in love with a friendly man, her life seems to change for the better when she is raped and her lover is killed by a gang of thugs. Tamed by these recent events, the woman returns to her violent ways and seeks revenge on the thugs, "it says in the DVD case.

Rino Di Silvestro's "La lupa mannara" begins with a frontal, writhing, groaning dance of the shapely blonde Annik Borel, who (as Daniella Neseri) mistakenly believes she is a werewolf. The hottest part is when the camera catches background fire between her legs. The first "look back" shows that her hairy ancestor was (probably) a Lycanthropic creature. Unfortunately, Mrs. Borel is not a werewolf; She is just a very strong lunatic.

As a movie, "Werewolf Woman" would have been better if Borel's character had really been a female werewolf; with their sexual victimization a great characterization. But as far as the skin and blood films of the 1970s go, this one is hard to beat. Bouncy Borel is either nude or sexy dressed in the movie, which contains a lot of superfluous blood. The dazzling Dagmar Lassander (as Elena) and the hunky Howard Ross (as Luca) are good supporting actors.

summary: Artemisia Gentileschi (1593-1653) was one of the first well-known female painters. The movie tells the story of her youth, when she was guided and protected by her father, the painter Orazio Gentileschi. Her professional curiosity about the male anatomy, forbidden for her eyes, led her to the knowledge of sexual pleasure. But she was also well known because in 1612 she had to appear in a courtroom because her teacher, Agostino Tassi, was suspected of raping her. She tried to protect him, but was put in the thumb screws...
translation: The acting is good, the women are beautiful and the men are good-looking, so if you're looking for well-performed soft porn, this movie is for you. Otherwise, you are wasting your time. The motivation of the main characters, especially the namesake, is often a mystery. She could have simply told the truth - the truth as portrayed in the film, not necessarily the historical truth - and her lover would have been in jail for a rape he had not committed. Was she protecting her father, who half-blown, as it were, when he fiercely launched a malicious trial? Was she protecting herself, with her reputation suddenly alarming, if only her art mattered? During the trial, this strong-willed woman turns to mush before our eyes. Conversely, her lover, who begins as a narcissistic idiot, becomes a selfless hero during the process. At least his motivation is clearer: he sacrifices himself for love. Of course, since no good deed must go unpunished, we are told that she will never see him again.

summary: In the year 2017, the world economy has collapsed. The great freedoms of the United States are no longer, as the once great nation has sealed off its borders and become a militarized police state, censoring all film, art, literature, and communications. Even so, a small resistance force led by two revolutionaries manages to fight the oppression. With full control over the media, the government attempts to quell the nation's yearning for freedom by broadcasting a number of game shows on which convicted criminals fight for their lives. The most popular and sadistic of these programs is "The Running Man," hosted by Damon Killian. When a peaceful protest of starving citizens gathers in Bakersfield, California, a police officer named Ben Richards is ordered to fire on the crowd, which he refuses to do. Subdued by the other officers, the attack is carried out, and Richards is framed for the murder of almost a hundred unarmed civilians. Following a daring jail break months later, Richards is...
translation:
I read the Running Man from King's books when Bachman and I found John and his family to be the protagonist. This movie could have been SO much more. Difficulties? It was discontinued during the big action movie craze. I saw the movie and was in pain all the time. I felt nothing for the character and less for his cause. Yes, it had funny scenes (or ridiculous), though I think it did not save the movie in my eyes. When you read the book, you can feel the climax and fire in John's heart when he gets his last revenge.

I give this movie a low number. It might not have been that deep if I had not read the book.

summary: In "Love Trap" we meet Richard- a laid-back yet forward-thinking law student- hanging out with the guys at a local pool hall. When Angel- a seductive vixen in a red dress- appears from nowhere and smothers him with attention, he finds himself in a situation most guys wish for. Faced with temptation, Richard makes a seemingly innocent suggestion that sets in motion a series of events that ultimately unbalances his world. When the dust settles, we witness Richard's small but profound epiphany about the true nature of love.
translation:
Love Trap is not a short film, it is obviously a feature-length feature film with a running time of 105 minutes.

As I write this, I could also talk a little bit more about Love Trap. I'm often asked what makes Love Trap different ... so I answer that question: 1) It introduces characters - a special one - that's never been seen in a movie before.

2) It reveals more truth about love and delves deeper into the concept of love than any other US movie has ever done, in my humble opinion.

3) Structurally, as in the way the story is told, it's unlike any love story you've ever seen.

4) It provides extremely timely insights into various cultural issues, both inside and outside the Black community.

Please visit www.lovetrapmovie.com for complete and accurate information about this movie.

summary: After walking away from an auto accident that leaves his wife in a coma and on life support, the distraught Cliff Addison finds himself in a living hell in which he must decide to let his wife die. But the situation becomes more nightmarish and crazy when her vengeful spirit threatens to expose a dirty secret of his own.
translation:
Why did it sound as if the husband still called her Appy? It ruined a big episode so I can only give it a 6. Proper grammar and pronunciation are essential for a movie.

It was very hellraiser, which ruptures with the whole skin, though I do not know how anyone can survive. Without skin, the skin is a vital organ for the body, the largest organ actually and without us dying , The more a horror movie is true, the scary it can be and more entertaining.

I admit, however, that the stories of the great horror directors are very disappointing and very mediocre.

6/10 Come on, yankies bring your English in full swing!

summary: An American in Ho Chi Minh City looks for a daughter he fathered during the war. He meets Woody, a child who's a street vendor, and when Woody's case of wares disappears, he thinks the soldier took it. Woody hunts for him. A cyclo driver, Hai, gives a ride to Lan, a hotel call girl, and starts waiting for her daily; he falls in love with her and tries to break through her tough veneer. Kien An, a young woman, takes a job harvesting lotuses in the ponds of Teacher Dao, a reclusive man who has leprosy. Her singing awakens him from depression, and he asks her to write down poetry he has composed. The characters' paths cross in small ways, around flowers and kindnesses.
translation:
Nice try and good ideas (redemption of the prostitutes, mutually helping people, ...) but a bad result ... The director apparently tried to emulate his French colleague Tran Anh Hung by imitating an ambience that should portray Vietnam. The only problem is that this Vietnam is long gone and had a historical background as "The scent of green papaya" ... trying to project that kind of atmosphere (dull sounds and the slow pace of life ...) Modern days leaves a sense of fake. It also quickly creates a feeling of boredom and the result becomes too obvious.

I can only assume that the action takes place in Saigon or Da Nang, because there is Harvey Keitel, ex-Marine in the film, was probably stationed during the war ... But nobody or South Vietnam speak very few people with the clip Northern Accent, which is shown by the actors ... Seriously funny even for a bad Vietnamese speaker.

An old poet with leprosy ... very doubtful (no disease for humans in his condition), a peasant girl who can read and write artful Vietnamese poetry, ... even more dubious ...

summary: A collection of skits that make fun of television. Everything from commercials to the nightly news are spoofed. Chevy Chase makes a brief (as well as his debut), appearance.
translation:
They know what they say about the '70s. If you can remember, you were not there. One of the few things I remember about the 70's was the first hippie and hip social satire, as seen from a completely, underground'or counterculture perspective..The Groove Tube. If the humor or witless fades out now some viewers may just be there, because a lot has happened in the last 30 years, and the comedy is not 'fresh' anymore..but hey! When this movie came out, it was a first ... and some of those skits were made for the first time ... At a time when Nixon was in office, the Vietnam War raged, the sexual revolution was in full swing. .and J. Edgar Hoover was still responsible for the FBI. This is a movie before Watergate broke and as such was one of the first to take a big punch at the establishment..to make fun of the hippies at the same time. And frankly, some skits are still funny. If you like Cheech and Chong's "Up In Smoke" ... you'll love this movie.

If you want to know what the 70s really were like ... watch the Groove Tube ... if you like the Oscar-winning "Network" from the same year and thought it was in Indeed, in his wild look at TV, you'll dig the groove tube .. which picks up the theme but plays from the view of the viewers .. the young viewers who turned off the TV in favor of other entertainment .... We had on Ozzie & Harriet "It's been to Beaver Leave", Father is the Best, My Three Sons..Happy Days ... so, our joy, as those of us who experimented with the new lifestyles, envision a shipment of the box from ours Could see perspective! The commercials of Uranus Corporation alone are priceless. "Good things come from Uranus" .... and the sudden break from the straight movie in Fritz's cat-style animation, when the hippies eat the grass, is still one of the best transitions in and out of sanity I've ever had seen on film.

If you liked the Kentucky Fried movie you will LOVE this movie. And if you've ever wondered why your crazy Uncle Harold still has a bad look in his eyes when he thinks back to his college days ... then that would be the perfect movie to watch.
Take it for what it is .. a memento of time ... and a cheeky little movie that helps us all those who have forgotten the 70s to remember them.

summary: In 1918 in World War I, in the Meuse-Argonne Sector in France, the former New York lawyer and Major Charles White Whittlesey is assigned by Gen. Robert Alexander to a massive suicidal attack against the German forces in the Argonne Forest with his five-hundred-man battalion. However, the forces supposed to be giving support through the flanks retreat and the communications with the headquarter of the 77th American Division are cut. Major Wittlesey holds his position with his men, mostly Irish, Polish, Italian and Jewish immigrants from New York, surrounded by the German army. Without food, water, ammunition and medical supplies, only two hundred men survive after five days of siege.
translation: This movie has the stench made for the TV. But it started with great intentions, with great-looking sets and authentic props and costumes. The film quickly degenerated into a terrible dialect on the nose and flooded TV melodramatic drama. The characters were so cheesy that at times I thought they were going to turn into a bilious puddle, and the plot was so intricate and badly cut that it looked like the soldiers just stood around and took turns shooting at each other. The Germans were presented so unrealistically that it was painful to observe them. The only thing the German officers talked about was how wonderful the Americans are. Please take my word for it. I'm a big fan of the war genre and this movie is crap. Nonetheless, this DVD has an excellent additional feature that covers letters from the front of the First World War, so this rental is not a total waste of my time.

summary: A wild stallion is captured by humans and slowly loses the will to resist training. Yet throughout his struggles for freedom, the stallion refuses to let go of the hope of one day returning home to his herd.
translation:
I recently saw Spirit and I really liked it, I've seen it four times on HBO and I'm going to buy the DVD. Those who gave negative reviews would probably think that "Vanishing Point" was just another chase film and "Thelma & Louise" was just another chick movie. Although the conclusions of these films are darker, I feel that the themes are somewhat related; that freedom and individualism are very important and that there is usually someone who wants to take it away from you. The other common feature of these films is the caring, thoughtful 'guardian angel' types that help the main characters overcome adversity.

Another review here mentions how this film refers to the theme of civilization invading a home. You just have to look at the dwindling open spaces around us to see that.

I loved the animation and the story, the entertainers really got the horses to look, act and move in a natural way. Spirit's emotions were very clear as the story progressed (yes, I'm aware that they are humanizing the horses a bit, but that's fiction). In some action scenes you feel trapped in the current of the rapids and the heat of a forest fire. In other quiet scenes (which are most of the time) you can enjoy the backgrounds. One of the great things that makes history work is that you do not go on the talking, singing animal route. This would escape the power of history. Instead, the storyline is told through occasional narrations of the main character, and the fantastic soundtrack adds even more. Another plus is that they were not afraid to tell the story something of a dark side (which made this film truly tangible to me). However, this is not common throughout the movie, and the conclusion is fitting and uplifting without being sappily.

Those who appreciate horses will really like this movie, but I think it's a bit more than a horse movie. I do not think that this would be a good movie to take children with if they grew up with the filthy food that is being offered today. But if they are the thoughtful kind who can handle compelling stories like The Lord of the Rings and Black Beauty, they'll probably love this movie. Damn, I'm 35 years old and love the stuff.

summary: Kevin Chan (aka Jackie) is a Hong-Kong cop, who scores his first big hit by virtually single-handedly capturing and arresting a big drug- lord. Of course, the drug-lord isn't too happy about this, and frames Kevin with the murder of another cop (who happened to be on the take). Kevin has to clear his name, whilst keeping himself from getting killed or arrested, and keeping his girlfriend from leaving him.
translation: Police Story is arguably one of the action master's best works. Compared to other action movies, Police Story Schwarzenegger and Stallone make them look like newbies. The stunt scenes are well prepared and the action scenes are outstanding. If New Line Cinema has any sense, they would release it in theaters.

summary: American kids go to a space camp during the summer holidays. They learn how to operate the Space Shuttle. A team consisting of a guy who just entered to meet girls, a wanna be astronaut and an instructor who wanted to go on a mission instead of teaching can sit in the Shuttle while testing the engines. Then they're launched by mistake ...
translation:
I could see that this movie is awesome. He did not surprise himself, as he did for the truth, as well as for himself, like a flooded escape to what did not have the place, but it's just such a conspiratorial theory, right?

I really liked seeing this movie when I was the kid. I'm interesting what it was like when it turned out that such a flight really took place, certainly because it's not a belief because it denies logic and common sense. If you are in good health, use the Space Shuttle to send children into orbit. I like to read about American and Soviet space programs. I know that a few space shuttle missions have been provided by the CIA with the TOP SECRET clause. Of course these are just my divavations, but who knows?

summary: Madhavi is a newspaper journalist in Mumbai whose task is to fill the Page 3 column. Her job consists of attending parties among the socialite and small-time celebrity circle and reporting on it. Her roommates are Pearl, an air-hostess who wants to marry a rich man and settle down to a life of comfort; and Gayatri, a struggling actress. Gayatri is seduced by a leading married actor Rohit Kumar. When she finds out that she is pregnant, he advises her to abort the baby. Dejected, Gayatri tries to commit suicide but Madhavi and Pearl save her. She loses the baby and leaves Mumbai. Madhavi's job of interacting with shallow high-society people is depressing her. She wants to do some substantial reporting for a change, so she is assigned to the Crime beat alongwith veteran reporter Vinayak Mane.
translation:
Madhur Bhandarkar takes you on the wild side. And it's a remarkable one, literally and figuratively.

Mumbai High-society - stars and starlets, glam dolls and witch doctors, business tycoons and broker types, yep the whole stinking lot - are in sharp focus here. In a typical boulevard fashion unfold their worlds, each colorful story is a smart subplot.

A struggling starlet was dumped by the producer after she became pregnant, the stewardess and her well-known husband, the pedophile businessman and his neurotic wife, the reporters and the police captain; All shades on the display and countless shades in between.

Bhandarkar's mission is to dig up the muck of the drama kings, the dancing queens and the living dead. Atul Kulkarni and Boman Irani as well as Sandhya Mrudul are a real eye-catcher. Konkona Sen Sharma is effective as the former crime reporter, but she could have been spiced up a bit after the job change and the party scene.

Highly concentrated (running time 140 min) and refreshing another movie, worth the money.

summary: In Mexico, another vampire slayer, Derek Bliss, is hired by a shady priest and aided by a group of fellow slayers in finding a large nest of 'suckers' and their powerful leader, a vampire princess. She is seeking a legendary black crucifix - the same crucifix used unsuccessfully in the first movie to perform a ritual which will enable vampires to walk in sunlight and be invulnerable.
translation: First of all, Jon Bon Jovi does not seem to be in a vampire movie. Together with the other not so interesting characters and the bad story, the whole movie becomes predictable. If you think that and you're a total vampire movie fan, you can have fun with a few scenes. Do not expect Tarantino-style chapters and Anne-Rice history. (I expect to have forgotten the whole movie until tomorrow;)

summary: Eighteen-year-old Mathieu vacations at the beach with his family when he meets local teen C√©dric. After an extremely erotic kiss, the boys begin a passionate romance, complete with skinny-dipping at night, nude dancing on the beach and intense lovemaking in the dunes; yet, as Mathieu grapples with his sexuality and copes with his sick mother, absent father and annoying kid sister, his bond with C√©dric grows stronger until it bursts.
translation: The romance of the film, which is also its main theme, is well and beautifully presented. The environment of the love story is too lyrical, graphic and unrealistic. Worse, the main character's psychology is strange and incomprehensible, as is the end of the movie. Do not hesitate to see this movie if it arouses your interest, but do not expect too much.

summary: In this sci-fi adventure a gorgeous alien woman is sent to Earth by mistake from the planet Epsilon. Landing in the Australian outback she meets a surveyor and they cross the continent together. However, she spends the trip haranguing him for the ecological recklessness and avarice of the human race.
translation:
EPSILON, ALENSE VISITOR, is not what I expected. This is an Australian no-budget movie with no special effects except for an accelerated movie and fast scene cuts. The female alien (who is immediately able to speak perfectly accented Australians) can "flick" from place to place or from time to time and change her perception of the flow of time to suit the "faster" human.

An elderly grandmother tells her two granddaughters about a story a traveling man told her 40 years ago, when a nameless "she" came naked and completely disoriented to the planet and could not tell from what a star in the sky she came ... She meets a man camping alone in the Australian outback, obviously confusing him. She is here through "mistakes" and gets angry when she is told that she is on earth. The Earthlings are known as perfect environmentalists and a metaphor for the most insulting thing imaginable to the rest of the universe: those who "breathe the lazy air" but do nothing about it and stick their heads under the sand like a bunch. In another amusing metaphor, Earthlings are "frogs."

From then on, it's a dialogue about dialogue as the perplexed man tries to understand them. She is a peculiar psychology and points of view, even if she calls him unintelligent "quaint". The man begins to realize that it may be people who are irrational and do not think straight. But while she waits to be "beamed up" at home, she sees that this person is not completely flawed in his thinking and even falls in love with him.

The dialogue about perspectives is interesting in points, but it's all superimposed with a lumbering environmental message and a low-budget feeling (there are only two main characters flashing around various deserted scenes and the evil people on the planet are never seen). The environmental message offers no solutions, but paints one or two terrible metaphors about what will happen to nature and man when something is not done. The logic is not related either: the rest of the universe has "given up" on earth, but a spacewoman mistakenly trapped on Earth manages to make a positive change by completing the film. What creates a battalion of aliens who have been deliberately sent here, against pollution and waste?

summary: An anthology of overlapping vignettes exploring the lives of a variety of characters who happen to live in a suburbial shantytown atop a rubbish dump: The boy Roku-chan lives in a fantasy world in which he is a tram conductor. In his fantasy world, he is both the tram and the tram driver and follows a set route and schedule through the dump, reciting the refrain "Dodeska-den", "clickety-clack", mimicking the sound of his vehicle. Ryotaro, a hairbrush maker by trade, is saddled with supporting many children whom his unfaithful wife Misao[c] has conceived in different adulterous affairs, but is wholeheartedly devoted to them. A pair of drunken day laborers (Masuda and Kawaguchi) who engage in wife-swapping, only to return to their own wives the next day as though nothing has happened. A stoic, bleak man named Hei is frequented by Ocho who appears to be his ex-wife, and he watches emotionless as she takes care of his domestic chores. Shima, the man with the tic, is always defending his ...
translation:
In 1970, after five years absence, Kurosawa made his first movie in color. Dodes' Ka-Den is a film that revolves around many intertwined stories that take place in a small Tokyo slum.

The title comes from the sound a mentally retarded boy makes as he imagines he is making a move. We are beginning to get to know more of the people in the small community, the two drunks who are wives because they are not happy with those they have. The old man, who is the center of the city, who helps a burglar who wants to rob him. The very poor father and son, who can not afford a house, they imagine their own. At the end of the film, the stories all come together, some happy, some sad.

As this was Kurosawa's first color film, you can see that he uses it to his advantage and shows it. Maybe too much. This movie goes in many different directions and it's hard to calm down and get in. But do not get me wrong, Dodes' Ka-Den may not be the best of Kurosawa, but by the greatest director of all time, it's way better than 99% of today's movies.

summary: Though recognized for heroism as a lad, Ned Kelly can not escape the stigma of being the eldest of a brood sired by a known criminal. In days when an arrest equaled guilt and a conviction, his unfair imprisonment for horse thievery puts him steadfast, in the eyes of Victorian police, on the wrong side of things for life. With a sister unable to dissuade the unwanted advances of Constable Fitzpatrick, Ned, his brother Dan, and friends Joe Byrne and Steve Hart soon find themselves labeled "an outlaw gang" by the less-than-honorable constable. It's a designation they're apt to live up to after Ned's mother is unfairly arrested and sentenced to three years hard labor. In retaliation, the Kelly Gang strikes out against the oppressive Victorian government, with ultimately tragic results and passage into Australian folklore.
translation: I'm tired of people judging movies about their "historical accuracy." It's a movie guy !! The authors and directors should contribute their own story to the story! There are a lot of films out there that are not exactly accurate with the story .... Braveheart, Wyatt Earp, gangs of New York, Geronimo: An American legend, the last of the Mohicans ... all the awesome movies that are in the past slightly inaccurate. If you want to see some great actors doing what they do best, then I suggest you watch this movie and not worry about the accuracy of the facts. Just enjoy the quality of the film, the plot and one of the greatest actors of our time.

summary: Sabrina Spellman, a perfectly normal 16-year-old, is informed by her aunts, Hilda and Zelda, that she (and they, and her whole family on her father's side) are witches. She lives with them in Massachusetts while preparing to receive her witch's license. Along the way, she gets into many scrapes while figuring out how certain spells work. She also has to keep the secret from her boyfriend, Harvey, friends Jenny and later Valerie, stuck-up nemesis Libby, and her ever-suspicious vice-principal, Mr. Kraft.
translation: I love Sabrina! It's one of my favorite shows !! My favorite episodes are; The one where she turns Libby into a geek, the first episode, the true love episode and the rest of the first series. I think the college episodes were not as good as the high school ones, but they were better than the last series, which was awful. Valerie was a good figure, she was more rounded than Jenny, but Jenny had some brilliant episodes. Hilda and Zelda were incredible, and there seemed to be no explanation as to where they were going! Libby was also a good character. I never liked Morgan or Roxy, they just were not as good as their other friends.

summary: In April 2002, an Irish film crew is making a documentary about Venezuelan President Hugo Chavez, when a coup from the opposition is made.
translation: A remarkable documentary that vividly depicts a deeply divided country (further proofs can be found in some comments on IMDb ...!). Compare very well with Oliver Stone's "Comandante" (mainly a thorough examination of Fidel Castro's nostril hair). I do not know if Ch√°vez is everything he is, or another in the long line of populist Latin American caudillos. I also do not know if he will be able to meet the great expectations he has clearly built among the poor majority of Venezuelans. It is hardly reasonable to expect such a film to answer such questions - but I now have a pretty vivid idea of ‚Äã‚Äãwhat is at stake and what it feels like to be caught in the middle of a coup d'√©tat. Someone says in the movie "We Make History," and that's exactly what the movie feels like it's catching. Excellent stuff.

summary: Executive transvestite Eddie Izzard takes his show to San Francisco to give a brief history of pagan and Christian religions, the building of Stonehenge, the birth of the Church of England and of Western empires, and the need for a European dream. Along the way, he dramatizes Dr. Heimlich's search for a maneuver, the naming of Engelbert Humperdinck, Scooby and Shaggy as archetypes, Neil Armstrong on the moon, society's tolerance of mass murderers, how we sing anthems and carols, Hollywood adapting British films, JFK's trip to Berlin, thoughts on puberty, and how to work schoolbook-French phrases into Parisian conversation. Closeups catch the glint in his eye and his carefully-applied make-up.
translation: So, I'm home and I'll go through the channels one night, and I'll come across this man who wears heels and make-up and stands on a colorful background on HBO. Of course, I double-clicked and decided that I would take care for a while. I did not change the channel until it was done, it was so funny. The next time it was on, I took care to record it so I could watch it over and over, and it has remained one of my favorite pieces. In the first few minutes you realize that the audience is not sure what to think, but he quickly wins them with his incredible humor and wit. While many stand-up comedians come together in my head, Eddie Izzard stands out as one of the best. His style is incredibly refreshing, and it's nice to hear jokes about things like history and puberty when most comedians stay current events. His show stayed with me afterwards. I went to Italy in the summer, and all I could think about while I was there was, like "Italians always go on scooters, CIAO ..." 10 out of 10. You will not regret it.

summary: All Tess Trueheart wants is to settle down to a quiet life with her boyfriend, detective Dick Tracy. But there's something pretty rotten going on in town, with someone pretty rotten behind it, and Tracy has his hands full with the likes of villain Big Boy Caprice and with the almost irresistible Breathless Mahoney.
translation: I just recorded it on DVD and watched it again. I love the bright colors vs. dark pictures. Not a big Beatty fan, but that's an excellent popcorn movie. Pacino is amazing, as always, and well, this movie marks the time when Madonna was her absolute sexiest. I wish she had stayed with the "Breathless" look for a while longer. Charlie Korsmo's first really big role, except "What's up with Bob?". At that time, the makeup effects were up to date and mostly still hold. Beautiful scenery and mood put you right in a comic environment. The cars, the cloakroom, the buildings, and even the street lights are a great sound, not to mention the perfect lighting, though the scenes with lots of red can get a little annoying as it tends to blur a little. I just wish Beatty had the chance to do a sequel. All in all a few nice hours.

summary: Mike Locken is one of the principal members of a group of freelance spies. A significant portion of their work is for the C.I.A. and while on a case for them, one of his friends turns on him and shoots him in the elbow and knee. His assignment, to protect someone, goes down in flames. He is nearly crippled, but with braces is able to again become mobile. For revenge as much as anything else, Mike goes after his ex-friend.
translation:
Okay, the story makes no sense, the characters have no dimension, the best dialogue is ad-libs about the poor quality of the film, the camera work is bleak and only the editing saves a bit of confusion, but Sam "Peckinpah has made the film "Somehow his direction is not enough. For those who appreciate Peckinpah and his great work, this movie is a disappointment. Even a great cast can not live up to the time the viewer spends on this minimal effort.

The correct reaction to the film is the contempt that San Peckinpah, James Caan, Robert Duvall, Burt Young, Bo Hopkins, Arthur Hill and even Gig Young bring with them. Take a look at the great Peckinpah movies.

summary: Stanley Cox is an illiterate short-order cook who has never taken a chance at love. Iris King is a newly widowed factory worker who has vowed never to love again. But as their friendship slowly blossoms and Iris helps Stanley learn to read, his strong yet gentle kindness helps mend her broken heart. And where two lonely strangers stood trapped within the past, Stanley and Iris can now begin a new chapter of their lives - together.
translation:
The production quality, cast, premise, authentic New England (Waterbury, CT?) Locale and lavish John Williams score should have resulted in a 3-4 star collector's item. Unfortunately, all we got was a passable 2-star "decent" streak that was largely memorable for what he was trying to do ......... brought an art-style movie mainstream. The small place and history of ordinary people is a genre of its own, and if done well, it will satisfy most adults. Jane Fonda could not hide her intelligence to make her character believable. I wondered why she did not do a PhD in Yale instead of working in a factory in Waterbury. Robert DiNiro's character was just a bit too artificial. An illiterate, a nice guy-loser who, with the help of Jane's character, is a version of Henry Ford or Thomas Edison of 1990.

This genre was made by "Nobody's Fool" in the mid-90s and this year (2003) "About Schmidt." I wish the mainstream studios to try and post more material for post-adolescents reserve some screens in the multi-cinema complexes for this effort.

I will give it an "A".

summary: Mob boss Vic returns to business from madhouse. Meanwhile his best and quickest assistant Mickey Holliday is having an affair with Vic's girl Grace Everly and, at the same time, with her sister Rita Everly. What will Vic do? Whom will he kill?
