Is he really insane and weak? Many other mobsters, including Jake Parker, WackyJacky Jackson and Ben London think he's not so powerful anymore and hope to take his place.
translation:
If you like movie, do not miss it. If you prefer action, horror or romance, you'll wonder what's going on. Everyone here is stuck in a gangster movie. And what happens is transcendental murder.

There are a few similar films. There will undoubtedly be a limited release and hard to find. But the search will be worth it. If you want to study a mileu as a possible symbol, then this is indeed a film to learn.

You can not even see it. If you do that, you'll never see what happens. Dark city is better. Joe Vrs. The volcano is more fun. But Mad Dog Time could make Gangsta people a symbol. , or at least think twice before taking another picture.

summary: When the young Kevin gets the boat of his dead uncle as a gift, he invites five friends of him to a trip to Catalina Island for the weekend. While in the journey, they drink booze, have sex and play games, with each one of them telling his or her greatest fear. Later Kevin drowns in the open sea, the engine stops, and they are haunted and murdered by their greatest innermost fear.
translation: This film on paper looked like it might be good, after seeing that I realized that this movie was absolutely awful !! The plot has no meaning, and I think I've counted the best part of 5000 cut scenes, making the movie annoying, boring, and ridiculous. I saw black late that night, no sound at all, just to amplify the TORTURE, but the truth is the only thing that scared me was the music, which they would call tragic music, they play opera, I mean seriously! This film sums it all up, which is not good at this kind of movie. To be honest, do not say more, but look at your own risk, this movie is just garbage, ENJOY !!

summary: Vince Lombardi High School keeps losing principals to nervous breakdowns because of the students' love of rock 'n' roll and their disregard of education. The putative leader of the students is Riff Randell, who loves the music of the Ramones. A new principal, the rock-music-hating Miss Evelyn Togar, is brought in and promises to put an end to the music craze. When Miss Togar and a group of parents attempt to burn a pile of rock records, the students take over the high school, joined by the Ramones, who are made honorary students. When the police are summoned and demand that the students evacuate the building, they do so, which leads to an explosive finale.
translation:
Fascist headmistress Miss Togar (Mary Voronov, photographed by professional photographer Dean Cundy as if she were three meters tall) has a plan to make her high-field square. In the adorable Rock'n'Roller Riff Randell (PJ Soles, who lights up the screen - she also has a hot bod), it's a compliment that challenges that goal. He is an obsessed fan of the punk band THE RAMONES. Pal Kate Rambeau (Dey Young, whose big glasses and nerdy role can not hide her amazing beauty) joins forces with Reef to put an end to the supposed crisis of rock'n'roll killing that is Togar's dream mission. >
Vincent Van Patten has a witty role as Tom Roberts, a success in everything but a lie. Kate is crazy about Tom ... if he could just pull his head out of the sand and see. Clint Howard almost steals the movie (honestly, who can steal that movie away from Soles?) As Eaglebauer, "the supplier" who can get almost anything. His office is in the boy's toilet! Paul Bartel is also funny as a music teacher who becomes an ally of Riff when he enjoys a concert by THE RAMONES.

A rough high school frolicking, defying all the rules of normalcy .. and I loved it. It's as if someone just says, "Let's make fun of life for 1.5 hours." The film is really anarchy ... a haphazard chaos that THE RAMONES affectionately adores (even if they are terrible actors, they have a chance to win a new audience with this film).

Ending sums up the movie as a whole..Riff and her classmates take over high school and a big party begins. To be honest, I did not want the party to end! In no way conventional, this movie just lets off a frenzy. Accompanied by a great rock soundtrack featuring some of THE RAMONES 'best songs, this film allows a viewer to accept a time in life when the war did not dominate the headlines and people just had fun. These were, I think, the days.

summary: Sandy has stumbled onto a lair of torture and humiliation. She was abducted and brought to this pit of pain as the next intended victim. But Sandy overthrows her captor and kills him. Does she release the other prisoners? Does she call the police? No. Her mind snaps and she assumes control over the prisoners. Blood runs down the walls in this shocking, nightmarish tale of madness and revenge.
translation:
... by the similar-minded antics of Eric Stanze. A not very talented director made a not very good movie, but I was still in the credits when it comes to nothing more than to see what happens next.

A rapist escapes from prison and calls his old flame. After capturing her (though she came willingly) and threatening to have sex (another event she wanted to do), he reveals that he has kidnapped three guys who have wronged her in the past. He then chooses to kill her (huh?), But is defeated and dies instead. The girl's mind snaps (or something like that) and she takes her anger on the unfortunate guys in the basement.

Okay, the writing is annoying: it's lengthy, loaded with ten-cent words and there's far too much of it.

The acting sucks: What a minute, what acting?

The shooting is a puking: home video is bad enough, but 20 minutes of cemetery stuff is just a damn insult.

And the budget is a joke: get it ... "budget", that was the punchline.

And yet there was a charm. In the 70s, these types of films came to the cinemas, with actual budgets and talent, but not in this day and age. If you want to see this kind of violent, sexually extravagant trash (do not lie, some of us do that), then you'll get it all today.

Some short hardcore scenes in a sex scene, torture with feces, fun with axes, banging anal rape and a longer shot of the crazy chicken masturbating with the same broomstick are some of the better things on the menu.

It's not good and it will not be remembered, but since the heyday of Joe D'amato, people have not made such films.

4/10

summary: Azuma Kazuma isn't terribly clever, but he's got a good heart and great skill - at baking. Since childhood, he's been on a quest to create the perfect bread to represent Japan internationally. Now, he seeks to enter the famous bakery Pantasia, in hopes of reaching his goal.
translation:
When I first started seeing this anime, I never thought that making bread could really be interesting, but luckily I was wrong. From the moment I started watching it, anime just moved into the world of bread making, I was addicted.

The biggest advantage of this anime is humor, which is very intelligent and very funny, with some recurring gags. But the animation, soundtrack and character development are below average, while these drawbacks are not so strong in the first episodes, because of the great work on this anime, it really shows in the last 20 episodes when the reactions and recurring gags become simple old and are not as funny as before.

For me, if this anime had ended with episode 52, I would have given it a 9, but the last episodes leave only a bitter aftertaste that unfortunately can not be washed away by the impressive 50 episodes.

7/10

summary: Two boys (Ramallo and Manuel) and a girl in the Spanish Civil War are involved in the death of other two boys, one killed, the other suicided. This terrible secret will be with them for all their lives. Years pass and they meet in a hospital for tuberculosis treatment. She is now a nun, Ramallo is a thief and Manuel is obsessed by religion. Reality is too hard to feel, only the sea should be the best place, where all is quiet...
translation:
If you want to know about the Spanish Civil War and all the political details and intrigues, let me tell you that you chose the wrong film.

This is a vision of war happened in Mallorca, a small island off the Spanish coast. If such a war takes place on a small island that almost immediately becomes a traitor, there is no war in the open air. The soldiers are sent to the front line to fight on the mainland, while another kind of war takes place at home on the small island. There, neighbors tell neighbors, sometimes because their political views contradict the new regime, but many people are informed about old family struggles, or maybe the silent introvert who has no friends will be told by someone who wants to "earn some points". And these things do not happen outdoors. There were some attempts, true, but many other times people would only be woken up in the middle of the night, taken from their homes to the nearest graveyard, where they would be killed. And the next morning, the bodies would be found, and people would have an idea of ‚Äã‚Äãwhat had happened, but no one would dare to say or do anything. We're not talking about soldiers killing someone they've never seen in their lives. We talk about people killing their neighbors, and probably said hello to their widow the next day, and also attend the funeral for the guy she killed. We speak of villages with one to two thousand inhabitants, where everyone knows each other.

I come from this little island and I heard the stories my grandparents told me, and I have to say that the film upset me, oh yes, it did; but I also found it remarkably beautiful and moving. The initial violence is not something that the director or the writer invented, so it happened in this war. A child who knows that his partner's father is in the fascist group that killed his father? Totally possible. All this happened later? Possible too. TB was real too. At that time, my island was not the resort it became. The people were poor, illiterate and worked in small farms. After the war there were times of need.

So, you will not find a war story in this movie, or at least not the kind of war story you expect. There are no battlefields, no soldiers, no political intrigues. This is the meanest kind of war that happens when space is limited (just check the size of the island), when neighbors fight with their neighbors, when members of the same family fight against each other, and they live in a place where everyone is everyone knows. You will find a story about the harm that this particular kind of war can cause to humans and the history of how they may or may not survive this damage.

I have to mention the excellent work done by the writers who adapted the novel and by all the actors who could really sound Mallorcan. That was remarkable.

summary: Vivian has magic powers. She doesn't hesitate to save her boyfriend David from failing in school by murdering teachers. However, David has gotten tired of her and is putting his charm on a new girl in school, Robin. Robin discovers that she also has magic powers, and it comes to a mental showdown between the two women over David.
translation:
After seeing MIDNIGHT OFFERS, I'm still convinced that the first decent movie about (teen) witches has yet to be made. I did not think much of THE CRAFT and not in CHARMED either. The only movie I liked more or less (about juvenile witches) was LITTLE WITCHES (1996), and even this one was not very good. But changes are that if you like all the above movies, you will also enjoy MIDNIGHT OFFERS.

I was expecting a stupid and cheesy early 80s movie about teenage witches in high school. But I was pretty surprised that this whole movie is pretty serious. Acting is decent and serious all the time. No jokes are played by teenagers or something. And the music, at first I thought, was pretty good. It added some horror and also something "classic", with the use of menacing violins and everything. But in the course of the film, I came to the conclusion that the result was just too ambitious. You did not have to add these threatening violins if you just saw someone getting in a car and then driving away at normal speed.

Then there is Melissa Sue Anderson who was the main reason for me watching this movie. A few weeks ago I saw her in Happy Birthday To Me, a pretty entertaining, fat (and sometimes silly) Slasher movie that she did the same year as MIDNIGHT OFFLINGS. And I have to say, she was very good as the ice-cold evil witch Vivian. But the main problem with the movie is: almost nothing happens! Vivian causes a death and an accident, yes, but that's it. Then there's Robin, the good witch who's just starting to learn about her powers. And we expect them to use their powers more than once, but on just one occasion, they use their powers to fly some pieces of wood and other material through the air as projectiles. That should be a fight between two powerful witches? And worse, I was hoping to see a spectacular showdown between the witches at the end of the movie, with at least some special effects, blazing eyes or whatever ... but nothing happens. There is a kind of confrontation in the end, but it is a big disappointment.

Well, the action of the two witches was good. The score was decent (if too ambitious). And the cinematography was sometimes quite dark and moody. But that does not make a good movie, right?

summary: Bruce Nolan, a television reporter in Buffalo, N.Y., is discontented with almost everything in life despite his popularity and the love of his girlfriend Grace . At the end of the worst day of his life, Bruce angrily ridicules and rages against God and God responds. God appears in human form and, endowing Bruce with divine powers, challenges Bruce to take on the big job to see if he can do it any better.
translation:
I was looking forward to seeing this movie because it seemed promising from the upcoming attractions: Jim Carrey with Godlike powers was an idea that definitely worked for me. As a big fan, I was sure that he would be in his element with such a promising premise and what could go wrong? Yesterday my bladder, boys and girls burst because I saw the movie.

The first act (where it is established that he hates his life, he is an angry employee and an extremely unfortunate camper with an ax to scold against God) is useful, the second act ( where he is called by God over the phone and receives Powers Almighty) is GREAT - Carrey is having fun with his new "Toys" and it's a pleasure to see, really funny. But the third act is unbearably bad.

After the dinner scene between Bruce and his girlfriend Grace (Jennifer Aniston, who performs well in this movie, considering her part only matters, the decay begins Plot device even her NAME stinks of unreliability) - she thinks he'll raise the question, but instead he tells her (still on his knees) that he finally gets his job as a news anchor, and is not it so exciting?

She does not think so. She wants him to marry her, look, so she undresses and leaves him, look, although she still LOVES him a lot, look, and the rest of the movie is spent with a miserable, frightening head over the To hit his head. After the next there was a spiritual-sounding cliche, until at the end I also prayed. , .for it to be over.

I did not like the lack of subtlety in the first two acts (an example - in the second act, after he gets his powers, Bruce dances into the room and sings, "What if God were one of those us, just a slab like one of us ", blah blah blah), and I was even ready to miss the amazing amount of contradictions that are flung towards us (Moran Freeman - a / k / a GOD - tells Bruce that he is it can not go against any free will, but it does so very often - these decisions were forgivable - it's a Jim Carrey comedy directed by Tom Shadyac - it's not The Remains of the Day.

summary: Micheal, a former test subject of a project to create supersoldiers, is forced to escape with his comrades after the project was cancelled. Months later, he is trying to have a quiet life as a librarian with a tough cop as his best friend. However, a string of vicious gangland murders begins that has all the markings of his former compatriots who seem to have turned to violent crime. Realizing that the police are helpless to fight these soldiers, Micheal decides to take them on himself. Donning a mask to protect his identity, Micheal must fight these powerful villians as the mysterious superhero known only as Black Mask.
translation:
Jet Li is one of the best hand fighting fighters in the world. He's been around for over 20 years and he shames others in the genre. While he is big in Asia, he is almost unknown here in the US.

Black Mask is supposed to be a breakout movie for him, but it fails terribly. Above all, it is synchronized. While it can have a stock value (dubbing is not even short and it is flat in tone), it seems inappropriate for the normal movie viewer. Second, the director in this movie, Daniel Lee, does a terrible job. He cuts scenes so fast, sometimes you do not know what's going on. Another time, the camera shakes and shakes. Fans see Jet Lis films for the fantastic martial arts. However, the director handles the scenes so fast that you do not even know who's half the time! At other times, a scene gets stuck (ie, Li starts cutting a hole in the bottom of a jeep while the badguys arm their weapons, two seconds later Li and the love interest are already under the car!) Other scenes are so unlikely that they exceed the point that they are completely ridiculous (Killer CD-ROMs? Just give him Throwing Stars !!!!). Li, he needs a director who is less prone to machine guns and more for a cinematic staging. The added rap / techno music goes from okay to intrusive. The storyline has possibilities, but all are wasted on cartoon characters who take away any credibility that this movie seeks. And should we really believe that the love interest Simon would not recognize because he has a half mask? Would not the hair, the lower jaw or the voice betray it?

If you want to see a Jet Li movie, try Iron Monkeys or its classic Shaolin Temple. This incoherent chaos is a total waste of time ..... 2/10

summary: A small community is besieged by vampires. After he watches friends ravaged in a convenience store, a lone avenger goes off to do battle with the undead, armed with shotgun, chainsaw, and Holy water. Later he finds other survivors and they try to stay alive long enough to do battle with Liven, king of the vampires.
translation:
When I borrowed this movie from a friend (luckily I did not buy it), the package (which looked really bad and ugly) printed "The Ultimate Vampire Horror". After watching, I thought the marketing campaign was probably more expensive than the movie itself. The "story" begins when a teenager (surprise!) Is chased by vampire / zombie creatures.

Lighting, sound and everything reminds me of my first attempt to make a vacation video on a ten year old VHS system, if not worse. I gave the movie a 2 out of 10 score just because the promo T-shirts looked kinda cool. I do not want to film film students or splatter movies in general, but I saw Braindead and saw a $ 20 budget movie by students ten times better than that crap.

summary: Summer 1939 in the Provence, France: the 14 years old Julien has a crush on his cousin Julia, who lives together with his family in their small hotel. Unfortunately she ignores him, because she's several years older. Then the hotel guest Charles enters the competition, a slimy twenty-something who lusts for the girl, despite the fact that he's engaged.
translation:
I like David Hamilton's artistic photographs of naked women on the border of femininity, sometimes erotic, but never pornographic. Someone else liked her too because my David Hamilton books were stolen. In a book were a few pictures of a boy to see, obviously naked, familiar with a young woman older than him, even naked. Although discreet, there was strong sexual connotation. New territory for David Hamilton, which has proved either as a still from the movie Tendres Cousines or as photos on the set.

Unfortunately, the art of still photography does not automatically translate into cinematography. Soft focus becomes blurry and discrete angles become confusing, perhaps because they can not be considered in motion. You either see it or miss it and there is no time to observe, understand. The movie is meant to be a farce, and fun things happen, but it's not related, maybe because the story is developing so slowly and you can wonder what's going on. Finally, 14-year-old Julien has intercourse with his cousin, but it's soft-core, with no genital contact in front of the camera. Since it is a farce, we have a disappointing virgin and an embarrassing act in the act-gag. After catching her, Julien's father even gives him a cigarette to complete the experience. In fairness, the film is in French and corresponds to French film forms, which are simply too subtle for most Americans, even with English subtitles, to help us Philistines.

It has been suggested that this film is a child pornography and that certainly stems from today's climate where the sexual exploitation of children is clearly a serious problem. No one in their right mind wants to endorse or support the sexual abuse of children so that there is virtually no room for children to be seen in the mildest erotic context without immediately raising the alarm of sexual violence and exploitation. Guys will think "Lucky Julien!" although they agree that sex and children in the movies are a "bad thing" while still wishing they could have been a Julien at this age. Women too may have similar thoughts, but all these considerations must be pushed out of consciousness. Hysterically, the worst assumptions have become automatic and matters of children and sex are consistently avoided. Too bad, because the sexual awakening is a real human experience. After all, children grow up and become sexual beings like Julien. It is a fitting literary theme, including cinema, but taboo under the threat of sexual violence against children. I think David Hamilton took a risk of making a movie about the subject even in 1980. He has been somewhat successful in researching this sensitive subject, and unfortunately we will be out of fear of the child pornography label in the near future.

summary: The story of human evolution is told through the stories of representative members of the various species leading up to modern homo sapiens. It is ongoing climate changes that force human ancestors to develop, one by one, the unique characteristics of the modern humans. Though earlier species were superbly successful in their environments they were unsustainable when the environment changes.
translation: Walking with Cavemen, host of Alec Baldwin, is a review of all the hominid species (that's us!) Of the last 5 million years: who they were, how they were and how they became extinct. Along with a very interesting scientific look at the information we have about these species, Walking with Cavemen also explores what makes us human. I waited several weeks to see that, and I was not disappointed.

summary: When general Mitchell's daughter joins South American rebels, he asks two of his ex-soldiers, Becker and Kelly, to get her back. They soon discovers that the rebels are in league with Russians.
translation:
All of David Prior's films are terrible in every way: bad writing, bad acting, bad cinematography, no budget (the director's brother is usually cast as a male lead actor). But all have an incredible entertainment value because of their unintentional cheerfulness. The plot of almost every David Prior "movie" (as I like to call it) is basically the same. Manly All-American Commandos team up to blow up Communist baddies. But unlike other Cold War-era garbage like Red Dawn, Prior's films are funny because of their exaggerated premises and their acting. The best part of Jungle Assault is the scene in which Becker (or was it the other guy?) Is called by General Mitchell to a top-secret mission in South America. The funniest line in the movie is then delivered, something in the effect of "this is my roommate, I trained him well". WHAT. You trained your roommate? And apparently this will be their solution to avoid the eviction.

If you can find these gems on video used everywhere, buy them. They are all funny and after some beers even funnier. Watch them with a group of friends for a true MST3K style experience. So far my friends and I have managed to get Night Wars and Aerobicide aka "Killer Workout". But what I recommend the most is Final Sanction with the weird-looking Robert Z'dar.

summary: Michel, a Parisian artist, is being hounded by numerous impatient creditors. To make things worse, when he is embracing the woman whose portrait he is painting, he is surprised by his indignant fianc√©e B√©atrice. Suddenly, Michel learns that he holds the winning ticket in the Dutch Lottery. But when he goes to retrieve the ticket from the pocket of his jacket, he finds that B√©atrice has given the jacket to a stranger who was in need. Now everyone has a keen interest in finding that jacket.
translation:
Rene Clair, one of the great directors and great pioneers of cinema, created in Le Million a gem of light comedy, which is a groundbreaking and technically brilliant film, the following filmmakers like the Marx Brothers, Lubitsch, and Mamoulian. The storyline, a witty story of a poor artist who wins a huge lotto jackpot but has to frantically search for the missing ticket all over the city, is basically just a means to a series of wonderfully funny comic scenes in a dream world World support the imagination of the director.

One of the most impressive things about this film is that, although it plays in the middle of Paris and contains nothing really impossible, it creates a sustainable and engaging fairy-tale / fantastic atmosphere in which it seems quite natural that the People sing as much as they talk, or that a fight over a stolen jacket should take the form of a football game. Another memorable element is that Le Million contains the funniest opera ever released (O this blonde plaited soprano! "I laugh, ha! Ha!") Also a pleasure is the casting: Clair has an amazing group put together, sharply different character actors, each with deadly satirical accuracy a bourgeois French "type", so that the film appears like a series of Daumier prints.

The serenity takes a while to roll, and I did not find the characters as emotionally engaging as they may even be in a light comedy (as they are in many Lubitsch films, for example). For these reasons, I refrain from giving it the highest estimate. But these little cavities should not distract from an enthusiastic recommendation.

Should you see it? By all means. Highly recommended if you want a classic and influential work of cinema or just a fun comedy.

summary: Damien Thorn is dead, but his prophecy is reborn in a mysterious girl named Delia, who is adopted by two attorneys, Gene & Karen York. When Karen realizes her baby was born under suspicious circumstances, she hires a private investigator to find Delia's real parents. A series of bizarre accidents occur, and Karen begins to suspect everyone of conspiring against her as she unravels the truth about her baby.
translation:
*** SPOILERS *** As with a wicked Tinkers-to-Evers-to-Chance double-play combination, in "Omen IV" we've gotten the evil seed of the late AntiChrist Damien Thorn back. His parents scolded his classmates, his neighbors, and finally the whole world when she called Delia York, Asia Vieila. After being donated to the "deserving" couple of Yorkers Karen & Gene, Fay Grant and Michael Woods from the St. Francis orphanage of the Catholic Church.

Little Delia wasted no time in feeling her peasants scratching her mother at a house party. Later, Delia is almost killed by an out-of-control truck, only to be saved by this "devil dog" named Ryder. Going to school Delia takes care of the local thug by getting the big guy to wet himself in front of all his classmates. Later, when his father threatens the Yorkers with a lawsuit, she is cut off in a self-induced traffic accident head! Delia is someone you never mess with, if you know what's good for you.

Meanwhile, Dalias father Gene will become a big man in the city, or so he thinks, by being elected to the congress, a champion of clean air and green trees, instead of the smog and concrete boys to let his eye on the White House itself! Did his weird and strange daughter Delia have anything to do with Gene York's sudden happiness?

It's only later, when Jo, Ann Hearen, is hired as Delia's nanny, that the truth about her comes out strangely and wickedly. Jo, a New Age guy, realizes that Delia is a bit weird after turning all her white crystals black, and calls her New Age guru Noah, Jim Byrnes, to come over and check her. Noah is so upset about what he sees in Delia Kirilian's color vibrations, all black and blue with a pinch of red that makes him look so bad that he almost crashed into Delia's parent car.

Taken on a journey to a psychic festival, Jo Delia transforms the entire event into an inferno that sets the place on fire through mental telepathy and places everyone who lives there under cover, including the poor Noah, who was at the festival and had his broken leg. The shaken and battered guru was so shaken by the experience that he later left the country to become a hermit in the Tibetan wilderness.

Later, with the help of sweet and cuddly pet Ryder, Jo is thrown out of a second-floor window to her death because she knew and talked too much. When Karen is pregnant again, she finally decides to find out the truth about the true parents of Delia. Then they and we in the audience face the truth. She is not only the dreaded Antichrist of Revelation, she is his twin sister! Her brother, the Anti-Christ himself, will appear as her little brother, the unborn son of Alexander York!

Three times were more than enough for the AntiChrist to return to Earth to bring forth Armageddon. The movie that went public became a little tired of him and his evil adventures. It really was not necessary with a fourth since Daimten Thorn, the original Antichrist, had been dead and buried for years. They were brought by the usual tone of voice without anyone believing that Delia was "Thee" AntiChrist until it was almost too late to stop them in their lethal rounds of destruction of all humanity. The movie, which is so bad, is also far too long, 97 minutes, for a horror movie that could well have told its story is as little as 80 minutes.

With a private eye Earl Knight, Mchael Lerner, and later a former Catholic nunner Yvonne, Megan Lehmich, and now faith healer Felichy in the movie, just to be killed, did not help the plot either. It only prolonged the suffering of those who saw the movie. They could almost see the surprising ending as soon as the movie "Omen IV" began with the bases finally free for the possible takeover of the civilized as well as uncivilized world of Delia. What was a surprise was that Delia did it with a little help from friends.

summary: When a body is found in the New Orleans docks, it's pretty obvious that he died from gun shot wounds. The police surgeon notices that the man is also displaying other symptoms and Lt. Commander Clint Reed, a doctor with the U.S. Public Health Service, diagnoses a highly contagious disease, pneumonic plague. He tries to convince local officials to find everyone who may have been in contact with the dead man. The Mayor supports his efforts but many, including the police, are doubtful. Reed wants to avoid publicity so as not to panic the public. They have little information to go on - they don't know the dead man's identity - and Reed estimates they have 48 hours before disease begins to spread. With police Capt. Tom Warren going through the motions, Reed sets out to find the killers.
translation:
"Panic in the Streets" was a decent thriller, but I was a bit disappointed. The central theme of a city plagued by a plague in modern times is intriguing, but the film never really explores or develops it. It's well done and entertaining, but it's not as interesting as it should have been. The script for this is really weak and brings down the whole movie. None of the main characters is really convincing or believable.

Luckily the movie is very well done and compensates for the weak scripting. The director of Elia Kazan keeps the movie exciting and moves with lightning speed. There are some outstanding sequences, especially the memorable pursuit highlight. When his director was combined with better scripts several years later, the man usually could not go wrong.

The acting is also very good. Richard Widmark has always been a handsome leading actor, doing what he can with a signed character. Paul Douglas spends his time roaring a bit too much, but he also does a decent job. The outstanding in the cast are the two villains. Zero Mostel, best known for his comic roles, is effectively slimy as one of cinema's ultimate toady characters. Jack Palance is, as you might expect, a vile villain. "Panic in the streets" is disappointing, but still worth seeing. (7/10)

summary: When his wife goes into a troubled labor while he is on the road over 1200 miles away James Kowalski, a former race-car driver and Army Ranger, attempts to elude police while trying to get home. After numerous chases, he turns into a aboriginal American reservation and reflects on his life, and his wife. He then heads off to break through an impenetrable police and F.B.I. road-block.
translation:
Spoiler through:

I'm really in the minority, but I liked this movie. It's not a classic, but it's definitely an adrenaline ride. I definitely thought it was worth at least a rating of 7.

Maybe the reason why I liked it is because I did not see the original. Something tells me that with a movie like this one it will be the strongest fans, the people who have not seen the original version and have little to compare. It was not a masterpiece, but I spent a lot of time on it and it really got me to see the original.

There were a few things I liked about it. One was the casting of Kowalkski. Viggo Mortenson was excellent and brought a lot of charisma to the role. Since most of the film fell on his shoulders, he really had to be excellent, and so was he. That was important to him.

Another interesting thing about Vansishing Point was the fact that it was made for television. I had no idea that this was the case. It really did seem like a great movie and I never thought that this was not a big screen release.

I also found the story very exciting. I'm not into action movies, but I got involved in them. Besides, it was much more than an action movie that had drama, mysticism, a love story, bizarre people, no matter how you turned. (I did not even recognize Priestly.) And it was touching. That was not a great movie, but it is worth seeing.

And then there's an end. It's a big hit, and if you've been involved in the story so far, it's very difficult not to be fixated in the end. I'm not sure how I feel about the end. The implication was that Kowalkski survived and though I'm very skeptical about how that would be possible, it's a movie and realism is not an ingredient that's always in the mix when you make a movie.

So I have to say that I found the ending incredibly unrealistic, but very touching in a manipulative way, which I do not usually like, but for some reason it's almost forgivable in this movie. Granted, many things were just props for the plot (could the rogues have been more stereotypes?) But the creators did a lot of right, even though they did a lot of things wrong. However, I will admit that I can understand why someone who is a big fan of the original would hate this version, because even though I did not see the original, I have seen many original films that have been re-made with terrible results. (My big dislike is actually sequels.) But I can understand the low ratings if the original is of that high quality.

People compared that to Smoky and Bandit. How about a street version of "Legends Of The Fall" and "Thelma And Louese"? I have touched the two films (which I both like very much). But I do not think that was a great movie. It was better than average, but not at all great. But it was a captivating, adrenaline-charged, touching film with excellent casting of the main character. My vote is 7 out of 10.

summary: A Scotland Yard investigator looks into four mysterious cases involving an unoccupied house and its tragic previous tenants: 1) A hack novelist encounters a strangler who's the villain of his books, leading his wife to question his sanity, 2) Two men are obsessed with a wax figure of a woman from their past, 3) A little girl with a stern, widowed father displays an interest in witchcraft, and 4) An arrogant horror film actor purchases a black cloak which gives him a vampire's powers.
translation:
The British production company Amicus is widely known as a specialist in horror anthologies, and this great omnibus called "The House That Drugged Blood" is without a doubt the best amicus production I've seen so far (admittedly, there's a whole lot of that I still have to see, though). "The house that dripped blood" consists of four wonderfully macabre tales, all in the same eerie mansion. These four stories are presented to you in a wonderful gothic atmosphere and with one of the best ensemble casts. Peter Cushing, Christopher Lee (Cushing and Lee are two of my favorite actors of all time), Denholm Elliott and the gorgeous Ingrid Pitt starring role in this movie - so what true horror fan could afford to miss him? Nobody, of course, and the movie has much more to offer than just a great cast. "The house that dripped blood" revolves around an eerie country house where strange things happen. In four parts, the film tells stories of four different heirs.

The first story, "Method For Murder", tells the story of horror novelist Charles Hyller (Denholm Elliott), who moves in with his wife. After moving in, the writer suddenly feels struck by a maniac of his own creation ... The first segment is a great catalyst for the film. The story is scary and macabre and the performances are very good.

In the second story, "Waxworks", the retired businessman Phillip Grayson (Peter Cushing) moves in and suddenly feels drawn to a mysterious wax museum in the nearby town ... The great Peter Cushing delivers here again a sublime performance, and the other performances are very good. The story is delightfully funny and the second best of the movie, after the third.

The third story, "Sweets To The Sweet" is by far the scariest and most brilliant of the four. John Reed (Christopher Lee) moves in with his little daughter. Private tutor and Nanny Mrs. Norton, who has instructed Mr. Reed to teach his daughter, is appalled by her employer's strictness towards his daughter, and is eager to find out why the overprotective father's views could be upbringing ... This best segment retains a very spooky atmosphere and a really scary plot. Christopher Lee is as always superb in his role. Nyree Dawn Porter is also very good as a nanny, and my special praise goes to the then 11-year-old Chloe Franks. This ingenious segment makes the film a must for any true horror fan.

In the fourth segment, horror actor Paul Henderson (Jon Pertwee) enters the house with his sexy mistress / co-star Carla (Ingrid Pitt). This fourth story is satire, more than it really is horror. However, it is a very amusing satire, and there are many allusions to other horror movies. At some point, Henderson indirectly refers to Christopher Lee, who plays in the previous, third segment ...

All four segments have a wonderfully macabre sense of humor and a great atmosphere. As mentioned above, the third segment is by far the scariest and biggest, but the other three are also atmospheric and often macabre humorous horror stories that any horror lover should appreciate. An ingenious atmosphere, a macabre sense of humor, real eeriness and a brilliant cast make this a must. In short, "the house that dripped blood" is an excellent horror bus that no lover of British horror can afford. Highly recommended!

summary: The small time criminal Heaton is anxiously waiting for the release of his close friend Spike, after spending a couple of months in prison for being caught with 87g of marijuana. Heaton robs a truck, meets Spike outside the penitentiary and travels with him through the country to drink some beers and celebrate his freedom. However, they run out gas and try to steal from a farm, but the owner arrives and arrests Heaton. Spike takes his shotgun and accidentally kills his daughter. They runaway through the wilderness while the locals organize a militia to hunt the criminals.
translation: Some have compared this movie to Deliverance. I believe in mice and men is more appropriate. Our leading man, Heaton, definitely loves Spike. It is irrelevant and irrelevant if this is a sexual love. That's why Heaton does not leave Spike. He needs him. They need each other. As brothers, as family, as their only connection to humanity. The setting, the scenario, the minimal cast make a fine movie. Honestly, I did not care what happened to the characters. But it was important to me what the filmmaker did to them. He has done well with them. I spent some time wondering what the end of Mice and Men would be like. The soundtrack and the cinematography were convincing and fascinating.

summary: Sort of a low-budget Short Cuts (1993), set in the Flemish port city of Antwerp on a warm day in June. Natalie, her brother Chouki, her boyfriend Walter and his ex Lara, the gallery keeper Firmin, unhappily married French language teacher Paul Garcin, a couple of party-loving studs from Ghent (another Flemish city) and the enigmatic Windman, independently go about their lives, which have little in common, yet all end up on the same place for a grand party that evening.
translation: This movie blows you off your feet. This debut film by Tom Barman (known from the Belgian rock band dEUS) introduces 8 fascinating people, building blocks of a rousing film mosaic. They survive one day and one night each in the metropolis of Antwerp. Barman paints his characters with great verve and skillfully interweaves their individual stories, a tour that commemorates the best work of Robert Altman and Paul Thomas Anderson. The patchwork of anecdotes surprised, moved, amused; The dialogues are so natural, they seem to be improvised. Some great performances by Matthias Schoenaerts, Natali Broods and the extremely funny duo from Ghent, Jonas Boel and Titus De Voogdt. Sam Louwyck is the memorable "Windman", a bizarre guy who dances the whole movie. Sam is also responsible for the breathtaking choreography, and of course Tom Barman himself has provided the ultra-cool soundtrack. We were very impressed: Any Way The Wind Blows is a movie that blows you away.

summary: Sidney Young is a disillusioned intellectual who both adores and despises the world of celebrity, fame and glamor. His alternative magazine, "Post Modern Review", pokes fun at the media obsessed stars and bucks trends, and so when Young is offered a job at the diametrically opposed conservative New York based "Sharps" magazine it's something of a shock! It seems "Sharps" editor Clayton Harding is amused by Young's disruption of a post-BAFTA party with a pig posing as Babe. Thus begins Sidney's descent into success - his gradual move from derided outsider to confidante of starlet Sophie Maes. Initially helping him out at Sharps is colleague Alison Olsen, who has her own secret. Wither their friendship?
translation:
Simon Pegg plays Sidney Young, a stereotypical clumsy idiot Brit, who works as a prominent journalist in this American comedy. After a very happy break, he starts working at the respected Sharps Magazine, led by Jeff Bridges in New York. It's more The devil wears Prada as Shaun the Dead. The unlikely love interest comes from Kirsten Dunst, who works well with Pegg, but she does not blaze the screen with her passion.

Sidney faces some emotional challenges to decide if He should forget his journalistic principles to get material in the magazine. Of course, he is eventually seduced by the glamor and glamor of the celebrity world, especially the young starlet Sophie Maes (Transformers' Megan Fox). Fans of Shaun of the Dead, Hot Fuzz and Spaced will wonder if Pegg himself has ever had similar feelings with this film and to some degree ruined Run Fat Boy Run as one of the UK's best comic talents
All in all, this is a forgotten comedy. Please come to us Simon, we can forgive and forget.

summary: In 1840, a samurai comes home to find his wife in bed with another man, so he kills them both and then himself. Flash-forward to the present day, and an American family of three moves into this since-abandoned house and starts to experience incidents of haunting and possession.
translation:
I do not think anyone sitting down to watch this movie would expect something remotely like a classic ghost story, but you have to ask yourself when it's over, when you'll ever be afraid. That does not really work on that level, but the cast tries it a lot and the movie does not fade on one of those happy endings. The story is about an American couple traveling to Kyoto, Japan for Ted Fletcher (Edward Albert) to write a book and bringing his wife Laura (Susan George) and their daughter Amy (Amy Barrett). Her friend Alex Curtis (Doug McClure), who works at the American Consulate, helps them find a home and finds one who is being persecuted. About 140 years ago, a samurai found his wife in the same house who cheated on him and he killed them and then committed suicide. Their spirits still inhabit the house and when the Fletcher arrives, it does not take long before strange things happen.

***** SPOILER ALERT *****

Sometimes the ghosts inhabit the bodies of the Fletchers and they begin to behave like the Japanese they do Laura and Laura start flirting with Alex, which leads to an affair. Meanwhile, Ted begins to act harder and after pouring soup into Amy's neck, he asks a monk for help. Unfortunately, the ghosts have got Ted, Laura and Alex to play their death scene as it happened 140 years ago.

This movie was filmed by Kevin Connor, who is known as a good TV director, but he has done horror and science fiction films before and has worked with McClure on some of them. While this is never nearly as scary or evolving atmosphere, it has two things that I like. First, it does not have one of those juicy ends where the couple embrace after defeating the demons. Instead, it ends in a very bloody fight in which everyone succumbs to the evil of ghosts. Second, it has Susan George in the cast! I have always been a fan of her, even though she has performed mainly in Schlock, but her performances are always top notch. She also usually appears naked, which makes her here in two different scenes and while she has no classical traits, she has a unique tomboy-like look about her and it's one of the reasons she was so popular. But after appearing in silly movies like this one, I think that made her quit or work sporadically. This is not a bad movie, but it is never convincing and observing the ghosts when the monk gives an exorcism is practically worth one or two giggles. The bottom line is that this is silly and I hope that George decides to resume her career.

summary: A hip, very erotic twist on the werewolf thriller, this atmospheric horror film adds a a wickedly sexy appetite to the bloodthirsty cravings of its monster. A vicious werewolf stalks the streets of Los Angeles. Between killings, its desperate goal is to mate with unsuspecting Josie, who is unaware of her special power attracting the beast. Forced to take over an investigation involving werewolves after his partner is killed, an LAPD Detective is led to the trail of this ravenously deadly hybrid werewolf. This unstoppable beast is in LA to find the next matriarch of the pure-bred werewolves so that it can mate with her before the night is over and continue the werewolf lineage. Josie, the young waitress becomes his target and the cop must find a way to rescue her and ultimately the entire human race which will become extinct if the mating occures.
translation:
Hi, I'm a friend of werewolf movies, and when I saw the title of Darkwolf coming on the shelves I was like "hmm, simple and nice name at least ... Althou ... I wonder why I did not hear about it before. "

First of all, the movie starts with tits. Many tits. Tits are pretty much everything the movie budget costs. Who cares about a werewolf effect, simply pays the actresses enough to get up without shots!

So, about the mysterious Darkwolf character (a few spoilers ahead, but who cares ...) He's your average cyclist every day. Not even super-tough, but as the old wise woman in the movie says "he's a lot more powerful and dangerous than you've ever seen before." Just by describing a tattooed biker guy of a guy. Pretty original. I even looked twice when they first used the "red-hot eyes" SPECIAL EFFECT! I mean, my God, since the seventies the effect "lets-plant-red-dots-on-eyes-with-computer" is used. It just looks ugly! And do not let me start with the werewolf 3D CGI. Like I said, like a bad and old video game.

And finally, as I like werewolff movies, as I said. They always build their own werewolf legend. Darkwolf is also building the werewolf world, about some silly legends of hybrid werewolves and the old bloodline. BUT. It begins almost instantaneously after creating the rules of engagement "the dark wolf kills everyone the girl has touched" and begins with random strokes. Which just does not make sense, why tell us the rules of killing, if they do not even play by them ... Aplus the Wolfsblick settings are made with a Sony Handycam or something, mainly filming the floor and the walls. Just add growling noises and you have a super werewolf effect. The blood is partly okay. But if the wolf hits anyone with an open hand by simply putting his hand on the victims, that just is not the case for me ... Really, who gives you money? Do these piles of junk-to-video horror tracks, they're not even funny, bad movies, just sad.

summary: A night out on the town turns into a nightmare as six young college students find themselves hunted by a killer.
translation:
I usually have no problem leaving a bad movie, but that was a unique case. This movie was so bad that I sat down and almost prayed that there would be a good minute movie time to justify the one and a half hours that were wasted. Needless to say, I was brutally disappointed. At a beach house, where a group of college friends celebrating vacation, this film suffers from numerous problems that make him not worth seeing. First, there are gaping plot holes. Second, very few of the C-list (I dare not call them B) actors can behave damn well, so any scenes that have potential fail miserably. Third, the speed of the film is very restless and awkward to watch most of the time, making tension very difficult, resulting in very few surprises for the audience. Fourth and most importantly, the ending is completely anti-climatic, partly because of how it ends (attitude / who is the killer) and partly because the dialogue is simply gruesome. To the movies credit, it's the only movie I'll ever say is the worst movie I've ever had, and I've seen a lot.

So, just like a bad joke that you would have the happier it was never to be heard, the next time someone asks you if you want to know a secret, you're going to scream no, you really do not do it if you run in the opposite direction.

summary: Four high-tech industrial spies, Beaupre, Alice, Jernigan and Unger, steal a top-secret microchip, and, to fool customs, hide it in a remote-control toy car. Through a baggage mix-up at the airport, grumpy old Mrs.Hess gets the toy and gives it to her neighbor, 8-year-old Alex. Spies want to get the toy back before their clients get angry and decide to burglarize every house at Alex's street to find the chip. But Alex is prepared for their visit...
translation: Alex D. Linz replaces Macaulay Culkin as the central character in the third movie in the Home-Alone-Empire. Four industrial spies buy a computer chip for missile guidance systems and smuggle it through an airport in a remote-controlled toy car. Because of the baggage confusion the grumpy woman Hess (Marian Seldes) gets the car. She gives it to her neighbor Alex (Linz), just before the spies arrive. The spies rent a house to blow up every house in the neighborhood until they find the car. At home alone with the chickenpox, Alex calls 911 every time he discovers a theft, but the spies always manage to evade the police while Alex is accused of making joke calls. Finally, the spies turn their attention to Alex, unaware that he has manipulated devices to skillfully trap his entire home. Home Alone 3 was not terrible, but probably it should not have been, you can not just replace Macauley Culkin, Joe Pesci or Daniel Stern. Home Alone 3 had some fun parts, but I do not like it when characters are changed in a film series, at your own risk.

summary: nan
translation:
When I got this movie free from my job, along with three other similar films .. I then looked with very low expectations. Now this movie is not bad in itself. You get what you pay for. It's a story of love, betrayal, lies, sex, scandal, anything you want in a movie. Definitely not a Hollywood blockbuster, but for cheap thrills it's not that bad. I would probably never see this movie again. In short, this is the kind of movie you see either very late at night on a local TV station that just wants to take some time, or you would see it on a local TV station on a Sunday afternoon, which is trying some time take advantage of. Despite the bad acting, clich√© lines and sub-par camera work. I did not want to turn off the movie and pretend that it never fell into my DVD player. The story has often been made in many films. This is no different, not better, not worse.

Just an average movie.

summary: A remake of the classic 1963 movie "The Haunting" about a team of paranormal experts who look into strange occurrences in an ill-fated house. Through the course of the night some will unravel, some will question, and all will fight for their lives as the house fights back.
translation:
Somewhere in his non-fiction book, DANSE MACABRE, Stephen King suggests that one of the secrets to writing scary stories is to avoid showing your readers exactly what a horrible thing is waiting to get behind the door. When the door finally springs open and a three-meter beetle hops through the door, the reader may be a little scared, but he'll also think, "Well, I can handle that, at least it was not a hundred feet tall." There's nothing More frightening than what lurks invisible and unknown, just on the other side of this tightly locked door, waiting to get you.

THE HAUNTING is so completely wrong that director Jan De Bont is more or less misunderstood, begins his film by metaphorically opening the door himself and shouting, "Look, everybody, look! ten-foot-tall beetle, is not that SCARY ?! " The law of diminishing returns immediately. At the end of the film, the director jumps up and down, furiously beating his CGI pots and pans and shouting hoarsely: "Look, everyone, look, ten hundred and fifty bugs! ... And now, here are a hundred and fifty bugs!" The filmmakers evidently believed that special effects alone could compensate for all the other shortcomings in this effort (and there are many) .You can not and not. In fact, the special effects, as impressive as they are, are insistent and intrusive that the distracted viewer stares at her - whether in admiration or anger - rather than delving into a story.

For me, the Nadir is the sheer stupidity of this movie, if a statue, with "blood" Out of his mouth, trying to drown Liam Neeson (as Dr. Marrow) in a well, the filmmakers clearly did not know what to do with this alleged idea once they got it, so they just have Neeson a bit Thrown around in the water, battered around with his arms and made lucky. In the next scene, the good doctor apparently dried himself and, ho hum, forgot all about the annoying incident.

Shirley Jackson's novel seems to have been dumbed down by a committee in this ridiculous script of young low-IQ pugnacii who thought the way to scare people was to make every effect bigger and louder : "Okay, next, let's, um, make the blanket, you know, look like a scary face and er, come down on her ... and all those spiky things, like, drop her in the bed."

The only salvation of THE HAUNTING is that it finally gets so horrible that it's actually funny. By the time Owen Wilson (as Luke Sanderson) fell to the ground and then walked on his Magic Carpet Ride O 'Death, I fell to the ground myself and laughed myself.

Badly built, witless, grotesquely ponderous, absolutely incredible, and filled with chunky dialogues and pointless scenes, this empty HAUNTING is a textbook example of how not to make a horror movie.

summary: Three friends out for a weekend motorcycle ride through Wales stumble upon a marijuana field and biker gang war.
translation: I just never get tired of seeing FREEBIRD. My husband was an extra, so I was involved from the start. Stayed in touch with Jon and helped to promote the movie both in theaters and now on the DVD. Even to the extent that advertising postcards have been distributed on ferries and various locations throughout France. FREEBIRD has been expertly written and directed with the perfect combination of fun and serious moments, as well as a choice casting. Only Phil Daniels could take on the role of Grouch. Great privilege to meet Jon and the actors at the party after the January premiere. Anything else you want, Jon just ask, either by email or phone, you know how to get me. Sue xx

summary: In the Fabulous Thirties, Doc Savage and his five Amazing Adventurers are sucked into the mystery of Doc's father disappearing in the wilds of South America. The maniacal Captain Seas tries to thwart them at every turn as they travel to the country of Hidalgo to investigate Doc's father's death and uncover a vast horde of Incan gold.
translation:
I dug it out and saw it tonight. I honestly believe it must have been 20 years since I last saw one. I remember that it was a seriously flawed movie. I can not remember that it is so bad !!!!!

I am absolutely appalled that a project with so much potential must have been treated so badly. Who am I responsible for this? The 2 guys who wrote the script (and I use the word loose)? The casting directors who have made at least three main characters in the story so terribly wrong? (Only two of them are among the "Fantastic 5".) The director, who obviously did not take it seriously and repeatedly pushed bad writing and bad drama everywhere? (I liked the title song - but it should never have been used throughout the movie!) Don Black, who was supposed to be ASHAMED on some of the lyrics he wrote for this music?

It is expected that I should get this out, less than a week after reading the comic adaptation again. The first 15-20 minutes of the film more or less (really, less) in parallel to the first issue of the comic. When I saw it tonight, I kept asking myself - why was almost every single detail changed? Doc appeared, then used the remote control of his watch to open the safe, and the sniper's bullet missed him by five inches because the refracting glass was the only thing that remained the same. I mean, if you make an "adaptation," WHY CHANGE EVERYTHING in God's name ???

Once they've left Doc's headquarters, virtually nothing is the way it was in the comic book (which, given Roy Thomas, I guess, probably follows the book). I read somewhere that they combined elements of two different novels in one movie. Again - WHY? I heard that it was changed because they were unable to get the budget they wanted. I look at the movie and think ... LACK OF MONEY does not explain what I saw on screen!

You know, when people complain about Joel Schumacher, they should really take a look at this thing. The best I can say is that the BATMAN feature from 1966 would make it a great dual feature - and probably a great triple calculation with the 1980's FLASH GORDON. All 3 films are "silly". Maybe we can "blame" the 1966 film (and television series) for that. Some fans have complained over the years that Adam West's BATMAN has ruined the image of comics in the minds of generations of non-comic fans. I think the same could be said for Hollywood. I remember how many really, really bad movies based on "classic" characters have been made over the years, especially (so it seems to me) in the late 70's and early 80's. Charlie Chan, Fu Manchu, Tarzan, Buck Rogers, Flash Gordon, The Lone Ranger - all "murdered" by Hollywood guys who think, "Oh, comics, you know, it's supposed to be stupid!" More like you are the "stupid". What a waste of potential.

Let me say a few good things ... Despite the script and the direction, Ron Ely is GREAT. When I read a DOC SAVAGE story, I'm not thinking of the James Bama pictures, but of Ely. Bill Lucking (who was a regular member of The A-Team later) is terrific. Eldon Quick (whom I have seen elsewhere but can not remember) is terrific. Paul Gleason - whom I absolutely hated with passion and revenge at the BREAKFAST CLUB ("Teacher" like the one he has played should not be taught anywhere) could be the best of the "amazing 5" in the movie. Pamela Hensley - although her part of the original story was almost unrecognizable - is terrific. Before she rolled her hair, I realized that she saw a HELL of a lot like "Ardala Valmar" from those awful John Calkins BUCK ROGERS streaks that I've just read. She has a big nose like Ardala - just not so pronounced. The comics Ardala actually looked more like the movie from 1936, Princess Aura- or Cher. Or maybe Streisand. Take your choice. (Ardala actually got a plastic surgery on the George Tuska strip - it was amazing after that!)

Paul Wexler, funny enough, I just saw in a GET SMART episode last week. I wonder if he was something like the character he was supposed to play? I do not know, because this character was certainly not in the movie from which the film takes its title.

summary: A secret Service agent and a news reporter investigate the conspiracy behind the assassination of the President.
translation: This movie had some great actors! Unfortunately they had forgotten to act. I was hoping the movie would get better, but the drama was so robotic that it was doomed from the start. Actually, it seemed like the actors were reading a script all the time. Maybe it was the music score or the director himself, but one thing is for sure, the make-up artist has to get another job! The face powder was so thick that you could see it on the faces of the actors! I would not recommend this movie to anyone, no wonder it never theaters. Cuba Gooding Jr. / James Woods is ashamed that you have not given everything. The plot was great, just needed a lot more.

summary: When it comes to romance, Missy's attitude has always been whatever. After all, her artistic career is flourishing...her spacious New York City loft is fabulous...and her relationship with a married man is totally uncomplicated-what more could a modern girl want? But then Missy meets Brat, who's sweet, genuine and shares her fondness for 70's sitcoms. Unfortunately, he's also dating her pal Spaz. When Missy and Brat unexpectedly fall for each other, will she lose her identity...and her best friend? No matter how far you run, true love always finds you.
translation: Why? Why did you make this movie? If Timothy Olyphant was not shirtless many times, there would be absolutely no reason to watch this movie. Um ... action? Nope. Well-defined characters? Nope. The only time I laughed was when my friend made fun of all the jail. P.S. Andy Dick? Nope.

summary: An examination of the commercialization of Christmas in America while following Reverend Billy and the Church of Stop Shopping Gospel Choir on a cross-country mission to save Christmas from the Shopocalypse (the end of humankind from consumerism, over-consumption and the fires of eternal debt.) The film also delves into issues such as the role sweatshops play in America's mass consumerism and Big-Box Culture. From the humble beginnings of preaching at his portable pulpit on New York City subways, to having a congregation of thousands - Bill Talen (aka Rev. Billy) has become the leader of not just a church, but a national movement.
translation:
This film is just another distortion, among many distortions, on the so-called "sins of consumerism". Please note that "Reverend Billy," an actor (Bill Talen), is nothing more than a bureaucrat against the "sins of consumerism." We might ask questions like: What does "Reverend Billy" do for a living? How does he earn his money? Does he earn a living from his "tax-deductible" organization? How does the Internal Revenue justify this as a tax deductible church or organization?

Everyone knows that Christmas is commercialized but it offers a day in a whole year where people have the opportunity to be benevolent and allow a considerable number of people to spend time with their families, To spend friends or extended families. Everyone is not charitable. Everyone does not spend time with their families, friends or extended families. But vacation and holidays give people this opportunity and opportunity. Yes, America has more than its share of problems - but with perseverance Americans have always had great difficulties. And even in times of conflict, America has proved to be the largest country in the world. This happens when Americans contract and unite instead of separating and sharing. Yes, there are problems with companies and monopolies, but it will take Americans to bring back the small businesses, along with the ethics of taking care of the people in our individual communities. Yes, globalization has brought us its share of problems, but it will take Americans to bring production back to America. The Americans and the US government need to learn how to stick to a budget, no matter how big or small, and we need to stop our credit dependency. Our excessive reliance on credit will make us from cradle to grave and keep us poor. It is important to buy - but if we buy less, we will rely less on credit. And if we are able to save even a small amount of money, we will have money for a rainy day. Not to say that we as Americans will get an equal share of wealth. Wealth is not guaranteed and was never guaranteed. But stratification teaches us that only a small percentage of Americans own most of America's assets. There is a good closeness that you or I can reach the upper middle class level. And who knows what can happen from there?!? Be positive, work hard - and at least we can achieve at least some (if not all) of our dreams. Nothing is guaranteed in life, but we always have something to achieve. And if you or I have no dreams, we might as well be dead. In America there is always room for many hopes and dreams. As individuals, we are part of the pack, but we can always be the leader of the pack.

It has always been my experience that churches and religion offer nothing more than additional bias, but I appreciate and respect people with different beliefs, values ‚Äã‚Äãand perspectives. But as far as the distortions are concerned, in this film I have no faith in such beliefs, values ‚Äã‚Äãand perspectives. I rate this film at 1 out of 10 - but in all honesty and truth, this film deserves a zero. This movie has no integrity, and I can not recommend it.

summary: Dennis Buckstead has the hardest calling in his church. Not only has he been asked to coach a group of non-basketball players in his church but the bishop has demanded that he lead the team to the Basketball Championship. Word from the top is that this is the last season of church ball and Bishop Linderman isn't about to have his team lose for the 20th year in a row in the last season of church ball history! What was supposed to strengthen the body, invigorate the mind and cultivate brotherly love seems to bring out the worst in these church-going ball players. Dennis must find a way to bring his team together and build unity along the way to win the championship or go down in church ball history as the worst team that ever played.
translation: I saw this movie with relatively low expectations and imagined it would be a nice piece of fluff. Unfortunately, it was not even that. I could barely sit through the movie without wanting to leave. I went with my two kids (ages 10 and 13) and even they kept asking, "How much longer?" After enduring to the end, I kept asking myself who would approve this script. Even the reliable Fred Willard could not save the trite dialogue, the jokes of the state and the banal conspiracy. I would suggest that the person who wrote and directed this movie (I use the term loose) should take an online screenwriting class or drop by for a film class at their local community college. At the very least, there are many books on directing, screenplay, and movies that teach them about structure, plot, dialogue, and tempo.

summary: Bill Dancer and his young companion Curly Sue are the classic homeless folks with hearts of gold. Their scams are aimed not at turning a profit, but at getting enough to eat. When they scam the rich and beautiful Grey Ellison into believing she backed her Mercedes into Bill, they're only hoping for a free meal. But Grey is touched, and over the objections of her snotty fiance, insist on putting the two up for the night. As they get to know each other, Bill becomes convinced that this is where Curly Sue belongs - in a home, cared for by someone that can give her the advantages that his homeless, nomadic existence lacks. He plans to leave the young girl in the care of Grey and take off.... but Curly Sue has other ideas!
translation:
My daughter, her friends and I have seen this movie literally dozens of times. I bought it twice and some little girlfriends left. Then I rented it so often. It just never gets old !!! Blockbuster does not even have it in their lists anymore and I've been trying to buy, find, rent for over 5 years. Without a doubt this was and is my favorite childhood film of my daughter ... it has everything! We laughed, we cried, we talked about real life and how hard some children are in the world. There was nothing wrong with this movie. We referred to every second and every line Bill! A thousand thanks for restoring our belief in human nature. Sincerely, Shelleen and Kailin Vandermey. Craven, Saskatchewan. CANADA, how !!! :-)

August '07 update:

Who do we judge when a rich woman falls in love with a poor man? or a man who has love decides to raise a child that is not his own. It can not be mine or your life. Not only is it believable, it happens every day. Thank God! Keep my faith in human nature alive !!! celebrate!!!!

summary: 3 men get stranded on an island. They are captured by this group of people who turn out to be members of a group under the direction of Karl Sr. and his son Karl Jr., who are the famous butcher/slashers from the first two Violent Shit movies. Soon these three men and a bunch of exiles are given a chance to run away from the group members; unlike some others who are brutally murdered. However they decide to fight back and a gory and violent battle ensues.
translation:
Ok, I like B movies ... I know what B movies should be. But that's just terrible. I am amazed that it has received such a decent overall grade. The only redeeming features of this strip are the (mostly) marginal splatter effects. Do not get me wrong, Gore is plentiful in this streak - but few effects have really jumped out (like the anal "probe" ... that was great!).

I think this movie was filmed with a camcorder. Come on - rent at least one Betacam, I've seen (and better) porn with better production values.

acting - sucked! But not on Troma or Full Moon Art.

Story - Invented! But that comes from movies like this. Very cool!

Sets & Props - sucked! My 16-year-old brother makes more elaborate sets for our house on Halloween.

Synchronization and dialogue - sucked! Terrible speech (I should not even call it acting) and every other word is "S ** t" or "F ** k".

There are tons of good classic and B-rated horror / splatter mending out there and they are not that hard to find. Do yourself a favor by not wasting time with this crap!

summary: A young French woman returns to the vast silence of West Africa to contemplate her childhood days in a colonial outpost in Cameroon. Her strongest memories are of the family's houseboy, Protee - a man of great nobility, intelligence and beauty - and the intricate nature of relationships in a racist society.
translation:
The film portrays France's unsolved problems with its colonial legacy in western (francophone) Africa through the confused and complex psychoanalytic prism of a young woman, France (symbolically representing her nation here). It is an often engaging and challenging portrait of the desire of a young woman to deal with a traumatic moment in her past, especially the desire of a nation to turn to the "other" that once possessed and shaped it. This is reflected in the way in which it is all about the notion of traveling (or transit) from the present to the past; reminded realities of undeniable contemporary political and economic news.

The characters all play a symbolic, albeit limited and unconvincing role. France, which is supposed to be both a visual and a totemic representation of contemporary French society, leaves her position indifferent, as she still seems to be filled with the same naivety she enjoys as a child - in fact, as a child, she seems more attached to her his possession of their reality. The rest of the rag-tag ensemble is easy to forget. The Black Africans are at least insulting impressionist portraits of former colonized peoples rumored by the poor handling of their material. They are nothing more than a dark and dying setting against which blythearted France longs for a world she has never known and hopes for that one can never find in Cameroon.

summary: Life in the Chicago projects is never easy, However, the Evans family never gives up trying to make the best of things. While Florida and James struggle to provide for their family, their sons J.J., an aspiring painter, Micheal, the undying political crusader, causing trouble while their sister, Thelma, stands between them as the voice of reason. Living in the same building were Willona Woods, Florida's best friend from High School who provided support, love and gossip and Nathan Bookman, the overweight janitor who gave them grief and was the butt of alot of fat jokes, especially Willona who often referred to him as Buffalo Butt or Booger. Life, at least, is never boring while they fight to keep their heads above water and one day leave the projects, which they did in the series finale. Sadly, it was without James who was killed off in the 4th season.
translation:
When they killed John Amos' character, they killed the show. He was the crucial part of the info structure. You had a story about an inner-city family struggling to do what it does best. They were poor, they were black, and they were living proof that if you have Jesus and your family, nothing is too difficult. Sure, James would lose jobs and JJ would fail at school, but the family always found a way.

James was the strong male role model who earned the income and disciplined the children. Florida was the strong lady that every James had trapped when it took a shoulder to cry or hug to make it. The children had personalities and input that made them important as a family unit. Her neighbor Willona was also a key element because she not only represented a friend, but also some people who were kind enough to be family. Things were bright, somber, funny and honest until they changed the course of the program. James dies and JJ takes over the show.

Flo was still a mother, Thelma was more thriving in a lady and Michael was still the militant midget but JJ was the show. We were expected to allow the family to stay in the apartment without a father or prominent breadwinner. I think James's paycheck did not do much for the family. They were only threatened with eviction because they said they were moving and not because no one worked in the house. I know that JJ, Flo, Thelma and even Michael finally got jobs, but come in here really. James worked so much that you could feel for him, but the others were not realistic at all, and that's a shame.

JJ was the weird relief, but I felt the show needed substance. It's OK to be funny, but she had a chance to show a real family and what it took to survive in the real world and she threw them all away on a few laughs. Michael's character almost disappeared as the rest of the cast slipped into the shadows of the JJ Evans show. I mean, here was a guy who failed at school, he was always fired and he painted about two episodes of money. James was always there to promote his talent, but Flo and the rest of the family did not seem to care.

Why did it take him so long to understand that painting was what he meant? He could have sold paintings on the street or worked for people printing billboards and maps. (But he did something wrong.) Why did not he make it and why did the others give up their dreams? I'll tell you why, because they did not have a father in their life to care for and cheer them on, and their mother stopped being hers to support their dreams. The show stopped teaching us about growth, building and learning and started to teach us gimmicks and catchphrases. They should have kept James. If any show needed a father, it was this one.

summary: In the highlands of Scotland in the 1700s, Rob Roy tries to lead his small town to a better future, by borrowing money from the local nobility to buy cattle to herd to market. When the money is stolen, Rob is forced into a Robin Hood lifestyle to defend his family and honour.
translation: This rousing drama has it all: first-rate acting, incredible photography, good story. It is often compared to "Braveheart" as both films are in historic Scotland. Although I love Braveheart, I think that this is the better of the two films. Jessica Lange gave an incredible performance (should be nominated for an Oscar). Liam Neeson is fantastic in the title role. Tim Roth plays one of the nastiest, most despicable characters in film history (he was nominated for an Academy Award). John Hurt is excellent as Lord Montrose, another unattractive character. I am always amazed at the incredible range of characters that John Hurt can play. This is a story about a dispute over money between Rob Roy and his clan and Lord Montrose. Rob Roy is a self-made man who will not solve his problems with Montrose if it violates his sense of honor. Montrose, who inherited his title, has no sense of honor. And that's what this story is about. Glory of the common man against corruption of the nobility. This movie is very entertaining, it should appeal to everyone. It has romance, action, beautiful scenery and has an exciting plot. One of my favorite movies.

summary: A family driving through Nevada decides to take some snapshots at an out-of-the-way ghost town named Weaver, and horrible things start happening.
translation:
