We had to go to an appointment, so we turned on the DVR to record the end. After it was over, I looked at my husband and said, "Do you have any idea?". He shook his head. I said, "So you made me see the end of this movie and I have no idea what just happened". He did not "make" me, but you know.

The film body itself was pretty good. There was a lot of tension. It woke you up. Then came the end. The end was ... well, it just ended. You were not informed about what happened or why. Until the credits, I always thought something would happen to explain it, but it never did. So I came here expecting someone to find out and I just would not pay attention. Nope. Here, four years later, I'm as clueless as Tom Sawyer.

I still have no idea what happened. I'm just glad I did not waste money to buy it because I was sure I was crazy.

OHHHHH! I get it! The end of the movie is gone! rofl

summary: After a German U-Boat sinks their ship, several survivors manage to take control of the boat. Bowen Tyler is the son of an American shipbuilder and Captain Bradley an experienced seaman. After several tussles with the German crew, they find themselves on a strange island. There they find a place where several stages of Earth's evolution co-exist at the same time. As a result several types of humans are found as well as prehistoric dinosaurs. There are also active volcanoes which all add up to a challenge to survive.
translation:
This is not one of those reviews of bad special effects or technology, or dated, issues that only the dorkiest people could identify with, but rather a storytelling review that most of us are really interested in. >
The plot is about a combination of members of the Allies and German Navy from the Second World War and two civilians (the hero and the heroine), who are rounded up on a German submarine and in a wild land of the Dinosaurs End> The manipulations are not so bad by film standards, and we know from the plot that realism will not be high. What such films need are credible and likable characters, along with some semblance of reason in the actions.

This movie is missing both. For a full-length movie, only 6 characters are provided and 3 of them are barely viewed. McClure's Hero is beyond "routine" and does not make much sense at any time.

The female seems to be seeking an answer to a riddle about the land of the dinosaurs they entered, but the puzzle is not much of a puzzle, and we could care less.

A lot of mistakes in a movie that should have been better, also for his time.

summary: An intense film about time travel, this Sci-Fi entry was directed by Terry Gilliam, a member of the comedy troupe Monty Python. The film stars Bruce Willis as James Cole, a prisoner of the state in the year 2035 who can earn parole if he agrees to travel back in time and thwart a devastating plague. The virus has wiped out most of the Earth's population and the remainder live underground because the air is poisonous. Returning to the year 1990, six years before the start of the plague, Cole is soon imprisoned in a psychiatric facility because his warnings sound like mad ravings. There he meets a scientist named Dr. Kathryn Railly (Madeleine Stowe) and Jeffrey Goines (Brad Pitt), the mad son of an eminent virologist (Christopher Plummer). Cole is returned by the authorities to the year 2035, and finally ends up at his intended destination in 1996. He kidnaps Dr. Railly in order to enlist her help in his quest. Cole discovers graffiti by an apparent animal rights group called the Army ...
translation: Most of all, we know that Bruce Willis is a good actor, but if you take the majority of his films, you'll see that the characters have those moments in which they're the same. His character in this film is far beyond any single so far ... and counts. The story begins in the (not so distant) future in which a man is sent back to the past to find the source of a virus that swept most of humanity from the face of the earth. The story seems to go in the direction of SF, but I think it's rather a drama because of the slow rhythm of the story. Movies tend to be faster and slower at some points and are more towards the end than at the beginning, but when you watch this movie, you will be aware of the constant rhythm of the story and reveal facts that neither accelerate nor slow it down. It's the same speed that flows gently and pretty well. But that does not mean the end will not irritate your nerves because it's pretty good. As far as the direction goes, it is prefect. Movies as such are easily destroyed by bad direction, but this has gotten a lot better. So, if you are preparing to see a sci-fi movie or action, you will miss it. B There should be more movies like this.

summary: Professor Wassermann (John Stacy) is asked by industry magnate Morgan Hunnicut (Eddie Faye) to lead an expedition to study the giant Yeti creature found frozen in a large ice block on Newfoundland's coast. The professor does not know that Hunnicut intends to use the prehistoric creature as a trademark of its multinational industrial group. A very big mistake.
translation:
Most Yeti images are shaken by a serious lack of energy and enthusiasm. Not so wonderfully twisted, batty and insane, twisted in Italy, shot in Canada Kitsch-Gut-Buster: It's a wildly mature and fiercely idiotic ghastly wonder, the breathless apotheosis of quite baked "What the hell" reached? "Crackpot excess and inanity.

A cargo ship crew discovers the body of a 30-foot yeti that resembles a hirsute 70's disco-stud (complete with jumbo-waved afro) perfect in a large piece of ice They disappoint the beast, shake it back with electric charges, grossly mistreat it, and keep the poor hairy goliath in a huge glass cabin before you can say, "Hey, the filmmakers are obviously killing King Kong," ours breaks gigantic, abominable snowstorm from his cage, takes hold of the first luscious, nubile, blond Euro - Vixen (the beautiful Pheonix Grant), who he relishes, storms off with his new lover The Yeti is being retaken and flown to Toronto to face a gawking Of course, he breaks free again, nods to the vixen and makes the expected pounding around the city.

The sublime stupid dialogue (ex el: "Philosophy has no place in science, Professor"), cheesy (far from it) special effects (the horrendous translucent blue screen and the quirky Tonka game miniatures are especially alarming in their scary shyness), chunky (wrong) direction and in Lumbering script that even makes a clumsy righteous attempt "Is the Yeti a Man or a Beast?" Ethical debates all combine to create one of the most glorious, ridiculous giant monster movies that has ever roared its absurd way across the big screen. Better still, we also have a few funky offbeat touches to add extra shabby spice to the already addictive slutty buffoon: The vixen accidentally pushes on one of Yeti's nipples, causing it to harden and a big, grinning grin of approval the lustful behemoth (!); the vixen cares for Yeti's injured hand while sticking his eyes at her, Yeti smashes windows with his feet as he climbs a towering office block, and the furry lad even breaks a man's neck with his toes (!!) , Overall, this unique screwball and shamelessly unheralded stock camp classic should be as tall as a remarkable monolith of contagious asinine celluloid madness worthy of a substantial hardcore underground sect.

summary: Internet love connections and mail-order brides rarely ever work out, and John should have known. Having never been lucky in the game of love and tired of waiting for the perfect woman to come along, John decides to take his chances and orders a mail-order bride from Russia online. At first, things seem perfect: his new bride Nadia is a gorgeous woman, and although she may not speak much English, her skills in the bedroom more than make up for any communication problems. When Nadia's 'cousins' unexpectedly arrive to celebrate her birthday, John is drawn into their web of corruption and crime.
translation:
I have a lot of experience with women in Russia and this movie unfortunately shows how many of them are. They are very cunning, unscrupulous, greedy and most unfair. From robotic sex, the search for gifts, to lies and betrayal, I experienced everything in Russia.

I know what I'm talking about. And here are my qualifications: Here are the photojournals of my three trips to Russia looking for a bride. It contains thousands of pictures of many hot Russian girls I've met, black comedy, scams I was exposed to, and the story of my raid and appearance on Russian national television.

http: //www.happierabroad .com / Photojournals.htm

It's like Reality TV. You will love it. I spent a lot of time putting it together. So look at it. The Russian, who plays Nicole Kidman, is in her photojournals like the Julia and Katya.

My 3 bride seekers in Russia are very exciting and would sell, so why do not they do that? a movie of my bride who is looking for adventure in Russia? There is, however, a virtual impossibility in this film, and that is the way the guy orders his bride from a catalog and lets her arrive at an airport. It does not work that way at all, so I do not understand why the media likes to continue that. There is not a single Russian bridal introduction website that works this way, and I challenge everyone to find one that does. The fact is that you can only order the CONTACT INFORMATION of the Russian lady (e-mail, address, phone number, etc.) from the website. From then on, you will correspond and visit them, and if you want to bring them to your country, start the immigration process in your INS office and wait months later. That's how it works in real life. You can not just order them at your airport. US immigration would NEVER allow that to happen.

WuMaster

- I got everything I wanted by going abroad! You can also! http://www.happierabroad.com

summary: Against the backdrop of AIDS, the film explores two families, each with a gay son. Jonathan is splitting from Miki because the more experienced Miki is playing around. Then Jonathan sees Thomas, the son and grandson of his neighbors, who is back in Israel after failing to make it as a musician in New York: Thomas is ill, detached, in search of hard drugs. Jonathan tries to connect with him. Meanwhile, Thomas's grandmother, facing old age, has become bitter, particularly toward her hard-working daughter. They worry about Thomas. A few blocks away, Jonathan's mother, brother and sister maintain their sometimes bickering relationships, watching Jonathan brave adulthood.
translation: ever seen. It acts so gently and subtly not only with AIDS (which is only hinted at) and gay life, but also with age, dying and death. It's a deep and beautiful movie (also visual) of a very special director. Highly recommended1

summary: The Stilwins are on vacation to an isolated beach in Mexico. Walking on a deserted jetty, Doug Stilwin gets his leg trapped under one of the logs. All attempts to move the log are futile and Helen Stilwin takes the car to get help. However, an escaped criminal kidnaps her. Will she be able to return to her husband before he drowns?
translation:
What a great movie by Barbara Stanwyck I saw last night. "Jeopardy" was fantastic. It was made in 1953 and probably for double bills, but it kept me on the edge of my seat.

Barbara Stanwyck plays Helen driving with her husband Doug (Barry Sullivan) and son (Lee Aaker) a localized fishing spot in Mexico for a vacation. The husband falls off the dock and the only way he can be saved is when Barbara drives back to a garage for a rope.

There she meets a psychotic killer (Ralph Meeker - one of My Darlings) and what follows is a cat-and-mouse game while Barbara tries hard to get Meeker back to her husband to free.

The movie was so exciting and such a surprise - I did not expect such a great movie. But I suppose I should have understood - is there anything that Barbara Stanwyck does, is all that less than wonderful?

summary: Vince Lombardi High School keeps losing principals to nervous breakdowns because of the students' love of rock 'n' roll and their disregard of education. The putative leader of the students is Riff Randell, who loves the music of the Ramones. A new principal, the rock-music-hating Miss Evelyn Togar, is brought in and promises to put an end to the music craze. When Miss Togar and a group of parents attempt to burn a pile of rock records, the students take over the high school, joined by the Ramones, who are made honorary students. When the police are summoned and demand that the students evacuate the building, they do so, which leads to an explosive finale.
translation:
This movie is a 90 minute Ramones concert with short periods of stupidity and absolute boredom. What kind of high school is that?

Unless you are a big fan of Ramones, DO NOT and I DO NOT repeat your time like me. This is completely unpredictable from beginning to end. This movie should be called Ramone Fever. Everyone seems to like them in this movie. There is no action in this film. As far as teen comedies go, scratch the bottom of the barrel with this one.

summary: A young man finds out that his parents had been used in an atomic-weapons experiment shortly before he was born, and that the results have had some unexpected effects on him.
translation: Now I rented this movie because Brad Dourif was there. He is an excellent actor, brilliant in everything ... except this movie. And I think that's just because he realized how stupid the movie was, and did not mess around with a good idea. This movie is an unintentional comedy. Some of the lines just tear me up. And there are a few lines that make no sense, and it seems Tobe Hooper is just interjecting the lines without thinking about the plot. Oh! BTW the property is bad! But it is one of those movies that is TAHT BAD, that it is actually painful to see them. I recommend this only for BIG Brad Dourif fans or fans of any other actor because the plot is pathetic.

summary: Professor Shuri is a scientist looking for rare Pocket Monsters. He reads a storybook to his daughter Mi about the powerful Pokemon Entei. Shuri is currently searching for the heiroglyph Pokemon "Unknown". While searching through some ancient artifacts, Shuri awakens Unknown and is sucked into it. Mi next awakens Unknown while looking for her father. Unknown bonds with her and turns her mansion into a Crystal Tower. The crystallization begins to spread. Unknown lives to serve Mi and creates an Entei with the personality of her father to make her happy. When Mi next desires a mother, Entei kidnaps Satoshi's mother Hanako to give to Mi. Satoshi, Kasumi, Takeshi, and of course Pikachu set out to get her back.
translation:
Pokemon 3 is just over three or four episodes of the TV series, without the usual commercials strung together. The story is typical of Pokemon (conflict, struggles and a resolution where everyone is happy in the end), and there is nothing original or unusual in the animation. Some of the holes in the plot are filled (over the credits!) Without explanation, and everything is just a bit too sweet.

Why do you see it on the big screen? The only reason is to be a part of the world of your child. Both of my sons enjoy Pokemon, and by showing an interest in what they like we are closer. Seeing a movie in a theater is still different than being seen on the subway, and my sons enjoy the full movie experience. I gave the movie a 4, mainly from the point of view of my children.

summary: A collection of skits that make fun of television. Everything from commercials to the nightly news are spoofed. Chevy Chase makes a brief (as well as his debut), appearance.
translation: Oh man. While Chevy Chase and the band at SNL set new heights with the Sketch Show format, this fails miserably on all levels. Fortunately, Chevy is not present at all and can not be held responsible for these tripe. It's really, very bad. Although it should be a political commentary on the US at the time of its publication (1974), it remains neither funny nor acutely observed. The sketches are far too long and any satirical effect they may have is lost, since they are all drawn to total boredom. This will be credited as a Chevy movie debut and I'm pleased to say that everything he did afterwards improved it. Avoid it even if it is curious.

summary: The Forrester family - father Mitch Forrester, mother Helen Forrester, their pre-teen son Billy Forrester and their pre-school son Woody Forrester - have just moved to a new town where Mitch is starting a new job. Both Mitch and Billy are worried about fitting into their new environment. It's worse for Billy as Woody, who is not worried about the move, is at that stage in his life where everything is simple and easy. Billy's first day in the fifth grade at his new school does not go well when he gets into an altercation with the class bullies, led by Joe Guire. The altercation involves worms and Billy stating that he eats worms all the time, which leads to all the bullies calling him "Wormboy". As such, Joe bets Billy that he can't eat ten worms (without vomiting), the bet to take place this upcoming Saturday, with the last worm to be consumed by 7pm. Despite having a notoriously weak stomach, Billy takes him up on the bet. As the bet starts, the only classmate on Billy's side is ...
translation:
I read the book in 5th grade and now I saw the movie a few years later. There are a few differences:

1. Billy was originally supposed to eat 15 worms in 15 days, not 10 worms in one day until 7pm.

2. Billy should get $ 30 after eating all the worms. In the movie where Billy eats all the worms, Joe has to go to school with worms in his pants.

3. Joe is supposed to fake some of the worms, but in the movie he does not do that at all.

Even though there are changes, this film is still one that children will enjoy.

summary: At an annual pace, a huge colony of ants is forced to collect every piece of food that grows on their island for a group of menacing grasshoppers. But that all changes when a misfit inventor ant named Flik accidentally knocks over the offering pile thus forcing the grasshoppers' devious leader Hopper to force the ants to redo their gathering of food. Despite the fact that his friends don't believe him and desperate to help save the colony, Flik volunteers to go out into the world and search for a group of 'warrior' bugs. Instead, what he got was a talented group of circus performers. But when the grasshoppers return and take control of the island, Flik must prove himself a true hero before it's too late.
translation:
(originally a reaction to a movie critic who said A Bug's Life was too much, too fast - he was "dazed and exhausted" by the pictures and seemed to ignore the story altogether)

Okay, first I am 26 years old, have a job, go to school and have a fianc√©. So maybe I'm crazy and just really good at hiding it ... but I did not just get away from A Bug's Life exhausted or dizzy, it was not until I saw it for the second time that I really could start guessing the art and the humor of the spectacular pictures - because when I saw this movie for the first time, I was so engrossed in the story and the characters that I FORGET that I should be sitting there are visually "enthusiastic" of any frame , How can you not empathize with Flik and his life, which is paved from the road to the devil? "Damn," I found myself identified with this little ant (not to mention a few other bugs) in more ways than one ... and that tells me more about what an incredible movie that is than a whole book about his nice eye candy. Of course it is beautiful (every blade of grass, the tree, the rain ...). Of course, what they can do with technology is amazing (you can read their lips, give it a try!). But this film is not just a masterpiece of art and technology, not just a dazzling explosion of movement and color. No, A Bug's Life would be static if that was not history. But I'm glad to say it is not! The life of a beetle has a real heart. Yes, there is a lot going on, both in the story and visually, but that's because the story and the characters actually have some depth! Just because it's a children's movie does not mean you have to turn off your brain at the theater door - children are smarter than you think! Besides, I think the PIXAR crew did that for themselves, even in front of their kids ... and that shows in the crowd in which the heart is. This film moves, touches, funny, intriguing and generally captivating. The character development in such an ensemble cast is amazing, there's a lot of character growth, not just the main character - so rare in animation and often in movies in general. It does not hit you over the head with its points once it's done - every scene, every frame has a purpose in the plot to be there, and there are no unnecessary shots. Not always saying exactly what is going on means subtlety to me, people; it does not mean "dumbing down" your movie and assuming that the audience is stupid, which it usually is not. All I can think is, if you see A Bug's Life and feel nothing at all, then you've never made a big mistake, hurt your friends, fell in love, was in love, was frustrated that no one would listen. You lied to someone who loved you important, feel like a social outsider, look forward to a new idea, come up with a great idea, had a great idea, were embarrassed, and in the next moment were sure of the pressure of responsibility, standing for yourself and your loved ones stood up against the crowd, felt like a failure, felt like a great success, felt the need to make a difference with your life in the lives of others ... well, you get the point. Closing words: A + rating from me; please, if you want to see it, try the movie (pan and scan video will NOT work for this movie); If you love Toy Story, you probably will love it (PIXAR knows how to make heart-shaped films); If you love it, you will see it several times, or you may still not know what you miss (the amount of detail and subtlety here is considerable); and if you really feel deep, pretend it's a seed, okay?

summary: Episodes in the novelist's life: In 1890, young Jack London quits a cannery job to try oyster piracy. Later, he signs on for a sealing voyage, tries Yukon prospecting and a brief university career, loving and leaving women along the way. Instead of riches, he gets story ideas. Suddenly, he finds success and a delectable lady; but the urge to adventure won't let him go.
translation: In his short 40 years on earth, author Jack London managed to make as many adventures and incidents as he could. This 90-minute film, supposedly a biography of man's life, but obviously fictionalized, does not even scratch the surface and remains a story ripe for a modern retelling. Here Michael O'Shea portrays London in one of his first roles, and his performance is both rough and likable. He is not the problem here. Nor is it a young and very beautiful Susan Hayward, who plays his future wife Charmian, whose biography about London forms the "basis" for this film. London's life has been broken down into a series of episodes that the film easily skips. So we have brief incidents with London as an oyster pirate, Sealer in the Bering Sea, Gold Prospector in the Yukon and correspondent during the Russo-Japanese War ... certainly colorful events, but hardly anything like deep treatment. And Alfred Santell's direction (he shot one of Susan's first films in 1939, "Our Leading Citizen") is capricious at best. Somewhat harder is a DVD of very poor quality with a cheesy-looking pressure source and a hissing sound. Perhaps the best thing about this movie rental for me was one of the extras of the DVD: a catalog of all alpha video films with hundreds of full-color movie posters. Hopefully these movies are better than "Jack London"!

summary: Kol is an evil guy about to be executed on a distant spaceship. He manages to escape on a shuttle and make his way to some woods in America. The commander of the spaceship decides to send out The Alienator to execute Kol at all costs. Kol meets up with some teens and Ward Armstrong and together they all try not to get killed by the pursuing Woman of Death - The Alienator.
translation: I do not know what this other meeting talked about. This is definitely not a bimbo movie, in fact I do not think there was a decent-looking girl in it. No, it's just cheesy, badly done, Ed Wood-style science fiction. And it is bad. I can not even tell you how bad it is. I saw it on the cable late at night and I was shocked. The fact that this film was ever released is an insult to us all. The actors were either friends of the producer or mentally retarded, the special effects are a joke, and the tempo is insanely slow. For me, music is the most important thing. A monkey could write a better topic with a toy xylophone. Do not rent this thing, but if you ever see it on cable, watch it. You'll be amazed how bad a movie can be.

summary: Comedian Eddie Murphy brings his proudly raunchy comedy act to a sold-out stadium and pontificates in his own vulgarly hilarious fashion on such subjects as sexual orientation, puberty, dating, disciplinarian mothers, ice cream trucks, and the personality traits of certain singers.
translation: That was the funniest piece of film / tape I've ever seen, but none. I laughed ill the first three times I watched it. I recommend it to everyone, with the warning, if they can not handle the F-Sharps, to stay far away. Best when he tells stories from the perspective of children.

summary: Chronological look at the fiasco in Iraq, especially decisions made in the spring of 2003 - and the backgrounds of those making decisions - immediately following the overthrow of Saddam: no occupation plan, an inadequate team to run the country, insufficient troops to keep order, and three edicts from the White House announced by Bremmer when he took over: no provisional Iraqi government, de-Ba'athification, and disbanding the Iraqi armed services. The film has chapters (from History to Consequences), and the talking heads are reporters, academics, soldiers, military brass, and former Bush-administration officials, including several who were in Baghdad in 2003.
translation:
This is a well done informative film in the vein of PBS Frontline. The problem is, Frontline has already done this piece and managed to bring in L. Paul Bremer to tell his side of the story. More disturbing is the fact that the director of the film, Charles Ferguson - a former think tank Wonk, was a warrior until the occupation went south. What did he think would happen?

The invasion of Poland was also very good until it was confused by the annoying Nazis. And so this film feels - an apology for the occupation and not for a deconstruction of the act of war.

Ferguson seems to point out that the war could have gone better - as if every war could be better.

summary: Finals at the prestigious University of Dreyskill are finally over and it's time to party. "The Crew", as they are known by their peers and dorm mates, are invited to a rich classmate's hideaway mansion high up in the hills of Colorado. What was supposed to be a weekend of fun and relaxation quickly becomes a trip they will never forget... If they survive! A simple game of prank scare phone calls becomes an intense game of survival and escape when one of the Crew members accidentally calls the wrong person.
translation:
The storyline of 7EVENTY 5IVE involves college kids playing a cruel phone game that unexpectedly (over their heads, if not horror fans) gets them over their heads. The story of 7EVENTY 5IVE, on the other hand, is that of a horror movie that had a little bit of promise, unfortunately overcompensated by really bad writing.

What could have been fun, albeit a silly, old-fashioned Slasher story, is derailed early on by the misleading beliefs of the filmmakers that the audience would enjoy listening to a bunch of louder, whiny children watching, who scolded each other most of the time. With the exception of a police detective, played by Rutger Hauer (in a minor role mainly focused on adding the film's only star power), every character on the screen is a different kind of young A-hole.

Male and female, black and white, straight and gay, a whole ensemble of superficial and shrill college kids carries most of the film's narrative. Worse, since the story is about a failed PARTY game, the scenes are usually full of these little b ***** ds. For this reason, there are few interruptions for the viewer, who has to resign himself to the angry sharp shooting of the thinly drawn protagonists. Although at least some of these people are supposed to be friends, all the characters interact in a very hostile way, long before any real conflict has actually arisen. This leads to the worst possible outcome in a Slasher movie: The audience, who should take care of the leads, cheers not only to the anonymous murderer, but wishes that he has started picking up the stinking brats much earlier. >
The real disgrace of this bad characterization is that otherwise 7EVENTY 5IVE actually had a potential. Visually, it is fine. The first directors Brian Hooks and Deon Taylor know how to build an exciting atmosphere. They also manage to deliver some competent, albeit sparse, moments of the classic '80s style. Surprisingly, the occupation of the production is quite capable. It's not that the actors are unable to express realistic human emotions; It's just that the script (along with newcomer Vashon Nutt and director Hooks, who ran much better behind the camera than with a keyboard) does not have such moments.

7EVENTY 5IVE can hardly be recommended as its familiar premise and thrill do not outweigh the bad taste left behind by a story driven by a bevy of disagreeable characters. In this lukewarm thriller, the real secret is why someone is interested in a group of young people who can not even make friends.

summary: Mason, who lives on the streets, wants to cease his life when on the same day his two best friends die: His dog and an older man with whom he shared his food and roof. Just in time Cole, from a charity organization, can prevent his suicide and also offers him a quite well paid job as servant for a hunting party in the Rocky Mountains. Mason accepts the job and flies with them to a hut in the wilderness where they prepare everything for the four rich businessmen who want to hunt something special. Mason does not yet know that he is the victim of their sports that should lead to the basic insticts of man, but they did not count with his cleverness...
translation: This movie was awful. I swear they did not even write a script that they went through the entire movie. Ice-T was hellishly annoying. * SPOILERS Pht more like reasons not to see it * They sit down and have breakfast for 20 minutes. he could have been gone for a long time. The ground was hard, it would have been almost impossible to track him with dogs. And if ICE-T is on that hill and uses that Spaz-15 assault SHOTGUN like a sniper rifle (and then slashes a tree with eight shells - it would take 1000 grenades to cut down a tree of that size.) Shotguns and handguns on 100 yards considered inaccurate. And they even saw the reflection. What did the light reflect? I have not seen any room for this thing. Even if he was shot in the stomach and went on, that had stayed behind, he would bleed right there. Plus the end where he stuffs a stone or a cigarette into the boys barrel. It would not explode and kill him. The bullet would still kill Ice T kill, but mess up the barrel.

summary: The stooges are private detectives looking for a missing millionaire. They wander around the millionaire's spooky mansion confronting various crooks and a dangerous dame. The stooges vanquish the crooks (Shemp uses his "trusty shovel") and find the missing man.
translation:
Of the elements that do that best at the time, I have to say that Christine McIntire is number one. Shemp's scene is poisoned and her reaction is really great. I imagine that Christine, as a poster has suggested, tried to keep the laughter off during this scene, but it actually made her look even more delicious than that she smiled that Shemp might have died.

Another character who helps is the Goon. His gaze was a great mixture of horrible and comedic nonsense. Hardly a character I would meet in a dark alley, or wherever. I would have preferred a bit of crime thriller, but hey, if a short thing is so good, somebody will complain. Not me.

summary: Seven young people go to a desolated forest looking for a bear, what they don't know is that a crazy Vietnam vet lives there and he is waiting for fresh blood. Soon, they are killed by stomach and throat slashing, axe in the neck, exploding inside a car, etc... Who will survive?
translation: Seven young people go into the woods in search of a bear. They are all persecuted by a crazy Vietnam veteran and brutally murdered. "Trampa Infernal" is a pretty entertaining Mexican slasher who reminds me a lot of "The Zero Boys". The movie is fast paced and there are some good death scenes like throat cutting or ax in the neck. Unfortunately, there is not much blood left, so fans of Grand Guignol will be disappointed. However, if you are a fan of Slasher movies, give this rarity a look. Mexican horror movies are pretty obscure (I only have "Alucarda" and "Do not Panic" seen), so this should be another reason to see this pleasurable Slasher. My rating: 7 from 10.Vote recommended.

summary: A German spy carrying information that will reveal the target of Operation Overlord becomes involved with the wife of a crippled man on an isolated island off the Scottish coast while he waits to be picked up.
translation:
I do not know what Donald Sutherland's acting style or vocal style has to do, but he always seems to be behind a bunch of fluffy Kleenex. He's just ... I do not know, DICK? Somnambulistisch? On medication? Strange.

That is, for the first time since the original release, I saw the movie again, and honestly, I can not remember that it ended so much. A bad end, too, because nothing is tied. What about the dead husband? The annoying kid (and was the kid dubbed?)? The Scotland Yard and military pursuers? I would like to have packed something and closed everything dramatically, not just the big panorama excerpt.

And what woman sleeps with the man she knows has just killed her husband? Even if she tried to dispel Nadel's suspicions of protecting her child, she could always have had a headache. At this last meeting I felt much too itchy and uncomfortable ...

summary: It's the Christmas season. Wealthy Chicago ad executive Drew Latham has long avoided the family traditions of Christmas, but has dreaded being alone on the actual day. So when his tropical Christmas vacation with girlfriend Missy Vangilder falls through with Missy breaking up with him in the process, Drew, in going through some self-therapy, decides what he really needs is to relive the memorable Christmases from his childhood, which includes spending time with his parents and younger brother. As that is not possible, he decides to rent a family, namely ones he's never met before, the Valcos - husband and wife Tom and Christine and their teenaged son Brian - who now live in Drew's childhood home in suburban Chicago. Tom initially wants nothing to do with Drew until an exorbitant sum of money is involved, all written in a contract which expires at the end of Christmas day. What Drew is initially unaware of, or what he chooses to remain ignorant about, is that the Valcos are going ...
translation: Survivors Christmas (2004) Ben Affleck, James Gandolfini, Christina Applegate, Katharina Hara, Josh Zuckerman, Bill Macy, Jennifer Morrison, Udo Kier, D: Mike Mitchell. A hot yuppie left by his girlfriend does not want to be left alone for Christmas, so he decides to return to his home, impose the dysfunctional family that now lives there, and bribe her for posing as his family. An offensive and one-dimensional performance by Affleck, who mainly acts with a flashy smile, makes his character appear as a spiritually unbalanced discomfort, but Gandolfini and O 'Hara breathe life into this mess. Even for the farce, her silliness is cumbersome, from scene to scene makes little sense, and her sentimental messages are as fake as Affleck's grin. 91 min., Rated PG-13. * ¬Ω

summary: In this extremely loose adaptation of Melville's classic novel, Ahab is revealed initially not as a bitter and vengeful madman, but as a bit of a lovable scamp. Ashore in New Bedford, he meets and falls for Faith Mapple, daughter of the local minister and beloved of Ahab's brother Derek. Faith herself quickly returns Ahab's love, as Derek is drab and ignoble. On his next voyage, however, Ahab loses a leg to the monstrous white whale Moby-Dick. When upon his return to New Bedford he mistakenly believes Faith wants nothing to do with him because of his disfigurement, Ahab returns to sea with only one goal in mind -- to find and kill the great white whale.
translation:
I suppose that any novel more stupid than Moby Dick would not be much of a favor to the onlookers of depression, who had had enough of their own problems. But any resemblance to the classic Herman Melville novel is a sheer coincidence.

In fact, half of the movie is a prelude to the main story as we know it, not that too much of it was kept for the movie. We first meet Ahab Creely (he has a surname and a brother) as a happy, happy soul with two legs and the intention to marry Joan Bennett, the daughter of Father Mapple. This brother Derek, played by Lloyd Hughes, also wants to marry Bennett.

John Barrymore is Ahab in an exaggerated performance. Barrymore had not quite mastered the sound cinema yet, and he gave up on all the silent film era and a stage voice that shook the rafters of every movie theater in which this movie was played.

We see Ahab lose his leg to the big whale Moby Dick and I have to say the amputation scene was pretty cruel. Of course, that was all before the code. But I'm sure 1930 shook audience.

After that the story of Ahab hunt for the whale he thinks made him look unsightly in Joan Bennett's eyes. This is not exactly Melville's motivation, in fact, there are no female characters in Moby Dick as he wrote it.

One of the things Melville did was personalize the crew of Ahab's ship Pequod. Unlike Queequeg, the cannibal harpooner, the names are there, but not the personalities. Starbuck and Stubbs might as well be Smith and Jones.

I would just watch this version of Moby Dick out of curiosity and nothing else.

summary: Det. Sgt. Mark Dixon always wanted to be something his old man wasn't: a guy on the right side of the law. But for a good guy, he's awfully vicious. After several complaints over his roughing people up, his boss, Insp. Nicholas Foley, demotes him. Foley tells him he's a good man, but needs to get his head on straight and be more like Det. Lt. Thomas, who has just gotten a promotion. Meanwhile, Tommy Scalise has an illegal dice game going and is looking to make a sucker out of the rich Ted Morrison, who was brought in by Ken Paine and his beautiful wife Morgan. She figures out too late her husband is using her as a decoy. Paine strikes her when she refuses to play along. The chivalrous Morrison intervenes but Paine knocks him out cold. That seems to be the worst of it, but later it turns out the guy is dead; and Paine looks guilty. Soon Dixon has fallen in love with Morgan - but not before losing his temper again and committing a terrible deed that he tries to cover up. Morgan's father...
translation:
Elegance and class are not always the first words that come to mind when people (at least people who could do that) sit around and talk about film noir.

But some of the best films of the genre, "From The Past", "The Murderers", "In A Lonely Place", "Night And The City", create a level of elegant sophistication that elevates them a moody chant and their connotations of menacing shadows, fedora and femme-fatales.

"Where the sidewalk ends," a rather hard-to-find film - the only copy in the possibly busy Manhattan video store was a rough bootleg from the AMC cable channel - belongs in a category with these classics.

From the moment the black cloud of the opening credits is over, a curtain runs around the crumbling world of Roger maverick detective Marc Dixon, and as the moments are over, he always approaches closer and threatens suffocation.

Sure, he's the familiar "policeman with a dark past," but Dana Andrews gives Dixon a bleak look and a distressed intensity that makes you seem as uncomfortable as he seems. And yes, he has been clapping too long with suspects, and the newly minted chief (Karl Malden, in a typically robust and challenging outing) warns him "for the last time".

But Dixon hates these clubs too much to stop now. And boy, did not they let it come?

"Hoods, Dusters, Cups, Gutter Nickel Rat," he spits out as a boss's teaser refuses him and clears up all the discomfort the office has gotten over Dixon's right hook. The advice is that he cools down to his best. Instead, he takes things into his own hands.

And what a world of trouble he finds when he relies on his instincts and resorts to a nature that may or may not have been passed on from a generation ago.

Immediately he is in the police, the syndicate, his own partner. Dixon's dubious involvement in a murder "investigation" threatens his work, making him wonder if he is just as much a base as he swears to. Like Bogart in "Lonely Place," can he "escape what he is?"
When he has nowhere else to go, he discovers that he has virtually lost his unexpected relationship with a seraphic beauty (the wonderful Gene Tierney) who looks like she can make something of his barren bachelor life that it does is worth to come home too.

The pace of this great movie is tense and thrilling. The group of authors who contributed to the production has polished the script to a high gloss - the dialogue is snappy, without falling into obsolete parody food, passionate, without becoming melodramatic or cheesy.

And all of this first-rate direction and acting is not too smooth or polished to ease the movie's emotional hold. Gene Tierney's angel, soft focus beauty is used with great effect. She turns out to be an actress of considerable size, and her gentle, friendly nature is as limitless here as her psychosis in Leave Her to Heaven. The scenes between Tierney and Andrews Dixon become more intense and touching as he approaches self-destruction.

Just before the end of his rope, cut, smashed and exhausted, Dixon sums up his fate: "Innocent people can also end up in terrible jams ..." he says. "One wrong move and you're over your head."

Perhaps it's so overwhelming that this movie gives the impression that things could go crazy for just about anyone - especially someone who tries so hard to get it right - with a slight shift in the world Wind a wrong decision or a blow, or, most frightening, due to factors that you have no control over. Noir has always reflected the darkest fears, brought them to the surface. "Where the Sidewalk Ends" makes that realistic.

(A nitpick from one side: This otherwise stereotypical film has a terrificly bad copy of a blonde model that does not seem out of place at the Mystery Science Theater.) How strange.) />
But Noir fans - HACK, ANY movie fans - who has not seen this one here, is for a grandiose reward.

summary: This is the story of a young boy who moves to a small town after the divorce of his parents. At a local festival, he becomes an unlikely hero when he is chosen as the "Kirin Rider," a protector of all things good. And he must lead Japan's ancient Yokai spirits in their apocalyptic war against the evil bizarre-looking monsters.
translation:
The premise of the movie was explained and if you've come this far, you're not pretending that I'm a movie critic. With this statement, my own opinion about the movie is pretty low. I'm a fan of Takashi Miike, but that falls into the category of his not so great work together with DOA 2 and 3 and a few others (many).

The movie seems to be getting free pass because it's a Takashi movie and nothing that can make Takashi wrong. This is a high school approach to the cinema. For the rest of us, we'll find one and a half hours of a kid screaming for no real reason (and yes, that removes the movie), the tempo of the movie almost reaches the level of Rigomortis, and doing ... well ... Hmmm.

If you are a Takashi fan, you will see it, no matter in order to fulfill your interests. It lacks any originality (see the infinite story) or any character development of the main character in the face of a conflict that is not superficial.

It should be noted that this is the first movie attributed to Miike Co-Writing, but that does not mean much that we would not hope that Miike's personality would be overflowing the screen. All we get are some of the token Miike shots against the cameraman.

The movie had the potential to be something great. The premise is not difficult to feral. But he seemed to have run into the ground.

My suggestion is that if you're just going to Miike, you're going through some of the standards like Gozu, Ichi and Audition. Then film in his works like Blue Harp, Fudoh, Rainy Dog, Bird People of China.

summary: Donald Woods is chief editor of the liberal newspaper Daily Dispatch in South Africa. He has written several editorials critical of the views of Steve Biko. But after having met him for the first time, he changes his opinion. They meet several times, and this means that Woods and his family get attention from the security police. When Steve Biko dies in police custody, he writes a book about Biko. The only way to get it published is for Woods himself to illegally escape the country.
translation:
I saw this movie for the first time in 1987 when it was released and was very emotionally affected by a combination of guilt over what my white fellow human beings could do with innocent people and the reluctance of the outside world to really investigate these atrocities against humans Particularly moving was the funeral of Steve Biko, even more livelier and more punchy due to the at the time played South African anthem. For a long time, I believed that this film achieved what no one else has managed to do - to open the eyes of the world to what is really happening in South Africa. I consider myself a normal, right-thinking person and I can confirm that this film has changed my mindset not only about South Africa, but also how we perceive black people as white people. I've never seen a difference between people of any color or creed, but after watching this movie, I've changed my life and spent the last 17 years in a predominantly black country, helping many people to go beyond their current living standards they would not have thought possible. I've received the biggest reward I can honestly say - to say that in my own little way, I've improved my balance a bit. But with more people like me thinking and actually doing something to help black people without seeking rewards, the entire black population of this planet would be a little better off.

I challenge every right-thinking person to watch Cry freedom from beginning to end and feel no emotion in your feelings as you testify how the 700 school children in Sharpville were brutally shot for refusing Learning Afrikaans, the pointless killing of Steve Biko, such a champion for the rights of his own people, and then, ultimately, to understand that all this is not just a movie, albeit a great movie, but that everything actually happens is and less than 30 years ago.

Yes, my friends, watch this movie and then watch if you can go out and party hard. I could not. I was too angry to know the truth. This is the hallmark of a great movie. It was obviously the intention of Sir Richard Attenborough to spread this message about South Africa. Of course he did it. Unless you support apartheid. God help you.

summary: From their stronghold in Icepeak, the evil Queen Juliana (Eileen O'Neill) and her son, Nekron (Stephen Mendel), send forth a wave of glaciers, forcing humanity to retreat south towards the equator. Nekron sends a delegationto King Jarol ( Leo Gordon) in Firekeep to request his surrender, but this is a ruse orchestrated by Queen Juliana for Nekron's sub-humans to kidnap Jarol's bikini-clad daughter, Princess Teegra (Cynthia Leake); Queen Juliana feels that Nekron should take a bride to produce an heir. However, Nekron is incensed and rejects the notion of peace, Teegra and his mother's plan. Later, Teegra makes an escape and comes upon Larn (Randy Norton), a young warrior and the only survivor of a village razed by glaciers, who offers to escort her back to Firekeep. As Teegra is recaptured, Larn teams with the mysterious Darkwolf ( Steve Sandor) to save Teegra and then travel to Icepeak to stop Juliana. Darkwolf faces Nekron and kills him as Icepeak succumbs to lava released by King ...
translation: Good story and excellent animation. The influence of Frazetta and Bakshi is obvious, and that's a good thing. Anyone who likes Conan the Barbarian or the Dungeons and Dragons game should enjoy it. The battle between good and evil is clear, though sometimes it looks like our hero is neutral. In fantasy films, elves are usually depicted with white skin and blond hair, while goblins and orcs have dark skin and hair. Anyone familiar with Frazettas, Bakshi or even Tolkien's work knows that they are not racist. Anyone who likes fantasy movies should like this movie. It is not for young children because of violence and sexual allusions. The casting was well done and the scenes and music are top notch. I hope someone will bring this gem to DVD soon. I am happy to have a VHS copy in good condition.

summary: Biography of the famed motorcycle daredevil, much of which was filmed in his home town of Butte, Montana. The film depicts Knievel reflecting on major events in his life just before a big jump.
translation: I paid a dollar for this DVD and at first I felt ripped off, but then I started to think about it and I should be grateful. I found a holy grail, a real touchstone for bad cinema. If you think the opening dramatic footage of an empty stadium succumbs successfully to Evel's awkward camera-address monologue, wait until the credits roll onto the chauffeur's butt. The script seems to be glued together from press clippings and ESL textbooks. But ... I just can not believe how bad George Hamilton is. He seems to have absolutely nothing to do with anything he says, the only inner monologue I can discover is "I bet they think I'm cute, really sweet!". This is an epiphany! I know now how bad it can be.

summary: Micheal, a former test subject of a project to create supersoldiers, is forced to escape with his comrades after the project was cancelled. Months later, he is trying to have a quiet life as a librarian with a tough cop as his best friend. However, a string of vicious gangland murders begins that has all the markings of his former compatriots who seem to have turned to violent crime. Realizing that the police are helpless to fight these soldiers, Micheal decides to take them on himself. Donning a mask to protect his identity, Micheal must fight these powerful villians as the mysterious superhero known only as Black Mask.
translation: This movie is full of action and gore. The plot is strong enough to support the action sequences. The English version needs some help in the synchronization section, but it was still nice. This film is one of my personal favorites besides "Hard Boiled" ...

summary: 25 years ago two boats raced G√∂ta Canal. It's about time to copy the race with live TV-coverage. Some really wild reality-TV.
translation:
... for one of the worst Swedish films of all time ... forgive me for being bored.

At first I did not see the first (I was bored, that's my reason to see the 2nd before the first one), well, I hope the first one is better than this, it was filled With strange cut scenes and very strange action changes, For the people who have seen that and think that 4/10 is high (believe me, me too), but it made me laugh a few times because it was so bizarre and I'm still laughing and thinking of the punk who had this idea, what's coming next "Det sjunde inseglet II". Sequels that are not based on novels or books often do not go well, and this is a perfect example of one.

OK, I'll be honest with you: I laughed a bit, it has some decent jokes and slapstick humor. But do not buy it, rent it. Let another idiot do it or download it.

4/10 This movie will be remembered and the director is probably already being laughed at ...

summary: Major Lloyd Gruver, a Korean War flying ace reassigned to Japan, staunchly supports the military's opposition to marriages between American troops and Japanese women. But that's before Gruver experiences a love that challenges his own deeply set prejudices... and plunges him into conflict with the U.S. Air Force and Japan's own cultural taboos.
translation: Published in December 1957, Sayonara garnered 8 Oscar nominations and won 4 victories. Red Buttons won the Oscar for Best Supporting Actor in his role as pilot Joe Kelly, who falls in love with a Japanese woman stationed in Kobe during the Korean War. Oscar nominees for Best Actor, Marlon Brando plays Major Lloyd Gruver, a Korean Air flying ace to Japan, who supports the military's opposition to marriages between American troops and Japanese women, and attempts to marry his friend Joe Kelly without success. Ironically, Marlon Brando's character soon finds his love in a woman of Japanese descent. This film highlights the prejudices and cultural differences of this time. Filmed in beautiful colors and with stunning backgrounds, I found this movie just because of these effects very worth seeing. Good movie, give me more ... GimmeClassics

summary: In Mexico, another vampire slayer, Derek Bliss, is hired by a shady priest and aided by a group of fellow slayers in finding a large nest of 'suckers' and their powerful leader, a vampire princess. She is seeking a legendary black crucifix - the same crucifix used unsuccessfully in the first movie to perform a ritual which will enable vampires to walk in sunlight and be invulnerable.
translation:
Thank you for killing the franchise with this turkey, John Carpenter and Tommy Lee Wallace. This movie sucks on so many levels that it's pathetic. The first VAMPIRES was fun, but this low budget retreader makes me yawn. Bon Bon Jovi (poor man's Kevin Bacon) drives a surfboard through Mexico, which houses a hidden compartment where his vampire killing equipment such as Antonio stands Banderas guitar case in DESPERADO. He picks up some lame "hunters" along the way (including a pesky feminist-infected girl who takes pills to avoid turning into a vampire), and they set about stopping a female champion vampire who has no background story less about her or her job (to walk in the sunlight stealing the black cross and performing a ritual to make it possible for her). If you've seen the first vampires, you've already seen that and done a lot better. John Carpenter has been responsible for many bad movies lately. Honestly, I think he has his best years behind him and is unable to make another horror classic. The only decent movie he has shot since THE LIVE (1987) is VAMPIRES. Everything else is complete crap, right down to the incredibly cheap-looking and backward GHOSTS OF MARS ... and now this waste of celluloid. Where are the greats like ASSAULT ON PRECINCT 13, HALLOWEEN (1), NEW YORK LIVE and THE THING?

Carpenter buddy Wallace proves he can not shout his paper out of a paper bag-The script is packed with yawns, groans, and recycled gags from the original. Did I mention that I hated every character in the movie? There was not a single memorable character in the whole movie. How did this happen? This movie has nothing to recommend. Not even the DVD presentation is good; the menu looks terrible.

For comparison: JASON X: "FRIDAY THE 13th IN SPACE" was a masterpiece. So make a sequel, revitalize a franchise, ladies and germs and create an exciting DVD menu.

summary: Mel is a musician in Manhattan, with plenty of one-night stands but no steady companion, except for his goldfish. He decides to move in with his current girlfriend, so he sublets his flat to Ginger, an English biologist new in town. The day he moves out, he flips for the bride at a wedding where he's playing, breaks up with his girlfriend, and moves back into his flat, negotiating with Ginger to her temporary flatmate. Meanwhile, he pursues Diana, the bride, working as the elevator operator in her building while he and Ginger develop a friendship as she does research on his fish. One of her lab frogs and his fish develop an attraction: is this a harbinger of opposites attracting?
translation: I saw this movie last night at the Tribeca Film Festival 2006 and it makes me seriously wonder if the people at the festival actually watch the movies before the selection. The movie was just awful - I say that without exaggeration or ulterior motive - it was awful. Matthew Modine's days as a leading man are over. Gina Gershon had an inexplicable and unnecessary English accent - she should be ashamed of her participation in this film. Gloria Reuben had a strange little cameo in it - she should be ashamed, too. The script was horrible and we had absolutely no reason to worry about the characters. I very much doubt that this will be addressed, but on the other hand, people in Hollywood are known to make mistakes sometimes. I really think "Kettle of Fish" is a serious contender for the worst movie I have ever seen.

summary: --**Contains Spoilers**----Air Force pilot John Sands has been wrongfully imprisoned in a military detention center, where his memory is to be chemically wiped because some of his superiors feel threatened by the knowledge that he gained from his assignments to operations that were deemed too sensitive for the regular intelligence services. Later, after John escapes from the detention center, a top secret Air Force Stealth Bomber known as the X-77, which uses the latest in stealth cloaking technology, making it capable of going anywhere undetected, is stolen by corrupt Air Force pilot Ratcher. General Tom Barnes, John's former commander, hears that John has been arrested after taking down a group of men who were robbing a rest stop. Knowing that John was Ratcher's trainer, Barnes sends John to northern Afghanistan with fellow pilot Rick Jannick to recover the X-77, promising John that he will be a free man if he succeeds. Barnes has Admiral Frank Pendleton, who is on an aircraft ...
translation: You have to give it to Steven Seagal: Whatever his other flaws, he has a good taste in women. If you choose a Seagal movie, chances are that one or more very beautiful women will be there. And usually they do not work as mere eye candy; They are involved in the action and fight, shoot weapons, kill with knives, etc. "Flight of Fury" features duo Ciera Payton (who has a very sexy face, with luscious lips to match Angelina Jolie) and Katie Jones, and finds time to involve her in a catfight AND a little lesbian caressing! And if it seems like I spend a little too much time talking about them, it's because the rest of the movie, while passable, is so little exciting that it's hard to learn more about it Find. Ironically, the weakest aspect is probably Seagal himself, who looks like he can not even bother to pretend to be worried. Being a military action fighter, there is very little combat action, and he does not fit into his role (a stealth fighter pilot, "the best in the world", of course) very well, which could almost explain his insulting sleepwalking , (* 1/2)

summary: Incarcerated and charged with murder, David Aames Jr. is telling the story of how he got to where he is to McCabe, the police psychologist. That story includes: being the 51% shareholder of a major publishing firm, which he inherited from his long deceased parents; the firm's board, appointed by David Aames Sr., being the 49% shareholders who would probably like to see him gone as they see him as being too irresponsible and immature to run the company; his best bro friendship with author, Brian Shelby; his "friends with benefits" relationship with Julie Gianni, who saw their relationship in a slightly different light; his budding romance with Sofia Serrano, who Brian brought to David's party as his own date and who Brian saw as his own possible life mate; and being in an accident which disfigured his face and killed the person who caused the accident. But as the story proceeds, David isn't sure what is real and what is a dream/nightmare as many facets of the story are incompatible to ...
translation:
Note: These comments are for people who have watched the movie.

Vanilla Sky is a brilliant, complex and exciting movie that explores existentially what the headline says: LoveHateDreamsLifeWorkPlayFriends. Perhaps the film plot may be the focus for confused moviegoers when viewed from a different angle.

Considering this:

Now I did not go through the film scene after scene, so I have to further investigate my claims (and I welcome your thoughts), but try Do it and see if the movie does not come on the spot: where exactly does the disputed "splice" happen?

Now I'm not talking about the splice as it's being explained by the LE "Technician," as this sequence itself could be interpreted as a rationalization within David Aames's mind / dream / coma state, but the true connection between reality and dream.

It seems to me that the reality of the car accident is the way it is filmed (no explosion for example), a probable "splice" point, and any particular sequence that one is filmed Existential / dream / coma / non-real feeling - whether shown on screen before or after the crash - is actually part of Aames' personal journey towards self-realization in his own mind.

So there are two questions left (if you know more, just let me know): is Aames really disfigured, and where does he wake up?

If you do not feel completely engulfed in the precise sequence of details plot, or at what particular point his dreams are scattered all over, this movie becomes a fascinating exploration of a person on a journey to himself to find yourself and wha That means in today's pop culture society.

summary: This is a documentary of 'drag nights' among New York's underclass. Queens are interviewed and observed preparing for and competing in many 'balls'. The people, the clothes, and the whole environment are outlandish.
translation: An excellent documentation. Personally, I remember growing up in NYC in the early '80s. This movie is for anyone who was not there during this time. This shows the one thing the Afro-American gay subclass felt only for themselves, and the love and camadry you see is real. People are real and unfortunately, few are still alive as this is written. The balls are still held, but not as they were in the 1980s. This time is over forever. This is a good "Homo Thug" movie. When Queens were really proud to be extroverted. Goodbye to Storyville, this is another era, but all hail film documented!

summary: Tom hears a ghost story on the radio and is spooked by it; Jerry notices this and takes advantage of it, using a variety of tricks to scare Tom.
translation:
Jerry spies on Tom, who hears a scary story on the radio and seizes the opportunity to scare his nemesis.

I did not find this particular episode funny: the humor seemed pretty limited and the whole setup was somehow lame (Jerry is basically the 'bad guy' in this, tormenting poor Tom for no particular reason).

There are occasional flashes of inspiration (like Tom's literal 'heart in mouth' experience, and the moment his nine lives are sucked out of his body), but on the whole this effort lacks that frenetic tempo, the excellent animation and the clever joke of most other cartoons by T & J

summary: Myron Breckinridge is waiting for her sex-change operation while a stoned surgeon stumbles into the operating room. Before the drugged doctor begins Myron's operation, he counsels him. Myron persists and the doctor goes through with it. An enthusiastic audience observing the operation applauds the medical achievement and rises in a standing ovation. After the operation, Myron arrives in Hollywood as Myra while in the rest of the film Myron pops up from time to time as Myra's alter ego. Myra goes to an acting academy owned by her uncle, Buck Loner, a former cowboy star. The real reason for Myra's arrival is to claim her half of Uncle Buck's estate, which she says she's entitled to. Buck Loner stalls by giving her a job teaching the history of motion pictures. Buck Loner has several friends. One of them is Letitia Van Allen, an ancient Hollywood talent scout. The sex-starved septuagenarian runs an acting agency "for leading men only."
translation:
I saw "Myra Breckinridge" when it came out in 1970. At that time, I was a healthy 20-year-old who loved movies and really liked Raquel Welsh. In addition, I had read the novel by Gore Vidal, on which he was based, and found it very funny. I saw the movie on a local drive-in and about halfway I was very tempted to turn on the engine of my car, so I might die from carbon monoxide poisoning and not have to see the rest of this shipwreck of a movie. It was not "smart" or "trendy", it was rude and sloppy. All the actors were flat and the director did not have the slightest idea what he was doing. The casting of Mae West was one of the worst decisions in film history. As a reviewer said, her role had nothing to do with the movie or the book. Her character in the book is sexually beaten by the young stallion, which would never do any good for the legendary Ms. West. Oh no, the plot has changed so that she beats him sexually, believably by a 77-year-old woman who looks every day of her age. I could go on, but why? It was a terrible movie.

Bluto

summary: When 21-year-old Leo, the oldest of four brothers, announces to his rural French family that he's HIV+ family bonds are tested. The family decides that 11-year-old Marcel, the youngest, is too young to understand, and the family agrees to keep the unsettling news from him. Marcel overhears enough to understand that something amiss with Leo and when the two travel to Paris together, Marcel confronts Leo with what he suspects.
translation:
It was very heartwarming. As an expatriate Frenchman, I particularly liked this "TV" film, which, in my opinion, deserves a wider distribution. The spectacle was good, and the bond between every member of this rural French family seemed so strong and so natural. Without a doubt, a great film about the concept of family and inclusion in the face of homosexuality and AIDS. One of the strongest aspects of the film is this privileged relationship between the eldest son (Leo), who suffers from HIV, and the youngest son (Marcel), whom the rest of the family tries to obscure. The two characters

are gradually exploring each other as time passes for Leo, who does not want to spend the rest of his life drugged ...

summary: Magloire Dazincourt, the owner of Bontemps, the largest sugar plantation of the entire South, asks his favorite cousin, Philippe Ferronaire, to marry his daughter Aglae Dazincourt and take over most of its management and family, including his colored mistress Cecile Ste. Marie, for whom he has a cottage build in New Orleans. When Magloire dies, Philippe becomes her lover and the father -not in law- of her son Marcel, named after his own father though, and promises her to get the boy educated in racially egalitarian Paris from age 18. However while still living in the decadent creole society in New Orleans, Marcel Ste. Marie gets in touch trough a colored carpenter with both his white and black roots, both of which bloodlines suffered greatly in the bloody racial civil wars on Haiti, a subject the American society refuses to deal with publicly, and the more people he gets to know or hears their past, the more he gets aware of social and racial matters. Then his father Philippe gets in ...
translation:
I read Rice's novel with interest and was quite enchanted by his characters and heartbreaking narrative based on historical truths.

However, I was THAT appalled at this catastrophic adaptation. The casting was based solely on physical appearance and not on acting talent (with the obvious exception of Peter Gallagher, who was neither blonde nor could work his way out of a wet paper bag). The embarrassingly clumsy and contradictory attempts of the cast to influence a French accent were hilarious, but not in an entertaining way. I realized that I was twitching through these dirty and melodramatic tripe and was surprised that I made it to the end.

A warning to the fans of the novel - stay away from this.

summary: Bruce Nolan, a television reporter in Buffalo, N.Y., is discontented with almost everything in life despite his popularity and the love of his girlfriend Grace . At the end of the worst day of his life, Bruce angrily ridicules and rages against God and God responds. God appears in human form and, endowing Bruce with divine powers, challenges Bruce to take on the big job to see if he can do it any better.
translation: When I read the summary of the movie, what happens when a man gains the power of a god, and later learns that supernatural powers require great responsibility and strength, I thought that was a clever and original concept. Casting was also promising, Carrey, Freeman, Aniston ... How can film be bad with a good idea and good actors, not to mention film costs? It can. The idea is good, but the script and the story itself are awful. To be honest, Bruce Nolan is a rather mediocre journalist, with not exactly great stories (like a story about a giant cookie, what a faux pas, and the Niagara report is a total fiasco!), He's a man with a job he has completely EARTHED (he is not a good journalist, he is a comedian), given his potential, with a nice home, sugar sweet girlfriend and OH HORROR !!!! Dog who is not trained in the house !!! Yes, as soon as Bruce GOd at the beginning of the film in a "God, why do you hate me!" So the average viewer has to think, "Why, what's wrong with your life, Bruce?". Bruce is not, and definitely NOT the man with real problems in life. Most of the difficulties he encounters are minor and not really worth all the fuss he makes, and some of them are really just the result of his stupidity. Most people have really big problems, worth attention, most people are worth more attention, that Bruce, who finally does not seem too human, does not even look realistic, too stupid and neurotic, but God still talks to him. Why? Although Morgan Freeman looks nice as a god, I can not help wondering what he's doing in this particularly bad movie. And what does Bruce do when God gives him his powers? God in this film could easily give his powers to a 5-year-old child and there would be little difference. No, wait, a clever child would probably use his goddess better than Bruce. What is Bruce doing? Pull the moon closer to the earth to create a romantic atmosphere, share the red soup, lift a pretty woman's dress on the street, answer prayers by email and make them all true !!!! Not anymore, Bruce, please! What Bruce did could actually end the world, but in the movie that does not happen, because that's "nice, family, little movie" and makes no sense at all !!! No trace of sarcasm, of real humor, of jokes, of any dirty humor, at least !!! Nothing. Just Carrey plays silly, which looks pathetic to middle-aged actors. Aniston is understated here. She plays a pale, undeveloped character of Bruce's girlfriend Grace and remains completely forgotten in this movie. No one with the right opinion would believe that these two have any chemistry between them. When Grace speaks the prayer for Bruce, it sounds not only lame and pathetic, but completely wrong. These two are not meant to be together. I would give three stars, but I doubt that movie deserves one. Bad script, lame dialogues, lack of real humor, wit and sophistication, as well as undeveloped characters and understated Freeman's and Aniston's roles, total lack of courage and sarcasm, all makes movie barely worth ***. But OK, there were some funny moments, and Freeman is always nice to see in every movie, so we leave three stars.

summary: A series of comedic short films guaranteed to offend.

summary: England, the 19th century. Young Victoria is crowned to be the queen of England. She aims to do her best in order to help her country prosper. However, the family and her trustful advisor, Lord Melbourne, plan marriage for her. She is to get married to a German prince Albert. But Victoria sees her future differently and decides to leave London for a few days. She goes to Paris. On her way to France, she stays incognito in a little tavern in Dover with a baroness. There by chance she meets a handsome man and falls in love head over heels. Later, however, in very strange circumstances, it turns out that the handsome man is prince Albert himself...
translation:
I loved this movie. It was so well done! Great drama and drama and historically correct. I love Romy Schneider films. This one rocks, not as big as Sissi, but still rocks!

And Scorpiolina, she commented and said French dubbing. Well, that's originally a German movie, not French. So yes. Second, there was a plot, maybe the story is unfamiliar to you.
