summary: A Jewish girl in nineteenth century London, dreams of becoming a stage actress.
translation: Boring and terrible act (Summer Pheonix). It sounded more Asian than Jewish. Some of the scenes and costumes looked more mid-20th century than the late 19th century. What on earth did good actors like Ian Holm and Anton Lesser do to me is a mystery to me.

summary: Rural Louisiana, summer of 1957, Elvis is King. At 14, Dani is coming of age. Her older sister is beautiful, smart, and off to Duke in the fall; her mom's pregnant with number four (Dad wants a son), and Dad's pretty strict. Life gets sweeter when 17-year-old Court Foster, his widowed mom, and two little brothers move into the vacant farm next door. Court likes Dani's high spirits and direct way, and though he has a man's responsibilities on the farm, they go off swimming sometimes. The waters of adolescence are deeper than Dani realizes as hers and Court's feelings get jumbled. Then Mother Nature throws wrenching surprises at Dani, and she must come to terms with new emotions.
translation:
Here is the kind of love story I like to see. And mostly it's for two reasons. One, it focuses on young people, very young people. People who are still teenagers and experience love for the first time or at least think that it is them. We've all been there in our lives and "The Man in the Moon" is a great reflection on our memories, which we may add and improve on a few more details than we've ever experienced. The second reason is that it is a love triangle. And I think it's the most dramatic as a teenager. And the story is so well developed that you believe that the characters could really be in love or just so new to love that they just strongly believe that they are and after a tragedy, they will do it for the rest of their lives Believe in life.

The cast of "The Man in the Moon" is full of great talented names. It plays Sam Waterston, who is really a versatile actor well able to play tough district attorneys as well as stern but caring and wise dads like in this movie. There are also Tess Harper, Jason London and a young, young Reese Witherspoon. You look at the young talented actress when she is fourteen and you think she will win the Oscar ten years later. All members of the cast pull off great achievements, and with the dialogue of the rousing script they are made to look like real people in real situations. As if everything had really happened. That's the kind of movie I'd like to see more often. Love story or not. I would love to see movies that make everything look real and are in no way fake or unteachable.

summary: Communication is the key for the survival of nine strangers who have been kidnapped by a masked gunman and told that one of them will die every ten minutes until they discover why they are there. Can they figure it out before they all die?
translation: Unfortunately it was misguided. This movie stank from beginning to end. It was hard to see because I saw Clarissa every day on Nickelodeon. I loved her. Then the next thing I found out, she has a spread in Maxim and she was beautiful! I really did not hear from her until I happened to see this movie. I could not believe that she would even see such a thing by her name. Everything was wrong, but it still looked as if someone in the team was really trying to rescue a sunken ship. Too bad, I hope she keeps acting and I would like to see her in a real movie.

summary: In New York, when the shy and lonely project manager of a design firm Matt Saunders meets Jenny Johnson in the subway, he invites her to date and have dinner with him. Jenny immediately falls in love for him, they have sex and she discloses her true identity to him, telling that she is the powerful superhero G-Girl. After meeting his co-worker and friend Hannah Lewis, the needy Jenny becomes jealous, controlling and manipulative, and Matt follows the advice of his best friend Vaughn Haige and dumps her, breaking her heart. Jenny turns Matt's life into hell, while he has a romance with Hannah. However, the archenemy of G-Girl and former high school sweetheart of Jenny, Professor Bedlam, proposes Matt to lure Jenny to strip her superpowers.
translation: I went to this movie yesterday and although I had no big hopes for this movie, I was still very disappointed! I can not believe that I have seen this movie 96 minutes of my life ... it was so bad !!! The plot was scandalous and the spectacle was terrible (though it had big names like Uma Thurman). This movie has relied heavily on its special effects ... but they did not affect me personally. I really wish I had never seen it and I warn everyone to watch this movie. It is a total waste of money and you will only be disappointed in the end. My advice is to save your money, go shopping, indulge yourself, just do not go and watch this movie ... you'll regret it, lol!

summary: A trio of Neanderthals struggle to live in modern day America.
translation: I wasted my time and gave this show a chance. This must be one of the worst new shows. If they give an award to shows that suck THESE, you should sweep the category. The spectacle is bad and the plot is invented. Now Dinosaurs was a bit strange, but at least it was entertaining. This show lasted three seasons and was finally scratched. This new show, based on commercials from insurance companies, is not funny and really does not help. It may be that the original commercials and the number of times they have been and are still repeated are what's wrong with this show. It just came to the television and we are already tired to see the "caveman".

summary: The continued Westward journey of settlers Missie and Willie Lahaye. Their roots now firmly planted as they set up homestead in the far West, Missie begins to realize her passion for teaching as Willie cares for the couple's young daughter Kathy while expanding the family ranch with a little help from sons Jeff and Matthew. When the frontier railroad comes to town, the pleasure of a long-promised visit from Missie's father Clark is suddenly offset by the tragic death of young Kathy. As the untimely demise of their beloved daughter begins to drive an emotional wedge between Missie and Willie, the devastated father unexpectedly accepts an offer made by the powerful Samuel Doros to assume the role of town sheriff. Their faith shaken and their once close-knit bond suddenly torn asunder, Missie and Willie desperately attempt to bring their crumbling family back together as son Jeff faces a series of dangers while hopelessly falling for Doros' beautiful daughter Colette.
translation: I was really looking forward to this movie. It's a good family movie; However, if the editing team of Michael Landon Jr. cut better, the movie would be much better. Too many scenes out of context. I hope there is another movie from the series, they are all very good. But, if another is done, I ask you to take better care of the editing. This story was everywhere and did not seem to have a center. Which is unfortunate because the other films in the series were great. I enjoy the story of Willie and Missy; They are both great role models. In addition, the romantic side of the audience always enjoys a good love story.

summary: In the year 2047, sex is forbidden and Big Brother uses robots to keep on eye on everyone. One young girl tries to outwit the government so she can be with the man she loves.
translation:
Living in a future fascist or almost fascist state that severely restricts personal liberties is a recurring theme in both modern literature and filmmakers. Such works warn us of undesirable trends in our society that we should be aware of; but to be effective, they also have to be entertaining. Unfortunately, most books are probably more effective in publishing the warnings than entertaining us enough to be read widely; While with the films the problem is usually reversed. The first such work, which became well known, was probably George Orwell's "1984" (first published in 1948), and this is still readily available, both in the form of a book and a film.

Watch or read it: And if you feel a little depressed by man's inhumanity towards humans, grab Cinderella 2000. This is a featherweight, low-budget movie comedy that takes place on the same topic based and effortless but inappropriate viewing offers; and as with 1984, the calendar has now gone beyond its former period. Most of the comedy is done with a trowel, though there are only a few really funny moments. To train your mind in the long intervals in between, you can focus it on the question of whether this film will get a new extension of life by being released as a DVD or forgotten, as existing tape copies will be copied after that Redemption will worsen. There are many worse movies these days that appear as DVD's, and frankly I do not care what happens in both directions.

So far, the best of the films in this genre has been "The Handmaiden's Tale," but I'd love to trade it for a well-made film of Jack London's soaring novel, "The Iron Heel." As ambitious as it may be, it seems unbelievable that no modern filmmaker ever dared (IMDb lists only a silent SW version shot in Russia in 1919).

summary: Meet best friends Michael, Albert, Stanley and Sefa; the ladies' man, the good boy, the weird one and the party boy. They're staring down the barrel of their thirtieth birthdays, but still act as if they're sixteen; they get drunk, they chase the wrong women and they have a remarkable record of misbehaving and causing chaos at every wedding they attend. But now Michael's younger brother Sione is getting married, and everything is about to change. Sione is their boy, the kid they used to look after, who grew up while they were still partying. And to ensure his big day isn't spoiled by his boys and their idiot antics, Sione has issued an ultimatum; the guys all have to bring dates to the wedding. And not just any dates; real girlfriends, someone they've made a commitment to. They have one month. So just how hard can it be to get a date for your best boy's wedding?
translation:
I just sat bored in the cinema, I wanted to leave the movie halfway. The plot is simply 4 Samoan guys wreck weddings. So they have to bring a date to get into the wedding. Yawn.

The thing that annoyed me the most was the so-called gross jokes ... They were very funny, clich√©d and thrown in your face to get you into the already boring movie. The acting was below average and I felt that this movie was just told by a bunch of filthy jokes and a predictable storyline. All in all one of the worst movies I've seen from 2006, unfunny, bad acting, just ugly.

Well, thank god, a friend called me.

Avoid.

summary: Sarah Silverman stars as Sarah Silverman, an unemployed single woman who still behaves like a child. Sarah depends in everything on her sister (played by her real sister Laura). Sarah is petty, self centered, childish, sometimes dumb and always Jewish. Other characters are her two gay neighbors (or gaybors as she calls them) and Laura's boyfriend who is a police officer.
translation:
And when I see Sarah Silverman, I get the same results. I love quirky, irreverent humor. BUT this woman is so damned B-O-R-I-N-G, annoying and yawning. She also lacks whatever is humorous. The hopeless way she tries to deliver her lines is just dead on arrival because she just is not funny. I saw two segments of her program and was ready for Novocaine.

Geez, my kid (19 years old) saw her promos on Comedy Central and said she was a "dumb chick". I thought that was a compliment. The one where she says, "Watch me, or I'll kill my dog," is actually credible. I know she wants to be a comedian. It only occurs as a distorted nut box. I just do not want to see her at MY dog.

summary: When one saucer of an invasion force has engine trouble, it lands on Earth. It happens to be Halloween and it happens the invaders are only about 4 feet tall. As the bumbling aliens wander around the countryside they are taken to be children and they make friends with two children, one of whom is the daughter of the sheriff. As their troubles mount (it's difficult for five aliens to conquer a world) they begin to give up their plans of conquest, but then there is that nasty killer robot.
translation: This movie is for Halloween, which is the hilarious "Christmas story" for Christmas: both are relatively low budget, no big name star movies ... and both are two of the absolutely best and funniest films available, both seasonally CLASSICS !! ! "Spaced Invaders" galloped from the beginning with warmth and humor and a great cast of characters ... all five stupid Martians, Klembecker the broker, Russell the deputy, Vern in the "tank farm" and so much more! All you have to do is watch this movie to believe it and, like "Christmas Story", it gets better and better with every viewing and every time you pick up funny little things !! MOST DEFINITIVE A TES !!!

summary: Kim is suffering from writer's block. A chance encounter with a handsome stranger opens her to a world of risky sexual experimentation. However, she becomes worried when he refuses to say anything about himself.
translation:
I have to admit that from the Eros Movie collection, this must be the one I love the most, as well as the one I've reviewed. History is something that really makes you observe. Many of the EROS films have an action that looks like a hammer would have torn them to pieces before production, if you look at them. It's all about sex, and who can come up with how many different people end the movie? And, oh god, never watch one of those movies when someone pulls a gun. It does not work that it's almost ridiculous, but you do not want to waste the energy on it.

Losing Control is exactly what it's called. The protagonist, the main character (the wonderfully talented and beautiful Kira Reed). Control is the control a person has over their senses, their body, and their emotions. And a man changes everything for her, almost turning her into another woman. But the mirror is destroyed at the same time. That makes a great movie, which I would have liked first !!

10/10

summary: Its All Gone Pete Tong is a comedy following the tragic life of legendary Frankie Wilde. The story takes us through Frankie's life from one of the best DJ's alive, through subsequent battle with a hearing disorder, culminating in his mysterious disappearance from the scene. A genius in his own right, he clawed his way to the top of the DJ ranks, now living the opulent life of a superstar, he resides in his trophy villa in Ibiza with his trophy wife. This is when tragedy hits. Due to a hearing disorder he is rapidly going deaf with only one functioning ear to complete the new Ibiza season. How is he doing behind the decks? Horrible. How is he doing in the studio where he produces his remixes? Frankie dives into a low period, struggling with deafness in utter depression. After a year of locking himself away he emerges on the other side with a fresh attitude towards his affliction. He accepts his deafness and learns to function without sound. Will Frankie make it back to the DJ booth? ...
translation:
The nice thing is at least fresh: Almost no films about dance music and the club scene (if any) come to the movies. And it also radiates a lot of energy, from the music to the presentation of Ibiza.

But the main problem is that it can not decide what it wants to be. Although this is definitely a mockumentar in the line of This is Spinal Tap, the makers have also realized that they do not want to play copycats. However, it roughly fails the jokes because it's not very well written and most of the characters are underdeveloped. And it does not bow in its script and direction to make it 90 minutes, so why not work on 75? The production department and cinematography are still trying to save the day (eg Paul's house).

In a strange way and unexpectedly it's all over Pete Tong works much better than a simple drama in the line of Almost Famous. Especially the scenes with Beatriz Batarda offer a certain theatrical power.

Conclusion: It's a mess, it entertains on a simple level, but you'd better spend a night at your favorite club.

summary: "Redline" is an auto/action thriller that features an extensive exotic car collection. The movie features a Phantom Rolls Royce, Lamborghini Murcielago, Enzo Ferrari, Ferrari F430, Ferrari Scaglietti and two Mercedes SLR McLaren AMGs. A $450,000 Porsche Carrera GT is actually crashed during one sequence. Eddie Griffin accidentally crashed and destroyed the Enzo Ferrari, one of only 400 ever produced. The film follows an ace driver who becomes part of illegal drag racing.
translation: Hollywood is apparently distributing money to someone with a camera and the ability to speak. This movie was stupidly bad. The casting was awful, the acting ineffable and the story full of holes. Script? Who needs script? I was surprised that the movie was not as verbally vulgar as I thought, but I have enough footage of T & A to last a lifetime. The film was like a 19-year-old street racer with ADD (who decided to buy a car instead of going to college) to tell a story. Since I was so poorly prepared, I thought that the two brothers in the movie were lovers first. The scenes on the racetrack, along with the lead actress in the movie, always made me think of Herbie: Fully Loaded. That's the kind of movie Grindhouse was after ... only the writers thought they were serious.

summary: A bump on the head sends Hank Martin, 1912 mechanic, to Arthurian Britain, 528 A.D., where he is befriended by Sir Sagramore le Desirous and gains power by judicious use of technology. He and Alisande, the King's niece, fall in love at first sight, which draws unwelcome attention from her fianc√©e Sir Lancelot; but worse trouble befalls when Hank meddles in the kingdom's politics.
translation:
50 years old, this musical comedy fantasy might look like its age, but it carries it with dignity.

This movie is still great fun. Crosby was never really romantic lead material, but he delivers the material with the slightly humorous touch it needs. Bendix plays wide and fun in an area that uses its strengths. Hardwicke - how glad a knight of the Reich - a real - is to plunge himself with such devotion into such dislocations. And Rhonda Fleming enjoys the least attention in the lead role. Only Murvyn Vye disappoints as an unconvincing Merlin.

Although it's not a musical, the songs are very good, and the "dance" routine that accompanies "Busy Doing Nothing" is perfect - funny, appropriate, skilful, without challenge, and out To make Crosby's musical movement a virtue that, frankly, was amusing because it was never his greatest strength.

The color is good, the sound is a bit muddy in some places br />
And the story - well, it takes some liberties with the original, but I suspect that Mr. Clemens could have been satisfied with the result.

summary: All Barry Singer wants, "is a woman to like him for who he pretends to be," ...or so he says in his act. A stand up comedian toiling in the netherworld of the L.A. comedy scene, Barry's universe is turned upside down when he meets Thea Douglas, a young political activist who is clearly in the "spiritual quest mode." Together, they throw into a comic dance of high intimacy where for the first time in their lives the physical and emotional come together. When their relationship hits the rocks, Thea is swept into the whirlpool of the '92 political season and hits the road with the Jerry Brown presidential campaign. All this leads Barry to one certainty; he has no choice but to take off cross country in pursuit of his "souler opposite."
translation: COME ON!!! They did that intentionally !! Two of my current favorites on TV (Meloni from "Oz" and "L and O-SVU" and Janel from "West Wing") are merging into a nice little sleeper / character study. Plot is nothing special, but acting is just right. Tim Busfield shows up for some clean stuff. Worth a look.

summary: Rayford Steele is an airline pilot whose relationship with his wife has gone sour;he ponders having an affair with an attractive flight attendant, Hattie Durham. In the midst of a flight to London, a number of their passengers mysteriously disappear, and chaos takes hold as a number of vehicles on the ground and in the air are suddenly unmanned. Meanwhile, Buck Williams, a television journalist, is pondering the rash of sudden disappearances as he works on a report about Dr. Chaim Rosenzweig, an Israeli scientist who has devised a formula that would make any soil on earth easy to cultivate. However, Buck wonders if there's more to Rosenzweig than he first imagined when he discovers the doctor is in cahoots with two multi-millionaires who plan to broker the invention to promote their own agenda of international domination.
translation: This movie is one reason why IMDB should allow a 0/10 vote. The acting is terrible, even what some have praised here, the Carpathia figure! The script looks like it's written in a hurry. In one scene, the black preacher left behind when Buck was asked what "dan7" meant in computer graphics said, "Daniel 7, * CHAPTER * 24." He probably meant VERSE 24, but the filmmakers missed this slip-up. Perhaps the worst part is that the film's eschatological position is not biblically correct. While many Christians have advocated the interpretation of end-time events from the film, such an interpretation is flawed in my opinion. To understand these mistakes, read "Christians Become Through the Tribulation" by Jim McKeever and "Blessed Hope, a Biblical Study of the Second Coming and the Rapture" by George E. Ladd.

summary: A documentary on the evidence which shows that the Apollo 11 astronauts never actually landed on the moon.
translation:
This so-called "documentary" tries to tell that USA feigned the moon landing. Year right.

All who have actually studied the case know otherwise.

Above all: there is definitely proof. When the astronauts were on the moon, they returned LOT of pounds of rock from the moon - for geological studies. These spread around the world in hundreds of labs testing them. And they all came to the conclusion that they came from the same planet, not from Earth: because the inner isotopes of the primitives are different from those on Earth, but similar to those calculated on the Moon. I.U. the conspiracy theorists never study anything: they only take what fits their theory and ignore the rest.

Another wrongful claim is that their wind was in the hangar where they shot the moon landing, IE The flag is moving. There is a logical explanation: The astronaut moved it with his hand, so he moved. And what does that prove? Well, if the conspiracy theorists were to study the footage at all, they would see that the flag NEVER moves after the astronaut has allowed it, I.E. the conspiracy theorists are bad scientists, they can not study a subject properly or just study it until they have what they have so that they can lie about it and profit (IE this so-called "documentary")).

There is an assertion that it was not possible to be filmed on the moon because all the shadows come from different places, because there are different sources of light, the artificial lighting from the studio. Once again, the conspiracy theorists are wrong (as always), the same would happen at night in a desert, without light sources. But I doubt that any conspiracy theorists ever kept a star trek convention outside of their grandmothers cellar for more than how many days.

The conspiracy theorists are in denial, big time. They only see what they want to see. They make all these lies out to be important - that's a fact.

summary: Aussie adventurer Steve Irwin aka The Crocodile Hunter has avoided the death-roll and nabbed another feisty croc, hoping to save it from poachers. What Steve doesn't know is that the crocodile has innocently swallowed a top secret US satellite beacon, and the poachers are actually American special agents sent to retrieve it. Crikey! In the Outback and through the bush with his wife Terri's ever-present commentary ringing out over the countryside ("That was a close one, Steve!"), the Crocodile Hunter is out to save the gorgeous croc and relocate him. It won't be easy, but if he can handle bird-eating spiders and venomous snakes without getting bitten, gun-wielding agents shouldn't be too much of a problem.
translation: I would like to have those two hours of my life back. It seemed to be several clips from Steve's Animal Planet series, which were spliced ‚Äã‚Äãinto a loosely constructed script. Do not go, if you have to see it, wait for the video ...

summary: During the War of 1812 against the United Kingdom of Great Britain and Ireland: General Andrew Jackson has only 1,200 men left to defend New Orleans when he learns that a British fleet will arrive with 60 ships and 16,000 men to take the city. In this situation an island near the city becomes strategically important to both parties, but it's inhabited by the last big buccaneer: Jean Lafitte. Although Lafitte never attacks American ships, the governor hates him for selling merchandise without taxes - and is loved by the citizens for the same reason. When the big fight gets nearer, Lafitte is drawn between the fronts. His heart belongs to America, but his people urge him to join the party that's more likely to win.
translation:
I'm afraid it was a movie that you have to ACTUALLY observe to make something out of it. I'm not a mindless movie like ... "LEATHAL WEAPON PART 58" Do you know the one where Riggs is really crazy? It's not a movie that is pretty much the same as the beginning. You can walk everywhere talking on the phone doing whatever and you do not enjoy it in any way. I have found in the past that most people who dislike this kind of movie are the kind who do almost everything, but one Movie and then slam it because ..... you do not understand or understand it or what happened.

DO NOT LET YOUR DOGS SHOW A SHOWER !!!

summary: Once upon a time, there were some people called the Rushers of Din. Each night as they slept, sweet dreams were delivered to them from sunny Frivoli, while nightmares came to them from the mysterious Murkworks. But the malevolent master of the Murk, Synonamess Botch, was not content. He wanted the Rushers to have non-stop nightmares. To do that, he would need to gain control of the Cosmic Clock. To accomplish this, he kidnaps the deliverers of the dreams, Greensleeves and the Figmen of Imagination, and then tricks Ralph, the All-Purpose Animal and his pal Mumford into stealing the mainspring from the Cosmic Clock. Realizing they've been tricked, Ralph and Mumford try to get the spring back and prevent Botch from unleashing his nightmare bombs. Along the way, they get help from their Fairy Godmother, Greensleeves' niece Flora Fauna, the junior varsity superhero Rod Rescueman, and Botch's own head nightmare writer, Scuzzbopper.
translation: One of the most unrealistic great works of animation. Although it uses the "cut-out" method of animation (a la "South Park") in the most sophisticated way, the real characteristics behind "Twice Upon a Time" are the vocal characterizations, with Lorenzo Music (Carlton from TV's "Rhoda") Woody Allen-ish Ralph - the all-purpose animal is the centerpiece. The episode "Accident Nightmare" is undoubtedly one of the best animations ever made.

summary: Emmy Coer, a computer genius, devises a method of communicating with the past by tapping into undying information waves. She manages to reach the world of Ada Lovelace, founder of the idea of a computer language and proponent of the possibilities of the "difference engine." Ada's ideas were stifled and unfulfilled because of the reality of life as a woman in the nineteenth century. Emmy has a plan to defeat death and the past using her own DNA as a communicative agent to the past, bringing Ada to the present. But what are the possible ramifications?
translation:
I was expecting a combination of sci-fi and epochs about Ada Lovelace, Charles Babbage, the history of computers, etc. I was disappointed with this nonsensical pseudoscience and mix of real and fabulous story. It gives the impression that his author (Lynn Hershman-Leeson) has no real understanding of the mathematics, technology, or history that make up the theme of the film, but instead acts from a kind of vague artistic impression of them. This is a sore point for me, since I have long been irritated by the tendency of the arts to irritate and misuse scientific concepts and ideas, eg: Emmy Coer: "Information waves have a half-life", Ada: "I am mine Not at all sure that half a life is better than no life at all. "

This film is worse than failing to entertain - he misinformed. The only redeeming value I can imagine is that it could make a viewer learn something about the subject that is so heavily distorted. It is more likely, I believe, to promote a superstitious perception of science and technology of a degree of progress indistinguishable from magic.

summary: After Siegfried's dead, Kriemhild marries Etzel, the King of the Huns. She gives birth to a child, and invites her brothers for a party. She tries to persuade Etzel and the other Huns, that they kill Hagen, the murderer of Siegfried, but he is protected by her brothers. A fierce battle begins to force her brothers to give Hagen to her.
translation:
I finally have a desire to see this in a movie theater. I saw Fritz Lang's movie on video several years ago. I had hoped that ideal screening conditions would work their magic.

The conditions were ideal in Cinematheque Ontario. Full length pristine print. Intertitles in the original Gothic script German with simultaneous English translation, accurate without being too literal. Live piano accompaniment. Ideal.

The magic of the movie spewed for a while, but in the end I did not manage to catch it.

This film has no real relationship to Wagner's ring cycle, as I already knew, but some did not. Wagner had adapted the 13th century. Niebelungenlied for his own purposes. The first part of Fritz Lang's epic - "Siegfried" - has a lot, but the listeners of Wagner will be familiar.

"Kriemhild's Revenge" is the story of Siegfried's wife Kriemhild, her marriage to King Etzel (Attila) the Huns, and her desire for revenge against Hagen and Gunther, the renamed Nibelung, for the murder of Siegfried , The spectacular conflagration in this film probably developed and expanded in the Wagnerian myth to its G√∂tterd√§mmerung, its G√∂tterd√§mmerung and the end of Walhalla. This movie remains earthbound.

Most of the movie is spectacular. The massive movements compete with those of "Cabiria" (1914), which inspired Griffith's "Intolerance" (1916). Their decoration sets a new standard in barbarian splendor. There is a huge cast of scarred, mangy huns and Art Deco burgundies. And fights. Battles that never really end.

Kriemhild is very successful in her plan of revenge. She manages to destroy everything around her. Her loyalty to her martyr Siegfried seems not so much due to love or devotion, but to something closer to psychosis. Lady Macbeth exclaimed, "Unsex me here." She knew that she was not emotionally prepared for what she had to do. But Kriemhild does not show normal human emotions, and certainly nothing is female. She is already "of the highest cruelty" to use Shakespeare's Theorem from the beginning. Margarethe Sch√∂n and her director convey this with a scowl. I do not want to exaggerate, but this scowl is practically the only expression that "animates" Kriemhild's face. It's the ultimate in one-touch performances. However, it is clearly intended, not just a case of bad behavior.

What we offer then is a one-dimensional sketch of a revenge revenge. Some see Kriemhild as an authorized heroine. I only see the movie as misogynist.

summary: 1865: Swiss captain Bluntschli fights as mercenary in the war between Bulgaria and Serbia. When his group's attacked by a few Bulgarian troopers, he learns that he's got the wrong ammunition for his cannon and has to flee. His flight leads him right into the bedroom of his enemy's fianc√©e.
translation:
The film has the feeling of being a piece right from the start - I think it would be a better game than a movie, because the set and the dramatization make a movie version look too artificial. But it is still pretty well executed, and the story and above all the dialogue are interesting. They pretty much took the dialogue as it is from the actual game. Maybe it's a good introduction to Shaw's pieces.

The main character Raina has her head in the clouds and a sense of drama, and Helena Bonham Carter's acting does a good job here. Her fianc√©, Serges, is a bit too cartoonish if he's supposed to be an extremely good-looking dashing character. Your parents are entertaining enough.

summary: A very weird exploitation flick. The whole film seems to centre round a group of dominating male chauvanists abusing young Japanese models after a photo shoot. After which they are butchered one by one by a mud covered nutter with a gigantic penis who lives in a wharehouse.
translation:
Entrails of a Virgin is so bizarre and incomprehensible that it allows the viewer to interpret it subjectively, exercising every imaginable meaning in its inexplicable excesses of sex and violence. If this were an intentional feature of the film, it would be a work of postmodern brilliance - but of course not.

Without learning too much about the plot, let us take a brief tour of the events. In an out-of-the-way lodge, there is an orgy involving topless wrestling and diaper p *** ing. A load of latecomers joins in the ongoing orgy, but unknowingly they've been followed by a monster that I like to call "the muddy ninja". This monster goes ahead to kill orgy participants one by one, except for the proverbial virgin (if you do not count oral sex), who receives his semen and is thus so passionately crazed that she masturbates with the severed hand.

Finally, she has pulled out her guts, and then there is a scene that seems to mean that she is pregnant with a muddy baby ninja. Do you have it all? If you rent this movie, it is best if you do not speak Japanese and have no subtitles. In a season populated by boring Hollywood movies, this could be the cinematic equivalent of shock therapy in your VCR. It will certainly be something else.

summary: Hard drinking, burnt out ex CIA operative John Creasy has given up on life until he's hired as a bodyguard to protect nine year old Pita Ramos. Bit by bit, Creasy begins to reclaim some of his soul, but when pita is kidnapped, Creasy's fiery rage is finally released and he will stop at nothing to save her as he sets out on a dangerous, revenge fuelled rescue mission.
translation: Revenge is the subject of this Denzel Washington thriller, which offers its share of action, chaos, murder and cruel bloodshed. Most importantly, a bodyguard's mission is to seek out and destroy the mission when his allegation, the young Dakota Fanning, is abducted from school. That's exactly what Washington threatened to prevent. The locations in Mexico City are as chaotic as the plot moves toward its predictable, violent inference. Washington, a former CIA agent with alcohol problems, gets a good reference from a former agent colleague who sets the outline of the plot in motion. Washington and Fanning have great chemistry between them and after a tedious start the bodyguard and his load become best friends. Christopher Walken, Rachel Ticotin, Radha Mitchell, Giancarlo Giannini and Mickey Rourke make up the good cast for the two stars.

summary: Two American tourists on a romantic camping trip are brutally murdered. A few days later, during the ancient festival of Samhain, a group of American university students moves into a beautiful cottage, surrounded by a lush forest and a majestic lake They are here to learn about the rituals of the ancient Druids and other Celtic legends. But in the remains of an abandoned copper mine, lives the ancestors of an incestuous clan of cannibals. Stalked by a hulking, disfigured mutant, the students and their chaperone are in for the most harrowing time of their young lives. And keeping their heads on their necks will become their main concern...
translation: Jenna Jameson is the best actress in this movie and she is just terrible. This movie has played every horror cliche in the imagination and everything bad. The exuberant teen couple. The funny (not) horny jock. The snotty cool chick. The spooky local color type. The parental couple. The virgin chick that never dies in these movies amazingly. The dialogue is so terribly awful and comes with the depth of a wading pool. It's almost as if you wish you all would die sooner. I saw the rough cut of this movie some time ago, but somehow it got worse. Sure, the funniest thing here is the ghoul trying to eat Jameson's implants, but that hardly rates even a dog's rent. Avoid at all costs.

summary: Two families, the Graystones and the Adamas, live together on a peaceful planet known as Caprica, where a startling breakthrough in artificial intelligence brings about unforeseen consequences.
translation:
To all the haters out there: Judging a TV series with an episode is like judging an entire book after reading the first few pages. That being said, I was a big fan of BSG, thinking it was one of the best TV dramas (not just science fiction) in the air. But it was time for the end and the story to continue. I liked the BSG epilogue "The Plan", but he raised so many new questions as he answered, so I was eagerly awaiting "Caprica" ‚Äã‚Äãand I was not disappointed.

I was hoping that it would not try another BSG, and I was glad that "Caprica" ‚Äã‚Äãis something else, and personally, I found the story exciting, in a different way than blazing Space battles, explosions and science fiction special effects (do not get me wrong, I like the stuff too). Eric Stolz and Esai Morales give solid performances, and Alessandra was just wonderful. I can not wait until next week.

summary: Whilst crossing a ledge, 4000 feet above the earth, Gabe's friend's equipment fails to work and she slips out of his hand, falling to the ground. Almost a year later, Gabe is asked to go back to the same mountain range and rescue a group of 'stranded' people. The only catch is that these so called 'stranded' people are in fact looking for three boxes filled with $100,000,000 and they need a mountain ranger to lead them to them!!
translation:
After the success of Die Hard and its sequels, it's no surprise that in the 1990s, a flood of "Die Hard on ....." movies went into the wrong type, the wrong place and the wrong time concept. That's what they've done with Cliffhanger, Die on a mountain just in time to stop Sly 'Stop or my mother will shoot' Stallone's career.

Cliffhanger is a great Nissen picker's dream, especially those who are experts in mountaineering, base jumping, aviation, facial expressions, acting. All in all, it's full of excuses to discard the film as a pompous garbage heap. Stallone even managed to get away from a horse! However, if you forget all the nonsense, it's actually a very lovable and undeniably entertaining romp that delivers so much thrill and unintentional, lots of laughter.

You must love John Lithgows scornful malice, his tick every box of band of villains, and best of all, the permanently harassed and hapless 'turncoat' agent, Rex Linn as Travers.

He might have been Henry in 'Portrait of a Serial Murderer' But Michael Rooker is notable for a disapproving performance as Hal, he insists on constantly yelling in painful disbelief at his kidnappers that this man never met anyone And although he can not be, it really looks like Ralph Waite's Frank grins out of character as the girl falls to his death.

Mention must also be the former "London Burning" actor Craig Fairbrass Yeah, you can not help enjoying that bit, Hal needed a good bluster.

So forget about your better judgment Who cares if 'this could never happen', reduce your acting expectations, turn up the volume and enjoy! And if you're looking for Qaulen, he'll carry the helicopter.

summary: Eva has just gotten married to an older gentleman, but discovers that he is obsessed with order in his life and doesn't have much room for passion. She becomes despondent and leaves him, returning to her father's house. One day while bathing in the lake she meets a young man and they fall in love. The husband has become grief stricken at the loss of his young bride, and fate brings him together with the young lover that has taken Eva from him.
translation:
Eva (Hedy Lamarr) just got married to an older man and on the honeymoon she realizes that her husband does not want her. Her disappointment with marriage and the privations of love make Eva go back to her father's house on a farm and leave her husband. One afternoon, while bathing in a lake, her horse escapes with her clothes and a young worker takes her back and gives her back to Eva. They fall in love and become lovers. Later, her husband misses her and tries to bring Eva home. Eve refuses, and luck leads the trio to the same place and tragically ends the affair. I've just seen "Extase" for the first time, and the first comment I've got relates to the awful quality of the VHS released by the Brazilian distributor Video Network in Brazil: The movie has only 75 minutes to go and it seems so Different rolls of film were used. Some parts are completely damaged and other parts are very damaged. Therefore, the beauty of the images is not achieved by the Brazilian viewer, if he has the chance to find these rare VHS in a rental or for sale. The film is practically a silent movie, the story is very outdated and has only a few lines. As a result, the characters are poorly developed. However, this film is also very daring, with the exposure of Hedy Lamarr beautiful breasts and nude body for today's state of beauty. Another fantastic point is the poetic and metaphorical use of flowers symbolizing the intercourse between Eve and her lover. The way the director shows the scenes to show the needs and deprivations of Eve is very clear. The inconclusive ending is also very unusual for a 1933 film. I liked this movie, but I hope one day I can see an 87-minute restored version. My voice is eight.

Title (Brazil): "xtase" ("Ecstasy")

summary: Grant City, the ardest place on earth. You are Jack Slate, a hard nosed K-9 cop, reports to normal duty call at a construction yard, only to find out that his father has been murdered. He takes the case trying to arrest his father's only enemy, Augie Blatz, then gets framed for murdering him. 7 months late, Jack escapes from prison to find guns and who killed his father. He soon finds out about a gold mining operation headed up by Mayor Pinnacle. After trying to expose the Mayor's plot, the two women on his side betray him and soon are betrayed by their superiors themselves. Jack then discovers that the man who killed his father was the first person who showed up after Jack at the construction site, Dick Hennessy, the head of Grant City Police.
translation: I have read countless posts about this game that are so similar to Max Payne when I first played it, when I thought it was a weird arcade-like game with a desire to rip off the Max Payne style (not only Sphere) time). When I played it for a few hours, I realized how much fun it is! and how different than "Max Payne", yes the ball-time is a bit similar, but I think it's different to the game style. This game is non-stop action - a mix of a shoot'em up and a fight, so much fun, as a big fan of Max Payne I have to say that the story of DTR is not nearly the size of Max Payne, the graphics are a bit average and some of the levels look the same, but if you want a bit more of this "ball time", you should definitely own this game.

summary: Larry Burrows (Jim Belushi) is unhappy and feels powerless over his life. He believes his entire life could have turned out differently had he not missed that shot in a baseball game when was a kid. One night he meets this mysterious man named Mike (Michael Caine), who could change his fate by offering him that alternative life he always dreamed of. But as Burrows embarks on this journey of self discovery he realizes that even this new life has its problems and drawbacks..
translation: It is not a big movie. Acting is not amazing (some subcharterers are even poorly played), the movie is not beautiful in any way. Nothing really innovative or new. If you like big movies, this one is not for you. But it has a big - really big plus in the story. Larry's story works because we know this story from our own lives. The girl we did not ask for a date, the test we missed, the friend we let down, are all in our story. This movie works because it touches him. It's a great story because it's a little story. It is the life we ‚Äã‚Äãall have, with regret that we all have, and yet the message is true: every life we ‚Äã‚Äãcould have lived would have had its drawback. The first time I saw it, I was 15. It was shown in a party at my school. Sixteen years later, I keep thinking about it, and every time I see it, it brings a smile to my face. Look at it. It will do you good. You will be happier with what you have.

summary: A movie that starts out with the "Man in the Mirror" music video, it then changes to a montage of video clips of Michael's career. Next comes a parody of his Bad video by children, and then Michael is chased by fans in a fantasy sequence. 2 more videos are shown, and then a movie in which Michael plays a hero with magical powers. In it he is chased by drug dealer Mr. Big and saves three children. Videos included in the movie are "Smooth Criminal" and "Come Together".
translation: Moonwalker is absolutely incredible !!!!!!! What else can I say? Michael Jackson is the true king of pop, rock and soul !!! Moonwalker has it all! Great story, fantastic music, great visual effects and of course Michael Jackson !!!!!!

summary: In fall 1977, Mikal Gilmore and his older brother Frank Jr. ride through the Salt Lake Valley in a Rolls-Royce driven by ACLU lawyer Richard Giaque. They are on their way to Utah's Draper Prison for a "one-time-only" visit with their notorious brother Gary, a death-row inmate set to be executed in a few days. Convicted a year earlier of the brutal murders of two Mormon men, Gary has been sentenced to death in the wake of the Supreme Court's decision to reinstate capital punishment. Since he stands to become the first American in more than a decade to be executed, Gary has become the subject of enormous national attention, and his request to die stuns his ailing mother Bessie and confuses his brothers. Mikal and Frank hope to meet with Gary, change his mind, and get papers signed that will stay the execution.
translation: Wow, I loved this movie. It may not have the funding and advertising that the latest Hollywood blockbusters get, but it contains twice the emotional punch. The story revolves around this one Utah family, and it's the connections between the people in the family who make their mark on the film. The main character (Giovanni Ribisi) plays his role very well, at no time does he make you believe that he plays all his emotions. It's his brother (Elias Koteas) who stole the show for me. When the two were together in scenes, they separated their lines from each other and gave fantastic performances. Great cast, great movie.

summary: In a suburb of Vienna during some hot summer days: A teacher who is in bondage to a sleazy pimp, a very importunate hitchhiker, a private detective on the run for some car vandals, a couple with a serious marriage problem and an old man, whose wife died long before on the search for some sexual entertainment live their lives while their lifelines cross from time to time.
translation: "Hundstage" is Seidl's first feature film (previously he has staged large documentaries as "animal love" or "role models"). Seidl worked on this project for more than 3 years, but it only cost about $ 2 million. the actors are very good, especially the non-professional actors, who almost played themselves. The cinematography is good, too. The whole movie is shockingly disturbing and some scenes may be too much for "normal" viewers. The film shows a lot of sex and violence, but also that people are lonely and can not communicate with each other. finally, I have to say that this is one of the best and most profitable Austrian films of recent years. please excuse my bad English.

summary: In the funeral of the famous British journalist Joe Strombel, his colleagues and friends recall how obstinate he was while seeking for a scoop. Meanwhile the deceased Joe discloses the identity of the tarot card serial killer of London. He cheats the Reaper and appears to the American student of journalism Sondra Pransky, who is on the stage in the middle of a magic show of the magician Sidney Waterman in London, and tells her that the murderer is the aristocrat Peter Lyman. Sondra drags Sid in her investigation, seeking for evidences that Peter is the killer. However, she falls in love with him and questions if Joe Strombel is right in his scoop.
translation:
They're not lamenting journalists Cary Grant and Rosalind Russell of "His Girl Friday" or witty detective William Powell and cheeky lady Myrna Loy of Thin Man, but Woody Allen and Scarlett Johansson are surprisingly charming as amateur snoopers in Scoop. Her republican screwball is postmodern rather than post-post-depressive, Allen's writings full of ironic self-irony and ordinary New York anxiety. Shades of the old joke are rare, as if he answers as Sid, the great Splendini magician, about his background: "I was born into the Hebrew belief, but when I got older, I converted to narcissism." Johansson, fresh from Allen's Match Point as a bad girl, is here a relatively good, sometimes thick journalism student, trapped in a murder mystery suitable for London: a serial killer. The storyline is a reworking of his recently released thriller Match Point in London, right up to the sins of the upper class and the accident with the "American Tragedy" / "Place in the Sun" boating. In fact, Allen is reviewing Manhattan Murder Mystery and Purple Rose of Cairo, to name just a few other examples. I do not care if he reworks; I would like the new material to be at least equal to the originals, and unfortunately it only reflects its younger size.

Allen as a director and actor can not hide his love for the actress, as he could not for Diane Keaton, and therefore takes a mediocre comedy to an appropriate location in the Allen canon, not big but amusing , sometimes brilliantly satirical: About the alleged upper-class murderer Sid (Allen) jokes "I would be very surprised if he had killed a person." This is Vintage Allen humor. Although there are hardly any literary allusions, as in most films, he smears Scoop with music by Grieg, Tchaikovsky and Strauss to tell us that the Woodman has not lost his class.

summary: Dr. Lorenz, a mad scientist, wants to keep his elderly wife young. He does this by kidnapping young females and extracting fluid from them. He then injects this fluid into his wife.
translation:
Now I love Bela Lugosi, do not get me wrong, he's one of the most interesting people ever to make a movie, but he certainly made his share of clunkers. That's just another one of those.

Lugosi plays Dr. Lorenz, a doctor who has inexplicably received his medical license. He does experiments, however, to keep his wife young and beautiful. It is known that she is 70-80 years old, but Lugosi seems to be in him in his mid 50s, so why he is married to this old woman is never really explained. Anyway, these treatments or experiments involved brides who are at the altar marrying some sort of sweet-smelling substance, but they pass out suspect that they are dead. Then Lugosi and some of his assistants steal the body on the way to the morgue and take it back to his lab, where it is kept in a kind of interrupted animation or catatonic state. Then a needle is rammed into the stolen brides Somewhere in their bodies, maybe the neck, and then the needle is rammed into the body of Lugosis's wife to bring her back to youth and beauty. We never really see where Lugosi's the needle sticks or what he pulls out of the brides, but it somehow restores his wife. Obviously, age makes you scream with pain because Lugosi's wife makes a lot of screaming until she returns to her younger state. Helping Lugosi in his lab is the only good thing about this film ... a weird old witch and her two deformed sons ... a son is a big lumpy-looking slow-acting guy who wants to caress the slumbering brides and the other son is a mean little dwarf ... little human to be politically correct in today's world. At night, these three just pile up and sleep in Lugosis monotony down in the lab. Who these 3 are and how they became Lugo's frightened assistants, as much in this film, is never explained.

This is how a reporter is hired by her rogue editor to find out where all the stolen brides go to The only common ground among all the stolen brides is a rare orchid found on them. So she asks and learns that there is a world famous orchid expert who lives nearby and happens to be the one who developed this particular orchid. This expert turns out to be a scary Dr. Lorenz. She pursues him quickly and disturbs his little horror house. I'm not sure where the police were, but they came in to mop up after the reporter did everything Dirty work.

It seems that Lugose's films always had some kind of unnecessary silly storyline that stinked the whole thing to a high sky. I mean, a world-famous orchid expert kidnaps brides by sending them a drug it is known that he himself has developed orchid? D'OH!

And then it is revealed later that the young women do not even have to be brides to work, so why should Lugosi continue to kidnap brides from heavily guarded churches for his experiments and create all the attention and headlines? Why not just pick a prostitute off the street like a normal spinner would? This clunker reminded me a lot of another Lugosi stinker, "The Devil Bat" .... the same silly storylines and bad acting and same silly 'reporter gets bad guy' deal.

But Lugosi is always good - he's scary and scary enough to keep you at least so interested that you continue to persecute him. The woman who plays the reporter was just a horrible actor ... she had no emotions at all, she just delivered her lines like a machine gun and spit it out as fast as she could. Everyone else blew pretty well when it came to being good actors.

But this thing can be seen, if only for Bela Lugosi fans. Lugosi was always so intense, even if the picture was a dog. He must have known that he made horrible pictures, but maybe he also knew that if he gave it all, he seemed a bit of that intensity through all the bad actions and bad spectacles that surrounded him.

And he was right - we horror fans will always have a love for Bela Lugosi. He did his best He was in front of the camera. We'll give you two harassments, Bela.

summary: Det. Supt. Peter Boyd (played by Trevor Eve) is the leader of a multi-discipline police team of detectives and scientists, the Cold Case Squad, which investigates old, unsolved murder cases using modern methods and new technology that may not have been available during the original investigation.
translation: I feel like I've just watched a snuff movie ... a beautifully played, tight, captivating and horrible thing! A two-hour litany of perversion in the most basic and inclusive sense of the word, sexual violence and torture, rape, beheading, incest, corruption, burial and abuse, abuse, abuse. No salvation at all. And I was entertained. I could not stop looking. What does that say about me, about the people who do and do such things, and about a world that has become so desensitized that, in the end, real snippets become the norm. And I'm neither puritanical nor humorless, I'm not trying to hide from the existence of darkness, and I definitely have not lived a sheltered life, but I'm ashamed. And I am sorry to see my British cousins ‚Äã‚Äãpulling the sewers as my own tribe does. It does not have to be comfortable, but does it have to wallow in vicarious sadism?

summary: Based loosely on the poem by Rudyard Kipling, this takes place in British India during the Thuggee uprising. Three fun loving sergeants are doing fine until one of them wants to get married and leave the service. The other two trick him into a final mission where they end up confronting the entire cult by themselves as the British Army is entering a trap. This is of the "War is fun" school of movie making. It has the flavour of watching Notre Dame play an inferior high school team.
translation: This, and not a slightly overblown Southern Soap Opera, was the biggest epic of Hollywood's greatest year, 1939. I'm not going to repeat the obvious - Cary Grant, Victor McLaglen (who was a Bengali Lancer) and Douglas Fairbanks Jr. are doing excellent comic performances. However, I want to notice two other, less understood elements of this masterpiece. The great last fight sequence, as the wonderful Sam Jaffe laboriously climbs to the top of the temple to blow his horn and warn the regiment, is just great. It always fails to inspire me. Another underrated element in the film is Eduardo Ciannelli's appearance as a guru. This is not a caricature of Fu Manchu, but a well-drawn, articulated, historically informed one ("Have you ever heard of Changruputra Maurya? He defeated the armies left behind by Alexander the Great in India"). In fact, one can see parallels between this mystical, evil nationalist and a certain well-known figure of the thirties (A German, not an Indian). Gunga Din, anti-Nazi tract? Not quite. But still, a huge, funny, moving epic.

summary: Upon his return from Vietnam, an ex-soldier finds his neighborhood has deteriorated badly, and is being terrorized by a vicious street gang. He calls some of his GI buddies, and together they hatch a plan to get rid of the gang.
translation:
Becky Harris plays the female shopper, whose misfortune is to be in business at the wrong time, and obviously ONLY the purpose of being in this movie is to give a reason to wear out remote controls! Miss Harris seems to be in her fifties or older when she first appears. Once the redheaded bat is done with her, it becomes clear that this is not an AARP queen. If this is not one of the best things ever shown on celluloid, I want someone to guide me. Absolutely breathtaking in my opinion, and I have literally worn out my VHS copy to capture her charms. I would like to know if this movie is available on DVD.

The rest of this movie is really not worth mentioning. I was hoping to see something pretty convincing and intelligent, but I was disappointed on both counts. God bless Becky Harris!

summary: A German-born engineer, his American wife and their children travel from Mexico to the United States to visit her family but their plans are complicated by a Romanian count.
translation:
It may be interesting (or not) that the only reason I ever saw this movie was that I wanted to see the performance of the man Humphrey Bogart in his CASABLANCA (10/10 role for Best Actor Oscar (I would have still given Bogie the Oscar, but Paul Lukas did a great job and at least deserved the nomination.) Well, I'm glad I checked this movie because I really enjoyed it, I think the movie preached a bit, but not only did I mind, I enjoyed the speeches and was never bored with them.

The acting was outstanding in this film, especially Paul Lukas, Lucile Watson (rightly nominated for an Academy Award), Bette Davis (wrongly not nominated), George Coulouris, and, strangely, Eric Roberts, who plays the middle kid, I really enjoyed his character: a funny-looking boy, d he somehow talks about philosophers. He just makes me angry. Even the name of the character (Bodo) is funny.

The endin g, in which Luke's character was forced to do something he thought was wrong, even though he was doing it for the right reasons, worked for me as well. I agreed why he felt he needed to do that, and I understood why he could not quite explain it. The message this movie makes is good and noble, the scenery (meaning the house) is beautiful and the acting is the excellent. Watch this movie if you ever have a chance.

9/10

summary: Serial killer is genetically mutated in car wreck on the way to his execution. After which, he becomes a murdering snowman hell-bent on revenge for the sheriff who caught him.
translation: Michael Keaton's children's comedy of the same name from 1998 was condemned for their, er, shabby special effects all around, but compared to what Screaming Mad George brought together for this horror comedy, they are absolutely stunning. The killer snowman seems to be made of styrofoam and his arms look like oversized oven mitts. What they were probably. The cast lays in this parody on dozens of other (much worse) movies thick and Paul Keith as the city doctor is particularly memorable in a small but funny role.

summary: In 2210, mankind has explored the space and found a vampiric menace, declaring war against different breeds of vampires some of them inclusive human flesh cannibals. The V-SAN (aka Vampire Sanitation) spaceship leaded by Captain Churchill receives a distress call from an Earth base and his team formed by the vampire Quintana, the rookie officer Damian and the rebels Rosa and Roman seek survivors and vampires and they rescue the scientist Fiona, but Capt. Churchill is captured by the vampires. After their next assignment, the provisional captain Damian and his group disclose that a traitor has disengaged the defense system of the bases and they chase their prime suspect.
translation: Man, I have to say, when I saw the trailer, I was excited. Futuristic soldiers who are guided on nasty ass vampires by veterinarian Michael Ironside .... In outer space. I mean, I did not expect high art, but it looked like a potential B movie classic. This was undoubtedly a television pilot who became a feature film some time later, after he was not picked up. Okay, I start with a few good points with the movies, the action was competent for a lower budget movie, and the CGI and the locations used were passable. Now on evil, first Michael Ironside was barley in it, and his performance here .... well, it was cheesy, not in a good way. But as I said, he was not there anyway, so I can not blame him. One thing that was really stupid was the PETA-type group for vampires, no, I'm not kidding, it's the stupidest unbelievable thing I've seen in time, and it's being taken seriously. Also this film commits one of the big B-movie sins, he teases a lesbian scene and does not deliver. Especially what sank this movie, nothing really happens. Since it should be a pilot, the script is almost nonexistent and has no regular ending. Even the main villains do not come in until the end. If ever a movie is needed to increase the sleaze and gore factor, it's Vampire Wars. Finally, I will say the main crew on the spaceship, were all very capable actors and could leave that mess behind and move on to bigger and better things. They just had nothing to do with it.

summary: Archie Grey Owl is a trapper in Canada in the early 1930s when a young Iroquois woman from town asks him to teach her Indian ways. They live in the woods, where she is appalled at how trapped animals die. She adopts two orphaned beaver kits and helps Archie see his way to stop trapping. Instead, he works as a guide, a naturalist writer, and then the Canadian government hires him to save the beaver in a conserve by Lake Ajawaan in Prince Albert National Park. He writes a biography, which brings him attention in Canada and invitations to lecture in England. Before he leaves, he and Anahareo (Pony) marry. In England, his secret is revealed. Will Anahareo continue to love him?
translation:
Okay, I admit that the casting in the movie is really weird - part of it is because of the storyline, but I still had a bit of a problem believing that Pierce Brosnan plays the lead role (though he really does a pretty good job has made).

It is based on a true story of an Englishman who moved to the Canadian Indians in the early 20th century. He claimed to be a half-breed from India. He was indeed so successful and thought well that people came from all over to hear his lectures and be taken along in his wilderness - although he was not a half-breed and all his knowledge came from books or counterfeits! The movie focuses on these and what happened when the fraud was exposed. The acting and the attitudes were great and I really liked the movie (after hanging up unbelief about Brosnan). It was not widely circulated - probably because it was quite cerebral - not a Bond movie or a romance - just a really strange movie about a remarkable man.

summary: Freelance reporter Jennifer and her two friends, Karen and Vicki, accept an invitation for cheap room and board in a large farmhouse offered by a friendly, but shady, museum owner named Ernest Keller since all the motels in and around town are booked for a holiday parade fair Jennifer is covering. But unknown to the women, some unseen "thing" has been living in the basement of the house for over 20 years and is looked after by Keller and his shy sister Virginia, in which the "thing" soon gets out and begins harassing and killing the women one by one in various violent, but seemingly accidental, means.
translation: It is true that Danny Steinmann's "The Unseen" is a simple horror thriller with a very predictable storyline, no special attempts at twists or surprises, and literally every single clich√© the genre has produced over the decades, but that does not necessarily make it is a bad movie. On the contrary, my friends and I were pleasantly surprised by this obscure, yet intense, 80s shock feature, which mainly benefits from a handful of brutal images and a downright brilliant casting. Beautiful and ambitious reporter Jennifer Fast and two of her equally attractive friends are traveling to a small Californian town to shoot a documentary about the Jubilee Festival, but their hotel has forgotten to register their booking. In search of a place to stay, the trio meets the overly friendly, but suspicious museum curator Ernest Keller, who invites the girls to his remote country house. Little by little the girls find that Keller and his extremely introverted and submissive sister Victoria hide a dark and murderous secret in their house. "The Unseen" can easily be described as a cheap and ultimately perverse fusion of the horror classics "Psycho" and "The Texas Chainsaw Massacre". The storyline is a series of familiar subjects infamous and endlessly imitated by these two films, such as twisted family secrets in the basement, voyeurism, crazy inbreeding killers and a very unappetising treatment of chickens. However, I do not consider that a negative comment, as "The Unseen" is a totally unpretentious and slightly disturbing thriller that clearly never wanted to be the decade's biggest horror classic. Although the resolution of the plot is rather clear pretty quickly, director Steinmann tries to keep the secret by keeping the evil gift in the house "unseen", as the title promises. The casting decisions and theatrical performances are really what lift this sleeper above the level of mediocre. Sydney Lassick, immortalized since his role as over-anxious psychiatric patient Charley Cheswick in "One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest" is truly the ideal choice for the role of Ernest Keller. His persistent friendliness and almost perverse appearance are exactly what the character needed. Even Stephen Furst, who eventually turns from the invisible to the seen, gives away as a "Junior" a tremendous achievement. He looks and behaves like an authentic, disabled man and his attempts to get close to Jennifer in the basement are really unnerving. "The Unseen" is a slow and predictable, yet potent movie from the early '80s, which fans of 70s exploitation and generally weird stuff will certainly like.

summary: The Mind's Eye is a compilation of experimental computer animations from when such technology was in its early infancy. The animations are from various studios, having been arranged in a sort of "2001" evolution-timeline theme, and set to synthesized music. These pioneering CGI projects later gave rise to films such as Toy Story, A Bug's Life, Antz, and Shrek.
translation: I probably did not see this movie until about 1995. Since then I have always come back to it. It is great! I especially like the first and second clips, "Creation" and "Civilization Rising". Impressive! That was so cool in the glory days of CG animation. CG is much older than me, because I know that the movie "Tron" was written 7 years before my time. But this film was a milestone in the early 90s. It was probably the first collaboration of various CG experiments that were translated into music. I like it so much, I think I'll take a look at it now. bye

summary: A German-born engineer, his American wife and their children travel from Mexico to the United States to visit her family but their plans are complicated by a Romanian count.
translation:
An American woman, her European husband, and her children return with Paul Lukas (who, I believe, reprises his stage role here) in "Watch on the Rhine," a 1943 film based on Lillian Hellman's play Bette, back to her mother's home Davis, Lucile Watson, George Coulouris, Geraldine Fitzgerald and Donald Woods. An anti-fascist, a worker of the underground movement, injured many times and wanted by the Nazis, Kurt Muller (Lukas) needs a long vacation on the estate of his wealthy mother-in-law. But he finds out that there is really no escape, as one of the house guests (Coulouris) is suspicious of his true identity and more than willing to sell it.

In this film, there are great performances, written a lot to bring forth Lillian Hellman's liberal position. It was certainly a powerful propaganda vehicle at the time of its publication, when the evils of war and what happened to people in other countries came to safe American homes. The big controversy of the film today is that Paul Lukas won an Oscar on Humphrey Bogart in "Casablanca". Humphrey Bogart was a wonderful screen presence and a fabulous Rick, but Luke is transcendent like Kurt. The monologue he has to kill about the need is heartbreaking, just to mention a scene.

Although this is not what you would call a Bette Davis movie, here's a masterful introduction to Kurt's faithful and affectionate wife, Sara. Her acting tugs at heart, and the love scenes between Kurt and Sara are beautiful and tender.

The last half hour of the movie has hit me in tears with the honesty of feeling. Lillian Hellman is not for everyone, but unlike "The Little Foxes," she has written some really likable, wonderful characters and a good story given by Warner Brothers A casting and production values. Highly recommended.

summary: Two sailors, one naive, the other experienced in the ways of the world, on liberty in Los Angeles, is the setting for this movie musical.

A classic Hollywood music from a bygone era.

summary: Bohemian Alex Morrison has just finished directing his first feature length movie. In its previews, the movie is considered a critical, artistic and surefire commercial success. As such, Alex seemingly has his choice of what his next project will be. Alex has a few thoughts in his mind, such as a biopic of Lenny Bruce, or a movie about a black uprising in Los Angeles. As he makes the rounds both in the Hollywood community and European movie centers for ideas, he fantasizes about movie scenarios of those everyday situations he is in. These fantasies are influenced by his movie idols, some who he meets such as Italian director Federico Fellini and French actress Jeanne Moreau. summary: Two families, the Graystones and the Adamas, live together on a peaceful planet known as Caprica, where a startling breakthrough in artificial intelligence brings about unforeseen consequences.
translation:
I have to admit, I was one of the skeptics who prematurely judged this show before relatively little information was disseminated about it. I realized that it would be a cheap spin-off led by Ronald D. Moore, who wields the recon staff.

I was wrong!

The pilot leaves an excellent impression on the spectators. The accessibility is wonderful! Of course, experienced BSG veterans will delve into the plot, which focuses on the development of the Cylons before the First War. (58 years before the events of the BSG pilot). The pilot also allows newcomers to clearly present their storyline and ideas in the first part of the episode.

Do not be wrong: "Caprica" ‚Äã‚Äãis not BSG. We are confronted with an immersive, cerebral drama that is interspersed with provocative, courageous and controversial ideas.

The casting complies with the BSG standards; Stoltz and Morales are just amazing. Morales 'portrayal of Joseph Adama, inspired by Olmos' portrayal of William, gives a wonderful insight into William's heroic father. Stoltz's account of Dr. Ing. Graystone provokes much thought and questions.

If the quality of the pilot is an indication of what's to come, RDM and the creative team will continue BSG's Legacy as the first-rate television program with another masterfully crafted TV masterpiece.

summary: "Redline" is an auto/action thriller that features an extensive exotic car collection. including, but not limited to, "all right, see what these guys can do".
