summary: In the mid-22nd century, the Earth ship Enterprise is launched under the command of Captain Jonathan Archer. When the crew rescues an alien from a crashed spaceship, Earth gets its first look at the alien's race - the Klingons. Archer and his crew must walk a fine line as they attempt to communicate with the Klingon pilot, whose language is completely unknown, and whose homeworld wants him back. Is this the beginning of friendship...or interstellar war?
translation:
Despite a decent first season, this series has never come close to its potential. As a forerunner of the original Star Trek series, it was almost doomed to failure by an executive producer, Rick Berman, who was forced to limit the definition of what a Star Trek series might be and restrict this futuristic show becomes increasingly anachronistic from a dramatic point of view). The actual show-runner, Brannon Braga, did not help with his uninspired and tired repetition of earlier Trek episodes and careless disregard for the franchise's internal mythology (it was painfully clear from an early age that he was only there for the paycheck). I have never seen a series that has done such a long service to a talented actor (except Jolene Blaylock) for so long. It's as if this entire series was produced in a bubble that exists outside of the contemporary television landscape, where audiences (even a Trekker audience) are more demanding and demanding in their dramatic desires and yearnings. Unfortunately, it seems Berman and Braga have managed to convince Paramount's superiors that "Enterprise" has suffered "franchise fatigue" and that the core audience has not run away but been expelled. Produce a range of quality products that meet the high ideals and standards of its predecessors and get them (the audience).

Put simply, in a TeeVee universe where we have shows like "Battlestar: Galactica" and "The Shield" the powerful have to give the public a "Star Trek" that is measurable and dramatic is competitive. It's so easy and simple.

summary: Ronny Bowers, a saxophonist in Benny Goodman's band has won a talent contest an got a ten week contract with a film studio. On his first evening he is supposed to go with the studio's star Mona Marshall to a movie premiere. But this lady doesn't want to go, so the bosses decide to use for Mona a double, Virginia. When Mona finds out next morning that happened, she insisted to fire her double and Ronny. Ronny finds work as singing waiter in a drive in, and is spotted by a director of the same studio, who wants him to lend his voice for an leading actor in a musical. After the first screening the actor is invited by Louella Parsons to sing in her program "Hollywood Hotel". He accepts, but he doesn't know that Ronny Bowers does not want to lend him his voice again. So everybody starts to play his little game to solve his own problems.
translation:
When we talk about the Hollywood Hotel, we could talk about one of three things, the actual hotel, the radio program, and this movie, which was partly inspired by the first two. Dick Powell hosted the Hollywood Hotel Program on CBS Radio Network, in which Louella Parsons distributed the weekly ball on the stars.

Powell and Parsons debuted the Hollywood Hotel Program in 1934, so by 1937 had its fair share of the radio audience. Powell hosted, sang and chatted with Louella and her movie star guests. With the power she had with her column, she was able to get the various stars to clog their latest movies for nothing.

Then the American Federation of Radio Artists came in and demanded that she pay wages accordingly and they won the case. This ended the program of the Hollywood Hotel in 1938. Of course Powell and Louella also went to other radio stations. The whole story is covered in the Tony Thomas book The Films Of Dick Powell.

But before the plug was pulled, this movie came from Powell's Warner Brothers home studio, inspired by the radio program. Powell plays a singer / saxophonist with the band Benny Goodman, which signs a contract in Hollywood. But when he comes to Hollywood, he gets into a selfish movie star named Lola Lane, her doppelganger Rosemary Lane and a ham actor in Alan Mowbray.

When Mowbray is asked to sing in a Civil War epic he makes with Lola Lane, it is Powell's voice that they use. Then Mowbray develops a Lina Lamont problem when asked to go to the Hollywood hotel radio program broadcast by the Hollywood Hotel. This has the studio in a dizzy state. Suppose the problem is not resolved, as it is in Singing In The Rain, but Powell's manager Ted Healy proves to be resourceful.

Richard Whiting and Johnny Mercer deliver really good music for the movie. The big hit comes right at the beginning when the band of Benny Goodman sings the Hollywood anthem Houray for Hollywood with Scat Johnnie Davis. My favorite is Powell and Rosemary Lane sing, I'm like a fish out of the water. Listening to Johnny Mercer's texts about Ginger Rogers with the Brooklyn Dodgers or Sally Rand without her fan, it's a compendium of American pop culture in the 1930s.

Busby Berkeley does the choreography here and while the movie is not I do not have the imposing imaginary stuff that has his previous work with Warner Brothers, the numbers are well staged. Berkeley's big moment is in a drive-in pub where Powell and Healy had to take jobs. The number starts with Benny Goodman broadcasting from the Hollywood Hotel Let's Do a Lesson to You and then on Drive-in Powell, Lane and the entire place begin to join Song to the despair of owner Edgar Kennedy. And you know what to expect from Edgar Kennedy's despair.

Benny Goodman shows why he was named King Of Swing when the band with drummer Gene Krupa and xylophone player Lionel Hampton was part of his ensemble. Sing along with Frances Langford. And maybe the last surviving cast member of the group was a guy who had a little bit as a radio announcer. He died in 2004, but not before he became the 40th President of the United States. Ronald Reagan always wrote Dick Powell and Pat O'Brien as the two guys on Warner Brothers who were most helpful to an eager young player.

Hollywood Hotel is a delightful and entertaining movie, outdated but charming.

summary: When a well-known gangster is killed in a small town, the local newspaper editor must decide whether the story is important enough to his readers to put it on the front page.
translation:
An MGM MINIATUR short topic. The editor of Cole County Clarion needs to decide what the KEY NEWS are for his readers: an imminent chill that could mean a disaster for their harvest, or the sensational launch of a notorious gangster on their small town high street.

This is a gratifying little One-Reeler, with a good performance of Comic Charles 'Chic' Sale. Today's viewers may be more interested in the appearance of James Stewart as nephew / assistant of Sale. Speaking slowly & a little stupid, Stewart shows many of the attributes that would make him a big star in no time.

Often overlooked or neglected today, the one- and two-roll short topics make sense The studios as an important training ground for new or budding talents, both in front of and behind the camera. The dynamics with which a successful short theme was created differ fundamentally from those of a full-length film, as if writing a top short story rather than a novel. They were both economical in terms of budget and schedule and able to show a wide range of material. Short topics were the perfect complement to the feature films of the studios.

summary: A desperate, childless couple kidnap a pregnant woman and lead her husband to believe that she is dead.
translation:
I am glad that some people liked it, but I hated this movie. It had a very good idea for a storyline, but it ended there. It was badly written, badly played and badly done.

It had some interesting plot points, but they were just skipped too fast, the authors had to realize what they should keep and expand these parts, as if they were lying, kidnapped, and throwing away the slag , Instead, it was "what's up?", 5 seconds later they tell you.

This film had no tension and I was bored from start to finish. I just wanted it to end.

Go and hire misery, or your best plans, if you want excitement or twists that will keep you guessing to the end.

summary: Two Spanish pan-handlers soon find themselves in over their heads when they stumble upon an opportunity to redeem themselves and perhaps the entire planet. The world appears to suffer from rampant poverty, violence and spiritual desperation and the relentless news media force-feeds these images to the Spanish people. A popular reality television show lets the audience decide between life or death for suspected felons, and one of the opportunistic pan-handlers attempts to escape poverty through this raucous and sensational TV program.
translation:
Salva and his friend Bigardo spent most of their lives on the edge of the law. We see them in a car of the subway, where their pitch to get donations is so boring, nobody gives them anything! Salva, who is a hardened petty criminal, does not even have redeeming qualities until he discovers a reality show on television that gives him the idea of ‚Äã‚Äãwhat to do next. Religion and show business prove to be a winning combination that benefits Salva.

He and Bigardo were imprisoned after the accidental death of a priest who had criticized the duo. Salva shows that he is a natural for the reality show. He transforms himself into a Christ-like figure, which is an instant success in the program. Espe, who is a no-nonsense woman who is the producer of the show, can not escape the way Salva pays her unusual attention. After all, Salva is the victim of his own success.

Jordi Molla, whose first directorial work is this film, has had some success in the way the film satirises the role of television. Spain, which was prone to this type of program, has seen its share of the bizarre, which the director felt as an attack on the audience, and wanted to make his story from the point of view of the people making a fortune out of the na√Øve public.

The cast has some good moments in the movie. Mr. Molla, like any actor who decides to shoot his first game, would have been more effective at focusing on the image in front of the camera. Candela Pena, a good actress, is one of the best reasons to watch the movie. Juan Carlos Villedo, David Gimenez Cacho, Franco Francescoantonio, Florinda Chico and the others responded well to the new director.

summary: Angela Baker has undergone years of therapy, electro-shock and sexual reassignment surgeries, and finally landed herself a job in the last place she should be working - camp rolling hills. She has an old fashioned approach as to how camp should be, and an old familiar deadly way of making sure that those who don't follow her rules don't get to come back next summer.
translation:
So Angela grew up and got therapy and surgery to turn her into a real daughter rather than the son she was born into, and now she has a job - wait - as a camp counselor! How fitting, right? I know, I love it. However, the first sequel to the Sleepaway Camp franchise follows all the rules of the horror sequel - more blood, more imaginative killings (which are not resourceful, but still more than the original), more nudity, a more polished plot, and generally worse than the original ,

It's entertaining, as is the original, where the characters and wardrobes are so stupid and authentic that you can not help but get a good laugh. At some point, a guy asks Angela, and she says, "I'll call you," and then walks away quickly. The guy says to himself, "How will she call me? I do not have a phone!" and then he sniffs his armpits and wonders what she's got off (it's the hair, old man !!).

It is a known fact that in the 1980s the murdered teenagers were more likely than not punished by their killer for some kind of bad behavior, usually for being too promiscuous. It was not clear to me when I started making horror films and seeing the thirteenth movie for the first time in the mid-90s. I learned it in a movie class a year or two later and was amazed that it was a method of madness. I was quite impressed, not only that the films conveyed some kind of message, albeit a morbid one, but that in fact something was being thought about.

But not in this movie! Just before Angela kills one of her victims, she says, "Let that be a lesson to you, say no to drugs!" Real subtle screen font, guys. On the other hand, the dialogue is the most entertaining in the film. Angela (who, by the way, went through all this therapy and these surgeries and all the trouble to clean up her past and reinvent herself as a normal and well-developed person, then changed her name from Angela to, um, Angela), says at one point "I do not like being the evil witch of the West, but I know what happens when things get out of hand." (People start getting killed ... by me! HA!)

Later, she asks that one of the counselors, Mare, make an excuse, to which the girl replies, "I would rather to die!" I'm sorry, Mare, but you've really come across this one ...

Two years ago, I was a camp counselor in a camp similar to the one in this movie (except in the camp where I taught) had more than three kids among the 15 or 20 guidebooks and it also had rules that were not in the movie). This made me realize the myriad discrepancies in the movie about how camp life really is.

That's alright, you can barely make such a movie with so many 9 year olds, even though 10 or 11 year old kids were killed in this movie. I had never seen anything like it before.

Definitely bad taste, even for a cheesy 80s Slasher movie ....

summary: F.B.I. agent Frank LaCrosse returns home to find his home has been broken into, his son is missing and Missy the babysitter is lying in a pool of her own insides. Her murder being the hallmarks of a elusive enigmatic serial killer whose slaughter spree...stretches nearly two years. Frank's desperate pursuit leads to Amarillo, Texas, where two more victims matching the killers M.O. have been found slashed to death. As Frank searches for his suspect the local Sheriff Buck Olmstead and his Deputy Nate Booker investigate the killings in-between a heated election feud, with his competition police chief Jack McGinnis. All the while drifting former doctor Lane Dixon is picked up by ex-railroad man, Bob Goodall. As a local Mechanic, Clyde 'Shorty' Callahan becomes the latest victim. Frank hopes and prays to find this sociopath before he disappears perhaps forever into the rocky mountains
translation: For me, this movie just seemed to fall on his face. The main problem for me was the cast of Glover as a serial killer. I do not know if it's from the casting or just from his behavior, but I doubt Glover would ever be a convincing villain. He's a good guy, and that's always obvious in his performances. Apart from that, the movie is your serial killer story. Nothing very innovative.

summary: Mason, who lives on the streets, wants to cease his life when on the same day his two best friends die: His dog and an older man with whom he shared his food and roof. Just in time Cole, from a charity organization, can prevent his suicide and also offers him a quite well paid job as servant for a hunting party in the Rocky Mountains. Mason accepts the job and flies with them to a hut in the wilderness where they prepare everything for the four rich businessmen who want to hunt something special. Mason does not yet know that he is the victim of their sports that should lead to the basic insticts of man, but they did not count with his cleverness...
translation:
This movie could have been so much better with a script rewrite. Not that I expect much plausibility in movies, but one might think that even the homeless and urban dweller Jack Mason wondered why a group of seasoned hunters wanted to hire him as a hunting guide. And on reaching the hunting ground, the poor Ice-T plays his part, as if he were actually leading these men through forests he has never seen before.

And how does Jack Mason find Thomas Burns in Seattle again? ?

I assume this movie is based on Richard Connell's short story "The Most Dangerous Game". A few years ago I showed this movie to a class of 9th grade students after they read the story. I rewrote the movie and cut out all the pointless scenes and all the obscenities. It was 43 minutes long.

summary: Needing extra cash, two brothers conspire to pull off the perfect, victimless crime. No guns, no violence, no problem. But when an accomplice ignores the rules and crosses the line, his actions trigger a series of events in which no one is left unscathed.
translation: Director Sidney Lumet has created some masterpieces, such as Network, Dog Day Afternoon or Serpico. But he was not too lucky with his latest work. Gloria (1999) was pathetic and Find Me Guilty was an interesting but failed experiment. Now Lumet brings his best movie in decades and, in my opinion, a true masterpiece: before the devil knows you're dead. I think this movie is like a rebirth for Lumet. This movie has an excellent story that is deep, has many layers. Also, I think the end of the movie is perfect. The services are brilliant. Philip Seymour Hoffman does a great job, as usual, and he is undoubtedly one of the best actors of our time. Etha Hawke is also an excellent actor, but he is underestimated from my point of view. His performance here is great. The rest of the cast is also excellent (especially the great Albert Finney), but these two actors bring monumental achievements, unfortunately by the. were ignored pathetic Oscars. The film has a good intensity, partly tha Thanks to the brilliant script, the band is an absolute masterpiece with perfect directing, great script and excellent performances. We need more films like this.

summary: A relentless New York City police detective, named Ken Marjorino, arrives in the town of Bedford, New York, to investigate the murder of a mysterious person at a 20th high school reunion. Through Marjorino's interviews with the suspects, the stories takes us back 20 years starting in 1986 where six close friends graduated from high school. They include good-natured and ambitious, blue-collared Will Malloy; wealthy and snobbish, white-collared Craig Brewster; overachieving but direction less Aaron Lewis; Craig's girlfriend Samantha Carlton who dreams of becoming a doctor; Samantha's best friend Carla Noll a struggling photographer; and the hip Jenna Moretti who's obsessed with becoming a world-famous actress. With each flashback we learn more about Will, Craig, Aaron, Samantha, Carla and Jenna over their various directions they take with their lives. With each passing year that we observe, it brings up more questions. Of the six, which one was murdered? Which one committed the crime ...
translation:
I'm not usually on a particular show (except The OC & Desperate Housewives ... hey, I'm 20!), But, kidding, after an episode of Reunion I was addicted.


That said, watching TV does not always make Emmy worth having fun. I do not expect R√©union to take home any prizes, but I expect it will grab my full attention. Did you see the first episodes of a beloved show years later? Sometimes you wonder how you ever got addicted. The character buildup takes some time.

The one episode for each year is wonderful in my opinion. The only other show I can remember doing something like this is 24, every episode is an hour ... and an eventful year is more realistic than an eventful day! Please give this show a chance. Relax about art form ... it's just TV!

summary: Hard rock idol Sammi Curr burns to death in a hotel fire. His biggest fan, Lakeridge High School student and resident metal head Eddie Weinbauer is devastated by the news and turns to local radio DJ "Nuke" for emotional support. After a heated discussion about the deceased rock star, Nuke presents Eddie with a rare demo record, the last ever recorded by Sammi and the only copy in existence. Overwhelmed by Nuke's generosity, Eddie accepts the gift without hesitation, unaware of it's dark role in things to come. After constant humiliation and a near drowning at the hands of school bully Tim Hainy and his sports jock friends, Eddie becomes enraged and vows revenge on all those who have wronged him, much to the dismay of love interest, Leslie and best friend, Roger. Alone in his room with feelings of rage and retribution racing through his mind, Eddie places the new record onto his stereo and is shocked to discover that he can communicate with the deceased rock star when it is rotated ...
translation:
This is a great, ridiculous horror movie that reflects the essence of mid-to-late 80's obsession with how evil metal music was supposed to be. I remember being freaked out by metal teenagers as a teenager. It does not help that at the age of ten I found a grave in my hometown cemetery. It turned out that this strange Metal kid had dug up some old bodies and used their bones in a strange sacrifice for Satan. Maybe things have put me off metal for a while, but I love it now as a 24-year-old.

I bought this DVD for 6 bucks and I expected it to suck because of the lame shell But to my surprise it reigned. It's about the extreme demonic power of the metal. And you have to love a scene where a guitar shoots Lazer and headbanger evaporates in the crowd. This movie is great, if you love 80s metal and bad movies, this one is for you. 9/10!

summary: Victor is growing up on the Lower East Side and is at the age where he is driven by desire and unchained by maturity. His image as a ladies man is shattered when he is found in Fat Donna's bedroom. Soon, as a result of his sister's big mouth, the whole Dominican community knows. Full of confidence, Victor sets out to reclaim his image by winning Judy. Judy proves to be elusive and difficult. Victor persists, and with a surprising tenderness, ultimately wins Judy's heart.
translation:
Real movie fans will love this authentic movie.

I do not agree with the trolls who call this movie a one-star movie and call it unrealistic. Although I do not have the background or background of the protagonists, I have worked for many years in lower-income and working-class areas and feel that acting is very real and representative of how teenagers behave. I do not know what the basis for the comments of others is that the film is "unrealistic". The dialogue is great.

The low budget production value did not bother me. I felt that the natural lighting improved the character of the film. The focus was solely on the story and the character development and not glitzy Hollywood support or melodrama.

I have completely taken over the motivation and reactions of the character. The drama was credible and impressive for new and non-actors.

If your idea of ‚Äã‚Äãa good movie is Transformers or Fast & Furious, skip it. If you enjoy good character dramas, then you see it.

(Concerning the negative commentators "Trolls": Click on their names and you will see, most of them have no other reviews or just negative reviews.)

summary: An anthology of overlapping vignettes exploring the lives of a variety of characters who happen to live in a suburbial shantytown atop a rubbish dump: The boy Roku-chan lives in a fantasy world in which he is a tram conductor. In his fantasy world, he is both the tram and the tram driver and follows a set route and schedule through the dump, reciting the refrain "Dodeska-den", "clickety-clack", mimicking the sound of his vehicle. Ryotaro, a hairbrush maker by trade, is saddled with supporting many children whom his unfaithful wife Misao[c] has conceived in different adulterous affairs, but is wholeheartedly devoted to them. A pair of drunken day laborers (Masuda and Kawaguchi) who engage in wife-swapping, only to return to their own wives the next day as though nothing has happened. A stoic, bleak man named Hei is frequented by Ocho who appears to be his ex-wife, and he watches emotionless as she takes care of his domestic chores. Shima, the man with the tic, is always defending his ...
translation: Another demonstration of Kurosawa's genius, his first color film, is a dark surreal look into the tragic life of the slum dwellers in Tokyo, essentially a series of intertwined vignettes that depict several groups of people entering a harsh and unfeeling post-war slum town lead a dangerous life. Swinging from comedy to tragedy and back, this film shows how people in their own way deal with the worst kind of life, mostly retreating to themselves and living in the fantasy worlds of their own minds, emotionally withdrawing from their fellow human beings or themselves drown in alcohol. Realistic and mixing with kabuki-like theatricality, Kurosawa skillfully plays with the emotions of his audience and draws tears and laughter with equal fluency. A wonderful, draining experience.

summary: 12 genetically enhanced childern escape from a military base that created them. 10 years later, after The Pulse, a magnetic bomb that destroyed every computer in USA, has struck, Max Guevara, one of the 12 escapees, is a bike messenger in (what's left of) Seattle and with cyberjournalist, Logan Cale, she tries to rid the world of crime and corruption, avoid her creators and uncover her past.
translation: I'm just wondering why damn FOX canceled season3 even though season2 was not as good as season1, which is really great !!! I like it so much that I even think about buying dvd on Amazon (failed !: (I'm a Chinese student and it's inconvenient for me to get an international credit card and $), I just hope FOX can DA somehow return somehow!

summary: The story of Jane Eyre, the plain quakerish governess is told from her childhood until she arrives at Thornfield Hall to tutor the young Adele. She finds herself intrigued by and attracted to Thornfield's owner, the dark, sardonic (natch) Mr. Rochester. But a dread secret resides in Thornfield Hall.
translation: Jane Eyre has always been my favorite novel! When I came across this movie version in the late 90s, I was thrilled! This is the best and most complete version of the book on film! This version is sitting a little long in a session, but it's worth it. Timothy Dalton is amazing like Rochester. I was glad that they cast a normal-looking actress (Zelah Clark) as Jane and not a glamorous person. I love the sets and the place. For anyone who is a true Jane Eyre fan, this is the version to watch !!! For those of you who are interested, I have just found this version on DVD. I almost broke my VHS copy, so I was thrilled to find it on DVD.

summary: Britain's second animated feature, which, despite the title and Disney-esque animal animation, is in fact a no-holds-barred adaptation of George Orwell's classic satire on Stalinism, with the animals taking over their farm by means of a revolutionary coup, but then discovering that although all animals are supposed to be equal, some are more equal than others...
translation: First of all, I have to say that I loved the book Animal Farm. I read it in my ninth grade and it was great. We also decided that it would be good to watch the movie. The movie was so disappointing for me. The film cuts out some characters and misses many of the main points of the book. It jumps around a lot and does not explain anything in detail. If anyone had seen this film without first reading the book, they would be confused. The most disappointing thing about this film for me was the end. The end in the book was the most powerful and in the movie they changed it! It was meant to be pigs and men in an alliance and somehow "melted together," but instead, the film made it look like the animals were rebelling against the pigs. In summary, I do not believe that this film captured the true meaning of Orwell in his book.

summary: Two cuban friends play in a blues band in La Habana. When a spanish music producer offers them a contract to record an album and to build a career in Europe, they will have to decide between stay in their birthplace with their loved ones or grab the chance of leaving Cuba.
translation: I do not know ... maybe because I'm Brazilian, but all that stuff was too much. Too much love for the music, too many parties, too much contrast between the nice life of the leading actor (come on, it is not so sad) and the aspect of the city that the director shows. For me everything looks too phony: the families, the relationships, the music, the "happiness". It just sells a little taste of a wrong Latin American culture. To be honest, it seduced me a little, but who would not be seduced by those wrong lives that consist of good music, sex and parties? I'm not so stupid: What kind of world is this where people do not suffer from diarrhea, deep sadness and sexually transmitted diseases? I liked the scene with Caridad's mother phone call and the discussion about the contract with all the musicians and the Spaniards.

summary: Aussie adventurer Steve Irwin aka The Crocodile Hunter has avoided the death-roll and nabbed another feisty croc, hoping to save it from poachers. What Steve doesn't know is that the crocodile has innocently swallowed a top secret US satellite beacon, and the poachers are actually American special agents sent to retrieve it. Crikey! In the Outback and through the bush with his wife Terri's ever-present commentary ringing out over the countryside ("That was a close one, Steve!"), the Crocodile Hunter is out to save the gorgeous croc and relocate him. It won't be easy, but if he can handle bird-eating spiders and venomous snakes without getting bitten, gun-wielding agents shouldn't be too much of a problem.
translation:
So, Steve Irwin. One must admire a man who is not only ready to rush into a river that is obviously filled with crocodiles, snakes, lizards, tons of feces from the above reptiles and mud, not just daily but with enthusiasm. He never made ME want to do it, but he managed to get closer to his wife.

This film does not fall into my parallel universe of film category - the films for people who have just had their teeth drilled, have migraines, or have no movie experience and therefore like quiet mediocrity (currently good at Disney movies populated). It's too loud. Well, Steve is too loud. He's just always so happy and would go right through the blase teen (I can hear it now, "that movie was so dumb") or the Tylenol with codeine. I would say his enthusiasm starts, but if it did I would have a room full of snakes and that has not happened yet. I agree that these are beauties, but I still will not stroke them.

The story was indeed predictable. Bad people were so bad, for a minute I thought I would go shopping in an electronic hypermarket. But the movie was full of animals, and Steve and Terri, which is why I saw it. This plot (if you could call it that) was more like a reason to throw a crocodile into a truck. My expectations were low and stayed that way.

I had hoped that there would be a sequel where Steve and Terri (having worked on their acting skills) made a film with a real plot and more animals with fur. I still can not believe we will not see Steve again. I hope that Terri and the kids continue to be involved in the Australia Zoo and the Discovery Channel. I can not imagine seeing a crocodile without a member of the Irwin family telling me how wonderful this crocodile is. Crikey!

summary: At an annual pace, a huge colony of ants is forced to collect every piece of food that grows on their island for a group of menacing grasshoppers. But that all changes when a misfit inventor ant named Flik accidentally knocks over the offering pile thus forcing the grasshoppers' devious leader Hopper to force the ants to redo their gathering of food. Despite the fact that his friends don't believe him and desperate to help save the colony, Flik volunteers to go out into the world and search for a group of 'warrior' bugs. Instead, what he got was a talented group of circus performers. But when the grasshoppers return and take control of the island, Flik must prove himself a true hero before it's too late.
translation:
"A Bug's Life" is like a popular candy bar - it's full of big little bits that add up to something really delicious.

The story could not have been better; it is clever, has "heart" (emotion) and every character has a nice "bow" (a growth or a change). By comparison, the only characters in "Toy Story" who have a "bow" are Buzz, who loves learning to be a toy, and Woody, who overcomes his grudge against Buzz. There are lots of laughs and sweet moments in "A Bug's Life". All the actors make a great voice, and the animation, both the movement and the detail, is outstanding.

This serious movie fan does not easily throw "10's, but this movie is sure to deserve the" 10 "I gave it.

summary: Rayford Steele is an airline pilot whose relationship with his wife has gone sour;he ponders having an affair with an attractive flight attendant, Hattie Durham. In the midst of a flight to London, a number of their passengers mysteriously disappear, and chaos takes hold as a number of vehicles on the ground and in the air are suddenly unmanned. Meanwhile, Buck Williams, a television journalist, is pondering the rash of sudden disappearances as he works on a report about Dr. Chaim Rosenzweig, an Israeli scientist who has devised a formula that would make any soil on earth easy to cultivate. However, Buck wonders if there's more to Rosenzweig than he first imagined when he discovers the doctor is in cahoots with two multi-millionaires who plan to broker the invention to promote their own agenda of international domination.
translation: This movie, which was released directly on video, should carry a warning that it is dangerous to human health and may expose the viewer to terminal boredom. There is yet another veiled, evangelizing "Rapture" forum in which the good (the believers) suddenly disappear and the wicked (the unbelievers) are left behind. It's an interesting concept, especially since we see it on a flight led by a non-believer who has a sinful affair with a stewardess on board (of course, the sinner does not disappear!). Unfortunately, the plane did not crash because all the pilots were infidels, or the movie was graciously over. Although this may be interesting without the severe religious harassment, the sluggish movie as a whole makes a gag, acting is terrible and the obviously computer-generated simulations are very fake. Also, it's another movie in Canada allegedly called New York City. Spare me ... I'm just reading the bible.

summary: A night out on the town turns into a nightmare as six young college students find themselves hunted by a killer.
translation:
OK, a Slasher movie. a very, very stupid Slasher movie.

We have your stereotypical teen in a house thing. We have an FBI agent who once saw Dirty Harry too many times. "So, what's the secret .... punks?" We have about 4 different small camera shots and scenes that make no sense. "Hey man, I fix the sprinklers" ((this guy was my favorite part of the movie)) Suddenly there's a preacher tied up on a couch watching home videos, he's killed.

Follow the killer in the middle of nowhere, without the police. Suddenly she is in a church wearing a wedding dress. I swear, this is the dumbest Slasher movie I've ever seen.

summary: Rural Louisiana, summer of 1957, Elvis is King. At 14, Dani is coming of age. Her older sister is beautiful, smart, and off to Duke in the fall; her mom's pregnant with number four (Dad wants a son), and Dad's pretty strict. Life gets sweeter when 17-year-old Court Foster, his widowed mom, and two little brothers move into the vacant farm next door. Court likes Dani's high spirits and direct way, and though he has a man's responsibilities on the farm, they go off swimming sometimes. The waters of adolescence are deeper than Dani realizes as hers and Court's feelings get jumbled. Then Mother Nature throws wrenching surprises at Dani, and she must come to terms with new emotions.
translation:
A young man named Court is loved by all. His painful bloody death brings everyone closer. You can find other symbols and allusions throughout the movie. Whether predictable or not, and independent of ecclesiastical convictions, this is a moving story full of milieus and sensuality.

Another thing, someone mentioned that his fate was so fast that it did not seem plausible. But the elements are subtle. Note what his mother says when he brings his lunch to the field. Notice how he holds the steering wheel and his gloves. He is sweaty and operates dangerous equipment. To date, tractors are pretty dangerous.

summary: Lewis an orphan wants to see what his mother looked like. So he invents a machine that looks through your brain so you can see your memories. But this weird kid says he's from the future and warns him about a guy in a bowler hat. The bowler hat guy messes with his invention and it fails. He decides that he's a failure and no one wants him. But the kid that warned him about the guy is here on a mission to find the bowler hat guy that wants to destroy Lewis. To prove he's from the future he takes Lewis to the future. But the time machine breaks and he's stuck in the future until he fixes it. In the meantime he spends quality time with the family. But the bowler hat guy is about to alter time and it's up to Lewis to save the future.
translation: This film began with an allusion to an action and was then abandoned for an endless series of random characters and encounters that have nothing to do with advancing the story. It was impossible to deal with this movie. This movie is a very cynical pile of garbage made by some people with animation skills, but totally devoid of creativity or storytelling ability. It's a frighteningly bad performance coming from a big studio. Of course, there are maladies in terms of morality and motivation at Disney, not to mention a complete lack of supervision and quality control. This management has allowed this film to see the light of day and speaks volumes about its incompetence and desperation. This movie complements my very short list of "worst movies ever".

summary: Eric Forman is a typical high school student growing up in Wisconsin in 1976 with his family and his friends. Together, they have the same kind of joys and sorrows that just about every teenager has while growing up. This show parodied many of the attitudes, events and fads of the 70s, along with those who grew up at the time.
translation: I can not believe we do not have this 70's show anymore. I have all 8 seasons of this 70's show !! I absolutely love it !! I lie in bed every night and watch several episodes before I go to sleep. At the end of a long, busy day, it's nice to sit back and laugh before going to bed. I was so sad that they took the show off the air ... at least we still have the reps !! I hope and pray that they will come back with at least one reunion ... For example, when Donna graduates from college and we finally see her and Eric marries !!!! Would not that be great !!! It would be even better if they would continue for several years !!

summary: Alan Johnson has everything he needs to get through life: a good job, a beautiful and loving wife, and their wonderful children. Yet he feels isolated because he finds having a hard-working job and managing a family too much to handle and has no one to talk to about it. Charlie Fineman, on the other hand, doesn't have a job or a family. He used to have both until a terrible loss, and the grief caused him to quit his job and isolate himself from everyone around him. As it turns out, Alan and Charlie were roommates in college, and a chance encounter one night rekindles the friendship they shared. But when Charlie's problems become too much to deal with, Alan is determined to help Charlie come out of his emotional abyss.
translation:
Greetings from the darkness. How rare is it for a movie to examine the lost soul of people with pain. Adam Sandler plays the lead role as Charlie, who lost his family in the 9/11 tragedy and has since lost his career, his livelihood and his sanity. Don Cheadle is co-starred by Sandler's former dentistry roommate, who apparently has the perfect life (which Sandler apparently had before 9/11).

Of course, the parallels in these men's lives are obvious, but it's really refreshing to see men's feelings in a movie ... feelings that are different than lust and revenge. Watching them help each other out just by being there is painful and heartfelt. Screenwriter and director Mike Binder ("The Head of Anger" and Sandler's accountant in this film) brings the film a different look and feel. Some of the scenes do not work as well as others, but overall it's well written and solid.

Sandler and Cheadle are both excellent. Sandler's character is a bit reminiscent of his good performance in "Punch Drunk Love," but here he brings much more depth. Cheadle is always alright and does a nice job of expressing the burden he carries ... just by watching him work a puzzle.

Support work is by Jada Pinkett Smith (as Cheadle's wife), Liv Tyler (as a very patient psychiatrist), Saffron Burrows (in a strangely appealing role), Donald Sutherland as Irritated Judge, and Melinda Dillon and Robert Klein as Sandler's in-laws.

The film really touches on how the tragic events of the day hit a person so deeply that it is basically ruined. In addition to the interesting story and some great shots of NYC, you have to love every movie that plays with voices from Chrissy Hynde, Bruce Springsteen, and Roger Daltrey ... as well as Eddie Vedder, who imitates Daltrey. Not just a hipper upbeat movie, but it's a quality movie with an unusual story.

summary: A young couple have twins, but unfortunately one of the babies, Jesse, has Down's syndrome. After realizing that she has difficulties coping, the mother, Tammy, decides to place Jesse with a family that has taken in several similar children. Jesse's grandparents object, believing that he will be better off living with his real family. As Tammy's mother starts fighting for custody over the child, she reawakens old hostilities between herself and her daughter, and the entire family is affected.
translation: Although I disagree with Bob and Tammy's decision to give birth to Baby Jesse, and it's something I would never do, they tried to do what was best for the baby. As this film is written, you see yourself trapped in history and ask yourself what you truly believe, from all different aspects. Patty Duke? Opponent? As far as I know, almost unheard of. But during the movie, she really convinces you that she is psychotic, or at least that something is seriously wrong with her. Her character is the meaning of "emotionally disturbed". The movie seems to end quickly and does not leave things unresolved. But otherwise this movie is really great. It really makes you think. It's not a movie you can see when you just want to sit back and relax and see something sweet that makes you laugh. But it's a good movie to see when you challenge your own beliefs, see things from the perspective of others, and discover something about yourself. Caution: You can even grow while watching this movie! And in the end it's all worth it.

summary: Two couples and their single friend, all at different stages in their relationships, deal with the complications of dating, commitment and marriage.
translation:
I missed almost the entire first season, but when the other shows were repeated, I started to look. In the end, I bought the entire first season of iTunes. This is one of my favorite comedy shows right now. Patrick Warburton is the key. His dry sense of humor makes me roll all the time. David Spade is funny, but sometimes a little Russell goes a long way. I like the other actors more (but I'm not saying that he does not contribute to the show).

Do yourself a favor. If you have not checked this, try it. If you watch the episode where "Jeff" goes to the sperm bank, you'll see how good this show is.

I hope this series has a long run.

summary: When a body is found in the New Orleans docks, it's pretty obvious that he died from gun shot wounds. The police surgeon notices that the man is also displaying other symptoms and Lt. Commander Clint Reed, a doctor with the U.S. Public Health Service, diagnoses a highly contagious disease, pneumonic plague. He tries to convince local officials to find everyone who may have been in contact with the dead man. The Mayor supports his efforts but many, including the police, are doubtful. Reed wants to avoid publicity so as not to panic the public. They have little information to go on - they don't know the dead man's identity - and Reed estimates they have 48 hours before disease begins to spread. With police Capt. Tom Warren going through the motions, Reed sets out to find the killers.
translation:
I can not really condemn the movie because it works. There are enough Film Noir elements to consider it a Noir movie, but I think it's just in the category.

There is nothing sinister in this piece, and here the Noir elements fail. Sure, the disease could be considered scary, but it's hard for me to see. The film points to a darker side: Blackie can do human trafficking, the New Orleans police are only too willing to arrest a reporter, the ghost of the plague hangs over all the people in the movie ... but that's really just them clues.

There is no attempt to question Reed's motivations, such as Marlowe or Spade, and there is no attempt to bring a human side to Blackie, which would make him even more contemptible, though the trafficking was actually played out.

This lack of depth is what makes the movie fail in the end.

The story is decent, the acting is good, the writing and the direction are well done ... but there is nothing to make this a movie to return to again and again. It is worthwhile to watch once, maybe twice, if you do not remember it years ago and then put it away.

summary: A psychotic police officer who murders his female arrests gets what's coming to him when a horde of zombified women rise from their graves to seek revenge.
translation: I'm an actor, producer, director and what I want to say is facts. This project was the worst movie in film history. From producer to director and editing this so-called movie is a joke and I mean a BIG joke. Why should blockbuster release such crap? I take my work very seriously and this film is an insult to my job. Did the director try to make a bad movie? I do not think so. I've seen bad zombie movies, but that takes the cake and everything on the damn table. THIS MOVIE SUCKS !!! I really hate talking about other filmmakers because I am one myself, but please keep in mind that you are taking a different job. I respect the fact that you have finished a movie, but I have to ask you "WHAT YOU'RE CRACKING CRACK", I mean the make-up of your girls, the scary zombies, what did you think. For the whole nation, if I had chosen zero, I would have done it. WORST FILM IN FILM HISTORY !!!

summary: A multi-volumed documentary mini-series, "The World at War" covers the entire history of World War II from the causes of the 1920s to the aftermath of the Cold War in the 1950s. Emphasis is also placed on several inside story episodes, where events are covered which occurred inside Germany and Japan such as resistance to Hitler, life in general under a dictatorial regime, and particular emphasis is focused on the Jewish Holocaust.
translation: This should be necessary for all teenagers. This is documentary in its best form, from the haunting music and grandiose narrative of Olivier to his intrepid and penetrating analysis. The world at war is unforgettable and irreplaceable for anyone who wants to experience the sad experience of humanity in the depths of the 20th century.

summary: It is post-World War III. War is outlawed. In its place, are matches between large Robots called Robot Jox. These matches take place between two large superpowers over disputed territories. The main character Achilles is a pilot in one of the large Robots. The plot revolves around him and a match for the state of Alaska.
translation: After watching this excellent movie over 100 times, I still find new things that blow me away with this movie, great special effects, incredible acting and a conspiracy full of brilliant twists make this movie an excellent portrayal of capitalism and communism happy and everything is fine. best movie ever !!!

summary: A group of film students attempt to finish a horror movie that stopped production years earlier when the director was killed. Unaware that every attempt to complete the pic coincided with the murders of those involved, the students return to the original location in an isolated part of the country. When filming begins, so do the killings.
translation: Slash flicks arrive today and in a few days, and when I heard about Cut, I had high hopes and heard good things about them. The good things I heard were all wrong ... very wrong! This strip is bad and I mean BAD. It's just stupid. Everything about it. First and foremost, the origin of the murderer and how he lives and how he is ultimately cared for. There is nothing original or outstanding about this film. Just another slasher wannabe with these "hip," "self-confident." "Movie savvy" characters. I am so sick of this crap. Somebody is doing something different because the slash genre literally needs new blood.

summary: A mysterious creature from another planet, resembling a giant blob of jelly, lands on earth. The people of a nearby small town refuse to listen to some teenagers who have witnessed the blob's destructive power. In the meantime, the blob just keeps on getting bigger.
translation:
No hidden agenda. Pure scifi. All fun.

I saw the original on TV and was pretty scared. I was a kid :)

The original can be more appreciated when compared to the new one that I have seen and forgotten. The original, starring big movie star Steve McQueen (BULLET), is by far the better and only version anyone should see.

The movie production is outdated, but the FX used to make the blob stand the test of time. I was convinced that this thing moved by itself. 10/10
zafoid

summary: Because of his salacious language, late-night radio advice-show host Leon Phelps, along with his sweet and loyal producer Julie, is fired from his Chicago gig. They can't find another job. About that time, two things happen: he gets a letter from a wealthy former lover who offers to take care of him (but she doesn't sign her real name, so Leon, an inveterate Casanova, has no idea who she is), and a group of angry cuckolds, all of whom have surprised their wives in flagrante delicto with Leon (who has a distinctive tattoo on his booty), are closing in, armed and dangerous. Can he find the sugar mommy and escape the wrath of the mob of husbands? What about Julie?
translation: I really do not understand why people are so excited and panning this movie! Remember, people, this is an SNL movie, not something that should be unpredictable and original in action or direction! The Ladies Man is a funny film, albeit sometimes stupid, with a freaky cast and, as always, WONDERFUL performances by Will Ferrel and Tim Meadows. Yes, some of the jokes are stupid, and yes, the characters are incredible, but his comedy! I really do not understand how you can not laugh a lot in this funny movie. Anyway, I'm just asking people to take it the way it is - a SNL, silly and irreverent comedy. Nothing that will win prizes, but nonetheless, some modern comedy gold. "10-4 apricot!"

summary: Baba (Rajini) an atheist, by a twist of fate, acquires magical powers from a divine source and takes on crooked politicians.
translation:
This is undoubtedly Rajnikanth's worst movie ever. The first part is held with solid comedy from Goundamani, but it is getting worse and utterly illogical. Our hero also takes an archaeological site for Saints of the same name (Baba) through a kitschy and totally lame one-liner. The first half, Rajni has his usual line of oneliner and style and in the second half, becomes a quasi-saint after a beggar gave him through an interdimensional portal into the Himalayas, where Babaji (not the famous saint he digs earlier) give him special powers for no apparent reason (except Karma). That really starts to get interesting, right?

The rest of the movie is about wasting his magical abilities and powers and warding off politicians and related black magic. The usual predictable crap with hilarious implementation. Oh, and the black magic never worked on our hero because he just happened to have a Param Vir ... he ... Shakti Chakra with him. The bad guys and the usual politician villains are stereotyped, overworked and in the end completely insignificant for the action that goes nowhere.

But despite all the mistakes, it was fun killing time with Baba-related one-liners during public events. It's also fun to watch others cuss this movie. AR Rehman is said to have composed the tracks for his film over the phone. That's how important he thought.

Rajni is very popular in Japan and he has two characters (one of them is called Keiko ... why not Samsung?) of Japanese origin in this movie just for the sake of it. But the way they are portrayed, dressed and treated is absolutely pathetic. The Japanese may stop seeing Rajni films after seeing this. This film was likely promotional material for Rajni, who entered politics, but the film's own outcomes would have ruined any of his political dreams.

Fun when you turn off your brain.

summary: Martha, a widow living in rural Pennsylvania, comes home to find her daughter about to blow her own head off with a shotgun in the basement of their house. Martha doesn't succeed in stopping her child's horrific demise, but the girl's death gradually leads the grieving mother to investigate a conspiracy that involves a legendary local witch, Nazi dabbling with the occult, and secret government experiments, with the story even referencing the fabled Philadelphia Experiment.
translation:
I am surprised by the low rating of this film by IMDb. With all due respect, its low rating is representative of the IQ level of those who rated it so poorly. They would rather see a movie with cheap thrill, bigger budget and more gore.

People's first misconception is that this is a horror movie. It is not, nor does the film lead you to believe that it is one. It's a psychological thriller. It is for people who want an intellectual experience when watching a movie. The Reel.com report is the perfect example of what I think about this movie. All other negative reviews make little sense. It's almost as if you want to make an original film for a change - very rarely in those days - is something bad and not worth it.

I'll reveal a few spoilers for the idiots who said it was boring and didn It makes no sense. Martha has brainwashed herself and made experiments on herself to be a caring mother, when she was really a nasty Nazi who would kill without warning. The evidence is all in the pudding and the fact that we at first glance sympathize with this cold-blooded monster for the duration of the film is a testament to the direction and writing of the film.

I definitely feel that this movie should be rated at least in the 6 series on originality. I recommend this movie for the people on the other end of the IQ scale - aka smart people - because this movie is obviously slaughtered by those who would rather see Scream or Freddy's Nightmare.

Kudos to the actors too. For such a low budget movie, you are amazed that this movie did not hit your local cinema with the big direction, writing and acting. Please do not be fooled by the rating by IMDb. This movie is worth it. I actually recommend to buy the film, because a first look at a rent that does not do justice.

summary: Eight college students become trapped in an Annual Haunted House when an ancient spell turns them into their Halloween costumes. By night's end, a group of survivors will have to take one final stand against ghouls, ghosts, zombies and vampires.
translation:
Horror movies can be a lot of fun with little money, bad behavior, and a bit of swing. I think the film lacks only verve, because a dull scene after another makes people ridiculously harmless with the claw in the air. If it were not so boring, it could be funny.

A horror movie can go a long way with a weary concept like "college kids in a haunted house" in the same way as the bad guys have had a lot of fun with a similar standard plotline. Unfortunately, Hallow's End does not go far. Actually, there is nowhere to go. It spends most of an hour putting up faceless and anonymous characters with endless interpersonal drama. I have nothing against character development, not even in a horror movie, but these are strictly one-dimensional characters (the alpha male, the milquetoast, the ... um ... disposable characters that exist mainly for sex scenes.) Spending more than forty bloodless, Booming minutes with them were more appalling than when the bloodshed began.

Well, implicit bloodshed anyway. When the college kids become what they wear for their haunted house (one is a vampire wearing O.R Scrubs and some white pancakes), they look the way they did in their amateur haunted house costumes; The Dead Hate The Living, with a similar theme, is a masterpiece in comparison. There is not really any blood that can be talked about, and there are no real scares.

I have thought about this in almost every approach. If it was a tight, exciting horror movie (which would explain why things were moving so slowly), the pathetic sex scenes and cheap monsters would invalidate it. If it was a real horror movie (which would explain the Schlock) ... where is the blood and the courage? And the anticlimax is one of the unrestrained endings of a movie I've ever seen. It's the kind of movie that, although it has no narrator through the movie, is posted by voice-overs because all the meaningless dialogues just were not enough.

That was a tough one ... come out, I wonder if I've just had a Christian horror movie. Maybe the "I know that hell exists" opening was not meant that way, but there are some clues (or misleading - I'm not sure which). For all the obscenities in the film, a line like "gosh-darnit" sounds a bit absurd, and so does most crucifix worship, godly and satanic, especially after a few lustful T & A sex scenes (a heterosexual, a lesbian).

If it's a Christian company (Highland Myst's logo even has a bit of a crucifix resemblance), then this movie weighs heavily for the atheist camp. An almighty being can not be such a bad filmmaker.

summary: Dr. Victor Sartorius, a dedicated but dying medical researcher working in Morocco, becomes frustrated when his funding is cut off and his experiments ended. He is approached by Lady Yvonne Clifford, the young and beautiful wife of wealthy but aging aristocrat Sir Charles Clifford. She has been carrying on an affair with a gold-digging army captain and offers Sartorius the 20,000 pounds he needs to continue his research if he will become her husband's personal physician and covertly murder him. When Sir Charles' son Roger enters the picture, it is clear that he is marked for death too. Only Sartorius' altruistic nurse Joan stands in the way.
translation:
This was released on Alpha's DVD market and it's only for die-hard Boris Karloff fans (like moi). It's not a horror movie, it's a drama in which Boris is a scientist struggling to kill the husband of a wealthy woman in order to get the assets needed to continue his work. But as soon as the dying victim changes his will and his wife does nothing, hell breaks loose.

It's reassuring enough to see Karloff as another selfish eerie guy, and part of the acting is unintentionally hilarious (especially by actress Mona Goya, who is absolutely a laughing stock than the crossed wife).

But be careful.

summary: When some Russian rebels takes control of some ICBM's, the Americans mobilize. Among the vessels sent is the nuclear sub, the Alabama. But before they leave they need a new X.O. and among the choices is Commander Hunter, who hasn't seen much action. But the ship's Captain, Ramsey OK's him. While on the way, there was an incident and Hunter disagreed with how Ramsey handled it, it's evident that Ramsey doesn't think much of Hunter because Hunter was college educated while Ramsey worked his way up. They're given orders to attack but when they were in the process of receiving another order, the ship's communications were damaged, so the entire message was not received. Ramsey decides to continue with their previous order while Hunter wants to reestablish contact first. That's when the two men butt heads that ends with Hunter relieving Ramsey. Later when some men die, some of the officers feel that Hunter is not up to the task so they team up to retake control. But Hunter has taken ...
translation: This movie is an insult to all submariners. It was stupid. It seemed to have been written by monkeys. Acting was absurd. If this is the view most people have of the Navy, then I cry for our defense. This movie was awful. I put it under "Journey to the Seabed" as far as submarine movies go. Gene Hackman really must have needed rent to do this crap. Denzel Washington must have been high. Little in the plot makes any sense. And the end. That a mutineer is rewarded for his crime? Only Hollywood would think of this garbage. If you have not found out yet, I do not like it. And if it had not been for all the pro comments, I would not have bothered to post.

summary: Set in the 1930s, an honest, goodhearted man is forced to turn to a life of crime to finance his neurotic mother's skyrocketing medical bills.
translation: This movie is just too funny, an absolutely non PC gangster romp. If Mel Brooks made a picture of the mob in the 1930s, it probably would. Too many great one-liners to remember, and while it's not for everyone, anyone who does not laugh much does not have a pulse. So, put it on and LAUGH you Iceholes !!!

summary: The Creeds have just moved to a new house in the countryside. Their house is perfect, except for two things: the semi-trailers that roar past on the narrow road, and the mysterious cemetery in the woods behind the house. The Creed's neighbours are reluctant to talk about the cemetery, and for good reason too.
translation:
The trivia section for Pet Sematary states that George Romero (director of two Stephen King stories, Creepshow and The Dark Half) would direct and then move out. One wonders what he would have brought to the film, because director Mary Lambert, who is not really a bad director, does not really bring much imagination to this adaptation of King's novel, of which he wrote the screenplay. Of course, there are some very effective, grotesquely surreal scenes (mainly with sister Zelda, who is more likely to be a creep for kids when they watch the movie), and casting in some roles is absolutely perfect. But sometimes something feels missing, a style that could correspond to the unmistakably king-like atmosphere, which in this case is about as morbid as you can get from the tombs without incestuous cannibals if he saves that for his last novel ...)

As already mentioned, part of the casting is terrific, especially Miko Hughes as Gage Creed, the little boy who is one of the best cutest kids this page of an 80's horror movie, to a little monster (I say that as a compliment, of course, especially in scenes with a specific scalpel). And for Fred Gwynne of the Munsters, who plays this old, mysterious man with the right undertones and undertones, there is also a juicy supporting role. And the applause goes to the one who made make-up for Andrew Hubatsek. But there are some other mistakes in the other cast; Dale Midkiff is good, not great, as the conflicting, disturbed father figure Creed and his daughter Ellie is played by an actress who does not work for me at all.

In terms of setting up some chilling set pieces, just a few really stand out: a certain moment that compacts the action (not to spoil, it includes a cool Ramones song), and the first visit to the pet Sematar (the larger one), including the kind of mystical overtones that King had in shining. In most cases it is a very demanding director's job, although it could have been even darker to fit the script. When elaborated in logical terms (though in King terms), it is truly one of his more effective works of the period. But it does not add up as it could or should. Nevertheless, it is a nice little midnight movie.

summary: The end of the 14th century. Parents send the eldest son Jan to study in Hamburg, and the youngest - Klaus - to the monastery. No sooner had the children moved away from their homes, as on Klaus'es eyes the robbers kill their parents and burn the house. Only thanks to the loyal monk Wigbold Klaus managed to survive the shock. A few years later Klaus St√∂rtebeker finds his brother Jan and his long-time friend Elizabeth Pren in Hamburg. From her, he learns that she is expected to marry Simon von Wallenrod, whose father Klaus suspects of killing his parents. But the Pranks and the Wallenrods are rich and respected people, and Klaus is a poor man. And now he becomes a pirate...
translation:
St√∂rtebeker is truly one of the worst TV mini-series ever made on this planet.

The acting is unbearable and the historical background is mostly nonsense: Just two examples: Visby was shown as a village with three houses. Instead, it was a big city at the time, the best days have passed. Second, Hamburg would never have been the city to look after pirates in the Baltic Sea. Hamburg had no access to the Baltic Sea, the then city was L√ºbeck.

But worse than all that: the director! How can a dilettante like this guy lead a movie that way? Impossible! There was not a single credible scene, the fights were ridiculous and I could not help laughing at most serious scenes.

I can not understand how a big TV station could be so incompetent.

summary: Ancient codes hidden within the Torah reveal the secrets of global events, past (i.e., Hitler, the Kennedy assassination, the Gulf War), present, and future. One man (York) is after the Code, seeking the power to change the world as we know it... for the worse. Another (Van Dien) seeks the truth, risking his life and everything he stands for in order to stop him.
translation: The Omega Code was a model for cinematic inconsistency. There was a little (but very little) good acting, mainly of the two prophets and Rosenberg, who appeared only once and had no lines. Otherwise, the acting was very bad. The storyline was rather weak and was only partially based on already questionable biblical interpretation. Certainly not one of the best of the year.

summary: 84 years later, a 100 year-old woman named Rose DeWitt Bukater tells the story to her granddaughter Lizzy Calvert, Brock Lovett, Lewis Bodine, Bobby Buell and Anatoly Mikailavich on the Keldysh about her life set in April 10th 1912, on a ship called Titanic when young Rose boards the departing ship with the upper-class passengers and her mother, Ruth DeWitt Bukater, and her fianc√©, Caledon Hockley. Meanwhile, a drifter and artist named Jack Dawson and his best friend Fabrizio De Rossi win third-class tickets to the ship in a game. And she explains the whole story from departure until the death of Titanic on its first and last voyage April 15th, 1912 at 2:20 in the morning.
translation:
When I saw this movie, I was amazed what a great movie that was. This is the only movie I would ever award 10 stars. I am sure that this film will always be in my top 5.

The acting is outstanding. Leonardo DiCaprio and Kate Winslett are at their best. I do not think anyone could have a better job than Kate.

If it's a rainy day and you can not decide what to rent then this is the place. You will love all the acting, special effects and much more.

If you have not seen this movie, go or buy it now !!! You will not regret it.

summary: Archie Grey Owl is a trapper in Canada in the early 1930s when a young Iroquois woman from town asks him to teach her Indian ways. They live in the woods, where she is appalled at how trapped animals die. She adopts two orphaned beaver kits and helps Archie see his way to stop trapping. Instead, he works as a guide, a naturalist writer, and then the Canadian government hires him to save the beaver in a conserve by Lake Ajawaan in Prince Albert National Park. He writes a biography, which brings him attention in Canada and invitations to lecture in England. Before he leaves, he and Anahareo (Pony) marry. In England, his secret is revealed. Will Anahareo continue to love him?
translation: All in all a good movie and better for the movie not having made the story could be hidden from the masses. Brosnan does a good job as a native American with a hidden past and photography is breathtaking. For some it's too strange, for others boring - for me it's a gentle, well told story and perfect for family visits. That's not much lately.

summary: While their father is away, his children begin killing people via a woodchipper.
translation: What a huge pile of crap. Shot-on video (really crappy camcorder, not digital) Pile of garbage. It is undoubtedly the stupidest thing that has ever been done. The fact that this crap was actually published is completely asanine. Anyone who sees it will become more stupid because he has seen it. Serious. I had the feeling that it killed several brain cells after watching this garbage. The positive reviews of this a $ crap were obviously made by the "filmmaker" (and I use the term VERY casually) himself and / or his family and friends because no normal human with the intelligence of a squirrel would really like that waste of life. Trust me, stay away from this video. You will thank me for that. Avoid it like herpes.

summary: Donnas senior prom is supposed to be the best night of her life, one of magic, beauty, and love. Surrounded by her best friends, she should be safe from the horrors of her dark past. But when the night turns from magic to murder there is only one man who could be responsible, the man she thought was gone forever. Now, Donna and her friends must find a way to escape the sadistic rampage of an obsessed killer, and survive their Prom Night.
translation:
When I saw the preview for this movie for the first time, I could not wait to see it. The plot seemed good and the environment was great. I mean, a Slasher movie taking place at the prom, great idea !! And the plot: A high school teacher who is sexually obsessed by one of his students, goes crazy, gets arrested and flees three years later on prom night! Prom Night, a night that should be happy and memorable, becomes hell !! Anyway, I saw it and was extremely disappointed. Not only was it the worst "horror movie" I've ever seen, but it was one of the worst movies I've ever seen !! Above all, it was not even scary. There was no moment in this movie when I jumped out of my seat. Besides, the murder scenes were so cheesy and boring. All the Slasher did was stab his victims several times in the stomach or cut their throats. Also, there was absolutely no Gore (his PG-13 rated). The scene with the most blood was probably the one in which the killer murders the black girl. He slits her throat and spills blood on the leaves that hang around her (they do not really show him how to cut their throats).

Next you'll see the killers when they first get introduced to the movie. He is not mysterious, creepy or scary. He's just the guy who kills people.

Also everything in the movie was so clich√©d. An example is when the killer ends up killing the main character and at the last moment the detective kills and kills him. Besides, every single thing in this movie was so predictable. The victim, after seeing the guy with a knife, runs for their lives, hides, thinks she's going to get away, and then the killer just pops out and kills her.

Finally, the sequence of the movie was extremely bad. The guy goes to the hotel, kills a few people, the bodies are discovered, someone pulls the fire alarm, and everyone evacuates. The main character forgets something in her room, has an encounter with the killer, runs and flees. That's it! She and her friend go home, the Slasher kills the guards patrolling the house, finds the girl, is then killed by the detective. The movie sequence was so stupid and clich√©d.

If you think about watching this movie only because the preview looked good, trust me, do not waste your time or money. No wonder this movie was shown in the smallest theater in the cinema. My friend and I, along with these two girls sitting in the back, were the only ones in the theater. That should have told me something about the movie before.

summary: Musical adaptation of Charles Dickens's classic tale of an orphan who runs away from the orphanage and hooks up with a group of boys trained to be pickpockets by an elderly mentor.
translation:
One of the best musicals, which is timeless and always worth seeing. Delicious! Acting, especially by Ron Moody as Fagin, is outstanding. Costumes are exquisite .... even the shabby ones.

The two young guys who play Oliver and The Artful Dodger are wonderfully talented. Oliver Reed does a great job by portraying Bill Sykes so that you can not help but hope that he comes to a terrible end ... what he does.

Dancing is cleverly choreographed and fascinated. Oliver can compete with people like My Fair Lady, The Sound of Music, Oklahoma and so on. A movie for the whole family.

summary: A film about struggling to deal with paralysis. Author Joel Garcia breaks his neck while hiking, and finds himself in a rehabilitation centre with Raymond, an exaggerating ladies' man, and Bloss, a racist biker. Considerable tension builds as each character tries to deal with his new found handicap and the problems that go with it, especially Joel, whose lover Anna is having as difficult a time as he is. As Raymond reveals a dream about dancing on the surface of a lake to stay afloat, it becomes apparent that each of them must find his own Waterdance to survive his tragedy.
translation:
This work is a bold look into the mindset of men in wheelchairs. This film never tries to refine the fear, confusion, and pain of those boys who live with it, cotton candy or soft soap. That's his strength, I think.

But more than that, the performances are fantastic, with a well thought out and delivered dialogue that attracts you and makes you feel part of the experience. The characters never try to stop the audience from knowing what's in their heads - what's in their hearts.

I found it tedious, but enjoyable.

It rates a 6.6 / 10 of ...

summary: A group of popular students play a cruel prank on a shy nerd resulting in a terrible accident. Years later a reunion is held where each of the students face a stalker killer who may be the same nerd out for revenge.
translation:
The school nerd Marty (Simon Scuddamore) is sexually humiliated by a group of classmates and then is in a laboratory blast (also set by them), where his face is marked by acid. Years later, all idiots are invited to a reunion (closed back). What they did not know is that Marty invites them to kill her. Then a storm starts, they are locked up in school and Marty starts to take revenge.

Pretty silly. The murders are inventive and bloody and there are some spooky atmospheric shots of the abandoned school - but that's it. The humiliations inflicted on Scuddamore are more than cruel (he has moved out, dipped his head in a toilet AND is being burned) and is only uncomfortable to watch. Considering that Scuddamore committed suicide soon after her release, it is almost impossible to see her. This movie is not about being naked. There's a frontal view of Scuddamore (surprising for every movie), but a girl decides to bathe alone ... AFTER they know a killer is after them! And then there is the couple who needs to have sex. This is the kind of movie where the killer seems to know where everyone will be and can teleport to them. It ends with a twist that made me moan and twisted my eyes, then another twist that made me throw something heavy on the TV! The spectacle is bearable - not good, but bearable. Caroline Munro is also there. She is a very beautiful woman, but not much of an actress.

This will be a 3 for some effectively bloody murders and atmosphere. Otherwise it is from the mill and forgetful. Scuddamore's tragic suicide has paid more attention to this film than it deserves.

summary: This slow-paced gem is about the civilizing influence of Italy on beleaguered Londoners both male and female and has its own civilizing influence on the viewer. It's almost like taking a little mini-trip to Italy, a gorgeously filmed enchantment.
translation: Nice character development in a pretty cool environment. Since I'm a man, I'm probably not qualified to fully understand it, but they do a good job of establishing the restrictive Victorian environment right from the start. It is not as bleak as it really was and the treatment of women was probably even harder. What this does is a wonderful chemistry among the main characters. Everyone has their own "thing" to fight with. As soon as they come out of the rain and break out of the spider webs, they begin to interact and slowly lose their suspicions. What I enjoyed about this movie is that it was not for cheap comedy if it was possible. It did not try to teach us a lesson. The people who appear without merit are really well-developed people who can see the light. I had some problems with the character of Alfred Molina having such an epiphany so quickly, but within that world it had to happen. Good action all around with something positive that takes place in the lives of some pretty good people.

summary: A sudden death tied to a list from the past leads to unimaginable evil. Fresh out of law school and full of hope for the future, Renny Jacobson is stunned by his father's sudden death--and then by the terms of the will: the elder Jacobson has left the bulk of his estate to charity. For his only son, he has left nothing more than the contents of a deposit box and interest in a company no one has heard of--the Covenant List of South Carolina, Ltd. When Renny encounters lovely Jo Johnston, meets the members of "The List," and discovers the staggering value of his father's mysterious bequest, his hope is resurrected. But why is Jo, to whom he is deeply attracted, so reluctant for him to claim his rightful share? Renny feels the supernatural power of the 140-year-old covenant--feels it and wants it for himself. But when his life and Jo's begin to unravel, he is forced to face the truth about "The List." And nothing short of a miracle will save them from its grasp.
