summary: Wang Bianlian is an aging street performer known as the King of Mask for his mastery of Sichuan Change Art in a true story. His wife left him with and infant son over 30 years ago. The son died from illness at age 10. This left Wang a melancholy loner aching for a male descendent to learn his rare and dying art. A famous master performer of the Sichuan Opera offers to bring him into his act, thus giving Wang fame and possible fortune, but Wang opts for staying the simple street performer. Then, one night after a performance he is sold a young boy by a slave trader posing as the boy's parent. "Grandpa" finds new joy in life as he plans to teach "Doggie" (an affectionate term often used for young children in China) his art. All is well until Doggie is found out to really be a girl.
translation:
This film is worth seeing for the visual beauty and moving spectacle alone, but there is also an interesting cultural subtext of alienation. Women and performers (both in a supporting role of a transvestite opera star) are both doomed to play submissive roles in China. This makes the unlikely connection between an aged street artist and a young girl even stronger than a triumph over native culture.

The only problem I had with this film was the tendency of the soundtrack to swell with emotions that are rendered unnecessary by the performance of the actors.

A welcome alternative to unsatisfactory summer action movies.

summary: A restless and abrasive young woman eschews the affections of a sensitive young portrait artist, preferring to chase punk singers in a misguided desire for fame and fortune in New York's Greenwich Village.
translation: "Smithereen's" is the kind of worthless movie that just hangs between the cable channels, like a cheesy dime novel in the public library. A worthless bit of tripe and first effort for mediocre director Seidelman, the movie is full of bad acting, bad sound, poor camera work and poor quality in all aspects of the movie. Many better movies never make it to the market and why junk flicks like this one never disappear is one of the great secrets of life. (D)

summary: Circa 1861, Angelina, ruling countess of an Italian principality, is at a loss when invaded by a Hungarian army. Her lookalike ancestress Francesca, who saved a similar situation 300 years before, comes to life from a portrait to help her descendant. Complicating factor: the newlywed countess feels strangely drawn to the handsome invader...
translation: Let me first say that I really liked Betty Grable, especially from "Down Argentine Way", but when she came to this catastrophe, she was also "round" and frankly, the whole movie was embarrassing. Against Douglas Fairbanks JNr (who must have been quite desperate) the story was bad, the colors good and the movie way too long. It had some of the old stables in it, like Harry Davenport and Reginald Gardiner, to arouse interest, but to no avail. The music notes were wistful, and I have to say that no melody was memorable in any way ... since I was such a fan of Miss Grable, I always wished I had never seen this one!

summary: Incarcerated and charged with murder, David Aames Jr. is telling the story of how he got to where he is to McCabe, the police psychologist. That story includes: being the 51% shareholder of a major publishing firm, which he inherited from his long deceased parents; the firm's board, appointed by David Aames Sr., being the 49% shareholders who would probably like to see him gone as they see him as being too irresponsible and immature to run the company; his best bro friendship with author, Brian Shelby; his "friends with benefits" relationship with Julie Gianni, who saw their relationship in a slightly different light; his budding romance with Sofia Serrano, who Brian brought to David's party as his own date and who Brian saw as his own possible life mate; and being in an accident which disfigured his face and killed the person who caused the accident. But as the story proceeds, David isn't sure what is real and what is a dream/nightmare as many facets of the story are incompatible to ...
translation:
I had heard some not so good things about this movie and probably had seen the low score here at IMDb and so I avoided it. Today they were showing Vanilla Sky on TV and I had nothing better to do ... and it turned out that I would have a hard time doing better. Vanilla Sky is a scary, sad and touching movie, actually one of the best I've seen in a while. I was surprised how I was affected. It's hard to explain, but during the movie, your feelings about the characters and your perception of what's going on are changing, and it's a pretty emotional journey. Vanilla Sky has touched me in a way that is very rare for a movie or other media.

I really recommend everyone to watch this movie. Regardless of what you have heard of it.

summary: In 2022, Earth is overpopulated and totally polluted; the natural resources have been exhausted and the nourishment of the population is provided by Soylent Industries, a company that makes a food consisting of plankton from the oceans. In New York City, when Soylent's member of the board William R. Simonson is murdered apparently by a burglar at the Chelsea Towers West where he lives, efficient Detective Thorn is assigned to investigate the case with his partner Solomon "Sol" Roth. Thorn comes to the fancy apartment and meets Simonson's bodyguard Tab Fielding and the "furniture" (woman that is rented together with the flat) Shirl and the detective concludes that the executive was not victim of burglary but executed. Further, he finds that the Governor Santini and other powerful men want to disrupt and end Thorn's investigation. But Thorn continues his work and discovers a bizarre and disturbing secret of the ingredient used to manufacture Soylent Green.
translation: Soylent Green is a classic. I was waiting for someone to do it again. They seem to make science fiction classics today (ie World War One), and I hope a director / producer will re-make Soylent Green. With today's computer animation and technology, it has the potential to be a great picture. Anti-Utopian films may not be that farfetched. The human race brood like cockroaches without external influence to prune them. We, as humans, have the opportunity to breed smaller species if they get out of control, but there is nothing that could control human breeding except ourselves. Despite all the diseases, wars, abortions, birth control, etc., people are still multiplying like bacteria in a petri dish. The classical Malthusian economy states that every species, including humans, will multiply beyond their means of existence. 6 billion and growing .... that's obscene.

summary: After seven years in solitary, Jake Green is released from prison. In the next two years, he amasses a lot of money by gambling. He's ready to seek his revenge on Dorothy (Mr. D) Macha, a violence-prone casino owner who sent Jake to prison. He humiliates Macha in front of Macha's lieutenants, leaves, and keels over. Doctors tell him he has a rare disease and will die in three days; Macha also puts a hit out on him. Loan sharks, Zack and Avi, demand Jake's cash and complete fealty in return for protection. Jake complies, and through narration and flashbacks, we watch him through at least three days of schemes, danger, and redemption. Who is his greatest enemy?
translation:
After reading the comments on the page, I feel compelled to write for the first time. It seems that this movie is like Marmite and has split the audience. I have to say that although I agree that movies do not make sense to be fun (see MULHOLLAND DRIVE), they still have to interact with the characters. Now, while fully engulfed in the murderous lesbian affair in Lynch's work, I have to say that I could not give a nonsense about Mr. Green or the other cardboard bands that lived in this tag globe world.

Also, while so many people try to say that you do not enjoy it because you did not understand it, I would have to argue - I did not enjoy it because I was bored. I wanted the movie to stop and over and over again listening to these quotes did not help. Call it clever if you want - I think it's repetitive.

My main reason for writing, however, is to ask all the other reviewers - there was no credits on the print of the movie I saw. Only music about black. Have I seen a dud, or is that an indication of the presumption of GR? Or did all those involved in the film see the rough cut and remove their name?

summary: On September 11, 2001, filmmaker James Hanlon and Jules and Gedeon Naudet were filming a documentary on a rookie New York City firefighter when they noticed a plane overhead. That plane would hit the World Trade Center. They rushed immediately to the scene. James Hanlon and the Naudets filmed throughout Sept. 11 and the days afterward from the firemen's perspective, as it became clear to them that this was the only known footage from inside the Twin Towers that day.
translation:
The French Naudet brothers did something no one else did, they had a video camera the day this tragedy happened. They were in Building # 2, when papers were seen drifting down, people rising from such a height to the ground.

I mean, it's as if both buildings collapsed, they ran, theirs The camera was still running when the white dust covered them, they found a store entrance and came in, but all the material is real and I think they did a fantastic job holding it for us.

Ten stars go to the brothers Naudet, who made this extraordinary film that I visit every 9/11, so I never forget what this country has gone through. I think, if I remember correctly, it shows the first death of the pastor of the firefighters, while he was carried to the church and to his honorable burial.

summary: A sheriff investigating the disappearance of a young girl from a small island discovers there's a larger mystery to solve among the island's secretive, neo-pagan community.
translation: A soldier is on the side of the road, making sure everyone1 complies with the speed limit (does his job); then he puts on a woman who looks like she is a mother (in the backseat is a child); He then tells her what is wrong and BAM ... they are killed. Okay, that's the beginning of what I personally thought would be a good movie. When I saw this movie in the theater, I was with some friends. Not only did I waste $ 7.oo on a movie ticket, but I had to put down torture for the brain. This movie started with mystery and suspense and I seriously thought "that can not be bad" ... I was so wrong. The whole problem with this movie is that it makes no sense; Even if you can go through the bad acting, the "not so scary" plot and the terrible mess of this movie, you will still be confused. It's not because you're not smart enough to understand it because no one with a brain can understand what this stupid movie is about. Now you may be thinking, "Oh man, I just have to watch this movie to see if it's as bad as the person says it." GET THIS THINK NOW FROM YOUR HEAD !!! I try to spare you the trouble of watching this movie by telling you that it is so bad that there is no point thinking about it. Please, people do not make the same mistake I made because I thought this movie has potential ... but not. I give this movie 1 in 10 (if I could give a zero, I would), and I recommend nobody ever to see this movie, you will save many sleepless nights and try to think about them. that damn movie is about.

summary: In New York, when the shy and lonely project manager of a design firm Matt Saunders meets Jenny Johnson in the subway, he invites her to date and have dinner with him. Jenny immediately falls in love for him, they have sex and she discloses her true identity to him, telling that she is the powerful superhero G-Girl. After meeting his co-worker and friend Hannah Lewis, the needy Jenny becomes jealous, controlling and manipulative, and Matt follows the advice of his best friend Vaughn Haige and dumps her, breaking her heart. Jenny turns Matt's life into hell, while he has a romance with Hannah. However, the archenemy of G-Girl and former high school sweetheart of Jenny, Professor Bedlam, proposes Matt to lure Jenny to strip her superpowers.

summary: In part six of the Nightmare on Elm Street series, dream monster Freddy Krueger has finally killed all the children of his hometown, and seeks to escape its confines to hunt fresh prey. To this end, he recruits the aid of his (previously unmentioned) daughter. However, she discovers the demonic origin of her father's powers and meets Dad head-on in a final showdown (originally presented in 3-D).
translation: I'm a fan of the Nightmare series, but this is awful. The deaths are so trendy. If you look at that 20 years later, the whole Nintendo scene is outdated. I liked the flashbacks. I think they should have been doing a prequel while he was still alive. That would have been more interesting. This is a movie that you can take or leave. Depends on how much free time you have.

summary: When a thieving cyclist steals a purse from a pedestrian, clumsy, naive yet honest rookie policeman Sang-hwan gives chase, but it's the skilled specialist in martial arts, Wi-jin, who captures the criminal while severely injuring Sang-hwan. She brings Sang-hwan to her home, where five Masters of Tao heal him and find that he has a powerful c'hi (spiritual energy of the universe). He could be a powerful warrior. As Sang-hwan begins training to ascend to the level of a Maruchi (male Tao Master), the evil, ancient and ambitious Heuk-woon, accidentally released from his imprisonment, awakens. The powerful Heuk-woon attacks the masters, searching for a key that they protect, which would permit him to become an Arahan and dominate the world. When the masters are defeated, Sang-hwan and Wi-jin are the only and last hope of mankind.
translation:
"Arahan" adds nothing positive to the kung fu genre. Comparing this muddled film with the inspired madness and quality of Stephen Chow's films is a mistake.

First, the fight scenes are nothing new. Everything presented here has been previously done by Yimou Zhang, Tony Jaa and Jackie Chan. Battles in smart motion pictures need logic. There does not seem to be any point in giving punches that have no harmful effect, as in the "Matrix" sequels.

So-Yi Yoon's attractive female lead captivated the screen, but she never convincingly convinced the physical demands of the role as Ziyi Zhang had made it so easy in "House Of Flying Daggers". Having a martial arts background is good in Kung Fu movies. Performers who are inexperienced in these abilities are a fatal flaw (see Aya Ueto in Asumi), unless you are a very talented director who proves, as "Arahan", that Seung-Wan Ryoo is not.

summary: Eli Wurman is a decadent drug addicted New Yorker public relation, who is promoting a social event on behalf of Afro-Americans. Along two days of his crazy life, the day of the event and the day before, he makes contacts and favors, 'kissing asses', using drugs etc. Victoria Gray is his widow sister-in-law and passion in the past. Cary Launer is an Oscar winner actor and principal client of Eli. On the day before of the event, Eli finds out secrets that evolve powerful men of America.
translation:
In the longest 1 hour 35 I have had to endure for a long time, Al Pacino delivers an accurate performance to make sure. Not his usual typecasting, that was nice. But his character was just pathetic. Someone who is too bad while stumbling around and forgetting appointments, realizing that social life in Hollywood has robbed him of his life energy. But in this movie we needed someone who liked us. And for some reason every character in the picture said, "I do not know why I like you, Eli" to Al Pacino's character and I could not even approximate him.

All the other actors played their usual styles. Tea Leoni, Richard Schiff and Bill Nunn did nothing to change their established roles that were developed on television or in previous films. And Kim Basinger was not even long enough in the movie to deliver a performance.

The story of the film had no dynamics. Most scenes never drive the story, but only collect facts about characters that came into play later in an anti-climatic end. There was potential, apart from her unwillingness to build on the story.

What's the point of the movie? Daniel Algrant and Jon Robin Baitz would make you believe, "Once Hollywood has you, you can not get out." Yes exactly! And that's why so many people are fired in Hollywood.

summary: Angela Baker has undergone years of therapy, electro-shock and sexual reassignment surgeries, and finally landed herself a job in the last place she should be working - camp rolling hills. She has an old fashioned approach as to how camp should be, and an old familiar deadly way of making sure that those who don't follow her rules don't get to come back next summer.
translation: No wonder Pamela Springsteen gave up acting to become a full-time photographer; it's a much better idea to have her behind a camera than in front of you. While this film is not without its interesting elements (mullets of hell, etc.), it is outweighed by deficiencies. For one thing, Angela, the homicidal counselor, seems to be about the same age as the campers. An older, more threatening camp leader would have done a lot for the film. And then you have the murder scenes. The budget was obviously too low to do most of them properly (no pun intended), though someone's drowning in a toilet in the outhouse is certainly original. But overall, there are a lot of movies that are scarier / more fun to spend one and a half hours of your life.

summary: A group of childhood friends, now in their thirties, reunite at Camp Tamakwa. Only a few of the original campers show up, but they still have a good time reminiscing. The people share experiences and grow while at the camp. They are dismayed to discover that the camp's owner, Unca Lou, is going to close the camp down.
translation: Wonderful cast, wasted on worthless script. Ten or more adults meet at the summer camp they visited as teenagers. Could this ever happen in a million years? It's just a fantasy, and a boring one. Will they be teenagers again? Do they reenact their pranks, games, good times? You can try it, but in the end the answer is no. Are there any intrigues? Any tension? Scary? Comedy? None of the above. How anyone can be entertained by this bickering is a mystery to me. I wanted to like this movie; I tried to like this movie, but my brain refused.

summary: A strange virus renders the entire human male population into homicidal maniacs who end up wiping out all females, leaving a woman and her daughter to fend for themselves.
translation: I was not very impressed with Dante's offer for the first season in Homecoming, it was not a horror story, but a smart political statement with the undead. The Screwfly situation is the story of a virus that is released in the world and replaces the sexual drive of men with murderous tendencies towards women. The episode begins with a short film that explains how the scientists killed the helicopters. Then there is a short scene in which a man is arrested when female bodies are discovered in his home. I suppose this should show the beginning of the outbreak, but it is unclear because it will never be picked up again. The episode starts for a while and introduces characters, blah blah blah. It seems cool and mysterious, but the episode keeps getting worse as she staggers forward to her sad and unsatisfactory end. The worst episode. Well, except for chocolate.

summary: Comedian Eddie Murphy brings his proudly raunchy comedy act to a sold-out stadium and pontificates in his own vulgarly hilarious fashion on such subjects as sexual orientation, puberty, dating, disciplinarian mothers, ice cream trucks, and the personality traits of certain singers.
translation:
And Gi Joe gets stuck in the water, I die every time I see this movie, and then came a big brown shark. This is comedy at its best, the kings of the comedy and everyone else, Andrew Dice Clay, Jerry, Tucker, Rock, You Can not Man the Myth of Legend Eddie Murphy,

Yo EDDIE WE WANT MORE

MORE MORE MORE MORE !!! !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

summary: Paris, 1969. The filming of a sci-fi movie set in the distant year 2000 is in trouble. The director's obsession with the actress who plays the sexy secret agent Dragonfly has clouded his judgment and the film has no ending. A young American, in Paris to document his life on film with total honesty, is brought in to finish the movie with a bang. This proves to be difficult when the line between his fantasy life and reality becomes blurred, and he finds himself seduced by the charms of Dragonfly.
translation:
Style, but no substance. Not as funny as it should be. Not as deep as it wants to be.

This is another in the genre of films about the difficulties of filmmaking. A young filmmaker is hired to end a 60s science fiction movie called Codename: Dragonfly. Think of Barbarella or Danger Diabolique.

But Jeremy Davies is a fear-obsessed filmmaker. He is not a hack, he is an artist. The movie he wants to make is a diary of his life. Hardly original.

All characters outside of Jeremy Davies filmmaker are as thin as rice paper. Characters who might be interesting, like his father, his doppelganger, or Jason Schwarzmann as a hack-director, are introduced and then shown the door without adding anything.

This movie is full of eye candy, but when compared to other films about filmmakers like Stardust Memories or 8 1/2 it fades in comparison. These movies are funny, provocative with well-developed characters. These movies have lessons that apply outside.

The movie wants to be weird and campy, but it's just deduced and there's no funny scene. The filmmakers describe it as a send-up, but what is the satirical goal? The actors say it's a tribute, but I think I'd rather have a full-length version of Codename: Dragonfly.

Coppola is obviously amused by the attitude, as the visual humor of science-fiction film shows in a movie. But he does not tell us why we should be amused.

Outside the science fiction movie, it's just a mess. There is continuity error, the filmmaker chooses a science fiction weapon after it has already been selected. What?

Just because he has a scene, the filmmaker is confronted with critics who complain about the lack of history, lack of a point, a scene in which he admits empty wisdom does not mean that he has addressed these criticisms.

I guess if you have your novel Coppola, you can get away with making a movie about a fear-obsessed idealistic filmmaker who does not know what he wants to say and does not say anything. In this sense, it can be considered autobiographical.

I would see it in Circuit City on a wall of TV if I had the choice. Watch the 15-minute codename: Dragonfly Movies on the DVD as extras, and then send them back.

summary: In the near future, Japan is ruled once more by a monarchy. But, rebels opposed to this rule seek to overthrow the government. The House of Takemikazuchi, a band of assassins is hired by the government to suppress the rebels. As a conspiracy from within signals the shadowy organization's impending demise, Yuki, the last of the Takemikazuchi bloodline befriends one of the rebels and seeks revenge against the group's leader.
translation:
After some comments in the IMDB, I was expecting an action movie - maybe a dramatic or a stupid or a simple or a funny, but essentially an action movie.

Whatever it is I saw it, it did not feel like a movie. The story is simple and straightforward (though the prologue tries to make it seem complicated). Take three interest groups: 1) the government 2) the rebels 3) a group of assassins.

Now pull the first one (they never appear in the movie). Then let one of the assassins, the princess, become a villain on a revenge journey. Add a rebel love interest with a bad conscience. And you have the ingredients.

But they still did not make it into a story or a movie. Between some random action sequences and some strange visuals trying to make sci-fi a low budget, all that remains is a sense of emptiness. The movie just does not feel like a movie, but a weird, disconnected, boring dream.

Me.

2/10

summary: In 1895, in a small town ravaged by the Mexican Revolution, the revolutionary leader Aguila and his men massacre the town's locals and the military garrison soldiers.Ten years later Aguila,now a reformed priest, sees a newly-arrived woman who is looking for those responsible for murdering her husband. The town is run by the corrupt Don Carlos who promises to help Alvira find those who killed her husband,in return for the gold reward Alvira is offering. Don Carlos has no idea where Aguila is or what Aguila looks like but he's prepared to do anything in order to collect the gold reward offered by Alvira. Everything is complicated by the sudden arrival of the Mexican Army led by a brutal Colonel whose face looks very familiar to the town priest.
translation:
This British-Spanish co-production is one of the countless films filmed in Spain following the unexpected phenomenal success of Italian spaghetti westerns and, as is typical of such genre aspirations, an eclectic mix of established and emerging genres has international stars: Robert Shaw, Telly Savalas, Stella Stevens, Martin Landau, Fernando Rey, Michael Craig, Al Lettieri, Dudley Sutton, Antonio Mayans, etc. Ironically, however, this disjointed confusion of a film serves as a shining example of why the most American of all film genres became a dying breed in the 1970s and is today practically (or is that officially?) extinct.

I really wanted to like this movie, not only because the Western one of them is my favorite kind of movies, but also because it had all qualities, including a fascinating premise to be a good one - whole not to mention the fact that my dad made a paperback copy of the novella by A TOWN CALLED BASTARD after his original relailability! As it is, the film's only virtue (if you can call it that) is its eccentric nature: Stevens, who plays a widow in revenge on the man who betrayed her revolutionary husband, sleeps in a coffin (!) in a carriage driven by her silent servant (?) Sutton; Savalas, as a bloodthirsty defector, who seems at first glance to be the main villain of the film, is sent by his own henchman Lettieri very early in the picture; the villain of the play then turns out to be Landau, who in the very first scene of the film will plunder side by side our legendary hero, who has become a priest Shaw; Fernando Rey, who plays a blind pawn, is the only one who can identify the rebel Shaw, who ends up with only one front for ... well, forget it! As you can see, the plot is very confusing and it gets weirder and weirder! The production team responsible for this film was also behind other Western costumes in the same period as CUSTER OF THE WEST (1967), BATH MAN'S RIVER (1971), CAPTAIN APACHE (1971) and PANCHO VILLA (1972).

summary: A counterterrorism specialist is assigned by the President to track down a terrorist who is suspected of planning to set off a nuclear device in the U.S.
translation: Overall, the movie was pretty good, a good action plot with a fair amount of explosions and battle scenes, but Chuck Norris did almost nothing except disarm the bomb and shoot some characters. The film was very similar to the events of September 11, when a bin Laden-style terrorist sent a video to the president (Urich) and threatened to detonate it. Judson Mills had some great action roles, eliminating Rashid's team and various kick-butt roles, but Chuck Norris was missing. Judson took over most of the action, leaving Joshua (chuck) with Que on her computer. But on the whole it was realistic and not lacking in the action, only by Mr. Norris. I gave the movie 7/10.

summary: An anthology film retelling the story of the famous Studio 54, a hot disco hangout for the social elite of New York. The movie follows several characters at once, some of whom are in desperate straits and on the verge of crashing.
translation: What a waste! This movie could have been a decent one, but writing is particularly crap, and the main characters are rather superficial and uninteresting. Mike Meyers was good and the historic recovery of decadence in the late 70's was well done, but overall this movie was a huge waste of time. Instead you can see the film, which deals with similar topics and the same basic time frame, the big BOOGIE NIGHTS.

summary: After several years apart, old friends Nina and Michael reunite in Germany, accompanied by Michael's associate, David. The three decide to take a weekend trip into the woods to escape the stress of their lives and relax for a few days. Unfortunately, the woods are inhabited by a long-forgotten family of cannibalistic mountain people - and these three look like the perfect meal.
translation:
A group of friends face a family of vile cannibals as they camp in the beautiful German countryside.

The concept of the mutant cannibal family is almost as old as the hills that the inbred freaks often call home, so any director who tries to breathe new life into the genre, have to come up with something special to impress. With Barricade Timo Rose tries to give the well-worn routine a Teutonic twist by transplanting the plot to the Black Forest and giving her the German low-budget splatter treatment. The result is a very bloody but totally unoriginal effort that is made almost unimaginable thanks to some terrible directing decisions - especially the incessant use of fancy filters and irritating editing techniques.

Had Timo Rose decided not to use every trick his editing software offered, and then perhaps Barricade had been a pretty entertaining Glefest: his inexperienced troupe was doing reasonably well. the bloody effects are suitably gastric vertebrae; and there are a scare or two and even some well thought out scary moments. However, all of this is completely destroyed by the terrible camera work, the restless editing and the overwhelming flood of visual gimmicks that give the film the desperate look that is so inexplicably popular with today's filmmakers.

I'm giving Barricade 3 out of 10 for the weird Gore, which has a nifty scene where a guy needs to drink acid, lots of nasty wounds caused by a lot of spicy gadgets, and some pretty proper shotgun damage.

summary: An American of German descent arrives in post-war Germany 1945. His uncle gets him a job on the Zentropa train line as a sleeping car conductor. The American's wish is to be neutral to the ongoing purges of loyalists by the Allied forces and do what he can to help a hurting country, but he finds himself being used by both the Americans and the influential family that owns the railroad. After falling in love with the railroad magnate's daughter, he finds that he can't remain neutral and must make some difficult choices.
translation:
EUROPE (CENTROPA) is a masterpiece that gives the viewer the excitement that must have come with the birth of narrative film almost a century ago. This movie is really unique and a brilliant work. The camera work and the editing are brilliant and in combination with the narrative trends of alienation used in the film creates an uncanny and unforgettable cinematic experience.

The participation of Barbara Suwkowa and Eddie Constantine in the cast are two guilt feelings to be seen and enjoyed. Max Von Sydow offers his great voice as a narrator.

A unique movie! Four stars (highest rating).

summary: Roddy is a decidedly upper-crust "society mouse" who lives the life of a beloved pet in a posh Kensington flat. When a sewer rat named Sid comes spewing out of the sink and decides he's hit the jackpot, Roddy schemes to rid himself of the pest by luring him into the "whirlpool." Sid may be an ignorant slob, but he's no fool, so it is Roddy who winds up being flushed away into the bustling sewer world of Ratropolis. There Roddy meets Rita, an enterprising scavenger who works the sewers in her faithful boat, the Jammy Dodger. Roddy immediately wants out, or rather, up; Rita wants to be paid for her trouble; and, speaking of trouble, the villainous Toad - who royally despises all rodents equally, making no distinction between mice and rats--wants them iced... literally. The Toad dispatches his two hapless hench-rats, Spike and Whitey, to get the job done. When they fail, the Toad has no choice but to send to France for his cousin - that dreaded mercenary, Le Frog.
translation:
Oh, if only I could give this garbage less than a star! There were two slightly amusing parts in the whole movie and that's it! one was where one or two lines from the song Do not Worry, Be Happy were sung by the slugs and the other was where Roddy fell off the toilet roll and fell apart with his feet and legs so that everything else he landed on The way down hit him in the groin. That's it, there was nothing funnier than that, at least not for me! Doctornappy2 is not right to say that "fans of the completely terrible" Shrek "may have fun, but" Wallace & Gromit "fans will probably turn away in disgust." As I loved Shrek 1 2 and 3 and I also love Wallace and Gromit. You see what it's all about, that if an animation is done well, it's definitely worth seeing, but as good as possible it was not possible! The continuity errors were too big. Some were pointed out by the creators of this site, others were not. I will not point out all the others, but here are a few more to see: When the young daughter goes to the beginning of the movie, the hook comes to the cage door and the hook to the right of it clearly goes behind the round button, making sure that Roddy does not come out and he just does it by just stepping on it. At one point the ruby ‚Äã‚Äãfalls on Roddy's back and is pushed straight into the air by Rita during the entire time the ship is moving forward. In the next scene, Roddy caught it again. That's impossible. As the ship moved forward, the only place where the ruby ‚Äã‚Äãwas thrown out from behind Roddy's shirt was the only place he could land, in the water, not in Roddy's hand. There was a third thing I wanted to point out, but at the moment I forgot it.

Too many, for lack of a better word, "jokes" were repeated in one way or another, there was not enough time to make any kind of connection with any of the characters that were characters hollow, shallow and empty, and the whole movie left a want to see ... 85 minutes of everything else! Drying colors or growing grass are two excellent options!

summary: A psycho who has contracted AIDS blames women for his disease, and begins to stalk and kill beautiful girls.
translation: Few films have left me with such a sense of unrest, and that is not a compliment. Having seen it in a theater (How it ended there, I can only wonder), I was exposed to 90 minutes of hateful, diverted garbage, the main impression was a bit like this other sick movie "Do not answer the phone" - but worse , The wickedness of everything, rape and everything, is shown without any distance (as opposed to strong stuff like "The Last House on the Left") and utter contempt for the (perfect?) Victims and all involved, leaving the viewer like one Man being treated sadistic voyeur. In the end I wanted to take a shower. No credits for the director

summary: The sexy, evil scientist Doctor Humboldt is attempting to resurrect an Ancient Egyptian king named Thotep in order to start the Fourth Reich. The only ones able to bring the mummy back to life are Professor Cleve and his daughter Kristen, whom Humbolt tries to seduce for the incantation. She fails and forces the girl to revive the creature. Now Kristen has to combat it and Humboldt's henchmen in a hail of bullets, leather and skin.
translation: This movie is not for the weak or weak heart. It could not decide if it would be porn or legitimate. It was not one. It was just bad. There was nothing in this movie that made me want to see something different made by these people again.

summary: The aftermath of a high school shooting leaves Deanna Cartwright seriously wounded and nine others dead, including the perpetrator. Det. Martin Van Zandt is assigned the unenviable task of investigating the crime and finding someone to hold responsible. His attention settles on Alicia Browning, a darkly troubled outsider who, as the only person present throughout the entire incident, is both the key witness and a possible suspect. Further complicating her isolated existence, Alicia's high school principal compels her to pay a reluctant visit on the still-hospitalized Deanna. Privileged and popular, Deanna differs dramatically from the alienated Alicia. Yet, beneath an upbeat appearance, she is struggling desperately with the emotional and physical scars left by the attack. Over the next few days, united by nothing more than their common suffering, the two young women form an unlikely friendship to cope with the tragic events that threaten to overwhelm them.
translation:
This is one of the most amazing stories I have ever seen.

If this film had been staged by Larry Clark, then this story about a school shooting would probably have been shown through the eyes of the killer and whatever brought that person to go crazy, instead it focuses Act mainly on the consequences of a shootout in school, and how it affected the victims who survived.

I had seen Busy Phillips in other films before, but her performance in this film is by far her best. The only other movie I've seen with Erika Christensen is "Swim Fan," which made me almost not want to watch this movie, but it did a great job on its own.

This is one of The few films I have seen have made me cry. Trust me when I tell you, that does not happen very often.

Home Room is a beautiful movie, and that's all.

summary: Dr. Bill Cortner has been performing experimental surgery on human guinea pigs without authorization and against the advice of his father, also a surgeon. When Bill's fianc√©e Jan Compton is decapitated in an automobile accident, he manages to keep her brain alive. He now needs to find a new body for his bride-to-be and settles on Doris Powell, a glamor model with a facial disfigurement. Jan meanwhile doesn't want to continue her body-less existence and calls upon the creature hidden in the basement, one of Bill Cortner's unsuccessful experiments, to break loose.
translation:
A scientist and his girlfriend are on the road when his speeding causes a car accident. He escapes unhurt, but she is beheaded. He saves her head, brings him to his house and keeps him alive (!!!!). Then he looks for models and strippers for the perfect head. His crippled assistant watches over the head, which begins to speak and has a telepathic (or telepathic) connection to a deformed monster kept in the closet.

As you can see, that's pretty stupid stuff, but I had a penchant for it. When I grew up in the late 1970s, a local television station showed this movie about 20 times a year (without exaggeration). They always showed it on Saturday afternoon TV - uncut. The television was great! Explicit blood and blood, along with a gruesome monster and greasy sexploitation - who cares if it was good? Now I see how bad that is.

The acting is absolutely pathetic, the production values ‚Äã‚Äãare nonexistent, the script is pretty stupid and (aside from the still rather nasty Gore) is the dull stuff. There is also a slight cat fight between two women and the admittedly big monster at the end. Also add an end that leaves many loose ends. On the one hand, this is an interesting example of an exploitation film of the 1960s. On the other hand, it's utter garbage. Anyway, it's not a good movie, but a must for horror and gore fans.

Also the laugh of the head is pretty scary. Remember the end credits that misinterpret the TITLE (call it "the head that would not die")!

summary: A remake of the television series, Matthew Broderick stars as Gadget, who suffers an accident at the beginning of the film, and befriends Brenda, a robotic surgeon who repairs Gadget so that he can defeat the villain Claw. In the meantime, Gadget and Brenda fall in love.
translation:
I really wanted to like this movie - the filming locations were mainly filmed in Pittsburgh and the trailer had wonderful photos. But even for a filmed cartoon, it was a really bad movie. The continuity and the pace were just terrible. The best parts of the movie are under the credits, so it's worth it (almost) to endure it to the end (although, oddly enough, it picks up in the last half hour).

If the best performance in a Andy Dick movie is, you know there must be a problem ...

summary: The story of the FBI unfolds through the eyes of one of its agents. During his career he investigates gangsters, swindlers, the klu klux klan, Nazi agents and cold war spies.
translation:
Marvelous James Stewart, Vera Miles vehicle. What makes this historic FBI-related movie so good is the family element portrayed in a film by Stewart over a 35-year career.

The film shows a story of the big investigative authority. These are plane bomb attacks that kill Indians in Oklahoma for real estate purchases to combat organized crime, Nazis and Communists in that order. The human element is never far behind, as Stewart marries Vera Miles. They raise 3 children as Miles' heart goes out every time Stewart places the order.

Look for a short but memorable performance by Murray Hamilton. Years later, he appeared as Mr. Robinson in 1967 "The Graduate".

The film has nothing but praise for J. Edgar Hoover. He certainly brought the FBI on par. Right, this could be considered as right-wing propaganda, especially with Stewart's real republican views, but it's well done, historically informative, and the view of the family so well represented.

summary: Det. Sgt. Mark Dixon always wanted to be something his old man wasn't: a guy on the right side of the law. But for a good guy, he's awfully vicious. After several complaints over his roughing people up, his boss, Insp. Nicholas Foley, demotes him. Foley tells him he's a good man, but needs to get his head on straight and be more like Det. Lt. Thomas, who has just gotten a promotion. Meanwhile, Tommy Scalise has an illegal dice game going and is looking to make a sucker out of the rich Ted Morrison, who was brought in by Ken Paine and his beautiful wife Morgan. She figures out too late her husband is using her as a decoy. Paine strikes her when she refuses to play along. The chivalrous Morrison intervenes but Paine knocks him out cold. That seems to be the worst of it, but later it turns out the guy is dead; and Paine looks guilty. Soon Dixon has fallen in love with Morgan - but not before losing his temper again and committing a terrible deed that he tries to cover up. Morgan's father...
translation:
Dana Andrews features "Where the Sidewalk Ends" in this 1950 film, which features Gene Tierney, Gary Merrill, Karl Malden, and Neville Brand. Andrews plays New York City Detective Sgt. Mark Dixon, a bad-tempered policeman who has been in trouble in the past for defeating suspects. When a man is murdered in a gambling club owned by a mafioso, Scalise (Merrill), Dixon and his partner investigate. Scalise blames the murder of Ken Paine (Stevens), who has now left the club after fighting not only with his wife Morgan (Tierney) but also with the victim. Dixon believes that the victim had won a lot of money and was consequently killed by the mobster's men. He goes to Paine and does not realize that he has a plate from the war in his head, hits him on the ground and kills him unintentionally. Now he has to cover up the murder. As a further complication he falls on Morgan; her father (Ken Tully), who went to Pinee's apartment after seeing that Paine had beaten his daughter, is being arrested for the crime.

This is a really magnificent, gritty Noir with some good performances. Robust, handsome and weather-beaten Andrews convinces as a tough, nervous detective who must always be one step ahead of his colleagues. The film reunites him with his fabulous "Laura" costar, Gene Tierney, and she looks adorable like a model with a bad taste in men who seem to be used to getting upset. She does not know, she has one more on her hands. Ken Tully does a great job as her father, who despite some damning evidence protests against his innocence. Karl Malden is very hard like Dixon's boss.

My only problem with this well-run, fast-paced and gripping movie is the end. Pure Hollywood and, if I go to Tierney's place, I doubt I would react the same way. A small point of criticism for a film by Ben Hecht and directed by Otto Preminger. I did not find it as impressive as "Laura", but there are few things in this world. If you like Film Noir, this is a must.

summary: FBI agent Wesley Doyle is startled by the declaration of youngster Fenton Meiks about how his father's delusions required him and his brother, Adam to become his 'demon-slaying' murder accomplices. But when Doyle accepts to be shown concealed victim graves, the plot twists in the present just as gruesome.
translation:
This movie is beautifully designed! There are no mistakes. Not in the design of the set, the lighting, the noises, the plot. The script is an invitation to a complex game in which the participants are on a simple mission.

Paxton is at his best in this role. His mannerisms, the infections used in the tones of his voice are without misconduct. Each shot is meticulous! Surprises arise when the film reaches its first hour. This may not be the best picture of the year, but it's a jewel that has been polished very well. It is not for the simple mind.

summary: In Manitoba, Hagar Shipley is nearing 90. She has little, she tells us, but her memories. Over several weeks, during which she runs away from her son and daughter-in-law who want to place her in a nursing home, returning to the small town where she grew up and the now-derelict farmhouse where she was married and raised two sons, we follow Hagar in the present and in memories that trace her childhood, marriage in defiance of her father, and later losses. She's fiercely even foolishly proud. Can she make peace with anyone she loves, or is she left to rage against the dying of the light?
translation: I saw this movie recently in Winnipeg - fitting, given the location that was used. I read Lawrence's book for the first time in the 1970's, and for me it has always been a very powerful picture of the trials of aging in our society. It resonated when I was young, and it resonates even more. When the movie came out, I wanted to see if the story could survive. and was thoroughly impressed, especially with Ellen Burstyn's performance. She manages to give us a perfect human being, even though the character is generally moody and judgmental - someone you do not want to live with. It's great to see your favorite characters come to life so authentically.

summary: Chaos unfolds as Tom is roped into being a pallbearer (and delivering the eulogy!) by the mother of a recently deceased "friend" from high school that he just can't remember. In the meantime, an unrequited love from high school (NOT the dead guy's girlfriend) reappears in his life.
translation:
... you can not shove her away because she's old; and if you were charitable, you might say that the lumbering walk she's with is not really her fault. However, under these circumstances, it is often difficult not to get irritated if you pull your heels behind you. So it is with "The Pallbearer", an attempt to do something "different" with a romantic comedy, which in this way is mainly hamstrunged, because the scene is all wrong; So to speak, as if you were showing off your 'breakdance' skills at the funeral of a grandparent.

To further expand the metaphor (perhaps unwise!); Like the old lady, you feel so much in the making of the film that your demise can not be far away. Certainly, this particular "death" tormenting tormenting and slowly breaks our small reserves of empathy in tiny small steps, how depressing we come to the realization that the process goes in one direction only: Downhill. His arduous attempts to show "humor" can be seen a mile away - again, not unlike the grim inevitability of death!

Back to the picture of "Drag Heels", the main character, Tom It is shown that he is constantly repeating this action throughout his life. If there are actually degrees of "pathetic", then this juice may be a few notches in front of Floater's other - more famous - role. To be in the embarrassing situation of associating public sympathies with a character even more 'unsuspecting' than Ross is certainly a difficult question, even as a 'capable' comedian like Swimmer, but I think he can fool himself in the first place Point to serious "echoing" situations.

How will he ever escape his most famous portrayal when selecting screenplays in which the characters could be almost "interchangeable", even if the situations are not? A man with a long high school crushes on someone he has not seen in years. Sounds famous ...? Paltrow is nothing but mild in her "Rachel" role, but anything that goes over old ground might be forgivable if the noticeable differences were not so inappropriate. Unfortunately, the romantic element is so worn out that it is worn out, and the "backdrop" is so inappropriate that it seems best to describe the resulting film as something "stiff" ...! 10.2.

summary: While practicing motocross in Hawaii, Sean Jones witnesses the brutal murder of an important American prosecutor by the powerful mobster Eddie Kim. FBI agent Neville Flynn persuades him to testify against Eddie in Los Angeles. They board the red-eye Flight 121 of Pacific Air, occupying the entire first-class section. However, Eddie dispatches hundred of different species of snakes airborne with a time-operated device in the luggage to release the snakes into the flight with the intent of crashing the plane. Neville and the passengers must struggle with the snakes to survive.
translation: I would rate that negatively if I could. I did not expect much in this movie, but I was unbiased. The whole thing is stupid! The snakes are obviously wrong and the first two things they bite are a boob and a guy Johnson. Oh how original; If I was a 12-year-old boy, I could laugh about it. I have no idea how this movie became so popular. Seriously, the worst thing I've ever seen. I was not entertained, it was not funny, I was not even bored! I was nothing. It was not so bad, it was good, it's just bad. Actually ridiculous. Please do not waste your money on this movie. Do not even rent this movie. No idea how it is rated that high.

summary: An intended rape victim manages to escape from her attacker but leaves her purse behind. Worried that he may visit her house and finish what he has started, she contacts the police but they are unable to help, saying that she has no proof. "If he calls, let us know and we'll send a man round!" A fat load of good that would be. Her worst fears are realised when, alone one day in the house, her attacker visits and attempts again to rape her. Circumstances allow her not only to resist the attack but to turn the tables and lock him away. And that is where her dilemma really starts. Does she release him and risk another attack? Does she go to the police and risk being called a liar? Or does she kill him - and become as low as him?
translation:
I loved this excellent movie. Farrah Fawcett played the role phenomenally and with a good heart. She plays a woman who is driven to extreme measures to protect herself and her friends after being attacked by a stranger. After being rejected by the police, she realizes that she is alone.

One day, when she's home alone, the stranger breaks into her house and attacks her again. Unable to call the police or get him out, she is forced to spray into his eyes and hold him in her fireplace.

I think there is a wake up call for the laws of the country. They are too easy for these criminals. It's time for tougher penalties.

summary: A young boy dies from a stray bullet during a shootout between a cop and mob family member who had previously been supiciously given probabtion, only to break its terms. New York's Deputy Mayor, Kevin Calhoun starts digging for information.
translation: After working in Downtown Manhattan, often having lunch in the park near the Town Hall during the summer days, I saw the mayor come and go. It was great to be able to go over the town hall doors and see what the lobby and the entire building looked like. Al Pacino, (Mayor John Pappas), "Gigli", 03, has shown an outstanding performance throughout the picture, especially as he delivered a speech in an African American church to a young boy who was killed. John Cusack, (Deputy Mayor Kevin Calhoun), "Runaway Jury," 03, was a devoted servant of the mayor and worshiped him in everything he tried to accomplish. Bridget Fonda, (Marybeth Cogan), begins to fall in love with Kevin Calhoun and gives a great supporting role. Last but not least, Danny Aiello (Frank Anselmo), "Off Key", "01, played a mafia boss who had to make some very difficult decisions at the end of the picture! Great movie with great acting and fantastic photography in NYC!

summary: Emily Crane is fired after refusing to give names to a 1951 House Un-American Activities Committee, and takes a part-time job as companion to an old lady. One day her attention is drawn to a noisy argument being conducted largely in German in a neighbouring house, the more so since one of those involved is her main senator prosecutor. Starting to look into things, she gradually enlists the help of FBI officer Cochran who was initially detailed to check her out. Just as well when things turn nasty.
translation:
Watching beautiful women sneaking around, policemen and robbers playing is one of the most delightful guilty pleasures the medium of film offers me. So The House on Carroll Street was not a waste of time, though the story was invented and the script was uninspired and somewhat irritating.

There are many allusions to various Hitchcock images, not least the choice of Kelly McGillis in the lead role. She's disguised as Grace Kelly, and she's not far from the mark. Not at all. But her character does not convince. As presented to the public, she should be someone with political beliefs and a purpose in life. After all, the film is about a clearly defined period, true events and a specific problem. But in the first few minutes, the story devours into a horrific crime story with incredible coincidences, high predictability and a series of two-dimensional characters. This is all the more regrettable as the performances of the actors are good, as well as the photography and stage design.

The final at Central Station in New York is breathtaking. It starts in the underground section and then moves to the roof. The film can be praised for its good use of the architecture.

summary: Chance, volition, and the large effects of tiny causes swirl through Paris on a single day. A clerk born 11 March 1977 hears her horoscope on the way to work: today she'll meet her true love, but she must be patient. Before the day ends under a full moon, twenty lives intersect time and again in unpredictable, connected ways: a jilted lover holds a souvenir pebble, a stolen coffee maker looks suspicious at a Metro stop, a yellow rain slicker is passed on as a gift, lettuce causes a bicycle accident, a leaf betrays an habitual liar who's just told the truth, and an Algerian waiter, also born 11 March 1977, sees a bug cross a tablecloth. Magical sand from the Sahara is in the air.
translation:
For me, this review may contain spoilers, but I like watching movies with NO idea what's going to happen, so I think many of the other reviews here of this movie contain spoilers!

I just watched this movie again, and I have to repeat that it has the best ending for any movie. Ever. Ever. Ever. The true translation, "The Beat of the Butterfly Wings," is strangely not used as a translated title. I suppose they thought most Americans would not know what chaos theory is (except for those who have seen or read Jurassic Park). The film is based on chaos theory and how a small event affects the outcome of seemingly unrelated events, all of which are traced back to an event. The movie is a whirlwind of miraculous cause and effect as we follow the chain of chaos as it traps between several characters (about 20?). In a sense, the end seems inevitable, but if you think about it, it's a perfect ending. Think of yourself: "What else should be said?" It is also a very courageous ending. Too bad we have to go overseas for a jewel like this, but an end like this would NEVER come from Hollywood.

summary: In his first independently produced feature film Buster tells of love and romance through three historical ages: the Stone Age, the Roman Age, and the Modern Age.
translation:
The first time I saw Buster Keaton's first feature film, and I have to admit that I liked it a lot and just wish I had stumbled upon it years ago. The Rohauer blurb warns that 1954 three-aged nitrate pressure was rediscovered and salvaged just in time for incineration, and many frames that appeared to be hopelessly stuck together were severed. Well, it's rocky in some places, but I've seen much worse and survived.

It would have been OK, like the 3 short films, but as an interpretation of intolerance it is inventive and witty from the beginning. The end: In the Stone Age with Baddie Wallace Beery riding an elephant and Goodie Buster riding Pet brontosaurus; In the novel Age Buster, who rides a car with wheel locks and is adapted for sledging, No Parking Sign in Latin; In this technological age of speed Need and Greed, his car falls to pieces on the first hump. Both he and Beery are after the girl through the centuries, a never-ending quarrel. Favorite piece: As a caveman, he is thrown back over a cliff edge, but still a kiss on the camera - an amazing second or two!

Great stuff that affirms my love for silent movie comedy.

summary: Elisabeth and Simon have been deeply in love for two months when Simon momentarily dies, but comes back to life. Simon does not want any further medical tests, but the couple are forced to grapple with the possibility of his death. They eventually tell their close friends J√©r√¥me and Judith Martignac about the event. The Martignacs are both clerics, and Judith has just been giving a funeral service for a villager who committed suicide, though J√©r√¥me would have nothing to do with suicide...
translation: Master cin√©aste Alain Resnais likes to work with the actors who belong to his family. Also in this film we see Resnais' family members such as Pierre Arditi, Sabine Azema, Andr√© Dussolier and Fanny Ardant dealing with serious issues such as death, religion, suicide, love and their overall impact on our daily lives. The formal nature of the relationship shared by these people is obvious, as even friends, they address themselves with a formal one. In 1984, while L'amour √† mort, Resnais dealt with time, memory and space to unlock the secrets of a fundamental question of human existence: is love stronger than death? Sixteen years ago, in 1968, Resnais made a similar film Je t'aime Je t'aime, which also dealt with love and memories. The message of this film is loud and clear: true and deep love can even shame science dead love their lost lives back and let the doctors look after their reputation. L'amour a mort is like a game that is not at all didactic. It is a film in which the music is in perfect tandem with his pictures of the reasons why this film is easy to understand.

summary: Anna is becoming lost in the loneliness of her own world when she discovers she can visit another, a house she has drawn herself and occupied by a young disabled boy. But as she discovers more of the links between her fantasy world and the mundane present, she is drawn only deeper into a dream turning into a nightmare.
translation:
This was a disappointing horror movie about a snotty young girl and her nightmares. For a horror or "thriller" movie and hype, it's way too tame. There are only a few tense moments here, not as many as it should have been for a movie of this genre. Even these "tense" scenes were not much. The music made them more dramatic than they really were.

There is a lot of symbolism here, so the elitist critics call this "horror movie of a thinking person". Well, if they think about it, they will surely come to the same conclusion I made - a waste of money in the video library.

Summary: A yawn who offers a disadvantageous protagonist and generally bad acting. Far overrated and certainly not what it is advertised.

summary: nan
translation: Bette Midler is divine again! Reasonably humorous. In love with Burlesque. Can either make you cry with old jokes with new clothes or just old songs with more power and punch than ever before. All in all, singing new ballads, power singing of the good old / perennial like "The Rose"; "Stay with me" and yes, even "wind under my wings". The best way to appreciate Divine Miss M has always been liberating - since this is the next best thing, I recommended everyone with a mix of big-eyed enchantment and appreciation for adults and the childish desire to cross all boundaries!

summary: Joanne, Patty, Brian, and Craig prepare the old dorm building to be torn down. They are pursued by a serial killer with a wide range of murder methods, ranging from power drill to industrial steam cooker. Is it that spooky weird guy John Hemmit killing off the incidental characters, or is it someone/thing even more terrifying?
translation: I've heard so much about this movie that it was a great slasher and one of those early '80s movies the fans of most Slasher movies had to die for. Well, I've rented it and I have to say that even though it caught my attention for most Slasher movies like "April Fools Day", "Friday 13th." and "Prom Night" has kept, this movie could have been right up there with the above just lacking real enthusiasm and potential from the characters as well as the ongoing story. Characters that I unfortunately found in this movie were the guys with the frizzy hair who crawled around in the dorm and of course led to its true climatic role when confronted with the killer. Another would be the dirty, shabby guy with the denim jacket, he could have played more roles in this movie that would have made the movie more interesting, instead the movie played this guy as another loser out there making unknown phone calls while he sleeps with his girlfriend and then his part falls and cuts him to the end, which was a waste, I was disappointed in his role in the end. As for the true identity of the killer when the identity was published, who I was, I just laughed, but it was all too obvious and he really made a true idiot out of himself as well as an annoying character after his true intentions were revealed. This movie should be one that at least once watches out for all Slasher fans but does not spend their hard-earned money on it in a rare, hard-to-find collector's inventory.

summary: The film takes place in three bathrooms. Two of them are side-by-side and the third sees the two right across the street. In these 3 places, 3 different couples and a young voyeur boy (actually an art student who researches for a project) are described in stories. At the core of these stories there are determinations of the nature of men and women, marriage and betrayal.
