The music is excellent from the deceased R.D. Burman, whose last score was "1942 - A Love Story". During the filming, Dev Anand Panchamda (R.D. Burman) asked to compose something special for this film. Days later, Panchamda returned with the composition "Dum Maro Dum". The song was an instant hit.

summary: Adam West and Burt Ward are taken on a crazy adventure when the Batmobile is stolen from a car museum and they must track down the thief and return it. After solving a puzzle, they realize that the clues to finding the fiend who stole the Batmobile are hidden in their past. During the search, they flashback to their three seasons in tights, including their many sexual escapades. Ultimately they find the Batmobile, but get caught in the villain's lair. Tied to dynamite, will Adam and Burt get out in time? Tune in next time...same bat time...same bat channel!!
translation: This is one of the best reunion specials ever with Adam West and Burt Ward parodying and having fun. It's amazing how much effort was put into the details, especially the 1960s feel, the Batcave set, Wayne Manor, the costumes and the actors chosen for the younger versions of West, Ward, Burgess Meredith and Cesar Romero were and Frank Gorshin! These 90 minutes are worth your time and a treat for all fans of the classic "Batman" television series from the 1960s. I find that clips from "Batman" are from the movie, not from the series itself, probably due to legal restrictions. Let's hope that the three seasons of the show will be released on DVD.

summary: Ukrainian Archbishop Kiril Lakota is set free after twenty years as a political prisoner in Siberia. He is brought to Rome by Father David Telemond, a troubled young priest who befriends him. Once at the Vatican, he is immediately given an audience with the Pope, who elevates him to Cardinal Priest. The world is on the brink of war due to a Chinese-Soviet feud made worse by a famine caused by trade restrictions brought against China by the U.S. When the Pontiff suddenly dies, Lakota's genuine character and unique life experience move the College of Cardinals to elect him as the new Pope. But Pope Kiril I must now deal with his own self-doubt, the struggle of his friend Father Telemond, who is under scrutiny for his beliefs, and find a solution to the crisis in China.
translation:
I saw this whole (very long) movie because I was fascinated by sheer stupidity and naivety. It seems hard to believe that so many famous people (Anthony Quinn, Lawrence Olivier, John Gielguld, Vittorio de Sica, etc.) willingly participated in this farce. But maybe in 1968 people were really so naive? The story seems to have been written by a confused Latin American Marxist priest with an agenda. There is a superpower conflict and the Russians are actually the good guys, and the Secretary General of the Communist Party is a nice and spiritual man who suddenly sees the light after 20 years and has to calm his guilty conscience by releasing a prisoner priest from a Siberian gulag. The priest then promptly becomes a pope by a series of coincidences. We are allowed to see the secret Vatican papal election process, presented in the most pious form you can imagine.

Meanwhile, the communists in China have reached the usual socialist economic miracle of the starving half of their country to death. To solve this little hiccup on the relentlessly shining path to communism, they want to start a nuclear war (to distribute the western capitalist riches rightly to the poor workers of China).

Our good old Comrade General Secretary gets a bit worried and calls on the Pope shortly before his coronation to ask him to mediate peace. They meet with Chinese leader comrade Peng, who looks and behaves like a 15-year-old boy. They will roll to the ground and laugh at how the Chinese believed the Chinese in 1968. Comrade Peng demands that Western capitalists pay (which is perfectly logical, capitalists do not always have to pay for the insanity of the Socialists?), And that the Pope must also sacrifice something for the common altruistic cause of equality and social justice.

When the Pope is crowned in Rome, he promises all the wealth of the Catholic Church worldwide to feed our poor Chinese brothers in Christ. And so he saves the world from the nuclear holocaust.

Apart from that, there are also some smaller sub-plots that, unfortunately, do little to redeem this incredibly bad movie. I would give it three Oscars for stupidity.

By the way, Anthony Quinn seems unlikely as Pope. He is much more plausible than Zorba the Greek.

summary: After countless millennia of watching, waiting and stalking, the unholy creatures known as werewolves are poised to inherit the earth. After newswoman Karen White's shocking on-screen transformation and violent death, her brother Ben is approached by Stefan Crosscoe, a mysterious gentleman who claims that Karen has actually become a werewolf. But this is the least of their worries... To save mankind, Stefan and Ben must travel to Transylvania to battle and destroy Stirba, the immortal queen of all werewolves, before she is restored to her full powers!
translation:
Terrible horror sequel to "The Howling". This begins with Karen White's funeral (she was killed at the end of the first movie). Stefan Crosscoe (unfortunately Christopher Lee) comes there and tells Karen's brother Ben (Reb Brown) that Karen is a werewolf. He goes to Transylvania to kill Striba (Sybil Danning), the head wolf. Ben and a colleague of Karens (Annie McEnroe) join him.

A horrible screenplay, bad direction, awkward editing and really horrendous drama by Brown and McEnroe single-handedly sink this one. The werewolf effects are usually kept in the dark - for a good reason! They are terrible when you see them. Below average special effects too - though I liked the cartoon flash coming from Danning's fingers. There is also a werewolf orgy that is especially stupid and Danning takes at least EIGHT TIMES during the credits!

There are a few good things - I found the village in Transylvania amusing - it looks like it's from a 1930s Universal horror movie! There are interesting camera ticks between transitional scenes; Brown and McEnroe have good bodies and Lee and Danning are good at it - but they can not save it. Really - WHY did you do that? Where do you hard for money ??? This is one of the least rated movies by IMDb. That alone should tell you something. Supposedly Danning was horrified when she saw the movie - I understand why! A must.

summary: When two sisters inherit their family castle, a string of murders committed by a mysterious dark haired woman in a red cloak decimates their circle of friends. Is the killer their ancestor, the "Red Queen" whom legend says claims seven lives every hundred years?
translation:
An old family story, told by two grandmothers to two young girls, comes to life 16 years later.

People are being murdered and blood is spilling and rats are running around everywhere and naked bodies are enjoying it.

Kitty (Barbara Bouchet) is the suspect, but we know she is not the killer. Is it Franziska (Marina Malfatti)? Is it Evelyn back in revenge for death? Is it a conspiracy to steal an inheritance? The color is outstanding in this thriller by Emilio Miraglia, who, as far as I know, has just made another giallo.

The only thing that spoiled the movie was the impression that several frames were cut out. Someone calls the police and suddenly they try to rescue Kitty.

summary: An eccentric toymaker's last wish is that his brother takes over the running of the business. The brother is a military General, and is out of touch with toymaking, and out of touch with reality too. The business should really have been given to Leslie, who was much more like his toymaking father. When the General starts making weapons instead of toys, Leslie decides to take action.
translation:
You will receive a gift. It is exquisitely packed. The box is handmade from the finest wood and shows skill down to the smallest detail. This is then wrapped in beautiful paper, handcrafted and hand-painted by the most talented artists. The whole thing is wrapped in ribbons of fine silk lace. It is an unforgettable sight.

Then you cut the ribbon, take off the paper, open the box and find ... nothing. This is toys. Either you enjoy the packaging or forget it.

The movie is not without meaning: war is not a good thing. Well, that is not original! The moral is so obvious that it is almost embarrassing to point it out. And even this faint insight is undermined by a story in which elements of war - especially war toys - are clearly a bad thing until they need an exciting climax and the movie simulates a war with innocent toys. It's like someone preaching a serious, condescending sermon just to say, "Just kidding."

But even as an empty box, the film can not be watched closely. Yes, it is a sight with some remarkable, eye-catching pictures. The sets are imaginative and the cinematography captures the colorful scenes with skill. But the pictures are cold and emotionally sterile. As with the script, the look of the film is joyless and sometimes aesthetically unfruitful and surreal. It is a film that wants to praise toys as a wonderful and special thing, and yet shows that they are creations of a world that is empty and cold. The movie wants to be sullenly funny, but the humor is forced and artificial. Robin Williams, the beleaguered heir of a toy-making empire, throws his ad-lib shtick, who seems alien to the bizarre, cold-structured world he inhabits. In fact, the thematic references and tasteless sexual allusions that are scattered throughout are contradictory to the childish fable that the film attempts to be vague. For this movie to work or make sense, it must be located in its own universe, Oz, far from Kansas. Every time the jokes push us back to reality, the toy land of the movie increasingly becomes an obvious illusion.

It is said that this was the favorite project of director Barry Levinson, one he was aiming for for ten years. It's very obvious why he had trouble getting support. Like most animal projects that are eventually made (RADIOLAND MURDERS, RADIO FLYER & BATTLEFIELD: EARTH are great examples), it seems to be a blind spot in the filmmaker's field of vision. Maybe Levinson TOYS steered and directed so many times in his head that he did not get a new vision for it when he finally got on stage. He had already perfected it to death.

Many of the toys shown in the movie are clumsy, mechanical, catching monstrosities. That's the movie itself.

summary: Life in the Chicago projects is never easy, However, the Evans family never gives up trying to make the best of things. While Florida and James struggle to provide for their family, their sons J.J., an aspiring painter, Micheal, the undying political crusader, causing trouble while their sister, Thelma, stands between them as the voice of reason. Living in the same building were Willona Woods, Florida's best friend from High School who provided support, love and gossip and Nathan Bookman, the overweight janitor who gave them grief and was the butt of alot of fat jokes, especially Willona who often referred to him as Buffalo Butt or Booger. Life, at least, is never boring while they fight to keep their heads above water and one day leave the projects, which they did in the series finale. Sadly, it was without James who was killed off in the 4th season.
translation: I would like to know why John Amos left the show and how did he die from the show? I could not relate to everything, but sometimes they encountered the problems they were facing. By the way, did they ever get out of the ghetto? I think the black Jesus episode was my favorite. We saw that they had some good times. something they did not often have. I wish they would bring the show back. During the day, people can actually stay up and watch. I do not think a movie or a new show would work. Especially without the original cast. They are really what Good Times GoodTimes did. These are my questions and comments. Thank you!!

summary: Signing a contract, Jack Torrance, a normal writer and former teacher agrees to take care of a hotel which has a long, violent past that puts everyone in the hotel in a nervous situation. While Jack slowly gets more violent and angry of his life, his son, Danny, tries to use a special talent, the "Shining", to inform the people outside about whatever that is going on in the hotel.
translation:
The Shining, do you know what's funny about this movie? This is the movie everyone for people who claim to dislike horror movies always say that The Shining is a terrific movie. This is Stanley Kubrick's classic vision of Stephen King's horror story of Madness and Blood. This is just an incredible movie and you've seen it or not, you've heard of it, know a few lines and know some of the classic pictures. Who could Jack's "Here's Johnny!" To forget? Who could forget "All Work and No Play Making Jack a Dull Boy"? Who could forget this frosty end? This is the movie that is memorable and, in my opinion, Kubrick's best work. I know that there is a lot of controversy in this department, a lot of people say it is 2001: Space Odyssey or Clockwork Orange or even Dr. Strange, but if this film pioneered film production, then The Shining perfected it. This is the story of isolation, madness, terrible imagery and the ultimate ghost story that will crawl under your skin.

Jack Torrance, Jack's son Danny and Jack's wife Wendy arrive at Overlook Hotel on the closing day. The older African American cook Dick Hallorann surprises Danny by telepathically speaking to him and offering him an ice cream. He tells Danny that he and his grandmother shared the gift; they called the communication "shiny". Danny asks if there is anything to fear in the hotel, especially in room 237. Dick tells Danny that the hotel has a certain "shine" and many memories, not all good, and advises him to stay out of the room all circumstances. Danny's curiosity about Room 237 finally comes over him when he sees that the room has been opened. Danny is hurt and visibly traumatized after Jack tells Wendy that he loves his family. Wendy thinks that Jack has abused Danny. Jack wanders into the hotel's Gold Room, where he meets a ghostly bartender named Lloyd. Danny starts frantically calling the word "Redrum" and scribbles it on the walls. He goes into a trance and withdraws; he now says that he is Tony, his own "imaginary friend". Jack sabotages the hotel radio and interrupts communication from the outside world, but Hallorann has received Danny's telepathic call for help and is on his way. Wendy discovers that Jack has written endless pages of the manuscript in which he repeats "All work and no game makes Jack a dull boy", which are formatted in several ways. Terrified Jack threatens her and she knocked him unconscious with a baseball bat and locks him in a pantry in the kitchen. Jack talks to Grady through the locker door, which then releases and releases it. Danny wrote "REDRUM" in lipstick on the door of Wendy's bedroom. As she looks in the mirror, she sees that "Murder" is written backwards. Jack picks up an ax and starts hacking through the door that leads to his family's living quarters. "Here's Johnny!", And Jack's legendary image is born.

The Shining is one of those films that you have to look at seriously, this is an incredible movie and still gives me nightmares. Jack Nicholson's performance is timeless and unforgettable. But one thing I also feel is extremely overlooked is Shelley Duvall, her scene, finding Jack's swear word All Work? It's unbelievable, it's a horror expression and you can see that fear in her face after realizing that her husband is crazy. Another unbelievable scene is when Jack sees a ghost woman in the bath, it's one of the dreadest scenes in the horror movie theater. The reason this movie is so well-known is that it's a film of perfection, it was on the Simpsons, it was shown in other films and it's a movie that will stay with you forever when you see it , trust me.

10/10

summary: A hungry little pig eats a couple of pies off the windowsill. When it's time for dinner, he ties together the spaghetti of all the other little pigs and eats it all. That night, he has a nightmare where he is force-fed by a mad scientist.
translation:
Regardless of what the title implies, "Pigs Is Pigs" is not under Porky Pig. Rather, it shows a young pig with an appetite more insatiable than John Belushi's "Animal House". His mother scolds him repeatedly, but it does not do well. So much so that he goes to another house where a deranged scientist nourishes him more than any ordinary mortal (but in the end there is a surprise).

I would say this cartoon looked like a placeholder between the really great cartoons (Daffy Duck made his debut three months after the show). But do not make mistakes, they are doing some nice things here. The whole force-feeding sequence seems to be more relevant today, given the obesity epidemic that is overtaking our country.

Not the best cartoon, but worth seeing.

summary: A homicide inspector -- Lindsay Boxer -- who teams with three other professional women to catch an ingenious serial killer targeting newlyweds on their wedding nights. But while Boxer is trying to solve the biggest case of her career, she is also falling in love with her partner -- and privately waging her own battle with a life-threatening illness.
translation: This movie is supposed to take place in and around Seattle. Which, why is Porteau Cove P-R-O-V-I-N-C-I-A-L Park shown? Provincial Parks are in Canada, and not in the United States. The inspector uses a Palm Pilot with pen to read that someone has hacked into the bridal shop computer. I did not know that this was possible with a database storage device. A woman appears in the movie without introduction and is never presented. We find out halfway through the movie that this woman works in the prosecutor's office. Then, in the correctional facility, a guard Jenks actually comes through a door and keeps his back to the culprit !! This would NEVER happen in a real correction situation. The director has really messed up - that does not happen in real life. The action is appropriate. The property is good. The camera is good. The many mistakes in continuity, however, lead to a 3 out of 10 votes.

summary: Made for television version of the Charles Dickens classic of the same name. Ebenezer Scrooge is a hard-nosed, single-minded businessman in Victorian London. He has no friends, has disowned his only living relative - his nephew Fred Holywell - and generally treats everyone he meets with extreme contempt. He hates Christmas, only cares about making money and only gives his clerk, Bob Cratchit, the day off. However, he is taught the true meaning and spirit of Christmas by three ghosts who show him his own past and present. He is also shown what the future holds for him after his death if he doesn't change his behavior for the better.
translation: and possibly closest to the story of Dickens. Although I find the young Ebenezer hard to see (who thinks the hair of the period, surely they could have done better!), Scott does an incredible job as Scrooge. His delivery of a few lines from Dickens eventually brought it to life for me. Edward Woodward is everything we expect and more of the spirit of the Christmas present. I find G.C. Scott's Scrooge is much more of a credible miser than the more recent version of Patrick Stewart. The scene Christmas morning, when Scrooge realizes that he has not "missed" it, is enough to convince one that Scott knows how to act against transposition. He is phenomenal here. Almost the entire cast is incredible. Little Tim in this version of The Christmas Carol is a bit hard to see, almost too cute. Nevertheless, the music and the landscape is a must for every holiday. Enjoy!

summary: It seems everyone is trying to get into heaven; at least those whose time is up. For Lance Barton, a struggling comedian and bicycle messenger, it's the last thing on his mind. His due date upstairs is 50 years away. In the meantime, he's got big dreams to pursue on Earth, such as landing a slot at the final Amateur Night Contest at the famed Apollo Theatre. Lance's has one little problem though - he ain't that funny. Thanks to an over-cautious emissary from heaven, Mr. Keyes, he's going to get hit (literally) with a much bigger problem. Showing that even God has difficulty finding good help these days, the inept minion mistakenly plucks Lance from a traffic accident - before it takes place. Transporting him to the Pearly Gates, or more accurately, the velvet roped-lines of the hottest club around, the error is finally addressed by Mr. King, the streetwise, no-nonsense head angel who manages the place from his plush windowed office. Since returning to his own body on Earth is ...
translation: Down To Earth is the best movie !!! It's SO fun and it's also very cute. It has a good plot and it is unique. It's not like those movies that are identical to the similar storylines, and it's not all comedy and no story. This movie also has a very good ending.

summary: A programmer who's working with the secret EWS computer system at a military air force base is threaten by foreign agents, along with his family. His only chance of rescue seems to be the war veteran Haglund who is a leader of a special taskforce.
translation:
The words "Swedish" and "action movie" do not mix. This becomes more and more obvious with every attempt of the genre. This is another failed attempt.

Lasse Brunell (Shanti Roney) works at a military airfield with top-secret computer systems. One day foreign criminals threaten to hurt his family if he does not do as they say. They want the secret equipment and will do anything to get it.

This movie has its ups and downs. And there are usually no "ups" in Swedish action movies, just downs. So I think something in this movie showed some quality. At the beginning of the positive comments I can mention that the film is technically well done. The images of planes and helicopters are well shot and look very good. The spectacle is of very different quality. Shanti Roney does a decent job, while Maria Bonnevie is as always stiff and unnatural (I wonder how long Swedish directors will continue to use her, even though she has the acting skills of a wooden plank?). Stefan Sauk is laughable as the "cool" special-force man who comes to the base to investigate.

And what about the action scenes? Well, as I said above, the air and helicopter flights are nice. But apart from that there is not much to talk about. And that's a common problem with Swedish action movies. There just is not enough action. Maybe it's a budget problem, maybe it's movie culture. I do not know, but it negatively affects the experience. Because honestly, the story and the drama are not good enough for this movie to rely on.

I rate this 4/10 as an expense.

summary: Christy Brown is born with cerebral palsy to a large, poor Irish family. His mother, Mrs. Brown, recognizes the intelligence and humanity in the lad everyone else regards as a vegetable. Eventually, Christy matures into a cantankerous artist who uses his dexterous left foot to write and paint.
translation:
At the time, "My Left Foot" was the little movie that could do that. It was very popular, and everyone applauded the fact that such a small, independent film could make it to the Oscars.

Films like "My Left Foot" have since become a dozen So it could be difficult to understand in retrospect what the fuss was all about. It's certainly a well done and competent movie, but it's clear that the bulk of the success lies on the shoulders of Daniel Day-Lewis, who takes on the role of Cristian Brown, a man with cerebral palsy. Day-Lewis pulls off the same stunt show that Dustin Hoffman had earned an Oscar the year before for playing a man with autism in "Rain Man", and the Academy followed Day-Lewis with the same honors. >
The only thing that separates this movie from a big Hollywood production is just that - its budget. In every other respect it is just as formulaic as any standard product. That does not mean it's not a good movie, but it's not a masterpiece.

Note: A-

summary: On the Franco-Austrian Frontier during WW I, an oriental priest, chaplain of a French colonial regiment, is condemned to life imprisonment because he possesses the power of turning men into zombies. As the priest,in his prison cell, is preparing to burn the parchment containing the location of the secret formula, Colonel Mazovia kills the priest and takes the partially-burned parchment. Fade to after the war to an expedition of representatives from all the Allied countries (only those with colonial interests it appears) being sent to Cambodia to find and destroy forever the Secret of the Zombies. The group includes Colonel Mazovia (somewhat akin to sending the fox to guard the hen house); a student of dead languages, Armand Louque; Englishman Clifford Grayson; and General Duval and his daughter Claire. Armand falls in love with Claire, who accepts his proposal of marriage in order to spite Clifford whom she really loves. Later, when Claire, following an accident, runs to Cliff for ...
translation: Knowing how old a movie is should prepare the viewer for some things, and with these things, the movie may be more bearable. So it was when I saw revolt of the zombies. The heavy dependence on boring dialogues and cheesy movements should be expected, as well as the primitiveness (or absence) of special effects in those days. It requires a lot of the viewer's imagination - maybe too much, in this case. And the plot is not easy to follow: some zombiefied Southeast Asian soldiers carried out during World War I very admirable. Although skeptical, why, if that's true, the explanation should remain out of the wrong hands, so, a group goes to investigate archaeologically. The key to remote hypnosis is learned by an expedition member who uses it, inter alia, temporarily to renounce the banquet for which he has the cravings. To prove his love for her, he gives up everything he should not have done. If they are all undefeated, many want to kill him so he never controls them again. Below average, even with caution. Recommended for only the extremely patient.

summary: Alice and Darlene, best friends, decide to take a trip to Thailand to celebrate high-school graduation. While there, they are befriended by charming Australian rogue Nick Parks. Nick convinces them to take a weekend side trip to Hong Kong, but at the airport, they are busted for smuggling drugs. They are convicted in a show trial and sentenced to 33 years; in desperation, they contact Yankee Hank, an American lawyer based in Thailand who has been reported to be helpful if you've got the cash.
translation:
A very good story for a movie that, if done right, would be pretty interesting, but where the hell is the end of this movie?

In fact, what's the point of it?

The achievements of the cast are questionable, if not credible.

Did I miss the conclusion somewhere in the movie? I think we have to wait for the sequel.

summary: Because boxing is a considered an illegal and disreputable enterprise in 1880's San Francisco, wealthy and influential members of the prestigious Olympic Club vow to make the sport a "gentlemanly" one. They sponsor a brash, extroverted young bank clerk named Jim Corbett, who quickly becomes an accomplished fighter under the new Marquis of Queensbury Rules. Despite his success, the young Irish-American's social pretensions and boastful manner soon estrange him from his benefactors, who plot to give their conceited former prot√©g√© a well-deserved comeuppance. Despite this, his dazzlingly innovative footwork helps him to beat a succession of bigger and stronger men, and he finally finds himself fighting for the world's championship against his childhood idol, John L. Sullivan.
translation:
Detached from James J Corbett's biography "The Roar Of The Crowd," Gentleman Jim is a wonderfully airy image that epitomized not only the rise of the pugilistic whistle-blower Corbett, but also the wind of change in boxing around the 1890s.

The story follows Corbett (a perfectly casted Errol Flynn) from his humble beginnings as a bank clerk in San Fransico, to a fortuitous fight with an ex-boxing champion, who eventually leads him to fight against the fearsome heavyweight champion, John L Sullivan {Beefcake, personified by Ward Bond}. Not all fights are in the ring tho, and it's all the spin-off vignettes in Corbett's life that make this a great entertaining image. There are class problems that need to be overcome here (played perfectly by other club members who are paid to have one or two hooks), and Corbett not only has to fight to get respect from his so-called peers but he has to also overcome his ego as it grows as fast as its reputation. Along with the rather wonderful Corbett family and all their stoic, humorous support, Corbett's journey is as thrilling as it is joyous, yet as outrageous and daring as he is, he is a very likable character, and it is a character who stands for the buzzword suitable moniker he has from gentleman Jim.

The movie does not stop for a moment, and it's a testament to director Raoul Walsh that even though we're waiting anxiously for the final fight, the outer ring keeps us entertained, not even the love interest sub Action violates this picture {thanks Alexis Smith}. The combat sequences are really good, and they perfectly show how Corbett became champion. His brand of dance rings around rackets is now firmly anchored in the boxing history. As the final roles roll, we all come down to earth because a match-up meeting between Sullivan and Corbett brings all the brutality into context, and here humility and modesty become the absolute winners and as far as that onlooker goes .... ........ I'm sure, 9/10 for a really wonderful picture.

summary: A famous opera singer, Giorgio Fini, loses his voice during an American tour. He goes to a female throat specialist, Pamela Taylor, whom he falls in love with.
translation:
Some time ago, there were different types of films. These different films co-existed, although everyone had something else to offer ...

That may seem obvious at first, but I thought I would point it out during this review because it looks like if some people might have forgotten it. This is just a funny movie for Pavarotti fans. That's all. It does not claim to be something different or something bigger. People who mock it as something that lags behind a promise, do not see the whole picture - literally. After all, Hollywood is always making films that are shameless vehicles for people (bodyguard or The Preacher's Wife with Whitney Houston are two examples that come to mind.) First, I want the movie as a vehicle for Pavarotti. There are worse things in this world - and worse movies. The vocals are fabulous and the selection of arias is fun. The film begins with Schubert's Ave Maria and then Leoncavallo's Matinatta. Pav sings arias from La Gioconda, Manon Lescaut and Turandot, but also sings popular music such as "I left my heart in San Francisco" and the song that was nominated for an Oscar and Golden Globe "When we were in love" w / music by John Williams & lyrics by Alan & Marilyn Bergman - all 3 previous Oscar winners.

The story is not that bad. It was built for Pavarotti, so of course it will not be something profound or universal for the average viewer. It is the story of a famous opera singer who was traumatized years ago by a bad opera night. When he is asked to sing again in the same place, the "MET" in New York, he loses his voice out of fear. Doctor Pamela (or Pah-MAI-lah in Italian :)), played by Kathryn Harrold, gives him a chance to heal his psychosomatic response. He offers her the chance to have an affair with him, and she reluctantly accepts.

They start an affair, they know that he is married and promises not to fall in love with him and he thinks she will be just another woman. In spite of everything, they fall in love (the song "IF we're in love") and with their help, he overcomes his fear and goes back to the MET, where he triumphs. I will not say how it ends, but it's pretty predictable. Which is not always bad.

The services are not that bad. Pavarotti (who plays Giorgio Fini) is not an actor, so if you're expecting a performance by Spencer Tracy or Tom Hanks, you're being fooled, not Pavarotti. He knows that he is not a theater player. What he is is sweet, charming and charismatic. He's having fun himself, and if you can just have fun, it's not so bad. A funny line is when he tells Pamela (Harrold) that she's a "thirsty plant, Fini can pour you!" and of course she says, "I do not want to be watered by Fini!" Kathryn Harrold is very sweet and does a good job as a half-jammed woman learning to live a little from this extravagant man. One of my favorite lines in the movie is, "Life never has to be life-size." And there's Eddie Albert doing his good job as finis manager. There are several "yourself" cameos of real conductors, singers etc and it is filmed on site at the Metropolitan Opera at the Lincoln Center.

If you like opera, if you like Pavarotti, or if you just let yourself go and enjoy a "little fling", as he suggests in the movie - then you can enjoy this movie for that , I know, I do it EVERY time. :)

summary: Luc Devereaux, the only surviving member of the original Universal Soldier Team. He now works with Dylan Cotner, on a project to create and improve a new Universal Soldier. Their plan is for the Universal soldier or UNISOLS to be controlled by a computer they call SETH. When the government decides to terminate the project, which includes shutting down SETH. SETH, not wanting this to happen, takes steps to prevent this. He first kills Dylan. He then has himself transfered into a body. He then seeks out Luc Devereaux, who is the only person who knows the code that will stop his program from being deleted. So he sends out all the UNISOLS to get him. Luc must try and stay away until SETH program is deleted. But SETH has targeted his daughter as possible leverage.
translation:
I tried to watch this movie twice and both times I still could not make it to the credits. For the first time I could get through the first fight sequence and then lost interest. The second time I've been able to force myself to digest more than an hour of precious shabby drama, lame SFX and extremely bad directing. Pales compared to the original.

Has anyone ever heard of the old ET Atari 2600 fiasco? For those who did not let me in. It's 1982 ... ET is one of the biggest blockbusters of all time ... Atari decides to release a movie tie-in game on her 2600 home console system. To make a long and financially painful story short, the game flopped a lot and caused thousands and thousands of Atari 2600 ET games to be dumped because they could not even sell or even sell them.

What did Universal Soldier: The Return have to do with this story? Look at the 3.2 rating and find out for yourself.

Terrible movie ... IMDb forced me to give it a 1 out of 10 because its rating systems are not as low as 0, let alone negative ones.

summary: nan
translation: Although not in the full movie, Andy Griffith plays his best role in this CBS TV movie again. The plot is simple - Griffith's character dies and his last wish is that his wife and children dispel his ashes is the place he called (Mountains Somewhere). Although never seen on TV and never released on video, if you get the chance to see it - TAKE IT.

summary: No sooner does Italian-American widow Loretta accept a marriage proposal from her doltish boyfriend, Johnny, then she finds herself falling for his younger brother, Ronny. She tries to resist, but Ronny lost his hand in an accident he blames on his brother, and has no scruples about aggressively pursuing her while Johnny is out of the country. As Loretta falls deeper in love, she comes to learn that she's not the only one in her family with a secret romance.
translation: I'm really surprised that this movie did not get a higher rating for IMDB. It's one of those movies that can easily come from someone, but for the romantic comedy "Moonstruck" is really in a class of its own. It's attitude and ethnic charm are things that people take for granted. The casting alone makes it a near-perfect movie. Some movies in the 1980s were as good as "Moonstruck" and it's funny too. **** out *****

summary: A remake of the classic 1963 movie "The Haunting" about a team of paranormal experts who look into strange occurrences in an ill-fated house. Through the course of the night some will unravel, some will question, and all will fight for their lives as the house fights back.
translation:
The version of "The Haunting" from 1963 has been one of my favorite horror movies for years, so I expected the release of this remake in 1999 with some trepidation. It hardly seemed that succession could surpass or even reach the original masterpiece. Unfortunately, my worries were justified: This film stinks.

I do not know what people thought in this movie. Jan De Bont, who seems to have had a random mistake in directing the excellent "Speed", is doing (or worse) just as badly as with the much acclaimed duds "Twister" and "Speed ‚Äã‚Äã2: Cruise Control". "Hey Jan, stay with the camera, would you? Liam Neeson is adequate in his role as a doctor pretending to be a sleep psychologist - I do not think he's capable of doing a really poor job - but even he does Can not Save a Lazy Script and Weak Story Catherine Zeta Jones proves again (as she did in Entrapment) that she lacks the theatrical ability to rise above the material she is given. which was great in an episode of "The X-Files," looks lost here as Eleanor, a sleepwalker hovering on the edge of reason, and this blonde guy, whoever he is, is more wooden than the ridiculously funny ones Statuettes of children carved into the woodwork around the house, I do not think that he changes his expression throughout the film.

(SPOILERS AHEAD)

The reason why the first fil What worked so well is that we were never sure whether the house was really haunted or whether the manifestations were a consequence of Eleanor's precarious state of mind. In the original there are no ghosts left to the imagination - a hallmark of other great horror movies like "The Changeling" and "The Blair Witch Project". Of course, in this updated version, we get tons of CGI ghosts that make the film completely unscientific (given the weak script / plot). The f / x are not even that great, considering they were made by ILM. The frozen breath looks particularly wrong. The effects in the underrated Peter Jackson movie "The Frighteners", which I have just seen, were much better. The wood carvings of the kids, who are supposed to look scary, just look silly (especially when they scream), and the CGI monsters are nothing to write home about. Instead of offering a relief from bad acting, bad direction and bad writing, the effects only add to that confusion of a movie.

Some particularly stupid scenes: When the three other characters break into Eleanor's bedroom and none of them seems to be surprised to find a huge, sinister demon hovering over the bed. The scene in which Eleanor "sees" the former mistress of the rafters is particularly theatrical. And last but not least, the unintentionally hilarious piece in which Wooden Blond Guy utters an uninspired scream of what is to be perceived as fear jumps onto a piece of furniture and begins to hack the image of the old, bad boy's house. We actually have some satisfaction in this scene. Seconds after his assault, Blond Guy is dragged to the fireplace by the old man's ghost and immediately gets his head cut off. It was the only part of the movie I enjoyed.

In summary, stay with the original 1963 "The Haunting". 3/10 stars.

summary: A high school outcast who lives in a trailer with his mother finally meets a friend. He wants to ask her if they can go the next step, but then sees her kissing another boy at a party. He runs home only to find his mother having sex with a drunk. He starts yelling, but is countered by the drunk when he suffocates him and makes him look like he hung himself. The scarecrow comes in when the boy's soul is pushed into it. He goes out for revenge.
translation:
Wow, what can I say about this movie? It's a lousy crap. I am surprised that it was rated so high. What's up with this movie? Here's a better question: what's wrong with this movie.

The story itself is just crap and clich√©. Here is just about everything that's at stake ... Any Nerd child without friends is picked, killed, and comes back as a scarecrow for revenge. "All" of it is in 86 minutes worthless film. If you have not seen this movie, do not waste your time seeing it. The second one is not much better either, so do not worry too much ... I rated this movie in three because I liked the scarecrow outfit, not because there was anything good about the movie. I think you get the picture.

summary: The Jews of Poland (invaded by Germany in 1939) are depicted as filthy, evil, corrupt, and intent on world domination. Street scenes are shown prejudicially, along with clips from Jewish cinema of the day and photos of Jewish celebrities, while the narrator "explains" the Jewish problem. The climax and resolution of the film is Hitler's 1939 announcement that the Jewish race will meet its "annihilation" (Vernichtung).
translation: This should be a documentary? I've seen it (which is banned in Germany) and I have to say it was the worst documentary I've ever seen. It is nothing but a big lie from beginning to end. Who can doubt about this garbage that all Jews in the concentration camps should be killed?

summary: A multi-volumed documentary mini-series, "The World at War" covers the entire history of World War II from the causes of the 1920s to the aftermath of the Cold War in the 1950s. Emphasis is also placed on several inside story episodes, where events are covered which occurred inside Germany and Japan such as resistance to Hitler, life in general under a dictatorial regime, and particular emphasis is focused on the Jewish Holocaust.
translation: If you want to know everything about WWII from different perspectives, then you are guaranteed to learn new things, so you do not need any other documentation on this topic. Get this, look at it, learn from it. Good for school use. As a bonus, watch this with Tora Torah, Private Ryan, Patton, Band of Brothers, A Bridge Too Far, The Longest Day, and other WWII epics along with this one to further your knowledge of World War II. Sir Laurence Oliver's voice contributes to the overall atmosphere of each episode of this 26-part series. Seriously, you will not find a better WWII documentary on the subject. PERFECT 10 !!!

summary: A security operative battles hijackers on a cruise ship.
translation: Van Dien must be embarrassed by the embarrassment of this silly movie, as every single one of them must do. To be honest, it is rather embarrassing to admit that I have seen it from beginning to end. The production values ‚Äã‚Äãare somewhere between the original series of "Crossroads" and "Prisoner Cell Block H". Most five-year-olds would be able to develop more realistic dialogues and plausible action. When it comes to acting, if you can imagine the most fucking porn you've ever seen - one of those where the action is lined with an endless "story" to explain how a pouting old peroxide blond water heater came to life Being spit-roasted by a couple of guys with mustache - you'll have an idea of ‚Äã‚Äãthe standard of acting in "Maiden Voyage". Worse, you can not even rush to the sex scenes because there are none. A terribly horrible movie.

summary: Japan's number one extreme reality show is having it's first all-American special! Six lucky contestants, chosen from thousands of applicants, will have the chance to win millions of dollars, and all they have to do is stay alive!
translation:
I could not help but think beyond the mask: the rise of Leslie Vernon (an incredibly much more impressive film) when I look at this because of the realistic feeling and the great innovative idea. that could have been a BIG movie. the acting is fine ... by some of the actors. from others ... it's terrible.

Apart from that, the idea is great and the format is great. The story is also pretty good, though she often suffers from big strikes on the logical mind.

Forget that, though right? After all, it's a horror movie.

I really want to see this remake ... I really want it to be the awesome movie it wants to be.

However (and you can not really blame the heads behind the movie for that) this is obviously built on a budget budget. and the FX have totally damaged the movie.

great movie. ... if you would swap for slightly better acting and slightly better FX.

Whoever wrote it should go on, great idea here.

summary: A collection of skits that make fun of television. Everything from commercials to the nightly news are spoofed. Chevy Chase makes a brief (as well as his debut), appearance.
translation:
When I heard how funny this movie is, I finally borrowed it in the video store and for 75 minutes I might have laughed three times. This

movie, a collection of skits making fun of television, is an incredible mess. The jokes fall flat, the humor deals with topics from the 1970s that are simply no longer relevant, and the jokes go way too long (almost like new) SNL skills the

in recent years ). Yes, Chevy Chase is in this but maybe of all

about 1 or 2 minutes. I liked the fact that this was very dirty and had nudity in abundance, but could not it be funny?

summary: "But if you forget to come back for Madame Zeroni, you and your family will be cursed for always and eternity." Those were the exact words spoken to young Elya Yelnats the day he forgot to repay Madame Zeroni. From then on his family was cursed with bad luck. One hundred years later Stanley Yelnats IV is accused of stealing a pair of cleats from a major league baseball player and sent to Camp Green Lake (a dry lake bed in the middle of the desert). It never rains at Camp Green Lake, it hasn't for one hundred years. The secretive and mysterious Warden has each inmate spend every day digging one hole to "build character." But when an artifact from the famous "Kissin' Kate" Barlow is found in a hole, the Warden forces the boys to work double time leading Stanley to deduce they're digging because the Warden is looking for something. But what? And how is the mystery of Camp Green Lake connected to Stanley's family curse?
translation: Loved the movie. Loved the two families crossing paths in the story. The only question is if Sam will be killed then. What's next? He is Madame Zeroni's son and Zero is supposed to be related, but no other children? Hmmmmmmmmm. Never mentioned other children or wife before he talked to the teacher and fell in love with him? Maybe she had a child before she kissed Kate Bandit? Even with the mistakes in the movie. Just loved it. The acting was great. Not sure where the story was with Sir, who in the end is Marion a woman, makes his character even funnier. The other "counselor" seemed worried about the kids, but not so much of course. Poor Warden must have had a really stinking childhood to be so mean when she grew up.

summary: A secret Service agent and a news reporter investigate the conspiracy behind the assassination of the President.
translation: This movie looked good - good cast, evergreen theme and an explosive opening. From there it went downhill. Why was it filmed with the handheld camera? It trembles, trembles, part captures scenes and simply confuses the viewer. A bad choice indeed. As if that were not enough, the worst editing in memory will take a stunned viewer - obligatory, if you want to make any kind of enjoyment out of it. And then it commits the worst of all sins. After leading the viewer to exhaustion in all sorts of unlikely and implausible scenarios, they roll off credits without revealing the resolution - the end - the payoff - how the hell was the motive? How can you succeed by making thrillers without end? Do! This movie was promising and ended up in the mud with a facial plant. What a waste of effort. Bad performance by author and director.

summary: An old German mine was split in two after the end of WWI because of where the new border was located. In the French part a fire breaks out; the German miners send a rescue group in, helping their French comrades. Three old German miners, who were not treated friendly at a French inn the night before, start their own private rescue through an old tunnel that separated the two mines. Will the official rescue party realize there are others left behind in time to save them?
translation:
Sentimental and naive, but undoubtedly poignant, emotional man-helping-man plea, in this case personified as German and French miners forced to separate after the First World War by a new frontier, which led to disappointment on the German side, like the French are the bosses. But when a fire starts on the French side, the general decency of the German men leads to help, security and even friendship. This was a request that would fall on deaf ears within the decade, as a certain man of Pabst's own side would break this piece and make the First World War a mere prelude. But it is obvious to me that Pabst really believes, or at least hopes, for this fundamental humanism, since this film radiates with this optimism, while his rather frivolous, cynical adaptation of the Threepenny Opera did not have the necessary bite to make this work work. His sincere belief is the fact that the characters here are not simplistic mouthpieces for positions, but real people, with real families whose lives we also know at home. These are ordinary working-class men who simply believe that it is important to care for and treat their fellow human beings, and on this day of individualistic opportunism, I will take some action in my action to get a positive message a perspective that I think we can all aspire to.

(Note: Apparently the ending is cut on most of the prints, where the French rebuild the Mine Gate and the men re-close a brutal turn of events, and may have made the movie a better overall movie, but I would complain about nursing the positive vibes of the last sequence, so I'm glad it was cut off.) {grade: 8/10 (B) / # 7 (of 11) of 1931}

summary: In 1840, a samurai comes home to find his wife in bed with another man, so he kills them both and then himself. Flash-forward to the present day, and an American family of three moves into this since-abandoned house and starts to experience incidents of haunting and possession.
translation: This is a spoiled movie. The actors seem to know how bad it was. It starts badly and is really bad in the end. Acting is miserable. The script could be written on the spot. And although the movie is a horror movie It has no scary scenes. Crap 1 out of 10

summary: A famous surgeon gets into a coma after a car accident. Seven years later, he wakes up as a mutilated monster and starts a massacre.
translation:
This infamous end of Koen Wauters' career became known to me through the 'Night of Bad Taste'. Judging by the commentary index, I was not the first and I'm not the last person in Western Europe who learns that this musician (no doubt one of the best in our contemporary pop scene, even the Dutch agree) is trying to be an actor , Whether he should have made the attempt or not can not be judged.

In 'Intensive Care' he is quite sympathetic, but he seems to be uncomfortable with the band he is attending. Nobody can blame him. It deserves its ranking in Verheyen's Hall of Fame by all means and standards. The story of the murderous maniac, who is said to have died in an accident but is alive and wrathful, has been told dozens of times, and even without original twists, a director can provide a more than mediocre story through innovative settings and cinematography />
IC teamed with a hospital wing and a few middle class homes. The tempo is boring. The suspense lightens the credibility of the score, as each occurrence of the killer is accompanied by a boring, threatening melody, followed by orchestral outbursts during the murders, which are widely proposed and at least as bloodless as a small budget , The sex scene is free, but not in the least appealing. The couple from Amsterdamned could have done it though. When dealing with the couple theme: the whole subplot between Wauters and the girl does not work. A more effective emotional connection could have been established on the screen if it were only for future fellow human beings relaxing their nerves halfway through physical intercourse. I will not even give the other performers the dignity of a mention, for they should all have been broken up into tiny greasy pieces. In fact, most of them do. The ones I remember were obvious to the genre: a pretty nurse and two policemen.

Therefore, the cavalry in a slasher only comes in time to save itself. The (anti-) hero usually has to eliminate the villain by skillful thinking, because former red caps often have no roles in these films; They could overcome the illusion of invincibility surrounding the killer. Translated to the events, Wauters kills the doctor and rescues the lady in distress.

No people, I'm not done. That's not the story. Wauters makes his heroic attempt, but is beaten with a rage that comes close to "A Clockwork Orange," so it's up to the girl to pick up the drill-killer act and sting through the doctors' brains. Although this method ensures the death of the killer more than the usual 9mm bullets, the physician survives so that IC can reach the 80-minute mark.

I should have clarified my point now. Intensive Care is a bad movie that can only be enjoyed by Bad Taste lovers who can verify Vereyen's catchy statements and take care of themselves, thus trying to assert themselves. For example, the (unintentional) parody value of the doctor's clown mask (Halloween) and the final confrontation in the park (the chase at the end of the 13th Friday).

But let me conclude by giving an overview through some seedy items that give IC a bit of credit. George Kennedy is not one of them. All he has to do is bear a terrible monologue of a doctor / French actor and watch in horror as they burn him to mark his great name on a substitute. He could have played his naked gun part again, eventually ending up as a beef, but with a longer screen time. The final could be one of them. I had never seen a madman brought into his bowels by fireworks to crush him against a flexible fence. It's good for a laugh.

Call a good point about intensive care ... Koen Wauters has learned his lesson and devoted himself entirely to his musical career. I wonder how many issues of the race in Paris-Dakar he must break off before he comes to his senses.

summary: Portrait of Andy Goldsworthy, an artist whose specialty is ephemeral sculptures made from elements of nature.
translation: A new way to enjoy Goldsworthy's work, Rivers and Tides allows fans to see his work on the move. When Goldsworthy builds his pieces, he develops appreciation for every stone, leaf and spike he uses. Goldsworthy describes how the flow of life, rivers, and tides inspires and influences his work. Although I was happy that the film covered most Goldsworthy pieces (no snowballs), I feel it was a bit long. The filmmakers did a wonderful job of bringing Goldsworthy's work to life and creating a beautiful film that was a joy.

summary: Two American tourists on a romantic camping trip are brutally murdered. A few days later, during the ancient festival of Samhain, a group of American university students moves into a beautiful cottage, surrounded by a lush forest and a majestic lake They are here to learn about the rituals of the ancient Druids and other Celtic legends. But in the remains of an abandoned copper mine, lives the ancestors of an incestuous clan of cannibals. Stalked by a hulking, disfigured mutant, the students and their chaperone are in for the most harrowing time of their young lives. And keeping their heads on their necks will become their main concern...
translation: It was the worst thing I've ever seen, when someone can tell me how and why the last girl goes crazy and ends up eating the old women. why dope the movie all the cheap crazy horrors at the beginning, but when the first person dies, kill them all in 5 minutes! Most people could act, but I give so much credit to the porn stars who have done their best. It also had some fun parts and kills, as if the caregiver rips his organs out of his ass and then suffocates. if this movie had an ending, it could do so because i would have given it an 8 out of 10, but the end has not existed since then. The end sucked, but the rest was great

summary: A fey Martian commander, traveling with his faithful green dog-soldier, K-9, lands his flying saucer on planet Earth and opens his sealed orders from Commanding General E.=McSquared at Martian Headquarters: "Bring back one (1) live earth creature." Armed with his disintegrating pistol, strait-jacket-ejecting bazooka and an unquestioned assumption of his own superiority, the Martian believes he'll have no trouble. Unfortunately, the earth creature he chooses is the wily Bugs Bunny, who at first mistakes the diminutive spaceman and his companion as Trick-or-Treaters. Bugs nearly flips when he see the enormous spaceship, but quickly regains his composure and seizes control of the situation. In fact, he seizes control of the ship, making the little Martin "very, very angry indeed."
translation: Part of what was so great about the classic Looney Tunes cartoons was their disrespect and how they were not afraid to do anything they wanted. In this case, Marvin the Martian has the job to bring back an earthling. In fact, he encounters Bugs Bunny, who warns against a rebellion of Marvin's dog. After Marvin has finally caught bugs - using an Acme straitjacket - bazooka! - Bugs has more stuff planned for the return trip to Mars. What I mean, if you thought it was a big change in the solar system when they robbed Pluto of its planetary status, then you have not seen anything! Yes, "The Hasty Rabbit" gets it all out. How they buy Acme products in space is probably beyond most people, but the point here - I mean "bunny" - is to have fun. And believe me, you will definitely do it. After all, a small excursion has never hurt anyone.

summary: Valentine's Day 1988: At the school dance, geeky Jeremy Melton bravely faces one rejection after the other when asking four popular girls to dance with him. A fifth girl, plump and insecure, agrees, but they end up making out under the bleachers. When a group of school bullies catches them, the girl claims that Jeremy attacked her. This causes them to strip off his clothes and beat him up in front of the entire school. Flash forward to 2001. We meet the five girls who were in that school gym: Kate, Paige, Shelly, Lily and the formerly plump Dorothy. They are all in their 20's now and trying to sort out their love lives, which is appropriate, since Valentine's Day is coming up. After a disastrous date with a loser, one of the girls, a pre-med student, is murdered by a Cherub-mask wearing killer who sent her a death threat in the form of a Valentine card prior to the attack. After the four remaining girls are reunited at her funeral, they all start receiving threatening cards and ...
translation: Valentine is now one of my favorite Slasher movies. The death scenes are elaborate and most of the acting is good. Marley Shelton was great as a female lead (much better than Jennifer Love Hewitt in the "I Know ..." films). David Boreanaz, who is the main reason why I saw this movie, had a pretty minor role, but he played it well. The exception to the list of good actors is Denise Richards. She was terrible in it. The only scene I was looking forward to seeing was * SPOILER * her death scene. All in all, it's a good movie to watch. You should definitely take a look at it, before you look again at "Scream" or "I Know ...".

summary: Young assassins Azumi and Nagara continue their mission to prevent a civil war. In their hunt for Masayuki Sanada, who is protected by both an army and a dangerous clan, they meet Ginkaku, a person who shows a remarking resemblance with former friend Nachi.
translation:
There is no doubt that the first Azumi film was a commercial product; It was an adaptation of a popular manga and had attracted young, attractive actors and certainly was not lacking in the budget department. But it was more than just what it was, and I can not deny that I enjoyed it so much.

"Azumi 2" lacks almost everything that made the original so wonderful. The first thing that sounds the alarm bells is the absence of the great Ryuhei Kitamura at the helm. With him, he not only seemed to take on his own visual flair and kinetics, but also the original style, the beauty, and above all, his heart. While the first one had a simple "hit list" storyline, this one has a corkscrew mess of a story, with too many dull characters biting each other in the back as often as the potential for any sympathy or pathos is erased. Gone is the effective interaction of the main characters; Azumi and her cohorts are often reduced to a group of scruffy teenagers arguing in a forest. Characterization is nonexistent; If someone really cares who lives and who dies, I will be shocked. The same applies to the rogues here. The final battle - indeed all battles - is completely tension-free. The fact that they are badly choreographed and abysmally directed - not to mention a few and far away - becomes a minor matter by their own sheer futility. The rogues themselves are trying too hard to camp, and even when they're all together, they do not come in a mile of the original Pete Burnsian antics of Jo Odagiri.

## Major spoilers at the end of the paragraph! #####

Aya Ueto tries her best, but she also managed to keep her hair in good condition between films. Azumi is now a full-fledged assassin, which means she can swing her sword in slow motion; Unfortunately, the character now has a kind of man-with-no-name style puzzlement, Ueto's model looks become even more inappropriate. I know that's the point, but combined with the ineffectiveness of everyone else in the movie, the stupidity of the plot, and the general incompetence of the movie in general, it means it's impossible to get behind your character this time. The less about Chiaki said "Remember me of Kill Bill" Kuriyama performance the better; Suffice it to say that their "turnaround" from good to evil is about as subtle as napalm. Overall that was just a colossal disappointment. All merits were made ten times better in the first film. A lazy, unsatisfactory - and usually downright boring - mess.

summary: Single father Dan Burns dedicates his life to his children, but one day he meets Marie at a bookstore. They get to know each other, but then Dan finds out that Marie is actually dating his brother, Mitch.
translation: Clean family-oriented movie. I laughed, I cried ... I loved it. I was worried that I would not see Steve Carrell as something silly Michael from the office. Boy, I lied. He should win an Oscar for his performance. I will definitely buy it on DVD when it comes out. My husband enjoyed it and he is not in films of this "type". I saw it with 2 other couples in the 30 year old selection and we agreed that it was the best movie we had seen in a long time and certainly the cleanest one. Only 1 dirty word! Not even sure why it was PG13. I would recommend this movie to anyone who likes comedy, drama, romance and more!

summary: A group of flamenco dancers are rehearsing a very spanish version of the Prosper Merimee's drama. Antonio (the coreographer) falls in love with Carmen (the main dancer). Their story then turns similar to the play.
translation: Personally, I think the film was made very professional, I loved choreography and acting. The plot is also gripping and mysterious. The movie itself is very emotional, and what I liked most is that you think about it. Antonio Gades has lived his role to the very end and I have to say that it is one of my favorite pictures and Saura is a wonderful director.

summary: Car theft in Long Beach went down 47% when Randall "Memphis" Raines walked away from the life. He gets dragged back into it by assuming the job his brother Kip screwed up for stolen-car broker Raymond Calitri: steal 50 exotic cars and have them on a container ship by 8 AM Friday morning, and he got this news on a Monday. With Calitri threatening to kill him and Kip, and the police GRAB unit breathing down his neck, Memphis reassembles his old crew and attempts to pull off the logistically impossible.
translation: This film should be shown to film students as an example of what NOT to do. The original poked a big tire squealing butt, this terrible disaster breaks the basic rule of the Bruckheimer films, which is: we all know that they suck, but they have big storyline. This movie has NO ACTION. This movie is boring. Where are the cars? Where are the chases? Where is the tension? Where is the tension? Where is the hurry? From where!!?? This is not a movie at all, it is a bad commercial. 50 cars in 24 hours? That's wrong. You have 3 days to steal it, the ad is wrong. How bad is that? The wires look stiff, wooden and forced. The bad guy, the cop, the others ... who cares? They express their meaningless lines, they serve the illogical action. They scramble as best they can, as the music video director says, "Do not worry, we'll do a lot of fast cuts and nobody will notice how bad the movie is" or "we'll fix it with a lot of noise music" The "script" is not a script at all, it's more like a list of cliches with an ending that's a total rip off of: ------- warning - possible spoiler ------ 5 ---- - 4 ----- 3 ----- 2 ----- 1 ------ The refugee. The biggest crime of all is the under-exploitation of Vinnie Jones, man .... that's the baddest, coolest mofo since Jules in Pulp Fiction. And what do you do? They make him a mute who is barely in the movie! Make Vinnie the main villain and he could have saved the movie. How could they be so stupid? As? As? Why? The original movie is very entertaining with a cool trick at the end that puts the driver away. The original has a great 40-minute pursuit that delivers! Go and find the original. Or if you want a real chase, rent RONIN. The chases in Ronin have raised the bar, with which all other chases are now judged. Bruckheimer and Cage had all the money, all those resources, all that experience, and they can not even get close to a movie that was filmed for $ 250,000 25 years ago? How can that be? You feel like you're being ripped off after this movie. Once I was excited to see Coyote Ugly, Remember the Titans and Pearl Harbor, now I say God help us all.

summary: Three girls, each about 15, deal with puberty, the onset of sexual attraction, and, for two, the pressure of virginity. Marie, who's slight and diffident, quiet and nearly expressionless, is friends with Anne, who's a bit chunky and impulsive and has decided that Fran√ßois will be her first love. Watching synchronized swimming, Marie is suddenly attracted to the team captain, Floriane, beautiful, aloof, tall, and rumored to be a slut. Fran√ßois pursues her. Marie begins to hang around her; they trade favors, and soon it's an odd sort of friendship. Each of the three experiences her own first, and Marie must sort out attraction and friendship.
translation: I saw it in the cinema MK2 Hautefeuille just one night after its first public projection in Paris. A very nice movie about three 15-year-old teenagers, who all have about the same psychological levels. Many of the scenes leave us in our youth and our first feelings about sexual relations. One can imagine that the director wants to reduce the first strong sensual feelings of the girls to the lesbian, but even in this case, they do not falsify the likelihood of the story. You can sometimes find the movie a bit slow, but it creates that intimate atmosphere. I donate talent to the young actresses, a special mention to Floriane and Marie, very convincing. There are many small details, but this film has also enabled me to discover what synchronized swimming is: impressive!

summary: In the future, a kickboxer and a robot lead a revolution against ruling cyborgs.
translation:
In a post-apocalyptic environment, cyborgs led by Warlord Job curb the human population. They basically consider them livestock, because they need fresh human blood to live off it. Nea and her brother managed to survive one of their attacks when she was a child, and years have passed since she faced the cyborg again, but this time she is saved by the cyborg Gabriel, created to destroy everything cyborgs. Job and his men are on their way to conquering a metropolitan city, while Nea (with revenge in mind) asks Gabriel to train her in the way of killing cyborgs, and she will take him to Gabriel.

The cheap low-rent cyborg / post-apocalyptic foray by writer and director Albert Pyun (who previously made "cyborg" and the glowing "nemsis" in the same year) is a rather misguided chunk with some interesting news. Very little structure finds its way into the threadbare history, since the swollen writing is weak, cheesy and exaggerated. The leaden banter tries to be funny, but it stinks pretty and looks funny in the unwanted moments. Most of the actions that occur are pretty pointless and routine. The material could have used a different polish as it was an inspired idea devoured by lazy inclusions, the lack of a narrative, and an almost jokey tone. The open-end cliffhanger graduation is just too abrupt, especially since a sequel has not yet been made. Feels like it has no more money and said, "Time to pack, let's end it another day (or maybe another decade), there's no hurry." But it was quite entertaining, especially thanks to its fast pace, some well done fights, and George Mooradian's sliding cinematography, which captured the visually compelling scenery. Performances are fair. Kris Kristofferson's dry and steely personality works perfectly like Gabriel, and a confident, psychic-minded Kathy Long expertly and aggressively stuns the stunts. Her acting is too wooden. A Raided Lance Henriksen gives a delicious performance of pure ham, like the rogue cyborg leader Job, who constantly has a saliva melt. Scott Paulin also drums up a lot of happiness as one of the cyborgs and Gary Daniels pouts as well. Pyun suggests some exciting martial arts set pieces that feature eye-catching power and unnecessary slow motion. Facing the background is a burning but mechanically sounding music. The special effects and make-up FX are good enough. Monitored, but no success and minimal restrictions can be the cause.

summary: A huge Solar flare is predicted to fry Earth. Astronauts must fly to the sun to drop a talking bomb (Freddy) at the right time so the flare will point somewhere else. Giant IXL Corp C.E.O. Teague thinks the flare won't happen and wants the mission to fail so he can buy the planet cheaply while the scare lasts. Employee Haas prepares a surprise for the astronauts. While daddy Steve Kelso commands the space ship where temperatures rise, granddaddy Admiral Skeet Kelso is searching the desert for grandson Mike who's gone A.W.O.L. to say goodbye to his dad but who inadvertently crossed the path of the men from IXL after meeting desert-dweller Travis.
translation: The su * k! Why do they have to make films that they need to know from the beginning? I mean, look at Alien from 1977 onwards. If the movie you want to do is no better than anything billions of years ago, why are you doing it? I had problems with the plot and who was the main character. That's not good either.

summary: An anthology of overlapping vignettes exploring the lives of a variety of characters who happen to live in a suburbial shantytown atop a rubbish dump: The boy Roku-chan lives in a fantasy world in which he is a tram conductor. In his fantasy world, he is both the tram and the tram driver and follows a set route and schedule through the dump, reciting the refrain "Dodeska-den", "clickety-clack", mimicking the sound of his vehicle. Ryotaro, a hairbrush maker by trade, is saddled with supporting many children whom his unfaithful wife Misao[c] has conceived in different adulterous affairs, but is wholeheartedly devoted to them. A pair of drunken day laborers (Masuda and Kawaguchi) who engage in wife-swapping, only to return to their own wives the next day as though nothing has happened. A stoic, bleak man named Hei is frequented by Ocho who appears to be his ex-wife, and he watches emotionless as she takes care of his domestic chores. Shima, the man with the tic, is always defending his ...
translation:
I saw this movie for the first time as a teenager, the age when children start to think through their identity. I was deeply affected by the scene of the man and the children he is raising as his own. The oldest boy was mocked that his mother is a prostitute and none of his siblings have the same biological father (which Kurosawa makes obvious by children who do not look alike). The man still convinces the boy that he is her father by the only definition that counts. The man is celebrated by all children as a father, but one who still prefers their brother.

Each of the vignettes is also convincing for their own stories and conclusions.

It's a great movie, even if it's not the biggest Kurosawa movie.

summary: In August, 1991, Estonia reclaims its independence from the USSR and brings to its national bank nearly $1 billion in gold bullion hidden in Paris for 50 years. Russian mobsters have a bold plan to hijack the gold after shutting down the capital's power at midnight. For this they need Toivo, an electrical technician. His wife is pregnant and she urges him to take the job ("$5000 buys lots of baby food"). After Toivo leaves for the plant, his wife goes into labor. Birth and blackout happen simultaneously; the baby needs an incubator, but there's no power. Jealousies within the Mob undercut the plan's smooth operation, and soon the Mob has Toivo to deal with as well.
translation:
I saw this for the first time at a foreign film festival. It is a wonderfully nifty fingernail finger on a plot to relieve the Estonian treasury of one billion dollars in gold. It's all shot in a grainy, grainy style that Hollywood rarely uses - but it captures the atmosphere of the newly emancipated Baltic states beautifully (note: Tallin actually looked a lot less grim in 2003 than I was there). >
There is a lot of humor and also some romance. I do not want to spoil a bunch of surprising but logical surprises, so I'm going to say that this robbery movie is based on a great script, and the direction and performances are first-rate. DARKNESS IN TALLIN is simply the fastest and most nerve-wracking example of its genre - I'd do it against RAFIFI, TOPKAPI, and it's miles ahead of the new OCEAN'S 11, though (intentionally) not so shiny. RENT OR BUY NOW.

summary: Comedian Eddie Murphy brings his proudly raunchy comedy act to a sold-out stadium and pontificates in his own vulgarly hilarious fashion on such subjects as sexual orientation, puberty, dating, disciplinarian mothers, ice cream trucks, and the personality traits of certain singers.
translation: If you were ever sad that you could not get a movie on DVD, it was probably "Delirious" you were looking for. How often do you laugh when watching comedy routines? I was too young to see Richard Pryor during his greatest time, and when I was old enough to see Eddie Murphy's "Delirious" and "Raw" (not so funny), I never knew where Eddie had much of his inspiration would have. Now that I'm older and have seen both Pryor and many of the comics after Murphy, I recognize two things: All STEAL of Eddie, while Eddie is LOVED by Richard. That's the big difference: Eddie was original, funny, provocative, thoughtful? and more. He was something that had never been seen before. He was everything we ever needed. Eddie Murphy is boring and old these days? but once he was king, and "Delirious" was the largest castle ever built. Truly one of the funniest routines of all time.

summary: Holly has everything it takes to be a star; the voice, the dream and the dedication, but she lacks the means to break away from her humble Texas upbringing. Then she gets the chance to attend an art and music school on the East coast and her future suddenly looks bright. But the road to stardom is a bumpy one. She must compete with the snobby Angela for the star spot and that's the least of her troubles. Luckily, Holly has the support from her mother and her roommate Ditz who prove that being a star has nothing to do with fame and everything to do with faith, family, and friends. Before all the number one hits and the adoring fans, all she had was the dream. Inspired by the book A Mother's Gift by Britney & Lynne Spears...the story of the true meaning of being a star.
translation:
First of all, this plot is exaggerated - girl wants to make it, everyone loves her, mischievous girl intervenes, everything looks lost, girl pulls through, everyone loves her again, etc. Throw the right thing, an attractive male heroine, plus one Parents problems and it is so predictable that you can practically recite it. Second, I really hate how they continue to do classical music. You send out the message that all those who deal with classical music are jammed and stuck-up and narrow-minded - in fact, I do not remember the quote exactly, but I remember a spot in the movie, Holly says, "Why have they're so jammed ... so classic? "It's really offensive how classical music is labeled in this way. Third, I've gone through it dozens of times, but the only reason I think about making this movie is to promote Britney Spears. there is simply no point.

And oh yes, while the actress who portrayed Holly (I'm not sure if that was really her vocals or not) had a pretty good voice, it was not as amazing as it was they did it - especially when she did. She has supported all the time.

1/10 stars.

summary: Growing up as identical twin sisters, Lora and Ashley Gerritson always had a special psychic bond. When one would feel pain, sorrow or happiness, the other felt it too. While Lora left the small town that haunted her as a child to become a successful photographer in the big city, her sister, Ashley, remained to live a simple life working at the local diner with her friend Maggie. Lora's life is suddenly changed when she begins to receive chilling visions from her sister, Ashley. Something is horribly wrong...she can feel it. Lora knows she must return to the small town of her childhood to find Ashley. She begins to realize that Barry Drake, a well-loved, upstanding member of the community, may hold the key to finding Ashley. There is something dark and unsettling about him. As the visions become stronger, she feels that time is running out. Prepare yourself for a game of cat and mouse that unfolds to reveal the mystery of a sister's "Second Coming".
translation: This movie is not worth the movie it was shot on. The dialogue is flat, filled with clich√©-swept lines and delivered by lay actors who sound as if they are reading a script for the first time.
