The choppy, shaky film style is a cheap imitation of the visual effects of the "ring". The characters do not even act like a normal person. For example, who is looking for her twin sister in her house forces the character to make her way through the front door, sneaking around the house all the fear and sobbing and she once did not even call her sister's name to see if she is home. What? They would think that she had just buried her sister instead of looking for her. Far too many flashbacks to her childhood. Too many unnecessary flashbacks are a typical sign of an amateur director. It's really funny to drive the numerous shots of the woman in front of her car on the road, the driveway, around this corner, here, there, oh a side view, now a front view. Enough now. You would think you are watching a commercial for the Solaris! Terrible movie. 0 out of 100. I really regret anyone who has spent money to make or see this movie.

summary: The Cahulawassee River valley in Northern Georgia is one of the last natural pristine areas of the state, which will soon change with the imminent building of a dam on the river, which in turn will flood much of the surrounding land. As such, four Atlanta city slickers, alpha male Lewis Medlock, generally even-keeled Ed Gentry, slightly condescending Bobby Trippe, and wide-eyed Drew Ballinger, decide to take a multi-day canoe trip on the river, with only Lewis and Ed having experience in outdoor life. They know going in that the area is ethno-culturally homogeneous and isolated, but don't understand the full extent of such until they arrive and see what they believe is the result of generations of inbreeding. Their relatively peaceful trip takes a turn for the worse when half way through they encounter a couple of hillbilly moonshiners. That encounter not only makes the four battle their way out of the valley intact and alive, but threatens the relationships of the four as they do, ...
translation: Before I saw this movie, I had heard a lot about it and certain scenes in the movie, but listening did not do it for me, so I wanted to watch it and wow! Ned Beatty, Ronny Cox, Jon Voight, and Burt Reynolds provide an interesting group of people who want to have the hell on the Cahulawassee River and the unfortunate series of events that affect them all. Character development takes some time to wrap the viewer in a better understanding of each person, but eventually you know those guys as if they were your friends. The drama, the dialogue is very, very real, as close to reality as is possible for Hollywood plays. Reynold's character "Lewis" was interesting as a guy who runs very hard, but under the male veneer is a very soft and broken man (I was impressed with his performance!) Jon Voight seems to be the character most in the limelight stands. the unfortunate circumstances that seem to find him on every corner eventually shape and castrate him into another man (his character transition was excellent). Ned Beatty and Ronny Cox really seem to be the silly idiots who just joke and do not get so terribly serious if they did not, and they did ... I was really surprised at Director Boorman's vision of Dickey's novel, very impressive. You can not go all your life without seeing this movie. I give it eight out of ten stars, very impressed.

summary: On a crowded subway, Skip McCoy picks the purse of Candy. Among his take, although he does not know it at the time, is a piece of top-secret microfilm that was being passed by Candy's consort, a Communist agent. Candy discovers the whereabouts of the film through Moe Williams, a police informer. She attempts to seduce McCoy to recover the film. She fails to get back the film and falls in love with him. The desperate agent exterminates Moe and savagely beats Candy. McCoy, now goaded into action, confronts the agent in a particularly brutal fight in a subway.
translation:
In what is likely to be on my list of Fuller's best films (that is, if I see more of them, only that and Shock Corridor), Pickup on South Street is a film noir, where the Femme Fatale, as well as the male protagonist , are not the stereotypes in the genre. Like most of his other works, Fuller injected his own experiences and sense of New York style, which is usually missing in the Hollywood Noirs. With a small budget - at least for Darryl F. Zanuck - Fuller and his actors create personalities who are sympathetic even in such a dark atmosphere. The good guys are basically those who do not get violent with you, even if they're looking for an extra buck.

Richard Widmark, Jean Peters and Thelma Ritter are all terrific in the lead roles. Widmark is one of the few performers I can imagine who could really have made this character. He's a bit like Bugs Bunny, because he can be a smartass who's a bit sneaky. On the other hand, the character of Skip McCoy has a number of values ‚Äã‚Äãin his life. He does not engage in the affairs of other people and does not care about much of the world of work outside of his small hut on the river after being sent away for three years. He unknows, unknowingly, when he puts a woman (Peters) on the train and picks up an object that is under the government's eye. It could have some secrets that could turn it into a lot of money. But what is the price at the heart of the film, because it is the moderator Moe (Ritter is one of the best and most credible character actor of that time), the ex-wife (a fugitive Kiley) and the police Br /> < Apart from the thematic elements narrated with a sharp dramatic journalistic style (like Fuller's previous position, along with Boxer), the dialogue is fresh and engaging. There is a spontaneity in many camera shots of Fuller. And what a third act. This is a slim, tight film noir that's worth checking out, even if you're unfamiliar with Fuller (it's comparatively less bizarre than some of his later work).

summary: Steven is multi-talented, handsome, and a expert seducer of women. He craves intimacy with women, literally cannot live without it, and is in search of the perfect woman. All of his relationships, however, end tragically. Eventually, he meets Anne, a strong woman who is different, better than the others. However, soon it becomes clear that this is a relationship that only one of them will survive. The title refers to a quote from Francis Bacon, who wrote about crocodiles, who shed tears when they devour their prey.
translation:
Jude Law does his best in this beautifully filmed vampire movie that has little value. Totally lacking in eroticism, excitement or leading ladies with appeal. A decent fight, a few moments of mild tension. And a one-note plot.

The film becomes philisophic in a series of talks between Law's character and a dogged murder detective, well played by Timothy Spall. But despite their best efforts, both actors are placed at the cross of the banality of the film.

With a minor actor in the lead role - and without the benefit of Oliver Curtis' cinematography - crocodiles would meddle the sea of ‚Äã‚Äãlow-budget vampire quickies.

summary: Four athletically able teenagers along with their brainy friend Billy are selected by Zordon to fight the evil of Rita Repulsa, her monsters and her minions after the witch is accidentally released from imprisonment in an intergalactic dumpster on the moon. Later in the series, the rangers are joined by Tommy, the once evil Green Ranger designed for Rita's evil, but later was deprogrammed and spent two portions of the series briefly as the Green Ranger. Over time, some rangers had to pass their powers to others as well. Action scenes and scenes with Rita were edited from footage based on Japanese action sagas. Replacement villain Lord Zedd was designed in the U.S.
translation: Worst show I have ever seen. The story is about a group of teenagers who, for some inexplicable reason, have superpowers, and when they use a special device they turn into weird, ill-designed suits. Acting, if they are not in the reserved suits, is decent. Definitely not good, but not the worst acting I've ever seen. But when they wear their suits, the actor's actions get worse and worse. much, much worse. The hyper-animated idiots have a myriad of unnecessary movements that they do. Even when they talk, they look like they have seizures. The rogues are stupider than the Rangers. Every episode, some weak, idiotic villain comes up with a plan to destroy the Rangers. He / she then sends a force of hyper-animated aliens to attack the Rangers. The rangers then initialize their 10-hour transformation animation, then destroy the aliens. Then the ill-constructed villain, who can either be an armored villain who actually looks and acts evil, will be a humanoid ladybug-like creature with trumpets on his back showing obvious signs of mental retardation. The Power Rangers fight the villain, then the villain turns into Godzilla, be it through a rain cloud or a nuclear missile (yes, they fire Nukes at the creatures and the creatures become giants). The Power Rangers play hyper-animated for 5 minutes, summoning up their Zords, which are obviously toys that the producers of the series have used to make their looks real. The Power Rangers win, the villain goes crazy, they all teach a "valuable" lesson and the show ends. That's it. Twenty-five minutes of brainwashing, wrong kung-fu fighting.

summary: Sameer Arya, Martand Damdere, Pankaj Tiwari, and Gautam Sesodia are friends who live in a small town in India. Broke, accident-prone, and unable to pay rent to their landlady, they are basically slackers with Sameer and Gautam having no family, while Pankaj has been kicked out by his brother-in-law, and Martand has illicitly borrowed money from his maternal uncle, is unable to re-pay it and hence rendered homeless. The four find out that they can better their lifestyle by obtaining a bank loan - albeit in vain as they are unable to secure one. Then they decide to woo a rich girl, let one of them marry her, and live their life in comfort. They find out that there is a new girl, Ritu Tripathi, in the neighborhood, who is on the lookout for her missing brother, Rahul. The foursome con her into believing that they are Rahul's friends and befriend her. Pankaj even re-names himself Jai, her fianc√©e, not for long though as she soon finds out that the truth after she meets with Sophie, the ...
translation:
The movie starts with a nice song. Looks like a thriller, with Arbaaz Khan in a suspicious way, but suddenly we're forced into a comedy with routinely stupid idiots like GOLMAAL with Tusshar, Sharman, Kunal, and Rajpal who behave like grown-up kids. Their scenes are pretty funny at first And then it gets boring There's a boring sub-plot of Tanushrees brother being killed Toward the end, the movie tries to get serious with the villain who kidnaps our heroes, but here it gets even stupid Then, a lengthy bashing highlight of HERA PHERI and wait, there is also a long chase in Payal's house.

The film is so boring that it will make you fall asleep.

Priyan's direction is very bad music (Pritam) is routine except the first song

Cinematography is bad, the movie has a cheap look

Rajpal Yadav is good in his first scene where he pays his rent and I w But happy is that the actor is not loud and exaggerated like other movies. But no, he becomes his usual self and gets annoyed most of the time, Tusshar should not speak in a movie, his dial delivery is awful. Sharman is the saving grace, He is The only actor who works very well in this film, the Kunal Khemmu in his first attempted comic film as an adult, but does not impress much Tanushree is bad as always Arbaaz Khan gets less headroom and is common Payal is a non-actress Murli Sharma is terrible

summary: Before his arrest and conviction for serial murders, chocolate factory worker Jeffrey Dahmer hunts Milwaukee, Wisconsin, for young attractive males to turn into unconscious (eventually dead) human sex toys, current acts which often prompt memories of earlier killings and of dealings with his suspicious but unaware father.
translation: Disappointing and unquestionably boring thriller movie that mumbled sparring character actor Jeremy Renner through the title role of Jeffrey Dahmer, who was easily one of the most recognizable degenerate serial killers of the last century. In early 2003 appeared "Dahmer", a blunt, boring, badly played and virtually bloodless snorer party of a crime drama that never really dives into the monstrous and insane psyche of the late mass murderer as if it had the perfectly good potential! However, what it does for reasons unknown to me is a sort of sympathy for the man, portraying him as a lonely, nebbishy, ‚Äã‚Äãand severely socially incompetent homosexual loser, simply for love in all the wrong places as opposed to the cold, calculating and spoiled sicko and madman, who he was! All in all, 2003's "Dahmer" is one thing that true crime fanatics can skip everywhere, because I'm not joking when I say it's one of the worst serial killer biopics ever made! It's even sadder than other pathetic and exploitative video trash like "Gacy," "Bundy," "Ed Gein," and "The Night Stalker!" (Turkey-zero stars)

summary: A young man finds out that his parents had been used in an atomic-weapons experiment shortly before he was born, and that the results have had some unexpected effects on him.
translation:
It is often said that Tobe Hooper was just lucky with his scary horror movie "The Texas Chain Saw Massacre" (1974) and every time I see a different Hooper movie - this view is only reinforced. It seems that in 1990 Hooper wanted to make his own version of films like Scanners and Firestarter, and so we end up with Spontaneous Combustion; A movie with some good ideas and a whole load more borrowed from other films. Put it all together and you'll get a chaotic, boring movie that most people would miss! The film leads the audience to believe it might be reasonably decent at first, with a fascinating backstory that focuses on a few experiments conducted on two young people in the 1950s. The couple has a child and shortly thereafter burns as a result of the experiments carried out on them. Fast forward some years and the baby is now an adult named Sam; but of course he is not a normal person and will soon find out if he has discovered that he has the ability to fire at will.

The film stars Brad Dourif, who must have seemed like a good casting choice to be successful with Child's Play two years earlier; but in fact it was an uninspired decision, since the central performance is really terrible; and not helped by the terrible benefits. The turbulent direction and the boring writing also do not do much for the film, and the trend of lacking in favors continues through the special effects, which are very unrealistic and have nothing to do with the films this film breaks off; all made a few years ago. The plot is very slow and it's almost an hour before something remarkable happened, and that did not bother me at the time. It soon becomes clear which direction the movie will go, and it all boils down to the boring ending that one would expect. The last confrontation is a big disappointment and nothing is really explained during the movie. Not that any revelation was any interesting. Overall, this is a nonsense movie and another reason why Tobe Hooper is far from being a great horror director. See Firestarter instead.

summary: Kirk is an average Joe who works as a TSA agent at the Pittsburgh airport with his friends. The status quo of his fairly monotonous life ends when he meets Molly, a smart, kind and gorgeous blonde. Because she's way out of his league (she's a hard 10 and he is but a 5), Kirk knows there's no way on earth she's ever going to fall for him. Or is there...?
translation: I thought that this cinema was a disappointment, I expected it to be so much better than it was. I'm so glad I did not pay to see this movie, and that I was not in a movie theater for this movie. Where to start in this film, the acting in this film was average, the humor was terrible and only the entire storyline of the film was not special. I thought this movie should be great, but it was nothing more than a cheesy waste of time. I think the acting in this movie was terrible, none of the actors in this movie had chemistry, it just was not there. I think if we might play another actor than Jay Baruchel, it might have been better, but the whole time I saw this movie, he looked tall and I did not feel like he was not in that movie played. Well, Alice Eve did a great job as an actress, but there was no chemistry between her and Jay. All actors in this film were not names and had little influence in this film. The humor in this movie was not funny at all, there were a few liners in this movie that were OK, but nothing worth telling your friends that they would understand. I think Jim Field Smith had a hard time because he could not decide whether he wanted a romance or a comedy. I honestly think he has to stick to the Burger King commercials. I think this movie could have been better if the authors had gone to another director. The story of this movie is just like any other hot girl just OK guy love story boring I think it would have been better if it had more originality, but what a disappointment nothing. I would not recommend anyone to watch this movie. I think you would have more entertainment with the dentist than in this movie. So save your agony and just do not see it.

summary: In the year 2014, Japan has collapsed economically and thus its people emigrated in large numbers and settled in other parts of the world. In a corner in Asia, there is a little street called Mallepa, a big melting pot where Asians such as Hongkongers, Taiwanese and Japanese live together. It was a place where people fought for order, food and freedom. It was there where Shou (Gackt), raised as an orphan and Kei (Hyde), who could live forever, met and became the best of friends. However, they were unable to escape from the fight for power involving gangs of different ethnicity on the street of Malepa...
translation:
I was looking for this movie in typical fan obsession. I just wanted to check it. I did not expect much from anything. After all, a musician, an actor and a screenwriter? It is not possible that so many talents live in one person. Law??

Wrong !! Obsession aside, it quickly became one of my favorites! The storyline and characters are not lost in the typical hype Hollywood special effects. The story tears your emotions and pulls you along. As the credits pass, you suddenly realize that you are stuck to the end.

Sometimes acting seems a bit over the top. However, I believe that it was done with comedic intent and very appropriate for the character. Otherwise I would not have expected to be a witness to acting.

It is worth seeing more than once. I laugh hysterically or gasp unexpectedly about something that I either missed or forgot the first time.

I can only recommend this movie. Feel free to go in with your doubts, but I'm sure it will find a place on your shelf.

summary: "Redline" is an auto/action thriller that features an extensive exotic car collection. The movie features a Phantom Rolls Royce, Lamborghini Murcielago, Enzo Ferrari, Ferrari F430, Ferrari Scaglietti and two Mercedes SLR McLaren AMGs. A $450,000 Porsche Carrera GT is actually crashed during one sequence. Eddie Griffin accidentally crashed and destroyed the Enzo Ferrari, one of only 400 ever produced. The film follows an ace driver who becomes part of illegal drag racing.
translation: "A total waste of time" Just throw a few explosions, not stop fighting, exotic cars a deranged millionaire, slow-motion computer-generated car accidents and last but not least a Hugh Hefner like character with wall to wall hot babes and mix a blender and you You will have this excuse for a movie. I really have a laugh from the "Dr. Evil" as heavily fortified connection. The plot was somewhere between grotesque and nonexistent. How many millionaires are willing to make a $ 25 million car race bet? Answer: 4 But did not they become millionaires through fiscal responsibility? This was written for pubescent men, it plays like a video game. I enjoyed the Gulfstream II landing in the desert.

summary: After the recently re-elected President of a fictitious state has been assassinated, one of the members of the investigation committee refuses to sign the final report and is given the task of investigating once more. In the course of his search he finds evidence that casts serious doubt on the committee's "lone-gunman" theory... A very bold film that basically told the "JFK" story thinly disguised as having taken place not in the US.
translation:
The first time I saw this movie in the Eighties, but now reviewed, this thriller is still up to date. Some recent films focus on similar topics, but they are not in line with this French milestone.

A president - obviously JF Kennedy - is shot dead in a public car in a public car. The resulting massive investigation found the "Lee Harvey Oswald" character of this film guilty, but a member of the jury insists on investigating further. He shows some surprising evidence ...

Unlike Oliver Stone's JFK - a movie with the same plot - this one does not play with emotion, but focuses on an exciting description of a conspiracy and how everything fits together a new one Draw a picture of the assassination. Even a real psychological experiment is used for this explanation of the crime scene. Compared to JFK, this movie is more sensible, smarter and more exciting. Parts of the plot can be found in many recent films, I had a kind of Deja-Vu sometimes sitting in the cinema.

"I ... like Icare" is a must. It's unique and brilliant, and the music of Ennio Morricone is wonderful. This movie deserves a very good placing, if it were a Hollywood production it would surely be famous.

summary: Widely recognized as the best of the Christmas horror efforts, Christmas Evil is the story of a boy who loves Christmas. He is scarred as a boy when he learns that Santa is not real. Throughout the rest of his life, the toy-maker tries to make the Christmas spirit a reality. He becomes obsessed with the behavior of children and the quality of the toys he makes. When he is met with hypocrisy and cynicism, the resulting snap causes him to go on a yuletide killing spree to complete this dark comedic horror.
translation: What else can one say about this film other than "watchers". Christmas Evil should be labeled with a warning like cigarettes because it was harmful to my eyes and ears. I'm rarely so unhappy with a "b" horror movie, but this movie might not even scare a five-year-old. The purpose of a ruthless lunatic who thirsts for blood in a movie is that he / she seems almost godlike, as nothing can stop her mad anger, but in this movie, the local psychopath puts himself in a chimney in a bizarre attempt to be Surprising the next victim and, of course, following the ever-popular legend of Santa Claus is a reminder to the viewer that this man is in no way dangerous because he is way too stupid to be dangerous. All in all, a total waste of film.

summary: In a small town, Roy Seeley and his girlfriend Mandy Pullman are camping by the lake. Out of the blue, they are attacked and Roy is murdered while Mandy is violently raped. Dr. Sam Cordell is impressed with the violence and realizes that Mandy has had the uterus ruptured. Then the librarian Carolyn Davies is also violently raped and murdered. Lieutenant Drivas believes that the women have been raped by a gang while Sam and Sheriff Hank Walden believe that only one man did. The snoopy reporter Laura Kincaid is always interfering with the investigation and Sam has a love affair with her. Meanwhile the young Tim Galen, who dates Sam's daughter Jenny Cordell, discloses that he has premonitory visions of the deaths, but his grandmother Agatha Galen tries to convince him that he has nothing to do with the murders. But when Jenny learns about his dreams, she summons her father, Laura and they discover a supernatural secret about the Galen's family.
translation:
I finally saw THE INCUBUS after waiting for 20 years for some weird years to see it, and well, it certainly was not worth it to wait all the time to see it. THE INCUBUS is strictly speaking horror film: Unseen killer / monster raped and murders women in a small town.

The movie goes like this: movie begins with killing; then blah blah blah; more blah blah blah; then another killing; more blah blah blah; continue with bla bla bla; another killing (surprising, is not it?); bla bla bla, etc ...

The movie is completely predictable from start to finish. Even the stupid "big" red herring used throughout the movie would not convince a 5 year old. And when I saw the sign, I found out the incubus's secret identity, and when the "shocking" surprise came, I was neither shocked nor surprised. In fact, it was so funny that I kept chuckling after the movie. It is so silly!

However, the movie is so typical that the "rock band" sequence is one of the few outstanding moments in this dreary movie. It's a standout scene, not necessarily because it's good, but because it's so funny and pointless: the movie on the big screen shows a rock video-like moment with a man in red leather pants cutting his obviously wrong long hair edited with scenes of a girl being attacked in the washroom of the cinema by the incubus. The best thing I could say about this movie is the cinematography that I really liked. But apart from that, there's almost nothing worth mentioning about THE INCUBUS except it's unintentionally funny.

summary: 16 years of alcohol is about a skinhead named Frankie; his violent childhood, alcoholism and his love for Ska.
translation:
As others have pointed out, this movie is a boast to the mindless or masochist.

We all know that after visiting Trainspotting and Acid House, Scotland is one of the most depressing places in the First World. But unlike Trainspotting and Acid House without a good dose of humor or gritty realism, movies like these do not work. More importantly, without a decent script, a movie will not work and there's nothing new, inspiring, or thought-provoking about the script for this film.

The fact that this movie has won a few Baftas shows how bad the British film industry is at the moment. I thought the Australian film industry was pretty bad at the moment, but unfortunately the British industry is even worse.

This movie is so bad that I would not even rent it from the weekly section. >
Do yourself a favor and give this movie a wide berth.

summary: In 1939, an intrepid reporter in New York City makes a connection between the story she's covering -- of famous scientists suddenly disappearing around the world, and a recent attack on the city by giant robots. Determined to find the solution to these happenings, she seeks the help of her ex-boyfriend, the captain of a mercenary legion of pilots. The two are investigating the case when the robots attack the city again, though in a stroke of luck, Sky Captain's right-hand man is able to locate their source. They then set off on an adventure in search of the evil mastermind behind these schemes, who is bent on creating a utopia and destroying the current world.
translation: Optically stunning? Certainly. I have already seen some movies that look so good. Sky Captain and the World of Tomorrow use eye-catching cinematography, computer graphics and creative futuristic designs to create a world that's historically familiar yet something new. The period seems to be in the 1930s or early 40s. The film tells of recent attacks on New York City by mechanized armies stealing generators and the like for some inexplicable reason. The mysterious disappearance of relevant scientific heads coincides. Who can stop them and save the world? Okay, it takes no leap of faith to know that it's the Sky Captain himself, his witty reporter friend who's always hot for a trail, and his wings, his faithful, thoroughly competent buddy. What Sky Captain has in terms of atmosphere and graphics lacks storytelling and characterization. The plot for this movie is ridiculous. That is, the film is for a serial feeling of film series of yesterday. They had pretty far away stories and bad acting - but none of them, and I mean none of them, had the budget and the big names this movie had. Two award-winning actors and Jude Law could hold a movie afloat, one would think, but Sky Captain sinks miserably. Despite the fantastic dark look, I wish the film would just end and I could go on with my life. I had little interest in a story that aroused little interest. I was not at all interested in any of the glittering presentations. Paltrow was just terrible. Jolie was a joke with a role that had virtually no substance. The law can not carry the one-stranded tradition too much on its limited shoulders. I mean, let's face it, he's not Will Smith, Mel Gibson or even Wesley Snipes. The sad thing about Sky Captain, at least for me, was that it was so promising and yet delivered so little. I was bored ten minutes after the movie - waiting for something that caught my interest - and it never came.

summary: JC is at the end of his Twenties and is living with his girlfriend Chloe in a small coastal town in England. He is a surfer legend and some day, three of his friends show up, including Terry who is about to get married. While he is supposed to have the last good time in his life, Josh (a successful Techno music producer) tries to figure out what type of music he likes most and Dean, who sells drugs on a regular basis, must face the fact that his life is not what he would like it to be. JC has his own problems with Chloe: Will he stay with her and run a surfer coffee shop or travel around the world without her?
translation:
I saw this boring waste of time on HBO's Comedy Channel, so I innocently and obviously assumed it was a comedy. But here is absolutely nothing funny. A good cast is basically wasted on a script that I could have written with my left buttock after it was struck meaningless by 15th century Inquisition Torturers. The first half is especially bad, as it has some of the most boring, meaningless dialogues I've seen for some time, and zero comma-zero plots that you can talk about. Just the fact that stars like Ewan McGregor and Zeta-Jones are in this little movie and yet this movie has less than 1000 votes on this page should tell you everything. A few nice shots of waves hit the cold British coast, but that's it.

This is the kind of movie that is made just because the people who wrote it have good connections (family connections, preferably) and / or a lot of cash lying around.

summary: College freshman Cassandra "Cassie" steps into a nightmare of otherworldly visitations after surviving a devastating car accident. Haunted by a grim reaper of a far different kind, her only hope is to cling to chance encounters with her lost love Sean and the aid of a mysterious young priest named Father Jude. It is the spirit of Sean, her soul mate, who guides her to love, but it is her friends Matt, Annabel and Annabel's morose friend Raven who try to draw her to the dark side.
translation:
Like a relative who gives you a bad gift, Soul Survivors has his heart in the right place, but stumbles with a bad execution. Stephen Carpenter's writing / directorial work borrowed free from other, better films like Jacob's Ladder and Abre Los Ojos (Open Your Eyes). For those who have not seen any of these films, I will not give away the premise; Suffice to say that it is not nearly as well handled here as in these two superior films.

Melissa Sagemiller plays the lead role as Cassie, who is just going to college. Her current boyfriend Sean (Ben Affleck) and her ex-boyfriend Matt (Wes Bentley), both friends, and Annabel (spicy Eliza Dushku) are in a car accident after being persecuted by two murderers (?) In transparent masks. She survives the wreck, but while attending college, there are visions of the ordeal of the hospital and dead people reappear and disappear, leaving them in a state of utter confusion: who is dead? Who lives? What is real?

Soul Survivors looks like a bad old, finished, blood spattered, blood spattered teenager. True, it has its share of Killer Stalking The Victim scenes (copious, repetitive, and mind-boggling), but at least it's trying to clich√© through ideas, but unfortunately it's rather unsuccessful. It brings confusion much more often than cohesion, as the story becomes messy, chaotic and incoherent near key points of the mystery (predictable as it is).

Horror fans picking up a copy will have no idea they're involved in a movie that's more concerned with building a troubled facade of reality than providing a body count. Credit goes to Carpenter for trying to create something beyond a derivative teen horror movie; Too bad he created a derivative psycho thriller. Sagemiller also deserves credit for showing strength in the central performance, developing her character, and evoking a certain sense of emotion as the unraveling Cassie. It's great that the filmmakers try something different, but the movie ends with a mixed bag and a failed experiment.

4 out of 10

summary: When the villagers of Klineschloss start dying of blood loss, the town fathers suspect a resurgence of vampirism. While police inspector Karl remains skeptical, scientist Dr. von Niemann cares for the vampire's victims one by one, and suspicion falls on simple-minded Herman Gleib because of his fondness for bats. A blood-thirsty mob hounds Gleib to his death, but the vampire attacks don't stop.
translation:
And the Oscar for the most underrated classic horror actor goes to - Dwight Frye. Seriously, his name should be given the same reverence as Karloff, Lugosi and Price, and this film proves it. His character Herman was one of the 2 reasons I can give to see this movie. Dwight gave this slightly more than slightly disturbed outsider a loveable but scary appearance that made you hope for a bigger part of the entire movie.

The other reason is the comic relief of M. Eburne. Being myself in medicine, I have to pay tribute to the expert performance of a self-pitying hypochondriac. Although other "medical errors" caused a brief giggle, especially when the good doctor scans his doctors colleagues ... "Well, pass it on to her." Unfortunately, these two outstanding achievements could not keep me awake with 3 attempts to get through unbearably Movie. The plot is predictable with only a few small twists. Shooting in a legitimate spooky atmosphere was more productive to make me yawn - yes, you can use too much shadow.

My recommendation - take a look at it to see Frye and Eburne - but only when you're wide awake and with lots of caffeine.

summary: Three-times MVP baseball player Bobby Rayburn joins the San Francisco Giants, and obsessive fan, whose profession is selling hunting knives, Gil Renard is excited over that. But Rayburn plays the worst season of his career and Renard tries to do everything to help him, but goes too far.
translation:
It always amazes me how to pick up an excellent actor and waste him in a movie like this one. Robert De Niro is one of the best Hollywood stars of all time, but even he could not save this movie. In fact, his character is very similar to the one he played in Cape Fear, which was actually pretty good, but I can not stand it when actors do the same thing about more than one movie. I think it's getting old, and that's the case here.

There is nothing surprising in this film, but then the story has been told millions of times. Wesley Snipes is your typical baseball player and his imagination shows in his characterization. De Niro plays the obsessed fan, but his role in this movie is less than entertaining.

However, since De Niro is in this movie, it makes a draw if you're a fan (no pun intended) who sees everything he does, no matter how bad. But to see De Niro in his best shape, watch "Midnight Run", "Goodfellas" or "Cop Land", or even go back and check out "Taxi Driver" or "Godfather II". Do not waste your time with this chub.

My rating: 3/10

summary: When the daughter Emma of the technical writer Allen Pyke and the photographer Julie is found slashed in the throat and wrists in their locked apartment, the couple decides to move to an isolated cabin in the mountains in Kingspike. Julie is very depressed and blames Allen for the death of Emma. Once in the new home, Julie sees the spirit of Emma in a photo she took in a nearby abandoned prison and she becomes obsessed shooting pictures of poltergeists. Allen is advised to move from the place by the local Jim Payne, and on May 21st, Allen finds that the former dwellers of the cabin have committed suicide, and he investigates the death in the spot and finds that many people died around May 22nd. He decides to move with Julie to a hotel, but she does not want to give up on Emma.
translation:
If you have ever seen a movie by Brian Avenet-Bradley and compared it to the feedback he receives on IMDb, you know that most comments and votes are fake. TRUST ME: You'll be bored! People in the production team write their feedback themselves (sometimes even admitting it). But that is not enough: you also constantly click "No" if there is a negative commentary on the film. That's why negative critics are always behind the hypnosis.

The movie itself is bad, bad, bad: bad acting, bad lighting, bad script, bad ending. Believe me now! If not, you will believe me later!

Brian Avenet-Bradley could be a pretty good businessman. Otherwise you can not explain that he finds people who still finance his films. (Okay, they are cheap, but still.) But as a creative person, he is a total failure.

summary: In 1918 in World War I, in the Meuse-Argonne Sector in France, the former New York lawyer and Major Charles White Whittlesey is assigned by Gen. Robert Alexander to a massive suicidal attack against the German forces in the Argonne Forest with his five-hundred-man battalion. However, the forces supposed to be giving support through the flanks retreat and the communications with the headquarter of the 77th American Division are cut. Major Wittlesey holds his position with his men, mostly Irish, Polish, Italian and Jewish immigrants from New York, surrounded by the German army. Without food, water, ammunition and medical supplies, only two hundred men survive after five days of siege.
translation:
When this film was first shown on television, I had high hopes that we would finally have a decent movie about World War I, as experienced by American soldiers. That's not it.

It should be a good movie about the First World War. Although it was made for television, it is obvious that a real effort has been made to use appropriate equipment and props. But the writing and the direction are missing very much, even if the makers of this film obviously borrowed from some well-made war films. War movie stereotypes abound, like the arrogant general who apparently does not care about the lives of his men. When will Hollywood realize that although there were many bad generals, most of the combat unit's generals themselves have seen much fighting and are not naive about what the average grunt experiences? The first part of this movie seemed to be "Paths of Glory" with American uniforms. Except that "Paths of Glory" was emotionally enthralling. Later there was Chamberlain's accusation (except uphill) of "Gettysburg" and even the capture of the American soldier by a ring of enemy soldiers from "The Thin Red Line". But in "The Thin Red Line" the soldier was alone trapped. In this film, in the middle of a battle, a ring is formed around the new prisoner.

If this movie uses a military advisor, ignore it. Although the actors (and I never forgot they were actors while watching) formed military tactics, I did not see much of it. The American soldiers got up to be shot while the Germans attacked. And the notorious stormtroopers, who seemed to be blind, did not seem to use tactics in their attack. In real war tactics was what made the stormtroopers so effective. But the dumbest scene was the attack of German flamethrowers. In this scene, the German flamethrower in a broad line towards the defending Americans. If that had been real, they would never have come close enough to use their flamethrowers before they were all thrown off the defenders' bullets.

Okay, most war movies are unrealistic when it comes to tactics. But it is still disappointing. But what really distracted me from this streak was the typical anti-military point of view that filmmakers consider important. True, war is hell. But most American soldiers, though they grumble and complain, tend to believe in what they do and can be pretty coddled about it. My grandfather served in the First World War. And although he died four years before my birth, I was told how proud he was of his service.

summary: Lo Tung and his friend Malted Candy, pedicab drivers working the streets of Macao, have both fallen in love. The problem is that both their objects of affection - one a baker, the other a prostitute - are working under cruel and lecherous bosses. Somehow, the pair must find a way to win the ladies' hearts and free them from their unpleasant jobs.
translation:
This, "Prodigal Son" and "Eastern Condors" are my favorite Sammo Hung movies. The fat dragon is thicker in this outing than in "condors," but he is no less sure of being a director or an actor. He is indeed at the forefront of his form and delivers a devastating, brutal action player who has half a dozen amazing sequences and manages to tell a compassionate, sweet love story. Love and romance are not the director's priorities here, but they serve as curious companions of the plot and ensure that viewers do not press the push button between physical clashes.

The opening scene, with a funny lightsaber duel that emits a solid but deceptive tone. A sequence in which Sammo's Pedicab is tracked by a car is beautifully staged and sweetened with a sharp, weird tone. The fast and furious fight between Sammo and Lau Kar Leung is a model of dazzling choreography and sharp, brilliant directing and easily one of the best of its kind. The violence of the film slowly escalates until finally, when the climax of the showdown comes, we become one of the most brutal Confrontations that have ever occurred in a Sammo production. The director / actor's attack on Billy Chow and a house filled with angry, threatening opponents is a bone-breaking, physically punishing treat.

Great on every level and one of the best martial arts films ever.

Great score too.

summary: Dave, Sam and Jeff are about to graduate from Holden University with Honors in lying, cheating and scheming. The three roommates have proudly scammed their way through the last four years of college and now, during the final exams, these big-men-on-campus are about to be busted by the most unlikely dude in school.
translation:
Although I had some hopes for this film, especially because I like the play by Jason Segel (Freaks & Geeks, Undeclared) so much, I have to say that it was one of the worst movies I've seen lately ( Loser and Dr. and the women are also on this list).

Yes, there were a few laugh moments, though the movie could have been so much better. The premise was not bad - scammers cheating on their way through college meet their match when they are discovered by someone with a suggestion for them. The problem is that the characters were all so dissimilar that I did not care about them. The blackmailer (played by the talented Jason Schwartzman) was a psychopath so it was not so funny to see him - he was not particularly funny or charming disturbed, he was just a crazy loser who was actually quite dangerous and not funny too see. The editing of the film was difficult to follow - he cut repeatedly between fantasy and reality and it was often unclear which was what. Only two or three of the gang's scams were really shown, you just had to believe that they were actually cheaters - showing their plans would have made a better movie. The so-called love story was absurd and unbelievable, in fact it was silly and poorly written and consistently directed. I could talk about the film's shortcomings, but you get the idea. Not worth the $ 4 rent or the gasoline it takes to rent to and from the movie shop!

summary: Two families, the Graystones and the Adamas, live together on a peaceful planet known as Caprica, where a startling breakthrough in artificial intelligence brings about unforeseen consequences.
translation:
I had to endure teenage years, high school anxiety and family conflict for most of the show. I'm really not interested in high school girls who are angry about their relationships. I've spent my time in hell dealing with such issues, and I do not care about fictitious teens who undergo "lite" versions of the horrors I've endured. I want science fiction. That's the only reason why I'm here. There were a few seconds of sci-fi late on the show. We finally see a Proto-Cylon. It was good, but with a problem. His red eye point would snap to an object of interest. We all know that Gypsy eyes always scan back and forth and give the machine a world map. The red-eye point never stops moving back and forth.

I really hope the authors fix this abuse before the second episode.

summary: Rose is a shop assistant at Harrods and finds herself in a top floor storage room when the mannequins seem to come to life. She's rescued by a man who calls himself the Doctor but reveals little about himself. Her Internet search leads her to a man who believes that the Doctor is an immortal alien who has been instrumental in averting various Earthly disasters. Their paths cross again and Rose helps the Doctor in fighting a race of plastics-based creatures whose home world may have been destroyed in a battle involving the Doctor. Rose seems like the perfect companion for his future travels.
translation:
As an integral part of British pop culture such as Monty Python and James Bond, Doctor Who was a big hit for 26 years (1963-1989), making it one of the world's longest-running TV shows (most series are lucky) ten seasons). Plans to restart the series have always been on the BBC's agenda, and after a miscalculated (not to be Americanized) TV movie produced by Fox, he did not manage to complete the magic of the original version for nine years Captured (Comic Relief Parody and Animated Miniseries) were needed before the Ultimate Time Lord could properly return, courtesy of acclaimed writer Russell T. Davies.

Davies Brilliance in reintroducing the character lies in his decision to do so through the eyes of an outsider: Rose Tyler (Billie Piper), a London-based young woman who leads a normal life, until one night it is attacked by living plastic creatures. She is rescued by an elusive stranger, who simply introduces herself as a doctor (Christopher Eccleston) and then disappears after annoying: "Nice to meet you, Rose, run for your life!". As she becomes more and more curious about this "man," she soon finds herself in a whole new world: extraterrestrials, invasions, journeys through time and space, and of course the ubiquitous police box-shaped TARDIS.

The true triumph of this episode, however, is Piper's achievement: in theory, Rose is in her late teens, almost the same age as thousands of young audiences who have never heard of the doctor before. Her portrayal of an ordinary girl, lost in a new, exciting universe, represents the new generation's response to the return of a TV icon, and the chemistry that is currently forming between her and Eccleston is a sign of the new Doctor Who, the old one is just as good.

First, fifth, ninth, it makes no difference: There might have been others before Eccleston (and Piper, for that matter), but together he is, William Hartnell, Peter Davison, and the rest of the bunch a single character, one so cool, he does not even need a name: he is THE Doctor.

summary: Cinderella, the beautiful and kind-hearted daughter, sees her world turn upside down when her beloved mother dies, and her pained father remarries another woman, the wicked Lady Tremaine, who has two equally cruel daughters, the jealous Anastasia and Drizella. But, once more, things will go from bad to worse, when Cinderella's father, too, dies, leaving her all alone in the Lady's clutches to serve as her maid-of-all-work. Under those circumstances, a shabby and neglected Cinderella doesn't stand much of a chance of attending the King's royal ball--let alone, captivate the handsome Prince--unless she turns to her loving Fairy Godmother who has quite a few tricks up her sleeve. Nevertheless, will the wronged damsel ever find peace--and with it--her own Prince Charming?
translation:
Cinderella is a beautiful young woman cruelly treated by her wicked stepmother and step-sisters. One day a ball is to be held in honor of the prince, but Cinderella has no chance to leave, because her stepmother and step-sisters will not let her. With the help of her fairy godmother and her animal friends she goes to the ball with the warning to return home at midnight. On the ball she meets the beautiful Prince Charming. When the clock strikes midnight, she runs home and leaves one of her glass shoes behind. With the help of their animal friends their true identity is revealed. She and the prince marry later and live happily ever after.

Cinderella, which was published 56 years ago, was a big box-office hit that continues to thrill audiences. It has a well-written script. The characters are unforgettable. The songs, including "A dream is a desire to make your heart", "So This Is Love" and the great "Bibbidi-Bobbidi-Boo", help to tell the story. This was my favorite movie, and he has lost none of his charm. A true Disney masterpiece! Recommended. 10/10 P. S. The latest DVD release is the best way to enjoy this movie, including featurettes, deleted scenes, music video, vintage radio programs, and a restored imprint of the movie!

summary: A tragic love story/psychlogical thriller, Hatred of a Minute, is the story of a medical transcriptionist that becomes a serial killer because of his physically and mentally abusive past. His mind spirals out of control as a war between good and evil; right and wrong unfold in front of his eyes in the form of personal angels and demons.
translation:
Barry, a medical transcriptionist, has corroded his thoughts from his work, coupled with memories of abusive education at the hands of his stepfather Barry (the original Leatherface Gunnar Hansen). He gets mad and eventually becomes a serial killer. Good (in the form of a gay man) and evil (in the form of a bald mute) fight for control of his soul. This film is reversed by some acting and unintentional humorous scenes. Not to say it's awful or anything, just that you say it's only as well known as it is because of Bruce Campbell's rabid fanbase (of which I'm one), who will probably see everything he's in or somehow with him has to do.

My class: C-

DVD Extras: Commentary with Michael Kallio and Bruce Campbell; Second commentary by Kallio and sound designer Joel Newport; "Hate every minute" a 17-minute documentary; deleted and extended scenes; alternative takes; Outtakes, footage of the world premiere; Poster & gallery; Talentbios; and movie trailers

summary: Pittsburgh, coming of age in the 1980s. At the beginning of June, Art Beckstein calls this the last summer of his life - after which he'll work as a stock broker. Art's father is the city's mob boss, steering Art's life, judging his choices. At a party, Art sees Jane, smart, blond, lovely. They meet; she has a boyfriend. The next day, Cleveland, the boyfriend, pulls Art from work and the summer of adventures begins. Cleveland lives close to the edge; he's explosive, with hints of problems with local thugs. The triangle of friendship gets complicated when Cleveland disappears for a couple weeks. Can Art sort out his feelings as well as help Cleveland? Where does his father fit in this?
