summary: Jake Roedel and Jack Bull Chiles are friends in Missouri when the Civil War starts. Women and Blacks have few rights. Jack Bull's dad is killed by Union soldiers, so the young men join the Bushwhackers, irregulars loyal to the South. One is a Black man, Daniel Holt, beholden to the man who bought his freedom. They skirmish then spend long hours hiding. Sue Lee, a young widow, brings them food. She and Jack Bull become lovers, and when he's grievously wounded, Jake escorts her south to a safe farm. The Bushwhackers, led by men set on revenge, make a raid into Kansas. At nineteen, Jake is ill at ease with war. As his friends die one after another, he must decide where honor lies.
translation:
Ride with the Devil, like Ang Lee's later Brokeback Mountain, is a film of aesthetic and historical significance. Film lovers should at least see it twice, because its artistic nuance is worthy of being caught.

A perfect work of art, a surprising depth of humanity. I really can not remember another war movie, I'll capture you so, change your existing view of history and politics, restore your belief in humanity. After seeing so many killings, so many woes, you do not feel numb, instead you value the connection between people more. The performances of the actors follow your heart, the music drives your thoughts. Some shoots are not just pictures, they transcend themselves and become soul seeing. So the true purpose of the film is to be a genre of art.

A movie like this does not need long comments or criticisms, everything he says. Ovation to the cast, Tobey Maguire, Jeffrey Wright and Jewel Kilcher, the cinematographer and the composer of beautiful and lyrical music, what a performance!

summary: Between the heaven and the Earth exist the Zu's mountain range, where live the immortals of Omei, the highest mountain of Zu, but the kingdom is in danger by Amnesia, a renegade immortal what want to rule Zu and all the world. White Eyebrows, Zu's leader, call to his most experts fighters for to defeat Amnesia until destroy It, but Amnesia hides in the legendary and almost myth Blood Cavern in order to make stronger his powers. This movie is well done on so many levels that I'm in awe that the score is as low as it is (5.9 / 10 (576 votes) at the time of writing). This movie has incredible special effects, a true epic story, complex interaction with great characters and breathtaking battles - they must be seen to be believed! The only complaint I have is the subtitles on the HK DVD version that I got (some lines were not translated - ???).

I just do not understand when I read from different sources and hear, "It has a confusing plot ....", "I could not follow the story ...." or "Characters came out of nothing ... ". From the first time I saw this movie, I understood it, followed it, knew why characters were there, and I totally loved it! I've seen it 8 times and every time it's pure enjoyment. Oh, and that's not just my opinion, because I showed this movie to many fellow Americans (people who have never seen a HK movie before) who think the same way. None of them could not follow the story and each person declared their love for this film. Oh man, why can not we have something like Hollywood? At least Lord of the Rings had a nice combination of special effects, character development and storyline.

This is not from an Asian movie lover newcomer. I own an extensive library of Asian films and I have to say that this movie is one of my biggest DVDs. If you look at it, you'll be overwhelmed by the amazing special effects and epic feel of this movie. You will be drawn into this fantasy world and you will not want to go! I have seen both the 1983 version and the 2001 version (both from Tsui Hark), and in 2001 IMO is much better.

In addition to the subtitles, I have another complaint about this movie: I did not want it to stop .... I implore you Mr. Hark - can we have a sequel, please?

summary: Kirk Bennett is falsely sentenced to death for killing blackmailer Mavis Marlowe, ex-wife of nice-guy drunk Martin Blair. Bennett's stand-up wife Catherine tries to prove him innocent, enlisting the aid of Blair, who falls in love with her. Failing to nail Marko, Catherine goes off to meet with her husband, scheduled to die the next morning, and Blair slips into an alcoholic stupor before the real killer is revealed.
translation: "Black Angel" is a little thriller with June Vincent as a woman trying to rescue her husband from the electric chair after being found guilty of an old acquaintance. It's nice enough, but eventually it stops making sense, and the mystery solution provokes one of those great "give me a break" reactions. This end alone could have completely submerged the movie, but what precedes the conclusion is not very good either. Vincent is a pennanting heroine and Duryea has never been good at playing good people. I love movie noirs, but this was a real disappointment.

summary: Emma Woodhouse is a congenial young lady who delights in meddling in other people's affairs. She is perpetually trying to unite men and women who are utterly wrong for each other. Despite her interest in romance, Emma is clueless about her own feelings, and her relationship with gentle Mr. Knightly.

Well, it's easy to see that I did not care about this. I'm sure it's a nice book and everything, but some books are really not meant for the big screen, and "Emma" is one of them.

Kenneth lets Della know that he thinks she gives all her attention to the twins and neglects her house and her appearance. Late on Christmas Eve, Della drives to the local mall to buy gift-wrap. While searching for a parking space in the jam-packed lot, Della notices an old car taking up two spaces. Frustrated and annoyed, she decides to leave a paper message on the windshield of the old car, writing, "Hey, Jerk. Two parking spaces. How selfish can you be?" After the mall closes, Della's car is held by the driver of the old car and she is threatened by four punks -- Chuckie, Huey, Vingh, and Tom√°s. When George is invited to work in a newspaper in the United States, Susan discovers a bone that she believes is from a dinosaur; but Eric tells that she is wrong. However he knows that Susan has made an important discovery and wants the credits. George packs their stuff to travel but Susan wants to check her discovery and leaves a note to him telling that she will investigate further in the forest. George hires an airplane to follow her and he succeeds to find his wife. Soon they find befriend the native Cephu and his tribe. summary: Alan Johnson has everything he needs to get through life: a good job, a beautiful and loving wife, and their wonderful children. Yet he feels isolated because he finds having a hard-working job and managing a family too much to handle and has no one to talk to about it. Charlie Fineman, on the other hand, doesn't have a job or a family. He used to have both until a terrible loss, and the grief caused him to quit his job and isolate himself from everyone around him. As it turns out, Alan and Charlie were roommates in college, and a chance encounter one night rekindles the friendship they shared. But when Charlie's problems become too much to deal with, Alan is determined to help Charlie come out of his emotional abyss.

Although the two scripts were written by Arthur Matthews alone. Set in London 1969 - Ray Purbs, a hippie, is the publisher of an anarchist journal. summary: It is now summer in the Parker family and the usual number of events is happening in their separate lives. Ralphie is searching for the perfect top to use to beat the school bully, the Old Man is in battle with their hillbilly neighbors (the Bumpuses) while eagerly awaiting the discovery of the perfect fishing spot, and Mother is attempting to collect all of the pieces of a glass china set at a local movie theater.
translation:
Since its release in 1983, "A Christmas Story," the story told by Jean Shepherd of his alter ego, Ralphie, has become a true classic. However, "My Summer Story" still has Shepherd as the narrator, but it has absolutely none of the charm, and the characters are far from the caliber of the original film.

"My Summer Story" is basically a mish-mash of mediocre and just not very interesting stories that include hillbilly neighbors and fighting tops. Charles Grodin, whom I usually like, is extremely unfavorable in the role of the father (originally better handled by Darren McGavin), and his character never seems to be anything but forced. Kiernan Culkin is a bad substitute for Ralphie, and his little brother is almost forgotten. Only mom seems to have a value here and maybe it's because she insults a movie manager with a gravy boat when he pushes his luck with angry housewives on "Free Dish Night" too far.

The stories are mostly inconsistent and stretched paper thin. May appeal to the most undemanding, but as a continuation of "A Christmas Story," it is a very poor and not worth the time of most people. 2 out of 10.

summary: Louie Jeffries is happily married to Corinne. On their first anniversary, Louie is killed crossing the road. Louie is reincarnated as Alex Finch, and twenty years later, fate brings Alex and Louie's daughter, Miranda, together. It's not until Alex is invited to Louie's home that he begins to remember his former life, wife and best friend. Of course, there's also the problem that he's attracted to Louie's/his own daughter.
translation: I have always been a big Cybill Shepperd fan since I saw her series a few years ago !! This movie will surely show you in its best light! summary: Alex Bernier (Ledger) is a member of an arcane order of priests known as Carolingians. When the head of the order dies, Alex is sent to Rome to investigate mysterious circumstances surrounding the death. The body bears strange marks on the chest which may or may not be the sign of a Sin Eater (Furmann), a renegade who offers absolution, last rites and therefore a path to heaven outside the jurisdiction of the church. Alex enlists the aid of his old comrade Father Thomas (Addy) and of a troubled artist (Sossamon) upon whom he once performed an exorcism. He soon finds himself plunged into a mystery only to find himself at the heart of it.

This is really the worst movie I have ever seen. Ever. Period. I actually paid ¬£ 3.50 to see that steamy shit of a movie. summary: Arthur is a happy drunk with no pretensions at any ambition. He is also the heir to a vast fortune which he is told will only be his if he marries Susan. He does not love Susan, but she will make something of him the family expects. Arthur proposes but then meets a girl with no money who he could easily fall in love with.
translation: Excellent comedy by Dudley Moore with support from Liza Minnelli and good-talk John Gielgud. Moore is Arthur, a man of a multi-millionaire family who would earn $ 750 million, provided he marries a woman (Susan) from another multimillionaire family. In principle, Arthur accepted the terms, but eventually he declined when he met the cute and poor Linda Marolla (Liza Minneli). Arthur was just a parasite because he did not work, he just enjoyed drinking hard and having fun with prostitutes. After some serious thought in his life and for the first time, Arthur decided to marry Susan just minutes before her wedding. The end was happy for Linda and Arthur, although he knew his life would change in the future. This comedy is a good life lesson for everyone. Rich people are usually not happy with their ways of life.

summary: Ben's dad Sam shows up one night with a note from Ben's mother (Sam's wife of 46 years), that she has left. While Ben's wife and his three sisters try to find her, Ben takes Sam on a day trip to see a farmhouse that's for sale. The day trip turns into a road trip while dad and son explore their past, their relationship, and why Sam's wife might have left him. The road trip includes fishing, drinking, playing pool, sleeping under the stars, and frank discussion. Anger simmers close at hand, as do love and hope. Where Sam's wife is - and why she left - leads to the movie's resolution.
translation: I have two good things to say about this film: The scenery is beautiful and Peter Falk gives a good idea (considering what he had to work with in terms of dialogue and direction). However, I found this movie extremely tiring. Drying paint would have been more fun. It seemed much longer than 97 minutes. Starting with the opening sequence, where everyone talks and Paul Reiser repeats everything he's been told on the phone, the movie is annoying. The film is filled with clich√©s and shticks, not to mention endless incidents of audible flatulence from Falk. Also, the director seems to have had difficulty deciding whether to aim for laughter or tears. There are some sequences that touch, but they are all played laugh. If you speak "schmackig, sentimental and" cute ", you will love it, but if you hope for something with more substance, look at another film.

summary: A couple who cannot have children joins an in-vitro fertilization program. While she is with child, she finds strange occurrences happening within her body. The horror surrounding the child comes to light when the parents find that their child has been part of a mad experiment.
translation: The Unborn is a pretty good low budget horror movie that takes advantage of the anxiety associated with pregnancy. It is very well played by the always good Brooke Adams and B-movie star James Karen, although the supporting actors are pretty average for a B-grader. The music, especially Gary Numan, is also good. Henry Dominic's script is quite intelligent for these kinds of things, though there is a hint of misogyny. Rodman Fender's direction is only appropriate, and there are some unnecessary cheap horrors. If you're a fan of Adams whose movie career is not nearly as illustrious as it should be, look at it; she is great, as always.

summary: Franco Arno is a blind man that lives with his young niece and makes a living writing crossword puzzles. One night, while walking on the street, he overhears a weird conversation between two man sitting in a car parked in front of a medical institute where genetic experiments are performed. The same night someone breaks in the institute and knocks out a guard. Arno decides to investigate with the help of reporter Carlo Giordani.
translation:
THE CAT O'NINE TAILS (Code from Il Gatto a Nove)

Aspect ratio: 2.35: 1 (Cromoscope)

Sound format: Mono

( 35mm and 70mm release prints)

A blind ex-journalist (Karl Malden) hears a blackmail action outside a genetics research lab and later works with a colleague (James Franciscus) to do a series of murders in the lab, unknowingly theirs own loved ones delivered to a psychopathic killer.

Following the unexpected worldwide success of his director's debut THE BIRD WITH THE CRYSTAL PLUM (1969), Dario Argento conceived THE CAT O'NINE TAILS as a Giallo thriller, much like his predecessor, the famous Hollywood star Karl Malden - fresh from his appearance in PATTON (1969) - and the rising star Franciscus (THE VALLEY OF GWANGI). Unfortunately, the resulting film - which, according to the ads, was "nine times more exciting" than "Bird" - is a disappointing successor, impeccably photographed and stylishly executed, but too tough and aimless for general consumption.

Malden and Franciscus are very well represented in sympathetic roles, and cinematographer Enrico Menczer (DE DEAD IS ALIVE) uses the wide Cromoscope frame to transport the high-tech world in which Argento's bleak scenario unfolds, but the subplot with Euro-star Catherine Spaak (DER LIBERTIN) as a romantic interest of Franciscus means little more than unnecessary padding. Highlights include an unforgettable encounter with the black-gloved assassin in a crowded train station (edited with an elegant affirmation of the cult film Franco Fraticelli) and a nighttime episode in which Malden and Franciscus seek and find an important clue in a spooky grave the devious machinations of the murderer. But despite these flashes of light, the film races aimlessly from one scene to the next, simmering gently, without ever really getting to the boil. It is not surprising that "Cat" did not emulate the incredible success of "Bird", which was released in 1971.

(English version)

summary: All Friedrich wanted was to propose to Heidi, his supervisor, on a business trip. But while rehearsing on an airplane toilet, he and his ring drop out into the sky over the alps. Only to land in a very strange fairytale world. Come to find out, Middle Earth is right in the heart of Switzerland! To make matters worse, the quirky inhabitants mistake Friedrich for Frido the Tellyhobbie. Before he can say Tolkien, he's on a mission to save the world from an evil wizard who wants to dip the whole planet in one huge sizzling Swiss cheese fondue. A mission so crazy... it just might wake the hero in him. In the tradition of Scary Movie, THE RING THING is a spoof of the Ring Trilogy, topped off with the funny peculiarities of Switzerland.
translation:
It was considered the "Swiss Answer to the Lord of the Rings", but it's much more than that. It's not an answer to anything, it's something new, something funny, and sometimes it's very stupid and silly - but it was Monty Python other than silly?

The beginning immediately makes the statement that this movie is low budget and should not be taken very seriously. Pappwolken on strings knock into the airplane, in which the main figure sits. But to compensate for the missing special effects, the landscape is the right one. It's absolutely beautiful and breathtaking - who needs New Zealand, Switzerland has it all.

What I liked about the movie was the simple approach and the obvious passion and energy behind it. It is not brilliant; Still, it has some good humorous roles. Edward Piccin as Friedo is absolutely convincing, it would be enough to watch the movie because of him! There are some good jokes, some are very lame, some are not understood by people outside of Switzerland. I liked the idea of ‚Äã‚Äãhaving Urukows instead of Uruk Hai; I loved the scene where Friedo decides to take "Pupsi", a telehobbie, on the journey. The scene in which Rackaroll, the swordsman decides to demonstrate with his sword - and then hits him in a wall and breaks it is also very funny. And there's this one scene where the "Nazgul-isch" characters make a wonderfully funny scene containing a toilet brush ... I disagreed with the idea that Schleimli's ring, the "Gollum" character in order to "seduce" the ladies. That was a bit far-fetched. The idea that Lord Saurau wanted to cover the grounds with fondue was not so brilliant either. Original, sure, but not brilliant. But most of all, I did not like the idea of ‚Äã‚Äãa gay dragon, which was really not necessary. All in all, I recommend watching the movie because it is so crazy and totally trashy. Do not expect a LotR parody like "Spaceballs" for Star Wars. But if you go to the movies and think that this is going to be an amusing evening, with absolutely no ambitions, then you will enjoy it. I'm not sure if it works in other languages ‚Äã‚Äãbecause it lives on the Swiss dialects as well as the jokes and actors.

All in all: Hats off to the courage of the Swiss crew, did this!

summary: Meat merchant Oleg, prostitute Marina, and piano tuner "simply Volodya" drop into an all-night bar in Moscow, where they are served by a narcoleptic bartender (three plus one is four) while each regales the others with made-up biographies. Oleg claims to work in President Putin's administration, supplying him with bottled water and his wife with liquor; Marina passes herself off as a marketing executive; and Volodya, the infamous lead singer of the rock group Leningrad, as a geneticist who clones twins (two times two makes four, again) in a laboratory that has been engaged in these experiments since the days of Stalin. After they separate, these fantasy realities, especially Volodya's, begin to dominate their everyday lives.
translation:
The movie is only worth seeing if you stop after half an hour. It starts with fun conversations in a bar and lets you expect a good, funny story to come. Well, I can tell you that it will not come. It will deteriorate in a matter of minutes into a movie that challenges your patience as well as your sense of shame for the actors to such an extent that you will probably not be pleased to witness.

In an interview, I heard that the director in this film wanted to express the sense of identity loss experienced by the majority of people in this globalized world. I was amazed to hear that. Am I living in the same world he lives in? OK, a lot of people walk around in the same clothes as mine and listen to the same music, but that does not make me believe that I'm losing my identity. What does Khrzhanosvky think we are no more than the clothes we wear and the films we see? Am I short-sighted or is that?

Well my voice: The good start of the movie saves it from getting a 1, a decent 4 is my conclusion.

summary: A young boy dies from a stray bullet during a shootout between a cop and mob family member who had previously been supiciously given probabtion, only to break its terms. New York's Deputy Mayor, Kevin Calhoun starts digging for information.
translation:
The film is about a classic theme. In fact, it is the subject exploited by Batman from beginning to end, but in real data and details. The mayor of New York, appreciated and very hard-working and dynamic to get through some project a little faster than normal, gives some pressure from some private entrepreneurs about a criminal drug dealer who should have been sent to jail and he puts pressure on the judge himself to release him on probation, despite a negative probation report that disappears, but is not destroyed, if only because of the political value he represents. And what will happen happens and a few people, including a black student, are killed in a shootout between a police detective and this criminal. The city could explode because of racial stress because of the black schoolboy and social tensions because of the insecurity that such criminals can roam around and continue with their criminal activities, they present to the public. Unfortunately, the film does not show this tension very well and follows the investigation of the first deputy mayor who wants to find out the truth and find out. But on the way, a few witnesses are killed, and those who have played a role in the whole thing are forced to retire (the judge) to their careers and their lives (the contractor or the contractor in between), a public one Ending officer was ready to deliver the missing probation report, and some dodgy figures, after he had delivered some important information. The mayor himself withdraws and makes a long vacation; But the main interest of the film is in exploring the contortions that the mayor is doing to cover up the problem and the dislocations he has remembered in the past that have led to the mistake of this probation case. The political philosophy that nothing is pure white or pure black and that everything is gray that decision makers do not like is cited as an excuse for making wrong but profitable decisions. We do not talk about necessary compromises in order to reach consensus in some areas of vital public interest. We talk about making it less important to make a bad decision about a small or supposedly petty criminal than about an infrastructure or economic project in the city. That's not typical of New York. That's true in every mayor's office. In a big metropolis like New York, and of course in a city or a country where police authorities are municipal authorities and controlled by political imperatives, it's quantitatively and qualitatively significant. The young Deputy Mayor pushes the old mayor out of the way and discourages his ambition to become governor of New York to become president of the United States. The mayor is perfect because of the embodiment that Al Pacino offers us, as he can express ten minutes of dialogue with a facial expression that makes the whole dialogue useless. I find the end slightly mushy with the ex-deputy mayor who fights in his own name. This seems to mean that he was so attached to justice because he saw his chance to push the mayor from his own side. Therefore, he is no better than anyone else, only too young in his ambitions.

summary: When a scientist discovers the possibility of the meaning of life, two shadowy organizations learn of this and will stop at nothing to steal the scientist's work for themselves. As a result, two burned-out assassins named Puritan and Sultan are assigned to protect the scientist and keep his project from falling into the wrong hands.
translation: It's obvious that all the good reviews that have been released for this movie come from insiders who either participated in the movie or know someone who knows someone and saw multiple cuts. Well, I do not know anybody, and I've seen the last cut, and it's pure garbage. The only thing that leads to it are ambition and several cameos of horror legends (not terribly long on the screen). It's as if the filmmakers filmed this movie during a horror convention weekend, and made actors like Tony Todd, Tom Savini, David Hess, and Michael Berryman shoot scenes in their coffee breaks. This is an ultra-cheap, shot-on-video would-be X-Files with terrible actors from a cast of non-actors with more mullets than is acceptable in the 21st century. There is little or nothing; It's all overly explanatory dialogues trying to explain a meaninglessly complicated plot. Their computer FX are a joke, but there is not enough of them or enough action to make this movie entertaining in an MST3K way. After about 8 scenes of talking only, you will notice that you reach for the fast forward button ... and do not let go. Absolutely worthless.

summary: After a wave of reports of mysterious attacks involving people and pets being eaten by the traditionally docile fruit, a special government task force is set up to investigate the violent veggies and put a stop to their murderous spree. Included in this crack team are a lieutenant who never goes anywhere without his parachute, an underwater expert who's never out of his scuba gear, and a master of disguise who conceals his appearance by dressing as a black Adolf Hitler.
translation: Yes, it can be done. John De Bello and Costa Dillon cleaned up the garbage of their thoughts and designed the worst comedy, horror and sc-fi musicals. If there is something, it is terrible or far too exaggerated. Special effects; Make your choice ... very low budget or kindergarten. Every cheap cliche is used. Without a doubt a funny movie that you can watch. A cold six-pack or two. Point your finger at radiation if you need an excuse. Mutant tomatoes are almost the size of a tow truck and begin to attack humanity. San Diego is a good place to start. Scientists and an absent-minded military must find the way to stop this red-rolling threat. These cult favorite features: David Miller, Eric Christmas, Al Sklar, Tom Coleman, Sharon Taylor and John Qualls.

summary: Gus Cantrell is a major league pitcher in the twilight of his career. He contacted by Roger Dorn, General Manager of the Minnesota Twins, and offered the role of managing the Buzz, the Twins' AAA team. Cantrell accepts but regrets it almost immediately. The Buzz is a dysfunctional no-hoper team, with an odd assortment of characters. However, Cantrell quickly sets about forging them into a winning team.
translation:
MAJOR LEAGUE: BACK TO THE MINDER (1998) ¬Ω *

Performers: Scott Bakula, Eric Bruskotter, Corbin Bernsen, Dennis Haysbert, Jensen Daggett, Screenplay and Director: John Warren 100 Minutes FSK 13 (for language and violence)

By Blake French:

Believe it or not, in the new John Warren comedy "MAJOR LEAGUE: BACK TO THE MINORS" there is a funny scene , It's a sequence in which an angry coach throws baseball hard into the wall behind him just to let it hit the cement and hit back and slap it in the face. It's not much, but apart from a few one-liners, it's all this movie has to offer ... enough said.

This film is not only structurally impaired, characteristically undeveloped, predictable and poorly written, but also just bad. Even uncritical viewers will hate this movie with everything they have. It's so familiar that it's just not funny.

How often does the same movie have to be about sports? Last year we saw the same material in "Air Bud: Golden Receiver", and as bad as that movie was, that's even worse. At least "Air Bud" was family-oriented. "Major League Back to the Minors" is too vulgar for a healthy family to see each other on a Sunday afternoon. It is too childish for adults. So who is this movie for? Young people? Old? People who are so desperate for entertainment that they would rent something like that?

The film, like so many others, has a basic point: teamwork conquers everyone. Yes, it does, and what a great moral to prove. Too bad we've seen it so many times before and have so little talent and intelligence that their cheerleading men are in ballerina costumes. Where the silly announcers make their own "buddy comedy routine" and mumble a liner to themselves like "suck you", "This fast ball for kids is timed with an hourglass," "This guy dropped out of the ball for a while to find something lost - maybe it was his opinion, "Someone needs a nap," and "ever see a sunset as beautiful as this game." Where the characters mean so little to each other that we never know them by name where the only warm talk scene about teamwork is so ignorant that it's almost funny.

"Major league back to the minors" is so bad, it stays in the middle of a good final sequence. Team is on a comeback, they're about to win and - the power goes out - I thought for a minute that this piece of garbage had come to an end, but in fact his wrong last scene only adds to minutes at runtime Movie best It's basically a series of disjointed sketches that throw so many lazy jokes that it's not funny. There is another kind of funny dialogue line where a coach and a player talk to each other why a longtime outfielder is no longer wanted in this position. The trainer's answer: "You are too old, too slow and too fat." The reaction of the player is a dream. But this scene certainly does not make this movie remarkable and does not cost a penny of your money.

So here's another terrible entree into this genre of film, another one that's condemned with its own scripture that has previously failed, and another that's so familiar that it's like Deja -Vu always shines.

summary: Three 40-something women in a small English town meet weekly for a ritual of gin, cigarettes, and sweets -- and swapped stories arguing which of them has the most pathetic love life. Kate is headmistress at the local school; her best friends are the town's police chief and a cynical, thrice-divorced doctor. When Kate begins a fling with a handsome younger man, less worldly than her friends but passionate and sincere, the other women can't simply be happy for the couple's unusual new romance. In jealousy they promptly take it upon themselves to break up the pair, taking drastic measures which result in unintended outcomes, some happy and some tragic.
translation:
As a single woman over 40, I found this movie extremely insulting and demeaning for single women over 40, not to mention any other woman of any age. It was a sad, pitiful attempt by a man to write and direct a "chick flick," and he failed miserably. Andy McDowell is not much of an actress in the beginning, but given the nonexistent "plot" (I even hate to call her action), she had no chance. There was no character development, no reason to feel sympathy / empathy for any of the characters, and no attempt to make the movie realistic or credible in any way. And then there is the compulsory male fantasy of an attractive, heterosexual woman who suddenly decides to become a lesbian - PLEASE.

Not only do I want to get my money back for the DVD rental, but I want to have those 112 minutes of my life back. What a rip off.

summary: Well-intentioned Marsha and David hire a foreign housekeeper, Sophia, to care for their new baby and put some "sanity" back in their lives. What follows is a situation that spirals out of control. In a frenzy to find an American husband before her visa expires, Sophia manipulates poor Marsha and David into caring for her ten-year-old daughter while she goes on a dating marathon.
translation: I gave this movie such a high score because it was really cute, really funny and unpretentious. I visited this movie while playing in the Philadelphia area and it was the centerpiece of a great night out with friends. The film is well written and well played, and although it feels more like a sitcom rather than a movie, it does not take the movie away. Comedies like these just do not exist anymore, where you do not have to shock people to be funny. The film revolves around a Ukrainian housekeeper who works for a young couple who needs help. Although she helps first, she soon adds more insanity to her life than the couple they set out to do. Things keep getting out of control until ... you'll have to see! The banter made me laugh even after I left the theater. This movie just made me feel good. I can not wait for it to be released on DVD because I want this movie in my collection.

summary: In 1886, the gunman and gambler Tom Early returns to his homeland to settle down, but he is rejected by his community. He rides to his farm, where he finds that his wife Alice has recently died and his son Tom Early Jr., who disagrees with taking up arms, is working alone. The next morning, Tom rides into the town to buy supplies and sees Sam, the grocer, humiliating his employee Jo. At the same time the cattle lord Grimsell arrives in town with two gunfighters, Gunn and Blondie, and tells the Preacher that he will be crossing 20,000 head of cattle through their lands and their town. Although the preacher tries to explain that the people own the land, Grimsell is not interested in their rights. When Blondie sees Tom Early, he draws his gun but is shot by Tom, in self defense, and kills the gunman. He then invites Jo to work on the farm. While the Preacher wants to send an emissary to Laramie to bring the law to his town, Grimsell summons more than thirty gunfighters to work for him. ...
translation: The story of peace-loving peasants and townspeople struggling for land, water, law and order, and the respect and ultimate subjugation of the long entrenched livestock interests and their rented weapons had been better processed in earlier (Shane) and probably later films. There are some good action scenes and the general layout of the story, except for a disappointing ending, is well executed. Law and order and religion have roots in the city, but the old order of drovers, cowboys and gunslingers is still there. The clash of the two comes in a nicely staged ambush scene in which the citizens drive into a trap. Granger, an ex-gunfighter, plays the guy who is shunned by the city dwellers who need his expertise with a weapon.

summary: A German-born engineer, his American wife and their children travel from Mexico to the United States to visit her family but their plans are complicated by a Romanian count.
translation: Probably my favorite movie, a story of selflessness, sacrifice and dedication to a noble cause, but it's not preaching or boring. It just never gets old, though I've seen it 15 or more times in the last 25 years. Paul Lukas's performance brings tears to my eyes, and Bette Davis is a joy in one of her few really sympathetic roles. The children are, as Granny says, more "disguised dwarfs" than children, but that only makes them more enjoyable to watch. And the slow awakening of the mother to what is happening in the world and under her own roof is believable and terrifying. If I had a dozen thumbs, they would all be up for this movie.

summary: Three friends out for a weekend motorcycle ride through Wales stumble upon a marijuana field and biker gang war.
translation: I was pleasantly surprised by the movie. Let's be honest; The premise does not sound particularly attractive when you have to hand over money for a movie of the night, but it has a serene nature that wins you over. There were no moments that I thought were noisy, and I doubt I'll remember it the next day, but that does not fail as a nice distraction. What I found funny was seeing it here in Beijing with my Chinese girlfriend who never understands what I like. I told her there was a plot - three guys have to bring some grass to London. Hardly satisfactory for her. There's no robbery for the camera here, which I expected after reading some of the comments. However, I take exceptions from comparisons with Withnail and myself; not in the same league, and I doubt it was intended. www.imperialflags.blogspot.com

summary: A Cockney con-artist just out of prison replaces an insurance company's computer programmer and sends claim checks to himself in various guises at addresses all over Europe. Meanwhile, he falls in love with inept secretary and frustrated flutist, Maggie Smith.
translation: I was excited to discover this comic comedy of the late sixties staring at some of my favorite people - Maggie Smith, a very young Bob Newhart and, of course, Peter Ustinov. My disappointment was that the film was neither a comedy nor a perfect robbery movie. Ustinov is playing a little time crook just out of jail, putting his websites on a big American company in London. He bluffs past the cumbered CEO Karl Malden and Tech-Geek Newhart and pretends to be a computer expert and immediately plans the "perfect raid" part of the movie. To do this, he must pass a tamper-proof security system that protects the company's mainframe. And here is problem one. His perfect plan works only because everyone else in the movie is remarkably confident and stupid. His lame excuses are taken at face value, and that must be the only data center that does not bother with video cameras anywhere. The second problem is the robbery within the first 30 minutes of the film, which will rob the rest of the picture in dramatic tension. Unfortunately, Maggie Smith is misled as Ustinov's neighbor / secretary, who just can not keep a job. I love Maggie Smith, but she just seems to be too much here, too composed, the role is more of a crazy, physical comedian. In addition, Ustinov and Smith have no chemistry with each other, maybe it's the age difference, but the later romantic relationship, as free of genuine romance as it is, still gets a bit scary. Ustinov co-wrote the script, which was well meant at that time, but I found it unconventional, meandering and a sad waste of a great cast.

summary: A man does an identity switch to collect insurance money but finds himself in danger.
translation:
Seeming to be a thriller of a movie becomes almost ridiculous. It caused me to say "Oh my god!" more than once in the interlaced lines of action that were just stupid.

Fantastic or absurd places just for the sheer novelty or dramatic situation and unlikely, almost impossible, human reactions and circumstances are too much to realize why they exist.

If you have time and want to find out how bad a picture can be, then you should see this. Otherwise, spend some time to watch some color for a more productive investment of the time!

(The fact that a film released in 2003 will be shown on television in July 2003 may give an indication of the quality of the film)

summary: The Griswolds win a vacation to Europe on a game show, and thus pack their bags for the continent. They do their best to catch the flavor of Europe, but they just don't know how to be be good tourists. Besides, they have trouble taking holidays in countries where they CAN speak the language...
translation: Every movie with "National Lampoon" in the title is guaranteed to die in London, England, Paris, France, Rome, Italy and all over Germany. It may be an institution in the US, but it is virtually unknown in Europe "National Lampoon's European Vacation" is unlikely to resolve this situation. The terrible Griswalds are just that - horrible. They are not funny. Sure, Mr Chevy Chase thinks he's funny, after all, Miss B.di Angelo laughs a lot about his jokes, but she gets paid for it and does not have to spend ¬£ 2.50 on the privilege. The section in England is typical. The same old, old TV stars, Messrs. Idle, Smith, Coltrane, and Miss M. Lippman, are trudging the same old, old, tired clich√©s. Mr. Chase is losing himself in the hotel corridor ... yawning, yawning, yawning. Buckingham Palace, Big Ben ...... I feel cheated that we never bobbies on bicycles two times-two ......... Rosie red cheeks on the little chil - Dren, do I need further? The English are fools, the French vicious - Yank haters. The Germans are pompous and pompous, (not to mention the war, Clark), and the Italians are lusting for ground-pinchers. Did I forget something? Every possible "weird" situation is worked to death, Mr. Chase gourns desperately, Miss di Angelo dimples sweet, the kids are embarrassingly bad. The fact that this franchise has been going for as long as it has must bring comfort to those who claim that you never lose money by underestimating the taste of the public.

summary: In part six of the Nightmare on Elm Street series, dream monster Freddy Krueger has finally killed all the children of his hometown, and seeks to escape its confines to hunt fresh prey. To this end, he recruits the aid of his (previously unmentioned) daughter. However, she discovers the demonic origin of her father's powers and meets Dad head-on in a final showdown (originally presented in 3-D).
translation:
Now all Springwood, Ohio, kids and teens are all dead, expecting a teenager (Shon Greenblatt) to be alive. Freddy (Robert Englund) lets him go and the teenager has no great memory when he arrives in a new city. As a tough psychologist (Lisa Zane) tries to break the new patient. She finds out where he's from. She brings him to Springwood to bring some memories, but three teenagers (Lezlie Deane, Breckin Meyer, and Ricky Dean Logan) came aboard unexpectedly. Once in Springwood, the psychologist has a reminder that she was a child in this city. While Freddy knows the true secret of her true identity.

Directed by Rachel Talalay (Ghost in the Machine, Tank Girl) made a grim, but strangely different sequel with a visual style and funny moments for this horror / fantasy / thriller. Yaphet Kotto (Alien) has a supporting role as a psychologist expert on dreams. This has some awesome visual effects (not everyone will love the climax, especially in 3-D) and some good style in his storytelling. This has eradicated some of the series of the film at the box office.

DVD has a strong anamorphic widescreen (1.85: 1) transmission (also in Pan & Scan) and a strong Dolby Digital 5.1 surround sound. DVD has the original movie trailer, Jump to a Nightmare opinion and Cast & Crew information. The "box set" of "Elm Street", the eighth disc, has interviews with the cast and crew of this sixth film. The sixth movie is also in 3-D for the movie climax, but you could see it at 2-D as well. This is the last of the "Elm Street" movies until Wes Craven puts Freddy back into a different, darker style in "New Nightmare" and the silly but surprisingly entertaining spin-off horror movie "Freddy Vs Jason". Watch Robert Shaye (co-owner and co-CEO of "New Line Cinema"), Roseanne Barr, Tom Arnold, Johnny Depp and Alice Cooper in amusing cameos. Written by Michael De Luca (John Carpenter's In the Mouth of Madness). From a story of the director. (*** ¬Ω / *****).

summary: American tourist Jesse and French student Celine meet by chance on the train from Budapest to Vienna. Sensing that they are developing a connection, Jesse asks Celine to spend the day with him in Vienna, and she agrees. So they pass the time before his scheduled flight the next morning together. How do two perfect strangers connect so intimately over the course of a single day? What is that special thing that bonds two people so strongly? As their bond turns to love, what will happen to them the next morning when Jesse flies away?
translation:
My clock came a little too late, but I am glad that I have seen both this and the sequel together ... which compliments me to the makers of this strip, that they have given the idea of ‚Äã‚Äãromance such a pure and basic treatment and very marginally have it separated from the idea of ‚Äã‚Äãrelationships! Since much has already been written about the film, it would be only appropriate to highlight some parts of the film that I personally loved.

I think the point where Jesse and Celine made fake phone calls to their respective friends was a very smart way to tell each other what they needed each other through a trip that did not even last 24 hours , had to tell ... the curiosity of two people, both of whom had made the one infallible impression on the other, was treated very smartly ...

On the plot in front, a romantic story working on pure Talking is not an easy task to accomplish.

I believe in romantic films of such a taste, the characters are not clear even in the mind of the author and director. What the actors produce is what becomes of them. Right or wrong even the idea bearer would find it hard to justify ... becoming the character, the life the actor gives has to go beyond the instructions and the story ... here both actors are doing just the right job! Kudos .. !!! And before sunset is another spring that makes this even more beautiful!

summary: When his wife goes into a troubled labor while he is on the road over 1200 miles away James Kowalski, a former race-car driver and Army Ranger, attempts to elude police while trying to get home. After numerous chases, he turns into a aboriginal American reservation and reflects on his life, and his wife. He then heads off to break through an impenetrable police and F.B.I. road-block.
translation:
I have to say, I loved Vanishing Point. I saw the original, and that's a pretty good remake of it. Although it did not follow the original plot (that's why I gave it 8 out of 10), it was still pretty good and that's probably a better story.

As far as the car is concerned, the DJ's commentary on the Challenger at the end, driving into the bulldozers at 185 mph, is pretty unlikely (And if you look, the tachometer needle wobbled at 145-150) but although I do not have an engine in one of the opening scenes in which they show the engine, the original story had a charged Hemi, so it's possible. For those of you who say aerodynamics would not allow it, today's normally aspirated Chrysler 300C can go 168 mph, and if you look at this thing, going on a freeway with it, it's like a brick wall by the wind pushing at 70 mph. In a wind tunnel test, it would probably be more aerodynamic if you equip the Challenger with a compressed air dam.

summary: A school director is forced to train the 'worst' students of his school to master Taekwondo as the old coach, taking along the best of his athletes, left the school.
translation:
They know the story - a group of brave no-hoppers enter into a contest they seemingly can not win - it's a story Hollywood has put to death (Bring It On, Karate Kid, Escape to Victory, Best of best, etc.). Now Korea is fighting with a Taekwondo team fighting for fame? and guess what ?? the result is predictable, but ultimately satisfying.

That this film does not fall on its nose is due to the talented young performers who really care about the characters, and this in turn keeps you watching until the end.

Fans of your typical martial arts movie might be disappointed? Taekwondo does not provide the usual moves and acrobatics seen in most kung fu films. The action is limited to (though impressive) kicks and occasional punch. However, this does not matter because it is the interaction of the characters and their struggle to make something of themselves that makes this movie a success.

summary: 25 years ago two boats raced G√∂ta Canal. It's about time to copy the race with live TV-coverage. Some really wild reality-TV.
translation:
This movie is an exception to the rule that a sequel is worse than the original one. His comedy at its best. This movie is a fast-paced action-slapstick comedy in which something seems to happen every second. On more than one occasion, the entire audience laughed aloud at a joke.

It's a great advantage to have seen the first movie, but it's not a requirement.

G√∂ta kanal 2 also have the advantage of being a parody of the reality production TV series of recent decades like survivors (Expedition: Robinson in Swedish) This is a Swedish film for the Swedish audience. So do not look at it if you are unfamiliar with Sweden and its language. Otherwise: Have fun! Johan

summary: A young inbred loner wandering the back roads of North Carolina comes across an abandoned baby. He immediately starts seeking the baby's parents, but starts developing a bond with the child that explores his own isolated roots. In true bad guy fashion, a traveling salesman appears and truths about the baby's origin start to unravel. But little did they know it was a trap.
translation: This is one of the most interesting movies I have ever seen. I love the hillbilly feeling of this movie. The movie is very realistic and believable. This seems to happen in another era, perhaps in the late 60's or early 70's. Henry Thomas works well with the baby boy. Very moving story and worth a look.

summary: Paul McCartney in concert during his spring 2002 tour of the U.S.
translation:
This is a great movie for McCartney and Beatles fans a glorious time for all.The audience guaranteed (feat some celebrities like Nicholson, Cuzak, Michael Douglas) is, as always, quite amazing: from little kids to old comrades from you know the words by heart to all the songs, and some of them cry when Paul breaks into "blackbird" "yesterday" "all my loves" and all the treasures of his catalog (who except John Lennon and Dylan, can claim such a repertoire?) There are two particularly moving moments:

-The double homage to Lennon and Harrison, first soloed "here today" (the title was included in the "Tug of War") in 1982 and was his best track), then " something "when Paul uses a ukulele.

- "The Long and Winding Road" Playback, a key moment when Paul's voice breaks as he moves too Tears in the hearts keep the members of the tour crew in front of the stage.

I remember in the early '70s when people despised Paul because he was not involved in politics like his ex-partner. They had to change their minds because Paul is a dedicated artist: "Fame is great because it allows charity". The film shows different aspects of Paul's activities, an artist who is anything but selfish.

summary: Riding her bicycle on her way to school, a dreamy, ten-year-old, red-haired farm girl decides to take a shortcut through a ruddy and luscious autumn forest, somewhere in the mountainous region of eastern France. Unexpectedly, the young girl encounters a bright-eyed red fox, however, the untamed wild animal flees in an instant, leaving her longing to meet again. Since then, a whole winter has passed and still no sign of the elusive fox, but with the arrival of spring, the girl determined to find the animal, finally locates its den and an ambitious effort to grow accustomed to each other begins. As we witness a succession of compelling scenes, lost inside the enchanting and breathlessly exquisite landscape, we observe the bond between a human and a savage animal grow gradually stronger, yet, a wish and question emerge. If only we, humans, could talk to the wild beasts, and if we could, could we ever become friends?
translation:
THE FOX AND THE CHILD is the latest film by MARCH THE PENGUINE filmmaker Frenchman Luc Jacquet. The film, which features only one human being, the young actress Bertille No√´l-Bruneau, tells the story of the rather rare but seemingly believable relationship between a child and a wild fox.

Natural documentary and part fairy tale, the film revolves around L'Infant, the child who one day finds the path of a wild fox in a picturesque setting, possibly France, on the way to school, though the exact location never is mentioned. In the next few weeks, the child returns to the place where she hopes her fox will see her on one of those days, the fox she calls Lily again. And so it continues. The days become weeks, and then the summer disappears, turns into autumn and winter and offers an excellent cinematography of the white winter landscape. At some point spring comes again, and the little child finds her fox, and in fact a friendship with the animal comes together. And so on.

I had little to no expectations for THE FOX AND THE CHILD. I had seen PENGUIN FAIRY and was simply impressed with the movie that was included in this film. Luc Jacquet is an extremely talented and indeed rare filmmaker, and I expected great, breathtaking cinematography, sweeping vistas, and brilliant wildlife shots. This was delivered in spades. But here Jacquet has a scriptwriter, and before the show I did not know anything about the movie. I was expecting something a little different from what you had seen before in March. A fictitious story.

The kid and the fox And the story is simple. A young, seemingly lonely child lives in a house in the middle of nowhere and goes to school, seemingly alone, every day seemingly without any care in a seemingly perfect world. Without the reference to an adult in sight. Brilliant. So she makes friends with a fox.

With such a film, you have to give your own opinion about the film and put yourself in the role of the target group. This is a movie that is aimed directly at children over the age of six. Or for families who want to go to the cinema on a wet Sunday afternoon with their race. Not a 31-year-old man who gets his films from films like the last, brilliant WANTED and the like. But since I'm the Newbie critic in London, I put myself in the shoes of an excited eight-year-old girl for about 95 minutes of THE FOX AND THE CHILD. Now I have some problems with this movie. As a 31-year-old boy and a loyal lover of all things cinematic, I loved animal and landscape photography. It's visually stunning. The direction of the animal figures is brilliant - as good as you find it at Attenborough. As an impressionable, brief attention spanning eight years, I loved the first half hour - then I lost interest. It's a bit repetitive and sometimes quite shocking and scary for a younger kid, especially the darker ending. As a 31-year-old man - I was a little scared. Wuss.

Well, it's not a kids movie. It's not really an adult movie and I felt a little disappointed. Is it a good family movie? Depends. It may be instructive and the movie carries a message. It's definitely not a movie I would pay the hard-earned green to see, and I rack my brains out to recommend it to a certain type of movie goer. It's hard, but I know that some will see this movie and fall in love. It's very European in feel and if you are a fan of wildlife issues, try it. Doubts? Well, I would wait for the DVD for a wet Sunday afternoon. - Paul Heath, http://www.thehollywoodnews.com, July 2008.

summary: When a promised job for Texan Michael fails to materialise in Wyoming, Mike is mistaken by Wayne to be the hitman he hired to kill his unfaithful wife, Suzanne. Mike takes full advantage of the situation, collects the money and runs. During his getaway, things go wrong, and soon get worse when he runs into the real hitman, Lyle.
translation: Before Nicholas Cage was a big action star, he was a great actor. In this lesser-known movie, Cage gives one of his best performances. "Red Rock West" was a low budget, almost unknown movie, but one of my favorite movies of all time. I discovered that it was in the video store and saw Cage and Hopper (who is also great in the movie) appear together. Go and get that, and I'm sure you will not be disappointed.

summary: Two couples and their single friend, all at different stages in their relationships, deal with the complications of dating, commitment and marriage.
translation: In general, the plot was much better than I expected. The Lachstrack was sometimes a bit annoying and tended to get in the way; However, there were enough real giggles in this episode to make amends. My biggest surprise was finding some of the best lines and situations that were not shown in the trailers. Spade, in particular, was not portrayed in the best light in the previous promotions, but his character does well in the pilot. There is enough eye candy to please almost everyone and all the normal characters seem to be up to the task ahead. Well, if the authors can only achieve what they started.

summary: When an unknown underwater object disables an American nuclear-powered submarine and attacks a submerged Arctic research complex, a scientific expedition flies to the North Pole to investigate these incidents as well as the sudden, inexplicable rise in temperature that threatens to melt the ice cap and flood the surface of the world.
translation:
Deep SH .. is more like it! The eels are only drawn over the film. Think "The incredible Mr. Limpet" meets "Leviathan". Very sticky.

No character or relationship development. So-called "romantic" scenes very cheesy and predictable. An interesting idea, but a poorly written script and LOUSY special effects make this a definite must-have!

summary: A group of soldiers in a caf√© watch a dancer as she entertains them, but later two of them become rivals over her.
translation: This is a terrible little movie - and unfortunately the company that did that made a few others. The short film is basically a one-wit idea that was not funny at first and could offend you as well. It certainly made me uncomfortable watching my very young children (most of them around 2 years old) frolicking and posing as adults - in this case, a dancehall girl and a bar-room fanatic. It's the kind of humor that you might have to laugh at from your own children if they pretend to be adults, but I can not see anyone who wants to see that - especially when a very young Shirley temple is dressed in a rather shabby way is outfit and behaves like a vamp! And then other children behave like adults in some more adult situations. I'm sure they did not try to appeal to pedophiles at the time, but when you look at it today, you realize it! That's why this boring movie got me and I hope to never see it again !! Pretty weird and pretty awful.

summary: The evil, sinister killer of the "Nightmare On Elm Street" movies, Freddy Krueger, hosts this show, where each week, he shows us a tale of evil and death about the lives of people who live in Springwood.
translation: I do not see how it can be said that Freddy's Nightmares is cheesy and a rip-off. Obviously you do not know a good TV when you see it. The episodes are full of drama and blood. Freddy is creative in the way he kills people. I love Freddy's Nightmares and I hope to get all 44 episodes on DVD. The best episodes are: Saturday Night Special, School Daze and Love Stinks. If you think that sucked this series, then you are entitled to your opinion, but remember that it is only your opinion and it does not mean anything. Freddy's Nightmares will always be one of the best shows of all time, and you'll soon accept that fact. If you do not like it, do not look at it, but do not deny it.

summary: Josh Pollack, a naive and ambitious reporter, is convinced the F.R.A.T., an elite force within the Edison Police Department, is corrupted. Working on a homicide case, he begins to unearth evidence which suggests that the entire justice system is willingly turning a blind eye to the abuses of the this force. When his life and that of his girlfriend are threatened from his research, he join forces with his editor, a once-famous reporter, and a renown private detective to bring down the F.R.A.T. and every one behind it.
translation:
Honestly, before I saw this movie, I had heard many people that this movie was a shame. I did not believe that since Morgan Freeman and Kevin Spacey took roles in this movie and looked at them myself. Apparently they were right. I was really disappointed and wondered all the time during the movie - why the hell did I watch this movie? Of course, I did not expect much from Justin, as he really does not belong in the movie / theater business. But Morgan and Kevin? I could not stop wondering why the hell they agreed to attend Edison. To be honest, her roles are pretty stupid.

Well, you might think, if the players are shit, then I should pay more attention to the story. It's indeed story is the core of a movie, but guys ... trust me ... this is not a movie you want to give credit for its story. Imagine, a clever journalist (Justin Timberlake) wrote a story against the system and at the same time learned from his boss (Morgan Freeman) how to become a "real" journalist. All this was supported by an agent who still has a heart for justice (LL Cool J) and a brilliant investigator (Kevin Spacey). In the end, they defeated the system with a happy ending story.

Geez, I could not go on with that. Remembering the movie makes me sick already. My advice, guys, do not look at this! Please save money and time for another movie.

summary: A group of guys capture a young girl with the intent of hurting her. They torture her in many ways, from beating her to putting a sharp piece of needle-like metal through her eye which pierces across her retina.
translation:
This is the first Guinea Pig movie from Japan and this one is the sickest in my opinion. A group of men torture a girl for several days before finally killing her. And at this point I will say that these films are NOT real! They are fake horror movies trying to be as realistic as possible.

The scenes are disgusting, but in many cases unrealistic. For example, when they kick the girl in the ground, we can clearly see her kick and stomp the floor next to the girl! And how stupid that looks! The sound effects are also unrealistic and make no sense. Other scenes include animal casts thrown at the girl, the girl who was exposed to loud noises for hours, the tearing of fingernails, worms on the wounds in the girl's body, the eye pierced and mutilated in horrific details. Very sick and mean movie and has absolutely nothing valuable or cinematic. This first entry is the sickest and most amateurish guinea pig, though it is not as bloody as the next part, flowers of flesh and blood that try to be as shocking as possible.

Guinea Pig: Devil The experiment is perhaps the most blatant thing I've seen, and the closest thing to it is. Of course that's (of course) wrong (s / n), the only difference to the real "snuff movie" is that in this movie nobody dies or hurts. I can not recommend it to anyone as it is so dirty and repulsive. Anyone who considers this a great horror movie knows nothing about the cinema and its true meaning. I've seen that as a curiosity (like the other parts in the series) and now I know how trivial the garbage is. They only work in the shock level and that's not an all-too-valuable cinematic achievement. Devil's experiment is perhaps the sickest movie I've ever seen, and Mermaid in a Manhole (Guinea Pig 4) is perhaps the most disgusting movie I've seen. That's pretty extreme in my book, but that's all they are.

summary: In Los Angeles, Henry is a veterinarian whose fianc√©e Kate dies in an accident on the day they're to marry. Worried that Henry has closed off his social life, his sister suggests he use a psychic to contact Kate, lay to rest unresolved feelings, and live more fully. He tries it, though he doesn't believe in it. Nothing happens, so his sister gives Ashley, the psychic, Kate's diary. Now she's able to convince Henry she's in contact with Kate and start the therapy. Two things happen: they find themselves attracted to each other, and Kate's ghost, who also has some unresolved issues, returns to stop this budding romance.
translation:
I took a flyer to rent this movie, but I have to say it was very, very good. On all fronts: screenplay, cast, directing, photography, high production values, etc. Probes Eva Longoria Parker is head and shoulders in Rome / Com about bad actors like Kate Hudson and Jennifer Aniston who douse and call it acting. Who'da thunk it?

Parker and Isla Fisher are in a class of their own and should try to endure projects like "Over The Dead Body". Lake Bell is also excellent, and that's the first time I've seen it. And finally, Paul Rudd comes out in a really good movie, instead of smaller films.

A movie like this never gets its contributions from narrow-minded men. This is a pity. As other IMDb reviewers have noted here, there's nothing lame about this gem - no hacker writing or acting.

And his depiction of contemporary L.A. and California in general makes every scene bright, beautiful, clean and otherwise outstanding in every way. Never has a movie made L.A. look so good. Ah, which can mean a bit of talent and a lot of care for a movie.

I will not divulge the action, but as a longtime and stubborn atheist, I was ready to stop disbelief and buy into the supernatural subject, to enjoy an excellent and carefree piece of entertainment. It reminds me a lot of the old "topper" movies that were so good too.

This film exposes popular but otherwise hackneyed movies like "Ghost" for the mediocre and overly sentimental manure festivals. We already know that public taste is heavily based on mediocrity. However, some of us save our praise for the really valuable ones.

If you've enjoyed other overlooked gems like "In the Night" with Michelle Pfeiffer, Jeff Goldblum and Clu Gulager, "Blind Date" with Bruce Willis and Kim Basinger, "American Dreamer" with JoBeth Williams, "Chances Are" with Robert Downey Jr., Christopher McDonald and Cybil Sheppard, "Making Mr. Right" with John Malkovich, etc., you'll love it.

A first-rate job all around (though it's hard to believe that a straight guy would pretend to be gay more than five years ago). But even this plot does not diminish the movie's overall excellence.

summary: A remake of the classic 1963 movie "The Haunting" about a team of paranormal experts who look into strange occurrences in an ill-fated house. Through the course of the night some will unravel, some will question, and all will fight for their lives as the house fights back.
translation:
Effect (s) without a cause is usually not possible in the real world, but in the world of Hollywood remakes it is not only possible, it is required. The Haunting has received the computer treatment from a top-notch cinematographer-Turner-director who was once promising (Jan de Bont-Speed), but has since produced a number of big-budget garbage (Twister, Speed ‚Äã‚Äã2). >
actors are superfluous in a movie of this kind and they seem to realize it. Liam Neeson and Cathrine Zeta-Jones act as if they feel different everywhere than in this movie. Lili Taylor tries to add something, but whatever that may be, is unknown because the script feels like half of it is missing. Events simply happen, good and evil spirits emerge without rhyme or reason, and then the story ends with a most unsatisfactory non-event meant to end the last 90 minutes of untaminess.

There is really no reason not even to see this for the effects, as we all know that now everything can be brought to the screen. Why not see effects in the service of a good story, not just for its own sake?

summary: Paulie, an intelligent parrot who actually talks, relates the story of his struggle to a Russian immigrant who works as a janitor at the research institute where he is housed and neglected. Paulies story begins many years earlier when he is given as a gift to a little girl who stutters. Eventually, he teaches the girl to speak correctly but is taken away by her father because he believes the girl cannot distinguish fantasy from reality because she believes the bird can talk. Paulie goes through a series of adventures with a pawn shop owner, an ageing widow, a Mexican-American troubadour and a would be thief before being taken to the institute where he now lives.
translation:
Most people would say that if you were to watch a movie on a Saturday night, you really have to be bored. Actually, I had just come home and turned on the TV and there it was "Paulie".

I had missed the opening credits, so I did not know the name, but I saw that Cheech Marin was in it, so of course I thought I had "Born In East L.A." voted. When I saw him talking to a talking parrot, I was ready to reject this as the kind of flop movie they show late at night.

I'm glad to say it was better than that. As you know, Paulie is, if you're not already lost, trying to return to his original owner. Seems that it took years to find them. What Paulie's advantage should be is actually a disadvantage in several ways. People encounter an educated parrot and everything they see is a way to make money or use themselves.

While Cheech Marin's character makes "money" from him, he is not mean to him. The dance sequences with the parrots are something that children find cute, I found them amusing.

Paulie, who is naive, quickly learns that not all people are nice people. Especially the owner of an animal research laboratory. The man lies to him that he will help him to find his owner, as long as he helps in his animal communication research. Paulie is now stuck, but decides to fool the man at a demonstration to others of Paulie's vocal abilities.

During the film, Paulie tells his story to the homeowner who frees him, finds some other animals and the location of Paulie's owner. It is a touching reunion.

8 out of 10, the wing-cut scene should have been accepted and not shown. This part could disturb younger children. Otherwise it's a great movie for older kids and adults who are a kid in the heart. (THE END)

summary: Celeste Talbert has been the queen of the soaps for over two decades. Montana Moorehead needs to get her out of her way before she can move on and begins her program to get her to leave. She hires an old boyfriend of Celeste to be on the show and has Celeste become a murderer in the script, but each attempt has unforseen consequences.
translation:
It is very, very funny. You know exactly how a comedy should be. It also looks very, very good, as a Hollywood Spectacular should. So what do you want more? Howz has a very good Sally Fields. She's so much better off here than anything else I've ever seen her, and she looks so damn good. This movie is all you need to understand why she is a star. Those eyes! Like a silent movie star, but better. In fact, all eyes are so good. I pretended to be a bad TV soap actor with my girlfriend. We would do the thing where you really look quickly from one eye to the other of your partner. They do not do that in soap dish at all. Great. The eyes have it! (Sorry)

There are so many great performances whose fun is just waiting for each one of them to reappear. There is a whole workshop in which Kevin Kline is very subtle about the matter. Roger that? Yes, he is damn good. So is Robert Downey, Jr., who has since made a career as a slick, slimy executive. Cathy Moriarity, though not the most gifted actress, is so charismatic and captivating, especially when she's mad. And also Whoopi Goldberg is decent, her natural timing gives a little flat delivery here a little Zing. OK, no whoopi bashing, I hear you.

And then there's the hair. Soap Dish was made at the end of the BIG Hair Eighties, so the ridiculous Doos are like a great character in their own right. They get bigger and more silly just like you did. Yes, we have pictures.

Soap dish is better than I thought it would be better than I wanted. I'm fed up with movies that tell me to care for shallow, selfish, half talented egomaniacs, d. TV Soap Actors. Soap dish seems to be happy just to make me laugh at you. Thank you.

summary: Portrait of Andy Goldsworthy, an artist whose specialty is ephemeral sculptures made from elements of nature.
translation:
As I am not a poet myself, I can not really communicate the beauty and simplicity of this documentary. The effortless movement of Goldsworthy as he incorporates the beauty of nature into his own work fascinates. Watch as he lays leaves in a net hanging from a tree for a few minutes while talking about his work, and then gets the reward when the camera cuts into the wide-angle shot. Amazed at the ease with which he works, and then you realize the futility of a light breeze blowing through the entire network.

The genius of Goldsworthy knows no boundaries as his inspiration is nature itself. It is in the essential change of nature, where his work, though completed in its own sphere, is made complete.

summary: All the hot gamblers are in town, and they're all depending on Nathan Detroit to set up this week's incarnation of "The Oldest Established Permanent Floating Crap Game in New York"; the only problem is, he needs $1000 to get the place. Throw in Sarah Brown, who's short on sinners at the mission she runs; Sky Masterson, who accepts Nathan's $1000 bet that he can't get Sarah Brown to go with him to Havana; Miss Adelaide, who wants Nathan to marry her; Police Lieutenant Brannigan, who always seems to appear at the wrong time; and the music/lyrics of Frank Loesser, and you've got quite a musical. Includes the songs: Fugue for Tinhorns, "Luck Be a Lady", "Sit Down, You're Rocking the Boat".
translation: At least something good came from Damon Runyon's misguided attempt to sentimentalize the mafia. "Guys and Dolls," the seemingly indestructible stage musical, was recorded in 1955 by Joseph L. Mankiewicz ("All About Eve") in a colorful, entertaining movie featuring a star cast with Vivian Blaine (from the original) Broadway show ), Jean Simmons (whose character bears a strange resemblance to Audrey Hepburn in "Roman Holiday") and two of the all time great leading men, Frank Sinatra and Marlon Brando, who recently won Oscars for Best Supporting Actor ("From Here to Eternity" ) and Best Actor ("On the Waterfront") and were at the top of their game. One hears Brando sing "Luck Be a Lady Tonight" speaks volumes about where the early Dylan got his voice. Stubby Kaye steals the show as Nicely Nicely Johnson, who brings the house down with "Sit Down You Rocking The Boat." Omnipresent Sheldon Leonard adds another page to his rogue gallery of onscreen gangsters. The film has a bright, comic-like appearance and anticipates early 1960s pop art. The characters speak in a stylized dialect that is obviously based on Yiddish idioms. Although the film's social attitudes and gender roles are outdated, it's all a lot of fun, and even the gentle joke of the Salvation Army is harmless and does not reflect a real aversion to organized religion. Seeing Sinatra and Brando in the same movie is reason enough to see this movie, but in its 149 minutes, it has many other attractions to offer.

summary: When the fleet puts in at San Francisco, sailor Bake Baker tries to rekindle the flame with his old dancing partner, Sherry Martin, while Bake's buddy Bilge Smith romances Sherry's sister Connie. But it's not all smooth sailing: Bake has a habit of losing Sherry's jobs for her; and despite Connie's dreams, Bilge is not ready to settle down.
translation:
From a modern sensibility it is sometimes difficult to see older films. It's annoying to watch the stereotypical Wallflower librarian take off her glasses and become pretty and stupid enough to win a man. Especially such a superficial and volatile man. He's obviously a player (I would not trust him to stay loyal to her) who does not want to settle down, who only looks at silly attractive women and always calls her "baby" (ick!). Even after she has completely changed her appearance and life for him, he only goes to her after being (allegedly) turned down by another woman and finds out that Connie spent all her money renovating a boat for him. I wanted her to resist him and not chase him pathetically! His sudden conversion within a few minutes was completely unrealistic and did not work for me.

Apart from this subplot, I liked the movie. How can it not be that sailors dance together? (You can tell they came from San Francisco ....; D) The "Probetal" dance was great, watching Ginger Rogers as he purposefully stepped in and out of the "right footsteps" was great. The last dance scene "Face the Music" with beautiful costumes and Art Deco set was beautiful. And I really enjoyed "We Saw the Sea" (though they used it too many times too often, as if they realized that it was their best song). Anyway, the plot was a bit weak, like most musicals (IMO) - and the songs were OK, but dancing was worth watching. I wish they had been able to show a few shots of San Francisco as the movie was supposedly shot.

It's also weird to see such a carefree marine movie, with the knowledge of what Hitler has been doing time. I must try to give up all knowledge in order to plunge myself into a fictitious fantasy land.

summary: Parker Concorde, a freelance writer by trade currently working for the Psychic Pals phone service to make ends meet, is out of a home after accidentally starting a fire to his New York City apartment. Barely able to stand sacking out at his noisy pal Jack's place, he finally finds new digs with Samantha, who only rooms with gay men. With currently no other place to live, Parker allows her mistake over his sexual orientation to pass uncorrected, which later leads her to believe she's helping him out by setting him up on dates with her gay friends. Truth is - he's falling hard for her, and somewhere between dealing with her philandering boyfriend and dating other men he needs to set the record straight.
translation: Another insult and slap in the face for gay men everywhere. This lame attempt at a comedy has nothing to recommend. Again we have an attractive "straight" hero, who is not supposed to win a woman. Yes exactly! And we are also introduced to the "likeable, attractive" homosexual friend, who is actually a fat, bald, ugly old man whom the line is supposed to find attractive. Also I did not find him appealing and I am a fat, ugly old gay man (but fortunately not bald)! Whatever theatrical talent is here, it was thrown away by a bad script and a really dreadful direction. Mr. Sneeeker should be excluded from the film, but then he is no different than the countless other hacks that work in Hollyweed.

summary: Dee and Dawn are two dim-witted, pink-clad, blond ladies whom meet by accident and try to make a living with their dull lives, until a series of circumstances ensue when after they unwittingly take jobs at a local strip club, they are mistaken for two deadly female brunette assassins known only as the Cat and the Kit whom are hired to kill the club owner whom is a mobster in a witness protection program. With two persistent, but inept, FBI agents on their tail, the ditsy Dee and Dawn try to stay one step head of the law, as well as try to figure out what is really going on.
translation:
How could I best express my feelings about this film: horrible? A headache? Lack of coherent writing? simple stupidity? Try all the above for this travesty. And that only for the direction.

Story? Well, I think there is a story. Two dumb blondes are looking for a job after plunging a plane into a golf course.
