They are mistaken for a "forgotten assassin" (sarcasm) and hired by two "mafiosi". One thinks, "taking him out" means a date, and the other gets the little actor she dreams of. And of course, the turtle reserve for the farting turtle they build with the casino profits.

Does this sound funny? Rate again. They try to make fun of it, but it's not like that. Shooting sequences are not well done. I've seen better movies in Hong Kong movies. Visuals are average for a late 80s movie. But the problem is that it's a 2007 movie.

Not worth my time to ever see this again. The movie "Out" by Danny Glover from the early 80s is still the worst movie of all time, but also this film is in a class of its own. "F"

summary: Magloire Dazincourt, the owner of Bontemps, the largest sugar plantation of the entire South, asks his favorite cousin, Philippe Ferronaire, to marry his daughter Aglae Dazincourt and take over most of its management and family, including his colored mistress Cecile Ste. Marie, for whom he has a cottage build in New Orleans. When Magloire dies, Philippe becomes her lover and the father -not in law- of her son Marcel, named after his own father though, and promises her to get the boy educated in racially egalitarian Paris from age 18. However while still living in the decadent creole society in New Orleans, Marcel Ste. Marie gets in touch trough a colored carpenter with both his white and black roots, both of which bloodlines suffered greatly in the bloody racial civil wars on Haiti, a subject the American society refuses to deal with publicly, and the more people he gets to know or hears their past, the more he gets aware of social and racial matters. Then his father Philippe gets in ...
translation: The story and the show were good, but it was really depressing and I hate depressing movies. Ri'Chard is great. He really did show a first-class performance, and the girl who played his sister was really fantastic and beautiful. Seriously, I thought she was Carmen Electra until I saw the IMDb profile. I can not say anything bad about Peter Galleghar. He is one of my favorite actors. I love Anne Rice. I'm reading the vampire chronicles right now, but I'm glad I saw the movie before I read the book. That's a bit too "real" for me. I prefer Lestat and Louis' funny little Tiffs to the slavery battles. Eartha Kitt was so scary and after her character did what she did The movie was ruined for me; I could barely stand to see the rest of the show. (Sorry for the ambiguity, but I do not want to reveal anything) Sorry, but it's just not my kind of show.

summary: A mysterious creature from another planet, resembling a giant blob of jelly, lands on earth. The people of a nearby small town refuse to listen to some teenagers who have witnessed the blob's destructive power. In the meantime, the blob just keeps on getting bigger.
translation: When a small lump of ancient putty lands on the earth, it soon starts to consume earthlings and gain weight. The only part of this pointless jib I enjoyed were all the cool vintage cars. This dog had so many holes that it could be cut and sold for Swiss cheese. This thing has actually made 20 million dollars? And McQueen's reward was 3K? All were far overpaid. The "monster" looked very much like a big beanbag and the "teenagers" looked like they could have children approaching their teenage years. And those explosions from the shotgun; sounded like a pellet gun with a silencer. The end was pathetic; obviously the producers left the door open for a sequel ... and there were many. Thumbs down.

summary: Focusing on the bonding between three female (an African American female, a half African American half Latino American female, and a Latino American female) high school members of Brooklyn's "Jackie Robinson Steppers Marching Band" and the choices the girls face once their school closes down because of the need for asbestos removal. This film is about a host of topics, not least of which is the hard-work involved in maintaining friendships.
translation:
"Someday we'll walk in the rays of a beautiful sun Someday, when the world is much brighter" - The 5 steps "Ooh Child"

films about black teenagers mostly refer to the inner city gangs who sell drugs or give up violence to a hip-hop soundtrack. Films about the everyday problems of ordinary teenagers in the city are hard to find, but there is an undiscovered gem that I would like to recommend. Jim McKay's song is about three girls in Crown Heights, Brooklyn, who learn that their high school is closed for asbestos removal and has to decide on its future direction, which may take separate paths. The story is told from the point of view of a 15-year-old, not an adult who remembers the past, as is the case in most coming-of-age movies. It avoids the obligatory street-length and excessive use of F-words, delivering an honest and loving portrait of three friends at a crossroad in their life. The girls: Lanisha (Kerry Washington), Joycelyn (Anna Simpson) and Maria (Melissa Martinez) are in their second year at the local high school. They are active members of Jackie Robinson Steppers, a true marching band whose rehearsals for a Labor Day parade provide discipline and purpose for their lives.

Similar to George Washington's David Gordon Green, but less stylized, the film does not feature professional black and Latin American actors with Kerry Washington. While the performances have some amateurish moments, I was so busy with the story that I forgot that the girls were even acting. Maria, whose father is in prison, has learned that she is pregnant by Terrell, a local student. She wants to have the baby despite the fact that she is only 15 and knows that Terrell will probably not help much. Joycelyn works in an upscale boutique, but dreams of becoming a singer. In a very moving scene in her bedroom, she pretends to talk to her fans and then goes to bed to recite one of her poems. She is initially very close to Lanisha and Maria, but drifts off to find friends outside the neighborhood. None of the girls gets much support at home and Maria is too scared to tell her mother about her baby. Still, single mothers are not typical movie killers or alcoholics. They are warm and loving parents whose time is limited with their children because of the pressure to support the family.

Lanisha's parents are divorced, but she can visit her father, a doorman in a luxury home, and talk about music. Her mother comforts when Lanisha learns that a friend in the neighborhood has committed suicide, a somewhat melodramatic storyline in an otherwise realistic film. When the summer is over, the girls drift apart and everyone decides on a different course. There are no big dramatic moments, but only the sad realization of the inevitability of change. Although we have no blinders to the frustrations they can expect, we identify with their hopes and dreams without embarking on the negative. Our song is an emotionally satisfying film about growing up in projects that refuse to see life in terms other than opportunity.

summary: An eccentric toymaker's last wish is that his brother takes over the running of the business. The brother is a military General, and is out of touch with toymaking, and out of touch with reality too. The business should really have been given to Leslie, who was much more like his toymaking father. When the General starts making weapons instead of toys, Leslie decides to take action.
translation: I really despised this movie when I saw it at the age of 6 or 7 because I was a big fan of Robin Williams and nothing he could do was bad. Until then. This complete garbage ruined Robin for me for a long time. I am recently recovering with his fun but serious part on Father's Day, but then he continued to cause another mistake, Bicenntial Man, I think it was named, but the point is. Robin should now get much better jobs and now he has come back to produce the slime that was created with this "classic".

summary: Back when the Earth was being overrun by glaciers, and animals were scurrying to save themselves from the upcoming Ice Age, a sloth named Sid, a woolly mammoth named Manny, and a saber-toothed tiger named Diego are forced to become unlikely heroes. The three reluctantly come together when they have to return a human child to its father while braving the deadly elements of the impending Ice Age.
translation: I will not lie, this is a great movie. I saw it 4 months ago in my local theater. I saw it a second time and in the slow scenes I was a bit bored. Sid (the sloth) is not that flattering, but Diego (a mountain lion, I think) is really good in the movie. The animation is outstanding and the story has a touching ending. It's worth taking children under the age of 10, but teens would probably find it a bit boring. Also the uniqueness in the characters is so interesting. Like I said, it's a pretty good movie, but I would rate "Toy Story 2" or "Shrek" higher. 8.10

summary: --**Contains Spoilers**----Air Force pilot John Sands has been wrongfully imprisoned in a military detention center, where his memory is to be chemically wiped because some of his superiors feel threatened by the knowledge that he gained from his assignments to operations that were deemed too sensitive for the regular intelligence services. Later, after John escapes from the detention center, a top secret Air Force Stealth Bomber known as the X-77, which uses the latest in stealth cloaking technology, making it capable of going anywhere undetected, is stolen by corrupt Air Force pilot Ratcher. General Tom Barnes, John's former commander, hears that John has been arrested after taking down a group of men who were robbing a rest stop. Knowing that John was Ratcher's trainer, Barnes sends John to northern Afghanistan with fellow pilot Rick Jannick to recover the X-77, promising John that he will be a free man if he succeeds. Barnes has Admiral Frank Pendleton, who is on an aircraft ...
translation:
FLIGHT OF FURY takes the mantle of the WORST Steven Seagal Stripe I've ever seen ... So far.

It's a terrible boredom without any scenes of interest, Seagal does not really try this one - he's fat and his voice is once again dubbed.

The co-stars do not get better, a pretty sorry load of 3. raters

The Direction of Keusch is very poor and it's no surprise that he is also for another Seagal stinker is responsible (SHADOW MAN & ATTACK FORCE). The script written by Seagal himself is ridiculously awkward.

According to IMDb $ 12M was spent for this boring load of old Tosh - If these numbers are correct, I feel a big tax violin, since this amount was not nearly spent.

FLIGHT OF FURY is actually a recording for a shot remake of Michael Dudikoff's BLACK THUNDER - it has to be better than this tripe.

This has NO redeeming qualities anyway, give it a MISS! 1/2 * from *****

summary: The show is set in the town of Trinity, South Carolina. Lucas Buck, the local sheriff, has supernatural powers. He uses these powers to manipulate people into making evil choices. Lucas himself has already committed crimes such as murder and rape. A young boy, Caleb Temple, has seen the deaths of his mother and father (both suicides) and older sister (murdered). Caleb does not know that he is the biological son of Lucas Buck. The sheriff plans to corrupt his son, but faces obstacles. Caleb's new legal guardian is his adult cousin Gail Emory, a reporter. Gail also investigates the mysterious deaths of her own parents. Caleb is helped by the ghost of his sister, Merlyn Temple.
translation: I may have seen an episode or 2 when the show was originally aired, but when I saw 1 episode on Netflix, I was also addicted. I saw the whole series in 2 days. :) I really liked Gary Cole's character. At first he is absolutely reprehensible, then you start to like the character ("These things have a thousand uses")! His folk Andy Griffith meets Charles Manson meets Satan is great. Charming, charismatic, smarmy and uh somehow dangerous and with "somehow" I mean "really". I want to be like me when I grow up. Lucas Black is great, too. The accents are great too. Anyway, I thought that was one of the best TV shows ever and you owe it to yourself to see it.

summary: A teacher overcomes his frustration in a high-school full of flunkies. As he attempts to educate his students, his attempts to help them gets him into trouble with the school board, which only adds to his problems. With the support of his students he beats the school board and his frustration.
translation:
This movie is shit. Ridiculous "school atmosphere", incredible students who are very bad and behave like criminals, but later, after the "good teacher" Nick Nolte taught them, they became as good and as quiet as kittens.

If that works for you, it's not for me. 0 out of 10

summary: A sheriff investigating the disappearance of a young girl from a small island discovers there's a larger mystery to solve among the island's secretive, neo-pagan community.
translation:
This movie is the biggest waste of nine dollars I've spent in a very, very long time. If you knew how many times I went to the movies, you'd probably say that's hard to imagine, but still, it's true! After seeing the trailer for this movie, I knew I had to see it! If you are a fan of horror, mystery and tension, why not? The trailer is no less than fascinating and exciting; Unfortunately, the movie is none of this.

From cinematography to screenplay to acting, this film is a complete flop. If you're reading this, planning to go to the movie for some thrills, mystery, action, horror, or anything but a waste of an hour and forty-five minutes, I'm afraid you'll be disappointed.

Why is it so bad? You may ask. Let me tell you. The movie was neither mysterious nor exciting. Nothing about the movie made me at the least "nervous," scared, or curious. The script was laughable at best. There were many times throughout the film where the dialogue was so ridiculous that I began to write it as a comic relief, only to find out a few seconds later that it was not. The acting was absolutely terrible. I like Nicholas Cage, but that was a miss. Without exception, every performance in this movie was unbelievably below average. The cinematography was terrible without a single moment of tension or mysticism. After all, the story is completely transparent. You can see that the end of this movie is a mile away.

I'm usually not a very tough critic. Honestly, when I see a comedy, I want to laugh and when I see a mystery / tension / horror, I just want to be surprised. This movie was boring, badly played, poorly written and an overwhelming disappointment. Do yourself a favor and look at something else.

summary: A brutal murder exposes the dark side of Internet fantasy.
translation: This must be the worst movie I have seen. Madsen fans are not as dressed as me. He is only there for a maximum of five minutes. This movie is so bad that the only reason you would see it would be if all the rest of the movies on earth are just like t.v. had been destroyed.

summary: Japan's number one extreme reality show is having it's first all-American special! Six lucky contestants, chosen from thousands of applicants, will have the chance to win millions of dollars, and all they have to do is stay alive!
translation:
I could not help but think beyond the mask: the rise of Leslie Vernon (an incredibly much more impressive film) when I look at this because of the realistic feeling and the great innovative idea. that could have been a BIG movie. the acting is fine ... by some of the actors. from others ... it's terrible.

Apart from that, the idea is great and the format is great. The story is also pretty good, though she often suffers from big strikes on the logical mind.

Forget that, though right? After all, it's a horror movie.

I really want to see this remake ... I really want it to be the awesome movie it wants to be.

However (and you can not really blame the heads behind the movie for that) this is obviously built on a budget budget. and the FX have totally damaged the movie.

great movie. ... if you would swap for slightly better acting and slightly better FX.

Whoever wrote it should go on, great idea here.

summary: Spoiled rich sisters, Taylor and Courtney Callum, have had it made. Their father owns a successful dairy that allows them to live comfortably. They can have anything they want: the latest designer clothes, cool cars, and an endless supply of money to spend. One day, the sisters end up ruining their house kitchen and their father had seen enough. He sends the two to work a summer job at his dairy hopping it'll teach them responsibility and the value of a dollar. However, problems emerge when the dairy goes broke and it's up to the girls to decide: give up their selfish ways and save the dairy? or sit back and watch the company fall to pieces?
translation: I saw this movie very late last night and usually, when it's late, I forgive movies. Although I tried, I just could not stand this movie, it got worse and worse as the movie went on. I know it's a comedy, but I did not think it was funny. It was also a particularly unrealistic and truncated account of rural life. If any of you think that country life is like this, it's definitely not. I have to agree that some of the actors were pretty, but the Frenchman was really wrong. I must agree that it has tried to have a good lesson in the story, but overall my recommendation is that no one over 8 sees it, it's just too annoying.

summary: A young man finds out that his parents had been used in an atomic-weapons experiment shortly before he was born, and that the results have had some unexpected effects on him.
translation:
I tried as hard as I could to get through this confusing mess, but I just could not do it. Brad Dourif sucked absolutely, as the lead and all minor players were only marginally worse.

The whole thing is just ridiculous, from the terrible acting to the ridiculous FX to the silly storyline.

Complete waste of time; do not bother. Root canal therapy would be more pleasant. Bamboo chips under the fingernails would be much more pleasant.

Watching a Uwe Boll movie would only be a little bit worse than that. Got a show?

summary: High school friends Andre Kriegman and Cal Gabriel declare war on their classmates and plan a terrifying assault on their high school. As they begin the deadly countdown to their final act of revenge, the two start a video diary to explain their feelings and chronicle their mission.
translation:
I rented Zero Day last week at the local video store. I had never heard of the movie and had my concerns. As soon as I watched the box, I knew that the movie was an indie movie and therefore the quality would be less than a mainstream movie.

I can tell you that after I finished Zero Day, I started right from the start. The film clearly followed the basics of what happened at Columbine High School in April 1999, but what struck me was how credible the two main characters were. When I saw this movie for the first time, I was not sure if what I was looking at was real tapes left behind by the shooters at Columbine. In the back of my mind, I knew that what I saw could not be real, but at the same time acting was so convincing that you had to keep shaking your head.

Does the movie bother you? Absolute! Will you see things that make you question the merit of the film? Probably. I think what most people will find annoying is having feelings for the two main characters Calvin and Andre (played by Cal Robertson and Andre Keuck). Why is this problematic for some people? Calvin and Andre are planning a massacre at their high school. I know myself, I felt a tremendous sadness for Andre and Calvin. I had compassion for her because her life was so terrible. They had fallen so badly that they had begun a journey along a road that could have been stopped if only the people around them had noticed their distress.

Zero Day is a phenomenal movie. It gives you a close and personal look at events that most of us will only see in the news. It makes you think about life. And it baffles you how people get to this point. One week after watching this movie, I think about it.

For those of you who have not seen Zero Day yet, consider the following: The film is an independent movie with little to no budget shot on camcorders. The material in the film is disturbing. This is not mainstream Hollywood and there is no happy ending.

But if you can put it all aside, Zero Day is a movie that can help you and maybe open your eyes a bit.

summary: A mockumentary chronicling the rise and fall of NWH, a not particularly talented--or particularly bright but always controversial--hip-hop group.
translation: If you like CB4, you have no idea what you will miss if you have not seen this movie yet. This movie is crazy hilarious and contains much more about the hip-hop industry than any other spoof movie ... It's unfortunate that this movie was not released on DVD because it's a movie everyone has ever seen loved and wanted a copy. If you really want to laugh well and like hip hop and know a few old school actors a little, then definitely rent this movie. There are not so many video stores that have copies of them, but if you run into them, you will not be disappointed.

summary: In a suburb of Vienna during some hot summer days: A teacher who is in bondage to a sleazy pimp, a very importunate hitchhiker, a private detective on the run for some car vandals, a couple with a serious marriage problem and an old man, whose wife died long before on the search for some sexual entertainment live their lives while their lifelines cross from time to time.
translation: This movie is in no way entertainment, but rather a look into the depths of the darkest side of human behavior. It easily combines half a dozen stories about the worst kind of depravity, perverted sex, greed, violence and intolerance. The whole action is played during a couple of very hot and sticky days during a heatwave in Vienna and the heat may be responsible for some of the anger and hatred in the movie. For me, the treatment of the backward girl by the security equipment vendor was the worst episode, closely followed by the scenes of drunkenness and perversity in the "slag" flat. You will be moved and I hope that I am appalled by this movie. I hated it, but I felt compelled to see through it. 1/10 for "fun" 8/10 to show "man" as he sometimes is.

summary: Vince Lombardi High School keeps losing principals to nervous breakdowns because of the students' love of rock 'n' roll and their disregard of education. The putative leader of the students is Riff Randell, who loves the music of the Ramones. A new principal, the rock-music-hating Miss Evelyn Togar, is brought in and promises to put an end to the music craze. When Miss Togar and a group of parents attempt to burn a pile of rock records, the students take over the high school, joined by the Ramones, who are made honorary students. When the police are summoned and demand that the students evacuate the building, they do so, which leads to an explosive finale.
translation: Imagine what the school would look like in a world like this: The kids are a big gang, with a good taste in music, and against bad school leaders and teachers. Rock'n'Roll High School takes place in this world. It's like a Ramones record that comes to life. The characters are all as silly, innocent and charming as the songs of the Ramones, and of course the music itself is fantastic. High school comedies have really changed over the years comparing a movie like "American Pie" to this late '70s classic, where no tasteless sex jokes are made at all. Since a remake is obviously in the works, it can be expected that the charm of the original will be lost along the way and replaced by vulgar, half-witted dick jokes, as Bill Hicks called them. The main problem, however, will be that the Ramones CAN NOT be replaced. They were the perfect band for this movie and nobody else could take their place. So, the best thing would be to leave the original alone, as bizarre and charming as it is. Gabba gabba hey!

summary: When the daughter Emma of the technical writer Allen Pyke and the photographer Julie is found slashed in the throat and wrists in their locked apartment, the couple decides to move to an isolated cabin in the mountains in Kingspike. Julie is very depressed and blames Allen for the death of Emma. Once in the new home, Julie sees the spirit of Emma in a photo she took in a nearby abandoned prison and she becomes obsessed shooting pictures of poltergeists. Allen is advised to move from the place by the local Jim Payne, and on May 21st, Allen finds that the former dwellers of the cabin have committed suicide, and he investigates the death in the spot and finds that many people died around May 22nd. He decides to move with Julie to a hotel, but she does not want to give up on Emma.
translation:
After all the crap that Hollywood (and the Indies) spawned, we finally get a movie that brings some scary moments. There are some clich√©d moments, but I am not sure if it is possible to make a very original film today. There is not much new here ... it is just well done.

Take care and pay attention, because the "subtle" horrors come fast and often. This is not a movie you can see when you eat pizza.

There is a very well written red herring in this movie and unfortunately a very bad cast. Cheri Christian just does not make effective Julie (the wife / mother). For one, she is totally unsympathetic. I know, I know ... she has just had a traumatic experience. But the audience never learns to know as "normal", and the relationship between her and her husband's rather unpleasant (on unintentional way). I think the director meant that we have some sympathy for her, but I never did.

Finally, a thumbs up for the end, which is both disturbing and satisfying. It could easily have been cheapened at the beginning of the credits with a sound effect, but the director wisely resisted.

This is not a masterpiece, but it's a good, old-fashioned scary movie ... something that is rare these days.

summary: Eric Forman is a typical high school student growing up in Wisconsin in 1976 with his family and his friends. Together, they have the same kind of joys and sorrows that just about every teenager has while growing up. This show parodied many of the attitudes, events and fads of the 70s, along with those who grew up at the time.
translation:
... and the series lets forget all that. I am about three years older than the children portrayed in the series. Born in 1958, I learned to drive during the first gas shortage and in 1979 got my first post-college final job during the second gas shortage. The 70s were a really terrible time to be young - inflation that rivaled the minimum of the school - daring jobs with laid-off thirties, horrible music, worse clothes.

The funny thing is, this series ignores none of this and still manages to make fun of the 70's for those of us old enough to know better. It manages to face the 70's face-to-face with contemporary clothing-and yet fill the show with the hope of youth and the things that make high school and college time both the best and the worst. Then there are the parents. The two young lovers on the show - Eric Forman and Donna Piniotti - have really terrible parents with the best intentions. Eric's parents, Red and Kitty, are not exactly June and Ward, though they're conventional for the decade. They represent what happened when the 1960s reached the suburbs in the 1970s. Donna's parents are two people who have been waiting for the 1960s to show their lives to give their craziness legitimacy. Eric's friends Fez, Kelso and Jackie complete the group, which is nerdiness, well-intentioned incompetence and snobbery. Hyde is an unusual teenager for a suburban show, but for the most part he represents someone who has to play the cards he's got, even if those cards come from largely absent and negligent parents. I recommend all eight seasons, though season eight lags a bit because of Eric's absence.

summary: The Blandings live in New York in a tiny apartment. They decide to move to the country and find that buying and building and living in their own home is easier said than done.
translation:
The movie begins with Bill Coles (Melvyn Douglas) telling a story about how his best friend - make this customer - Jim Blandings (Cary Grant) and his family are packed tightly into a small New York apartment, with not enough storage space and much too few bathrooms. When Jim's wife, Muriel (Myrna Loy), wants to renovate the apartment, Jim, the advertising manager, falls in love with an advertisement for a house. Once he's bought the house, bills and frustration pile up incessantly as anything that can go wrong with building Jim's "dream house" goes awry.

One of three collaborations between Grant and Loy, this is a charming little comedy - not very exhausting, without really good news, but a great way to spend an hour or two. The laughs are there from the beginning, when the alarm rings and Jim tries to turn it off, just to defeat Muriel at every opportunity. The timing and delivery of the comedic lines and situations can only be given by a few experienced professionals, and that's what Grant and Loy give us: sophisticated performances, simple chemistry and lots of fun. Myrna Loy is in a pretty ungrateful role (it's obvious that Grant's character gets Jim the lion's share of the lines and acting and Grant, as always, subtracts both with remarkable serenity), but she gives Muriel a color, life and bite that only Myrna Loy can give a character. Melvyn Douglas also plays fun to perfection and never hits a single wrong note.

One of my favorite scenes must definitely be when Bill locks up in the "storeroom" and Jim goes to "rescue" him ... just to capture everyone! Every little problem that comes up for Blandings' renovation project - including jealousy and a wham advertising campaign - seems to bring together everything that could go wrong with building a new home, but makes it believable and entertaining. 8.10

summary: People are dying mysteriously and gruesomely, and nobody has a clue what the cause is. Only health worker Mike Brady has a possible solution, but his theory of killer slugs is laughed at by the authorities. Only when the body count begins to rise and a slug expert from England begins snooping around does it begin to look like Mike had the right idea after all.
translation: Was just a joke! This was one of the worst movies I have ever seen! It was so bad that it was hilarious. My friend and I rented it because it looked so bad. Cheese old horror movies are always good for a few laughs. The story stank, some of the voices were dubbed, the quality was horrendous. But I enjoyed watching it!

summary: When Adams and his crew are sent to investigate the silence from a planet inhabited by scientists, he finds all but two have died. Dr. Morbius and his daughter Altaira have somehow survived a hideous monster which roams the planet. Unknown to Adams, Morbius has made a discovery, and has no intention of sharing it (or his daughter!) with anyone.
translation:
I first saw this movie when it first came out. I was about 9 years old. old and found this movie both very entertaining and very scary and unlike any other movie I had seen until that time.

BASIC PLOT: An expedition is sent from Earth to the fourth planet of Altair, a great series star in the Aquilae constellation, to find out what happened to a colony of settlers that landed twenty years ago and since then no longer heard. TOPIC: An inferior civilization (namely ours) comes into contact with the remains of a far-advanced alien civilization that Krell - 200,000 years away. The "seed" of destruction from one civilization is passed on to another, unknowingly first. The theme of this movie is very good and evil.

I saw this movie for the first time with my brother when he first came out. I was just a boy and the tiger scenes really scared me, as did the battle scenes with the invisible creature power. I was also amazed at how real things were in the movie.

What really gets my attention as an adult is the truth of the film "forbidden knowledge" and how relevant that will be when we come into contact (if any) with an advanced (foreign) civilization which is much more developed than we ourselves are. Advanced technology and responsibility seem to go hand in hand. We must do the work for ourselves to acquire the knowledge along with the wisdom of using advanced technology. In my opinion, this is the great morality of the film.

I learned in the graduate school that "knowledge is power" is not correct at best! Knowledge is "potential" power, depending on how it is applied (if it is applied at all.) [It's not what you know, but how you use it, what you know!]

The Whole The effects of this film could materialize sometime in the future of humanity. The knowledge in and of itself is not enough, we MUST have the wisdom that knowledge really depends on actually controlling our own destiny, OR we'll end up in the movie like the Krell - just extinguished.

Rating: 10 out of 10 Stars

summary: Ten years after Voyager's return from a 23 year journey across the galaxy, Admiral Janeway breaks all the temporal rules and journeys back in time to change a decision she made that prolonged their journey by 16 years. Bringing technology that will help fight the Borg, the Admiral wants her younger self to fight the Borg and use their transwarp hub to go home.
translation:
After waiting eagerly for the end, I have to say that I wish I had not been in first place on the whole series. The last episode was all about the last seven years. It ruined everything. The trip was 23 years old, but Captain Janeway has the power to reduce it ... say, only seven years. Why seven? Why not just one? Or nothing? Why not avoid the whole adventure? Crew members died all the way. Why does she just want to save Seven of Nine? The others do not count or what? The most ridiculous part when the crew realizes it's not really important for them to come home. As I said, "travel is more important than the destination". Incredible. And in the final scene, they are surrounded by other Federation ships and the earth is in sight. Nothing about landing, return to normal life.

Worst end of all time.

summary: The nephews, Landau and Maltby, of the original owners of Lotus Cat Food [For cats who love people] start up the family business again. Duplicated from the original are nosy nurse and doctor characters as well as the greedy grave digger and his wacky wife. What's added to the mix in this sequel are cat-like aliens. Battle weary and beaten by their enemy [evil dog-like aliens], the cat people ask for Earth's assistance in procuring food. Guess which cat food the aliens really like a lot?
translation: That's awful! The acting, costumes, production values, editing, the script, everything about this film is as bad as it gets. It looks like it was filmed with a video camera. Can you give a movie a negative rating? Look at the ring instead.

summary: A free-spirited woman enthusiastically engages in torrid interspecies sex with a delighted dog.
translation: What can you say about a grainy, badly filmed 16mm deer movie, where the best and most attractive actor is a German Shepherd? Nothing that would be positive. Avoid this travesty at all costs. In any case, it would be hard to find, because bestiality in the US is still a taboo and illegal topic. I urge the IMDb to revisit their weighting formula for creating reviews, as a rating of 8.8 for this feces matter is absurd! I am by no means prudish and have spent many hours enjoying the classic porn movies of the 70s and 80s; but this is an inferior product, even with the lower standards of the (then illegal) stag loop.

summary: Back when the Earth was being overrun by glaciers, and animals were scurrying to save themselves from the upcoming Ice Age, a sloth named Sid, a woolly mammoth named Manny, and a saber-toothed tiger named Diego are forced to become unlikely heroes. The three reluctantly come together when they have to return a human child to its father while braving the deadly elements of the impending Ice Age.
translation:
I saw "Ice Age" in the movies and I liked the movie. Despite the fact that "Ice Age" has many flaws and scientific flaws, like humans, sabers, dinosaurs and mammoths living at the same time, and even the place where the story passes (North America looks like, but has some characteristics from Iceland) for example) we can even have fun. (Unless you are very strict!)

The planet enters an ICE AGE and many animals migrate to the south, where it is warmer. Sid is a stupid sloth left behind by his own family, who can no longer endure him. On his way he meets Manfred, or as he calls "Manny", a moody mammoth who does not care about extinction or immigration and goes north. Concerned that he can easily be caught, Sid decides to follow Manfred, and in the middle of their journey they have found a human mother with her baby. The mother dies, but Manfred and Sid decide to take him and give the baby back to the people. Diego, one of the sabers, decides to follow them and help them go to a shortcut to the human camp. What Manfred and Sid do not know is that Diego is from a saber clan who hates humans and wants to kill the baby and pretends to betray them both so they can eat sabers. What will happen depends on Diego's behavior and conscience ...

aka "A Era do Gelo" - Brazil

summary: Chile, second half of the 20th century. The poor Esteban marries Clara and they get a daughter, Blanca. Esteban works hard and eventually gets money to buy a hacienda, eventually to become a local patriarch. He becomes very conservative and is feared by his workers. When Blanca grows up, she falls in love with a young revolutionary, Pedro, who urges the workers to fight for socialism. It is unavoidable that Pedro and Esteban are pitted against each other. Esteban tries to stop the love affair between Pedro and his daughter by all means possible but soon Blanca becomes pregnant and has a daughter. The void between father and daughter seems unbridgeable when Blanca moves in with Pedro.
translation: I'm sorry that I saw this movie. I can not believe that the creator of Best Intentions and Pelle the Conqueror could make such a dull and boring movie. What a waste!

summary: A comedy about bending the rules to reach your goal, Bend It Like Beckham explores the world of women's football, from kick-abouts in the park to freekicks in the Final. Set in Hounslow, West London and Hamburg, the film follows two 18 year olds with their hearts set on a future in professional soccer. Heart-stopping talent doesn't seem to be enough when your parents want you to hang up your football boots, find a nice boyfriend and learn to cook the perfect chapatti.
translation:
This is one of my favorite movies and I would recommend it to anyone. On my list of favorite movies (mental list, mind) are the only films with films like The Lord of the Rings Series, Spirited Away and Fly Away Home.

I can really relate to the main character Jess. At the beginning of the film she is a shy girl with a strange background who has many more friends than boys. She really sucks you in her life. I also can not blame the actor's acting or anyone else in the movie.

The football was interesting, even for someone like me who has no idea about the rules. The movie never gets boring. The romance is really cute and did not make me blush too much! One thing that really made it was the Indian factor. Jess's parents are Indians and there are many colorful Indian conventions throughout the film that provide a very interesting cultural insight as well as everything else. The Indians are also hilarious! Basically, this is a movie that goes beyond the time to choose the right path and fight for it.

Comic movies become my favorite movie genre thanks to this movie. They are fun, they are refreshing and they make you feel good! ^ _ ~

summary: In the year 2041, the rebel Centros are a plague to the survivors of the great toxic gas scare of 1993. A renegade Megarobot pilot and an archaeologist must team up (despite personal differences, a reluctant romance, and official pressure to cease and desist) to thwart the Centro's attempts to resurrect a hidden Megarobot, with which they can challenge the prevailing order.
translation: There's nothing like watching huge robots in a desert on the battlefield delivering Robot Wars. Sure, the acting is miserable, the dialogue is below average and the characters are one-dimensional, but they have huge robots! The special effects themselves are actually pretty good for the period. They are certainly not as polished as today's standards, but they contain a minimum of computer graphics and use miniatures instead, so they have aged fairly well. His shortcomings are easily overlooked in light of the short-running films, and it has a certain amount of humor in parts that make it quite enjoyable. I would recommend it to any fan of giant robots or cheesy sci-fi looking for a carefree hour of distraction.

summary: A gruesome homage to the cult Amicus anthology Asylum, Cradle of Fear unfolds four screamplays all linked by the unspeakable need of an incarcerated child killer to wreak vengeance on those responsible for his imprisonment. Helped by deranged angel Dani Filth, who leaves a trail of charnel house death in his crimson wake, the cannibal convict forces two Goth vamps to endure a one night stand from hell, two tough female robbers to see through each other, an obscenely rich coke-head to chop up more than a few lines and an internet surfer to descend into madness when he uncovers the ultimate web depravity.
translation:
This movie was made for fans of Dani (and Cradle of Filth). I am not one of them. I think he's just an imitator on the Black Metal band (I'm not a fan of Black Metal in general). But when I wore this DVD case to pay for it, I convinced myself that the less authentic something is, the more it tries to convince. So I assumed that I was in a rollercoaster ride with rubber harness and do-it-yourself splashes with a sinister background. Well, that's what I like.

I came home and put it in. My patience lasted 15 minutes. AWFUL camera work and DISGUSTING quality. And that was then (2002), that it looked as if it had been recorded with a Hi8 camcorder. I left it on the shelf. Maybe a nice evening with beer and bmovies would create a nice backdrop for this ... image.

After a few months I came back (in the mentioned environment) and saw half. Then not only the aspects mentioned annoyed me. My dislike developed. I noticed how funny Dani (1.65m, 5'5 "height) looked in his platform shoes and tore a hijacker's head (yes, tear, his head did not seem to have a skull.) summary: A group of flamenco dancers are rehearsing a very spanish version of the Prosper Merimee's drama. Antonio (the coreographer) falls in love with Carmen (the main dancer). Their story then turns similar to the play.
translation: This is one of the best movies we have seen in my high school Spanish class. If you are a fan of the opera, this movie will entertain you greatly. Of course, dancing is wonderful. Watching these fantastic dancers move to the music of Bizet is well worth a visit.

summary: L.A. real estate agent Kate Wooten gets a new lease on life when she learns that her new client, a mysterious and handsome man named Vlad, is looking for a house isolated in the Hollywood Hills where he wants to live and doesn't want to be disturbed. It doesn't take long for Kate to fall in love with her new client and to learn that he's a real vampire.
translation:
What a gem of a movie, so good that they made a sequel.

The movie starts off really well with a nasty monster eating a few people and a party where the 2 main characters first caught their eyes off each other.

Bendan Hughes plays the eccentric Vlad, a bit of a clue of who this character is who moved to the city and uses the services of a particular estate agent to find a house for him.

summary: When a storm strands a group on a Massachusetts island where the only dwelling is an old hotel supposedly haunted by the ghost of a former German actress (Knef), the result is the standard horror film as each of the cast is picked off one-by-one.
translation:
Oh my ... bad clothes, worse synth music and the worst: David Hasselhoff. The 80s are back with revenge in Witchery, an American-Italian co-production led by the notorious Joe 'D'Amato on the production side and the short-acting director (thank God for little miracles). Directed by Fabrizio Laurenti. As a continuation of Sam Raimi's Evil Dead series in Italy (referred to as "La Casa"), Witchery delivers some modest Gore food and bad acting.

A mixture of ghost story, possessions and witchcraft, the movie bounces perplexed from scene to scene, without some serious wood actors and hilarious day-night confusion slowing their progress to the expected end, topped off with a serious WTF -√úberraschungs-climax. (I just love the expression on her face ...) Surprisingly, Laurenti succeeds in a few - very few - scenes of a certain tension and malice; Unhappy for him, these few glimpses of mild movie magic go fast and effective.

The plus sides are experienced when the Gore hits the fan. This section is quite effective and entertaining in the 1980's classic latex and red lacquer style of Italo-Gore, when things were done 100% by hand and could be as shocking and vivid as modest budgets. Only with sadistic joy and few laughter could I observe all the exaggerated ways in which offensive characters (and actors) were gradually mutilated and abused. I just felt sorry for Linda Blair, who apparently could not try any other good, obsessed girl / woman role in his career, the way it looks when reviewing his filmography.

Well, people - not much to tell, and even less to talk about at home. Do not expect too much if you spend a rainy afternoon with it, and you will probably at least experience some mild fun. It also helps when your rotten little heart beats to the beat of the 80s Euro Gore horror. And if you speak from the heart: Every film in which David Hasselhoff is impaled by a considerable metal object and bleeding heavily through the room and the corridors MUST have it in the right place.

That's my truth - what? is yours?

summary: Joe Baker has a dream. He wants to do 'something big.' When he needs a Gatling gun to accomplish this, he seeks out a black marketeer. The price he wants for the gun? A woman! So Baker kidnaps a woman off of the stagecoach, only to find that she is the wife of the commandant of the local Cavalry detachment. Things get further complicated when a girl named Dover McBride shows up. She has come to force Baker to marry her and return east, as he promised to do four years earlier.
translation: Strictly a routine, by-the-numbers western (directed by genre-mainstay Andrew V. McLaglen, so that's no wonder?). Colonel Brian Keith locks himself up with Deam Martin, the dork Martin, who has just abducted the Colonel's wife (Honor Blackman, who never found her niche after "Pussy Galore" in "Goldfinger"). Fist fights, shootings, post coach robbery and Denver Pyle in a supporting role ... in other words, absolutely nothing new or original. Keith talks to a prostitute (which is a shock after running in the TV series Family Affair), but Keith's amiable talents are not wasting anything else. It's also bad news for Dino, who does not notice or care. Hack-direction, bad writing and some nasty attempts in lowball humor. * from ****

summary: The story begins one hot summer's day when Leanne Wellings is taking her two young children to visit her grandfather. She stops to buy flowers at a motorway lay-by but then inexplicably vanishes - leaving her two small children waiting for her in her car - lost and far from home. Her two small children then set off to find her only to go missing themselves. Their ordeal is captured on CCTV cameras and before long the family's heart-stopping trauma is not only a complex police investigation but a major national news story.
translation: "Five Days" is referred to as something special, a thriller that consists of a series of episodes that are each made on a specific day of a police investigation. But in fact, this element of history turns out to be less significant than might initially be supposed, since the fact that the plot is limited to 24 hours in each episode is barely perceptible, and the program hardly distinguishes from countless others' thrillers. In fact, one can hardly help but make comparisons with the last "prime suspect" as one of the cynical female police officers focuses on retirement: and it is not just the absence of Helen Mirren that makes the comparisons unfavorable. There is a lot of serious over-motivation, manipulative music, and a set of characters that seem to be constructed in such a way that everyone is sympathetic in one sense and suspicious in another. And it's possible to guess the guilty party long before the end, not because of the inner dynamics of the story, but because of the construction of the entire drama: certain things must be true to justify the series's focus on specific characters at specific times , Despite these shortcomings, the series grew on me: in the end, I was pretty touched. But it is a sad sign that the BBC, which once made "The Singing Detective", boasted of the "perhaps best drama of the year": for here there is little genuine originality, and the claim reveals a lack of ambition that is dreadful disappointing. "Five Days" is in fact no nonsense; but it is formulaic, and one would hope that the best that the BBC had to offer was something more innovative and fresh.

summary: Successful and single businesswoman Kate Holbrook has long put her career ahead of a personal life. Now 37, she's finally determined to have a kid on her own. But her plan is thrown a curve ball after she discovers she has only a million-to-one chance of getting pregnant. Undaunted, the driven Kate allows South Philly working girl Angie Ostrowiski to become her unlikely surrogate. Simple enough ... After learning from the steely head of their surrogacy center that Angie is pregnant, Kate goes into precision nesting mode: reading childcare books, baby-proofing the apartment and researching top pre-schools. But the executive's well-organized strategy is turned upside down when her Baby Mama shows up at her doorstep with no place to live. An unstoppable force meets an immovable object as structured Kate tries to turn vibrant Angie into the perfect expectant mom. In a battle of wills, they will struggle their way through preparation for the baby's arrival. And in the middle of this ...
translation: What happened? What we have here is basically a solid and plausible premise and with a decent and talented cast, but somewhere the movie loses it. Actually, it never really started. There was a bit of excitement when we found out that Angie is not really pregnant, and then find out that she is, but that was it. Steve Martin, who is a very talented person and usually brings a lot to a movie, was terrible and his entire character was not so important to this film to make him longer. I really would have liked to see more interactions between the main characters, Kate and Angie, and maybe not for a mere comedy, which unfortunately was not, but maybe a drama with comedic elements. I think if the movie had done that, it could have been a lot of fun, since both actresses are pretty funny in their own way and when I'm sitting here, I can imagine many scenarios that would have been a turmoil.

summary: Hamilton High is no place for a teacher who cares. Teacher Sam Decker doesn't care anymore. He's quitting. Sam marks his last day in the battleground of public education by getting saddled with the detention class after hours, playing warden to a pack of rebellious students, the worst troublemakers in school. But Hamilton High is about to become an all too real battleground when a well-organized group of killers armed with automatic weapons and explosives invade the supposedly deserted school after hours to use it as an operating base for meticulously planned armored car robbery. Led by the brilliant and sadistic Chester Lamb, the invaders are surprised to discover Sam and the kids from the detention room are still inside the school. The hunt is on as the killers ruthlessly stalk the teacher and students through the school's halls and classrooms, while Lamb tracks them on the surveillance cameras, turning the school's security system against his prey. Sam and the kids band together ...
translation: This is the kind of movie that wants to be good but sucks. The first thing the hell do the punks do with school? I think the kids do not seem to realize the gravity of the situation. Deker guy tell the girl that she's under his responsibility when they ask why he wants to go back for her, but right after that he gives a gun to the wheelchair guy and wants him to fix the phone line by himself. Where is the responsibility? I understand poor actors have to pay for their food, but why not just give them the money they need to make such a stupid movie or give the money to a charity. Oh yes, and none of them can aim. The stupid punk-guy does not shoot around in the cafeteria like crazy. They all want to look professional, but everyone is shit. Another thing I do not think is that there is no emergency exit at school, the children try several doors, but they all shut up. What happens if there is a fire and the security guard is dead? It is illegal not to have an emergency exit at school. Anyway, there is much more to say, but it would be too long. I spent some time of my life watching a crap.

summary: Between the heaven and the Earth exist the Zu's mountain range, where live the immortals of Omei, the highest mountain of Zu, but the kingdom is in danger by Amnesia, a renegade immortal what want to rule Zu and all the world. White Eyebrows, Zu's leader, call to his most experts fighters for to defeat Amnesia until destroy It, but Amnesia hides in the legendary and almost myth Blood Cavern in order to make stronger his powers. While Red, Eyebrows' servant, watches the enter of Blood Cavern, King Sky and the others warriors will try to find a way of exterminate Amnesia with an ancient and powerful mystical swords, hoping to be free of the Amnesia's threat.
translation: OK, at first the video looks like it was filmed in the 80s. I was shocked when I found out that it was released in 2001. Second, the plot was everywhere, and the story is confusing right away. Had there been a short prologue or an introduction, the story would have been better. I also value fantasy, but this movie was too much. It was bizarre and badly filmed. The scenes did not run smoothly and the characters were strange. It was hard to follow and maybe it was the translation, but it was even hard to understand. I love Chinese epic movies, but if you're looking for a Chinese epic fantasy movie, I would not recommend this movie Promise (visually stunning, plot is interesting and good character development). Careful, you will be disappointed.

summary: Bo and Luke Duke are southern cousins. In Hazzard County, Bo and Luke help their Uncle Jesse and their sexy cousin Daisy run the Moonshine business and always getting into trouble with Sherriff Roscoe P. Coltrane and recklessly driving in their orange car "General Lee". Boss Hogg, the mean and corrupt local county commissioner who hates The Dukes evicts The Dukes from their farm. Bo and Duke travels to Atlanta and meets up with old friend Katie Johnson and her friend Annette as they set out to find out why Boss Hogg has evicted them from their farm and what he plans to do. With local ace race car driver Billy Prickett in town to take part in the Annual Hazzard Road Race rally, Bo and Luke sets out to save their farm and foil Boss Hogg's scheme.
translation: I have to say, many people have argued that some of us have to move with the times because the new "Dukes" movie is a modernized version. OH PLEASE. If you look at that modernized, Hollywood can keep it. Many people on the MSN site have also said that (and I quote) "your old Negroes need to get over it and save it as it is." Well, let me tell you something, I'm 24, so I'm a long way from being and OLD FOGIE, and I will not get over it, it was a shame for everything that is Havzard County. The only thing that was right in the movie title was "Hazzard". Was all the obscenities, smoking and drinking really necessary. The cast was terrible. Jessica has been to several shows in the morning to discuss the movie and frankly, I think it all went to her head. It's NOT a Daisy Duke in any way, maybe a coincidence, but definitely not a duke. I love Sean Williams Scott, but not Bo. They were supposed to contain the original cast as at least cameos, but even Hollywood knew they would not approve of the script. I mean, people, even today actors and actresses express a negative opinion, why some of you say positive comments?

summary: A woman forces a man to move forward with his life after his wife dumps him.
translation:
Also, I have suffered a very painful personal loss (Twice) and this film portrays the painful reality of this experience very well, life out of balance, nothing makes sense, well-meaning relatives, etc ...

It It was nice to see Ally again. She is one of my favorite movie actors.

I laughed and cried as the story unfolded. Great story and cast. Well done!

summary: Heading home late one night after a party, Kate falls asleep while waiting for her train. She awakens to find herself trapped in the London underground, with all the doors locked for the evening. While being attacked by a co-worker who has followed her, a mysterious unseen creature drags him away and kills him. This begins a terrifying ordeal, as Kate and a young homeless couple are stalked through the dark tunnels by something dangerous with payback on its mind.
translation:
- SMALL SPOILER HEREIN! -

When I watched the voices for "Creep" today, I was surprised that so many IMDb users rated this movie "1". I ask myself: what do people expect from such films? Are there so many people watching a movie without knowing it?

"Creep" is a HORROR movie and it's a pretty good movie! This automatically means that it has an absurd story of holes, outrageous dangers, and simple one-page characters. So why complain about it? Just take popcorn and coke, make yourself comfortable on your seat and ... then enjoy being scared to death! The first 60 minutes, with almost only Kate and a lonesome tube station, are incredibly frightening. There is tension and anxiety in every corner of the screen, and you'll give some idiots just because a flashing neon lamp suddenly sounds in your back. (In my opinion, the sound engineer has done the best work in this film.)

When Kate meets her pursuer, the quality of the movie goes down, but it's still not going to be a bad movie. The second part of the movie is not scary, but the gore effects are well done and the story is pretty well developed. (as long as you think it's a horror movie you're watching, not the Discovery Channel!) So, if you want to make a very, very scary hour. Just look at the first hour of "Creep" and then leave the cinema or turn off the TV. You know the rest of the story anyway, right? The villain will die and Kate will be the only survivor. But even if you watch this movie to its end, you will not be disappointed.

... and if you want to take fear to the next level, do what I did after seeing this movie: leave the movie theater at dark night, go to the next U -Bahn station and take the last train home ...

summary: During WWII in England, Charlie, Carrie, and Paul Rawlins are sent to live with Eglantine Price, an apprentice witch. Charlie blackmails Miss Price that if he is to keep her practices a secret, she must give him something, so she takes a bedknob from her late father's bed and places the "famous magic traveling spell" on it, and only Paul can activate it. Their first journey is to a street in London where they meet Emelius Browne, headmaster of Miss Price's witchcraft training correspondence school. Miss Price tells him of a plan to find the magic words for a spell known as Substitutiary Locomotion, which brings inanimate objects to life. This spell will be her work for the war effort.
translation: Bedknobs & Broomsticks is another of Disney's masterpieces. It was filmed with animation sequences and the actors and actresses interact with the animations. (A similar concept was used in Mary Poppins, as the children and Mary disappear in sidewalk art.) I judge this film mainly with children's eyes, because I have not seen him for years. At that time it was one of my favorite movies. It was magical and mystical, and the last scenes (the conflict that started with the ghostly armor that went into battle) were my favorites. There has also been a lot of stop animation using the spells (ie people turning into bunnies), which can be a bit old-fashioned and silly now. (I also think the movie is starting to go slow.) Through a child's eyes, this is a funny movie, and it's easy for kids to get into the places of the kids in the movie. It is a fantastic film that is unfortunately largely forgotten today.

summary: A mysterious creature from another planet, resembling a giant blob of jelly, lands on earth. The people of a nearby small town refuse to listen to some teenagers who have witnessed the blob's destructive power. In the meantime, the blob just keeps on getting bigger.
translation:
The only thing notable about this movie is that it was Steve McQueen's first big lead.

McQueen's talent is undeveloped and raw, but refreshingly honest in this scamped little sci-fi horror piece. Steve portrays himself as the anti-establishment, Hot Rod car-loving actor who would become a polished icon of the film industry in just five years.

Later, McQueen said he hated this movie and "He was the blob". But everyone has to start somewhere and The Blob is sweet, fresh and innocent. Would we all have stayed that way?

The plot is fast-paced and predictable, still a fun hour or so. And it's really fun to see Steve McQueen before he became The King of Kool (and Anita Corsaut before she became Andy Taylor's girlfriend). A close friend sent me the DVD a while ago and it's a nice addition to my Steve McQueen movie collection.

summary: A documentary on the threat that climate change poses to the Earth - it's causes, effects and history and potential solutions to it. Presented by Al Gore through a lecture that he has given to audiences across the globe, plus through more introspective moments.
translation:
A tip, I think, can be collected through the various comments on this topic.

I was quite surprised at the number of people who liked this movie, who want to do it "obligatory" or "obligatory". Br />
I think that gives us some insight in the reason why this movie and the underlying theme so polarized.

Global warming addresses many people who want to force others to "get it right". Above all, it appeals to more 'liberal' leaning people because it has nothing to do with the bedroom's morality, which is usually given to conservatives who want to force you to be 'good'.

And that's the problem with the movie. Al Gore is a politician. And a very successful one. He just can not help but turn to people who want to force others to act the way they would. The political appeal is just too big.

And that leaves us with a scientific problem that can be of great importance and is reduced to a political problem attractive to those in politics who have a fondness for forcing others to "be right close".

Another interesting question is how the environmental movement was abducted by such people?

summary: When two sisters inherit their family castle, a string of murders committed by a mysterious dark haired woman in a red cloak decimates their circle of friends. Is the killer their ancestor, the "Red Queen" whom legend says claims seven lives every hundred years?
translation:
Emilio Miraglias first Giallo feature, The Night Evelyn came out of the grave, was a great combination of Giallo and Gothic horror - and this second movie is even better! This time we have more of the giallo side of the equation, though Miraglia does not lose the gothic horror styling that made the earlier movie so delightful. This time, Miraglia puts more emphasis on the finer details of the plot, and as a result, it's the typical Giallo maze, with characters everywhere and red herrings dropped every few minutes. This is a definite bonus for the movie as it can be a bit confusing at times. There is always enough to keep the audience interested and Miraglia's storytelling has improved since his earlier film. The plot begins with a scene in which two young girls fight before their grandfather tells them the legend of a rather garish painting in their castle. The legend is about a woman named "The Red Queen," who, legend has it, returns from the grave every hundred years and kills seven people. A few years later, murders begin to appear ...

Although he made only two giallos, Miraglia has its own tribute. It is obvious that the color red is important to him since it is very pronounced in both films; and he seems to have something against women called 'Evelyn'. He likes locks, gothic atmospheres and stylish murders - that's fine with me! Miraglia may not be Argento when it comes to spilling blood, but he knows how to drop an excessive murder into his movie; and here we have pleasure with a Volkswagen Beetle and a death on an iron fence, which is one of my absolute favorite scenes of Giallo. The female side of the cast is awarded the stunning Barbara Bouchet and Marina Malfatti an attention-grabbing cast of ladies who are not afraid to undress! The score courtesy of Bruno Nicolai is catchy, and although it does not contain much of the psychedelic rock that came in The Night Evelyn's tomb; it goes well with the movie. The end is a bit of a diversion, because although Miraglia refreshes the gothic atmosphere, it seems more than a bit hurry and the identity of the killer is too obvious. But still this is a delightfully entertaining giallo and one that I can warmly recommend to the fans of the genre!

summary: In 1909, the beautiful but amoral British belle Ivy Lexton meets older, rich Miles Rushworth; undeterred by the prior claims of her husband Jervis and lover Roger, she goes after Miles and has no trouble fascinating him, but oddly enough he has compunctions about making love to other men's wives. The means that Ivy reluctantly adopts to resolve the problem of too many men promise disaster for all concerned.
translation: An excellent melodrama of the time murders, in which Fontaine effectively played against her former naive little wallflower type, in a role that Olivia DeHavilland allegedly rejected. That's fine, because Fontaine is wonderful. Spoken by Charles Bennett, who wrote for Hitchcock in the 1930s and later also wrote the award-winning screenplay for the classic British horror movie Night of the Demon. The opening scene, in which Ivy visits a sinister fortune teller played by the wonderful Una O'Connor (the screamer of James Whale's fame), is a tour de force, and the film keeps interest throughout the numerous sinister machinations. I hope to see this movie on DVD someday, but the desperation that this ever happened because it seems like an undeservedly obscure movie. Luckily I saw it on AMC seven or eight years ago, but have not seen it since. Start it if you can!

summary: Shecky Moskowitz, a deservedly struggling young comedian, lands a menial job on a cruise ship as the Miss-Universe contest is being held on-board. The Big Man On Deck for this voyage is Dickie Diamond, the ship's comedian and all-around ladies' man. As an assorted array of thugs, Panamanian mercenaries and terrorists try to storm the ship, Shecky hopes for one big chance to prove himself and enter the exciting world of cruise ship comedy.
translation: I had never heard of this Adam Sandler movie until I saw him on the wall at Blockbuster. Since I was an Adam Sandler fan at the time, I rented it. HONEST I could only watch for about 30 minutes. from that. It was terrible. Do what is necessary to deprive the public. I really hope that this movie will soon be OOP, and I hope it stays that way!

summary: A vicious serial-killer is on the loose in San Francisco and the police trace a link to a small town further down the coast. When Harry Callahan upsets the press and the mayor in his usual style, he's shipped out of town to investigate while the heat is on. With the help of his new Magnum handgun Harry goes on the trail leaving behind the usual trail of dead criminals along the way.
translation:
In Don Seal's 1971 masterpiece "Dirty Harry", Clint Eastwood embodies the super-hard, super-cool, unorthodox cinema cop with his role of eponymous inspector "Dirty" Harry Callahan. Two sequels followed, the first of which, "Magnum Force", tamed the politically incorrect posture of the first, which outraged many critics but delighted audiences. The second sequel, "The Enforcer," was grumpier again and was advertised as "the dirtiest Harry of all". However, this title belongs to the fourth film in the series, Clint Eastwood's "Sudden Impact", which is without a doubt the dirtiest, meanest, most brutal and very dirtiest Harry movies, and in my humble opinion, the second -Best after the masterpiece original.

*** Attention! SPOILERS ahead! *** In a small town near San Francisco, a mysterious sexy lady (Sondra Locke) lures men to be alone with her. What these men do not know is that their mysterious beauty is their former rape victim and longs for bloody revenge. As luck would have, San Francisco spends h√§rtester policeman Inspector Dirty Harry Callahan, who was suspended because of his anger at his superiors again, his free time in this very small town ... "Sudden Impact" is the dirtiest Callahan film in many Respects. The film is extremely crude and graphically violent. Harry Callahan himself is dirtier than ever. Without fear of taking advantage of his 44th Magnum to avoid annoyance, Harry treats "punks" as they should be treated and even allows a person with multiple murders to get away, as he believes the revenge killings are justified. As always, Clint Eastwood excels in the role of Harry Callahan. Eastwood embodies Coolness and Bad Assery as the "Man With No Name" in Sergio Leone's Dollar Trilogy, and he did so in the Dirty Harry movies. "Sudden Impact" gives us the dirtiest Harry we've ever seen. Eastwood's real friend Sondra Locke fits very well into the role of vengeful beauty. The great Pat Hingle, who worked with Eastwood on Ted Post's stubborn western "Hang 'Em High" back in 1986, plays the small town police chief. The film also includes a whole series really despicable bastards, including a pathetic criminal who was played by Kevin Major Howard (known for his role in Stanley Kubrick's "Full Metal Jacket") and a woman named Ray Perkins (Audrie J. Neenan). Undoubtedly one of the most disgusting and despicable female figures in the cinema. Albert Popwell, who robbed the bank robber in the famous "Do You Feel Lucky?" Also the scene in "Dirty Harry" and the black militant leader in "The Enforcer" is back, this time as Harry's colleague and buddy. Overall, "Sudden Impact" is the dirtiest and dirtiest of all "Dirty Harry" movies (though "The Dead Pool" is not exactly tame either), and my second favorite after the brilliant 1971 original. An absolute must for Callahan fans, and highly recommended to all lovers of police timers and cinematic villains. My rating: 8.5 / 10

summary: A widow discovers after her husband's suicide that he has mortgaged everything they own and the banks are ready to foreclose. Faced with impending doom and little working knowledge except her ability to grow plants, she struggles to save her home. Enter her gardener, who is struggling to make a few marijuana plants grow in a hidden location and suggests that she use her green house to help grow the plants and sell them to make the money both need. He is wanting to get married, but needs capital. What he doesn't know is that his girl friend is pregnant and thus fears that they will be busted for growing marijuana. While supposedly working, the whole village is well aware of the endeavor and is hoping for their success. When the plants come in, Grace takes the crop to London and tries to sell it to a ruthless, but charming drug dealer. Everything busts loose from there.
translation: This is a film recommended to me by my dentist, and I'm glad he did! The mix of British humor (should I say, humor?) And the reality of a lost middle-aged widow trying to maintain her lifestyle was a joke. Add to that the reality of what it takes to really raise a pot (these plants under the bushes would NOT do it without the TLC they got), and it's a really funny but touching movie. I laugh every time I conjure up the vision of all the bar patrons who sit in sunglasses on their loungers when she counts down the lights! Maybe it's just my blood from Mendocino County, but the British definitely have that right! 10/10

summary: College students, Terry, Nancy and Gloria are on their way to a rock concert, driving through a torrential rainstorm... only to crash their car, badly injuring one of them. Seeking shelter and aid they come across a house occupied by a man-hating mother and her daughter... our trio soon wish they hadn't.
translation: I had never heard of it before the owner of my local DVD rental office mentioned it to me; Since this is an 80s horror movie with the infamous distinction of being banned in the UK, I decided to review it. The movie proved boring, amateurish and ugly-looking ride; The sound recording is so bad that the dialogue is incomprehensible half the time, while the play gives the word incapable a new meaning! Worse, the film follows the awful tired formula of a trio of teenage girls involved in an accident, feeling protected by a dysfunctional family living in remote areas. Soon one of the girls goes for help and is never heard again; another, still bedridden, is quickly disposed of (after being forgotten for most of the time). The heroine is the one who interacts most with the three occupants of the house: a hurricane of a Bible-mumbling mother (a horrendous excess), her oppressed (and suffering) daughter and her strange brother, who occasionally turns up the scene to talk about the sleeping female To drool guests. Often resort to table-table reminiscences by the man-hating mother (as a means to fill the drab, not to mention unoriginal, backstory) and inevitably to mother-daughter sparring Developing competitions, the film has an ace up its sleeve - the twist end is as unexpected as it is ingenious, but it does little to eliminate the bad taste the film has left in the movie through the lameness of it all intermittent gore) or the inescapable feeling of wasting 80 minutes of my time ...

summary: A grizzled derelict tells a quartet of horror tales to a trio of young campers.
translation:
William Cooke and Paul Talbot share the director / writer for this entertaining, low-budget movie about three guys camping in the woods with their horror magazines. Feet are supported by the fire and schoolboys are drifting back and forth ... and an ugly city tramp named Ralph (Gunnar Hansen ... of Leatherface fame) wanders around and trades four stories of blood in return for food and the warmth of the fire />
One story is the old retreading of "The Hook," two teenagers on Lane's Lane who were attacked by an insane killer with a hand hook. Another story has a few tokers who need to score some weeds. You stumble upon a guy who knows a guy who has some great s # @ t. When they smoke a few sacks, their skin starts to turn gray and green before it blooms and falls off. One of the better stories is about an unfortunate man who comes home for Christmas, who can not wait for his mother to drop dead and enjoy telling his nephew and niece of Satan Claus. The fourth campfire story is about a greedy sailor who digs ashore for an empty treasure chest and is finally chased away by zombies into the sea.

Without a big budget for special effects, CAMPFIRE TALES gets to the point and really could have been much worse. A bit cheesy, but fun to see, except maybe the sailor's story. Understandably, acting is not worthy of praise. Cast members include: Tres Holton, Courtney Ballard, H.Ray York, Johnny Tamblyn, Walter Kaufmann, Kevin Draine, David Avin, and Paul Kaufmann.

summary: An evil plot slowly unfolds. A mysterious villain is planning a vast symbiote invasion of New York, and at the same time-has framed Spider-Man of stealing Dr. Octavious' new machinery. That's not the only trouble plaguing Spidey. He must also save J. Jonah Jamison from the Scorpion, stop Rhino's Rampage, and save Mary Jane from Venom.
translation:
This cool Marvel superhero game pays real tribute by staying true to the comics. Of all the Marvel superhero games that are so lame with faint graphics and gameplay, Spiderman is improving in both divisions. It also contains the voice of Stan Lee, the creator of Spiderman Comics.

As you expect, Spiderman does whatever a spider can. He does more than cobwebs. In fact, he uses them as weapons and shields. If he does not use a web in combat, he will hit and kick as well. Spidey's got his hands full with Venom, Rhino, Mysterio, Scorpion and Dr. Octopus fights, just to name a few. Look for Captain America in a cameo.

Most levels are challenging, but some of them require patience to beat. The only complaint about this game is that it is so short and can be completed in less than three hours. If you're a true Marvel superhero fanatic, this game is for you, but do not expect a long gameplay. More luck in "Spiderman 2" My rating: 9 out of 10.

summary: A Cambodian assassin finds himself on the run from Hong Kong police after completing his assignment.
translation:
I have to be right away - I have not seen such a solid movie like DOG BITE DOG for a long time. I'm a big fan of CAT III "old school" movies from the late '80s to the mid' 90s, and I'd heard that "style" of movies with such films comes back a bit Herman Yaus GONG TAU (which I suppose had not yet seen this point ...), so I was very interested in giving some of these newer CAT III films a chance. Did this movie meet my expectations? Absolutely - but not quite as I imagined.

The story follows a young, animalistic, imaginative and practically unstoppable Thai hitman with a bit of a vague story coming to Hong Kong for a "mission". Due to some bad luck, he is quickly identified by a mischievous copy (which emits many of the same qualities as our hit man), and is quickly caught and captured. However, this situation does not last long, as the unnamed assassin escapes his captors and quickly shows the local police that he should not be taken lightly. The hunt continues and a cat-and-mouse game between the police and the "crazy dog" (as the police call him) follows. Along the way, Mad Dog is inadvertently made friends with a slowly beating young woman, and a connection between the two forms when she helps him out of a sticky situation.
