summary: A team of trainees of the National Guard brings supply to the New Mexico Desert for a group of soldiers and scientists that are installing a monitoring system in Sector 16. They do not find anybody in the camp, and they receive a blurred distress signal from the hills. Their sergeant gathers a rescue team, and they are attacked and trapped by deformed cannibals, having to fight to survive.
translation: Wow, that's the worst movie ever. The only reason I signed up for IMDb was that I could complain about this movie. I have never gone out of a theater or stopped a DVD, but I almost stopped them (and I should). but I watched it until the end, only to come down with an absolutely terrible ending. Wow, if that's all we Craven can produce, its time is long. I never saw the first one and I'll never see it. his terrible spectacle with a terrible plot. Hey, does anyone see a mirror throwing at us, let's check it. and the sad part is that when this movie came on DVD, it was checked out to blockbuster forever. I feel bad for all the people who saw this garbage.

summary: A teacher comes to terms with his past during a school trip to Salisbury Cathedral.
translation: Although this was not without mistakes, this drama was suitable for the Easter season. It reminded us of our spiritual selves and showed that behind our facades we often hide our deepest suffering and experiences. There was so much to enjoy in the drama, not least the rapping teenagers who provided the drama with better musical accompaniment than the rather poor sound score in the background. The acting was excellent and Timothy Spall was once again outstanding. The climax was very satisfying, if rather simple. Timothy Spall's "letting go" of the suicide of his long-dead wife was believable, reflecting well the feelings of despair that existed in the teenage self-injured teenager. The resolution between the graffiti boy and the Muslim was pleasing, but less credible. A wonderful drama that made me and my husband spend the evening well. Congratulations!

summary: New York, Christmas Eve, 1999 - at the dawn of the new millennium - a subway construction crew unearths an eight hundred year old Celtic skeleton and a mysterious key. Archeologist Karen Goodleaf is called in to determine the meaning of the discovery. News of the discovery reaches a Middle East monastery where the warrior monks knowns as the Knights Templer - an ancient sect entrusted with protecting holy relics - choose their best pupil, Lukas (Dolph Lundgren) to face the diabolical threat. As Lukas races to New York, an evil Minion seizes Karen and uses its body like a parasite and host. Lukas arrives just in time to rescue Karen and despatch the Minion. The Minion takes hold of another host - revealing that it is immortal. As it cuts a path of destruction through the city, decimating a parking garage and leaving a trail of death, Karen realizes that the Minion can't be killed - but only delayed from finding a new host.
translation:
The Minion is about ... well, a servant. A servant of Satan and his goal is to get the key that opens the door where his master is trapped. He is a kind of demon who has humans and when the body dies, he will have another. Anyone who happens to be obsessed will continue in furious rage. Dolph Lundgren plays Lukas, a member of a secret Knights Templar who is to keep the key away from the minion. The film begins a thousand years ago in the Middle East, where a few Knights Templars flee from the minion. Then you flash until 1999, when the key somewhere in New York rises underground. An archaeologist is instructed to study / dig the place where the key was found. Needless to say, the servant is behind the key and the movie becomes a lengthy chase between the servant and Luke and archaeologists.

The movie is just that, a low-budget B-movie strip. The movie lacks energy, and he just keeps going. They will follow the persecution, but you will never feel involved in the story, which purposely inherits ideas from previous films (especially the Terminator movies). The battle scenes with the servant are laborious, because you never get the impression how good or bad a warrior this demon is. It becomes "skilful" to a one-man army when battling a troop of Templars, but when it comes to fighting one-on-one. And it should be for a long time. All this shows that any sense of logic is simply thrown out of the box. The whole idea of ‚Äã‚Äãa secret order of the Templars, a door to hell and the key is not well explained. We just have to accept that they simply exist. The film seems to have been made with the feeling that there is not much potential for the story, but only enough to make a few bucks. Dolph Lundgren looks like he wants to be somewhere else.

The verdict: 2 out of 5 stars.

summary: Junior high in a time of rotary phones. Cougars have been spotted in the area. Logan is 13, the odd kid, with an active imagination and few friends. His young, single mother seems stressed. Latency is giving way to puberty, and Logan, who keeps a tube of lipstick in his dresser, may be gay or, more mysterious, transgender. He stares at himself in the mirror. He becomes friends with Rodeo, older and more mature, good-looking, with girlfriends. They take walks. Logan calls Rodeo and pretends to be a girl. Will he disclose himself to Rodeo? The kids at school talk. The school wants to promote kindness and tolerance. There are stories of child suicide. How do we find our way?
translation: had some nice poetic bits, but is really just an artistic-fartsy toss - together with no sense or determination. beautiful beautiful beautiful beautiful beautiful beautiful who gives them money to to do this crap? I could have been so much more, a good lead actor, and I always like Fairuza Balk, but come on, the old-rock metaphor of just staring blankly and not finding anything compelling is just so tired, and it certainly is not good movies. The director has to go away and live long and not return to the camera until he really has something to say. It's like the school for spaghetti-on-the-wall school, just put a group of serious pictures in front of each other and hope that you hope the poetry is created. that can work if the director actually has some kind of vision or has a brain that knows when it's near potential, but here it's just space filler, meaningless. I felt the lazy end come just before it hit, shouting "you lazy bastard" on the screen as the credits popped up.

summary: Valentine's Day 1988: At the school dance, geeky Jeremy Melton bravely faces one rejection after the other when asking four popular girls to dance with him. A fifth girl, plump and insecure, agrees, but they end up making out under the bleachers. When a group of school bullies catches them, the girl claims that Jeremy attacked her. This causes them to strip off his clothes and beat him up in front of the entire school. Flash forward to 2001. We meet the five girls who were in that school gym: Kate, Paige, Shelly, Lily and the formerly plump Dorothy. They are all in their 20's now and trying to sort out their love lives, which is appropriate, since Valentine's Day is coming up. After a disastrous date with a loser, one of the girls, a pre-med student, is murdered by a Cherub-mask wearing killer who sent her a death threat in the form of a Valentine card prior to the attack. After the four remaining girls are reunited at her funeral, they all start receiving threatening cards and ...
translation: I wanted to see Valentine since I saw that Denise Richards and Marley Shelton were in it because they had played in some of my favorite movies. When I saw Valentine, I was amazed at how great the story really was. It kills me to see that it has a low rating because it was not terrible at all. The actors and actresses played the parts wonderfully and the way they ended was so brilliant and smart. Some scenes were a bit unbelievable and or poor, and I admit that it was just a bit boring with a few minor parts, but on the whole it was entertaining and exciting nonstop. It had a confusing story that saw you all the way through and it does not deserve all the crap it gets. I recommend this movie at any time, but especially on Valentine's Day, because it is sure that you will give a lot of chills. Oh, and do not even pay attention to the trailer OR rating, please, NOT ...

summary: Adapted from the successful play, the film takes place in the 19th Japan where a war between demons and their slayers is fought. Izumo, an Kabuki actor with a demon-slaying past, meets and falls in love with Tsubaki. However, something is not right as mysterious marks appear on her body as time progresses. At the same time, it is announced that Ashura, the queen of all demons, will be resurrected and bring destruction to the universe.
translation: Beneath the dense green mica of computer graphics gleamed the amazing art and skill of Ichikawa Somegoro. Oh, it was lost in the dope. The scenes of Old Edo - with the Courtesan, drifting on the Sumida, rehearsing and playing in the Nakamura-za - were all exciting and engaging, taking you back to an interesting and rich era. The action on the Kabuki stage, where Somegoro shines and excites, was more rewarding than the absurd high jinks that followed. The ability, the energy in the audience, the colors of the sets, were far more satisfying than all the nonsense that took action and performance. What a missed opportunity! One of the best Kabuki actors lives and he loses himself in the dirt.

summary: Sissy Hankshaw is born with enormous thumbs that help her hitchhiking through the U.S. from a young age. She becomes a model in advertising, and her New York agent, "the Countess", sends her to his ranch in California to shoot a commercial, set against the background of mating whooping cranes. There, she befriends Bonanza Jellybean, one of the cowgirls at the beauty ranch. The cowgirls take command of the ranch from the Countess, and drug the cranes with peyote. The police besiege the ranch.
translation: I love all the books of Tom Robbins, so I was very excited and interested to see a movie made after one of his books. I knew the movie would not even capture half of Robbin's magic, but after watching the movie, I never wanted to read the book again. The movie Even Cowgirls Get the Blues does not contain one-eighth of the content in the book and seems to focus more on the love affair between Bonanza Jellybean and Sissy than anything else. Along with the incredibly weak line in the movie, I think better actors could definitely be selected to play the characters. The only actors in the movie I thought were playing their roles to match Robbins descriptions in the book were Julian's friends in their five-minute clip at the beginning of the film. Those who have not read the book may enjoy the movie, but as a big fan of Tom Robbins, this movie was nothing but a disappointment.

summary: The love which binds mother and daughter -- seen through the prism of one mother's life as it crests with optimism, navigates a turning point, and ebbs to its close. Overcome by the power of memory, Ann Lord reveals a long-held secret to her concerned daughters; Constance, a content wife and mother, and Nina, a restless single woman. Both are bedside when Ann calls out for the man she loved more than any other. But who is this "Harris," wonder her daughters, and what is he to our mother? While Constance and Nina try to take stock of Ann's life and their own lives, their mother is tended to by a night nurse as she journeys in her mind back to a summer weekend some fifty years before, when she was Ann Grant, a young woman who has come from New York City to be maid of honor at the high-society Newport wedding of her dearest friend from college, Lila Wittenborn. The bride-to-be is jittery, and turns to her maid of honor rather than her own mother for support. Ann stays close to her friend...
translation:
I never expect a movie to follow too much the novel (especially a loved one, like Evening), but when I saw that the author of the book, Susan Minot, was a screenwriter and executive producer of the movie, I thought Evening was one good adaptation.

If you liked the book, do not worry about this movie. It's so far from the book that the two barely resemble each other.

Here are our characters very different: The bride is in love with Harris. Harris is the son of the housekeeper. Buddy is a drunk, in love with Ann and / or Harris. I do not think a single character made it from the book to the screen; Oh, it gets worse with every passing moment.

And, really, we did not learn from Bridges of Madison County that we cut from the story we're supposed to be in to scenes of our heroes' adult children have offensive and youthful struggles just not on film? This movie is a disaster. Skip it.

summary: When world-famous genetic engineer Dr. Van Helsing discovers the secret to immortality, his world is ravaged by true-blood vampires. The Lord of the Undead makes a pact with the young doctor: "Make a bride for me, one as perfect as I, and I shall show you wonders this world has never seen." Shadows haunt the doctor, when a hot young student enters his lab and the line between ethics and curiosity are crossed. As bloodshed fills the halls, the battle between Good and Evil begins. Should he believe the promises of the vampire or is he creating another Anti-Christ?
translation:
The title says it all.

I'm not a film critic, nor will I be like the rest of the snobbish people who comment on this movie. Obviously, this movie does not have a budget of several million dollars, but the plot was very well done, the acting was fantastic, and the cinematography was great! It looked like you had a lot of fun making this movie! I chose 9 out of 10 because the sound was strong on only one channel and not both, but I imagine that this could have been a mistake in recording the DVD.

I will definitely check out other movies from Brain Damage Films!

Dylan O'Leary, cast and crew, thank you!

summary: Charley Partanna is a hit-man who works for the Prizzis, one of the richest crime syndicate families in the country. Unbeknownst to Charley,the Prizzis just hired Irene Walker, a free-lance killer, to eliminate someone who double-crossed them. When Irene and Charley fall in love their jobs become complicated. Their jobs become impossible when each is given a contract that neither can go through with.
translation:
Eight Academy nominations? It's incredible. I can only think that it was a very bad year - even by Hollywood standards. With Huston as director and Jack Nicholson and Kathleen Turner as leads I would probably have swallowed the bait and watched anyway, but the Oscar nominations really sold it to me and I feel betrayed by it.

So it's a black comedy, right? Can anyone tell me where the humor in Prizzi's Honor is? It's certainly tasteless (shooting in the head of a cop's wife is just another supposedly weird interlude in this intended farce about mafia life), but with the exception of a joke about 'your favorite Mexican cigars' (which I imagine) that it's an old joke Americans who were officially banned from buying something Cuban in the last 50 years, I have not seen anything funny - and I've tried it - there's a lot of mafia clich√©, but clich√© is not a humor in there

Is it a romantic comedy? Never The characters and their relationships are so unbelievable and superficial that they are on par with Gigli with Ben Afleck and Jennifer Lopez.
< br /> Is it a sophisticated parody of the mafia? Not in a million years, the plot is just pointlessly absurd and not hilariously absurd, and it usually only has the feel of a really bad (and cheap) mafia movie. It feels more like a homage than a parody.

With one-dimensional characters and little in the way of the humor written for them, the actors make ambiguous accents and draw faces. Well, it is not enough; even if the face is drawn by the master of the comical expression, Jack Nicholson (with a puffed upper lip added ... is this a parody of Brando's padded wiggles in The Godfather? ... Oh! Who Interested? ... everything I do it is not funny).

Throw in a slow, lazy direction (this movie lasts for 2 hours), some hopelessly dumb and clich√©d dialogues like; Well, we're much taller, we'll track you wherever you go ", and stereotypical mannerisms and you'll reach for the fast-forward button before you say" Capiche? " Can say. Prizzi's Honor is far from being Huston's "masterpiece" and is rather a very poor last work. It's definitely a work in the canon of the great director, who should give a concrete coat and throw in the Hudson River.

summary: Meena, a 12-year-old living in a mining village in the English Midlands in 1972, is the daughter of Indian parents who've come to England to give her a better life. This idyllic existence is upset by the arrival in the village of Anita Rutter and her dysfunctional family. Anita is 14, blonde and beautiful - exactly what Meena thinks she wants to be. She becomes part of Anita's world, but events do not run smoothly. Meena's growing up - and that brings plenty of changes.
translation:
I had high expectations for "My Beautiful Laundrette", "Bend it like Beckham" and (less) "East is East". The history of British Asians, which fits in with their adoptive home, has many good runs on the big screen, as well as a number of excellent TV and radio series (goodness graciously, etc.). This falls flat. Despite a good start, it went downhill quickly.

Ultimately, this was a horribly typical BBC stunt, complete with strong regional accents, rickety over-turned characters, a soundtrack "These were the days" and many "problems" in an attempt to be worthy.

I found myself twitching at many points during this movie. The letter is predictable. Every possible clich√© was pulled out and broadcast. In fact, I have difficulty thinking about any intercultural / intergenerational devices that could have been used that were not. The characters were thin and clanked: the eccentric nonconformist minister; the well-meaning but ultimately racist old woman; the overweight, overbearing aunt; the intrusive Indian parents; the neighbor of the working class; the "wise" deep grandmother; the motorcycle knight. The script was weak and had a chance to shock the audience with an open racist dialogue from the two racist white characters. And why it had to be set in the 70s (apart from an apology for a 70s soundtrack) is a mystery. Maybe it makes incredible characters more believable for people born after 1979. I dont know.

Even if these things were left aside, good action could have brought them into respectable darkness. Instead, the usual suspects of the "BBC comedy" were taken out. "Bend it like Beckham" had a much better comic acting (and serious acting in fact) than that, with a nearly unknown cast.

In summary, a lazy, clicked script, acted on, in a dull, predictable story. Give it a miss.

summary: A well-known actor, who hasn't accepted a role in four years, is considering a project. The cousin of the director drives him to Archie's Ranch Market, in Carson, and drops him off to do a little research. He's fascinated by one of the checkers, Scarlet, a young woman from Spain with a preternatural ability to ring up items at the cash register. She hates her job, stuck at the 10 items or less lane. The actor chats her up, and when her shift ends, he asks for a ride. In the course of the afternoon, he helps her prepare for a job interview. She needs to have confidence, he needs to commit. Human contact, however brief, can change people.
translation:
A still famous but decadent actor (Morgan Freeman) has not shot for four years. When invited to participate in a new project, he asks the director's awkward cousin to send him to a poor Latin neighborhood in Carlson to investigate the work of the manager of a small supermarket. He sees the beautiful Spanish cashier Scarlet (Paz Vega) and he is attracted to her ability. His driver never returns to catch him, and Scarlet takes the actor's ride. But first she has a job interview for the secretary's position in a construction company and the actor helps her to be prepared; then spend the afternoon together and have a good time.

I'm a big fan of Morgan Freeman and Paz Vega. The pointless "10 items or less" is absolutely disappointing. This low-budget movie does not seem to have a story and is backed by the chemistry and improvisations of Morgan Freeman and Paz Vega, and in fact, nothing happens in 82 minutes. The ambiguous open ending is simply ridiculous, with the character of Morgan Freeman returning to his silver spoon world and telling the simple worker that they would never see each other again. Was he afraid to have a love affair with her and to destroy his perfect world with his family? Or was it a class struggle, and he realizes that his fancy neighborhood would be inappropriate to a simple lower-class worker? My voice is four.

Title (Brazil): "To Astro em Minha Vida" ("A Star in My Life")

summary: A tough female district attorney is investigating a man who picks out women from public places by posing as a famous photographer, then takes pictures of them, then pushes on their submissive tendencies and takes advantage of them physically and financially. The trouble is that none of these women want to press charges, because they feel fulfilled in some way by their encounter. The DA arranges to meet him and finds herself in a similar situation as the other victims, and has to come to grips with her own submissive desires.
translation:
This is by far my favorite movie of all time. This is mainly due to the fact that it is not afraid to deal with some very politically incorrect topics (like spanking and female submissiveness) that other mainstream films are just too shy to touch. Nothing seems to be taboo in this film as the director freely develops the story without worrying about possibly offending the viewer. However, I think that nothing was done here to shock or deliberately offend anyone. Sean Young is doing an excellent and courageous performance. Most established mainstream actresses would not have taken on this role or would have requested major changes to the script before accepting it. The other actors also do a good job.

Did you notice that this movie has not appeared on pay-cable since a mandatory short appearance a year after it came to the cinemas? Did you ever wonder why? The obvious reason is that it simply does not fit in with today's political atmosphere. It seems pretty ironic that some premium channels now carry softcore porn (which is closer to hardcore pornography) but no mainstream movie like "love crimes". Although this movie is only 11 years old, unfortunately it could not be done today.

summary: An ex-boxer is drifting around after escaping from the mental hospital. He meets a widow who convinces him to help fix up the neglected estate her ex-husband left. Her Uncle talks them both into helping kidnap a rich boy for ransom money, and the ex-fighter must make decisions about his loyalties and what is right.
translation: A desolate, hopelessly predictable film in a most unpleasant environment (lower Coachella Valley). Acting is as amateurish as anything I've seen. Looks like a script 101. However, it works as a great sedative.

summary: Shohei Sugiyama has attained all that he has wanted in life. But he is still depressed and unhappy. One day, he gathers up the courage to sign up for dancing lessons. He hopes they will rid his depression and help him get his life back together.
translation: A sweet and totally charming movie, Shall We Dansu? made me laugh and cry. At the first appearance Sugiyama-san was not particularly attractive - a jammed waged worker who was seemingly devoted to his family but all too easily fascinated by a face in a window. The object of his obsession is distant and cold. But at the end of the film, I was in love with him, her, his wife and daughter, all dance teachers and dance students. This straightforward story of transformation and renewal is a little gem that I would like to see again.

summary: While visiting Starbase 11, the Enterprise is hijacked by Mr. Spock, leaving Captain Kirk behind while abducting the recently crippled Captain Christopher Pike, former commander of the Enterprise. The destination: Talos IV, off limits by Federation order since the Enterprise first visited the planet thirteen years earlier while then under the command of Captain Pike. After Kirk and Commodore Mendez, the Starbase commander, intercept the Enterprise, a court martial against Spock's apparent treachery is convened. Spock's only defense is a video feed showing Pike's capture and imprisonment by the inhabitants of Talos IV.
translation:
It is a well-known fact that when Gene Roddenberry first put Star Trek on NBC, the original pilot episode The Cage was rejected because it was "too cerebral." When the series got another chance, Roddenberry thought it would be fun to establish the events of the rejected episode as a canon, and did so by writing the Menagerie, which has the unique distinction of being the sequel to what at the time was still, an unchecked episode.

Instead of exploring a new planet, Kirk and his crew are at Starbase 11 this time, visiting former Enterprise commander Christopher Pike (Sean Kenney), now horribly disfigured and paralyzed by an accident. Pike joins his successor on the spaceship, where an unpleasant surprise awaits: Spock, who formerly served under Pike, has abducted the ship and paved the way to Talos IV, a planet that has since been taboo (punishment is death) Pike and Spock's last visit there, 13 years earlier. Of course, Spock is a logical creature, hiring himself and arranging a court-martial to justify his actions.

There is no need to say more about the plot as the rest is played out in Part 2. What's really impressive is how Roddenberry blurs the connection between The Cage and the rest of the Star Trek. Universe, by creating a specific type of flashback (to say more, would be too much), that leaves everyone on the screen and out To see what Trek could have been, NBC had not rejected the original project. In particular, it's fun to see Jeffrey Hunter (who could not return to The Menagerie) play Pike as a more serious captain than Kirk usually does, and Nimoy's early days as Spock, whose personality was not yet fully established: that's just the Time throughout the series that each of us beloved volcano spontaneously grins.

In short, not just a big "mystery" episode, but also a treat for those who do not bother tracking down The Cage in its original form (it's considered part of the box of the Season 3 available).

summary: On the Franco-Austrian Frontier during WW I, an oriental priest, chaplain of a French colonial regiment, is condemned to life imprisonment because he possesses the power of turning men into zombies. As the priest,in his prison cell, is preparing to burn the parchment containing the location of the secret formula, Colonel Mazovia kills the priest and takes the partially-burned parchment. Fade to after the war to an expedition of representatives from all the Allied countries (only those with colonial interests it appears) being sent to Cambodia to find and destroy forever the Secret of the Zombies. The group includes Colonel Mazovia (somewhat akin to sending the fox to guard the hen house); a student of dead languages, Armand Louque; Englishman Clifford Grayson; and General Duval and his daughter Claire. Armand falls in love with Claire, who accepts his proposal of marriage in order to spite Clifford whom she really loves. Later, when Claire, following an accident, runs to Cliff for ...
translation:
While this film certainly has the stench of a bad movie, it is surprising to see on several levels. First, for old movie fans, it's interesting to see the lead role played by Dean Jagger (no relation to Mick). While Jagger later got a very respectable role as a supporting actor (he even got the Oscar in this category for 12 O'CLOCK HIGH), his performance here is truly one-of-a-kind as he actually has a full head (I've never seen him like that it was before) and because he was by far the worst actor in the film. This film only shows that if an actor can not act in his previous films, he can not learn to become a great actor. Another good example of this phenomenon is Paul Newman, whose first film (THE SILVER CHALICE) is considered one of the worst films of the 1950s.

Another reason to watch the movie is the shuffle of everything. The writing is bad, the acting is bad and the special effects are bad. For example, when Jagger and an unidentified Cambodian wade through the water, it is obvious that they are really just going in place and the background is projected badly behind them. And when they have left the water, their costumes are 100% dry !!! There is horrible continuity and brainless dialogues throughout the movie - so much so that it is hard to imagine why they did not ask Bela Lugosi or George Zucco to star in the movie - both starring in many class Z horror movies. In many ways, this would be a perfect example of a film class about NOT doing a movie.

So while it's a 3, it's probably a bit too generous, it's fun to laugh about and short, so it's worth a look for bad movie fans.

summary: A Midwestern farm family faces major emotional adjustment after a tragedy results in the death of an older brother.
translation:
I had seen this movie back in the 80's and had almost forgotten it when I realized it was back on TV and looked at it. I remembered liking this little sleeper when I saw it first, and I liked it better the second time I looked at it.

All the actors, including Robert Duvall, Glenn Close, Wilfred Brimley, Frederic Forrest, and Jason Presson (as the twelve-year-old boy responsible for the accidental death of his older brother) are great. The film has a very authentic feel - a subliminal, calm, deeply moving story of a family suffering from grief. Dialogue is sparse, but narrative, and nonverbal action is excellent. Similar to a simpler, rural version of Ordinary People without a psychiatrist, but equally impressive family dynamics.

The Stone Boy is worth the time and emotional energy that comes with watching.

summary: Tobe is about 16, living with her dad and younger brother in LA's San Fernando Valley. She invites a gas station attendant named Harlan to come to the beach with her and her friends. He's from South Dakota, wears a cowboy hat, talks country, and has been a ranch hand. They have a great time, his simple expressions seem like wisdom, he's attentive and polite, and even though he's more than twice her age, she wants to spend time with him. When her father objects, she rebels. Harlan, meanwhile, thinks she's his soul mate, and he starts making plans to get her away from her father. Worlds are set to collide, but which ones?
translation: This movie really did make a good start. It had the potential to turn into a truly heartbreaking, romantic love story with cinematography that captured the love between "Harlan" and Tobe in long, poetic and idyllic scenes. It really did not have to be anymore and for a moment there I was excited that someone was finally making a nice movie for its own sake, another timeless classic, maybe a modern myth. Why, oh why, then screw it up halfway, turning the main character (Norton) into another psycho? Maybe I'll reveal the point, but do we really need another movie about psychos? Or is it necessary in Hollywood to portray the sick side of human nature, which indicates a general malaise in the film industry? For a moment I would write down the name of the director; Now I feel indifferent. At the very least, in the film's defense, it should be added that all actors seemed to be investing in their roles. Also Evan Rachel Wood is really nice to look at and a good actress with a lot of potential.

summary: Cast members of a show at the Alden theatre are being terrorized by a hunchback killer known as the Fiend, using frozen bullets, and two have been killed. Newspaper reporters Jean Monroe, drama editor, and Frank Gordon, accompanied by a dumb photographer, Elmer are on the story. Jean receives a note from Ted Wallington, the star of the play,"Satan's Bride", to meet him. From him, she learns the note was a fake, the lights go out and the Fiend strikes again as Wallington slumps to the floor dead. Peter Fortune, the author of the show, who has helped the police solve previous cases, agrees to assist on this case, but insists on working alone. Jean and Frank have taken rooms at the Globe Hotel, where Reardon, an actor, is also a resident. A telephone message for Frank turns out to be a ruse in the hopes of getting him out of the hotel. Reardon suggests calling the police but, while phoning, his finger is holding the receiver hook down. Meanwhile, Elmer calls Frank and the reporter is ...
translation: From terrible death scenes to guns firing without sound to a figure called Fiend. It's all tiresome, slow moving, unimaginative. It was okay to see the guy in the cape and the hunchback. Visually, it was scary and probably involved the moviegoer of the time, but even in 1936 one would think that even a movie would have given a little more imagination and credibility. I was just waiting for something to happen when people stood around making speeches and behaving as if they were posing at a business picnic. And then there are these bullets mentioned as a former commentator. Maybe the best indication would have been to look for a water stain in your pocket.

summary: Fred, Daphne, Velma, Shaggy and Scooby-Doo travel from town to town in their van, The Mystery Machine, solving cases of hauntings, monsters and unexplained occurrences. Joining the gang is Scooby's pint-sized nephew, Scrappy-Doo. Unlike his uncle, the little pup is constantly looking for a fight, and it is all Scooby and Shaggy can do to keep him from hurtling head-on into every ghost and monster they encounter.
translation:
This show started with big mystery episodes. I think everyone is in the first 15 or 16 episodes. After that the show started playing short episodes with Shaggy, Scooby doo and Scrappy doo.

I think Hanna Barbera Productions had to turn 20-minute episodes into short episodes. Some of the speakers were no longer available. After 15 or 16 episodes, Frank Welker (who played Fred) became unavailable. I think Velma's voice changes after the first 12 episodes because the first voice actress Velma played was not available.

And the network ordered the studio Hanna Barbera, with Shaggy, Scooby doo and Scrappy Doo, because the ratings were high. So they had to do more shorts. I wish they were mysteries like 15 episodes. Still, it's a good show.

summary: A team of trainees of the National Guard brings supply to the New Mexico Desert for a group of soldiers and scientists that are installing a monitoring system in Sector 16. They do not find anybody in the camp, and they receive a blurred distress signal from the hills. Their sergeant gathers a rescue team, and they are attacked and trapped by deformed cannibals, having to fight to survive.
translation:
No plot, shitty acting and pointless blood ....

That's supposed to be a horror movie? There is no fear or tension, just BOOM BANG GORE, then you're done. Some Marines are in the desert for some reason, and they are hunted by these mutant beasts from the first movie, which was good, and should have left it at that.

This is just another excuse for money and the use of senseless violence, just like the "saw" secrets. You know, no matter how pointless the action is and the more blood you can add, people will see it. I miss good exciting horror movies. Come Hollywood, you can do much, much better.

summary: An intended rape victim manages to escape from her attacker but leaves her purse behind. Worried that he may visit her house and finish what he has started, she contacts the police but they are unable to help, saying that she has no proof. "If he calls, let us know and we'll send a man round!" A fat load of good that would be. Her worst fears are realised when, alone one day in the house, her attacker visits and attempts again to rape her. Circumstances allow her not only to resist the attack but to turn the tables and lock him away. And that is where her dilemma really starts. Does she release him and risk another attack? Does she go to the police and risk being called a liar? Or does she kill him - and become as low as him?
translation:
Farrah Fawcett excels in this powerful 1986 drama in which she plays Marjorie, a woman who manages to escape the clutches of a would-be rapist. Well done, nominated for Farrah's Golden Globe 'Best Actress'.

When her rapist Joe (unbelievably played by James Russo) arrives at her house, sharing it with her two roommates (who are comfortable out!), Marjorie has to play with Joe's frightening demands. There are some disturbing and shocking pictures!

When their roommates come home, they are (to say the least) stunned by Marjorie's actions, and a great performance by Alfre Woodard, who desperately tries to convince Marjorie to do the right thing and put him in the Transforming the police makes the movie even more nerve-racking.

I find Diana Scarwid rather irritating, but when Joe finally admits he's come to kill them all. It's actually making the movie a very emotional drama.

Overall, Extremities is a brilliantly thought out and well-played movie and I've seen it hundreds of times! Well done for all involved.

summary: Santa Claus, high above the North Pole in his cloud-borne castle equipped with more surveillance devices than the Impossible Mission Force, prepares to deliver presents on Christmas night. Santa is especially interested in helping Lupita, the daughter of a poor family who wants nothing more than a doll; and a young boy whose parents are so wealthy they never spend any time with him (Santa fixes this by feeding them Pan-Galactic Gargle Blasters). However, the Devil will have none of this and sends his minion, Pitch, to foil Santa's plans. Pitch in turn recruits three Naughty Boys to help him set traps for Santa.
translation:
Believe it or not, I have my own DVD copy of this "movie" I bought at Walgreens for a big whole dollar. I'm still not sure if it was a well-spent dollar or a stupidly wasted dollar.

Pretty amazing sets and costumes. Apparently they made a lot of thought and effort. The sets are very Mexican in stylization. I liked her very much. And Santa Claus is impressive. One of the most impressive Santa Clauses in the film world.

I suspect that the original intent and purpose of this film was to be something encouraging and fun for a children's audience. But somehow it seems pretty disturbed. In fact, I'm stunned by how crazy it is.

Maybe it's the English dubbing that makes it so crazy and bizarre. One of the reasons I like movies in the original language in which they were made, and the use of English subtitles as a sync often results in an unwanted strangeness. The children's voices were at least synchronized with actual children's voices, as opposed to women who pose as children, who tend to sound very, very funny. Did you know that demons in hell spend their free time dancing around? Ballet in her long johns? Do not you have? Not me, either, until I saw this movie. You learn something new every day.

Is this movie really worth seeing? Well, that's a tossup. I can not recommend it to a clear conscience, as it is quite disturbing in its own bizarre way. But his unintentional bizarre is what it pays to watch. You decide what you will do. I do not know ... for myself, it made me uncomfortable to see demons constantly making sweet ballet moves. Well, that's just wrong ...

summary: Single father Dan Burns dedicates his life to his children, but one day he meets Marie at a bookstore. They get to know each other, but then Dan finds out that Marie is actually dating his brother, Mitch.
translation:
Expectations were a bit high for me when I watched this movie, finally I thought Steve Carell could not go wrong by coming out of great movies like Anchorman, The 40 Year Old Virgin and Little Miss Sunshine. Boy, I was wrong.

I start with what's right in this movie: Steve Carell may be Steve Carell. There are a handful of moments in the movie that make me laugh, and it's almost entirely up to him to be given the leeway to do his thing. He is undoubtedly a talented person, and it is a shame he signed up to what I believe was a total train accident.

With this topic I will discuss what has gone terribly wrong.

The film begins with Dan Burns, a widower with three girls who qualifies for a nationwide syndicated counseling column. He prepares his girls for a family reunion where his relatives meet for some time.

The family is high on the list of things that make this movie a terrible one. No family behaves like that. It's as if they were transported by Pleasantville or Leave it to Beaver. You are a caricature of what we think a family is when we are 7. It reaches the point where it becomes offensive and simply frustrating. Touch football, crossword puzzles, family cones, and talent shows. ARE NOT HOW KEEP ACTUAL PEOPLE KEEPING. It's almost disgusting.

Another big mistake is the woman Carell should fall for. Watching her in her first scene with Steve Carell is like a stroke victim trying to get rehabilitated. What I imagine is unique and original in this woman comes as easily lagged behind.

It makes me think that this movie is taking place on another planet. I left the theater and wondered what I had just seen. After thinking about it, I do not think it was much.

summary: The 1991 Persian Gulf War is a military triumph for the United States. But when thousands of returning veterans start to develop medical problems, it appears that the military is trying to downplay or ignore the situation. It takes perseverance on the part of military families and members of Congress to bring to light the dilemma and prompt action on the part of the government.
translation:
What this film does not answer is how wrong this war is (and most US wars have been done recently, just to get some oil). How many innocent civilian casualties were there, how many lives were killed and how blatantly stupid are the perpetrators.

So, let me ask you - if American soldier kills women and children except enemy, it's fine, but if the government accidentally kills their own forces by killing deadly chemicals and killing so many civilians Well, that's it not? Your logic fails, gentleman.

I give it 5 for the solid performance and 1 for everything else, a total of 3.

summary: Disillusioned and temporarily rudderless, John Woodson is about to experience a dramatic and profound metamorphosis. Through a mysterious set of coincidences, he finds himself on an adventure to Peru in search of ancient scrolls, known as the Celestine Prophecy. The prophecy and its nine key insights, predict a new awakening that redefines human life and provides a glimpse into a completely spiritual culture on earth. Resistant at first, skeptical and unsure, John finds that each step he takes, each person he encounters leads him to a new awakening. It is only in this letting go that he finds his destiny and comes to understand the meaning that had escaped him when his adventure began.
translation: The book on which this film is based has changed my life greatly. But to call this film a disappointment is an understatement. The acting, the directing, the cinematography and the plot were all terrible. I would not recommend this movie to anyone. I've told countless people about the book, but now I'm going to tell everyone that they definitely should not see the movie! I did not expect the plot to follow the book exactly, but they have omitted too many key components of the book. The film attempted, but failed, to deliver a powerful and inspiring message, humiliating only the central theme of the prophecy. While I put myself in the position of who did not read the book, I saw the Celestine Prophecy as a bunch of malicious B.S. I am very disappointed with Redfield, how this movie was made.

summary: nan
translation: After losing Emmy for her role as Mama Rose in the TV version of GYPSY, Bette won an Emmy for BETTE MIDLER the following year: DIVA LAS VEGAS, a live concert special filmed for HBO in Las Vegas. Midler, who has been performing live since the 1970s, proves that she is still one of the most electrifying live performers in the industry. From her opening number, her classic "Friends", where she descends from the wings on a beautiful prop cloud, Bette's style and charisma dominate the stage of a rap-type number called "I Look Good," proving she's one has a joke like few other artists in this business as she pushes her way through a variety of musical selections. The part of the show where she hails burlesque is a little too long, but she manages to use her old Sophie Tucker jokes well here (though she actually forgets a joke in the middle of storytelling, but her ad libbing) until she remembers that it is hysterical). Bette also pampers us with "Rose's Turn" by GYPSY and the theme tune from her smash movie THE ROSE as well as a shameless plug for her hit movie THE FIRST WIVES CLUB. She brings the house towards the end with "Stay With Me, Baby" by THE ROSE and her only number 1 hit album "Wind Beneath My Wings" by BEACHES. It's a dazzling evening of musical comedy entertainment and it's a must for Midler fans.

summary: Mr. Peepers is a shy science teacher at Jefferson Junior High. He is always faced with problems but is never outwitted.
translation:
I also loved this series when I was a kid. In 1952 I was 5 and my family has always seen this show. My favorite character was Marion Lorne's rather stuttering, hobbling and very lovable "Auntie" type person played. I can still remember her "ubba bubba um" type comments as she would try to say something important. And then, when she came back and played Aunt Clara in Bewitched, it was a great casting!

It was the first time I remember seeing Walter Matthau, whose career I followed as a fan for many years.

I have a question if anyone can confirm: was the title or credits the "Swedish Rhapsody" by Hugo Alfven? Every time I hear it on my classic radio station here in Southern California, it brings back memories of the image of Mr. Peepers running away with his back to the camera. I'm not even sure if this picture is right in my mind's eye.

summary: 12 genetically enhanced childern escape from a military base that created them. 10 years later, after The Pulse, a magnetic bomb that destroyed every computer in USA, has struck, Max Guevara, one of the 12 escapees, is a bike messenger in (what's left of) Seattle and with cyberjournalist, Logan Cale, she tries to rid the world of crime and corruption, avoid her creators and uncover her past.
translation: This is an absolutely great show. Jessica Alba is not only the most beautiful woman in the world, but also a great actress. She does a great job of portraying Max, and I could never see anyone playing that role. It is definitely unique and absolutely great.

summary: --**Contains Spoilers**----Air Force pilot John Sands has been wrongfully imprisoned in a military detention center, where his memory is to be chemically wiped because some of his superiors feel threatened by the knowledge that he gained from his assignments to operations that were deemed too sensitive for the regular intelligence services. Later, after John escapes from the detention center, a top secret Air Force Stealth Bomber known as the X-77, which uses the latest in stealth cloaking technology, making it capable of going anywhere undetected, is stolen by corrupt Air Force pilot Ratcher. General Tom Barnes, John's former commander, hears that John has been arrested after taking down a group of men who were robbing a rest stop. Knowing that John was Ratcher's trainer, Barnes sends John to northern Afghanistan with fellow pilot Rick Jannick to recover the X-77, promising John that he will be a free man if he succeeds. Barnes has Admiral Frank Pendleton, who is on an aircraft ...
translation:
Normally I do not comment on anything (I read the other opinions) ... but I have to comment on this ... I was convinced that I see this movie from worlds like Action, F-117 and other hi-tech stuff, but through just a few first minutes and I changed my mind ... Lousy acting, lousy script and a big science fiction.

It's one of the worst movies I've ever seen ...

Just ... do not bother ...

And yet one thing, before any movie I usually look user comments and rating on this page ... 3.7 points and I give this movie a try, now I wonder, WHO rate this movie by giving it more than 2 points ??????????

summary: In the Kennedy days, all the States buzz about the Apollo moon program, even the bugs. Grandpa fly keeps 'inspiring' his grandson and two mates, a nerd and a glutton, with heroic stories. New they decide to get in on the action at Cape Canaveral via an astronaut's bred box. Grandpa also gets involved. There's also an evil Soviet Russian fly to with.
translation:
I, who has endured hundreds of children's films in the past, consider this one of the worst I've ever seen.

1) I am annoyed to have to explain this to my children these days Russia is not "the bad guys". Even the mocking Russian names like "Poopchev" are inappropriate.

2) The grandfather fly's birthday scene featured a quasi-sexist joke in which he implied that men drink beer and women talk on the phone. Two other flies also unnecessarily use the word "crap" twice.

3) The whole movie is largely influenced by 50s stereotypes and propaganda that I thought we, as a nation, were proud to have survived. In all, it's just crude, badly animated, even worse written and not worth wasting the time to see.

summary: When Secret Service agent David Somers is fired, he takes a quiet job with the Fentons at their country estate - cataloging butterflies, hence the title insect. David grows fond of Jess Fenton's niece, a fragile, fey young woman named Sophie. Because he hates traps of any kind, he reacts quickly when Sophie is framed for the murder of Hick, the nasty handyman. He helps her escape London by using his agent's skills and a network of old friends. The pair lead the police and David's ex-employers an exciting chase, from Newcastle to the Lake District to Liverpool. As the fugitives try to catch a ship for France, everyone, including the murderer, join in the finale.
translation:
A delightful little thriller opens with Trevor Howard in his Jaguar convertible and ends at a dock in Liverpool. It's all thrills and spills as the ex-spy has to restart his career just as he gets some serious R & R cataloging butterflies (how British is that?).

Trevor Howard and Jean Simmons romp from London to Newcastle-upon-Tyne to Liverpool (via Ullswater) - he was just thrown out of MI5 or something, and she, you guessed it, is on the Escape, falsely accused of murder. There are shabby docks, hilly Lake District hills, sheep, country pubs, copper looses, waterfalls, a number of amateur cyclists, rooftop car chases and many Chinese (do not ask), and it's all very Hitchcocky and Hannayesque ...

..and a great example of British Noir ...

summary: A multi-volumed documentary mini-series, "The World at War" covers the entire history of World War II from the causes of the 1920s to the aftermath of the Cold War in the 1950s. Emphasis is also placed on several inside story episodes, where events are covered which occurred inside Germany and Japan such as resistance to Hitler, life in general under a dictatorial regime, and particular emphasis is focused on the Jewish Holocaust.
translation:
I had just reached thirteen when I saw this series for the first time, and I'll watch it on DVD again, over thirty years later. The pictures about the opening credits have never left me. It has influenced my view of the world and the peoples. My parents had been with me long enough to see the show with me, and we always discussed the program thereafter. It gave me a love for studying history and the highest grades I got in the public exams of our school!

Sir Laurence Olivier's voice and delivery is timeless and perfect. I feel that the people who have experienced it feel that this is their version of World War II history. I can not imagine getting bored. Perhaps one could consider a similar series of the Cold War, though it is hard to imagine replacing Sir Laurence.

Buy it!

summary: A rowdy rock group are accompanied by a film crew to desolate Lake Infinity to produce a music video. One night the musicians visit the local pub while the various members of the film crew satisfy their carnal desires with one another aboard the luxurious houseboat they are all staying in. They are so busy they fail to notice that a rampaging lunatic has snuck aboard the boat, and one by one the various characters are brutally slaughtered in a variety of grisly ways.
translation:
It is very regrettable when such a film is shot. A lot of work and money was put into a movie that is amateur at best.

Editing is on the rise, there are obvious mistakes that could easily be corrected in a second shot, and the soundtrack is uninspired. Much more could be achieved with this video. I think they had no time left, or videotape.

Hand shots have a pronounced amateur feel for them.

summary: Murderous screenwriter Stanley Caldwell, who incidentally is thought to be dead, returns to the scenes of his crimes.
translation: Back to H√ºtte am See is perhaps one of the few successors that can live to the original. It had black humor, good excitement, good-looking girls and of course a psycho-killer. What do we miss? I do not think anything. Unless we're left with a small amount of gore and nudity, because it was made for television. Besides being one of the best sequels, it's one of the best thrillers you can see as a family. Recommended for everyone.

summary: L.A. real estate agent Kate Wooten gets a new lease on life when she learns that her new client, a mysterious and handsome man named Vlad, is looking for a house isolated in the Hollywood Hills where he wants to live and doesn't want to be disturbed. It doesn't take long for Kate to fall in love with her new client and to learn that he's a real vampire.
translation: When I found this movie in my local video store, I expected it to be another kitschy American vampire movie in the same vein as The Lost Boys (1987). To my surprise, "To Die For" is a really good movie sometimes kitschy, but there are still enough stylish set pieces and surprises to satisfy vampire enthusiasts. This is a perfect mix of romance and horror and it is sometimes surprisingly bloody. Highly recommended.

summary: Twenty-four year old Angeleno Lionel Carpenter teaches a citizenship class at night school, most of his immigrant students who have no idea of what he is teaching in the language barrier. He has also had no luck with women largely due to the sheltered life he's led under the wings of his overbearing mother. His lack of encounters with women in the sexual sense is unlike his brash cousin, Sgt. Danny Bonhoff, who will do anything and take whatever opportunity to be up close and personal with the opposite sex. With Danny's help, Lionel is able to lose his virginity, although it isn't a totally satisfying experience. Regardless, Lionel learns that the reason for his nausea and vomiting following that encounter is because he got pregnant from it, he being the first male in recorded history to be so. By this time, he and one of his students, Russian gypsy Segoynia Savaka, have fallen in love and want to get married. They have to decide what to do about the baby. But the infamy and notoriety...
translation: I can not say enough bad things about this train wreck. It's one of the few films I've ever tried to get out of. It was a bad condition, pregnant at first, but then they tried to make it a parody. What are you spoofing all these genuine pregnant men? That was the worst movie I have ever seen. If it had enough votes, it would be 100 on the IMDB bottom. If it were possible to give it a zero, I would, and I would still feel that I had given it too much credit.

summary: The misadventures of a family of White Lions who perform with Siegfried and Roy in Las Vegas.
translation: I never saw it on TV, but rented the DVD through Netflix as soon as I realized it was available. I had high expectations and was not disappointed. It's funny and the animation is outstanding. I would have expected this quality level only from feature films, and I'm surprised by some bad comments. Maybe the DVD release has improved the animation? A bonus to the DVD is that it was fun to see both versions of the pilot. I am an adult and I really appreciate that it is for adults. It's not just kids who like cute cartoon characters. It's far from being "slippery," as some have claimed, but I can see where some parents do not want their little kids to see it. I am very disappointed that it was canceled. I wish they would produce more episodes. Or maybe a movie.

summary: Samantha Morrow, a middle-class mom deserted by her shallow husband, David. In order to keep a roof over her head - not to mention the head of her son, Travis - Samantha decides to take in boarders.
translation: So maybe you're reading some of the comments posted for this movie and you might even think, "Huh, there were a lot of RAVE REVIEWS released on December 30th." Funny is that most of these rave reviews sound as if they came from the same person, or at best a small, coordinated group of "open house" groupies. The truth, my friends, is that this movie is really imperceptible. Just because it is "independent" does not mean that there is a free pass. If you want to make a musical, whether on film or on stage, on Broadway or in the local theater, you should be sure that (a.) Your actors can sing, (b.) Your actors can dance (c.) You have decent sound equipment, (d.) You have a well-written score, and (e.) You have lyrics that are funny and charming. Even Anthony Rapp can not save that. It's one of those unfortunate experiences where I made films that made me really ashamed of everyone involved.

summary: The past, present, and future lives of surviving Oceanic Flight 815 passengers are dramatically intertwined as a fight for survival ensues in a quest for answers after crashlanding on a mysterious island. Each discovery prompts yet more secrets, as the hastily-formed colony search for a way off the island, or is this their home?
translation: Before that, everything that was shown on television was predictable. You can predict who will die or who will find something, but in Lost you can NOT foretell anything. Every thing was so surprisingly stunning and it was really a mystery, not because it has so many secrets, but because there was nothing like that before everything was so great. I literally became addicted to it. LOST is a classic work of art. You can look forward to every week. It's genius. The environment is awesome, it's quiet and warm on the beach and so scary in the jungle. The characters are a work of genius each of them especially those who are already on the island. The castaways are so dramatic, but we can never predict their deaths because they have so much more to do and so much more to say, and they have secrets that affect the other castaways who die with them.

summary: In this purely fictional story, Paul McCartney drops by The Dakota to visit John Lennon in 1976. Paul is still on top of the music world, reaching #1 with his new band, Wings. John, however, has retired from public life, choosing to raise his son, Sean. Rumors are rampant that The Beatles are going to reunite to play a concert. Paul, the consummate entertainer, is intrigued by the possibilities. But John, still fighting his inner demons, is content keeping Beatlemania a thing of the past. But even though the two men are still at odds over the band, they rediscover that they still have bonds from the past that will never go away.
translation: This is one of the few films published about a "what if" situation that made me think. It was amazing to hear them talk to each other and think about all the wonderful (and not so wonderful) things that happened between them. I really think there is a very good possibility that this happened, as the movie implies, and they actually made peace with each other. Those are good memories any fan can think of and wondering what really happened between them would be selfish. What an amazing movie that was. The comedic aspects of the movie were wonderful. Thinking that they were together to cover things up between them in this way is a comforting thought to people who wish they had the opportunity to clear the air with someone they did not come to. Seeing John as such a caring, relaxed character was refreshing when he heard all the garbage talked about ...

summary: An intense film about time travel, this Sci-Fi entry was directed by Terry Gilliam, a member of the comedy troupe Monty Python. The film stars Bruce Willis as James Cole, a prisoner of the state in the year 2035 who can earn parole if he agrees to travel back in time and thwart a devastating plague. The virus has wiped out most of the Earth's population and the remainder live underground because the air is poisonous. Returning to the year 1990, six years before the start of the plague, Cole is soon imprisoned in a psychiatric facility because his warnings sound like mad ravings. There he meets a scientist named Dr. Kathryn Railly (Madeleine Stowe) and Jeffrey Goines (Brad Pitt), the mad son of an eminent virologist (Christopher Plummer). Cole is returned by the authorities to the year 2035, and finally ends up at his intended destination in 1996. He kidnaps Dr. Railly in order to enlist her help in his quest. Cole discovers graffiti by an apparent animal rights group called the Army ...
translation: One of the biggest movies I've seen this year. Maybe even before sunrise, which you can see in the lab alone late at night. I like the idea of ‚Äã‚Äãthe film, which suggests the free will of man and our weakness against fate. Over time, James and Kathryn are doomed to failure and an indescribable suffering comes. I like the end. but a big question comes too. The virus should not be released again, right? In the last scene at the airport. Jose is sent back to see James again from future scientists. When he told him that scientists had already received his message and knew that someone else would spread the virus. And they both meet Kathryn when Kathryn tells James that the real man is DR. Goine's assistant. So it's clear that Jose also gets the true information about the virus (James is keeping an eye on him at the time, remember?) And he has teeth. So why did everything still happen? Why future scientists do not do anything after the truth is revealed? My biggest question after the movie ...

summary: A Cockney con-artist just out of prison replaces an insurance company's computer programmer and sends claim checks to himself in various guises at addresses all over Europe. Meanwhile, he falls in love with inept secretary and frustrated flutist, Maggie Smith.
translation: I saw the description of the movie on TCM and just let it go because I liked both Peter Ustinov and Maggie Smith, so I was delighted to see that I really liked the movie and found it quite extraordinary. Of course, it is very old-fashioned, but as a historical piece it pays to look at the subtle humor of the way of life and life almost forty years ago. Now the only problem is to find it on DVD so I can see it more often. I was also very fond of the appearances of Smith and Ustinov as leads and of Karl Malden, Bob Newhart and the performances of Robert Morley and Cesar Romero.

summary: nan
translation:
Men In Black 2 was a real disappointment to me. While the actors did a pretty good job, especially Smith, there's simply no cure for a bad script once in production. The film really had a "sequel" feeling and played partial events of the first movie. The story was in one word ... in the worst case. It was not well thought out and sometimes seemed very choppy and incoherent.

In the first streak, the MIB organization had a sort of "elite" sense of power. You had some special agents and it had a "secret" feeling. In the sequel, the MIB organization has a JROTC Summer Camp atmosphere.

The movie was not terrible or anything .. it just lacked the "coolness" (for lack of a better set) of the first movie. A lot of the same old humor was recycled from first to second, adding no real originality to the MIB universe.

A perfect analogy would be Episode 1 of the first 3 films. Was it decent? Yes. Is it worthy to wear his title? Not really.

summary: Two Spanish pan-handlers soon find themselves in over their heads when they stumble upon an opportunity to redeem themselves and perhaps the entire planet. The world appears to suffer from rampant poverty, violence and spiritual desperation and the relentless news media force-feeds these images to the Spanish people. A popular reality television show lets the audience decide between life or death for suspected felons, and one of the opportunistic pan-handlers attempts to escape poverty through this raucous and sensational TV program.
translation:
Salva and his friend Bigardo spent most of their lives on the edge of the law. We see them in a car of the subway, where their pitch to get donations is so boring, nobody gives them anything! Salva, who is a hardened petty criminal, does not even have redeeming qualities until he discovers a reality show on television that gives him the idea of ‚Äã‚Äãwhat to do next. Religion and show business prove to be a winning combination that benefits Salva.

He and Bigardo were imprisoned after the accidental death of a priest who had criticized the duo. Salva shows that he is a natural for the reality show. He transforms himself into a Christ-like figure, which is an instant success in the program. Espe, who is a no-nonsense woman who is the producer of the show, can not escape the way Salva pays her unusual attention. After all, Salva is the victim of his own success.

Jordi Molla, whose first directorial work is this film, has had some success in the way the film satirises the role of television. Spain, which was prone to this type of program, has seen its share of the bizarre, which the director felt as an attack on the audience, and wanted to make his story from the point of view of the people making a fortune out of the na√Øve public.

The cast has some good moments in the movie. Mr. Molla, like any actor who decides to shoot his first game, would have been more effective at focusing on the image in front of the camera. Candela Pena, a good actress, is one of the best reasons to watch the movie. Juan Carlos Villedo, David Gimenez Cacho, Franco Francescoantonio, Florinda Chico and the others responded well to the new director.

summary: A Nebraska farm community is plagued by a storm with a series of tornados acting against normal patterns. Dan is left at home to look after his baby brother Ryan along with his friend Arthur while Dan's mother is at work. His stepfather goes to check on his grandmother. When a tornado destroys the house, Dan and Arthur attempt to re-unite the family
translation:
TV version of "Twister" jumps a few leaks, but it remains to be seen. My sister bought this a few years ago at a Wal-Mart when it was released, I saw it then and thought it was alright. Later, "Twister" comes out with Bill Pullman and Helen Hunt (or was it before? I think it was 1997) and did a better job overall. But "Twister" was more silly fun; That's realistic with a message. It all depends on what you want from a movie with Twisters: Twisters, or a low-budget character study?

John Schneider and Devon Sawa (he's the reason my sister bought it) Stern and Devon Sawa, who switched to "Wild America", "Final Destination" and "Slackers", got his big one here Pause. In a way, I was one of the first to really see him move out. I do not know if it's an honor or a shame, I have not seen him act in recent movies.

"Night of the Twisters" is all about the personal taste, as I said it all depends on what you expect from a movie with twisters: twisters or a low-budget character study. "Night of the Twister" has the latter. So you decide.

I give him a 2.5 / 5 ...

- John Ulmer

summary: Lizzie Borden High's class of 1972 are going through the motions at their tenth-year reunion, until deranged alum Walter Baylor, driven insane by a sadistic senior-year prank, escapes from the mental institution and crashes the party. When guests start getting killed, the other alumni, including snooty yacht salesman Bob Spinnaker, class tease Bunny Packard, and class zero Gary Nash, spring into action to uncover the culprit. Chuck Berry makes an on-stage appearance.
translation:
Personal taste prevails when it comes to talking about movies like this little gem. Already in the eighties, early eighties, I discovered this movie, as so many published at the time, "Night Patrol", "Bad Manners" or even "King Frat", the artwork and the blobs on the back of the cover you ,

Of course, there are movies I've already mentioned, as well as things like "Screwballs" and the many others that inspired the imagination, and fortunately many years later I still remember a few with preference and some with the contempt for the many films that help preserve my love of such genres as parodies or pastas.

Many years after the great success of "Animal House" and after seeing how it has been played Over the years, I now know that there would be no way that this movie ever would the box office hit would mention it would remain in the memory, similar to National Lampoon's Vacation.

Honestly, not everything that bore the National Lampoon logo was a wild success. Class Reunion remains one of my absolute favorite movies, with instantly recognizable characters, such as the unapproachable Bob Spinnaker, played by Gerrit Graham, so good at Charles Band's "Terror Vision", which still lingers in the past glories of his youth. Or how about Stephen Furst's cheeky and ballistic twisting when high school fucked lazy, drunken sex boy Hubert Downs.

Sweet as. Which makes me think. As I said, personal taste can not be resisted. People can be so cruel that they never win a prize or are compared to their colleagues in the comedy world. It has some advantages. It was one of John Hughes' earlier scripts that would later become one of my own favorites for his work "Weird Science" and would have a wonderful title sung by the great Gary US Bonds.

What can I say more, it's a movie just waiting to be discovered again and again.

summary: After a traffic accident Kaylie is in coma for months. Her doctors want to try a new procedure on her: to regain her consciousness, they stimulate her brain with neural patterns of a woman who just died. It works, and Kaylie seems to be ok again. However in her dreams, she lives the last day of her savor - and realizes that she's been killed! Together with her husband she tries to find out what happened.
translation:
And a self-admitted to boot. At one point, the assistant's doctor calls himself an Igor.

With the increasingly plausible idea that computers could be used to replace or reconstruct brain functions, this movie does not spend enough time exploring the premise. Most of the time on the screen is split between domestic quarrel of the girlfriend in a coma and the murderer of the brain donor. It tries to be a sci-fi / drama / thriller, but fails with each of the three.

As a Frankenstein remake, it misses everything that made the original good. Nobody calls the doctor insane or even threatens to throw him out of the hospital. The transformation scene consists of a coma victim opening an eye and the amazing computer that makes it possible is not even shown. When the experiment works, there is no praise, and when it starts to go wrong, there is little reaction.

Any suspense about who the killer might be is shattered by showing him in the same room with all the possible suspects. Finding the killer is as easy as opening a file and interviewing a person.

San Francisco as a hiring is both overused and underused. The opening sequence recalls that this is happening in SF, a cable car plays a significant role, the leads live in a Victorian mountain peak, Pier 39 appears and the final showdown takes place at the Golden Gate Park. Specifically, along three feet of ledge in the park - just enough to keep the bridge in the picture at all times. Once the obvious scenery floor plans are completed, no further attempt is made to explore the city.

Acting here is the only salvation. Keir Dullea shows a good selection and attracts some really emotional scenes. Suzanna Love portrays recovery from a coma. Tony Curtis gets only a handful of lines and twice as many glares that most of the francscience have explained by his assistant. The little blonde child meets his cues pretty well.

I also gave an extra star for the scene where the husband drives south from the bridge, it cuts to a U-turn on an unrelated parking lot and then he is immediately back on the bridge goes north. It takes a good deal of something - valor, ignorance, deadlines - to try to slip that through the viewer during the single chase.

summary: Lena, aged twenty, wants to know all she can about life and reality. She collects information on everyone and everything, storing her findings in an enormous archive. She experiments with relationships, political activism, and meditation. Meanwhile, the actors, director and crew are shown in a humorous parallel plot about the making of the film and their reactions to the story and each other. Nudity, explicit sex, and controversial politics kept this film from being shown in the US while its seizure by Customs was appealed.
translation: "Jag √§r Nyfiken? Yellow" is a lot of fun. Like at least one other reviewer, I have laughed a lot on many occasions. Yellow is energetic, playful, self-confident, explorative. Do not expect Bergman here. This film is about a youth in the early to mid-60s in Sweden and about the problems that * read * contradictions * faced by the nation and the world. Occasionally, Yellow seems to be a serious socio-political documentary, with Lena, the protagonist, and others who interview both ordinary people and politicians (such as Olaf Palme at home). At other times, Yellow seems to be parodying this kind of documentation. All the while, Yellow is a personal documentary exploring Lena's life - her domestic life, her love, her political views, her view of herself. She is a complete person ?? complex, flawed, contradictory, happy, sad, curious. And above all that lies the wonderful additional dimension of the director Sj√∂man and his crew, who document themselves and document Lena. That's what gives me yellow wings. Not only do they suddenly appear in very funny times and in a funny way, they remind the viewer that this is fiction and artificiality, but their presence is itself another layer of the film; You are filming yourself. I am reminded of a Bj√∂rk music video with the same quality? a music video about making a music video, ad infinitum, with each repetition becoming stranger and more cartoonish. I think Sj√∂man may have had something similar in mind. While "Jag √§r Nyfiken? Yellow" may not be for everyone, it's certainly intelligent, funny, refreshing, exuberant and authentic.

summary: Nasik-based Heerendra Dhaan and Raj Ranade are bodyguards of a politician, but after their employer is implicated in a scam, they end up assaulting a police officer and flee to Mumbai. Once there they meet with Rambhabhai, who in turn, gets them employed with a gangster named Shambhu. After a short while the duo are apprehended by Police Inspector Narsimha, questioned, and after they agree to cooperate to bring down Shambhu, are let go. The two do succeed in assisting the police arrest Shambhu, but they themselves are arrested, tried in Court, and sentenced to a year in jail. After their discharge they are met with Inspector Narsimha, who wants to recruit them to capture and kill dreaded bandit Babban Singh, who had slaughtered his wife, Kavita, and son, Subbu, as well as cut his arms off. Heerendra and Raj agree to carry out this task for 8 Lakh Rupees. They re-locate to Kaliganj where Heerendra falls in love with auto-rickshaw driver, Ghungroo, while Raj gives his heart to Subbu's ...
translation: This movie should not be watched because it should be a flop. Ram Gopal Verma wanted to do a remake of the classic Bollywood movie "Sholay" first, but after having problems with the original creators, he decided to continue with the project and ... I think, let all the good parts of the film (acting, Screenplay, songs, music, comedy, action, etc.) and film the film, just because he already hired the crew. Waste of money, a waste of time. After making films like Rangeela, Satya and Company, he drew a Coppola (godfather) on us; What did you think RGV? Anyway, the story, though hard to follow, is almost like old Sholay. Ajay Devgan plays Heero (Beeru, Sholay) and Ajay, a new kid who plays Ajay (Jay, Sholay). Both "bad but funny" friends help a policeman to catch a bad boy first. Later in the film retired policeman hires them as personal safety and protection from the hands of a very popular Bubban played by Amitabh Bachan. If you have not seen Bollywood movies, the good guys win in the end. There I have just saved you 3 precious hours of your life!

summary: Edward Carnby, detective of the paranormal, unexplained and supernatural, investigates a mystery (the recent death of a friend) with clues leading to "Shadow Island" that brings him face to face with bizarre horrors that prove both psychologically disturbing and lethal, as he discovers that evil demons worshiped by an ancient culture called the Abskani are planning on coming back to life in the 21st century to once again take over the world... and only he and a young genius anthropologist with an incredible memory (and his ex-girlfriend), Aline Cedrac, stand in their way, at a gateway to hell. Standing in Carnby's way, however, is the impact that a brief encounter with an evil spirit called the Queen had upon his mind, as he slowly finds himself overpowered by the forces of darkness as they eat away at his very sanity...
translation:
Alone in the dark is Uwe Boll's kick in the Nuts to Hollywood, after House of the Dead has missed a slap in the face.

That proves how much a Master Manipulator Boll is. After putting Artisan out of business on the flop that was House of the Dead, one can only assume that the normally credible Lion's Gate films have only released AITD by contract after acquiring Artisan's assets. Because AITD is an even greater example of the total lack of coherent filmmaking, exposing an action and simply stealing badly from other films because it should look cool instead of integrating it into the frame of the film.

But then that's the point, right? Boll does not try to make a coherent film because he does not try to direct alone in the dark. He just tries to manipulate Hollywood.

Alone in the dark, like House of the Dead, Dungeon Siege, Far Cry, Bloodrayne and the other 3 or 4 projects that are "announced" or in "before". Production ".
