summary: When the daughter Emma of the technical writer Allen Pyke and the photographer Julie is found slashed in the throat and wrists in their locked apartment, the couple decides to move to an isolated cabin in the mountains in Kingspike. Julie is very depressed and blames Allen for the death of Emma. Once in the new home, Julie sees the spirit of Emma in a photo she took in a nearby abandoned prison and she becomes obsessed shooting pictures of poltergeists. Allen is advised to move from the place by the local Jim Payne, and on May 21st, Allen finds that the former dwellers of the cabin have committed suicide, and he investigates the death in the spot and finds that many people died around May 22nd. He decides to move with Julie to a hotel, but she does not want to give up on Emma.
translation:
A mourning couple, after losing their daughter, moves to a mountain hut and discovers that there can be ghosts, restless ghosts of past residents committing suicide. Julie Pyke (Cheri Christian) accuses husband Allen (Greg Thompson) of the terrible death of her daughter because she left the door unlocked and the marriage has deteriorated. Julie remains in a zombie state, elicits almost no emotion, is far and deaf, photographs only a nearby abandoned prison and finds a frightening image of a ghoul girl clinging to the bars. Although Allen sees nothing unusual, Julie continues to take pictures and we can see that something is wrong. A local artisan, Jim Payne (Scott Hodges), a rather distant companion who hides a secret, becomes a dangerous threat when it turns out that his dead mother may have something to do with the places that happen to the pykes. In the meantime, the neighbors who sold the pykes in the cabin find victims, the alcoholic Mr Booth's mistreatment of his wife, who come back to haunt him. Allen will conduct an investigation into the history of his hut and try to decipher the mystery around the place.

Many ghosts are unhappy in the background in this murky, supernatural story of virtually every character. Cheri Christian remains so empty and lost, it's incredibly hard to connect with her despite the fact that you understand her plight. The plot, as often mentioned, remains frustrating because none of the characters are locked exactly. I suppose that's the way it should be in these circumstances, but the difficulties I had were never able to hug the Pykes properly because of their constant detachment. Cheri gets cold and distant as I would expect a mother to lose a child that way, but the icy nature made me plead inwardly to embrace her, which I just never could. I think the right performers, even if the characters go through an emotional uproar, can grasp the hearts of their audience when a humanity reaches us. In this movie, the leads are for some reason unable to do so. I could be, I do not know. I wanted to take care of her, but nothing in the characters pulled my heart strings. Anyway, as the movie continues, Allen slowly reveals certain truths and has to fight back against his wife, who has convinced herself that her daughter is among them and that she will not lose her little girl again. Jim, the fragile neighbor who believes that to stop the haunting spook that plagues the area, he has to kill the pykes becomes a vital threat. The ghosts remain a central part of the film, their presence, especially Jim's mother, is anchored in the distance. The finale reveals to them all how Allen must find help for his wife as he tries to thwart Jim's mission. It was hard for me to get into this subject because I was dissatisfied with the leads and their characters.

summary: The remake of the 1970 Neil Simon comedy follows the adventures of a couple, Henry and Nancy Clark, vexed by misfortune while in New York City for a job interview.
translation:
Granted, that seems like a good idea. Steve Martin, Goldie Hawn and John Cleese in a Neil Simon comedy. Where can you be wrong? Look at the movie and you will find out.

In fact, Martin, the lead role, is mismatched. He does not make the great slapstick he's known for from films like "The Jerk," but instead plays some sort of intermediate character that does not work. Hawn, playing with nobody is terrible. Cleese is the only even partially funny member.

To top it off, the plot is pretty stupid. I can not say how much of that has changed, but the characters seem to have the least common sense. They rush through New York, do nothing right and unfortunately nothing funny. Not only is the whole premise totally unbelievable, it seems to give the message that people who do not live in New York are not very bright, a theme that is repeated throughout the film.

In short, instead If you see it, rent the original "Odd Couple" again.

summary: Four elite Galaxy Rangers with unique abilities defend law & order among the space colonies and protect humanity from the evil Crown Empire.
translation:
Damn straight ... this show was kick ass in the day and continues to outshine cartoons today. I can not wait to find some of the DVDs to share with my little guy and see the same sparkle in his eyes. I introduced him to Voltron (the 5 lions, not the 15 vehicles) and I laughed when he said to me one day, "Dad ... you've probably looked at some great cartoons when you were a kid !! "How cool is that.

Come on Hollywood, dust it off here and give it a live action try. Could not be worse than Spiderman 3 was ... Man oh man ... 2007 was pretty lame for summer movies so far.

OK, I'll shake now
Cheers

summary: Episodic look at an unlikely couple trying to make it in L.A. during the late 1970s. He's Albert, an illegal alien from Belgium, serving as chauffeur and lover to a string of powerful men. She's Stella, a real estate agent with several women lovers. When he's out of a job, she temporarily takes him in. He becomes her cook and housekeeper, time passes, and they marry so he won't be deported. Later, after a boozy birthday celebration with him, she finds herself pregnant. They try to be a family, love grows, and she puts her career on hold as his career, as a fashion designer, takes off. Can this gay couple stay true to each other, and what happens when their hormones call?
translation: I find it regrettable that the leading commentaries on this film contain the words "ignorant and dreadful nonsense". I think it's a very funny movie and excellent entertainment. One must expose his unbelief that a homosexual man and a lesbian woman fall in love, have a child, and live happily together. But it's always wonderful when it's played in a movie and your heart warms up. Is it that impossible? There are many more implausible events described in other films. Acting is good, the script is funny. The only negative comment is that the story could well have ended when the family moves away from their original home instead of continuing to investigate whether the man retains a residual homosexuality.

summary: After total humiliation at her thirteenth birthday party, Jenna Rink wants to just hide until she's thirty. Thanks to some wishing dust, Jenna's prayer has been answered. With a knockout body, a dream apartment, a fabulous wardrobe, an athlete boyfriend, a dream job, and superstar friends, this can't be a better life. Unfortunately, Jenna realizes that this is not what she wanted. The only one that she needs is her childhood best friend, Matt, a boy that she thought destroyed her party. But when she finds him, he's a grown up, and not the same person that she knew.
translation: I start to see a pattern in the movies that I give a 1. It's almost all the movies that my wife showed me. Maybe I should stop believing in her taste in movies. Anyway, that's typical of girls, but even worse than usual. Once again, the writer has broken the cardinal rule of a movie. He / she has disabled the main character. She starts by being a complete friend at the beginning of her girlfriend, and then finds out that when she turns 30, she is essentially a shy person (with affairs, etc.). Why do we feel for this person? OK, let's say we can get over it. Jennifer Garner is as far from being attractive as you can get without having any kind of deformity. I do not know if it's her or the scribe's fault, but her character goes well beyond my threshold for anger. Here is a tip for future filmmakers: 13-year-olds are NOT entertaining, they are annoying. By far the most embarrassing moment in the movie came when they danced to "thriller". Holy crap that was painful. It showed that she practiced this dance in the beginning. That explains why she knows, but a whole club full of people?!? Argh !!! The Macarena would be more believable! Suddenly she is completely incompetent and has no idea how to do her job and nobody notices it? At least Tom Hanks's character on "Big" had a job that made sense to a child. This body switching / kid is getting more and more out of hand, and that's by far the worst.

summary: Ben Stiller and Jack Black star as Tim and Nick, best friends, neighbors and co-workers, whose equal footing is suddenly tripped up when one of Nick's harebrained get-rich-quick schemes actually succeeds: Vapoorizer, a spray that literally makes dog poop, or any other kind for that matter, evaporate into thin air -- to where exactly is anyone's guess. Tim, who had scoffed at Nick's idea and passed on an opportunity to get in on the deal, can only watch as Nick's fortune -- and Tim's own envy -- grow to equally outrageous proportions. When the flames of jealousy are fanned by an oddball drifter (Walken) who imposes himself into the situation, Tim's life careens wildly out of control ... taking Nick's with it.
translation:
Envy has some of the best. Jack Black, Ben Stiller, Amy Poehler and the great Christopher Walken. With such a cast you can only expect the best. Nobody could save this catastrophe with "Envy".

Tim Dingman (Stiller) and Nick Vanderpark (Black) are the best friends and employees of a sandpaper factory. Both make a decent living, but because Tim performs better at work, he can afford more than his buddy Nick. Nick is a dreamer who always develops new ideas for inventions. One day, Nick comes up with the idea for a spray can that makes dogs disappear (yes, I'm serious). Nick falls in love with the idea and decides to really invent this product. He offers Tim an offer to invest in his idea and share the profits 50/50. Tim refuses to think that the idea will never work.

Nick's invention, entitled "va-poo-rize" (again, I'm serious), ends up making millions. He enjoys spending money on things like a much bigger house, a horse, a personal trainer and fantastic desserts. Tim starts to feel jealous for Nick. Hence the name of the movie.

The concept is not bad, but it is still going to be terrible. This movie contains some of the worst dialogues and very bad performances of all actors. On the other hand, as I mentioned earlier, none of them could save this mess. Not even the great Christopher Walken, who played a homeless character called "J-Man," made this movie funny. The film is bad from the beginning and only gets worse.

I recommend this movie if: * you crap (no pun intended) * do you want to see Jack Black in a white tux

I say, avoid this movie for everyone Price, but avoid ESP, if: * You are offended by bathroom humor * You love animals

summary: Jerry Mulligan, a struggling American painter in Paris, is "discovered" by an influential heiress with an interest in more than Jerry's art. Jerry in turn falls for Lise, a young French girl already engaged to a cabaret singer. Jerry jokes, sings and dances with his best friend, an acerbic would-be concert pianist, while romantic complications abound.
translation: I dug up some old musicals from my garage and that's another of my favorites. It was written by Jay Alan Lerner and directed by Vincent Minelli. It won two Oscars for the best picture of 1951 and the best screenplay. The story of an American painter in Paris trying to make it big. Nina Foch is a sophisticated lady of the media and keen to help, but soon finds out she loves the guy. In the meantime, Gene Kelly falls in love with Leslie Caron. His main dance partner, and I have to say, they are fantastic together on the floor and otherwise. The famous French singer Georges Guietary also sings. So, if you like good, gentle dances and funny scenes with Oscar Levant's nimble pianofinger, the songs of George Gershwyn will live on forever in this colorful gem. 8.10

summary: Ned possesses the unique talent of being able to bring the dead to life merely by touching them. However, the person may remain alive only for one minute, or else someone else dies for them. A second touch will render the person dead again, unable to be revived. Through his connections with PI Emerson Cod, Ned revives his childhood sweetheart, Chuck. The trio, aided occasionally by Olive Snook, helps solve the mysteries of various murders, whose murderer is often surprising.
translation:
I really enjoyed the first episode and I'm looking forward to more. A bit soft on the crime front (it's almost an afterthought and not terribly exciting or elaborate), but I thought the romantic angle was wonderfully charming. I will see it again!

I hope they will have a bigger role for the aunts, who are wonderful actresses and have been used a little too little this time. The actress who plays the assistant / waitress (also by Bewitched, I think) is very cute and bubbly and comes across as nice dorky and cute instead of stupid and annoying, which is nice.

Take a look.

summary: Jane Eyre is an orphan cast out as a young girl by her aunt, Mrs. Reed, and sent to be raised in a harsh charity school for girls. There she learns to become a teacher and eventually seeks employment outside the school. Her advertisement is answered by the housekeeper of Thornfield Hall, Mrs. Fairfax.
translation: I read the novel "Jane Eyre" in 1986 for the first time. It was about this time that I saw the BBC version with Timothy Dalton and Zelah Clarke. It was an excellent version and very similar to the book. Years later, I saw this version and was appalled. William Hurt is totally miscast as Mr. Rochester. Mr. Rochester is a passionate character, where William Hurt portrays him as an ice block. The same goes for Charlotte Gainsborough. It was like watching two zombies together. This is a story of love and passion, but I could not see it in this version. No, back to the BBC version. A wonderful time is guaranteed.

summary: In the Fiji islands, the greedy and unscrupulous owner of the Valalola Resort Primal Park invites investors and guests for an opening party of his compound composed of hotel and zoo aiming to find partners for his discoveries. When a bunch of college smalltime thieves puts a virus in the security system to participate in a scavenger hunt, the greatest attractions of the zoo - sabretoothes from the prehistoric age developed from DNA found in fossils - escape, killing the hosts and guards for fun.
translation:
First, the CGI in this movie was awful. I saw it in a marathon of bad movies on the sci-fi channel. In the end, if the owner of the park is killed, it's probably one of the worst examples of CGI I've ever seen. Even Night of the Living Dead had a better animation.

That said, the movie had almost no action. Why were you on this island? Well, it was not said in the movie. And why should people keep coming back to the cat area? Makes no sense.

One thing that stood out in this movie was moderately good acting. In a movie that could be described as "B made for TV Film", acting was very good. Parry Shen stood out.

If you have absolutely nothing to do on a Saturday, watch this movie. It may be good for some memorable quotes.

summary: The B.T.K. killer harasses a news reporter with threatening letters as he ponders about the murders he committed 30 years ago.
translation: This is the biggest bitch of all time. It looks like they've spent more time, effort and money making the DVD cover than on the actual movie. I really thought that the DVD was turned off with someone's homemade porn until I recognized one of the actors from the cover. This movie looks like someone did it with a hundred bucks and a camcorder and spent half of it on rats. The picture is really clear, but that, along with the very unfortunate lighting, cinematography, if you can call it that, production, acting, if that's actually what they do, and script if they have one, makes this movie worse than an old porn. At least the old porn has a point. This looks like some PETA members have joined forces and decided to make a really disturbing, pointless PSA about animal rights and feelings. So this is not worth the money or time. It has nothing in common with the actual BTK serial killer except the name of the killer and some of the victims. The people who made this movie should be glad that he is not still free, or that he came after them just because he made this movie so bad.

summary: When her surrogate father who owns the casino she works in gets murdered, Modesty Blaise takes on those that killed him and are now at the casino to rob it. It turns out she is more than just a modest worker.
translation:
Summary: It's like always at Louche's Casino in Tangier. The casino is nearing completion and preparing for a big transaction the next day. The owner Louche and some staff go out for the night and leave Modesty in charge. Suddenly, armed gangsters storm the casino and shoot wildly. Unknown to Modesty, they have already killed Louche, and are now hiding in the vault for the money. But nobody present and still alive, in the casino knows the code to open the vault. The vault itself is heavily trapped with explosives so that the attackers can not break through the door as planned. Suddenly Modesty finds herself in a roulette game with gang leader Miklos in a life-threatening situation.

Comments: This is a review that is unrelated to other published media by Modesty Blaise, as I have neither seen nor read them. The first point I like to do is that this is easily wrongly classified. First and foremost, I thought that was a thriller with a fight between Modesty and Miklos as the main plot. Sure, there are some bursts of action, but they are not really an integral or important part of the story.

As mentioned in the main story and the main suspense scene, the game is between Modesty and Miklos. It's an innovative and intriguing way to reveal the background of a character, and the story takes place much earlier outside the casino. Someone has said that it is almost like a pilot for a TV series, and the feeling is that it could indeed be used as such. But I found that it was a much better way to introduce a character than many others. I was in no way disappointed with the lack of action, instead I enjoyed this game, the story much more than a simple action movie.

I think the two main stars, Alexandra Staden and Nikolaj Coaster-Waldau very well. Staden especially portrays Modesty very well and really wears this confident and talented character.

7/10

summary: Sidney Young is a disillusioned intellectual who both adores and despises the world of celebrity, fame and glamor. His alternative magazine, "Post Modern Review", pokes fun at the media obsessed stars and bucks trends, and so when Young is offered a job at the diametrically opposed conservative New York based "Sharps" magazine it's something of a shock! It seems "Sharps" editor Clayton Harding is amused by Young's disruption of a post-BAFTA party with a pig posing as Babe. Thus begins Sidney's descent into success - his gradual move from derided outsider to confidante of starlet Sophie Maes. Initially helping him out at Sharps is colleague Alison Olsen, who has her own secret. Wither their friendship?
translation:
I really enjoyed watching this movie, mainly because of Simon Pegg, who has quickly become a solid box-office hit for comedy films.

He is hired by his crazy London publishing job by big shot NYC media mogul Jeff Bridges, as a writer, for one of his celebrity rags.

After paying his dues, he makes it to the higher echelons of the celebrity writing Hackdom (the "seventh room"), where he is a little celebrity himself. The plot is very funny, and Gillian Anderson plays an impressive supporting role as an advertising agent.

On the way to success he finds the true meaning of love, etc.
Apart from the formula action, the movie was very funny, mainly because of Simon Pegg, Jeff Bridges and Gillian Anderson. Kirsten Dunst was good as the love interest. The rest of the supporting cast has done a good job.

It was a good comedy and worth visiting in the theaters.

summary: During WWII in England, Charlie, Carrie, and Paul Rawlins are sent to live with Eglantine Price, an apprentice witch. Charlie blackmails Miss Price that if he is to keep her practices a secret, she must give him something, so she takes a bedknob from her late father's bed and places the "famous magic traveling spell" on it, and only Paul can activate it. Their first journey is to a street in London where they meet Emelius Browne, headmaster of Miss Price's witchcraft training correspondence school. Miss Price tells him of a plan to find the magic words for a spell known as Substitutiary Locomotion, which brings inanimate objects to life. This spell will be her work for the war effort.
translation: I've personally seen a lot of Disney movies in my life, though none of them fits in any way with bedknobs and broomsticks. Although personally I would not have crossed live action with animation, it was an improvement when trying to disguise people as animated characters. The film tells three evacuees from the Second World War, who are to remain in the country with a silent and socially embarrassing woman. I would have to say that the casting was brilliant. Angela Landsbury has done a perfect Miss Price while David Thomilson has made a great desperate entertainer love interest. Endings always surprise me and that was no exception. It was neither happy nor sad, although I do not know if that was intended. The dialogue was not great, but considering it was a children's movie, that's fine. Overall, I would give the show nine out of ten, the dialogue six out of ten, the cast nine out of ten and the costumes eight out of ten.

summary: nan
translation:
There was such a hype about a game show with Bill Shatner ... and especially right after deal or no deal and 1 against 100. So of course everyone had to watch to see what the whole thing was about new game show What a disappointment ! As Ben Stein says so stoically and nasally: "Wooww".

The only thing that was nice about this show was the fact that you knew it would be over someday. Sitting for an entire hour was like going to the dentist ... you look at the clock at 10-minute intervals, only to find out that only a minute has passed (but seemed like an eternity) You look at the clock last. So, why did not I just change the channel? Well, probably for the same reason that most other people do not ... out of sheer optimism. I mean, no one really wants to think that a show with Bill Shatner could really be SO BATH.

Personally, for the first 15 minutes, I never thought this would be the kind of vehicle it would be. Look at the talents of William Shatner. My main complaint was that the set was so dark. When I watched it, I felt depressed. You still wanted a little excitement, but there was no one to have. There was not even enough light on the set to get a sense of energy from the audience (that you could not even see).

Dear Network: People do not watch game shows to cure their insomnia. ..You watch game shows to be excited and have a good time. Please do us all a favor and lose it in the vault.

summary: Wealthy Elias Graves builds his home on the top of a hill, where a group of squatters have taken up residence at the bottom. Many of the men in the squatters' village have their eyes on young Tess, and one of them, Ben Letts, frames Tess's father for murder. While maintaining her father's innocence, Tess must keep her love for Graves' son a secret, while caring for Elias' daughter's illegitamate child.
translation:
Here is proof of why Mary Pickford was "America's treasure." In this rather complex drama, Mary plays the young daughter of a squatter, who dares to dream of a relationship with the son of one of the "mountain peaks". The scenes in which they steal a kiss and otherwise fall in love are simply adorable. She is even ready to take a bath. The fact that Mary can take on this role at the age of 30 is just amazing and something because of her small stature (5 ').

Tess has to face many physical and emotional challenges. She does this with sperm, which was not seen in many heroines of the time. Tess grabs a wallop and is not afraid to fight someone. Why she agrees to help the Hill Topper daughter is a mystery to me, but she sacrifices her own happiness to keep a deep secret. Pickford's close-ups are wonderful.

Born in Denmark, Jean Hersholt is just wonderful as a villain. The scene in which he serves a little baby is enough to throw vegetables (or whatever) on the canvas. If Forrest Robinson (who plays Daddy Skinner) wore a beard, would he have grown up to the model of World War I that recruited poster from Uncle Sam ?? Wills You!

Although the story is somewhat predictable and slow at first, it is an investment in your time to see the play or the pure Americana. The film shows opportunities that are available to all of us to make someone happy and what it means to be a true Christian. Recommended.

summary: Colonel Pepper brings his daughter, Peggy, to Hollywood from Georgia to be an actress. There she meets Billy who gets her work at Comet Studio doing comedies with him. But Peggy is discovered by High Art Studio and she leaves Billy and Comet to work there. For her new image, she is now Patricia Pepoire and ignores Billy when he sees her on location. When she is not longer wanted by the little people who do not understand "ART", she plans to marry Andre to get a fake title. Billy will not let her go without a fight.
translation: Marion Davies plays in this remarkable comedy "Show People", which was published in 1928 by MGM. Davies plays a hick from Savannah, Georgia, who arrives in Hollywood with her father (Dell Henderson). The venetian blind they arrive in is a hunt - like Davies outrageous southern costume. Davies lands a job in slapstick comedy, not what she wants, but it brings her success. She meets the slapstick star William Haines, who is immediately impressed by her. Well, Davies gets a job in a prestigious studio ("High Art Studios") and gets a job in stuffy periods. A handsome, but wrong actor (Andre Telefair) shows her how to become the typical, swanky Hollywood star. Davies gives up her slapstick boyfriend and dad for the good life, but of course that does not teach who she really is. Marion Davies is wonderful because she dominates - outrageously - the range of emotions that a "serious" actress needs. William Haines is his usual comic me, and there are cameos by Charles Chaplin, John Gilbert and other famous stars of the day, including the director of the film, King Vidor. This is a silent film with a few "sound effects", as sound images just came at their expense. A treasure of a movie.

summary: On a crowded subway, Skip McCoy picks the purse of Candy. Among his take, although he does not know it at the time, is a piece of top-secret microfilm that was being passed by Candy's consort, a Communist agent. Candy discovers the whereabouts of the film through Moe Williams, a police informer. She attempts to seduce McCoy to recover the film. She fails to get back the film and falls in love with him. The desperate agent exterminates Moe and savagely beats Candy. McCoy, now goaded into action, confronts the agent in a particularly brutal fight in a subway.
translation:
This is a pretty good example of the movie Noir. The setting is the early '50s with the Communists trying to steal gun secrets from the US government.

Richard Widmark is the nice pickpocket with no qualms. He gives a pretty decent performance, but there is no A-list about him. The interesting thing was that he was not only an anti-hero, but by the majority of the film an invulnerable anti-hero. That's not very normal. Jean Peters performed as well as the whore with the heart of gold. This great character actress Thelma Ritter shines as a chair dove.

The plot had its fair share of twists and turns, jokes and hard talk. There is a fight scene at the end of the movie (at the subway station) that was pretty crude and exciting.

I think that noir fans (like me) will enjoy this movie. For non-Noir viewers, it may seem a bit old-fashioned and the whole Commie thing is a bit over the top.

summary: After her husband's unexpected death and subsequent financial woes, suburban mom Nancy Botwin (Mary-Louise Parker) embraces a new profession: the neighborhood marijuana dealer. As it seems like everyone secretly wants what she's selling, even city councilman Doug Wilson (Kevin Nealon), Nancy is faced with keeping her family life in check and her enterprise a secret from her neighbor, pseudo-friend, and P.T.A. President, Celia Hodes (Elizabeth Perkins).
translation: Do not get me wrong, I want to see marijuana legalized like the next guy. I will digress now. The writing was unrealistic. A PTA mother who sells drugs but is adamant about getting her drugs into the hands of a minor. Give me a break. The complacency of Mary Louise Parker's character was an insult to my intelligence. The characters were not likeable at all. Basically, the storylines went nowhere. I understand his only TV country. The hypocrisy was blatant. Mary Louise Parker is supposed to be a great mother and I should believe that .... WHY ???? I just felt like I was being preached by a show that smells like cinders. It's like it's OK to cheat on your wife, but with someone who is of legal age. OK, not exactly the same, but I think you understand my opinion. Saving kids gear is wonderful for campaigning, I think, but it does not hold water in a cable sitcom about a suburban mother, as the local pot dealer.

summary: Hindustan (Urdu name for India) used to a vast territory and countries' like Pakistan, Sri Lanka, Nepal, Bangla Desh, and Bhutan were all it's provinces. All this changed when the British established their rule over India, and promoted their policy of hatred, and division - mainly between the Hindus and the Muslims. After their departure in 1947, the celebrations of a independent India were short-lived, and the divisions created by the British stayed on and flourished with extremists from both sides ready to kill anyone from the other side. While the Muslims under Jinnah wanted a separate country, which they would like to call Pakistan, the Hindus wanted the Muslims to leave this country and go to Pakistan. Clashes followed, millions fled, millions more were killed, Very little is known of mankind's heinous behavior in this circumstances, such as looting, raping, and kidnapping. puro was one such woman who was recently married to Ramchand, and then abducted by a man named Rashid, who ...
translation:
Pinjar is truly a masterpiece .... It is a thought-provoking film that makes you think and questions our culture. It is without doubt the best Hindi movie I have ever seen. This film was supposed to have been screened at film festivals around the world and I believe he would have been a serious candidate in Cannes. All characters were perfectly cast and Urmila Matkondar and Manoj Bhajpai played in their roles.

The story told by the film about division is a very important story that should never be forgotten. >
It has no prejudices and prejudices and has given the partition a human history. Here no country is represented as good or bad. There are evil Indians, evil Pakistanis and good Indians and Pakistanis. The cinematography is excellent and the music is melodic, meaningful and haunting. Everything about the movie was incredible ... and acting took my breath away. All were perfectly staffed.

summary: Set in New York, 'Whipped' is about a group of three single men, buddies from college, whom meet every Sunday at their local diner hangout to discuss their favorite sport: scoring with women. Their conversations (always revealing, sometimes revolting, and occasionally riotous) revolve around the weekend past and the girls that these three egotistical and narcissistic swingers were able or unable to "scam." However, when all three single guys unknowingly go after the same "perfect" woman, Mia (Amanda Peet), they begin to question their skirt-chasing ways. Squabbling breaks out amongst the group as they compete for her attention and suddenly, the fate of their ritual and their friendships, becomes uncertain. Who will win the morning round table bragging rights? You'll be surprised.
translation: This movie is not funny. It is not entertaining. It does not contain a single second of originality or intelligence, nor does it cause you to have the least interest in the characters or the situation. In addition, it is a youth film like everything that has lately been remembered. It's as if a group of 14- or 15-year-old high school kids, who never had or have had a real relationship with a real girl, sat down and made a movie about their false fantasies about it, like an adult Man would be. This movie is boring, offensive, deafening and sometimes offensive and disgusting. It contains at most one or two moments that make you laugh. It also seems twice as long as its 85-minute runtime.

summary: During childhood, Fred Claus suffered his younger brother Nick's saintliness. Jump ahead: Fred is a fast-talking, genial but self-centered guy in Chicago looking for $50,000 to open an off-track-betting shop. When one scam goes awry, he calls Nick at the North Pole for a loan: Nick will give him the money only if Fred comes up to help a few days with the Christmas rush. After his girlfriend dumps him, Fred heads north. Santa's facing an audit from an efficiency expert, and it's not pleasant. Fred's job is to review charts and determine who's naughty and who's nice. Is there any fraternal feeling left, can either learn from the other, and what about Santa getting fired?
translation: Well, I have to say, this movie was so bad that I would have gone out if I did not have to see it through to work. And the worst part is, I wanted to see it so badly that I drove all over the city, paid two times ten dollars, because the newspaper ads were wrong. Vince Vaughn plays the guy he always plays - the only time I ever saw him play someone else was in this movie with John Travolta. Anyway, the plot has potential - it sounded great in the preview, but it's full of ridiculous, predictable, faint plot turn points. And I was hoping that this would be a Christmas movie, in which Christmas does not have to be saved and that Santa does not need a replacement, but no. The only cool part was the sleigh rides, and the little bladck boy was the one I'm sure this movie would be great for young kids, but for adults it's so lame that it's hard to sit through.

summary: A documentary on the evidence which shows that the Apollo 11 astronauts never actually landed on the moon.
translation:
This so-called "documentary" tries to tell that USA feigned the moon landing. Year right.

All who have actually studied the case know otherwise.

Above all: there is definitely proof. When the astronauts were on the moon, they returned LOT of pounds of rock from the moon - for geological studies. These spread around the world in hundreds of labs testing them. And they all came to the conclusion that they came from the same planet, not from Earth: because the inner isotopes of the primitives are different from those on Earth, but similar to those calculated on the Moon. I.U. the conspiracy theorists never study anything: they only take what fits their theory and ignore the rest.

Another wrongful claim is that their wind was in the hangar where they shot the moon landing, IE The flag is moving. There is a logical explanation: The astronaut moved it with his hand, so he moved. And what does that prove? Well, if the conspiracy theorists were to study the footage at all, they would see that the flag NEVER moves after the astronaut has allowed it, I.E. the conspiracy theorists are bad scientists, they can not study a subject properly or just study it until they have what they have so that they can lie about it and profit (IE this so-called "documentary")).

There is an assertion that it was not possible to be filmed on the moon because all the shadows come from different places, because there are different sources of light, the artificial lighting from the studio. Once again, the conspiracy theorists are wrong (as always), the same would happen at night in a desert, without light sources. But I doubt that any conspiracy theorists ever kept a star trek convention outside of their grandmothers cellar for more than how many days.

The conspiracy theorists are in denial, big time. They only see what they want to see. They make all these lies out to be important - that's a fact.

summary: Two unemployed actors flee the drudgery of Glasgow for the fame promised by Hollywood and Las Vegas.
translation:
It was Jon Pertwee who said, "It's very difficult to be funny, but very easy to be silly." Well, if that is the case PASTY FACES is "very easy". David Baker (as director / screenwriter) and his cast seem to have the impression that comedies steal scenes and style from superior Britcoms such as LOCK STOCK .. and TRAINSPOTTING, using a completely underdeveloped screenplay and talking very fast up and down voice very loud. Alan McCaffrey suffers particularly from this kind of OTT performance, but not enough to ruin the movie because there is not enough to ruin from a movie.

PASTY FACES is terrible on all fronts, especially in the script. I could not understand why it ended the way it was, it just seemed to stop in an abrupt and stupid way. Oh and other glaring mistakes are that you need a visa to visit the US, and a green card to work there - this movie would make you believe that you can get off a plane without a permit is still going to be paid for it Donate blood in America - People I know in America and who donate blood tell me that donations have been stopped a few years ago - and that you can buy any kind of weapons from a gun shop. As far as I know, gun laws in America are different from state to state, but no arms shops sell anti-tank weapons over the counter. So we have a very wrong view of America from a very unreal and oh so naughty movie. Maybe revenge for BRAVEHEART is a very Hollywood view of the Scots? Maybe, but that does not stop PASTY FACES from being a crap comedy

summary: Pete Thompson thinks he has it all. However, following the death of his father his close friend and accountant reveals the company he has been left is bust and the only way out is to do business with the Russian mafia. His life and heart are on the line when he leave to restore the fortunes of the family firm.
translation: How can you bring together this respectable cast of young British actors and come up with such a bunch of movie stuff? Terrible writing, annoying hectic camera, terribly edited, acted cruelly badly. Only Rhys Ifans tries to fill his role with life. Another painful proof that "different" sometimes equals "dirt". Why do not the money people read the scripts before? Do yourself a favor: protect yourself and do something else - like beating a mallet on your knees. It's less painful and funnier than this movie!

summary: International terrorists are terrified when their hijacked cargo turns out to be genetically engineered dinosaurs. Now... the army commando team attempting recovery of this secret cargo is about to make the same deadly discovery!
translation: I do not know where to start; Acting, special effects and writing are about as bad as you can imagine. I can not believe that the production staff reached a point where they said, "Our work is done, time for publication". I'm just glad that the first two in the series never made it to the UK. I would actually recommend watching this movie just so you know how well most movies are made. I do not know how the other IMDb users could find it frightening when the "terrifying" dinosaurs waddle down corridors with swirling gum arms.

summary: Bored with her marriage to burnt out poet turned corporate executive Thierry, Zandalee falls prey to an old friend of her husband, the manipulative and egotistical Johhny and becomes enmeshed in a sensual, passionate and destructive affair. But it isn't only the flames of their erotic affair that are fanned by the steamy heat of the deep New Orleans nights; hatred, desire and revenge stalk the lovers' with a relentless precision, and for Zandalee, the moment of truth arrives with a terrifying finality.
translation: There's a reason why this went straight to the video - the story is tough, Nick Cage plays Johnny in a sordid way - sex in churches and other scenes bordering tasteless boundaries (like the scene in the laundry room) are good for this movie. Judge Reinhold as Cuckold is okay - but the movie itself with its themes of degradation and revenge is not well done. But it's a good movie for trivia competitions - because so few people have seen it.

summary: A documentary on the rivalry between two rock bands. On one hand we have The Dandy Warhols, and its leader Courtney Taylor-Taylor, and on the other The Brian Jonestown Massacre, lead by Anton Newcombe. They used to be close friends but their differing lifestyles and ambitions, especially that of Anton Newcombe, have forced them apart, to the point of being enemies.
translation:
A documentary about two rock bands spanning several years. Brian Jonestown Massacre and the Dandy Warhols. What makes it special is the confrontation with the complex contrasting personalities and the ironies of success and failure.

Anton Newcombe, the lead actor of Brian Jonestown Massacre, is not only regarded by him as a musical genius colleague, his friends and rivals the dandy Warhols, but also record producers and most of the people who have worked with him , Unfortunately, he and his bandmates are also unable to integrate into the real world. Newcombe selects fights with band members on stage or with members of the audience (arrested at one point because he literally enters a fan's head). Newcombe knows no boundaries? he plays between 40 and 100 different instruments, writes and produces all BJM music, can produce enough songs to fill an entire album in a single day, has a prophetic obsession with his own musical genius, but is also a strong drug user, At the slightest compromise of his own artistic integrity, he rages, commands his band members as if they were lesser forms of life, and can ruin business as quickly as he does. BJM go through a large number of record labels in quick succession? They register them as soon as they recognize Newcombe's talents and release them as soon as they realize he is completely uncontrollable.

The Warhols acknowledge their guilt in Newcombe's creativity and do not even put themselves in the world like lofty sphere of greatness? but the Warhols have something that BJM does not do? the ability to connect their talents with common sense, the real world and their marketplace? as a mix of talent (though much of it is distilled by guru newcombe) and accessibility, they are the real definition of "cool." Dig! follows the parallel careers of both bands with increasing sharpness. At one point, Newcombe stunts designed to generate publicity send seeming death threats and hate messages to the Warhols (in a box containing live ammunition and insults like a bar of soap to clean up their act)? He only forgets to tell them that it is a trick and they become so paranoid that they issue a restraining order against Newcombe. By the time the Dandy Warhols in Europe start with hits like "Every day should be a holiday" and "Bohemian like you", Newcombe is becoming more and more isolated. BJM are stopped and the band collapses when arrested for possession of marijuana? The Warhols are killed at about the same time because of drugs, released with a warning, and even allowed to keep the grass.

The broad appeal of DiG! is that the genius versus accessibility lessons go way beyond two bands or even rock music. The downside is that it's still a documentary, even if it's intimate, and it will mostly appeal only to dedicated movie fans or people who are already interested in the music of one or both of the bands listed. Newcombe may be a largely unrecognized genius, and in the film there is a glimpse of it, but for the untouched ear there is little more than the claims of the interviewees confirming that. In the words of one of the band members: "In every spiritual tradition you burn in hell because you pretend to be God and unable to support it." Newcombe does not do that? but in numbers there may still not be enough people to appreciate him in his own life, and DiG! Englisch: www.germnews.com/archive/

summary: A salaryman, a drug addict and a yakuza go on a breathless three man chase through the streets of Tokyo, each for a different reason and fighting demons.
translation: I saw this movie tonight after renting it to Blockbuster (VHS). I have to agree that it is wildly original. Yes, maybe the characters were not fully realized, but it's not one of those movies. Rather, we are confronted with the director's gaze, with his vision of what history is about. And it does not stop. And to be honest, I did not want it. I think Sabu must have been directing "Lock, Stock & Two Smoking Barrels" and "Run, Lola, Run". But I loved the way the three leaders SEE the beautiful woman in the street to distract her for a moment. I absolutely have to see the director's work, because this film really fascinated me. If you want insight, culture, storm and urge, go somewhere else. If you want a laugh, camera movement and criminal glee, look here.

summary: A high school outcast who lives in a trailer with his mother finally meets a friend. He wants to ask her if they can go the next step, but then sees her kissing another boy at a party. He runs home only to find his mother having sex with a drunk. He starts yelling, but is countered by the drunk when he suffocates him and makes him look like he hung himself. The scarecrow comes in when the boy's soul is pushed into it. He goes out for revenge.
translation:
I really want to give this movie a 10 ... I really do. Some movies, especially horror movies, are so cheap that they are good. A witty ninja scarecrow that can use corn on the cob as lethal weapons definitely fits this "budget to brilliance" system. The depth of the movie is definitely its strength and the twists and turns that it performs keep the audience on the edge of their seats really driving the creepy ... ninja ... puberty affected ... thirty years ago student ... Non-Cowboy Drawing ... Wise-Cracking ... the son of a bitch scarecrow into the limelight as the scariest horror icon of the year. All I can really say is, "Can you dig it out?" And I recommend watching movies like Frankenfish if you enjoy this hilarious horror.

(WHAT DO YOU HAVE TO SMOKE?! '

summary: The Hennessy clan -- mother Cate, daughters Bridget and Kerry, and son Rory -- look to one another for guidance and support after the death of Paul, the family patriarch. Cate's parents lend a hand.
translation:
This show was great, it was not just for kids I first thought it was for the whole family.

The first season was mainly about the dad taking care of two daughters and son, unfortunately he died in season 2, I could believe it when I heard it.

I'm disguised that they have gone on with the show as what would really happen in real life and I have to mention the Goodbye episode it was so well done, it had to be so hard for them To film this, one could say that there were real tears in her eyes. I'm a 24-year-old man and this episode made me cry because I know how they felt when my dad died when I was 13, just like Roy.

Season 2 and Season 3 had great comedy Season 3 also had some of my favorites like Freaky Friday, Secrets. I still think that the show was strong enough to keep going, I was disappointed that it ended, it was one of the best was the best family comedy show since Home Improvement and it would have been the next friends can be.

It should never have ended, but still loves to watch the repetitions every day.

summary: An animated documentary about blood and the circulatory system. It was one of a series on bodily systems.
translation:
A film by Frank Capra WONDERS OF LIFE.

The blood that pumps through our veins is the responsibility of the diligent HEMO THE Magnificent.

In the mid-1950s, AT & T and Bell Science teamed up with the famous Hollywood director Frank Capra to produce a series of CBS television science films to the public about the universe to enlighten them around. Far from the dreary black-and-white food so often forced upon young scholars, Capra's films would be taught and entertained with vivid scripts as well as eye-catching images shown in Technicolor. The four films - OUR MR. SUN (1956), THE INCREDIBLE COSMIC RAY (1957), HEMO THE GORGEOUS (1957), THE UNFORGETTABLE GODDESS (1958) quickly became schoolhouse favorites, where they were shown endless in 16mm format.


THE HEMO Magnificent, which was produced, written and directed by Capra, tells the story of the human heart and blood circulation system, with animation and gentle humor. Movie star Richard Carlson appears as the Fiction Writer and helps Dr. Baxter is busy telling Hemo's story.

Filmmakers will recognize Sterling Holloway as part of the television production crew and the voices of Marvin Miller, Mel Blanc, June Foray & Pinto Colvig as various cartoon characters, all uncredited.

The devotional writing that begins the film is fully in tune with the tone and tone of the production.

summary: John Holmes was a legend of the porn industry and revered in circles as a stud. But in 1981, years after his successful career and star fading, Holmes was a desperate man with his own internal demons to live up to. He's estranged from his wife, holding onto a relationship with his teenage mistress, and living as a junkie in search of his next fix. But one fateful night left four people dead and John as a key suspect in one of the most grisly murders in Los Angeles. Was he partly responsible for what happened at Wonderland Avenue?
translation:
Just watched this movie on DVD and thought that the show was very good, but the whole story left a lot to be desired. This movie has the same texture and look of panic in Needle Park or Drugstore Cowboy. Hard to believe that people can live this kind of lifestyle; on the bottom of society, where their total existence is based on hardcore drug use, crime, violence, sex and a total lack of self-esteem for anyone or anything, including themselves.

Val Kilmore is outstanding in his role as "burned out" former porn star John Holmes. The supporting cast is just as good. However, this is a dark, dark, disturbing and depressing film. The murder was brutal, but the daily life of these people was brutal. Unless you are not interested in these killings or have been a "fan" of John Holmes, this is really not a movie to watch. If you want to see a documentary drama about murder, Truman Capote's 1960s In Cold Blood with Scott Wilson and Robert Blake is much better.

summary: The film carefully examines the divisive nature of politics in an overwhelmingly conservative mid-western community. In September 2004, the student body representatives of Utah Valley State College invited controversial filmmaker Michael Moore to speak on campus two weeks before the Presidential election. An unanticipated uproar from the students and community ensued. Moore protestors claimed university funds should not pay for Moore's visit, while those in support of Moore fought to defend free speech. A community once considered politically passive was stirred to action, and the conflict played out in the media and several public forums. Those opposed to Moore's visit, in an effort to have the invitation rescinded, resorted to death threats, petitions, law suits, and bribery. Moore supporters, living in the high concentrate of Mormon conservatism, struggled to be heard, to defend new ideas, and to keep plans for his visit on track. Steven Greenstreet, the film's director, tracks the...
translation:
The film's author, Steven Greenstreet, obviously not only adores Michael Moore, but also follows in his footsteps using some of Moore's propaganda tactics. Moore has the expertise to distract the viewer from this focus, while Greenstreet is obviously less qualified here.

Since I was privy to all matters relating to Moore's speech at UVSC, I was disappointed that it was the major complaints of the community - that Moore was paid $ 40,000 of Utah's education allowance to John Kerry Promoting the campaign and promoting his own liberal film - were pushed into the background by Greenstreet, while minor problems were sensationalized. The marketing methods for this video were equally biased and reprehensible ... promoting the film with the claim that "Mormon is trying to kill Moore". This is not only absurd but also slanders an important religion with which Greenstreet obviously has some personal problems. I followed Moore's visit very closely, and all the major news agencies found Moore's visit came and went away with no credible security issues or incidents in Utah.

Greenstreet has put on this film to start its film career to the point that he even left the film school to accelerate that. However, this seems to have been a grave miscalculation, as Moore's visits to approximately 60 other colleges and universities across the country in 2004 diluted interest in this more common event. Greenstreet's assumption that the American public would be interested in this film because of the promoted religious and conservative perspectives does not seem to be well founded.

The name of the movie, This Divided State, is a bit of a misnomer since Utah overwhelmingly voted in favor of Bush's re-election, and thus seems to be more politically consistent than any other state. The division into the movie title seems more likely to point to the divide that exists in Greenstreets ideological differences with its religion and its state. If anything, I find a humorous connection between the religious aspect of this supposed documentary and Woody Allen's hilarious claims in Sleeper (1973): "I was beaten up by Quakers."

summary: After a terrible day, two good friends and housemates find the outside world converted into a featureless and empty white void.
translation:
I saw that as part of my course at Aberystwyth University, and it amazes me that there is no distributor in the UK. Well, not really, because this movie is everything that a Hollywood movie is not - original, creative, bizarre and humorous. It seems that nobody today really wants to see this kind of movie because in the simplest sense it does not conform to the generic conventions that most young viewers look for in a movie.

I haven I have not written a review for the IMDb for a long time, but I wanted to mention this movie, even though it's between classes during my 30-minute break! Essentially, it's not about anything because the two main characters are overthrown by a hate of the world in their own world of nothingness. The brilliance here is how the director arouses interest throughout most of the run with just two characters and when the only staging is half a house and a huge white, empty space. This is largely due to the outstanding achievements of the actors, both of whom are very laughing and at the same time can give their roles a great emotional depth.

I would love to write something more, but I'm pretty timed. But I encourage everyone and everyone to give this film a try. A very unique concept is brought to the screen in a coherent and well-executed way, with the combination of good performances, a strong script, nice sound design and (pretty) impressive visuals that make a very entertaining movie.

It's just a shame that only few people know ...

summary: In the 60's, the Puerto Rican Carlito Brigante, the Afro-American Earl and the Italian Rocco become best friends while in prison. When they are released, Rocco intermediates a heroin business with a family of the Italian Mafia leaded by Artie Badalato Sr. Carlito negotiates with the lord Leroy "Hollywood Nicky" Barnes the area where the trio could operate in his neighborhood and sooner the three friends become powerful. Later, Carlito dates and has an affair with the beautiful Leticia. When Earl decides to move to Barbados with his girlfriend and leave the heroin business, his stupid younger brother causes a situation with the Italian mobsters, and Carlito and Rocco have to resolve the mess to save their lives.
translation:
This movie had potential and I was ready to give it a try, but there are so many timeline issues that are so obvious - it's hard to swallow how such an idiot handles it.

Rise to Power is in the late sixties. Carlito's Way plays in the mid to late seventies. For this film to be realistic, it would have to be filmed in the fifties, if not in the late forties.

Rise to Power has no trace of Gail (Pennelope Ann Miller), no trace of Kleinfeld, no sign of Rolando, with whom Carlito allegedly converged in his "hey-day". None of the main characters in the original movie was in this movie. We should believe that Carlito has met all these people in a few years.

Rise to Power ends with Carlito walking along the beach, talking about retiring to Paradise, what he wanted to do in the original movie. The Pre-Quel also creates the Rocco and Earl characters - what should happen to them, since they are clearly not on Carlito's way? It is also difficult to understand how Carlito could have had the relationship with the Italians he has in the original film about the events of Rise to Power. Where are the Taglialucci's in this movie? The two films are probably seven years old and he spends five of them in jail. It's like trying to put a square plug into a round hole.

It's obvious that no one was interested in telling a good story and that they were more interested in making a few bucks by making an average gangster movie and throwing a character called Carlito Brigante into the story. The movie had some good moments, but I think they would have been better off leaving this film alone, rather than trying to make it a pre-history of Carlito's Way.

If you feel determined to watch this movie The only advice I can give is not to consider the movie as a linear pre-quel. Remember how the Spaghetti Western with Clint Eastwood man without a name, in other words two films that have the same character, but not necessarily connected.

summary: The Cahulawassee River valley in Northern Georgia is one of the last natural pristine areas of the state, which will soon change with the imminent building of a dam on the river, which in turn will flood much of the surrounding land. As such, four Atlanta city slickers, alpha male Lewis Medlock, generally even-keeled Ed Gentry, slightly condescending Bobby Trippe, and wide-eyed Drew Ballinger, decide to take a multi-day canoe trip on the river, with only Lewis and Ed having experience in outdoor life. They know going in that the area is ethno-culturally homogeneous and isolated, but don't understand the full extent of such until they arrive and see what they believe is the result of generations of inbreeding. Their relatively peaceful trip takes a turn for the worse when half way through they encounter a couple of hillbilly moonshiners. That encounter not only makes the four battle their way out of the valley intact and alive, but threatens the relationships of the four as they do, ...
translation:
I remember watching this movie a few years ago on television and not paying full attention, maybe even missing the first half, so I decided it was boring and overrated. I decided to visit it again last night to see if I had missed anything the first time. I certainly did. This is one of the most disturbing and amazing films of all time, and it has clearly had a lot of impact on movies today and probably forever. I can not believe that I thought this movie would be boring!

A young Jon Voight and Burt Reynolds are performing their careers and are supported by Ned Beatty and Ronny Cox. This story will leave you with a sense of disgust and fear long after you've seen it, it's really horrifying. Oh, and did I mention that the title song is great, too? Well, it is, and this movie should be seen everywhere by movie fans.

Everyone should see this movie for the experience. Do not expect a picnic.

summary: Peter Weston is engaged to Vanessa Colebrook, the daughter of a wealthy businessman. On a journey home on a steamer he meets an old sea hand who shares with him how his wife won't let him keep his pet Daisy anymore. Weston offers him a kind ear and the sailor takes him for a kind man. When Weston wakes up later in the journey he finds that the sailor has left Daisy in his care. The problem is that Daisy is a middle sized alligator. Whilst trying to throw the beast overboard, he meets Moira who helps him out. He is desperate to see her again and uses the alligator as an excuse.
translation: A 1957 (yes, that's the right date) J. Arthur Rank Production with James Robertson Justice, Margaret Rutherford, Wilfred Hyde White; it has to be a smash comedy, right? Oh, it's just awful. It's a one-gag movie: seeing people shocked at the sight of a small alligator. Music is thrown in the most inappropriate and forgetful way. Jeannie Carson is a lively dancer and competent singer. But what did she do in this movie? Diana Dors is also here and offers such daring shots for the preview. Her acting level is not bad, but she's in the movie to teach someone. Well, you have to do something besides moaning during this movie. The movie is now being sold by people on e-bay on VHS. Save yourself the cost and waste of time. A comedy without laughter. A musical without a memorable song or an unforgettable dance.

summary: Kevin Chan (aka Jackie) is a Hong-Kong cop, who scores his first big hit by virtually single-handedly capturing and arresting a big drug- lord. Of course, the drug-lord isn't too happy about this, and frames Kevin with the murder of another cop (who happened to be on the take). Kevin has to clear his name, whilst keeping himself from getting killed or arrested, and keeping his girlfriend from leaving him.
translation:
Police history brought Hong Kong films to modern cinema.

Jackie plays a policeman who tries to catch some drug traffickers while looking after a young woman from the bad guys and still watches his relationship with his girlfriend Selina (Brigitte Lin).

The film offers many stunts, not only from Jackie, but also from other actors (who are now in Jackie's stunt club). >
Three of Jackie's stunt members went to the hospital while filming the film.

The film also has some incredible fight scenes like "The Parking Lot Battle" and "The Shopping Battle" ranked as one of Jackie's best.

The film also won Jackie Chan Best Picture and Best Action Design Award at the Hong Kong Film Awards.

Anyone who loves Jackie Chan and / or martial arts films will see this

summary: When dad BUDDY and mom MOLLY are dognapped, their five adorable pups, the AIR BUDDIES, must save the day...

summary: The story of the FBI unfolds through the eyes of one of its agents. During his career he investigates gangsters, swindlers, the klu klux klan, Nazi agents and cold war spies.
translation: The story of the FBI, as told by Agent Stewart about flashbacks, is intertwined with his personal life story. Stewart and Miles (as his wife) are pretty good, as is Hamilton as a serious agent. The problem is that the episodic nature of the story makes it difficult to get involved. It's like watching a dozen different films bit by bit as we take a look at a gangster commercial. Some of the episodes are too long, some too short, and some just look out of place (Stewart's Daughter School). Overall, it is far too long. Nevertheless, it is worth a look for its beautiful production values.

summary: A businessman becomes the target for a ruthless criminal who mistakes him for the thief who stole his drug money.
translation: There was something here about the female lead that had this perfect life she always wanted after the worst of life, starting as a child prostitute and dating Eric Roberts. But her background makes it impossible for her to trust Dean Cain, and that destroys it in the end. It sounds weird, but I like the position in which Dean Cain was at the end and the choice he made. He can not hurt her because he loves her and she is the mother of his child (I think the timeframe makes it clear that it is his child and not his brother), but at the same time he can not forgive her for everything she did has to sleep with his brother (which shows the love and commitment he felt was kind of like) and then to be part of his death. summary: Sidney Stratton, a humble inventor, develops a fabric which never gets dirty or wears out. This would seem to be a boon for mankind, but the established garment manufacturers don't see it that way; they try to suppress it.
translation:
Often referred to as comedy, the man in the white suit is far more than just a giggle.

Sidney Stratton is an eccentric inventor who does not get the chance to flourish his inventions The world, because nobody Noticing him, he's just one or the other odd job man about the place so to speak. After making his way into Birnley's textile mill, he uses his lab to invent his goal of inventing a fabric that not only never wears away, but never has to be cleaned! He is first declared a genius, and those who ignored him at first suddenly want a big chunk of him, but then the gloomy harbingers of an industry that is breaking up will sit up and quickly turn to something much scarier.

Frankly, I can not go wrong in this movie, the script by Roger MacDougall, John Dighton and director Alex Mackendrick could be filmed today and would not be so out of place is the sharpness and thought of the mind that it is Has. The sound and setting are huge, the direction is seamless, and the sound shift is cleverly handled by Mackendrick. Some of the scenes are just wonderful, one attracts the heartbands and recalls a certain scene in David Lynch's Elephant Man about 29 years later, and after such a downturn of events, the movie still manages to take a wink as the genius, that Alec Guinness closes the film, not just to give viewers the future of Stanley, but the rest of us in this fast-moving world.

A timeless masterpiece, thematically and as a work of art, 10/10.

summary: Micheal, a former test subject of a project to create supersoldiers, is forced to escape with his comrades after the project was cancelled. Months later, he is trying to have a quiet life as a librarian with a tough cop as his best friend. However, a string of vicious gangland murders begins that has all the markings of his former compatriots who seem to have turned to violent crime. Realizing that the police are helpless to fight these soldiers, Micheal decides to take them on himself. Donning a mask to protect his identity, Micheal must fight these powerful villians as the mysterious superhero known only as Black Mask.
translation: "Hak Hap" or "Black Mask" (in English) was a disappointment. I was told that it was a kind of "Japanese version of the Matrix". Imagine my disappointment. The film was either badly synchronized or the soundtrack did not fit well with the movie. Another thing is that the dialogue was pretty bad. In the English version of this film, very little thought and only the genre "senseless action" addressed. No movie I want to see again.

summary: It is the year 2029: Astronaut Leo Davidson boards a pod cruiser on a Space Station for a "routine" reconnaissance mission. But an abrupt detour through a space time wormhole lands him on a strange planet where talking apes rule over the human race. With the help of a sympathetic chimpanzee activist named Ari and a small band of human rebels, Leo leads the effort to evade the advancing Gorilla Army led by General Thade and his most trusted warrior Attar. Now the race is on to reach a sacred temple within the planet's Forbidden Zone to discover the shocking secrets of mankind's past - and the key to its future.
translation: This is a bit of a first for me, the first time I've ever been disappointed in a Tim Burton movie. POTA is not a bad movie (great sets, costumes and some great performances), but it could have been made by any Hollywood director. The pace was very strange, the last third was only used to wait for the film of me and the cast came to an end. Tim Roth was excellent, probably the only pleasure in the movie. Come back Tim.

summary: Santa Claus, high above the North Pole in his cloud-borne castle equipped with more surveillance devices than the Impossible Mission Force, prepares to deliver presents on Christmas night. Santa is especially interested in helping Lupita, the daughter of a poor family who wants nothing more than a doll; and a young boy whose parents are so wealthy they never spend any time with him (Santa fixes this by feeding them Pan-Galactic Gargle Blasters). However, the Devil will have none of this and sends his minion, Pitch, to foil Santa's plans. Pitch in turn recruits three Naughty Boys to help him set traps for Santa.
translation:
The NSA, CIA, FBI, FSB, and all the other snoop agencies around the world should watch this movie for information on spying on people. (As MST3k comment puts it ... "Sanata does not give a damn! Santa's Tentacles reach far and wide! There are no hiding places from the Klaus organization")

From telescopes that can make millions of espionage Miles to ears that can hear everything. It's amazing that the CIA does not have Santa Claus on the payroll.

Satan's dance routine is hilarious. Pitch ... he is so useless.

The cheese factor in this movie is enormous. Very low budget, but so fun to see. I recommend the Mystery Science Theater 3000 version for even more laughs.

They even laugh about the bad luck of the good children.

I give this a 1 for the production quality and a 10 for pure cheese and fun factor.

summary: India - a Nation obsessed with cricket - and it is not very often one comes across anyone who loathes cricket as much as farmer Anwar Khan, who feels that it is a waste of time watching some grown men playing, not only getting paid, but costing the nation millions of lost work hours. His family, especially his wife, Saida, does not quite agree with him. As a matter of fact, she broke water when watching a cricket match with a TV set perched on a branch of a tree with almost the entire village in attendance. This is how Iqbal was born, followed by the birth of his sister, Khadija. Iqbal, though deaf and dumb, shared his mother's and sister's passion for cricket, he would tend to the buffaloes, who though all female, had been named after male cricketers, including Kapil Dev. While tending to them, he would stop and watch youngsters being trained by the renowned Guruji. When Guruji finds out about Iqbal's interest in the game, he recruits him, but lets him go when a dispute flares up ...
translation:
Everyone just seems to rave about the subject and not really notice how the movie was made. The deaf, dumb guy is fine, the underdog wins - that's good, the cricket aspect is great, but the movie is overall average. I think it could be done much better than it is.

The plot is too predictable for a movie that is not based on a real event. I'm sure the movie could have been more interesting. The songs are just stuffed in there, and I literally had to relay the scenes that showed the same thing from different angles.

Good acting. Monitored.

summary: When the daughter Emma of the technical writer Allen Pyke and the photographer Julie is found slashed in the throat and wrists in their locked apartment, the couple decides to move to an isolated cabin in the mountains in Kingspike. Julie is very depressed and blames Allen for the death of Emma. Once in the new home, Julie sees the spirit of Emma in a photo she took in a nearby abandoned prison and she becomes obsessed shooting pictures of poltergeists. Allen is advised to move from the place by the local Jim Payne, and on May 21st, Allen finds that the former dwellers of the cabin have committed suicide, and he investigates the death in the spot and finds that many people died around May 22nd. He decides to move with Julie to a hotel, but she does not want to give up on Emma.
translation: With all the hype about this movie, I was open to what I would ultimately think. And although the first 90% of the movie is sometimes a bit slow, they are pretty good, with more than a few "old" horrors that make you nervous and restless. I actually thought that cinematography was excellent in many of these scenes. Where Dark Remains fails, however, is at its peak. The end of the film and the dissolution are seemingly MILES APART of his body. The storyline falls on her face with an illogical conclusion and the answer I was most looking for - what really happened to Emma? - was not informed! The justification for the negative energy was ridiculous at best, and in the end I felt very cheated. What could be a great horror movie was ultimately hounded to a terrible end.

summary: An intended rape victim manages to escape from her attacker but leaves her purse behind. Worried that he may visit her house and finish what he has started, she contacts the police but they are unable to help, saying that she has no proof. "If he calls, let us know and we'll send a man round!" A fat load of good that would be. Her worst fears are realised when, alone one day in the house, her attacker visits and attempts again to rape her. Circumstances allow her not only to resist the attack but to turn the tables and lock him away. And that is where her dilemma really starts. Does she release him and risk another attack? Does she go to the police and risk being called a liar? Or does she kill him - and become as low as him?
translation:
Kudos to Fawcett for taking roles that were considered controversial at the time. In my mind, rape in the 1980s was still a taboo subject, and women's rights and feelings were rarely studied so deeply during that time.

Fawcett is just a woman who is being followed, followed by actor James Russo. He is adequate as the obsessed psychopath, but sometimes a bit transparent.

Diana Scarwid has a small role, as does Alfre Woodard as a house mate. Woodard worries about the legal consequences if Fawcett, the rape victim, avenges the culprit. The scene where she throws a pan of hot oil at Russo is classic and as a rapist he deserves it. She then holds him in bondage, and the consequences must be confronted.

A very real story that reflects the emotions and rage of rape victims who have been physically and mentally injured. Highly recommended. 8.10.

summary: Portrait of an American innocent. In 1955, Bettie Page (1923-2008 ) waits to testify before a Senate subcommittee investigating the effects of pornographic material on American adolescents and juveniles. In flashbacks, we see her childhood in Tennessee, a brief marriage, a gang rape, and her going to New York City in 1949. There she takes acting lessons, models for photos, and acts in short films for adults, earning the nickname, "The Pin-Up Queen of the Universe." We see her relationship with merchants Irving and Paula Klaw, photographers John Willie and Bunny Yeager, boyfriends, and the public. Through it all, she is wholesome, sporting, and forthright - Eve before the fall.

summary: Lawyer Rick Magruder has a one-night-stand affair with caterer Mallory Doss. He becomes hooked on her, and when he learns her nut-case father Dixon is threatening her, he puts the weight of his law firm behind Mallory, has Dixon arrested and subpoenas her ex-husband Pete to testify against Dixon in court. Dixon is sent to an asylum, but escapes from there and the lives of many people are in danger.
translation: That was one of the worst movies I have ever seen. Branaugh seemed to have taken so much trouble remembering his accent that he could not deliver his lines. The plot was definitely not worth John Grisham's name. No wonder it was never published as a book or published in theaters. I did not even watch the whole thing.
