summary: Felix's (Jack Lemmon) wife has left him and he is contemplating suicide. His friends sense his depression and one of them, Oscar (Walter Matthau), volunteers to take him in until he is fine again. The two of them are like chalk and cheese - Oscar is fun-loving, gregarious and slovenly, Felix is a shy, stay-at-home, obsessive-compulsive neat-freak. Being around Oscar brightens Felix up, but he quickly starts to irritate Oscar.
translation: I have seen this movie many times and I like that all bad teachers want to give it ten out of ten, but I think it would be unfair to other good movies. But I think that this is one of those rare gems: a perfect comedy. I would dare one of the biggest comic films of all time. Matthau and Lemmon are perfectly coordinated and not coordinated. The script is so sharp that you have to stop the bleeding. The story is known and has been described in other comments. The two leads give extraordinary performances, the girls are great and the situations are funny side by side. Not a single curse in sight (mark Hollywood, you do not have to swear to be funny, you have to be funny) and the transition from stage to film is seamless. They do not do it that way anymore. Timeless.

summary: A secret Service agent and a news reporter investigate the conspiracy behind the assassination of the President.
translation:
I think it's possible I've seen worse movies, but this one is a real stinker! The plot is unremarkable, but that's not the worst. The direction is not nearly as expected from Andy Ching. He is able to do a good job, but he did not manage to pull this movie together.

Angie Harmon starred as a reporter urging the murder of the president and really slaughtered the role. there was no chemistry with the good, her behavior was flat and wooden, and the 5-inch stiletto he wore throughout the movie was absurd. This trip to Harmon places her at the bottom of the "b" list.

And what was the Cuba thinking? He has made a number of outstanding achievements in his honor, but that was far below what we expect from him.

Poor James Woods and Burt Reynolds. poor, poor, poor, poor

summary: A C.I.A. Agent and a geneticist battle to keep a deadly biological weapon from falling into the wrong hands, when the weapon's inventor is kidnapped.
translation:
Terrible acting, terrible cast and cheap props. Would have been much better if set as an action parody-style movie. What a waste. Based on the name of the movie.

"The Enemy" Naming it "Action Movie" could have done better. (contributes to the parody effect). The policeman looked like a 60-year-old player, and the blond girl always had the same empty, boring expression on her face. Towards the end of the film, he and she work together to eliminate the bad guys, and every time they exchange words, it feels like the cheap lines of a sex scene in a porno movie. Dreadful. Do not waste time.

summary: A well-known actor, who hasn't accepted a role in four years, is considering a project. The cousin of the director drives him to Archie's Ranch Market, in Carson, and drops him off to do a little research. He's fascinated by one of the checkers, Scarlet, a young woman from Spain with a preternatural ability to ring up items at the cash register. She hates her job, stuck at the 10 items or less lane. The actor chats her up, and when her shift ends, he asks for a ride. In the course of the afternoon, he helps her prepare for a job interview. She needs to have confidence, he needs to commit. Human contact, however brief, can change people.
translation:
This movie is really real and random. It's really hard to find movies in Hollywood. I really enjoy seeing this movie, I bought his DVD Tuesday this week and I watched it 4 times. I love Paz's spangling accent, it's just as cute as it is. And her acting and Morgans are so funny and natural.

My taste in film might really be different from others, but I have to say that I really love this movie, the simple is the best!

This film may be cheap in price, but its meaning is not at all cheap. I can rarely learn anything from movies, but that's an exception.

summary: Det. Sgt. Mark Dixon always wanted to be something his old man wasn't: a guy on the right side of the law. But for a good guy, he's awfully vicious. After several complaints over his roughing people up, his boss, Insp. Nicholas Foley, demotes him. Foley tells him he's a good man, but needs to get his head on straight and be more like Det. Lt. Thomas, who has just gotten a promotion. Meanwhile, Tommy Scalise has an illegal dice game going and is looking to make a sucker out of the rich Ted Morrison, who was brought in by Ken Paine and his beautiful wife Morgan. She figures out too late her husband is using her as a decoy. Paine strikes her when she refuses to play along. The chivalrous Morrison intervenes but Paine knocks him out cold. That seems to be the worst of it, but later it turns out the guy is dead; and Paine looks guilty. Soon Dixon has fallen in love with Morgan - but not before losing his temper again and committing a terrible deed that he tries to cover up. Morgan's father...
translation:
Director Otto Preminger meets with his Laura stars Dana Andrews and Gene Tierney in this raw movie Noir: Where The Sidewalk Ends. This movie is complete with a well-written detective story featuring interesting characters, unexpected twists and clever dialogues and an eye-catching look with great tracking shots and dark and gritty movie noir lighting. Dana Andrews plays detective Mark Dixon, a partial grower and a partial cop, who has a reputation for being too criminal. After a case Dixon looks for suspects and answers, he gets involved much more than he wanted.

Dana Andrews is terrific in his role - tough and edgy, Andrews' Dixon is ready to put everyone off track when they get on his bad side. He's the perfect anti-hero movie noir - he's not always very nice, but we're still rusting for him. Gene Tierney does a solid job in her role as she is, a sweet shoulder for Dixon. There may not be much left for Tierney's role, but she certainly goes far beyond what others might do with the role and pushes out every member of the audience with her friendly smile, her gentle manner, and her sparkling eye. The supporting cast are also not bad - Karl Malden is the most memorable, enters and gives as Lieutenant Thomas a good side presentation. Where The Sidewalk Ends is not Laura, but it's a great movie noir with great characters, stories and pictures.

summary: Sexy, romantic comedy about a girl in her early 20s named Violet Sanford going to NYC to pursue a dream of becoming a songwriter. Violet gets a "day" job as a bar maid at a nightclub called Coyote Ugly. Coyote Ugly is the city's newest hot spot where the employees are a team of sexy, resourceful women that provoke the clientele and press with their mischief.
translation:
What a disappointment! Piper Perabo is adorable, Tyra Banks is beautiful, but pitiful as an actor, and the talented and beautiful Maria Bello is wasted! Bello must have been embarrassed by some lines! The storyline, script and premise is a joke!

I'm not against silly movies, I think something about Mary is a masterpiece, but Coyote Ugly is a waste of 90 minutes ..... ...

summary: A nurse apprentice, who had a bad day at work, meets a computer programmer at a car garage. The man is urged to go somewhere, but his car is not ready yet, so the nurse offers him a ride. Before leaving the man, they pick up the nurse's baby nephew. Once on the street, they almost run over a young man. Not knowing if he is hurt, they pick up the man too. But the worst luck begins when the car brakes break down.
translation: I thought it was pretty interesting, my social studies / language teacher was the police chief who held the microphone on the water barrel = D I was excited my teacher is in some commercials he was in a gas / coffee / phone / play station commercial it nice Seeing him on TV He was also hating Chris on every one except he always made the small part of la la Why do we need 10 lines right That's so stupid -_- I think I'm done no matter, I'm still not done What is that a joke? Why do we have to go all the way to the tenth place ... really, what's the point? i'm just getting random words for now -_- maple history is fun i love my friends

summary: The saga of three British soldiers and their German captive as they trek through the European countryside.
translation:
I was fortunate enough to get a DVD copy of this movie recently and have now seen it for the second time. The first time I was in Australia late in the evening was more than 20 years ago, but I could never forget this strange and dark movie.

Not many people like this movie because it is so unconventional. The fact is that there is hardly any spoken dialogue this turn - we only hear the thoughts of the characters - is just an unconventional aspect of it.

Looking for a copy of this movie I found out that the producer was dead, the lead actor was dead, he was not kept in a British television or film archive, he was never on video or DVD released, television stations around the world destroyed him after their copyright expired in the '80s. When it first appeared on television in Australia, there were no writable devices for consumers.

On the second visit I could see why it was unforgettable. Sometimes it is very tense and unbearably claustrophobic like a Harold Pinter stage play.

If someone wants to have a DVD copy of it, please email me and I'm sure we can work something out. Greetings Adam (whiteflokati@hotmail.com)

summary: George is a high-strung professional photographer who is starting to unravel from the stress of his work with a Manhattan advertising agency. Needing some time away from the city, Jake, his wife Kim, and their son Miles head to upstate New York to take in the winter sights, though the drive up is hardly relaxing for any of them. George accidentally hits and severely injures a deer that ran onto the icy road; after George stops to inspect the damage, he's confronted by an angry local named Otis who flies into a rage, telling George that he and his fellow hunters had been tracking the deer for some time. An argument breaks out, which leaves George feeling deeply shaken. When George and Kim arrive at their cabin, they discover that it's next door to Otis' property, and they soon find that a dark and intimidating presence seems to have taken over the cottage. Since, when they stopped at a store en route to the cabin, a shopkeeper told Miles about the legend of the Wendigo, a beast from ...
translation:
If you want to know the true story of Wendigo, I suggest you make a copy of Algernon Blackwell's original story. Not only was this movie bad, it had nothing to do with the book.

I loved the book when I read it as a kid (in "Campfire Chillers" by EM Freeman) and was so excited to see a film based on it comes out. I was so disappointed when I finally saw it. Another thing is that throughout the movie there were too many PC (Politically Correct) undertones that had no place in the movie. When the book was written, the PC did not exist yet.

My suggestion is, do not waste time or money !! If you see it on the video library shelf, LEAVE IT THERE.

summary: At an annual pace, a huge colony of ants is forced to collect every piece of food that grows on their island for a group of menacing grasshoppers. But that all changes when a misfit inventor ant named Flik accidentally knocks over the offering pile thus forcing the grasshoppers' devious leader Hopper to force the ants to redo their gathering of food. Despite the fact that his friends don't believe him and desperate to help save the colony, Flik volunteers to go out into the world and search for a group of 'warrior' bugs. Instead, what he got was a talented group of circus performers. But when the grasshoppers return and take control of the island, Flik must prove himself a true hero before it's too late.
translation: A must for all - if you need to borrow your neighbor to see this. Easily one of the best animations / cartoons released in a long time. It has brought the films Antz to a whole new level. Do not confuse the two as the same movie - although the movie act is basically similar. Just go and enjoy.

summary: FBI agent Wesley Doyle is startled by the declaration of youngster Fenton Meiks about how his father's delusions required him and his brother, Adam to become his 'demon-slaying' murder accomplices. But when Doyle accepts to be shown concealed victim graves, the plot twists in the present just as gruesome.
translation:
The film is very complete in what it is, keeps you constantly interested in flashbacks to childhood and grows up with such a bizarre father and mixes it with the tails of serial killing, you just can not go wrong. The plot itself, the story and essence of the movie, is entertaining. It's the kind of story the director (Bill Paxton) was able to do so much, and in that case, he really did a lot of it.

From beginning to end you expect more and more about what happens and where the movie goes, and the creativity behind this story is first-rate. I felt like this movie was done well from start to finish, and one of those rare jewels that seemed boring lulls - the action went neat, fast, and tight from one scene to the next.

It shows how far people can go to do such terrible things to their loved ones and do such acts of evil in the name of the "God" when they are disappointed as in this case. It is also sometimes interesting in its' twists and takes on the concept of morality as a whole.

Overall, this is the kind of movie that's easy to miss, but I would advise you not to do that and to watch this movie - it's well worth your time.

summary: Originally broadcast by KCET (PBS) on their dramatic showcase series, "Visions," this sweet, quiet film is set during World War I. It is the story of Amy, a proper, but lonely housewife whose husband is away at war. She finds solace in a friendship with a more worldly female photographer, only to have her entire world turned upside down when the friendship becomes genuine love and she is forced to choose. Groundbreaking for its powerful yet non-prurient portrayal of lesbian first love.
translation: In 1976 I had just moved from Ceylon to the USA. I was 23 and had been married for a little over three years and started appearing lesbian. I saw this movie on an old black and white TV, with terrible reception, alone and uninterrupted, in an awakening that seemed like an echo of history. i lived in a small house in tucson arizona, and it was summertime ... like everyone else here, i never forgot the feelings that created the images of this story and their remnants of fragile magic, and i admired a hope for that I would see it again someday. I will always check in again. I also wish someone would make a film of Shirley Verel "the other side of Venus". It also has some of the same delicacy and persistent sharpness ...

summary: When David Sinclair, a popular and talented high school student commits suicide, his best friend Chris takes over many of his responsibilities; from the school production of "H.M.S. Pinafore", to caring for his family, and soon finds himself under the same pressures.
translation:
I recorded this video after reading the text on the box, the story seemed to be good and it had Keanu Reeves! But after 5 minutes I saw how awful his acting was, he walks and talks so stupid all the time, it's wrong and not convincing. It does not end there, almost ALL characters act so badly that it's ridiculous, the only acceptable play was by Alan Boyce (David), but the guy commits suicide early and you do not see him again, you never know why he did it ! Everything about this movie screams of poor quality, I can not believe how such a thing will be released! I was often tempted to stop, in fact, halfway I decided to stop and turned off the thing, came to the IMDB to check what others think about it, I found no comments (not surprised), So I decided to myself to force it to cope with the pain and go back to finish it, then I come here to comment on it. The only good thing (for me) was the high school rock band theme, the occasional guitar playing and the singing of parts, but that's not worth it.

Very bad acting and directing ... Terrible movie.

summary: Nina, an end-of-teenage orphan with mental problems, starts a new job as a garden cleaner when she meets Toni. They fell in love with each other, but soon Toni starts betraying Nina. In the meantime, Francoise is picked up at a psychic department of a Berlin hospital by her husband, Pierre. After seeing Nina, Francoise believes that she has found her kidnapped daughter Marie, but neither Toni nor Pierre believe her. Nina is unsure about what to think...
translation:
"Gespenster" (2005) forms together with "Yella" (2007) and "Jerichow" (2008) the ghost trilogy by director Christian Petzold, undoubtedly one of the German filmmakers of the cream-de-la-cr√®me era.

Roughly speaking, "Ghosts" tells the story of a French woman whose daughter was abducted as a 3-year-old child while her mother turned her head for 1 minute in Berlin - and had never been seen before. Since then, her mother has been traveling on and on to Berlin, looking for girls of her own age with her time-stretched photographs. As we hear later in the film, the mother was very often convinced that she had found her daughter Marie. But this time, when she meets Nina, everything is different.

The film does not bring any solutions, not even partial solutions, and so it is rather disappointing. We are also not equipped to decide whether the mother is really crazy or not, whether her biological daughter is still alive or not. The most disappointing is the end. From what we have seen in the movie, it is unreasonable for the observer to be left alone as the author leaves Nina alone. The simple departure symbolizes that nothing has changed, can be a strong dramaturgy (eg in "Umberto D."), but in "ghosts" it is postponed.

Since critics I've suggested Freudian motives in this film, let me give my own try: Why do not similar people know each other, especially not those people who know another similar person? That is, from the point of view of the Aristotelian logic according to which the concept of the individual applies, a rather crazy question. The individual is such a person who does not share any of his defining qualities with others. The Aristotelian answer to my question is thus: they do not know each other because their similarity is through pure change. Anyone who is not crazy believes that. But what about the case when these similar persons have other similarities that are unlikely to change, for Scarves on the left under the ankle or a heart-shaped birthmark under the right shoulder blade? This is the metaphysical context from which this film is made, though I'm not sure if even the director has realized that. In spite of our modern, Aristotelian world, of superstition, conserved in the mythologies of people all over the world that similar people also share parts of their individuality, and this individuality is therefore not unpredictable, but rather diffuse, so that the boundaries between people open are such and similar beliefs that, despite our otherwise highly rational thinking, form a strong backbone of irrationalism - a source of the most interesting type of ghost.

summary: A fat Lawyer finds himself growing "Thinner" when an old gypsy man places a hex on him. Now the lawyer must call upon his friends in organized crime to help him persuade the gypsy to lift the curse. Time is running out for the desperate lawyer as he draws closer to his own death, and grows ever thinner.
translation:
I was really looking forward to seeing this movie, but after seeing it, I was really disappointed. The best was when Stephen King was inside. Rober John Berk can not act to save his life, and none of the others. Some of the performances even made me laugh! The movie was not as I imagined, after reading the book, which was great, I imagined it was darker and much scary. If I were Stephen, I would be really crazy!

I do not know why they changed the end, I thought the end of the book was very good. If you've just figured out that the cake killed your daughter, you would not bring it to anyone else, would you ?!

Book was so much better!

summary: Paris, je t'aime is about the plurality of cinema in one mythic location: Paris, the City of Love. Twenty filmmakers have five minutes each; the audience must weave a single narrative out of twenty moments. The 20 moments are fused by transitional interstitial sequences and also via the introduction and epilogue. Each transition begins with the last shot of the previous film and ends with the first shot of the following film, extending the enchantment and the emotion of the previous segment, preparing the audience for a surprise, and providing a cohesive atmosphere. There's a reappearing mysterious character who is a witness to the Parisian life. A common theme of Paris and love fuses all.
translation:
Only a handful of the segments are involved here. A segment with a workshop supervisor from Nigeria is heartbreaking. One with Fanny Ardent & Bob Hoskins makes sense Twist by Twist until the last shot drowns things out.

The problem with this movie is that only a few of the clips call Paris. The others are so scattered in theme, tone, willpower and production that you can also see "The Years Best Commercials, 2006". It is really everywhere. It does not develop over its term, and nothing rules the directors. No construct successfully connects the pieces ... boredom sets in. I'm at the hour, twenty minutes and Elijah Wood is in some stupidity, over - commercial, over-produced vampire Shtick. It has about as much to do with Paris as old ladies knitting in the Antarctic. Fantasy turns up, I think first in the Coen Brothers segment (Uh, thank J & E for ruining another movie) and then makes far too many appearances. The point of being in Paris is that you do not need fake crap to make your days extraordinary. Why divide it into neighborhoods when Quartier de la Madeleine is equated with vampires for a loser director? Was a genre ever over-represented as the vampire movie? Every three years we get the same lame vampire clich√©s. Worse yet, the change from segment to segment is pretty artless. The transitions are lost. This does not feel like it's going to be sloppy.

summary: Tells the story of Sadie and Bessie Delany, two African-American (they preferred "colored") sisters who both lived past the age of 100. They grew up on a North Carolina college campus, the daughters of the first African-American Episcopal bishop, who was born a slave, and a woman with an inter-racial background. With the support of each other and their family, they survived encounters with racism and sexism in their own different ways. Sadie quietly and sweetly broke barriers to become the first African-American home-ec teacher in New York City, while Bessie, with her own brand of outspokenness, became the second African-American dentist in New York City. At the ages of 103 and 101, they told their story to Amy Hill Hearth, a white New York Times reporter who published an article about them. The overwhelming response launched a bestselling book, a Broadway play, and this film.
translation: A wonderful movie version of the bestseller and Broadway game about the lives of Sadie and Bessie Delany, two African-American sisters, both over 100 years old, who told their story of experiencing a century of American history. Ruby Dee and Diahann Carroll perform very well as Bessie and Sadie respectively. Amy Madigan is also good as Amy Hill Hearth, the white reporter for The New York Times, whose article on the sisters launched the book. Many of the retrospective scenes and even many of today's are very powerful, if not as inspiring as in the book. This is the only real drawback associated with the fact that certain aspects of the story are not clearly illustrated, such as the mother's inter-ethnic background and why her father was so strict. But otherwise a very successful, excellently played, powerful movie.

summary: Edward Walters, an auto mechanic, falls for the intelligent and beautiful Catherine Boyd. It is love at first sight. There is however a problem, she's engaged to jerk James Moreland. Fortunately, Catherine's uncle likes Ed, and with his friends they scheme to make Catherine fall for Ed. The comedy in this movie stems from the fact that Catherine's uncle is none other than Albert Einstein, who's portrayed as a fun loving genius, as are his mischievous colleagues, Nathan, Kurt and Boris.
translation: Since I am a big fan of the romantic comedy genre and have therefore seen a large number of these films, it is rare that they make me feel unique. Likewise, it is rare for me to gasp through the laughter in several scenes. The love story is a bit thin on the ground, but I would say that's probably the best, because this romantic comedy has the emphasis on "comedy," and in any case, it just pushes the limits of credibility a little more than I like Most rom com's do. The four scientists have provided some of the funniest moments not just in this movie, but in every movie I've seen in a long time. I hesitated for a few moments until I finally chose a "10" over a "9" as a rating, as I believe that too many people use them indiscriminately and therefore lose the maximum rating of effectiveness. I'm also a big Meg Ryan fan who helps, but this is one of the few films I've seen that I would say is in the shade. She and Tim Robbins are the main characters, but for me they play the second fiddle against the antics of the awkward intellectuals. A really laughing loud movie.

summary: American kids go to a space camp during the summer holidays. They learn how to operate the Space Shuttle. A team consisting of a guy who just entered to meet girls, a wanna be astronaut and an instructor who wanted to go on a mission instead of teaching can sit in the Shuttle while testing the engines. Then they're launched by mistake ...
translation:
The perfect space fantasy movie. a group of children accidentally go into space and have to go down again, but they do, sure. That would not be a family movie if they were all dead. Then everything will be sad. You do not want Kate Capsaw, the lead actress, to give a Golden Globe performance, but unfortunately she still has Lea Thompson one. Thats so bad. I can not say enough, this movie is so great, Lea Thompson - oh Lord, a perfect girl for this movie. This movie is the best for sure.

Sorry, but better than Star Wars. Star Wars is so overrated and the space camp was so undervalued. It should be the other way

excellent 10/10 or maybe 11/10. I'm not good at math

summary: A dying teacher instructs his final student to check on the activities of five former pupils, each of whom he taught a unique and special style of kung-fu: Centipede, Snake, Scorpion, Lizard, and Toad (hence the title). His final student, who knows a little of each style, must team up with one of the other good students to destroy the evil ones, if there are any. Greed and treachery ensue as the student discovers that some of the students are indeed evil, but which one can he trust enough to team up with?
translation: This is one of my favorite kung fu movies and is considered one of the most beloved Shaw Brothers of the late 70's. The plot is interesting and curvy, the characters are cool, each with its own style - toad, snake, lizard etc. The action is limited compared to other Chang Cheh / Venom's films, but what is there is interesting with different Kung Fu Styles display of different characters. I recommend this movie to those who think that all Shaw Brothers, especially Chang Cheh's films, are the same. Most of his films focus on the 10 Tiger and Shaolin vs. Manchu conflicts. This movie is fresh breath by comparison.

summary: Three pets (Chance, a young dog unfamiliar with the world; Shadow, an aging, wise dog; and Sassy, a snobby cat) are left behind when their family goes on vacation. Unsure of what happened, the animals set out on a quest to find their family. This journey across America is very dangerous and the animals risk never seeing their masters again. The group of pets travel across forested mountains and areas of wide-open countryside, while their family searches for them in the same areas.
translation:
Hey guys,

summary: When the South Side Gang and the Cut Throat Mafia start a drug war at a local high school in Santa Ana, CA, detective McClure goes undercover to investigate the brutal murder of a young Latina student. The gang members are the key suspects but nobody is talking. And as McClure continues to dig for answers, it becomes clear that the two gangs are fighting for territory - and nobody is getting in their way.

summary: In a suburb of Vienna during some hot summer days: A teacher who is in bondage to a sleazy pimp, a very importunate hitchhiker, a private detective on the run for some car vandals, a couple with a serious marriage problem and an old man, whose wife died long before on the search for some sexual entertainment live their lives while their lifelines cross from time to time.
translation:
What a horrible piece of garbage !!! Who are all these people babbling about how good that is? Yes, it is "arty"; and yes, it is "foreign", but .... that's not enough. The plot is boring and incoherent, like a reality show, but not so smooth.

People are uninteresting in themselves; but as characters, they do not have enough depth to feel empathy for them. If they are based on real people, then I feel very, very sorry for them.

The violence (and some of them are very violent) seems quite ostentatious and free. It's as if the producer had visions of being Quenton Tarantino. Not that I think about him too much.

And oh yes, if I had neighbors like this, I would move!

summary: Frank leads a respectable yuppie life working at a noted Stockholm law firm. He has also been married for eight years to his beautiful wife Nenne, who runs an upscale boutique. Yet Frank is deeply bored with his life and is supremely randy. He even fantasizes about the marriage counselor that he and Nenne visit weekly. Eventually, Frank shacks up with a young fetching art student named Sofia, though the experience wracks Frank with guilt. Meanwhile, Nenne's friend and co-worker Rosie suspects that Frank is having an affair, though she does not have the nerve to tell her. Little does Rosie suspect, however, that her friend is sleeping with her lover Georg, an uptight journalist with an ego the size of Finland. Soon wires get crossed, and all hell breaks loose.
translation:
This is really the biggest Swedish movie ever. It is not only revolutionary in its narrative, but also one of the first films to feature the next generation of Swedish humor and Swedish comedians. Felix Herngren and Fredrik Lindstr√∂m are two of Sweden's most intelligent and witty filmmakers today, and this film really shows that.

"Vuxna M√§nniskor" (Adult People) is warm-hearted and funny about adulthood and the question of whether we would not be better off without them.

summary: A black man is distraught when he discovers his son is gay and is determined to set him right.

summary: Bill Dancer and his young companion Curly Sue are the classic homeless folks with hearts of gold. Their scams are aimed not at turning a profit, but at getting enough to eat. When they scam the rich and beautiful Grey Ellison into believing she backed her Mercedes into Bill, they're only hoping for a free meal. But Grey is touched, and over the objections of her snotty fiance, insist on putting the two up for the night. As they get to know each other, Bill becomes convinced that this is where Curly Sue belongs - in a home, cared for by someone that can give her the advantages that his homeless, nomadic existence lacks. He plans to leave the young girl in the care of Grey and take off.... but Curly Sue has other ideas!
translation:
I totally disagree with "ctomvelu" regarding Jim Belushi's talent. I really like Belushi. Admittedly, I was skeptical when he appeared on stage for the first time because I was such a big fan of his deceased brother John. But Jim has a screen charm that has taken him a long way - and he's done well over the years.

Curly Sue is one of his earlier films - his weight is a giveaway (is not that true for most of us?) - and I like the movie. Yes, it's touching and heartwarming, so if you're into car hunts, explosions and groundless sex, then you might want to pass this on here - it's a warm movie of three lost soles that find each other. Do not get me wrong, I'm all in favor of the three above keys to a successful movie, but I also like a nice, solid story like this.

And although Belushi and Kelly Lynch deliver outstanding performances, the real star of this movie is Alisan Porter - who is absolutely adorable.

I do not know what happened to her career, but who is responsible for dropping the ball (Agent? Parents? Himself?) should be shot. You could not ask for a more perfect introduction to fame than this movie, and yet you have not heard from her since.

Another sad Hollywood story ...

summary: A pair of entrepreneurs with more bravery than brains hit upon the idea of blood surfing: spreading chum in the water in order to attract sharks, then hopping on a surfboard and riding through the middle of the pack. As they're filming their promotional documentary, the fun gets interrupted by a thirty-foot long salt water crocodile that begins snacking on everyone in the expedition. Will any of them make it back to civilization?
translation:
I expected a bad movie and got a bad movie. But in my worst imagination, I could not imagine how bad this movie was. I do not even want to try to explain what Blood Surf is about. It's not about bloodsurfing, but about a big crocodile. They complain about the wrong shark in Jaws, but Spielberg was wise and did not show the shark until the end. The crocodile is often shown here, and it's the worst fake crocodile I've ever seen, and they're not trying to hide it. If you want to see a good fake crocodile, watch Lake Placid.

The director had the opportunity to make a decent surf / shark movie, but he had to make a bad B-Monster movie. He had the chance to make an original surf movie, but he wanted to make a monster movie. So you understood how bad this movie is, does it have some good parts? Not really, it has some nudity and a sex scene that comes directly from a Playboy movie. Acting is not bad either, and Kate Fischer looks good. Too bad that she does not take off her top. The main actors are not bad either. They had some potential. The location was beautiful and the movie started with some nice surfing scenes. The blame lies with the untalented writer and director. The dialogue is one of the worst I've ever seen, and the script is really poorly written, and the director has no talent, whatever, and not much imagination.

Do not look at it. Even if you want to see the beautiful Kate Fischer. It is not worth it. Watch sirens to see Kate naked, and watch Lake Placid for good crocodile action.

3/10 because I'm in a good mood, and Maureen Larrazabal looks good, and Kate looks good (but is a bad actress), and Dex Miller, Joel West and Matt Borlenghi do a good job made with the part of which they had to work.

summary: A group of very efficient robbers strikes banks in downtown area of Stockholm. Detective Klara and commanding officer Krona takes on the case.
translation:
This must be one of the worst movies I have ever seen. I was expecting a bad movie, but I was surprised to believe it or not. The plot is traditional, all clich√©s are included.

The dialogue is written so poorly that you actually have to laugh when the otherwise half-descending actors try to make it sound real. The photo is not too good, the music is so wrong, it made me angry, the actors do not even try it, although the script makes it almost impossible to expect more from people who have been trading for 30 years and the so-called Action scenes actually manage to miss the action itself.

I do not understand why these types of bad movies are coming, who is funding this shit? Where is the screening? And why on earth do actors take this mission impossible script?

There are a million Hollywood movies in this genre without even striving to reach the theaters, but even they Straight To Video things actually manages to see it professional compared.

I can not say anything positive except the title that explains everything, I feel robbed 2 hours of my life.

summary: Wilder and Wallace are brothers and pyrokinetics. Ever since childhood they've been able to start fires with their minds but following a tragedy in which they accidentally killed a man, the brothers have grown up very differently. Wilder has become a regular 9-5 workaday joe but Wallace performs his feats with a traveling circus. When the circus comes to Wilder's home town Wallace starts coming on strong to Wilder's wife, Vida who, ironically, is a slight pyromaniac.
translation: I saw this during HBO or Showtime or Cinemax during a mid-nineties summer that my parents subscribed to these channels. I have seen it several times in different places and always found it dark, bizarre and fascinating. I was young then, in my early teens; and years later, after I discovered the great Arliss Howard and was blown away by "Big Bad Love," I bought the "Wild Napalm" DVD and saw her with my girlfriend for the first time in many years. I totally loved it! I was very impressed and influenced by it. There are so many dynamic fluid complexities and wisdom within camera movements and cinematography; All this fits in perfectly with the intelligent, intense and immediate chemistry between the three leads, their story, the music and all the other actors. It's really "cinematic". I love Arliss Howard's subtle intensity, ambivalent strength and hidden intelligence, I'm a big fan of everything he does; and his interaction with Debra Winger's manic joy (they are, of course, married) has this magical-looking reality that passes by the camera. (I wonder if they see it on wedding days? ... "Big Bad Love" should be the next stop for anyone who has not seen it, it's brilliant.) And Dennis Quaid in full clown make-up, sneakily introduced, angled, hidden and displayed by the shot selection, and the full flower abundance is of the kind of pure dark film magic that you do not often see. Quaid has always had an eerie quality for me, with that huge cleft of the mouth hiding behind his flickering eyes that are waiting to be unleashed as mischievous charm or devilish craziness (here as both). Both Howard and Quaid have the insane fire behind their eyes to peel off their wonderful intense internal turret squares in a dark cool way. In fact, the whole movie has a dark cool energy and hip intensity. It's really a fantastic movie put together by everyone involved in intelligence, imagination, agility and chemistry. I really can not imagine how this was funded, and it looks pretty expensive to me, through such a conventional, unimaginative system, but I thank God that movies like these are constantly slipping through the system. By and large, with all of its bright carnival colors, hipper intelligence, darkly warped, true humor, and gripping chemistry, it reminds me of one of my favorite movies of all time: "Big Pointe Blank" ...... That's a compliment in my book!

summary: A young French woman returns to the vast silence of West Africa to contemplate her childhood days in a colonial outpost in Cameroon. Her strongest memories are of the family's houseboy, Protee - a man of great nobility, intelligence and beauty - and the intricate nature of relationships in a racist society.
translation: I do not know what the previous reviewer saw, but I think these are reviews, personal tastes. Missed in this movie was the depth, a very deep movie, many layers of emotions, influenced. Undercurrents of restrained love because of submission to social beliefs, taboos of times and classes, racial relationships that are not in a very good state of equality, guilt, longing, hate, confusion, very dark emotional, I thought under the skin you have to follow the airire of it, a flowing movie, not slow as before, let go of the flow of the movie, the feelings will show, characters reveal their faults, their nasty innards, excellent and really very cruel!

summary: Because of his salacious language, late-night radio advice-show host Leon Phelps, along with his sweet and loyal producer Julie, is fired from his Chicago gig. They can't find another job. About that time, two things happen: he gets a letter from a wealthy former lover who offers to take care of him (but she doesn't sign her real name, so Leon, an inveterate Casanova, has no idea who she is), and a group of angry cuckolds, all of whom have surprised their wives in flagrante delicto with Leon (who has a distinctive tattoo on his booty), are closing in, armed and dangerous. Can he find the sugar mommy and escape the wrath of the mob of husbands? What about Julie?
translation: Do you really like imaginative comedy or do you love "the wedding crashers" when the answer is the last, stop reading. I can not believe that this movie is not rated higher. Basically, Meadows plays a character that is not unlike Austin Powers. There are so many innovative moments in this gagorama. Meadows is great as the childish but very sweet nature Leon. Some great lines "do not blame the Wang" "freaky Deaky sex world" too many. , , Why this movie was not huge is a mystery. Great comedy.

summary: Bud Davis is a country boy who moves to the city to visit his uncle and his family. He starts hanging out at Gilley's, the popular nightclub owned by Mickey Gilley himself. He takes a job at the oil refinery where his uncle works, hoping to save enough money to buy some land. He also meets a cowgirl named Sissy, they dance together, fall in love and suddenly get married. And then their marriage is shattered when Bud sees Sissy allegedly seeing con man Wes, who teaches her how to ride the mechanical bull... and plans to rob Gilley's. When a bull-riding contest at Gilley's is announced, Bud decides to sign up. Can he win the contest and save his marriage to Sissy?
translation:
does not disturb the soundtrack that is played now.

Nevertheless, Debra Winger is always interesting and while this was an earlier role for her she is pretty good as Cissy, Girl of the Wrong Side of the Traces, lived in a trailer with Bud, (Travolta) only to be replaced as a rival for a time by City Slicker Madolyn Smith.

Worth seeing for Debra Winger; She is still so sympathetic and has never had this Hollywood personality to whom we are exposed today by too many actresses. 10.7

summary: Darcy Wagner and her ten-and-a-half-year-old daughter Pamela "Pammy" are heading to the bed and breakfast of her boyfriend Peter Campbell in the River Bend Road in Northern California. Peter has quited his career of doctor and bought an old house to have a calmer life and write a book. When Darcy stops at a gas station to ask for direction, she has an abusive treatment from the owners, the Hammond Brothers. Meanwhile Peter welcomes his first guest, the student Stephanie "Star" Roberts, while he works with his friend Bobby Boulet repairing the house. When Darcy and Pamela arrive, he explains that he had a dispute in the justice with the Hammond Brothers and asks Darcy to forget the incident. Soon Pamela befriends the girl Emma in the barn and she tells that the house belonged to the Tooth Fairy Witch that killed many children to get their milk-teeth; further, Pamela would be in danger since she still has her last milk-tooth. Pamela tells Emma's story to her mother and Peter, but they ...
translation: Being with you I think in this movie, everything was so good that there should be no reason why it did not go to the cinemas. The deaths in the movie are awesome, the FX are awesome when you use them The story follows the little girl, but all in all it was a very good movie that I hope will one day get the props. The very first part of the film is prob, why it came straight to video, with which they killed a little boy, but afterwards The story is based on a little girl and her mother, who had come to visit the mother's friend, who was moving out to become a writer. The property he buys turns out to be the place where the witch lives or goes on her property will be in great danger does not really want to give anything away just a little info, if you then wanted to see this movie then it is worth the price of the rent

summary: In the early 20th century, some convicts while on a road gang escape and one of the convicts is Zach Provo, a half Indian, who was sent to prison during the latter part of the 19th century. He escapes with 6 others to exact vengeance on Sam Burgade the lawman who not only captured him but was also responsible for the death of Provo's wife, at least in Provo's mind. Part of his plan is to kidnap Burgade's daughter, which prompts him to strap on his guns and go after him on horseback. Can Burgade who has been retired for sometime still have what it takes to track Provo down?
translation: At first it was thought that this film was a typical western film, but it turned out to be very interesting and kept me spellbound until the end, which turned out to be very unusual. Charlton Heston, "Midway", 76, had past experiences with James Coburn (Zach Provo), "Deadfall", 93, and Zach never forgave Sam and would stop at nothing to make sure he was caught up with him and paid him back. Unfortunately, Barbara Hershey (Susan Burgade), "The Portrait of a Lady", 96, managed to get caught up in this situation and found herself among sex-hungry men who never left her alone. Sam Burgade had to make some very tough decisions and I was pretty surprised by the result. This is a very entertaining movie and the acting was outstanding.

summary: Dr. Carter Elson is a man who finds a list of men's names among his wife Alex's possessions. When Carter discovers his own name at the bottom of the list, and that some of the other names are those of dead men, he confides in his friend/agent Betty. Time is ticking as they try and figure out what the list means before his name reaches the top. Alex, a small town girl who marries the up-and-coming doctor as an entry to the social-climbing world she always coveted, is frustrated when obstacles are placed in her path. She meets two other "unhappy wives," played by Sonja Smits and Donna Pescow, and discovers a way out that may be the answer to all of her prayers. The women conspire to 'shorten the list!'
translation: When I rented this movie, I had very low expectations ... but when I saw it, I realized that the movie was less (much less) than I expected. The actors were bad (the doctor's wife was one of the worst), the story was so stupid ... it might work for a Disney movie (except the murders), but this one is not a comedy, it's a ridiculous masterpiece Stupidity. The title is well chosen, except for one thing: you could add a dumb movie to Dead Husbands! I give it 0 and a half out of 5.

summary: After the murder of her lover Caesar, Egypt's queen Cleopatra needs a new ally. She seduces his probable successor Mark Antony. This develops into real love and slowly leads to a war with the other possible successor: Octavius.
translation: I'm a big Charlton Heston fan. He's undoubtedly one of the greatest actors of all time, but what did he think as he filmed this movie. Normally, if he did a bad movie, I could blame the scriptwriter or director, but in that case, he's everything. The suction of this film is his fault. It proves that even Heston can not make a Shakespearean story interesting. I wasted two and a half hours of my life on this slumber party and will never get that time again. This is by far the worst Heston movie I have ever seen. If you're a Shakespearean fan, you might find this movie entertaining, but if you do not waste your time, you'll regret it in the long run.

summary: The American writer of horror novels Cheryl is a woman tormented by nightmares since she was a child. She rents the Trifiri Villa in Italy with her husband Tom and they travel on vacation with their son Bobby. On the arrival, Chery befriends the local Ann that offers her younger sister Maria to babysit Bobby in order to allow Cheryl and Tom to have dinner with her. Cheryl is writing her latest novel about an ogre that horrifies her since her childhood and soon she finds that all her fears are coming true. Further the house is surrounded by orchids that attract the ogre and his victims. Now Cheryl has to convince her skeptical husband that they are in dangerous and must leave the place.
translation: Best-selling horror author Cheryl (a solid and likeable performance by the beautiful Virginia Bryant), her husband Tom (the lovable Paolo Serra) and her son Bobby (nicely played by Patrizio Vinci) go to a secluded castle in the country for summer vacations. Local legend claims that the area is cursed. Cheryl discovers a scary, hairy, hideous ogre in the basement (hobbling David Flosi in a strikingly hideous costume). Cheryl must overcome her deep-seated childish fear of the beast to defeat the lazy find. Director / co-author Lamberto Bava is an expert who creates and maintains an eerie and nerve-wracking nightmarish mood. In addition, Bava abandons the standard routine of blood and terror to make a captivating and provocative, dark, fairytale-like fable of how the best way to overcome what scares us is to face that source head-on. Stable support turns by Sabrina Ferilli as friendly teacher Anna, Stefania Montorsi as hottie babysitter Maria and Alex Serra as batty painter Dario. Gianfranco Transunto's high-gloss cinematography offers some smooth camera shots and plenty of atmospheric light. Fabrizio Sforza's grim make-up f / x, Simon Boswell's sumptuously spooky haunting scary 'n' shuddery score, and the damp, dark, cobwebbed basement set hit everyone's skin. It's worth watching.

summary: In 1939, the author Annemarie Schwarzenbach and the ethnologist Ella Maillart travel together by car to Kabul, but each is in pursuit of her own project. Annemarie Schwarzenbach, who was among Erika and Klaus Mann's circle of friends in the 30s, is searching for a place of refuge in the Near East to discover her own self. Ella Maillart justifies her restlessness, her need for movement and travel, with a scientific pretext: she would like to explore the mysterious Kafiristan Valley and make a name for herself with publications on the archaic life of the nomads living there. Both women are on the run, but political developments and their own biographies catch up with them again and again. Their mutual journey through the outside world, which runs from Geneva via the Balkans and Turkey to Persia, is compounded by the inner world of emotions with a tender love story.
translation:
We went with a group to the movie because the play we wanted to play was canceled. It is without doubt one of the worst films of all time. It's not like I do not like cult movies that I do. But nothing happens in the movie. You do not feel any connection with the characters. endless times without dialogue. And the car. How do you carry a huge tent and put chairs and clothes for every day in this car? It is a two-seater! But I have to say, the scenery is beautiful, but not in a movie, the director should have done a photo shoot of the movie, so that we could miss about 80 minutes useless time in which nothing happens anyway.

I would not recommend it as it is a waste of your time

summary: The story begins one hot summer's day when Leanne Wellings is taking her two young children to visit her grandfather. She stops to buy flowers at a motorway lay-by but then inexplicably vanishes - leaving her two small children waiting for her in her car - lost and far from home. Her two small children then set off to find her only to go missing themselves. Their ordeal is captured on CCTV cameras and before long the family's heart-stopping trauma is not only a complex police investigation but a major national news story.
translation: I can not believe that I wasted five hours of my life on this garbage. The previous five-day offer of this author was very pleasant and I was very much looking forward to it. But most of the dialogue was completely incomprehensible. Surprise Jones was the main culprit because she either mumbled or chatted with her lines, but the rest of the cast followed her example. Notable exceptions were Bernard Hill and Anne Reid, old hands whose diction was exemplary. Do producers not listen to productions before they air to make sure the dialogue is audible? As a result, I lost track of what was going on, and as the original storyline became the usual I-and-we-thing between Muslims and the rest, I soon lost interest. The end was a complete anti-climax. A complete dud.

summary: Pete Thompson thinks he has it all. However, following the death of his father his close friend and accountant reveals the company he has been left is bust and the only way out is to do business with the Russian mafia. His life and heart are on the line when he leave to restore the fortunes of the family firm.
translation:
Just so your movie friends understand the movie, I decided to write another review. I missed a few things last time ...

First the script. Second, the acting. Third, Jesus Christ, what did you think you would do to make such a piece of garbage and then expect us to enjoy it when there are no redemptive features from beginning to end, except when Joseph Fiennes is finally blown off in a very unspectacular climax !!! I can not believe I wasted my money on this when I could give it to a homeless or street musician or SOMEWHAT!

Do you have the photo?

summary: Tomas is a doctor and a lady-killer in 1960s Czechoslovakia, an apolitical man who is struck with love for the bookish country girl Tereza; his more sophisticated sometime lover Sabina eventually accepts their relationship and the two women form an electric friendship. The three are caught up in the events of the Prague Spring (1968), until the Soviet tanks crush the non-violent rebels; their illusions are shattered and their lives change forever.
translation:
This movie is pretty boring. There are snippets of naked flesh thrown around in a lame attempt to keep the onlooker awake, but they fail.

The best thing about the movie is Lena Olin - she does a masterful job with her character, but Day-Lewis maims most of his lines.

Kaufman obviously had no idea how to do that. The disagreements between domestic household / marriage issues and political crises are poorly coordinated. Character settings change without explanation. Very incoherent.

summary: In 2022, Earth is overpopulated and totally polluted; the natural resources have been exhausted and the nourishment of the population is provided by Soylent Industries, a company that makes a food consisting of plankton from the oceans. In New York City, when Soylent's member of the board William R. Simonson is murdered apparently by a burglar at the Chelsea Towers West where he lives, efficient Detective Thorn is assigned to investigate the case with his partner Solomon "Sol" Roth. Thorn comes to the fancy apartment and meets Simonson's bodyguard Tab Fielding and the "furniture" (woman that is rented together with the flat) Shirl and the detective concludes that the executive was not victim of burglary but executed. Further, he finds that the Governor Santini and other powerful men want to disrupt and end Thorn's investigation. But Thorn continues his work and discovers a bizarre and disturbing secret of the ingredient used to manufacture Soylent Green.
translation: This film has a very good acting by almost all actors, a poignant story with a captivating ending, great music and excellent pictures without any significant special effects. It's interesting to note that, like so much science fiction, their predictions for the future are not as likely, as early as illustrated. That does not mean we're still out of the woods, but by 2022 it's obviously too early to be in that state. It shares this failure with a rather illustrious list of sci-fi classics: "1984," "2001: A Space Odyssey (compare its space station with our International Space Station) and Isaac Asimov's" I-Robot "(positronic brains should have been invented ) In the 1990s).

summary: An intense film about time travel, this Sci-Fi entry was directed by Terry Gilliam, a member of the comedy troupe Monty Python. The film stars Bruce Willis as James Cole, a prisoner of the state in the year 2035 who can earn parole if he agrees to travel back in time and thwart a devastating plague. The virus has wiped out most of the Earth's population and the remainder live underground because the air is poisonous. Returning to the year 1990, six years before the start of the plague, Cole is soon imprisoned in a psychiatric facility because his warnings sound like mad ravings. There he meets a scientist named Dr. Kathryn Railly (Madeleine Stowe) and Jeffrey Goines (Brad Pitt), the mad son of an eminent virologist (Christopher Plummer). Cole is returned by the authorities to the year 2035, and finally ends up at his intended destination in 1996. He kidnaps Dr. Railly in order to enlist her help in his quest. Cole discovers graffiti by an apparent animal rights group called the Army ...
translation:
There is a story (possibly apocryphal) of an exchange between Bruce Willis and Terry Gilliam at the beginning of Twelve Monkeys. Gilliam (allegedly) produced a long list (think of the Fifth Element plane) and gave it to Butch Bruce. It was titled "Things Bruce Willis Does When He Trades." It ended with a simple message saying "Please do not do anything of the above in my movie".

There is a fact about this movie (definitely true). Gilliam had no handwriting.

I argue that these two factors have played a major role in creating the extraordinary (if not commercial) success of the Twelve Monkeys.

Visually, the Twelve Monkeys are all we can expect from a Gilliam movie. It is also full of Gilliamesque surrealism and general (but splendid) strangeness. Gilliam is pleased to have wronged his viewers. Although the end of the Twelve Monkeys will not surprise anyone who has been through for the first time, in the bureaucratic, ruthless movement of the characters, Gilliam hardly lends herself to her fate by Kafka. It is this journey, and the character developments that they experience, are troubling.

I love Gilliam films (especially Brazil). But they all tend to suffer from the same weakness. He seems to have so many ideas and enthusiasm that almost without exception his films end up as a jumble (especially in Brazil). I still say that Brazil is Gilliam's tour de force, but there is no denying that The Twelve Monkey's brings fresh wind to the dense section. Style, substance and form seem to merge in a way that is not normally seen by ex-Python.

Whatever the truth of the rumor, Gilliam also manages to achieve a first-rate (and very atypical) balding performance. Bruce is excellent in this movie, as are all the other actors, especially Brad Pitt, a fitting but also very scary guy.

It's been over a decade since this movie was released. When I looked at it again, I realized that it had not really aged. Of course I had changed. And that made me watch the movie with fresh eyes. That seems to me to be an appropriate homage to a film that is at least partially about reflections, changed perspectives and the absurd one-way street of the time we all do. A first-class movie. 8.10.

summary: A dreamer who aspires to human flight is assigned public service after one of his attempts off a public building. This leads him to meeting a young woman, who is dying of motor neuron disease. The strong-willed woman admits her wish to be de-flowered before her death. The man, struggling to maintain his relationship with his girl friend, declines but offers to help pay for a gigolo to do the deed. The following events play off the inherent comedy and drama of the circumstances.
translation: I found this movie quite by accident, but I am glad that I did that. Kenneth Branagh's appearance almost toppled this movie from Helena Bonham Carter, but her strong chemistry together made for a much more enjoyable movie. This movie was reminiscent of the excellent films Branagh made with Emma Thompson. Carter's star is here when a disabled young woman trying to complete herself was as good a performance as I've ever seen from a female lead in a long time. It's hard to portray a disabled person, but basically just her eyes to show her grief over her life situation has made her so believable. If this movie had appeared after the current wave of films with beautiful women "teasing" for the roles (Charlize Theron, Halle Berry), I was sure Carter would have had a strong regard for an Oscar. If you're running on cable over this movie late at night, believe me, it's worth the lost sleep.

summary: When Jonathan Jordan gets divorced he's thrust back into the world of being a single Mormon - a world who's ultimate goal is eternal marriage. Struggling to fit in, Jonathan decides to stop going to church only to be pursued by the members of the local singles ward who want to reactivate him. Nothing works until Jonathan falls for Cammie Giles, the ward activities director. Suddenly, going to church becomes much more appealing. But is he going for the right reasons?
translation:
Yes, that sums it up. This movie was horrible. I wanted to dig up my eyes for two minutes. This was praised as an "innovative LDS comedy," but it's not even good for members of this church! I do not think that a person should be such a victim to watch a movie of this low quality.

First of all, it can be said that absolutely no effort was invested in this film. Then there is the acting, which is saddened by * all *. Even the cameos do not bring anything to life.

And let's not forget that our protagonist is a shallow idiot we like to think he can change, but this path is full of embarrassing dialogue, terrible gags, and a lot Mormon "jokes" that anyone who is in his right mind should consider LDS or not as * stupid *! This must be one of the worst movies I have ever seen!

summary: A couple of friends are chased by a killer clown in the woods during a week-end.
translation:
I rented this movie about a month ago when I had nothing else to do on a Friday night. All I can say to describe this worthless movie is 'TRASH'. Acting is so bad. I've seen kids do a better job at school. The whole cast seems to read only its lines, no emotion, no emotions and no space to grasp the viewer. On another note, the special effects were insanely cheesy and the whole thing looked like it was shot with a camera, anyone can buy a radio cabin.

The clown himself does not look like the one on the video cover. Damn, he does not even get in the movie until just before the end and all he does is humming songs and walking around stalking some characters. It is also shown no real murder, so this is not a real Slasherfilm. Since I saw it, I've questioned a few things. 1. If 'Serial Insane Clown Killer' would not be a serial killer killing clowns? 2. If your friend is missing, why would you go to the forest to have sex instead of looking for her? Sorry, really.

3. Why did the only REAL action suddenly spit out in vain in the end? Has the cast finally decided to show up in their jobs? This movie is as sad as they come. I advise you not to rent it, so you do not waste an hour or two of your time laughing more than shouting.

summary: Boris Zaroff is a modern businessman who is haunted by his past -- his father was the notorious Count Zaroff of The Most Dangerous Game fame. Consequently, Boris is subject to hallucinations and all-too-real social lapses which normally involve sadistic harm to beautiful naked young women. His butler is sworn to indoctrinating him into the evils of the family line, and their castle's torture dungeon proves quite useful in this regard. However, Boris is periodically lured away from his destiny by the romantic apparition of the deceased countess who previously owned the castle.
translation: You just have to open scenes like "Seven Women for Satan"? At the intro, a naked girl runs through the forest, chased by a hunting dog and a vicious-looking guy on a horse, until she falls off a cliff and splits her head on a rock. Then the camera zooms on the guy's face and we notice him just sitting behind a desk while his secretary waits for him to sign some papers. "Oh, I'm sorry, I was lost in my thoughts ??" he says then! Sweet, I came across another completely crazy movie. Even if you understand only a minimum of French and look at the original title, you know immediately that "Seven Wives for Satan" has nothing to do with Satan or ritual sacrifice, but simply count on the extravagant escapades of a pervert and mentally unstable during his weekend in the country. This is indeed another seedy twist on the classic milestone "The Most Dangerous Game" about a madman's disturbing hobby of chasing people? preferably hot naked chicks - in the woods for sports. Actually, this is more than just a variation of the classic from 1932, as the author / director and actor Michel Lemoine had the claim to connect his protagonist directly to the legendary villain of Leslie Banks in "The Most Dangerous Game". Count Zaroff was said to have been the son of the original Earl Zaroff, but he traded his private island for the remote French countryside. He can no longer afford to be unemployed, so he's an office worker from Monday to Friday and an insane killer at the weekend. Zaroff is a real spinner, hallucinating dancing with deceased women, but actually driving her car over the living. His butler once promised to stop the Zaroffs from killing, but he's obviously doing a lousy job. There is no depth in the script and the setup certainly does not take into account any tension or weird atmosphere. Really, the only useful thing to do in this film is the girls being lured into Zaroff's fallacy and hoping they'll quickly reach seven. Half of the film is senseless and boring footage, like the excessively erotic dance act in which a statue inexplicably transforms into a muscular black man, and the other half is psychedelic slime that eventually becomes boring. All the girls look gorgeous , I have the impression that it was Michel Lemoine's intention to imitate his buddy Jean Rollin and make a delicious kinky sex thriller. "Seven Women for Satan" is a French production, so Jess Franco regularly plays Howard Vernon ("The Awful Dr. Orloff", "Zombie Lake"). Lemoine herself certainly has the look of a crazy killer, but not the talent to portray one.

summary: A beautiful young woman travels to a remote estate to seek employment as a biochemist for Baron Janos Dalmar. She finds herself attracted to him, so immerses herself in her work to suppress her lusty desires. A rash of rather brutal murders occurs in the area and she soon discovers that the Baron is not what he seems. Not long thereafter, the Baron transforms into a demon, and the beautiful young woman becomes his very own love slave.
translation:
I bought the BLOOD CASTLE DVD on eBay for a few dollars without knowing what it was, and all I can say is that I was not disappointed with this purchase. BLOOD CASTLE is one of those trashy European horror movies that have almost no redeeming quality, except that they are entertaining for all the bad reasons. The opening alone was worth the price of the DVD: Our heroine, Dr. Ing. Ivanna arrives at the castle to help a scientist, Baron Dalmar, experiment with dead tissue. On her way to the castle 1) a man tries to rape Ivanna. 2) The housekeeper of the castle fights with her. 3) The maid wants to see her dead. 4) and finally Baron Dalmar almost spits on her and wants her out the next day. Hmm ... something tells me that she is not welcome. With such a miserable arrival, you'd think Ivanna would leave the place in a NY-minute, but no, like so many great trashy movies, our "wayward" heroine decides to stay with us and even enjoys a candlelit Dinner with the grumpy baron same eventful day. The intro is so overly trashy (it's even bigger than the memorable first minutes of this Canadian movie, JUNIOR) that I knew I would enjoy that.

But the fun does not end there. Ivanna is repeatedly stunned when she goes to bed in the evening to be naked, tied up and tortured by an invisible man in a light session. Even after experiencing these nocturnal S & M sessions, Ivanna remains in the castle, fully convinced of the angry Baron, that what she experiences is nothing but dreams. It is to be expected that Ivanna, even after being treated so poorly from the beginning, falls in love with the Baron. Ivanna completely ignores everything negative about him, including the obvious fact that the grumpy baron is popular with the young ladies. Every woman in the castle (it seems like only women work there) is in love with the miserable jerk who does not mind using the pretty young things. Things get even more silly when someone lurks around the property killing (and killing) women. Basically, the Baron's physically disfigured brother, Igor, is responsible for everything. In a very lengthy scene, the brother warns the baron that he should not concern himself too much with Ivanna, otherwise he will suffer the consequences. What are Baron and Ivanna doing with it? Well, they marry, of course! During the short wedding ceremony, the baron is shot dead by one of the angry natives (father of one of the dead girls). But all this does not stop Ivanna, who, amidst all the dead young ladies and the torture that surrounds them, comforts the wounded baron cheerfully: "It's just a flesh wound" and they can go on and enjoy their honeymoon in the castle where the killer / rapist / torturer brother is. The whole thing quickly develops into a nightmarish love triangle between Ivana, the Baron and Igor. Do everything for love! Anyway, you get the idea: it's not subtle. Almost everything is overly ridiculous in this movie and if it's not OTT, like the foreseeable climax, things get a bit boring. But for the greater part of the film, the director or author indulges in one illogical, trashy moment after another. I really love these types of films, being as slippery as a sledgehammer and being populated by characters who are illogical. Even those who created the Retromedia DVD recognize this, and when you go to the scene selection, we hear one of the funniest parts of the dialogue from the dubbed movie, which is endlessly looped.

The production values ‚Äã‚Äãare beautiful. The opening and closing credits, with these candles and red curtains ... oh, a soup of the class. The music sometimes sounds like something from a Tim Burton movie, which only adds to the inconsistency of everything. And when these young women take off their clothes, they are just begging to be killed.

As a standard movie, I rate that as 2, but as "it's so bad, it's good" movie, I rate it as solid 8 stars. If you enjoy trashy movies, please look at them. You must have seen something like that. The only thing I could think about: What would that woman need to get out of this damned castle?

summary: The morbid Catholic writer Gerard Reve who is bisexual, alcoholic and has frequent visions of death is invited to give a lecture in the literature club of Vlissingen. While in the railway station in Amsterdam, he feels attracted to a handsome man who embarks on another train. Gerard is introduced to the treasurer of the club and beautician Christine Halsslag, a wealthy widow who owns the Spider beauty shop, and they engage in a one night stand. On the next morning, Gerard sees the picture of Christine's boyfriend Herman and recognizes him as the man he saw in the train station. He urges her to bring Herman to her house to spend a couple of days together, but with the secret intention of seducing the man. Christine travels to K√∂ln to bring her boyfriend and Gerard stays alone in her house. He drinks whiskey and snoops through her safe, finding three film reels with names of men; he decides to watch the footage and discovers that Christine had married each; all of whom died in tragic ...
translation:
Paul Verhoeven's The Fourth Man is one of the most convincing thrillers I've ever seen. It was really a pleasant surprise. The story refers to the bisexual writer Gerard (Jeroen Krabbe), who is lured into a relationship with the beautiful hairdresser Christine (Ren√©e Soutendijk), but in the twisted thoughts of Gerard could be more part of the story. Verhoeven and cinematographer Jan De Bont create a beautiful and dense atmosphere full of surreal and disgusting sexual imagery that really draws you into the story, you do not want to watch, but you can not turn away. This is by far the best film by Verhoeven (maybe just Robocop). True The Fourth Man is not for everyone, some of the sex scenes are completely superfluous (just ignore them, but trust me, if you watch for at least ten minutes, you'll be addicted.) This is one of those movies you need to know how it ends, a true thriller in the Hitchcock tradition, captivating, controversial and exciting, I even like the spider metaphor.

8/10

summary: In 1896, Jeff Webster sees the start of the Klondike gold rush as a golden opportunity to make a fortune in beef, and woe betide anyone standing in his way. He drives a cattle herd from Wyoming to Seattle, by ship to Skagway, and (after a delay caused by larcenous town boss Gannon) through the mountains to Dawson. There, he and his partner Ben Tatum get into the gold business themselves. Two lovely women fall for misanthropic Jeff, but he believes in every-man-for-himself, turning his back on growing lawlessness, until it finally strikes home.
translation:
This is a western action. James Steart leads an all-star cast in the scenic northwest, which is filmed in great splendor. The scenery and the costumes are great. There are action and adventure. Stewart plays a wealthy rancher who conflicts with a crooked government in the old northwest coast.

The main drawback is the stereotypical cynic that Hollywood has always turned into a hero. Even as this movie was filmed, the cynic was the stereotyped hero, and the one portrayed by Stewart really has few engaging graces. He is friendly to his two partners, and that gives him an extra dimension of credibility and sympathy.

However, he is so humid for all the others, it's hard to really care about him, accept him. He is very similar to the one-dimensional spaghetti western characters (cut not so bad).

Nevertheless, the secondary characters are quite enjoyable. Walter Brennan, Royal Dano, Harry Morgan and others make it worth seeing.

summary: When a trendy young couple enter a quaint-looking antiquarian bookstore seeking a present for their friend, they find more than they bargained for. A mysterious shopkeeper takes them into the world of his books, leading them through four amazing stories. What happens next they could never have imagined!
translation:
I really felt bad for the actors in this matter. Undoubtedly, a high school drama class could do a better job or at least a job. The actors must have thought that this would be their big chance to work in a movie, it was not. Besides the terrible drama, the stories were boring and largely predictable. The over the remote control has made no sense at all. For a bad reason it had the best condition in the group.

I'm all in favor of supporting low budget films and giving new filmmakers a fair chance, but this turkey is a waste of time and an insult to the observer. I just saw it because of some good comments posted here. They must have been planted by people associated with the film. You may make people observe this, but you can not make them like what they saw.

I gave him a 2 instead of a 1 because at least the boxer story was heartwarming. Sure it failed miserably, but it tried. I reserve 1 s for the worst of the worst.

Do yourself a favor and skip this dribble. I wish I had.

summary: Ya'ara, 24 years old, is attractive, independent, confident and intelligent, and she has just begun her PhD in Mathematics at Princeton University. Ya'ara is blind. When she hears of her cousin Talia's suicide, she rushes back to Israel. They were best of friends and twin spirits. Talia saw for both of them, and was always the one who believed and led Ya'ara to believe, that in spite of her blindness, Ya'ara could see everything. Ya'ara joins Talia's family for the traditional 7-day mourning period "The Shiv'a" and there, she discovers the secrets of Talia's life and embarks on an investigation trying to discover the reason that led Talia to commit suicide. Lies, secrets and gaps are revealed in this powerful story
translation:
Although there is melodrama in the middle or at the bottom of the film, the story is beautifully and subtly narrated, and the acting is superb.

Yaara, who studies in Princeton, returns to Israel for her life. Funeral of her oldest and dearest friend, Talia. Because Yaara practically lived with her friend's parents after the death of her own mother, she lost her adoptive sister. And because Yaara, blinded by birth, was led and guarded by Talia, her friend's suicide is as unbearable as it is inexplicable. Inevitably, the blind girl is the one who determines to solve the mystery of this death. Although she has no view, she has insight. Although she can not see, she is able to find what is out of sight, as the "normal" people around her. The film becomes an intriguing mystery as Yaara seeks to recall her relationship with Talia, her adoptive family home, tapes, diaries, and Talia's past and present.

Told by Yara's perspective, the film is also viewed from her point of view as she imagines what she hears, believes and imagines. The mystery solution is more conventional, but the search is performed with such subtle care, and the response is rendered so beautifully and without fanfare that the pat moment is easily forgiven. The truths are gradually coming to an abrupt end, illustrating not only Talia's life, but also her relationship with Yaara. Tali Sharon, as Yaara, uses her mobile face and voice effectively and is completely believable both as an adult and as a teenager. We fully accept their ability to find their place in the world more securely at the end of the film. Noteworthy is the precision with which places and actions are repeated with small but significant variations that never get boring, the dead - through the minor characters and the interesting decision to portray Talia as a teenager. I'll argue with Yaara's final statement standing with Gadi, Talia's last boyfriend, on the edge of a cliff, but this trip to the edge is so intriguing that the picture stays in sight longer than her words are recalled.

summary: Meat merchant Oleg, prostitute Marina, and piano tuner "simply Volodya" drop into an all-night bar in Moscow, where they are served by a narcoleptic bartender (three plus one is four) while each regales the others with made-up biographies.
