Director Lee did not have a long career? with this and the somewhat similar (albeit with a change of attitude and point of view) A TOWN LIKE ALICE (1956) his most notable achievements? but in this case he certainly milked every exciting situation (even if alleged delays in filming led to Lee giving up his post prematurely and producer Ian Dalrymple having given up the task of tying loose ends!). In any case, the exquisite lighting (especially during the nightly processes) is to be emphasized throughout.

summary: Vampires fighting zombies.
translation: This is the absolutely worst movie I have ever seen !! There was absolutely nothing good to say about this film. I've seen some bad movies, but this one takes it. There is no plot, and most of the film either rushes to make the movie faster, or you wonder what the hell's going on because you can not seriously believe someone was thinking about this movie and you look at him. I'm sorry for anyone who has to go through this one and a half hours. Please take my advice and do NOT watch this movie because I think you will think that this is the biggest waste of time you have ever spent in your life.

summary: In New York, Alvin Sanders is a small-time thief who's just been hauled in for stealing a bunch of prawns (shrimp) from a local restaurant. He ends up in a cell with John Jaster, one half of a high-tech criminal team that's just stolen $42,000,000 worth of gold from the Federal Reserve. Realizing that he could die at any moment from his worsening heart condition, Jaster tells Alvin to relay a cryptic message to his wife about the whereabouts of the hidden gold. Alvin doesn't know exactly what the message means, and Edgar Clenteen, the U.S. Treasury investigator working the case, hopes it will lead to the gold or Jaster's partner Bristol, but it does neither. Eighteen months later, Jaster is dead, and both Clenteen and Bristol are still looking for that gold. Clenteen decides to secretly plant a tracking device in Alvin's jaw, release him from prison, and then let the word out that he knows where the gold is hidden. Knowing that Bristol is probably watching their every move, Clenteen ...
translation: I think this movie is much to recommend, especially a particularly sinister performance by David Morse and a more than passable performance from the always-worthy Mr. Foxx. Although there are many holes in the plot, and in some cases the motivation is very difficult to follow, it all adds up to a good time in front of the tube.

summary: A remake of the classic 1963 movie "The Haunting" about a team of paranormal experts who look into strange occurrences in an ill-fated house. Through the course of the night some will unravel, some will question, and all will fight for their lives as the house fights back.
translation:
The Haunting, if you have seen the original, you know a great ghost story, it's perfection in the movie. It's a haunting story of 4 people going to a haunted house, and they've scared people with the simple trick of sound and movement. It remains effective to this day, if you appreciate film. When The Haunting was redone in 1999, many people had the same reaction: "WHAT? WHY? WHAT?" But in my opinion, if a remake is respectful enough and the story for the newer generation just reinvented, I'm pretty cool with it. This is definitely not the case, this is just a disrespectful boring shame that wastes your time and I guarantee that you are not afraid of it? pfft! PG-13, what are you thinking about? Not much, apparently.

When her mother dies and her sister drives her away, Nell receives a phone call from an ad for a study of insomnia run by Doctor David Marrow at the remote Hill House mansion. On arrival, Nell meets Mr. and Mrs. Dudley, a strange pair of caretakers who do not stay on the property after dark. Shortly thereafter, two other participants in the study arrive, the wild Theo and the "Bad Sleeper" Luke Sanderson together with Doctor Marrow. The participants are unaware that the real purpose of Doctor Marrow is to investigate the psychological response to anxiety. Every night, the janitors concatenate the gate in front of the Hill House so that no one can go in or out until morning when the janitors open the lock. There are no working phones at Hill House and the nearest town is several miles away. Doctor Marrow indulges in the story of Hill House. The house was built by Hugh Crain, Crain built the house for his wife, hoping to fill it with a large family full of children, but all of Crain's children died during childbirth. Crain's wife killed herself before the house was finished, and Crain became a hermit. On the first night, Theo and Nell experience strange phenomena in the house, including unusual noises and inexplicable changes in temperature. Nell is confronted after the main hall has been vandalized with the words "Welcome Home, Eleanor". He is extremely disturbed and wants to prove that the house is being persecuted by the souls of the victims, who are affected by Crain's cruelty. She learns that Crain built his fortune by exploiting kidnapped children for slave labor and murdering them if they no longer benefit him. Then he burned the corpses in the fireplace of the house to hide evidence. She also learns that Crain had a second wife named Carolyn, from whom Nell descended. Everyone thinks they are crazy, while Nell is convinced she belongs here. Seriously, I suggest you stay away from this movie, it's really stupid and pointless. Not to mention the actress who played Nell, Lili Taylor completely annoyed me, her performance, her looks, all about her, does not turn me into things I would do just to keep her from seeing her again in the movie. Catherine Zeta Jones just did not fit into her role and Liam Neeson, a wonderful actor, wasted talent again. The effects are exaggerated and too computerized, I just can not believe that they would destroy a wonderful classic with this quark. Believe me, if you're afraid of something, you're scared to see how you can turn a big ghost story into an annoying piece of confused nonsense. Oh, this movie hurts, just do not see, it's bad.

1/10

summary: Because of his salacious language, late-night radio advice-show host Leon Phelps, along with his sweet and loyal producer Julie, is fired from his Chicago gig. They can't find another job. About that time, two things happen: he gets a letter from a wealthy former lover who offers to take care of him (but she doesn't sign her real name, so Leon, an inveterate Casanova, has no idea who she is), and a group of angry cuckolds, all of whom have surprised their wives in flagrante delicto with Leon (who has a distinctive tattoo on his booty), are closing in, armed and dangerous. Can he find the sugar mommy and escape the wrath of the mob of husbands? What about Julie?
translation: Okay, like many other such films that came out of a SNL sketch. However, Tim Meadows has done a fantastic job transforming a three-minute one-dimensional character into a moderately manageable comedic film character. He falls witty and consistently threatened One-liner with decent frequency, Billy Dee Williams is there, although his Lando days are long gone and the whole thing is shot pretty well. It's not great art, but if you searched for the Gone With The Wind in Wayne's World, you did something wrong. Pleasant for what it is .......

summary: Erik, and Cooze start college and pledge the Beta House fraternity, presided over by none other than legendary Dwight Stifler. But chaos ensues when a fraternity of geeks threatens to stop the debauchery and the Betas have to make a stand for their right to party.
translation:
I have to hand it over to the creative team behind these "American Pie" films. "Direct To DVD" usually stands for cheap, incompetent filming. However, last year I was pleasantly surprised when I thoroughly enjoyed the DVD sequel "The Naked Mile". The filmmakers took the opportunity to deliver a slippery but funny little movie. This year they offer the successor "Beta House". That's the honest truth, "Beta House" makes the first "American Pie" movies look like "The Little Mermaid".

This is not an inhibitor, tasteless, sheer fun. Sure, the story is a bit thin, but that's the beauty of the whole thing. Within the first 10 minutes we will be introduced to the main characters, the new subordinates, get a handful of crunchy gags, hit the bad guys and set the general storyline. With all this out of the way, the movie becomes a no-limit ride. The gags are plentiful and they have NOT held back in this case. I'm talking about male semen, urine, dildos, cock with tails, sex with sheep, female orgasm sprays and much more. Not to mention the fact that no minute passes without breasts or sex scene.

The return of "The Naked Mile" comes from John White, Jake Siegel, Steve Talley and Eugene Levy (similar) supporting act as the last films). The entire cast works well. In particular, Steve Talley (Dwight Stifler) has a great deal of energy and screen presence. I predict good things for him. The film also contains great movie references for those who keep their eyes peeled. By far the biggest laugh in the movie was the parody "The Deerhunter" for me. Classic.

The bottom line is that you feel at home with "Beta House". It really pushes the boundaries of good taste, but is pretty funny in the end.

summary: The world of our distant future is a veritable utopia, thanks to the lyrics of two simple-minded 20th Century rock and rollers, Bill S. Preston, Esq. and Ted "Theodore" Logan. However, a would-be conquerer threatens to throw history off-track by sending "most non-non-heinous" evil robot Bill and Teds back to kill their good counterparts. Finding themselves dead, the boys must outwit the Grim Reaper and traverse Heaven and Hell to return to the land of the living, rescue their "babes" and have a "most triumphant" concert at the all-important Battle of the Bands.
translation: What can I say? I know this movie from beginning to end. It's hilarious. It's a strong connection to my past and will change my view of the movie in the future. Hypothetical :) The descent? There is no Socrates-Johnson!

summary: The Mind's Eye is a compilation of experimental computer animations from when such technology was in its early infancy. The animations are from various studios, having been arranged in a sort of "2001" evolution-timeline theme, and set to synthesized music. These pioneering CGI projects later gave rise to films such as Toy Story, A Bug's Life, Antz, and Shrek.
translation:
These things have been floating in my head for almost ten years. Some pieces of this work were really memorable. - I would like to see another more recent example of cg flashy stuff. Actually, I would like to be part of it.

If I had the opportunity to just say what I wanted and that was it, I would not have to write it all out in the right order "10 lines if text" as this site requires. I'm serious? That's almost discouraging, luckily for the guys who did the movie. I really liked Minds Eye - and it cost me 3 times to have enough lines. I hope you do not get me spelling mistakes. - you have done it.

summary: On the Franco-Austrian Frontier during WW I, an oriental priest, chaplain of a French colonial regiment, is condemned to life imprisonment because he possesses the power of turning men into zombies. As the priest,in his prison cell, is preparing to burn the parchment containing the location of the secret formula, Colonel Mazovia kills the priest and takes the partially-burned parchment. Fade to after the war to an expedition of representatives from all the Allied countries (only those with colonial interests it appears) being sent to Cambodia to find and destroy forever the Secret of the Zombies. The group includes Colonel Mazovia (somewhat akin to sending the fox to guard the hen house); a student of dead languages, Armand Louque; Englishman Clifford Grayson; and General Duval and his daughter Claire. Armand falls in love with Claire, who accepts his proposal of marriage in order to spite Clifford whom she really loves. Later, when Claire, following an accident, runs to Cliff for ...
translation: Since the cinema-loving universe made acquaintance with a guy named George A. Romero, the word "zombie" is automatically associated with blood-soaked horror images and non-stop game sequences. It is safe to say that his "Night of the Living Dead" shaped the zombie movie as we know it now. In the early years of cinema, however, the premise of revived corpses was only used in slow, almost actionless psychological thrillers. Jacques Tourneurs "I've gone with a zombie" is a perfect example, and "White Zombie" with Bela Lugosi. This "uprising of the zombies" could have been another example, but unfortunately it's a failure across the board and easily one of the most boring movies I've ever seen. Terrible spectacle, a very poorly written script and a complete lack of atmosphere and excitement! The movie lasts only 65 minutes and yet the first half hour is completely wasted on stupid love story intrigues and not exciting monologues. The setting in the legendary Cambodian city of Angkor could have led to a more compelling story, but all we ever see is interior photography. The lead actress (Dorothy Stone, textbook blond with curly hair and an ugly nose) irritated me enormously and I always hoped that an enthusiastic undead would suddenly emerge from nowhere to devour her. Bad luck again? If you manage to fight through 60 sleepless minutes, you will be rewarded with a decent final. However, this is still far too little to rate this film positively, let alone a recommendation. Avoid! You should only see this type of film if you have already seen everything else.

summary: In 1939, an intrepid reporter in New York City makes a connection between the story she's covering -- of famous scientists suddenly disappearing around the world, and a recent attack on the city by giant robots. Determined to find the solution to these happenings, she seeks the help of her ex-boyfriend, the captain of a mercenary legion of pilots. The two are investigating the case when the robots attack the city again, though in a stroke of luck, Sky Captain's right-hand man is able to locate their source. They then set off on an adventure in search of the evil mastermind behind these schemes, who is bent on creating a utopia and destroying the current world.
translation: "Sky Captain and the world of tomorrow" (an amazingly unusual title) is just a bad movie. It has no heart, no deep ideas, nothing special. Yes, the CGI backgrounds look interesting, but the result is that it's taken up with an annoying blur. In addition, the film uses music in the same way as "Gilligan's Island" or the Scooby Doo cartoons. Terrible, just terrible. There are also no fresh ideas, just gobs and gobs and gobs and ... etc., which come from older films and series. There is no gatekeeper here, the movie just seems to exist because he can. Save your money and your time. Not entertaining at all.

summary: Shot around the breathtaking coastline of B.C.'s Howe Sound, Whale Music is the triumphant adaptation of Paul Quarringaton's Governor General's Award-winning novel about the redemption of a faded rock star through love and music. Richard J. Lewis' exploration of the reclusive musician's efforts to create a piece of music that will summon the whales is a sensory and emotional tour de force.
translation: I'll tell you a story from the summer of 1994. A friend and I attended a Canada Day concert in Barrie, and it was a who's who of the best Canadian bands of that time. We arrived at 4am, waiting in line almost all morning, and when the doors opened at 9am, we were among the first inside the gates. We then waited and waited in the hot sun, slowly grilling, but we did not care, because the headliners were among our favorites. At some point in the early afternoon, I sat down and fell asleep with my back to the barrier. A screaming girl wearing a Rheostatics T-shirt woke me to my shock and dismay. That's why I hated the rheostatics until today. Apart from her fandom, there is nothing sensible, neither taste nor certainty. Rotten of me, right? Well, in my hatred of the band, I denied the joy that Whale Music is. Desmond Howl had everything. It's hard to say what he lost as he lives in a fantastic manor house sandwiched between the sea and the mountains (the BC region where the movie was shot is breathtaking). The life that most of us dream of is dismantled by dreams, ghosts and its own past, until the day a juvenile criminal breaks in ... and, as it sounds, breaks out. Canadian cinema has several problems. In general, a lack of money and an unbearable lack of help (as if the feature was somehow no longer Canadian) lead to lower production levels than American or British films, and most people do not look or sound like an American movie , Next, Canadian screenwriters often seem so dumbfounded that they do not know how to tell a good story and tell it well. Third, they seem to think that an unaffected nudity (often quite frontal) does something artistic. I'm sure anyone who watches enough Canadian films, especially late in the CBC, knows exactly what I'm talking about. It's almost as if there's a "do not do this" manual out there, and Canadian filmmakers kicked it out long ago. Bruce McDonald's work and the brilliant CRAZY broke that mold and managed to do that Keeping what makes you Canadian while capturing observable production values ‚Äã‚Äãand great stories. Whale music is such a film on the surface. Deeper than just the Canadian isms, it is a profoundly moving story of a man who has lost his footing through grief and excesses and is redeemed by music through love. And that even relieves the rheostatics. :)

summary: A man's terminal illness reunites him with his estranged brother.
translation:
I found this movie for streaming on Netflix and thought I would try it.

The plot revolves around Ryan and Theo Taylor (Colm Feore and David Cubitt), who have seen each other in succession their father has died. Ryan and Theo first argue about who did what. But later, Theo learns that his brother Ryan is not only gay, but also dies of a deadly disease. So Ryan and Theo spend their time improving their differences.

This is such an incredible movie. I only saw Colm Feore in Season 7 of 24, but he was phenomenal. David Cubitt, an actor I NEVER heard of before doing a phenomenal job.

I would recommend this to those who are interested in the gay and lesbian genre. This is a movie you do not want to miss.

I give this movie 10 out of 10 stars. Excellent movie!

summary: The Romeo Division is a special anti-terrorist unit made up of five women and conceived by former government agent John Romeo. When one of the members is killed and an associate kidnapped Anya, the leader, vows revenge. But before long Anya is unsure who she can trust. Can she depend on her comrades? Can she avenge her sister? Can she control her own anger?
translation:
When I saw the Romeo Division for the first time last spring, my first reaction was BRILLIANT! On future visits, however, I was offered more than just masterful filming. This image has a unique voice that will be reflected throughout the history of film history.

The inaugural assembly offers a great palette for Helmer JP Sarro to establish his art on this entertainment screen.

Sarro really uses the camera as a brush, as he takes us on a ride that wraps the audience into a massive action movie that goes beyond the traditional format we've got used to and dives deep in dark themes of betrayal, revenge, and the importance of camaraderie. This movie is the dream of every director.

However, Sarro was not alone in this epic quest. The writing provided by scribe Tim Sheridan was just as breathtaking.

The dialogue was so precise and direct that it gives the actors such presence and charisma on the screen. More specifically, the last scene (WARNING: SPOILERS !!! SPOILERS !!!), in which Vanessa shows herself as one of the coalitions and as a villain, is written in such a dark tone that she is one of the most frightful endings I have ever seen. Sheridan is the next Robert Towne.

In a final note, it is obvious that this production was no small thing.

That's why producer Scott Shipley deserves a lot of praise, who seems to have the creativity and genius in addition to Jerry Bruckheimer. Never before have I seen such a grandiose production with so much attention to every detail. A producer's job is one of the hardest in any movie, and Shipley makes it easy.

All in all, this film combines creative writing, stunning production and masterful direction. This is the art of the film at its best. When the end of the movie arrives, the only thing you want is more.

The Romeo Division is groundbreaking, a masterpiece and, above all, the Romeo Division is art.

summary: Lawyer Rick Magruder has a one-night-stand affair with caterer Mallory Doss. He becomes hooked on her, and when he learns her nut-case father Dixon is threatening her, he puts the weight of his law firm behind Mallory, has Dixon arrested and subpoenas her ex-husband Pete to testify against Dixon in court. Dixon is sent to an asylum, but escapes from there and the lives of many people are in danger.
translation: The only thing noteworthy about this movie? is that all the actors could bomb at the same time. Idiocy. I want my money back ... and I got it from the library for free. Sheesh I would rather chew on the tin joke and shave my head with a cheese grater, then watch again.

Resolute in his pursuit, Marshall engages in a merciless battle with a drug dealer operation that appears to be secretly funded by a rogue arm of the military.

summary: Bus driver Stan Butler agrees to marry Suzy, much to the anguish of Mum, her son-in-law, Arthur, and daughter Olive. How, they wonder, will they ever manage without Stan's money coming in? Then Arthur is sacked, and Stan agrees to delay the wedding. Meanwhile, he hits on an idea: Arthur should learn to drive a bus. Somehow he does just that, and even gets a job. Stan then blackmails the Depot Manager into giving him the job of driver on the new money-making Special Tours Bus. A great idea ...if only the inspector hadn't taken Stan on his trial run to the Windsor Safari Park.
translation:
As a Hammer executor, I was scared of the time when I needed the courage to watch this movie and the subsequent Holiday on the Buses. I saw the movie One the Buses and thought it was one of the worst movies I've ever seen. It was full of all the horrible comedy that plagued British TV screens in the early '70s.

I'm ashamed to say there were actually parts of this movie that I laughed at. I do not know if that was because I was now familiar with the characters and had enjoyed some situations that knew how they would react. I found Blakey particularly funny, though I could not swear at any time in the trilogy that he said his slogan, "I'll get you butler."

After seeing Holiday in the Buses, the jokes started wearing thin and these three films could be compared to an early Hammer trilogy, Dick Barton, since the second movie is the best (though this is probably the only way they can be compared to) Only people who want to watch this movie are probably fans of the TV series who will undoubtedly enjoy it, and Hammer executors like me. To the completeists, I would say that this movie is not so bad, and I can certainly imagine worse hammer comedies.

summary: Sheriff Buford Pusser continues his one-man war against moonshiners and a ruthless crime syndicate after the murder of his wife in late 1960's Tennessee.
translation:
How can they go from Joe Don Baker (as Bufford Pusser in the first sequel) to Bo Svenson (as Bufford Pusser in the second sequel). Why did you do that? I strongly suggest that anyone who intends to watch this cheese should not, and look instead at the first sequel.

summary: Charley Partanna is a hit-man who works for the Prizzis, one of the richest crime syndicate families in the country. Unbeknownst to Charley,the Prizzis just hired Irene Walker, a free-lance killer, to eliminate someone who double-crossed them. When Irene and Charley fall in love their jobs become complicated. Their jobs become impossible when each is given a contract that neither can go through with.
translation:
Eight Academy nominations? It is incredible. I can only think that it was a very bad year - even for Hollywood standards. With Huston as director and Jack Nicholson and Kathleen Turner as leader, I would probably have swallowed the bait and looked at it anyway, but the Oscar nominations really sold it to me, and I feel clearly betrayed by it.

So it's a black comedy, right? Can someone tell me where the humor is in Prizzi's honor? It is undoubtedly tasteless (shooting a policewoman in the head is just a supposedly comic interlude in that intended farce about mafia life), but with the exception of a joke about "your favorite Mexican cigars" (for which I think old joke) Americans who were officially banned from buying Cuban products for 50 years) I have not discovered anything comic - and I've tried. There's a lot of mafia clich√©, but clich√© is not a humor in my book.

Is it a kind of romantic comedy? Never. The characters and their relationships are so incredible and flat that in Gigli they are equivalent to Ben Afleck and Jennifer Lopez.

Is it a nifty parody about the mafia? Not in a million years. The plot is simply pointless absurd and not weird absurd and it usually just feels like a really bad (and cheaper) mafia movie. It feels more like a tribute than a parody.

With one-dimensional characters and little humor written for them, the actors remain dubious accents and make faces. Well, it is not enough; even if the face is drawn by this master of funny expression, Jack Nicholson (puffy upper lip repetition ... now this is supposed to be a parody of Brando's padded cheeks in The Godfather? ... Oh! cares ... everything I do knows, is not funny).

Throw in a slow, busy direction (this movie lasts 2 hours), some hopelessly silly and clich√©d dialogues like; "Do you remember the Camora? Well, we're much taller, we'll track you wherever you are," clich√© manners and you'll reach for the fast-forward button before you "capiche?" Can say. Prizzi's Honor is far from Huston's "masterpiece" and is a rather poor final work. It is definitely a work from the canon of the great director, who should get a concrete coat and throw in the Hudson River.

summary: Horror following a group of medical students who come across the body of the world's most notorious vampire, Dracula (Stephen Billington). When a mysterious stranger appears and offers the students $30 million to harvest the body and steal its blood for auction, it's an offer they can't refuse. But as the lure of riches collides with unimaginable terror, the students also find themselves relentlessly pursued by a vampire killer from the Vatican.
translation:
Mediocrity, laziness and thoughtlessness were written in this film. If you're making a movie about vampires that's been shot a thousandfold, then you should do a damn good job. I'll be the first to say that this movie just did not cut it. Some scary horror movies simply fail to let the form of "begging" be fun, because all the stories are just lies. "Clich√©, this was not different, and like all the creepy movies, there's no turning back when you dare to walk down the street.

And the end? How do the heroes throughout the movie do the same work over and over again, but then mysteriously get wrapped up in the moment and can finish the job The end was very anti-climactic and spelled Part 3, which I'll never see. Terrible movie.

summary: Crime novelist Catherine Tramell is living in London, and becomes the center of police investigation (yet again) when her football player boyfriend drowns in a car accident and it is revealed that he was already dead because of a drug overdose before Tramell drove the car into water. Police psychoanalyst Dr. Michael Glass is called for examining Tramell, and is intrigued by the seductive and manipulative woman. On the other hand , his friend Det. Roy Washburn is sure Tramell is guilty. Tramell asks Glass to treat her for her 'risk addiction' problem, and with each therapy session , Glass gets more and more suspicious about her intentions. As more and more murders are committed, including that of Glass's ex-wife, Glass becomes obsessed with proving Tramell's guilt even though the evidence is contradictory .
translation: I'm not an ordinary commentator on this site, but since I underestimated this movie, I try to write comments and comments about it. I enjoyed watching this movie, maybe because Cat is everything I wish, I could not post spoilers or reveal plans, but there are things that I found really amazing. This is a very underrated movie, I do not have any arguments here, I enjoy it and enjoy it, then talking little about it when going to the movies to have fun, and I have the 1h53 I spent in the dark room I really enjoyed it. One has to be seen again and again, until the joy fades. Let's not be so critical. Thank you for reading.

summary: Out at Pacific Coast University, five students living in the same apartment building go through personal trials. Stacey was a famous volleyball player and fashion model once; now she's in semi-hiding, and someone from her past is stalking her. Serena, a pre-med student from East LA, is losing her scholarship because PCU is cutting back. Joe, fresh from the East Coast, is hiding something from his famous father, and Randy is searching for something to help him define himself apart from his rich dad. Polly just wants a roommate and a friend. Everything comes to a head during a charity volleyball game set up by Jake their landlord, who's a local restaurateur.
translation: Of all the movies (and I'm a movie graduate, if that's worth anything to you), this is the BAD movie I've ever seen. I know that there are probably a few worse ones I have not seen, but I have seen this and that is the worst. A friend and I rented it one night because Denise Richards was on the cover. Talk about young and retarded. She is not in the credits! Her role was incredibly small! How did she make it on the cover? IMDb does not even list it in her filmography. This movie was so bad that we wrote a short message to the video store when we brought it back and put it in the suitcase. It read something like "Please save your other customers from viewing this complete and totally bad movie!"

summary: Victor is growing up on the Lower East Side and is at the age where he is driven by desire and unchained by maturity. His image as a ladies man is shattered when he is found in Fat Donna's bedroom. Soon, as a result of his sister's big mouth, the whole Dominican community knows. Full of confidence, Victor sets out to reclaim his image by winning Judy. Judy proves to be elusive and difficult. Victor persists, and with a surprising tenderness, ultimately wins Judy's heart.
translation:
I can not believe that this movie has reached such a high rating of 6! It's barely visible and incredibly boring, certainly one of the worst movies I've seen in a long, long time the mere impression that you see a totally creative train wreck.

This movie should be avoided at all costs. It's one of those "festival films" that only pseudo-intellectuals like because they're so bad that people think it's "different," so good, "it's just bad filmmaking.

summary: Four young friends have tedious night jobs and meet every night after work in a caf√©. Sean hasn't met his girlfriend in three weeks, Vincent flirts with everybody, Lenny is too afraid to ask a girl at work on a date and Jody can't admit that she shows up at the caf√© every night, although she was fired some time ago.
translation:
The idea is that something interesting happens in the first ten minutes to keep the audience informed. Late night shopping takes much longer to avoid interest. When we get to a point, it's so monumentally idiotic that I always thought I had misunderstood it. But I did not do it.

Sean tells the story of an Osaka landlord who rented the same apartment to two people at the same time, who worked in different shifts and therefore did not know they were sharing. His friend asks, "But what about the weekends?" Sean has no adequate explanation. Sean then tells the story of his own similar problem, that is, he is not sure if his girlfriend still lives at home because he works at night and works during the day so they never see each other. This has been the case for three weeks. But his friend does not ask, "Yeah, but like I said, what about the weekends? You need to see them, it does not make sense, what are you, Sean, are you on medication or something, but be generous and assume that both work seven days a week.

We see Sean checking to see if soap and towels have been used (actually, he starts bizarrely carrying the soap) What about the conditioner and shampoo of his girlfriend, the Sanpro and the moisturizer, the toothpaste and the toothbrush Let's go to the kitchen What about food and drink? Is something missing? Was the bedroom made in the bedroom? Is your clothes used and swapped for clean? Is the laundry basket full? Is the seat in the toilet up or down? I mean, good grief!

And to limit everything, Paul makes an appointment to leave work early to see if his girlfriend still lives at home. Why does not he just call her?

But it is getting worse. In the last act, although Vincent has not told anyone where the rest of the group is going, he finds them. Lenny's love interest and Sean's girlfriend seem to be practically best friends and also find the group. There is not the slightest attempt to explain one of these unusually unlikely coincidences.

To be fair, the dialogue is OK, but not nearly enough to make up for the weak characters or the annoying, lame story.
It did not take much to solve these issues However, on the official website, the director states that the film was not edited in the script. That's all you need to know.

summary: A young actor's fascination with Robert De Niro's "Taxi Driver" persona leads him into a morass of strange and obsessional behaviors.
translation:
Are you talking to me? (1987) is a pretty bad movie with some guys I've never seen before or since then as a neighborhood actor trying to become an actor. He has a heavy Jones for Taxi Driver as he tries to use this Shtick to make it big. When he learns the hard facts of life, he does what everyone else does, changing his image! He goes over to a good guy overnight. His friend can not believe the change (but he scores with Faith Ford and gets a cool, paying gig). Can this young punk keep his street criticism as he grows up?

This is a real, lame movie that tries too much to integrate too many things at the same time. An interesting idea that breaks down due to bad execution. Who knows, maybe someone will pick up the ball and run because the filmmakers fumbled the ball this time.

Do not waste your time with this movie. Unless you want to see a hot Faith Ford and a young Bubba from Forest Gump.

xx

summary: Dr. Bill Cortner has been performing experimental surgery on human guinea pigs without authorization and against the advice of his father, also a surgeon. When Bill's fianc√©e Jan Compton is decapitated in an automobile accident, he manages to keep her brain alive. He now needs to find a new body for his bride-to-be and settles on Doris Powell, a glamor model with a facial disfigurement. Jan meanwhile doesn't want to continue her body-less existence and calls upon the creature hidden in the basement, one of Bill Cortner's unsuccessful experiments, to break loose.
translation:
I would have enjoyed this movie a bit more if Jason (Herb) Evers had not experimented constantly. Many early reviewers of The Seven Samurai accused Toshiro Mifune of being too busy. But as more and more critics thought the film was right, they thought it was intentional. Jason Evers is obviously not Toshiro Mifune, and his overacting is just that.

Most of the actors in this B classic were pretty good actors, except for Evers and the showgirls. If you saw this movie, you would have noticed that Evers screamed almost every line until he smoked and blew the smoke coolly from his nose.

The special effects were normal in a B-movie like this one. In hindsight, I do not notice much, which is fantastic good or bad for this movie.

summary: A semiserious, often rollicking, multigenerational insider's look at the origins of surfing, the colorful and subversive birth of surf culture, and the mythology and lure of the big wave. This passionate and fluid film is without question the first authentic history of surfing from its humble Hawaiian beginnings to the big business it became to the still-rebellious universe it inhabits today. Riding Giants is a study in individuality and freedom, the pursuit and techniques of pure kinetic pleasure, and the risk taking and attitudes that characterize its leading figures. For some viewers, this is perhaps more than they ever wanted to know. But Peralta's detailed knowledge of the surfing lifestyle, its icons and locations, its boom and exploitation by the media, and the fascination it has held for young men for more than five decades is unparalleled and fuels this expedition for the expert and initiate alike. Closely chronicling the sometimes-life-and-death drama that big-wave riding ...
translation:
Riding Giants is a brilliant documentary that dives deep into the world of one of the most underrated sports and brings to the surface a very human and raw emotion that only director Stacy Peralta could capture. Everything, from the structure to the players to the amazing footage, to the style in which it was filmed, only enhanced the beauty and power behind surfing. Of all the surf movies I've seen (Endless Summer, Billabong Odyssey and Step Into Liquid), this was the most consistent and relevant. Beginning with the early days of surfing (a short history lesson) that lasts all the way to Laird's notorious ride, Riding Giants continues into the mind, heart, and soul of the sport than any other of these documentary films. How does it do it? By engaging in the entire story from beginning to end, without fictionalising or jigging from wave to wave.

At first this movie was structurally sound. In the other films I've seen about surfing, you sometimes jump from a new person to a new person, from wave to wave, from event to event, without knowing why or who? In Riding Giants we have a very small cast of veterans and newcomers. That way, you can really immerse yourself in the mind of everyone. Instead of just rippling, we get more story and more personal insight into the world than before. That really attracted me to this movie. I was impressed that instead of showing all these big waves (because it's a big wave movie), we hear stories and see what these surfers had to overcome to get to those waves. I loved the information about the "beach freaks" or the surfers of the father. The incredible stories of Greg Noll and his early deep blue deep adventures are still on the ground. To see him in person and talk about what was going on in his head, he just added more fuel to the fire. The straightforward structure followed by Peralta enabled me to learn more about the sport than the previous films. Peralta shows so much emotion and passion that you can not wonder what these brave people have done and where the sport is heading.

Add some intense and creative camera to a flawless structure, damn almost perfect movie. With techniques I've recently seen in The Kid Stays in the Picture, Riding Giants creates some scenes that almost feel like they're jumping out of the screen. Although it's not 3D, it's the flat sense of dimension you get when you put two images on top of each other. It worked in this movie. It adds more depth to the scenes, adding not only to the shock (the waves were huge), but also to the danger these guys were constantly facing. If it broke or maneuvered wrongly, those waves would kill her. Some have died, but the sport has not stopped. It just created more excitement and more passion to do better. It is this love of the sea and the sport that leads me to my last point.

The human element. So many of my previous adventures in the world of documentary surfing have left me with beautiful waves, but little about humans. The movies knew that people were looking for the waves, so basically it went from wave to wave to wave and maybe a brief second over the person. This movie was the direct opposite. Peralta created this masterpiece by still giving us the waves but paying so much attention to the surfers and the immortal question of why they do it every day. What penetrates her thoughts, what drives her to go further, and the bonds that form out there on the wild blue. I felt that after this movie, I did not just know more about big wave surfing, but also about the emotional side of the sport. This was an element that was not developed as in the other films, and brought Riding Giants to a whole new personal level.

Overall, the movie was brilliant. I have never seen so much passion, dedication and love in a structurally sound film. I was impressed from the beginning to the end. I would be very happy if this year's film won the Oscar for Best Documentary, seeing a new rebirth in the world of surfing and opening more doors to films of this kind.
** from *****

summary: Finals at the prestigious University of Dreyskill are finally over and it's time to party. "The Crew", as they are known by their peers and dorm mates, are invited to a rich classmate's hideaway mansion high up in the hills of Colorado. What was supposed to be a weekend of fun and relaxation quickly becomes a trip they will never forget... If they survive! A simple game of prank scare phone calls becomes an intense game of survival and escape when one of the Crew members accidentally calls the wrong person.
translation: That was not a really good movie. There were many implausible and predictable things that happened throughout the film ... but I think most reviewers miss the point of why this movie should appeal to a wider audience. THIS FILM WAS MADE BY MAGIC JOHNSON! Is not that enough to inspire us all to watch this movie? A movie produced by a former NBA star does not come with you every day, you know. Pretty stupid kids in a big house cut up by an ax with psycho. Every clich√© trotted for us to groan. Teen sex. And everything was produced by MAGIC JOHNSON! I can not say enough about this movie! Teen drug use! College Hijinx! And everything was produced by MAGIC JOHNSON! Yippeeee!

summary: Vampires fighting zombies.
translation:
I really have no idea how to comment on this movie. The special effects were lackluster, the spectacle was terrible and if there was a conspiracy, it was on the back of the box. I do not think I can remember a movie that's been so bad for a long time, and I'm a big fan of lesbian sex and dumbbells !! ;) Even that could not save this movie from a terrible excuse to pay someone to stand in front of a camera (or lying in this case).

"By killing the two apparent heroes in the film, the whole thing was exaggerated. The drama and special effects were at a historic low. You could almost see the hoses pumping out the wrong blood during the close-up of the zombie run over by the general. Speaking of General, where did you like THAT Kenny Rogers anyway? No idea what he was the General apart from generally confusing and misguided ones. All in all, watch the movie if you have nothing better to do or if you have a strong urge to waste $ 3. Only my $ 0.02.

summary: A movie that starts out with the "Man in the Mirror" music video, it then changes to a montage of video clips of Michael's career. Next comes a parody of his Bad video by children, and then Michael is chased by fans in a fantasy sequence. 2 more videos are shown, and then a movie in which Michael plays a hero with magical powers. In it he is chased by drug dealer Mr. Big and saves three children. Videos included in the movie are "Smooth Criminal" and "Come Together".
translation:
And I do not say it bad.

I saw this movie at the age of 6 or 7 years in the cinema. For me and my cousins ‚Äã‚Äãit was magical, beautiful and scary at the same time. When we left the theater, Michael was our best friend, although we knew he had no idea. Over the years, I've seen this movie air a couple of times, but I've always switched channels. Seeing it for a few seconds would bring back that sense of magic and warm my heart. And I liked it that way.

I only saw this movie once and I think it was a good decision not to look at it again. If I have seen it today, I know that I could not help but criticize MJ's acting, the plot (if any) and this and that. For me, this is a childhood memory, so my feelings are those of a child of 20 years ago.

I see that my adult engages in my own assessment and gives him an 8 for the memories and the wonderful music. For the little kid who was awed 20 years ago, it's definitely worth 10.

summary: Alekos and Flora were high school sweethearts 20 years ago. Now both are into unhappy marriages, Flora with Achilles & Alekos with Soso. They meet again and start an affair. At the same time, Achilles goes to a missing-persons TV show to find his long-lost sister Corrina while Soso finds out about the infidelity and decides to kill Alekos.
translation: Eglimata (= crime) is a story about small crimes committed by people in everyday life that could lead to a catastrophe in a crazy scenario. One of the smartest Greek series of all time! Actors like Ketty Konstadinou and Maria Kavogianni showed a whole new dimension of themselves and their talents and gave us moments of incredible "guilty" laughter. Every onlooker seemed to recognize the bad side of his self in one of the characters, or at least on one side of his self that he wished. Actors of all ages playing ever larger and smaller roles gained just as much space in the heart of the Greek public. My personal favorites (apart from the first two I've mentioned) are Vassilis Haralambopoulos, Athinodoros Prousalis and Stavros Nikolaidis, but so many amazing actors have passed through some episodes from time to time. Anyone who understands Greek all over the world should find a way to see it, even though it has been on television for more than five years. In Greece, the series (ANT1) is repeated on every occasion where there are summer or early afternoon zones. We will never forget Eglimata or the cast teams!

summary: Mike O'Donoghue's parody of "Mondo Cane" showcases curious performers, strange musicians, celebrity mutations and unusual short films, including Thomas Alva Edison's "Elephant Electrocution".
translation: Mr. Mike was probably the most misanthropic comedian of all time, so I was interested in seeing what he would do with total creative control over a movie. Unfortunately, it's not customizable, but not because the jokes are not funny - some of them (I do not say most), and in fact, Mr. Mike has done a good job translating his mentally unbalanced screeds into visual gags. The problem is that the technical quality (sets, lighting, sound, editing, you name it) is so horrible that the movie is unbearable. Some outfits named "PKO Productions" receive the production credit, but do not look at all; It looks like Mike stole one of the cameras from the SNL kit and did it one afternoon. I understand that Mike's goal was to torment the audience, but it also deserves some basic standards, such as the ability to actually see, hear, or understand what's shocking. Nevertheless, the DVD is not a total waste: it contains a laudatory speech on O'Donoghue by Bill Murray and three "Mr. Mike's favorite bedtime stories" by SNL. Also, the movie's "cat-swimming" section is a great scene you can watch if you want to freak someone out. 3.10

summary: This is the story of Magnus Pym, from his childhood to the end of his career in middle age. As a young man, there is little doubt that his father Rick was the most influential character in his life. Rick was a raconteur, con man, thief, black marketer and all in all, simply larger than life. From a young age, Rick included Magnus in his schemes and the young man learned that you would do anything for the ones you love. When a university student in Switzerland, Pym meets the other person who will have the greatest influence in his life, Axel, a Czech refugee. As Pym enters his career in the British Secret Service, his relationship with Axel and the values he developed in childhood lead him down his own path of betrayal and loyalty.
translation: Undoubtedly the best of the novels of John Le Carre, exquisitely transformed into a classic movie. Performances by Peter Egan (Magnus Pym, The Perfect Spy), Rudiger Weigang (Axel, real name Alexander Hampel, Magnus 'Czech secret service), Ray McAnally (Magnus Con-Man-Father) and Alan Howard (Jack Brotherhood, Magnus' Mentor) (Believer and British controller) are so perfect and natural along with the rest of the characters that the person responsible for the cast would have received a prize. Even the small parts like Major Membury are executed perfectly. For the power of performance and the strength of the novel's characters, much is said that despite the duplicity of Magnus, one can not help but feel closer to Magnus and Axel than Jack Brotherhood and the slimy Grant Lederer of US Intelligence. I've read the book at least a dozen times and seen the movie almost as often and am still fascinated by both. If I took a book on a desert island, A Perfect Spy would be the choice before anyone else.

summary: Dee and Dawn are two dim-witted, pink-clad, blond ladies whom meet by accident and try to make a living with their dull lives, until a series of circumstances ensue when after they unwittingly take jobs at a local strip club, they are mistaken for two deadly female brunette assassins known only as the Cat and the Kit whom are hired to kill the club owner whom is a mobster in a witness protection program. With two persistent, but inept, FBI agents on their tail, the ditsy Dee and Dawn try to stay one step head of the law, as well as try to figure out what is really going on.
translation:
When I was in the movie shop the other day, I gave up blondes and blondes, but something just seemed like a cute movie. Who knows? I mean, I'm sure most people beat Romy and Michelle before they saw it. Blond and blonde were just another secret treasure that was passed over. But when I started to see it: executive producer Pamela Anderson, wow, I knew I had something weird in mind. Not only that, but also what was considered the pinnacle of sharpness: Pam Anderson and Denise Richards, so as not to offend them, but they did not get older, and they played roles I thought were more for women, Those who are in their 20s should not be in their 40s. The story was just awful and disgusting.

Dee and Dawn are your stupid stereotypical blondes, they really have no idea what's going on in the world, it's really just sad. But if the girls are somehow confused with murder bombers, the cops are in their history, calling the girls "geniuses" because of their "ignorance as bliss" attitude. They are set to "beat" a guy, and they think they'll just "show him a good time", but the real assassin is ticked and wants to kill the case and the girls.

Denise and Pam look very awkward on the screen and almost as if they read the script the day before. I know that this should be the stupid comedy, but it was more than stupid, it was intrusive and was just unnecessary. Would I ever recommend this? Not in a million years, the girls are just trying to maintain their status as a "sex kitten", it's more a sign of desperation and Blonde and Blonde is a huge blonde BOMBshell.

1/10

summary: Two American tourists on a romantic camping trip are brutally murdered. A few days later, during the ancient festival of Samhain, a group of American university students moves into a beautiful cottage, surrounded by a lush forest and a majestic lake They are here to learn about the rituals of the ancient Druids and other Celtic legends. But in the remains of an abandoned copper mine, lives the ancestors of an incestuous clan of cannibals. Stalked by a hulking, disfigured mutant, the students and their chaperone are in for the most harrowing time of their young lives. And keeping their heads on their necks will become their main concern...
translation:
this movie has its good points: hot chicks dying people

the problem ... the hot chicks barley gets naked and you do not see many of the people dying, mostly just a lot of fast movements and screaming, though there are two gave good kill scenes.

Also for those of you who see this for JENNA JAMESON, she is just a minor choreographer with a very minor role and minor-nude scenes.

What this movie needed ... The script and story would be nice, but I will not complain. Simply put, it takes more nudity and better scenes to kill, because we have to look at it. That's why we watch those movies ...

I would not waste my money ... and if you have to, wait until it's on the OLD shelves of your local video store

summary: The paranoid registrant administrator of the Department of Public Safety Erroll Babbage is forced to an early retirement due to his abusive behavior against the sex offenders that he should monitor, and shall spend his last eighteen days training his replacement Allison Lowry. When the seventeen years old Harriet Wells is considered missing in his area of work, Errol is convinced that her disappearance is related to one of his parole sex offenders. However, his superiors do not believe on his investigations and he convinces Allison to follow him in the sick underworld of pornography and perversions trying to find the missing girl.
translation: I saw the movie "The Flock" because of the casting of Gere and Danes and because the story synopsis sounded interesting. This was one of the worst movies I've seen in a long time (and I've seen a few turkeys). I've never posted online, but this movie was so horrible that I had to do that. I suppose the problems start with the script, which was so amateurish that it is unbelievable. History makes no sense and dialogue is so banal that it is disgusting. Poor Gere, he deserves so much better. As for the Gere / Danes on screen, one does not believe any of the characters for one minute because of the horrible writing. I bet Gere wishes he could buy back the negative if that were possible. It's a shame to waste so many talents, not to mention the desire to get my 2 hours back. (I know what you think, how do I really feel?)

summary: In a world overtaken by eternal darkness, the buttoned down entomologist abandons his phantoms to embrace the unknown. Oscar is a conservator at the Natural Science Museum, and spends most of his days surrounded by bugs. When Oscar isn't tending to the tiny specimens that line his home and workplace, he can frequently be found reflecting on his childhood traumas in the psychiatrist's office. One day, Oscar returns home from work to find an African woman from the museum lying in his bed.
translation:
Extremely interesting and fascinating movie. The similarities with David Lynch (who is even literally quoted by red curtains in the film) and the novels of Franz Kafka (the janitor in this movie is called Mrs. Grubach, as well as the process in The Process ...) are clearly present in this However, there are clear indications of the colonial past of Belgium in Africa. The exact content of the film I can not clearly describe: This colonialism is an important part, as well as the inability to cope with such a past, but also the personal memories of the main character are a central theme and his pursuit of social life contact and love. These are the symbolic themes that I have derived from the film, but in reality they are nothing more than impressions.

But even if you try to follow the linear story without these symbolic backgrounds, you will still discover an extremely fascinating movie with beautiful pictures (beautiful close-ups of Beatles, larvae and other evil insects alternate with it great dream sequences and also the dark atmosphere gives the movie extra style). Maybe I can say that I did not quite "understand" the movie, but I watched hypnotized for 1.5 hours, deeply impressed by the visual quality and the mesmerizing mystery.

summary: Jealousy eats at Louise. Like Esau, Louise is a twin, a few minutes older than Caroline, who, like Jacob, is the family favorite. Blond, pretty, with a voice like an angel, Caroline is selfish. Louise is plain, brunette, unappreciated, and hard-working, crabbing and oystering on the Chesapeake Bay island where they live, the money she earns paying for Caroline's voice lessons. In her seventeenth year, between the Christmases of 1941 and 1942, with the help of an old sea captain who's fought his own demons of bitterness and anger, Louise must get past her jealousy and figure out what it is she wants, what it is that she loves.
translation: That was just terrible. I read this book for the school, I did all the tests and I saw it that way! My teacher forced me and 20 other people to look at it, and it was worse than Leonard Part 6, Plan 9 from Outer Space, and Hudson Hawk together. What made this movie so horrible was enough reason to kill itself. First it was done on Hallmark. Second, the spectacle was terrible. Third, it was very different from the book. Literally it was so bad that I apologized. Basically, I would prefer Basic Instinct 2 to this. Take my advice, do not watch this movie. Nobody would want to see that. It was terrible. DREADFUL!

summary: To make Sidney's slump all the more painful, Clifford Anderson, a student of one of Sidney's writing seminars, has recently sent his mentor a copy of his first attempt at playwrighting for Sidney's review and advice. The play, "Deathtrap," is a five character, two act thriller so perfect in its construction that, as Sidney says, "A gifted director couldn't even hurt it." Using his penchant for plot, and out of his desperate desire to once again be the toast of Broadway, Sidney, along with Myra, cook up an almost unthinkable scheme: They'll lure the would-be playwright to the Bruhl home, kill him, and market the sure-fire script as Sidney's own. But shortly after Clifford arrives, it's clear that things are not what they seem! Indeed, even Helga Ten Dorp, a nosey psychic from next door, and Porter Milgram, Sidney's observant attorney, can only speculate where the line between truth and deception lies.
translation: This is one of my favorite movies of all time. It's great and the acting is brilliant. In the scene where Michael Caine sheds tears on the police and then stops the waterworks, the second call that ends the call shows Caines brilliance. The twists are a lot of fun. The movie is first class.

summary: Two losers from Milwaukee, Coop & Remer, invent a new game playing basketball, using baseball rules. When the game becomes a huge success, they, along with a billionaire's help, form the Professional Baseketball League where everyone gets the same pay and no team can change cities. Coop & Remer's team, the Milwaukee Beers is the only team standing in the way of major rule changes that the owner of the Dallas Felons wants to institute.
translation: There are so many words I want to use to describe this movie, but can not I really? This movie is a movie to watch if you just want to sit, laugh, cry and then pee. I'm serious. Do not look at this movie if it's easily offended by obscenity, sex, nudity, homosexuality, and anything connected to nature. Being a woman and maybe not even a factor, I can watch this movie over and over again. Trey Parker and Matt Stone are absolutely brilliant. I think Baseketball is the winner, along with all its other debuts. Now I'm just laughing at some of the stupid things they do in the movie. Watch the movie !! That's all I'll say. It's hard for me to leave that comment because I'm one of those people, like Ozzy Osbourne, who has a curse in almost every line that gushes out of her mouth when they speak. So I think it's professional. Best movie. Crap yes !!

summary: 5 college guys head to a resort in Cabo to do what college guys do during spring break in Mexico, filming it reality show style. Will the remaining virgin manage to lose his virginity before returning to the US?
translation:
This is a documentary, it's not like that, it's filmed like a documentary, but I guess it was just because they got away with a shaky camera and dodgy movies. This has just been released on DVD in the UK as "American Pie style comedy", that's not it.

Basically, it follows a group of teenagers going on spring break when they go to Mexico for cheap liquor and endeavor to finally get their virgin friend down there. Throw is a few dwarfs, even on the same kind of search, and you have a nondescript story of drunken teenagers trying to get some girls.

Considering rating 18, this has very little nudity and practically zero sex scenes, mainly I appreciate that the rating applies to cursing, of which there are many.

If you like crude Jackass behavior without humor, then this may be your thing, if you have brain cells links I would probably avoid that!

summary: A businessman becomes the target for a ruthless criminal who mistakes him for the thief who stole his drug money.
translation: When you first watch this movie, it's hard to know what happened, but when you look at it, it becomes clearer. I enjoyed this movie. Dean Cain was excellent in the role of Bob. Lexa Doig's character was confusing, first she wanted to trap Bob, but I really think she loved him even though she had broken his heart at the time. The performance of Dean Cain was usually excellent. He gets better with every movie. My only question at the end of the movie was what happened to Bob, Camilla and the baby. It was up to the viewer to decide

summary: Passing through a small Georgia town on their way to Florida, four young college girls witness the local sheriff murder a woman. They try to escape before he murders them, too.
translation: Four teenage girlfriends go to Springdale to Fort Laurdale. Unfortunately, they get a flat tire in Medley, Georgia and one of the girls witnesses a brutal murder deep in the forest. The local sheriff is behind the crime and the nightmare begins ... "Shallow Grave" is a pleasant low-budget surprise. The cast is sympathetic enough, the direction is stable and the violence is especially evil and misogyny. Especially the second murder is pretty dark. The Murderous Sheriff Is Not A One-Dimensional Character In some scenes, it seems he feels remorse for what he did. The subplot of the two boys they meet at the diner is nowhere to go, but the stalking scenes in the woods are tense and exciting.7 out of 10.

summary: "But if you forget to come back for Madame Zeroni, you and your family will be cursed for always and eternity." Those were the exact words spoken to young Elya Yelnats the day he forgot to repay Madame Zeroni. From then on his family was cursed with bad luck. One hundred years later Stanley Yelnats IV is accused of stealing a pair of cleats from a major league baseball player and sent to Camp Green Lake (a dry lake bed in the middle of the desert). It never rains at Camp Green Lake, it hasn't for one hundred years. The secretive and mysterious Warden has each inmate spend every day digging one hole to "build character." But when an artifact from the famous "Kissin' Kate" Barlow is found in a hole, the Warden forces the boys to work double time leading Stanley to deduce they're digging because the Warden is looking for something. But what? And how is the mystery of Camp Green Lake connected to Stanley's family curse?
translation:
I read holes in 5th grade. When I heard that they were making a movie, I was thrilled. Of course I had no opportunity to see the movie in the cinemas. Holes were on the drive-in out of town, but unfortunately we were just too busy. I was surprised to hear that all my friends had seen it and none of them had invited me! They all said it was good, but I read great books that made crappy films, and I was definitely worried.

Suddenly the perfect opportunity to see it come. It was this week and my parents were on a cruise and I had to take care of myself. My sister, who is 9 years old, and I have seen it and totally loved it! I then brought it to the other people I was a babysitter and their kids, 9 and 4, liked it too. Even my parents loved it and they are definitely movie critics. Overall, I recommend this movie to anyone who understands family morality and loves a fun cast! This movie should be on your top 5 list "See" !!!!

summary: Conrad and Sally Walden (Spencer Breslin and Dakota Fanning) are home alone with their pet fish. It is raining outside, and there is nothing to do. Until The Cat in the Hat ('Mike Myers') walks in the front door. He introduces them to their imagination, and at first it's all fun and games, until things get out of hand, and The Cat must go, go, go, before their parents get back.
translation:
Holy Cow, what a piece of this movie. I did not know how these filmmakers could make a 250-word book into a movie. I think they did not know either! I can not remember farting or belching in the book, right?

They took all of the classic classics of the kids, added fart, belching and sexual inuindo and prostituted it to a KAKA joke. This should give you a good idea of ‚Äã‚Äãwhat these Hollywood producers think. I have to say, visually it was interesting, but the brilliant visual story is ruined by the toilet humor (if you even think that's funny), I do NOT want the kids that I know they think it is.

Do not take your children with you, do not rent the DVD. I hope the ghost comes from Doctor Suess Ghost and follows the people who made this movie.

summary: A plane explodes; one passenger is a London businessman who's insured for $1 million. His unfaithful wife is the beneficiary. The insurance agency arranges to pay, but also assigns their top investigator, Peter Lynch, to sniff out irregularities. The widow goes to Greece for the payout; Peter follows her, introducing himself. He becomes her protector and her companion, but the relationship is short lived. She has decided to take the money in cash and plans an immediate trip to Tokyo. Is she guilty of her husband's murder, and if so, who's her accomplice? An Athenian police inspector, an Interpol agent, and a French photojournalist join Lynch in the investigation.
translation:
La Coda Dello Scorpione was the successor to director Sergio Martino after the wonderful Giallo Strano Vizio della Signora Wardh. This is the epitome of Giallo, which encompasses all aspects of the genre he has come to know and love. Twisty plot, beautiful girls, black gloves, sharp blades and a bit of gore all make up a piece of Italian exploitation. A group of Gialli favorites, both in front of and behind the camera, can help make this one of the best non-Argento gialli. There is the aforementioned Martino, who adds a touch as a director, star Ernesto Gastaldi as writer, Bruno Nicolai who creates the music, and a number of Giallo stars and starlets such as George Hilton, character actor Luigi Pistilli and the returning Anita Strindberg br />
Does Scorpione with all this talent behind it? You bet The movie works on many different levels. It's an exciting thriller, a thrilling and violent horror movie and a thriller thriller. All in all one of the best Gialli.

Martino definitely knows what fans want when it comes to Gialli. In some parts of the film, he seems to almost channel Argento in his approach. In Bird With the Crystal Plumage, for example, there is a direct rip-off of the scene where the killer tries to break the door, which actually surpasses Argento's film.

Are there any problems with the movie? ? Hmmm ... only smaller ones. First, any scenes that do not follow the murders or the emerging romance between the two leaders begin to bore. But just before you fall asleep, the killer jumps out of nowhere and you are immediately back on track.

Towards the end, the twists become a bit too bizarre. I mean, what purpose did the scorpionsticks really serve? If you do not pay much attention to the dialogue, you may easily lose yourself with the confusing, web-like plot.

But these little trifles aside, La Coda Dello Scorpione is tense, exciting, stylish and all-around entertaining movie for Giallo fans. Find it out!

summary: In Dallas, when the two prime witnesses against the drug-lord Octavio Perez are murdered by his gangsters in a safe-house, the testimony of the FBI agent Kate Jensen and three other agents become the only chance to keep the criminal in prison. They are lodged in another safe-house to wait for the trial, but the place is invaded by the criminals and the agents are executed. However, Kate is only wounded and her boyfriend Nick believes there is a traitor in the agency and decides to bring her to his ranch in the country to protect her life with his reliable local friends.
translation:
One of the worst movies I've seen with bad camera, crappy filter operation, film was grainy, script was awful, I mean, come on, how predictable was the big fight in the end ...

Some The fight scenes were okay, I guess.

Some scenes were so bad that it was weird ... like Sorbo getting the horse in the end and riding in the end ... LOL, I really mean .. a horse? Oh, I can not forget how the bad assassins roll around in the same vehicle throughout the movie. One might think that after killing key witnesses and federal agents, they would have been tracked down. ETC, ETC really does not mind. ,

summary: A bump on the head sends Hank Martin, 1912 mechanic, to Arthurian Britain, 528 A.D., where he is befriended by Sir Sagramore le Desirous and gains power by judicious use of technology. He and Alisande, the King's niece, fall in love at first sight, which draws unwelcome attention from her fianc√©e Sir Lancelot; but worse trouble befalls when Hank meddles in the kingdom's politics.
translation: Hello, I have to comment on this wonderful, exciting and believable story of romance and intrigue. The music is wonderful and unforgettable. Very good colorful movie. summary: In Paris, the pedantic Alexandre lives with his mate Marie in her apartment, an open relationship. Alexandre, who is idle and chauvinist, spends his days reading, drinking and shagging women. After flirting with his former affair, Gilberte, who tells him that she will marry soon her boyfriend, Alexandre meets the Laenne Hospital nurse Veronika Osterwald and they schedule a date. Alexandre learns that Veronika is a promiscuous woman that loves to shag and introduces her to Marie. They have a threesome and Alexandre has a crush on Veronika.
translation: This film is so complex that it can be described in any way and still play along. They have an insecure, restless and intriguing protagonist (played by Jean-Pierre L√©aud) trapped between two (no, three) women. We hear his social, philosophical and moral idiosyncrasies in endless monologues, we see him surround his three magical women he loves. This could be the premise for a poultry movie that is full of stiff, cold, uninteresting comments. Director Jean Eustache, however, manages to keep it fresh, ironic and funny. Since it's such a long film, it's imperative to laugh when Jean-Pierre L√©aud suddenly shouts on the phone after two hours of polite speech, recalling a cheesy line from a movie. These situations are purely filmic and can not be completely restored in a commentary. Still someone can restore the tragic and painfully beautiful monologue by Fran√ßoise Lebrun towards the end of the film. 3 1/2 hours and worth every minute.

summary: In this second installment to the original Care Bear Movie trilogy of the 1980s, the Care Bear Family goes on their first Caring Mission--to stop the evil doings of a demon villain, named Dark Heart, from taking over a summer camp while making the Bears and Cousins vanish forever. In exchange for the Family's capture, he gives a camper named Christy the chance to succeed as the "Camp Champ" over her so-named rival. While starting the Kingdom of Caring, its founders (True Heart Bear and Noble Heart Horse) will stop at nothing to end the wrath of the Bears' first villain. Christy's friends, Dawn and John, and the rest of the Family join them in doing so. Narrating the tale is the Great Wishing Star (voiced by Chris Wiggins), who also helps True Heart and Noble Heart start the Kingdom, as both of them take care of the little orphan Cubs.
translation:
Every kid has this movie he puts in the VHS when he has nothing to do or when a babysitter is around. This was the movie for me.

I can tell you the whole plot, I must have seen it at least 100 times, and I can say that it is a good children / family movie.

You just love the nursing bears and their message.

summary: A political satire set in Turaqistan, a country occupied by an American private corporation run by a former US Vice President. In an effort to monopolize the opportunities the war-torn nation offers, the corporation's CEO hires a troubled hit man, to kill a Middle East oil minister. Now, struggling with his own growing demons, the assassin must pose as the corporation's Trade Show Producer in order to pull off this latest hit, while maintaining his cover by organizing the high-profile wedding of Yonica Babyyeah, an outrageous Middle Eastern pop star, and keeping a sexy left wing reporter in check.
translation:
Joshua Seftel's first film - a satire of memorable proportions - is about what the title says: the impact of corporations on the war.

The film is about a mercenary (John Cusack) traveling to Turaqistan (not a real movie) country, fyi) to help the American government to convey its message to the leaders of Turaqistan. He meets a reporter (Marisa Tomei) and we all know what will happen to a lonely man + a hot reporter. Somewhere in the mix, a pop star named Yonica Babyyeah is thrown in. When Yonica marries one of Turaquistan's most important people (a son of the president), a subplot is created in which the mercenary has to oversee that star. The movie starts with a lonely cusack in a bar; no more than fifteen seconds later, the film captivates. With its amusing and fascinating insights into terrorism and politics, the running time of the film is influenced by you. The movie has much more action than I expected, with occasional theaters of war, well-choreographed battles, and only a few murderous scenes. Although the story is not very deep, the film's simplicity makes the movie perfect for both the common man and film critic.

In the final act of the film, everything revolves around the simplicity very hostile and confused. I thought it was done very well, but others may disagree, and I could understand why. Twist-by-Twist is the ultimate goal, and like most movies, it's a real hit / miss situation. Regardless, the film's three authors (Mark Leyner, Jeremy Pikser & John Cusack) did a fantastic job creating a realistic and entertaining satire about the current overseas situation. Joshua Seftel does an outstanding job to assure the film's integrity; not reduce the material to the most superfluous films (which I feared would happen). Seftel has made the movie as perfect as possible: he has created a lively atmosphere that explores both the harsh reality and the caricature craving. - perfect contrast - and the movie feels as if you would see everything. Seftel really gets you into the action and it's worth it. No missteps here. Hopefully he'll do more directing jobs, because he's one of the directors to watch out for.

summary: Lolita 2000 is a modern adaptation of Vladimir Nabokov's novel from exotic and sci-fi perspective.
translation: Cybil Richards conducts another Full Moon / Surrender Cinema masterpiece of eroticism. This time around, Jacqualine Lovell (dressed in a rather silver outfit) has the task of destroying all evidence of sexual activity. However, she can not resist looking at the tapes and she somehow likes them. The sex scenes are well filmed and set for an excellent soundtrack (at least for this type of movie). The cast is mostly awful and above all very average. Jacqueline Lovell is her exceptionally attractive self and manages to lay bare her breasts and fumble between sex files. It also fits in with a little lesbian activity. To be honest, Lovell deserves so much better than this kind of fare. Here she looks great naked, but is in her silver clothes that tells the "drama", much more attractive. Absolute garbage movie with Lovell and soundtrack the only true salvation features. Mediocre even for Surrender's performance and clearly a new budget, which is low for them too.

summary: Sexy, romantic comedy about a girl in her early 20s named Violet Sanford going to NYC to pursue a dream of becoming a songwriter. Violet gets a "day" job as a bar maid at a nightclub called Coyote Ugly. Coyote Ugly is the city's newest hot spot where the employees are a team of sexy, resourceful women that provoke the clientele and press with their mischief.
translation:
Just remember, it costs $ 250,000 to make "clerks." How the hell did they spend $ 45 million to make this transfigured music video? A virtually unknown cast, two or three movements, no special effects I could see ... I know it must have been written for this professionally designed, thrifty and suspenseful script. Shoot, the bar set must have cost a bundle. I think Jerry Bruckheimer would not get caught if he did something for less. I'm just surprised that he did not blow anything up.
