IMO It seems only a pity that this rather mediocre project could be made for $ 5 million without loss of production, and another six more $ 5 million worth of merit films could have been made.

summary: A young woman in L.A. is having a bad day: she's evicted, an audition ends with a producer furious she won't trade sex for the part, and a policeman nabs her for something she didn't do, demanding fellatio to release her. She snaps, grabs his gun, takes his uniform, and leaves him cuffed to a tree where he's soon having a defenseless chat with a homeless man. She takes off on the cop's motorcycle and, for an afternoon, experiences a cop's life. She talks a young man out of suicide and then is plunged into violence after a friendly encounter with two "vatos." She is torn between self-protection and others' expectations. Is there any resolution for her torrent of feelings?
translation:
I'm not sure why this movie received such rave reviews.

When I saw "Bang" on television one evening, I was bored with the nonsensical, random plot that appeared on the screen. The entire film seems to be nothing more than an exercise in pointless, artistic-furzerischer indulgence of the filmmaker. The fact that the director / writer calls a moniker with a name reinforces this feeling of presumption.

Those interested in indie movies are better off looking for something better, and dare I say, more entertaining than this complete waste of time.

summary: Tormented by the death of young son, Captain Jeff Walker patrols the most dangerous territory on earth in his Blackhawk... Afghanistan. Walker is risk taker, hero to some, a danger to everyone. When he and reporter Kris Andrews are shot down over a vicious warlord's territory, Walker seeks to save her, and in the process find himself.
translation:
Impressive. I've seen some really bad movies in my time, but this one really takes the cake. It's the worst movie I've seen in the last decade - no exaggeration.

As a veteran of the US Army of the war in Afghanistan, it was almost impossible to finish this ridiculous movie, not because it brought back memories - far from it - but because there was absolutely no attempt To find "authenticity" somewhere in the movie. Not so much the smallest shred. It seemed as if it had been written by an eight-year-old child who got all his ideas about war (and soldier behavior) directly from comics. The film was filmed in Honduras, which was supposed to be a clue, but even that can not fully explain the gruesome output of this stereotyped garbage. I could try to list endless technical defects, but it would take forever. From the old shoulder parts of the unit, which were not seen or worn since World War II, and the character's name tags, such as "ColCollins" (worn by the figure "Colonel Collins"), actually written with the inverted mirror image "N" "The Russian alphabet (not the American alphabet) just goes on and on - the uniforms, the equipment, the plot, and above all, the behavior of the characters themselves - every single scene was just full of ridiculous mistakes, inaccuracies and absolutely pointless ones Clich√©s.

Neither the plot itself nor the characters were that credible or believable, it was all extremely ridiculous, this was obviously a movie aimed primarily at pre-pubescent boys, and I doubt it Not that even they would find this film absolutely absurd.

In short, this movie has absolutely NO redeeming qualities n at all. It is a total waste of time. I would urge everyone who reads this to get past this garbage; It really is not worth wasting a single moment of your time.

summary: Based on a comic book series. A woman burned at the stake in 15th century Sweden actually is Satan (Lucifer)'s daughter - and plots revenge against him.
translation: First and foremost I would like to tell you that I like comics, anime, animations and the like. It's true that everyone has their own preferences, but you can trust me in this movie. I will be objective. It's okay to start the story. Follow the history of comic books as far as I know them. But the animation ... Well, it's not really terrible, but it's definitely cheap and mediocre. It would be much better if they did not try to imitate the anime style and stick to the original cartoon style drawings. If we pretend we do not see the rare, sloppy effects of fire and lightning, you could say that the movie was shot about 10 years ago and even more. Looks a bit like the original Vampire Hunter D from 1985. Take Heavy Metal FAKK 2000 for example - four years ago they made a movie that looks much better! In addition, the vocal talents do nothing special, the music is nothing special. All in all - there is a lack of atmosphere. I saw it, but I can not say that I really enjoyed it. It just does not catch you. There is a lot of blood and violence, but that does not impress me at all. Maybe it's shocking for someone who has never seen more mature animations and sees animated blood for the first time (is there anyone around?), But I do not think that's the audience for this movie. So they could add some nudity and spice. The chicks around Lucifer were delicious and we have Lady Death ourselves! There are few sexy looks, but that's not enough. Instead of Bill Brown's music, I think it would look better on a hard rock / heavy metal soundtrack. All in all, the movie is not that bad, but if you want something better, take the original Heavy Metal, Heavy Metal FAKK 2000, Ralph Bakshi's Fire and Ice or Wizards. And of course - vampire hunter D: Bloodlust

summary: The spaceship Marco Polo is returning from a mission at the newly discovered planet Rossum. While the five members of the crew are in deep sleep a mysterious shape is captured on one of the surveillance monitors. Awakened the crew soon discover that one of their number has been killed, and something is living among them in the shape of a crewmate. But who is it??
translation:
OK. I admit. I'm one of the nerds who spent many hours with my beloved DVD player and my wonderful television to watch science fiction series. Star Trek (Next Generation) was my first space event and since then I've been changing partners regularly. I've seen them all, it seems, and my favorites are "Lexx," "Farscape," and the new "Battlestar Galactica," in other words, the latest space operas. But I'm generally into the old-fashioned, the cheap, the crush, like the great, four-year BBC show "Blakes7." Here are the budgets smaller than hobbits, the special effects seem to have been made on a Commodore 64, but who cares if the scripts are written sharp and intelligent with dark humor, the real dead are serious and sometimes even high class? >
But why do you always speak English in the future? Because this is NOT the future, it's fantasy for kids. Still, it can be irritating at times. I, as a Norwegian, have often condemned this terrible fact that you never make genres such as science fiction for Scandinavian viewers. I never thought that this could have happened. But in fact, even in my homeland, Norway. I was two years old when the so-called Fjernsynsteatret (Television Theater Division) of our state public broadcaster Nrk produced this version with three episodes of Blindpassasjer (The Stowaway). When I first heard about it, I was not surprised that the show has been shown only once in Norway so far, which makes it impossible for me to actually see it. It has also been shown on Swedish, Danish and Finnish television at the time, but that was a long time ago. There was no video or DVD release, no surprise, and when it was shown in an arthouse cinema, it happened in Bergen, a city far away from Oslo (where I live). And another thing about "Blindpassasjer" did not surprise me, it was written by the two Norwegian authors Tor √Öge Bringsv√¶rd and Jon Bing (Bing & Bringsv√¶rd). This duo introduced the SciFi genre to Norwegians in the 1970s; They published anthologies and wrote what they called fable prose. In my opinion, Bringsv√¶rd is the most interesting of the two writers and has written several great and entertaining novels, even masterpieces, some of them hilarious, such as Bazar and Syvsoverskens Dystre Frokost. No one but this man, also a celebrated playwright, could construct the script of Blindpassasjer.

When I finally saw it, it was a weird Swede who recorded the three episodes on VCR, and the 80's finally managed to convert it to DVD and give it to me. He was a nice guy. So I sat down and looked at it, with Swedish subtitles, bad sound and some scratches and mistakes. But the thing came through and I was surprised that I finally loved it.

The outdoor scenes with the spaceships and planets are better than those of Blakes7, and the recognition goes to the Caprino studios (who made the famous Fl√•klypa Grand Prix), and the interior of the Marco Polo (the spaceship ) works better than I expected. The drama is typically theatrical, but it works better than playing Ibsen, to put it mildly, and Bj√∏rn Floberg has a solid role to play, as does Trini Lund. Legendary actress Henny groans her lines in a serious and relaxed tone that suits the genre, but this is an ensemble, and I'm happy to say that Ola B. Johannesen wears his mustache in the nobility and Marit √òstbye a really hot room Chic of my standards.

But is it really that good? Well, you have to swallow the rather abrupt end, the overbearing criticism of "modern society", but yes, it's not really that fantastic, but charming, cool, nostalgic and enjoyable. One and a half hours of classic Norwegian sci-fi.

summary: Conrad and Sally Walden (Spencer Breslin and Dakota Fanning) are home alone with their pet fish. It is raining outside, and there is nothing to do. Until The Cat in the Hat ('Mike Myers') walks in the front door. He introduces them to their imagination, and at first it's all fun and games, until things get out of hand, and The Cat must go, go, go, before their parents get back.
translation:
The cat in the hat is just a slap in the face. Mike Myers as The Cat in Hat is downright funny and Mike Myers could not have been worse. This is his worst movie ever. The acting and the story were just awful. I mean, how could you talk about Dr. Frank's favorite stories? Make Seuss become a movie that is one of the worst films of all time and disappointment. I could not have seen a worst movie except Baby Geniuses. But this movie is so bad that I can not even describe how badly he made this movie. Bo Welch should be fired or the author should do it.

Hedens Viewpoint: 0/10 No stars F

summary: A small community is besieged by vampires. After he watches friends ravaged in a convenience store, a lone avenger goes off to do battle with the undead, armed with shotgun, chainsaw, and Holy water. Later he finds other survivors and they try to stay alive long enough to do battle with Liven, king of the vampires.
translation:
A small town is being attacked by a horde of bloodthirsty vampires. The only hope is a single avenger and a group of composite survivors.

Released in 1993, "Darkness" gained some cult following his release. It's easy to understand why - it's filled with gore (and I mean, damn loaded), and it's energy and enthusiasm like you would find on other no-budget cult horror movies like "The Dead Next Door" and "The Children of Ravensback" finds. is actually quite contagious.

Even if that's true, it's not enough to save it. The movie was filmed on a Super 8, so the picture is grainy and dark, making it very difficult to see (it would have been great if it had masked the terrible mullet of the protagonists.) Also, the soundtrack that made up the annoying Casio If you do not expect any Oscar-worthy performances, the drama is still an amateur class, as the band is still listening to keyboard and more annoying death metal (seriously, what about those no-budget horror flicks and bad death metal?) Actors sometimes seem almost confused instead of being anxious or threatened.

In the end, I'm sure fans of no-budget gorefests will love this. Everyone else, however, wants some more meat on the ribs.

summary: It is 1957. J.C. Cullen is a young man from a small town, with a talent for winning at craps, who leaves for the big city to work as a professional gambler. While there, he breaks the bank at a private craps game at the Gem Club, owned by George Cole, and falls in love with two women, one of them Cole's wife. Infuriated, Cole wagers everything on the craps table, including the Gem Club itself, and he and Cullen have it out.
translation: I was attracted to this movie when I looked at the cast list, but after seeing it, I have to admit that I was a bit disappointed. The main problem with this movie is that actors can not keep the movie on their backs. Why? Because of bad script. Although Dillon, Lane and Jones try hard to take this movie to another level, there is no innovative storytelling and the direction is too common. For Matt Dillon fans, this is a movie, as well as for lovers of beautiful Diane Lane. The legendary Tommy Lee Jones is always great, but this is not a movie for him. far below his level. So, if you're excited about this great cast, look at them, but do not expect anything big or out of the ordinary. The only thing you'll remember about this movie is Diane Lane scenes; The rest is very forgotten.

summary: Nanni, a renowned director, is working on a musical when suddenly he has a change of heart and cancels the film on the first shooting day. He has a new idea, making a documentary about the Italian national elections, but work isn't going very fast, much to the frustration of the crew. Nanni can't stop thinking, worrying and getting excited about the birth and early days of life of his newborn son, yet is torn by his sense of obligation to make the documentary.
translation: ... but I'm not one of them. Caro Diario was seen at least two-thirds of the time, but the boring and selfish third part of this movie gave us a taste of what was to come in this exceptionally self-indulgent chaos. Moretti says he feels a need to shoot this film, but he does not want it, while the viewer feels he should stick to it, but he does not want to. A film about Italian politics and elections could be intriguing, but that's not the movie. At some point, Moretti and his friends stand in front of the headquarters of the Communist Party and discuss the interviews they are preparing with the party leaders, but it is characteristic of this film that we never see any of it. Between Moretti's political desires are the events that led to the birth of his son, and the subsequent shots of the child with the baby and later with the baby Pietro (the film pulls us through several years and more than one legislature). We always expect a final order or convincing arguments, but they never come. I doubt I would have the patience to ever get through a movie by Nanni Moretti again. He manages to make an hour and twenty minutes seem like an eternity.

summary: Janine Reynaud stars as a nightclub stripper who free-floats through a spectral 60's landscape littered with dream-figures, dancing midgets and bizarre S&M games.
translation: Although the repertoire of over 180 films to choose from, this 'Succubus' is often referred to as the best Jess Franco film. Heck, even the legendary filmmaker Fritz Lang counts "Succubus" among his personal favorites. Maybe it's me, but I thought that was a terribly boring and overly confusing movie. The opening is great and shows Janine Reynaud playing an SM act on stage. Unfortunately, it goes from here downhill. Reynaud's character is a maneater that finally kills his lover in a kind of trance. Franco had a reasonable budget to work with, and spends well with beautiful locations, beautiful photos and fascinating music. This COULD was indeed his best movie, if not for the lame and uninteresting story. It's supposed to be psychedelic, but I'd say sophomoric is a better term to describe what's shown here. Half the time, you have no idea what is going on or what exactly is said, even the short running time of 80 minutes seems to take forever. This is certainly not the best movie by Franco. I would not even recommend it to die-hard exploitation fans. If you're looking for a better Jess Franco movie, try grabbing Las Vampiras, The Terrible Dr. Orloff, or Female Vampires.

summary: Major Lloyd Gruver, a Korean War flying ace reassigned to Japan, staunchly supports the military's opposition to marriages between American troops and Japanese women. But that's before Gruver experiences a love that challenges his own deeply set prejudices... and plunges him into conflict with the U.S. Air Force and Japan's own cultural taboos.
translation:
I really enjoyed this film about the relationships that sometimes developed between American soldiers and Japanese women in post-war Japan - and the obstacles that prejudice created for them. Brando goes from the contempt of the Japanese (which is natural in World War II) to fall in love with a Japanese woman and want to marry her. His performance is fine (I'm not a big fan of his acting style) and the movie is consistently wonderful. Red Buttons received an Oscar for his touching performance of another GI who falls in love with Japan (although the Japanese playing next to him did a remarkable job as well).

I do not want to spoil it But the movie is a good movie with a box of handkerchiefs.

This film manages to say something while being entertaining. A mostly underrated gem.

summary: At the end of the 19th century a large cylinder falls on the English countryside. A young writer is among those who witnesses the event. But soon the cylinder opens and a group of Martians appear. It soon becomes apparent the Martians intend to attack. The writer soon finds himself fighting for his own survival as the military fights to stop the Martians, society collapses, and as the human race fights to win the war of the worlds.
translation: Running did not bother me. At that time, people had really gone for a walk. It gave this historic piece a touch of authenticity and some perspective on the technology of the Martians. I too was disappointed with the effects, especially the "Thunderchild" scene, which I see as one of the most exciting in the book. But I can not praise this movie enough, because it remains true to Wells story! It's time. The actors are personable and the performances are charming. Also, this movie is well worth seeing just to hear the really great music of Jamie Hall. It was interesting to see that the same actor played both the writer and his brother in London.

summary: Donald Woods is chief editor of the liberal newspaper Daily Dispatch in South Africa. He has written several editorials critical of the views of Steve Biko. But after having met him for the first time, he changes his opinion. They meet several times, and this means that Woods and his family get attention from the security police. When Steve Biko dies in police custody, he writes a book about Biko. The only way to get it published is for Woods himself to illegally escape the country.
translation:
I think the context of the story was covered by other posters. I just want to talk about the effects of this movie on me.

I saw this movie for the first time in the year of its 1987 release. My school organized a visit to the cinema for a RE project, I think. Of course we were all excited because we were on a school trip to the cinema! We did not know what we would experience. To this day, I still remember the feelings that awoke in me, and I remembered how I had cried most of my friends. I believe in the age we were in, we found it shocking and quiet, rightly outraged in our own youthful way. It influenced me so much that I joined the anti-apartheid movement in the same year.

I think so In my case, it served its purpose.

summary: Sort of a low-budget Short Cuts (1993), set in the Flemish port city of Antwerp on a warm day in June. Natalie, her brother Chouki, her boyfriend Walter and his ex Lara, the gallery keeper Firmin, unhappily married French language teacher Paul Garcin, a couple of party-loving studs from Ghent (another Flemish city) and the enigmatic Windman, independently go about their lives, which have little in common, yet all end up on the same place for a grand party that evening.
translation:
I've seen this movie 2 times, a friend of mine has seen him at the release party, and he told me that he's so great that I expect a lot about the movie because I'm not in nuteral position have seen. The second time I knew what to expect and I enjoyed it more than the first time. After the second time I felt so much like a party. I LOVED the music, it's just great.

If Tom Barman improves his directing talent, he will be a director everyone will talk about. If you can deliver this movie first, you have to be talented.

The play is performed by some of the big Belgian stars (Dirk Roofthooft) and a bunch of up and coming talents like Titus De Voogdt.

summary: During WWII in England, Charlie, Carrie, and Paul Rawlins are sent to live with Eglantine Price, an apprentice witch. Charlie blackmails Miss Price that if he is to keep her practices a secret, she must give him something, so she takes a bedknob from her late father's bed and places the "famous magic traveling spell" on it, and only Paul can activate it. Their first journey is to a street in London where they meet Emelius Browne, headmaster of Miss Price's witchcraft training correspondence school. Miss Price tells him of a plan to find the magic words for a spell known as Substitutiary Locomotion, which brings inanimate objects to life. This spell will be her work for the war effort.
translation:
Adorable Disney film starring Angela Lansbury in fine form as a middle-aged philanthropist whose interest in witchcraft evolved in England during World War II.

Lansbury was about 51 years old at the time of the film and just ideal for her part. She's Jessica Fletcher again, but this time it's in favor of children and for Mother England during a time of great danger. The film follows the adventures of Miss Price (Lansbury) and David Tomlinson as a professor of witchcraft while attempting to obtain certain information about sorcery. These three little darlings, who were sent to Price to escape the London bombings, are wonderful in this enchanting movie for all of us, regardless of age. Pity that Tessie O'Shea, Roddy McDowall and Sam Jaffe have so little to do in this enchanting movie.

I really thought of the Ben Stiller movie - "Night at the Museum", at the end of the film, as the relics come alive to fight with the Nazi invasion in the small British coastal town.

summary: This cinema version of the Sam Shepard play is set well after the mid-century. James Woods as the alcoholic farmer drives a huge beater with a rusted roof which is emblematic of the general disrepair of his farm. A lovingly tended lamb with maggots is the reverse emblem of something helpless, needy and cared for. The refrigerator is spoken to as a character, as if standing in for absent nurturing from Woods' self-centered wife. The couple have two kids who must come of age as their home is being torn apart around them and the parents pursue fantasies of "better things" offered by crook Randy Quaid. Henry Thomas as the son copes by holding on to the land and creating a poetic commentary, and the responses of his sister to the crisis become a powerful and surprising tribute to womanhood.
translation:
That would have been a great silent movie. Acting is really good, at least in a Ma look, I'm really doing great acting! Way.

Everything is HUGE. Every line is PROFOUND! Every scene is shaped by people with disabilities.

Mostly I felt like gagging. But like every train accident, I could not tear my eyes. This dialogue could have worked on stage, although I doubt it. It was cluttered on the screen, arbitrary, hacked, and pretty much any other stereotypical negative adjective that you can use to describe a truly dire dramatic work.

If you enjoy your melodrama in huge, heaped cans you might enjoy the movie. But be prepared to wait. With all the melodrama, this thing is sure to trot at its own pace.

This script must have sounded quite different when the actors involved read it to themselves. It just does not work once they have managed to deliver it in front of the camera.
IMDB sometimes makes us a big drawback when using their stupid computerized "weighted scores". The Curse of the Starving Class earns less than a 1.

Character-driven fiction is great, but if you develop your characters by simply pushing them through hoops and giving no plausible explanation for their maturation or development this does not happen character development! Your characters must have a motivation. Being drunk for a while and waking up in an area is * not * character development. That's a plot.

Stay away from this movie. Or at least you can see how it is muted. Maybe you will be a bit fun of all the poor people who do the characters. Oh, and a word to the wise - to prove that this is truly an artistic film, see James Woods in all his hanging male "look at me, I'm the figurative-and-literal-representation of the naked-vulnerable -of-man ". Fame.

Do not say you have not been warned

summary: When a terrorist's body, infected with a stolen chemical, is recovered by the US military, the corpse is cremated, unintentionally releasing the virus/bacteria into the atmosphere over a small island. Soon the infected populace mutate into flesh-hungry zombies, and a trio of soldiers on leave must team up with a group of tourists and board themselves up in an abandoned hotel as they try to fend off the agile and aggressive living dead.
translation: We have high expectations for this. , , because his Zombi 3 is the official sequel to Zombi 2 and is directed by Lucio Fulci. , , however. , , Co-directed by Bruno Mattei (Night of the Zombies), it was not written by Dardino Sachetti but by Claudio Fagrasso (Night of the Zombies). It was filmed in the Phillimines like the Night of the Zombies and much resembles the Night of the Zombies the Living Dead). As a result, it is more of a companion in Hell of the Living Dead than Zombi 2. Fabrazio DeAngelis, who produced Zombi 2 and its publisher Tomassi (?), And efx gianetto De Rossi gave Zombi 2 its magic. , , Zombi 3 is not magic. , , It's like a peanut butter-jelly sandwich without peanut butter. But over the years I have accepted Zombi 3. I swore that I saw a version where a soldier was bitten on his arm and walked into the hotel room. , , There was a pointless fulci cut and the Mattei / Fulci cut is on DVD.

summary: Jonathan Trager and Sara Thomas met while shopping for gloves in New York. Though buying for their respective lovers, the magic was right and a night of Christmas shopping turned into romance. Jon wanted to explore things further but Sara wasn't sure their love was meant to be. They decided to test fate by splitting up and seeing if destiny brought them back together... Many years later, having lost each other that night, both are engaged to be married. Still, neither can shake the need to give fate one last chance to reunite them. Jon enlists the help of his best man to track down the girl he can't forget starting at the store where they met. Sara asks her new age musician fiance for a break before the wedding and, with her best friend in tow, flies from California to New York hoping destiny will bring her soulmate back. Near-misses and classic Shakespearean confusion bring the two close to meeting a number of times but fate will have the final word on whether it was meant to be.
translation:
Wow, I can not believe that people think this is a 'good' movie. Now I have seen much worse, but there are much more romantic / funny comedies with John Cusack.

This is a mediocre film at best. While acting was not terrible, but not great for a romantic comedy, there was little passion, little romance. There were many loose ends that did not show up or were not addressed. Unfortunately, the main characters appear as complete cowards. They do not know each other well enough to realize that they do not love the people they are working with. How do we know they are not in love? Due to the total lack of remorse both characters have to leave their finances. I can imagine a few more romantic things than the constant escape from the commitment shown by these two. The movie does not even end with a wedding scene, probably both get cold feet and drop each others like hot potatoes as soon as a commitment approaches. This film is really about two people who can not commit to anything, unlike Cusack's earlier characters, who were more than willing to make a deep commitment (Loyd in Say Anything, Martin in Grosse Pointe Blank, etc.) /> The biggest failure of this film was the total absence of any twists or anything of interest. When the movie was over, I felt like they had not climaxed into the story, which basically fits the movie: boring. No excitement about whether the two will come together, no joy in doing so, no consequences for their actions.

It is sad that people are so blind to the shabbiness of this movie that they simply rebut criticism of "Everyone is too cynical!" Criticizing this film is not cynicism, but an unbiased examination. There are many other better romantic comedies, even with Grace Kelly or Eva Marie Saint.

If you think this movie is great, try these movies, your hearts will explode: The Princess Bride, Say Anything, Big Pointe Blank, High Fidelity, Keeping the Faith, Charade, Rear Window , North by Northwest or There's Something about Mary (which is a good exploration of idealized romance over today's society).

summary: This unique short film follows the night of a young British insomniac named Jack, narrated almost hour by hour from a first hand perspective. You see what he sees, you feel what he feels, you experience the horrible delusions and the verge of insanity as he struggles to find the thinning line between reality and the subconscious.
translation:
I have to say that I wanted to see this movie for a long time and I was not disappointed. The acting of Dominic Monaghan is just fantastic. As part of insomnia, I can tell how the story unfolds. I've never experienced anything like it, but some awake moments are superimposed on sleeping and it can be weird. It was a great movie, worth every penny. I hope that one day I can work with Tess myself, it would be an honor and beyond. I recommend it to anyone. Maybe not small children, because they could get scared. But if you're an insomniac like me, you understand the world, the secrets and the fear. You will love it.

F.

summary: "If you like THE SOPRANOS, you'll love THE DELI" - The Phantom of the Movies From director John Gallagher, THE DELI is an enchanting slice-of-life comedy about a hard luck gambler who gets in over his head when he starts putting his store's profits on the line.
translation: Everything about this movie was terrible. In the beginning, this film had a pretty good cast, and I find it impossible to make such a great cast the biggest catastrophe of the gangster movie genre. The soundtrack was like a very bad slap-stick comedy. It had this music throughout the movie and it got pretty annoying

summary: Shiloh Falls is an exhilarating tale of good versus evil set in the untamed wild west. Gritty lawman John Gaffney has finally tracked down the murderous Dalton Taggert and his gang to the outpost town of Shiloh Falls. But before the fugitives can be brought to justice, a mysterious stranger appears in town, more powerful than any man. When there is no escaping his powers, the sworn enemies must pull together to fight true evil. The heart racing quest rides from the majestic frontier to a pulse pounding main street shoot-em-up for divine retribution.
translation: I love westerns. I could see her all day. "The good, the bad and the ugly" is my absolute favorite. I probably saw "Silverado" for the eighth time the other day because it was shown on CMT. This movie, Shiloh Falls, is undoubtedly the worst Western I've ever seen. The acting was terrible all around. They do not explain anything at the end of the mysterious compass appearance. The only good thing I can think of is the pretty Cantina girl. The conspicuously long pauses between the dialogues seemed intentional, only to make up for the time for an acceptable length of film. This movie was not even worth the new rental fee I paid in our local movie distribution. I felt like I had been robbed and would have refunded a rent if there was such a thing. The only reason I finished it was because I hate not seeing a movie to the end. I turned it off halfway because it was so bad. Ask the director better if you decide to do another. This is the kind of movie that has the potential to distract people from westerns.

summary: A young man just released from a reformatory moves to a new neighborhood with his sister, intending to start a new life. However, he gets mixed up with the local mob boss and corrupt politicians and soon finds himself being framed for an arson and murder he didn't commit.
translation:
I do not have much to add to what was said before, but it's a movie of its time and the first (and probably only) time the studio has completely hung the movie on Dead End Kids.

The Warner's have helped the boys a lot, from director Ray Enright and an A budget to an almost magical cast of supporting actors. At every turn we get one of these gem services from real professionals. There are too many to list, but it seems that almost everyone on the Warner lot (without the biggest stars) goes through this picture. (See, if you can recognize John Ridgely.)

The only outstanding achievement comes from ever-reliable Eduardo Cianelli as a mob boss with a messianic complex. He plays this character almost as much as the Thuggie leader in "Gunga Din". He is something to see! And Marjorie Main is excellent and gets her best role since "Dead End".

My bid for this is a second feature of a double bill with something like "City for Conquest".

Hurray for Warners!

summary: The film concerns the theme of self-imposed limitation and continues Matthew Barney's interest in religious rite, this time focusing on Shinto.
translation: I can understand what Barney is trying to achieve, but after sitting in a college movie house last night, I could not help but think ... when will that end? A very long and cumbersome two hours and fifteen minutes. I only saw part of Cremaster 3 on DVD and thought I knew what to expect. However, experimental films like these are better digested in small steps. There are a few beautiful / horrible pictures ... including the title sequence (no joke), but if you count on these types of actions or meanings, you will experience a long, slumbering ride. I managed to stay awake (if that's a compliment), but mostly I waited for a meaning or narrative ... big mistake. Among the collection of pictures is a very ornate gift-wrapping ceremony, creating a disgusting bowl of petroleum jelly plates that are shaped with a cookie cutter and sprinkled with shrimp (this is served to the crew of the ship shown throughout the film), a large one bubbly cheese cake with a large tentacle herb in the center, and the mutual evisceration of Bjork and director Matthew Barney, which eventually leads to a bizarre type of communion, followed by their transformation into whale-like creatures. The soundtrack is sometimes nice and annoying ... sometimes even crazy. Once a song is sung by Bjork to accompany the ephemeral rituals that are played before us, and at other times there is only a constant drone of a high instrument in which a mysterious woman plays in music at the beginning and end of the film. If that sounds like it does not make sense, it's because it's NOT DOING! If this sounds like a cup of tea, you will absolutely love it! If that sounds like something you probably do not like, then stay far from it, because you'll most likely go out of the theater during the halftime, like several people at the show I attended. This is the definition of an art film. You get what you take from it. But otherwise there is not much, except a few strange things and constant construction and deconstruction rituals. I am glad that there is a place for films like this, but I can not say that I want to go through it again. However, I can not say that I do not want to see and compare any of Barney Cremaster's films from start to finish. I think, now that I know what to expect, I could enjoy something more. To give you an idea of ‚Äã‚Äãthe understanding of this film, I would probably have liked it better if I had been stoned. On the other hand, it could have been twice as long as it had been then, and then it would have been REALLY cumbersome. Definitely not for everyone.

summary: A group of martial arts students are en route to an island that supposedly is home to the ghosts of martial artists who have lost their honor. A Hitler lookalike and his gang are running a female slavery operation on the island as well. Soon, the two groups meet and all sorts of crazy things happen which include cannibal monks, piranhas, zombies, and more!
translation: "Raw Force" is like an ultra-left and perverse version of Love Boat, with additional Kung Fu battles, denied cannibalist monks, white slave trafficking, energetic zombies and a lot of lousy acting. No wonder this movie was included in the recently released "Grindhouse Experience 20 Movie Box Set". Anything fanatic seeks to fit into a totally incoherent and seemingly improvised script! The production values ‚Äã‚Äãare extremely poor and the technical aspects are pathetic, but the extent of violence and sex can hardly be described. The film opens in a tropical sunny spot called Warriors Island, where a band of despicable monks raise the dead for no apparent reason, unless they become Kung Fu fighters. The monks also buy sexy slaves from a shabby businessman who looks like Hitler, supposedly because the woman meat gives them the necessary strength to increase their zombie army. Tourists on a passing cruise ship, including three martial artists, an LA police officer, and a whole host of gorgeous but gloomy ladies, are attacked by the Hitler's thugs for planning a trip to Warriors Island. Their lifeboat flushes the island to the coast anyway, and the monks challenge the survivors to a combat test with their zombies. Okay, how does that sound for a crazy midnight horror movie chaos? It's not over yet, as "Raw Force" also has piranhas, wild boat orgies, Cameron Mitchell in another embarrassing lead role, and 70-year-old exploit duchess Camille Keaton ("I spit on your grave") in a most insignificant performance. There are a lot of poorly recognized bleedings, including ax massacres and beheadings, hammer blows, and bad taste romance. The waste value of this movie will literally make you speechless. Of course, the background of the evil monks remains unclear and they are not even punished for their questionable hobbies. Maybe the film ends with "To Be Continued" instead of "The End". The sequel never came, unless it's so dark that IMDb does not even list it.

summary: The seven American lawyers hired by Australian media magnate Jack Doulan, whose company rivals Albert Teal's Digicron for preponderance on the world market of telecommunications, are suddenly struck during a video conference in Seattle by an incredibly fast-working virus which wipes out everyone on their floor. Dr. Nick Baldwin, a brilliant virologist who works as an 'insubordinate' ambulance technician after being fired for failing to observe procedure, is first on the site and points out to US Army disease specialist Dr. Samantha Carter, who told him there were deaths in several other cases but never a trace of the virus, his ambulance has taken a survivor to his hospital; her therapeutic incompetence gets the patient killed, him assigned as temporary consultant to her army research unit- even there computer model operator Darren is killed by the virus, which also strikes at other sites in and around Seattle, notably at places where Digicron's 500 TV channels setup box is being ...
translation:
In some ways, the concept behind the plot was a pretty interesting mix of different types of movie in an interesting combination. No point in this movie, however, was so obvious that he did not deserve close-ups. I had the feeling that I had been hit over my head with the so-called mysterious explanation for the ill people. The writer seems to have picked up clich√©s from other films simply as a substitute for customized writing lines to actual characters. The actors did not help. No chemistry I think they should develop some sort of attraction, if only because that is an essential element of these stories. The authors, however, did not work very hard on the development of chemistry. Sure, both are attractive, but whether they are attractive to each other seemed to be an open question.

The self-confidence shown by Turner's character in Sabato's development has arisen far too quickly and for no particular reason. Sabato's character is said to be a discredited doctor who just does not seem to play by the rules. Think of the Jeff Goldblum character on Independence Day. Normally this type of character should show talent or brilliance. Sabato's character does not do it. He is Cassandra with the crazy and all the prophetic abilities of a magic eight ball. He seems to be right by accident.

The death scenes are funny. Each actor really tried more than a little too hard to demonstrate the agony inflicted on him. The symptoms looked like a bad mood, like the video from the 80s, Peter Gabriel, I think.

summary: Tenshu is imprisoned and sentenced to death for murdering the men who raped his girlfriend. However, he manages to survive his execution and is presented with an option: face another execution attempt or subject himself to their bizarre and dangerous experiments. He choses the latter and is put in a cell with a rapist and a woman who's infected with a taint that transports from person to person during extreme anger. The taint is transferred to Tenshu and he must now deal with the military who has interrupted the experiment to obtain it.
translation:
I liked this movie very much. The premise is quite imaginative, and as a spectator I was taken along as the characters evolved. The tempo is very well done for those who like to think - enough is denied to the viewer at an early stage, and there are always questions that will be answered later, producing a well thought out and very satisfying film, both cerebral and action Position.

It seems that some people have been looking for an uninterrupted roller coaster ride with this movie - one who storms out of the gate. This would be more like one of those coasters that first takes you slowly up the hill - a wonderful feeling of anticipation - and ultimately, in my opinion, more fulfilling for the original foundation laid out /> Excellent movie.

summary: "But if you forget to come back for Madame Zeroni, you and your family will be cursed for always and eternity." Those were the exact words spoken to young Elya Yelnats the day he forgot to repay Madame Zeroni. From then on his family was cursed with bad luck. One hundred years later Stanley Yelnats IV is accused of stealing a pair of cleats from a major league baseball player and sent to Camp Green Lake (a dry lake bed in the middle of the desert). It never rains at Camp Green Lake, it hasn't for one hundred years. The secretive and mysterious Warden has each inmate spend every day digging one hole to "build character." But when an artifact from the famous "Kissin' Kate" Barlow is found in a hole, the Warden forces the boys to work double time leading Stanley to deduce they're digging because the Warden is looking for something. But what? And how is the mystery of Camp Green Lake connected to Stanley's family curse?
translation: Holes, the novel, was forced on me in a training course. I did not think I would like a children's book. Besides, the other books I had to read for class were really bad. But to my surprise, I absolutely loved holes. It's really one of the best written novels I've ever read. I think it has the rare quality that makes it attractive for teens, teens and adults. Everyone who reads it, I think, will leave a better person. I can not quite say that for the movie, but I'm glad they usually got it right. I do not think that viewers of the movie will go off as enriched, but they will certainly entertain without the side effect of being stupid when they sit down. It's a smart story that is told very well. I think it's moving a bit too fast. The novel needs more time to develop the characters. And the flashbacks come in and out so fast that they do not have much time to register. The interracial romance in the past feels smarter and more banal than in the novel. And the end that holds all loose threads together seems very ridiculous. It is exactly the same in the novel, but there is a sense of the absurd that does not quite exist in the film. It works much better. I also do not like the variety of pop songs. I wish Disney did not see it as a necessity to sell soundtracks. The cast is excellent across the board, from the little kids to the old pros. Jon Voight is especially great. Not sure why we need Catwoman and the Fonze. 10.9.

summary: On Christmas Eve, a little girl named Marie (Cohen) falls asleep after a party at her home and dreams herself (or does she?) into a fantastic world where toys become larger than life. Her beloved Nutcracker (Culkin) comes to life and defends her from the Mouse King, then is turned into a Prince after Marie saves his life.
translation: I have seen many, many nutcracker productions. Maybe I saw this movie from the corrupt perspective of a theater director, but I was disappointed. I am sure that the people in ballet choreography find this production impressive, but from a purely theatrical perspective, I found everything from design to choreography to be inconclusive and unsatisfactory for a "film". None of the traditionally "weird" and impressive costumes looked like what they should be (ie, the sweets did not look like candy, the rats did not look like rats, but rather like chocolate kisses) too toned for the canvas, and the Choreography just did not do anything for me. This makes the entire show (at best) very satisfying, as if it should not stand out from any other production. But remember, this is from the artistic perspective of a theater director, not a dancer or choreographer, but a direct male theater director.

summary: Dennis Buckstead has the hardest calling in his church. Not only has he been asked to coach a group of non-basketball players in his church but the bishop has demanded that he lead the team to the Basketball Championship. Word from the top is that this is the last season of church ball and Bishop Linderman isn't about to have his team lose for the 20th year in a row in the last season of church ball history! What was supposed to strengthen the body, invigorate the mind and cultivate brotherly love seems to bring out the worst in these church-going ball players. Dennis must find a way to bring his team together and build unity along the way to win the championship or go down in church ball history as the worst team that ever played.
translation:
I've never been a big fan of Mormon movies. As a Mormon, I have always felt that the sense of humor was too exclusive for the LDS community, making us seem like a bunch of obsessive wackos. I had hoped that this would be the fresh breeze, the Halestorm movie that I could finally discuss with my non-Mormon friends.

Boy, I was wrong.

I thought Since this had B-list talents like Clint Howard, Gary Coleman, Andrew Wilson and Fred Willard (one of my favorites), this would have to be a bit funny at least. In addition, the basketball in the church is ripe with potential for lots of funny gags and the like. But I have to say, throughout the movie it seemed like nobody knew what they were doing. Every joke fell flat and every opportunity for a really funny gag was ignored. The dialogue was mild, and the movie had one of the worst character developments I've ever seen. Every single character except Wilson's was less one-dimensional. It's hard to believe that after nine rewrites, the movie was still as staggeringly stale as the train I've been through. I can not put into words the anger that made me feel. My friends and I were in the last game scene, so we went to the premiere in Washington City, UT. Kurt Hale, the director, was there, and I have to say, I avoided any contact with him after the show. He was waiting at the door, apparently ready for feedback. I could not bring myself to tell him that not only did his film demolish an hour and a half of my life, but it also left an unpleasant, painful scar that I'll never forget.

Here we are I had some specific problems: There was a little love story between the janitor and the dumpy pianist, but these two characters came out of nowhere and were impossible to care for, so my friends and I Ever wondered why we should do that to take care of these two lame, uninteresting characters. There were plenty of subplots that appeared from time to time, promising the audience the chance to laugh, but everyone came and went into a cloud of smoke until it was done before you could even take care of it. That's how the whole movie felt.

This movie was a big flop and I feel bad for anyone expecting the first really funny Mormon movie. True, the jokes in this case are not too exclusive for Mormons. On the other hand, it's hard to say what a joke was and what a loud ringing in my ears was.

Please DO NOT watch this movie. Keep the imagination in mind that this movie is hilarious. Spare yourself the disappointment I went through

summary: This is the story of a young resourceful heroine named Lisa Reisert who hates to fly, but the terror that awaits her on the night flight to Miami has nothing to do with a fear of flying! Upon boarding the plane, Lisa is trapped on a red-eye flight with a creepy villainous handsome and charming man by the name of Jackson Rippner, who's playing middle-man in the plot to assassinate a Homeland Security official. He's got her father pinned down by a would-be killer, using that advantage to coerce Lisa into phoning the luxury resort where she works and arranging to move the target into a pre-set position.
translation:
I was bored one night and Red Eye was on and thought why not.

Red Eye has been one of the best movies in a long time.

I mean, I just got in The movie was awesome.

The story is new and different.

The film also has two great leads in the movie with Rachel Mcadams like Lisa Reisert and Cillian Murphy as Jackson Rippner.

The acting is awesome and you get the feeling for the people in the movie.

The music is just excellent, it gives you a shiver and it also makes you feel relaxed.

I just love how the movie was done so well and never gets boring.

Red Eye is just phenomenal. No more and no less.

It's an excellent thriller.

Overall, I enjoy Red Eye so much that I can see it over and over again.

I'm giving out Red Eye 9 10.

Great movie

summary: Roy and Candy and Lonnie Earl and Darlene are two married couples who thought they knew one another, until they decided to take their dream vacation together. Hitting the road in a brand-new SUV, they're having the time of their lives until something funny happens on the way to the monster truck show in Reno. Turns out Lonnie Earl has a thing for Candy, and when evidence of this starts to surface, things really start to heat up.
translation:
If you hate redneck accents, you hate this movie. And to make matters worse, you see Patrick Swayze trying to be a redneck. I really do not like redneck accents. I like Billy Bob Thornton, he was good in Slingblade, but he was annoying in this movie. And what name is Lonnie Earl? How much more Hickish can this movie get? The story was stupid. I'm not usually so judgmental about movies, but I could not stand this movie. If you want a good movie from Billy Bob Thornton, visit Slingblade.

My mom found this movie for $ 5.95 at Wal Mart ... Paying ... I think I'll wrap it up and give it to my grandma for Christmas. It could be that I usually can not stand redneck accents or Patrick Swayze. Maybe if Patrick Swayze was not there. I did not even laugh in the movie. I usually laugh about something stupid. If someone had shown you smashed fingers, maybe I would have laughed. The fingers of the people smashed by an accident always make me laugh.

summary: In New York, Alvin Sanders is a small-time thief who's just been hauled in for stealing a bunch of prawns (shrimp) from a local restaurant. He ends up in a cell with John Jaster, one half of a high-tech criminal team that's just stolen $42,000,000 worth of gold from the Federal Reserve. Realizing that he could die at any moment from his worsening heart condition, Jaster tells Alvin to relay a cryptic message to his wife about the whereabouts of the hidden gold. Alvin doesn't know exactly what the message means, and Edgar Clenteen, the U.S. Treasury investigator working the case, hopes it will lead to the gold or Jaster's partner Bristol, but it does neither. Eighteen months later, Jaster is dead, and both Clenteen and Bristol are still looking for that gold. Clenteen decides to secretly plant a tracking device in Alvin's jaw, release him from prison, and then let the word out that he knows where the gold is hidden. Knowing that Bristol is probably watching their every move, Clenteen ...
translation: Jamie Foxx is fun, but this movie was made earlier. The villain plays a "malkovichian" character from "In the Line of Fire". The cops will do anything to find the evil - and of course the good guy has two bad guys and a set of cops behind him - while he's just trying to turn over a new leaf ...

summary: The film (the third of the Reding brothers) is about a German teenager following his identity crisis. The boy, transformed by the usual down-trodden socio-economic conditions of contemporary Europe, becomes a skin head, following the first one's lead. On the other side he befriends with a leftist (a punk) who is gay. This causes more and more conflicts which eventually leads to an atrocious end for the punk. The film offers scenes of homophobic violence by skinheads, and the whole relationship between the skinhead and gay movements (in Germany gay skinheads represent a substantial subculture).
translation:
This movie is just crap. Although the directors claim to be part of this culture, it is still a very, very bad directorial debut. The theme itself is very interesting and I accept the bad acting due to the fact that they are all amateurs and have never played before, but the worst part about this film is the dialogue and very inexperienced and naive directing. There is no timing in this movie. I felt that the directors were so excited about making this movie (it's their first movie) that they never really wondered which story they wanted to tell. I've met Ben (one of the directors) several times and he's a nice and thoughtful guy, but that does not make him a director. I think "American History X" is full of clich√©s but somehow manages to transport a story. "Oi! Warning" is full of clich√©s, says nothing new or provocative and (- that's the sad thing about this movie) - it's far from any oi! - Reality.

If you want to see weird but great German movies, check out the films by Michael Haneke, Christoph Schlingensief, Oskar Roehler, Hans Weingartner or Oliver Hirschbiegel:

Bennys Video Funny games The untouchable My last movie The experiment The white noise Muxm√§uschenstill ...

*** of ten because of the subject and the photography

summary: Shohei Sugiyama has attained all that he has wanted in life. But he is still depressed and unhappy. One day, he gathers up the courage to sign up for dancing lessons. He hopes they will rid his depression and help him get his life back together.
translation: "Shall We Dance?", A lighthearted film from Japan, tells the story of a retired accountant and family man attracted to a dance studio by a beautiful woman he sees off the train during his daily commute. What he finds in the studio, are dance lessons and especially himself. "SWD" is an award-winning film that is worth a look for mature viewers. (B)

summary: In Panama, Maggie King meets soldier Skid Johnson on his last day in the army and reluctantly agrees to a date to celebrate. The two become involved in a nightclub brawl which causes Maggie to miss her ship back to the States. Now stranded, she's forced to move in with Skid and his pal Harry. She soon falls in love with Skid. Skid gets a job playing the trumpet at a local club and becomes a big success. Fame and fortune go to his head which eventually destroys his relationship Maggie and his career.
translation: I'm pretty much the Mitchell Leisen fan, so it was a big expectation that I rented this movie, but the pressure I got was extremely bad, so worn and burned that it was apparently beyond repair Movie was so dark. summary: John Holmes was a legend of the porn industry and revered in circles as a stud. But in 1981, years after his successful career and star fading, Holmes was a desperate man with his own internal demons to live up to. He's estranged from his wife, holding onto a relationship with his teenage mistress, and living as a junkie in search of his next fix. But one fateful night left four people dead and John as a key suspect in one of the most grisly murders in Los Angeles. Was he partly responsible for what happened at Wonderland Avenue?
translation:
Some films survive almost exclusively with originality - "Wonderland" is certainly one of those films. The script manages to throw everything in an almost feverish mood, but without incoherent. The speed of this thriller is not to choose to cover up a weak script, but to accurately reflect the drug-dependent reality.

As a director, James Cox acts as a very special way to work his actors. Most characters are constantly on the up and often because they are pretty ugly personalities. Val Kilmer has described John Holmes as a hustler capable of manipulating and controlling. Not an insult to Kilmer, but his version of Holmes seems to dominate only the drastically weak. Nevertheless, it is an amazing achievement. Comparing this to Kilmer's more "Hollywood" roles as in "The Saint", he seems to prove that he is much more at home in edgy indie films.

The actors are the main force that holds everyone together. There are several small performances that stand out - especially the women. Carrie Fisher, Kate Bosworth, and Lisa Kudrow have only a limited screen time in addition to their male counterparts, but they are all fantastic. Apart from Kilmer, Ted Levine and Dylan McDermott give their roles a crazy, breathtaking energy.

I originally watched "Wonderland" because I assumed it was a movie about a porn actor. Yes, the story revolves around John Holmes, but it has literally nothing to do with his professional career. Basically, this movie is a murder mystery and as such - it's excellent.

RATING: 7.5 out of 10

summary: Ben's dad Sam shows up one night with a note from Ben's mother (Sam's wife of 46 years), that she has left. While Ben's wife and his three sisters try to find her, Ben takes Sam on a day trip to see a farmhouse that's for sale. The day trip turns into a road trip while dad and son explore their past, their relationship, and why Sam's wife might have left him. The road trip includes fishing, drinking, playing pool, sleeping under the stars, and frank discussion. Anger simmers close at hand, as do love and hope. Where Sam's wife is - and why she left - leads to the movie's resolution.
translation: This is one of the best movies I have ever seen. I feel very touched by the topic that the film should convey. One phrase that keeps coming to my mind is that "history repeats itself." Life is what the film shows: when people are young, they do not seem to understand their parents, their own spouses; People have every excuse to spend their favorite time not too late with their children. People always have to work hard to support the whole family, but they only neglect the subtle feeling of their partners. People change their perspectives in different phases of life; People can always be forgiven if their hearts are full of love for their beloved; Nothing is more important than the kinship that people in this world share, and it's never too late to talk to their people about what they feel from the bottom of their hearts to achieve a better understanding between themselves and life To end the day, people should not regret or regret, because they have kept their words and there is always hope - a new life. The actors and actresses are fantastic. You fully understood the intention of the director. The charm of the film for me is to bring the audience a skillful and splendid mix of cheers and tears.

summary: Hard rock idol Sammi Curr burns to death in a hotel fire. His biggest fan, Lakeridge High School student and resident metal head Eddie Weinbauer is devastated by the news and turns to local radio DJ "Nuke" for emotional support. After a heated discussion about the deceased rock star, Nuke presents Eddie with a rare demo record, the last ever recorded by Sammi and the only copy in existence. Overwhelmed by Nuke's generosity, Eddie accepts the gift without hesitation, unaware of it's dark role in things to come. After constant humiliation and a near drowning at the hands of school bully Tim Hainy and his sports jock friends, Eddie becomes enraged and vows revenge on all those who have wronged him, much to the dismay of love interest, Leslie and best friend, Roger. Alone in his room with feelings of rage and retribution racing through his mind, Eddie places the new record onto his stereo and is shocked to discover that he can communicate with the deceased rock star when it is rotated ...
translation: I heard about this movie when I saw "100 Most Metal Moments" by VH1. In this segment, Gene Simmons (who had played a cameo) and several other interviewees discussed how horrible this movie is. Unlike most people, I am often more curious about films that are said to be ridiculously bad than a masterpiece of cinema. The benefit of such an attitude is half the time I realize that the movies are not nearly as bad as people said, and I enjoy them much more than I had originally expected. That was my experience with Trick or Treat. Well, it's hard to make a movie about a teenager who gets news from a dead heavy metal star by playing one of his vintage records backwards without people making fun of the prerequisites. Sure, it's certainly a strange premise, but one that has never been done! Give the filmmakers points for the originality around Pete's sake! If you want to buy the DVD without first knowing about the movie, do not think that Ozzy Osbourne and Gene Simmons are the stars. Although Simmons plays a thankless role, Ozzy has a funny cameo as Reverend (that's right, a Reverend !!) that speaks out against Heavy Metal. For one, it's funny to see Ozzy with short hair. And second, you can not help but laugh at the irony. Sure, it's a cheap shot, but an effective one. Acting is pretty good. I found the performances convincing. The teenage characters are terribly cliched. So expect the usual range of jocks and nerds. And as in any of these movies, the pretty girl is a decent person who has sympathy for the alienated main character, but still goes on with her friend from Jock. Why is she ever going out with such a complete jerk? Because the plot needs an obstacle. No other reason. But I can not deny that one of my guilty amusements witnessed the descent of the evil jocks in these movies because I was an outsider in high school. summary: Chile, second half of the 20th century. The poor Esteban marries Clara and they get a daughter, Blanca. Esteban works hard and eventually gets money to buy a hacienda, eventually to become a local patriarch. He becomes very conservative and is feared by his workers. When Blanca grows up, she falls in love with a young revolutionary, Pedro, who urges the workers to fight for socialism. It is unavoidable that Pedro and Esteban are pitted against each other. Esteban tries to stop the love affair between Pedro and his daughter by all means possible but soon Blanca becomes pregnant and has a daughter. The void between father and daughter seems unbridgeable when Blanca moves in with Pedro.
translation:
This is one of the few films I have seen twice in the theater. I love this movie because of its atmosphere and its life about the tragic hero Esteban Trueba. He makes so many mistakes, but gets a chance to salvation. Is not that a comforting thought?

When I saw it for the first time, I thought the movie would be over after the election wins - I did not know the book. I was wrong when the dramatic climax was still to come! I was literally swept along by the sheer power of the last half hour of the movie.

Many people here do not like this movie. I can not understand this. Perhaps those who read the book first, as is often the case with screen adaptations of novels, are simply disappointed that so many things remain unimagined, unseen, unexplained. But as a film that tells a touching story - the story of a family, the ups and downs of a man, the deep pity of a woman, the power of love and the madness of hatred (and conservatism) - this movie is just great! Plus the soundtrack is amazing and the cast is wonderful too - especially Winona Ryder and Jeremy Irons.

Definitely one of those films for which the cinema was invented!

summary: The movie explores Cinderella's "happily ever after" life as a princess in three stories, with help from the Fairy Godmother. Third, how Cinderella taught one of her nasty stepsisters how to smile which leads to her own true love.
translation: Although Cinderella is not the obvious choice for a sequel, I love Jaq and Gus, so I did not hesitate. The format of the mice writing a book for Cinderella was inspired. I like to write stories myself and hope that children will be encouraged. The three stories are sweet and amusing, though the songs were forgotten. Jaq and Gus were my favorite characters, but I also enjoyed seeing Lucifer, Bruno, the Mice Chorus and everyone else. Pom Pom proved to be the perfect companion for Lucifer and I liked the governess. A sequel that was made right for a change. My rating 8/10

summary: "WHAT THE #$*! DO WE KNOW?!" is a radical departure from convention. It demands a freedom of view and greatness of thought so far unknown, indeed, not even dreamed of since Copernicus. It's a documentary. It's a story. It's mind-blowing special effects. This film plunges you into a world where quantum uncertainty is demonstrated - where neurological processes, and perceptual shifts are engaged and lived by its protagonist - where everything is alive, and reality is changed by every thought.
translation: "What the bleep do we know?" was one of the worst times I spent in the cinema. It was less a movie and more of a post-school special, but nothing special at the same time. The attempt of a narrative in which they founded their ideas was utterly pathetic, which almost everyone will say. Marlee Matlin in her underwear just should not happen. It was terribly contradictory because it was so manipulative to become a creator of your life, manifestation of abundance, shoeless propaganda. Interconnectivity is declared as a big party of our existence. However, the film encourages us to control our environment with our minds. It completely neglects that there are other people with brains who could control us, which seems to be more the case. Or at least the structures in which we exist restrict us greatly. In this way, the film was inappropriately solipsistic. Solipsism and networking just do not mix, unless you are the almighty God. If you are, you will be impressed (?!?) Of all the nice things this movie will show you can do. If not, you'll be painfully disappointed, an idiot, or maybe both. Besides, the title is so ridiculous. I have trouble warning people not to watch the movie because I feel left behind when I mention it by name. Shame on all involved.

summary: An aging but successful and wealthy crime fiction writer blames the death of her niece on the girl's husband. One night she invites him up to the house to sign their wills before getting him to leave and return within a few minutes so she can spring a trap (locking him in her soundproof safe). Detective Columbo arrives and suspects the writer of murder but clues are few and far between.

summary: Wang Bianlian is an aging street performer known as the King of Mask for his mastery of Sichuan Change Art in a true story. His wife left him with and infant son over 30 years ago. The son died from illness at age 10. This left Wang a melancholy loner aching for a male descendent to learn his rare and dying art. A famous master performer of the Sichuan Opera offers to bring him into his act, thus giving Wang fame and possible fortune, but Wang opts for staying the simple street performer. Then, one night after a performance he is sold a young boy by a slave trader posing as the boy's parent. "Grandpa" finds new joy in life as he plans to teach "Doggie" (an affectionate term often used for young children in China) his art. All is well until Doggie is found out to really be a girl.
translation: This movie is the best movie ever. I can not remember the last time a movie made me cry. With a tear in my eye, I admire this movie. It has all the elements a good movie has to have: Excellent Dialogues, Music, Drama, Story / Plot.
