The little girl liked to be his granddaughter, and the king of masks liked a grandson. They were not really conventional. Every scene they were together was invaluable. The camera work is impeccable and packs you. The spectacle is inspired. Xu Zhu was excellent as the king of the masks. Renying Zhou "Doggie" looks pretty and played her character very well. Zhigang Zhao as Liang Sao Lang was great. He played his helpful and kindhearted character very well. If you do not have this movie, give it a try, look at it.

summary: On 24 October 1955, the hard-work geologist of the Hadley Oil Company Mitch Wayne meets the executive secretary Lucy Moore in the office of her boss Bill Ryan in New York and invites her to go to a conference with the alcoholic playboy and son of a tycoon Kyle Hadley. On the way of the meeting, he confesses that they had traveled from Houston to New York to satisfy the wish of the reckless Kyle, who is his best friend since their childhood, of eating a sandwich from club 21 and the meeting was just a pretext to Kyle's father Jasper Hadley. Mitch and Kyle immediately fall in love for Lucy, and Kyle unsuccessfully uses his money to impress Lucy; then he opens his heart and proposes Lucy. They get married and travel to Acapulco and the insecure Kyle stops drinking. Meanwhile, Kyle's sister Marylee is an easy woman and has a non-corresponded crush on Mitch that sees her as a sister. One year later, Kyle discovers that he has a problem and might be sterile and starts drinking again. The ...
translation:
WRITTEN ON THE WIND, directed by Douglas Sirk and released in 1956, is like all the movies from Sirks in the mid-fifties - pure melodrama. It is, however, a captivating, richly-developed melodrama, and Sirk's distinctive lurid color expressionism, throbbing, barely suppressed emotions, symbolism, and class juxtaposition make this movie a covetous movie of four central characters, and the plot introduced as credits continues. Sirk uses a clever flashback structure to bring us into his world ...

Robert Stack and Dorothy Malone are great as the two Hadley kids "Kyle" and "Marylee". He drinks and sleeps with women. She drinks and sleeps with men. Both are worth millions thanks to Hadley's oil business. The weak but poor Mitch Wayne (Rock Hudson) is Kyle's lifelong friend and Marylee's dream lover. Enter into this messy mess Lucy Moore (Lauren Bacall), a slender, attractive young woman who falls under Kyle's charm after picking up a phone and flying over the landscape one evening. Mitch loves her too, but Kyle wins her. They marry quickly and Kyle stops drinking. But fate seems to be about the wind, and it does not take long for a seductive Marylee (who will have Mitch or a marriage), a stealthy Mitch, the confused Lucy and the sad, drunken Kyle to strike. ...

Malone is just wonderful as Marylee Hadley, who earned her Oscar for Best Supporting Actress. She steals every scene she's in. Stack is almost as good, reinforcing the melodrama while maintaining subtle and quiet desperation. Hudson and Bacall are much more restrained than these two, but it suits the characters they play.

So, what's the whole melodrama really about? Well, many things. Stack's powerful portrait of male inadequacy and fear, for one. Sirk surrounds Stack with phallic symbols throughout the movie. Notice its tiny little rifle, the oil derricks and the ultimate phallic symbol. Kyle's apparent inability to conceive children. Stack seems to be suffering from a massive male superiority complex compounded by his father's preference for Hudson, his sister's longing for Hudson, and the suspicion that his wife is going on with Hudson. With all the wealth, Kyle Hadley still lands at the wrong end of the city and buys cheap corn brandy like a "bum."

It's about impossible dreams and letting go of them. The river on which Kyle, Marylee and Mitch played when they were children is constantly referred to throughout the film as a reference symbolizing Kyle and (especially) Marylee's desire for innocence and simplicity of youth. In an excellent melodramatic scene, which Malone demolishes perfectly, Marylee stands by the river and introduces herself as a child, with Mitch's voice telling Marylee that she will always be his girl. Here Sirk meets the viewer with a huge emotional chord. Who has not dreamed of returning to this special place in childhood? Who has not lived on a cherished memory at some point? Who did not want something that they could not have? And Hudson's last line of the movie (yes, he does not get any dialogues in the last 10 minutes, just close-ups) remembers how far we came from the river, Marylee. Amazing.

summary: The US needs to convince the visiting emir Khala'ad of Othar to allow an American military base in his strategic realm. Clueless nightclub waitress Sunny Ann Davis accidentally spots and stops a terrorist shooting at the president and his royal guest. Her naive comments charm the press, so the State Department recruits her for its Protocol. She falls in love with charming Middle East desk chief Michael Ransome, who resigns rather than help trick her into a 'contact mission' to Othar, where the emir's plan with her unexpectedly stirs a revolution.
translation: A monstrous premise that is plausibly low and, unfortunately, fights feebly for arousing laughter or interest. Only Hawn's well-known charm makes it possible to walk on very thin ice. Goldie must be a contender for an actress who has done so much in her career with very little high quality material ...

summary: In London, the executive Michael and his wife Amelia have successful upper class lifestyle, living in a comfortable house, having a fancy car with driver and showing a great respect and affection to each other. However, Amelia has a lover in coma in the hospital, and she frequently visits him and pays the expenses of his treatment. While traveling to Milan in a business trip, Michael has one night stand with an escort girl. Amelia receives a phone call, and when she arrives in the hospital, she realizes that her lover has died. When Michael returns from Milan, their lives return to their hypocrite routine.
translation:
Amelia and Michael are a married couple cheating on each other. Amelia has a longtime lover in the hospital and Michael hires a prostitute who does not satisfy him. The two smolder with their unfaithfulness, but finally manage to get in touch with each other.

There is not much to this brief moment. The direction is straightforward and dramatic, which is good, the spectacle is sincere, but the story leaves much to be desired. Why exactly do these two people interest us? It's a bit hard to see how this story sets itself apart from any other infidelity story except that it's much smaller and does not seek meaning in it (a welcome change, if anything).

I do not know, it's possible I will not associate with these stories because I have never experienced them. However, I've found that the blockage in these stories is usually the same, meaning a couple talking to each other while avoiding eye contact by pretending to be immersed in magazines for something else, and I would like a different setting see.

- PolarisDiB

summary: Paris, je t'aime is about the plurality of cinema in one mythic location: Paris, the City of Love. Twenty filmmakers have five minutes each; the audience must weave a single narrative out of twenty moments. The 20 moments are fused by transitional interstitial sequences and also via the introduction and epilogue. Each transition begins with the last shot of the previous film and ends with the first shot of the following film, extending the enchantment and the emotion of the previous segment, preparing the audience for a surprise, and providing a cohesive atmosphere. There's a reappearing mysterious character who is a witness to the Parisian life. A common theme of Paris and love fuses all.
translation:
Although I live in Minnesota, I have recently studied in France and came across this bizarre jewel of a movie.

This movie was amazing, to say the least. A creative and unique film, which the different directors each interpreted differently than their interpretation of love in the city of light. The first instinct is to try to fit each of these little stories into an overall storyline, similar to Love Actually in 2003. However, this attempt makes the magic of each segment obsolete. If you take them at face value and consider each of the short segments as your own individual film, the love stories together convey a beautiful message.

The film is sometimes strikingly bizarre - often to the point of confusion - and every single segment can be hard to follow. However, for an observer who closely observes each segment, the short plotting lines become clear after a short time. The confusion is almost fascinating. They stay on the edge of the seat waiting for what comes next. The viewer asks: "Did that really just happen?" but they are also satisfied that it actually happened. It is a kind of film in which the viewer can not really decide when he leaves the theater whether he loved him or if he hated him. The first reaction is to look at it again and again just to see how these individual lives merge into a cinematic masterpiece.

The interesting decision to make the film multilingual adds something to the range of people it can relate to. It contributes to the reality of the film - here the American tourists speak English, the Parisian French and so on. The number of people the film encompasses leads to an understanding of the international language of love.

From Illness to the Supernatural, Parents 'Love for Husbands' Love: This film covers all the basics of romantic storytelling. In its beautiful and quirky way, each unique event somehow blends together to tell a story: all sorts, sizes, nationalities, and forms of love.

summary: Jane Eyre is an orphan cast out as a young girl by her aunt, Mrs. Reed, and sent to be raised in a harsh charity school for girls. There she learns to become a teacher and eventually seeks employment outside the school. Her advertisement is answered by the housekeeper of Thornfield Hall, Mrs. Fairfax.
translation: The first half of this release was the best I've ever seen (and I think I've seen every version of Jane Eyre ever made). The development of Jane's childhood and character was extraordinary. Then it was like saying, "Oh, that's too long," and hacked the rest of the story to pieces. The main scenes, if any, are so whitewashed, combined, and put in order that they completely change the plot. There was so little transitional or even scene development that it would be difficult for someone unfamiliar with the story to follow. The big disappointment was that the beginning opened so much hope and then destroyed the end of it.

summary: In meeting in Kansas, ex-cons Perry Smith and Dick Hickock are breaking several conditions of their respective paroles. The meeting, initiated by Dick, is to plan and eventually carry out a robbery based on information he had received from a fellow inmate about $10,000 cash being locked in a hidden safe in the home of the farming Clutter family of Holcomb, Kansas. After the robbery, they plan on going to Mexico permanently to elude capture by the police. Each brings a necessary personality to the partnership to carry out the plan, Dick who is the brash manipulator, Perry the outwardly more sensitive but unrealistic dreamer with a violent streak under the surface. Perry literally carries all his dreams in a large box he takes with him wherever he goes. The robbery does not go according to plan in any respect, the pair who ultimately hogtie and execute all four members of the Clutter family, only coming away from the home with $43 in cash. As Perry and Dick go on the run, a murder ...
translation:
The movie was gripping from beginning to end and its b / w photography of the American heart is breathtaking. We feel that we are with them when they cross the great sky land and then back to Mexico and back to America. Towards the end of the movie, the rain on Robert Blake looks like little streams of sweat and tears rolling down his face. At the end we follow them up the stairs until their last moment.

The two criminals listed by Robert Blake and Scott Wilson as Perry Smith and Dick Hickock were seen on every street in every city. Hickock is a smiling boy next door and Smith, the man with stars in the eyes of the wrong side of the city. This point is addressed in the film and it is always surprising that criminals do not differ from other appearances. Evil, even the most abominable, is part of the human condition. These two insane men kill a whole family and look for a safe that is not there. Once they are on the run, they start writing bad checks and finding a way for the authorities.

There are many good supporting actors. I like John Forsyth as Detective Alvin Dewey. Will Geer shines in a short but excellent scene as a prosecutor.

I often wanted to see this movie through and through, as I only caught it in brief incidents; After buying the DVD, I finally came to it. The result is the most beautiful classic thriller I have ever seen.

Do not miss this brilliant movie. For me, that's what great filmmaking is all about.

summary: In the highlands of Scotland in the 1700s, Rob Roy tries to lead his small town to a better future, by borrowing money from the local nobility to buy cattle to herd to market. When the money is stolen, Rob is forced into a Robin Hood lifestyle to defend his family and honour.

summary: Colonel Pepper brings his daughter, Peggy, to Hollywood from Georgia to be an actress. There she meets Billy who gets her work at Comet Studio doing comedies with him. Sunday, July 16, 8:00 pm The Castro, San Francisco

"As Colonel of the South, your make-up is very Indiana"

The moaning gossip of Hollywood has it managed to hurl more than a bit of mud in Marion Davies' direction over the years. That she had fame and was undeserved is often speculated. Given the Mawkian dramas she has been so often pushed into, this critique seems to have some validity. As a comedienne, however, her star shone very well. She had a career in light comedy and slapstick, she might have been able to compete with Mabel Normand. Her better outings included King Vidor's Show People (1928), who survive and are so well known because MGM has filled them with star cameos. This fortunate coincidence inadvertently saved what is undoubtedly one of the best works of his two stars, Davies, and notorious Joe College joker William Haines. Rumor has it that Show People is based on the life of Gloria Swanson, who began in Sennett comedies and a big drama (and do not think she did not spend the rest of her life reminding everyone!) Spent with Walsh of Stroheim and DeMille. Coincidentally, the comedy studios used in this film are the original excavations Keystone abandoned a year ago (think who worked there!). Colonel Marmaduke Oldfish Pepper (Dell Henderson) travels from Georgia to Hollywood with his daughter Peggy (Davies) to play in the movies. These two country hicks are an unsuspecting food for the incorrigible Billy Boone (Haines), "A Custard Pie Artist ??" She walks down to her cafeteria table in an outrageously funny entrance (watching out for the piece with the noodle), and then helps Peggy land a piece in his next picture. What she considers a high drama turns out to be a spinner, but a job is a job and Billy convinces her. "All stars have to take it by the chin?". The preview bumps Billy and Peggy ?? .. Charlie Chaplin, asking for her autograph! She pushes the little guy aside and a horrified Billy reaches for the book and makes her mark. Chaplin climbs into his car and Billy tells Peggy she's just nudging, so of course she faints. It's so funny, considering that Davies character does not recognize this guy! Peggy soon works at High Art Studios, changing her name to Patricia Pepoire, leaving poor Billy behind. Davies makes a wonderful show of a serious actress, with all the necessary fluttering eyelashes and trembling lips. Vidor launches a parade of stars having lunch in a long tracking shot (and they're all sitting shoulder to shoulder in front of the camera!), Including Polly Moran (who's also a sensational joker playing Davies's maid), Louella Parsons (one of the friendly vampires), Estelle Taylor, Claire Windsor Aileen Pringle, the comedy duo of Karl Dane (with the arm in a sling) and George K. Arthur (pretending to steal the cutlery), Leatrice Joy (amused by Arthur's antics), Renee Adoree, Rod (eating and smoking) La Rocque, Mae Murray, John Gilbert (who also appears to be riding through the MGM gates at an early stage), Norma (eeeww!) Talmadge ( as always evil-tempered) and Patricia, dressed as Marie Antoinette, sandwiched between Douglas Fairbanks (he does an amusing trick) and William S. Hart (protecting her from Doug). Billy meets the high art crew on the spot as the comedy troupe disturbs their shoot with predictable nutty results. Vidor himself works as director of the current production of Peggy in the final scene. Also noteworthy are Harry Gribbon as a comedy director who plays a great caricature of Eddie Sedgwick, Sidney Bracy as a dramatic director who can not make Peggy cry for her screen test and can not stop her if she does, and Paul Ralli as Andre, her dramatic love interest and a hilarious cheater. When her character tries to "act," it's as if Davies makes fun of all the horrible dramas she's been forced into, and she's brilliant at doing it.

Although true, Show People is a hokey satire The good old days ten years ago are still an extremely entertaining example of the quality work of MGM Irving Thalberg and her enormous wealth of gathered talent. What a pity, so much has been lost. There are too many examples of great films like The Patsy (1928), Vidor and Davies' hugely successful comedy from the beginning of the same year that languished in vaults when they could be seen and enjoyed.

summary: Pro-Life, directed by John Carpenter, written by Drew McWeeny & Scott Swan, tells the story of a young girl trapped inside a clinic, who discovers the only thing more dangerous than her pursuers is the demonic secret that she carries within her. Ron Perlman, Mark Feuerstein, Emannuelle Vaugiere and Caitlin Wachs star.
translation:
Well well well. As good as John Carpenter's season 1 excursion was in Masters of Horror, this is the complete opposite. He's certainly proved that he was still a master of horror with "Cigarette Burns", but "Pro-Life" is perhaps the worst thing I've seen of him, it's welcome beyond time, despite the running time of less than an hour. The script is nonsense, the characters are cranky and unsightly, and the conclusion is utterly absurd.

And for the jerks who actually bought the DVD (one of them was me); Did you see how Carpenter describes the film? He is really proud of this and talks a long time about it as his best work, and he praises the script. And in the commentary track, where he notices an obvious flaw that made it to the final cut, he just says he does not feel it necessary to correct the mistake, and he just left it there. I'm afraid the old master has completely lost his touch. I sincerely hope that I proved wrong.

I would like to make a positive comment and mention that the creature effects are great though. Technically speaking, this film is first class, with effective lighting concepts and make-up effects.

summary: Gothic lesbians prowl the corridors of a miserable little castle in Italy and fall prey to a deranged count with resplendent canine gnashers, a ghostly white complexion and the personality of Atilla the Hun.
translation:
Wow, that's shit. I will summarize it as soon as possible.

A count invites 4 naive sluts into his castle. A heap of nothing happens for a long time. Some lame and unexotic softcore sex scenes happen. Some girls get their heads cut off (off-screen) -The end.

The only things that are for this one are the decent-looking sets and costumes, some bad synchronization that leads to an unintentionally funny dialogue. and a few short nudie shots. And believe me, these things are not enough to save the 90 minutes of boredom this movie is about. In fact, the best part is tackling the beginning of the trader, which contains some nasty Goth chicks covered in blood and showing off their boobs - and again - this is definitely not worth the price of the garbage. As everyone else has noted, the title of the movie is completely nonsensical, since there is absolutely no bloodsucker or dance of any kind in the movie at all. It could just as well have been called "the goat-raper leads the circle joke", and at least it would have had a better title, which also concerns nothing in the film. An exact title would have been "90 Minutes of Torture" - another tantalizing title that would have been at least true ... for the viewer. Honestly, the trailer on the CD shows the best parts (and I use the term "best" extremely loose ...). I can not imagine anyone liking this wreck of a movie - please take my advice and leave it on the shelf. 2.10

summary: A snake lover sends out venomous snakes and reptiles to kill his enemies.
translation:
A rather memorable film from the variety of animals that kill people, who is particularly similar to "Willard" as he plays an aging character actor (in this case, a step down to the level of Les Tremayne, who is the only outstanding artist) I have seen him in a role as a man who lives an unbalanced life and decides to use his animal friends to revenge on those who have wronged him. Yeah, this is one of those movies where pretty much everyone is despicable, so they'll rejoice when they die, and really the selection of actors, locations, etc. could not be better, lending the movie an air of shabby decadence ,

Tremayne's character is "Snakey Bender," and he's certainly the most interesting thing about the film: an old snake collector obsessed by John Philip Souza's music. As the local preacher suppresses his practice of collecting small animals from local schoolchildren as bait for his snakes and his friend marries a stripper (which disturbs his ritual Wednesday evening concert), he sets out on a rampage. He creates a memorable pile of clunkers under the cliff, where he dumps the wrecks after disposing of his unfortunate owners. An entertaining game you can play while watching "Snakes" is placing bets with the cars landing furthest down the cliff. All in all very cheap and exploitative, but will really be a lot of fun for fans of this type of movie.

summary: At the beginning of World War Two a Hungarian Jew living in British Palestine volunteers to parachute behind enemy lines in German-occupied Yugoslavia to save fellow Jews from deportation to Nazi Death Camps. After she enlisted in the British Army she trained in Egypt as a paratrooper for the British Special Operations Executive. In the Spring of 1944 Hannah and a few colleagues were parachuted into Yugoslavia and joined a partisan group. Despite warnings against venturing into German-occupied Hungary Hannah insisted that she continue her mission. Arrested at the Hungarian border Hannah and her companions are sent to a special prison where she is interrogated under torture. However, Hannah refuses to reveal little more than her name.
translation: I think this movie is the best movie I've ever seen because it reflects the inner strength of a young girl during World War II. The film is impressive, not least because it actually happened. It reminds me of the story of Anne Frank.

summary: Dr. Blake runs a TV show called "Independent Thinkers", which is sort of a Scientology-like self-help/religion program. But he's not making his audience think any more independently - with the help of an alien organism he calls The Brain, he's using brainwashing and mind control. The only thing that stands between them and world domination is a brilliant but troubled high school student with a penchant for pranks...
translation: It was all over with the slashers around 88, so it was time for the cheesy rip-off of these older movies. The brain is well done, the script reminds me of Videodrome, but then, as I said, a bit cheesier. Acting can go through with it. But it is the effect that makes you laugh, the so-called brain is really a turkey and the blood is never shown. The opening sequence makes this movie worth seeing, the hallucinations are really nice and reminded me of Nightmare on Elm Street. Remember that the phone comes to life. It's visible to all the freaks out there, because there's no thrill in it, and as I said, the blood is not there either, but there's nudity for the perverts. I've seen worse movies than this, just wish they'd made it bloodier ...

summary: Taylor James is NOT the man. Although he's a popular bar mitzvah emcee in New Jersey - a state which he's never been outside of - he can't dress, he can't dance, and he's...well...totally clueless. So when premiere NYC event planner Vanessa Dupree offers to make him a star in the Big Apple bar mitzvah scene, it's an offer he can't refuse. With the help of legendary emcee Sebastian, Vanessa and company make Taylor the mitzvah MAN, and soon they are booking the most lavish bar mitzvah gigs ever. But emcee fame - a world of fast living, demanding customers, and competitive rivalry - has its price... This is the story of a bar mitzvah emcee's rise from lame - to fame - and back again.
translation: MY EYES! NAME OF GOD AND ALL THAT IS HOLY, MAKE THIS FILM UNSEE! Which drugs do you use? This could be the worst movie ever! I felt like I had been on a bad acid journey the whole time. I need to call a therapist to help me cope with the trauma of this epic catastrophe. From beginning to end Glow Ropes is an unholy masterpiece of satanic cinema. When I thought about seeing this movie with my Jewish best friend and family, we thought, "Oh, that can be funny, it's probably going to be bad, but still a bit funny." Movie could be. All my friends went for lobotomies after the movie ended. In the course of the film, one of my friends tried to hang up with his belt while another tried to cut his wrists with a wooden spoon. I wish I had seen The Ring's video instead, so the pain and suffering would be over in just seven short days. For all who want to watch this movie, YOU ARE NOT PREPARED! You may think that you are some kind of "tough guy" if you borrow this, but this movie will break you, knock you to the ground and urinate on you.

summary: The car of successful author Anna Rivers is found disabled next to the river, the thought being that she accidentally fell into the river while trying to change a flat tire. Her dead body is found upstream several weeks later, consistent with the accidental death theory. Based on incidents around him, her grieving husband, architect Jonathan Rivers, decides several months later to visit with Raymond Price, who approached John prior to Anna's body being found with news that she was trying to contact him from beyond. At that time, John was skeptical of Raymond's claims of electronic voice phenomena (EVP): that he is contacted from the beyond through electronic means - radio, television - which he is able to record. Along with Sarah Tate, another of Raymond's "clients" whose fianc√© passed away, John becomes obsessed with EVP as he gets more and more audio and video messages, however fuzzy, from Anna from beyond. That obsession takes a slight change in focus when John believes that Anna ...
translation: I do not think I was so impressed by the sheer absurdity of a movie throughout my life as I was when I left that piece of crap. NOTHING makes sense. None of it is wise or thoughtful. For lack of really exciting moments, they keep using this total cop-out trick in which you build up the music before the character opens something like a door or pushes a curtain aside and then there's nothing left. That's alright, maybe to do it once, but I counted three times. There are things for no apparent reason, characters, semi-formed storylines ... the characters were not well developed at ALL. the end was .. bad. bad, bad, bad, everything, every component of this movie is terrible. and I'm just here to warn you.

summary: Erika Kohut is a pianist, teaching music. Schubert and Schumann are her forte, but she's not quite at concert level. She's approaching middle age, living with her mother who is domineering then submissive; Erika is a victim then combative. With her students she is severe. She visits a sex shop to watch DVDs; she walks a drive-in theater to stare at couples having sex. Walter is a self-assured student with some musical talent; he auditions for her class and is forthright in his attraction to her. She responds coldly then demands he let her lead. Next she changes the game with a letter, inviting him into her fantasies. How will he respond; how does sex have power over our other faculties?
translation:
I rented the video from "The Piano Teacher" and did not know anything except what was on the video box. I did that with some concern because films that win prizes in Cannes are usually very good or very bad. Unfortunately, this falls into the latter category. About a quarter of the way inside, I said aloud, "This movie is boring." Halfway, I said to myself, "Where have I seen this?" At the three-quarter mark I had found out.

Despite its literary heritage, this film is essentially a remake of Robert Altman's much earlier (1969) and better: "That Cold Day in the Park." Although the details are obviously different and Altman's work was characterized by action rather than character studies, the two films are thematically identical. There is nothing "new" in this production. Every aspect of it has been done before: a character who gets out of control with increasingly self-destructive behavior (Abel Ferrara's "Bad Lieutenant" 1992); a perverse and doomed "love" ending in a (near) (almost) surefire scene (David Cronenberg's "M. Butterfly" 1993); unusually brutal sex scenes (David Lynch's "Blue Velvet" 1986); and so on. So I'm amused by the fact that so many felt the movie was "shocking," "shocking," and so on. This highly derivative film seems to be for the sole purpose of making viewers uncomfortable and obviously successful with some. However, I attribute such a reaction largely to the lack of film experience. Watch enough movies and you will have really seen everything. And while it's true that I saw the translated "R-Rated" version, I doubt the additional scenes would change my general opinion of "The Piano Teacher." Technically, the movie is not without earning. The camera works very well and the lighting is excellent. The performance of Isabelle Huppert also helps to avoid wasting time. This is the first of Hanekes films I have seen, and if I saw more I would have the same opinion of him as Ferrara: an interesting director, but not nearly the genius others do. Rating: 4/10.

summary: A grandson gives his grandfather a vow to go to the city to sell a cow and come back with a spouse. Extremely metaphorical representation of certain period of time in transitional Serbia is shown throughout the entire movie. Meeting the characters on his voyage, boy gets into various troubles, managing to fulfill the given promise.
translation: I did not expect much from this movie, after the terrible "life is a miracle". It turns out that this movie is ten times worse than "Life ...". I have the impression that the director / writer jokes only with the audience: "Let me see how much emptiness you (public) can hold". Dialogues are empty, ... Scenario is minimalistic. In a few moments the photography is really nice. Some sarcastic lines are half funny, but it's hard to really laugh during this "comedy." I was laughing because I could see the movie to the end. If you can rise above the fiasco of this director, you will find some good legends (Miki Manojlovic, Aleksandar Bercek) and a very good performance by Emib's son Stribor Kusturica. pity for such a great director! Emir Kusturica is still young and should shoot first-class films. Instead, he chooses this low-budget film, intended only for my private plays, with an arrogant attitude to world trends and carelessness towards his old fans.

summary: Ning Tsai-Shen, a humble tax collector, arrives in a small town to carry out his work. Unsurprisingly, no-one is willing to give him shelter for the night, so he ends up spending the night in the haunted Lan Ro temple. There, he meets Taoist Swordsman Yen Che-Hsia, who warns him to stay out of trouble, and the beautiful Nieh Hsiao-Tsing, with whom he falls in love. Unfortunately, Hsiao-Tsing is a ghost, bound for all eternity by a hideous tree spirit with an incredibly long tongue that wraps itself round its victims and sucks out their life essence (or 'yang element')...
translation: This is a great movie. I like it when Ning climbs his ink and the skeletons chase him, but fortunately he avoided them, opened the window, and did not even notice her. Xiao Qian is also very pretty. and when he put the needle in Ma Wu's butt, it's hysterical. And when he says love is the greatest thing on earth, standing between two swords is great too. then the part where he eats his bread while watching the man kill many people. then you see him sing poems when he wanted to escape the wolves. The love scenes are romantic, Xiao Qian and Ning look cute together. add the comic timing, the giant tongue, and you have horror, romance, comedy at once. not to mention great special effects for the 90s.

summary: This casts key characters from the Jungle Book into a 1930's pacific setting where Baloo is a bush pilot who finds himself as part of a struggling courier company.
translation:
Since reviewing this classic, I have decided to review it in more detail, but first some insider notes from a film critic.

This animated series is one of those I grew up with, it pleased my childhood, it made it great, I miss some of this stuff today that we clearly do not see as much as Back then, well on the review ...

Talespin or Luftens Helte, as it is called in Denmark, is a great animated series. It resembles Chip and Dale, Ducktales, and many of those old ones, so that it surrounds that weird feeling, I can not. Remember this series as much as I would like.

But in my opinion it was very good, she came with some kind of message, not so wild of a message, but it's one of the old ones so can be forgiven.

Now I do not want to sound old or anything, but I feel like the time has slipped out of my hands with these cartoons. Today we see something like Ed E dd and Eddy or anything else weird, we have all these new or almost new shows like Hannah Montana or something like that, but I feel like we do not have the same spirit in cartoons or real shows like we did in the beginning.

Now I may be wrong, but I feel like the time has changed too much. In conclusion, I would be thrilled if this series, like Talespin, reappears on the TV screen and not on the new one, give me back my childhood cartoons, give them back to the kids I have one day, give them back. ..

summary: Whilst crossing a ledge, 4000 feet above the earth, Gabe's friend's equipment fails to work and she slips out of his hand, falling to the ground. Almost a year later, Gabe is asked to go back to the same mountain range and rescue a group of 'stranded' people. The only catch is that these so called 'stranded' people are in fact looking for three boxes filled with $100,000,000 and they need a mountain ranger to lead them to them!!
translation: This movie is really a nerve-racking cliffhangin movie! Stallone was good as always! Michael Rooker showed a surprising performance and John Lithgow plays a great villain! Watch a Stallone fan and cliffhanger, you will not be disappointed!

summary: Exploring the lives and struggles of a varied group of people in a small, rural California town, Greendale focuses in on the Green family. From Grandpa sitting on the front porch commenting on the state of the world, to his struggling artist son Earl Green, to Sun Green, Earl's vibrant, free-spirited daughter, daily existence in Greendale seems idealistically perfect and trouble-free, at first. This uneventful lifestyle is proven to be more intricate than first glaces would indicate, when Cousin Jed shoots and kills a police officer, sparking a chain of events that change the lives of those around him in both simple and profound ways.
translation:
I saw this movie a few months ago in the city that appeared in the movie as Greendale. That's the only reason why I saw him. Another local who was there sent me an e-mail announcing a rerun showing that the first one was sold out and people were turned away. His editorial commentary in his presentation is a good summary:

"Yuk."

Unless you are a Neil Young fan or live in / near "Greendale" (if the latter know the real name), skip this movie. It's usually an ego tour for the filmmaker. There is no discernible plot, the music is just OK, and too many lyrics are incomprehensible, so it's impossible to track what little bits of it are in your hand.

I do not have to go in. A spoiler alert, as there are no surprises to give away.

I would rate this at 1.5 / 10, but that's just fun when you see the locations turned into a movie. The $ 6 was not worth it. I could rent a video camera and drive around in "Greendale" and do a better movie myself.

If you want to see a * good * environmental news movie without a plot, go to Koyaanisqatsi.

summary: As a reward from a jilted millionairess, Davis is given the $100,000 Porsche of the unfaithful husband. Unknown to Davis and the wife, the body of the husband is in the Porsche. The killer tries in vein to recover the body before it is discovered.
translation:
This week, I just thought it would be fun to meet Corey Haim after seeing the two "Lost Boys" movies last week and all. Not that I'm a fan boy - far from it - but I liked the two Coreys in earlier movies of my early teens.

So I prepared for three movies with him. Unfortunately, I chose "Dream Machine" first (never seen before), and it was so god-fearing that I decided to lock Corey back in my closet and let him sober up before I went into something else his. However, I managed to fight through this movie first. I had the impression that he wanted to play in the same league as "Ferris Bueller's Day Off" (1986), but was involved in his own delusions. Virtually the whole movie wants to be a comedy and in the end he hopelessly tries to be a thriller. The only good thing about "Dream Machine" is the premise: a corpse in the trunk of a Porsche. The rest fails so much that it is embarrassing. Even the best for Haim. I can unearth him as his young, enthusiastic self, but at least when he comes up with a kind of directorial statement. This was clearly not the case with "Dream Machine". So we have a perfect car, yes, this black Porsche. Haim's perfect girlfriend? Only a blond chick who has hardly any lines in the film. The perfect murder ... almost? A guy who falls on his butt as the movie's villain, tries the whole movie to steal the body from the trunk is never really successful, and at the end of the movie he thinks he's Michael Myers (minus the white William) Shatner Mask) and mistaken Corey Haim for Jamie Lee Curtis. I do not think she could have made that punch if they tried. A silly, funny movie with a story that is nowhere led by a director who does not know how to control his cast. Good job!

One last question for Mr. Haim: who had the idea to make you smile directly into the camera in this last movie? Your or the director? Not done

summary: "WHAT THE #$*! DO WE KNOW?!" is a radical departure from convention. It demands a freedom of view and greatness of thought so far unknown, indeed, not even dreamed of since Copernicus. It's a documentary. It's a story. It's mind-blowing special effects. This film plunges you into a world where quantum uncertainty is demonstrated - where neurological processes, and perceptual shifts are engaged and lived by its protagonist - where everything is alive, and reality is changed by every thought.
translation:
At first glance, this documentary / fiction / cartoon is quite entertaining and thought-provoking. Of course, if something is thought-provoking, it can be investigated. The reality is that this film combines metaphysics with allusions and groundless conclusions. The connection between "what the bleep ..." between science and spirituality is indeed not anchored in science at all. The study on transcendental meditation mentioned in the film claims that group meditation can reduce crime in a particular area, in this case Washington D.C. In fact, the HRA's crime rate (homicide, rape and assault) in 1993 was about 30% higher than the average crime rate between 1988 and 1992. There was absolutely no decrease in the homicide rate during the study. Any claim that connects metaphysics with science can and has been unmasked.

My conclusion from this information is that this film is either a bad attempt to indoctrinate people, or a joke. Anyway, I suggest you do not waste your time.

If you are looking for a lengthy film about science that might be thought-provoking, consider Mindwalk (1990).

summary: Santa Claus, high above the North Pole in his cloud-borne castle equipped with more surveillance devices than the Impossible Mission Force, prepares to deliver presents on Christmas night. Santa is especially interested in helping Lupita, the daughter of a poor family who wants nothing more than a doll; and a young boy whose parents are so wealthy they never spend any time with him (Santa fixes this by feeding them Pan-Galactic Gargle Blasters). However, the Devil will have none of this and sends his minion, Pitch, to foil Santa's plans. Pitch in turn recruits three Naughty Boys to help him set traps for Santa.
translation: My mother took me to this film as a kid, and every year I yearn to see him, like all my other Christmas favorites. Most of all, I remember the stupid devil and Santa Claus looking through his telescope. I waited and watched the TV Guide every year to see when it would be shown. I would normally find it playing on a Saturday afternoon. I found the movie in English only, which demands a lot from the film, and I longed to find a copy in Spanish. I think this movie is for my heart and have never suffered from nightmares as others might think. Yes, it's another movie about Santa Claus and that makes him special and unique. I can not wait to get a copy of this movie and watch it with my kids as I tell them my favorite pieces and memories !!

summary: When some Russian rebels takes control of some ICBM's, the Americans mobilize. Among the vessels sent is the nuclear sub, the Alabama. But before they leave they need a new X.O. and among the choices is Commander Hunter, who hasn't seen much action. But the ship's Captain, Ramsey OK's him. While on the way, there was an incident and Hunter disagreed with how Ramsey handled it, it's evident that Ramsey doesn't think much of Hunter because Hunter was college educated while Ramsey worked his way up. They're given orders to attack but when they were in the process of receiving another order, the ship's communications were damaged, so the entire message was not received. Ramsey decides to continue with their previous order while Hunter wants to reestablish contact first. That's when the two men butt heads that ends with Hunter relieving Ramsey. Later when some men die, some of the officers feel that Hunter is not up to the task so they team up to retake control. But Hunter has taken ...
translation: As a former submarine, this was one of the worst submarine movies I've ever seen. First of all, a mutiny aboard a US naval ship, especially a nuclear-powered submarine (Trident), unthinkable. These men are the best of the best and dedicated to their mission. The responsibilities they carry are great and they take the whole way from the captain to the youngest crew member very seriously. I could never see a crew of a ship splitting their alliance between the captain and the executive officer. An executive officer, acting as the character played by Denzel Washington, was released from his duties, and Court Martialed was then drummed by the Navy. No wonder the Navy refused to send in a technical advisor to make this film. If a member of a submarine crew made the sounds that were traveling on that ship, they would be severely reprimanded. Submarineers learn early in their careers to be as quiet as possible to avoid detection. They do not close doors and even speak quietly and wear soft-soled shoes on the way. I was amazed at how loud they portrayed the crew during the trip. Loud music would never be tolerated. I know the U-boat portraits would not actually sell movie tickets, but that's overkill until it's ridiculous. I would not recommend this movie to anyone.

summary: The misadventures of a family of White Lions who perform with Siegfried and Roy in Las Vegas.
translation:
It was 9:30 pm last night in my friend's caravan and we were so excited to see South Park (a new episode). In my country, South Park is broadcast at 10:30 pm, and we decided to kill time by watching the broadcast now being broadcast, Father of Pride. I start by saying that I only watched episodes. The first time I saw it, I did not find it nude and rude, so I thought, 'Holy, I have a football game tomorrow, so I have to stop watching stupid cartoons'. But yesterday I tried to give the father of pride a second chance. I think it's a complete rip-off of the Simpsons and instead only replaces yellow human characters with lions.

The second thing is, I wonder why it has its TV 14 rating. I find the Simpsons much more vulgar, and the only real vulgarity on this show are a few homosexual (listless) jokes. The Simpsons are also much more violent (Halloween specials) and crude. I also heard that the creator of the series also staged Shrek 2. Well, I have news for him: Shrek 2 was a lot better and I think he was too busy with the topic of family. However, I have to admit that the Father of Pride made me smile (even laugh) three or four times.

All in all, the father of pride does not bother me. I do not hate it, but I do not like it. I have seen much better from "The Simpsons".

3.5 / 10

summary: A child of the sixties sexual revolution, beautiful, sensuous Marguerite is addicted to sex and money. She is kept by a wealthy man, has a string of young lovers and hosts wild orgies in her luxurious villa. When she falls in love with the handsome bachelor Armand (Nino Castelnuova), he insists on absolute fidelity. Known by her reputation, Armand's controlling father soon intervenes, triggering a tragic turn of events.
translation:
CAMILLE 2000

Aspect Ratio: 2.35: 1 (Panavision)

Sound format: Mono

In love with a Roman nobleman (Nino Castelnuovo) during a visit to Rome herself into a beautiful young Libertine (Daniele Gaubert), but her unusual romance is rejected by Castelnuovo's wealthy father (Massimo Serato), and Fate suffers a tragic blow ...

A Sexual Love A story for the swinging sixties, which scriptwriter Michael DeForrest has taken from a literary source (Alexandre Dumas 'La Dame aux Camelias'), and Radley Metzger, who is also well known alongside Russ Meyer and Joe Sarno, with a free-spirited flair led by a redefinition of the parameters of "adult" cinema in the 1960s and 70s. Metzger's analysis of "la dolce vita" is, for the last time in his Scope-format career, very rich in visual excesses (for example, emphasis on reflective surfaces), even though the film's sexual openness is alarming by modern standards. The production values ‚Äã‚Äãare consistently beautiful and the performances are engaging and humane despite weak re-synchronization exercises (Castelnuovo and Gaubert are particularly memorable). Although he is in an indefinite future, Enrico Sabbatini's crazy stage design is able to pinpoint the film within his time, and Piero Piccioni's 'Wah Wah' music score has become a cult object among cultivators. After all, CAMILLE 2000 is an acquired taste, but fans of the director's elegant softcore eroticism will not be disappointed. Next up was Metzger THE LICKERISH QUARTET (1970), which many consider his best film.

summary: Amber is 40, beautiful, rich, spoiled, and arrogant beyond measure. Nothing makes this woman happy, including her wealthy but passive husband (Tony), a pharmaceutical kingpin. When Tony takes her on a private cruise from Greece to Italy, Amber is unimpressed at this impromptu no-frills vacation, and takes out her anger on the ship's first mate, Giuseppe. When a storm leaves the two shipwrecked on a deserted island, however, the tables suddenly turn...
translation:
and forget that. Completely. If you really need to see how Madonna acts, you can rent "Body of Evidence", at least Willem Defoe is one of them.

If the sets are beautiful, you might want to mute the dialog. You will miss nothing. Bruce Greenwood is wasted, Jeanne Tripplehorn is a prop and Madonna is so awful that it gets amusing. I will never know why they had to slaughter the original film into this mess; Presumably they thought it was "bankable". Madonna as an actress is certainly NOT.

If you borrow the original movie from 1979, you will enjoy it, and the performers can actually act. 1.10

summary: A surreal drama about an alienated family set in Koreatown, Los Angeles and Rishikesh, India.
translation: Why did I waste my money on the last Sundance day? I want a refund ... Can I get my $ 16 back? While watching this movie, I always waited for something to happen. Nothing happened. I only knew what it was about when I read the story, which was not really similar to the movie. Why did the director zoom in on his practical cam and then out? It was not very artistic. Why did the director show Lulu how to file his nails for fifteen minutes? Why did the actors stop talking as if they were reading? Or was that the point? I felt that Phantom Love had no story at all, and to be honest, I felt that my friends' holiday videos had a much higher entertainment value than this movie.

summary: New York's Odyssey Detective Agency is hired by two different clients to follow two women suspected of infidelity. Ladies' man John Russo trails Angela Niotes, the elegant wife of a wealthy Italian industrialist, while Charles Rutledge and Arthur Brodsky follow Dolores Martin, the beautiful young wife of a jealous husband. Their respective cases are complicated when John falls for Angela, and Charles falls for Dolores.
translation: This movie is just awful. John Ritter makes Pratt cases, 75% of the actors deliver their lines as if they were reading them from cue cards, bad editing, terrible soundmixing (dialogues are hard to hear above the background noise), and an action that's really right nowhere goes I I did not think I'd ever say that, but Dorothy Stratten is not the worst actress in this movie. There are at least 3 others who suck more. Patti Hansen delivers her lines with the passion of Ben Stein. I began to wonder if she was not dead. Even Bogdanovich's children are terrible (the oldest definitely reads their lines from a cue card). This movie is really terrible. There is a reason why Bogdanovich could not get another project until four years later. Please do not look at it. If you see it in your TV programs, cancel the cable. If a friend recommends it to you, reconsider your friendship. If your spouse wants to see it, it's better to find another soulmate. I would rather pry my eyes out with grass darts than sit down in the trash. If I could sum up this movie in one word, the word would be Suckotrocity

summary: Because boxing is a considered an illegal and disreputable enterprise in 1880's San Francisco, wealthy and influential members of the prestigious Olympic Club vow to make the sport a "gentlemanly" one. They sponsor a brash, extroverted young bank clerk named Jim Corbett, who quickly becomes an accomplished fighter under the new Marquis of Queensbury Rules. Despite his success, the young Irish-American's social pretensions and boastful manner soon estrange him from his benefactors, who plot to give their conceited former prot√©g√© a well-deserved comeuppance. Despite this, his dazzlingly innovative footwork helps him to beat a succession of bigger and stronger men, and he finally finds himself fighting for the world's championship against his childhood idol, John L. Sullivan.
translation:
Gentleman Jim is not a boxing movie. It is a vehicle for Errol Flynn as Jim Corbett. However, the boxing scenes are a real eye-opener for the modern viewer. There are no 12 round point decisions.

Errol Flynn plays the Irish bank employee who gets a shot at the heavyweight world title. Flynn lends itself well to the role of the polite but unpredictable Corbett. However, his opponent John Sullivan is still better, an old-school admirer whom Ward Bond plays.

The theme of the film is a man who is looking for his big chance. Corbett leaves his earthly life behind and builds a new personality as a gentleman Jim. Jim is a chancer who can adapt to any social environment. He is a liar and an egotist. Sullivan, the heavyweight boxing champion, is portrayed as a simple beast, but his honesty and sportiness contrast with the main character.

There is a lot of action and excitement and a wonderful ending with the necessary salvation for all. And Errol Flynn gets the girl.

summary: In Los Angeles, Henry is a veterinarian whose fianc√©e Kate dies in an accident on the day they're to marry. Worried that Henry has closed off his social life, his sister suggests he use a psychic to contact Kate, lay to rest unresolved feelings, and live more fully. He tries it, though he doesn't believe in it. Nothing happens, so his sister gives Ashley, the psychic, Kate's diary. Now she's able to convince Henry she's in contact with Kate and start the therapy. Two things happen: they find themselves attracted to each other, and Kate's ghost, who also has some unresolved issues, returns to stop this budding romance.
translation:
Well, this is the first post commenting on IMDb. You see, this movie has made me warn all good souls who will stop experimenting with movies.

Like most of them I've considered watching this movie because it seems some decent actors seem to have (though I've read the worst critics against the movie). I thought of experimenting with it, assuming it was a comedy strip., Comedies ... then it all started miserable ... man, you can believe yourself, you would feel like you're closing your head every time and every time the pathetic-looking woman, the film's heroine, is called helpless. Well, how much can a person digest a disease that does everything possible, trying to do anything to irritate you and keep you from doing what you do.

The next worst thing the movie is the "ZOMBIE" hero, yes, as he loses his fianc√©, he roams around like a goat, with black markings and his eyes., and with the "awful stupid "sister of the hero .. you would bleed from head to toe if you tried and managed to fully watch this movie ~!

summary: How important is the truth when falling in love? Bella is a Manhattan caf√© waitress, about to turn 35, stuck in a long-term affair going nowhere. Paul is a widower, facing old age alone. Bella's mother sets her up with Bruno, a novelist/cabbie who likes to bed-hop and whose ex-wife expects their two children to stay with him for awhile. While Bruno learns some maturity from his young daughter, Paul answers a personals ad placed by a "widow, 60." The two couples - along with one of Paul's older pals and a Jungian stripper - sort out how to initiate a relationship these days, what to do when someone you like disappoints you, and when to tell the truth.
translation:
My girlfriend and I were stunned at how bad this movie was. After fifteen minutes we would have given it up unless we were too curious to see if the movie could possibly redeem itself. That did not do it.

I can not understand the praise given to this movie. The writing was downright horrible and was delivered by some of the worst acting I've seen in a long time.

One thing that particularly annoyed me about this movie was that people often talked to each other there was an unnatural break between the lines. I know how to use a pause to create a sense of awkwardness (as in luck). This was not such a break - it was just bad governance. In fact, this movie could be much better with subtitles, and maybe the overseas market is the best one for this movie, because then the inner dialogue and the bad drama would not be perceived that much.

I generally like those kind of little quirky movies (The Real Blonde, Walking and Talking, Lovely and Amazing) that have failed on so many levels that I think they're one of the worst movies, which I played through in the last few years.

summary: All Tess Trueheart wants is to settle down to a quiet life with her boyfriend, detective Dick Tracy. But there's something pretty rotten going on in town, with someone pretty rotten behind it, and Tracy has his hands full with the likes of villain Big Boy Caprice and with the almost irresistible Breathless Mahoney.
translation:
When we use the word "escapist", we usually mean it negatively. Warren Beatty's big-screen movie "Dick Tracy" proves that "escapist" can be good. This is really a fun movie. As the same-named, fearless title character dressed in yellow, Beatty creates a detective we can all relate to: ready for action, but not without his weaknesses.

From then on, the rest of the characters are almost a world apart. Tess Truehart (Glenne Headly) is as glamorous as one would expect from the man of a criminal. The breathless Mahoney (Madonna) is perhaps the most amazing person you can imagine; Big Boy Caprice (Al Pacino) is the average villain: ruthless but cool. Other characters include the voice-challenged Mumbles (Dustin Hoffman), the over-musical 88 Keys (Mandy Patinkin) and The Kid (Charlie Korsmo). Charles Durning, James Caan, Dick Van Dyke, Estelle Parsons, Catherine O'Hara, Seymour Cassel, Paul Sorvino and Kathy Bates also play a role. Oh, wait a minute. I did not even explain the plot! The plot involves Tracy trying - and so far failed - to find a way to snap Big Boy. At the same time, some very bizarre events have been held in the city whose answers may be closer than anyone thinks.

Of course, the most important thing about this movie is that it's fun to watch it. If Warren Beatty struggled to keep up with his age, he made good use of it. "Dick Tracy" is a cool movie.

summary: Nancy Drew accompanies her father on a business trip to Los Angeles California. Nancy booked an abandoned house for them to stay in hiding the mystery of a movie star's murder from her father as a promise that she would stay out of trouble and be normal. Fitting into high school as a normal teen turns out to be harder than it sounds, for Nancy Drew. She soon befriends a younger boy and determines that the sleuthing world is where she belongs. While snooping through the attic, she finds a letter from the Hollywood star, Dehlia Draycott, written to someone named 'Z'. This leads Nancy on a wild goose chase as she comes to find out that Dehlia has a secret daughter, her daughter is to inherit everything and someone killed Dehlia because they were written out of the will.
translation: I came to Nancy Drew and expected the worst ... because of the bad reviews of everyone else. I thought, even if I do not read the books, it does not look like Nancy Drew, of whom I've heard. But I was wrong. Sure, it was not a copy of the books, but if you make something out of something, you need to modify it to become entertainment on big screens. The plot was enjoyable and exciting, with many real horrors, and I thought Emma Roberts really believed in her own way of portraying this classic character. There were some funny moments, and unlike many statements, Nancy never appears as Ditz in this movie. She was intelligent, conservative, polite and sincere. One thing that made this movie good was the balance between comedy, romance, suspense and heartfelt moments. I loved this movie. What a movie, what a movie! And if you are wise and decide to trust me and see this, prepare yourself for some scary moments because I was freaking out! Look at this or be an idiot and let other people decide what you think about this movie for you ... a mistake that I almost committed. I love it, I want to own this movie! I also love Emma Roberts now. It's like a mini Bree Van De Kamp from DH. I love it, I love it.

summary: A group of drag-racing fanatics, members of a Los Angeles club, move into an old deserted mansion and set up shop, making it their headquarters. They hold a Halloween masked ball for the club's grand opening, and invite everyone to come dressed as their favorite monster! Oddly enough, the festivities turn sour when one of the bright youths discovers an impostor among them in the form of an honest-to-gosh live monster who's been hogging all the dances with the best-looking girls!
translation: "Ghost of Dragstrip Hollow" seems to take place in an immaculate underworld, a bygone era where the biggest sin a child could commit is to defy the law and get a ticket. It starts with a young car fanatic who gets the business from her archrival who forces her to a car race. That's it with drag racing - this B-Flick is mainly about rock 'n roll, man! The people at American International obviously had a decent, square-footed teenager who liked to party but did not do anything about an adult chaperone. There are some amusing double appetizers and fruity exchanges ("Necking Kid:" We thought we were going to get some fresh air "... Dad:" Where do you think you would find it, in the throat? "), But the ghost comes a little late. Short on 65 minutes, the movie cheats us off with a climactic race that actually takes place off screen, and a "Scooby Doo" style unmasking that makes no sense. For nostalgia fans, however, there are some pointless fun. ** from ****

summary: Alex and Cristina (Kiki) are university students who end up living in the same building. Their friendship develops quickly, overcoming several phases, from fellowship to care and tenderness. While the two are very different, the two girls get along fine, except for the moments when a third character shows up - Sandu. Kiki's brother is permanently tormented by an unnatural jealousy which implies an incestuous liaison between the two siblings.
translation:
I saw the movie with a homophobic girlfriend, my wife and her friend. So I had views from all directions. Especially the movie made me laugh, the sexual tension was not really there and the only conspicuous actors were Tudor Chirila and Maria Popistasu. Yeah, I think she played her part well, even if the script did not fit. There were good Romanian actors, they just did not have complex roles. I welcome that Puya enters the movie business. I do not know why, but I think he's a good guy, I just hope he's going to be a good actor.

The woman, however, loved the movie, and I think there were chords to play and to which I had no ear. If the film tries to portray unusual sexual behaviors and their consequences in today's Romania, then it has failed miserably. There were no consequences. Imagine, the girls are actually a boy and a girl, and the same story just becomes a boring, uninteresting conspiracy. I have no idea why she received all these BAFTA awards. In my book it should have received the award "Better luck next time". (bafta = good luck in Romanian).

summary: A young boy's dreams of glory and war turn into a bitter nightmare as his father's kingdom is overrun by an invading army. Lost and alone in the woods, he finds an ancient sword that promises him the ability to claim his vengeance.
translation: "Mechenosets" is one of the most beautiful romantic films I have ever seen. The name of the film can be translated in English as "sword-bearer". The main hero (Sasha) was born with an extraordinary ability: he can protect himself with the extremely sharp sword that is under the skin in his hand. At first glance, he seems to be another stupid superhero from the pointless movie about unreal events and feelings. But it's not about Mechenosets. He can hardly be called an antihero. I think he's just a person who has lost the sense and trust in good, justice and love in their lives. In his life he has never met anyone who could understand and love him (except his mother). Every one of his steps is stained with blood; He takes revenge on everyone for his gift, which became a condemnation to him. And suddenly he meets her. She does not need the idle conversations and explanations. She loves him for what he is. She does not care what he did. The fact that he is beside her is more important than anything else. But soon she learns his secret: he kills two people (her ex-boyfriend and his bodyguard) to protect her from their eyes. Even then she could not escape her feelings. They try to run, but it's hard to hide. After all, they have a serious car accident. He is locked up; She is in a mental hospital. They do not know each other, but she thinks he will save her. He overcomes many obstacles and finally finds them. They walk again but are not invulnerable. She is wounded, she needs a break, but the police almost catch her. He does not know what to do, they drive into a corner and then his sword starts cutting trees, helicopters around them, but it's not necessary, since she's already dead in his arms, and he's the one again lonely person around the world.

summary: A rock singer is determined to rise to the top of the profession, letting nothing stand in the way of that goal.
translation:
I recently purchased one of my favorite movies on DVD, and as usual, watching it all just blew me away.

I'm a big fan of Hazel O'Connor and the soundtrack to this movie just made me cry, especially the "Will You" track. It's a pure nostalgic journey for me, back to my youth. This is the second best place for Quadrophenia (with Phil Daniels).

A great soundtrack and a great view of Britain in the 80's thatcheritic years I grew up in. The end is so sad that for hours after the end of the movie I'm like a bubbly baby.

I expect to wear this DVD through repeated viewing, I can see it over and over again and never boredom, just for the soundtrack alone.

Hazel, I'm sorry I heard from your dad. God bless you all. xx

summary: Edward Walters, an auto mechanic, falls for the intelligent and beautiful Catherine Boyd. It is love at first sight. There is however a problem, she's engaged to jerk James Moreland. Fortunately, Catherine's uncle likes Ed, and with his friends they scheme to make Catherine fall for Ed. The comedy in this movie stems from the fact that Catherine's uncle is none other than Albert Einstein, who's portrayed as a fun loving genius, as are his mischievous colleagues, Nathan, Kurt and Boris.
translation: Pretty good romantic comedy, in which I do not think that Meg ever looked cuter. All players have done a good job to keep the game alive. Of course, in the real world, no genius mathematician would even see a little monkey finger, but that's why I love romantic comedies. Beautiful movie. Damn, Meg is a baby, eh?

summary: A traveling minister and his wife are quietly menaced by a devil cult in the Old West. By the time the Good Reverend figures out what's going on it may be too late to stop the evil.
translation: So, finally I know it exists. Together with the other British contributors here, I have seen this on the MUST that it was just UK screening in the 70's. I remembered the title, but nowhere did I mention it to the people. It scared me (that's 2 's), but if you went to bed with Doom and scurried about your mind to hear threatening horrors, is not that what a TRULY CLASSIC horror movie is? I can barely remember the subtleties of the film, but I remember my trembling flesh and my heightened senses. Can anyone confirm my suspicion that this is black and white? If anyone has information on how to get a copy of it, please contact ...

summary: Two couples and their single friend, all at different stages in their relationships, deal with the complications of dating, commitment and marriage.
translation:
The show is really funny. Nice topic. Jokes and insoles are really good. With a few extra settings, it can become a very popular show. The only big drawback of this show, however, is the cast. David Spade does an excellent job as Russell, Megyn Price does a good job. But who the hell has taken Patrick Warburton, Oliver Hudson and Bianca Kajlich.

Technically, Russell and Jeff are the show's main characters, making viewers watch the show. Russell is a playboy and Jeff is a kind of frustrated family man. The relationship is awakened ... with an experience of all the problems a couple is facing in a relationship. Patrick Warburton - does a terrible job as Jeff, he is not suited for the role at all. He is like a robot, literally there is no punch in his dialogue delivery.

Cast is really important for viewers. The bad acting will certainly bring the show downhill ...

summary: Lady Alyce Marshmorton must marry soon, and the staff of Tottney Castle have laid bets on who she'll choose, with young Albert wagering on "Mr. X". After Alyce goes to London to meet a beau (bumping into dancer Jerry Halliday, instead), she is restricted to the castle to curb her scandalous behavior. Albert then summons Jerry to Alyce's aid in order to "protect his investment".
translation:
This film seems to have been conceived as a Fred Astaire-Ginger Rogers movie - the plot, the dance numbers, the funky music and the entire formula are there ... except Ginger! Whether it really was REALLY intended to reunite the team is uncertain, but it certainly has the look of one of those films. Instead of Fred's usual companions (like Eric Blore or Edward Everett Horton), Burns and Allen are used - probably because, although they're known as a comedy team, they could sing and dance very well. That really shocked me, but the team was a welcome addition and some of the traditional Fred and Ginger numbers were made with either Fred and Gracie or those two along with George. Only at the very end Ms. Fontaine dances with Fred, but it is very short and with a distant camera shot.

When I talk about Burns and Allen, I think I owe it to the team to talk about it in the movie. I've never been a fan of her show or her movies. In general, I find Gracies Dumbbell Act very annoying and I have given bad reviews on her short films and feature films. But in this movie, I have to admit that they were great - not only competent dancing, I even found them funny and filled the hole left by Edward Everett Horton very nicely. They were at the top of their game and the authors did a wonderful job in this department.

Well, for the rest of the movie, it's all a lot of fun and entertaining. The problem for me, however, was that Joan Fontaine was not a very good choice for the movie - not just because she performed out of her reach (after all, she was not a singer or dancer), but because she had the screen presence of a lint. For that reason, the usual balance and dialogue between girls and girls was missing. It was also a very charming performance of Harry Watson as a devilish little boy who did everything to play Cupid - all because he wanted to win a bet! And finally, I loved the Fun House and Tunnel of Love sequence - it's too hard to describe, but it's great fun! Overall, I liked the movie pretty much - it had a lot of charm and good writing. Unfortunately, it also featured a bland performance by Ms. Fontaine, who scored one point - brought my score to 7 for this film.

summary: Jim Morris is a Texas high school chemistry teacher and coach of the school's baseball team. He's always loved baseball and as a way of motivating his players, he agrees to go to a professional try-out if they win the championship. He once had aspirations to be a professional baseball player but an injury brought that to an end. Sure enough, the 39 year-old father of three finds himself at a camp for the Tampa Bay Devil Rays and he somehow seems to have regained his pitching arm, easily throwing a 98 mph fastball. Signed to a contract, he toils in the minor leagues while his supportive wife stays home raising their children. He soon finds himself called up to the big club and pitching for Tampa which is in Texas playing the Rangers. Based on a true story.
translation:
An end to an era was released here in the US in the spring of 2002 with "The Rookie," a Disney live-action movie that "The Best of the End !!!!" seemed to be. It took place right here in Texas! Actually, the story began in West Texas, as a code on a local sign shows. It was a high school trainer who was so convinced of his high-class baseball team that he decided to become a professional. !! It was a very good sports movie, including "The Mighty Ducks" trilogy. It also had moviegoers through Texas, from somewhere between the Panhandle and El Paso to the Metroplex (where I live). I can tell because I recognize this ballpark (It was "The Ballpark in Arlington, now it's" Ameriquest Field "!) It was nice to see Disney's" Golden Age "ending up here in my area !!!!! RIP < br />
Golden Age of Disney

1920s Spring 2002

"It all started with a mouse ... and ended with baseball." (sobs)

10/10

summary: The Kingdom is the most technologically advanced hospital in Denmark, a gleaming bastion of medical science. A rash of uncanny occurrences, however, begins to weaken the staff's faith in science--a phantom ambulance pulls in every night, but disappears; voices echo in the elevator shaft; and a pregnant doctor's fetus seems to be developing much faster than is natural. At the goading of a spiritualist patient, some employees work to let supernatural forces rest.
translation: The second part (actually Episode 4-8) of the successful Danish TV series is somewhat inferior to the first, but also has a lot of laughter and fear. This time, Udo Kier plays two parts, like the monster baby and his demonic father. Other outstanding parts this time are the doctor Krogshoj of S√∏ren Pilmark, who faces the terrible revenge of Dr. Krogshoj. Helmer must face. Once again, the patient Frau Drusse tries to solve the secrets of Miss Marple-Art. At a cliffhanger and after the death, the main actors Ernst Hugo J√§reg√•rd (Dr. Helmer) and Kirsten Rolffes (Mrs.Drusse) ask themselves, how they will do the third part, but I hope Trier will give it Unfortunately, Morten Rotne Leffers, the dishwasher of Down syndrome no. 2, died shortly after. Look for Stellan Skarsg√•rd in a cameo. ***

summary: Eleven vignettes, all homages to New York City life, are presented. I. Ben, a pickpocket, is attracted to Molly on first sight, and gets into an interesting "pissing match" with Molly's married lover, NYU professor Garry. II. Mansuhkhbai, an orthodox Jain diamond wholesaler, and Rifka, an orthodox Jewish diamond retailer who is getting married tomorrow, learn that they have more in common than just diamonds. III. David, a musician and music editor for a video being directed by Abarra, is having problems meeting Abarra's demands while he slowly falls for Abarra's assistant, Camille, who he's never met but has only talked to on the telephone solely about work. IV. A young man believes he's made a powerful connection to a stranger, a young woman, in the simple act of lighting her cigarette, and proceeds to convince her of the same and as such that there is a future for them from that point on, and not at some unspecified time down the road. V. A high school senior, who has been dumped by...
translation: This was a movie I could not wait! So I finally got it and was pretty disappointed. For starters, the movie has said so little about New York, just a few confusing shots of buildings, streets, bridges, and cafes. He is not really focused on New York magic. Another thing that changed my mind was the French movie in this movie. I know it's a remake, but it's not a French-style remake! Anyway, here you will notice elements reminiscent of French films, such as long and messy scenes, no or little talking, and of course everyone smokes in French style! The story tells a lot of lives (too many for my liking) and they seem somehow connected at the end. I feel as if there were no devotion for the characters as for the stories. The film was too short to describe every single fate to which everyone is happy. So we can see about 30 people for about 5 minutes each. And there you have your 120 minutes! If you like active scene dialogues and the like, this is not the movie for you! I give it 4 just because I love New York and loved the cast!

summary: In the year 2014, Japan has collapsed economically and thus its people emigrated in large numbers and settled in other parts of the world. In a corner in Asia, there is a little street called Mallepa, a big melting pot where Asians such as Hongkongers, Taiwanese and Japanese live together. It was a place where people fought for order, food and freedom. It was there where Shou (Gackt), raised as an orphan and Kei (Hyde), who could live forever, met and became the best of friends. However, they were unable to escape from the fight for power involving gangs of different ethnicity on the street of Malepa...
translation: Moon Child was one of the more symbolic films I saw. What I really liked was the illustration of immorality / mortality and the obstacles and guidance through life. The film shows a lot of vampire Kei with the power of immorality and the benefits of it. Whether there are supernatural abilities or eternal life is what people usually wish for. Moon Child shows the pains and disadvantages of immortality, as the feelings of loss affect almost all characters, especially the main characters Sho and Kei. The meaning of the title "Moon Child" reveals itself as the film comes to an end, where it is clear that everyone is a moon, lighting the path of other people and giving guidance. Personally, I like the moral on which the film is depicted. The film's weaknesses are in some parts of the drama and special effects, as the film became less authentic. The scene in which the character Toshi dies could have been more powerful and realistic if more authentic emotions were included in the drama. Some scenes with special effects, such as the gunshots, could have been more authentic without this being similar to an action video game. The sparks that came out of the guns were too wrong and I think that could have been fixed or fixed. Still, I think Moon Child should be a movie everyone should watch. The symbolic ideas and images produced by the film are easily accepted by everyone and can interest many viewers. It's a pretty pensive movie and entertaining too.

summary: "The Straight Story" chronicles a trip made by 73-year-old Alvin Straight from Laurens, Iowa, to Mt. Zion, Wis., in 1994 while riding a lawn mower. The man undertook his strange journey to mend his relationship with his ill, estranged, 75-year-old brother Lyle.
translation:
If you want action and adventure in a movie, you should look elsewhere. On the other hand, if it's a lazy day and you want a good movie to go with that mood, watch The Straight Story.
