Richard Farnsworth shows a compelling performance as gentle and gentleman Alvin Straight, in this true story of Alvin's journey on a riding mower through three states to see his estranged brother, who has suffered a stroke, winding road, making friendships with strangers and many grandfatherly advices give about family on the way. The story moves as slowly as the riding mower, but somehow manages to continue watching the viewer and waiting for the next hour Alvin will offer.

Stretch out on the couch, relax and enjoy. It's the only way to watch this very good movie, rated 7/10 in my book.

summary: The aftermath of a high school shooting leaves Deanna Cartwright seriously wounded and nine others dead, including the perpetrator. Det. Martin Van Zandt is assigned the unenviable task of investigating the crime and finding someone to hold responsible. His attention settles on Alicia Browning, a darkly troubled outsider who, as the only person present throughout the entire incident, is both the key witness and a possible suspect. Further complicating her isolated existence, Alicia's high school principal compels her to pay a reluctant visit on the still-hospitalized Deanna. Privileged and popular, Deanna differs dramatically from the alienated Alicia. Yet, beneath an upbeat appearance, she is struggling desperately with the emotional and physical scars left by the attack. Over the next few days, united by nothing more than their common suffering, the two young women form an unlikely friendship to cope with the tragic events that threaten to overwhelm them.
translation: This movie is so misunderstood that it is not even funny. If you remember seeing this for the shootings, stay clear. This deals with the effects and traumas that the survivors have to endure. Even the detectives are looking for the answer we all make ... WHY? Fantastic spectacle of the two leading ladies as we see how those we ignore are affected by the same things we are concerned with. Yes, the language is sometimes tough, but it goes well with the characters. There are some loose ends that still remain unanswered, but all the movies have these. The main topics are covered, and this film gives an important statement about how all adults feel after such incidents. Highly recommended for teens and adults.

summary: Set before the events of the previous films. As group of strangers awaken with no memory to find they have been involuntarily placed in a maze containing deadly traps, a young man whose job is to watch over the Cube endeavors to rescue a woman trapped within.
translation:
The murders in this movie are not that bad, but the movie is safe. It's even worse than that. It's not even worth the wear that could be caused if you push it into your DVD player.

Not even the wear and tear on your shoulders when you carry it out of the DVD store, and not the money and time you hire and watch. Horrible.

It's unbelievable how anyone can say something positive about this movie. It was just a mere masochistic tendency of me not to stop watching and, in addition, the peer pressure from my fellow observers.

The manuscript is terrible, the director's worse and the acting just abhorrent.

I hope you do not see this as fun for your fun, I would rather see it as a proper warning: do not waste your time watching this garbage!

summary: At an annual pace, a huge colony of ants is forced to collect every piece of food that grows on their island for a group of menacing grasshoppers. But that all changes when a misfit inventor ant named Flik accidentally knocks over the offering pile thus forcing the grasshoppers' devious leader Hopper to force the ants to redo their gathering of food. Despite the fact that his friends don't believe him and desperate to help save the colony, Flik volunteers to go out into the world and search for a group of 'warrior' bugs. Instead, what he got was a talented group of circus performers. But when the grasshoppers return and take control of the island, Flik must prove himself a true hero before it's too late.
translation: This film is full of references. Like "Mad Max II", "The Wild One" and many others. The ladybug face is a clear reference (or tribute) to Peter Lorre. This movie is a masterpiece. We will talk about it much more in the future.

summary: The 74th Annual Academy Awards
translation:
OK, the Oscars seem to be hyped a little more every year. And I wanted to win "Gosford Park" to win (well, Robert Altman earned an Oscar for years!). I think it was high time for an African American to win the Best Actress. Unlike the previous critic, Halle Berry's role in "Monster's Ball" was far more original than that of Nicole Kidman's "Moulin Rouge"; I never thought to nominate the latter for anything, especially in a year when "Mulholland Dr." Was seen.

One of the things I predicted was the stuff of the 9/11 attacks. I knew that they would say something about freedom. Yes / Yes. Robert Redford should know better. Unlike the previous reviewer, Whoopi Goldberg is not the worst host (among the previous hosts was Bob Hope, for whom I have no respect). I really liked her jab at John Ashcroft.

Although I would not have given the best picture to "A Beautiful Mind," the 74th Annual Academy Awards still pleased me (I must admit, I enjoy the Oscars more than on my own birthday the day after my parents and I wandered into the apartments in Bandalier, New Mexico, it was spring break, I thought, when Jim Broadbent won his Oscar, most viewers asked "Jim, who ?!" "I wonder if Woody Allen will ever attend the Oscars again.

summary: Archer Coe has been found dead in his locked bedroom. The cops consider it suicide, but Philo believes otherwise. When the Coroner shows up, he finds that Archer had been hit with a blunt object, stabbed and shot - making suicide unlikely. When the evidence points to his brother, Brisbane is found stabbed to death in the closet. Archer had a number of enemies, any one of which would have been glad to knock him off, but which one did and how did the murder occur in a room looked from the inside. Only one man, the keen, fascinating, debonair detective Philo Vance, would be able to figure out who is the killer.
translation: "The Kennel Murder Case" starts with a run and does not stop until the end. Everyone had reason to kill the victim, and several people tried. William Powell is great as Philo Vance, Gentleman Detective. Mary Astor is a refreshing niece who only wants to marry her Scottish master and enjoy her heritage. This movie comes along with "Nancy Drew, Reporter" on DVD, which is also fun. If you need to rent the disc (or check out from your local library), do it. It is pure entertainment!

summary: Parents, children, brothers. A few days in Santiago, Chile, seen by three different characters: V√≠ctor, a schoolboy who develops a crush on a stripper he sees at a club on his birthday; Silvio, Victor's older brother, hired by the club owner to be his driver and who also falls for the woman; and, Gracia, the stripper who's the boss's girlfriend and who wants out. The club owner, Don Pasqual, has many illegal enterprises and a bad heart. V√≠ctor's impulsive puppy love, Silvio's libido, Gracia's plans, and Don Pasqual's possessiveness make for a dangerous mix.
translation:
Director and writer Andr√©s Waissbluth spent seven years completing this two-hour film on the underground crime scene in Santiago de Chile, and perhaps that's one of the reasons why the resulting film has to be episodic and editorial. OR, maybe this is the technique of a director who has a keen sense of film noir storytelling. Two brothers - Silvio the Elder (N√©stor Cantillana) and Victor the Younger (Juan Pablo Miranda) - have moved to Santiago from their home in Temuco after the death of their parents and Silvio supports Victor in training. On Victor's seventeenth birthday, Silvio brings the maiden to the clubs, where he encourages Victor to lose his virginity to a stripper / prostitute of the club. In a tender scene, Victor has to face his burgeoning impotence while Silvio is on the club floor, impressing the "owners" with his potential for hiring.

Silvio goes as a bodyguard for the "gang" to work / stooges and earns good money to support Victor's education. However, Victor has eyes for one of the dancers of the club Gracia (Antonella R√≠os) and starts to woo her. He leaves school and takes Silvio's furious disappointment. Gracia is simply the squeeze of the leader of the club band Don Pascual (Alejandro Trejo), the boss of Silvio! Gracia is the glue that holds this story together, because she is the personality of Victor, Silvio and Don Pascual and the consequences of that bizarre m√©nage that has a trinity to deadly consequences. By recounting the story through the eyes of Victor, Silvio, and Gracia, we understand the flaws and tears in each character that make possible the demise that results.

Sounds like a Chilean pulp fiction? Well, it is and is filmed in a brutally colorful, dark way that involves a lot of frontal nudity (both female and male) and provocative sexual encounters. But in the end, it's the sensual aspect of the director's vision that drives this movie, playing successfully on the debut virgin psyche against the die-hard professional sex worker. The cast is pretty strong, especially Antonella R√≠os in the demanding role of Gracia. There are enough phrases and repetitions and repetitions of incidents that you think you have understood the first consideration, but whose effects change dramatically when viewed through the eyes of another character. After two hours, a reasonable cut would have improved the effect of the film. In Spanish with English subtitles. Recommended for those who like the trendy movie Noir style and the art of South American cinema. Grady harp

summary: Larry Burrows (Jim Belushi) is unhappy and feels powerless over his life. He believes his entire life could have turned out differently had he not missed that shot in a baseball game when was a kid. One night he meets this mysterious man named Mike (Michael Caine), who could change his fate by offering him that alternative life he always dreamed of. But as Burrows embarks on this journey of self discovery he realizes that even this new life has its problems and drawbacks..
translation: Belushi at his most ingratiating and Courtney Cox in front of Friends has a small role. I often think Belushi is not used enough in Hollywood, and this movie role is one of his best. For those of you who watch his television show, this is a very different and likeable character. The film itself is not earth-shattering, nor is the message new, but rather sweet and lovable. Supporting familiar faces and names is a perfect balance, although Lovitz 'whining can get tiring and Michael Caines charming spiritual leader has a slightly dark, if not well-intentioned, advantage. Hamilton, as Belushi's wife is unfortunately two-dimensional and one wonders why he married her. In addition, Renee Russo is wasted and not particularly convincing with the "Prom Queen" who escaped. Still a nice way to spend two hours.

summary: Lewis and Clark were famous comedians during the vaudeville era. Off-stage, though, they couldn't stand each other, and haven't spoken in over twenty years. Ben, Willy Clark's nephew, is the producer of a variety show that wants to feature a reunion of the classic duo. How will Ben convince the crotchety old comedians to put aside their differences before the big show?
translation:
The Sunshine Boys are among my favorite movies. It was the first time I saw it as a Christmas attraction at Radio City Music Hall when it first came out and loved it ever since. I've seen it six times in the theaters, and if it had played today, I'd see it again.

Many of the reviews here mentioned the wonderful performances of the leads. Matthau was brilliant, but was unlucky enough to be nominated for Jack Nicholson's Oscar-winning performance of Randall P. MacMurphy in "One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest." Burns won, though Richard Benjiman had to be nominated at least roles were played perfectly, as Fritz Feld plays for the French fries advertising.

What brings me to my reason for discussing this movie is directing the much underrated Herbert Ross person play, "The Owl and the Pussycat" on the screen and making a full movie out of it, does it again. He opens the games out without making them look like a photographic stage play. He fled the story and the characters.

Here we are 20 minutes into the movie, before we come to the scene that opens the play where Ben Clark comes to see his uncle and tell him about the comedy special. Although there are dialogues from the play in the first twenty minutes, the sequence itself is completely new. A few years ago I saw on the Broadway Revival of the play with Jack Klugman and Tony Randall, which was wonderful. But I think Ross and the scriptwriter, playwright Simon, have improved it. It's just a wonderful movie.

summary: The movie describes the life of Adolf Hitler from childhood to manhood, and how he became so powerful. It describes his poor childhood in Austria, it describes the first world war from his point of view, and how he became the strongest man in Germany. The movie show us how Hitler turned from a poor soldier into the leader of the Nazis, and how he survived the attempts to kill him. It describes his relationship with his mistress Eva Braun, and his decisions and enemies inside Germany and inside the Nazi party.
translation: As someone who was born of a German mother and an English father (who spent five years in a POW camp), I come from a unique position. On the one hand the confrontation with the various Nazis on the one side of the family and the victors of the Second World War on the other side. This miniseries can not immerse themselves in every single part of Hitler's psyche and must give the viewer a general impression of the situation at that time and as much as possible Hitler's state of mind. This series is doing quite well. Carlyle is very good at O'Toole, but I would have liked to get more information about relationships with others in the party because Hitler did not do anything on his own. He had people around him who often followed him without question, and certainly without question later in his murderous career. What went through Goebbels, Goring and Hess's mind? It would have been helpful to see more of these relationships. But I hope that it causes people to explore the subject more. It could also make people understand why someone like Saddam Hussein should not stay in power.

summary: Controversial tragicomedy about a brother's obsessive love for his sister. Having left her husband, Hilary moves in with her unbalanced brother, Pink, who uses wit and humor to hide his amorous yearnings.
translation:
I thought maybe a movie featuring Peter O'Toole, Susannah York, Michael Craig and Harry Andrews might be worth watching. Oh, I was wrong. Totally exaggerated nonsense from start to finish, with both O'Toole and York wildly exaggerating. I have seen it twice and still have no idea what it was about. I have the feeling that O'Toole is playing the laird of a Scottish castle that has a drinking problem and likes to play games with his sister (York). He also barks furiously. But other than that, your guess is as good as mine.

The movie does not have any redeeming function. I can only assume that the cast and the director have been blackmailed to make this bleak, uninspired, prickly puff. Obviously a waste of the time of a talented actor and director. Ridiculous.

summary: Alice, having survived the previous installment of the Nightmare series, finds the deadly dreams of Freddy Krueger starting once again. This time, the taunting murderer is striking through the sleeping mind of Alice's unborn child. His intention is to be "born again" into the real world. The only one who can stop Freddy is his dead mother, but can Alice free her spirit in time to save her own son?
translation:
What happened? Those were the first words that came to my mind when that terrible movie appeared on my computer screen for the first and last time. Nightmare on Elm St. had gone noticeably downhill after becoming a cult classic of a first movie, but I doubt anyone expected that dreadful departure. Nobody expected this cosmic joke of a movie, and nobody is more desperate about it than me.

This is by far the worst movie ever. In the beginning it does not seem to be that bad, with a really scary intro and a rather long shower scene with Alice. But then, at the beginning, we hit a low point with a bad drama and a confusing sequence of events. I mean, sure, Freddy movies are supposed to be gorgeous and scary, but this one is like a train wreck in its bad sequence of events and awful plot construction. It feels like you're coming down with a terrible headache, not that you're scared. So the director fails completely. None of the suspense and well-made horror of previous sequels can be found here, and even the death scenes are mostly crass and moronic (death by food especially), aside from this one cool scene that's shaped like a cartoon fight. That's why this movie gets a point.

The story ... lame, lame, lame, LAME. It was an excuse for angering people and driving the MPAA crazy, and nothing more.

The acting ... should I mention how Freddy was turned into a childish boogey-man-like clown figure? How his rebirth scene made him look like a monster from the horror book of a 7-year-old, rather than the gritty and nightmarish dream killer we've all known and loathed since the first film? This arm waves and stutters silently as it reappears ... ugh. And his one liners too. During the whole movie they suck. Bad. A classmate might come up with funnier things, then vomit vomits Freddy throughout the 90 minutes of the movie. Damn, a chimpanzee could bring in much weirder lines than what Freddy said. Who wrote the script for this? This movie is also very irritating. It seems so pointless. Like a mosquito whirling around your head, a mosquito that just will not go away. Freddy is just a nuisance now. We've seen him so many times. This is nothing else, and most of the time you just want him to take his dreadful one-liners and come from your TV screen. Alice, instead of the thoughtful and quiet girl from the last movie, seems to be annoying and very superficial, and this is obviously due to the horrible, terrible screenplay this movie was designed for. Lisa Wilcox may be a great actor, and sometimes it seems that way through the cracks, but she can not save this movie. The other actors are mostly shit.

The last 15 or 20 minutes of Freddy's existence in this movie are terrible and embarrassing. I hope Englund was ashamed of it. Who wants to see Freddy walking around like a mutated gorilla with outstretched limbs and laughing like a cartoon villain? This movie destroyed everything positive that I felt for the Nightmare series. I can never see her again without this picture going through my mind; from the mutilated horror of the cartoon that became Krueger. He slowly became a jokey, backward pop culture icon, but that's the lowest of the low. That's the low point. No one will ever take Freddy Krueger seriously after watching this movie. He is nothing but a joke, a clown who is long overdue. Pathetic.

Of all the films I could hate, why did it have to be Nightmare on Elm St, a series I once liked and liked a lot? The Dream Child represents the death of a legend and the breaking of any hope I had in the Nightmare on Elm St. series. Freddy would go on to his downward spiral in clown status in the next episode, Freddy's Dead (which was more entertaining than that, actually), and then he would go on to lower the mood in Freddy VS Jason, and eventually he would lower in nothing break out, which is the best.

I know that was mostly a rant about why Freddy is shitty now, but this movie is horrible and one of the worst movies ever made. Not recommended for anyone, and even ANOES completers do not want to see this one again.

summary: A wild stallion is captured by humans and slowly loses the will to resist training. Yet throughout his struggles for freedom, the stallion refuses to let go of the hope of one day returning home to his herd.
translation:
Well, what can I say, this movie really came to me, it's not as bad as many say, I really loved it, though the idea sounds so simple and rather boring, it's not. First of all, I enjoyed the soundtrack (Bryan Adams), it really fits the movie. Second, the simple story, and the drama of Spirit gets your attention. One thing I like the most is that they do not give the stallion a human voice to interact with the other horses, it makes the movie more realistic, not many animations seem realistic now, but ... I do not know, talking animals is just so ... lame.

One of the nicest animations of 2002 in my opinion, I recommend it to everyone, not just the kids :), because it is very relaxing.

summary: Based on the famous novel by Emile Zola. The vivacious and beautiful Nana seeks fame on the stages of Paris in the shows at the Th√©√¢tre des Vari√©t√©s. (which will look familiar to lovers of "Children of Paradise"). When she bombs as an actress, Nana becomes a courtesan, using her allure and charisma more directly to entice and pleasure men. She is kept in a sumptuous fashion by a wealthy count, and several prominent and wealthy men find themselves unable to withstand her charms. In the novel, the theater manager describe Nana: "Nana has something else, dammit, and something that takes the place of everything else. I scented it out, and it smells damnably strong in her, or else I lost my sense of smell." But there's a pain and a pathos at the heart of Nana's situation, and it slowly makes its poisonous way into the lives of all in Nana's orbit.
translation:
When Jean Renoir's first movie "Whirlpool of Fate" takes us into the world of the countryside, the rivers, the peasantry, which he will continue to explore, it seems only fitting that his second film be largely with the rich and privileged, the upper ones Classes and those who want to fight their way up. Put the characters from the first two films together and you have the seeds of his great "Grand Illusion" and "Rules of the Game". This is beautifully filmed, with the restless camera taking full advantage of the amazingly large apartments and backstage areas that dominate the interior of the movie, and the often-outdated drama also offers some great moments, especially from Werner Krauss's Muffat. But the glamorous and sultry Ms. Hessling, who seems to be giving Louise Brooks a run for her money in vampire-seeking, never goes beyond a monotonous, selfish whoredom. Maybe this is partly a problem with the script, which mostly causes highlights and indignant emotions; If I did not read the novel, I'm not really sure if the decisions were good or not.

Nevertheless, the differences between the candidates of Nanas have been good, and I especially liked the relationship between Muffat and Jean Angelos Vandeuvres - the tragic understanding that everyone seems to have of his last fate and sympathy, especially in the scene at the foot of the huge staircase where Vandeuvres warns Muffat and we wonder if violence will break out - these and other glimpses of the lazy rich ridiculous help to give the movie the depth it has.

Far from his greatest achievement, and for me probably just the shy overall of "Whirlpool of Destiny," this is still worth seeing for Renoir fans or anyone else interested in silent film.

summary: General Hammond summons Colonel Jack O'Neill out of retirement to embark on a secret rescue mission. O'Neill confesses that he disobeyed orders to destroy the Stargate on Planet Abydos, and that scientist Daniel Jackson may still be alive. Arriving on Abydos with his team, O'Neill meets up once again with the scientist, who has discovered a giant elaborate cartouche in hieroglyphics. All signs point to the fact that this is a map of many Stargates that exist throughout the galaxy - a development that makes the dream of the SG-1 team to travel throughout the universe in time a reality.
translation:
I'm not great at writing reviews, so I'll just give my opinion ...

I loved this series first. The adventure, the action, the comedy, the drama ... I thought everything was brilliant. Anderson, Tapping, Shanks, Judge, Davis ... I loved them all. Davis, it seemed, was the fifth most important person in the cast. No big deal. But when his character (General Hammond) disappeared at the end of Season 7 and Anderson's character (Colonel O'Neill) moved from the field to the office, the quality of the series suddenly fell off a cliff. I do not know if it's because Hammond was more important than me or what, but for some reason, after the seventh season, the series became ****.

The first seven seasons, though, were great. The film Stargate seemed mediocre to me when I saw it for the first time, but it turned out that, even if that was not the original intention, it was a brilliant build of the series. I recommend that you first watch the movie, then watch the first season of the TV series, then watch the movie again (you'll have a whole new appreciation for it the second time, believe me) and then the rest of the TV series ,

The last three seasons of the series are not nearly as good as the first seven, but that does not mean that they are not good. It just means that they are a disappointment if you were spoiled by the first seven seasons.

After completing this series, be sure to see the spin-off series Stargate: Atlantis. It is a worthy successor to this brilliant series.

EDIT on 7/18/08: I just heard that Don S. Davis had died a few weeks ago. It's a big loss.

summary: When a body is found in the New Orleans docks, it's pretty obvious that he died from gun shot wounds. The police surgeon notices that the man is also displaying other symptoms and Lt. Commander Clint Reed, a doctor with the U.S. Public Health Service, diagnoses a highly contagious disease, pneumonic plague. He tries to convince local officials to find everyone who may have been in contact with the dead man. The Mayor supports his efforts but many, including the police, are doubtful. Reed wants to avoid publicity so as not to panic the public. They have little information to go on - they don't know the dead man's identity - and Reed estimates they have 48 hours before disease begins to spread. With police Capt. Tom Warren going through the motions, Reed sets out to find the killers.
translation:
When the movie opens, two thugs kill another criminal. When the body is discovered and soon to be autopsied, the doctor realizes that although the man was shot, he also suffered from the lung plague - a very vicious and malignant version of bubonic plague! So it's a race against time to find those who came into contact with the dead man and treat them immediately, otherwise a disaster could break out.

Strangely, I know a great deal about the pneumonic plague when I taught a series of lectures on my history lesson. The movie really did not do well to get the facts right because it looked like the people in the movie. The biggest problem is that this disease is so incredibly grotesque that they really did not show it in 1950. Sure, there's a high fever and cough (they got it right), but also a lot of bleeding and explosive vomiting of blackened blood - along with the hugely swollen lymph nodes that you would get with bubonic plague - all pure and disgusting! I can certainly understand why they did not go that far. I am also sure that the federal government has been much more involved in the control and treatment of the disease - here in the film it was treated on a very local level and everyone seemed ill prepared and a bit stupid. Nobody seemed to believe the doctors !! As for acting, the film had some excellent actors here. Richard Widmark and Paul Douglas are each the public health doctor and police chief. Good actors but also well-known actors in 1950. In his first film, however, is the very threatening Jack Palance (still under his original nickname "Walter Jack Palance") and the relatively unknown (then) Zero Mostel. Palance was great - very scary and physically very skilled in his own stunts. Mostel played a heavy, typical of his early work - a greasy and cowardly kind of evil.

Overall, the film is very tense, even though it does not sort the details properly and keeps everything a bit too neat and has a great acting - and it is well worth seeing.

summary: Signing a contract, Jack Torrance, a normal writer and former teacher agrees to take care of a hotel which has a long, violent past that puts everyone in the hotel in a nervous situation. While Jack slowly gets more violent and angry of his life, his son, Danny, tries to use a special talent, the "Shining", to inform the people outside about whatever that is going on in the hotel.
translation: Kubrick once again demonstrates his amazing ability to create the perfect setting for a movie. Mainly by cinematography, but also by an ingenious score, he creates a chilled and ominous tone that runs throughout the film and gives me goose bumps right from the start. It is really this immaculate ambiance that makes The Shining a masterpiece, as it is in my eyes. Of course, it does not hurt that Jack Nicholson gives one of the greatest performances I've ever seen. A scary authentic depiction of a crazy spirit. Duvall and Lloyd are artificial to be nice, but it's easy to look beyond them when the rest of the movie is so brilliant. Add to that the actor with the biggest name of all time (Scatman Crothers).

summary: After World War 2, Senior Japanese Officials and their followers were killed and buried together in China, after being defeated and forced to give in. The Japanese Evil People of Nine Chrysanthemum have sworn revenge and are secretly plotting against China after sealing the graves of the Officials. Before their conspiracy can come to an end, Chinese police Captain Li and Taoist master Mao Yuan Feng discover the conspiracy and kill some of the Japanese Evil People. The members who survived used then their blood to call them back from Hell and became Devil Masters. But before their Japanese Imperialist Agressive Ambition can succeed, Captain Li and Taoist Master Mao Yuan Feng kill them and defeat their plot of revenge for good.
translation: I searched for this movie for a long time, because it's pretty rare to find because it was one of the video nasties. I finally found it on DVD late last year. It's a very low budget movie. The story revolves around Amazonian jungle tribes who live in fear of the devil. Laura Crawford is a model abducted by a thug troop while working in South America. They take her to the jungle Laura is guarded by a ridiculous native who calls himself "The Devil", she has to go through all the unpleasant things until they are happy. Girls are chained up. The devil shows horrible ways to eat meat. Peter Weston, is the devil hunter who goes to the jungle to save her,

summary: Edward Carnby, detective of the paranormal, unexplained and supernatural, investigates a mystery (the recent death of a friend) with clues leading to "Shadow Island" that brings him face to face with bizarre horrors that prove both psychologically disturbing and lethal, as he discovers that evil demons worshiped by an ancient culture called the Abskani are planning on coming back to life in the 21st century to once again take over the world... and only he and a young genius anthropologist with an incredible memory (and his ex-girlfriend), Aline Cedrac, stand in their way, at a gateway to hell. Standing in Carnby's way, however, is the impact that a brief encounter with an evil spirit called the Queen had upon his mind, as he slowly finds himself overpowered by the forces of darkness as they eat away at his very sanity...
translation: Tara Reid as an intellectual, Christian Slater (usually great) as a dollar shop Constantine and Stephen Dorff as ... well, it's STEPHEN DORFF FOR CHRIST SAKE !!!! I just want to thank these brilliant casting directors for the hard work and effort. Your turn. Here's an idea, just my humble opinion of how the film goes public, but it follows directly with your previous decisions, a film about the most brilliant neuro-physicist in history inventing a pill to cure all the diseases ever known are, and get, Heres The key point is that they have to be played by Jessica Simpson and Paris Hilton. I knew you would love that. Seriously, though you owe me $ 7.50.

summary: Pete Thompson thinks he has it all. However, following the death of his father his close friend and accountant reveals the company he has been left is bust and the only way out is to do business with the Russian mafia. His life and heart are on the line when he leave to restore the fortunes of the family firm.
translation:
I have to admit that I saw some howlers in my day, but this one is up there with the worst of them. Act disturbingly to follow. Sex and violence are there to disorient and distract the really poorly composed film.

I can only imagine that the cast will look back on the final product and wish that it should not dust on a shelf for a generation or two to be disturbed. Unfortunately I have the DVD in my case. It will sit on the shelf and watch me from time to time.

summary: The Hennessy clan -- mother Cate, daughters Bridget and Kerry, and son Rory -- look to one another for guidance and support after the death of Paul, the family patriarch. Cate's parents lend a hand.
translation: "8 SIMPLE RULES ... FOR MY TEENAGE DAUGHTER," is in my opinion an absolute ABC classic! I'm not sure if I have not seen every episode, but I enjoyed it anyway. It's hard to say which episode was my favorite. However, I think it was always funny when a mishap occurred. I always laughed about it. Despite the fact that James Garner and David Spade were good, I liked the show more than John Ritter was the lead actor. If you ask me, his sudden death was very tragic. Everyone has always done well, the production design was spectacular, the costumes were well designed and the writing was always very strong. Finally, I hope a network will blow it up so fans on the show can see it.

summary: In the late 1930s, world politics begin to head in a dangerous direction. In Europe, Germany expands and rearms and proceeds to annex several border countries into the Reich. Meanwhile, Italy attempts to establish a Facist Colonial Empire under Mussolini while the Empire of Japan stands ready for a major war with China. Enter the Henry family, headed by career naval officer Victor "Pug" Henry. "Winds of War" thus follows the exploits of Pug and his children, all of which are set against the backdrop of world events leading up to the Japanese attack on Pearl Harbor in 1941.
translation:
I mention this miniseries from the perspective of someone who first read the novel. And from that perspective, I can honestly say that, although pleasing, I can see why it has not been aired lately. More precisely, this Mini has some serious problems, such as:

1) It's awfully miscast. The actors, who played the younger generation, were every 15 to 20 years older than the characters. Ali McGraw (then 45) played Natalie Jastrow, who was about 26 years old. Jan-Michael Vincent (39 at the time) played Byron Henry, who was about 22 years old. The other Henry children and Pamela Tudsbury were also played by actors far too old for characters to be in their 20s.

2) Some of the actors were absolutely terrible. Ali McGraw has sometimes made this mini almost unpredictable. I have seen more convincing performances in high school games.

3) The direction was bad. To be fair to Ali McGraw, the bad acting and character development was probably the director. The portrayal of Hitler was exaggerated. His character looked and acted more like a cartoon villain, as the charismatic, sometimes charming, but always devilish genius Herman Wouk painted him as in the novel. Some of the other characters are so stereotyped (Berel Jastrow) that they do not reach the depth of character that Wouk created for them.

4) This mini is very old fashioned. The hokey music, the flashy narrative (it sounded like a narrative of the story of junior high school history), and the mini-prime-time-soap-opera feel of the mini sometimes made it almost weird. In addition, Byron and Natalie are too often costumed and made as if they were 1979 instead of 1939.

Someone who sees this without the benefit of reading the novel first, will probably not stand it all because of it rather than a late 70's / early 80's "taking myself too seriously" Prime Time soap drama, rather than the TV version of what is certainly a modern American classic.

Remakes of older films and the like are sometimes poorly done, but this is probably a case where a creative and inspired director could make a very impressive, memorable and critically acclaimed production. I never see it, because a remake would take as long (15 hours) or more to get it right, and given the short attention span of most current American viewers, it would not fly.

summary: 12 genetically enhanced childern escape from a military base that created them. 10 years later, after The Pulse, a magnetic bomb that destroyed every computer in USA, has struck, Max Guevara, one of the 12 escapees, is a bike messenger in (what's left of) Seattle and with cyberjournalist, Logan Cale, she tries to rid the world of crime and corruption, avoid her creators and uncover her past.
translation:
Wow, here it is finally; the action "movie" without action. In a real low-budget setting (do not miss the funny flying saucers that fly a few times) of a future Seattle, we find a no-brain hard body trying to avenge their childhood.

There is nothing remotely original or interesting about the plot and the performance of the actor is only made up in stupidity by the attempts to steal from other films, especially "Matrix" without the money to to do it right. Yes, we see some running on walls and slow motion shootings (about 45 sec.), But these scenes are about as cool as the stupid hardbody's attempts to make jokes about male incompetence from time to time.

Believe me, it's as bad as it gets. In fact, it does not deserve to be taken seriously, but maybe I can get some of you to not rent it and save your money.

summary: "The Straight Story" chronicles a trip made by 73-year-old Alvin Straight from Laurens, Iowa, to Mt. Zion, Wis., in 1994 while riding a lawn mower. The man undertook his strange journey to mend his relationship with his ill, estranged, 75-year-old brother Lyle.
translation:
Maybe more than many movies, this is not for everyone. For some people, the idea of ‚Äã‚Äãslowing, reflecting, and allowing things to happen in their own time is a good description of their personal hell. For others, such an approach speaks to a deep part of themselves that they know exists, to a part they crave.

I assume that it is a function of where I am in my own life I am counting in the camp of the latter group. I found the meditative speed of this film almost hypnotic and gently led me into an almost mythological realm. This is indeed a journey story, a rich account of the distance many of us have to travel if we want to close the circle at the end of our days.

As far as Farnsworth's presentation of Alvin was written straight ahead, though I'm not sure if there are words that express the exquisite balance of amused sadness and wise innocence he conjured up for us , Now that he knew he was really arranging his own mortality while sitting on the tractor seat, I wished I had had the opportunity to spend time with him before he left. I hope he had a glimpse of the satisfaction and truth that he had given to so many people, not just for "acting" but to share his absolute humanity with such brutal honesty.

Given the Realities of Production I am not sure if Mr Lynch has developed the story so slowly for the courage he has shown. As an outsider of film production, I understand that there are few areas of modern life in which the term "time is money" is so aptly described. To go deep into our hearts is not an adventure that can be rushed, and Mr. Lynch seems to understand that he is not simply telling a story - he invited his viewers to spend some time with their own mortality. Not an easy task, that.

If you want to experience the power of the movie to introduce yourself to a valuable part of yourself, you could do worse than spend a few hours with The Straight Story , And then give yourself time for the next little play while listening to his echoes at night.

summary: The murder of a cop in 1968 is reopened when a dying jailbird makes a deal with the police in order to get released earlier and tells them that he found drugs in the victim's car.
translation: That was a fantastic episode. I saw a clip of it on YouTube, and I swore that if it was ever shown on TV, I'd stick to the set to watch. I saw it with a friend who is gay, and in the end we both cried. that was a really credited, heartfelt episode of the forbidden love between two policemen who, I think, really were (in Coop's words) "the lucky ones". It's episodes like these that make Cold Case one of TV's most intriguing and popular works on CBS. I'm looking forward to more episodes and a repeat of "Forever Blue", because I'll see it again and again.

summary: The Snake Eaters are an elite division of the Marines especially trained for search and destroy missions. This actioner chronicles the exploits of one of them who has become a cop. Known as a tough loner, he returns to find the band of backwoods bad-guys who killed his parents and abducted his sister.
translation:
Words can not just describe how awful this movie is. I saw it on video last night and just could not believe what I saw. Basically, "Snakeeater" is a former military man (Lorenzo Lamas) and his search for his abducted sister, who was held captive by dolphin rednecks. Acting, writing, directing, photographing, and editing the film are regrettable, along with a song called "Soldier," which must be one of the worst title songs of all time!

But there is a treat. "Horshack" (Ron Pallio) of "Welcome Back Carter" plays a ridiculous villain in the movie. Otherwise, please avoid this mess at ALL COST.

summary: The story revolves around Yoko Inoue, a pregnant woman in search for a cafe that's frequented by a Taiwanese composer whose life she is researching.
translation:
I am a relative latecomer to the transcendental work of film writer Yasujiro Ozu, whose masterly understated views of Japanese life, especially in the postwar period, illuminate universal truths. After seeing some of his seminal films, such as Late Spring in 1949 and Tokyo Story in 1953, I am convinced that Ozu had a particularly idiosyncratic gift for conveying the range of emotions from intergenerational conflicts through elliptical narratives and subtle imagery. It is the wish of Taiwanese director Hou Hsiao-hsien to honor Ozu on this centenary of his birth with this generally amusing 2003 film. Under the co-script writer T'ien-wen Chu, Hsiao-hsien seems to be doing the visuals right, but does not capture the necessary emotional weight that would have made the glacial stimulation bearable.

The story is about Y√¥ko, a young Japanese writer who explored the life of 20th-century Taiwanese composer Jiang Wen-Ye in Tokyo after she returned from Taiwan where she had taught Japanese , After 25 minutes of character-drawing, she reveals to her father and step-mother that she is pregnant by one of her students in Taiwan. At the same time, Y√¥ko's coffee shop friend Hajime, who runs a used bookstore, has an obsession with trains and seems to be in love with her. Hsiao-hsien combines this thin storyline with a series of shots that are considered unusually long takes as the frame composition changes. There are also long stretches of silence as well as a wealth of scenes with trains. While these techniques are in line with Ozu's style, Hsiao-hsien can not plunge into the psyche of the characters, as Ozu did with maximum fluidity and minimal theatricality; in particular, Y√¥ko's plight in the scheme of the drama presented seems rather noncommittal to her parents' reaction excessively passive, to have great interest. In fact, the whole movie has an atmosphere of exhaustion that makes the movie seem infinite.

The performances are unobtrusive but hardly memorable. J-pop music star Yo Hitoto brings a natural lightness to Y√¥ko, while Tadanobu Asano is a kind of cipher like Hajime. The rest of the characters are barely registered, even Nenji Kobayashi and Kimiko Yo as Y√¥ko's parents. Cinematographer Lee Ping-Bing offers expert work, although he violates a basic rule of Ozu films by keeping the camera unstable during the shoot. Hitoto speaks - sings the groovy pop song, which is used in the credits "Hito-Shian". The DVD features a one-hour documentary produced in France, "M√©tro Lumi√®re", which in fact contributes to providing part of the context for Hsiao-hsien's approach to the film. It contains excerpts from Ozu's films, especially "Equinox Flower," to show the parallels to this film, though surprisingly no mention of "Tokyo Story" or "Early Summer," the obvious basis for some scenes and situations, was found. UPS. There are also edited interview clips from Hitoto, Asano and Hsiao-hsien, as well as the trailer of the film.

summary: The love which binds mother and daughter -- seen through the prism of one mother's life as it crests with optimism, navigates a turning point, and ebbs to its close. Overcome by the power of memory, Ann Lord reveals a long-held secret to her concerned daughters; Constance, a content wife and mother, and Nina, a restless single woman. Both are bedside when Ann calls out for the man she loved more than any other. But who is this "Harris," wonder her daughters, and what is he to our mother? While Constance and Nina try to take stock of Ann's life and their own lives, their mother is tended to by a night nurse as she journeys in her mind back to a summer weekend some fifty years before, when she was Ann Grant, a young woman who has come from New York City to be maid of honor at the high-society Newport wedding of her dearest friend from college, Lila Wittenborn. The bride-to-be is jittery, and turns to her maid of honor rather than her own mother for support. Ann stays close to her friend...
translation: Wow, what a waste of acting talent. My husband and I sat there, both thought it must get better, these actresses are too good to waste their time with this crap. Unattractive characters, hackneyed script and listless pacing will take two hours to complete. I really could not hack it and went shopping (cat litter is more attractive than this movie). The man stayed and confirmed that it did not get any better - when Buddy was killed, they wished they would all be hit by a car and end their miserable lives. It would be infinitely more entertaining. Beautiful landscapes and costumes can not keep this alive.

summary: Raj and Priya are newly married. Priya is heavy with children, but due to unexpected circumstances, she loses her child and is unable to conceive again. Enter Madhoo, a prostitute who is willing to become surrogate mother for the couple. Their relationship becomes entangled with love triangle when Madhoo falls in love with Raj.
translation: The year 2000 was a bad year for Indian films because of the lack of quality and imagination of the directors. Unlike Mohabbatein and Kaho Naa pyaar shark, nothing stands out. CCCC has had much controversy over the financing of the film and, without really knowing what the movie is about, has generated good publicity and advanced ticket sales for the film in India and abroad. The only information was that it was a thriller. The movie was released in 2001 and the movie was surprisingly good. The main plot has to do with surrogacy and is well managed. Salman and Preiti perform well, though Salman does not actually take off a shirt. Must be special effects !! Rani plays Salman's wife, but it's a slightly less demanding role compared to Preiti, who plays prostitute, who eventually becomes the surrogate mother. The three main features confirm that Har Di Jo Pyar Karega has a solid screen and off-screen chemistry (apparently). Salman Khan, who is excellent, plays a serious role in the film as a successful businessman and is a pity that he is being exploited as a would-be comedian in his other films, as he is partially underestimated in the Mumbai film industry, partly because of the films he does chooses. Rani's character does not know that Preiti is a prostitute until the very end ... she kept that from her and the rest of the family ... the rest you should find out as it will ruin the movie if I tell you. The songs are all well portrayed, especially the Decon Walon and the theme song. The other supporting actors make a minimal but fine effort as Salman's loving family. Abbas Mastan has produced a hit and treated the film theme tactfully. I say, go and see it or rent it, whatever you prefer!

summary: When Adams and his crew are sent to investigate the silence from a planet inhabited by scientists, he finds all but two have died. Dr. Morbius and his daughter Altaira have somehow survived a hideous monster which roams the planet. Unknown to Adams, Morbius has made a discovery, and has no intention of sharing it (or his daughter!) with anyone.
translation: I know I should like this movie, and I do that for the most part, but as others have mentioned, it's a bit long in the tooth. I also find the raging hormones of the entire male crew a bit annoying. It's a wonder they did not start howling and howling on the moons. I have to say that the movie leaves me cold altogether. It's a very sterile atmosphere that permeates the film. On the positive side are the effects (in addition to the cartoon monster), like the effects, props, costumes and of course Robbie. If the robot was not in this movie, I would not believe that he was as popular as he was / is. The second half of the movie picks up as soon as we begin to examine the forgotten gadgets of the "Krell". As often as I have seen this movie, Krell still makes me scratch my head about who exactly or what they were. Based on what was produced at the time, "Forbidden Planet" is miles above "This Island Earth" miles above average sci-fi movies of the time. Filmed in color also contributes to his enjoyment. Certainly a classic for itself, mistakes and everything, and rightly so.

summary: Stripped of his medical license after performing an operation while high on amphetamines, famed LA surgeon Dr Eugene Sands abandons his former life only to find himself crossing paths with Raymond Blossom, an infamous counterfeiter. Employed as a "gun-shot doctor" when Raymond's associates cannot risk visiting a hospital, Eugene is lured deep into the criminal world and becomes entangled with his boss's girlfriend.
translation: Very smart, sometimes shocking, I just love it. It pushed another side of David's brilliant talent. He impressed me a lot! David is the best. The movie captures your attention every second.

summary: "Offside" is about a group of Iranian girls who attempts to enter Tehran's Azadi Stadium dressed as boys in order to watch a big football match but some get caught and arrested. After the establishment of the Islamic Republic in Iran, women are not allowed to enter the stadiums.
translation:
I must point out that, before reading this review, this is in no way a statement against Iranian people ... if you really want to read something in it, than hopefully you will see that I am against politicians in general ... but if you feel insulted ... I can not help you!

Not in Iran, as this movie is banned there (see IMDb Trivia for this movie). What a pity, because the movie is great. If it were not "Grbavica", this film would have won at the International Film Festival in Berlin.

Rightly (it was the runner-up, or the second place, if you want). Why? Because it's a movie about oppression. It's not even that this is a complete women's problem. The point is that the government is trying to hold people back. An analogy that was so clear that the government felt the need to ban the film. But nothing is solved by the ban and / or they can make this movie disappear!

Another reviewer had a great summary: "Comedy about a tragedy" that sums it up nicely!

summary: Raj is a rich industrialist he meets Priya in Shimla and is madly in love with her.But Priya ignores him all the time Priya's mother tells her that she should marry Raj as he is a good person and tell him everything about her past.Priya writes a letter to Raj which is misplaced by his servant Hari who replaces it with another letter.Raj is shocked to find from Priya's mother that she was married earlier and is angry that she never disclosed it.Hari finds Priya's letter in his coat and gives it to Raj.Priya has mentioned everything about her past in it that she was married to an abusive and over caring husband Vikram who had made her life hell.She managed to run away from him and started a new life in Shimla.Raj forgives and accepts Priya after finding the truth.Vikram who believed that Priya died due to drowning finds that she is alive and about to get married to Raj.Vikram manages to trace them in Shimla and tries to kill Raj on failing he send shim to jail and goes to kill Priya.
translation:
This was the third remake of SLEEPING WITH THE ENIEMY After YAARANA (1995) and AGNISAKSHI (1996) AGNISAKSHI was the only one who worked and was a better movie.

DARAAR is directed by Abbas Mustan, who unfortunately failed in this attempt.

The story was good, but the handling was not so good and the heroine was too regressive and portrayed Climax was disappointing.

/> Direction is bad Music is good

Rishi plays his role as YAARANA (oddly enough, a remake of SWTE) and looks too fat for the lead and is okay Juhi is decent while Arbaaz tries too hard in his debut and manages to cool the audience in many scenes, but his voice was terrible Johny is too loud

summary: No sooner does Italian-American widow Loretta accept a marriage proposal from her doltish boyfriend, Johnny, then she finds herself falling for his younger brother, Ronny. She tries to resist, but Ronny lost his hand in an accident he blames on his brother, and has no scruples about aggressively pursuing her while Johnny is out of the country. As Loretta falls deeper in love, she comes to learn that she's not the only one in her family with a secret romance.
translation:
This movie is still an absolute favorite. Only a cheeky, humorless idiot would not enjoy this wonderful movie. This movie feels like a piece of warm apple pie with French vanilla ice cream! I think that's Cher's best work of all time and her most credible performance. Cher has always been blessed with charisma, good looks and an enviably thin figure. Whether you like singing or not, who else sounds like Cher? Cher has definitely made a name for herself in the entertainment industry and will be remembered long after others come and go. She is one of the most unique artists out there. It's funny, because who would have considered Cher as such a naturally gifted actress? She is the head of the so-called movie "Stars" of today. Cher is a real actor on the same level as Debra Winger, Alfre Woodard, Holly Hunter, Angela Bassett and a few others, as she never seems "acting", she becomes really convincing. She has more than earned the respect of her colleagues and the movie-going public.

Everything about Moonstruck is wonderful - the characters, the scenery, the dialogue, the food. I never get tired of watching this movie.

Every time I look at the scene where everyone is sitting at the dining table of Rose's house, I pause to see exactly what delicious food Rose's serving is. I saw the spaghetti, mushrooms (I think), but I can not tell if they eat ravioli, Ziti? What is the main course? It looks wonderful and it drives me crazy!

Everyone in this family was a hard working person and they respected and cared for each other. The grandfather was not marginalized and tolerated, he was an important part of the family and he was listened to and respected for his age and wisdom. He seemed like a pretty healthy, independent old guy.

Loretta's mother was not "just a housewife", she was the glue that kept the family together and was a prime example of what a wife, mother and home director should aim to be. She was proud of the lifestyle she had chosen, but she did not define who she was. High-powered business people are not as comfortable in their skin as Rose Casterini was. Notice the naughty way she said, "I had no kids until I was 37. It's not over yet." They felt that she had been the kind of young woman who had done exactly what she wanted and got through without the other person noticing what had happened. She was charming, quick-witted and very smart. What a great mother!

Actually, I did not really like Loretta, because she seemed a bit of a know-it-all, who was not really as adventurous and self-possessed as she wanted others to think. She could tell others about herself and where they had gone wrong, but she did not use common sense in her own life. She wanted to marry a middle-aged boy just because she wanted a husband and a sense of identity and purpose in her life. She was more conventional than her own mother. She got dressed and wore her hair like a matron in a detention center and seemed humorless and bored, but under that they felt that she was vulnerable and lonely and had much love to give the right man. She would probably be a great mother, too.

I could see a house full of Loretta and Ronnie's screaming happy children in the future and Rose and Cosmo enjoy every minute of it.

summary: Ben Stiller and Jack Black star as Tim and Nick, best friends, neighbors and co-workers, whose equal footing is suddenly tripped up when one of Nick's harebrained get-rich-quick schemes actually succeeds: Vapoorizer, a spray that literally makes dog poop, or any other kind for that matter, evaporate into thin air -- to where exactly is anyone's guess. Tim, who had scoffed at Nick's idea and passed on an opportunity to get in on the deal, can only watch as Nick's fortune -- and Tim's own envy -- grow to equally outrageous proportions. When the flames of jealousy are fanned by an oddball drifter (Walken) who imposes himself into the situation, Tim's life careens wildly out of control ... taking Nick's with it.
translation:
This could be considered in many different ways. This movie sucks, it's good or just funny. The third is probably the best way to explain this movie. It has weird themes and just a strange plot. So, who else but Christopher Walken would play in it, no matter how bad, average or even how good it might be.

The acting was what you would expect especially from Ben Stiller. Jack Black I've always liked it, so you know what you get from it, but that's not bad. Christopher Walken is always off the wall. He's always fun no matter how bad the movie is. Funny it is a bit strange. Of course, that means it has its moments (albeit very few), but here and there it can be exaggerated a bit, which makes me feel that the movie is just desperate for laughter, but of course not in a good way br />
The direction was also average. Barry Levinson is a slightly overrated director and has not really done a good job here. This movie seemed to have a lot more potential and he did not do much to reach him. Only very average and it did not seem like you put a lot of effort into the movie.

Writing is the key to a good comedy. Obviously this means that the letter failed here. In the best case, it is below average. Considering that it has its moments, it was not too terrible. However, this is never a good thing to say about a movie.

If it were not Christopher Walken and the silly ridiculous ending, I would have given him a lower rating. He is always a character in his films. Style is a crazy movie with strange characters that go nowhere. Not terrible, but I would not really recommend it because it's a very forgetful movie.

summary: A vicious serial-killer is on the loose in San Francisco and the police trace a link to a small town further down the coast. When Harry Callahan upsets the press and the mayor in his usual style, he's shipped out of town to investigate while the heat is on. With the help of his new Magnum handgun Harry goes on the trail leaving behind the usual trail of dead criminals along the way.
translation:
Inspector "Dirty" Harry Callahan once again annoys his superiors with his unconventional approach to policing. Since he refuses to go on vacation, he gets a simple case that brings him to San Francisco. But he soon discovers a connection between a recent murder in the city and a murder outside the city, which leads him on the trail of a revenge killer.

As an entry in the Dirty Harry Franchise The film opens with some promising moments, including the legendary "Go ahead, make my day" line, which Eastwood delivers wonderfully through clenched teeth before he manages a robbery single-handedly thwarted. Very tough and exactly what fans can expect from him. However, the movie soon changes gears and focuses on the mysterious revenge killer. The problem is that this murderer is not so mysterious, because she's as distinctive as Harry. This really lessened the presence of the main character who frustrated all his previous film appearances with, excuse the pun, Magnum Force.

On the bright side, this new storyline draws parallels to Harry's own unorthodox methods, giving his character a dramatic depth that did not exist before, but fans looking for another tough Harry outing will more than likely be a little disappointed. A tense climax, however, puts the film on an exciting note. If you do not disturb anything else, it's a good movie for fans. --- 7/10

Rated R for violence and a rape scene

summary: Ben's dad Sam shows up one night with a note from Ben's mother (Sam's wife of 46 years), that she has left. While Ben's wife and his three sisters try to find her, Ben takes Sam on a day trip to see a farmhouse that's for sale. The day trip turns into a road trip while dad and son explore their past, their relationship, and why Sam's wife might have left him. The road trip includes fishing, drinking, playing pool, sleeping under the stars, and frank discussion. Anger simmers close at hand, as do love and hope. Where Sam's wife is - and why she left - leads to the movie's resolution.
translation: This movie is one of those who know him very well. It is earthy, grounded and a movie that will make you think ... and smile. Paul Reiser and Peter Falk take you on a journey that you will not forget. The soundtrack is beautifully varied and suitable; and the movie itself is like a breath of fresh air. That surely deserves recognition for the movie and the actors! Finally a piece of art that deviates from the obvious love story and the frequent special affects that can be seen today. Never have I come out of a movie with such deep warmth and a sense of thoughtfulness in my heart; because it felt like someone had just wrapped it in a fluffy fleece blanket. To see this movie, you have to find a true treasure and enjoy it.

summary: Two Spanish pan-handlers soon find themselves in over their heads when they stumble upon an opportunity to redeem themselves and perhaps the entire planet. The world appears to suffer from rampant poverty, violence and spiritual desperation and the relentless news media force-feeds these images to the Spanish people. A popular reality television show lets the audience decide between life or death for suspected felons, and one of the opportunistic pan-handlers attempts to escape poverty through this raucous and sensational TV program.
translation: A wonderful surprise of the Spanish cinema. I never thought that Jordi Molla would be such a great director, after all, his choice in movies really does not interest me. But this movie was absolutely fantastic and unpredictable ... something I ALWAYS enjoy! It has not enjoyed much good press and I really do not think it will ever be released on the US market. We'll have to settle for the DVD or VHS, though that ... I do not want to say much about the story because I do not want to spoil it for you, but basically it's a homeless drunk just the new Messiah for kicks and to make some money out of it (like soooooooooooo many), before he knows it, he plunges into a life he did not count on.

summary: A writer accepts a bet that he cannot spend the night alone in a haunted castle on All Soul's Eve. Once night falls at the castle, several who had been murdered therein return to life, reliving their deaths and seeking to kill the writer for his blood in a vain attempt to stay alive beyond that one night. Barbara Steele, as one of the living dead, tries to aid his escape from the castle.
translation: I've never seen a Barbara Steele movie I did not like and was always a jerk for a good haunted house story (especially for such wonderful pictures as "The Legend of the Hellhouse" and the original versions of "The Haunting" and "House on Haunted Hill "), so I had the feeling that" Castle of Blood "was in my alleyway, and boy, was it ever! This Franco-Italian co-production, which may not be the classic in which Steele's first horror movie" Black Sunday "is still an extremely atmospheric, frightening introduction to the haunting genre, filmed in black and white, manages to convey a truly scary miasma about a journalist, a Lord Blackwood and commissioned an author named Edgar Allen Poe to spend the night in Blackwood's Castle on the Night of All Saints when the ghosts of those killed in the castle track their fate The audience sees these deaths, and for the most part, they are pretty awful. The movie actually gives the viewer goose bumps, and in the uncut DVD I've just seen - thanks to the fine folks at Synapse - there's even a surprising topless scene and a light Lesbiantis! And Barbara is wonderful in this movie; Her otherworldly beauty is exploited by a sympathetic ghost. Their sheer presence transforms a spooky ghost story into something truly memorable. It was not for nothing that she was called the "Queen of horror".

summary: Threatened with recapture after a prison escape, Martin Stechert grabs a twelve-year-old as hostage. He proves to be named Martin, too, a quiet "good little boy" always obeying the rules, whom life has given only dismal loneliness and frustration in return. Soon he begins to admire "Stech" for his cheeky pranks against society and his desperate mission to make dreams come true. In a climactic moment, he chooses to stay with the man even though he could run away. Via hijacks and hijinx, they flee to the idyllic peace of the older Martin's childhood home, a cabin on a lake. But the police are close behind, impatient and trigger-happy.
translation:
I first saw Martin's day at the age of ten, at home in the movie channel, and still remember the impact he had on my life. It touched me like no other movie had touched me, and I remember extending my eyes.

After the first time I saw it, I could not find it anywhere else. I would ask and nobody had ever heard of the movie! I suppose it was one of those rare movies that not many knew, because nobody, and I mean no one, knew what I was talking about. I searched and searched over the years, checked video library shelves and scanned cable TV, but always came up short. Finally, in 1996, I found out that I could order it specifically, I did it and probably saw it at least 50 times - and it still makes me cry.

Martin's Day is about Martin Steckert, a man in jail (but really a good guy) who yearns to return to the special lake where he grew up as a boy. This was a special place where he lived by nature, spent time with his dog and was left alone to enjoy life. Soon in the movie he flees and starts to return to the lake.

It does not take long for the police to find him and Steckert grabs a child hostage to convince the police to come back. Soon, Steckert and his hostage (the 2nd Martin) become best friends and have a lot of fun adventures in common - stealing from a toy truck, hauling a train, all on the way to this particular lake.

During the film, Steckert has big flashbacks of him at the lake as a boy.

I will not ruin the end for you, but I'll tell you, this movie is a must. It's the BEST movie I've ever seen in my life! I'm without doubt the biggest fan of this movie EVER! I managed to find the song the two Martins sang throughout the movie ("I'm going back to where I'm from ...), and I'm even planning a trip to Canada, around Martin's lake and cottage Day was filmed Crazy, I know - but this movie means so much to me.

summary: Sort of a low-budget Short Cuts (1993), set in the Flemish port city of Antwerp on a warm day in June. Natalie, her brother Chouki, her boyfriend Walter and his ex Lara, the gallery keeper Firmin, unhappily married French language teacher Paul Garcin, a couple of party-loving studs from Ghent (another Flemish city) and the enigmatic Windman, independently go about their lives, which have little in common, yet all end up on the same place for a grand party that evening.
translation:
I went to see the movie twice, a friend of mine went to see it at the release party, and he told me that it was so great that I was expecting a lot from the movie, to Mutch, I could not enjoy it, because I did not see it in the nuteren position. The second time I knew what to expect and it was more fun than the first time. After the second time I felt so in the mood to have a party. I LOVED the music, it's just great.

If Tom Barman improves his directing talent, he will be a director everyone will talk about. If you can deliver this movie as your first, you have to be talented.

The acting is done by some great Belgian stars (Dirk Roofthooft) and a number of up and coming talents like Titus De Voogdt.

summary: Single father Dan Burns dedicates his life to his children, but one day he meets Marie at a bookstore. They get to know each other, but then Dan finds out that Marie is actually dating his brother, Mitch.
translation:
I saw this movie in a preview and was blinded by it. It is not the typical romantic comedy. I can not remember laughing so much at a movie and still being moved by it. The laughter are not gags here - they are observations, laughter of appreciation, little shocks of "Oh, my God, I thought I was the only one who felt that way!" I will not betray the plot, which is more than just "Guy falls in love with his brother's girlfriend." The whole family plays a role here. Probably the best mix of laughter and warmth since While You Were Sleeping.

Steve Carell goes much deeper than he was before and for the first time I really liked him. The cast is amazing, a list of veteran theater actors that I've loved in other roles, but they fit together to form a compelling family. Dianne Wiest is adorable like the mother, Juliette Binoche is bright and witty (who knew she was funny?), And even the slain Dane Cook gives a warm, calm, touching performance. The Sondre Lark Soundtrack is a wonderful addition, and I will buy the CD as soon as it becomes available.

Do not miss these.

summary: In the Fiji islands, the greedy and unscrupulous owner of the Valalola Resort Primal Park invites investors and guests for an opening party of his compound composed of hotel and zoo aiming to find partners for his discoveries. When a bunch of college smalltime thieves puts a virus in the security system to participate in a scavenger hunt, the greatest attractions of the zoo - sabretoothes from the prehistoric age developed from DNA found in fossils - escape, killing the hosts and guards for fun.
translation:
The film opens with a manager (Nicholas Bell) giving welcome investors (Robert Carradine) in Primal Park. A secret project that mutates a primitive animal with fossilized DNA, such as "Jurassic Park," and some scientists resurrect one of nature's fearsome predators, the Sabretooth Tiger or Smilodon. Scientific ambition, however, becomes deadly, and as the high voltage fence opens, the creature flees and savagely stabs its prey - the human visitors, tourists, and scientists. Meanwhile, some teens enter the restricted area of ‚Äã‚Äãthe security center and are attacked by a pack of large prehistoric animals that are deadlier and bigger. In addition, a security agent (Stacy Haiduk) and her buddy (Brian Wimmer) barely fight the carnivorous Smilodons. The Sabretooths themselves are of course the real stars and they are amazingly frightening, but not convincing. The huge animals hunt their prey and the group runs off fighting the most fearsome predators in nature. In addition, a third Sabretooth stabs more dangerous and slower at his victims.

The film delivers the merchandise with lots of blood and blood as decapitation, hair-raising shudder, terrified when the Sabretooths show up with mediocre special effects. The story offers thrilling and intoxicating entertainment, but it gets pretty boring. The huge animals are mostly made by computer-generator and seem completely lousy. Game-related achievements, although players react appropriately to become food. Activists vigorously perform physical activities by dodging animals, running, jumping and jumping or dangling over walls. And it contains a ridiculous final deadly scene. No for small children through realistic, bloody and bloody attack scenes. Other films about Sabretooth's or Smilodon's are the following: ¬®Sabretooth (2002) ¬® by James R Hickox with Vanessa Angel, David Keith and John Rhys Davies and the much better ¬®10.000 BC (2006) ¬® by Roland Emmerich with Steven Strait, Cliff Curtis and Camilla Belle. This bloody-filled film is staged badly and without originality by George Miller because it incorporates too many elements from previous films. Miller is an Australian director who usually works for television (Tidal Wave, Journey to the Center of the Earth and many others) and occasionally for the movies (The Snowy River Man, Zeus and Roxanne, Robinson Crusoe). Rating: Below average, barrel bottom.

summary: The Herlihys are a working class family from Chicago whose three children take wildly divergent paths: Brian joins the Marines right out of High School and goes to Vietnam, Michael becomes involved in the civil rights movement and after campaigning for Bobby Kennedy and Eugene McCarthy becomes involved in radical politics, and Katie gets pregnant, moves to San Francisco and joins a hippie commune. Meanwhile, the Taylors are an African-American family living in the deep South. When Willie Taylor, a minister and civil rights organizer, is shot to death, his son Emmet moves to the city and eventually joins the Black Panthers, serving as a bodyguard for Fred Hampton.
translation:
Do we really need more narcissistic waste in the Baby Boomer generation? Technically, I'm a boomer, even though at the time when all "idealistic youths" of the 1960s read Marx, burnt their draft cards and generally prolonged a war that destroyed tens of thousands of lives; I was still in elementary school. But I remember them well, and 9 out of 10 were just stupid idiots who would believe everything as long as it was destructive.

This is just another exercise in self esteem from the kids who never really grew up on.

summary: Whom will you touch in life? Who will touch you? They say that anyone on the planet can be connected to any other person through a chain of six people, which means that no one is a stranger... for long. In this new drama from the producers of "Lost" and "Alias," six very different New Yorkers go about their lives without realizing the impact they're having on one another - yet. A mysterious web of coincidences will gradually draw them closer, changing the course of their lives forever. Is it happenstance? Is it fate? Is there a greater force at work in our world, guiding us along and connecting our lives? Laura, a grieving single mother, begins the chain. Next is Whitney, the self-made success story who thinks her boyfriend is cheating. Move on to Steven, the artist/photographer who believes he's lost his "eye." Follow with Damian, who can't escape his criminal brother's shadow, then on to Mae, the girl with a dangerous past that she's hiding from, and finally to Carlos, the good guy ...
translation: So, what is the reason? Is there a kind of vendetta against this great show or someone involved in it? Why should the best show I've seen in years be canceled? I am addicted. I happened to watch this show last fall and was immediately excited, watching it every week. Then it went away and I tried to Tivo, but it was not broadcast. So I forgot it for a while, until I found the episodes on ABC's website. Now I want MORE. I agree with everyone else - with the rest of the junk email on TV, it was refreshing to see something so rounded and sophisticated. I'm watching Boston Legal for my eccentric-comedic correction and House for my intellectual-mysterious-jackass correction. My wife loves Gray's Anatomy because of her "realism" and I love / hate the show, but she could not be further away for me. Far too much drama. Everything that can go wrong does it. But for once there is a drama that is REALLY real. Real people, real problems. Sure, there are some extremes like a former gangster who got well, a girl running in front of the mob, etc., but these people (especially in NYC) are really out there, and I'm connected to every single one of them. I just can not get enough. I just hope that ABC will get their heads out of their bean counting butt and continue this show. Gain respect for a QUALITY drama. This could be one of the best shows ever. If someone just leaves it.

summary: Jerilee Randall, a simple schoolgirl living in the San Fernando Valley, dreams of becoming a famous screenwriter. While at a party, she meets the son of a famous screenwriter. The son invites her over to his house; she accepts. They drive away with some other people, and that night, she is assaulted by one of the son's friends with a garden hose. The friend is interrupted in his assault by screenwriter Walter Thornton, who arrives in time to save her from an even more disgusting fate. Walter's rescue of Jerilee begins a friendship between the two, and before you know it, the two fall in love. They marry. Their marriage falls apart when Jerilee's script rewrites actually improve one of Walter's screenplays and he feels one-upped. Jerilee then goes through affair after sordid affair in her attempt to write her own screenplay and have it produced.
translation:
There is absolutely nothing to redeem this movie. They took a greasy story, miscast it, falsely mistakenly filmed it wrong. It has done bad dialogues badly in a tangled and trashy story.

As bad as it fails as art, it fails even worse than the trade. Who could have been the target market for this? Which age group? Which interest group?

Someone should make a movie about how and why they made this movie. I would pay that to see.

I've seen thousands of bad movies, and that ranks with "Sailor Who Fell from Grace" and "Manos" ... my choices as the three most unbearable bad movies I've ever seen. Everyone associated with it should be forced to speak to VanDamme for eternity.

I challenge you. Watch this movie and do an academic exercise - how could you do that and make it worse? I can not imagine a way.
