summary: Delphine and Solange are two sisters living in Rochefort. Delphine is a dancing teacher and Solange composes and teaches the piano. Maxence is a poet and a painter. He is doing his military service. Simon owns a music shop, he left Paris once month ago to come back where he fell in love 10 years ago. They are looking for love, looking for each other, without being aware that their ideal partner is very close... A film whose scenario is much less important than its feeling of euphory, according to the director Jacques Demy.
translation:
Despite much style, lightning and glitter, this French musical can not speak. The melodies are repetitive, predictable and tedious. The story is uninteresting, as are the many characters.

People break into song and dance without motivation or reason. Most performers wear false wigs and hairpieces, and the sets look hopelessly studio-bound.

To be honest, this video of the restored version was stopped before the end, so it had a negative effect on me. Surely a shame to have such a multi-talented cast in such a weak final attempt.

Go to the show, I guess, where episodes (in this case the big classic "umbrellas") often go awry. You can not recapture, just re-create.

summary: Depicting the events after the Gamma Bomb. 'The Incredible Hulk' tells the story of Dr Bruce Banner, who seeks a cure to his unique condition, which causes him to turn into a giant green monster under emotional stress. Whilst on the run from military which seeks his capture, Banner comes close to a cure. But all is lost when a new creature emerges; The Abomination.
translation:
This restart is like a processed McDonald's meal compared to Ang Lee's very good but very underrated 2003 "The Incredible Hulk".

Ang Lee's "The Hulk" is a comic book movie for the thinking person. The Hulk takes some time to appear (about 40 minutes), but when he does that, we see the conflict at the core of our protagonist. He does his best not to lose control, but as he admits, when he gives in to his anger, he likes it.

Now compare this to Edward Norton, who shows no conflict in his personality, and he turns into hulk when he gets aroused and his pulse rate reaches 200 beats per minute (not 183, not 197) but exactly 200). This reviewer resembled the introduction of Midichloriern in The Phantom Menace, which show how strong the "power" is at one, as if mystical abilities could be measured by a blood test. In the 2008 film, Bruce Banner of Ed Norton only has to keep his pulse below 200, as a device holds on to his wrist. And for the record, it's extremely difficult to get your pulse rate up to 200 even through a very exciting run, especially for a physically fit person.

Emotions drive Eric Bana's Hulk. He has repressed memories of his mother's death and his father's role in his early life. He is calm on the surface, but there is great anger in there, enough anger to fuel the Hulk when unleashed. But the Hulk never deliberately kills, not even its attackers. Mostly he just wants to get away or be close to Betty Ross (Jennifer Connelly). He makes his shooters incapacitated and rescues in a critical scene a fighter jet, which pursues him from a collision.

In the movie 2003, the visual effects are present, but as needed. The action scenes (and there are plenty of them) are necessary for the storyline, unlike the movie from 2008, which uses action action.

In his quest to turn it into a "refugee". History, Ed Norton loses focus on how Bruce Banner feels about the hulk. For him, the hulk is a dangerous side effect of an experiment that went awry. And Louis Leterrier, the director who deals with Ed Norton's keyword, adds no emotional dimension to the Banner-Hulk relationship. The story can be summarized as follows: Banner is tracked and Hulk beats the butt, Banner is flattened and Hulk steps. Repeat as needed.

The only thing that went against the film in 2003 is that it may not be as faithful to the comics as the 2008 version. But even if I'm a fan of the comics, I'd prefer a movie who is not as comics-wise as a fan-boy's dream, but he has a heart every day over the comics-loyal, but crafted and soulless version of 2008.

Maybe Ang Lee might have read more comics should. Iron Man, also released in 2008, is a perfect example of a movie that is true to its comic roots and has a heart.

summary: When her surrogate father who owns the casino she works in gets murdered, Modesty Blaise takes on those that killed him and are now at the casino to rob it. It turns out she is more than just a modest worker.
translation:
I had heard of Modesty Blaise before, but never read a novel or a comic, my wife and I really liked the movie. It delivered in a fascinating way a good introduction to the figure and its background.

Although it has some action-flick elements, it is much more of an intimate game, excellently written. Unfortunately, this is also where a major disadvantage of the film is revealed. An intimate game thrives on the skills of its performers and has unfortunately delivered only half of the performers. While Alexandra Staden did an excellent job as Modesty Blaise, her opponent Nikolaj Coaster-Waldau - as the villain Miklos - did not. As he threaded his way through the plot as if it were an extended toothpaste, he failed to build an atmosphere of fear that would make the movie a masterpiece. The supporting cast are somehow similar, from some stereotypical gangsters and sluts to decent performances by Fred Pearson as Professor Lob and Eugenia Yuan as Irina.

summary: In the Fabulous Thirties, Doc Savage and his five Amazing Adventurers are sucked into the mystery of Doc's father disappearing in the wilds of South America. The maniacal Captain Seas tries to thwart them at every turn as they travel to the country of Hidalgo to investigate Doc's father's death and uncover a vast horde of Incan gold.
translation:
DOC SAVAGE: THE MAN OF BRONZE (1 of 5 stars)

Terrible, horrible movie ... based on the Pulp Magazine / Paperback series by Lester Dent / Kenneth Robeson ... about a superhero Adventure heroes in the thirties and his five assistants, all experts in an area that allows them to fight evil. It was a pretty hokey series ... but a bit of fun to read when I was a teenager. I knew they made a movie version with Ron (Tarzan) Ely in the 70s ... but I never had a chance to see it. It never played in theaters where I lived and was never shown on television. Now that I've finally seen the movie, I can understand why. The plot and the characters are never treated seriously ... it's all a kind of winking and campy ... somehow like the old Batman TV series ... only without the advantage of being funny ... or having any visual flair , Corny dialogues, cheesy special effects, stupid clich√©s, cheesy action scenes and bad, bad acting. In fact, I find it somehow fascinating in its wickedness ... what could you possibly have thought? It has been rumored that Arnold Schwarzenegger plays the lead role in a modern remake ... but I can not imagine that it would have been much better.

summary: Widely recognized as the best of the Christmas horror efforts, Christmas Evil is the story of a boy who loves Christmas. He is scarred as a boy when he learns that Santa is not real. Throughout the rest of his life, the toy-maker tries to make the Christmas spirit a reality. He becomes obsessed with the behavior of children and the quality of the toys he makes. When he is met with hypocrisy and cynicism, the resulting snap causes him to go on a yuletide killing spree to complete this dark comedic horror.
translation: This (extremely) low-budget movie is compared to the great classic "Silent Night Deadly Night", as it's called the Slasher Flick. First, I'd like to say that I think even "Silent Night Part 2" is better than that (that was filled with flashbacks of the original for more than half of the movie). "Christmas Evil" tries to become psychological by introducing the main character as insane (a strong word), slowly (very slowly). He is irritated by people who do not have the true meaning of Christmas and at work he can not stand how the fabricated toys are made with such a lack of quality and love. Disguised as Santa, he finally goes on a rampage. Also a strong word, as only 3 people are killed without special effects really needed. No tension, no thrill, no blood, no plaster. For one exception, Jeffrey DeMunn is in it. He is best known for playing Tom Hanks as one of the guardians in the classic "The Green Mile". He still has to beat himself to accept the role. He is really the only one who can really act, his supporting role is better than the main one. (Who is not so bad, but if you are overshadowed by a small supporter, you are not great either.). And what about this strange ending? (You have to see it to believe it). "Christmas Evil" is downright boring, nothing happens and the artwork is simply misleading. This is not a slasher. You want to see a real Christmas Lasher, look at the biggest of all times: "Silent Night, Deadly Night".

summary: A series of comedic short films guaranteed to offend.
translation: My brother is an avid DVD collector. He took a look at the cover (two models on toilets) and had to add it to his collection. I stayed with him to see what turned out to be the most shaky movie (using the term loosely). I felt obliged to prevail. I did not dare to have eye contact with my brother, quite sure he had cursed the receipt in his clenched fist. The biggest name in the whole movie is Michael Clark Duncan, who appears in one scene, and the "filmmaker" decided to show each shot of (about four) throughout the movie. In fact, the whole movie pretty much follows this suit. The fact that the DVD contained deleted material was a shock. (But I went to bed without looking at it). Not surprisingly, I found this disc without his fall behind the television about a week later.

summary: Two garbagemen (Tom Wilson, Karim Prince) are picked up by aliens to be experimented on and they become the lead in stopping the ultimate alien invasion which is secretly being planned by a weak Dr. Strangelove clone (Wigald Boning as Strangemeister).
translation: Although I was warned correctly, I actually sat down to watch this movie. Partly because I usually give each movie a break, and because I thought a single movie could not be so bad. I am correct. Not even George Kennedy, Barry Bostwick or Ben Stein could save this turkey from ruin. Only once did I laugh at a parody during this humorless travesty. Namely during the Simon scene says. The other jokes are either poorly executed or just ignorant. And some of them actually see you a mile away. This movie just does not have what it takes to be a good spoof like the plane! (I + II), Naked Weapon (I + II + III) or Scary Movie. They all had A. funny gags, B. good dialogue and most important of all C. unforgettable quotes. Men in white have D. none of the above. To name this film bad would be a gross understatement. AVOID THIS FILM AS YOU CAN! OBSERVE YOURSELF WARNING!

summary: Signing a contract, Jack Torrance, a normal writer and former teacher agrees to take care of a hotel which has a long, violent past that puts everyone in the hotel in a nervous situation. While Jack slowly gets more violent and angry of his life, his son, Danny, tries to use a special talent, the "Shining", to inform the people outside about whatever that is going on in the hotel.
translation: Not the best of the films that can be seen today. I read a lot of reviews about Shining and expected it to be very good. But this movie has disappointed me. The sound and surroundings were good, but there was no history here. There was not a single moment of horror. I expected it to be a horror thriller movie, but there was no horror thriller. The only scene I got scared of was during the chapter change scene that showed "Wednesday." There are many fragments in the movie. Most things are unexplained, and nothing is connected with anything. The story tells us nothing about the women or other scenes being shown. Could be a good movie in the 80s, but not for the 21st century.

summary: Divorced nurse Kathleen McAllister becomes depressed as her ER is about to be closed by budget cuts. Delightfully surprised to spot a newspaper picture of her brother hank, who left town 25 years ago, she approaches the photographer, who can't help her as it was a mer coincidence, but the editor smells a gimmick and posts a fat reward for whoever finds the man whom the public dubs 'John Christmas'.
translation: Being a fan of 'Columbo' I was very disappointed with 'Corky Romano'. While certainly a fun movie, Falk's mafia boss character was a long way from the lovable lieutenant he has played for many years, especially with the offensive language he uses. To be honest, after "Corky Romano" I was both surprised by Mr. Peter Falk and angry. However, after seeing "Finding John Christmas" and its predecessor "A Town Without Christmas" for the first time in a week, I have to say that "Max", Peter Falk's adorable character in both films, is certainly so memorable and lovable like 'Columbo'. While parts of the film are quite predictable, such scenes by no means enjoy watching the story. I also wish I had recorded these two heart-warming Christmas movies, and I highly recommend them, whether you're a Falk fan, a Christmas nut, or just someone enjoying the occasional feel-good movie of the week. This movie can get lost among the many TV holiday flips, so be sure to find "Finding John Christmas" before it's too late.

summary: Abandoning artistic ambitions, sensitive and club-footed Philip Carey enrolls in medical school and falls in love with a waitress Mildred Rogers. She rejects him, runs off with a salesman and returns unmarried and pregnant. Philip gets her an apartment and they become engaged. Mildred runs off with another medical student. Philip takes her back again when she returns with her baby. She wrecks his apartment and burns the securities he needs to pay tuition. He gets a job as a salesman, has surgery on his foot, receives an inheritance, and returns to school where he learns Mildred is dying.
translation: Although this film brings Davis on the map because of her brilliant intense performance as an illiterate of the gentleman pub / prostitute Mildred Rogers, this film is strangely unsatisfactory for me as a whole. The spectacle is fine in every way. What I can not fathom for my life is how or why Phillip, a sensitive, well-mannered young man, is taking away the constant abuse of this tramp that is constantly coming in his way: I find his naive tolerance in some ways ridiculously incredible. Yes, I know that he is a sensitive, self-absorbed, introverted intellectual. But Davis is such a venomous witch that no one who is cultivated would tolerate her attitude or actions and make her credible. Davis is amazing in her role: yes, she may occasionally go overboard in her show, but it's a vividly creative depiction, no matter how one looks at it. Too bad that she played no gangster minor. Her character would have been completely credible as a tramp among the Lesser Lurks!

summary: After the death of Kishen and Karan's dad they are left destitute and struggle to survive on Bombay's footpath. They are eventually befriend by Paro and her brother Prakash; Paro and Karan fall in love and after days of starvation and hunger Kishen decides to rob a handbag only to escape whereby he is introduced to a dreaded gangster Anna who introduced him to crime thus Kishen is able to educate Karan in a convent school and eventually send him to the United States of America for further education. After years Karan returned home as an adult with the intention of re-uniting with his brother, Kishen, his beloved Paro and her brother Prakash all of whom are now adults. He find out that Prakash is now a police inspector and they plan to meet at a spot in Delhi which happens to be a front where pigeons are fed by passers-by unfortunately Prakash is killed before Karan's eyes by a gang of three men in a car who are recognize by Karan. Karan then vows to get Prakash's killers prosecuted by...
translation:
I watched this movie after having so many problems downloading Rapidshare. And I have to say it did not deserve it.

Parinda was so excited that I was really looking forward to seeing it.

Parinda is one of those films that does not live up to the standards of other good Indian filmmakers, despite a great story. It was even more pathetic to know that the story itself was not original, it was loosely based on the classic "On the Waterfront".

Anil Kapoor was irritating, especially when he came from America. The direction lacked quality many times, except for a few intervening scenes.

Give this script to one of them - Ram Gopal Verma, Deepa Mehta, Mahesh Bhatt, Sudhir Mishra, and I'm 100 sure they'll make a stunning movie out of it.

I'm not saying that Parinda is bad. It just was not good enough.

summary: Joel Keefer is a stockbroker trying to climb the corporate ladder. There's only one thing stopping him - his boss' beautiful and flirtatious wife.
translation:
If you love casual nudity with Slap Stick Comedy Junior High School then look no further.

At about half of the time, the beautiful and erotic Arielle Dombasle begins to undress at every opportunity. That's the only thing that made this movie worth seeing.

The story is both lame and absurd, the humor is cheesy, and character development is basically nonexistent.

summary: This is a story about a sports broadcaster later turned morning talk show host Danny Tanner and his three little girls, D.J. (Donna Jo), Stephanie and Michelle Tanner. Before the show begins, Danny Tanner's wife is killed by a drunk driver. So he needs help raising his three little girls. He asks his rock musician brother-in-law, Jesse Katsopolis, and his comedian best friend, Joey Gladstone, to move in with them. As the show goes on, Jesse gets married to Rebecca Donaldson, Danny's co host of the talk show. The two have kids of their own, who are twins, Alexander and Nicholas Katsopolis. However, the show is about what happens as the story is going on.
translation: This show has a great story! It is very credible! A man's wife dies and he can not look after his children, so he calls his brother-in-law, his best friend and many others come later on the show. Like, for example, Rebecca Donaldson, the lovely but strong dog Comet, Nikki, and Alex you can find out for yourself (I do not want to ruin it for you) and coercion Kimmy Gibler! (The sidekick of DJ) but the kids are wonderful too. This is Mary Kate and Ashley has started for the first time! And you too can know Candace Cameron Bure from shows like St.Elsewere Punky Brewster and that's Rabe! Jodie Sweetin plays Steph the gracious middle-aged child who feels left out. Really, that's a very good show!

summary: Amongst the communal riots that erupt in the city, Tara shelters a wayward Sakina from a crazed mob and a bond that blossoms into love is created. The two eventually get married and have a son. The happy family, now living in Amritsar, gets the shock of their lives when Sakina learns that her father (Amrish Puri), whom she previously believed died in the riots back in Amritsar, is still alive after seeing his picture in a tattered, old newspaper. Upon contacting him, Sakina's father, now the mayor of Lahore in Pakistan, arranges for his daughter to arrive in Lahore to see him. Sakina leaves for Lahore minus Tara and her son, and upon reaching the city, learns of her father's plans for her - plans that include forcing Sakina to forget about her family and start life anew in Pakistan. Then begins an extraordinary journey which will lead Tara to cross the border into Pakistan to find his love Sakina.
translation: Gadar is an example of one of the most overrated movies in Bollywood. Directed by Anil Sharma, who prefers to shoot a time-related film, there is a nonsense. The songs were boring and not the kind of song you want to hear in your car, full volume. Sunny Deol is famous for making stupid films where he alone beats 100 villains. He even steps on a metal prison door (Indian) and kicks a moving car far away (Teesri Aankh). I can give you another 50 examples of shameful actions by Sunny Deol. But I'm sure most people already know that. Sunny gives a miserable performance and repeats the same kind of role. A guy who claims to fight for his international match by using force. Amisha Patel is deadly sexy with an amazing body that I would love to bones. But even she could not save the movie from disaster. Instead of wearing sexy clothes as she usually does, she does not do that in this movie. Maybe because she played a Muslim, but she does not act like one in the movie. All in all, this is a bad show, I'm sure it will appeal to some people who love seeing the Bollywood actor beat up 100 men. Give me a break.

summary: At 18, Diana has a chip on her shoulder; she's close to expulsion from high school for fighting, her mother is dead, her dad is surly, the popular girls at school set her teeth on edge, she knows men can cause pain. When she picks up her younger brother at a Brooklyn gym where he boxes to please his father, she decides she wants to train. Hector, a coach, reluctantly agrees to teach her. It's soon clear to him that Diana has talent; he pushes her. She spends time with another young fighter, Adrian, who has a girlfriend, but Diana intrigues him and stirs real feelings he tries to articulate. She, too, must accommodate her toughness and ironic detachment to her feelings for him.
translation:
Michelle Rodriguez is the defining actress who can be the driving force behind other actresses. She has the audacity to embark (and subtract) a rare Tough Girl role early in her career, which is a feat that should be recognized. Although her later films put her in the same role, this film was made for her robustness.

Her character is a romanticized student / fighter / lover struggling to overcome her disillusioned existence in the projects a little over the top in the movie ... but not by a girl. This aspect of this film is not very original, but the story goes deep when the heated relationships that this girl has to deal with come to a boil and take on her original fury.

I haven 'I've never seen an actress take such an aggressive stance in filmmaking, and I'm glad she has that original twist in Hollywood. This movie got a 7 of me because of the average ghetto youth story, but it has such a great actress that plays a rare role in a minimal budget movie. Good work.

summary: Geronimo is the sheriff of a small Texas town. One night, 2 brothers from Palermo kill the sheriff's coworker and pal so he chases them. The chase takes him across the border down to Mexico where he kills one of the brothers and takes the other back to the States to stand trial. The surviving brother vows revenge on the sheriff. But the criminal is handed over to Italian police, and the sheriff's goes to Malta with the prisoner.
translation:
I note from the comments that most people discussing this film base their comments on the MST3K broadcast. That's fair (after all, that's how it was most prevalent), but after seeing the "Final Justice" in its original form, I just wanted to share a few thoughts and comments on the Uncut version.

First of all, we have to admit that the original version is a bit more coherent than the MST3K program, mainly due to an expository scene between Rossano Brazzi and Venantino Venantini (I could use the names of the characters) instead of the actors, but I just like to type the words "Venantino Venantini" and explain why Venantini's fleeting character can not just leave Malta. (It's not a very convincing storyline, but at least the filmmakers have tried to talk about it.) Whether this scene was cut just for the time or because it did not provide much food for riffs, I do not know.

Another storyline is missing in the original: The in the MST3K version apparently unmotivated betrayal of Venantino Venantini to Joe Don Baker on the stripper explains itself from an earlier, extremely unpleasant scene in which Venantini under the Shower raped. While that gives her a motive to turn against him, the whole scenario is just really ... disgusting. (There's no other word for it.)

Some of the MST-worthy moments (the ever-cut-off calls of "Son of a--" and the "Deja-vu" shoot of the sheriff) were pure The result of the edited TV print with which they worked and which did not appear in the original film.

One scene I wish had made it into the MST3K version: Before entering the bar to interview some people, Joe Don asks the Maltese policewoman to accompany him, to stay outside because "they see this uniform, they will not cooperate." However, Joe Don wears his ridiculous cowboy slash sheriff outfit, complete with a shiny badge! I can not imagine why they gave this great opportunity to make fun of him ...

One final comment on the original, uncut version of "Final Justice": Why, oh, why ? the feeling of putting Venantino Venantinis naked butt on the screen?

summary: A Scotland Yard investigator looks into four mysterious cases involving an unoccupied house and its tragic previous tenants: 1) A hack novelist encounters a strangler who's the villain of his books, leading his wife to question his sanity, 2) Two men are obsessed with a wax figure of a woman from their past, 3) A little girl with a stern, widowed father displays an interest in witchcraft, and 4) An arrogant horror film actor purchases a black cloak which gives him a vampire's powers.
translation:
This is a great Amicus horror anthology, with 3 great stories and fantastic performances !, just the last story disappointed. All the characters are fantastic, and the movie is pretty chilled and exciting, and Peter Cushing and Christopher Lee are just amazing! It's very underrated and my favorite story has to be the 3rd "Sweets To The Sweet", plus all the characters are very personable. Some of them are predictable and the last story was unbelievably disappointing and rather boring! The end was really cool! This is a great Amicus horror anthology, with 3 great stories and fantastic performances, just disappointing the last story!, I say it has to be seen!

1. History ("Method for Murder"). This is a great story, with a lot of excitement, and the killer Dominic is really scary, and it's also very good! This was the perfect way to start a story, and in most cases it's unpredictable, and the double-twist ending is shocking and pretty scary! Class A

2. History. ("Wax figures"). It's a solid story, with wonderful performances, but the end is pretty predictable, but it's still scary and pretty exciting, Peter Cushing did a great job, and I could not believe how young Joss Ackland was really enjoyed this story! Class B

3. History ("Sweets to the Sweet"). This is the best story here, as it is extremely scary and unpredictable, it also has a nice twist! Christopher Lee did a great job, and Chloe Franks did a wonderful job as a young daughter, and the end is pretty shocking! I do not want to ruin it for you, but it's one of the best horror stories I've seen! Class A +

4. History ("The Cape"). This is a terrible story that is really weak and unconventional. Jon Pertwee annoyed me, but the end got me a little surprised, and Ingrid Pitt was great as always, but it's just boring and has been done many times, and where was the creativity ??. Class D

The direction is great!. Peter Duffell does a great job here, with ingenious camera work, great angles, a spooky atmosphere, and keeps the movie at a very fast pace!

The Acting is awesome!. John Bryans is great here, as a narrator, he had some great lines, I just wish he had more screen time. John Bennett is very good as Det., And was pretty intense, he was especially good in the end! I really liked him. Denholm Elliott is excellent like Charles, he was vulnerable, showed fear, was very personable and I loved his facial expressions, he rocked! Joanna Dunham is amazingly beautiful! And did great with what she had to do as a wife, she also had a great chemistry with Denholm Elliott! Tom Adams is scary as Dominic, he looked scary and did the job extremely well! Peter Cushing is fantastic as always, and is amazing here, he is personable, focused, charming and, as always, has a lot of class! (Cushing rules !!). Joss Ackland is fantastic as ever and looked so young here, I barely recognized him, his accent was not so thick and played a different role, I loved it! (Ackland rules). Wolfe Morris is scary here and did what he had to do well. Christopher Lee is amazing as always and is incredible here, he is incredibly intense, very focused and as always he had that great, intense look on his face, he was especially amazing in the end! (Lee rules !!). Chloe Franks is adorable like the daughter, she is a bit scary, and gave one of the best children's performances I've ever seen !, I loved her. Nyree Dawn Porter is beautiful and was excellent as a babysitter, I liked her a lot! Jon Pertwee annoyed me here, and was pretty boring, and completely ignorant, he had no chemistry with Ingrid Pitt! Ingrid Pitt is beautiful and does her usual vampire thing and does it well!

Rest of the cast is fine. Overall a must! **** of 5

summary: Mrs. Anna Leonowens and her son Louis arrive in Bangkok, where she has been contracted to teach English to the children of the royal household. She threatens to leave when the house she had been promised is not available, but falls in love with the children. A new slave, a gift of a vassal king, translates "Uncle Tom's Cabin" into a Siamese ballet. After expressing her unhappiness at being with the King, the slave decides to make an attempt to escape with her lover. Anna and the King start to fall in love, but her headstrong upbringing inhibits her from joining his harem. She is just about to leave Siam but something important she finds out makes her think about changing her mind.
translation: 1. Look 12/6/2009 - 4 out of 10 (Dir-Walter Lang): Disappointing musical from the perspective of character development, from my point of view, from this much-vaunted Rodgers and Hammerstein piece. There are some good songs and a decent comic performance of Yul Brynner's King of Siam - but the movie is not really good at presenting the situation and settings. I can only blame the script and possibly the acting, why we do not fully understand the characters and their situations. I know that maybe it would be a bit too much to ask for a musical intended for the enjoyment of the songs and the dance, but even that part did not strike me. The basic story is about an Englishwoman who comes to Siam to teach the children about fine European things. We later find out that the king is actually the greatest student. There is a side ban romance between the king's latest wife, played by Rita Moreno (a Latino as an Arab - come on !!) and a former lover who caused some complications but added nothing really intriguing. Deborah Kerr, as the main character Annie - is fine, but not so convincing. The king learns some things because of their presence and then the movie fades like him. This is really a tiny story with some songs and dances, but not really great for a spectator.

summary: Julia Young and Steven Harris are having marital troubles, but on a weekend trip to visit Julia's family on the remote Savage Island, marital problems quickly become the least of their worries. An intense struggle between the Young and the Savage families, the only residents living on the island, takes thrills and chills to a whole new and disturbing level. The Savages, a bunch that take the terms 'hillbilly', and 'hick' to a new frontier, are out to claim Steven and Julia's baby as payment for the death of their own son who was accidentally run over by Julia's pot-head younger brother.
translation:
Savage Island (2003) is a lame movie. It's more like a home video recording with very little lighting and terrible drama. Not only that, the storyline and the script were miserable. I do not know why this movie was made. I've seen a lot of movies in my time and the ones I really hate are movies that make me angry. He brought my blood to a boil. The situations were sour at best. If I made such a film, it would have been a short one. Really, because these backwoods "idjits" would not have been in the picture.

Do not be fooled by the cover of the D.V.D. I am an avid observer of the bad cinema. But this movie is practically invisible. I do not mind watching movies on D.V. to be turned around. but if you do, that makes the movie enjoyable, not some tired retreading of superior horror movies (sans Wrong Turn).

I do not have to recommend this waste of disk. If you pass this on hire, be careful.

Movies that really make you angry get an automatic 1.

summary: In the sixties Romano Amato, his wife Rosa and their two sons Giancarlo and Gigi emigrate from Solino in Italy to Duisburg in the Ruhr area and establish the first Pizza restaurant in town. Their business emerges well and both children get used to Germany. 10 years later the brothers fall in love with the same woman; they break tie with each other in anger and Gigi returns to Solino with his mother. A decade later both meet again and have a retrospect on their lives.
translation: Solino really moved me with his deeply drawn characters. While it was a simple rivalry between two brothers, it was not just hate or jealousy. What I liked most about the film was how I identified with the feelings Gigi was going through, especially if he had to take his mother to her hometown in Italy and failed to attend the film festival. Seeing this character, who fought so hard between his artistic dream and his innate sense of duty to his mother, was so frustrating. Even at the end, when he tried to reach his father again, he was so brave. And as in real life, most fathers can never overcome their walls to reach their children. I even identified with Giancarlo, the brother who, while he was the more confident and older brother, had so many insecurities. A really nice movie that made me laugh and cry.

summary: The 1991 Persian Gulf War is a military triumph for the United States. But when thousands of returning veterans start to develop medical problems, it appears that the military is trying to downplay or ignore the situation. It takes perseverance on the part of military families and members of Congress to bring to light the dilemma and prompt action on the part of the government.
translation:
What this film does not answer is how wrong this war is (and most US wars have been done recently, just to get some oil). How many innocent civilian casualties were there, how many lives were killed and how blatantly stupid are the perpetrators.

So, let me ask you - if American soldier kills women and children except enemy, it's fine, but if the government accidentally kills their own forces by killing deadly chemicals and killing so many civilians Well, that's it not? Your logic fails, gentleman.

I give it 5 for the solid performance and 1 for everything else, a total of 3.

summary: Raggedy Ann and the rest of the toys in Marcella's playroom are curious about a package that has just arrived. They look inside and discover it contains a beautiful French doll. The haughty girl, named Babette, is horrified by her new home. She wants to go back to Paris. Meanwhile, the Captain, a pirate in a snow globe, sees Babette and falls in love. He tricks Raggedy Ann into freeing him and then immediately kidnaps Babette and sails out the window. Raggedy Ann and Andy leave the playroom to rescue her. Their adventure includes meeting a blue camel with wrinkled knees; the Greedy, a living, self-consuming taffy pit filled with every candy and confection known to the palate; King Coo Coo and the Loonie Knight, who love to laugh, but only at the expense of others; and Gazooks, a tickle monster hired to give King Coo Coo the last laugh. Finally, they find the Captain; but the damsel in distress proves more capable than they had imagined.
translation:
Personally, this is one of my favorites of all time! No, I'm not 10 .. I'm 30! I own an old, original VHS of this, which I bought in a rental. I have seen it countless times.

While it's an amusing movie for kids, it's a fascinating adult movie. I once saw this movie, even though I was not sober. My eyes were open for things I had never noticed before. I saw morally strong support, both open and somewhat subliminal. I wish I could remember all the things I've noticed, but it's been a very long time since then. rest assured, there are tons of things that are played during the movie. If you have the chance to see it .. not sober .. do it, you will not be disappointed .. in fact, you will probably feel more happy and warm.

unique and wonderful!

summary: A rock and roll story that portrays the decay of political and cultural lacunae that have separated China and Hong Kong for so long.
translation:
This became a cult movie in Chinese college students, though I saw it until it aired in Channel4, UK.

full of artsy dizzy, the plot is mediocre and unreal; the "spirit" he wants to convey is how independent artists "resist the marketing of the music industry" and preserve their "purity of an artistic soul" and not sell themselves for dirty money. that is really dizzy and superficial; The diologists are mainly pathetic. Action is bad. sceenplay is full of art ideas. It's a fantasy movie for kids and that's all

summary: An insecure young Asian man, played by Japanese pop star Goro Inagaki, meats an interesting sensual European woman who teaches him the secrets of love and life.
translation: This is probably one of the worst movies ever. It is terrible. But it is so good! It's probably best if you do not expect a gripping plot and something fantastically clever and entertaining because you'll be disappointed. However, if you would like to see 50 million vases and Goro's fantastic hair / bad English then you will have a real treat. The harder you think about the movie, the worse it gets, unless you have a contest to discover the most plot gaps. In this case you have hours of entertainment in front of you. I would recommend this movie only to the bored or die-hard Smap fans. And even then, the latter should be a bit cautious, because Goro's Japanese fans were a bit annoyed that they thought he was going to sell himself. (He was not real, not if Johnny Kitagawa (who was the executive producer) can do that for him).

summary: Sarah Silverman stars as Sarah Silverman, an unemployed single woman who still behaves like a child. Sarah depends in everything on her sister (played by her real sister Laura). Sarah is petty, self centered, childish, sometimes dumb and always Jewish. Other characters are her two gay neighbors (or gaybors as she calls them) and Laura's boyfriend who is a police officer.
translation: Sarah Silverman is like a totally manic Zooey Deschanel and I think I'm already in love. Yes, if you loved Jesus, it's magic, you'll love that. If not, what the hell is wrong with you? A big compliment to the Comedy Channel for writing that in my face. My life finally makes sense, and "your car smells like farts" is my kind of humor. I am a happy guy. The first episode made me laugh hysterically and I'm looking forward to next week impatiently. That's like Grease meets South Park. Totally outrageous. Sarah Silverman is someone I could see in the phone book. Your delivery is accurate and oh so funny. She never skips a beat. When you think about it, it's not so much the choice of materials. By the way, that's a couple of really good things, as it is for them. Thanks, Sarah Silverman! Thanks, comedy channel!

summary: At an annual pace, a huge colony of ants is forced to collect every piece of food that grows on their island for a group of menacing grasshoppers. But that all changes when a misfit inventor ant named Flik accidentally knocks over the offering pile thus forcing the grasshoppers' devious leader Hopper to force the ants to redo their gathering of food. Despite the fact that his friends don't believe him and desperate to help save the colony, Flik volunteers to go out into the world and search for a group of 'warrior' bugs. Instead, what he got was a talented group of circus performers. But when the grasshoppers return and take control of the island, Flik must prove himself a true hero before it's too late.
translation: A must for all - if you need to borrow your neighbor to see this. Easily one of the best animations / cartoons released in a long time. It has brought the films Antz to a whole new level. Do not confuse the two as the same movie - although the movie act is basically similar. Just go and enjoy.

summary: L.A. in the early 1930's: racism, poverty, and disease color the Bunker Hill neighborhood where Arturo Bandini, a lover of men and beasts alike, has arrived from Colorado to write the great Los Angeles novel. After six months and down to his last nickel, he orders a cup of coffee, served by Camilla Lopez, beautiful, self-possessed, and Mexican. Arturo gets advice, encouragement, and an occasional check from H.L. Mencken, so he keeps writing and he keeps seeing Camilla. But, he's mean to her for no apparent reason, so the relationship sputters. A housekeeper from back East suggests a way out of his jealously and fears. "Camilla Bandini": is it in the cards?
translation: Given the story of the director of this film, it's hard to believe that this was such a painful bad movie. I was at the European premiere last night and one of the executive producers was there. He was not supposed to see the movie yet, and boy, he was in a surprise. I have not read the book on which it is based, nor do I know if it has been highly rated or appreciated, but I have read "Captain Correlli's Mandolin" and how bad it was for the screen and how bad this movie was I only suspect that something similar happened here. The acting was not bad, even if only a few too many eyebrows were pulled up by Farrell. Honestly, I can not believe how little I was interested in any character in this movie. Situations are played out on the screen in an empty sequence of nothingness. Donald Sutherland's part consists of a few scenes in which he opens a door, says something and closes it again. I looked at my watch when I did not duck over the dialogue on the screen. I never went out in a movie, but I was tempted to start with it. I've given this movie a score of '2' for reasons that seem horrendously shallow to me, but those are the best things I can say about this movie. The first is that I really enjoyed the all too short earthquake scene and the second is that Salma Hayek was naked and looked beautiful. I can not say much about this movie. Do not ask the dust, he can not talk!

summary: Well-intentioned Marsha and David hire a foreign housekeeper, Sophia, to care for their new baby and put some "sanity" back in their lives. What follows is a situation that spirals out of control. In a frenzy to find an American husband before her visa expires, Sophia manipulates poor Marsha and David into caring for her ten-year-old daughter while she goes on a dating marathon.
translation: Glamorous! In October, I saw food imports with my children in Philadelphia. We all liked it so much that we saw it a second time with my parents. I have not heard her laugh like that for years! It was the first time I remember seeing a movie that my parents and children could enjoy. It's really cute and we can not wait for it to come on DVD. You have to do more movies like domestic import. It's refreshing to go to a movie that three different generations can enjoy (and not be ashamed of). I have not seen a movie since My Fat Greek Wedding. I loved Mindy Sterling as a mother. She was also in Austin Powers. Howard Hesseman is there too and he is hilarious. I remember him from WKRP.

summary: 25 years ago two boats raced G√∂ta Canal. It's about time to copy the race with live TV-coverage. Some really wild reality-TV.
translation:
(Review in English, as Swedish is not allowed)

I saw this movie with extremely low expectations, and unfortunately I can say that the movie did not do it justice.

As much as I would have liked to see Janne "Loffe" Karlsson back on the big screen, the authors had to realize early in the script process that seven people fall into the water, neither original nor funny. The story is very thin and the jokes are used and predictable, that's not boring. I smiled three times during the whole movie.

The placement of Swedish Findus products is (unintentionally) funny, why not just say a big sign; "Findus made it possible!".

G√∂ta Kanal 2 does not have to be seen in the cinema or on DVD, just wait for it to be televised, it will not take too long.

summary: Cybersix is the name of a powerful advanced female genetic construct android who is the creation of malevolent scientist named Von Richter. He considers her a failed creation owing to her indomitable free will and she was forced to escape to avoid termination by her creator. Now she hides in regular society as a male teacher named Adrienne Seideleman, but she stalks the night as a caped superhero. Vowing eternal opposition to the plans of her creator and his henchmen, she protects her new found world and friend and seeks the humanity that her creator denied from her.
translation:
I love this TV series so much. It contains animations that are interesting and beautiful. I can not believe they cut it off the television, and also that I've never figured out if Cybersix and Data7 die or not, apparently they survive, but I'm not sure. Cybersix was by far the best TV show ever. I know it's too late to hope they'll start the series again, so I'm really glad I can see it. I have so much <3> it's about a woman named Cybersix, she's not human. She goes to Adrian Sieldman, a man teacher at a high school. Now Cybersix is ‚Äã‚Äãactually a woman, she is only disguised as a man a day. Cybersix patrols the city during the night.

A man named von Reichter is the one who created Cybersix, and once he finds her alive, he uses everything to catch her.

If you have never seen it before, you should download it completely. It was the best TV show in the world. Why did you cut it ???? Some people have problems. but I am glad that I have looked at the 13 episodes.

summary: Set in New York, 'Whipped' is about a group of three single men, buddies from college, whom meet every Sunday at their local diner hangout to discuss their favorite sport: scoring with women. Their conversations (always revealing, sometimes revolting, and occasionally riotous) revolve around the weekend past and the girls that these three egotistical and narcissistic swingers were able or unable to "scam." However, when all three single guys unknowingly go after the same "perfect" woman, Mia (Amanda Peet), they begin to question their skirt-chasing ways. Squabbling breaks out amongst the group as they compete for her attention and suddenly, the fate of their ritual and their friendships, becomes uncertain. Who will win the morning round table bragging rights? You'll be surprised.
translation: First and foremost, Zorie Barber (Zeke) could be one of the worst actors I've ever seen. As a character who's supposed to be a hipper, a Village author in martial arts and proud to be mysterious, why is he so over the top, overdramatic and just terrible? Did he know anything about his character before they started filming? Does the director? Do martial arts not teach discipline? Apart from that, this film misses the goal with its lame jokes and the already pimped humor. Hand in the toilet? <i> Trainspotting </ i>. Masturbation? Hmm. <I> Fast Times at Ridgemont High </ i>, <i> American Pie </ i>, the list goes on .... Bad Dialog: In a sequence, Eric says "it's none of my business, <i> but </ i> ... "and 30 seconds later, Mia says," Why is this something to you? "Bad Editing: At least five minutes of footage is wasted on NYC traffic. <hr> It's also impossible to believe that the four male protagonists in each world would be a close-knit group of friends. I can not say what makes everyone laugh, but if you enjoy the low brow, the basic humor of the bathroom and the insults in any case enjoy. If you want something smarter, but in the same direction, you will see <i> Boomerang </ i>. If you want a solid romantic comedy, go to <i> The Tao Of Steve </ i>. But anyone who thinks that <i> Whipped </ i> is funny and dates a precise representation, I can not agree.

summary: A sheriff investigating the disappearance of a young girl from a small island discovers there's a larger mystery to solve among the island's secretive, neo-pagan community.
translation:
The Wicker Man. I'm so angry that I can not write a correct comment about this movie.

The plot was ridiculous, thinly tied up and overall - just lame. Nicolas Cage ... shame on you! I assumed that since you were there, it would at least be decent. That was not it.

I felt like a lot of the film had been left on the cutting machine floor, and even if it was complete - the movie was just crazy and silly.

In the end, your mouth stays open, the mind is confused and the good taste is offended. I've never heard so many people leave so much hatred on the opening day. People complained in small groups in the mall, four floors from the theater at the entrance. It is so bad.

I've heard it compared to Glitter, American Werewolf in Paris and Gigli. My friend was so angry that he would not even talk about it.

Grrrr!

summary: After a terrible day, two good friends and housemates find the outside world converted into a featureless and empty white void.
translation:
I've just seen that at the Toronto Film Festival, and I hope it will be broad release because I want to see it again! It's a character-driven movie, and Andrew and David are more than up to the job. Any discussion of the storyline could be considered a spoiler, so I'll just say the plot is clever, the acting is outstanding, and the effects are amazing. Well filmed and well done. One of the best movies I've seen in ages, and very refreshing this summer's dreary

movies. The audience laughed the whole time. See it if you can. (I especially liked the "chocolate bars! Chocolate bars!" Scene.)

summary: Haunted by a secret, Ben Thomas looks for redemption by radically transforming the lives of seven people he doesn't know. Once his plan is set, nothing will be able to stop him. At least that's what he thinks. But Ben hadn't planned on falling in love with one of these people and she's the one who will end up transforming him.
translation: The emotional effect of this film defies the words. It's elegant, subtle, beautiful and tragic, all rolled in two hours. This is Will Smith, when he matures into his acting skills, the whole gamut of it. Who knew? I saw The Pursuit of Happiness and thought it must be a coincidence for the blockbuster, over-the-top actor, Smith. His performances in both films show Smith a whole other dimension, a refinement of talent, scriptwriting selectivity, I'm not sure, but I see him differently now. Seven Pounds is one of those films that needs to suspend their beliefs in order to fully enjoy their essence. Do not pay attention to the action, pay attention to the fragile state of the human heart, both literally and metaphorically. It is a story of human guilt, atonement, love and sacrifice.

summary: An elite group of vice cops are fired from the L.A.P.D. for being over-zealous in their war against drugs. It is immediately apparent that some of their superiors are involved in the drug ring. Banded together, four of the banned cops (which quickly becomes three when one is killed early) band together to fight the drug ring undercover. They gain capital for weapons by ripping off minor drug dealers. Then well-armed they go after the kingpin (Boyd).
translation: I was satisfied with the cast of respected players. The story is to stand up for a cause, even if you're personally in danger. At a time when violence and pain are often in the foreground, this movie focuses on the old-fashioned good policeman. Although similar plots have been repeated, these guys are doing well. Step back and enjoy. Dennehy is a master at taking on a movie.

summary: When a crusading chairperson of the military budget committee pressures the would be Navy secretary to begin full gender integration of the service, he offers the chance for a test case for a female trainee in the US Navy's elite SEAL/C.R.T. selection program. LT. Jordan O'Neill is given the assignment, but no one expects her to succeed in an inhumanly punishing regime that has a standard 60% dropout rate for men. However, O'Neill is determined to prove everyone wrong.
translation: How this film ever got a 6-star average is a mystery to me. The script is so banal and frankly an insult to the life on which it is based. Cinematography comes straight out of the advertising world, and the talented Ridley Scott should be ashamed. However, Demi Moore shows no surprise by participating in this movie, looking at her tracklist. All in all, a movie in the "High Concept" style, for which even Don Simpson would be ashamed.

summary: "The Straight Story" chronicles a trip made by 73-year-old Alvin Straight from Laurens, Iowa, to Mt. Zion, Wis., in 1994 while riding a lawn mower. The man undertook his strange journey to mend his relationship with his ill, estranged, 75-year-old brother Lyle.
translation:
[No Spoilers]

As a David Lynch movie, you might have the idea that he portrayed his enigmatic mind like most of his feature films. But it's a very straightforward story, as the title might suggest. Not to be caught in the usual lynch-gap of incomprehensibility that usually occurs after consideration, d. H. Lost Highway. It's a simple movie, but it's indeed a great movie. This is both innovative and entertaining. It's innovative because it's not Lynch. But maybe that's Lynch. He likes to twist our minds and therefore puts together a movie that may seem very mainstream and far from Lynch itself. As a very avant-garde director, he could just make such a movie to annoy his regular audience because he knows what to expect, but he does not give it to them. That would be smart.

The tempo of the movie is slow. I'd almost say lawnmower speed ... Do not expect an action orgy, but the movie is really entertaining for those who go with the flow of the movie. Pay close attention to the small details Lynch designed for our entertainment during the movie. Watch out for the great cinematography that brings this movie to life. And listen to Badalamenti's score and the main theme that truly invigorates the landscapes of Iowa and Wisconsin that are frequently shown.

Farnsworth plays one of his finest in this film, making him one of the most likeable men ever to be shown on film. He does not have to say anything to express his feelings and thoughts. His cheerfulness shines through him and his acting earned him an Oscar nomination. Do I have to say that his weak health was not played in this movie? He was diagnosed with cancer and shot himself right after this movie was done. This knowledge only pays more attention to the movie because it is rather a tribute to Farnsworth.

All the above make a very nice movie suitable for all kinds of people who like a movie the way it should be made. You might ask for homilies that are not so obvious and a bit na√Øve, but it does not ruin the overall picture, as it's a memorable movie. 10.9.

summary: The passage from this world to the fantasy kingdom of Stormhold is through a breach in a wall beside an English village. In the 1800s, a boy becomes a man when he ventures through the breach in pursuit of a fallen star, to prove his love for the village beauty. The star is no lump of rock, it's a maiden, Yvaine. Tristan, the youth, is not the only one looking for her: three witches, led by Lamia, want her heart to make them young; and, the sons of the dead king of Stormhold want her because she holds a ruby that will give one of them title to the throne. Assisting Tristan are his mother, the victim of a spell, and a cross-dressing pirate of the skies. Will Tristan win his true love?
translation:
When I saw this movie, I was a bit skeptical because fantasy movies are not always my cup of tea. Especially a romantic fantasy.

I did not know that I would go through cinematic magic. Everything in the film from action to dialogue to effects was very close to perfection.

Claire Danes seems like the star she is in this movie. From start to finish you fall more and more in love with this figure.

Michelle Pfeiffer is threatening as a wicked witch who wants to conquer the star for eternal youth and beauty.

Robert De Niro is a loveable character who gives the audience the greatest bit of weird relief as the movie climaxes. Overall, this was a movie that surprised and delighted me as a movie fan. If you are looking for a fun and entertaining movie that is fun for both children and adults, Stardust is the way to go.

summary: A young and handsome archaeologist discovers the crown of the Queen of Sheba, and returns with it to a San Francisco museum where it is put on display. Its safety is in doubt as many criminals want the crown -- an international pair of criminals, a San Francisco gangster and his cohorts, and a super criminal known as Metaxa. Mr. Moto is forced to postpone his vacation while he deals with the threat.
translation: I generally love those 1930s movies that come from Mystery / Police Charlie Chan, and that's no exception. However, something with this movie seems to be bad. A later attempt to switch from cerebral moto-films revolving around the storyline to a salad bar pampered by comic relief as relieving as sore feet. A Typecast buffoon appears out of nowhere and incarnates a clumsy Englishman playing the detective, and even other characters seem to get involved in the comedy. The action may seem odd today or a mere apology for us, but at that time the possibility of epochal archaeological discoveries was not only real, but a common occurrence.

summary: Darkman, needing money to continue his experiments on synthetic skin, steals a crate of cash from drug lord Peter Rooker, attracting the gangster's attention. Rooker is determined to find the source of Darkman's super strength, and uses his beautiful but evil doctor to lure Darkman into a trap. Thinking that the doctor will restore feeling to his tortured body, he discovers too late that they have taken a sample of his adrenaline, which they will market as a super steroid. As Darkman plans his revenge on Rooker's gang, he slowly begins to care about Rooker's neglected wife and daughter. He must now find a way to help them, and destroy Rooker before he uses the adrenaline to plunge the city into chaos.
translation: OK, but is that a good movie? Well, not really, in my opinion. There is not much to recommend. I found it very slow, tedious, indeed. It's pretty predictable, too. The numbers one and two were predictable, but not so much. I also found that this film was sometimes quite squeamish, which I did not really consider this series and the character. Jeff Fahey plays the main evil in this episode. He is a decent actor, but I felt that he also played his character exaggeratedly. I suppose that matched the tone of the movie, which would have been great if I liked the movie. There were also some pretty bad one-liners. Arnold Vosloo returns in the title role, but there is little work in this film. The character has not really evolved, as I had hoped. Well, that's just my opinion. For me, while this movie is not abysmal, it's pretty bad. My voice for Darkman III: 3.5 / 5

summary: Based on a comic book series. A woman burned at the stake in 15th century Sweden actually is Satan (Lucifer)'s daughter - and plots revenge against him.
translation: This movie was a big disappointment for me. I had been waiting for this movie to come out for years, and I was a staunch supporter of Chaos Comics until they went bankrupt. Not only did they cut half of the story, they also changed the information. The statement that Lucifer is the father of hope is untrue. He has corrupted her father, but he himself is not her father. Nor did the voices match the characters, and once you hear the voice of a beloved character, the voice you heard in your head can never be returned. I can not even remember everything that was wrong with this movie. The bottom line is, if you love Lady Death, do not look at this movie. It just did not do the weird justice !!

summary: Julia Ross secures employment, through a rather nosy employment agency, with a wealthy widow, Mrs. Hughes, and goes to live at her house. 2 days later, she awakens - in a different house, in different clothes, and with a new identity. She's told she is the daughter-in-law of Mrs. Hughes, and has suffered a nervous breakdown. I'd Julia really 'Julia', or, is it true, that she's lost all memory of who she is?
translation:
Julia Ross (Nina Foch) agrees to accept a job as a secretary to the wealthy Hughes family to get over her friend who left her. Almost immediately, she is drugged and taken to the family home in Cornwall. When she wakes up, she tells her again and again that she is Marion Hughes, mentally ill and keeps her trapped ... but why? You're probably guessing why, but I do not mind, because this is fun.

Together with "The Narrow Margin" and "Face Behind the Mask" this is one of the best B-pictures ever made. (B-pictures were low-budget pictures made quickly with low budgets and no big stars). It's only as long as it needs to be (just 65 minutes), is well-directed, fast-paced and exciting. It only stumbles at the end, which I found a little too implausible to buy it.

Foch (a good actress) is only OK in the lead, but Lady May Witty is great and George Macready is excellent (and scary) like the villains. It's worth catching. A perfect example of how to make a great movie on a budget.

summary: 12 genetically enhanced childern escape from a military base that created them. 10 years later, after The Pulse, a magnetic bomb that destroyed every computer in USA, has struck, Max Guevara, one of the 12 escapees, is a bike messenger in (what's left of) Seattle and with cyberjournalist, Logan Cale, she tries to rid the world of crime and corruption, avoid her creators and uncover her past.
translation: All I have to say is, if you do not like it, then something is wrong with you. Plus Jessica is just a lot of hot !!!!! The only reason you do not like it is that it's going to be in the future when Seattle went to hell. That and you do not like it, because the future they are showing could happen very well.
