summary: The Cahulawassee River valley in Northern Georgia is one of the last natural pristine areas of the state, which will soon change with the imminent building of a dam on the river, which in turn will flood much of the surrounding land. As such, four Atlanta city slickers, alpha male Lewis Medlock, generally even-keeled Ed Gentry, slightly condescending Bobby Trippe, and wide-eyed Drew Ballinger, decide to take a multi-day canoe trip on the river, with only Lewis and Ed having experience in outdoor life. They know going in that the area is ethno-culturally homogeneous and isolated, but don't understand the full extent of such until they arrive and see what they believe is the result of generations of inbreeding. Their relatively peaceful trip takes a turn for the worse when half way through they encounter a couple of hillbilly moonshiners. That encounter not only makes the four battle their way out of the valley intact and alive, but threatens the relationships of the four as they do, ...
translation:
It is a shame that Deliverance is mainly known as the Redneck rape film and Dueling Banjos. Even people who have seen the movie can not forget this rape scene. It's not as bad as the rape scene in Pulp Fiction. It's certainly not as bad as any female rape scene in almost every movie. People tend to miss the power of the movie, which contains the infamous Nerve Saw scene.

Deliverance, action, cinematography and the soundtrack of Deliverance all contribute to its brooding charisma. The backcountry in which it was filmed is beautiful and quite in contrast to the dark theme. The actors, both primary and minor, make you feel like you are going downriver with them directly.

What separates this film from others is the tangible sense of fear it inspires. Not many films can make you sneak like that. Conclusion: This film is a classic. I can not say more about that.

summary: Al, Louise, Max and Sy - four literary types who work in the theater business - are discussing what they believe to be the real life truths underlying their work, Max who writes primarily tragic plays, and Sy who writes primarily comic plays. Al proceeds to tell them a real story of a troubled woman named Melinda Robicheaux showing up unexpectedly at a door in the middle of an important business dinner party. Melinda long ago left her physician husband to embark on a relationship with who she initially believed to be the man of her dreams, which ended up not being the case. Melinda tries to put her life back together with the help of select people at the dinner party, some who have their own ulterior motives. Melinda's appearance also opens up the cracks existing in the marriage of one of the couples at the dinner party, while it leads to the dissolution of a friendship that has existed since college. With this basic outline of a story, Max and Sy try to make their point of life being...
translation: Can I have my $ 13.00 back, please? I would have preferred to see Hydro-Electric Power Comes to North America. Once again. This is a movie with one voice. The same voice that comes from every mouth of a character, regardless of age or gender. To hear that voice again, I would have to charge at least $ 150 an hour. And I do not take insurance. It was eerie to see Will Ferrell become Woody. But I do not think that imaginative casting is enough. One should wait until they have a story before making a movie. Unless he only does it for the money. And if that's the case, why not just do an all-rap version of "What's up Tiger Lily?"

summary: A film about struggling to deal with paralysis. Author Joel Garcia breaks his neck while hiking, and finds himself in a rehabilitation centre with Raymond, an exaggerating ladies' man, and Bloss, a racist biker. Considerable tension builds as each character tries to deal with his new found handicap and the problems that go with it, especially Joel, whose lover Anna is having as difficult a time as he is. As Raymond reveals a dream about dancing on the surface of a lake to stay afloat, it becomes apparent that each of them must find his own Waterdance to survive his tragedy.
translation:
This story had a different perspective that fascinated me - enough to buy a previously viewed VHS view - unseen. That was a mistake.

In what could have been a very beautiful story - about crippled people in a hospital and their various personalities - quickly turned into a very mundane soap opera with dissimilar characters />
We have "Bloss (William Forsythe) The stereotypical racist white person who says the F-word every other sentence and is so despicable that she did not give him a first name in the movie. It's a lot of fun to be here. Then there is "Raymond Hill" (Wesley Snipes), a fast-talking womanizer. Snipes liked these fast-acting "hip" arrogant roles because he played in a number of them, as in "White Men Can not Jump". Then there's the cute Helen Hunt who plays "Anna", this wonderful, loving person who has an adulterous affair with the main character in the movie "Joel Garcia" (Eric Stoltz).

Yup, that's heartwarming, feel-good stuff. It melts my heart to watch these nice people. But if you're one of those who love sleazy characters portrayed by greasy people in this greasy movie ... you might really like it! Add a dose of Hollywood Political Correctness and there you go! What could want more?

summary: After a terrible day, two good friends and housemates find the outside world converted into a featureless and empty white void.
translation:
Charlie Kauffman has made strange metaphysical anxiety popular, but this Canadian gem makes it hilarious.

Like most weird movies, the less about plot, the better, but let's face the scene, two friends Anthony and Dave have been together since childhood, they can not cope with the world and finally This means that they no longer have to. But that's where more problems start.

I loved this movie, it made me smile long after the credits were over and that's a rare experience with so many mass productions of "nothing" out there.

Do not miss this.

summary: Viennese doctor Josef Breuer meets with philosopher Friedrich Nietzsche to help him deal with his despair.
translation: I rented this DVD after seeing it while looking for something else. When I saw the title on the jacket, I could not believe my eyes. I read Yalom's book about a year ago and loved it, admiring Yalom's work in general. (I'm a clinical psychologist.) I may have seen 30 minutes of this movie and had to turn it off. I am not sure if I can take much more. On a superficial level, the wrong accents, as others have said, are at best simply distracting and at worst irritating and vague. The drama is boring when it should be passionate and funny, if it should be serious. The portrayal of Lou Salome is just superficial, and the brilliant Freud is little more than a schoolboy. I see very little of the spirit of the book that has been transmitted so far. I was hoping to recommend this film to my students. Instead, I'll refer you to the book. Imagine.

summary: Haunted by nightmares. Plagued by a past that won't go away. When Maddy goes to a party with her new boyfriend, Shawn, she only wants to meet his friends and have a good time. They tell her about their 'Murder Club' and invite her to join. Confused but intrigued, Maddy really wants to be part of the group. Before she can join, though, the 'Murder Club' members are being killed off, one by one. Who can be trusted? Can the killer be stopped? Or will they all bleed?
translation:
The only reason I'm trying to comment on this movie is to save you every 97 minutes of your life and maybe your money.

I bought it for 3.00 ‚Ç¨ ex-rent, it looked interesting, so I took a chance.

Within minutes of powering up, I realized that I had made a mistake. The entire cast was to be stored away until winter and then thrown to the nearest log fire, where they could meet more of their kind.

As far as the Devin Hamilton (writer and director) is concerned, he should be shot dead, alas, that should be done before he does this junk.

Avoid this movie if you see it running away in the shops.

1/10

summary: Lucienne, typist and gorgeous bathing beauty, decides to enter the 'Miss Europe' pageant sponsored by the French newspaper she works for. She finds her jealous lover Andre violently disapproves of such events and tries to withdraw, but it's too late; she's even then being named Miss France. The night Andre planned to propose to her, she's being whisked off to the Miss Europe finals in Spain, where admirers swarm around her. Win or lose, what will the harvest be?
translation: It is often only after years that it is possible for us to look back and see those stars that are really stars. Like the French film critic whose name escapes me, he said: "There is no garbo, there is no lockpick, there is only Louise Brooks"; and there is, thank goodness! Louise Brooks! This is the third of her European masterpieces. But it is also an extraordinary film to be the first French sound film, following a script written by the famous Ren√© Clair, allegedly done by Georg Pabst and the voice of Edith Piaf before it became known! So much talent on and in a movie, how could it not be a masterpiece ?! And that is exactly this movie. It's a shame that Louise Brooks was scolded by Hollywood when she returned to the States - so much talent was so arrogantly thrown on the track! In the movie, in addition to seeing Louise Brooks in action, it's great to see pictures of Paris. 1930 and Piaf's young voice. I never get tired of this movie!

summary: Mike Dooley has been teamed up with Jerry Lee, a German Shepherd dog, for nearly ten years, but Jerry Lee isn't as young as he once was, and Dooley's superiors suggest that maybe it's time that Jerry Lee was retired from the force. But there is a stalker who wants Dooley dead. The stalker, disgruntled crime novelist Devon Lane, became obsessed with Dooley's wife after she rejected his book, and he blames Dooley for her death. When Jerry Lee can't keep up with chasing Devon during a shootout, Captain Byers teams Dooley and Jerry Lee with a younger K9 team -- aggressive female detective Welles and her dog Zeus, a young, strong Doberman Pincher. After Dooley futilely investigates a convict he once busted, the dogs get him back on track by sniffing out Devon's storage locker. The room reveals Devon's identity to Dooley, and one of Devon's manuscripts reveals that he intends to make Dooley suffer for his words. When Devon makes a bold move by invading the precinct and taking Welles hostage...
translation:
The biggest killer is that they say Zues takes DUTCH commands. But she speaks German with him. The 2 are totally different, it's like "good he takes French orders" and start speaking Spanish.

James Belushi feels more like a comedy actor, not a detective in the least. The role just does not suit him, even if it's a comedy.

Too many stereotypical / predictable things. Typical comment or comeback.

If you do not look at these things, I think it could be a nice movie if it's ever on TV. But I would not suggest renting it.

summary: Two American tourists on a romantic camping trip are brutally murdered. A few days later, during the ancient festival of Samhain, a group of American university students moves into a beautiful cottage, surrounded by a lush forest and a majestic lake They are here to learn about the rituals of the ancient Druids and other Celtic legends. But in the remains of an abandoned copper mine, lives the ancestors of an incestuous clan of cannibals. Stalked by a hulking, disfigured mutant, the students and their chaperone are in for the most harrowing time of their young lives. And keeping their heads on their necks will become their main concern...
translation: I have watched horror movies since I was 5 years old, starting with Childs Play. Since then I've seen good horror movies and bad, but that's without question the DUMBSTER movie I've ever seen! The actors did everything they could with the material. The plot was just idiotic. Plus, it was just all blood. I can endure a lot of blood, but that was just ridiculous! In one of the scenes a character is stabbed in the rump and smothered with his bowels! Just stupid! Another problem with this movie is that it is boring and probably the slowest movie ever. The end of it is just stupid. But then again, it goes with the rest of it! In the end, when the girl gets away from the cannibal / ancestor, she gets help from an old lady. The old lady makes tea, but when she turns to talk to the girl, the girl attacks her! She has turned into a cannibal! Delayed movie.

summary: Lewis an orphan wants to see what his mother looked like. So he invents a machine that looks through your brain so you can see your memories. But this weird kid says he's from the future and warns him about a guy in a bowler hat. The bowler hat guy messes with his invention and it fails. He decides that he's a failure and no one wants him. But the kid that warned him about the guy is here on a mission to find the bowler hat guy that wants to destroy Lewis. To prove he's from the future he takes Lewis to the future. But the time machine breaks and he's stuck in the future until he fixes it. In the meantime he spends quality time with the family. But the bowler hat guy is about to alter time and it's up to Lewis to save the future.
translation:
I went to see that with my wife and my 3 year old son. He seemed to like it much more than my wife and I. The writing is surprisingly bad for a Pixar / Disney excursion. In fact, I found it very difficult to even pay attention. The movie looks awesome, but the story just gets so funny and lengthy that I was hoping my son fell asleep so I could pick him up and go out.

Not to say that the movie is not. It's an interesting concept that's being told so strangely (bad script?), Especially when we "meet" the family for the first time. I know that we should get the impression that the family is crazy, but good sir, they could have shortened this sequence by a good 15 minutes (apparently I did not really timed it). At that point, I scratched my head and searched for an exit.

summary: Gabriel Noone is a late night radio-host in a big city, specializing in spooky tales culled from his active imagination. When Gabriel's lover decides he needs some "space" and moves out, Gabriel descends into a funk until a publisher friend brings him a manuscript written by 14 year-old Pete Logand, a troubled young fan. Pete's story touches the vulnerable Gabriel deeply. Pete was severely abused by his parents and is now under the care of his former social worker, Donna Logand, who has adopted him. Pete is very ill and he and Donna are keeping a low profile in a small town in Wisconsin to avoid discovery by Pete's mother. Gabriel develops an unsettling long-distance telephone relationship with the boy and his guardian. Nothing is as it seems and the skepticism of friends causes Gabriel to become suspicious of Donna and her motives, so he tries to resolve the loose ends by traveling to Wisconsin to confront Donna and Pete. But this effort is largely unsuccessful and we are left ...
translation:
You know, Robin Williams, God bless him, is constantly bumping into the stupid comedies he's done this decade (with the exception of "Death To Smoochy", which bombarded when it came out, but now is a cult classic.) ). The dramas he has done lately have been fantastic, especially "Insomnia" and "One Hour Photo". "The Night Listener" is one of his best works despite his mediocre reviews and a quick DVD release.

This is a very frightening story, though it does not include a serial killer or anyone that is physically dangerous in that regard. The concept of the film is based on an actual fraud case that has not yet been officially confirmed. In high school, I read an autobiography of a child named Anthony Godby Johnson, who suffered terrible abuse and eventually contracted AIDS. I was touched by the story until I read reports online that Johnson may not even exist. When I saw this movie, the confused feelings that Robin Williams portrayed so brilliantly reappeared in my mind.

Toni Collette probably also gives her best dramatic portrayal as the ultimately sociopathic "janitor". Her role was far removed from those she had in films like "Little Miss Sunshine". There were even times when she looked at the camera, where I thought she was staring directly at me. It takes a good actress to play this kind of role, and it is this understated (but well reviewed) role that makes Toni Collette one of the best actresses of this generation not even nominated for an Oscar (as of 2008) ). , It is unbelievable that there is at least one woman in this world that is, and it is also scary.

This is a good, dark movie that I highly recommend. Prepare to be restive, as this film leaves a strange feeling in the end.

summary: The morbid Catholic writer Gerard Reve who is bisexual, alcoholic and has frequent visions of death is invited to give a lecture in the literature club of Vlissingen. While in the railway station in Amsterdam, he feels attracted to a handsome man who embarks on another train. Gerard is introduced to the treasurer of the club and beautician Christine Halsslag, a wealthy widow who owns the Spider beauty shop, and they engage in a one night stand. On the next morning, Gerard sees the picture of Christine's boyfriend Herman and recognizes him as the man he saw in the train station. He urges her to bring Herman to her house to spend a couple of days together, but with the secret intention of seducing the man. Christine travels to K√∂ln to bring her boyfriend and Gerard stays alone in her house. He drinks whiskey and snoops through her safe, finding three film reels with names of men; he decides to watch the footage and discovers that Christine had married each; all of whom died in tragic ...
translation:
"De vierde man" (The Fourth Man, 1984) is considered one of the best European thrillers of the eighties. This last work by Dutch director Paul Verhoeven in his homeland, before moving to Hollywood to become a big star with films like Total Recall, Basic Instinct and Starship Troopers, is about a psychopathic and disillusioned author ( Jeroen Krabbe) to the sea to relax. There he meets a mysterious Femme Fatale (Ren√©e Soultendieck) and begins a deadly love affair with her. He becomes addicted to her heart and soul and finds out that her three former husbands all died under mysterious circumstances ...

"De vierde man" is heavily influenced by the old Hollywood movie Noire and the psycho thriller by Alfred Hitchcock and Orson Wells. It takes a lot of time to create a dark and enthralling atmosphere, and a few moments of extreme graphic violence have the right impact on the story. The tension is sometimes almost unbearable and sometimes reminiscent of the works of the Italian cult director Dario Argento.

The cast is also outstanding, especially Krabbe's performance as a deranged writer, who opened the doors to his international film career ("The Living Daylights", "The Refugee"). If you have the opportunity to see this brilliant psycho thriller on TV, video or on DVD, do not miss it!

summary: When her surrogate father who owns the casino she works in gets murdered, Modesty Blaise takes on those that killed him and are now at the casino to rob it. It turns out she is more than just a modest worker.
translation: The movie was a long-awaited release that was a bit disappointing because of the expectation I had. If I look at it again, I have to say that it is actually pretty OK. Above all, it is very true to the original (of course, not completely) and is made as such only for the film. Modesty's story as a child is shown and is very true to the original. Acting may not be the best, and the plot is a bit thin, but compared to the 1966 Vitti movie, it's much better just because she's not trying to be a musical. In general, I would only recommend it to fans of Modesty Blaise or someone who catches it on TV.

summary: Chimney sweeps Stanley and Oliver go about their job, reducing Professor Noodle's living room to a shambles in the process, while the mad doctor works in his laboratory perfecting his "rejuvination formula." Cackling with glee, the Professor demonstrates his success for the boys, dropping a duckling into the vat and winding up with an egg. There's a somewhat different type of regression, however, when Stanley accidentally knocks Oliver into the formula.
translation: This is by far the funniest short made by the two comic geniuses. From the moment they come in, to the time Hardy just falls off the roof, it makes me laugh hysterically. I suggest that every fan of Laurel and Hardy should see this for a moment. I also recommend all Ghost Series. If you are looking for laughter, you will see this movie and you will be happy.

summary: Focusing on the bonding between three female (an African American female, a half African American half Latino American female, and a Latino American female) high school members of Brooklyn's "Jackie Robinson Steppers Marching Band" and the choices the girls face once their school closes down because of the need for asbestos removal. This film is about a host of topics, not least of which is the hard-work involved in maintaining friendships.
translation:
This is the first American film to successfully apply the naturalistic style of Europeans, especially the French and Belgians, for at least a decade, and is not there time? After three high school girls in the Crown Heights neighborhood of Brooklyn during the final days of their summer break between freshman and sophomore sophomore, it does what all good art should do: it discovers the universal in particular. Although girls' concerns are outwardly conventional-boys, sex, popularity, money, freedom, and clothing-we see how their entire lives are shaped, the universal interface between character and destiny.

Naturalism is complete and complete. The film breathes, stays in the moment, lives in real time. The story is told. For a change, the medium and its artifacts are not the message. The film unerringly and truthfully conveys the childhood perspective of its characters; it does not impose its adult meanings or morals. Details arise from their own, are never crowded and therefore seem all the more real and powerful for their understatement. Although much effort has been made to capture the authentic social reality of Crown Heights, part of the largest black ghetto in New York City and one of the most dangerous violent places in the US, childhood is in the ghetto, not the ghetto itself br />
Documentary footage of the practice sessions of a marching band, the Jackie Robinson Steppers, punctuates the film at regular intervals with an explosion of color, movement and sound. Otherwise, the camera remains very close, very intimate, a patient, smart and unobtrusive observer. The language is rich, spontaneous, the spectacle transparent. Some scenes stand out, like the loitering girls, each revealing their deepest fantasies. Lanisha's admission of her acceptance of a death by arbitrary force is the most shocking, one of the deepest scars of the ghetto. She shares with her mother her confusion and fear of the harsh challenges of adult life and is equally moving and beautiful, unsentimentally affirmative.

Social realities are respected, not propagated: All three girls are brought up alone Mothers, only one, Lanisha, has a father active in her life (and not by chance of the three she is the most emotionally stable and empathic too) others, and the one with the greatest self esteem). Two of them suffer from asthma, a condition that is disproportionately common in the city center. Shots, an everyday event, only briefly interrupt their conversation. Only one of the girls, Joy, feels hope, feels that she has control over the future, while the other two have accepted despair to varying degrees.

This is by far the best dramatic American movie I have seen in years. See it, see it, see it.

summary: A meltdown at a nuclear power plant turns a bunch of folks into lethal shambling flesh-eating zombies who go on a gory rampage.
translation: I swear, this zombie was killed twice and kept coming back. I gave this movie an 8. Let's face it, folks, that's exactly what the other critics say, d. H. A "handy cam", a film shot. Hey, hey, hey, welcome to the Total Indy movie. The fact that Todd Sheets had over 700 zombies in this film is a tribute to his talents. Yes, the story has gaps, yes, we see the same zombies again and again, but who cares? Take it for what it is, a funny and bloody horror movie that you can share with your buds, or bring out the people that really matter to you. Mild out people, I suppose, they all liked trash like "Titanic" or "Twister". Peace and support of independent film production !!!

summary: A family that has faced hardship has their dilapidated house completely rebuilt while they are away on vacation for a week. While early episodes renovated houses, the usual approach is to tear down the house on the first day and build a brand new, usually much larger, one, fully furnished. The houses are customized to the families, with rooms reflecting the interests of, especially, the children, and special technology for any unusual medical conditions. Host Ty Pennington usually has a "secret" project which is only revealed when the family sees it. The construction is accomplished with the help of a large army of blue-shirted volunteers and a wide array of sponsor-donated products and services.
translation:
"Extreme Makeover: Home Edition" is another "feeling of well-being", the so-called "heart-warming", and out-for-ratings show that ABC had the time to sit down together.

I understand the problems these families are going through. I'm sorry for that. But would not you think that putting four widescreen plasma televisions, three flat-screen computers, a built-in pool that occupies half a backyard, and cabinets full of expensive designer clothes is one too much for any family? Sure, these families have been through a lot. Sure, they deserve better things than what they had before.

But honestly, the things Ty Pennington and his crew put into these homes are enough to fit a whole neighborhood.

Another thing that really annoys me about this show is how Ty and his crew always have something good to say about every little thing that relates to the family or the condition of the family. To tell a wheelchair user that he is "so strong" or "very brave" becomes really old after a while. That may sound rude, but believe me; Look at this show and you'll see what I mean.

All in all, this show is overrated. If you want to see it, go on. This comment is just an indication of what you would see.

summary: When Christian Turner gathers together his fianc√©e Elizabeth and their friends Adam, Benjamin, Piper and Katie to celebrate their high-school graduation, they play the cheeky card game 'taboo' which anonymously confides their secret vices to paper. The following year Christian inherits the grand estate and invites them back for New Year's Eve. This time the games are far more serious, but go way weirder then anyone planned, with several unexpected twists.
translation: The film has the longest, most agonizing and painful end of a movie I've seen in a long time. Unfortunately, it starts right after the opening credits. January Jones gives such a wood performance, I was surprised that she did not go up in flames as she approached the candles in the film. I do not really remember her from the other films she made (a blessing I have to believe in. I never criticize any actor performance because there are too many things in the film that can affect her, but in this case it's so bad that it's true she has got lines and situations that Meryl Streep would have problems with, but I swear that she sometimes reads from a cue card on the set, while sometimes I thought she might be disabled or slow Learn for REAL! The plot, the dialogue and the tempo are as bad as you'll ever see it, but there's still no excuse for this performance and not even for the director who has been pushing a small Indian / breakfast club in a rotten burrito then regurgitated by a primary school scriptwriter.Take that back has studio exec crayola everywhere.

summary: A young man finds out that his parents had been used in an atomic-weapons experiment shortly before he was born, and that the results have had some unexpected effects on him.
translation:
Tobe Hooper did great movies, so I was sure that could not be BAD. I did not read any reviews and tried to watch this unintentionally humorous movie. Sometimes that made me laugh, sometimes I almost fell asleep, sometimes it almost made me evil for Hooper.

I rated this 3/10 because its "horror" movie 1990 and many interesting or funny things happened there. Throughout the movie, I thought of something like "they just can not add more stuff in this movie ..." .. but they did.

Some say it's a kind of Firestarter clone, but it's not really. It's based on that idea, but that's all. This is a combination of horror, comedy, strange religions / deities, funny gore, simple effects, drama, terrible acting, incredible script and more.

Spoiler * Story is: Government is trying to create ultimate weapon with nuclear or something and fails while process child is born for 2 test subjects. When mother sings to her child after birth, both husband and wife burn and it is SPONTANEOUS BURN. The government buries the whole thing and lets this child live among other people and ... then this child grows up after x years and realizes that he was born for a reason and can burn things with his brain. Well then, when the government realizes "Okay, now he can work that fire thing" they bring him to a normal hospital where some nuclear toxic is what they will use on this man , BECAUSE you could kill him, no you can not shoot him no! .. and argh, I think that's enough to say, I promise there are 100 more weird things in this movie.

Well, if you want good laughs, look at them. My goodness.

summary: A small-town cat-and-dog detective duo investigate a new neighbor who they believe may have committed a murder - but the snag is, locals are attempting to pair him off with their owner.
translation: Some wonder why Mrs. Murphy did not exist after this movie. Will it be, because this movie has totally spits. Disney was not the right studio to run this movie. Maybe Touchstone (well, they belong to Disney, but it would be grown-up). The movie is too kid-ish, as the book series is not. The casting is all wrong for the characters. The characters do not act the way they do in the books. And why did Tucker become a guy? He is a girl in naughty books! Was this done to make the movie attractive to boys? My goodness. And where was Pewter, the gray cat? One of the funniest characters in the book is missing in this mess. Rita Mae Brown is a good writer, but leaving Disney behind in her work was wrong. An animated feature film, perhaps in the wings of Don Bluth's artwork, would suit a better Mrs. Murphy movie. Overall, I give this a 2 because Disney has at least made a movie from an underrated book series. But I wish they had done better. Anyway, I still have my books to talk to.

summary: Colonel Pepper brings his daughter, Peggy, to Hollywood from Georgia to be an actress. There she meets Billy who gets her work at Comet Studio doing comedies with him. But Peggy is discovered by High Art Studio and she leaves Billy and Comet to work there. For her new image, she is now Patricia Pepoire and ignores Billy when he sees her on location. When she is not longer wanted by the little people who do not understand "ART", she plans to marry Andre to get a fake title. Billy will not let her go without a fight.
translation:
I'm a big classic movie fan, but I'm getting into silent films right now. Many silent films do not interest me, but Show People is a notable exception.

Marion Davies and William Haines are just wonderful in this picture. Davies, in particular, shows a wide range when she turns from a giggling town girl to a starlet who takes herself a little too seriously.

Show People is a fast-paced movie featuring a fantastic selection of cameos from some of the biggest stars of the silent movie era. The movie immediately grabbed my attention and I really forgot it was a silent movie. (I know that does not make much sense, but that's exactly what happened.) The actors are so skilled in their craft that only a few dialogue cards are needed.

Show People is a perfect introduction to silent films. It's a fast paced, interesting movie with two of the best stars of the silent era. Add in the satire of Hollywood and Show People should be on the must-have list for all classic movie fans.

summary: Dr. Bill Cortner has been performing experimental surgery on human guinea pigs without authorization and against the advice of his father, also a surgeon. When Bill's fianc√©e Jan Compton is decapitated in an automobile accident, he manages to keep her brain alive. He now needs to find a new body for his bride-to-be and settles on Doris Powell, a glamor model with a facial disfigurement. Jan meanwhile doesn't want to continue her body-less existence and calls upon the creature hidden in the basement, one of Bill Cortner's unsuccessful experiments, to break loose.
translation:
This recalls the days of the Matin√©e, when children who nowhere else could hang out, took their appointments to the balcony after they had thrown their younger siblings under the blanket. It did not matter what was on the screen - the little kids sat there and the big kids ignored it. The adults, of course, would never see it.

But they put it on video, anyway, along with most of the other creaky, low-budget "B" horror movies of the Golden Age ... of television. The film's inherent and unintentional humor is derived from stale ideology (the "bad girls" that were harvested to replace the wretched body of poor Jan - they had come) overused action (a mad scientist trying to divine God a violent yet conscientious monster (whose presence in the former scientist's rural laboratory is never fully explained, and acting polarized on wood or over-the-top.)

This is one great party movie, provided your guests enjoy adding dialogues and commentary on otherwise vile cinema exploits, and if you or your guests prefer more passive entertainment, this movie is also available as a video in its Mystery Science Theater 3000 treatment, in the moderators and dolls of the cult TV series make the necessary additions for you.

summary: A drama revolving around characters whose lives are transformed one summer at an exclusive East Coast country club.
translation:
The only word I can think of to describe this movie is: Usually.

The storyline about Gary Sinise's character attempting suicide is a ridiculous premise and comes across as a sort of Salingeristic recluse or hermit in a hut driving golf balls into the ocean because he is not living in the ocean could handle lucrative pro / golf community? Cry Me A River. I wish these were my problems. I like Dylan Baker and Sinise, but this film was clearly a bad choice or a paycheck for Sinise. summary: The story about a very small god-forgotten village in Siberia reflects the history of Russia from the beginning of the century till early 80s. Three generations try to find the land of happiness and to give it to the people. One builds the road through taiga to the star over horizon, the second 'build communism' and the third searches for oil. The oil is found but the destruction of the old cemetry and everything the people of the village cared for followed to get the 'black treasure' of Siberia.
translation:
I was a young film student in 1979, when the Union of Soviet filmmakers came to Sofia Bulgaria and premiered Konchalovsky's "Siberiade"; Tarkosvky's "Stalker" and Danelia'a "Autumn Marathon". I was overwhelmed by the cosmopolitan dimension of the art form. Then and only then did I see "Siberiade" 4 and 1/2 hours epic and speechless. Much better than Bertolucci's "1900". By far!

Hope Andron will eventually come in the negative and someday "Director's Restored Version Full Length" make! On DVD of course! I also fought hard to defend this cinema against most of my colleagues who equated the Soviet film with a bad taste! The time is on my side.

summary: Three 40-something women in a small English town meet weekly for a ritual of gin, cigarettes, and sweets -- and swapped stories arguing which of them has the most pathetic love life. Kate is headmistress at the local school; her best friends are the town's police chief and a cynical, thrice-divorced doctor. When Kate begins a fling with a handsome younger man, less worldly than her friends but passionate and sincere, the other women can't simply be happy for the couple's unusual new romance. In jealousy they promptly take it upon themselves to break up the pair, taking drastic measures which result in unintended outcomes, some happy and some tragic.
translation:
This film is a calculated effort to exploit the success of Sex in the City and Four Weddings and a Funeral. In fact, if they called it sex at a funeral, they might have done better at the box office.

But the film falls between two chairs and can not get up. The characters make an unlikely bright dialogue, but never appear in any way as human recognizable. An arbitrary, meaningless act follows another to continue what is a conspiracy, and one soon becomes tired of the falseness of the whole enterprise.

Andie MacDowell gets points for playing her little heart, but the performing honors are stolen by Imelda Staunton from a police detective (they have no height over there?). Mrs. Staunton seems unable to make a wrong move. Could we have said the same thing about the author and the director? If Notting Hill has upset you, stay away from it. Phonus bolognus on the half-shell.

summary: George is a high-strung professional photographer who is starting to unravel from the stress of his work with a Manhattan advertising agency. Needing some time away from the city, Jake, his wife Kim, and their son Miles head to upstate New York to take in the winter sights, though the drive up is hardly relaxing for any of them. George accidentally hits and severely injures a deer that ran onto the icy road; after George stops to inspect the damage, he's confronted by an angry local named Otis who flies into a rage, telling George that he and his fellow hunters had been tracking the deer for some time. An argument breaks out, which leaves George feeling deeply shaken. When George and Kim arrive at their cabin, they discover that it's next door to Otis' property, and they soon find that a dark and intimidating presence seems to have taken over the cottage. Since, when they stopped at a store en route to the cabin, a shopkeeper told Miles about the legend of the Wendigo, a beast from ...
translation:
I was disappointed. The film was a bit predictable and did not meet the hype that was plastered everywhere on the packaging. After that said, the characters were well developed, the Windegymythos was used in a unique premise, and the house was pretty scary, but it just missed me. I was waiting for this big AHHHHH or BOO! But it never came.

Also, the movie was plagued with bad movies of bad special effects. So showing too much of a bad thing and not using atmosphere and viewer perception to create the horror and suspense. Try movies like Session 9 or the Cube if you are looking for a cheap but well thought-out horror movie.

summary: The adventures of a gang of British workmen abroad. Combines black and white humour with moments of drama, poignancy and drunkenness. In series 1, the lads head to Germany seeking work, and are thrown together by virtue of shared nationality and a run-down wooden hut. The story follows the lads' relationships with women, Germans and each other, and their attempts at passing the time away from home, saving money and ordering food in a German curry house. The series ends with new employment legislation forcing some of the Brits having to choose between the UK and their new-found pleasures abroad. Two years later the gang are reunited for a second series, in which they travel to Wolverhampton to rebuild both the "magnificent seven" and Barry's home for his impending marriage. A further offer of work sees the lads head to a Derbyshire stately home in need of refurbishment. Here they fall foul of an irritable pub landlord, suspicious locals, a less than enlightened employer and the Inland ...
translation:
Geordies ... salt of the earth characters ... bricklayer ... beer ... geordies ... happy go happy ... work adventure abroad ... salt the earth sign ... warm wonderful people ... Tyne Bridge (tears in the eye) ... brown ale ... salt of the earth sign ... cute little indian kids in newcastle united tops ... crowbar ... geordies ... salt of the earth sign. .. etc.
etc etc ....

Please. Thats so bad. And you better know Timothy Spall. They can not have paid you so much.

As for Jimmy Nail. Well, the friendliest thing you can say is that he is as good an actor as a singer and author. Come on Jimmy, the joke is over. "Crocodile Shoes" and "Donor" were very funny, unfortunately I do not think they should be. Goodbye Pet is the opposite.

summary: A chance encounter between a travelling salesman and a lonely hitman triggers a strangely profound relationship which provokes each to act in ways neither would have imagined possible. Fate steps in to form a friendship between two men from irreconcilable worlds that will alter the lives of both forever.

Not to mention Pierce Brosnons best performance. Of course, Greg Kinnear is always great. Really, when is he really bad? I think this movie is incredibly underrated! The use of colors in this film is something completely different in today's film world, where every other movie has the Payback Blue Filter. I also like the way they used the song from Asia. I did my first feature when it came out. Since my movie was a hit-man movie, I had to try everything in the genre that was released. summary: Anthony John is an actor whose life is strongly influenced by the characters he plays. When he's playing comedy, he's the most enjoyable person in the world, but when he's playing drama, it's terrible to be around him. That's the reason why his wife Brita divorced him; although she still loves him and works with him, she couldn't stand living with him anymore. So when Anthony accepts to play Othello, he devotes himself entirely to the part, but it soon overwhelms him and with each day his mind gets filled more and more with Othello's murderous jealousy.
translation:
Ronald Colman plays a famous Broadway actor who has lost his wit and identity. After years of playing a wide range of parts, he can not remember who he is - who are his roles and who is the self. And, more seriously, he starts to see and hear his play even in regular daily life. Since he is playing in "Othello" he starts to act jealous and suspicious - just like the title character. Ultimately, it takes him to the depths of madness and murder.

I saw this movie years ago and I liked it. I just saw it again and loved it. Well, maybe my enthusiasm is because I've always loved Ronald Colman and that's a big triumph for him - and for which he won the Oscar for Best Actor. And given the competition this year (Gregory Peck for GENTLEMANS AGREEMENT, John Garfield for BODY AND SOUL, William Powell for LIFE WITH FATHER, and Michael Redgrave for MOURNING BECOMES ELECTRA), Colman was a very good choice of his usual comfort zone and played a much more sophisticated role ,

Now I noticed that a reviewer hated this movie because they hated Shakespeare - and that took about half of their review to talk about their dislike of him. But this movie is not really about Shakespeare, and it does not matter if you do not like Shakespeare. I'm not a big fan of Shakespeare, but I'm amazed at the small parts of the play that Colman has reenacted - though, as I said, this is not a Shakespeare movie. Instead, it's a wonderful portrait of an actor losing his mind and mixing his stage role with reality. It could have been EVERY game, though "Othello" was an excellent choice for the murder scene - which is later played out in the movie.

Overall a very clever movie because of a nice script - with some undertones of Film Noir. Fortunately, the show was also terrific as Colman had excellent support from Signe Hasso, Shelly Winters and Edmond O'Brien (which was especially good - he played his part just right). And given the great director George Cukor, it's no wonder that it's a wonderful movie from start to finish.

summary: Bruce Nolan, a television reporter in Buffalo, N.Y., is discontented with almost everything in life despite his popularity and the love of his girlfriend Grace . At the end of the worst day of his life, Bruce angrily ridicules and rages against God and God responds. God appears in human form and, endowing Bruce with divine powers, challenges Bruce to take on the big job to see if he can do it any better.
translation:
I was looking forward to seeing this movie because it seemed promising from the upcoming attractions: Jim Carrey with Godlike powers was an idea that definitely worked for me. As a big fan, I was sure that he would be in his element with such a promising premise and what could go wrong? Yesterday my bladder, boys and girls burst because I saw the movie.

The first act (where it is established that he hates his life, he is an angry employee and an extremely unfortunate camper with an ax to scold against God) is useful, the second act ( where he is called by God over the phone and receives Powers Almighty) is GREAT - Carrey is having fun with his new "Toys" and it's a pleasure to see, really funny. After the dinner scene between Bruce and his girlfriend Grace (Jennifer Aniston who BORDER performing well in this film, considering that her part plays a role, decay begins) plot device even her NAME stinks of unreliability) - she thinks he'll raise the question, but instead he tells her (still on his knees) that he finally gets his job as a news anchor, and is not it so exciting?

She does not think so. You want him to marry, see to, so she takes off and leaves him a look, although they are still very LOVES him a look, and the rest of the film is spent us with a pitiful, scary head over To hit his head. After the next there was a spiritual-sounding cliche, until at the end I also prayed. , .for it to be over.

I did not like the lack of subtlety in the first two acts (an example - in the second act, after he gets his powers, Bruce dances into the room and sings, "What if God were one of those us, just a slab like one of us, "blah blah blah), and I was even willing to overlook the amazing amount of contradictions that are thrown at us (Moran Freeman - a / k / a GOD - tells Bruce that he it can not violate anyone's free will, but he does so very often these decisions were forgivable -. that's a Jim Carrey comedy, directed by Tom Shadyac - it's not the remains of the Day

summary: A U.S. Army sergeant is home on leave to reconnect with his girlfriend he hopes to marry. However, in the years he's been away, she's gotten a huge promotion where they used to work together - and has become engaged to another man.
translation:
My observations: Post-war desire. Tom Drake and Grandpa of Meet Me in St. Louis two years later (the year I was born). Donna Reed charming and pretty. Margaret Hamilton as good as ever; smaller part than in "Wizard of Oz". Spring Byington is much prettier, even with the presumptuous pouty little nose missing from Hamilton. Tent scene at the end with former boy next door was hilarious. As a two-year veteran of army tents, he looked pretty young and inexperienced when I looked him in the eye.

I worked in a department store and it was just as elegant as this one. Unfortunately, it has disappeared and been forgotten. We were famous for these great showcases used to lure passers-by into the store to get them to buy all those wonderful goods.

10/10

summary: A rural Colombian village is attacked by a horrible sea serpent, aroused by industrial pollution of a nearby lake. Based on a real event that took place in June of 1971.
translation: Hard guys, sexy women, lots of swearing and a little convincing monster rising from the depths of a polluted lake. You'd think "Monster" would be fun ... but it's not really. However, there are stars like Tony Eisley and John Carradine, and in my book it is worth seeing at least once. In an interview with "Fangoria" in 1987, Eisley recalled that Herbert Strock had directed most of the film, but somehow Kenneth Hartford - who only staged the material with his children Andrea and Glenn - invented full credit. Given how awful the end result was, Strock was probably glad he had not been credited! "Monster" has the look and character of a mid-70s TV movie, so I keep it in the background again and again. As a conversation, it falls flat on his face, but as a reminder of another age and a vanished nature of filmmaking it is very effective. The only thing missing is a chase.

summary: Dr. Mark Sloan is a doctor at Community General Hospital, and he is a consultant for the police department. His son Steve Sloan is a detective for the department. He and his father, along with emergency room resident Dr. Jesse Travis and Dr. Amanda Bentley, who is the pathologist at the hospital help to solve some very strange murder cases in Diagnosis Murder.
translation: Just a stilted rip-off of the infinitely better "Murder, She Wrote", it's absolutely amazing that this badly written garb lasted for eight years. I'm sure most of the people who saw this fun crap were in their sixties and seventies and just went in because they had nothing better to do or just remember their star from the old Dick Van Dyke Show. Van Dyke, who had only a decent career in the 1960s, was never an actor (according to himself) and was already far too old to play a doctor in 1993. He looks absolutely ancient A result of years of chain smoking and heavy drinking. His talentless son Barry, a wood actor who was rarely in something that did not involve his father, plays his son in the series.

summary: The seven American lawyers hired by Australian media magnate Jack Doulan, whose company rivals Albert Teal's Digicron for preponderance on the world market of telecommunications, are suddenly struck during a video conference in Seattle by an incredibly fast-working virus which wipes out everyone on their floor. Dr. Nick Baldwin, a brilliant virologist who works as an 'insubordinate' ambulance technician after being fired for failing to observe procedure, is first on the site and points out to US Army disease specialist Dr. Samantha Carter, who told him there were deaths in several other cases but never a trace of the virus, his ambulance has taken a survivor to his hospital; her therapeutic incompetence gets the patient killed, him assigned as temporary consultant to her army research unit- even there computer model operator Darren is killed by the virus, which also strikes at other sites in and around Seattle, notably at places where Digicron's 500 TV channels setup box is being ...
translation:
Robert Wagner is the evil boss of Digicron, a telecommunications company with a virus that kills people.

So you're saying that the software virus has become a real virus that can kill people - it can be medically possible but not possible from my system "

I need to write new virus software to catch it - it may take some time "

But it's not software, it's killing people

Pay attention the moment of "I am in Virology" and perhaps the first movie action that shows the death through the Braille keyboard

summary: Internationally famous thief, Arsene Lupin the Third, receives half of the large diamond known as Twilight from old crimeboss Doruune. Doruune tells him that if he finds the other half of the diamond in Morocco, they will lead him to treasure. Lupin and his gang (Daisuke Jigen, Goemon Ishikawa, and Fujiko Mine) head to Morocco, but get caught up in the middle of a conflict between the government and Gelt rebels. Both sides want Lupin, but no one wants him more than his 'old friend' Interpol Inspector Kouichi Zenigata, who has pursued him to Morocco...
translation:
Lupine sets off for Morocco in search of a legendary treasure. His only clue is an interesting gem given to him by an old man. It's a nice place for Lupine, with the desert and that hot exotic feeling.

An interesting thing about this movie is that Jigen plays a much smaller role than usual and is generally in a different location than Lupine. On the one hand, their classical dynamics are missing together, but it is a change of pace. That way, Lupine can focus on the ladies ...

Fujiko rules in this. Throughout the game, she seduces Lupine and us viewers. Then there's Lara, the virgin of this special story, and she's very personable. This one has more nudity than any other Lupine anime, which is a funny difference.

There is a very entertaining, effeminate ninja type who is the best villain in this, and of course he has some great fights with Goemon as well as some fun scenes with Fujiko. Inspector Zenigata is also on a warpath, of course.

Pretty much, that's a smooth ride with Lupine. The plot is average and there are some slow spots, but all in all, this movie is a real treat. Enjoy.

summary: "Mango Kiss" is a story about Lou whose world turns upside-down when she falls in love with her best friend Sassafras. They journey to San Francisco and stumble into the wild world of role-playing and non-monogamous S/M dykes. Comedy ensues as these wholesome girls get in over their heads.
translation:
OK, my girlfriend and I rented the DVD and about 30 minutes after the movie we had exchanged a lot of "ehhh what this movie is about and, more importantly, I'm interested in finding out what it ends with" and decided either needed we use drugs to engage in the "act", or we simply ended the pain there and then and looked at something else. We opted for the latter.

I liked "But I'm a cheerleader" a lot, but Mango Kiss is too stupid and surreal for my liking, sorry! I definitely prefer "D.E.B.S", "Better than Chocolate", "Fucking √Öm√•l", "Goldfish Memory" and "Fire".

-Sorcia

summary: The Maysles brothers pay visits to Edith Bouvier Beale, nearing 80, and her daughter Edie. Reclusive, the pair live with cats and raccoons in Grey Gardens, a crumbling mansion in East Hampton. Edith is dry and quick-witted - a singer, married but later separated, a member of high society. Edie is voluble, dresses - as she puts it - for combat in tight ensembles that include scarves wrapped around her head. There are hints that Edie came home 24 years before to be cared for rather than to care for her mother. The women address the camera, talking over each other, moving from the present to events years before. They're odd, with flinty affection for each other.
translation:
One question that must be asked immediately is: Would this movie have been made if the women were not the aunt and cousin of Jacqueline Lee Bouvier Kennedy Onassis?

The answer is: Probably not />
But luckily they are (or were) the cousin and aunt of Jackie.

This documentary film by the Maysles Brothers about the existence (you could hardly call it a life) by Edith B. Beale, Jr., and her daughter Edith Bouvier Beale (Edie) has the same allure of a train accident - You do not want to look, but you have to.

Big Edith and Little Edie live in a once magnificent villa in East Hampton, New York, which slowly decays around them. The once beautiful gardens are now a jungle.

Magnificent oil paintings lean against the wall (with cat feces on the floor behind them) and beautiful portraits of them as young women vying for room on the walls next to covers of old magazines.

Living alone for many years has cut many barriers between the two women but has built others.

Clothes seem to be optional. Edie's favorite costume is a pair of shorts with tights pulled over them and a few pieces of cloth wrapped around her torso and head.

As Edith says, "Edie is still beautiful at the age of 56 years." And she is too. There are times when it almost shines and both women show the beauty that was once there.

There is a constant undercurrent of sexual tension.

Your eating habits are (to be polite) strange. Ice cream distributed on crackers. A dinner party for Edith's Wonder Bread Sandwiches birthday, served on fine china with plastic dishes.

Time is irrelevant in their world; as Edie says, "I have no clocks."

Your relationships with men are so strange.

Edie feels that Edith has thwarted any of her attempts. She says, "If you do not get a man to make you an application, you might as well be dead." Edith replies, "I'll take a dog every day." It is obvious that Edith does not see her role in Edie's lack of male camaraderie. At the beginning of the film, she says, "France has fallen, but Edie is not.

Sometimes it's difficult to hear exactly what's said, both women talk at the same time and keep contradicting each other." There is a strange relationship with animals during the movie, Edie feeds the raccoons in the loft with Wonder Bread and cat food. The cats (and there are many of them) are everywhere.

At one point, Edie explains, "The mark of the aristocracy is responsibility." But they do not seem to be able to take responsibility for themselves.

This is a difficult movie to see, but worth the effort.

summary: A vicious serial-killer is on the loose in San Francisco and the police trace a link to a small town further down the coast. When Harry Callahan upsets the press and the mayor in his usual style, he's shipped out of town to investigate while the heat is on. With the help of his new Magnum handgun Harry goes on the trail leaving behind the usual trail of dead criminals along the way.
translation:
Despite the other comments listed here, this is probably the best Dirty Harry movie; A film that, better or worse, reflects the country's socio-political sentiment during the Reagan glories of the early '80s. It's also a kick-ass action movie.

Opening with a liberal, female judge who overturned a murder case for lack of tangible evidence and then went straight into the coffee shop encounter with some unfortunate crooks (the scene calling for "Sudden Impact" is the famous one) The first time you catch your breath is when the troublesome Inspector Callahan is sent to a nearby city to investigate the background of a murdered hood, and it only gets better with an exaggerated group of grotesque thugs Callahan has to deal with a sheriff with a mysterious past along with great directing and photography and a sometimes hilarious script make this movie one of the best of the 80s.

summary: The story of how a boy was abandoned by his mother and how he, later, abandoned her. The year he'll be 14, the parents of Augusten Burroughs (1965- ) divorce, and his mother, who thinks of herself as a fine poet on the verge of fame, delivers him to the eccentric household of her psychiatrist, Dr. Finch. During that year, Augusten avoids school, keeps a journal, and practices cosmetology. His mother's mental illness worsens, he takes an older lover, he finds friendship with Finch's younger daughter, and he's the occasional recipient of gifts from an unlikely benefactor. Can he survive to come of age?
translation:
To create a cinematic audience - I am certainly amazed at the many positive comments this wretched film has collected here. I can not approve, I can not help but be suspicious when it comes to rewarding back alleys for critics who praise Annette Bening for an Oscar; the hole in the kitchen ceiling could more fittingly be attributed to their chewing landscape. She is a wonderful actress, but this is an unfortunately unbalanced notion that requires filmmakers of essential quality to be able to capture the rhythm of the script and maintain it for the duration of the disconnected madness that is a movie shoot.

I do not really want to blame Miss Bening or most of the other performers (well, Gwyneth Paltrow has no excuse for her spongy work), because this is a horrendous adaptation, a classic case of mistranslation (me I'm prepared for that) suppose I did not read the book and I do not think I'll do that afterwards). The script puts us in the midst / clutter of inexplicable behavior and extreme emotional fear emanating from mystifying characters who have not developed with us or with other relationships. It quickly becomes a grotesquely exaggerated tsunami-like robbery that baffles characters and audiences alike, leaving me like a survivor shaking his head at the end of each repetitive episode. Shock and awe would describe my response to hectic, bipolar mood swings between the murmuring and the oh-so-subtle sensibilities telegraphed by one of the most irritating, manipulative, booming soundtracks I've heard - all this is not put on ridiculously inappropriate toons - Time witness, you know, but chosen with an astonishing disregard for the tone of the scenes.

How this good cast mingled with it, I'm not mistaken you know - I can not believe they saw the script before signing. They use their skills with devotion - I was so sorry for the wonderful Jill Clayburgh, who was saddled with a cartoon bag lady costume and a wig that tried in vain to rip out something meaningful from fleeting and clich√©d dialogues. In contrast, Alec Baldwin somehow rises above the material to deliver consistent, nuanced, real performance. Can someone please give this man a major role of substance? And what about Rachel Evan Wood - or Joseph Fiennes? One might think that industry could do with it better and without being as hair-raising as Elliot Gould in M.A.S.H.

My voice? A standing turd, all right, but no connection to the sky.

summary: Luke Skywalker battles horrible Jabba the Hut and cruel Darth Vader to save his comrades in the Rebel Alliance and triumph over the Galactic Empire. Han Solo and Princess Leia reaffirm their love and team with Chewbacca, Lando Calrissian, the Ewoks and the androids C-3PO and R2-D2 to aid in the disruption of the Dark Side and the defeat of the evil emperor.
translation:
After '' Empire strikes '' '' Return of the Jedi '' is my second favorite movie from the Star Wars series.

Luke went to Tattoine to rescue Han Solo from Jabba. At the same time, the Galactic Empire is secretly building a new space station like the previous Death Star. If this station remains fully constructed, this is the end of the Rebel Alliance. Both Vader and the Emperor are impatient with the delay of the new Death Star, and they have to kill many of their commanders to make the project work.

R2 and C3po are in Jabba's palace to send a message from Luke to Jabba, where Luke pretends to negotiate Hans's life. He gives R2 and C3po as a gift to Jabba as part of his plan. Jabba does not accept the negotiations because he uses Han Solo as part of the decoration of his palace (Han is still frozen in carbonite). Lando is hid as Jabba's guardian and Chewbacca is also given by a reward hunter to Jabba. When the same Hunter tries to save Han solo and make sure he stays in human form again, we see that Princess Leia is in disguise. The problem is that Jabba discovers Leia's plan and takes her as his slave, while Han is thrown away in Chewbacca's cell.

Luke comes as a Jedi Knight to rescue his friends. On his first attempt to kill Jabba, he falls into Jabba's monster cell (Bantha), but kills her easily. Jabba remains angry and decides to throw Han, Chewbacca and Luke at Sarlacc, a large creature from the desert that remains for 1,000 years and digests it. Luke, Han and Chewie succeed again, and even Boba Fett dies when Han accidentally throws him into Sarlacc's mouth. Leia kills Jabba and goes after Han, Luke and Chewie, as well as c3po and R2.

All are safe again, Luke decides to go to Dagoba to complete his Jedi education and promise to Yoda. The problem is that Yoda is too old and sick since he's 900 years old, and before he dies, Yoda tells Luke that he does not need more training, but to really be a Jedi, he has to go back to Vader fight. He confirms to Luke that Vader is Luke's dad and that there is another Skywalker besides Luke. In his last moments, Yoda asks Luke to remember his advice about the temptation of the dark side and to pass on his Jedi knowledge to Luke. When Yoda dies, Obi Wan's ghost shows up to Luke and tells him that Luke's father killed his good side Anakin to become Darth Vader, and also that he is more machine than a man since becoming a Sith. Luke remains concerned about killing his own father and says that he feels that his father still has kindness. Obi Wan tells Luke that his twin sister is Leia and tells her why Luke and Leia have been separated since babies. He gives Lukas his last advice and says if he refuses to kill Vader, the Emperor will win the war.

At the same time, the Emperor tells Vader that he has to give him Luke, if he does, as Luke is stronger than before, and both must combine their efforts to turn Luke to the dark side bring.

Now we'll have one of the best battles in the Star Wars series As the Rebel Alliance plans to attack the new space station, the "Death Star 2", Luke will confront Vader and the Emperor, and Leia, Han and Chewie have to turn off the force field "Death Star 2" with the help of EWOKS. (little creatures that see little bears)

This is certainly one of the most exciting Star Wars of all!

summary: When the daughter Emma of the technical writer Allen Pyke and the photographer Julie is found slashed in the throat and wrists in their locked apartment, the couple decides to move to an isolated cabin in the mountains in Kingspike. Julie is very depressed and blames Allen for the death of Emma. Once in the new home, Julie sees the spirit of Emma in a photo she took in a nearby abandoned prison and she becomes obsessed shooting pictures of poltergeists. Allen is advised to move from the place by the local Jim Payne, and on May 21st, Allen finds that the former dwellers of the cabin have committed suicide, and he investigates the death in the spot and finds that many people died around May 22nd. He decides to move with Julie to a hotel, but she does not want to give up on Emma.
translation: Although I played the role of Sheriff Hodges in this film, I still managed to jump in several places and to believe that I was not that easy. You could say I'm biased on the movie, and OK, I'm, but I did not see the finished product until December 27, 2006, and was very pleased. I'm not a horror movie fan as such, but love the old "B" movies and black and white sci-fi movies. This movie will make you "think" when something happens, then it does not, then it does. It will totally unbalance you. I would suggest watching the movie first and then the director's notes and peculiarities. It's so well written, directed and filmed and I can tell you personally that working with this cast and crew was a real pleasure. I sincerely hope to be part of Brian and Laurence's future projects.

summary: Alex, a sad-eyed mournful man, goes into psychotherapy: he discloses he's a hit man. He also tells the doctor, after a few sessions, that he's attracted to a young woman he's met in the waiting room. She's Sarah, 23, quick, edgy, and perhaps attracted to him as well. But he's married, the dutiful father of a young precocious boy, so Sarah brushes him off. In flashbacks we see him get his start as a killer, at his father's prompting: it's the family business. Dad gives Alex his next assignment: to kill the therapist. Alex keeps returning to Sarah, calling her, stopping by her apartment, as he decides what to do about the hit, his father, his marriage, and his malaise.
translation:
I really liked this movie. One of those rare movies that Hollywood really does not do anymore. William H Macy is just great as the killer with a soul, and Neve Campbell is just fantastic, as the woman who sets his life on the trail of salvation.

If you have a chance, watch this movie. It deserves praise

summary: The story of airmen training in rural Manitoba in the summer of 1942 to go overseas and become bomber pilots in World War II, as well as the romantic entanglements which overcome them while they contemplate life and love in a world at war.
translation:
I got stuck in a hotel in Kuwait and happily switched to the channel that showed it at the beginning. First, Pachelbel's canon brought a lump to my throat, and the sight of a tiger moth (which my grandfather, my father, and I all had flown) produced a slight moisture around his eyes, and Crowe's name hooked me completely. I was fascinated by this movie, Crowes Performance (again), the subject (and yes, what debt we owe), how different things were addressed and edited, the flight sequences (my father also flew Avro Ansons), the story - and, As another contributor has pointed out, Crowe's recitation of High Flight. I will not spoil the movie for anyone, but, separated from my wife of 4000 miles, as an ex-army officer employed in a few wars and as a private pilot, I admit to crying a few times heartily. Buy it, rent it, download it, beg, borrow or steal it - but watch it.

PS Have I seen a Bristol Blenheim (in yellow training colors) on the floor? Looked like a twin-engined plane with a twin Browning in a dorsal tower.

summary: In 2210, mankind has explored the space and found a vampiric menace, declaring war against different breeds of vampires some of them inclusive human flesh cannibals. The V-SAN (aka Vampire Sanitation) spaceship leaded by Captain Churchill receives a distress call from an Earth base and his team formed by the vampire Quintana, the rookie officer Damian and the rebels Rosa and Roman seek survivors and vampires and they rescue the scientist Fiona, but Capt. Churchill is captured by the vampires. After their next assignment, the provisional captain Damian and his group disclose that a traitor has disengaged the defense system of the bases and they chase their prime suspect.
translation:
Whoo-boy, that was definitely one of the worst movies I've seen all summer. Granted, it was on Sci Fi, and I do not watch much Sci Fi, but man, talk about a razor-sharp plot and two-dimensional characters to the max.

The characters were stereotyped and exaggerated, the plot and setting were incredible, the vampires were less intimidating, more funny-looking, the blood was unnecessary, the special effects were terrible - and the end? Well, the only thing that was unpredictable in the end is when the tomboy suddenly becomes lesbian and does it with the female vampire, which by the way is not really hot, considering that it takes about three seconds for you to get closer to "what the hell?" then "man, that's hot." If this ever happens in repetitions, God forbid, do not watch it.

summary: Alice's father left when she was a child. She continued to share her life with him in letters that she sent not realising that he never received them. Eventually, they all come back with "Dead Letter Office" stamped on the front. As an adult, she becomes consumed with a desire to find him and takes a job with the Dead Letter Office, convinced that she can use them to fulfill her romantic notions of a reunion with her father. What awaits her at the DLO is far more than that ...
translation: This movie is a wonderfully easy work. To enjoy pleasantly from start to finish is both sad and uplifting at the same time. The performances of Miranda Otto (oh how she deserves so much more recognition!) And George del Hoya are beautiful and yet almost painful to watch as the two tortured souls understand each other. The supportive staffing of Dead Letter Office workers are wonderful little bits in themselves, as well as Alice's boring friend, whom I could not help but felt a little sorry for. There is a certain scene that I can see time and time again (and I have!). It is such a pity that films like these do not get any recognition and therefore bring them further to the public so that more people can enjoy them. I cried, I laughed and I sighed. I would recommend this movie to anyone.

summary: Meg and Charles Wallace are aided by Calvin and three interesting women, Mrs. Which, Mrs. Whatsit, and Mrs. Who in the search for their father who disappeared during an experiment he was working on for the government. Their travels take them around the universe to a place unlike any other. They must learn to trust each other and to understand that everyone is different.
translation:
I read the whole book "A Fold in Time" and then saw the movie. The movie contained all the elements of the book, but since the book was 190 pages long and the movie was 2 hours long, it really felt crammed with too many effects and bad drama.

A wrinkle in time is about one The girls Meg, Charles Wallace and Calvin have to get together to find Meg's father and disappear from the island of Camazotz.

The beginning of the movie is really a stinker. The acting is terrible, the direction is ridiculous, and so far the situations are not necessary. I was really crushed to see the same person Madeleine Engle who wrote the book and made the film, made a great book and a horrible movie. Acting is worse than any direct-to-video action. Yes, I have to admit that there were cool effects. But seriously, they were all terrible and not serial in any way possible. When you read the book, you are overwhelmed by the movie. I wish I could give him a 0, but unfortunately I can only give it a 1. One half could have been useful.

summary: In this live-action TV series, the Turtles are older than in the movies or cartoon, and are joined by a fifth, female Turtle. "Venus De Milo" mutated with the other 4 Turtles but was washed away with the current in the sewer into New York's Chinatown before Splinter came across the turtles. After learning the Shinobi arts in China for 17 years, Venus has returned to New York. The Turtles are now faced with new villains such as Dragon Lord, Bonesteel and Vam Mi.
translation:
Sometime in 1998, Saban had acquired the rights to produce a brand new Ninja Turtles action series. Of course, since I was a fan of the TMNT at the time, it obviously caught my interest. When I started watching the show ... to say that I was disappointed with the end result is an understatement. Some time later (more like recently), I had a chance to revisit the series.

First, let's talk about some of the positive things. They managed to render the Turtles' Cave, as it was last seen in the movies, relatively well, given the limited budget they provided. There is a tendency for this gloomy atmosphere regarding the sets and so on. And the turtle suits, though not the biggest piece of puppetry and whatever, were functional and seemed pretty sturdy for most of the action stuff that would follow in the series.

People tend to complain about getting rid of Shredder quickly and replacing him with those original villains that could easily be used in a Power Rangers show. But you can only beat Shredder until it gets boring and undermines its value as a villain ... and besides, most fans do not know, or do not remember or just ignore the fact that they're in the original comic Shredder was in the very first issue! Forget the countless resurrections that would follow. From a personal point of view, I was somehow glad that they got rid of Shredder, because then the anticipation grew to the point where they would eventually bring him back in a later episode. I think Shredder works best in small quantities, because then his encounters with the Turtles are all the more memorable.

Unfortunately, they replace him with those original villains who, as I said, seemed more suited to a Power Rangers show than a Ninja Turtles show. And with these new magically swinging generics comes a new female, magically swinging turtle, the infamous Venus De Milo. I will be honest; I never made friends with her. I am not against the idea of ‚Äã‚Äãa female turtle; I'm only against the idea of ‚Äã‚Äãsomeone who uses magic, and thus stands out as a wild sight in a clan of ninja turtles who seem to be a little out of their domain. I almost have the impression that this could have been the Venus De Milo show dealing with their supposed enemies, and the TMNT are just there to deliver the star power (or whatever, given the time frame left over) remained). Fortunately, they all share the limelight.

Next Mutation was aired after a season, and the creators were more than happy to ignore it. Given the time and maybe another season, I really believe that this live iteration of the TMNT could have been something and maybe got a shot at size. But while the idea was solid, the execution was flawed (though there are some good episodes in this series). As it stands, Next Mutation is one of those curiosities in Turtledom that is best buried and forgotten.

summary: Returning to England from a bombing run in May 1945, flyer Peter Carter's plane is damaged and his parachute ripped to shreds. He has his crew bail out safely, but figures it is curtains for himself. He gets on the radio, and talks to June, a young American woman working for the USAAF, and they are quite moved by each other's voices. Then he jumps, preferring this to burning up with his plane. He wakes up in the surf. It was his time to die, but there was a mixup in heaven. They couldn't find him in all that fog. By the time his "Conductor" catches up with him 20 hours later, Peter and June have met and fallen in love. This changes everything, and since it happened through no fault of his own, Peter figures that heaven owes him a second chance. Heaven agrees to a trial to decide his fate.
translation:
If anyone ever asks if cinema is an art form, you can do worse than pointing to this movie.

It's simply the perfect combination of story, screenplay, actors and cinematography ever committed to celluloid.

The story of a killed bomber pilot who is missing during the Second World War from his heavenly conductor in the English Nebula, and his subsequent clashes with the celestial authorities (or is it in his mind) is played with a hint of David Niven and Kim Hunter and is incredibly touching - especially in the opening scenes, when the doomed pilot (Niven) describes his plight against the floor radio operator (Hunter).

The sense of otherworldlyness is enhanced by Jack Cardiff's photography and incredible production designs.

The heavenly accents extend to the sky shots in black and white and earthbound scenes presented in Technicolor - this is even mentioned by the heavenly conductor (a fantastic Marius G√∂ring).

Not just a highlight in British cinema, but a highlight in the cinema, period.

summary: Max Seed, a mass murderer, is scheduled for execution at the hands of Warden Wright. Before the executioner throws the switch, Wright steps in front of Seed, "Do you have any last words?" Seed, " I'll see you again." After three attempts to electrocute, complete with boiling blood that steeps from his eyes, he's still alive. The executioner, Wright & the doctor collectively agree, that the breathing Seed be pronounced dead. He is bound and buried alive. After biting & clawing his way to the surface, Seed, the blood soaked, enraged madman, is now bent on vengeance. The reign of violence that follows will redefine the boundaries of extreme gore, physical & mental torture explored through cinema.
