translation:
The name Uwe Boll is automatically linked to bad horror / cult cinema and every new movie he publishes? what's about two, three a year ?? Receives always negative reviews and harsh criticism. You're almost tempted to think that this is just a contemporary hype. You know, it's popular to hate Uwe Boll, whether you like his movies or not. Let me assure you that this is NOT the case. Uwe Boll is a terrible writer / director and frankly a threat to the entire film industry. "Seed" is another unfortunate proof of that. Here, Boll is so desperate to be controversial and shocking that he overlooks many other elements a movie actually needs: plot, narrative structure, character development, build-up of tension? "Seed" is an ugly movie full of superfluous dirt and incompetent footage. I once read that "Seed" is Uwe Boll's interpretation of Torture's pornography horror trend today, but that's not nearly close. The film undeniably lends some of the influences of "Saw" and "Hostel," but basically it's just another x-pure dull slasher with an indestructible killer and video-playing power.

The first 45 minutes of "Seed" are boring and just confirm all the obvious things that you already knew would happen. Boll was stupid enough to start his film with a (lightning fast) scroll text declaring that US law requires that death row candidates be released if three attempts to kill them fail. So you know that's going to happen later, but still the first three quarters are wasted catching a serial killer and putting him on the electric chair. Seed is a dumb serial killer who reportedly killed 666 victims (over the top?) Carrying a bag over his head. He's watching real animal cruelty shootings (and WE are watching real animal cruelties, thanks for that, Mr. Boll) and filming people who are slowly decomposing in their basement (including a screaming baby who is really sick and twisted). When he is finally captured while the most amateurish and implausible police hijab ever filmed and goes to death row, the movie is even more retarded. After he was buried alive because the electric chair could not fry him, Max Seed crawls back to the surface and makes a brand new rampage; This time mainly focuses on the people who arrested him and executed him.

The pointless plot twists and the complete lack of story depth in this film go way over, just bad; They are downright annoying and insult the intelligence level of an average horror movie fanatic. Multiple twists and subplots in "Seed" are simply not acceptable as they are just too stupid! Nobody believes that police and prison staff let a mass murderer live without first shooting bullets through his head. No one will accept that a refugee can not be found for another six months, even though he will return directly to the same hiding place where they first caught him! "Seed" is full of smaller things like this and the movie gets dumber with every passing minute. Personally, I refuse to accept that the Cast & Crew member did not notice. It makes you really believe that Uwe Boll simply ignores all advice and criticism and only stubbornly turns his films as he wants. I imagine him telling his actors, "Shut up and do what's said to you," when they realize that the scene they're making does not make sense.

Just for the fun of pissing off people, there's a gigantic overlong sequence in which Max Seed kills an elderly lady with a hammer while she's shackled to a chair in the middle of her living room. Rather than shock as Boll intended, this episode masterfully embodies how pathetic and controversial the entire movie really is. "Seed" is awful, it's disgusting, it's unfortunate, is it ?? Boll.

summary: Television talk show dedicated to bringing uplifting stories, exciting guests, breaking news, and much more from a Christian perspective.
translation: Unlike those who hate Christianity, the 700 Club offers both real answers and inspiration. It also provides reliable news, logical commentary and a different view than what ABC, CBS, NBC and PBS think is best. Unlike other programs that provide a social and faith-based comment, those behind the 700 club are helping those in need, such as For example, providing the Blessing with hungry people, providing medical help to poor communities, and giving hope to those in need of hope. It's not hateful at all. If the 700 Club offends you, I recommend searching for the remote and turning the channel on your TV. I do the same when I find CNN Headline News or programs that I find biased or insulting. What I find offensive is the way in which the ABC family inserts the disclaimer that the views of the 700 club are not the same as those of ABC Family.

summary: After Elizabeth's husband dies, she begins to play her tenor saxophone again, and remembers when she was 15 and a member of the Blonde Bombshells, an all-girl (with one exception) swing band. Accompanied by the exception and urged on by her grand-daughter, Elizabeth hunts up all the old members of the band and urges them to perform, and in doing so, learns more than she knew about the band, its members, the roses on the drum set, and herself--the last of the Blonde Bombshells.
translation: I grew up in the time when the music was popular in this movie. What a wonderful time for music and dancing! My only complaint was that I was a bit too young to go to the USO and nightclubs. Guess it sounds like I'm living in the past (I have wonderful memories), so what's wrong with that? !!? World War II was a terrible time, except when it came to music. Glenn Miller's death was a terrible sadness for us. This movie will be one of my favorites. Clio Laine was excellent; what a voice! I do not know how I ever missed this movie. My main reason for commenting is to make the modern generation aware of an alternative to rap and new age music that is offensive to me. Please watch this movie and give it a try!

summary: While the rest of the gang goes fishing, Spanky gets stuck babysitting.
translation: This is one of the best "Our Gang" shorts ever made. Spanky is in his cutest and funniest, and the babies he gets to babysitting are also hilarious. Tiny Spanky is forced by the gang to watch all their little siblings. The opening scene of everyone in strollers being entertained by various things that hang the gang of fishing rods is a beautiful gag. Spanky's apparition carries his huge toy knife when asked by older boys to babysit is priceless, as well as his answer - "Hey, where do you get the stuff - I do not care about babies!" The little guy who says "remarkable" throughout the movie, all those beautiful sight-gags and Spanky telling the babies "all about Tarzan" make it one of the best "our gangs" you'll ever see.

summary: Elmer Fudd spots Bugs in a pet shop window, but after he takes him home Bugs heckles him and complains about having to eat carrots.
translation:
I'm really shocked that a great director like Chuck Jones started doing some of the incredibly boring cartoons I've ever seen. I never laughed in this short film, and it's a Bugs Bunny cartoon, for God's sake! Bugs Bunny cartoons are always funny, not boring! Unfortunately, this short film turns out to be Good Night Elmer (another incredibly boring Jones short game) with the addition of Bugs Bunny.

The first warning sign for a boring cartoon is always not gag-profit. Good night Elmer was boring because he dragged the same two gags forever with predictable profits. This cartoon, on the other hand, bears the second warning sign of a boring cartoon: There are too many dialogues. The cartoon has at least more than two jokes up its sleeve, but most of them seem to be taller than they are thanks to the immense padding of the dialogue. At one point, Elmer finishes having dinner and comments, "That was wowwwy awfuwwyy well off wamb," possibly the most superfluous dialogue I've ever heard in a cartoon reading characters text in the later-era Woody Woodpecker cartoons not in my book). Although this cartoon is only 8 minutes long, it feels like 20 thanks to superfluous dialogues.

Elmer's Pet Rabbit was not a funny cartoon for me, but if you sold your soul to Chuck Jones and you are not able to recognize that he has run a few clunkers during his career, you could enjoy it.

summary: A story of zombies eating freshly killed humans.
translation: This thought lost stripe sometimes comes on the internet. So I bought a copy. Well, of course the acting is terrible and the plot is childish, but it has its moments. I think people who searched this one know the back story of it. It was made by a Grindhouse movie theater owner for an extremely low budget. But for me he certainly did not spoil the money for props, but the makeup. The make-up is well done for this type of movie. The zombies are worth seeing and the blood is intact. The only problem with this type of film is the quality of the pelicula. It's awful, luckily no hissing sound, but sometimes it's way too dark. So you have to look closely to see the blood. In a funny way, they were trying to sell this one, not really for Gypsies. A voice-over says at the beginning of the film that one has to watch for a sign and a man who appears with green flashes, indicating that there is blood on the way. Of course that does not work, let me think of Cannibal Girls, had that annoying bell as the red stuff started to flow. They had the original idea, Cannibal Girls was made a year earlier. Do not go for the storyline, go for the zombies and notice a continuity mistake. When the girl and the guy love each other first, she takes her bra, then they love each other and suddenly her underwear is back on ... try to do that or I'll go offline a bit ... eat it ugly corpses

summary: Feature-length version of the documentary TV series Πλανήτης Γη (2006), following the migration paths of four animal families.
translation:
Greetings from the darkness. Breathtaking photography highlights this Disney documentary and gives an insight into the harshness of animals living in the wild. For over 40 years, Disney and Mutual of Omaha's Wild Kingdom have provided much of our wild-animal insight since our childhood ... back when there was no channel for National Geographic or Nature or Animal Planet.

Whatever the intriguing circumstances are for many of these majestic creatures. To defy the elephant for days, almost insane because of lack of water, is so painful. But their nocturnal battle against the lions is exciting.

Some of the underwater photos are breathless. The mommy and baby humpback whales are beautiful and watching the white shark attack its prey is just as daunting as "Jaws". The most amazing landscape for me was the breathtaking view of the Himalayas. I've never seen such a detail of the breadth of the range.

Do not think that most young kids today are too upset, but it's certainly one of the most beautifully photographed documentaries I've ever seen.

summary: In a penitentiary, four prisoners occupy a cell: Carr√®re, who used his company to commit a fraud and was betrayed by his wife; the drag Marcus and his prot√©g√©e, the intellectually disabled Paquerette, who ate his six months sister; and the intellectual, Lassalle who killed his wife. One night, Carr√®re finds an ancient journal hidden in a hole in the wall of the cell. They realize that the book was written by Danvers in the beginning of the last century and is about black magic. They decide to read and use its content to escape from the prison, when they find the truth about Danvers' fate.
translation: A prison cell. Four Prisoners - Carrere, a young company director accused of fraud, 35-year-old transsexual in the process of his transformation, Daisy, a 20-year-old mentally retarded idiot Savant, and Lassalle, a 60-year-old intellectual who murdered his wife. Behind a stone slab in the cell, which was mysteriously torn loose, they discovered a book: the diary of a former prisoner, Danvers, who inhabited the cell at the beginning of the century. The Diary contains magical formulas designed to help prisoners "Malefique" is one of the scariest and most intelligent horror movies I've seen this year. The film has a grubby, shady feel that is influenced by the works of HP Lovecraft, which creates a very scary and disturbing atmosphere. There is plenty of blood associated with imaginative and brutal death scenes, and the characters of four prisoners are surprisingly well developed. It's a shame that Eric Valette really made a terrible remake of "One Missed Call" after his stunning debut.9 out of 10.

summary: "Offside" is about a group of Iranian girls who attempts to enter Tehran's Azadi Stadium dressed as boys in order to watch a big football match but some get caught and arrested. After the establishment of the Islamic Republic in Iran, women are not allowed to enter the stadiums.
translation:
At first glance, a movie about women who want to watch a football match would not appeal to someone who has little interest in football like me, but it's not about football, it's about discrimination and the enthusiasm of women for the sport they do love.

The film begins on the day of a crucial World Cup qualifier between Iran and Bahrain. A girl tries to enter Tehran's Azadi Stadium like a boy. It looks like she'll get it until a soldier tries to search her. Once captured, she is taken to a small enclosure high up on the outside of the stadium, where there are a handful of women who have already been captured. Here they are guarded by a small group of conscripts whose leaders would rather go back home cattle. We never get to know the names of the characters, but we get to know them as humans when the girls ask the guards to watch them through a nearby gap in the wall and if they are turned away try to at least comment.

Aside from an important point regarding the rigid gender segregation in today's Iran, the film contains many funny moments, like the "disguise" that one of the girls has to wear when it comes to the toilet and the girl She disguised herself as a soldier and was caught only because she watched the game from a seat reserved for a senior officer. The enthusiasm of the girls for the game is so great that in the end the spectator will probably be at the height of his place, in the hope that Iran will win and thus reach the finals in Germany. The soldiers are not shown as fundamentalists, they are just recruits who are there because they have to be, and when they explain to the girls why women can not watch male sports, they do not seem to be convinced of their own arguments.

It's a shame that this movie is not seen in Iran itself, but it's good that the world can see it and see that ordinary Iranians are not fanatics desperate to to fight the West but ordinary people with the same passions and worries as people everywhere. The cast has done a great job by letting their characters appear as real people rather than mere cartoons.

summary: A young man just released from a reformatory moves to a new neighborhood with his sister, intending to start a new life. However, he gets mixed up with the local mob boss and corrupt politicians and soon finds himself being framed for an arson and murder he didn't commit.
translation:
The film begins with a group of children in the Reform School and focuses on a child named Gabe, who seems to have worked hard to earn his probation. Gabe and his sister move to a new neighborhood to make a fresh start and soon Gabe meets the Dead End Kids. The kids in this movie are little punks, but they are much less antisocial than in other previous movies and deep down, they are well-meaning punks. However, in this area there are also some criminals who commit arson fraud and consider Gabe a comfortable scapegoat - after all, he had been reformed the school and nobody would believe that he was innocent once he was framed. So, when Gabe is ready to be sent back to The Big House, it's up to the rest of the gang to rescue him and expose the real crooks.

The "Dead End Kids" appeared in several Warner Brothers movies in the late 1930s and the films were generally very good (especially ANGEL with dirty faces). However, after the boys' contracts expired, they went over to Monogram Studios, and the movies, to put it mildly, were very weak and formulaic - Huntz Hall and Leo Gorcey were pretty much the whole show and the group was renamed "Monogram Studios". The Bowery Boys ". Because ANGELS WASH THEIRE FACES had the excellent writing and production values, AND Hall and Gorcey did not constantly touch the camera, that's a pretty good movie - and earns almost a score of 7 (it's really close). In fact, while this is not a great movie aesthetically, it's certainly a lot of fun to watch, so I'll give it a 7! Sure, it was a bit hokey - especially towards the end when the kids take the law into their own hands and Reagan ignores the Bill of Rights - but it was also very entertaining. The Dead End Kids are doing their best and Ronald Reagan and Ann Sheridan have provided excellent support. Sure, this part of the movie was illogical and impossible, but somehow it was still funny and quite charming - so if you lift the unbelief, it works fine.

summary: Sexy air stewardesses - four naughty female flight attendants - become involved with a wealthy womanizer, with unsurprising results. They live out their wildest sexual softcore nude fantasies.
translation: That's the dilemma (above) that Debbie endures at the end of this Sam Sherman production of Naughty Stewardesses. Debbie has just come to town, become a stewardess, slept with an older rich man (who describes her is in her fifties, but has cracked that mark a decade or two ago), shoots nude scenes for a photographer she just finished got to know has central element to a kidnapping / extortion plot. Through all this and in the midst of all these emotional upheavals and spiritual searches, what in the name of Heaven will Debbie do? Well, I can not completely tell, but I do not expect a real epiphany. Let's be honest. Naughty stewardess is exactly what she wants to be (at least two-thirds): a soft-core porn movie with lots of topless women and a funny one in this cheesy 70s movie. There is no great art here. The film was designed to earn money and use a growing trend to put nymphomaniac stewardesses into movies so that audiences could express their voyeuristic tastes. By today's standards, the movie is pretty tame. What makes this movie wrong is in the end a kind of statement movie. Come on, anyone here believes in this little tribute from Debbie as he thinks about life on the beach. She would spend more time figuring out which halter top she will wear that day. And what about the ridiculous act of stealing 50 Grand? It made no sense to me, how on earth did these characters "dug" it? Who buys Cal as a member of the PLO (something like that) or even as a director for hardcore pornography? He would be lucky enough to work for Seven Eleven! This, as another reviewer noted, is more of a piece by Sam Sherman and then a play by Al Adamson. You can see if Al is completely responsible. There is practically no budget and the film does not look nearly as polished. Adamson is doing a decent job this time and I have to give Sherman a loan. While this movie is bad for what it should be, it has a certain style. I liked the opening credits with the animation and the photos. I even liked the music of Sparrow. "Silver Heels" was a catchy tune. The movie does not look cheap at all. Compare that to EACH of Als Horror movies. As far as the cast is concerned, yes, Bob Livingston is a bit old for the lead role, but some research has been done, and the obvious thread of attracting money from young women to men has also been explored. I had big problems with Robert Smedley, who was just terrible in his role. The girls all have great sets, so what else was required of them, right? Naughty Stewardesses is a relatively harmless 1970s exploitation movie and will serve as a lifetime cap for certain aspects of life in this decade. Incidentally, did I mention that it is a pretty bad picture?

summary: The three Craig sisters, in Switzerland with their ten-years-divorced mother, run away to New York to prevent their father from marrying calculating socialite Donna Lyons. The overpowering vivacity of the Smart Girls (nominal ages 14-20) sweeps all before it, but a romantic complication between middle sister Kay and their accidental ally, Lord Michael Stuart, threatens shipwreck to their schemes...
translation: It was said that Deanna Durbin invented teenagers. This first movie was one of the best. The humorous story features a delightful 14-year-old Deanna, a small beauty with a beautiful voice, as the "Miss Fixit" in a divorced family. For a summary of the plot, see other IMDb entries, but Deanna and her two older sisters plan to go to America from Switzerland to prevent her father from marrying again. With an excellent supporting actress, especially Barbara Read and Nan Gray as sisters, good direction and editing, the film also succeeds in later sightseeing. Of Deanna's three songs, only "Il Bacio" comes from the classical repertoire, but when she sings it in this police station, the place of the film is secured in the story. At least it was for this spectator, who at the age of 15 both with Deanna and with classical music came to life. One of the many nice touches that occur during THREE SMART GIRLS is a quick look at how the drunk stretches his neck to catch a last glimpse of Deanna as the cops drive him! An unfortunate result of this film's success was that later writers for Durbin vehicles were locked up in the "Miss Fixit" theme, which quickly became obsolete. Deanna herself never did. Her stature as an actress is more questionable than her charisma, which she certainly had. It seems to me that she, like many other film personalities, has replaced "naturalness" for the histrionic ability she lacked. The trick worked well for 21 feature films.

summary: In the near future it's discovered that the dinosaurs did not die off, but instead live on near the center of the Earth. The evil lord Tyrannus uses the mutated dinosaurs descendents to attack Earth in his effort to rule the world. Can Gemini Force, a group of four superpowered teens who've pledged to protect the Earth, stop his plans?
translation:
This movie is incomprehensibly bad. It starts with some random explosions and then cuts to a sock puppet of a T-Rex who (!) Talks to the audience. It goes back and forth between Sackpuppe and animation, probably because the filmmakers could not afford live performers. I'll spare you the long, tiresome, inexorable action that pulls this pathetic movie for a brutal 85 minutes.

One of my friends found this very rare video in a hobby shop somewhere out of stock. I print B-movies and he bought it just to make fun of it, but like himself turned out, our intervention was not necessary. This movie makes fun of itself better than we do.

I thought Ed Wood's "Plan 9 from Outer Space" was the dirtiest movie ever, but let Japanamation / Lego Cars / Sock Puppets outnumber him. If you see this movie anywhere, buy it without hesitation. It is very rare and worth many, many good laughs.

summary: Izo Okada, a ronin (masterless samurai), desperately seeks a way out of his financial straits. He allies himself with the Tosa clan under the ruthless leader, Takechi, and imagines that he has come up in the world. But Takechi makes Izo a killer and a puppet, filled with self-loathing and a need to stop Takechi.
translation:
Tenchu ‚Äã‚Äãaka. Hitokiri Director: Hideo Gosha - with Shintaro Katsu and Tetsuya Nakadei (along with Goyokin, HAra Kiri & Rebellion) is one of the best existing Chambara films.

It's the story of Shintaro Katsu (who plays Okada Izo) working for Nakadei, who wants to become the Tagmio. Okada, the "clean" for Nakadei, is treated like a dog - and after a while he realizes what he really is for Nakadei.

But there's so much more in this movie - every fan of Japanese cinema should have seen it !!!!!!!

(Tenchu ‚Äã‚Äãmeans Heaven's Punishment)

summary: Romantic drama about a young career girl who is swept off her feet by a shy florist, who fell in love with her after one glimpse through a shadowy window.
translation:
I tried to really like this movie. When I look at it, I can only think, "This guy gives me the goose bumps, I would have got a restraining order". It also calls CODEPENDENCE in uppercase. Was that really the conversation before the movie? "Let's make a movie that brings two chronically depressed, socially incompetent people into a relationship that deepens their isolation and encourages them to complain about how bad their lives are!" From what I've seen in life, the last thing we find attractive on Earth for a potential partner is constant self-pity.

The mood of the movie is clearly 80-ish; brooding and slow. Do not get me wrong, the movie has its moments, very few of them.

summary: Raymond is a bank clerk that dream on Rio de Janeiro and the beautiful and exotic samba dancer Orlinda. He has a secret class of samba at night, where he teaches the rhythm and how to dance samba to British persons. One day, he finds that his wife is cheating him with his boss and he decides to rob the bank and go to Rio de Janeiro to meet his passion. In the arrival, he meets the cab driver Paulo, an authentic 'malandro carioca' (smart guy born in Rio) and he crosses the way of the powerful 'bicheiro' (owner of an illegal and popular Brazilian lottery, called 'jogo de bicho' - translating, would be animal lottery), getting into trouble.
translation:
This was one of the most boring movies we've seen in recent months with a predictable plot and pretty bad drama (mostly from the minor characters). The interview with Hugh Laurie on the DVD was actually more rewarding than the movie itself ...

Hugh Laurie obviously spent a lot of effort learning how to dance the samba, but the scope of his character is just Required that he is frolicking at the kiddie end of the pool. The movie is based on the look of a beautiful girl and great music, but these are not enough to make good conversation.

If you've never seen Rio or the interior of a British bank, this movie is for you. 2 out of 10.

summary: Nasik-based Heerendra Dhaan and Raj Ranade are bodyguards of a politician, but after their employer is implicated in a scam, they end up assaulting a police officer and flee to Mumbai. Once there they meet with Rambhabhai, who in turn, gets them employed with a gangster named Shambhu. After a short while the duo are apprehended by Police Inspector Narsimha, questioned, and after they agree to cooperate to bring down Shambhu, are let go. The two do succeed in assisting the police arrest Shambhu, but they themselves are arrested, tried in Court, and sentenced to a year in jail. After their discharge they are met with Inspector Narsimha, who wants to recruit them to capture and kill dreaded bandit Babban Singh, who had slaughtered his wife, Kavita, and son, Subbu, as well as cut his arms off. Heerendra and Raj agree to carry out this task for 8 Lakh Rupees. They re-locate to Kaliganj where Heerendra falls in love with auto-rickshaw driver, Ghungroo, while Raj gives his heart to Subbu's ...
translation:
First of all, I'm sorry I gave this movie a rating of 1 (not less than this available). The film fails in every department, be it scripting, directing, characterizing or acting.

1) To begin with, the name of the movie is really C-Class (though the movie itself matches the name). 2) Amitabh Bachchan tries his best to do justice to the character, but the weak writing paired with pathetic directing makes him a humorous character. 3) In Sholay, Gabbar Singh has a reward of 50,000 (which was convincing). Here in Aag was the number 100 crores for Babban (Amitabh Bachchan, but the poor man was beaten by our so-called hero and had few men's bikes to commute with all automatic weapons.) A Sholay like a movie in Mumbai type setup in the modern time does not look convincing 4) As for Nisha Kothari, someone has to tell her that she does not know acting. Why does Ram Gopal Verma always throw her back? 5) Mohanlal was good but there is hardly anything for him. 6) Sushant Singh and Rajpal Yadav, who are great actors, are wasted in the movie. 7) Legendry role of Lila Misra in Sholay is replaced in this movie by some Gangu mummy cheap. Ramu, please grow up and understand that there must be some intellect in your film. Enough of stupid characters in your movie like Shiva and Aag. 8) I should not say anything about modern Jai and Veeru. Extremely pathetic.

In summary, I was shocked to see this movie because it looks like a cheap and funny translation of the original classic. Please do not waste money and time in this movie. I think seeing Aap Ka Surror (which I thought was the worst movie) would be a better idea than seeing this terrible package of stupid characters, bad songs and miserable direction.

Thank you, Saurabh

summary: It's the Florida party season for heiresses, with both Oklahoma oil heiress Hortense Burke-Meyers and New York face cream heiress Daisy Appleby in the state. And where the single American heiresses are, the European bachelor set wanting their hand in marriage are close at hand. While nouveau riche, uncouth Hortense courts the attention, the excitement and the European bachelors clamoring after her, Daisy is more reclusive, wanting to stay out of the party scene and limelight by hiding aboard her yacht. Daisy desperately wants to marry for love, and not marry because it makes good print (and thus sell more face cream for her father), especially as she knows those European men are only after her money. So Daisy offers a proposition to Johnny Jones, a Florida Star newspaper reporter she befriends: marry her out of convenience. What she wants is that marriage license to dissuade all those European suitors while she quietly searches for that true love, a man with simple, American values. ...
translation: This is an excellent example of Bette Davis' early talent. Production is above average for 1936. I can not understand why the owners of the rights to this movie did not put it on DVD. Owner, please release it. I would buy it immediately. I have not seen it on TV for over thirty years, but remember it well.

summary: A global war begins in 1940. This war drags out over many decades until most of the people still alive (mostly those born after the war started) do not even know who started it or why. Nothing is being manufactured at all any more and society has broken down into primitive localized communities. In 1966 a great plague wipes out most of what people are left but small numbers still survive. One day a strange aircraft lands at one of these communities and its pilot tells of an organization which is rebuilding civilization and slowly moving across the world re-civilizing these groups of survivors. Great reconstruction takes place over the next few decades and society is once again great and strong. The world's population is now living in underground cities. In the year 2035, on the eve of man's first flight to the moon, a popular uprising against progress (which some people claim has caused the wars of the past) gains support and becomes violent.
translation:
I have "things to come" on D.V.D. and it is very clear compared to my VHS version. The tone is fair but can sometimes be hard to understand.

I liked the movie so much that I looked for a copy of the book and found it. There were details about why some things happened. The best thing about the movie are the little things that I did not notice at first. Like John Cabal playing a toy airplane at a Christmas party, as was a dive bomber, and spending the sea power, calling a battleship called "Dinosuar." Ships sunk by Luftwaffe, an unexplained enemy attack by aircraft. Curved flying wings. Strong roles for the women throughout the movie.

There is more, watch the movie to enjoy it.

summary: A vicious serial-killer is on the loose in San Francisco and the police trace a link to a small town further down the coast. When Harry Callahan upsets the press and the mayor in his usual style, he's shipped out of town to investigate while the heat is on. With the help of his new Magnum handgun Harry goes on the trail leaving behind the usual trail of dead criminals along the way.
translation: Since this movie is the only Dirty Harry movie that Clint Eastwood not only plays, but also produces and conducts, you know it must be good. Although some say the Enforcer is the best in the series, I do not agree at all. In my opinion, apart from the original Dirty Harry, Sudden Impact and Magnum Force are the only ones worthy of the series. Although The Enforcer is a good movie with some good action sequences, it does not get the dirty and filthy impression the other three films have. This movie captures all the excitement that makes Clint Eastwood movie good, and he has the quotes that make a Dirty Harry movie good. In Diry Harry it is ".. well, yes, punk?"; in Magnum Force "A man must know his limits"; and in this it's "Go on, make my day." Also in this movie, it's nice to see a change of scenery as you're a little tired to see the old San Francisco streets in the other movies in the series. With great actors from Clint Eastwood and co-star Sandra Locke and good directing from Clint, I think this is the best sequel to Dirty Harry.

summary: The battle of the sexes and relationships among the elite of Britain's industrial Midlands in the 1920s. Gerald Crich and Rupert Berkin are best friends who fall in love with a pair of sisters Gudrun, a sculptress and Ursula Brangwen, a schoolteacher. Rupert marries Ursula, Gerald begins a love affair with Gudrun, and the foursome embarks upon a Swiss honeymoon. But the relationships take markedly different directions, as Russell explores the nature of commitment and love. Rupert and Ursula learn to give themselves to each other; the more withdrawn Gerald cannot, finally, connect with the demanding and challenging Gudrun.
translation:
Well, you may not see women in love in this film, but you will certainly hear women talking about love, and men talking about love and women talking about men, men talking about women and men talking about men, and everybody talking talk about death, talk and talk until you scream yourself and do something that does not have to talk like painting your bedroom or watering your plants.

Welcome to the world of DH Lawrence, where the psycho-chatter prevails and no one can come to a productive life because everyone is too busy talking about how unproductive their lives are. Time with the characters in a D.H. Spending Lawrence's novel is like being locked in a closet with a group of your most selfish acquaintances you'd run away from if you met them at a party. When I read "Women in Love," I desperately wanted to strangle every single character in it, but since I could not, I hoped they would at least strangle each other. Unfortunately, only one of them dies, not by strangulation, and I will not spoil it for you by telling you in case you or that people really shit.

In order to give the director Ken Russell his fee, he makes this filmed version as entertaining as possible to make this essentially unfilmable novel. He casts off much of the psychological hocus-pocus that Lawrence worshiped, and instead focuses on all the naughty parts, so we get a lot of histrionic lovemaking in beds and fields, two naked men in the firelight, and an embarrassing scene with Alan Bates (yup , buck naked again) stray on a meadow and love bush and grass (I'm not kidding). Glenda Jackson won an Oscar for her performance as Gudrun, the more dominant of the two sisters in the storyline, and she's certainly trying her best to do something with this material; Everyone would deserve an Oscar just because he had to endure Russell's decision to give her a scene where she had to dance wildly in front of a herd of mystified cattle. Oliver Reed has an expression, an intense scowl. The whole thing is over-written and over-directed, and it's deliriously campy. In fact, this competes with "Mommie Dearest" as perhaps the most unintentionally hysterical movie I've ever seen.

Note: D

summary: When an un-exploded WWII bomb is accidentally detonated in Pimlico, London, it reveals a treasure trove. They find documents proving that the region is, in fact, part of Burgundy, France and thus foreign territory. The British government attempts to regain control by setting up border controls and cutting off services to the area. The 'Burgundians' fight back.
translation:
This is a very funny Ealing comedy about a church in London, which by unusual circumstances discovers that they are not English but are a branch of the French province of Burgundy.

The film features comic actor Stanley Holloway (known as Alfred Doolittle in MY FAIR LADY), as well as a host of other classic comic actors of the time.

The story was apparently based on a message at the time when the Canadian government "officially" provided a hotel room to a European member of the royal family. The idea reminded me of the true case of Hutt River Province, Western Australia, where a landowner "split off" from the Australian government over a wool quota dispute. (It was never recognized by the Australian or Australian government).

This is a great script that plays on many political and economic topics, similar to the Yes Ministers TV show; and also a great little eccentric character piece.

summary: The film takes place in three bathrooms. Two of them are side-by-side and the third sees the two right across the street. In these 3 places, 3 different couples and a young voyeur boy (actually an art student who researches for a project) are described in stories. At the core of these stories there are determinations of the nature of men and women, marriage and betrayal.
translation: If you expect to see a lot in the Altƒ±oklar bathtub, as the slogan promises, you will be very disappointed to see that the film only includes and deceives the populist style of Altƒ±oklar in relation to the most famous topics such as sex, marriage and cheating. Too much nudity, which seems to appear out of thin air and has no connection with the plot, proves that Altƒ±oklar unsuccessfully tried to "try something new," as he quoted. Too many sex-centered jokes seem to show that Altƒ±oklar fell for the famous saying "sex sells". I was hoping for a very good story with a very good narrative technique. In the end, however, I sat down for 90 minutes and watched Altioklar's experimental but still much too popular work.

summary: North Carolina produces more tobacco than any other state in America. Bright Leaves describes a journey taken across the social, economic, and psychological tobacco terrain of North Carolina by a native Carolinian, Ross McElwee, whose great-grandfather created the famous brand of tobacco known as Bull Durham. The comedic chronicle is a subjective, autobiographical meditation on the allure of cigarettes and their troubling legacy for the state of North Carolina. It's also a film about family history, addiction, denial, and filmmaking--as McElwee, noted director of Sherman's March, grapples with the legacy of an obscure Hollywood melodrama that is purportedly based on this curious man that was his great-grandfather.
translation:
I was fascinated by how bad this film really was. Should the viewer learn something or think about something here? What was wrong with the pumpkins? Should I be impressed by the motel pictures? Does it matter that a garbage bag is lying on a roof across the street? Why does the narrator vilify the people he interviews in vain (it's so obvious that he cut out the really informative parts of his interviews to get ridicule). The best part of the film was the interview with the film professor, who tells us how bad this movie will be before it's done.

I'm really surprised. I believe that the Creator is struggling to become an intellectual, or trying to impress the intellectual community.

summary: A young American hustler in Las Vegas spots a rich English Lady. Smitten, he pursues her to England, where his only chance of getting together with her is to enroll in Oxford and join the rowing team.
translation: This is one of those thought-provoking films: would Hulk "The Real American" Hogan have done the same? Honestly, I do not believe and he was right. I'm Italian, I can not be proud of my country for many reasons, but I would not have rowed for another team (the French, for example) simply because I'm in love with Juliette Binoche. In addition, the main actress does not fall in love with a British girl at the end of the film, but with a compatriot, so why row against Yale. As far as acting is concerned, all players are very bad. And then, you know, I hated the atmosphere of the "Society of the Dead Poets". In fact, that's another movie I hate.

summary: At 18, Diana has a chip on her shoulder; she's close to expulsion from high school for fighting, her mother is dead, her dad is surly, the popular girls at school set her teeth on edge, she knows men can cause pain. When she picks up her younger brother at a Brooklyn gym where he boxes to please his father, she decides she wants to train. Hector, a coach, reluctantly agrees to teach her. It's soon clear to him that Diana has talent; he pushes her. She spends time with another young fighter, Adrian, who has a girlfriend, but Diana intrigues him and stirs real feelings he tries to articulate. She, too, must accommodate her toughness and ironic detachment to her feelings for him.
translation:
Michelle Rodrigez was made for this movie when I saw her for the first time in Fast and the Furious. They could say that she was a strong woman. With this film, she has not only proven her acting, but she is not afraid and hard as she should be in this film. She is more of a bad girl and that's what I like about her. This movie is about a restless girl who lives as Tom Boy and constantly gets into trouble with the school and family. As she is interested in training her brothers to boxer, she decides to fight for her love and asks her trainer to train her. Although they do not believe that they have the potential, they are proven wrong.

I think the movie ended up being a bit slow but well done. It shows that people can do anything, even if they do not have the potential. I recommend it to be seen.

summary: Kevin Chan (aka Jackie) is a Hong-Kong cop, who scores his first big hit by virtually single-handedly capturing and arresting a big drug- lord. Of course, the drug-lord isn't too happy about this, and frames Kevin with the murder of another cop (who happened to be on the take). Kevin has to clear his name, whilst keeping himself from getting killed or arrested, and keeping his girlfriend from leaving him.
translation: Police Story is arguably one of the action master's best works. Compared to other action movies, Police Story Schwarzenegger and Stallone make them look like newbies. The stunt scenes are well prepared and the action scenes are outstanding. If New Line Cinema has any sense, they would release it in theaters.

summary: "Go Figure" follows 14-year-old Katelin in her quest to become a world class championship ice skater. When renowned Russian figure skating coach Natasha Goberman offers to train her at the private school where she teaches, Katelin will do almost anything to take advantage of the opportunity - even join the girl's hockey team on scholarship.
translation:
This movie was a terrible excuse for ... a movie. First of all, the casting could have been better; Katelyn, the main character, did not look like her TV mother.

Also, the plot was pathedic. it was extremely clich√©d and predictable. The end was very disappointing and cheesy. (But that's all I'm going to say).

The nail in the bag, however, was a scene when Katelyn (Jordan Hinson) should cry, but the girl could not cry on command! no tears streamed down her face, just a few incredible sobs. She is not a dynamic actress at all. she gave the same false little laugh that was identical to that of hillary duff on lizzie maguire (sp?). That was when the movie went from not so good to just bad. it really looked like she was acting.

In a nutshell: This movie was really bad! it was a mix of every clich√© movie from the 1990s that everyone was tired of - only worse!

I give him an "F" because it was so damn hard to sit through (b / t / w, I was babysitter when I saw it).

However, you may like it if you are 9 or less. ;)

summary: "Creepshow 2" is divided into three stories, conducted by a leading segment where a boy that loves the horror comic book Creepshow buys seeds of carnivorous plant and is bullied by four teenagers. Meanwhile the Creep tells the tales of Creepshow: (1) "Old Chief Wood'nhead" - The elders Ray (George Kennedy) and Martha Spruce (Dorothy Lamour) have lived their whole life and raised their family with their small store in an Arizona town. Now the town is economically decadent and Ray gives credit to his costumers including the Indians of Ben Whitemoon's tribe. When Ray is repairing the wooden statue of an old chief in the front door, Ben (Frank Salsedo) arrives and asks him to keep the jewels of his tribe as a guarantee for their debts. However, Ben's nephew Sam (Holt McCallany) unexpectedly arrives with two other punks to steal Ray, and he kills the elders. They expect to travel to Hollywood, but the Old Chief Wood'nhead will not let them go. (2) "The Raft" - The teenagers Deke (Paul ...
translation:
CREEPSHOW 2 is the unfortunate sequel to George Romero's (overrated) original, CREEPSHOW. Any sequel that follows a Romero movie that is not directed by Romero himself has some big shoes to fill, mainly because of the Romero fans out there who think he is God. I did not really care about the first movie and it was funny enough, I did not really care about the sequel. The film series had so much potential, but it was short-lived because both films were less than stellar.

The biggest problem with CREEPSHOW 2 was that it had only three stories (with the exception of the intermediate story), and because the first story looked implausible, there was only a chance for almost half of the movie really well his. I saw CS 2 in the cinema and the first segment was a real groomer. Everything Dramatic with George "I Can not Act" Kennedy is automatically doomed to fail and the story of the Indian statue was too delicate and did not belong in this sequel. After a really dreary and dull start, there were only two more stories left to reverse the fiasco of the aborted start, and unfortunately the other two stories were not big enough to forget the first story. THE RAFT and THE HITCHHIKER are moderately successful, moderate, because although the other two segments have their moments, they still fall flat. The last two stories are basically too long stretched out. It's not that I wanted the stories to happen at a dizzying pace and end quickly, but both good ideas that were found in these stories were made by the fact that they were slow and padded and eventually flat when the Segments were more energetic, nullified. brittle and with punchier ends. Even if the last two stories had not been expanded to fill the film, or if all three segments had been shorter with better editing and direction, they could have added a much needed fourth story to the Bund. With only three padded segments for a boring feast.

The acting and writing in the segments THE RAFT and THE HITCHHIKER are from horrible to good. I like Lois Chiles in the last segment. It's probably her best moment on screen, apart from her role as Bond Girl Holly Goodhead in MOONRAKER and DEATH ON THE NILE. But even their role is sometimes difficult to understand because of the useful direction and the unfocused story. Should we hate her or sympathize with her? Shall we sympathize with the annoying hitchhiker? If the body of the pickup was found by other people on the street, what was it when he attacked Chile? Was he a ghost or a zombie or something? How did the body abandon the presence of the other people who found it dead to attack Chile? The whole thing is not very clear, even for a supernatural story. And the end is pretty boring and uneventful.

As for the infamous THE RAFT story, well, acting is mostly on the dreadful side and none of the characters is likable or interesting. The characters would have been more interesting if the actors had played themselves. None of the actors is convincing in its specific roles. Paul Satterfield looks smarter than the stupid jock he plays, and the actress who plays his girlfriend is not as convincing as the typical bitchy bitch. She seems too shy. The same could be said with the other two who play the "normal" teenagers. The idea of ‚Äã‚Äãthe killer oil spill is interesting and scary, but not well executed. There should have been a fifth figure, maybe a homeless person or a ranger who lurks around the lake and knows about the oil spill and might have been the alter ego of the watery monster. As scary as the oil spill is, it is not a compelling "character". And as the story ends, everything seems pointless. No punch.

Apart from the few exciting aspects that make it always boring to see CREEPSHOW 2 in a theater, was basically a waste of money and time. CS 2 is more rental material than anything you pay for on the big screen.

summary: A free-spirited woman enthusiastically engages in torrid interspecies sex with a delighted dog.
translation: Linda Lovelace was the victim of a sadistic womanizer, Chuck Traynor. I do not understand how it is fun to have sex with a dog (which is also animal abuse). Linda Lovelace was a virtual prisoner who was forced to make these films. I know that some people will criticize this comment, but I'm convinced that this kind of movie is fueling the fire of hatred and more misogynistic feelings. This society continues to portray women as sexual objects as opposed to humans. We call ourselves "civilized," but I think we still have a long way to go before we can ever scratch the surface of civilization.

summary: The Maysles brothers pay visits to Edith Bouvier Beale, nearing 80, and her daughter Edie. Reclusive, the pair live with cats and raccoons in Grey Gardens, a crumbling mansion in East Hampton. Edith is dry and quick-witted - a singer, married but later separated, a member of high society. Edie is voluble, dresses - as she puts it - for combat in tight ensembles that include scarves wrapped around her head. There are hints that Edie came home 24 years before to be cared for rather than to care for her mother. The women address the camera, talking over each other, moving from the present to events years before. They're odd, with flinty affection for each other.
translation:
When it first came out, this work of the Meysel brothers was much criticized and even considered exploitation. Fortunately, it is now hailed as a documentary cinema masterpiece, especially now that society has been exposed to real exploitation in reality television and the bad development of most direct cinema.

Really, at first, we have to say that this is not directly cinema, it's more cinematic. The difference between the two is very small, but it is mainly the fact that in this documentary we feel the presence of the brothers Meysels, and they interact with the filmed characters. This also makes it clear that this is not exploitation. The Meyssels have been allowed in the house, and they are contained in a very eccentric situation of a very eccentric household. And Edith and Edie just love the idea of ‚Äã‚Äãbeing filmed.

It would have been very disappointing if only one voice of God's narrative and superficial interviews had been shown. Here we get a full picture of the madness of the house, a madness that is well received both with Edie and with her mother Edith. Their house is a mess, trash and animals everywhere, faded paint and furniture throughout the house, and the constant struggles that are the constant interactions of reality. These two people have lived together all their lives and are not fighting the camera because they want to get the attention, but because they can not help but talk to each other. They know themselves too well to hide their inner feelings, there is no need. But in the end, they really love each other because they blame each other for their lives. Edie says she does not want her mother to die because she loves her very much and Edith says she does not want Edie to leave because she does not want to be alone.

But the most interesting aspect of the movie is that regardless of her age, the two women can not help being girls. You can not help being one of the singers, the other the dancer. Show all their artistic skills in front of the camera. When Edie asks David Meyssel's rhetorically, "Where have you been all my life?" She is really happy that she is finally able to show the whole world and her wonderful showgirl skills. A beautiful portrait of stylistic significance and a charm that will most likely never be seen again, as only the Meysel and few others can do.

summary: A young boy stumbles into a mysterious girl who floats down from the sky. The girl, Sheeta, was chased by pirates, army and government secret agents. In saving her life, they begin a high flying adventure that goes through all sorts of flying machines, eventually searching for Sheeta's identity in a floating castle of a lost civilization.
translation: I know anime. I spent a long time studying it before it became a national phenomenon; I loved Ranma before most people knew what Dragonball Z was all about. And just so you know I'm not going to brag about it, let me say this: of all the animes I've seen, Castle in the Sky is by far one of the best. It's obvious that people say Spirited Away is the best, but I do not agree at all. Most people only know this movie because it's an Acemy Award; This is not an exaggeration - I have shown Princess Mononoke and Castle in the Sky to people who have only seen "Spirited Away" and they agree that the latter two are the supervisors of the Three. Personally, I never thought anything would be comparable to Princess Mononoke until I finally saw Castle in the Sky. I still think the Prior is the better of the two, but Castle in the Sky is on par with him; In many ways, Castle has important elements that Mononoke missed. Either way, if you've just seen Spirited Away and think that this is Miyazaki's best movie, be prepared to shake your Earth.

summary: Micheal, a former test subject of a project to create supersoldiers, is forced to escape with his comrades after the project was cancelled. Months later, he is trying to have a quiet life as a librarian with a tough cop as his best friend. However, a string of vicious gangland murders begins that has all the markings of his former compatriots who seem to have turned to violent crime. Realizing that the police are helpless to fight these soldiers, Micheal decides to take them on himself. Donning a mask to protect his identity, Micheal must fight these powerful villians as the mysterious superhero known only as Black Mask.
translation:
I can not understand why they decided to release this movie to introduce the American audience to the Dynamo Jet Li. Fist of Legend would have been a much better choice. Anyway, Black Mask is not terrible, but it's not great either. The final combat sequence is well staged by Yuen Woo Ping, who coordinated the matrix. But the English publication suffers from rough editing and synchronization. (I implore the Hollywood studios to release these films uncut with subtitles.) Jet Li shows his characteristic charisma in the title role, and Francoise Yip has a cool, but short, role as a 701.

Black mask has a strange goth style that arouses some interest, but is overloaded with gun battles and explosions. A bigger focus on Li's fantastic physical abilities was in order. Black Mask is a decent movie, but do yourself a favor and take Fist of Legend with you if you want to watch a great movie showing Li's abilities.

summary: When he wakes up the morning after his bachelor party in bed with a strange woman, a man presumes he must have cheated on his fianc√©e. Guilt leads him to try to cover it up in the week before the wedding, high jinks ensue.
translation:
I happened to watch this movie on TV a few days ago. My expectations were not very high, but it was an interesting movie. In 'A Guy Thing' Jason Lee Paul, a heterosexual man from Seattle, who just marries his fianc√©e Karen (Selma Blair) and wants to settle there plays an undisputed life of bourgeois domesticity. We meet Paul for the first time at his bachelor party, where he does not call for any of the normal bachelor party activities that encourage his (surprisingly few) friends in case he is a little naughty and gets into trouble crashes and strife. Of course, the next thing Paul knows is the morning after night, he's in bed with a naked hula dancer and his mother-in-law rings to tell him that Karen is on her way. Oh, and the hula dancer is Karen's cousin Becky (Julia Stiles).

From this little acorn with potential annoyance, a mighty oak tree grows from frantic misfortune as Paul crawls from mishap to mishap and tries to cover up what he did while he seemed a dutiful, family-oriented good one Being a guy who is very happy about his upcoming wedding. His effort to keep Karen up to date on a possible misconduct forces Paul ironically to get closer and closer to the fun-loving Becky, forcing him to ask if he really wants the life he seems to have. The film contains the right mix of comedy and romance. Definitely worth a watch.

summary: At an annual pace, a huge colony of ants is forced to collect every piece of food that grows on their island for a group of menacing grasshoppers. But that all changes when a misfit inventor ant named Flik accidentally knocks over the offering pile thus forcing the grasshoppers' devious leader Hopper to force the ants to redo their gathering of food. Despite the fact that his friends don't believe him and desperate to help save the colony, Flik volunteers to go out into the world and search for a group of 'warrior' bugs. Instead, what he got was a talented group of circus performers. But when the grasshoppers return and take control of the island, Flik must prove himself a true hero before it's too late.
translation: When I bought my Toy Story Tape when it appeared in the movies after the release, I saw a trailer coming from the creators of Toy Story. As soon as I saw that, I knew that would be a good feature! I was right! A Bug's Life like Toy Story is a great story, great characters, and great animations. My favorite characters are Dim the Rhino Beetle by Brad Garrett and Hemlich the Caterpillar by the late Pixar storyman Joe Ranft. My favorite scene is when Slim, the walking stick (David Hyde Pierce) lifts up Hemlich and tries to distract the bird and Hemlich as you lift Mr. Early Bird. How about a delicious-tasting worm on a stick and Slim's as I'm gonna grab! I will snap! I just died and laughed about this scene. Since I'm a big fan of insects, I think A Bug's Life is my favorite Pixar, though I know that many people think it's the worst Pixar movie ever! I do not know how you can hate a Pixar movie! I think those are all pretty good movies! Good job PIXAR!

summary: After several people and a dog are found dead in their closets, a mild-mannered reporter, a college professor, her son, and a befuddled professor band together to uncover the mystery.
translation:
Wow, I just got it on T.V. seen as one of the "scary" movies they show around Halloween. Was this rated G? There was not really anything that would make this movie frightening or worth watching. Other people say it's a parody, but I do not think so. For a parody, you need something called "humor." This cheap crap party had no sense of humor, and it made little sense. You basically have a stupid-looking monster (man in a rubber suit) coming out of closets and killing people, I think, since you'll never see the monster violate anyone or any bloody consequences. The spinning newspaper tells you that people were killed by the monster, so I think that's good enough.

The military weakly tries to kill the monster that is not much taller than a man. You have a very bad goal. Then the military FLEES! Wow, did this movie make the US military look pathetic or what? The monster, though it's hard to kill, does not do much but cry and roar. Oh, and occasionally a second head pops out of his mouth and screams. It was a bit interesting, but a total alien rip-off.

What was the deal with the scientist who played the xylophone to attract the monster? Due to the poor sound quality, it was difficult to understand much of the dialogue. Besides, why did the monster carry around the main weak guy for so long? Why did not the monster get in the closet when it had a chance? Why am I insisting on trying to make sense of the meaningless?

summary: The car of successful author Anna Rivers is found disabled next to the river, the thought being that she accidentally fell into the river while trying to change a flat tire. Her dead body is found upstream several weeks later, consistent with the accidental death theory. Based on incidents around him, her grieving husband, architect Jonathan Rivers, decides several months later to visit with Raymond Price, who approached John prior to Anna's body being found with news that she was trying to contact him from beyond. At that time, John was skeptical of Raymond's claims of electronic voice phenomena (EVP): that he is contacted from the beyond through electronic means - radio, television - which he is able to record. Along with Sarah Tate, another of Raymond's "clients" whose fianc√© passed away, John becomes obsessed with EVP as he gets more and more audio and video messages, however fuzzy, from Anna from beyond. That obsession takes a slight change in focus when John believes that Anna ...
translation:
Michael Keaton was never really a good actor; In the Batman films of Tim Burton, he always falls into the shadows of his big villains. Here he plays as a widowed husband, recording radio frequencies that look like dead people trying to connect with the living ...

Well, that's supposed to be a pretty shocking thriller, but it does really misses every point where it shocks you. Because there is way too much stuff that ends up being unexplained, undiscovered and uninteresting. So where is the shocking excitement when everything gets so bad that WITH NOISE makes a fool of itself? Really bad acting and frightening edited, this movie is nothing to see. Michael Keaton tries to make a thriller comeback, but ends the goal more than ever.

summary: A remake of the television series, Matthew Broderick stars as Gadget, who suffers an accident at the beginning of the film, and befriends Brenda, a robotic surgeon who repairs Gadget so that he can defeat the villain Claw. In the meantime, Gadget and Brenda fall in love.
translation: I was a big fan of the original animated series and was looking forward to finally seeing Gadget on the big screen - but I never expected anything extreme in my wildest dreams. The pace was way too fast, there was no conspiracy and "Wowser!" - What the hell is that?? It was "WOWSERS !!".

summary: A stripped down Galactica attacks the Cylon's Colony ship in the hopes of rescuing Hera. The meaning of the shared dream in the Opera House on Kobol is revealed. Sam Anders is moved in his Hybrid tank to the CIC in the hopes that he will be able to assist the combatants. Their mission complete, Admiral Adama orders Starbuck to pick a destination - any destination - to which the ship can jump to get out of there. With that, the meaning of the tune and the musical notes are explained. Having successfully jumped, the old Galactica has truly reached the end of it's life. A planet capable of sustaining life is found and Lee Adama makes a radical proposal for the future of humankind. In a flash forward far into the future, Hera's importance to the human race is revealed.
translation:
Did I step in or did this bad smell come from day 1 + 2? God was behind everything? What does God have to do with sci-fi? God is only the answer if you can not come up with a rational explanation for something. In fact, this is exactly the issue with the series finale - they obviously could not come up with any reasonable explanation for the multitude of big questions that came up during the series, like Kara Thrace returning from the dead in a brand new Viper, like her old viper and her charred body landed on Earth 2, why Baltar has an imaginary 6 in his head, why 6 has an imaginary Baltar in their head, etc., they explain it with "angels" or simply do not explain it at all.

The plot of the last 2 episodes had holes big enough to let a basestar through. For example, why are Galactica and her crew going on a suicide mission to rescue a girl (Hera), especially after Adama said that he would not attempt a rescue? Because they found out the position of the Cylon base? That's not a good reason to sacrifice the life of the crew. And how did Anders know the place? And what was the purpose of the flashbacks to the lives of the main characters before the war? It's like they forgot to do it earlier, so they threw something in at the last moment.

The people who wrote the last two episodes could not be the same authors who created the sensational series so far. It feels like script writing was done by evangelical Christians to spread the word. Do not forget to link the loose ends of the plot, the important message the authors wanted to convey is: Do not rely on technology, as this will lead to your destruction; God is your ultimate salvation (bad luck if you have a disease that needs medical treatment).

Imagine, in the final movie of the Star Wars series, they tell you that there is no "power" ... instead, a Jedi actually gets his power from Jesus. Then they fly their spaceships into the next star and live with the Ewoks in the forest. Would that be a good end? No, it did not break.

summary: A documentary on the rivalry between two rock bands. On one hand we have The Dandy Warhols, and its leader Courtney Taylor-Taylor, and on the other The Brian Jonestown Massacre, lead by Anton Newcombe. They used to be close friends but their differing lifestyles and ambitions, especially that of Anton Newcombe, have forced them apart, to the point of being enemies.
translation: Excellent documentary, allegedly about the friendship and subsequent rivalry between two retro rock'n'roll bands from the West Coast: The Dandy Warhols and Brian Jonestown Massacre. It turns out that this is a portrait of a frontier psychologist - Anton Newcomb - and his tormented relationship with the rest of the world. Interestingly, there is hardly any music for a music documentary. What is there - bits and pieces of songs, mostly broken off by the actors - is rather incidental than central. Although the protagonists are musicians, the story is not about music, but about a particularly American version of a British myth of a cartoon lifestyle, where nobody has to take responsibility to behave like idiots. Tantrums, drugs, violence, gross dysfunctional attitudes, egomania on a truly epic scale - all this is excused or positively encouraged because it's a collective idea of ‚Äã‚Äãwhat rock'n'roll is all about. As a film, this is a first-rate documentary, but it raises more questions than it answers. Why, for example, is Anton Musik so conservative? For someone who is so wild and outrageous (and he is wild and outrageous), his music never seems to have gone beyond the most obvious derivations of his idols of the '60s (The Stones, Velvets, etc.) For someone who claims to play 80 instruments It has never bothered to play any of them beyond the rudimentary level. Likewise, Dandy Warhol's burning ambition is based on a vision of rock'n'roll, which astoundingly petrified in 1969. Of course, nothing is wrong with Pastiches, but of course there is more to life than living a cartoon of the late 60s. Why do not they take risks with their music - just as their role models did? Because one suspects that it is not about music. Music is just an accessory, a support or an excuse to lead completely dysfunctional and irresponsible lives. But why? In the case of Dandy Warhol, the answer is obvious: make a lot of money and be famous. Big thing. Anton Newcombs case is more interesting. He's obviously very talented, but every time he gets the opportunity to reach a wider audience, he sabotages it, usually in the most dramatic way. He is terribly afraid of success, and at the same time he annoys anyone who has it - especially his former friends, the Dandy Warhols. Fascinating movie. Highly recommended.

summary: Two losers from Milwaukee, Coop & Remer, invent a new game playing basketball, using baseball rules. When the game becomes a huge success, they, along with a billionaire's help, form the Professional Baseketball League where everyone gets the same pay and no team can change cities. Coop & Remer's team, the Milwaukee Beers is the only team standing in the way of major rule changes that the owner of the Dallas Felons wants to institute.
translation: There are so many words I can use to describe this movie, but I can not really do that, right? This movie is a movie that you can see when you just want to sit, laugh, cry and then pee. I'm serious. Do not look at this movie if you are easily offended by obscenities, sex, nudity, homosexuality ... and everything else that has anything to do with nature. As a woman, and that may not even be a factor, I can watch this movie over and over again. Trey Parker and Matt Stone are absolutely brilliant. Together with all her other debuts, I think Baseketball is the laureate. I'm laughing now, just thinking about some of the stupid things they do in the movie. Watch the movie !! That's all I'll say. It's a bit hard for me to leave that comment because I'm one of those people, like Ozzy Osbourne, who has a dirty word in almost every line that pops out of her mouth when they speak. So I think it's professional. Best movie. Heck yes!

summary: Jack is a wanderer whose aimless roaming leads him to a number of interesting locations and into the company of many interesting people, and despite his fascination with bullfighting he leads a largely peaceful existence. When a crime boss' daughter is accidentally gored to death, Jack is implicated in the unfortunate event and singled out for termination by a seemingly unending army of lethal hitmen. As Jack wages an uphill battle for survival against the harsh desert terrain and a hail of gun smoke and lead, his will to live depends on his ability to exercise his demons and come to terms with the fact that he may not live to see another sunrise.
translation:
I only watched this movie because I was so impressed by Olivier Martinez in SWAT. But that is not SWAT. SWAT had an action and some sympathetic characters and made sense. Bullfighter had none of this.

I should have realized that it can not possibly be good, after all, the always painfully bad Michelle Forbes had a major role.

A poster here called the film incoherent. Another called it the worst movie ever. Both gave the film way too much credit. I'm so glad I got it for free from the library, but I still feel ripped off.

IMDb must include a "0" in the "Rate this film" vote, only for movies like this one.

summary: A contemporary remake of Lewis Carroll's classic "Alice's Adventures in Wonderland", Alice finds herself bored and fed up with the world around her. When she is offered the chance to know all the answers to all her life's questions, she takes it, and falls deep into the demented world of Wonderland.
translation:
I had the misfortune to have seen this at the Sidewalk Film Festival. Sidewalk as a whole was a disappointment and this movie was the last nail in the coffin. As an avid fan of Lewis Carroll's "Alice" books, I was very excited about the premiere of this movie, which made it even more uncomfortable to see them. Usually, I am enthusiastic about modern retellings if they are treated well. It is usually interesting to see the parallels between past and present in a known story. Unfortunately, this film was less of a modern retelling and more of a pop culture perversion. The adaptation of the characters of the original appeared youthful and usually proved to be terribly annoying. It probably did not help that the actors were not very good either. Most appearances were ridiculously exaggerated, which was probably due to a bad direction or a bad script. I did not even laugh at the time of the movie. All jokes were outdated clues to not so current events that will lose their sharpness over time. Really, the only highlight of the movie was the opening sequence in which the White Rabbit is about to meet Alice, but even then the score was a poor imitation of Danny Elfman's work. Also, I have to say that converting the croquet game into a rave dance-off was terrible. It was undoubtedly the low point of the film.

What a joke. Do not see this movie. After graduating, I was really angry.

summary: College students, Terry, Nancy and Gloria are on their way to a rock concert, driving through a torrential rainstorm... only to crash their car, badly injuring one of them. Seeking shelter and aid they come across a house occupied by a man-hating mother and her daughter... our trio soon wish they hadn't.
translation: I too was deceived by the packaging. I also liked the bloody packaging and the DVD case, which claimed "saddened fans as each copy was pulled off the shelves". Although it was cheap ($ 6.99), it was not really worth it - no frights and very limited blood. The end was very cheesy and did not deliver the punch it should have. I really do not even know how it became a "video nasty" with how tame it is. The story draws, the characters are obvious lay actors ... they do not keep the promise. The DVD bonus feature (the "interview") is very strange as the director is very incoherent and not all there. The lead actress talks as if she were performing in a Shakespearean production. It's a big laugh.

summary: A hapless Navy grunt is assigned SP duty. The catch: he must escort a beautiful female prisoner on her way to prison for going UA. She in turn will try anything to escape.
translation:
What can I say?, ms Erika Eleniak is my favorite blonde girl of all time, and like an Italian American, fan number one of female beauty I can not forget this movie.

You know that I really do not 'I remember a lot the plot or the situations or the other actors. All I can remember is Drop Dead, the beautiful Erika and that she looks better in this movie than ever before, I do not care if it was a bad movie or a good movie, I'm just worried about the beautiful moments in Brooklyn I'm just thinking about Erika's beauty.

Well, in the end, if you're a beauty fan of Erika Eleniak like me, this movie is definitely for you.

summary: A man who has devoted himself to serving the leader of the free world is accused of plotting against him in this thriller. Pete Garrison (Michael Douglas) is a veteran Secret Service agent who has had a long and distinguished career helping protect the president of the United States. David Breckinridge (Kiefer Sutherland) is a fellow Secret Service agent who learned most of what he knows from Garrison and holds him in great respect. When intelligence data suggests that there is a mole within the Secret Service who is part of a plot to assassinate President Ballentine (David Rasche), Garrison launches an investigation to ferret out the rogue agent, and asks Breckinridge to go over the evidence with a fine-toothed comb. Breckinridge is shocked when the clues point to Garrison as the traitor within the Secret Service, but his sense of duty compels him to see that his former mentor is placed under arrest. Garrison eludes his captors and struggles to prove his innocence while tracking down...
translation: It is good. It's bad. And then it's The Sentinel, a political thriller that's one of the worst films I've ever seen. The act of a mole in the Secret Service is a good one, but never was a movie so thoroughly slaughtered with so much potential. Directed by Clark Johnson, every actor in this film is programmed on autopilot. Even the great Michael Douglas looks bored here. I can honestly say that I've NEVER seen another movie with so many glaring holes in my life. The phrase is predictable from the beginning, and the character's motives are so ridiculously ridiculous that they made the audience laugh. Avoid this at all costs. This is a disaster of a movie without loss of value.

summary: Forrest Gump is a simple man with a low I.Q. but good intentions. He is running through childhood with his best and only friend Jenny. His 'mama' teaches him the ways of life and leaves him to choose his destiny. Forrest joins the army for service in Vietnam, finding new friends called Dan and Bubba, he wins medals, creates a famous shrimp fishing fleet, inspires people to jog, starts a ping-pong craze, creates the smiley, writes bumper stickers and songs, donates to people and meets the president several times. However, this is all irrelevant to Forrest who can only think of his childhood sweetheart Jenny Curran, who has messed up her life. Although in the end all he wants to prove is that anyone can love anyone.
translation: How was this rip-off of Being There ever so beloved? People say it's proof that a decent, honest man can succeed despite lacking intelligence. You are wrong. The movie is the proof that happiness is everything: Hope your friend invests all your money in Apple and not Atari; hope your crab boat is the only one at sea when a storm breaks; Hope you do not die from a shock if fortunately you are shot in the buttocks and not in the back; I hope you do not get AIDS from your wife. This film is also politically reactionary - all those who rebel against social conventions lose their legs, make drugs, beat their girlfriends or die young. In addition, the product placement in this film (Nike and Dr. Pepper) is shameless. An emotionally manipulative film that is very, very empty.

summary: In part six of the Nightmare on Elm Street series, dream monster Freddy Krueger has finally killed all the children of his hometown, and seeks to escape its confines to hunt fresh prey. To this end, he recruits the aid of his (previously unmentioned) daughter. However, she discovers the demonic origin of her father's powers and meets Dad head-on in a final showdown (originally presented in 3-D).
translation:
Okay, that's stupid, they say they do not make another nightmare movie, that this is the "last" ... and what do they do? They keep on, not that the next (part 7) would be BAD, but why are they playing us? Anyway, this movie made no sense, even though it was extremely boring, the characters were very one-dimensional, Freddy was another joker, which is very stupid for such a good show. The plot is very, very bad, and that's even worse than part 2 and 5. I did not get the movie, it's a stupid story in 3-D, pointless! I hated this movie so much that I still listened to the parts I did not like, which was basically the whole movie. This is SO different from the prequels, it tries and tries, but this tried it hardest and was hit back in the face. There were some death scenes, though they were different, they sucked big.
