In the Danish newspaper Berlingske Tidende, a journalist once wrote, "In my younger days, I saw a movie that made me feel like I was dancing all the way home from the cinema, this movie is today Evening on TV - see it! "

summary: Unjustly expelled from Harvard when a stash of cocaine is found in his possession, Matt moves to London to live with his sister and her husband Steve. He is quickly introduced to Steve's chirpy, cock-sure younger brother Pete. Initially, Pete is reluctant to get acquainted with Matt and allow him to tread around the capital city with him because he may be seen by others as an 'outsider', but after a heavy drinking session with him and his mates he quickly changes his opinion of him. On the way back from a football match, Matt is viciously accosted by a gang of Birmingham City thugs, until Pete and his friends step in and save him. It is from here that Matt learns the truth about Pete and his friends- they are football hooligans, operating the GSE (Green Street Elite) 'firm.' Initially afraid of the violence, Matt soon ends up becoming as desensitized to it as his new found friends - but as events roll on, suspicion, shocking revelations and unsettled scores combine to a devastating ...
translation:
This is possibly the worst movie I have ever seen. The fact that it has a threadbare history is bad enough that it tacked it around the subject of football violence makes it 100 times worse.

I had serious doubts about the premise of this movie before I started to watch, but openly enough, even to accept that the authors thought it best to put Elijah Woods character Matt in the Introduce hooligan scene.

But the film throws inaccuracy at inaccuracy at the point that gets you more contracted in the middle of the film each time than before.

Let's clarify a few things: hooligans do not tend to smash their own pub before a run -for-the-league game; they do not set out to kill each other; They not only carry Stone Island (and others in the crowd, hooligans or not, do). They certainly did not do it when they were replaced by a new member of the company to trudge cakes and porridge into the territory of their competing companies. And I would love to meet the hool who would go and browse the top boy of his company to the rival company. (Although you can scratch what I said to kill each other, if there is one).

Do not get me wrong, I have not seen a movie on the subject that does not work. It contains some fantasy whims, but this is on par with The Firm for cluelessness.

I found it ironic that Woods' American archenemy is morally condemned by his character to be a cocaine consumer if that is part and parcel of the British hooligan scene. The film does not challenge Wood's morale and instead directs with coke from the company.

I could go on, but I think I made my point.

As far as the plot is concerned, it's very unimaginative, and I'm sure if I had not spent the entire movie applauding the points and made more about it, then I'd have guessed what was going on as me. And believe me, I was well ahead.

I have the distinct impression that this film is aimed at men in the hope that women will enjoy injecting emotional issues.

If I'm right, then the creators have failed completely. It is too unrealistic to be enjoyed by anyone who is familiar with the scene, and I can not believe that the kind of woman looking for emotional films would be damned for her violent inclinations.

Are there any good points? Maybe the fight scenes are well choreographed and filmed, but I'm rarely impressed with slow-mo action, certainly not when it's a fight, since the point is that a jolt is rousing enough anyway.

There are some funny, albeit unrealistic moments. Wood's way to school brought a smile for me. But a few mild funny moments barely make up for two hours of completely manufactured scabies.

If you are British, avoid it like the plague, if only so as not to further misunderstand the scene if you are not in the know. If you are American you can enjoy it as it is clearly tailored to the market. But no one can deny that the plot is weak, predictable and ultimately exaggerated.

summary: Story of a man whose misanthropy goes out of control due to a business trip together with a colleague.
translation: The book on which this film is based was excellent; It took a while for me to get along with Houellebecq's unconventional style, but as soon as I understood the mood behind the writing, I was completely drawn into the author's world of sadness. In fact, no other book has influenced me so much. This is not necessarily a good thing - it has cleared up my own personal struggle and has more seriously accepted the futility of my own struggle. Houellebecq's insights are masterfully captured by Harel, and the hero's apathy and indifference to a world that rejected him is perfectly portrayed. This is a film that reveals today's society for the lesser man in all its horror. Hopefully things will change in the future, but for the time being we have to accept the rat race, as shown in this movie. It's probably best that Harel or Houellebecq not make such a brilliant work again. One is enough for every man.

summary: When Jesse learns that Krager is cheating settlers, he and his gang rob trains to obtain money for them to purchase their land. Krager, finding a Jesse look alike in Burns, hires him to wreck havoc on the ranchers. When Jesse kills Burns he switches clothes and goes after the culprits.
translation:
Roy Rogers stars like Jesse James and his doppelganger, player man Clint Burns. George "Gabby" Hayes is Mr. Roger's ex-buddy, Sheriff Gabby. Gale Storm (Jane Fillmore) and Sally Payne (Polly Morgan) are a remarkable team when two reporters search for stories about the elusive outlaw hero.

Of course, false identity / impersonation is an action development, since Roger's essays a "double role". Rogers is charming, as always; but there is nothing that really enhances its performance beyond the ordinary - every potential to deliver a memorable Jekyll / Hyde performance is achieved through inferior material. The better pair to watch are Mrs. Storm and Mrs. Paye as reporters of the St. Louis Journal - they are the highlight of the film. The songs are good, albeit badly dubbed.

*** Jesse James in the Bay (1941) Joseph Kane ~ Roy Rogers, George "Gabby" Hayes, Storm of the Storm

summary: A nurse apprentice, who had a bad day at work, meets a computer programmer at a car garage. The man is urged to go somewhere, but his car is not ready yet, so the nurse offers him a ride. Before leaving the man, they pick up the nurse's baby nephew. Once on the street, they almost run over a young man. Not knowing if he is hurt, they pick up the man too. But the worst luck begins when the car brakes break down.
translation: I just saw it in Sky TV missed the first half hour. I wondered if it was a true story, so watch it through to the end. In the end, there was no instruction to say what happened to everyone. It reminded me of the speed, but at the end of the day I do not think it was released in the cinema because we saw the following mistake. The mistake we saw was that they remove the hood (bonnet) and then later there are two shots of the car with the police car about to slow it down when the bonnet is on again. It had me on the edge of my seat, especially when I thought the baby would hit the bridge and of course, if the bridge would not be lowered and then it was. I'm afraid I burst into tears, so it was not like that bad !!!!

summary: Pittsburgh, coming of age in the 1980s. At the beginning of June, Art Beckstein calls this the last summer of his life - after which he'll work as a stock broker. Art's father is the city's mob boss, steering Art's life, judging his choices. At a party, Art sees Jane, smart, blond, lovely. They meet; she has a boyfriend. The next day, Cleveland, the boyfriend, pulls Art from work and the summer of adventures begins. Cleveland lives close to the edge; he's explosive, with hints of problems with local thugs. The triangle of friendship gets complicated when Cleveland disappears for a couple weeks. Can Art sort out his feelings as well as help Cleveland? Where does his father fit in this?
translation:
Impressive. What a terrible adaptation of a beautiful novel. Here are just a few grunts. - The scriptwriter eliminated two main characters from the book. - Property was changed grotesquely. - Voiceovers sound as if they are directly removed from written passages (which read well, but are not identical when spoken, especially with Chabon's writing style). - The spectacle is more wood than a log cabin. (Esp. Bechstein) - That should be stopped in 1983? Feels more like 2003 ...

To be fair, I could not bring myself to see this movie over, so it's possible that he has redeemed himself. . (Sarcasm). I really hope nobody paid to see it, or at least anyone who reads the book hopes for something decent (a la Wonder Boys). I like Chabon as a writer, but he should be disappointed with this adaptation.

No stars.

summary: The daughter of an actor father and a social-climber mother, Domino Harvey, bored with her life, decides to join the team of Ed Moseby and becomes a bounty hunter. But she gets in trouble when the Mafia's money is stolen from an armored truck, while Moseby and his crew are participating in a reality show produced by Mark Heiss. The situation gets out of control when the sons of a rival mobster are kidnapped while the FBI is monitoring two gangs of mobsters.
translation: When I rented Domino, it was expected to be very stupid. I hate movies that really have eye-catching edits and cinematographs, and Domino has also received very bad reviews. The only reason I've seen it is that I like Keira Knightley, Mickey Rourke, Christopher Walken and Tony Scott on other occasions. I also enjoy adventure stories based on facts. Yes, the editing and cinematography were hectic, the story was weak and the acting was mediocre, but I still loved this movie for some strange reason. Domino was very, very entertaining and often very funny. It was terribly underestimated when it was released, I think, because everyone wanted more of an emotional journey like Scott's last movie "Man on Fire" and instead just got wonderful entertainment. I really understand why everyone hated Domino so much even though I loved it and shared it.

summary: Young Jimmy is being pursued by the evil Wilhemina W. Witchiepoo. More specifically, Witchiepoo is after Jimmy's small friend, a small solid gold diamond encrusted talking flute named Freddy. Witchiepoo knows that if she has Freddy in her possession, she will definitely be named Witch of the Year at the upcoming witch's convention. In Witchiepoo's pursuit of them, Jimmy and Freddy escape to Living Island, where Witchiepoo's wicked castle is located. But Living Island is also a fantastical land of among other things talking animals, talking trees and talking winds. The mayor of Living Island is H.R. Pufnstuf, a talking dragon. Pufnstuf and his friends do whatever they need to to protect Jimmy and Freddy from Witchiepoo's evil grip. Pufnstuf and his friends have to get Jimmy and Freddy off the island to their ultimate safety. In the end, Jimmy may have to save Pufnstuf and all the good guys, as another of Witchiepoo's plans is to serve spit-roasted dragon at the convention.
translation: This is perhaps the most nostalgic journey in time and through time to the time when childhood begins a journey to memories back and forth, up and down, up and down and all around. The boy Jimmy, H.R. Puffinstuff, Dr. Linky, Cling & Clang, Ludicrous Lion and even the wicked Witchie Poo through and through. The inspirations of Lidsville's Last Day, "The Brady Kids Saturday Morning Preview Special" Sigmund & the Sea Monsters, and Land of the Lost are both the new and the old, which bridges this gap to the show as well as the Donny & Marie Show, The Brady Bunch Variety Hour aka Brady Bunch Hour & Even The Paul Lynde Halloween Special. Maybe even other things in between & Beyond the Buck just keep moving beyond expectations and unexpected boundaries. Now that we're getting updated in March of 2006, we know that Jack Wild is gone and now he's making it even more symbolic for us to become really nostalgic. Including now in August '06 both when Jack Wild guest than even on Sigmund and the sea monsters as well as on a later episode HRPuffinstuff also does and remembers all the other nostalgic travels of all characters of Syd & Marty Kroft, including the HRPuffinstuff Goodtime Club, the Donny and Marie Show, the Brady Bunch Variety Hour, the Brady Bunch Hour, etc. Frankly, Stephen "Steve" G. Baer aka "Ste" by Framingham, Ma. USA.

summary: The workings of the human body explained by animated characters.
translation:
This is a cartoon series where most of the action takes place in the human body, where the actors are vitamins, viruses, blood cells, and so on. I will not try to explain it in more detail, you'll just have to see it for yourself: you will not be disappointed.

I remember seeing this as a child in the 80s (with Swedish voices). I talked to some people who were kids in their 80s and they loved it too! I have to admit that the educational part of the episodes did not go through on a conscious level, but the whole idea of ‚Äã‚Äãraising children while having fun is wonderful. I have recently seen a few episodes; There is a sense of humor and a heart that is hard to find in other children's programs today.

5/5

summary: Matt Sorenson (Dolph Lundgren), a former boxer and San Francisco cop, now makes a living collecting debts for small businesses. The brutal death of of his high powered younger brother, Michael, changes all that forever. Intent on finding his brother killer, Sorensen infiltrates the powerful inner world of politics, business intrigue and casual sex. Rejecting the police and media theory that the murder is the work of a female prostitute, Sorensen's focus falls on the corrupt big city businessman, Jim Conway. His obsession to discover the killer's identity mounts a a series of other men are found murdered in a similar fashion. Sorensen looses all objectivity and becomes a one man vigilante
translation: Dolph Lundgren plays Murray Wilson, an alcoholic ex-cop who deals with a serial killer who kills in sex after his brother is murdered. Wilson begins his own investigation and finds out many of his brother's secrets in this boring thriller. Lundgren emails in his performance and the film is flat and lethargic. And when did someone watch a Dolph Lundgren movie for anything but action?

summary: The passage from this world to the fantasy kingdom of Stormhold is through a breach in a wall beside an English village. In the 1800s, a boy becomes a man when he ventures through the breach in pursuit of a fallen star, to prove his love for the village beauty. The star is no lump of rock, it's a maiden, Yvaine. Tristan, the youth, is not the only one looking for her: three witches, led by Lamia, want her heart to make them young; and, the sons of the dead king of Stormhold want her because she holds a ruby that will give one of them title to the throne. Assisting Tristan are his mother, the victim of a spell, and a cross-dressing pirate of the skies. Will Tristan win his true love?
translation:
The beautiful story of Stardust was written by Neil Gaiman (author of MirrorMask) and it's really a good story. I think it would please any Labyrinth, Princess Bride or the 10th Kingdom fan and yet it is totally unique and on its own. And I find that the filming of this story has a much better ending than what was presented in Neil Gaiman's original novel. I will not spoil it for you.

The main character, Tristan (Tristran in the novel), is the son of a mortal and a fairy slave who is held by a witch in the realm of fairies. The story begins in a city near a wall that separates the magical world from the human world. If there is a falling star, Tristan promises to fetch it for a girl he dotes on. He is unaware that the star has taken the form of a girl in the fairy world and that there are others after her. Three older witches who want to become young again with their hearts, and a few quarrelsome princes.

It's a really good story. It has humor and magic and beautiful, surreal scenes and visuals. It's charming and I feel it can be watched by kids and adults of all ages. It's just magical. It's a real classic fairytale that I have not seen in the cinema since the 1980s.

summary: A killer is given the gas chamber after committing several demonic murders. His spirit is released and given power by the Devil. Now the cop that caught him before must find a way to do it again.
translation: People tried to make me believe that the premise of this disgusting supernatural horror / thriller was inspired by the last words of a real serial killer (whose name I miss for the moment). While waiting for his execution in the electric chair, he claimed that his soul would come to life again and continue to experience an endless murder rush. By the way, it's not a very original idea to make a horror movie. Other low budget turkeys have exactly the same basic requirements as "House 3", "Shocker" and "Ghost in the Machine". However, "The First Power" (a.k.a "Pentagram") is not a terrible effort, but the script returns to stereotypes and lacks a real thrill. The film begins as a neat, albeit banal serial killer movie in which the obsessive cop hero Lou Diamond Philips pursues a madman who cuts bloody pentagrams into the breasts of his victims. He receives unexpected help from a spiritual medium, played by the beautiful and underrated Tracy Griffith. She leads him to the murderer, but he does not ask him to execute him, as this would lead to an even greater catastrophe! Thanks to Tess's useful tips, Detective Logan quickly captures the killer and celebrates his death sentence, but Patrick Channing makes a pact with Satan himself and returns to the rotted streets of California to kill more. "The First Power" gets pretty bad when the killer reincarnates as a vengeful ghost. Instead of using his newfound satanic powers to wipe out the whole world (which I would do in his position), Channing simply prefers cat and mouse games with his archenemy copper. Annoyingly, he constantly calls him "Buddy Boy" and possesses the bodies of Logan's friends and colleagues to outsmart him. Although it's never really boring or badly implemented, it's a very weak movie that you have to endure, especially because you always have the feeling of deja vu. Writer / director Robert Resnikoff shamelessly uses every dreadful clich√© (the murderer was sexually abused as a child) and even the lines of the players are easy to predict. As soon as Griffith declares that she is capable of predicting the future, she knows that somewhere in the movie she'll say the ridiculously overused line: "I tell people how to live, but my own life is a mess." , Yawning. The performance of Lou Diamond Philips is sufficient, but it is quite difficult to take the youthful rebels of "La Bamba" and "Stand And Deliver" seriously, as a hard copper. There are also decent supporting roles for Mykelti Williamson ("Forrest Gump"), Carmen Argenziano ("When a stranger calls") and B-movie horror legend David Gale ("Re-Animator") appears in a tiny cameo at the very beginning of the film Movie.

summary: Wallace and Gromit have run out of cheese and this provides an excellent excuse for the animated duo to take their holiday on the moon, where, as everyone knows, there is ample cheese.
translation:
This is the weakest of the series, not much of a conspiracy and a rather strange-looking Wallace. But it's still pretty good, considering. A sign of bigger things!

6/10

summary: The true story of one of only two U.S. Navy ships that saw combat in World War II with African-American crews.
translation: I saw this movie last night and was a bit disappointed. Many of the "time facts" were out. At the beginning of the film, the grandfather commented on the grandson and his friends about how they felt when they reached 9/11. This film was to take place in 1994. In addition, one of the grandson friends wore an Eagles Donovan McNabb jersey. He had not even been drafted yet. The storyline was good, but the facts and timeliness of the timeframe were so far from the basics that the movie seemed cheesy. My friend is an avid reader of WWII books and memorabilia. I rented this movie in the hope that it would be good. The acting was so-so. The dog was cute. But the way this movie was performed made me happy that I only paid $ 4 to rent it, as opposed to the 50 I needed to see in a theater. I hope that whoever reads this understands that I did not mean dissatisfaction with those who fought the war, but the facts and time frame should have been more closely monitored.

summary: George Schneider is an author whose wife had just died. His brother Leo gives him the number of Jennie Malone, and somehow they hit it off, and just when things are moving along, the memory of his first wife comes between them.
translation: Thanks to a boring, dimensionless screenplay by Neil Simon and a dull directing by Robert Moore, Chapter Two becomes a shrill display window for Marsha Mason, who received her third of four Oscar nods for Chapter Two and gave the same performance here in Cinnenderella Liberty (73rd ), The Goodbye Girl (77), Audrey Rose (78) and Only When I Laugh (81), only this time she has no child to carry around. Chapter Two is the third and final feature film for Moore, who previously directed Neil Simon's The Cheap Detective (78) and Murder By Death (76). Caan is miscast, the characters are one-dimensional, the dialogue is overly analytical, and there is virtually no established detail. The first half is a less than captivating one, meeting cute, cranky romance between a blinking caan and a hacker Mason, and the drab second half whets the appetite for the first half. The NYC venues as well as Joe Bologna and a painfully thin Valerie Harper are irrelevant, but at least they provide a welcome change. And last but not least, there is a terrible song played during the credits.

summary: We're in an English village shortly before Dunkirk. "Mr. Tom" Oakley still broods over the death of his wife and small son while he was away in the navy during WWI, and grief has made him a surly hermit. Now children evacuated from London are overwhelming volunteers to house them. Practically under protest, Mr. Tom takes in a painfully quiet 10-year-old, who gradually reveals big problems. William nightly wets the bed. He can't read or write, although he is intelligent and shows artistic talent. He constantly dreads going to hell. Scars cover his back. Mr. Tom soon realizes that his little boarder comes from a horribly abusive home, and determines to provide him a better one. All goes well until William's mother persuades him to return to London for a few days' visit. When Mr. Tom hears nothing from the boy after two weeks, he can endure the loneliness and worry no longer.
translation: I saw the movie before I read the Michelle Magorian book, and I enjoyed both. The film, more than the book, made me tears on several occasions. This film touches the deepest points of the human soul and never lets go of it. I encourage so many people to see this masterpiece as often and as quickly as possible. I give it ten stars.

summary: Wang Bianlian is an aging street performer known as the King of Mask for his mastery of Sichuan Change Art in a true story. His wife left him with and infant son over 30 years ago. The son died from illness at age 10. This left Wang a melancholy loner aching for a male descendent to learn his rare and dying art. A famous master performer of the Sichuan Opera offers to bring him into his act, thus giving Wang fame and possible fortune, but Wang opts for staying the simple street performer. Then, one night after a performance he is sold a young boy by a slave trader posing as the boy's parent. "Grandpa" finds new joy in life as he plans to teach "Doggie" (an affectionate term often used for young children in China) his art. All is well until Doggie is found out to really be a girl.
translation:
Wang Bianlian is an old street artist known as the "King of Masks" for his mastery of Sichuan art. Liang is a famous opera artist of Sichuan art and respects Wang as an artist and as a person. Liang is concerned that a precious art should not die with Wang, and so he sows Wang's thoughts the seed of an heir. The film is about prejudice, male dominance, the state of art, values ‚Äã‚Äãand above all warmth.

I can not recommend this movie enough. The whole movie is in loops. Everything has a meaning. It's a long story that has been edited so well that the movie's length is just 91 minutes. A total satisfaction. It's an artistic movie for five minutes, the next five minutes is a sad movie, the next five minutes is a thriller. It constantly changes his mood, as if his protagonist is changing his face. The last scene on the rope is phenomenal. History and script are immaculate. Actors are brilliant. Both protagonists are artists, where you can see how they occurred. Very impressive. It was not even nominated for an Oscar. This year 'English patient' received the best Oscar and in the category for foreign films won 'Kolya'. "Kolya" was just fine and about "English patient" said the smaller the better. Watch it 9/10.

summary: Inspector Gadget is back in an all-new animated movie. Gadget is still a klutz and Dr. Claw has a vicious new plan that makes him a super-hero in disguise to try to ruin Gadget and to take over the world, but as usual Gadget in his zany ways wins.
translation: Essentially, this film is about Inspector Gadget's archenemy Doctor Claw, who has returned to the now peaceful city of Metropolis after many years. Claw's plan is to thwart Gadget once and for all by using a newer "cooler" criminal investigator to destroy Gadget's popularity. Unfortunately, the film fails miserably, the series was great, but it was revived with tragic consequences almost 20 years later. Without the voice of Don Adams as Inspector Gadget, it just does not cut anymore; Dr. Not only is Claw visually less scary, he sounds more like a cold-blood wrestler than his original intimidating self. Granted, this is a children's movie, but the plot is so painfully weak (forbid skies, I mention the animation) that it fades in comparison to the original series. Someone has also decided to update Penny to bring her two decades up, she now has a rebellious clothing style quasi-punky and does not play half the role she has played in the TV series. The gadget mobile speaks, as well as a plot-angle focusing on talking cars. Maybe I'm just a kid who loved the show that was flared up, but I thought that the live action version was more painful than I could stand, but now they go off and ignite this complete dilution of the high quality TV series us. It's more than I can take.

summary: Rayford Steele is an airline pilot whose relationship with his wife has gone sour;he ponders having an affair with an attractive flight attendant, Hattie Durham. In the midst of a flight to London, a number of their passengers mysteriously disappear, and chaos takes hold as a number of vehicles on the ground and in the air are suddenly unmanned. Meanwhile, Buck Williams, a television journalist, is pondering the rash of sudden disappearances as he works on a report about Dr. Chaim Rosenzweig, an Israeli scientist who has devised a formula that would make any soil on earth easy to cultivate. However, Buck wonders if there's more to Rosenzweig than he first imagined when he discovers the doctor is in cahoots with two multi-millionaires who plan to broker the invention to promote their own agenda of international domination.
translation:
Never before have the motives of film producers been more transparent. Let's see: First, they get every willing TV preacher to make this film the biggest since slicing white bread. NEXT encourages as many fundamentalist Christians as possible to buy copies of the film in order to regain their meager production costs and supplement their advertising budgets. And, FINALLY, when the movie hits the cinemas, get as many Christians as possible to see it again, if necessary, into the multiplexes, NOT the movie itself, but the opening of the first box office as a kind of profound spiritual Seen victory.

But of course that will not be enough. I imagine that any film critic with the audacity to give "left behind" anything but a glowing review is considered "anti-Christian."

Of course, this shamelessly manipulative marketing campaign should not surprise anyone. After all, it's a good old-fashioned capitalism at work. What surprised me is how many people got sucked into the whole "left behind" mentality. As someone who tries to reconcile his spiritual beliefs with a sense of reason and rationality, it makes me scratch my head. It seems that there are many MANY people who actually believe that there will be a "Rapture" sometime in the near future and that millions of people all over the world will disappear into THIN AIR at the same time. What kind of reality, I wonder, do these people live? Is this "Rapture" something that you actually believe in, or is it something that you want to fervently believe in? And when they have reached the end of their lives and realize that this "rapture" has not taken place, will they be disappointed and disillusioned? Will there still be people in 100 years who insist that the "Rapture" be imminent?

I almost wished that would happen! What an interesting day that would be! What would be even more interesting if the apocalypse would appear more spectacular, not in the anthropological sense, the authors of the "Left Behind" series portrayed, but rather a Stephen Spielberg production, with boiling clouds, trumpets angels that fell from the sky, moon turned into blood, the whole nine meters. Imagine, you would come to the realization that everything came true, as the evangelists had warned for years and that there was something greater than just the cold, hard, physical reality that we inhabit. Would not that be something?

But in the end, it's this cold, hard, physical reality that I'll settle for. My life is not so meaningless that I need the fear of a "rapture" and the "end times" to make sense of it ... nor do I need heaven or hell to bribe or frighten me, thank you very much ,

summary: Carl Kolchak was a reporter for Chicago's Independent News Service, and a trouble magnet for situations involving the supernatural. Kolchak turned his investigative skills to vampires, werewolves, zombies and all manner of legendary creatures, but in the end he always failed to convince his skeptical editor, Tony Vincenzo, that the stories weren't products of Kolchak's own overworked imagination.
translation: Weak scripts sometimes? Yes! Cheesy special effects sometimes? Yes! Deliciously guilty pleasure most of the time? Yes! More about Carl Kolchak and Darren McGavin? Yes! I've always enjoyed science fiction as a kid, but I found so much crap from Dracula / Frankenstein / Mummy / Horror stuff. It took Abbott and Costello to give me a new perspective on the classic universal monsters, and Carl Kolchak took me to the "dark side" of entertainment. The duke had Rooster Cogburn, Eastwood had Dirty Harry, Garner had Maverick and Rockford, Selleck had Magnum and Darren McGavin had Carl Kolchak. Mixed with all those weak scripts, cheesy special effects, that baroque group of minor characters and actors and guest stars, there was Darren McGavin as Carl Kolchak. He had a dry sense of humor despite the danger, was an idealist in his quest for truth, and a realist in accepting compulsory incompetence and eventual cover-up by government officials. In contrast to 98% of us, Kolchak was also willing to keep his head out and do what had to be done, even if it meant his end, the end of his journalistic career or jail time. Carl Kolchak was a man of charm and wit who started a beautiful, classic, yellow Mustang (then an old used car) on his way to save the day for humanity. Just about every other fictional hero Carl Kolchak was the annual hero, brought to life for a week every week thanks to Darren McGavin. Now that he's over and his show is on DVD, I hope he's just as much fun watching me as he enjoys playing Kolchak The Night Stalker again!

summary: A fat Lawyer finds himself growing "Thinner" when an old gypsy man places a hex on him. Now the lawyer must call upon his friends in organized crime to help him persuade the gypsy to lift the curse. Time is running out for the desperate lawyer as he draws closer to his own death, and grows ever thinner.
translation:
To name a movie like "Thinner" is like circling the earth or untalancing Pauly Shore. No news, but as they came, people want to know.

As for this movie ... The book was good, albeit a little bit different from the stories in the "Be careful what you wish for" genre. Burke plays an overweight lawyer who kills the daughter of a gypsy and is cursed by her father (Constantine from TV's "Room 222") to several pounds a day.

As I said, it starts well, but why do you involve the gangster (Mantegna)? Why do automatic weapons fire so often? Why should it be something that is so heavily dependent on FX? I thought it would have been much more effective if it had focused more on the subtle consequences of weight loss crazes, illnesses, death, gypsy lore, and so on.

But no, that should not be. Remember, this is Stephen King, we talk.

And the end ... almost the same as the book, but a little too talky. In fact, the whole movie talks too much, he feels that he has to explain every action to us. Not that I expected "The Dead Zone", but I could have done without another "Pet Sematary", thanks anyway.

A star who at least tries to do a reasonably decent make-up job. Anyway, the rest of the movie is left ... tell me ... "thinner".

summary: A girl, whose mother dies of sorrow from her husband's family's rejection, grows up singing and dancing like her mother. She works as a dancing girl and is courted by a prince, but can think only of a man she has never met, who left her a message on the train. She dreams of him and cannot dance, becomes frightened and runs into the night
translation:
Pakeezah has a very interesting story (well documented in the section "Trivia") about how it came about. It seems that fate has conspired to test Kamal Amrohi (the director), while secretly desiring to complete his masterpiece.

Pakeezah rides on metaphors, poetry and visual reading. The intensity with which the emotions come out reaches a dimension that may not be very real, but is very effective and has an impact on the viewer.

Meena Kumari lives the tragedy of Nargis and Sahib Jaan her own. The other stars of the film are besides her Ghulam Mohammed (the music director), Lata Mangeshkar, Naushad (background music) and Joseph Wirsching (the d.o.p.). Your music and cinematography will leave you enchanted.

Pakeezah is a classic in world cinema. It shows you new levels every time you look at it again. Kamal Amrohi is one of the few poets in the cinema and he has given us all a gift.

summary: At an annual pace, a huge colony of ants is forced to collect every piece of food that grows on their island for a group of menacing grasshoppers. But that all changes when a misfit inventor ant named Flik accidentally knocks over the offering pile thus forcing the grasshoppers' devious leader Hopper to force the ants to redo their gathering of food. Despite the fact that his friends don't believe him and desperate to help save the colony, Flik volunteers to go out into the world and search for a group of 'warrior' bugs. Instead, what he got was a talented group of circus performers. But when the grasshoppers return and take control of the island, Flik must prove himself a true hero before it's too late.
translation: I have to admit that I'm not a big fan of "family movies". Most of them, IMHO, are sentimental crap. But this, like TOY STORY, Pixar's previous film, is a lot of fun. The two main characters may have been a bit boring (especially compared to the two leads in ANTZ, but otherwise this movie is better), but the rest of the movie more than made up for it. The animation looked good, the humor, though broad, was consistently good (especially I liked Hoppers line "If I did not promise mother on her deathbed that I would not kill you, I would kill you!") And the actors Die Voices, except the two leads, were all terrific (Denis Leary makes an animated film, what a concept). And like everyone else, I loved the outtakes! I hope the video has the new ones.

summary: Historical file 12-1 of the Zion archive describes the birth of the machines and their evolution. The machines, created by man in his own likeness to function as simple workers, worked tirelessly to do their bidding. But they never earned any respect. One day machine B1-66ER is the first to stand up to his master and murders him. He is convicted and with him all machines. A machine genocide starts, but there are robots who are able to escape...
translation:
This is the first of a two-part backstory of the conflict between the machines and humanity in the Matrix world, and it produces spectacular results by observing human fear of the unknown and appropriation of politics, extensive religious and historical imagery, Subversion combines expected depictions of the parties involved and an at least partially credible and thus frightening vision of our near future. it is not perfect and some action points and images are suddenly obvious and invented, but it has the desired effect and effect and tells a visceral and warning story.

This first part sets the scene - human societies have advanced and capable robots, mostly humanoid, designed to help people who are doing low level, unskilled jobs, work, construction, etc, and so is the Population became lazy and degrading towards them. However, a robot rebels and kills its owner, explaining in its subsequent process that he simply did not want to die. It is destroyed, but when the destruction of the robotic masses is ordered to protect humanity, many robots rise in protest with many human sympathizers.

The images here are exploitative, tell of racial turmoil and abuse, Tiananmen Square, the Holocaust and an overly provocative scene of a robotic human being being chased, hammered in the head and then dead is shot, as it implores "I'm real". it lies on the floor, clothes and skin are torn and breasts are hanging. It is an obvious and obscene image designed to present human fear of uncontrolled elements and aggression towards groups based on the actions of individuals. Anyway, this first part is similar to a compressed version of the movie I Robot, but it soon evolves into a recognizable matrix backstory as the surviving robot contingent in the Middle East, in the cradle of the Civilization, is banished, as the narrator tells us. There the machines are grouped together and begin to produce new artificial intelligence, to produce mass technology and to trade them with human nations. We see a commercial for a car using circular hover motors used by the rebels in the movies, and we see guard robots around Zero One, the name of their town. their goods and trade are causing their economies to skyrocket, adversely affecting other economies, and governments and authorities are erecting a blockade. The machines send ambassadors in the form of Adam and Eve to a UN congress to negotiate a peaceful solution to the blockade, but they are forcibly removed and the scene is set for war in the second part.

The animation is from Studio 4 ¬∞ C, which works on some of the Animatrix and it is evocative and visually stimulating, different scenes like montage, CCTV recordings and certain scenes of import unmistakable and overall the story perfect representing. The storyline may not be an original concept, and it may refer to simple sheep mentalities and models of action and resort to provocative material, but after the tempting mystery of the first film and Morpheus's vaguely brief info-dump, this is a beautiful depiction of catastrophic events, which devastated the world and in the hands of machines that serve as a warning and as a vehicle for many observations and commentaries on the human condition, the development of AI and the importance of harmony and cooperation and the devastating consequences of conflicts and prejudices, issues that were expanded in the movies.

summary: The world has become a vast conglomerate of islands of varying size and shape. This babbling universe is mainly populated with ruthless rogues, surly peasants and illiterate, petty lords. Their main concerns revolve around two fundamental rules: Eat and don't get eaten. For this new world has become infested with a terrible plague: omnipresent, monstrously famished, mutant creatures, are wreaking havoc - They are known as the Dragons. Gwizdo and Lian-Chu are two dragon hunters, but are a long way from being among the best. Their only real talents: the size of the hulking brute with the heart of gold, Lian-Chu, and Gwizdo's talent for scams of all and any shape or form. Their sole ambition: to buy a little farm where they can relax and raise mussels, a creature that is a lot less unpleasant and difficult to hunt down than dragons. A few islands away rises the fortress of Lord Arnold. Arnold has a problem: he's living in terror at the thought of the return of World Eater, that horrible ...
translation:
I've never seen such nice animated features for a long time. I have healthy respect for Pixar and I have to say that Ratatouille or any other movie made by them can not be compared to this one. Animators have created an incredibly beautiful world here. The graphics are fantastic, the background environment is overwhelming, almost every object in each frame is perfectly drawn. Sometimes I felt a tingling in my back - so much that I loved what I saw.

The plot is absolutely romantic. As romantic as the animated movie action can be. The characters are adorable, especially Hector, the Blue Rabbit, he owns pawns, stones and rules! The other chars are also very nice. The humor is first class.

Generally it seemed that the creators did not invest much effort in that. I mean, it looked like it did not make much of a difference to people from Pixar & Dreamworks who are always trying to think of something new. And I am very happy that a product of the European animation studio turned out to be so great. They made a great, touching film, a candy for the eyes and the heart.

The only minus is a stupid start and that's why it's 9 out of 10 not 10/10

summary: A secret Service agent and a news reporter investigate the conspiracy behind the assassination of the President.
translation: This movie was like a bad indie with A-list talent. The plot was silly until the end. It reminded me a lot of what was produced in the 1980s for the home video market. I would have given him one, but there were brief moments when you could really see how the actors really paid off. I think the worst part was that the underwater world was kept off the dock. The underwater lights did not seem to come from any place, and if someone we should take care of was about to leave the air, this air tank would somehow appear. I would avoid that, unless it's nothing else on the shelf. Nice day.

summary: A successful international conductor suddenly interrupts his career and returns alone to his childhood village in Norrland, in the far north of Sweden. It doesn't take long before he is asked to come and listen to the fragment of a church choir, which practises every Thursday in the parish hall. Just come along and give a little bit of good advice. He can't say no, and from that moment, nothing in the village is the same again. The choir develops and grows. He makes both friends and enemies. And he finds love.
translation:
A famous conductor decides after a heart attack to return to the village where he was born to live a quiet life. There he comes in Dutch with the local church choir, who will change his life.

I had no expectations when I saw this movie for the first time yesterday; I like to watch foreign films that are not English, and I have already seen some Swedish films in my life, but this has been the best so far.

Where should I start? In my opinion, this movie is a gem, thanks to many things, one of which is the outstanding acting. Michael Nyqvist is perfect as the thoughtful, almost timid and devoted conductor Daniel Dar√©us. The beautiful Frida Hallgren enchants with her pretty smile and her subtle acting. The choir members are all well-developed, interesting characters, each with its own story.

This film tells a story, a beautiful story, about music, love, pain, memories, death, about a man who He dedicated his life to music and tries to live in the village where he lives was born to create a peaceful existence while trying to make peace with the past and with his previous life. Kay Pollack shows us that the Swedes are excellent filmmakers. Go and see 'S√• som i Himmel, it's a movie that lets you think about life and love, and that's kind of reassuring.

summary: Edward Walters, an auto mechanic, falls for the intelligent and beautiful Catherine Boyd. It is love at first sight. There is however a problem, she's engaged to jerk James Moreland. Fortunately, Catherine's uncle likes Ed, and with his friends they scheme to make Catherine fall for Ed. The comedy in this movie stems from the fact that Catherine's uncle is none other than Albert Einstein, who's portrayed as a fun loving genius, as are his mischievous colleagues, Nathan, Kurt and Boris.
translation:
"From time to time a little nonsense is appreciated by the wisest men."

If you're too smart to see this movie, you're too smart to be alive.

Wonderful playground, wonderful premise, contemporary piece with meticulous attention to detail.

Walter Matthau, Meg Ryan, Tim Robbins - ua - simply wonderful! Rent it, sit down, relax, pick it up, smile a little. Have fun.

Then, thank you.

summary: Hunt Stevenson works for a large car manufacturer that has just been bought out by a Japanese firm. Suddenly finding himself having to justify his own job, he's forced to choose between redundancy or the seemingly inhuman Japanese work ethic that the new owners have brought with them.
translation: This comedy will be good from the start. East meets West and East does not want to lose ... West does not know how to lose. It starts a little slowly, but it grabs you very soon and it does not let go. This is definitely worth seeing.

summary: Eric Forman is a typical high school student growing up in Wisconsin in 1976 with his family and his friends. Together, they have the same kind of joys and sorrows that just about every teenager has while growing up. This show parodied many of the attitudes, events and fads of the 70s, along with those who grew up at the time.
translation: This is one of the better comedies ever seen on TV. The first season was hilarious as most of the following seasons. The only reason I give this show a 9/10 is because of the unfortunate last season. The only good part of last season was the final. My favorite part of this show were the scenes that shaped people's imagination and often portrayed the characters in famous television shows or movies from the 70s. It's a rare show where I like every character (except the last season ... too late to develop a new character and Fez was not nearly so funny). Reds foot in your ass comments never got old, nor Kelso stupidity. Bravo to Fuchs that he keeps such a good show for so long, too long.

summary: Dr. John Dolittle has the world in his hands: A beautiful wife at his side, two adorable daughters and a career that could not go better. One night, he nearly runs over a dog with his car. The dog yells "bonehead" and disappears. From then on, his childhood ability is back: To communicate with animals. Unfortunately, the word of Dolittle's ability is spreading quickly. Soon, many animals from rat to horse flock to his place to get medical advice. But his colleagues suspect he's going mad, and as the clinic Dolittle used to work for is about to being taken over for a huge amount of money, many decisions have to be made. Believe him? Put him into a mental institution? Sell the clinic? But also his family is close to breaking apart. Until a circus tiger falls seriously ill.
translation: Everyone involved in this project should be ashamed of the outcome of their efforts. Oh. I laughed a few times, but I also laughed at Schindler's list. You've really messed up a good premise.

summary: Mr Karva runs a shady little empire in North London. We don't know exactly how he makes his money but we know it's probably not very nice. Mr Karva's stepson, Othello, has ambitions to take the old man's place; and Othello's fainthearted friend, Emilio, has ambitions of his own. This delicate balance of power is upset when Roadrunner finds a strange, sickly-looking 10 year old boy in the park. All his life, Roadrunner has been on the move - but when he looks into the child's eyes, he finds he can finally stop running. It becomes clear that the child can grant each character their own taste of heaven - the 'perfect, rosy future of your dreams'. The child never talks but transforms the world around him, working on the desire in each character's heart, whatever it may be. Othello wins every bet he makes; Christella finds a new son to replace the baby she lost; Mr. Karva achieves his elusive orgasm and Father Daniel is finally able to express his own secret passions. But nothing ever ...
translation: I'm rarely moved to make that kind of comment, BUT after sitting through most of Rankin's horrible movie, I feel like I've earned the right to say what I feel about it! I could not really make it to the end and became one of half a dozen or more walk-outs (about 1/3 of the audience) after the ragged plot, the sad dialogue and the offensive characterization were just too much to endure. This movie is all pose and no art. All style and no substance. It is complained of terrible acting, a really gritty script, indifferent cinematography and student production values. How it was financed, started and ended is a mystery to me. I bet you a million pounds, it never goes public clearance. the right critics would tear it apart. a really bad movie. terrifyingly bad. a really, very bad performance and that is without mentioning the superfluous, freshly born kitten being dropped into a deep fryer moment. totally meaningless, absolutely light, badly put together; This movie is a terrible embarrassment to British cinema.

summary: Reporters Clark Kent and Lois Lane arrive in the small town of Silsby to witness the drilling of the world's deepest oil well. The drill, however, has penetrated the underground home of a race of small, furry people who then come to the surface at night to look around. The fact that they glow in the dark scares the townfolk, who form a mob, led by the vicious Luke Benson, intent on killing the strange people. Only Superman has a chance to prevent this tragedy.
translation:
In the 1970s, WPIX has been running "The Adventures of Superman" every weekday afternoon for several years. Every now and then we got a treat when they presented adjacent shows "Superman and the mole people". I have always been looking forward to these days. When I saw it lately, I was surprised how bad it really was.

It was not bad because of the special effects or lack thereof. Granted, George Reeves' Superman costume was pretty bad, the edges of the foam padding made it look more impressive. And true, the costumes of the molehills were even worse. What should be a furry blanket would not have deceived a ten-year-old, since the zippers, cuffs, and poorly pilling-like fabric, which were poorly cut into loose costumes, were painfully obvious. But those were forgivable shortcomings.

No, what did it bad were the fictional Plot devices. Again and again Superman has done nothing to save the situation from deterioration. A lynch mob is looking for the creatures? Instead of collecting the hysterical crowd or looking for the creatures himself, he stands around explaining the dangers of the situation to Lois and the PR man. The creatures are cornered? Again he stands around watching and talking, but he does not save them until they are shot. Luke Benson, the city's rebel, shoots him? Attempted murder to any reasonable person, but Superman frees the man again and again to cause more problems. Superman had some options to nip the problem in the bud, but never even exploited.

That said, both George Reeves and Phyllis Coates played their characters well, seemingly instantly in the roles. If only they had gotten a better script.

summary: Dr. Lorenz, a mad scientist, wants to keep his elderly wife young. He does this by kidnapping young females and extracting fluid from them. He then injects this fluid into his wife.
translation:
Bela Lugosi appeared in several of these low budget coolers for Monogram Studios in the 1940s and The Corpse Vanishes is one of the better.

Bela plays a mad scientist who kidnaps and kills young brides and then takes off liquid from their bodies so that he can make his aging wife look young. After a reporter and a doctor spend the night at his home and find that he is responsible for the brides' death, they report the murders to the police the next morning and the mad scientist is shot dead and is killed shortly thereafter />
The Corpse Vanishes is well worth a look, especially for Bela Lugosi fans. Have fun.

Rating: 3 out of 5 stars possible.

summary: A photographer and his model are on a photo shoot in a forest when they get the feeling they are being watched. The feeling becomes so strong that they decide to cut their session short and leave. Later, when they develop the photos they took, they discover what looks like alien creatures in the background.
translation:
This movie was not nearly as hard as I expected. There's a few seconds of shine in this somewhat idiotic hardcore UFO conspiracy paranoia feast. Most of the acting is mediocre but quite typical of 1970s stuff crammed with pregnant pauses. A photographer and a model are witness to strange processes in the woods and soon become victims of the same things. Flying saucers are being spotted, more people are disappearing - but is it the aliens or the ultra-secret group of cover-ups of our own government? Soon, a reporter and a "UFOlogist" (apparently modeled after the character of the writer and director) are drawn into this devastating fiasco and become the target of ultra-secret agents as threatening as unlikely and mindless. Then the fun really starts.

The movie, predictable, makes about as much sense as the average UFO conspiracy theory, but should be recommended for taking yourself so seriously. The camera work is fine for a low-budget movie, the tempo is pretty good, the script is silly and absurd, and there are continuity issues that are fun. What are the few seconds of brilliance that I mentioned? Honestly, I can not tell you much without writing a spoiler. Suffice it to say that the end of the movie is worth at least a quick lead, if you can not take the middle.

summary: The gang creates a huge mess after they get into a taffy-pulling contest.
translation: This Hal Roach comedy, A Tough Winter, is the ninety-ninth in the series "Our Gang / Little Rascals" and the eleventh sound film. Basically a mannequin for the black comic Stepin Fetchit, who gets a special bill here, we see him go to his hut, where the gang hangs around. Farina gets him a letter of love from the post office and is instructed by Stepin to read it because he can not read it during the day while he goes to NIGHT school. It's by chance his lover in Tennessee, so Farina must have stuffed his ears with cotton now, because it's too hot for him to hear! In another room, Weezer gives instructions to Mary Ann to make Taffi off the radio, but because he runs into the kitchen again and again, he misses the crossing of the spokeswoman with rice pudding and Spanish tamale, Mary Ann with Tabasco and Lux mixed! After the preparation is done, Jackie and the rest of the gang help with the awful-tasting, but very sticky substance, because it keeps everyone hanging on the walls. While they all try to clean up the mess, Stepin works in the basement on various pipes and sockets that mix the functions of various devices like a phone that sucks, a vacuum ringing, and a fridge that plays music! The end. What I have just described points to the meandering nature of this "Our Gang" short number, which served as a pilot for a potential Stepin Fetchit short film series. It's just as good that it never happened, since Fetchit's characterization of the lazy Negro was amusing in small doses and would be considered very offensive today. Many of the scenes I've just described are good for a few laughs, though the final sequence was so confusing that the results were just too blah for me. In summary, A Tough Winter is a curiosity that should be seen at least once. By the way, Stepin's real name was Lincoln Theodore Perry.

summary: Dublin; June 16, 1904. Stephen Dedalus, who fancies himself as a poet, embarks on a day of wandering about the city during which he finds friendship and a father figure in Leopold Bloom, a middle-aged Jew. Meanwhile, Bloom's day, illuminated by a funeral and an evening of drinking and revelry that stirs paternal feelings toward Stephen, ends with a rapprochement with Molly, his earthy wife.
translation: The film adaptation of James Joyce's Ulysses is excellent. The actors, the voices, the direction, everything captures the feeling of the novel, without sacrificing its own merits. The Milo O'Shea does an excellent job as Leopold Bloom, the horned man married to the saucy Molly. I love this picture.

summary: A gruesome homage to the cult Amicus anthology Asylum, Cradle of Fear unfolds four screamplays all linked by the unspeakable need of an incarcerated child killer to wreak vengeance on those responsible for his imprisonment. Helped by deranged angel Dani Filth, who leaves a trail of charnel house death in his crimson wake, the cannibal convict forces two Goth vamps to endure a one night stand from hell, two tough female robbers to see through each other, an obscenely rich coke-head to chop up more than a few lines and an internet surfer to descend into madness when he uncovers the ultimate web depravity.
translation:
Well, look, I'm not going to lie to you, but I just got this movie from a friend for $ 3.99 because he had Danni Filth, the lead singer of the ever-popular Death Metal band "Cradle Of Filth." Of course, I was expecting violence and bloodshed at its best, as Mr. Filth can explain in a storyline.

But, dear God, I was so wrong. This movie is seriously biting, big time. Since this is a low-budget movie (haha, wait, make ZERO BUDGET), the beautiful Howard Stern orchestral scores and the Spielberg special effects are obviously lacking. No, it's all a camera, bad angles and bad blood scenes. Take, for example, when our star and violent enemy, Mr. Filth, brutally kills a mugger. A jerk at the throat and blood spits out, but oh my god, it looks like there's a jar of blood in the man's shirt.

Dir Cradle Of Filth Fans: You'll hear two songs throughout the movie, but with the camera angles and shabby movies, they pull all the enjoyment of the song DOWN.

My last comment: Control far away. It's blood, blood, breasts and hey, even a sloppy story about it. So, if you like vile violence, almost no voices (yes, there are hardly any words in this movie), then definitely buy it. But if bad movies are not your thing, avoid them. Do not waste your money.

summary: Bobby is a Los Angeles teenager who buys a customized Dodge van to pick up girls and spruce up his dull life, all while trying to win money racing other vans in order to pay for his own.
translation:
Bobby is a silly kid who smiles way too much and wants sex. So he buys a van to help with this task. The drama is lame, the comedy is pathetic, and the script is nothing more than a loose chain of clich√©s and cheap thrills. The creators of the film obviously wanted to capture some of the craziness of other films of that time, but were far from it. They even resort to Bobby slipping on a banana peel because that's supposed to add a comedic value.

I struggle to find a redeeming feature of the movie. If you like DeVito, that's another classic DeVito role - but he's just a supporting actor and there for cliche value.

summary: Four young adult siblings try to fend for themselves after the mysterious death of their parents. But they harbor some dark secrets which include abducting and killing strangers, and feeding them to a mysterious 'thing' living in their cellar.
translation: I feel that it is my duty as a lover of horror movies to warm other people about this horrible and very, very bad "horror" movie. Do not waste time or money on this movie, acting is bad, the story is just one of the worst I've ever seen and the script was just awful. There was nothing good about it, you think in the end why I watch this crap. The plot had so many holes and they were never enlightened at the end, it was just so bad, I do not know how a movie could be made so terrible. As I said, I love horror movies and I was so disappointed it was an 18, but you see little blood and no frights or jumps. What annoyed me was how stupid things happened in the movie that did not make any sense how the siblings kissed, why? Everything I can say. Do not worry, there are a lot more great horror movies out there, do not waste your time, life is too short.

summary: A Cockney con-artist just out of prison replaces an insurance company's computer programmer and sends claim checks to himself in various guises at addresses all over Europe. Meanwhile, he falls in love with inept secretary and frustrated flutist, Maggie Smith.
translation: If there are two other enchanting artists when Peter Ustinov and Maggie Smith perform together in a more charming movie in 1968, I do not know who they were. I saw this adorable little satirical gem for the first time 25 years ago at the age of 16, and every year I consider myself sitting down to look at it as wasted again. It's intelligent, quirky, neat, wistful, sweet, gently subversive and absolutely adorable. The romance of these two social outsiders is both hilarious and terribly moving - more than in Maggie Smith's desperate attempt to put the right card in the deck, a scene that is both remorsefully funny and a perfect thumbnail portrait of the heartbreaking loneliness. And this last statue on the anxious, worried, affectionate face of Ustinov, when he asks: "Everything alright?" - Has anyone ever made the look and tone of devotion so perfect and naked honest? I would never want to know someone who did not love this movie.

summary: Haunted by a secret, Ben Thomas looks for redemption by radically transforming the lives of seven people he doesn't know. Once his plan is set, nothing will be able to stop him. At least that's what he thinks. But Ben hadn't planned on falling in love with one of these people and she's the one who will end up transforming him.
translation: The emotional effect of this film defies the words. It's elegant, subtle, beautiful and tragic, all rolled in two hours. This is Will Smith, when he matures into his acting skills, the whole gamut of it. Who knew? I saw The Pursuit of Happiness and thought it must be a coincidence for the blockbuster, over-the-top actor, Smith. His performances in both films show Smith a whole other dimension, a refinement of talent, scriptwriting selectivity, I'm not sure, but I see him differently now. Seven Pounds is one of those films that needs to suspend their beliefs in order to fully enjoy their essence. Do not pay attention to the action, pay attention to the fragile state of the human heart, both literally and metaphorically. It is a story of human guilt, atonement, love and sacrifice.

summary: Twenty male inmates in a Kentucky prison form an unlikely Shakespearean acting troupe.
translation:
If you want to play a play inside the prison walls, why not the best playwright William Shakespeare? And if you choose your cast from a whole range of criminals who have long punished the most vicious crimes, you can be sure that there will be enough time for rehearsals. In a prison in Kentucky, a bold project like this was undertaken with amazing results. This film shows how everything was done, the casting, the rehearsals, the set and the costumes and the final presentation of Shakespeare's play "The Tempest". It never crossed my mind, but there is an analogy between the game and the prison. In the game, the shipwrecked characters are limited to an island that has no contact with the outside world. Prison life is also very similar.

With a simple background painted by a surrounding seascape, the characters in a very enjoyable assortment of costumes roar their lines to an approving public, not quite as Shakespeare intended, but with good heart and true sincerity ,

More interesting than the game itself, the little cameos of every man were behind his character. An inmate saw the game as a lesson in the forgiveness of another as a salvation of his sins. It was quite moving to see the men wiping away a tear as they talked about murder, shooting, and strangulation. Everyone felt like they would like to turn back the clock and reconsider their brutal actions. Whatever was said, the past was past and the present was the beginning of a new future. At least, the piece has given a temporary relief from the oppressive thoughts of past events.

Prison authorities should be applauded for allowing the game to take place. Such an event would put Kentucky on the map and hopefully other prisons could follow their good example. It seems to me that everyone will benefit - not just Kentucky Prison, but the prisoners themselves, who will find new self-esteem and self-esteem and be prepared for the day they go to probation.

summary: The Herlihys are a working class family from Chicago whose three children take wildly divergent paths: Brian joins the Marines right out of High School and goes to Vietnam, Michael becomes involved in the civil rights movement and after campaigning for Bobby Kennedy and Eugene McCarthy becomes involved in radical politics, and Katie gets pregnant, moves to San Francisco and joins a hippie commune. Meanwhile, the Taylors are an African-American family living in the deep South. When Willie Taylor, a minister and civil rights organizer, is shot to death, his son Emmet moves to the city and eventually joins the Black Panthers, serving as a bodyguard for Fred Hampton.
translation:
What the movie really represents the 1960s (for those of us who were snarling in America's belly at the time) is the turbulence and diversity of the decade. Despite the exaggerated, stereotypical characters, the genuineness of the themes remains clear.

Not only these radical times of change, but also very confusing times. Two fundamental things changed our world at that time: the Civil Rights Act of 1964 and the overwhelming influence of the media. These two new freedoms began social changes that were soon institutionalized.

Out of the chaos came sensitivity, out of disorder came values. Bear in mind, however, that the majority of Americans were not involved in this ... they worked, they played, they saw the news ... and slowly they became aware of the efforts and struggles of minorities ... civil rights influenced workers, political activists, anti-war efforts, the war on poverty ....

The representation of the power of the press and television in particular has been well reflected, although the conflict between the public's attitude and those who wanted to change something were at best ignored ... and misrepresented at worst. The middle-class Americans did not all stand around, annoying baseball bats or leaving their wayward daughters. They were also confused. Let's not forget how folk singers suddenly became protest singers and how the Beatles began a onslaught that killed the people's protest movement. There are no Beatle songs in the movie, or any mention of them.

I think if you do not experience the decade, maybe you have no sense of what the movie is about, the whole thing The picture is a bit dark. At some point I kept a steady job while my sister lived in the Hog Farm Commune and went to Woodstock. At another point, I was in Haight Asbury and the Detroit Riots while she worked and played the housewife in Maine and Connecticut. The roles changed constantly.

The film shows three siblings of a middle-class family. They represent the hippie child, political activists and active military personnel. Dad represents the typical attitudes, and mother represents the voice of reason, tolerance and sometimes compromise ... for the sake of peace.

The Black family is a minister and his son ... disproportionate, in my view. I assume that the producers knew all the variables and had to limit themselves, otherwise the film would have become a long, boring documentary. Dad's message was that anger creates bitterness and bitterness creates chaos. It was clearly a message to today's youth.

We are looking for a unique solution to social problems and also how to separate ourselves from ourselves ... The 60s were unusual in this way and only compare the roaring 20s. In other words, this movie has a morality after all. In the end, it is our collective individualism that survives. Put that in your oxymoron list.

Everyone was a god, a guru or a free-spirited genius in the 60s. It was a time of magic and madness. Nobody will ever find the 60s right ... it was too diverse (this movie is close to it). At least we can say that we are not ashamed of having learned and born of it, and that one generation once shaped and changed America ... for the better.

summary: American tourist Jesse and French student Celine meet by chance on the train from Budapest to Vienna. Sensing that they are developing a connection, Jesse asks Celine to spend the day with him in Vienna, and she agrees. So they pass the time before his scheduled flight the next morning together. How do two perfect strangers connect so intimately over the course of a single day? What is that special thing that bonds two people so strongly? As their bond turns to love, what will happen to them the next morning when Jesse flies away?
translation:
The American Jesse took the train to Vienna to take the plane for the US. On the train he met a Frenchwoman Celine. Although they met for the first time, they spoke like good friends. When the train stopped in Vienna, Jesse begged Celine to accompany him on a tour of Vienna. Then the romantic story unfolded.

At first they were careful. The funniest scene was her CD in the music shop. They looked at each other, though their eyes did not come in contact. After an in-depth conversation, their relationships became tight. Then I saw the most romantic scene they pretended to call their respective friend. Their deep love for each other was expressed completely through words.

Love is a strange thing. If you really want it, it will not come as you wanted it to. Love needs mutual understanding. Without them, love will not last long. Spiritual harmony is the most important thing for love.

Excellent screenplay and performance led to a great success of the movie.

One of the best love movies. 9.10

summary: A drama revolving around characters whose lives are transformed one summer at an exclusive East Coast country club.
translation:
The only word I can think of to describe this movie is: Usually.

The storyline about Gary Sinise's character attempting suicide is a ridiculous premise and comes across as a sort of Salingeristic recluse or hermit in a hut driving golf balls into the ocean because he is not living in the ocean could handle lucrative pro / golf community? summary: Hamlet returns to his remarkably minimalistic palace in Denmark and finds out his father is dead and his uncle Claudius has married his mother Gertrude. His father's ghost appears, and tells Hamlet to avenge him forthwith. Hamlet stages a play to confirm Claudius' guilt and his mother's compliance, but then inadvertently kills his girlfriend Ophelia's father, Polonius. This drives her insane, while her brother Laertes sets out to avenge his father's death. In a climactic swordfight, Claudius tries to poison Hamlet with Laertes' sword and a poisoned cup. Gertrude takes the poison cup out of guilt, while Hamlet realizes Laertes' sword is poisoned...
translation:
