summary: Mismatched travellers are stranded overnight at a lonely rural railway station. They soon learn of local superstition about a phantom train which is said to travel these parts at dead of night, carrying ghosts from a long-ago train wreck in the area. The travelers eventually get to the bottom of the things that go bump in the night. In between the scary bits, comedian Arthur Askey plays the gags with his Vaudeville style humor, to the constant irritation of his fellow passengers.
translation:
I saw the current Region 2 DVD of this movie, which was shown in the Horror section of a store on Oxford Street and also advertised as a "classic thriller". In fact, it's almost just a vehicle for Arthur Askey, one of the most popular names in the British comedy and entertainment industry for over four decades.

Perhaps his incessantly happy, exuberant and essentially good-humored sense of humor will be a bit of a culture shock to many who are used to the sour and cynical taste of the British comedy of the last twenty-five years. But there are still those who appreciate his lively and cheerful persona and the total avoidance of pathos. Askey was an idol to the great Tommy Cooper, who often borrowed the "self-strangulation" gag with which Arthur tries to entertain the stranded passengers.

There is a striking, rare appearance of the undervalued Linden Travers who acts as a mysterious Julie.

summary: There are times when it's right and proper to simply bury the dead. This is not one of those times... Gram Parsons was one of the most influential musicians of his time; a bitter, brilliant, genius who knew Elvis, tripped with the Stones and fatally overdosed on morphine and tequila in 1973. And from his dying came a story. A story from deep within folklore; a story of friendship, honour and adventure; a story so extraordinary that if it didn't really happen, no one would believe it. Two men, a hearse, a dead rock star, five gallons of petrol, and a promise. And the most extraordinary chase of modern times.
translation:
If you are a fan of the deceased Gram Parsons, this movie will definitely share you! Part comedy, part road movie, but mostly a bad fictionalization of one of the strangest stories in rock history.

SPOILERS--

The story is about a well-known roadie named Phil Kaufman (played by Johnny Knoxville), who "allegedly" pacts with cult rock / country / folk -Music hero Gram Parsons, who explained that one of them died first (it did not matter) that the other one lived to bring the deceased to the desert, the Joshua Tree National Park in California, to be exact and setting fire to the body ... to free the mind and become one with the earth, and so on! Safe to keep his word, the barely sober Kaufman, with the help of a self-hating, pot-headed buddy, picks up the body of the deceased Parsons, who had been fatally overpowered by a drug and liquor anesthetic the day before. And shortly after, a nagging mix of fiction and truth emerges in which the late Parsons girlfriend, Kaufman's girlfriend, Parson's stone-headed dad, and a gaggle of cops and other pointless characters try to beat the clock (just to try Kaufman and his Caught buddy before they get the chance to torch Parson's body!

The movie's incompetent direction, bad acting and lame unconventional tone in general sink this movie faster than the Titanic - and not to forget the fact that this movie does not even tell the truth about the actual events.The accuracies that should have replaced the inaccuracies, as far as I've heard them, are: Number 1, Parsons was married at the time of his death and even had a child So what the hell was that with the girlfriend and the hunt and what was not ?, Number 2, Kaufman's drug mate was a familiar one Terry's willing participant (as opposed to what the film tries to portray) in the elimination of Parson's body, and finally number 3. Gram Parson's real father died when he was a boy, and so it was Parsons stepfather (who, to be honest less able to take care of Gram Parsons when he was alive) in real life, who took care of the body after it was lit! All in all, though, it's probably bothering me the most that the real Phil Kaufman was on set to help with the facts of the story. And yet, the film was so untrue and so bad that it really blew me away!

Also, the mediocre act of acting mentioned above in the movie concerns its main character, played by the ultra-raging Johnny Knoxville (Phil Kaufman), is not only a bad actor, but it actually seems to be so for the most part The movie's asleep, and the rest of the miserable cast is mostly either hysterical, brain dead, or seems completely unaware of what they're doing there at all! All in all, if you like Johnny Knoxville or really the bad ones - they're not good-punk movies - then I guess you might get a kick out of this movie! But if you're like me and a fan of the deceased Gram Parsons, then you enjoy watching movies that try to tell the truth as well as possible, especially if they're based on an actual real story and or just like good movies, road movies or fictional slice-of-life stuff, you'll really detest this movie and advise others to do it as well. I obviously hated this movie and wished it had never been done, but since it was made, I would rather have done it differently than it unfortunately did! Maybe one day, the true facts of the story will come through and become a really great biopic about the life of Gram Parsons ... not just what happened to his body after his mind left. But until then, all we get as audiences and / or fans of the late performer is this sad waste of film and an all-encompassing terrible monument to the musical legacy Gram Parsons has left behind. It should also be noted that they have actually used Parsons music and a few others in the movie, but not surprisingly, you never hear enough of it to enjoy it in the least. (Turkey-zero stars)

summary: In meeting in Kansas, ex-cons Perry Smith and Dick Hickock are breaking several conditions of their respective paroles. The meeting, initiated by Dick, is to plan and eventually carry out a robbery based on information he had received from a fellow inmate about $10,000 cash being locked in a hidden safe in the home of the farming Clutter family of Holcomb, Kansas. After the robbery, they plan on going to Mexico permanently to elude capture by the police. Each brings a necessary personality to the partnership to carry out the plan, Dick who is the brash manipulator, Perry the outwardly more sensitive but unrealistic dreamer with a violent streak under the surface. Perry literally carries all his dreams in a large box he takes with him wherever he goes. The robbery does not go according to plan in any respect, the pair who ultimately hogtie and execute all four members of the Clutter family, only coming away from the home with $43 in cash. As Perry and Dick go on the run, a murder ...
translation:
Simply one of the best ever! Richard Brooks' adaptation of Truman Capote's non-fiction book is truly an artistic achievement. Stunning black and white cinematography (which should have won an Oscar), a haunting Quincy Jones score, and massive performances by Robert Blake and Scott Wilson as the oddly fitting killers. This film was 0 for 4 at the Academy Awards and was not even nominated for the best picture, while Dr. Doolittle was. Imagine that!

Although you do not know the Clutter family as well as you do in the book, it was a good decision to focus more on Perry and Dick and follow the process of tracking down these guys Low. John Forsythe is also impressive as Alvin Dewey. There are simply no mistakes in this. 10 out of 10 points. Best performance = Scott Wilson with R. Blake just behind. Highly recommended!

summary: Meet best friends Michael, Albert, Stanley and Sefa; the ladies' man, the good boy, the weird one and the party boy. They're staring down the barrel of their thirtieth birthdays, but still act as if they're sixteen; they get drunk, they chase the wrong women and they have a remarkable record of misbehaving and causing chaos at every wedding they attend. But now Michael's younger brother Sione is getting married, and everything is about to change. Sione is their boy, the kid they used to look after, who grew up while they were still partying. And to ensure his big day isn't spoiled by his boys and their idiot antics, Sione has issued an ultimatum; the guys all have to bring dates to the wedding. And not just any dates; real girlfriends, someone they've made a commitment to. They have one month. So just how hard can it be to get a date for your best boy's wedding?
translation:
Ever wonder why Pacific Islanders seem to automatically adopt the sense of humor of the Black Americans? regardless of their ethnic origin? Well, this movie will not give answers to this common question - but it will provide an excellent case study.

From the very beginning, this film acts as a kind of "old school" for Pacific New Zealanders. This immediately raises the question of what exactly the purpose of such a task is. Is it intended to maintain deep-rooted stereotypes of Pacific Island New Zealanders? or should this potential market be used? The story is weak, jokes humorlessly, and the ending is expected. This film has not done anything for New Zealand cinema because it's just an appropriated romantic comedy that has no merit.

summary: Gillian Holroyd is just your average, modern-day, witch, living in a New York apartment with her Siamese familiar, Pyewacket. But one day a handsome publisher, Shep Henderson walks into her building and Gillian decides she wants him--especially as it turns out he's marrying Merle Kittridge, an old poison penpal from Gillian's college days. So, Gillian casts a spell over Shep. But her powers are in danger of being exorcised by something stronger than the bell-book-and-candle routine: Love.
translation:
Bell, Book and Candle was one of the great pop culture phenomena of the mid-twentieth century, very similar to the phenomena we see today (in the '70s - more than ten years later - there were endless references to this film). It made Novak a big star, put a nice article in Jack Lemon's CV, shed new light on Jimmy Stewart and gave Lancaster and Gingold new ways to discover their careers (both still playing witches and other curious "old bats"), in film and television).

Together with the 40s movie "I married a witch" (which helped make Veronica Lake an icon), Bell, Book and Candle inspired the fascination of film and television with sorcery started and was continued by practical magic, worst witch and Harry Potter.

What I rarely notice is that the movie is also a pretty interesting alternative Christmas movie. The story takes place during the Christmas holidays, and although she acts superficially about witchcraft, she actually embodies a lot of Christmas spirit (giving, love, family, self-sacrifice, etc.).

I'll always see this movie (I've seen it several times since my first performance in the early '90s), especially when it's shown around or right after Christmas. It has style, substance, a great cast and great production values. And like Adam's rib, it casually expresses ideas that were quite radical for its time, even radically (in both films, the female figure is innocent and strong) and always seems to be ahead of the times.

summary: While investigating his friend Chin Ku's (Hwang Jang Lee) death, martial artist Billy Lo (Bruce Lee) is killed. His younger brother, Bobby Lo (Kim Tai Chung), investigates both deaths. His search takes him to Japan, where he befriends Lewis (Roy Horan), master of the Castle Of Death. But when Lewis is brutally murdered, Bobby must investigate the mysterious Fan Yu temple, where he must enter an underground pagoda and face off with the most terrifying of enemies.
translation:
There are so many silly moments in "Tower of Death" / "Game of Death 2" that you really wonder if it's a spoof. Sometimes it felt like I saw a sequel to Kung Pow rather than a Bruce Lee movie.

To be honest, this movie has everything to do with "Game of Death". If anything, it's more of a sequel / remake of "Enter the Dragon," which contains many elements of this movie - especially the actual footage. Bruce Lee's character Billy Lo (apparently) examines his friend's sudden death and encounters a piece of film left behind by the man's daughter. When the body is stolen during the funeral (!), Billy is also killed and it is up to his idiosyncratic brother to avenge the death of both men.

Tong Long plays as Brother Bobby Lo and does not really have the kind of charisma to wear the movie. His fighting skills are very good though. Obviously, thanks to (no more) deleted footage, Bruce Lee simply comes to pay for the legacy. On the whole, the footage is actually better edited than in "Game of Death," but it does not stop the film from getting mixed up.

OK, so the fights are really entertaining (I dare to say overwhelming) and make the movie worth seeing. But there are so many stupid elements in this movie that it really tests your patience. First of all, there is the alleged villain who lives on his palatial estate ... or is this spiritual institution? Seriously, the hooker eats raw game, drinks deer blood, carries a monkey on his shoulder and has some peacocks and lions (?!). This attempt to make him look tough and intelligent only makes him feel sorry for him - one almost expects someone to accompany him back to his room.

In fact, this middle section is awful and when the scene came with a nude hooker and a lion suit, I turned it off. But I finished the movie and was kind of glad that I did that because the fight scene towards the end (much like 'GOD') was the whole reason for the reputation. While the story is an embarrassment, the plot is very good and contains excellent choreography.

But even the final disappointed when the premise is something. We were told that the "Tower of Death" is a pagoda that is upside down and underground. That sounded great as if Bruce Lee's original idea was being reinterpreted with different fighting styles on every level. Could this be the "Game of Death" originally planned? No! The movie should have been called "Generator Room of Death", because as far as the tower goes. Yes, there were actually one or two "different" styles ... there were foil-clad grunts, leopard-skinned and stupid monks. It's as if Enter the Dragon was never done, because the plot is a bad imitation.

It's worth watching the fast-paced battle scenes, but sometimes so stupid that it hurts. If that was intended, then fine. Thumbs up to recreate this projector room scene from "Enter The Dragon".

summary: All Tess Trueheart wants is to settle down to a quiet life with her boyfriend, detective Dick Tracy. But there's something pretty rotten going on in town, with someone pretty rotten behind it, and Tracy has his hands full with the likes of villain Big Boy Caprice and with the almost irresistible Breathless Mahoney.
translation: At the time I write this, I see a rating of 5.8 out of over 15,000 votes. Something is wrong with this picture. Personally, I give him a 10th. I can see a 7th lowest or a possible 8th, if it was rated by people who see this movie for what it really is. It's a movie based on a comic book hero. This movie has won more than just the prices. Won 3 Oscars. Another 5 wins and 26 nominations ... that's where it tells me it's better than a 5.8. Some great plays by some very good actors, some great special effects and in my opinion, if not a classic for years to come. If you're looking for sheer entertainment, check out Dick Tracy. Definitely a movie that you can see more than a few times. Al Pacino is great as a Big Boy Caprice.

summary: When Adams and his crew are sent to investigate the silence from a planet inhabited by scientists, he finds all but two have died. Dr. Morbius and his daughter Altaira have somehow survived a hideous monster which roams the planet. Unknown to Adams, Morbius has made a discovery, and has no intention of sharing it (or his daughter!) with anyone.
translation:
Certain elements of this film are of course dated. For example, a pure white male crew. And like most Pre-Star Wars science fiction, it takes too long for her to admire herself.

But still, no movie has ever caught the taste of Golden Age science fiction, like this one, not even using the "electronic tonalities" to make the score available. Robbie the robot embodies the Asimov robots and was the inspiration for everything that followed, from C3PO to Data.

The storyline is of course Shakespeare's "The Tempest". Morbius is a Prospero and an exile wizard who has stalked his empire of intruders ... It was a movie that treated science fiction as an adult genre, perhaps the first.

summary: Kurt Harris (Jeff Wincott), a bitter, ex-cop goes undercover in the "Peacemakers" after his friend is killed by their leader. While there, he discovers that the woman wants to run for mayor, and will do anything to achieve this goal, even murder.
translation: This movie really rocks! Jeff Wincott is great in the movie! His fight is incredible! He is such a fast martial artist! Brigitte Nielsen & Matthias Hues was very good! Mission of Justice is an action-packed movie that never gets boring! If you like watching movies with unbelievable non-stop action, visit Mission of Justice today!

summary: Whilst crossing a ledge, 4000 feet above the earth, Gabe's friend's equipment fails to work and she slips out of his hand, falling to the ground. Almost a year later, Gabe is asked to go back to the same mountain range and rescue a group of 'stranded' people. The only catch is that these so called 'stranded' people are in fact looking for three boxes filled with $100,000,000 and they need a mountain ranger to lead them to them!!
translation:
This movie is just great. It's entertaining from start to finish, and you'll always be by your side throughout the movie. In my opinion, this film is underestimated by the critics.

Sly fits perfectly into the role of well-trained mountain rescue guy Gabe Walker. Together with him Michael Rooker appears as Hal Tucker. And then, John Lithgow, one of the best performances I've seen of him as a villain.

And the fact that 75% of the movie takes place on a mountain with a lot of bad guys makes room for a lot of action!

Brilliant movie!

summary: When Adams and his crew are sent to investigate the silence from a planet inhabited by scientists, he finds all but two have died. Dr. Morbius and his daughter Altaira have somehow survived a hideous monster which roams the planet. Unknown to Adams, Morbius has made a discovery, and has no intention of sharing it (or his daughter!) with anyone.
translation:
If you like Star Wars / Trek, check out where they got all their ideas and movie equipment. It's my top 2 favorite movie of all time, other world futuristic and psycho-thriller. The intensity of the root material (Shakespeare's "The Tempest") is not overshadowed by Whizbang gimmicks (a la Lucas). And just because it was made in 1956, you can not assume that you can see the threads that hold the flying saucer. This was the first movie you did NOT want to do. Miracle that it was made in "A-movie" scale, economy and taste at the time were heavily stacked against it. And director Wilcox's last hit was "Lassie Come Home." Until I looked up, I assumed that Fred Wilcox was a pseudonym for a director who became famous, or later, but at that time he did not want to be associated with sci-fi, which was strictly a "B" genre back then. This was either a VERY VERY visionary production or a very random "mistake" on the part of people getting Hollywood rolling.

There are the massive scale mats with live action almost microscopically inserted, which Lucas uses extensively. There are intelligent machines that go beyond the stereotypical "user interface"; "Computers", as they are presented in later works much less futuristic. Star Trek 'Transporter' is visual, almost unchanged by Roddenberry 10 years later. And if the Technobabble from Trek / Wars scares you off, the scientific references of FP are not exaggerated and are still correct today. The "Ship" set is comprehensive, sparklingly realistic, pretty much everything you've seen since, and more convincing than anything Trek has done for TV or film. We did not spend as much time there as I would have liked.

If you've ever wondered how movies got so competent into space, FP will explain everything to you. It's definitely not 'Wagontrain to the Stars'.

summary: Bud Davis is a country boy who moves to the city to visit his uncle and his family. He starts hanging out at Gilley's, the popular nightclub owned by Mickey Gilley himself. He takes a job at the oil refinery where his uncle works, hoping to save enough money to buy some land. He also meets a cowgirl named Sissy, they dance together, fall in love and suddenly get married. And then their marriage is shattered when Bud sees Sissy allegedly seeing con man Wes, who teaches her how to ride the mechanical bull... and plans to rob Gilley's. When a bull-riding contest at Gilley's is announced, Bud decides to sign up. Can he win the contest and save his marriage to Sissy?
translation: What an overlooked 80s soundtrack. I imagine John Travolta sang some of the songs, but when I watched the movie, he seemed to personify everything that was 80s cheese. Films based on mechanical bulls, bartenders, and immature relationships were clearly in fashion. The best part was his lousy Texas accent. Compare that to Friday Night Lights. I suggest seeing Cocktail and Stir Crazy to really get into the movie stupor. Also, a side note Made in America with Ted Danson and Whoopie Goldberg is a terribly bad movie. I was so shocked to realize that I had never seen it. An even stranger movie of this genre would have to record Cadilac Man with Robin Williams. Keep in mind that all these big stars have played a big role in these Cheesy movies. Tom Cruise, Richard Pryor, Robin Williams and John Travolta

summary: Car theft in Long Beach went down 47% when Randall "Memphis" Raines walked away from the life. He gets dragged back into it by assuming the job his brother Kip screwed up for stolen-car broker Raymond Calitri: steal 50 exotic cars and have them on a container ship by 8 AM Friday morning, and he got this news on a Monday. With Calitri threatening to kill him and Kip, and the police GRAB unit breathing down his neck, Memphis reassembles his old crew and attempts to pull off the logistically impossible.
translation: It's a great movie if you've ever named your cars or are really in old, fast or exotic cars. It has an action and a lot of action. The car scenes are great except for the totally wrong auto-jump scene. All other scenes are great. I really enjoyed it and I hope that everyone else will succeed.

summary: An inspector is having a secret relationship with a woman. When she is murdered by his boss, all proof is against him.
translation:
Like his older brothers Claude Sautet and Jean-Pierre Melville, Alain Corneau began in French cinema with a series of thrillers such as "la Menace" (1977) and "S√©rie Noire" (1979). "Police Python 357" is a good example of how Corneau designed and shot his works at this time of his career. They had an excellent cinematography, meticulous scripts, and a polished direction that was created for the sake of efficiency.

Police Superintendent Ferrot (Yves Montand) is an out-of-the-box policeman who normally works all by himself. He becomes acquainted with a young woman Sylvia L√©opardi (Stefania Sandrelli) and becomes her lover, while ignoring that she has another lover: his superior Ganay (Fran√ßois P√©rier). When the latter finds out, he kills her in a tantrum. Ferrot has to investigate the murder and all the clues are inexorable against him ...

You'd think that this kind of far-fetched story is not exempt from mishaps and sometimes you can see through it but Corneau's pedantic directorial style helps to conjure up a suffocating, gloomy atmosphere. The first part of the movie before the murder night may seem uninteresting, but it is crucial to what will follow this key moment. Corneau resorts to a sober treatment with rather sparse moments and short appearances of secondary characters, which the viewer will see again during the examination. Corneau and his scriptwriter Daniel Boulanger have written a clever story despite all the disadvantages. M√©nard (Mathieu Carri√®re), who sometimes expresses his surprise because Ferrot remains relatively unremarkable during the investigation. But his supervisor knows that he usually works alone. Actually, Ferrot has to find solid tricks to tarnish the water and thus relieve itself. Ultimately, the main idea of ‚Äã‚Äãthe film is Ferrot himself. He is a cop who gradually loses his identity and finds himself in the midst of a terrible depersonalization. It is embodied by the moment he throws acid on his face so that witnesses will not recognize him when confronted with them.

The backdrop of this thriller, Orl√©ans, is efficiently enhanced by Corneau's camera, helping to inspire this sinister thriller with its ruinous charm.

summary: In the year 2017, the world economy has collapsed. The great freedoms of the United States are no longer, as the once great nation has sealed off its borders and become a militarized police state, censoring all film, art, literature, and communications. Even so, a small resistance force led by two revolutionaries manages to fight the oppression. With full control over the media, the government attempts to quell the nation's yearning for freedom by broadcasting a number of game shows on which convicted criminals fight for their lives. The most popular and sadistic of these programs is "The Running Man," hosted by Damon Killian. When a peaceful protest of starving citizens gathers in Bakersfield, California, a police officer named Ben Richards is ordered to fire on the crowd, which he refuses to do. Subdued by the other officers, the attack is carried out, and Richards is framed for the murder of almost a hundred unarmed civilians. Following a daring jail break months later, Richards is...
translation:
Did Mystic Pizza not win the Oscar for this year? This film never had a chance because of the casting, but maybe people can now see why I felt that way when leaving the theater. Only "wargames" left me similarly distraught as I left the theater with the feeling of glancing at our future. History has shown that's exactly what happened.

Casting is a pop culture 1980s Cuisinart: you get Arnold as Ben Richards, the framed refugee who had the chance to "run" for his freedom in the game show with the same title as the movie ; Richard Dawson as Damon Killian, treating his role as if he were the host of the family feud, with the fighters using real weapons; Jesse Ventura as "Captain Freedom" and co-wrestler Professor Tanaka as "Subzero", both "stalkers" who kill the "running men". Even Mick Fleetwood (Mic) and Dweezil Zappa (Stevie) appear, while the "Dancers of the Future" are nothing but the Laker Girls. This movie SCREAMS "80s." The plot is a good excuse for the action: Ben Richards is determined to prove his innocence, but agrees to be the Running Man when told that his friends would be released; Instead, they join him as a "candidate". Maria Conchita Alonzo as Amber Mendez is the benchmark for judging Salma Hayek in the 1990s.

The production value on the film was a bit meager, the lines were cheesy and (at the time), the plot seemed a bit far-fetched. I remember leaving the theater thinking that we would definitely go in the direction of the movie, but who could have seen how far we went there and how fast? If The Running Man were listed in TV Guide, most people would think that it was just another reality show breaking through the envelope today. The government's influence on the media has only worsened, and the stultified American public of the future, which reveals all its freedoms for "national security", is downright frightening. Ben Richards is brilliantly played by Arnold as one of the few remaining holdouts against a government tyranny that the rest of America is too willing to accept in return for good television and some farewell gifts for the public.

The movie was way over the top, maybe even off the cliff for its time, but like Back to the Future III, the "gorge" it seemed to sink into in 1987 became 2006 and later replaced by completed tracks This movie will sail into the future as one of the more prophetic films of our time. It's tragic that the Academy, like Wargames, did not give this brilliant script the credit it deserved. "Serious" actors who act seriously while being so arrogant that they want to surrender may win more Oscars, but that does not make them better movies than their "usual" counterparts like these.

An absolute must.

summary: A Cockney con-artist just out of prison replaces an insurance company's computer programmer and sends claim checks to himself in various guises at addresses all over Europe. Meanwhile, he falls in love with inept secretary and frustrated flutist, Maggie Smith.
translation: Hot Millions is a great movie in every way. A fun, unconventional story with wonderful performances by four of the best professionals ever to work in this business. As always, Peter Ustinov is brilliant, and Maggie Smith - definitely one of the greatest actresses of all time - is an absolute joy. Karl Malden and Bob Newhart complete the cast and are also perfect. If you want a movie with perfect casting then that's the thing. What's so impressive is the way these people work in such a natural and effortless way, creating many laughs and funny moments. Peter Ustinov was a genius with a wonderful sense of humor and this is one of his most memorable performances. The direction, photography and editing are also first class and it's a great time capsule from London in the 60's. It's definitely on my absolute favorites list.

summary: Eva has just gotten married to an older gentleman, but discovers that he is obsessed with order in his life and doesn't have much room for passion. She becomes despondent and leaves him, returning to her father's house. One day while bathing in the lake she meets a young man and they fall in love. The husband has become grief stricken at the loss of his young bride, and fate brings him together with the young lover that has taken Eva from him.
translation: I suppose at least a few people saw it on TCM on September 2nd. If you knew that Hedy needed to change her name to avoid being associated with this movie when she came to the US. summary: Spike Lee's take on the "Son of Sam" murders in New York City during the summer of 1977 centering on the residents of an Italian-American Northeast Bronx neighborhood who live in fear and distrust of one another.

I had to go out of the theater. After an hour, all I saw was people cheating on women, scolding dogs in a rut and using the F-word like a diabetic with Equal.

It was especially frustrating because the movie could have done a lot. Any of the characters could have been very interesting if given more to do than fornicate, talk about, and abuse each other.

More than that, I'm not waiting to see you.

The photography and interaction between the characters was outstanding, but there was nothing for them to do. The flood of sex and vulgarity was barely worth an hour of waiting for ETWAS.

Sorry, Spike. Take a few hours from Notting Hill or Shawshank Redemption. Either one is a better study in the community and interpersonal relationships.

summary: A group of popular students play a cruel prank on a shy nerd resulting in a terrible accident. Years later a reunion is held where each of the students face a stalker killer who may be the same nerd out for revenge.

Another Friday the 13th rip-off, even with some of his music! A group of young adults gather for a small school meeting and begin slaughtering Jason Voorhees. Could it be that nerds tormented her at school?

Routine Slash Fest is fun for fans of the genre, and contains the usual T & A odds for movies when it's second to none. The end is a bit more resourceful than your standard Slasher.

summary: Pro-Life, directed by John Carpenter, written by Drew McWeeny & Scott Swan, tells the story of a young girl trapped inside a clinic, who discovers the only thing more dangerous than her pursuers is the demonic secret that she carries within her. Not a single person from this episode or what should you get away with? It's just awful. Like, Plan 9 terrible outerspace. How, good God, please, please turn off somebody, before I'll be terribly smudged. Look at this and The Thing on the same day and your mind will implode.

summary: Toots and May's marriage is one of Toots being dependent on his wife. Shortly after Toots and May arrive in London to visit with their grown children Bobby and Paula and their respective children, Toots falls ill and dies. Toots' death brings to the surface the underlying strain that has always existed between May and both of her two children, and the unhappy lives they have all led. Now specifically with Paula, May is disapproving of her relationship with a construction worker named Darren. Not only does May think his occupation makes him beneath Paula, he's also a married man. Darren is in an unsatisfying marriage but doesn't want to leave it if only because of his son. Even after May gets to know and like Darren, she still encourages Paula to break up with him. The issue is that May herself has fallen in love with Darren, the two who begin a sexual relationship. What will ultimately happen between May and Darren also depends on Darren, who is floundering in his own life and doesn't...
translation:
While movie titles include the word "mother," the first thing that comes to mind is the mother's love for her children.

However, the mother tells a different story.

The mother does not discuss the love between a mother and her child or how she sacrifices herself for the benefit of her child. Here Notting Hill director Roger Michell tells how a mother's love for a man about half her age hurts the people around her.

Before taking on the role of James Bond, Daniel Craig plays Darren, a man who helps renovate the mother's son's house and sleep with her daughter as well. Anne Reid, who has been a familiar face in TV series, takes on the challenging role of the main character May.

The story begins with May's sudden loss of her husband Toots on a family visit to her son, Bobby. While she befriends Darren, a craftsman who is being renovated in Bobby's house, she was shocked to discover that her daughter Paula slept with Darren. At the same time, May was done with the afterlife of Toots. Fearing that Harry and Paula will not have her, May starts losing her life until she spends her afternoon with Darren.

Darren was nice and friendly to May and May soon finds affection for Darren. Instead of treating him like a friend, she treated the man, who was about half the age of a couple. Later, May found sexual satisfaction with Darren, where he gave her the pleasure she could never otherwise find. And this is the beginning of the catastrophe that could lead to the collapse of a family.

The mother explores the inner world of a widow who wanted to try something she never had in her life and comforting someone who is there to shoulder her. This may be said in May to buy tea snacks for Darren to meet the sexual needs of a man younger than her, where she eventually gave more than she expected.

Anne Reid has made a breakthrough for her role of May, as she was previously best known for her various roles in television series. Since she does not have many films in her career CV, the mother has made her aware of the criticism. Daniel Craig, on the other hand, had played a similar role in his film career as Sylvia (2003) and Enduring Love (2004). If his role as James Bond fails, film critics should not forget that he has performed better in small film productions during his years as a film-maker. The mother is one of them.

The mother is not everyone's favorite, but it's definitely not your usual matin√©e show with tea and scones, accompanied by butter and jam.

summary: A counterterrorism specialist is assigned by the President to track down a terrorist who is suspected of planning to set off a nuclear device in the U.S.
translation: I've always enjoyed watching Chuck Norris in the movie. Although the spectacle may not be great, the fight scenes are fantastic. I also enjoyed watching Judson Mills perform next to him. In my opinion, the Norris Brothers have proved to be good entertainers and that was another nice production! I hope you take the time to see this movie!

summary: Young Brendan lives in a remote medieval outpost under siege from barbarian raids. But a new life of adventure beckons when a celebrated master illuminator arrives from the isle of Iona carrying an ancient but unfinished book, brimming with secret wisdom and powers. To help complete the magical book, Brendan has to overcome his deepest fears on a dangerous quest that takes him into the enchanted forest where mythical creatures hide. It is here that he meets the fairy Aisling, a mysterious young wolf-girl, who helps him along the way. But with the barbarians closing in, will Brendan's determination and artistic vision illuminate the darkness and show that enlightenment is the best fortification against evil?
translation:
While watching this movie, I was frustrated and distracted and at the end I wanted to give the film a solid 4 or 5. I thought the animation was random and everywhere and there was too much going on. Even my A.D.D could not keep up. It felt like a light sour journey. Everything looked flat, for all there was no dimension. There were so many shapes, lines and patterns. I really wanted to stop the movie halfway and smash my burnt copy of this movie. But after I looked at it, I went online to read the movie, and I should have investigated a bit before watching the video.

The secret of Kells is loosely based on the true story of Kells' original book. A little boy, Brendan, has the task of writing new pages in the book, which is considered the best book of all time. This book contains information that helps to "turn darkness into light." Brendan lives in the village of Kells behind huge stone walls. Brendan's uncle, the abbot of Kells, tries to build the wall in the 8th century to keep the Vikings out. Brendan's uncle insists he helps to complete the wall, but a traveler and guardian of the "book" secretly trains Brendan to improve his illustration skills, persuading him to "complete the book" and execute his word.

The Kells book is a copied version of the first few New Testament books transcribed into Latin by Irish monks in Ireland in the 8th century. Along with its palaeographical and insular writing, the book is also beautifully illustrated in Island Art, a kind of early art form known for its complexity, complexity and miniature illustrations. Much of the art in the Book of Kells is presented in the same way that many artworks were flat and dimensionally challenged at the time, with no perspective. But what differentiates the Book of Kells from other early works of art is the use of many colors.

The secret of Kells is very colorful. I originally thought the animation was flat and boring. It reminded me a lot of the cartoon Samurai Jack, who also had a flat and "amine" look. Once I've learned about the art styles of the Book of Kells, it's obvious that many of the styles in the book are imitated in the film. There are lines and whirls and various shapes that inhabit Brendan's opinion. When he enters his imagination, circular shapes resembling the sun, cogs, clocks, and wheels fill the screen. The edges of the screen are framed in decorated, moving triangles or circles. Transitions are filled with color and Celtic knots. From the trees to the floors, many things in this world are covered in shapes or patterns.

The secret of Kells is 70 minutes without credits. It's a funny little history class with a little adventure and stupidity to interest people (maybe just kids). I think you have to generally fall back on the mystery of Kells as a half-art piece, half-film about history. Although it looks like it was animated with Adobe Illustrator, it's a very good-looking movie. But based on the 20 films submitted for Oscar, I do not think it's worth nominating over Mary and Max.

ThatWasJunk.Blogspot.com

summary: An apprentice farmer (Sammo Hung) ventures to the city and helps his family battle a gang of thugs.
translation:
"Enter the Fat Dragon" is one of the funniest martial arts movies I've ever seen. Sammo Hung portrays a Chinese peasant boy visiting a city friend. Just like Tang Lung from "Way of the Dragon". Everywhere Sammo goes, trouble starts, so he has to rely on his martial arts skills to solve the differences. Fortunately, Sammo's character learns martial arts by imitating and imitating his role model, Bruce Lee. He even strokes his nose with his thumb, just like Bruce Lee and lets go of his screeching scream. He also uses nunchucks in a scene. It was like watching a fat Bruce Lee. Towards the end of the film, there is a big showdown consisting of foreign fighters. Sammo has to hit each opponent individually. Similar to "The Game of Death," where each fighter has a different martial arts discipline.

This is one of the films I have loved to see and the very first Sammo Hung Movies I have seen. Excellent fight scenes and a lot of laughter. A rare classic Sammo Hung movie that I warmly recommend to all martial arts connoisseurs. 8.5 / 10!

summary: Life couldn't get much worse for News Producer Tim O'Hara. He humiliates the one he loves, Brace Channing and ends up getting fired by her father. Then, a Martian from Mars arrives in his home. The Martian adopts the name 'Uncle Martin' and becomes friends with Tim, whilst he fixes his ship. Unaware to Martin, Tim actually wants to reveal him to the world, but can he actually do that to his new friend and 'Uncle'?
translation:
The story is similar to ET: An alien runs around the earth trying to get home. While it stays on our planet, it will create friendly bonds with people.

But unlike ET, which airs drama, comedy, poetry, this movie is just fun. It is indeed a pure Dysney production: its core audience is children and the film is more visual than news.

So you can find some funny scenes (the first sighting of the city, a "cosmic" stray toaster) and the casting is experimenting, with special mentions to "Doc", which is in a "Mac Fly" - Character rejuvenated, and to Hurley, who is open to self-mockery.

Ice cream on the cake: The main title is written by Danny Elfman, and like any other great composer, you recognize your "voice" before you even give it credit.

summary: Stroker Ace, a champion NASCAR driver, is standing at the top of his career, but is getting fed up with having to do as he's told. In between rebelling against his sponsor (a fried chicken chain)'s promotion gimmicks (like making him dress up in giant chicken suit) he spends the rest of the movie trying to bed the buxom Pembrook.
translation: I love old Burt Reynolds movies. They are funnier and better than any other movie together. They might as well have stopped making films after "Cannonball Run 2," but I think how could they know that there would be no better ones? Man, this movie is good. Burt Reynolds has to dress like a chicken and drive around a lot in a race car, and the lush Loni Anderson is on the ground and looks extremely hot in the eighties. Burt and Loni, those were the days! I had this magazine where Loni Anderson advertised a vacuum cleaner. I loved this advertisement! There's also this part in the movie, where the crowd on the racetrack teems with something that makes Stroker Ace (Burty R.), and it shows a guy in the audience who bends down and sticks his finger in the butt to his disappointment to show! I laughed so hard that I almost went out into the night! If you can find this movie, rent it! And then never watch a movie again, because I'll tell you now: It does not make sense.

summary: The Maysles brothers pay visits to Edith Bouvier Beale, nearing 80, and her daughter Edie. Reclusive, the pair live with cats and raccoons in Grey Gardens, a crumbling mansion in East Hampton. Edith is dry and quick-witted - a singer, married but later separated, a member of high society. Edie is voluble, dresses - as she puts it - for combat in tight ensembles that include scarves wrapped around her head. There are hints that Edie came home 24 years before to be cared for rather than to care for her mother. The women address the camera, talking over each other, moving from the present to events years before. They're odd, with flinty affection for each other.
translation: Gray Gardens is shocking, amusing, sad and fascinating. I watched in amazement as Ediths Jr. and Sr. squabbled and performed while remembering their past. Their existence in a dilapidated villa (which they had not left for more than fifteen years) is both a comedy and a tragedy. This is a movie that you will not forget so quickly.

summary: After seven years in solitary, Jake Green is released from prison. In the next two years, he amasses a lot of money by gambling. He's ready to seek his revenge on Dorothy (Mr. D) Macha, a violence-prone casino owner who sent Jake to prison. He humiliates Macha in front of Macha's lieutenants, leaves, and keels over. Doctors tell him he has a rare disease and will die in three days; Macha also puts a hit out on him. Loan sharks, Zack and Avi, demand Jake's cash and complete fealty in return for protection. Jake complies, and through narration and flashbacks, we watch him through at least three days of schemes, danger, and redemption. Who is his greatest enemy?
translation:
First of all, do not go in Revolver and expect another snatch or lock stick, this is a different kind of gangster movie.

I saw the gala the other day and this movie definitely shared the audience. It's the kind of movie that half of the audience will think WHAT was it? That was awful, and the other half will think, WHAT was that? That was cool. Personally, I like movies that I do not understand, d. H. Mullholland Drive and usual suspects, so I enjoyed revolvers.

But it was definitely not perfect. I saw the big turn come a mile away, at least part of it, and though sometimes some loose ends that are unexplained are good, Revolver leaves a lot of questions unexplained for no reason, it seemed. Also, some scenes, like the animation, and the scene where Sorter kills (actually one of my favorites), though, seeing great scenes, just being there because they were great to look at, not because they fit with the movie ,

But there were also many good things. I found the acting of all the main actors, Jason Stratham, Ray Liotta, Vincent Pastore and even Andre Benjamin (which was a pleasant surprise) to be excellent. This movie definitely caught my interest, with one great, exciting, action-packed scene after another. When Ray Liotta was held under the table, wow ... well, you have to see it. The script was very well done and the soundtrack, as with most Guy Ritchie movies, was great.

Although it went one step below movies like "Fighting Club", "Mullholland Drive" and "Usual Suspects", it was still a stunning action movie with lots of twists and lots of scenes to go on for a long time will remember after the movie.

summary: When one saucer of an invasion force has engine trouble, it lands on Earth. It happens to be Halloween and it happens the invaders are only about 4 feet tall. As the bumbling aliens wander around the countryside they are taken to be children and they make friends with two children, one of whom is the daughter of the sheriff. As their troubles mount (it's difficult for five aliens to conquer a world) they begin to give up their plans of conquest, but then there is that nasty killer robot.
translation:
This is a silly movie of a thinking man. If you do not expect Star Wars and enjoy British humor, this could become a cult classic for you and my wife - from the "voice" of Cary Grant and Jack Nicholson as Martians for the over-simple population of Big Bean. This is a movie, you either sleep through or watch and enjoy carefully.

It's not for everyone, but if you have fun, relax with light humor, who needs a quick mind to see the joke slip by, you'll enjoy this movie.

summary: A cynical tragicomedy focusing on the different ways of love in the times of the sexual revolution. Nicholas Mallet, an inconspicuous and shy bank employee, one day successfully invites Marie-Paul, a young woman he hadn't known before, in the streets of Paris to a caf√© and sleeps with her the next day. When he tells his surprised friend Claude about the incident, the disillusioned and handicapped writer develops a plan to control and manipulate Nicholas' life. First of all, he procures him to Roberte, a professor of philosophy's frustrated and bored wife...
translation: LOVE ON THE TOP - the completely insane American title for the great French movie "Le Mouton Enrage" (which means "The Rabid Sheep") is such an original movie, the fact that it dates back to 1974 seems all the more amazing. This film was far ahead of its time; Even by today's highest standards, it reaches things that seem rich and new. Filmed by the extremely undervalued director Michel Deville, he escapes from the description of social criticism, comedy, mystery, love, sex and satire to a very unique mix - and leaves at the end of a big, but subtle surprise behind him is suddenly suddenly sad and understandable went. The cast is great, as well as the script and theme. But it is Deville's delicious tone that constantly upsets you, but in a rapture that drives this "lost" movie to a very high level. (The written interview with the director in the "Special Features" section of the DVD is definitely worth reading if you have time.)

summary: Rich Lois Frazer, divorcing her fortune-hunter husband, finds he's bought a gun. Suspecting he plans to kill her, she calls in her lover, who just happens to be Homicide Lieutenant Ed Cullen. When Ed arrives, the gun gets used...and because of his relationship with Lois, Ed is compelled to compound a felony. The good news: Ed himself is assigned to the case. The bad news: Ed's hotshot younger brother Andy, a new- minted detective, is also on the case...and anxious to prove himself.
translation: That was a disappointing movie for me. It came to me about a box called "Classic Film Noir", which was a gift from someone who knows that I usually enjoy movies in this style (I insist that Noir is a style, not a genre) , I do not think it's a noir movie at all. There seems to be a tendency today to label and market every black-and-white B film from 1947 to 1955 as Noir, and the label does not always fit. There is a persecuted male protagonist, Ed Cullen (Lee J. Cobb), and most of the plot of the movie takes place in the house. These are just the only Noir elements I could see. There is no omnipresent paranoia or any real reason why you should sympathize with Ed Cullen. Jane Wyatt was exaggerated and unconvincing as Femme Fatale. I do not want to spoil this movie for potential viewers. But I would like to know what other movie connoisseurs have to say about it.

summary: It is 1957. J.C. Cullen is a young man from a small town, with a talent for winning at craps, who leaves for the big city to work as a professional gambler. While there, he breaks the bank at a private craps game at the Gem Club, owned by George Cole, and falls in love with two women, one of them Cole's wife. Infuriated, Cole wagers everything on the craps table, including the Gem Club itself, and he and Cullen have it out.
translation: Very entertaining and a great cast as mentioned. I would like to add that Bruce Dern has also done a good job, as is usually the case. Rented, if you can find it, which has proved to be difficult for me. Also note that the Amazon link from this page currently leads to another movie of the same name.

summary: Archie Grey Owl is a trapper in Canada in the early 1930s when a young Iroquois woman from town asks him to teach her Indian ways. They live in the woods, where she is appalled at how trapped animals die. She adopts two orphaned beaver kits and helps Archie see his way to stop trapping. Instead, he works as a guide, a naturalist writer, and then the Canadian government hires him to save the beaver in a conserve by Lake Ajawaan in Prince Albert National Park. He writes a biography, which brings him attention in Canada and invitations to lecture in England. Before he leaves, he and Anahareo (Pony) marry. In England, his secret is revealed. Will Anahareo continue to love him?
translation: If you know the story of Gray Owl, you will love the movie! Annie Galipeau is a great actress and Pierce is better than never in Gray Owl. But in this movie there is no real scene of action. I think this movie should be nominated for the Oscars! Welll go and watch this movie, it's a classic!

summary: By fighting for their right to live and worship as they choose, Jehovah's Witnesses won legal victories that protected civil liberties and free choice for all Americans. By refusing blood transfusions, but insisting on medical care, Jehovah's Witnesses risked their lives in pursuit of new bloodless technology now used on all types of patients. By resisting Hitler and his Nazi army, German Jehovah's Witnesses were sent to the concentration camps and became martyrs.
translation: I found it very balanced to show what Jehovah's Witnesses did to protect American freedoms. It also showed the strong faith of two families who were witnesses of the first generation. I also appreciated that it has shown that Jehovah's Witnesses, when they are witnesses of non-witnesses and how difficult it is for them to accept the fact that they do not celebrate holidays, the sad part is that non-witnesses Witnesses Families do not mind having family with family meals / visits or giving gifts at other times, but for holidays or birthdays. When it comes to medical care, the witnesses want and expect a high standard of medical care. What people forget is that blood transfusions allow sloppy medical care and surgeries, while bloodless treatments have highly trained and trained the medical team, which would you prefer to treat your loved ones? I recommend this video very much!

summary: Shenzhen businessman, Da Ming, goes home to Beijing when he thinks his father has died. He finds his father hard at work at the family's bathhouse (the false message was a ruse of Da's mentally-handicapped, exuberant brother, Er Ming, to get Da home). Da stays a couple days, observing his father being social director, marriage counselor, and dispute mediator for his customers and a boon companion to Er. Da is caught between worlds: the decaying district of his childhood and the booming south where he now lives with a wife who's not met his family. When Da realizes his father's health is failing and the district is slated for razing, he must take stock of family and future.
translation: Just watched the Australian premiere of Shower [Xizhao] at the Sydney Film Festival. The program notes said it was - a perfect pleasure - direct, touching, amusing, dramatic and poignantly meaningful. I could not agree more. I just hope the rest of the festival films are up to this level of entertainment, and I look forward to seeing more Chinese films to be screened in Sydney in the coming months.

summary: At an annual pace, a huge colony of ants is forced to collect every piece of food that grows on their island for a group of menacing grasshoppers. But that all changes when a misfit inventor ant named Flik accidentally knocks over the offering pile thus forcing the grasshoppers' devious leader Hopper to force the ants to redo their gathering of food. Despite the fact that his friends don't believe him and desperate to help save the colony, Flik volunteers to go out into the world and search for a group of 'warrior' bugs. Instead, what he got was a talented group of circus performers. But when the grasshoppers return and take control of the island, Flik must prove himself a true hero before it's too late.
translation:
Lately, I've seen a lot of movies by Tom Hanks and old Chaplin movies, and even some of Rowan Atkinson's early bean performances, and it seems that all of them have their unique charm that permeates them, something they relate to Can identify viewers of all ages, in a way that just does you good. A Bug's Life has the same charm, it has a connection with real life that allows us to easily lift unbelief and accept many talking insects because even though they talk, they still act like real bugs. It's as if the team that made the film found a way to put us in the head of a child and allow us to think, to imagine bugs, like a young mind does.

Darling, I've Shrunk The Kids was one of my favorite movies when I was younger, and to me A Bug's Life is like a more realistic version of the movie, just because the animation is so breathtaking and this type of storytelling simply so many opens up more narrative possibilities. I'm not trying to compare it to something like Toy Story (which I still claim is the best computer-animated movie of all time) because the story of A Bug's Life is not as good as Toy Story, but almost nothing. The important thing is that it's still a lot of fun.

The story is about a colony of hard-working bugs that have an impressively developed society that is primarily geared towards building a crop of food, most of which goes to the tyrannical grasshoppers that are in power and wickedness are far superior and hopefully enough left for the beetles to make it through the winter. We are visited by grasshopper visits, which make it clear that if the beetles provide an insufficient amount of food, the consequences will be bleak. And by the way, the similarities between this crippling level of food extraction is strikingly similar to Mao Tse-tung's malign enforcement of food from his own people during the "Big Leap Forward".

The fun and excitement begin as Flik, ‚Äã‚Äãthe main character, sets out to find a band of suitable warrior bugs to come back and defend the colony against the grasshoppers. You see, he spilled all the food and put everyone in great danger, so he feels it's his responsibility, but he ends up inadvertently hiring a fighting group of insect circus performers. Great for the audience, not great for the security of the clan.

The film was released in the late '90s when so many films appeared in pairs, such as Armageddon and Deep Impact, Independence Day and The Arrival, A Bug's Life and Antz, etc comparisons between A Bug's Life and Antz are inevitable, though it seems clear to me that A Bug's Life is by far the most superior movie, and not just because Woody Allen is not stuttering and whining through the lead role. This is great family fun!

summary: Maurice Pialat's portrait of contemporary France mocks prosperity as a substitute for social and sexual revolution. Nelly abandons her bourgeois friends and a steady relationship for the unemployed layabout Loulou, whose charms include focusing his energy into sex.
translation: This is a pretty dull movie. Well shot with realistic performances, especially a very good one by Depardieu as cad and bad boy with realistic location mood and art-house connotations everywhere, it fails because the director does not take a position, attitude or critical comment on the subject he has given. One of France's revered and regular workers in films with Depardieu - I think they did 7 together - Pialat failed. It seems to be a treatise on why women fall in love with the bad boy who gets hurt if they have a caring friend and a kindhearted husband. Isabelle Hupert, who plays the womanizer with nonchalant distinction, offers shameful answers like "I do not know"; "I like his arms"; "I like the way he makes love" to her questioning husband, who tries to kick her out of the house, but relieves and thinks over, because ... I suppose he loves her. So he accepts and hopes for something? That she will one day wake up and come to her senses. Such things are not answered in Pialat's condescending docu-drama style with long speeches and even longer scenes that do not add up. I know the answers are not correct, but please comment. Jules and Jim, that's not it. The last shot, as cold as the movie we just saw, is a heartache and a headache only for the most outrageous.

summary: Musical adaptation of Charles Dickens's classic tale of an orphan who runs away from the orphanage and hooks up with a group of boys trained to be pickpockets by an elderly mentor.
translation:
I was lucky, "Oliver!" 1968 on a big movie screen in Boston when I was a young teenager. Later, in the summer of 1969, I was pleased to see that the movie still starred in a prominent movie theater in Leicester Square, London, after winning the Oscar for best picture of the previous year.

The success of "Oliver!" Both on stage and on screen reminded me that not all talent on Broadway starts and ends in Hollywood. This legendary story by Charles Dickens, part of the literary heritage of all English-speaking people, was admirably brought to the London stage by Lionel Bart of Great Britain. His charming musical became a hit in New York and around the world. The film was made in the summer of 1967 in England and then published in 1968. The sets and musical numbers are insane. The song "Who buys?" Hundreds of actors were needed, and the British film director really deserved his Oscar for putting everything together seamlessly. Some Canadian and American talents are also part of this wonderful production, but above all a tribute to the fine craftsmanship of British film studios like Shepperton. Good show! Other film studios in Elstree, Boreham Wood, Bray, Denham and Ealing have given many films to the world over the years.

summary: Portrait of an American innocent. In 1955, Bettie Page (1923-2008 ) waits to testify before a Senate subcommittee investigating the effects of pornographic material on American adolescents and juveniles. In flashbacks, we see her childhood in Tennessee, a brief marriage, a gang rape, and her going to New York City in 1949. There she takes acting lessons, models for photos, and acts in short films for adults, earning the nickname, "The Pin-Up Queen of the Universe." We see her relationship with merchants Irving and Paula Klaw, photographers John Willie and Bunny Yeager, boyfriends, and the public. Through it all, she is wholesome, sporting, and forthright - Eve before the fall.
translation:
THE SPECIAL BEDDY PAGE (2006) *** 1/2 Gretchen Mol, Lilli Taylor, Chris Bauer, Jared Harris, Sarah Paulson, David Strathairn, Austin Pendleton, Norman Reedus, Dallas Roberts.

Mol appears as a legendary pinup queen Bettie Page in a fine biopic.

Gretchen Mol has been known to be reprimanded as The Next-It-Girl a few years ago, especially when no-one knew who she was, despite a notorious cover story by Vanity Fair among other media -Dubbings, but despite some co-starring here and there, her predicted fame seemed even less bright. Here, like the famous pin-up queen Bettie Page, Gretchen Mol is indeed a shining star on the rise.

Bettie Page was born in Tennessee as a God-fearing and family-oriented, real girl herself the unjustified object of lust and affection as she grew older. A criminal gang rape is not graphically portrayed, and even the subtle portrayal of her own father has not quite as good designs for his own relatives, which is important to understand how Page mysterious life for a career could escape an actress who Traveling to New York City in the 1950s, in fact, was the time and place to catch the lights in a bottle. What Page did not know was that it was exactly when she arrived.

A beautiful, raven-black treasure with a divine figure. summary: Charlie B. Barkin (Burt Reynolds), a rascally German Shepherd with a shady past, breaks out of the New Orleans Dog Pound with the help of his faithful friend Itchy (Dom De Luise), a nervously hyperactive dachshund. He then makes tracks to reunite with his gambling casino partner Carface Malone (Vic Tayback), a shifty pitbull who has planned a dastardly, and potentially deadly, double cross. Suddenly, Charlie finds himself at the Pearly Gates, face to face with the Heavenly Whippet (Melba Moore). Charlie weasels his way back to earth and reunites with Itchy. He plots his revenge against Carface and, along the way, acquires help from a little girl named Anne-Marie (who can talk to animals). summary: What happens when you throw two guys who hate each other together. A cool call center executive Jimmy Cliff (Saif Ali Khan), a desi wannabe gangster Bachchan Pande (Akshay Kumar) add for good measure a beautiful girl Pooja (Kareena Kapoor) who cant be trusted - on a journey across spectacular India - a journey which will alter the course of their lives in more ways than one - a journey where even enemies need to trust each other if they want to stay alive. Trouble is, in this world no one can be trusted ever. summary: A Cockney con-artist just out of prison replaces an insurance company's computer programmer and sends claim checks to himself in various guises at addresses all over Europe. Meanwhile, he falls in love with inept secretary and frustrated flutist, Maggie Smith.

A good cast is horribly wasted in this slow comedy chased more than molly and arbitrarily. Subplot, Ustinov romance colleague longtime Maggie Smith, who happens to be his secretary after he gets an apartment in her building. Then he marries Smith and they fly to Brazil, which since then (Nuns on the Run? A fish called Wanda?) Has become the staple of almost every British comedy.

The surprising turn of an end is more ridiculous than anything that came before. In the end, I thought I really must be away from my rocker to do such a banter. Even a cameo by Cesar Romero did not help him. One of the most unmotivated, low-profile "comedies" I've ever seen, and certainly the worst caper game. Do not waste time. If you love that, you have to watch better movies.

summary: After working in the noisy horn factory, just the sound of one drives Oliver into a violent fit. Dr. Finlayson prescribes a long, restful sea voyage, so Stan and Oliver rent a boat and set sail, unaware that escaped killer Nick Grainger has stowed away onboard. To disable the crook, the boys prepare him a meal using string for spaghetti, sponges for meatballs and soap for cheese. But Grainger discovers their plan and decides to make them eat the stuff themselves.
translation: I can not believe that people in this movie are looking for an act. This is Laural and Hardy. Make yourself easier. These two were a rebellion. I guess it takes a simple mind to enjoy this stuff, so I qualify. Two-man comedy teams do not charge, we're just too demanding ... are not we lucky?

summary: A group of film students attempt to finish a horror movie that stopped production years earlier when the director was killed. Unaware that every attempt to complete the pic coincided with the murders of those involved, the students return to the original location in an isolated part of the country. When filming begins, so do the killings.
translation: Oh man, this movie will ever bite! If you were ever afraid to see a repeat of the Slasher genre as cheap as possible and at the same time cautious (PC-friendly, does not mean nudity, a classic element of Slasher movies) Cut is it.
