Suffering from such crap, you only realize that the delightful spirit of the 80s Slasher has disappeared forever.

summary: A Cockney con-artist just out of prison replaces an insurance company's computer programmer and sends claim checks to himself in various guises at addresses all over Europe. Meanwhile, he falls in love with inept secretary and frustrated flutist, Maggie Smith.
translation:
I can only repeat the praise of the other reviews here. It's a delightful movie with a feel-good factor it achieves without crossing the line into slippery sentimentality. Of course sweet - without added sugar.

One small point: It seems to me that the slight objections about Ustinov's character Pendelton, who is able to intervene and defeat system security, ignore the fact that Pendelton is clearly one of Genie / Savant in this kind of thing. Yes, the film was pretty computer illiterate, but it showed Pendelton "studying computers" in his apartment, and I believe the implication was that his gifts allowed him to devour the whole subject virtually overnight.

There were a few strange moments in which, in some scenes, Gnatpole tried to test Pendelton's knowledge and call his bluff. I am not sure if we should think that Pendelton craftily got out of these situations, or if he actually had enough knowledge to pass the tests - it was a bit unclear.

Certainly I needed to know enough to set up the dummy accounts. Presumably, Wallach and Ustinov have relied on their own rather foggy notion of how computers worked then, and to understand exactly what they are aiming at, it is necessary to know exactly what their concept was. They knew that something about "procedures" was important; They thought that the "intelligent light" could actually control safety rather than just indicate its condition; They thought that the properties of the (stupid) user terminal would greatly affect what could be done on the mainframe itself. Although I do not see myself apart from things like the graphics.

Mostly, I think they are trying to avoid the subject of actual computer operations as much as possible, and they did that pretty well. I allow them to get some artistic license, I do not think their efforts had any bugs worth mentioning.

CD

summary: Micheal, a former test subject of a project to create supersoldiers, is forced to escape with his comrades after the project was cancelled. Months later, he is trying to have a quiet life as a librarian with a tough cop as his best friend. However, a string of vicious gangland murders begins that has all the markings of his former compatriots who seem to have turned to violent crime. Realizing that the police are helpless to fight these soldiers, Micheal decides to take them on himself. Donning a mask to protect his identity, Micheal must fight these powerful villians as the mysterious superhero known only as Black Mask.
translation:
What could I say more? The Americans totally hated it, because the US cut was so bad, though you could see the underlying goodwill in it.

In terms of the US theatrical release (along with the newly released Blu-ray Disc version), it's faster and firmer than HK cut, the background music has been replaced by the dark, grim HK Music changed to hip-hop music; and many cruel scenes were cut out. However, the synchronization was a remarkable work as they tried to capture the voice and tone of the original actor. But the problem is Hak Hap (Black Mask), the film was designed to be dark, grim, superstitious and totally cruel. Unfortunately, the US release overflowed the cream they wanted, which in turn completely changed the undertone of the film (HK release was rated 18+) to be even funnier and more amateurish.

Now let's talk about the original HK release. This movie is like a hidden gem, a prototype for the whole "matrix" of tides and ages. The fight scenes are totally awesome, even the camera work was a little "old-school" among HK movies. However, the style of the film was a unique blend of kung fu and pop culture. With all the leather, black costumes and decorations, this movie features a Batman-style superhero in a black mask against an ordinary gang of multinational supersoldiers, led by a punk heavy metal rock star boss. Yes, it sounds like the idea of ‚Äã‚Äãa disabled child, but it works. It's so impressive that the whole movie triggers nightmares in which foreigners wage a bloodbath in leather coats. In 2002, they made a sequel that had a PG-13 rating, but without Jet Li and Liu Qing Yun. And you know how bad that was because Li and Liu were the main characters of the movie and had strong personalities and an interesting friendship. And, did I happen to mention Francois Yip? Her roundhouse kick was totally cool, even cooler than the villain boss, because she did not use a stuntman for all the fights. Did I mention that she also smoked hot? Anyway, there are a lot of things to like about the movie.

However, the movie also had a lot of problems. First of all, it's a mediocre script with the best potential, which means this production team deserves a better script writer. There are many highlights throughout the 100 minutes, but they often felt far-fetched and did not make perfect sense to the audience (the US version was even worse because all character development was dropped). Anyway, you can not ask too much for a comic-inspired action movie. In addition, this film is completely unsuitable for children. I will not recommend it to you if you are less than 20 years old. It's full of disturbing content like blood, blood, sado-maso costumes, extreme brutal violence and so on. Along with the style of the film, it can be described as a wet dream for heavy metal rock fans and action fans. (The US cut was milder, but if you want to see it, watch the HK release for what it is.) 7/10. Status: inspirational, hidden, underrated, adult.

summary: Sort of a low-budget Short Cuts (1993), set in the Flemish port city of Antwerp on a warm day in June. Natalie, her brother Chouki, her boyfriend Walter and his ex Lara, the gallery keeper Firmin, unhappily married French language teacher Paul Garcin, a couple of party-loving studs from Ghent (another Flemish city) and the enigmatic Windman, independently go about their lives, which have little in common, yet all end up on the same place for a grand party that evening.
translation: The story is about the lives of ordinary people from Antwerp who live their lives. So I said it, and there's really nothing left to tell about the story. The movie is fast, like an MTV movie and well photographed, and we think the director is talented and should make more films. Let's forget that and hope for the best with the next Deus Barman image.

summary: The story of a very dysfunctional family and what happens when the parents divorce. Eve (Geraldine Page) and Arthur (EG Marshall) are a 60-something couple, recently separated. They have three adult daughters - Renata (Diane Keaton), Joey (Mary Beth Hurt) and Flyn (Kristin Griffith). Renata is a poet and is married to Frederick (Richard Jordan). Joey is (reluctantly) in advertising and is married to Mike (Sam Waterston). Joey is a film and TV actress. Eve is an incredibly negative woman and this has had a toxic effect on her children. This results in stifling, unsupportive relationships and joyless lives.
translation: When I was little, my parents took me to the theater to see interiors. It was one of many movies I saw with my parents, but that was the only one we left. Since then, I had seen Interiors only recently, and I could have lived the rest of my life without it. What a swanky, cumbersome and painfully boring piece from the 70s wine and cheese tripe. Woody Allen is one of my favorite directors, but Interiors is by far the worst part of his career. In the distinctive style of Ingmar Berman, Allen gives us a dark, angular, subdued insight into the life of a family caused by the psychological damage caused by divorce, alienation, career, love, non-love, bad breath, or whatever , The film deliberately has no comical relief, no music and is bathed in shady pathos. This style of film can best be defined as an expressionistic expression in nature, using an improvised method of dialogue to spread a "deeper depth of meaning and truth". But Woody Allen is not Ingmar Bergman. The movie is painfully slow and boring. But beyond that, I simply had no connection or sympathy for any of the characters. Instead, I felt only contempt for this parade of shuffling, wailing, nicotine-smeared martyrs who were forever searching for identity. In the midst of a cosmopolitan abundance and baked Brie intelligence, the story emerges like a fart in the room. Everyone talks about cigarettes in concerned platitudes and heightened language. Everyone is "lost" and "struggling", desperate to find direction or understanding or whatever, and it just keeps going on and on to the point where you just want to beat everyone. It's never about dissolution, it's just endless, introspective chatter. It is nothing more than a psychological drama that goes beyond the connectivity of the public. Woody Allen chose to immerse characters in themselves so that we feel excluded. And that's why I found this film painfully complacent and spiritually draining. I see what he was up to, but his insistence on spreading his message through Prozac prose and distorted film techniques throws them beyond the point of relevance. I highly recommend them if you feel a bit too happy and need something to remind you of death. Otherwise we pretend that this movie never happened.

summary: The Cahulawassee River valley in Northern Georgia is one of the last natural pristine areas of the state, which will soon change with the imminent building of a dam on the river, which in turn will flood much of the surrounding land. As such, four Atlanta city slickers, alpha male Lewis Medlock, generally even-keeled Ed Gentry, slightly condescending Bobby Trippe, and wide-eyed Drew Ballinger, decide to take a multi-day canoe trip on the river, with only Lewis and Ed having experience in outdoor life. They know going in that the area is ethno-culturally homogeneous and isolated, but don't understand the full extent of such until they arrive and see what they believe is the result of generations of inbreeding. Their relatively peaceful trip takes a turn for the worse when half way through they encounter a couple of hillbilly moonshiners. That encounter not only makes the four battle their way out of the valley intact and alive, but threatens the relationships of the four as they do, ...
translation:
* SPOILER * Four men, Ed (Jon Voight), Lewis (Burt Reynolds), Drew (Ronny Cox) and Bobby (Ned Beatty), decide to do a rafting tour on the Cahulawassee River before it is flooded. >
They wanted to have fun to have a nice weekend in nature.

But when two miners cross their path and rape one of them (Bobby), everything starts to go bright in a handbasket, and this "nice weekend" will cost even one of the four lives ...

"Deliverance", in Italian "Un Tranquillo Weekend Di Paura" ('A Calm Weekend Of Fear'), is the grandad of films like "Texas Chainsaw Massacre", "The Hills Have Eyes" , "Wrong Turn", "The Last House on the Left" and all the other "Evil Nature / Revenge" subgenre movies, and one of the scariest, right next to 'The Hills Have Eyes'.

Based on a book by James Dickey (who appears in the movie as Sheriff Bullard), it's a scary story about how someone can think in a situation he knows everything when he does not ,

And the image of the dead man's hand jutting out of the water, or the hands holding the rifle from the monosheet, are haunting images that never go out of their minds />
liberation : 9/10.

summary: Cheech must deal with losing his job, his angry neighbor, and trying to score with sexy Donna. Meanwhile, Chong meets Cheech's cousin Red and the two have a wild time in Hollywood with a big bag of buds and a cool Ferrari. Along the way they meet everyone from Pee Wee Herman to really cool aliens.
translation:
Cheech & Chong's Next Movie (1980) was the second film to make pot-loving duo Cheech Marin and Tommy Chong a star. The lovable burnout smokers are now roommates. They live in a condemned building looking for ways to score more smoke and lie around all day. But Cheech is the "responsible person". He has a job and a girlfriend. One day Cheech wants to put on his freak to get Chong out of the house. Another problem crops up, Chech's brother "Red" (Cheech is a different role) is in town and wants to hang out with him. With the confirmation that he can kill two birds with one stone, Cheech Chong and Red pledge. What adventures come Chong and Red? Will Cheech put on his freak? How long will Chong go without a bit of smoke? Check out CHECH & CHONG'S NEXT MOVIE to find out !!

Tommy Chong will direct the sequel. He got some experience when he did some unrelated work on UP IN SMOKE. Funny, but not as good as the first movie. But Cheech and Chong fans will enjoy it. Followed by NICE DREAMS.

Recommended.

summary: Dr. Feinstone has everything, a beautiful wife and a successful career in dentistry, but, when he discovers his wife in an affair, he realizes that behind every clean, white surface lies the stench of decay. Having gone insane, he enacts cruel dental torture on his patients.
translation: The brilliance of this film is that even a competent dentist is pretty scary. It is one of the original fears of man. This movie is the nightmarish picture that every kid in the waiting room has to go through. Corbin Bernsen gives a surprisingly non-dazzle performance as a crazy dentist trying to kill people, but he only works on her teeth so it does not really work. In a particularly bloody scene, we find the so-called actor Earl Boen, who has completely destroyed his teeth with drills and whatever, which I feel is the absolute worst thing to do if you're a killer dentist. It is a typical situation of Brian Yuzna, not well written, but there is blood. The plot is shabby and sometimes seems to be done on the spot, but hey, it's a killer dentist movie, we all thought about it, but they did it first.

summary: A young girl develops a clever plot so she doesn't have to move away from her friends.
translation: That was the worst movie I have ever seen! Molly (Molly Hall) could not do EVERYTHING! she had no emotions, it was all, blah blah blah, as if reading from a boring textbook. The smart kid and the kid who loves food (where the names were not worth remembering) were so annoying that it drove me crazy. When it came to the topic, it was about something scientific or food. Molly's father did not show enough emotions about his missing daughter. The police officer and Molly's father said the same thing four times. It was just awful. Everything has been repeated way too much. Beatrice would have had to do something bad because she was so mean. I just wasted a moment in my life by watching this movie!

summary: Two losers from Milwaukee, Coop & Remer, invent a new game playing basketball, using baseball rules. When the game becomes a huge success, they, along with a billionaire's help, form the Professional Baseketball League where everyone gets the same pay and no team can change cities. Coop & Remer's team, the Milwaukee Beers is the only team standing in the way of major rule changes that the owner of the Dallas Felons wants to institute.
translation: This movie is just funny. mindless, but funny. To fully enjoy this movie, you can not have any idea how a movie like this is going to run and just enjoy all the side jokes and puns that have to do with the movie. I still find that bit funny in the beginning when he says "Will a beer ........ tail". Funny stuff. but what makes the movie decent is the fact that it's not trying to make a serious turn of the movie, too many comedies are trying to have serious aspects that you simply do not believe in. But that's different and just focuses on being funny. However, I have to say that Yasmin Bleeth is terrible in the movie and does not add anything, except for the 3 captains, Coop, Remer and Squeak, who are very funny and make the movie look great

summary: Car theft in Long Beach went down 47% when Randall "Memphis" Raines walked away from the life. He gets dragged back into it by assuming the job his brother Kip screwed up for stolen-car broker Raymond Calitri: steal 50 exotic cars and have them on a container ship by 8 AM Friday morning, and he got this news on a Monday. With Calitri threatening to kill him and Kip, and the police GRAB unit breathing down his neck, Memphis reassembles his old crew and attempts to pull off the logistically impossible.
translation: The story is quite original, but the movie slowly builds to the point where they steal the cars. It's nice to watch them steal, but the actual stealing should be more in the picture ... But the stunt work on this movie was excellent and it's definitely a movie you can see (7/10)

summary: In a 1950's mining town called Coalwood, Homer Hickam is a kid with only one future in sight, to work in the local coal mine like his father. However in October 1957, everything changes when the first artificial satellite, Sputnik goes into orbit. With that event, Homer becomes inspired to learn how to build rockets. With his friends and the local nerd, Homer sets to do just that by trial and a lot of error. Unfortunately, most of the town and especially Homer's father thinks that they are wasting their time. Only one teacher in the high school understands their efforts and lets them know that they could become contenders in the national science fair with college scholarships being the prize. Now the gang must learn to perfect their craft and overcome the many problems facing them as they shoot for the stars.
translation: The presentation in this film was excellent. As an amateur rocket player I have found very few mistakes. As a human, it touches my heart and soul. To see the actors, you would think that they are the real characters. Laura Dern, one of my favorite actresses, has not forgotten about her performance. The young actors who played the Rocket Boys showed talent beyond their years, especially the young Homer. Homer's father inspired this eternal love / hate relationship between father and son so that it felt real. If you do not get a lump in your throat or shed a tear, when the first successful rocket goes off, or when father and son come to terms, then check your pulse (you may be dead).

summary: Cecile, decadent young girl who lives with her rich playboy father Raymond. When Anne, Raymond's old love interest, comes to Raymond's villa, Cecile is afraid for her way of life.
translation:
This is superficial hedonism and / or social commentary, wrapped up in a tragic story about a jealous young woman's plan to disperse her father and fiancee. Is it incest or just a look through the eyes of a daughter with an Electra complex? Who cares? All characters except Anne (Deborah Kerr) are empty and mean. Seberg is poor (I agree with the comment "Boys with Breasts" from an earlier review). The action plagued itself. This predictable material was enough for about 30 minutes of film, which unfortunately was stretched over one and a half hours! If you want to see great clothes and jewels on the Riviera, I recommend "catching a thief" - where you get the extra bonuses of a fun story and sympathetic characters.

I like movies to entertain myself. I personally do not care where a movie is made. No matter what time or place, I want a good story - comedy or drama. I also want to see some nice characters. It does not hurt if I can identify with them. The bad Deborah Kerr gives a typically good performance, and also David Niven in a despicable role.

The rating "2" is exclusively for Kerr and Niven, and for the cinematography - the rich color scenes and the gloomy, menacing black and white scenes. Unfortunately, the great cinematography of the world can not save a bad story with inappropriate characters. The ear of a sow is still the ear of a sow. Consequently, it was a serious waste of my time to observe this chaos.

summary: This is a short film based on the 1979 film of the same name. The film is stylized with the actors wearing modernized robes and Roman jewelry and females playing male characters and vice-versa.
translation:
Since I loved the original "Caligula" even with all its flaws, I have to say that this remake trailer was abysmal.

Listen to Jovovich saying in this lazy American accent "Mmm cuhligyooluh ..." makes me feel bad. The set does not look Roman at all ... it looks like the Hollywood Mansion backyard of a rich actor, and the Roman costumes look like cheap crap you buy in a suburban costume shop.

The "charming" Adriana Asti looks like a fifty-year-old Hispanic woman who is totally crazy with fear as if she does not know it's a movie trailer.

Acting must be one of the worst I have ever seen, On most lines I hear random actors who scream "CALIGULAAAAAAAAAAAAA !!!!!!!!" as loud and annoying annoying as they can.

The random sex scenes also filled well 40 or 50% of the trailer, and the scenes with notable actors / actresses like Gerard Butler (who graces the screen) shadows for every three and a half seconds) that do nothing but look uncomfortable or go over the top with their minimal lines, just pull them down with the ridiculousness of their delivery.

Courtney Love's part is that she looks like her ordinary, clumsy crack-whore leaning against a door mumbling over the moon or something. You can not say it because she is either drunk or high or just mumbles idiotically.

Karen Black is simply annoying ... indiscriminately laughing and screaming in such a way that it irritates you.

Frankly, this must be the worst, most exploitative, self-sufficient, arrogant crap known as the "art" I've ever seen. Even if Gore Vidal hated the original Caligula, he should not have shown up or given up his name for this pile of rubbish, no matter how much they paid him (unless it was a billion trillion yen). Worst trailer ever.

summary: A girl is caught in a drug bust and sent to the hoosegow. The iron-handed superintendent takes exception to a skit performed by the girls and takes punitive steps, aided by the sadistic doctor who is doing illegal electroshock experiments and raping drugged prisoners. After a while the prisoners put away their petty differences and plan the Big Prison Escape.
translation:
Wilson (Erica Gavin) is caught by the police and sent to jail in this nifty and amusing example of exploitation of the Prime 70, marking the directing debut of Jonathan Demme. After writing and producing some of Mentor Roger Corman's New World films, Demme was given the opportunity to direct for the first time and he delivers a film that not only delivers the expected and palatable dose of nudity and violence, but also appealing is winking quality; it's often as funny as it is conspicuous.

Outstanding scenes include a lewd vaudeville style being played for the prisoners, as well as a potent dream / fantasy sequence for the jammed and obviously suppressed superintendent McQueen (horror icon Barbara Steele) antagonistic role makes a wonderful turnaround). I also enjoyed a bank robbery scene that went haywire and a carjacking scene that was just noisy. As in other films of this kind, it is also commendable that it is both a portrait of female empowerment and of pure exploitation. These women are tough, they do not take rubbish from someone, and they are more than capable of treating themselves.

Our attractive cast here makes the most of their roles: Juanita Brown as aggressive Maggie, Roberta Collins as the cheeky Belle, Rainbeaux Smith as the cute and timid Lavelle, Gavin as the wide-eyed newcomer and Lynda Gold ( also known as Crystyn Sinclaire) in a light appearance as an accomplice on the outside.

As our climax unfolds, Demme comes with a tense "beat-the-clock" finish, while our heroines try to stop Belle from taking on the predatory Dr. Randolph (Warren Miller) to be lobotomized, the kind of man who does not think anything of exploiting women.

Going down on "Caged Heat" to John Cales's tasty score, it's a happy conversation and a guaranteed good time.

8/10

summary: Jean-Luc Godard's densely packed rumination on the need to create order and beauty in a world ruled by chaos is divided into four distinct but tangentially related stories, including the attempts by a young group of idealists to stage a play in war-torn Sarajevo and an elderly director's efforts to complete his film.
translation: ... said a couple as he left the cinema just as I entered to watch this. Hmm, not a good sign, but who knows? Different strikes for different people finally. Well, no. They were nice. Godard has published works that are passionate (contempt), entertaining (Band of Outsiders), sometimes both (My Life to Live). This is just a stupid intellectualism that gets on your nerves pretty fast. During my performance, literally half of the audience had dropped out at the end of the movie. If only I had been so wise.

summary: A conflict develops between a troubled Vietnam veteran and the sister, with whom he lives, when she becomes romantically involved with the Army buddy who reminds him of the tragic battle they both survived.
translation: Who chooses these ratings? "Jacknife" is a beautifully performed, brilliantly viewed piece of work, with actors at the top of their game, especially Ed Harris and the incomparable Robert DeNiro (please do not mention Marlon Brando in the same breath of this man - see "Taxi Driver" for confirmation) point). Is it a "banal" movie because it does not involve sex / meaningless action / nudity? This movie is about the complexity of the characters involved. Ed Harris lets you feel with him any moment and his emotional breakup at the end is heartbreaking. The part where he orders a young man in a bar to take off his army clothes is a wonderful observation of how fashion and movies exploit tragic situations and how frustrated real men must feel to see a young upstart wearing military clothes. While we are on this topic, "Casino" 7.8 out of 10? One of the greatest films of all time, from one of the greatest directors, to the greatest movie actor of all time, to the scariest movie psycho-musician of all time, deserves above average? COME ON!!!!!

summary: Karen Davis, an American Nurse, moves to Tokyo and encounters a supernatural spirit who is vengeful and often possesses its victims. A series of horrifying and mysterious deaths start to occur, with the spirit passing its curse onto each victim. Karen must now find away to break this spell, before she becomes its next victim.
translation:
That was great. When I first saw the Japanese version, it was probably the scariest movie I've ever seen. It was not blood and guts, it was scary, atmospheric and terrifying. When the mother-spirit lent over the bed in the Japanese version, I almost had a heart attack ... I was worried that the American version would be watered down and that Buffy would remove the dark, spooky nuances of the original version. I did not have to worry. The creators of this film wisely kept the same Japanese who were involved in the original film, and gave the same man the direction of the film. You have it in Japan in the same place, in the same house. In fact, the Japanese director tried to make the same film as the original, the only difference being the casting of American actors. This became an advantage when the item "strangers in a foreign land" was added to the general horror. Not only were they haunted by an absolutely terrifying and ruthless spirit, but they were also stuck in a completely foreign land and had difficulty integrating into society. It just added the general anxiety that was built into the movie, and I thought it was an excellent note.

Buffy is really doing a very good job. She looks vulnerable and can convey her fear well. There are no clever remarks that are so common in American horror movies, or liners that distract from the general darkness and horror of the character's situation. In fact, it was just as good as the ring, which I really enjoyed. I hope that the future of American horror begins more closely with the Japanese New Wave of Horror, which began with the incredible success of Ringu. We finally get movies that can actually be categorized as "horror" !! 8.10

summary: The Herlihys are a working class family from Chicago whose three children take wildly divergent paths: Brian joins the Marines right out of High School and goes to Vietnam, Michael becomes involved in the civil rights movement and after campaigning for Bobby Kennedy and Eugene McCarthy becomes involved in radical politics, and Katie gets pregnant, moves to San Francisco and joins a hippie commune. Meanwhile, the Taylors are an African-American family living in the deep South. When Willie Taylor, a minister and civil rights organizer, is shot to death, his son Emmet moves to the city and eventually joins the Black Panthers, serving as a bodyguard for Fred Hampton.
translation: I like a lot of the actors / actors who are involved in this project, so offended by the movie felt even worse than if they used an unknown one. The main problem was this movie was clearly just a concept created to appeal to Baby Boomers 30 years Nbc is likely to make a movie just like that in the early '90s. I can now see a black family in which the children with the La Riots and the white family join in the rebels' rebels and hear the dirt rock music. The soundtrack features bands like Nirvana, NWA, Public Enemy, Soundgarden and so on. The movie will be just as cheesy as the 60's and I guarantee you NBC will. See the biggest problem with antique pieces when you buy networks, that when you live in a certain time, you do not think I live in it. The 60s or whatever decade is trendy retro at the time. Next time, someone like that They should put more weight into their project

summary: A PBS documentary concerning Jared Diamond's theory on why there is such disparity between those who have advanced technology and those who still live primitively. He argues it is due to the acquisition of guns and steel and the changes brought about by germs.
translation: "Jared Diamond pointed out in the first episode that other peoples in the world do not have animals to domesticate, but the Europeans did, and that explains why we were able to make steel and invent complex machines. " --- It is obvious that the person who wrote this comment did not understand the reasons for this documentation or the original book. Please do not ruin this great piece with your simplicity. The reasons are much more complex than the only thing you mentioned. Please read the book as it is a great source of information. I really enjoyed it. This book is even taught at some universities as a textbook.

summary: Portrait of Andy Goldsworthy, an artist whose specialty is ephemeral sculptures made from elements of nature.
translation:
I went and saw Rivers and Tides again today. It's the second time in two days and yes, I watch movies that I like as often as necessary. Yesterday I was impressed by the brilliance of the pictures and Goldsworthy's work. This morning, when I threw the coins, I received # 29 The Abysmal (Water). Goldsworthy has an affinity for water, hence the title. I got the fifth line, which changed to # 7 Army. Blake Art was a war. Anyway, I knew that I had to watch the movie again.

I read one of the few surviving reviews of the SF Examiner. The critic loved the movie, but said Goldsworthy's comments had affected his enjoyment of the film. He would rather have only the pictures and the wonderful soundtrack. I was aware of that when I saw the second time.

Yesterday I thought that I would choose Andy Goldsworthy as King of the World. Well, today I could come a little behind the pictures and hear what he had to say. Can I enjoy the movie without his comments? What he does, what he says, goes far beyond "art." His understanding of water, time, stone, change and so on has made me believe that the man is the reincarnation of Lao Tsu or an avatar. Some of his works / words are Zen-like. His knowledge ...

Anyway, the movie is only (seemingly) shown here in the Bay Area. Be a trendsetter. Go to your local movie theater and tell them not to insist that they need to book a movie that you heard about in the backcountry. It's called rivers and tides.

summary: One of the few (if any at the time this film was made) films shot in England with New York City's 'Little Italy" as the locale. This was Edward Dmytryk's first film after he had refused to tell a Congressional Committee whether or not he was, or had ever been, a member of the Communist Party. This is a 'runaway production' shot in England for political reasons and not for the usual USA tax-break reasons. Geremio, a young Italian immigrant to New York City, works as a bricklayer and is courting an Italian girl, Annunziata, by mail. He lies to her that he owns his own home and, after they are married, has to rent one for their three-day honeymoon. The years pass and they are unable to save enough money to get out of their slum tenement, and the 1929 depression brings even harder times to the family that now includes three children. Geremio, in order to make enough money to care for his family, exploits his "comrades" in dangerous construction work. This practice leads to the accidental ...
translation:
This movie has some great noirish / neo-realistic visuals and tells a story that is refreshingly free of Hollywood's icing, which was only possible because it was essentially an independent foreign film. But some of the scenes take far too long (especially the wedding), and I found the exaggerated drama and unrealistic dialogue more for the stage than for the screen.

The dialogue was particularly disturbing, and it seemed to get worse as the movie progressed. Most of the characters were either Italian or Italian immigrants living in New York in the twenties and thirties, but their dialogue sounded like they were practicing lines for a Shakespearean piece while mixing cement and laying bricks. I laughed towards the end, not because the filmmakers wanted it. I think the stilted poetry could be defended by saying that the characters spoke Italian, and the dialogue is a literal translation of how they would really talk. But it did not work for me at all.

Another type of dialogue made me laugh for a different reason: the son of the main character, born and raised in New York in the 1920s, suddenly begins to laugh with a British accent. I just suspect that had something to do with the film being shot in England.

I give this movie an "A" for effort and purpose, but a considerably lower grade for the performance.

summary: An American of German descent arrives in post-war Germany 1945. His uncle gets him a job on the Zentropa train line as a sleeping car conductor. The American's wish is to be neutral to the ongoing purges of loyalists by the Allied forces and do what he can to help a hurting country, but he finds himself being used by both the Americans and the influential family that owns the railroad. After falling in love with the railroad magnate's daughter, he finds that he can't remain neutral and must make some difficult choices.
translation: Zentropa is the most original movie I've seen in years. If you like unique thrillers influenced by Film Noir, then this is just the cure for all the Hollywood summer blockbusters that are clogging the movie theaters these days. Trier's follow-ups like Breaking the Waves have gained more recognition, but that's really his best work. It is striking without being distracting and offers the perfect combination of excitement and dark humor. It is a pity that he has decided that handheld cameras are the wave of the future. It is difficult to say who has distracted him from the style he exhibits here, but it is everyone's loss that he instead went in his hard theoretical dogma direction.

summary: It is post-World War III. War is outlawed. In its place, are matches between large Robots called Robot Jox. These matches take place between two large superpowers over disputed territories. The main character Achilles is a pilot in one of the large Robots. The plot revolves around him and a match for the state of Alaska.
translation:
Note to the previous reviewer: This film is "Sci-Fi Adaptation of the Iliad" according to the scriptwriter. So, whether the references are painful or not, no excuse, it's the basis for the movie. They admit that they stole ... although adapted, the P.C. Term.

Great strip but too short. Probably not as good as the author, director or studio, but damned fun. The fact that the studio itself imploded during production only adds to its legacy.

A big-budget remake would not be so funny and probably would not make the script justice anymore. But it's fun to dream of the potential. A DVD release with some meager extras is apparently available, but I do not think it would play on NTSC players. I am not an expert and I am still trying to find out. For now, I live with the VHS incarnation.

summary: Two extremely clever British men are in a game of trickery and deceit. Andrew Wyke, an aging famous author who lives alone in a high-tech mansion, after his wife Maggie has left him for a younger man; and Milo Tindle, an aspiring actor, equipped with charm and wit, who demonstrates both qualities once again. When Wyke invites Tindle to his mansion, Tindle seeks to convince the former into letting his wife go by signing the divorce paper. However, Wyke seems far more interested in playing mind games with his wife's new lover, and lures him into a series of actions he thoroughly planned in seeking revenge on his unfaithful spouse.
translation:
A remake of the great movie from 1972 that portrays Caine as the archenemy of his character from the first movie. But do not do anything else well.

An under-par performance by The Actors, Law and Caine, further diluted by weak self-compliant direction.

The warmth of The Original setting is abandoned for a super modern home setting. The subtle interplay between Oliver and Caine, which made the first film so tangible, is replaced by a terrible, arrogant arrogance that instantly causes contempt in the viewer. But that's not the clever back and forth, because you like the other character that the original has so well promoted, this is an obvious OTT character murder of both characters from the word.

This version of Sleuth is not really worth seeing, watch the original movie and be blinded by the pre-program.

summary: The Stilwins are on vacation to an isolated beach in Mexico. Walking on a deserted jetty, Doug Stilwin gets his leg trapped under one of the logs. All attempts to move the log are futile and Helen Stilwin takes the car to get help. However, an escaped criminal kidnaps her. Will she be able to return to her husband before he drowns?
translation:
What a great movie by Barbara Stanwyck I saw last night. "Jeopardy" was fantastic. It was made in 1953 and probably for double bills, but it kept me on the edge of my seat.

Barbara Stanwyck plays Helen driving with her husband Doug (Barry Sullivan) and son (Lee Aaker) a localized fishing spot in Mexico for a vacation. The husband falls off the dock and the only way he can be saved is when Barbara drives back to a garage for a rope.

There she meets a psychotic killer (Ralph Meeker - one of My Darlings) and what follows is a cat-and-mouse game while Barbara tries hard to get Meeker back to her husband to free.

The movie was so exciting and such a surprise - I did not expect such a great movie. But I suppose I should have understood - is there anything that Barbara Stanwyck does, is all that less than wonderful?

summary: In 1902 Texas, thirteen-year-old Horace goes to work on old Soll's farm to earn enough money to buy a headstone for his father's grave. Unfortunately for Horace, Soll's senility, ill health, and obsession with the convict labor he uses to work the farm, make it unlikely that Horace will ever be paid the twelve dollars and fifty cents Soll owes him for six months work.
translation: Holy crap. That was the worst movie I've seen in a long time. All performances are ok, but there is no action. Really! No action! A bunch of clowns talk about this and that and that's your movie. Ug ... Robert Duvall's character is senile and always asks the same people for the same questions. This always brings him the same answers. I'm pretty sure this movie was up to six years old because people think they should like it. Good performances with famous and respected actors, but the real work is a steaming bastard. Well, maybe that is a bit deceptive, because steam rising from a fresh pile, something like something happens and in this movie, NOTHING happens! bag

summary: Ben's dad Sam shows up one night with a note from Ben's mother (Sam's wife of 46 years), that she has left. While Ben's wife and his three sisters try to find her, Ben takes Sam on a day trip to see a farmhouse that's for sale. The day trip turns into a road trip while dad and son explore their past, their relationship, and why Sam's wife might have left him. The road trip includes fishing, drinking, playing pool, sleeping under the stars, and frank discussion. Anger simmers close at hand, as do love and hope. Where Sam's wife is - and why she left - leads to the movie's resolution.
translation:
"The Thing About My Folks" came as a surprise. We had no idea what to expect. The film directed by Raymond DeFelitta, based on a screen play by his star Paul Reiser, turned out to be a pleasant time in the cinema. Although the film is predictable and we know what it will become, this is a journey of discovery where Ben meets his father. Maybe for the first time in his life Ben sees his father for what he really is, not the one mythical figure he has in his mind.

The film seems to be a vehicle for star Peter Falk, and he runs away with the movie as expected. Mr. Falk, one of the loveliest actors to work in films during this time and years, is an actor of such stature to be reckoned with. As Sam Kleinman, the distant father of Ben, he is a man who is clearly misunderstood, not only by Ben, but by the whole family and his wife of forty-seven.

When Muriel, the matriarch of the Kleinman clan, runs away, everyone panics because this woman, who was the strong figure of the family, is vital to keeping everyone together. Without knowing where she went, Sam shows up in Ben's house, confused because he feels abandoned, suddenly by the woman he has married and faithful for all those years.

Ben, the youngest son, takes his father on a trip to look for a house he wants to buy so he can bring his own family from Manhattan to the country. The journey gives Ben the opportunity to connect with his father in a way he never knew, because the old man always showed his younger son a distant figure. Along the way, father and son realize how much they love each other and how the old man was misunderstood by his children. The love of Sams for Muriel spans the many years they know each other; they seem to be inseparable.

Peter Falk is great in the movie. He is an excellent Sam Kleinman, the man who suddenly realizes that his life will change to the worst. Mr. Falk shines as the older man and there is never a wrong move in his interpretation of the man whose whole world is crumbling under him.

Since we are not a Paul Reiser fan, we have to confess that as Ben Kleinman, he is right. Ben and his dad discover how much they have in common and their love for Muriel, the mother who sacrificed her life to keep the family together. Olympia Dukakis can only be seen at the end of the film. She makes a good contribution as a fleeing mother. Elizabeth Perkins plays Rachel on a grand scale.

The film has a beautiful look thanks to the camera work of Dan Gillham and the excellent music of Steven Argila. Ultimately, the film shows a great team effort between its director, Mr. DeFelitta and Paul Reiser, who wrote it for the screen.

Although this movie is clearly intended for an older audience, everyone should enjoy it.

summary: The seven American lawyers hired by Australian media magnate Jack Doulan, whose company rivals Albert Teal's Digicron for preponderance on the world market of telecommunications, are suddenly struck during a video conference in Seattle by an incredibly fast-working virus which wipes out everyone on their floor. Dr. Nick Baldwin, a brilliant virologist who works as an 'insubordinate' ambulance technician after being fired for failing to observe procedure, is first on the site and points out to US Army disease specialist Dr. Samantha Carter, who told him there were deaths in several other cases but never a trace of the virus, his ambulance has taken a survivor to his hospital; her therapeutic incompetence gets the patient killed, him assigned as temporary consultant to her army research unit- even there computer model operator Darren is killed by the virus, which also strikes at other sites in and around Seattle, notably at places where Digicron's 500 TV channels setup box is being ...
translation:
In fact, this strip made in 1999 has pretty good production values. The actors are attractive and reasonably talented. There is not a bunch of clowns running around and wasting hundreds of laps, but never eating meat. There are no wild chases where thousands of dollars worth of valuable machines are destroyed uselessly.

The interiors look respectably modern and architecturally, and the equipment looks like snuff. Well, this high-tech computer room is furnished with something that looks like remnants from a 50s electronics lab. And the pancake make-up on the bodies woke me up. Not pancake makeup in the traditional sense, but what looks like dried pancake dough is on the skin. This is to support the notion that the bodies are calcified - although how the virus would perform this transmutation is an exercise left to the student (viewer).

Oh, the virus. I'd like to tell you that this is not the absolute worst condition for a science fiction, horror movie I know, but I can not. A computer virus transmitted through a television screen (or computer screen) that becomes a deadly biological pathogen? Give me a break. Warp drives like "Star Trek" are one thing, but photons become viruses? This is so silly that the desired "shock factor" is simply not feasible. The strip could have used one of those horrible dream sequences where the dead come to life or a cat jumps out of the closet, or something, because the viral dingamajig does not.

It is believed that Robert Wagner has the same excuse for playing in the discomfort Lord Oliver has given for some of his later, trashy settings. He needed the money. No other comparison between the two, however, should be construed.

summary: In 1902 Texas, thirteen-year-old Horace goes to work on old Soll's farm to earn enough money to buy a headstone for his father's grave. Unfortunately for Horace, Soll's senility, ill health, and obsession with the convict labor he uses to work the farm, make it unlikely that Horace will ever be paid the twelve dollars and fifty cents Soll owes him for six months work.
translation: Robert Duvall is a direct descendant of Confederate General Robert E. Lee, according to the IMDb.com movie database. After watching this movie, you might think that Duvall's reincarnation is the best. One of my favorite movies. I wish the composer, Peter Rodgers Melnick, had a CD or a soundtrack available. Wonderful landscape and music and "just too lifelike", especially for those of us who live in the south or moved south. This is a "real moment". Life goes on slowly, but "strangers do not stay".

summary: Based on a comic book series. A woman burned at the stake in 15th century Sweden actually is Satan (Lucifer)'s daughter - and plots revenge against him.
translation: First and foremost, I want to tell you that I trust in comics, anime, animations, and stuff like that. It's true that everyone has their own preferences, but you can trust me in this movie. I will be objective. To start the story - it's OK. Follow the history of comics as far as I know them. But the animation ... Well, it's not really bad, but it's definitely cheap and mediocre. It would be much better if they did not try to imitate the anime style and stick to the original comic-style drawings. If we pretend not to see the rare sloppy effects of fire and lightning, you could say that the movie was shot about 10 years ago and more. Looks a bit like the original Vampire Hunter D from 1985. For example, look at Heavy Metal FAKK 2000 - 4 years ago they made a movie that looks a hell of a lot better! In addition, the voice talents make nothing remarkable, the music is nothing special. All in all - there is a lack of atmosphere. I saw it, but I can not say that I really enjoyed it. It just does not catch you. There is a lot of blood and violence, but that does not impress me. Maybe it's shocking for someone who has never seen mature animation and sees animated blood for the first time (is anyone around?), But I do not think this is the audience for this movie. So they could add a little nudity and spice. The chicks around Lucifer were pretty tasty, and hell, we have Lady Death ourselves! There are some sexy looks, but that's not enough. Rather than Bill Brown's music, it would look better on a Hard Rock / Heavy Metal soundtrack. All in all - the movie is not so bad, but if you want something better, take the original Heavy Metal, Heavy Metal FAKK 2000, Ralph Bakshi's Fire and Ice or Wizards maybe. And of course - vampire hunter D: blood lust

summary: Four year old Desi learns to accept the death of her father by sending him a letter on a balloon to which she receives a reply.
translation: This is just a short comment, but I happened to stumble on this movie and I loved it. Acting is great, the story is simple and touching, and the lines, especially by 4-year-old Desi, are so sweet and sad. Choose it.

summary: Television talk show dedicated to bringing uplifting stories, exciting guests, breaking news, and much more from a Christian perspective.
translation: The person's comment that Pat Robertson is evil and his program is evil has nothing to compare with what is evil and righteous. His definition of evil is the opposite of evil. The Bible itself says that in the last days people will call good, evil and evil good! He does not even know that he has fulfilled the biblical prophecy! If you do not know God and you refuse to know him now, that's fine. He still loves you, but when you finally bend your knee in front of him, and you will be, it will be too late for you. God does not send anyone to hell, not even you! You will make your own decision there and your spitting will define it! May God have mercy on you and give you a Damascus experience. The service of 700 Club and Pat Robertson is one of the reasons why I am still here. On the verge of alcoholism, adultery, and probably death, God grabbed the screen and used Pat Robertson to do it, and thank God he did! You have the right to say what you have said, but you have no right to curse with your words. God be merciful to you.

summary: Two sailors, one naive, the other experienced in the ways of the world, on liberty in Los Angeles, is the setting for this movie musical.
translation: Similar to "On the Town", this musical about farm workers in terms of pace and quality of the songs is inferior to the later classic, but has its own charms. Kelly has three fabulous dance routines: one with Jerry, the cartoon mouse of "Tom and Jerry," one with a little girl, and a fantasy sequence in which he is a Spanish lover determined to set his lady on a high To reach the balcony. Sinatra, playing Kelly's shy, inexperienced buddy, and Grayson, the woman who serves as a love interest for both men, make the most of the singing. Iturbi offers a good piano playing. At almost two and a half hours it is a bit too long for a light musical, but it does not pull.

summary: Four young women from Europe and Asia, recently arrived in England, begin their new jobs as Au Pairs. They quickly find that the English are not as stuffy and staid as they appear, and the young ladies are soon spending more time in bed than on the job.
translation: The story has already been described by other reviewers, so I'd just like to add that my reason to see this movie was Gabrielle Drake in all her undisputed splendor. Miss Drake must be one of them the sexiest, most beautiful examples of "Posh Totty" that were set on celluloid. From her epoch and her age, only the equally exquisite Jane Asher gets closer. What about actors with musical brothers? (Nick Drake and Peter Asher) For those who, like me, admired Gabrielle, their scenes in this film will not disappoint. She has a great figure and none of this is left to the imagination. Overall the movie is very poor and very cheap in its time. The song that covers the opening credits seems to go on forever and is appalling.

summary: In April 2002, an Irish film crew is making a documentary about Venezuelan President Hugo Chavez, when a coup from the opposition is made.
translation:
One of the best documentary films of recent years. Some points ...

1. Hugo Chavez was elected president of Venezuela in 1998 and his support came mainly from the poorer parts of Venezuela.

2. In 2002, Chavez was sold off in a coup d'√©tat. At that time, Irish filmmakers Kim Bartley and Donnacha O'Briain were in Caracas shooting a documentary on Chavez for British television. Her film deconstructs the coup d'etat and its consequences and electrifies the history that takes place on-site and outside the presidential palace.

3. Chavez aimed to free Venezuela from the free market policies imposed by the US. Although Venezuela's oil was already owned by the state, it was led to private advantage by executives who wanted to replace Chavez.

4. Although Venezuela is the fourth largest oil supplier in the world, Venezuela remains flooded with poverty and its resources are literally sucked away by foreign multinational corporations.

5. The documentary begins with Chavez's first years as president before the coup. It focuses on its popularity among the poor and its various policies that were popular with the locals (education plans, distribution of oil revenues, democracy on the grassroots, etc.).

6. Chavez was a great advocate of education and printed thousands of copies of the Venezuelan constitution, encouraging children and adults to study and understand them.

7. When Ch√°vez came to power, he immediately promised to redistribute the oil profit. This, understandably, made the oil companies nervous.

8. A media war broke out. The six private television stations immediately began to oppose the state TV station. They questioned Chavez's motives, mental health and sexual orientation.

9. Without media support, the coup would not have been successful. The film makes clear that the putschists rely heavily on the media to spread information, and that news can be easily made.

10. Under the guise of the "restoration of democracy", the opposition silenced the state television station, dissolved the National Electoral Council, the Supreme Court, the National Assembly and took control of the military.

11. Monetary interests, supported by the military elite (encouraged by the US and the CIA), organized a civic march in the presidential palace to bring about the coup. Snipers shot at Ch√°vez supporters, but the private media stations worked the material, so it seemed as if the refire was targeting the opposition march, which had indeed been safely diverted.

12. The police shoot at Chavez supporters and ravage the streets.

13. Chavez, imprisoned, refused to step back. Of course, then the media / government lied and said he had resigned, but Chavez's Cabinet members told the truth to the international community, which eventually brought the cable TV news back to Venezuela.

14. People rose and pressed for the return of the elected president, which only a referendum could replace constitutionally.

8.9 / 10 - With just over an hour this doc is far too short. Nevertheless, it is a captivating piece of journalism and is about a form of "media warfare" that is rarely touched. Is a great counterpart to "The Battle of Algiers".

Worth a visit.

summary: Dominick and Eugene are twins, but Dominick is a little bit slow due do an accident in his youth. They live together, with Dominick working as garbage man to put Eugene through medical school. Their relationship becomes strained when Eugene must decide between his devotion to his brother, or his need to go away to complete his training. Things are also not helped by Dominick's co-worker, or Eugene's budding romance.
translation:
That was 2 or so. The morning before a Saturday a few years ago, for various reasons, I do not remember the whole story, but what remains are the two outstanding achievements of the central characters. Dom had an unfortunate fate, manipulated and literally worked a crap job, tugging Eugene between personal aspirations and duties toward his siblings. Tom Hulce's dome does not ask for sympathy - it comes naturally. Ray Liotta is a universe away from Henry Hill, showing a soft center in what must feel a thankless position.

In many ways, this addresses the dilemma many young carers face - the past or the future. As it turns out, the two can happily coexist with some work. Thoughtfully handled & sensitively played Dominick & Eugene Is hard not to get warm.

summary: Howard W. Campbell, Jr., an American expatriate playwright, Nazi radio propagandist, and Allied spy, writes his memoirs during his pre-trial confinement in 1961 Haifa and learns that people are what they pretend to be.
translation: I felt drawn into the world of manipulation of mind and will into the core of the story. The play by Nolte, Lee, Arkin and the supporting actors was outstanding. The strange twists in Vonnegut's story are made strange by strange details.

summary: The true story of Juliane Koepcke, the seventeen-year-old schoolgirl who survived one of the most amazing adventures of our times. Flying from Peru to see her father for the New Year celebrations, Juliane's plane hits a cyclone and breaks up at 24,000 feet. Somehow, Juliane miraculously survives the horror only to find herself alone in the hostile world of the South American rainforests. There her tormented battle to find civilization begins.
translation: I saw that when I was 17 and have not seen anything since. The "CBS Late Movie" used to show it regularly. I remember how sad and angry it was, it really made me sick in my stomach. Effects were not what they are today, but still it gives the feeling of being alone in the Amazon after both parents have been lost and they have been looking for a way out. I remember the beetles and maggots that were so realistic that they ate their meat. It is a dark film that was controversial at the time, though it was probably heavily edited for television. I wish I had more details in mind, and if I ever get a chance to see it again, I can say more. I've been looking for this for years. I believe that it could have been shown under a different title on CBS. I have no idea if it has ever been released on video.

summary: A vicious serial-killer is on the loose in San Francisco and the police trace a link to a small town further down the coast. When Harry Callahan upsets the press and the mayor in his usual style, he's shipped out of town to investigate while the heat is on. With the help of his new Magnum handgun Harry goes on the trail leaving behind the usual trail of dead criminals along the way.
translation: Sudden Impact is a two-story story. Harry is attacked by the crowd who wants to kill him, and Harry is very happy to be able to return the favor and show them how to do it. This little war puts Harry in a suspension he does not care about, but he's going on a little vacation. Now the second part of the story. Someone kills some punks and Harry gets pulled into this situation, where he meets Jennifer Spencer with a secretive woman who wants to keep quiet about the small tourist town. The police chief is not a subtle man, and he warns Harry not to interfere or cause trouble. This is Harry Callahan Trouble following him. The mob leads him to this city and hell opens when Harry goes to war. Meanwhile, the vigilante strikes again and the gang that found it out is ready for it. Jennifer Spencer gets caught and Harry comes to her aid during the climax of the movie. Sudden Impact is not the biggest Dirty Harry, but at the time we have a Harry who is an antihero ready to go to war just for the sake of justice. Again not the best, not the worst, but the one with the most remembered line. Go Ahead Make your day.

summary: When five bodies turn up in the waters of Burman City, its illusion of safety is shattered, and Mayer Hackett will stop at nothing to see the peace returned.
translation:
*** Possible plot spoilers ***

I admire Dennis Hopper. I wonder why in 2000 he adopted The Spreading Ground as a police detective. This movie is totally annoying and I'll tell you why.

This is about a small town that is currently getting a contract for a sports arena. One difficulty: There is a killer at large and that is bad for the business. The mayor makes a deal with the Irish mob to find the killer and make sure he never gets to court. Det. Ed Delongpre has other plans. He wants this guy to get caught too, but he's up to the level and believes in the system. He wants to see that the system does its job.

That could have been pretty good. It could have tied. It was terrible. First, they call this guy a serial killer. Err no. There are certain criteria and nothing fits here. The villain killed 5 children on the first day, and I think it was 2 on the second day. This entire film stretches like a 48-hour period .... Hardly a serial killer action. I do not care what twisted motives they give him in the end, serial killers do their act over a long period of time. Not only are you suddenly killing 7 children in two days. That's a spree.

Ok, besides, the acting was horrible. The only name here was Hopper, and he's the only one who nearly got his own way. Unfortunately he is a type of guy for me and I think he does psycho-parts much, much better. That was just not a good vehicle for Hopper. It did not allow him to do what he does best, which is to act scary. It's not that he did bad, it's that I made him so much better.

The Irish mob-type Johnny Gault (Tom McCamus - The Long-Day's Journey into the Night), who is responsible for her investigation, is just overly stiff. Contradiction? Not really. He tries to play the cold, hard guy, and he does that to the point that the character is only made of wood. Drilling to the max. He did not scare me. He never inspired any emotions except boredom. I can not tell you how many times I checked how long it was until the end of this movie.

The other thing is that it had the feel of a TV movie. You know what I mean. The bad production values, the low budget, the reuse of scenes to save costs. Only eh. Yanno? But I feel like comparing them with them is an insult to them.

Derek Vanlint was both director and cameraman on this project. He bit more than he could chew. I can not help but feel that Hopper must have taken this role as a personal favor to a friend. That's the only reasonable argument I can think of. That was Vanlint's first job as a director, third cameraman. I hope that was a learning experience for him.

I will not ruin the end in case you decide to torment yourself with it, but I would say that everyone dropped the ball here. ..the hopper. In a scene that was emotionally heartbreaking for the detective, it was just ... well ... blah. I did not see any of the fear that would accompany this guy's entire gearshift. Very disappointing.

These 100 grueling minutes and Rated R for violence and language. No child under the age of 13 will be interested in seeing this, so do not worry. It's not suitable for anyone anyway. heh.

Skip this. You will thank me later.

summary: Having discovered they could turn animals invisible, a group of scientists test the subject on a human. Head of research, Dr. Sebastian Caine decides to use himself as the subject. After the experiment can't be reversed, it takes a toll on Caine's personality, causing him to hunt down and kill his colleagues
translation:
(some spoilers) - as if you did not know how it will end up

My expectations for HOHLMANN were high. A very good commercial, a director like Paul Verhoeven and actors like Kevin Bacon and Elisabeth Shue, plus a very interesting topic - Invisibility. Every requirement for a great movie has been fulfilled. Unfortunately, these things were not important at all. The movie was very week, without tension and terribly predictable.

It's about a group of scientists who have discovered invisibility. After the animal experiments, Kevin Bacon decides to test it on himself. As soon as he is invisible, he changes completely and realizes the advantages of not being seen. From this to murder there is a very thin line.

Hollow Man is a bad movie. It suffers from the disease that many new films have: the special effects. From a challenging theme that could have led the producers to an exciting psycho thriller, Verhoeven ruins everything that focuses only on special effects without betraying the true value of the movie. I have to admit, the FX are awesome, probably the best I've seen since Matrix, but that's not enough to make a movie good. Actually, that's the problem with today's movies. Like Verhoeven, most directors only care about spectacular scenes - and nothing more. The exceptions are very few, and probably the Matrix is ‚Äã‚Äãthe only movie that combines perfectly fabulous special effects and great action.

After Starship Troopers, Verhoeven disappoints again. In place of a great movie, HM cr * p. There are only 2 reasons why you can watch this movie: 1. the special effects 2. the joke with Superman and Wonder Woman (I will not spoil that moment for you ...)

Okay, so, what went wrong with the movie? Everything. Let's see what I can remember.

--- It's not tense at all. It should have been, but it is not.

--- It is too predictable. You know from the beginning who will die and who will live.

--- Instead of focusing on the psychological part, Verhoeven only cares about the effects.

- - a lot of clich√©s.

--- Of course, the villain wakes up a few times before he dies.

--- As in any horror of inferior quality, the first rule to let the characters separate as much as possible. Every time someone is alone in the lab, perfect sacrifice for Bacon.

--- Some holes in the plot. Example: In the beginning, Bacon has to scan his finger to get to the lab. After being invisible, how can he do that?

--- The end: absolutely terrible.

--- After Shue hits Bacon in the head, Bacon falls to the floor. Then Shue and Brolin leave quietly and slowly, without looking back. Is that normal? Then Bacon gets up, attacks them, they "kill" him again. And then Shue screams "I heard an explosion" (happened a few minutes ago) and they suddenly run inside. Did not she hear this explosion some time ago?

--- There's a scene where you see the microphones hanging over the actors. Come on, Mr. Verhoeven, I expected much more from you!

So this is Hollow Man. What should be a great movie became a scam.

Vote: 4 out of 10 (for the special effects)

summary: Ben Stiller and Jack Black star as Tim and Nick, best friends, neighbors and co-workers, whose equal footing is suddenly tripped up when one of Nick's harebrained get-rich-quick schemes actually succeeds: Vapoorizer, a spray that literally makes dog poop, or any other kind for that matter, evaporate into thin air -- to where exactly is anyone's guess. Tim, who had scoffed at Nick's idea and passed on an opportunity to get in on the deal, can only watch as Nick's fortune -- and Tim's own envy -- grow to equally outrageous proportions. When the flames of jealousy are fanned by an oddball drifter (Walken) who imposes himself into the situation, Tim's life careens wildly out of control ... taking Nick's with it.
translation: Start with the script. I have seen cartoons with more depth than "Envy". Whenever characters repeat over and over again what you have already seen, and for the first time was not funny, a movie is in big trouble what "Envy" is certainly. A movie that relies on a joke should fit better. Here we have a movie that absolutely leads nowhere. Especially Christopher Walken would like to forget this bomb, because his character is so weak. Ben Stiller had immediately come to mind in some pretty good black comedies, "Flirting With Disaster" and "Duplex." Be sure that "Envy" is not a black comedy. There are no double meanings, just total nonsense. "Envy" deserves its low rating as it stinks content. - MERK

summary: Eva has just gotten married to an older gentleman, but discovers that he is obsessed with order in his life and doesn't have much room for passion. She becomes despondent and leaves him, returning to her father's house. One day while bathing in the lake she meets a young man and they fall in love. The husband has become grief stricken at the loss of his young bride, and fate brings him together with the young lover that has taken Eva from him.
translation:
The young beautiful Eva (Hedy Lamarr) marries an older man (Zvonimir Rogoz). Unfortunately, he can not sexually satisfy her and ignores her. Frustrated, she goes home and wants a divorce. Then, one day, she dives into a lake in the middle of the forest. Her horse gallops with her clothes ... and she runs after! She meets the young and very handsome Adam (Aribert Mog). They make love and she realizes that this is the man she wants.

ENDING SPOILER !!!! Of course, since this was done in 1933, she must be punished for her sin, which leads to a tragic finale. End of the end spoiler !!!!

These horrified people in 1933, but it's pretty tame by today's standards. Lamarr's nude bathing shows nothing and when she runs after the horse completely naked, it is either shown in extreme wide-angle shot or is covered by branches and the like. There are only a few shots of her breasts. Even though she has sex with Mog, nothing is shown except her face, but you see her reach an orgasm. This scene was considered extreme at the time and was completely cut out of the American release. Today they are back. This movie would now easily get along with a PG-13.

Shock episodes aside, that's just OK. It is beautifully filmed and there is virtually no dialogue. Apart from the music score, this could be a quiet picture. Fortunately, all actors are good - Lamarr and Mog especially and they are so attractive that they just take their breath away and watch them. The sequence they love is one of the most beautiful shots I've ever seen in a movie. The scenes with the sexual symbolism (there are not a few of them) are unfortunately pretty obvious today. I actually started giggling during one!

So, great direction, beautiful pictures, attractive actors, good acting everywhere - but I was not overpowered by it. I found the movie slow (beautiful pictures do not make a picture for me), a bit boring, obvious, static and had a negative ending. I can live with the end, but it does not excuse the other problems I had with it. Even the last sequence is really strange - and out of place. I admire this movie more than anything else. It was well done and I would recommend it with caution. Many people seem to love this movie, so I'm in the minority. Use your own judgment.

summary: A teenage boy befriends an escapee from a mental institution who sees visions of horrible murders being committed.
translation:
Reed Diamond plays a man who suffers from amnesia and has been in a lunatic asylum for more than a decade after wondering with blood on his hands over the back roads. The doctors want to test an experimental new drug that returns its lost memories when it works. But when the drugs give him hallucinations of a demon, he decides to escape instead. While he befriends a little boy whose stepfather (Greg Grunberg) abuses his mother, he will not let her into the darkroom of his cellar and generally behaves suspiciously.

While the general "secret" of the movie is a bit easy to identify before it's revealed. I found that Mr. Diamond's acting is so exciting that I can keep my attention throughout. (For the sake of full disclosure, I'm a big fan of his since Homicide and his brief but pivotal role in The Shield to Journeyman & Dollhouse) Not a great movie nor a good one, but usable enough. Although I liked it better than the previous films that I've seen by director / author Michael Hurst (Room 6, Pumkinhead 4, Mansquito).

Eye Candy: a fleeting pair of boobs in a hallucination
My class: C-

summary: In April 2002, an Irish film crew is making a documentary about Venezuelan President Hugo Chavez, when a coup from the opposition is made.
translation:
You have never seen anything like it. Once the coup starts, it's the most dazzling thriller you've ever seen - even though you know the result. And it's all real, because it's a documentary - amazing.

When it was over, it was on my top 10 list of All Time Great Movies.

Ignore the drooling right-wing fanatics. Everyone I know who saw this movie gives him the 4 star rating. Even if you are not interested in politics or Venezuelan politics, you will feel nervous and - believe it - on the edge of your seat.

It's a rollercoaster ride.

summary: In WW1,German intelligence sends a team of saboteurs and a female spy to Scotland to kill Lord Kitchener.Also,German intelligence sends another team of spies to Allied headquarters in Belgium to steal the secret Allied defense plans.German female spy, known as Fraulein Doktor, is tasked with stealing the new mustard gas formula from its French female inventor.The German army plans to use the new French mustard gas on the battlefield during the upcoming German offensive against the Allied armies.
translation:
Like other people who have commented on "Miss Doctor," I happened to stumble upon this little gem on late-night TV without ever having heard of it. The strange mixture of a pulp-fiction story about a sexy but unscrupulous anti-hero on the one hand and a realistic and well-researched depiction of the war in the trenches on the other hand made me addicted from the start.

For me, this is one of the five best films about the First World War (the others are "All quiet on the Western Front", "Paths Of Glory", "Gallipoli" and the post-war period "La vie et rien d'autre "). And the scene with the poison gas attack is really daunting; the horses and men appear like horsemen of the Apocalypse with their gas masks.

I just wish I had taken the movie.

summary: The car of successful author Anna Rivers is found disabled next to the river, the thought being that she accidentally fell into the river while trying to change a flat tire. Her dead body is found upstream several weeks later, consistent with the accidental death theory. Based on incidents around him, her grieving husband, architect Jonathan Rivers, decides several months later to visit with Raymond Price, who approached John prior to Anna's body being found with news that she was trying to contact him from beyond. At that time, John was skeptical of Raymond's claims of electronic voice phenomena (EVP): that he is contacted from the beyond through electronic means - radio, television - which he is able to record. Along with Sarah Tate, another of Raymond's "clients" whose fianc√© passed away, John becomes obsessed with EVP as he gets more and more audio and video messages, however fuzzy, from Anna from beyond. That obsession takes a slight change in focus when John believes that Anna ...
translation:
I often talk about the absolute extent of really scary movies on the market, and unfortunately, White Noise has only helped reduce my belief that the film industry remains capable of such an endeavor. I was surprised that I was getting increasingly tired as the plot progressed and my headache caused by static electricity increased. I found White Noise beyond our best efforts to lift unbelief, absurd. Even after witnessing the shocking ordeal of Michael Keaton, I was completely untouched by his death. Until the credits, I diligently waited for something - anything - substance to connect with the story of the characters, but such relief never came. Sure, there were occasional cardiac arrest moments, but only because loud noises tend to do this to the drowsing viewer.

While acting was lame, Michael Keaton may have played his most common role. The only redeeming quality White Noise has to offer is the stunning architecture in both Keaton dwellings. Overall, White Noise leaves the morbidly depressing notion that those who die are trapped in a world guarded by three vicious shadows. They try to get the living to follow the dead into their own graves.

summary: Three couples set off to spend some time in the desert. At first, all is well and they have a lot of fun. Watching them is a mysterious stranger, who has plans for some fun of his own that the youngsters aren't going to appreciate.
translation: A group of friends decide to take a camping trip into the desert - being followed and murdered by a mysterious killer in a black pickup truck. "Mirage" is obviously inspired by Spielberg's "Duel" and Craven's "The Hills Have Eyes" .This slasher yarn has a lot of evil power and blood.The bloody climax of the film is a sequence in which a man reverses his arm and leg chained a tree and then dismembered its limbs when pulling the chain off a truck is also a bit of suspense and some exciting stalk-and-slash sequences.The acting is pretty lame and the script is pretty weak, but the movie is is a fast-paced and shocking.BGSteers, who plays the villain, is pretty threatening. Desert locals provide some atmosphere and the blood is pretty strong.Overall, if you like low-budget horror movies, give it a glance.8 out of 10 points.

summary: The body of an unknown woman turns up in a stolen car abandoned in a New York park, and the only clue the detectives on the case have to work from is the tattoo on her arm, and the fact that someone tried to deface the corpse to remove the evidence. From this slender trail, and that of a single stem of grass discovered in the car, they gradually trace back first the victim and then her killer, in a case that's all science and legwork, and no magic inspiration.
translation:
This police procedure is no worse than many others of his era and better than some. Obviously, it follows in the steps of "Dragnet" and "Naked City", but turns out to be a pleasurable programmer. Best of all, it's the unadorned look he brings to a world long gone ... New York's mid-late-40s / early-50s sublime. Here it is in all its glory, from the old-school tattoo parlors, to the cheap hotels, to the greasy spoons. These old police films are like travelogues in a bygone era and very bittersweet for anyone who does not like the hygienic, soulless cityscape of today.

Also interesting is the emphasis on the scientific aspect of solving the crime ... in this case the murder of a tattooed woman found in a deserted car. Our main heroes, detectives Tobin and Corrigan, do the footwork, but without the tedious and laborious efforts of the "lab boys" they would not achieve anything.
