Although the technology is not in the same league, the police here use the stubborn persistence of a C.S.I. Investigator to track down her husband.

As some reviewers have written about this film, you think it was directed by Ed Wood and acted as extras from his films. What's happening! I enjoyed John Miles when the lanky ex-marine policeman Tobin became ... he had a cheerful, serene approach to the role that was a welcome relief to the usual stone histrionics of most film cops of that time. Patricia Barry is sweet and adorable like his naughty girlfriend who helps to solve the crime. Walter Kinsella is stuffy and droll like the older detective Corrigan. I liked the chemistry of the two and did something different from the robotic "dragnet" approach.

The mystery itself is not too deep, and the latest hunt and shootout will certainly not be among the classics of the thriller, but during the short run, "The Tattooed Stranger" has more than held my interest.

summary: Orson Welles plays the head of a witches' coven in the town of Lilith, where he needs the powers of Pamela Franklin to raise his son from the dead.
translation:
Like most comments, I saw this movie under the name The Witching, which is the reissue title. Apparently Necromancy, which is the original, is better, but I doubt it.

Most scenes of witchcraft still contain most of the necromancy scenes and these are still bad. In many ways, I think the added nudity has added some entertainment value to witchcraft! But do not be fooled - there are only 3 scenes of nudity and there is plenty of people standing around. No Diabolique rumpy pumpy involved!

This film is so inherently horrible, it's hard to know what to criticize first. The dialogue is awful and straight from the Troma cabinet. At least Troma is obvious. This is a personified bored boredom. The play is variable with Pamela Franklin (Flora, the obsessed kid in The Innocents, would you believe it!) The worst thing with her shrill screaming voice. Welles just seems to wait for his paycheck. The other female lead has a scary face, so I do not know why Pamela thought she could trust her in the movie! And the doctor is pretty bad too. He also looks like Gene Wilder.

It is inappropriately filmed with scenes that change without reason and the cutting is choppy. That's because witchcraft is a copy-and-paste job, not a subtle one. Only the lighting is fine. The sound is also terrible and it's hard to hear with the appalling new soundtrack that never closes. The "ghost" mother is also nonsense, but the actress is so weirdly bad at acting that she causes at least unintentional laughter.

Really this movie (at least the witchcraft) is only for the careless. It can not have a lot of decent fans as it is quite unplayable and I actually found it dull boring!

Best of all, when the credits were rolled - enough, that's just how better to say this poor excuse for a movie like the plague!

summary: The story of how a boy was abandoned by his mother and how he, later, abandoned her. The year he'll be 14, the parents of Augusten Burroughs (1965- ) divorce, and his mother, who thinks of herself as a fine poet on the verge of fame, delivers him to the eccentric household of her psychiatrist, Dr. Finch. During that year, Augusten avoids school, keeps a journal, and practices cosmetology. His mother's mental illness worsens, he takes an older lover, he finds friendship with Finch's younger daughter, and he's the occasional recipient of gifts from an unlikely benefactor. Can he survive to come of age?
translation:
I'm a big movie fan. I like movies of all kinds. This is probably the worst movie I've ever seen.

I understand that the book follows closely, which addresses the point that not everything should be made into a movie. Especially as the authenticity of the experiences in the book has been questioned more than once.

These characters are not quirky, they are mentally ill. The things that happen are not funny, they bother. especially when you consider that they should be true.

This movie had the feel of The Royal Tenenbaums, another movie I hated, only Running With Scissors was even dysfunctional and less funny.

I will never get those hours back. I wanted to wash my brain after watching.

summary: The daughter of an actor father and a social-climber mother, Domino Harvey, bored with her life, decides to join the team of Ed Moseby and becomes a bounty hunter. But she gets in trouble when the Mafia's money is stolen from an armored truck, while Moseby and his crew are participating in a reality show produced by Mark Heiss. The situation gets out of control when the sons of a rival mobster are kidnapped while the FBI is monitoring two gangs of mobsters.
translation:
Kiera Nightly moved straight from the P & P set to this action movie ... she could hardly have decided to make her image even more dramatic. A Great Success in Love Actually and as a Lizie in Jane Austen's classic, she is, once again, "worth a try". Just as her bikini-clad warrior in King Arthur's was more skin than muscle, it's hard to imagine that delicate frame will withstand the life of a bounty hunter ... but that's exactly what Domino Harvey (the real one) did and I ( one of Nightly's biggest fans) think she wears when out.

stuff ....

* 90210 (for the non-American world) is the postcode of Beverly Hills in LA, where all the movie stars live. * Domino Harvey's father's most famous film was Manchurian candidate (appearing in the movie). * Domino Harvey died of a drug overdose in her bath before the movie came out in June 2005 after being arrested for drug trafficking. She had just completed negotiations to include some of her music in the film. * Kiera Knightly in her interview with Lucy Liu alludes to Domino Harvey's sexuality.

If you find this movie a bit far-fetched, then look at Domino Harvey, as the facts are more amazing than fiction.

summary: A young boy dies from a stray bullet during a shootout between a cop and mob family member who had previously been supiciously given probabtion, only to break its terms. New York's Deputy Mayor, Kevin Calhoun starts digging for information.
translation:
Full score for Pacino's presentation of the speech about the dead child's coffin; Shakespeare's Mark Antony would be ashamed!

Was it Paul Schrader or was it Ken Lipper who was to be congratulated on the remarkable dialogues? You are rich and intelligent and worth your time if you like movies with good scripts. I found the story tale pretty well developed, right down to the voice over postscript.

There is little left to talk about in this film; Even John Cusack played better roles than this one. Interestingly, the film is very male-oriented - the women are just appendages.

summary: A documentary on the rivalry between two rock bands. On one hand we have The Dandy Warhols, and its leader Courtney Taylor-Taylor, and on the other The Brian Jonestown Massacre, lead by Anton Newcombe. They used to be close friends but their differing lifestyles and ambitions, especially that of Anton Newcombe, have forced them apart, to the point of being enemies.

This movie is endlessly quotable and is an interesting clock when we look at two groups of very talented musicians creating their art. One of the best things this movie has is a unique perspective between the indie music scene and the larger corporate scene.

Recommended especially for the music and the two fantastic bands.

summary: The warrior Deathstalker is tasked by an old witch to obtain and unite the three powers of creation - a chalice, an amulet, and a sword - lest the evil magician Munkar get them and use them for nefarious purposes. The false king holds the true princess in captivity, and plots to have Deathstalker killed, and Deathstalker must fight to free the princess.
translation: DEATHSTALKER is perfect for B fantasy movie fans; this nearly 80-minute movie trailer craps everything that intrusive callers can demand - non-existent plotting, terrible acting (apart from at least one scratchy-sounding old lady), ridiculous scripting and lock-editing, and bargain-basement-background shots. There are no characters that seem sympathetic or interesting (in particular, the main character has nothing BETTER in it), and the assembled actors barely do anything to outgrow F-class material. If that's not enough, how about the lack of convincing action (which this movie does not actually have) to make DEATHSTALKER a big turkey? I was also offended that the women in this film have little other purpose than 1) to be topless and / or sparsely clothed; 2) to be raped; 3) have sex with the hero; 4) Everything above. Besides, the background music is horrible; a bizarre jumble of electronic noise, cheesy chorale bursts and booming orchestral cacophony. Stunned and stunned in one filled with nothing to keep anyone interested, DEATHSTALKER is probably best suited for people who are looking for something to laugh about (and believe me, there is one here) enough). Otherwise, I would not recommend this 100th grade CONAN to anyone in the least.

summary: An episodic look at Grace Elliott (1760-1823) and Philippe, the Duke of Orleans, during the French Revolution. In 1790, they are friends, no longer lovers. He suggests she leave France, she warns him to quit the Revolution. In 1792, she must escape Paris on foot. Less than a month later, she returns on an errand of mercy and shows great courage saving the governor of Tuileries. The Duke in turn steps in to protect Grace. In early 1793, she demands a promise from the Duke that he vote to spare Louis's life; he does not, and Grace is furious. In April, he warns her of a search; she is arrested and brought before the committee. Orleans, too, is suspect. The guillotine awaits.
translation: I can hardly believe that this sluggish, bombastic and poorly staged film is about a filmmaker whose other works I really liked. The experience of enduring THE LADY AND THE DUKE (and no other word except "permanence") left me in a bad mood, a condition that was only made easier by reading ali-112's IMDb user commentary. For not only did Rohmer (with success) try to see the world through the genre art of 18th century France, but, as ali has emphasized, has shown the effects of class consciousness and the audience (at the expense of the alienation of his audience) Revolution inspired her through the eyes of an elite woman of her time. The director has done something undeniably difficult, but I wonder if it was worth doing it - or watching the stupid results of his work.

summary: The United State's Department of Homeland Security is led to believe an American teen hacker playing a terrorist-attack simulator game online is a real terrorist out to destroy the U.S.

summary: Talented small-town girl Lily Mars hounds producer John Thornway for a part in his new play, but he doesn't want anything to do with stage-struck amateurs. But when Lily follows him to New York, he gets to know her better and his opinion of her changes for the better. Then, when the leading lady of the play walks out, Lily gets her big break on Broadway.
translation:
Introducing Lily Mars (MGM, 1943) is a cute movie, but in my opinion it could have been better. Judy Garland is great as always, but some scenes in the movie seem out of place and the romance between her and Van Heflin is developing too fast.

I mean, in a minute he's ready to hit her butt, but in the next minute he falls in love with her. I believe that this production, the film editing and the script (although the photography was great, the scenery was beautiful and the costumes were pretty) could have been a little better. It feels like the production is too busy.

The supporting actress was also good, especially the little Janet Chapman as the second youngest daughter Rosie. She's 11 years old, looks really cute and it's a shame she did not turn into a teenage comic actress. She is much better in this film than in her previous films as Warner Brothers in the late 1930s (with the exception of Broadway Musketeers in 1938, she is really good at it) when they tried to make her a Shirley Temple / Sybil Jason hybrid , Overall, this movie could be better, but in the end, Judy gave it all.

summary: Dublin, 1920. Gypo Nolan, strong but none too bright, has been ousted from the rebel organization and is starving. When he finds that his equally destitute sweetheart Katie has been reduced to prostitution, he succumbs to temptation and betrays his former comrade Frankie to the British authorities for a 20 pound reward. In the course of one gloomy, foggy night, guilt and retribution inexorably close in...
translation:
Like many people here, I started to try my patience with this movie. In the end, I actually shed some tears.

It seems to be in the nature of most old films, 7/8-length to pull and then to catch fire in the end. Older movie-goers learned to walk patiently through the slow parts, reassured in the knowledge that the big win is on their way. But that is not exactly true. You see, for earlier listeners, the "slow parts" were the bulk of the story. They observed and found there anecdotal and thematic interest. The modern public, Post Spielberg, is constantly waiting to reach a small climax every two minutes when watching older films. It is the inflation problem of modern films. Well, that will not happen. It is not necessary to apologize for these films; It's easy to adjust your expectations and your personal rhythm when you see them. At this point, the difference between Avatar and The Informer is the difference between Euripides and a traveling production of Rent. Think about it for a minute or two. Not concentrating on the obvious, but Euripides deserves to be heard.

The "exciting part", for most modern audiences, starts with the IRA tribal scene and escalates to the last few minutes that will be yours when you're on board or up to that time tear out the heart. It is not some high-pitch universal abstract plea for forgiveness; It is a request from a fool, and those who are sorry for the great Lummox, for a little mercy. It's so personal and this embarrassingly naked appeal. After being angry at Gypo, irritated by him and thinking that this is the dumbest character of all time, one finally finds himself convinced by the scene of Gypo's former girlfriend, who asks another woman to make her husband join him help.

The film can be sentimental, but the sentimentality is not cheap, as some have charged here. There is a question of life and death happening here, and as long as you take a life's proposal seriously to a client, it's the sentimentality that is squeezed out of the most serious stuff.

8 out of 10. And the mistake of not being 10 out of 10 is your own and to some extent yours if you read this. We have all been asking for more, more and more, faster, ever faster, until in 1935 - just yesterday, really - we can not put ourselves in the position so easily.

summary: An introverted, socially awkward, middle-class youth, Robert Carmichael, is a talented cello player but is bored by his existence in the coastal town of Newhaven. He becomes associated with several other unsavory teenagers and is soon tempted into the use of hard drugs like cocaine and ecstasy. Robert initially does not take part in the rape of a teenage girl in a squalid flat with the gang, but later joins in another violent attack on a middle-aged couple, with the woman involved being viciously raped.
translation: With a title "borrowed" by Werner Herzog and liberal contributions by Kubrick, Haneke and Noe, it is painfully obvious that Thomas Clay considers himself a cut that goes beyond the usual garbage of our British cinema. "Robert Carmichael" (in short :) presents itself as a realistic study of youthful alienation and at the same time apparent criticism of the Iraq war. The problem with realism is that the characters are so obviously unrealistic and atypical - unlike the stinking notions of "extreme" filmmakers, most teenagers are not drug-addicted rapists. As a criticism of the Iraq war, a film about youth violence (by a gifted classical musician - the subtext society has harmed this sensitive individual) is so childish that he can hardly think. There are signs of technical skill, but some reviewers have overdone it. Like Kubrick and Noe, he shows that the desire to shock combined with supposedly serious intent could be the worst cinematic trick of the last film. People liked "Clockwork Orange" and "Irreversible" because they liked the rapes and the violence, but most of all, they liked being culturally superior because they loved things that they hated the most. So much Kubrick and not enough Haneke (a serious and moral filmmaker) calls this one of the darkest movies in years. (I'm not against film violence, but to be serious it's a tough trick - people in the cinemas cheered Alex in "Clockwork Orange" and showed how Kubrick's supposed intention was missed by miles.) Gratuitous violence is much easier reach and less insulting than the claims of many art film directors.)

summary: A young Hobbit known as Frodo has been thrown on an amazing adventure, when he is appointed the job of destroying the one ring which was created by the dark lord Sauron. He is assigned with three warriors including Gandelf, Aragorn and Boromir. But it's not going to be an easy journey for the Fellowship of the Ring, on the ultimate quest to rid the Middle-Earth of all evil!
translation:
I recently rented the animated version of The Lord of the Rings on video after watching the live action version of FANTASTIC 2001. The Peter Jackson-led live action trilogy "The Lord of the Rings" will undoubtedly be much better than the "Prequel" trilogy (Episode 1-3) by George Lucas will ever be the true fantasy film series of the 21st century! >
I remember seeing the animated version as a child and not fully understanding the depth of the film at the time. Now that I've read the books, I understand what the story is all about. However, some of the characters are pretty silly (Samwise Gangee is particularly annoying, much like Jar Jar Binks in Star Wars Episode One, (AWFUL!)), But I have to say that he follows the book fairly closely, and it goes into part from Book Two, The Two Towers. The good things are that the plot is a bit interesting and some of the animations are quite remarkable for the time being. The bad part is that it ends halfway between the Two Towers, without Frodo trying to destroy the one ring, and the animation looks pretty outdated compared to today's standards.

Overall, not as bad as many say. BUT, the live action version of 2001 is the new trademark of The Lord of the Rings! At least Ralph Bakshi took the script seriously! Peter Jackson said that the animated version inspired him to read the books, which in turn made him create one of the greatest fantasy series of all time, so at least we can thank Ralph Bakshi for that! I will take the animated version of Lord of the Rings on the live version of Harry Potter!

A 7 on a scale of 1-10, far less violent than the live version of 2001, but NEVER close so good! For die-hard fans of the books and movie versions of The Lord of the Rings.

summary: Lo Tung and his friend Malted Candy, pedicab drivers working the streets of Macao, have both fallen in love. The problem is that both their objects of affection - one a baker, the other a prostitute - are working under cruel and lecherous bosses. Somehow, the pair must find a way to win the ladies' hearts and free them from their unpleasant jobs.
translation: What can I add that the previous comments have not already said. This is a great movie and the Light Saber Duel Star Wars tribute must be seen to be believed !! There are awesome moments in this movie, if you can, SEE IT NOW! Thanks again to Rick Baker, who gave me this movie many years ago!

summary: The Griswolds win a vacation to Europe on a game show, and thus pack their bags for the continent. They do their best to catch the flavor of Europe, but they just don't know how to be be good tourists. Besides, they have trouble taking holidays in countries where they CAN speak the language...
translation:
The stupid Griswalds win the grand prize of the TV series "Pig in a poke", and all fly together to Europe, where they make one stupid disaster after another. Of all the ridiculous, unconventional money-spinning sequels, this surpasses one. Harold Ramis' film of 1983 was a below-average mishap in which the Misfit family undertook a nightmarish "holiday" through the states. This time around, Amy Heckerling ("Look who's talking") proves to be a fateful "comedy" that will annoy you more than make you laugh.

Hughes script (starring Rob Klane) is terrible and you wonder why people like Chevy Chase and Beverly D'Angelo were involved in such a dead-beat project, even Anthony Michael Hall and Imogene Coca felt they were rejecting the offer. Even an almighty Michael Palin is unable to lift the process to a level that could be called entertaining.

As unimaginable as it may seem, "European Vacation" was successful enough to justify a second sequel! Surely it could not be as unbearable as this one. You know, I have to see a National Lampoon show that's worth it.

Monday, December 26, 1994 - T.V.

summary: In this loose modern adaptation of the classic novel, Cate and her adopted brother Heath grow up together and fall in love once they hit their teens. Her desire to leave the simple life conflicts with his wishes for them to stay at the Heights (their lighthouse home) together. It gets worse when her father dies, leaving everything to Cate's awful older brother Hendrix, who hates Heath. Cate ends up marrying the wealthy Edward, while the bitter Heath becomes a rock star and exacts revenge upon those who mistreated him. Once he and Cate start an affair, tragedy follows.
translation: I did not expect much from this movie - a funny little distraction. Wuthering Heights could be transformed into a plausible modern story - nice and soapy, melodramatic and fascinating. But this movie decided to discard the talents of people involved in a simple version so diluted from the source material that it is amazing that they had the courage to even call it Wuthering Heights. It ignores the fact that it is a story of people who are essentially dissimilar, mostly unsympathetic, and often cruel to each other. It changes the nature of certain characters - Isabelle, for example, in the novel, had no sneaky bones in her body - they have taken off their blind idealism and turned them into a scheming whore. Heathcliff is a terrible person who mentally tortures most people on his way, but in this version, Catherine leaves her daughter in his care. The dialogue is banal, and one wonders how the actors managed to deliver with straight faces. Instead of depth or actual emotions, we know that they mean something when they scream someone in the face. I read critiques of the early 90s version of "Emily Bronte's Wuthering Heights," in which Ralph Fiennes and Juliette Binoche were portrayed as turning a very dark Gothic story into a frothy bodice ripper. A little valid comments, but the MTV version goes one step further and uses the basic story structure to deliver hacker beach-bums that romp around to really bad music.

summary: nan

I really miss the show. Of ALL the games that have ever been played, and to be honest, I HATE game shows, that's what I really liked and really miss. summary: The love which binds mother and daughter -- seen through the prism of one mother's life as it crests with optimism, navigates a turning point, and ebbs to its close. Overcome by the power of memory, Ann Lord reveals a long-held secret to her concerned daughters; Constance, a content wife and mother, and Nina, a restless single woman. Both are bedside when Ann calls out for the man she loved more than any other. But who is this "Harris," wonder her daughters, and what is he to our mother? While Constance and Nina try to take stock of Ann's life and their own lives, their mother is tended to by a night nurse as she journeys in her mind back to a summer weekend some fifty years before, when she was Ann Grant, a young woman who has come from New York City to be maid of honor at the high-society Newport wedding of her dearest friend from college, Lila Wittenborn. The bride-to-be is jittery, and turns to her maid of honor rather than her own mother for support. Ann stays close to her friend...
translation:
I knew "Evening" was a girlie movie, so I expected to be bored. A spiteful teaser on IMDb had said it was a "chick flick," but that your companion would survive.

Survive? Yes. I'm still here, but when we both came out, we were amazed that it only took two hours - it seemed like a much longer evening! I suppose it should be exalted or intriguing for Yanks because it involves rich people living on the beach - well, next to the beach, in a house with a large porch and a lawn, but no apparent mower. If that impresses you, it could be a short movie.

There's a Monty Python movie about a knight who just will not die. It ends up fidgeting (why do yanks add a third syllable to that word, which I'm wondering) Torso on the road, still yelling threats to his archenemy. This movie is also about a kind of living dead. Vanessa Redgrave (inappropriate name for the grave robber shown here) goes on and on while she has inappropriate guilt feelings. She is not worried about being a pale, breathless Bimbo, but imagines a killer.

Obviously, it's a girl's movie that's supposed to be a Mr. Darcy / Heathcliff character. I am not a Whofter, so I can not claim to be a good judge of such things, but the boring sissy rolled for this role seems to have only the title of a servant in his favor. He is a bloodless cipher.

As you may notice, the main characters are not much cop, but the smaller ones manage, surprisingly, to be much worse off. There's a guy whose only job is to respond to the news that his girlfriend is preggers. Of course, but it's not the role of Hamlet - why is it so bad? Since I forgot it was a girlie movie, I thought it was going to be thrown out because any decent friend would have told him that the facial fungus did not flatter him, but then I realized that she must have encouraged him to grow a "beard" because he looked worse without him.

I stayed awake, noting which actors and actresses were clinging or releasing their earlobes and writing down interesting parts of the scenery - if you're dragged along with them, you'll see exactly when you see the stuffed buffalo head what you would expect in a beach house.

Apart from the obligatory wedding there is only one piece of action. You would have thought that they did it right. Sadly, the accident is committed by a car that can not be there. When the accident is discovered, the actors wander around screaming for a character they can not know is nearby (but we make the audience). If they have no idea the person is only a few miles from the location, why are they wandering aimlessly and calling him? I suppose the director's apology is that it should be a half forgotten dream sequence ...

Another scene item that caught my attention was a saucepan with copper bottom. I did not think the technology was developed until the fifties.

summary: Biography of the lead singer of Queen.
translation: This is a review of "Freddy Mercury The Untold Story," theatrical release, Chicago Int. Film Festival, 2007 One of the most magical, unimaginative and boring biographical documentaries I have ever seen. If the movie I saw in a movie was originally released on television, I would ask its producers and distributors not to deceive a paying audience with the false promise of cinematic worthy documentary. The sentimental piano solos, which were presented to the interviewees in front of the flower arrangements in the hotel rooms and the pompous, pseudo-literary narrative, even fulfilled the feeling of a sleepapedic bed infomercial even as a TV documentary. The only redeeming aspects of this "Unknown Story of Freddy Mercury" - or, um, it was "The Unpublished Story of Princess Diana" are the original concert, video and television recordings - unabridged Freddy Mercury and Queen. Testimonial interviews with irrelevant eyewitnesses with insights such as, "He was a free spirit" (really .. I thought Freddy Mercury was a company man ...) belittle those Freddy testimonials, from Brian May or Montserrat Caballe, to the reissue and Loving light in Mercury's complex life and character. And ... what's up with the Harry Potter-like boarding schools? How did the interview with the first girl swarm ("... who now works in a travel agency") and members of Freddy's first school band contribute to what I really want to know about Mercury? Vital milestones of his personal life, his sexuality, his artistic style and his growth, Queen, the band remain unexplored. These filmmakers neither ask a single, provocative question, nor do they pursue independent or visionary research on their subject, but provide a boring montage of polite, clean and very empty commentary on a puzzling and brilliant rock legend who does not deserve it Moving grandparents on a Sunday evening.

summary: Cinderella, the beautiful and kind-hearted daughter, sees her world turn upside down when her beloved mother dies, and her pained father remarries another woman, the wicked Lady Tremaine, who has two equally cruel daughters, the jealous Anastasia and Drizella. But, once more, things will go from bad to worse, when Cinderella's father, too, dies, leaving her all alone in the Lady's clutches to serve as her maid-of-all-work. Under those circumstances, a shabby and neglected Cinderella doesn't stand much of a chance of attending the King's royal ball--let alone, captivate the handsome Prince--unless she turns to her loving Fairy Godmother who has quite a few tricks up her sleeve. Nevertheless, will the wronged damsel ever find peace--and with it--her own Prince Charming?
translation:
The story of Cinderella is among my favorite pieces by Charles Perrault, with Sleeping Beauty, which was also converted into a Disney movie in 1959; This movie is a sweet, charming masterpiece by Disney.

The movie has a great soundtrack; that's one thing I like in a movie is a very good soundtrack and I love the songs too; My favorite song is the romantic "So This is Love". I also love the mice from the movie, they are cute. My favorite scene is the scene after the story, the little birds have tried to wake Cinderella up in the morning; I love it too, when Cinderella's animal friends (the mice and birds) raise Cinderella's birth mat so she can go to the ball ... until Drizella & Anastasia tear it to pieces, the B **** it!

summary: New York narcotics detective Popeye Doyle follows the trail of the French connection smuggling ring to France where he teams up with the gendarmes to hunt down the ringleader.
translation:
I just can not believe how many people compare that to the first movie. It moved me to leave this comment! This is just an obvious attempt to exploit the success of the first film. The dialogue is appalling and nothing as authentic or compelling as the original film.

The story is ridiculous, the portrayal of French police ridiculous and the characterization of Doyle a mile from the first movie. br />
How many drug lords think you are going down to the docks in person to see a delivery coming? The ease with which Doyle finds his husband is pathetic. Like all French policemen, they just drank coffee until Doyle emerged from America and did real policing. What a joke. Try to go to a foreign city and discover the biggest Crims in town with a travel map and some tourist brochures. Pathetic.

A really terrible sequel, everyone who thinks differently is crazy.

summary: Louie is a New York slum landlord who is given 120 days to repair one of his apartment blocks. The problem for Louie is that he must live in the rundown block until the repairs are complete. Louie's father is the real boss, and he has no intention of paying for the repairs. This leaves Louie to live in the squalor his tenants endure all year round.
translation: Obscenities, stupidity, licentiousness and bad manners combine to make a real tour de force in terrible filmmaking. Pesci's attempt to prove My cousin Vinny was no coincidence, instead showing the opposite. He is generally too easy and lazy to take the lead. A real must!

summary: In 1939, an intrepid reporter in New York City makes a connection between the story she's covering -- of famous scientists suddenly disappearing around the world, and a recent attack on the city by giant robots. Determined to find the solution to these happenings, she seeks the help of her ex-boyfriend, the captain of a mercenary legion of pilots. The two are investigating the case when the robots attack the city again, though in a stroke of luck, Sky Captain's right-hand man is able to locate their source. They then set off on an adventure in search of the evil mastermind behind these schemes, who is bent on creating a utopia and destroying the current world.
translation: The exploding zeppelins that gush down to the base of "Jude Law" from "Sky Captain" are an adequate metaphor to describe how awful this movie really is. First of all, I'd like to say at first glance that I seriously doubt that Paramount will ever get the money back from this film. It could become a cult hit, but only because it is so remarkable for what it has not achieved. I can now see the studio pitch. "Combining German expressionism of the 1920s and a global adventure of the 1940s with a modern action movie and dominating every scene with computer animation! Wow, that will not be a success!" Skycaptain bludgeons the audience with his sheer excesses. There are too many false explosions, too many unconvincing dogfight scenes, and too few real moments when the characters are anything but painfully two-dimensional. After all, why shock and awe with a floating airship when you can have three or five or a hundred ?! In addition, a groundbreaking film that blends computer-generated imagery and human actors seamlessly in a stylized and intriguing environment will be a flop, not least because it does not meet CGI's most important requirement in film. Quite simply, the graphics are amazingly bad. From the movement of the cars to the physics of the aircraft in the air battles everything seems to be just a bit offside. I'm not fussy in any way. A child might notice that a car does not glide across the street like a maglev train (unless it's a Mercedes S500). And for those of you who raise your voice in protest and yell, "This is a stylized film, it should not be like reality," let me just say that. Lord of the Rings has set the standard for integrating real actors with CGI, Starship Troopers has set the standard for ironic sci-fi movies, the Rocketeer has done a solid job of putting the decade of the 1920s back into the Hollywood film industry. Portfolio and Tim Burton's Batman created a unique image of New York City / Gotham that has not been repeated yet. Sky Captain is so close to all these movies that it's hard to mention them in the same sentence. Plus, acting is so poor, it makes me sick positively. So, there you have it. I spent $ 9 to watch this movie and you get my review. I hope it could dissuade you from making the same mistake as me.

summary: Edward Carnby, detective of the paranormal, unexplained and supernatural, investigates a mystery (the recent death of a friend) with clues leading to "Shadow Island" that brings him face to face with bizarre horrors that prove both psychologically disturbing and lethal, as he discovers that evil demons worshiped by an ancient culture called the Abskani are planning on coming back to life in the 21st century to once again take over the world... and only he and a young genius anthropologist with an incredible memory (and his ex-girlfriend), Aline Cedrac, stand in their way, at a gateway to hell. Standing in Carnby's way, however, is the impact that a brief encounter with an evil spirit called the Queen had upon his mind, as he slowly finds himself overpowered by the forces of darkness as they eat away at his very sanity...
translation:
True, there are many movies that are much worse than this movie. This movie was not Mano's: The Fate's Hand, or Troll 2 (yes, I've seen them twice before), but at the same time this movie is not an Alien, Predator or even Alien Vs. The soundtrack - Apart from "I wish I had An Angel", the soundtrack is pointless and bad heavy medal is pumped into the ears of the beholder, maybe to d I carry the terrible story (something I'll get soon). A long and very expensive 2-CD soundtrack is now available for those who feel musically challenged.

Director-director Hollywood star Uwe Ball, who brought us the classic House of the Dead. He told us, "Yes, films can get extremely bad and that's just the beginning of my deadly saga of terrible movies." At least it should be steered by Uwe Ball. Without telling me, I would have guessed that a monkey from the Congo was abducted, brought here, and forced to give opinions on how to make the movie punishable by shock. The cameraman was probably a camcorder glued to a skateboard and pushed forward until it hit a wall. In the scenes where the camera is supposed to stay calm, it keeps moving and does not allow us to stop anywhere. If she moves in action, the camera will stop for some reason.

The Producing Who on Earth is stupid enough to put money in this bomb? I feel sorry for the fool ... sometimes. Sometimes I'm glad that he or she has learned such a lesson in never putting money in the bin, worse than dog waste in a bag.

Writing / Storyboarding - Trying to analyze the story is more painful then jamming an ice ax under a big toe and kicking a football as hard as possible, but I'll try anyway.

Edward Carnby escapes as a child from an orphanage where 20 children where one can go under scientific experiments. He escapes and hides in a power outlet where he gets electrocuted (that's the point where it got so bad I started laughing out loud). Then, fast forward many years later, where he is a paranoia detective. He is attacked by a zombie who can not be shot, kills him and goes on with his life. Later, he is attacked by a crazy monster and discovers secrets that nobody else knows.

Yes, the plot is bad, really bad. The cinematic beings expect us to read about 10 minutes, which feels like 100, of random text about an untrue civilization called Abskani. The movie has no turn after turn, more than the audience can handle, more than the audience wishes to cope with, more than the audience could ever care. This storyline is so bad that even Double Dragon is better.

Overall, you miss this movie. I gave it a 1 out of 10, but that's because there is no 0.

summary: An intense portrayal of elite soldiers who have one of the most dangerous jobs in the world: disarming bombs in the heat of combat. When a new sergeant, James, takes over a highly trained bomb disposal team amidst violent conflict, he surprises his two subordinates, Sanborn and Eldridge, by recklessly plunging them into a deadly game of urban combat, behaving as if he's indifferent to death. As the men struggle to control their wild new leader, the city explodes into chaos, and James' true character reveals itself in a way that will change each man forever.
translation:
I really wanted to like this movie but ended up bored and incredulous. The first shot is a camera shot by a robot about to hit a bomb, and of course it's shaky. But then the rest of the movie stays in ridiculousness in Shakycam mode, even in quiet conversations. Do the tenements have no tripods and steadicams? The fact that it was shot to 16mm does not help, as the entire film is grainy and wobbly.

Despite all of Bigelow's efforts in precision vehicles and equipment, there are enough glaring mistakes and disagreements that undermine the film's credibility.

- A car would not go up in flames after a single shot and would be suffocated by a small hand extinguisher.

- A single Humvee would not drive around Baghdad in 2004, but would be assisted by other vehicles in the event of a collapse or attack. - It would be extremely unlikely to hit an insurgent insurgent at a great distance, where the bullet clearly takes a second to reach the target.

- I think bombs were dumped on or near a base to certain disposal areas, not anywhere in the desert.

- The attack on the oil tanker is said to have taken place in the Green Zone, a highly secure area with very few internal attacks. The zone consists mainly of offices and palaces with few residences, but is presented as a dangerous labyrinth of dark streets and lurking insurgents. Oddly enough, James never gets into trouble over the ridiculous tactics of ordering his two companions to take each other a lane to prepare for the attempted abduction.

- Speaking of which, the 3-man team is always portrayed cleaning buildings, chasing insurgents etc. on their own, even if there are dozens of soldiers right there.

- How many hours does the team have to stare at a dead insurgent hanging a window to find he's not pretending?

There were no founding shots to show the viewers what the size and layout of the base was or where Baghdad was related. I had no idea who the EOD team was reporting, and no other characters had been drafted. These are things that the characters would know, so we should too.

Many of the "surprises" and scenes are perfectly predictable. Yes, it is obvious that the psychiatrist colonel will be in trouble with the Iraqis he is trying to persuade that the choice of grain at home will be overwhelming, and that a driver whom you have kidnapped will not wait for you when you leave the vehicle br />
Finally, there was an almost complete lack of character development. Renner's character has a problematic relationship from the start, is ruthless and addicted to adrenaline. He's the same at the end of the movie. What's the point?

If this is indeed the best of Iraqi war movies, it is a sad bunch. Based on the half-hour that I saw, I would instead recommend Generation Kill on HBO.

summary: Jean Claude Van Damme plays a dual role as Alex and Chad, twins separated at the death of their parents. Chad is raised by a family retainer in Paris, Alex becomes a petty crook in Hong Kong. Seeing a picture of Alex, Chad rejoins him and convinces him that his rival in Hong Kong is also the man who killed their parents. Alex is suspicious of Chad, especially when it comes to his girlfriend.
translation:
Please, even if you are in the worst mood, you should not see this streak.

I do not think there was anything wrong with this movie. On the recommendation of a friend, I looked at this and literally flew down the cupboard for 1 hour and 48 minutes of my life. Bad acting, stupid directing, faint action and wretched action sequences - and if you do that together, you get double impact. Even the fewest expectations were not fulfilled.

I think I learned one thing - never look at Van Damme action movies. You are a waste of time!

summary: FBI agent Wesley Doyle is startled by the declaration of youngster Fenton Meiks about how his father's delusions required him and his brother, Adam to become his 'demon-slaying' murder accomplices. But when Doyle accepts to be shown concealed victim graves, the plot twists in the present just as gruesome.
translation: I rented this movie and watched it 20 times before I took it to the store. Bill Paxton hired a first-class talent to make a good thriller with some interesting twists. The story is original and well written. Powers Booth and Paxton both perform well. The story is narrated in an interesting way, with the flashbacks 20 years ago, then in the present, alternately back and forth. This kind of storytelling makes for a good thriller that can not get boring. Bill Paxton, please make more horror movies, you have the talent for it!

summary: Haunted by a secret, Ben Thomas looks for redemption by radically transforming the lives of seven people he doesn't know. Once his plan is set, nothing will be able to stop him. At least that's what he thinks. But Ben hadn't planned on falling in love with one of these people and she's the one who will end up transforming him.
translation:
Seven Pounds stars Will Smith as Ben Thomas, an IRS debt collection agent who has an ulterior motive to meet those who are back on their tax payments. Thomas has caused the deaths of seven people talking on the phone while driving, and the film follows his attempt to atone for his obvious, unpardonable crime.

The story is as subtle as a brick a green house window. What you see is exactly what happens - even the end of the Titanic was more surprising compared to Seven Pounds. There is absolutely no twist, there is never any confusion or doubt about what happens.

I usually only like Will Smith when he's in Bad Boys mode. The guy is at his best when he carries a gun, drives a Ford GT and says "Aw Hell Close", when he tries to behave seriously, he just appears as a pathetic attempt to get an Oscar who is so desperate for , That's probably the main reason why I did not look forward to the movie, even though it's very understated here. There are moments of comedy, but they are subtle, in fact it was the most submissive performance of Will Smith I've ever seen, and for that very reason he was fantastic and ironic should be nominated for a grand prize.

The supporting cast were all great too - Rosario Dawson looked pretty closely at deaths from throughout the movie and Woody Harrelson and Barry Pepper were fine, with all the other little players.

Overall, it's a whiny - but it does not throw away all the usual clich√©s and sentimental violins to give you no choice but to cry. There were a few times that even my hard heart almost broke. It will be hard for you to find none of the situations that are not related to your own life, which makes it all the more real.

I would give it 8/10. The Will Smith Show moves into drama without the despair of The Pursuit of Happiness, and makes it all the better.

summary: The first spaceship to Mars, presumed lost, is found in space and brought back to Earth by remote control. Only two from an initial crew of four are still alive, but one is unconscious due to an attached alien growth, while the other is traumatized, blocking out all memory of what happened. In hopes to save the unconscious crewman, the amnesiac is interrogated back into remembering. Those in charge thereby learn of the terrible dangers awaiting anyone venturing into the spooky, ruddy stillness of the very alien Martian ecosystem.
translation:
The Angry Red Planet

Like "The Man From Planet X," this is a bizarre sci-fi story from a time when fantasy and sci-fi are still condemned were close. That is, we have some highly ridiculous special effects and wild pseudo-science masquerading as science fiction. And yes, it's another "classic" in a high-quality broadcast with a sharp image and sharp sound - from Midnite Movies.

So, the main reason to watch this movie? Oh, it's definitely the whole time our Space Crew is on Mars. (What, you thought, "Angry Red Planet" was referring to Neptune?) Before that is a pretty bad space crew boarding a spaceship where they smoke and making sexist chauvinist banter against the "weak female" member of the crew. By today's standards, it would be a bit offensive if it were not so funny. But Mars is the real reason why we observe this thing. The film is generally black and white, but Mars, well Mars is screaming blood red. It's filmed in that bizarre red plastic sheen that gives the angry red planet a pretty interesting look of overexposed redness. It's really a sight, as the (ha ha) aliens spectators are witnesses. The best is the Ratbatspidercrab. Do you think that's a joke? That's what they call it in the movie! It's a gigantic chimera (little doll) of a thing that combines the characteristics of rats, bats, spiders and crabs. It borders on all puppets and terrifies the horror of our "heroic crew". There are other strange and ill-conceived aliens that you can see, but you take the cake. Eventually, after her shattering experience on Mars, the sexist crew climbs onto their "ship" and returns to the planet from which they came.

This is not for everyone. Sci-fi movie buffs and curiosity seekers, and some general movie freaks. Mystery Science Theater 3000 fans will have a field day with them (if they never got around on the show).

2/10 Modern score, 6/10 nostalgic score, 4/10 in total.

(www.ResidentHazard.com)

summary: The Forrester family - father Mitch Forrester, mother Helen Forrester, their pre-teen son Billy Forrester and their pre-school son Woody Forrester - have just moved to a new town where Mitch is starting a new job. Both Mitch and Billy are worried about fitting into their new environment. It's worse for Billy as Woody, who is not worried about the move, is at that stage in his life where everything is simple and easy. Billy's first day in the fifth grade at his new school does not go well when he gets into an altercation with the class bullies, led by Joe Guire. The altercation involves worms and Billy stating that he eats worms all the time, which leads to all the bullies calling him "Wormboy". As such, Joe bets Billy that he can't eat ten worms (without vomiting), the bet to take place this upcoming Saturday, with the last worm to be consumed by 7pm. Despite having a notoriously weak stomach, Billy takes him up on the bet. As the bet starts, the only classmate on Billy's side is ...
translation: I remembered that it was one of my favorite books as a kid and I wanted to read it to my 5 year old daughter for a while now. I knew the movie would be out soon, so we went to the library to get the book and they gave us preview maps for the next day! We hurried home and spent the afternoon reading the book so we could compare it. Was not necessary. The only thing common between the book and the movie is the fact that there is a bet, and a lot of worms. Oh yes, I almost forgot that the boy who cooks the most worms presents his masterpieces with a French accent. How the children know each other, the number of children involved, how the bet was made, the number of worms to eat, the time frame in which to eat the worms, how they are cooked, the progress of the friendships, climax Scenes, etc., NOTHING is the same. But somehow it did not ruin the movie for me. The characters are fun and the movie did not disappoint. A word of caution for the parents, there was a moment when the adults in the room were collectively holding their breath, and that was when Billy's little brother called his penis a "fat cock." The embarrassing part came when my daughter continued to ask those around us, "Does anyone know what a fat cock is?" lol. That and an occasional "shut up" is as disgusting as this movie. My daughter thought she could get Worms 3 and 4 (and kept the empty Nacho tank for all cases), but she was fine with Worm 6. She and I both enjoyed the movie and had a wonderful time enjoying the experience divide.

summary: Years after moving to Tokyo with her parents, Hinako returns to her hometown in rural Shikoku. She soon learns that her childhood friend, Sayuri, died several years ago and that Sayuri's mother, who used to perform seances and exorcisms, has gone almost insane with grief. After seeing Sayuri's ghost several times during the night, Hinako consults with some local experts on the paranormal and discovers that Sayuri's mother has something planned for her daughter...
translation:
Feh. This movie started in an interesting way, but quickly the scale went from confusing to boring. Most of the confusing parts were created at the beginning, where the editing scenes are so numerous that you can hardly say what's going on in the first twenty minutes. The dull comes later, with a lukewarm romance between the two living humans (both pushes). The vengeful spirit of the dead girl is indeed the liveliest person in the movie who is sad. If the rest of the cast had grown to its caliber, the movie might have been better.

Maybe. Because the storyline becomes interesting for a while as it looks as if the mentally ill priestess is trying to raise the dead sixteen-year-old girl's mother from the dead, with the unfortunate side effect that all the other dead would come back human form and most likely start killing everyone. A kind of Japanese mystical night of the living dead. But that will not happen. Although this hairy unwashed priest with a tiny basket on his head tells uninteresting young people that this will happen when the priestess finishes her ritual, she does just that and the only dead person who manifests herself is her daughter. No mass rebellion of the dead, no wandering army of corpses, nothing. The priest only brings the ghost of the girl back to the Land of the Dead and takes with him the washed-out friend of a friend who had crushed her like peanut brittle (at that point I was tempted to cheer aloud, so.) Idiot went over to that DEAD girl to kiss and stroke, ohwww !!!). The Robitussen sucking, spineless best friend ends up with a long, introspective attitude as she leaves the village for the last time, and that's it. No real horror, no real horror, which tends to make the Japanese better than American filmmakers with their emphasis on exaggerated cheesy facial make-up, no screaming mimis. I was very disappointed.

summary: Italy 1600: A convent of nuns are invaded by the Tarantula Sect on their annual pilgrimage. The cultists defile the place of worship, orgying in the chapel and desecrating the altar. One nun decides she can't take the religious oppression any longer and flees the convent upset that all the leaders are male.
translation:
She was expecting another Nunsploation movie with a malicious Mother Superior, who abused and tortured her allegations. Flavia turned out to be MUCH more than I expected.

It actually has a feminist history, though I do not think such a term existed in the era in which the film plays. It certainly was not practiced. Women (and the Jews and the poor) are very oppressed and imprisoned in the lower reaches of society. Throughout history, Sister Flavia (Florinda Bolkan) experiences the tyranny of her time until she just can not sit there any longer and actually does something about it, albeit with catastrophic consequences.

The pre-credit sequence has Flavia as a young adolescent near a battlefield. She sees an injured "evil" Muslim soldier (one of the few still living) and tries to help him. Before she can, her hateful father beheaded the soldier and waved his head in his face (big family dynamics, huh?). Afterwards, her father forces her to join a monastery, where she sees more injustice. Although scenes include violence, rape, and nuns, I would view this as a historical drama rather than a nuns ploitation.

In fact, many of the ingredients for a trashy piece of evaluation are there, but the acting, the camera work, the plot and the music are too good to keep it at this level. Most of the "nuns" movies I've seen usually have the following basic assumption: A good girl ends up in a convent where the matron is a huge bitch who likes to whip people and / or make their lives hell
Flavia passively spends much of the first part of the film questioning all the atrocities that are taking place around her. Much of her passivity is forgotten when she meets the strong (but a bit crazy - she likes to pee outside like me, but it's a lot easier for boys) Sister Agatha. As a group of Muslims attack their abbey, Flavia and Agatha are not frightened like the other nuns. Their attackers actually function as their liberators (the cruelty and near slavery of the abbey). In fact, it is a Christian, not a Muslim intruder, impaling sister Agatha.

It is Agatha's death that sends Flavia on her violent crusade against those who oppressed her ... Her father treats her like dirt. Your Muslim lover leaves you at a very inappropriate time. I do not want to tell too much of the rest of the story, but be prepared to be shocked, devastated and saddened by the end. This is a great movie, so do not let it deter you from its (undeserved) reputation as a trash epic. And how on earth could a film go wrong with Florinda Bolkan and Claudio Cassinelli? I am not familiar with the other works of Mar√≠a Casares, but Sister Agatha is a hellish figure.

I've read a lot of great reviews about the release of Synapse (US), but I love my German X-Rated cult DVD copy. It's not anamorphic / 16: 9, but actually has a little more image information on all edges than the release of Synapse.

And there are also many great, wise or funny dialogues (many by Sister Agatha)

"Why is God male? The Father, the Son and the Holy Spirit? are all male! " -Flavia

"These men are scared - look at them, sister - fear they will lose their power!" -Sr. Agatha (regarding Christians who flee after the Muslims arrive)

"Woman, where are you going, the Muslims can not do anything the Christians have not done! Ha Ha Ha!" -Sr. Agatha (to a group of fleeing Christian women)

"Lord, bless these Muslims - for frightening these pompous Christians." -Flavia

"Does it take the mere sight of a Muslim to make you $ h! Your underwear?" -Sr. Agatha

Closing message: "Flavia Gaetani, not yet a Muslim - no longer a Christian - was punished as an outlier The idea for the film came from events that culminated during the Musalman invasions in Italy still remembered today as THE MARTYDROM OF THE 800 AT OTRANTO "

summary: An old woman finds a baby among the cauliflowers in her garden. She takes care of the orphan, and calls him Tot√≤. When she dies, he is sent to an orphanage, which he leaves as a teenager. When Tot√≤ goes out in the world, he expects everyone to be open-hearted as himself, but it isn't so. Without belongings and a place to live, he soon turns up among other homeless people, living scattered in boxes and cement pipes on a vast, barren field outside Milano. With his energy and enthusiasm Tot√≤ quickly engages the outcasts in transforming the place into a small shanty town. The eccentric misfits are turned into a warm-hearted community. But when the wealthy Mr. Mobbi buys the land he will try to get rid of the outcasts.
translation: The snobs and pseudo-experts consider it "far from De Sica's best". Those who suffer from a serious lack of innocence will find a problem that connects with this masterpiece. De Sica spoke very directly. His Italianess does not have the kinky self-examination of modern Italian filmmakers, or the bitter self-parody of Pietro Germi, the sharp bittersweetness of Mario Monicelli, the solemnity of Visconti, or the cold observation of Antonioni. De Sica told us the stories like a father sitting on the edge of his cot before going to bed. There is no attempt to intellectualize. Miracolo A Milano and to a lesser extent Il Giudizio Universale are realistic fairy tales, or what we call magical realism today. The film is a jewel from start to finish and Toto is the kind of character you accept with an open heart, but of course that requires you to have a heart. Cinema in its purest form. Great.

summary: A mysterious creature from another planet, resembling a giant blob of jelly, lands on earth. The people of a nearby small town refuse to listen to some teenagers who have witnessed the blob's destructive power. In the meantime, the blob just keeps on getting bigger.
translation: This is a pretty well known one, so I will not go too deep. The basic story is about two teenagers who learn about a slimy alien blob of goo that comes to Earth by meteor. Human contact with this slime ball burns like acid through meat. It also absorbs human body and makes it bigger. No one believes the teens (Steeve McQueen and his girlfriend) and when they finally do, it seems the blob is unstoppable. It's really well done for his age and unlike many other 50's flicks, the pace is pretty fast. The story is unique and a must for any fan of old science fiction and monster movies. If you can dig up the gooey gore of 80s horror, you should also check out the '88 remake.

summary: The B.T.K. killer harasses a news reporter with threatening letters as he ponders about the murders he committed 30 years ago.
translation: This is actually an insult to the victims and their families of the BTK killer. The events in this film are not even true. Why they could not make a film of the real events makes no sense, since the real events are more interesting than this invented farce. Do not waste your time watching them for free. Low budget and a shameful presentation of events that should not be joking, what was really this movie. If you would allow me to give this movie a -10, I would do it. The acting has sucked and it looks as if it had been shot on an old VHS video camera from the 80s. Save time and money by not watching this movie.

summary: A sailor prone to violent outbursts is sent to a naval psychiatrist for help. Refusing at first to open up, the young man eventually breaks down and reveals a horrific childhood. Through the guidance of his doctor, he confronts his painful past and begins a quest to find the family he never knew.
translation:
A few years ago, the Navy kept the development of "Men of Honor," a film based on the experiences of the Black Master's first fight to overcome virulent racism. Always eager to support films that show the best side of our Navy, the U.S.S. Nimitz and two helicopter attack ships, with supporting land installations, were provided to supplement this captivating story of a young sailor's fight with uncontrollable rage. Part of the film was aboard the U.S.S. Belleau wood.

Antwone Fisher has written the script for Denzel Washington's directorial debut, playing as a Navy psychiatrist with Fisher, effectively and deeply played by Derek Luke.

Fisher is an obviously light-hearted soldier assigned to the USS Belleau Wood (LHA-3), a front-line helicopter attack platform. Fisher can not avoid launching his own attacks from his peers with minimal provocation. As part of a possible pre-separation procedure, Fisher is assigned to the MD. He opens slowly to the black psychiatrist and reveals a terrible childhood of neglect and shattering brutality.

The story evolves as Fisher cautiously, but increasingly familiarizes his doctor and gets the courage to pursue a love interest, a registered sailor named Cheryl, played by a stunningly beautiful Joy Bryant.

Fisher reluctantly reluctantly asks the doctor by asking long-simmering questions, but soon realizes he needs to seek the answers, even if they are painful to grow and move away from conflict-relevant destructive behavior.

While all the main characters are black, this story transcends the breed and shows fearlessly the evil of exuberant religiosity and the associated hypocrisy in foster care. Viola Davis, a versatile actress featured in a series of recent films, is a picture of sullen immorality, but nothing compared to foster mom, Mrs. Tate (Novella Nelson), who would earn in short but burning scenes - if there was Oscar for brutal brutality.

Films about patient-therapist interaction have a certain predictability (all these transference and countertransference things), but the seriousness of Fisher and his / her mentor is realistically tangible. It's a good story, well told. Period.

While "Antwone Fisher" plays in the Navy, it is in no way a service story like "Men of Honor," an excellent movie that deals with smashing racism against a real person , It's not a movie about black people either. It's about surviving terrible childhood experiences and, as Fisher says, announcing in adulthood that the victim is still "upright." The persecutors are shrinking in size and importance as a brave and strong young man claims his right to a decent life with the help of a caring physician.

My only contention is that Washington is a Lieutenant Commander, but is addressed as a commander. With all the supporters of the Navy listed in the credits, somebody should have told Washington Director that his character, like all naval officers, is addressed under the rank of commander as "mister." No big criticism, right? :)

I do not know why this movie plays in so few theaters. It deserves a wide distribution. Derek Luke could get an Oscar nomination.

8/10.

summary: A clairvoyant woman, inspired by a vision, smashes open a section of wall in her husband's home and finds a skeleton behind it. Along with her psychiatrist, she seeks to find the truth about who the person was and who put her there. Soon enough, she starts to realize the possibility that she may share the victim's fate...
translation:
Average (and surprisingly tame) Fulci giallo, which means that it is still pretty bad by normal standards, but with its solid presentation and some nice touches it releases like a proper twist on the questions of vision and clairvoyance.

The known weaknesses of the genre are in full swing: banal dialogue, wooden drama, illogical action points. And the finale continues much too long, while the resolution is rather lame or should I say flabby affair.

Fulci's ironic handling of Giallo standards is amusing. Yellow hints wherever you look.

3 out of 10 limping killers

summary: My Bollywood Bride tells the story of Alex, a copy-writer dreaming of being an adventure novelist someday, who meets and romances Indian beauty Reena, while she is vacationing in California. Torn by her blossoming feelings for Alex and her Indian family values and obligations, Reena returns home without saying goodbye. Alex, distraught by the turn of events, decides to follow her to Mumbai and win her back. The trouble is, Alex couldn't be more out of his element on the sub-continent, not helped by the fact Reena has kept something very important about her from him (Reena is the top Bollywood film star - the Julia Roberts of India)! However, with the help of a rambunctious rickshaw driver and some of Reenas friends, Alex just might have a chance at winning her heart. A parallel love story centers on Bobby, an up-and-coming Bollywood star, who has forgotten his roots and started to believe his own press. As a close friend of Reena, he tries to help her by taking Alex under his wing. ...
translation:
Incredible!

This movie gets a 7 out of 0 10. That must be one of the worst movies I've seen in years. The plot was not only incredibly bad, the story (if you may say so) was just as bad. Of course, everyone knows what will happen in the first 5 minutes. Which is not bad if you can tie the audience during the lead. However, this is not the case. There is no action, no tension, not even a spark between the two main actors. Unfortunately it was a waste of my time and certainly a waste of my money.

and the 2 of only to try

summary: A Baltimore sandwich shop employee becomes an overnight sensation when a photographer's photos he's taken of his weird family become the latest rage in the art world.
translation: I found this movie funny from the beginning. John Waters uses characters reminiscent of some of the down-to-earth Fellini characters. Christina Ricci has once again expanded her skills in this film. If you are looking for a funny movie without preaching, I recommend this movie.

summary: After a spot of therapy Cruella De Vil is released from prison a changed woman. Devoted to dogs and good causes, she is delighted that Chloe, her parole officer, has a dalmatian family and connections with a dog charity. But the sound of Big Ben can reverse the treatment so it is only a matter of time before Ms De Vil is back to her incredibly ghastly ways, using her new-found connections with Chloe and friends.
translation: After watching the 1996 remake, I thought it would be the funniest way to see Cruella De Vil, who would be punished for torturing animals just for her skin. The whole movie was pretty funny and in my opinion better than the animated one. But there was no need for a second. First of all, when Cruela returns, she does not heal and drives her crazy again. Just let her break out of prison and that's rap. I thought it was not very funny. It's just meant to give back an original puppy. I expected it to be Lucky because he was the most attractive and also had Roger and Anita back. However, they decided to have a complete recast and not really one hundred, not even one hundred and two, but only three puppies and a parrot who thought he was a dog (smart). Gerard Depardieu's role was meaningless. In the end, Cruella suffers too much, too humiliating and too over the top to be true. She is baked in a giant cake. This was a desperate attempt at physical humor, trying to mimic the same effect of the first one. That just did not work. It was too much over the top, and not too funny. I really felt sorry for Cruella.

summary: Condemned to life without end, and to an undying passion for a lost love he can never find, a vampire stalks a beautiful young woman.
translation: The opening scenes move as smoothly as frozen Velveeta. Trying to engage in dramatic dialogue just makes me wish I could better control fast-forward control. Vampires are usually portrayed as sexy and intelligent or mangy disgusting creatures. This vampire tries to seduce his prey by imitating a lost puppy. I usually count a body count, so there was a cat (that does not matter) a bum, a girl who fell into her with a sword (whatever that was) and then the plot. Foley artists are respected for using celery to create the sound of a broken arm, but the sound of biting into an apple for a vampire who bites a victim is simply silly. I liked Warlock, but this movie stinked so badly that we turned it off, and it was so forgetful that we rented it a year later, just to turn it off.

summary: Verne wants nothing more than to escape from a penal colony located off the northern coast of South America. He tries to involve Julie, a saloon girl, in his plans but she turns him in to the authorities. On Verne's next try, he piggybacks on the escape of six other convicts and runs into Julie again in the process. One of the convicts is a spiritual figure who seems to know what will happen before anyone else. The group attempts to travel through the jungle, board a boat, and make it to the mainland.
translation: This movie is pure "Hollywood Hokum". It's based on a novel called 'Not Too Deep' by Richard Sale, which may or may not have been interesting, it would require research to find out! The story in the film takes on many incidents and a lot of background obviously existed in the novel, but nowhere to be seen in the film, so that the film was either brutally cut or the script was confused from the beginning.There is not a millisecond in this film, which is realistic in terms of events or characters away is pure Hollywood fantasy in every way, two well-known actors, Paul Lukas and Peter Lorre, are so worn out and wasted that it made no sense to be in the film at all, they must have been thrown into the mix, in style and manner How to sprinkle a piece of omelet with chopped chives in the hope that the taste will be improved. "The film is a cumbersome attempt to create a" moral hte "and is so cheesy that it is ridiculous. The story is about some serious criminals who are imprisoned in French Guiana and want to flee their French colonial prison through a jungle (very much Hollywood jungle with a rubber band). Of course, there must be a woman in the story, so Joan Crawford keeps it as an unfortunate tramp that, for some reason, becomes irresistible to Clark Gable, one of the escaped criminals. Crawford, who has escaped through the jungle, wears high-heeled shoes and keeps her makeup fresh. Gable flirts and twists and makes grotesque facial expressions, curls his eyebrows as he is used to, grins and looks suggestive on all of what his way of acting is. It's hard to treat such a character as a hardened criminal if he's always trying so hard to be Clark Gable that he certainly will not have time to be a thief. (Attention seekers are by definition too busy to steal and unfit for a task that requires people NOT to see them.) The whole escapade is so ridiculous that it can only be considered light entertainment. An attempt at religiosity and "depth" is made by injecting into the story a mysterious angel of mercy who voluntarily goes to jail pretending to be a prisoner. He helps with the escape and accompanies all criminals and ministers to their different deaths and helps them find "peace" in their last breaths. This character is played very well by Ian Hunter, who is convinced by a convincing atmosphere of secret knowledge, smiling enigmatically, making cryptic prophetic remarks and having a small spot on his face to give it a heavenly glow. The theme should be redemption. You could call it the Donald Duck version of Hollywood Goes Moral and Gets Heavy. For real depth, Hitchcock's 1953 "I Confess" shows how it really should be done. In contrast, this banal nonsense shows how empty the lockers of Meaning were in Tinsel Town, and that if they were looking for something that could mean anything, everything they could imagine was more tinsel.

summary: Izo Okada, a ronin (masterless samurai), desperately seeks a way out of his financial straits. He allies himself with the Tosa clan under the ruthless leader, Takechi, and imagines that he has come up in the world. But Takechi makes Izo a killer and a puppet, filled with self-loathing and a need to stop Takechi.
translation:
Hitokiri (which means "murder"), a / k / a "Tenchu", which roughly means "divine punishment", shows Hideo Gosha at the head of his form. DO NOT miss this or Goshas other classic, Goyokin! Hitokiri is not only one of Gosha's best films, it's one of the best "Samurai / Chambara" films ever and perhaps one of the best Japanese films ever to be exported.

Be forewarned, all the complicated plot details in Hitokiri can be a little hard to follow for those unfamiliar with 19th century Japanese history. Nevertheless, the underlying human drama is obvious and open to all viewers. According to the Gosha standard, Hitokiri offers another variation on his traditional theme of "loyalty to his master" versus "doing the right thing". Anyway, Gosha is developing his favorite subject with such sophistication that it's really the movie to see (along with Goyokin of course).

I suppose it breaks like this: If you want a simpler, more action-oriented story, you might want to see Goyokin. However, if you want a more elaborate, complex (though grim) drama, look at this.

(OK, OK, basically the historical background is a huge power grave between many different Samurai clans who either work (1) to reform and keep the Tokugawa shogunate, and (2) Those who try to install Emperor Meiji as the supreme ruler of Japan. Of course, those clans who worked for Emperor Meiji were often less interested in "reforming" Japan than giving their own clan more power in the country. " Ironically, the entire feudal system was formally abolished as one of the first Meiji government reforms, ironic phrases like this - Gosha's ironic - that makes the whole thing all the bittersweet.

What distinguishes "Hitokiri" from Gosha's other films is Gosha's mature cinematographic sense, each recording is thoughtfully composed, and (like Kubrick's Barry Lyndon) every frame of the film could be a still composition n exist. Of course this is typical Gosha. Hitokiri stands out with breathtaking scenery, including (like Goyokin) many captivating seascapes. Just look at the opening sequence and you're excited! Make no mistakes, this is not an English testimony of time: Hitokiri is extremely violent (do not say that you have not been warned).

What else does Hitokiri do except for a cool camera work? The performances seem to me to be a bit more subtle. Katsu Shintaro (of Zatoichi / Hanzo the Razor Glory) turns in a star performance as the conflicting protagonist / antihero, Okada Izo. Katsu manages to give humanity a character who seems to be more of a wild animal than a villain. Throughout the movie, you're never quite sure if you're engaged or outraged by Okada's character. At the same time, Katsu's portrayal of Okada's craving for respect and his later pathetic attempts at salvation seems so human that one can not help but feel empathy / compassion. After watching Nakadai Tatsuya play the tormented hero in "Goyokin," it's great to see him playing such a ruthless villain in "Hitokiri." He is just perfect, there is nothing left to say!

As a final comment, perhaps more interesting for buffs than for occasional fans, do not miss the last appearance of Mishima Yukio (yes, the closed gay guy). The right-wing ultranationalist novelist who stands in front of the jubilant crowd of Japanese military men he "kidnapped" in 1970 and shot a film about his life and work by Paul Schrader, who took his life from Seppuku, who actually does a pretty good job of honoring (for an assassin) Shinbei Tanaka.

summary: A documentary on Guatemalan sex workers who formed a soccer team in 2004 and joined their local five-a-side league. The league's organizer expelled them when their profession was revealed, bringing about a media frenzy.
translation: a handmade / manipulated documentary about one of the darkest places of Guatemala. portrayed as a fun, safe ... but sad place where a group of sex workers play in a football team that is gathered in not more than a week! The focus of the documentary is on proving that society repels this type of "worker," even though these poor women never find a solution, except that the people who documented it made them "stars" (as did the title) ) says so) in exchange for the exploitation of this realshowlike documentation. but it does have its own documented reality ... but unfortunately that has nothing to do with the main story. I would not accept to see it again; but I would only recommend it for general cultural purposes.

summary: In "Love Trap" we meet Richard- a laid-back yet forward-thinking law student- hanging out with the guys at a local pool hall. When Angel- a seductive vixen in a red dress- appears from nowhere and smothers him with attention, he finds himself in a situation most guys wish for. Faced with temptation, Richard makes a seemingly innocent suggestion that sets in motion a series of events that ultimately unbalances his world. When the dust settles, we witness Richard's small but profound epiphany about the true nature of love.
translation: Love Trap is an independent movie you must have seen. When I sat down to watch the movie, I came in with low expectations, but left with a blessing. The story is poetic, contentual and creative. The author pulls you further and further in each scene so that you can relate to the realistic characters that everyone can identify with. The movie allowed me to think about my life and my love. The film showed what love really is, action not emotion. I was also impressed with the quality of the film's cinematography and soundtrack. The entire presentation exceeded my expectations. I'll give the film two big thumbs up and recommend it to everyone of all ages and backgrounds.

summary: After countless millennia of watching, waiting and stalking, the unholy creatures known as werewolves are poised to inherit the earth. After newswoman Karen White's shocking on-screen transformation and violent death, her brother Ben is approached by Stefan Crosscoe, a mysterious gentleman who claims that Karen has actually become a werewolf. But this is the least of their worries...
