To save mankind, Stefan and Ben must travel to Transylvania to battle and destroy Stirba, the immortal queen of all werewolves, before she is restored to her full powers!
translation:
Terrible horror sequel to "The Howling". This begins with Karen White's funeral (she was killed at the end of the first movie). Stefan Crosscoe (unfortunately Christopher Lee) comes there and tells Karen's brother Ben (Reb Brown) that Karen is a werewolf. He goes to Transylvania to kill Striba (Sybil Danning), the head wolf. Ben and a colleague of Karens (Annie McEnroe) join him.

A horrible screenplay, bad direction, awkward editing and really horrendous drama by Brown and McEnroe single-handedly sink this one. The werewolf effects are usually kept in the dark - for a good reason! They are terrible when you see them. Below average special effects too - though I liked the cartoon flash coming from Danning's fingers. There is also a werewolf orgy that is especially stupid and Danning takes at least EIGHT TIMES during the credits!

There are a few good things - I found the village in Transylvania amusing - it looks like it's from a 1930s Universal horror movie! There are interesting camera ticks between transitional scenes; Brown and McEnroe have good bodies and Lee and Danning are good at it - but they can not save it. Really - WHY did you do that? Where do you hard for money ??? This is one of the least rated movies by IMDb. That alone should tell you something. Supposedly Danning was horrified when she saw the movie - I understand why! A must.

summary: Felix's (Jack Lemmon) wife has left him and he is contemplating suicide. His friends sense his depression and one of them, Oscar (Walter Matthau), volunteers to take him in until he is fine again. The two of them are like chalk and cheese - Oscar is fun-loving, gregarious and slovenly, Felix is a shy, stay-at-home, obsessive-compulsive neat-freak. Being around Oscar brightens Felix up, but he quickly starts to irritate Oscar.
translation: There is nothing wrong with "The Odd Couple", and it's no surprise that Jack Lemmon and Walter Matthau are a hugely successful comedy team. But there is something so underdeveloped about Neil Simon's adaptation of his hit stage play that it seems more like a sketch in a sketch comedy show than a full-bodied movie. I did not see the piece, but I have to assume that the screen version is pretty faithful, as Simon wrote it, so the errors are not due to an adaptation from the stage to the screen. There are some interesting ideas in this story - two recently divorced men who immediately fall into traditional married roles when they become roommates because nobody knows anything else - that Simon never completely fills out. Still, there are many worse ways to kill a few hours.

summary: When petty thief Cosimo is given the plan for the perfect heist from a lifer in prison - the kind of job you dream about - he has to get out of jail, fast. But with Cosimo stuck in the joint, it's up to his girl Rosalind to track down a patsy. But while no one wants to do the time for Cosimo's crime, everybody seems to know a guy who will - and for a share, they're willing to track him down. Before long, Rosalind has five guys trailing behind her, looking to get their bungling hands on a piece of the action.
translation:
I had tried to rent this on many occasions but was always with the girlfriend, who usually commented "Uhm ... looks good, but I'm not in the mood," stumbling and ensemble comedy rejects for this movie. "That's how the" Almighty Solo Movie Night "comes in.

Anyway, I found Welcome To Collinwood a pretty entertaining movie, and although it's rather forgetful, it has moments of fun and a few laugh moments was not familiar with the fact that it was a remake, and as a general rule watching movies try to ignore that fact and still watch them on their own merits George Clooney has put down a humorous and short cameo as a wheeled safecracker, who drew my attention for the most part to two things ... 1. Would not every comedy be better if Mr. Clooney plays a weird 5-minute cameo and 2. how do they make fake tattoos that look old and faded, and how easy to wash? The performers, all of them good actors, have done a great job, and one gets the impression that they had a good time working together, which in a movie like that This is pretty important. Needless to say that everything in this film is not planned and humorous, but I had to check the specifics and look at the original, so I think it's a success! Rent this for a good time, maybe a few friends and a pizza. You will have a good time.

*** 7/10 ***

The soundtrack is spectacular. It's great to hear the much underrated Paolo Conte, who hummed to me long after the end credits.

summary: College freshman Cassandra "Cassie" steps into a nightmare of otherworldly visitations after surviving a devastating car accident. Haunted by a grim reaper of a far different kind, her only hope is to cling to chance encounters with her lost love Sean and the aid of a mysterious young priest named Father Jude. It is the spirit of Sean, her soul mate, who guides her to love, but it is her friends Matt, Annabel and Annabel's morose friend Raven who try to draw her to the dark side.
translation:
May I start by saying that Casey Affleck is a very talented actor and I respect his work very much. I wish he was in more movies showing his talent. Soul Survivors was a very, very bad movie. Very bad.

I would say that I blame almost everything on the bad script. Affleck is a very talented actress, Wes Bentley had an outstanding performance in American Beauty, Melissa Sagemiller did well, and Eliza Dushku is currently the It Girl in Hollywood. I do not think any of the actors really got into the script, and I understand why. To say that this movie belongs to the horror genre is an exaggeration. It had the twists and turns you would expect, but they just did not go anywhere ... except for more confusion. I found the ending to be very anti-climatic because it just did not make sense or really answered any of the questions I had about the plot.

I wish I could give this movie a good review, but I can not. Honestly, the only thing you'll find scary about this movie is that you paid for it.

summary: Two students, Gerardo and Jonas, are in love. However, Jonas becomes obsessed with another boy, which leads to Gerardo moving into arms of Sergio.
translation: I saw that at the Chicago Film Festival - avoid it at all costs, unless you have trouble sleeping. It's a movie full of pretensions - it starts with a little quote from "Hiroshima mon amour" and it's all downhill from there. Camerawork - Imagine a kid trying to imitate Wong Kar Wai. Storyline - Smokey Robinson and the Wonders "The love I saw in you was just a mirage" extended from 3 minutes to over 2 hours but filled with repetition. For blunt numbing pain, this film ranks with the benches in the Methodist church that drew me to my parents when I was a kid. I would like to get refunded 2 hours of my life. The promoter of Julian Hernandez gave the consideration with comment the charge that the film is "controversial" - this is only true for the narcotic effect of the film.

summary: Paris, je t'aime is about the plurality of cinema in one mythic location: Paris, the City of Love. Twenty filmmakers have five minutes each; the audience must weave a single narrative out of twenty moments. The 20 moments are fused by transitional interstitial sequences and also via the introduction and epilogue. Each transition begins with the last shot of the previous film and ends with the first shot of the following film, extending the enchantment and the emotion of the previous segment, preparing the audience for a surprise, and providing a cohesive atmosphere. There's a reappearing mysterious character who is a witness to the Parisian life. A common theme of Paris and love fuses all.
translation:
Greetings from the darkness. 18 directors of 18 seemingly unrelated vignettes about love in the City of Light. A very unusual format that needs some segments to adapt to the viewer. We're so used to character development during a 2-hour movie, it's a bit disarming that this happens in an 8-minute segment.

The idea is 18 love / relationship stories in 18 different quarters of this gorgeous city. Of course, some are better off than others and some go for comedy while others focus on dramatic emotions. Some well-known directors are involved, including: The Coen brothers, Wes Craven, Alfonso Cuar√≥n, Alexander Payne, Gus Van Sant and Gurinda Chadha. Many well-known faces can also be seen: Steve Buscemi, Barbet Schroeder, Catalina Sandino Moreno, Ben Gazzara, Gena Rowlands, Gerard Depardieu, Juliette Binoche, Willem Dafoe, Nick Nolte, Maggie Gyllenhaal and Bob Hoskins.

One of the best segments is a pantomime, then another pantomime and the nerdy but happy young son of the two pantomimes. Principal roles include a red trench coat, cancer, divorce, sexual fantasy, the death of a child, and many other topics. Do not miss Alexander Payne (director of "Sideways") as Oscar Wilde.

The variety of segments makes it interesting to see, but as a film it can not be called big. Nevertheless, it is very good to see and a nice change for the frequent moviegoers.

summary: Kol is an evil guy about to be executed on a distant spaceship. He manages to escape on a shuttle and make his way to some woods in America. The commander of the spaceship decides to send out The Alienator to execute Kol at all costs. Kol meets up with some teens and Ward Armstrong and together they all try not to get killed by the pursuing Woman of Death - The Alienator.
translation: Recipe for one of the worst movies of all time: An evil villain who looks like he has escaped the WWF has a terrible target with a weapon that has conflicting effects (the first guy she shoots catches fire, but if she does someone else shoots them disappear) and take time to pet a deer. Then you have the unspeakable characters, 30-year-old college students, a lame attempt at a startling ending, and much, much more. Avoid at all costs.

summary: On September 11, 2001, filmmaker James Hanlon and Jules and Gedeon Naudet were filming a documentary on a rookie New York City firefighter when they noticed a plane overhead. That plane would hit the World Trade Center. They rushed immediately to the scene. James Hanlon and the Naudets filmed throughout Sept. 11 and the days afterward from the firemen's perspective, as it became clear to them that this was the only known footage from inside the Twin Towers that day.
translation: I was a bit skeptical if I should look at this when it was first shown on CBS. I was one of the many people who were in NYC that day, I went to school at Hunter College. I did not want to see all the devastation and carnage again, but like many others, I was curious what it was all about. Tears came to my eyes and watched this documentary. All my memories came back and only the intense pictures were incredible. I bought the DVD for the one-year anniversary and looked at it several times. How these guys were able to record this material was incredible. If you have not seen this documentary, do yourself a favor and check it out. It is obviously depressing and will bring tears to your eyes, but it is an incredible document of this darkest hour of this land.

summary: A famous opera singer, Giorgio Fini, loses his voice during an American tour. He goes to a female throat specialist, Pamela Taylor, whom he falls in love with.
translation:
A crossover attempt to appeal to those who do not appreciate the opera and exploit the fame of one of the greatest opera singers of all time fails very much. All that is desirable in this film is the opera, and it is best to find a recording of Pavarotti doing what he does best. The plot revolves around a romance with a doctor who heals his neck, which has suddenly become tedious.

Just because it's been so long, it's largely forgotten. Like most opera stars, Pavarotti is a decent actor and has stage presence alongside his vocal talents, and nothing he does in this film negates that opinion. His fault lies in not refusing the horrible writing. Maybe because great operas can have stupid stories, he has tolerated them.

Who knows, except those involved? Do we need to know?

The plot is weak and hackneyed. This movie is like trudging through cold mud to make a few juicy treats (the opera music) hanging over the mud. We have other ways to appreciate the great Pavarotti, and he is not one of them. Just pick up one of his many excellent opera or vocal concert recordings and recognize the master tenor where he is best suited.

It would be one of IMDb's 100 Worst movies if more people remember and voices would vote; it would fit neatly into a list that includes several efforts of singers, actors, models and athletes to exploit their popularity through film. Very often it goes wrong because of incompetent acting or a terrible writing. Pavarotti would have been a decent actor if he had not shown such a great voice. How effective he is as an actor (opera demands it), not even Jimmy Stewart could have saved that turkey of a screenplay.

I give him a polite 3 out of 10 because someone might be a fan of Pavarotti's singing and the opera because of this movie.

summary: Lewis and Clark were famous comedians during the vaudeville era. Off-stage, though, they couldn't stand each other, and haven't spoken in over twenty years. Ben, Willy Clark's nephew, is the producer of a variety show that wants to feature a reunion of the classic duo. How will Ben convince the crotchety old comedians to put aside their differences before the big show?
translation:
I remember seeing this movie originally in Radio City Music Hall when it came out. I did not really understand the humor back then, but this movie can make me laugh.

With all due respect to George Burns (RIP), Walter Matthau really deserves the Oscar for this film. His performance is amazing given that he was 20 years younger than his character, Willie Clark. His mannerisms are first class. ("Do you know what songs he wrote? Sh * t!" And when he speaks to the Spanish-speaking man at the reception: "No, no, no enchilada !!") Absolutely hilarious!

Kudos to Richard Benjamin, who has just played Matthau.

I just wish it was on DVD because my VHS recording gets a bit old.

I had no interest in seeing the remake with Woody Allen because it can not match the original in any way.

summary: Portrait of Andy Goldsworthy, an artist whose specialty is ephemeral sculptures made from elements of nature.
translation: Watch this movie for the beautiful images of Andy Goldsworthy's sculptures and treat yourself to an eye-opening and relaxing experience. The music perfectly complements the footage, but never attracts attention. Some commentators called the snippets of interviews with the artist a flaw, but keep this in mind: why would you delve into a film, read in detail Andy's reflections in his books, or attend one of his excellent lectures? This medium is much better suited to show the transient nature of the artist's works, and is used expertly in this regard.

summary: Heading home late one night after a party, Kate falls asleep while waiting for her train. She awakens to find herself trapped in the London underground, with all the doors locked for the evening. While being attacked by a co-worker who has followed her, a mysterious unseen creature drags him away and kills him. This begins a terrifying ordeal, as Kate and a young homeless couple are stalked through the dark tunnels by something dangerous with payback on its mind.
translation: CREEP is a serious, real-time horror film that wants nothing more than just showing people how to be attacked by a mutant in an empty subway platform for 85 minutes. And it does just that. No more, no less. Director Christopher Smith portrays the drama as much as he can by introducing a series of characters who would actually have a reason to be in the subway after closure. He deliberately leaves the origins of the eponymous creep vague (unlawful experiments that take place in the '60s underground are hinted at) and this little secret works for the most part. Sadly, he undermines himself towards the end by actually holding back from a twist end where further genetic abnormalities would appear (they are also implied). Yeah, you heard me right - I wanted a cliched twist ending! Franka (RUN LOLA RUN) Potente is good as the terrorized female lead and the rest of the cast is fine.

summary: The nephews, Landau and Maltby, of the original owners of Lotus Cat Food [For cats who love people] start up the family business again. Duplicated from the original are nosy nurse and doctor characters as well as the greedy grave digger and his wacky wife. What's added to the mix in this sequel are cat-like aliens. Battle weary and beaten by their enemy [evil dog-like aliens], the cat people ask for Earth's assistance in procuring food. Guess which cat food the aliens really like a lot?
translation: This movie is fantastic. I saw it with my cousin Jay-Jay the other day. He said it was alright, but I think it RULEZZZ! I mean, it's so cool. Ted V. Mikels is so brave and smart. He made a movie that's totally unlike those terrible Hollywood movies, like Matrix and STop or my Mom Shoot. It could have been better. I like ninjas and pirates. I also like the big claw that the funny man wears. I think he's the coolest guy since Domino Pizza Clayman. Not only does this movie look really cool, like those blurry movies that my dad did on my birthday when I turned 6. He tells a complex story with dozens of characters who seem completely independent, but they all eventually meet. It's awesome how this web is woven to bring everything together. I wish Ted V. Mikels would make a sequel. But it needs more aliens. And a pirate.

summary: Tucker is a chronic underachiever and a loser. A Vietnam war veteran who just can't seem to keep out of trouble, in the years since his discharge. The only thing he got out of the war was his skill with a rifle. Now, serving a long stretch in prison for murder, he has hit rock-bottom. But one day a man in a three-piece suit visits him in prison, a man he has never seen before, and informs him that he can walk out of prison a free man if he will shoot someone for them, no questions asked.
translation:
What did producer / director Stanley Kramer see in Adam Kennedy's novel and Kennedy's highly enigmatic screenplay? Were some pieces purposely left out? And what about Gene Hackman, Richard Widmark, Edward Albert, Eli Wallach and Mickey Rooney? What did you see in this very confused story?

And why has Candice Bergen, who has done a terrible job, taken such an ungrateful role?

The domino principle wants to be on the same level as The Parallax View or The Manchurian Candidate and misses the mark with a wide margin. A big misfire from Stanley Kramer.

summary: USA, summer of 1969. Man is about to walk on the moon, the Vietnam War is breaking out, and there is the great concert in Woodstock. In a holiday camp for Jewish families not far from Woodstock, Alison and her family are on vacation. Pearl, the mother is young and attractive, but defeated by life, having become pregnant on her first loving relationship, forgetting her dreams to devote herself to her children. Marty, the father is absent because he is busily occupied working at a television repair business. One day a charming salesman arrives at the camp, selling clothes and knick-knacks. He lives an intense life of love and passion, culminating in an escape to Woodstock with Pearl, where events have a deep impact.
translation: Any movie that depicts the hardworking responsible husband as the person who needs to change because of the bored, cheating wife is an obvious result of 8 years of the Clinton era. It is no wonder that this movie was written by a woman.

summary: The story begins one hot summer's day when Leanne Wellings is taking her two young children to visit her grandfather. She stops to buy flowers at a motorway lay-by but then inexplicably vanishes - leaving her two small children waiting for her in her car - lost and far from home. Her two small children then set off to find her only to go missing themselves. Their ordeal is captured on CCTV cameras and before long the family's heart-stopping trauma is not only a complex police investigation but a major national news story.
translation:
A series of posters commented on the unsatisfactory conclusion. This is always a problem with long, complex dramas. The crime is essentially banal, so the repayment is always anti-climactic, while the detailed depiction distracts from the human drama. The author used a bunch of clever devices to get around this, but was not quite successful. Answers to exactly what happened and why, may have been delivered, but if so, they are well buried. The viewer inevitably feels cheated.

But in a way, that's not important. The drama was never about the crime or even the investigation, it was about the impact of events on the lives of those involved; the family, the investigators, the witnesses, the press. And as such, it was gripping. The writing was a significant cut across the mill's run for home-time drama, and the performances equally well. In an ensemble piece, focusing on individuals is tricky, but Penelope Wilton deserves a special mention for an extraordinary tour de force as the mother-and-wife daughter, and Janet McTeer was in shape as a hardened old cop. >
One of the most interesting aspects of the drama is the handling of the breed, as the elephant in the room, which no one is prepared to mention. Subtle, powerful stuff.

summary: On September 11, 2001, filmmaker James Hanlon and Jules and Gedeon Naudet were filming a documentary on a rookie New York City firefighter when they noticed a plane overhead. That plane would hit the World Trade Center. They rushed immediately to the scene. James Hanlon and the Naudets filmed throughout Sept. 11 and the days afterward from the firemen's perspective, as it became clear to them that this was the only known footage from inside the Twin Towers that day.
translation:
I have to admit that I was very skeptical about this documentary. I expected it to be the kind of All American propaganda we do not like here in Europe. I was wrong. This is not propaganda, in fact it is not political at all.

It shows the events of 9/11 through the eyes of firefighters who were called into the scene shortly after the aircraft crashed. It is an amazing sum that this documentary was shot at all! This film was originally filmed as a documentary about a New York firefighter who became "a man". We can only thank the filmmakers for continuing their work during the terrible ordeal that awaited them.

A great piece of work. Absolutely stunning material. Highly recommended.

Greetings,

summary: Vince Lombardi High School keeps losing principals to nervous breakdowns because of the students' love of rock 'n' roll and their disregard of education. The putative leader of the students is Riff Randell, who loves the music of the Ramones. A new principal, the rock-music-hating Miss Evelyn Togar, is brought in and promises to put an end to the music craze. When Miss Togar and a group of parents attempt to burn a pile of rock records, the students take over the high school, joined by the Ramones, who are made honorary students. When the police are summoned and demand that the students evacuate the building, they do so, which leads to an explosive finale.
translation: I just love this movie. I also love the Ramones, so I'm biased right from the start. There is not much critical praise to give this movie, either you like it or you do not. I think it's a great cult movie.

summary: A movie that starts out with the "Man in the Mirror" music video, it then changes to a montage of video clips of Michael's career. Next comes a parody of his Bad video by children, and then Michael is chased by fans in a fantasy sequence. 2 more videos are shown, and then a movie in which Michael plays a hero with magical powers. In it he is chased by drug dealer Mr. Big and saves three children. Videos included in the movie are "Smooth Criminal" and "Come Together".
translation: The first time I saw this "movie" I loved it. When I was 11 years old I was more interested in music and dancing. As I got older, I'm also more interested in acting. While the first half is just a retrospective of Michael's career (from Jackson 5 to Bad), it was still entertaining to watch. The "Badder" sequence could have been omitted, although the kids were pretty good. "Speed ‚Äã‚ÄãDemon" and "Leave Me Alone" were funny, especially when the policeman said to Michael, "I need your autograph here," after making him dance in a non-dancing area. But it's "Smooth Criminal", that's the icing on the cake. Joe Pesci did an excellent job as the Toughie (and the hair was wild). The dance is perfect, and so are the special effects. The only thing I could have done without was the spiders. Every fan of Michael should see this, if you have not already done so. I give it 10+!

summary: This is the story of a young resourceful heroine named Lisa Reisert who hates to fly, but the terror that awaits her on the night flight to Miami has nothing to do with a fear of flying! Upon boarding the plane, Lisa is trapped on a red-eye flight with a creepy villainous handsome and charming man by the name of Jackson Rippner, who's playing middle-man in the plot to assassinate a Homeland Security official. He's got her father pinned down by a would-be killer, using that advantage to coerce Lisa into phoning the luxury resort where she works and arranging to move the target into a pre-set position.
translation:
On a night flight from Los Angeles to Miami, Lisa Reisert (Rachel McAdams) meets a charming man who turns out to be a contract killer demanding her help in killing a businessman, otherwise her own father dies.

Red Eye is a terrific thriller that keeps the audience on edge. The requirement is similar to Cellular and Phone Booth, but Red Eye is better than these two films. Almost everything about Red Eye is above average, including excitement, acting and directing. Most of the movie is on a plane, but that does not slow the movie down. The movie is very fast and exciting, with no slow or boring passages. Wes Craven does a really good job behind the camera. Instead of focusing on the thrill, he focuses on the story and the characters. The film has its share of exciting moments, but that's not really what the movie is about. I also like how Wes Craven focuses on the other passengers and the little details that will matter later. Red Eye shows his storytelling skills.

Red Eye also works well because of its young and talented cast. Rachel McAdams gives a very engaging performance and her character is hard to hate. You can even cheer for them at the end. Cillian Murphy gives a very scary and effective performance as a villain. The way he first behaves charmingly, but then becomes psychic, is particularly impressive. The supporting actors are also pretty good, including Brain Cox and Jayma Mays.

The movie is also very stylish and it has this totally weird vibe to it. The setting works well, as there is an obvious fear of isolation and no escape. Overall, the sound of the film is always scary. The script is not as strong as anything else. There are a few unrealistic moments that can distract the viewer. Most of them did not bother me, but there were only a few who shook my head. The end is disappointing too. It's not a bad ending, just a very simple and different approach would have been better. Since the movie focuses on the characters, there are really no screaming moments, maybe just a few jumps. If you expect a horror movie, you will be disappointed. In the end, Red Eye is an engaging thriller and it's one of the best movies of the summer. Rating 8/10

summary: Shiloh Falls is an exhilarating tale of good versus evil set in the untamed wild west. Gritty lawman John Gaffney has finally tracked down the murderous Dalton Taggert and his gang to the outpost town of Shiloh Falls. But before the fugitives can be brought to justice, a mysterious stranger appears in town, more powerful than any man. When there is no escaping his powers, the sworn enemies must pull together to fight true evil. The heart racing quest rides from the majestic frontier to a pulse pounding main street shoot-em-up for divine retribution.
translation: I still find it hard to understand that a movie as bad as it could be can be filmed in Hollywood. The acting and the story is just pathetic and the direction is terrible. I do not see any logic behind this garbage, except maybe that the director did not have anything good to do. It took me ten minutes to realize that I had wasted my precious thirty rupees. It filled me with the consternation that I would waste even more of my life with this crap. I bet the movie was shot in less than a day. I do not know which category it falls into. Please avoid this movie at all costs, just do everything, even hit your head against walls, but do not go for this movie.

summary: Lena, aged twenty, wants to know all she can about life and reality. She collects information on everyone and everything, storing her findings in an enormous archive. She experiments with relationships, political activism, and meditation. Meanwhile, the actors, director and crew are shown in a humorous parallel plot about the making of the film and their reactions to the story and each other. Nudity, explicit sex, and controversial politics kept this film from being shown in the US while its seizure by Customs was appealed.
translation:
I do not know how or why this movie has a low rating on IMDb. This film, accompanied by "I'm Curious: Blue," is a masterpiece.

The only thing that will disappoint you in this movie is if you do not like the process of the movie, not psychology or if you expect hardcore pornographic ramming.

This is not a movie you want to watch to relax; It's a movie you want to see like any other masterpiece, with time, attention and care.

****** ABSTRACT, MAY CONTAIN A SPOILER OR TWO ******* The main thing about this movie is that it mixes the whole movie within a movie thing, but it does in a way that sometimes one forgets that the fictions are not real.

The movie is like many movies in one:

1. A political documentary about the social system in Sweden at that time. Which in many ways are still relevant today. Interviews of a young woman named Lena.

2. A story about a filmmaker, Vilgot Sjoman, who makes a movie ... about a relationship with his star in the film and about how he should never deal with people with whom he should work.

3. The movie that Vilgot is doing. It's about a young woman named Lena (IE. # 2), who is young and very politically active, she's doing a documentary (IE. # 1). She has also grown up and in her sexuality and the freedom of it.

The splendor and sheer brilliance of "I'm Curious: Yellow / Blue" is how these three elements are cut together. One moment you see an interview about politics, and the next you watch what the interviewer is doing behind the scenes, but that makes it so good that sometimes you forget that it's the narrative.

Another thing is the dynamics between "yellow" and "blue", when you see one, you have to see the other. "Blue" is not a sequel. I'll try to explain it as well as I can, because no other movies have done it to my knowledge, although it's a great technique.

Think of "yellow" as a living thing, actual events in 14 scenes. A complete story.

Think of "blue" as all things that are between the 14 scenes in "yellow" that you have not seen, this is a complete story in itself.

Essentially, these are parallel films ... the same story told in two different ways.

Only when I saw the first 30 minutes of "Blue" did I understand "Yellow"

I hope that was helpful for people who are discouraged by various influences, because this movie changed the way I watched movies.

Thank you for your time.

summary: After an unsuccessful mission, FBI agents Kevin Copeland and Marcus Copeland fall in disgrace in the agency. They decide to swap their bad position with his superior Section Chief Elliott Gordon working undercover in an abduction case, disguised in the two spoiled white daughters of a tycoon, Brittany and Tiffany Wilson, getting in hilarious situations.
translation: I do not write often enough to write comments, but I had to, just to warn someone who might think they would see a comedy. That does not come close. While the premise (change in color / gender / whatever) is bad enough (and has been done many times), the actual transformation of two black guys into two white girls is one of the least convincing transformations ever on the screen were brought. It would be bad enough if the script required only a switch to white chicks. However, the Wayans brothers have to disguise themselves as two particular white women. As you have guessed by now, they fail completely. I've seen drag queens without make-up are more convincing women than these two with the best special effects and make-up people Hollywood can offer. It is horrible. Add to the mix a basketball player built like a building, terrific dialogues and more action holes than a golf course and this movie hits a new personal low. And I like bad movies! Avoid like the plague.

summary: Britain's second animated feature, which, despite the title and Disney-esque animal animation, is in fact a no-holds-barred adaptation of George Orwell's classic satire on Stalinism, with the animals taking over their farm by means of a revolutionary coup, but then discovering that although all animals are supposed to be equal, some are more equal than others...
translation: First of all, I have to say that I loved the book Animal Farm. I read it in my ninth grade and it was great. We also decided that it would be good to watch the movie. The movie was so disappointing for me. The film cuts out some characters and misses many of the main points of the book. It jumps around a lot and does not explain anything in detail. If anyone had seen this film without first reading the book, they would be confused. The most disappointing thing about this film for me was the end. The end in the book was the most powerful and in the movie they changed it! It was meant to be pigs and men in an alliance and somehow "melted together," but instead, the film made it look like the animals were rebelling against the pigs. In summary, I do not believe that this film captured the true meaning of Orwell in his book.

summary: American kids go to a space camp during the summer holidays. They learn how to operate the Space Shuttle. A team consisting of a guy who just entered to meet girls, a wanna be astronaut and an instructor who wanted to go on a mission instead of teaching can sit in the Shuttle while testing the engines. Then they're launched by mistake ...
translation:
I notice that the DVD version seems to have missing scenes or lines between the release of the FRF and the launch.

You must prove that you have the right to sit in the FRF except the green team.

Another scene is like during their simulation failure, Kevin gets Joaquin to calm down.

I think the VHS edition except the ABC could have all the missing stuff.

Otherwise, I would like to know which DVD release has the missing stuff.

The DVD I saw feels like being on TV.

summary: Toots and May's marriage is one of Toots being dependent on his wife. Shortly after Toots and May arrive in London to visit with their grown children Bobby and Paula and their respective children, Toots falls ill and dies. Toots' death brings to the surface the underlying strain that has always existed between May and both of her two children, and the unhappy lives they have all led. Now specifically with Paula, May is disapproving of her relationship with a construction worker named Darren. Not only does May think his occupation makes him beneath Paula, he's also a married man. Darren is in an unsatisfying marriage but doesn't want to leave it if only because of his son. Even after May gets to know and like Darren, she still encourages Paula to break up with him. The issue is that May herself has fallen in love with Darren, the two who begin a sexual relationship. What will ultimately happen between May and Darren also depends on Darren, who is floundering in his own life and doesn't...
translation: "The Mother" tells the story of a recently widowed mother of two grown-up children in the mid-1960s (Reid), who awakens from a sleepwalking life after her husband's death, as she has an affair with a young carpenter who is also married Lover of her daughter. The film thrives on the quiet-passive mother, her weak relationship with her adult son and daughter, the silent needs she seeks to satisfy in bed with her young lover, and the twists and turns that come from it. A somewhat antiseptic drama with blustering psychodramatic undercurrents, "The Mother," does an excellent job of realistically handling unpleasant problems while avoiding unnecessary sensationalism. It's best to play with a mature audience, possibly women, who can better empathize with their central role, needs and problems. (B +)

summary: All all-female gang of Old West bank robbers comes out of retirement to rescue a sister in peril.
translation:
The costumes, the dialogue, the historical accuracy are terrible. For example - Stacey Dash and the hanging scene. The sling was correct (as far as I could tell), but this type of sling broke the person's neck. Ms. Dash gets stuck at the end of the rope with no damage until the rope is shot. This species did not strangle the person, she killed her at the end of the drop.

And just before they go in to rob a bank (in a flashback), they are holding a group hug in the street - with their bandannas hiding their faces - that would have been obvious to the people on the street ,

The bad newsroom - this is a battery pack under the shirt and it's obvious the clip from the "Long Ride" shows them how to ride, then reverses the movie.

I liked the fact that they kept the scene while the horse did a crap - it seemed symbolic. The whole movie was crap.

summary: This is a documentary of 'drag nights' among New York's underclass. Queens are interviewed and observed preparing for and competing in many 'balls'. The people, the clothes, and the whole environment are outlandish.
translation: Grown up in NYC in the club scene of the late 80's / early 90's, I can personally say that this is one of the most important documentary films that have emerged during this time. No, Madonna did not come for Voguing, but here she has it! Instead of inflicting violence on each other or in bitchy cat fights, one allowed oneself to compete in an environment in which one hardly touched one another (which would justify an automatic disqualification). Seeing these types of exceptionally talented / well-orchestrated "adventures" in the clubs was nothing short of spectacular and all the big names back then were here ... Pepper La Beija, Paris Dupr√©e, Xtragavaganza, etc ... everyone remembered such songs as Malcolm McLaren's song "Deep in Vogue" ... it did not matter who you were or where you came from as you walked through these doors into this "magical kingdom" you became part of something bigger than you / you were important / and most importantly creating your own movements and imagination ... and anyone from anywhere could become king (or queen) as was the case. The words and the joke were as sharp as the movements on the floor. All the excitement, excitement and magic of this very urban NYC energy is captured in this movie. BRILLIANT!!! PLEASE TO SEE RELEASE ON DVD FOR THE WORLD !!! Thank you!

summary: A group of very efficient robbers strikes banks in downtown area of Stockholm. Detective Klara and commanding officer Krona takes on the case.
translation:
Swedish action films have evolved in recent years into something that mimics American action movies like "Heat," but on a low budget. This movie follows the same recipe as "Noll Tolerans" and "Livvakterna". However, it is obvious that they are trying too hard to make a cool and hard movie.

The story has been seen before, the dialogue is artificial and the acting is very bad, especially by the lead actress. The film attempts to paint a picture of hard-nosed, military-looking robbers without remorse, and a female investigator who has completely lost her with past problems, but at the same time acts rationally. It does not work very well.

The bluish-styled photo style does not seem to be fresh anymore, and in this picture it did not even work well. Only a few scenes look really good. Also, the sound sounds pretty weird and it sounds like many of the dialogues are being recorded later.

The main quality of this movie is Stefan Sauk, though he does not make a convincing portrait of a SWAT team leader, has some really funny lines. The music is also pretty good.

summary: Roddy is a decidedly upper-crust "society mouse" who lives the life of a beloved pet in a posh Kensington flat. When a sewer rat named Sid comes spewing out of the sink and decides he's hit the jackpot, Roddy schemes to rid himself of the pest by luring him into the "whirlpool." Sid may be an ignorant slob, but he's no fool, so it is Roddy who winds up being flushed away into the bustling sewer world of Ratropolis. There Roddy meets Rita, an enterprising scavenger who works the sewers in her faithful boat, the Jammy Dodger. Roddy immediately wants out, or rather, up; Rita wants to be paid for her trouble; and, speaking of trouble, the villainous Toad - who royally despises all rodents equally, making no distinction between mice and rats--wants them iced... literally. The Toad dispatches his two hapless hench-rats, Spike and Whitey, to get the job done. When they fail, the Toad has no choice but to send to France for his cousin - that dreaded mercenary, Le Frog.
translation:
After all, too stupid and pointless. Yes, there is the gilded cage metaphor, but most kids would probably miss that. Forgetable. Immediately.

Animation is, as we expect, super-real. The plot could best be described as thin but persistent. Although the end seemed arbitrary to me.

The Channel Underworld is a suitably disgusting reflection of the world above, and somehow wealth and money seem to count there too. Oh yes, and there is a romantic interest in the fact that the female becomes smarter, smarter and more walking - that quickly becomes a tiring (anti) stereotype. Your children will probably love it.

summary: "WHAT THE #$*! DO WE KNOW?!" is a radical departure from convention. It demands a freedom of view and greatness of thought so far unknown, indeed, not even dreamed of since Copernicus. It's a documentary. It's a story. It's mind-blowing special effects. This film plunges you into a world where quantum uncertainty is demonstrated - where neurological processes, and perceptual shifts are engaged and lived by its protagonist - where everything is alive, and reality is changed by every thought.
translation:
I created my own reality by walking out of the theater where I was locked up by my girlfriend to go to that mess with my mother. We (my friend and I) went in for about an hour. What a load of pseudo-scientific New Age jargon.

Subatomic particles are thoughts? By sticking labels on water bottles and blessing by a Buddhist monk, little pretty crystals were created? A 25% decline in the murder rate in DC happened when a group of people meditated. Wow, what a rigorous scientific study. I'm sure someone ate Cheerios for four days at the same time. Should we conclude that the food of Cheerios led to a decrease in the murder rate?

Hogwash, hooey, bull gucky!

BTW- It was funded by the Ramtha cult, whose director was one of the "experts" interviewed by the filmmakers. No ulterior motives here, right?

summary: An outrageous collection of surreal, short attention span non-sequiturs largely revolving around Guitar Brother, his randy older sibling, and the pair's portly Caucasian brother.
translation:
To say Funky Forest: The first contact is a bad movie is an understatement of incredible proportions. I can really immerse myself in a good art house movie, even in surreal and twisted fiddles like El Topo, Naked Lunch and Survive Style 5+, because these films actually have something to discuss when the credits roll.

The FFFC tries to be so profound and intellectual at all levels, essentially there is no substance in this film. This movie is done poorly, the visuals in this movie are not inspirational, the dialogue is worse, the musical numbers destroy this movie .. I chuckled for GUITAR BROTHERS, but that was immediately wiped out by something completely unnecessary and irrelevant. It's been trying to be deep and meaningful, I think, but it's just pretentious disoriented nonsense. Freshman film students without a camera could make something more interesting.

Guitar Brothers and the stand-up routines between the skits get 1 point at a time, everything else is poorly timed, pseudo-creative, hard attempt As good as films by other REAL directors like Sogo Ishii, David Lynch and Jodoworsky. Give me a break. I am convinced that the people who rave about the FFFC do so because they have no idea what they have seen, because there were only mild factual statements here and there mixed with stupidity and mingled until you get on your own Shoes puke.

This film was an extreme disappointment, it came from the height that was Survive Style 5+, a movie that actually has meaning, combined with excellent use of landscapes, cinematography, catchy dialogue, funny moments , good soundtrack, excellent performances. fantastic speed and flow. FFFC offers the exact opposite in every way, boring landscape (20 minutes staring at a bland beach at night? A completely white stage? Alien balls floating in the white room? A dirty school hallway and then ... school hallway?), Terrible Cinematography, forgetful dialogues, nothing funny or humorous except for the fact that you have wasted your life for two hours, soundtrack ?, amateur performances, inconsistent, incoherent, and often fluttering sluggish pacing, no flow.

There are some who claim that this is what makes FFFC a great movie that is so unconventional at every turn that it is a pure genius. This is simply a way of caressing one's ego, because "unpredictable" could be a good quality for a movie if it were not coupled with "boring," "innane," and "awful." Personally, I talked to two people who confessed to me that FFFC was terrible when they left the theater, but overwhelming rave of arthouse elites let them see the movie again and then with a ... "Hey, it was pretty good, I liked it. "

I'm going to put my foot down, this movie is Slop, I do not care if Roger Ebert says that this movie is the best thing he has seen since his days has lost his own virginity. "The new cape of the Emperor," I say ... this movie is not a reference to the other psychedelic / trippy films that came from Japan in the last 10 years. Taste of Tea, Party 7 and Kamikaze Girls are much better movies (even on a low budget) and no one can honestly compare them to Survive Style 5+. Only look at FFFC if you are interested in making a pompous pile of nothing on a tight budget.

summary: How was it possible that a movie like "Plan 9 from Outerspace" could be made? This documentary about Ed Wood Jr.'s masterpiece gives the answer.
translation: The Haunted World by Edward D. Wood, Jr. is not a very good documentary. Aesthetically it is lackluster and cheap, the people in it go on tangents that make it very uncoordinated and disconnected, but that adds to its charm. I say that because it's a documentary about a funny guy who made strange pictures and surrounded himself with weird comrades, and as such there's really no other way to document the life and career of the man and his crew of outsiders , There are some insights into the genius and inability of Wood, and the portrayal of both qualities is a merit of the authenticity of the documentary. Overall, it is worth a clock for the Wood fan and cinema in general, but do not expect brilliance here. Expect a documentary shot after Wood's own heart.

summary: Celeste Talbert has been the queen of the soaps for over two decades. Montana Moorehead needs to get her out of her way before she can move on and begins her program to get her to leave. She hires an old boyfriend of Celeste to be on the show and has Celeste become a murderer in the script, but each attempt has unforseen consequences.
translation:
I do not see soaps. My grandmother still sees the one with the hourglass. I made fun of her when I was ten (it was so easy).

But this movie takes parody and spells it out in a new way. I found the story damn funny. The fashion of the 80s - shoulder pads, sequins and polyester - complete the whole. The huge hair, the high heels and the plays - what a combination.

And all the actors just go into town, chewing on their pieces and spitting them out in a big well-scripted stack. Sally, Kevin, Elisabeth - wonderful! Whoopi - great! Robert Downey - refreshing to see him back when he had so much potential, in front of the tabloids. And Garry: Why did we have to wait so long to see him in the movie? Leesa Gibbons - had not missed her, but nice to include her as a real entertainment journalist (and where do you even apply for this job?).

Granted I could have done without Sally climbs the drainpipe. Lucy Ricardo did it, how many times? Like any comedian of Carol Burnett, I do not know who and I'm so finished, I could spit peanuts if I had them. Apparently, that's what you do when you're funny in a tall New York building. I'm just thankful that they did not pull out the flagpole.

But it was cute, it was funny, it had Plot Twists, it had an after-credit ending, that was common, it had clothes that was worth a second look, they had a great one Cast and she has personal memories for me. Really, what do you need more?

summary: When Secret Service agent David Somers is fired, he takes a quiet job with the Fentons at their country estate - cataloging butterflies, hence the title insect. David grows fond of Jess Fenton's niece, a fragile, fey young woman named Sophie. Because he hates traps of any kind, he reacts quickly when Sophie is framed for the murder of Hick, the nasty handyman. He helps her escape London by using his agent's skills and a network of old friends. The pair lead the police and David's ex-employers an exciting chase, from Newcastle to the Lake District to Liverpool. As the fugitives try to catch a ship for France, everyone, including the murderer, join in the finale.
translation: A young woman (Jean Simmons) is convinced of her intriguing and dangerous aunt (Sonia Dresdel) and her uncle (Barry Jones), that she loses her mind and in a very delicate condition that requires her supervision, which is more like manipulation to keep them as far away from human contact as possible. The only other person she sees is the estate manager, a lascivious figure, played by Maxwell Reed, who caught the stubborn eye of the aunt of middle age. All this, the aunt and the caretaker, the butterfly expert Uncle, who has a serious base to him, and the sensitive niece in the middle, would have made for a darker and more sinister film. As it turns out, Trevor Howard (a government-fired secret agent who buys a butterflies cataloging job) and Simmons across the countryside while fleeing the police, headline Police Net Closing In on the front page , bouncing in buses and in Liverpool, where they meet some wonderfully occupied characters and finally face the greedy and murderous aunt and uncle.

summary: The townsfolk of Cripple Creek fear Johnny Concho (Frank Sinatra), who acts tough and takes advantage of the populace because his brother is a notorious gunfighter. But when a stranger arrives in town, claiming to have killed his brother and treating people worse than Johnny, he's forced to face his fears and stand up for himself and the town.
translation:
Somebody compared this movie to High Noon in a way. Now this is a real route! I'm a big fan of Sinatra, including some of his acting roles, but maybe Don Knotts was the only person who could have played that role. First of all, as someone has pointed out, Sinatra simply does not want to build for a western villain wannabe. He is just too small in his life at this time. Maybe he was about the size of Audie Murphy, but Murphy had a pretty good physique. Sinatra appears as the big talking little kid that nobody should take seriously.

The story is uninspired and really unbelievable. I do not want to ruin it, but I think the end and how the city dwellers react in this story makes no sense. Another thing, these people are constantly dominated by a "bad boy". This is just a small town so I do not get the attraction nor do I understand why people are so dominated.

There is a "love interest" in the story and if I followed it properly, she was angry when the lead actor refused to admit who he was so another bad guy would not kill him. Now there is true love for you. "Get up for yourself, tell him your name to kill you! LOL Listen, you'll kill me.

Unfortunately, the basic assumption of the movie is not good enough and no matter how they tried This story had no logical path to follow, except in the dustbin - do you want to know why it's not shown on video and never on TV - the critics obviously made it in 1956 and they were right - this movie is pretty I would almost bet that Sinatra paid someone as much as possible.

Do you want to see a good western, where a city gets up against a villain? Try Tension at Table Rock or At Gunpoint - two really, really good westerns on this subject Johnny Concho is Johnny Stinko Frank, you were the greatest singer ever - but you're not in such a movie.

summary: Mason, who lives on the streets, wants to cease his life when on the same day his two best friends die: His dog and an older man with whom he shared his food and roof. Just in time Cole, from a charity organization, can prevent his suicide and also offers him a quite well paid job as servant for a hunting party in the Rocky Mountains. Mason accepts the job and flies with them to a hut in the wilderness where they prepare everything for the four rich businessmen who want to hunt something special. Mason does not yet know that he is the victim of their sports that should lead to the basic insticts of man, but they did not count with his cleverness...
translation: Had the original casting idea been maintained (chasing Rutger and not Ice-T), this movie might have worked. Unfortunately, racism (literally) had to come into the picture and mess it up. The predominantly black production staff could not allow the opponent to be black, so they traded Rutgers and Ice-Ts roles. This was just the beginning of the downward spiral of this film. Ernest Dickerson's approach of "directing" merely stated that it was another task. Master shot, close up, close up. Gads, "Who's Line Is It Anyway" even uses more creative camera work. Eric's recast of "The Most Dangerous Game" is at least an attempt to modernize classic history, but does not give us motivation for why the characters do that. We are never told the reasons except that "nobody will miss these people", why the leader (rewritten as Rutger) does these things. Apart from a heartfelt performance from John McGinley and a fair job from Charles Dutton, do not worry about this. A little bit of trivia, there was a real car accident during the filming that hurt F.Murray Abraham and led to the death of the intoxicated young driver who caused the accident.

summary: After Charles Forsythe was sent to the electric chair for a crime he didn't commit, he forever haunts the prison where he was executed. Flash forward several years when the prison is reopened, under the control of its new warden Ethan Sharpe, a former security guard who was present at Forsythe's execution. When prisoners are ordered to break down the wall to the execution room, they unknowingly release the angry spirit of Charles Forsythe, a powerful being distributing his murderous rage to all, leading up to the Warden himself.
translation: This is an excellent example of what can be done with a small budget movie. The drama is excellent, considering the script and the whole atmosphere of the movie is very threatening. The Gore is well made and used sparingly (pay attention to the excellent barbed wire death) and the action is punchy. While it is true that there are sometimes stupid lines in the script, it is barely noticeable compared to other films with the same (or larger!) Budget. Overall, this is recommended. Trust me, it's better than it seems! 8.10

summary: Carol, a twelve-year-old Spanish-American girl from New York, travels with her mother to Spain in the spring of 1938, at the height of the Civil War. Separated from her beloved father, Carol arrives in her mother's home village and transforms the secretive family environment. Her innocence and rebellious nature drive her at first to reject a world that is at once new and foreign. But she soon journeys into adulthood through a friendship with Maruja, the village teacher, and a young local boy, Tomiche.
translation:
Another Spanish film about the civil war of 1936. This time tells us the story of Carol (lovely played by debutante Clara Lago), a little girl who moves from New York to a small Spanish village. It is such an introductory journey, and soon she will find out about the injustices of the human race, their stupid struggles and conflicts, their contradictions.

Imanol Uribe is making his best film since "D√≠as Contados" (1994) with such a sober pulse, a beautiful photograph and a beautiful script. He tries not to participate in the conflict, he just shows us some facts and lets us decide (ok, the facts are explicit enough to let us decide which band we are in) and he takes a big advantage out of presence and the freshness of the young couple: Clara Lago and Juan Jos√© Ballesta.

A well-maintained production.

My price: 7/10

summary: This film is a prequel to all of the The House of the Dead video games. Set on an island off the coast, a techno rave party attracts a diverse group of college coeds and a Coast Guard officer. Soon, they discover that their X-laced escapades are to be interrupted by zombies and monsters that attack them on the ground, from the air, and in the sea, ruled by an evil entity in the House of the Dead...
translation:
Fuck me! I've seen some incredibly horrible movies in my time, but that takes the p * ss!

Frankly speaking, I can not say in words how bad this movie really is. Apart from the plot that's not really there, the weird crap, the weirdly terrible excuses for zombies; You know, I could go on all day. Every little thing in this movie is either stupid, pointless, crap or embarrassing. I tell everyone who wants to see this movie ... not!

I'm ashamed to say I have this on my rack. It's hidden on the goddamn floor of the huge stake. I could not even give this horse excuse for a movie. It's that bad.

summary: After the recently re-elected President of a fictitious state has been assassinated, one of the members of the investigation committee refuses to sign the final report and is given the task of investigating once more. In the course of his search he finds evidence that casts serious doubt on the committee's "lone-gunman" theory... A very bold film that basically told the "JFK" story thinly disguised as having taken place not in the US.
translation: When I saw this movie for the first time, I was shocked for days afterwards. His meticulous and captivating treatment of the subject attracts attention, supported by good acting and some truly fascinating music. The end just made me gasp. First class!

summary: In the midst of a nasty public breakup of married movie stars, a studio publicist scrambles to put a cap on the escalating situation as the couple's latest film has found its only print kidnapped by the director.
translation:
Let me put it another way: balls. Or how about bollo * ks. That's really awful, more embarrassing than the one who's trying to satirize. summary: Talented rock star John Norman Howard has seen his career begin to decline. Too many years of concerts and managers and life on the road have made him cynical and the monotony has taken its toll. Then he meets the innocent, pure and very talented singer Esther Hoffman. As one of his songs in the movie says "I'm gonna take you girl, I'm gonna show you how." And he does. He shows Esther the way to stardom while forsaking his own career. As they fall in love, her success only makes his decline even more apparent.
translation: I saw the trailer for this movie in the 70's when I was just 16 years old while watching another movie. Oh!!!! how excited me and my best friend were. summary: In this sci-fi/western film set two hundred years from now, a bank robber, Grange is captured and sentenced to the penal colony on the mining planet Proxima Centauri 3 where he meets bounty-hunter Walker, and the Colonel, a retired policeman from LA who was considered the best of his kind. Grange is a dangerous lunatic and Walker and the Colonel must team up to keep him from escaping.
translation:

If you like cheap, futuristic, post-apocalyptic B movies, then you'll love them !! I really did!

summary: Irish talk show that was produced by Happy Endings Productions for RT√â.
translation:

Unlike what another comment says, I do not think this is the best RTE ever made, it's really dry and sarcastic. summary: Cowboy Rick,on his way to visit his sweetheart, encounters a bevy of beautiful Indian maidens and dallies with one of them. translation:
A cowboy sympathetic to the plight of a close-by Native American tribe is falsely accused of raping and murdering the chief's daughter, leading to much hatred and violence.

This crazy nudity feature is fun to defend on any artistic level. The horrible costumes and the fact that all Indians are obviously white make the whole thing look more like a live-action caricature than the reputable production for which there are press materials.

In short, the luscious nudity (The real reason is) is good. Everything else is not. There are definitely better examples of both genres.

Interestingly, The Ramrodder was filmed at the infamous Spahn Movie Ranch and has not just one but two members of the Manson family, Catherine Share and Bobby Beausoleil, who was probably already in the can for murder at the time when this hit the soda-stained screens of the Pussycat Theater!

summary: Paris, 2054: a dark motion-captured world of shadows and right angles. Ilona Tasuiev, a brilliant young scientist, is kidnapped, and her employer, Avalon, a major health and beauty corporation, wants her found. Karas, a jaded police captain, is assigned to find her, fast. He seeks help from her sister, Bislane, and they are soon uncovering identify theft, missing files, and hints that something back in 2006 may explain what's going on. Ilona's mentor, Avalon's vice president, a Japanese researcher, an underworld boss, and Bislane's drug connection all figure in the mix. So does an attraction between Karas and Bislane. What's behind the kidnapping? Who's the victim?
translation:
This movie is absolutely stunning. A new Blade Runner - the Future Noir at its best. The vision of Paris is superb, both recognizable and visionary, with far-reaching prospects, grungy set-pieces and futuristic virtual reality.

The plot is pretty simple, with few surprises, but that's not what I like the most about the movie. It's an optical treat.

Done in 3D and rendered in black and white (no grays!) with just a short blot, it's less hard on the eyes than it sounds. There are many "arty" camera shots - close-ups and strange angles - but that only adds to the temperament of the movie. Overall, you get the impression of a graphic novel in footage form.

I initially had the impression that the film was rotoscoped, so the animation level and the details were in the facial expressions of the figure. But unlike "A Scanner Darkly" - which suffers from (or is even amplified by) an inconsistent character definition (just watch how some of the hair changes shape!) - Renaissance is consistently consistent and precise. When the character is in close-up, additional details and textures can be seen, but if details are omitted in the middle or farther away, but not at the expense of the character definition.

For me The only negative side of the movie is that a comment says it's a one off project. Such a shame, because I would like to see more of this futuristic film noir story and especially in this cutting-edge graphic style.

Oh, and the English dub is great too. All in all a great movie and highly recommended.

summary: This movie follows the life of a young German woman, married to a soldier in the waning days of WWII. Fassbinder has tried to show the gritty life after the end of WWII and the turmoil of the people trapped in its wake.
translation:
*** SPOILER *** *** SPOILER *** This is undoubtedly the best movie Rainer Werner Fassbinder has ever made and even with the wonderful script, the movie is enhanced by a great performance by Hanna Schygulla. The film begins with Maria (Schygulla) and Hermann Braun (Klaus Lowitsch), who are getting married while the bombs are falling and Hermann is being handed over in the waning days of war. Now Maria and her mother and sister have to survive. Maria decides to get a job as a dancer / prostitute in a club that meets American GIs, and she meets a black soldier named Bill (Greg Eagles) and they start seeing each other regularly. Maria hears that her husband Hermann died in the war, so she gets very serious with Bill. But one day, when they come into contact with Bill, they see Hermann at the door. He did not die and when he enters the room, a melee ensues and Maria breaks a bottle over Bill's head and he dies. Hermann takes the blame and is sentenced to a long prison term. Maria tells him that she will achieve something and get him out. The war is over and Germany has to rebuild. One day, Maria meets Karl Oswald (Ivan Desny), a successful textile entrepreneur, and uses her charms to find work. Maria is determined to do well, climbs the career ladder and becomes Charlemagne's lover. She tells him that she will never marry him, but he is in love with her. Hermann comes out of prison, but goes to Canada to do whatever Mary has done since he was imprisoned.

***** SPOILER ALERT *****

One day Karl dies and leaves Maria pretty much everything in his will and Maria buys her own house. Then Hermann finally comes to his wife and both are ready to marry, although they have been married for some time. But Maria leaves the gas on the stove and the house explodes with both still in it.

There are so many interesting things in this film that it is one of those films that can be studied and discussed to great lengths. As in all Fassbinder films, the use of color is used in a very interesting way. At the beginning of the film, the tones are brown and gray to depict the war-torn Germany, but when Maria begins to succeed, they switch to bright, rich colors like red and white. The reconstruction of Germany with all the building noise is used as the only backdrop and the film focuses on the heroic deeds of Maria. Fassbinder wanted the sounds of reconstruction to remind us of what was going on in Germany at the time. Hanna Schygulla has never been better and her performance is the key to the success of this film. With a smaller actress that would have been just another interesting movie, but Schygulla is so strong that her performance elevates this movie to an elite status. Schygulla shows Mary as very purposeful and smart, but at the same time she uses her beauty and femininity to get what she wants. She is neither embarrassed nor guilty about it, and Fassbinder wanted to show Maria as a woman who practically sells her soul to survive. Schygulla was not nominated for an Oscar, but she has shown a great performance that will stand the test of time. Fassbinder himself appears in the film as a peddler and his own mother Lilo Pempeit plays Ms. Ehmke. I have heard many things about the end of the movie and it has to do with whether Maria purposely started the gas. Later in the bathroom, her water runs over her wrist and she seems sad. This is just speculation and if you think I'm wrong, please email me. I think she was overly excited because Hermann was home and accidentally left (Remember, she put on a dress for no reason?). When the will is read to her then she learns that Hermann and Karl have become friendly without her knowledge, and I think she felt that everything she had done was in vain. That's the reason for the bathroom scene. So if the house accidentally explodes. But I think the reason for Fassbinder's end is to show that anyone who would sell his soul has no business. Fassbinder was fascinated by survivors, but he was also incredibly passionate. In his opinion, Mary can not have both. A fascinating movie.

summary: An intended rape victim manages to escape from her attacker but leaves her purse behind. Worried that he may visit her house and finish what he has started, she contacts the police but they are unable to help, saying that she has no proof. "If he calls, let us know and we'll send a man round!" A fat load of good that would be. Her worst fears are realised when, alone one day in the house, her attacker visits and attempts again to rape her. Circumstances allow her not only to resist the attack but to turn the tables and lock him away. And that is where her dilemma really starts. Does she release him and risk another attack? Does she go to the police and risk being called a liar? Or does she kill him - and become as low as him?

After watching some of the other comments here, I have a main complaint with this presentation.

But this is a movie and a story that forces so much, despite, how, because, the director's work.

summary: Archer Coe has been found dead in his locked bedroom. The cops consider it suicide, but Philo believes otherwise. When the Coroner shows up, he finds that Archer had been hit with a blunt object, stabbed and shot - making suicide unlikely. When the evidence points to his brother, Brisbane is found stabbed to death in the closet. Archer had a number of enemies, any one of which would have been glad to knock him off, but which one did and how did the murder occur in a room looked from the inside. Only one man, the keen, fascinating, debonair detective Philo Vance, would be able to figure out who is the killer.
translation: This is one of those films you would have wished you had not seen before - so you can see them again for the first time. Van Dine's books still bring joy - but many refer to them as overly flowery. This film is by far the best filming of his works. William Powell is William Powell - do not say more. The plot is complicated. The story moves too fast because you want it to stop. Enjoy.

summary: What happens when you throw two guys who hate each other together. A cool call center executive Jimmy Cliff (Saif Ali Khan), a desi wannabe gangster Bachchan Pande (Akshay Kumar) add for good measure a beautiful girl Pooja (Kareena Kapoor) who cant be trusted - on a journey across spectacular India - a journey which will alter the course of their lives in more ways than one - a journey where even enemies need to trust each other if they want to stay alive. And to top it all there is the evil eye of Bhaiyyaji (Anil Kapoor - Slumdog Millionaire and 24), maverick gangster who enjoys killing people as much as he enjoys learning to speak English.

If there's a movie that's the worst this year - it's TASHAN The first promo hinted that the movie was going to be a boring Dhoom 2 style movie, and now I just knew it was a bad movie at first It's a Yashraj movie Or maybe you can see the cheesy promo But this movie shocked me, it was even worse than Dhoom 2 and what I expected Saif-Kareena to meet, Kareena is so artificial and then Anil Kapoor Oh God, what's he doing in a funny movie?
