summary: Jimmy is drafted and ends up in Fred's troop on his way to Europe. Jimmy becomes vicious with his gun, wins a medal, and weds Fred's nurse girlfriend, Rose. Back home years later, Rose discovers Jimmy is a gangster, has him arrested, and finds a job in Fred's circus as Jimmy escapes, determined to kill Fred.
translation:
Wedged between San Francisco and Captains Courageous two of Spencer Tracy's biggest roles is this very strange movie about the war and the impact on some people. They gave him a gun star Spencer Tracy and Franchot Tone in the only movie they've made together, and Gladys George as the woman who loves them both.

Tracy and Tone are a few of the First World War conscripts, Tone is a feeble character who almost goes over the hill in Bootcamp, but Tracy stops him. Tracy is still playing the lovable, blood-soaked, younger Wallace Beery guy MGM intended for him when they turned him down from Fox.

Over at the front, Tone gets a chance and takes it when he reaches a church tower during a fight looking at a German MG nest. He's learned how to shoot and he's making a sergeant York. But Alvin C. York was never changed by the war like Tone.

wounded in battle clay heals in a hospital with Gladys George looking for him. Tracy goes to WOLL to visit his buddy and he and George get things going. Later, when Tracy is reported missing, Tone and George marry. Tracy is broken when he comes back and finds out about the marriage, but he walks step by step.

The rest of the movie is about Tone, who uses the martial skills he has learned in gangster trading. He's a killer now and George does not really know what he's doing professionally. I think you can do the rest.

The part of the film that troubled me is that I can not believe that Gladys George could not figure it out. She is a street smart girl, her part is very similar to the one she played in the Roaring Twenties opposite James Cagney.

Speaking of The Roaring Twenties, Humphrey Bogart's character development is similar to Tone, although he was not the central character of the film. In fact, there are elements of They Gave Him A Gun that can be found in Taxi Driver and in Clint Eastwood's classic The Unforgiven.

The fighting sequences of the First World War are very well staged by director Woody Van Dyke. For some reason, Leonard Maltin shot this movie, I think it's much better than he let it be.

summary: A group of guys capture a young girl with the intent of hurting her. They torture her in many ways, from beating her to putting a sharp piece of needle-like metal through her eye which pierces across her retina.
translation:
This is the first part of the Guinea Pig series and is one of the most notorious films in the collection.

It took a long time for me to finally find a man and get a copy of this infamous group of films. I bought the Guinea Pig Box Set and decided to see the collection in the order of the release date. So I threw that jerk off and sat down.

From what I read on the internet and the content of the movie, I expected to test my nerves with full force. This is not the case.

The film focuses on a group of men abducting a woman and starting to torment her with the hope of discovering the human point of break and how long a person can endure pain.

Sounds like a sick strip, right? Not correct. The movie does not shock. This may be because I have become more insensitive over the years as far as my obsession with horror is concerned, but I think it's safe to say that every true Gorehund can easily handle this.

On the other hand, people who are not well acquainted with this type of film will most likely be overwhelmed and disgusted by the images they see on screen. Although he could not shock me, the film contains some pretty mean and graphic scenes of violence. Including the tearing of fingernails, guts thrown at an unconscious woman, and a needle through the eye. Overall, I think that the majority of Gorehounds on this board should only get a copy of this movie for the novelty of him, but I suggest that for every newcomer to that kind of movies, that You should work your way up to this.

summary: A hitman who lives by the code of the samurai, works for the mafia and finds himself in their crosshairs when his recent job doesn't go according to plan. Now he must find a way to defend himself and his honor while retaining the code he lives by.
translation:
Spoiler

Well, the summary in one line says it all. Melville's "Le Samurai" is the original and there are elements of "Leon". And they are better - much better!

In the Samurai, Alain Delon is a lone warrior / professional killer holding a bird in the cage and stealing cars for his jobs (with so much excitement in those scenes!). Even the end is exactly the same: the samurai seeks death in dignity and is shot with an empty weapon in his hand. The world has changed, he notes, and there is no room for the samurai in it.

Delon does not kill as many people as the Ghost Dog. But Jarmusch really liked "Leon" or even "Desperado" by Rodriguez. So he added that. And let me guess: the girl becomes a pro like Ghost Dog (like Natalie Portman in "Leon")?

So what was Jarmusch thinking? Where is the unique, original thought in this movie?

I can not see the point in producing carbon (celluloid) copies.

A 4/10 review by Macaulay Connor

summary: This animated adventure series of Bruce Wayne, billionaire by day, crime fighter by night, starts as Wayne balances life as a free-wheeling bachelor, with his role as the Caped Crusader. He's joined on occasion by Robin and Batgirl. Black Mask, Killer Moth, the Everywhere Man, and a brand-new Clayface join The Joker, Penguin, and The Riddler in ceaselessly tormenting Gotham City. Can Batman stop them once and for all?
translation: I have never commented on IMDb, but I have to look for Batman animation. It is absolute nonsense! Warner Brothers had the perfect animated series in Batman in the early '90s. What the hell are you doing with the winning formula? I feel like writing a letter of complaint to WB. The original animation was dark and brooding, just as Batman was meant to be. WB had to confuse that with tripe of the future. Now they are producing this network. The Joker is not remotely like the joker of DC Comics. DC should sue. I urge everyone who agrees with me to write e-mails or write to WB and use the power of people to get the original formula back

summary: Dominated by her possessive mother and her bullying consort, Conroy, since childhood, teen-aged Victoria refuses to allow them the power of acting as her regent in the last days of her uncle, William IV's rule. Her German cousin Albert is encouraged to court her for solely political motives but, following her accession at age eighteen, finds he is falling for her and is dismayed at her reliance on trusty Prime Minister Melbourne. Victoria is impressed by Albert's philanthropy which is akin to her own desire to help her subjects. However her loyalty to Melbourne, perceived as a self-seeker, almost causes a constitutional crisis and it is Albert who helps restore her self-confidence. She proposes and they marry, Albert proving himself not only a devoted spouse, prepared to take an assassin's bullet for her, but an agent of much-needed reform, finally endorsed by an admiring Melbourne.
translation:
It is a difficult thing to play a queen. On the one hand, the actress must be majestic and domineering, on the other hand she must show vulnerability in a difficult situation as well as the collection of courage and determination to overcome the odds since almost all movies about queens have this basic storyline.

Emily Blunt is as radiant as Victoria, but it's not as good a performance as I want it to be. I can not help but believe that this is a Mills & Boon novel adaptation compared to a darker, more dramatic film about another young queen, Elizabeth. Therefore, Blunt can not play the full range of royal feelings, at least not fully, because she is, as you know, the young Victoria. To see old Victoria, look at Mrs. Brown.

Jean-Marc Vallee is an interesting choice of director for the film. Most recently, he was C.R.A.Z.Y., which was excellent and led him to fame. It was a completely different movie, but I remember it looks great and that's probably the main resemblance between the two films. But while Vallee C.R.A.Z.Y. wrote, this was one of Julian Fellowes, and although I had really enjoyed his Gosford Park, the story for this movie was much less interesting. I soon lost all government policy. Maybe it was less engaging because there was no possible decapitation of the monarchy. I only say yes.

summary: At 18, Diana has a chip on her shoulder; she's close to expulsion from high school for fighting, her mother is dead, her dad is surly, the popular girls at school set her teeth on edge, she knows men can cause pain. When she picks up her younger brother at a Brooklyn gym where he boxes to please his father, she decides she wants to train. Hector, a coach, reluctantly agrees to teach her. It's soon clear to him that Diana has talent; he pushes her. She spends time with another young fighter, Adrian, who has a girlfriend, but Diana intrigues him and stirs real feelings he tries to articulate. She, too, must accommodate her toughness and ironic detachment to her feelings for him.
translation:
Michelle Rodriguez plays Diana, a schoolgirl with an outrageous scowl and 2 x 4 on her shoulder. She is ready to fight anyone, especially her father, who pays for her brother's boxing lessons. Diana decides boxing would be a great way to focus her anger.

I really liked the relationship between Diana and Adrian. Santiago Douglas as Adrian is excellent. Watch how their feelings about each other are shaped by the square circle.

summary: General Hammond summons Colonel Jack O'Neill out of retirement to embark on a secret rescue mission. O'Neill confesses that he disobeyed orders to destroy the Stargate on Planet Abydos, and that scientist Daniel Jackson may still be alive. Arriving on Abydos with his team, O'Neill meets up once again with the scientist, who has discovered a giant elaborate cartouche in hieroglyphics. All signs point to the fact that this is a map of many Stargates that exist throughout the galaxy - a development that makes the dream of the SG-1 team to travel throughout the universe in time a reality.
translation:
I watch it now on pink (Serbia TV station) and I have to say, that's a crap. Flat, no acting, effects too sloppy, I mean, who made this series?

This was a stupid attempt by the studios to earn more money for the success of the film. OK. The movie was great in 1994 when it came out. But the series?

Sometimes you can see how idiotic the lines are in the language of the characters. I mean, did they actually pay someone who wrote that, was that someone in the studio? This is not a scifi.

The movie was the bomb, the series sucks.

summary: After young policewoman Gina Pulasky succeeds in handling a domestic fight particularly well, she's added to a small team of detectives assigned to a case of gruesome child killings. She proves herself to be a worthwhile reinforcement by tracking down the prime suspect, a disturbingly smart young man named Kyle Timler. Much to the horror of her team mate and lover Will McCaid, Pulasky goes undercover to infiltrate in Timler's life and trying to get as close to him as necessary to make him confess his crimes without even noticing it. A dangerous mission involving a process of growing identification with the killer, something that doesn't leave Pulasky unscathed.
translation:
I have just finished this finely designed and beautifully played / directed film. It was a question of whether I should spend my time watching a movie on the Lifetime Movie Network because of the awfully distracting advertising. Reading the previous comments made me try it. After all the worst that could happen, I might fall asleep during one of the boring but tedious bug spray ads. Why did I look at it? especially if IMDB gives a movie a "WEIGHTED AVERAGE" OF 5.8, WHO WAS STATISTICAL AVERAGE 7.3 It must be a sure hit.

I was delighted to have taken the time to see this movie, commercial smallpox and everything. Helen Hunt always surprises me with her ability to take on tough roles by adapting her core person to each role.

The portrait she painted in this movie by the tough but sensitive human policeman was beautifully executed. If the scene demands a quick, verbal, oral intercourse, it can face any actor. However, she is adept at delivering levels of emotional response without uttering a word based solely on facial expressions and body language. Without the commercials, which by design destroy the continuity of a good movie, this would have been a real nail biter. I gave it a 9.0

summary: Wong Kar-Wai's movie about two love-struck cops is filmed in impressionistic splashes of motion and color. The first half deals with Cop 223, who has broken up with his girlfriend of five years. He purchases a tin of pineapples with an expiration date of May 1 each day for a month. By the end of that time, he feels that he will either be rejoined with his love or that it too will have expired forever. The second half shows Cop 663 dealing with his breakup with his flight attendant girlfriend. He talks to his apartment furnishings until he meets a new girl at a local lunch counter.
translation:
A never-ending rage of clever visual irony does not necessarily create a responsive movie. The "Blonde Wig", the half of the film, may never have developed through too much license of its makers.

The Wong Faye half (with a very playful, if Karen Carpenter looks like, Faye Wong) has much more appeal. All the ingredients are there, but the girl-meets-boy-story element is behind the artistic wisdom. The character development is uneven. Emotion is missing.

For music lovers, Wong Faye's "Mung Jung Yun" (Cantonese version of the cranberry hit "Dreams") is used effectively on the Chungking Express. Faye Wong also recorded a Mandarin language version called Zhen Tuo. Both are on CD, though only "Mung Jung Yun" can be found on the official movie soundtrack CD.

summary: nan
translation: This is a very entertaining film that follows the rehearsal process of a NY production by Macbeth. Although in our modern world it has a lot to say about power, jealousy and ambition (the themes of Macbeth), the movie works best if it does not take itself too seriously. Recognizable actors such as John Glover, Gloria Reubens and David Lansbury are doing nice jobs in the lead roles, but the highlight for me was the hilarious scene rehearsing the "murder" of Banquo (John Elsen). Probably a more entertaining movie for those who play drama, but anyone who likes Shakespeare should enjoy this movie.

summary: A young girl develops a clever plot so she doesn't have to move away from her friends.

summary: In 1966, somewhere in Russia, a wounded woman drives a truck to an isolated farm with two babies. Forty years later, the film producer Marie Jones leaves her daughter in California and travels back to her home land in the wilderness of Russia. Marie is one of the children and had received a phone call from the notary public Andrei Misharin, who told her where the farm of her family is located. Marie arrives at the abandoned house and meets the stranger Nicolai, who tells her that he had also received a call from Misharin and he is her twin brother. Weird things happen in the house and Marie and Nicolai are haunted by zombie-like ghosts of themselves. Further, they find that they are trapped in the house and can not leave the place.
translation:
This film (along with Rinne) are little treasures among the retouched homage pictures that used to happen on the horror movies at the 8FTDF "HorrorFest". And, yes, that's a low praise. summary: A Scotland Yard investigator looks into four mysterious cases involving an unoccupied house and its tragic previous tenants: 1) A hack novelist encounters a strangler who's the villain of his books, leading his wife to question his sanity, 2) Two men are obsessed with a wax figure of a woman from their past, 3) A little girl with a stern, widowed father displays an interest in witchcraft, and 4) An arrogant horror film actor purchases a black cloak which gives him a vampire's powers.
translation:
(SPOILER included) This movie is certainly the best amicus production I've ever seen (though I still have a few). The house that dripped blood is a horror bus - an anthology that contains four eerie stories about the tenants of a devilish, hellish house in the British countryside. A common mistake in productions like this is to waste too much energy on the ongoing story that connects each story. Peter Duffel's film does not pay much attention to this. It's just about a Scotland Yard inspector coming to the house to investigate the last tenant's disappearance, and he learns about the bizarre events that took place there before. All four stories in this movie are of high quality and together they make a perfect healthy. High expectations are allowed for this movie since it was written entirely by Robert Bloch! Yes, the same Bloch who wrote the novel that resulted in the brilliant horror milestone `Psycho '? We also honor Peter Duffel's solid and very professional debut as a director.

The four stories ?? Chapter, if you want ?? In the house that has dripped blood, there is a wide variety of topics, but they are (almost) equally chilled and uncanny. Number one is about a horror writer who comes into the house with his wife to find inspiration for his new book. That starts off really well, but after a short time his haunting is haunted by the rogue of his own imagination. The idea in this story is not exactly original, but it is very exciting and the climax is quite surprising. The second story stars horror legend Peter Cushing as a retired stockbroker. Still haunted by the image of an unattainable and long-lost love, he encounters a wax statue that looks exactly like her. Cushing is a pleasure to watch as always and ?? although the subject of wax museums is not new ?? This story looks fresh and innovative overall. This chapter also contains a few glorious shock moments and a constant tense atmosphere. It's a great warm-up for probably the best story: Number 3. Another legendary actor in this one, as Christopher Lee gives away an impeccable depiction of a frightened father. He is very strict and strict about his young daughter and he keeps her in isolation for the outside world. Not without reason, because the little girl shows a bizarre fascination for witchcraft and voodoo. In addition to the great portrayal of Lee and the remarkable achievement of Chloe Franks as a creepy child, this story also has a great gothic atmosphere! The devilish undertones in this story, along with the haunting sound effects of the Thunder, make this story a must for fans of authentic horror. The fourth and final story, in which a vain horror actor is controlled by his vampire cloak, is somewhat weaker than the others when it comes to suspense and credibility, but the overburdening subtle humor more or less offsets it. There is even a small space for parody in this story, as the protagonist refers to co-star Christopher Lee in the Dracula series! The most notable element in this last chapter is the presence of the gorgeous Ingrid Pitt! The cult queen from "The Vampire Lovers" is certainly one of the many highlights in the film - especially her cleavage.

No doubt? The house, which dripped blood, is much appreciated by classic horror fans. I am firmly convinced that, with some preparations for improving the mood, this could be one of the few films that will terrify you and make a big impact. Intelligent and captivating horror as it should be! Highly recommended. An extra small remark: This film may not be repeated. CAN NOT be mistaken for "Dorm Room That Drops Blood". This latter one is a very irritating and lousy underground 80s Slasher who has nothing in common with this movie except the title he stole.

summary: Textile company heir Wayland is accused of murder of a prostitute named Elizabeth, whose body was found cut in two in the park. The murder is investigated by tough detective Kennesaw and his less experienced partner Braxton. Wayland is a heavy drinker and compulsive liar, he is prone to memory losses and periods of heavy violence. He is rich enough to access necessary information, and he gets the interrogators' own dark secrets - Kennesaw is angry about affairs his wife had and had let off steam with Elizabeth, and Braxton has gambling debts with Mook, who is demanding payment.
translation: Loaded with fine actors, I expected much more from "Deceiver" than was delivered. The plot is extremely fictional and manipulative. The many flashbacks only add to the confusion. Believability flies out the window and becomes unbearable and downright ridiculous with the end. I would urge anyone who likes his movie plots to rely on something that is at least possible to avoid "scammers" because you will be very frustrated. Maybe I'm just not hip enough to get it, but my suspicion is that many others were totally confused by the plot and especially the end. Blurring the line between reality and lies just does not work because the whole movie does not make sense. - MERK

summary: Two students, Gerardo and Jonas, are in love. However, Jonas becomes obsessed with another boy, which leads to Gerardo moving into arms of Sergio.

After a while, one is distracted from a brief encounter with a sensual guy in the disco, and that awakens doubts: exploration, fantasy, desire, lust and the feeling of losing love are themes that are all intensely painted with music, close-ups will and tell silent scenes like a poem. but it really takes too long, annoyingly long, too bad, the effort was promising

summary: Italy 1600: A convent of nuns are invaded by the Tarantula Sect on their annual pilgrimage. The cultists defile the place of worship, orgying in the chapel and desecrating the altar. One nun decides she can't take the religious oppression any longer and flees the convent upset that all the leaders are male.
translation:
"Flavia, the Monaca Muslmana" aka. 1974's "Flavia the Heretic" is a truly disturbing and uncompromising piece of Italian exploitation cinema, which to some extent follows a somewhat feminist premise (though the level of sleaze and brutality would probably deter the majority of feminists). The film "Flavia the Heretic", which mainly takes place in a convent and with a nun as lead actress (great achievement by the wonderful Florinda Bolkan), can be called a "Nunsploitation" movie. However, this film is very different from the typical Nunsploitation films of the time, as it does not focus so much on the nonsploitation elements as lesbianism, sadistic lesbian punishments, etc. Personally, I saw more resemblance to the hexploitation films of the time, such as "The Sign of the Devil" (though this does not address the subject of witch hunts), which focus on the brutal execution of Christian fundamentalism in the Middle Ages and early modern times.

Italy around 1600: After Flavia witnesses her despotic father beheading a wounded Muslim soldier, she is forced to become a nun in a monastery. When her father years later condemns a co-sister to a painful death for a small offense, Falvia's loathing of male violence against women turns into hate for the despotic church, and she joins a group of Arab scavengers ...
< One thing's for sure, "Flavia the Heretic" is not for the faint of heart, nor for those who want happy ending. Director Gianfranco Mingozzi obviously tried to make his film as realistic and disturbing as possible, especially in his nasty scenes. The many scenes of torture and execution are extremely disconcerting, with ruffians, spikes and other gruesome scenes in exact details, with the most shocking scene likely to be the young nun's torture, right at the beginning of the film. The violence here is never superfluous. After all, these cruel methods were a reality in the time the movie plays. The film is very well done, with realistic costumes, fantastic settings, an elegant cinematography and a great score by Nicola Piovani. The stunningly beautiful and magnificent Florinda Bolkan has proven her talents in many of the great Italian cult productions (including Lucio Fulci's Giallo masterpiece "Non Si Sevizia Un Paperino" of 1972). It's another great, charismatic show here, and I could not imagine another actress in the role as fitting as she. The film has some minor inconsistencies (eg why did the Rigid Church drop bizarre cult followers in monasteries at all). However, it is amazing how realistic this movie is. "Flavia the Heretic" should by no means be missed by my fans of the Italian Exploitation Cinema. This is a great exploit strip, though it is definitely deeply depressing and therefore should be viewed in the right mood. Highly recommended for fans of disturbing exploitation cinema. 7.5 / 10

summary: The film is about two teenage girls, Behiye and Handan, with contrasting characteristics and backgrounds, forming a close relationship with sexual implications. As they become closer and closer the relationship becomes more fragile, and the impossibility of the survival of their relationship becomes more evident over time. Economic, social, psychological, and sexual problems come in the way. Behiye is angry and rebellious, but her frequent outbursts cut little ice with her conservative family. Handan is trapped in a different way, in a love-hate relationship with her single mother Leman. Although Leman is willing to turn tricks to raise Handan's college fees, she's otherwise hopeless with both men and money. When a mutual friend introduces Behiye and Handan they immediately hit it off, and despite the differences in their backgrounds they embark on an intense relationship, and with it a secret plan to escape their dysfunctional families.
translation: This book-based movie is really terrible and a big disappointment. We have been waiting for this step for over a month. Many movie critics were hopeful. summary: Rachel Green, Ross Geller, Monica Geller, Joey Tribbiani, Chandler Bing and Phoebe Buffay are six 20 something year-olds, living off of one another in the heart of New York City. Over the course of ten years, this average group of buddies goes through massive mayhem, family trouble, past and future romances, fights, laughs, tears and surprises as they learn what it really means to be a friend.
translation:
Television influences society ... just look at the growing popularity of cappuccino stores after this superficial little work debuted. Besides, real people who look as good as these people have no problems.

Also, does anyone really believe that these people can afford to live in a nice Manhattan loft, considering what they are working for? NBC simply loves to offend the viewer's intelligence, even if they're just near Gump's level. I know a person who earns $ 100,000 a year as a web designer and lives in a tiny studio apartment in Manhattan that costs $ 2,200 a month in rent.

I would like to see a show called "Phriends", where there are six ugly guys in dead ends living in a lousy area where sirens keep moaning and somebody is robbed every week ... and then the landlord picks up the rent. Well, I would see that.

summary: A young professional woman (Simpson) unwittingly becomes the pawn of two business executives in their bid to oust the head of a mega-conglomerate.
translation:
The story goes like this: A little girl, Katie (Jessica Simpson), decides to visit her boyfriend in the big city. When she arrives, she discovers that he is not as faithful as he should be. Katie then ventures into the adventure of New York. As a bike messenger comes comedic and charming mishap. She falls into a hole in the ground and meets the charismatic Good Ben (Luke Wilson). It's not love at first sight, at least for them, but fate and Ben, will not give up easily. Since she is "just" a small-town girl AND a blonde, a few evil executives in a construction company decide that she's the perfect scapegoat for her sly plan. Misunderstandings with funny and sad consequences follow. However, this is a blonde who will not lie down!

People who judge this film will soon prove wrong. The jokes are confident and fit, and the story is well developed. The relationship between Katie and Ben feels so natural that it overshadows everything Godard has created. The all-rounder Jessica Simpson surprised once again with a strong role that only she could pull through. Simpson is really the Marilyn Monroe of our day (there is even a scene that honors her!). She balances perfectly between vulnerable and moody. Katie really shows us that you can not judge a book by its cover! Luke Wilson is as charming as ever. Even if he was covered in liquid manure, this man would be just as appealing as anyone else. His light touch, his doggy eyes and his loose manner make it difficult to resist him. Andy Dick plays the role in which he was born, one of the two evil leaders. He really can not be underestimated. The strength of the achievement lies in its restraint. It's remarkable, because most actors would just run away with it and play it cheap laugh. Not this guy!

Finally, director Scott Marshall has made a smart and often hilarious comedy that will become a classic alongside classics like Epic Movie and Norbit. Kudos to everyone involved, especially to Jessica Simpson. Her sincere smile and hearty laugh made even the toughest man break out with a big grin. They may be tough, but they are not that hard! Warmly recommended for those who want to be swept off their feet and see a romantic comedy that is, for once, honest. Thanks for this movie! Oh, and the soundtrack rocks!

Now, if you still have not gotten it. I am sarcastic. 1.10

summary: There is a war going on between masters and servants in order to attain the Holy Grail. Each master can call up one servant each, and their task is to eradicate the other servants, either by defeating them or killing their master. When there is only one master or servant left, he or she is granted the Holy Grail, and any wish they desire will come true.
translation:
This anime seriously rocked my socks. When the anime opened for the first time, I felt it was too slow; The story did not really move forward and Shirou was a rather inconspicuous male lead. Once he has learned more about the persecution and learned more about Saber and the Holy Grail War, the story goes on and you see several facets of it moving together. It was fantastic.

Also, I felt that the way the characters evolved is very true in the real world with the way real people evolve. There were no stupid, completely obvious things; The development of Ilya and Rin was interesting to observe, but I think the way Shirou and Saber grew in their particular personalities was only interesting to observe. Some of the "surprising" people who emerged (Gilgamesh?) Also being unique in one way or another, which meant that we did not "Generic Bad-ass A" by "Generic Bad-ass B" once A died ,

Anddd, I loved the music. The opening music rocked, and the finishing theme from the last episode has pushed the theme of the last episode even more. Good job, type MOON!

summary: Portrait of Andy Goldsworthy, an artist whose specialty is ephemeral sculptures made from elements of nature.
translation: Andy Goldsworthy is a first-rate Taoist master who shows the way through his sublime transient art. In fact, time and change are all about his work. I bought his first book a few years ago and my family admired it a lot. So it was a pleasure to get to know the artist personally through this movie, he is as patient and gentle as you would expect and has some wonderful things to say about the natural world, the deepest of which is expressed in his occasional inability to even say it in words. He is like most children who play alone in nature (when they stop doing it), creating things out of sticks and sand and mud and snow before they grow out. Mr. Goldsworthy has been given the gift and mission to expand this kind of game to create profound visions of nature and open our often weary eyes in a brilliant new way. And always with the greatest respect, gratitude and humor of a wandering and wondering monk.

summary: It is the year 2029: Astronaut Leo Davidson boards a pod cruiser on a Space Station for a "routine" reconnaissance mission. But an abrupt detour through a space time wormhole lands him on a strange planet where talking apes rule over the human race. With the help of a sympathetic chimpanzee activist named Ari and a small band of human rebels, Leo leads the effort to evade the advancing Gorilla Army led by General Thade and his most trusted warrior Attar. Now the race is on to reach a sacred temple within the planet's Forbidden Zone to discover the shocking secrets of mankind's past - and the key to its future.
translation:
while watching this piece of crap! The next day I saw a 1min trailer - this one minute included everything, EVERYTHING which was not boring ...

summary: A lonely man, tired of being rejected by women, gets ahold of a rifle and prowls the Hollywood hills, picking off rich couples.
translation:
Michael Stearns plays Mike, a sexually frustrated person with an interesting moral attitude to sexuality. He has no problems with naked dancers, but when women have sex with men, he loses them. He believes that when women have sex, they lose all sense of "innocence" and / or "beauty." So he strolls through the Hollywood Hills, pursuing lovers in the distance and finally kills the men with a high-performance rifle with a telescopic sight.

The main reason for the existence of this movie is to indulge in sexually activity over and over again. The "story" comes more as an afterthought. That will certainly make many happy heterosexual men happy, as we handle enough drawn-out scenes of nudity (the ladies look terribly well without clothes here) and sex that serve as a big dose of tickling. Of course, if you look at a lot of them through a playing field, the scary factor increases considerably and illustrates the compulsion to voyeurism. (For one thing, Mike looks at the pairs for a few minutes through the riflescope before finally pulling the trigger.) This is underscored by a haunting, if somewhat atmospheric, music on the soundtrack.

Those with a penchant for garbage will enjoy this to some extent. It even includes a lesbian rendezvous that confuses Mike and makes him unsure * how to * respond. It unfolds at a very slow pace, but concludes with an amusingly ironic twist. It's a kinky and twisted rarity that, unless otherwise stated, will bring some viewers to the screen.

7/10

summary: The past, present, and future lives of surviving Oceanic Flight 815 passengers are dramatically intertwined as a fight for survival ensues in a quest for answers after crashlanding on a mysterious island. Each discovery prompts yet more secrets, as the hastily-formed colony search for a way off the island, or is this their home?
translation:
OK, I'll be honest, when I saw the trailer for the program for the first time, I thought it was an advertisement for a sunscreen. Walking around with all the people on the beach. Still, I decided to look at it and thought it was a new show that I could laugh about. But I was very surprised.

I was thrilled with the first 10 seconds of the program, why is it in the trees, why did the plane crash, etc.?

It's not commonplace to have a show that combines intelligence, humor, action and excitement. But "Lost" does it all. With a great cast and crew, beautiful locations and pretty decent special effects, "Lost" will awaken anyone who comes in and is a must for anyone who is tired of addictive sitcoms and poor reality TV.

Lost is on Tuesdays at 10 o'clock on Channel 4 (UK) 4, 8, 15, 16, 23, 42 = O

summary: A U.S. Army sergeant is home on leave to reconnect with his girlfriend he hopes to marry. However, in the years he's been away, she's gotten a huge promotion where they used to work together - and has become engaged to another man.

Superficially, this is an above-average postwar romantic comedy. Under the veneer, it's the funniest MGM character actor stuntscasting.

The leads are straightforward, but all secondaries are very anti-type. It's also fun in many romantic comedy conventions, which is another indication that this was not possible as a "straight" romantic comedy, as it is a dry edition of the many romantic comedies of the post-war era 2-dimensional, preferred characters.

I just saw it once, intermittently, so I can not be positive, but this movie may be one of those that worked better in the context of the time it was made, but is less successful now, as viewers "see" these secondary characters a completely different lens. I assume that this is the case if I give it 9 stars. I found it hysterical.

summary: Lena, aged twenty, wants to know all she can about life and reality. She collects information on everyone and everything, storing her findings in an enormous archive. She experiments with relationships, political activism, and meditation. Nudity, explicit sex, and controversial politics kept this film from being shown in the US while its seizure by Customs was appealed.
translation: "I'm Curious: Yellow" is a crafty and boisterous steaming bunch. It does not matter what the political views are, because this film can not be taken seriously at any level. summary: Mary is a free-spirited young woman with a run-down New York apartment and a high fashion wardrobe. She calls her godmother, a librarian, for bail money after being arrested for throwing an illegal party. To repay the loan, she begins working as a library clerk. At first she hates it, but when challenged decides to master the Dewey Decimal System and become a great library clerk, while romancing a falafel vendor and helping her roommate in his goal to become a professional DJ.
translation: I remember Parker Posey in "As The World Turns" before she became the queen of independent films. In this film, Posey shows her potential as a high-profile actress. Posey, when Mary learns that she must grow up and grow up. Losing her position as a librarian makes her realize how much she misses her as a place in her life. Mary's life is surrounded by friends in the Lower East Side Village of New York City before being gentrified with yuppies. This movie is pretty good for an independent and I enjoy Parker Posey as Mary as well as other characters in other movies.

summary: Based on the true story of a Russian serial killer who, over many years, claimed over 50 victims, mostly under the age of 17. In what was then a Communist state, the police investigations were hampered by bureaucracy, incompetence and those in power. The story is told from the viewpoint of the detective in charge of the case.
translation:
A surprisingly complex and well designed study of the "first" serial killer in the USSR. In the days of perestroika, this intense piece is brought to life with the performances of Stephen Reah and Donald Sutherland.

This investigation of Cicatillo as a killer is well rounded and points to some of his behaviors. While others show it right, there is a subtlety that is irresistible without being open. Not for the faint of heart, but the theme is often disturbing, but necessary for the full development of key stakeholders in this fact-based story.

HBO provided us with an excellent movie in an unusual way. Congratulations to the director and publisher of this great piece. It's on my top 10 list.

summary: Cinderella, the beautiful and kind-hearted daughter, sees her world turn upside down when her beloved mother dies, and her pained father remarries another woman, the wicked Lady Tremaine, who has two equally cruel daughters, the jealous Anastasia and Drizella. But, once more, things will go from bad to worse, when Cinderella's father, too, dies, leaving her all alone in the Lady's clutches to serve as her maid-of-all-work. Under those circumstances, a shabby and neglected Cinderella doesn't stand much of a chance of attending the King's royal ball--let alone, captivate the handsome Prince--unless she turns to her loving Fairy Godmother who has quite a few tricks up her sleeve. Nevertheless, will the wronged damsel ever find peace--and with it--her own Prince Charming?
translation:
"Cinderella" is one of the most popular Disney classics. And it really deserves its status. Based on the classic tale of Charles Perrault, the film follows the rigors of Cinderella, a good girl abused by her evil stepmother and equally unlikely stepsisters. If a royal ball is held and all the appropriate young women are invited (say, the king wants to marry the prince), Cinderella will stay home while her stepmother takes her terrible daughters home. But there's a fairy godmother at hand ...

The story of "Cinderella" alone would not be able to work out a feature rather random characters of the animals that the fairy uses to the title character Cinderella's true sidekicks become the ball. The mice Jaq and Gus are the main buddies, and her own archenemy is the stepmother Lucifer's cat. Their antics are generally intertwined with the main tale and are mostly wonderful. Granted, the movie slows down slightly between the main launch of the characters and just before the stepsisters start the ball, but after this slowdown, the movie is really coming back and surprising (since "Cinderella" is the most worn story) of all time, probably ) ends up being one of the most involved Disney stories.

The animation and art direction is nice. All of the legendary Nine Old Men animated in this image and Mary Blair's color and conceptual art (she also did conceptual art and color design for "Alice in Wonderland", "Peter Pan", "The Three Caballeros" and many others) make it onto the To move screen. The colors and designs are beautiful, especially in the fairy godmother and ball scenes, as well as in those pretty little moments.

Overall, "Cinderella" is one of the best Disney fairy tales. Narratives and comes recommended too young and everything that embodies the Disney philosophy that dreams can really come true.
